headlines: Scoring error led to Pakistani batsman getting run-out on 499
text: Pakistan's Hanif Mohammad got run-out on 499 in a first-class match on January 11, 1959, due to a scoring error. The scoreboard showed Hanif on 496 instead of 498 before the third day's second-last ball. Wanting to reach 500 off the last ball to give his captain the option to declare overnight, Hanif got run-out while attempting the second run.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Mamata asks PM Modi to withdraw CAA, NRC during meeting in Kolkata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Saturday met PM Narendra Modi in Kolkata and said she asked the PM to withdraw CAA and NRC. "I told him we are against dividing people. No one should face atrocities. Please rethink on CAA," she said after the meet. The PM said such matters can be discussed in Delhi later, she added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Kerala fishermen hold 'water march' against CAA
text: Fishermen in Kerala held a protest to oppose the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in which they sailed waving the national flag and shouting slogans. The 'water march' was held in the Chaliyam area of Kozhikode on Thursday. The organisers said the protest was "against the central government's move to deny citizenship to one community on the basis of their religion."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Latest rankings for T20I bowlers released, Navdeep Saini jumps 146 places
text: Team India fast bowler Navdeep Saini, who was named Man of the Series for taking 5 wickets against Sri Lanka, jumped 146 places to the 98th spot in the latest rankings of bowlers in T20I cricket. Fast bowler Shardul Thakur, who also took five wickets in the series, shares the 92nd position with Scotland's Hamza Tahir.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pak players remember Sarfaraz on Twitter, Fakhar says 'Shady abay ball pakar'
text: Pakistan batsman Fakhar Zaman took to Twitter to share a fan's post which included pacer Hassan Ali's Instagram Story remembering Sarfaraz Ahmed. "Captain will be my Captain," Hassan had written. Fakhar wrote in his post, "Saifi bhai", with heart emojis. Responding to Fakhar, spinner Shadab Khan wrote, "Saifi bhai the great," to which Fakhar Zaman replied, "Shady abay baalll pakar."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Scientists image heart RNA structure for the first time
text: Scientists have created the first 3-D images of a special type of RNA molecule critical for stem cell programming and called genome's "dark matter". Researchers used the small angle X-ray scattering technique that reveals the RNA molecule's 3-D envelope. "The RNA studied is called "Braveheart", it triggers the transformation of stem cells into heart cells," the study's lead author revealed.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Vijayvargiya threatens WB Police, says he will make them 'murga'
text: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya seemed to threaten the West Bengal Police while addressing a rally in Purulia. Vijayvargiya said, "What is the name of Purulia's SP? Murga?", while referring to S Selvamurugan SP, Purulia. He added that they will make all police officers 'murga' who are harassing BJP workers when his party comes into power in the state.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Fight won't go in vain: Kerala CM after meeting JNUSU President
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Saturday met Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) President Aishe Ghosh at Kerala House in Delhi. "I thank...Kerala government for standing by us and extending solidarity," Ghosh said in a statement after meeting Vijayan. "Expressed our solidarity to the (JNU) students who are fighting for justice. Their fight will not go in vain," Vijayan tweeted.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bengaluru man with OCD spent 10 hours bathing every day for 7 months
text: An IT professional in Bengaluru suffering from Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD), spent 10 hours bathing every day for seven months before seeking medical support. "He did all this out of a fear that he would contact infections if that kind of hygiene was not maintained," the doctor said. As per the doctor, the man used three full soap bars daily.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Canara Bank ATM gives out ₹500 instead of ₹100 in K'taka, public withdraw ₹1.7L
text: A Canara Bank ATM gave out ₹500 notes when customers wanted to withdraw ₹100 in Karnataka's Madikeri on Wednesday, with public withdrawing a total of ₹1.7 lakh. "The ATM cash handling agency made a goof up. Instead of loading  ₹100 notes, they filled that tray with ₹500 notes," a police official said. The police managed to recover the amount later.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: ₹84-crore worth property damage in anti-CAA protests in WB: Railways
text: The Railways have claimed to suffer losses of properties worth over ₹84 crore in the violence related to protests against CAA and NRC in West Bengal from December 13 to15, according to the reports filed by it before the Calcutta High Court. The Eastern Railway said that it suffered the brunt of the protests with losses amounting to ₹72.2 crore.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: West Bengal had most acid attack incidents in 2018: NCRB report
text: West Bengal had the maximum number of acid attack incidents in 2018, a National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) report has said. The report titled Crime in India 2018 said that West Bengal had 50 incidents of such attacks with 53 victims. The state accounted for 21.9% of the total 228 acid attacks in India in 2018.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 3,000 litres of beer delivered by Aus Navy after bushfires cut supply to town
text: The Australian Navy delivered 3,000 litres of beer to a pub in the town of Mallacoota as beer supplies were affected after raging bushfires cut off the one road in and out. The beer supply "will positively impact morale of the community", an Australian Defence Force spokesperson said. "Not all heroes wear capes", a resident of Mallacoota wrote on Facebook.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Secret letter by Oman's late Sultan decides his successor
text: Oman's Sultan Qaboos bin Said's cousin Haitham bin Tariq al-Said has been announced as the successor following the former's death on Friday. Qaboos, who had no children, had recommended Tariq's name in a secret letter, in case the family could not agree upon his successor. The letter was opened by his family in a council convened today.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 17-yr-old activist Greta tweets #StopAdani, asks Siemens to quit Adani mine
text: Seventeen-year-old Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg has called on German engineering giant Siemens to review its $20-million contract to supply rail infrastructure to Adani Group's controversial Carmichael coal mine project in Australia. Siemens said it will decide on its involvement in the development of the mine by Monday. Most of the coal from the project would be exported to India.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Phoebe Waller-Bridge auctions Golden Globe outfit for Aus bushfires
text: Phoebe Waller-Bridge has put her Golden Globes 2020 outfit up for an auction to help raise money to fight the Australian bushfires. The starting bid of her custom made Ralph & Russo suit is AU$77,000. "I'm very excited that this stunning, one of a kind, couture tuxedo...will continue its journey by contributing to this urgent cause," Phoebe said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Rahul and company behind storm of misinformation on CAA: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that "Rahul baba and company, Mamata, Kejriwal and Communists" are behind the "storm of misinformation" on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). "The opposition does not have any other issue, so they are spreading misinformation and falsehood on CAA. This has resulted in anarchy in the entire country," Shah said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: World no. 2 beats 2-time Grand Slam champ to reach Brisbane final
text: World number two Karolina Pliskova on Saturday defeated two-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka to enter the Brisbane International final. Pliskova triumphed 6-7(10-12), 7-6(7-3), 6-2 in the semi-final that lasted two hours and 48 minutes.  The 27-year-old Pliskova, who won the Brisbane International title in 2019, will now face Madison Keys of US on Sunday to defend her title.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Young players talented but need mental preparation: Lasith Malinga
text: After Sri Lanka lost T20I series 2-0 to India, captain Lasith Malinga said that team's young players are talented but need mental preparation. "They can bat and bowl but mental preparation is important," he stated. After the first T20I was abandoned due to rain, India defeated Sri Lanka in the remaining two matches by seven wickets and 78 runs respectively.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Always a guiding light, role model: Rahane on Dravid's birthday
text: Ajinkya Rahane took to twitter to wish former India captain Rahul Dravid on his 47th birthday and wrote, "My inspiration…Always looked up to him…Always a guiding light and a role mode to me…." "He's someone whom I truly treasure. Wish Rahul bhai a very happy birthday," he added. Dravid played 164 Tests, 344 ODIs and one T20I for India.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Ubtech's Walker robot now pours drinks and does 'yoga'
text: Ubtech showcased its upgraded Walker robot at CES 2020 which is now able to pour drinks and pull off poses similar to some of the yoga poses. Walker's new software update allows it to carry heavier items, adds more steadiness and also gives it an enhanced environmental perception. The robot continues to maintain its balance even on encountering a force.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Rare salt formations appear along the Great Salt Lake
text: Rare salt formations have been documented for the first time on the shores of the Great Salt Lake. Scientists claim that the formations could yield insights about salt structures found on Mars. "That powder will eventually get blown away or dissolve into the lake," said Elliot Jagniecki, a geologist with the Utah Geological Survey.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Was beacon of peace for world: Modi on Omani Sultan Qaboos' demise
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi condoled the demise of Omani Sultan Qaboos bin Said Al Said and remembered him as the "beacon of peace for India and the world". He also said that Qaboos was a visionary leader who transformed Oman into a modern and prosperous nation. Qaboos had ruled Oman since 1970 when he ousted his father in a coup.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Shehla says old pics being used to prove she's holidaying, tweets new pic
text: Former JNU Students' Union (JNUSU) Vice-President and activist Shehla Rashid took to Twitter on Saturday to claim that "the IT cell is pulling her old photos" to "prove" that she is holidaying in Europe amid ongoing JNU protests. Clarifying, Shehla posted a new picture of herself and wrote, "Stop using old photos. Let me help you with my recent picture."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Iran must learn lessons from downing Ukrainian plane: Russia
text: After Iran admitted to accidentally shooting down the Ukrainian plane killing 176 people, Russia said that it must learn lessons from the disaster. The incident must be closed if the probe doesn't prove that the Iranian army did this "intentionally", the Russian parliament's foreign affairs committee chairman, Konstantin Kosachev said. The plane crashed after Iran launched missiles at US bases.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US rejects request to remove American troops from Iraq
text: The US has rejected Iraq's request to pull out its troops after Iraqi PM Adil Abdul-Mahdi told US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo that the forces used in killing Iran's top commander entered Iraq without permission. The US State Department said the presence of its troops was "appropriate". Last week, Iraq's parliament voted to expel foreign troops amid US-Iran tensions.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Car sales in India fell by a record 19% last year: SIAM
text: India's car sales fell by a record 19% in 2019 as consumers hesitated to spend on big-ticket items amid a slowing economy, the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) said. Passenger car sales fell to 1.81 million in 2019 from 2.24 million in 2018 and two-wheeler sales fell 14%. The auto sector recorded its worst decline in over two decades.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: NASA hosts first public astronaut graduation ceremony
text: American space agency, NASA on Friday celebrated its latest class of graduating astronauts at a public ceremony in Houston. The graduating class, comprising six women and seven men, is now qualified for spaceflight missions including America's return to the Moon and eventual journey to Mars. The group also included two candidates from the Canadian Space Agency (CSA).
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: I wish I was dead: Iran commander takes full responsibility for downing plane
text: Commander of Aerospace Force of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, Amir Ali Hajizadeh, has said he "wished he was dead" upon learning of the Ukrainian plane downing and accepted full responsibility for the incident. Iran admitted that the aircraft carrying 176 people was unintentionally hit by a missile. Iranian forces mistook the aircraft for an enemy target.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Rahul Dravid became wicketkeeper to break into school cricket team
text: Former India captain Rahul Dravid, who turned 47 on Saturday, started wicketkeeping to get into school team. Dravid revealed when he went to the inter-school selections, there was no wicketkeeper, so he made himself available as wicketkeeper to break into the side. Dravid added he never kept wickets again until he was asked to keep for India in 1999.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Joaquin to wear Golden Globes outfit entire award season to 'reduce waste'
text: 'Joker' actor Joaquin Phoenix will wear his 77th Golden Globe Awards outfit, a Stella McCartney tuxedo, for the entire award season in order to "reduce waste", the designer announced. "This man is a winner...wearing custom Stella because he chooses to make choices for the future of...planet," Stella said. "I'm proud and honoured to join forces with you, Joaquin," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Give credit to Laxmi's lawyer: Delhi HC denies Chhapaak makers' appeal
text: The Delhi High Court on Saturday directed Chhapaak makers, Fox Studios and Meghna Gulzar, to give credit to lawyer Aparna Bhat, who represented acid attack survivor Laxmi. This comes after the makers filed an appeal against Patiala House Court's order asking the same. The film, which released on Friday, is based on Laxmi's real life.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: No such war is taking place: Ajay Devgn on Tanhaji-Chhapaak Twitter row
text: Reacting to a 'Twitter war' between Tanhaji and Chhapaak that erupted after Deepika Padukone's visit to Jawarharlal Nehru University (JNU), Ajay Devgn said, "A war is happening?! Who is doing it?" "I feel there is no such war is taking place. People express themselves on social media and we don't take it seriously," the 'Tanhaji' actor added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: SFI stages protest in Kolkata ahead of PM Modi's visit to WB
text: The Students' Federation of India (SFI) staged a protest in Kolkata on Saturday ahead of PM Narendra Modi's two-day visit to West Bengal. Posters saying, 'Go Back Modi' were seen at the protest. PM's visit comes at a time of widespread protests in West Bengal against the newly enacted Citizenship (Amendment) Act and the proposed National Register of Citizens (NRC).
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: When Gods fail, they hide behind the wall: Fan on ICC's post on Dravid's b'day
text: Commenting on ICC's Twitter post wishing Rahul Dravid on his 47th birthday, a fan commented, "Sachin- GOD, Ganguly- GOD OF OFFSIDE, Laxman- GOD OF LEGSIDE...But even when these GODS fail they all hide behind WALL." He added, "The wolf who lived for the pack. Happy birthday, Dravid. Some succeeded because they were destined to...He succeeded because he was determined to."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: My wife said I'll not live at home till govt allots us bigger house: Ajit Pawar
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said he has still not been allotted official residence, adding that he holds meetings in his bedroom and dining room at his current home. "My wife Sunetra told me that I'll not live here till a bigger house is allotted," he joked. He appealed to NCP workers to come to Mumbai only when it's important.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Outsiders involved in JNU violence: V-C after police names students
text: JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar has said there were many illegal students staying in the hostels who could be outsiders and they may be participating in violence as they have nothing to do with the university. This comes a day after Delhi Police named nine suspects, including seven belonging to left-leaning student organisations, for their alleged involvement in Sunday's violence.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Policeman caught taking ₹50,000, liquor bottles as bribe in Hyderabad
text: A sub-inspector from Jubilee Hills police station in Hyderabad was on Thursday caught red-handed while accepting a bribe of ₹50,000 and two liquor bottles. The accused was caught by Anti-Corruption Bureau officials while taking the bribe on the instruction of his superior. The bribe was demanded from a person who was released on station bail on December 31, 2019.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Have full support of people in J&K: Army Chief General Manoj Naravane
text: Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane on Saturday said that the Army has the full support of people in Jammu and Kashmir and they are grateful to local police and administration. General Naravane added, "The judgment call of the commander on ground has to be respected. All the complaints that have been filed (against officers) have proved to be unfounded."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Ukraine demands compensation for plane shot down by Iran
text: Ukranian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has demanded a full admission of guilt and compensation from Iran after it admitted to shooting down the Ukraine International Airlines plane. "We expect from Iran assurances of their readiness for a full and open investigation, bringing those responsible to justice, the return of the bodies of the dead (and) apologies through diplomatic channels," he added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Don't think this should be happening to Queen, I'm sad: Trump on Harry, Meghan
text: Reacting to Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's decision to step back from royal duties, US President Donald Trump said, "I think it's sad...I just have such respect for the Queen, I don't think this should be happening to her." Trump had earlier called American-born Markle "nasty" after she threatened in 2016 to move to Canada if Trump became the president.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pak bar association bans non-Muslim lawyers from contesting council elections
text: The Multan Bar Association in Pakistan has passed a resolution barring non-Muslim lawyers from contesting the bar council elections, the local media reported. Candidates, as well as voters, are required to submit a declaration to prove their faith in Islam. The elections are being held for the post of the president, general secretary, finance secretary and two vice presidents.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: CEO will speak on rural job creation at RSS event, nothing more to it: Zoho
text: Business software company Zoho has said its billionaire Founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu will share his expertise in rural job creation at an event in Chennai organised by RSS. There is "nothing more to it", it added. Social media users had called for the boycott of Zoho's products but Vembu said, "I don't decide my views based on Twitter attacks."
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Mine $9 billion diamond deposit: Madhya Pradesh asks state-owned NMDC
text: Madhya Pradesh has asked NMDC to explore and mine diamonds at the $9-billion Bunder project abandoned by Rio Tinto, an official said. The state-owned miner already mines in the neighbouring Majhgawan mine where it has extracted about 1 million carats of diamonds.  "NMDC is enthusiastic and looking forward to taking on another mine in Madhya Pradesh," the company said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Joaquin Phoenix, Martin Sheen arrested at climate change protest: Reports
text: Actors Joaquin Phoenix and Martin Sheen were among the hundreds of climate change protestors who were reportedly arrested from Jane Fonda's 'Fire Drill Fridays' protest in Washington DC on Friday. The protestors were charged with crowding, obstructing or incommoding, a spokesperson from the US Capitol Police said. All the protestors were later released, reports added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I've known Ranveer for a decade, we share a special bond: Pankaj
text: Talking about working with Ranveer Singh in '83, actor Pankaj Tripathi said, "Now, Ranveer and I share a khaas rishta (special bond)." He added that he has known Ranveer for a decade now, even before his debut film, 'Band Baaja Baaraat', was released. "There is no difference between...Ranveer then and...Ranveer now. He's adbhut (wonderful) and...immensely passionate about...work," said Pankaj.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Anything could happen: Downey Jr on Iron Man's return in Marvel
text: Robert Downey Jr, while talking about the possibility of the return of Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, said, "Anything could happen." Robert, who has been playing the character since 2008, further said "he hung up his guns" in the previous film and he's good to let it go. "I also think Marvel is...trying...bunch of other stuff," he added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: If this happens to students, it's panicking: Kamal on JNU violence
text: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan has condemned the violence on the campus of JNU and said, "It's really worrying." "If this happens to students, it's definitely panicking. It's also injustice and I can keep on saying more about it. This situation should change...dictatorship should change," he added. The actor had earlier condemned the clashes between Delhi Police and Jamia Millia Islamia students.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Facebook forces content moderators log toilet breaks: Ex-employee
text: An ex-Facebook content analyst in Dublin revealed the firm makes moderators log each and every break they take, including toilet breaks. If the senior management felt the break taken was too long, an explanation has to be given, Valera Zaicev told VICE News. Facebook in 2018 introduced a 'new time management system' which monitored moderators throughout the day, he added.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Skype recordings reviewed without security by contractors in China: Report
text: Microsoft hired contractors in China to listen and review Skype call and Cortana recordings for years with "no security measures", the Guardian reported. A worker claimed he was allowed to review potentially sensitive audio from home on a personal laptop, without being asked for proper identity proof. Microsoft said the ten-second-long snippets are now graded in "secure facilities" outside China.
author: Dharna

headlines: Tesla driver caught using Autopilot at 135 kmph to floss teeth, arrested
text: The Canadian police has caught a 58-year-old man speeding his Tesla at 135 kilometres per hour whilst flossing his teeth with both of his hands. The man, who was using Tesla's Autopilot mode to guide the car, was arrested and charged with careless driving. Last year, a video of a Tesla driver sleeping while the car drove itself had surfaced.
author: Dharna

headlines: At ₹1,450 cr, BJP got 61% funding via electoral bonds in 2018-19
text: BJP raised ₹2,354 crore through funding in the financial year 2018-19, out of which, almost 61% (₹1,450 crore) came through electoral bonds, according to the annual audited accounts of BJP submitted to Election Commission. Congress, on the other hand, received ₹383 crore worth electoral bonds in the same period, which is 41% of its total ₹918 crore funding.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Trump's birthday greet to Kim not enough to resume talks: N Korea
text: US President Donald Trump's birthday message to North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is not enough for a return to denuclearisation talks, according to a statement published by North Korea state news agency KCNA. North Korean Foreign Ministry adviser said that although Kim has "good personal feelings" about Trump, they are "in the true sense of the word 'personal'".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Vote counting begins in Taiwan's 2020 general election
text: Taiwan on Saturday voted for the 2020 presidential and parliamentary elections where vote counting started after the polls closed at 4 pm (08:00 GMT). According to Taiwan's Central Election Commission, there are 19.3 million eligible voters where citizens are eligible to vote starting at the age of 20. The results are expected to come by Saturday evening.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 5 dead, 10 injured after explosion at medical gases factory in Vadodara
text: At least five people were killed and 10 others injured after an explosion at a medical gases factory in Gujarat's Vadodara on Saturday. The explosion took place at around 11 am at AIMS Industries Limited, as per the police. Fire tenders have been rushed to the spot and rescue operations are underway.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Teen discovers new planet on third day of internship at NASA
text: Wolf Cukier, a 17-year-old who joined NASA as a summer intern for two months in 2019, discovered a previously unknown planet on the third day of his internship, the agency has revealed. Cukier, assigned to study the trajectory of two stars in the TOI 1338 solar system, noticed something in the orbit of two stars that was blocking the light.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: #NewPassword trends on Twitter, Mumbai Police and Google share memes
text: As '#NewPassword' is trending on Twitter, user accounts like Mumbai Police, UP Police and Google shared memes comparing 'weak' and 'strong' passwords. In its meme, Mumbai Police showed 'RoadRash' as weak password while 'RoadSafety' as strong. While Google India showed 'password123' as weak password and '1NotSoObvs2It$FullOf$pclChs3CantTouchThis' as the strong one.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: US actor Hains dies at 27, his mom says he struggled with mental illness
text: Harry Hains, known for his role in 'American Horror Story', passed away at the age 27 on January 7, his mother Jane Badler has announced. Although the cause of his death hasn't been revealed, Badler took to Instagram to share that Harry struggled with mental illness and addiction. A memorial service will be held in Los Angeles on January 12.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Sex racket busted in Mumbai's 5-star hotel, actress Amrita Dhanoa arrested
text: Mumbai Police busted a sex racket being operated at a five-star hotel in Mumbai. Police arrested Bollywood actress Amrita Dhanoa and model Richa Singh for allegedly supplying girls for prostitution at plush hotels. They conducted a raid by sending decoy customers to the hotel, during which two women were rescued from the hotel.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Why was Samson missing from Team India group pic after series win over SL?
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson, who played a T20I for India after over four years on Friday, was missing from the team's group picture after series win over Sri Lanka. He didn't join the group picture as he had to travel with 'India A' team to New Zealand. He was spotted in a picture posted by opener Mayank Agarwal from his flight.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I was mistaken for being homeless, a man gave me $5: Harry Potter actor Radcliffe
text: Harry Potter actor Daniel Radcliffe has revealed that he was mistaken for a homeless man in New York recently. Describing that he was wearing a hoodie and a big coat and was kneeling down to keep his dog warm, Radcliffe said, "I saw this guy looking at me and...[he] handed me $5 and said, 'Get yourself a coffee mate.'"
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: PM Modi asked me to support govt's J&K move in return for safe passage: Zakir Naik
text: Wanted Islamic preacher Zakir Naik has said that Indian government officials had approached him on behalf of PM Narendra Modi a few months ago. He said he refused the government's offer to provide him free passage in exchange for his support on Article 370 revocation. Naik added they also sought to use his connections to improve relations with Muslim countries.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: We'll act on acquiring Pakistan-occupied Kashmir if we get orders: Army chief
text: Addressing a press meet on Saturday, Indian Army chief MM Naravane said that if the Parliament wants PoK, then it should also belong to us. "When we get orders to that effect, we'll take appropriate action," he added. The chief stated that there's a parliamentary resolution that entire J&K is part of India.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Navy's Tejas jet lands on carrier INS Vikramaditya for first time
text: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) on Saturday said that the Naval version of Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) (N) MK1 landed successfully on aircraft carrier INS Vikramaditya at 10:02 am. "Commodore Jaideep Maolankar did the maiden landing," DRDO tweeted. "This will pave...way to develop and manufacture the Twin Engine Deck Based Fighter for the #IndianNavy," the Indian Navy tweeted.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Focus is on ABC- allegiance, belief, consolidation: Army Chief
text: Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane on Saturday said that his focus was on 'ABC'- "allegiance, belief and consolidation". "We swear allegiance to the Constitution of India, be it a jawan or an officer," he said. He added that the Army was deployed at the border to secure for Indians the core values of the Preamble to the Constitution.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Oman's Sultan Qaboos bin Said, who ruled the country since 1970, dies aged 79
text: Oman's Sultan Qaboos bin Said, who ruled the country since 1970, has passed away at the age of 79. Qaboos had been ailing for years and was in Belgium in December for treatment. He became Sultan after removing his father in a palace coup with the aim of ending Oman's isolation and using its oil revenue for modernisation and development.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I let 11 elderly Trump supporters die at retirement home: Reddit user
text: A Reddit user by the name 'LoveThisLife0101' has claimed he let eleven elderly supporters of US President Donald Trump die under his care by refusing to revive them, adding that he gave them the wrong medicine. "I am literally letting you fu**ers die off. These people vote like 100% of the time so it counts," he wrote in a post.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Killing of Iran General by US 'divine intervention', will help us rise again: ISIS
text: The Islamic State (ISIS) terrorist group has hailed the killing of top Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani by the US and described it as a "divine intervention", saying his death will help them rise again. Soleimani's Quds Force fighters were among those who fought against the Islamic State alongside the Syrian Army and the Russian forces in Syria.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: This is season 3 of this Netflix series: Nilekani on whistleblower complaints
text: Infosys Chairman Nandan Nilekani compared the number of whistleblower allegations at the company over the past few years to a Netflix series, adding that such complaints are certainly a distraction. Referring to the latest complaints, he said, "This is Season 3 of Netflix series. I can't say if there will be another season, I'm not the producer of these episodes."
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Film world always made fun of my English and criticised it: Kangana
text: Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel on Friday took to Twitter to share a video of the actress, wherein she can be seen speaking about the World Hindi Day. Kangana said that the film world always criticised and made fun of her English. "But...I kept the Hindi language as my priority because of which I...achieved major success," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Djokovic defeats Medvedev to take Serbia into ATP Cup final
text: World number two Novak Djokovic on Saturday defeated world number five Daniil Medvedev 6-1, 5-7, 6-4, to provide Serbia 2-0 lead during their semi-final clash with Russia in the ATP Cup. In the first singles match, Dusan Lajovic had defeated Karen Khachanov 7-5, 7-6(7-1) to put Serbia ahead. In doubles, Nikola Cacic and Viktor Troicki completed the 3-0 tie victory.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Alphabet Chief Legal Officer retires amid probe into affairs with employees
text: Alphabet's Chief Legal Officer David Drummond is retiring from the company on January 31. In November, Alphabet's board opened a probe into how executives handled misconduct claims. Months earlier, a former Google employee disclosed Drummond's extramarital affair with her, alleging she was forced out of her job after becoming pregnant with his child. He recently married another Google employee.
author: Dharna

headlines: Which Indian startups showcased their tech innovations at CES 2020?
text: At the first 'India Tech Park' booth at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2020, six Indian startups showcased their innovations. Among these were Wagr which displayed location-tracking device for dogs, Strom Motors with a three-wheeled electric car model and Hyper Lychee with a hand-held electric scrubber. Altifarm displayed a produce-growing smart box, while Calamus exhibited its smart e-bike.
author: Dharna

headlines: Scientists find oldest-known fossilised digestive tract
text: Scientists have discovered one of the oldest known fossilised internal anatomical structures in the form of a fossilised digestive tract dated back 550 million years. "These fossils fit within a very recognisable group of organisms, the cloudinids, that scientists use to identify the last 10 to 15 million years of the Ediacaran Period," the study's lead scientist Jim Schiffbauer said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Jupiter flinging asteroids at Earth 'like a sniper', warns scientist
text: A research has claimed Jupiter is actively flinging passing objects into the inner Solar System "like a sniper", potentially threatening Earth. Another theory says that Jupiter, with its huge mass, acts as a shield by sucking in or deflecting dangerous asteroids. Scientist Kevin Grazier said, "Simulations show...Jupiter is just as likely to send comets at Earth as deflect them away".
author: Dharna

headlines: Will make sure that CDS is a success: Army Chief General Naravane
text: Addressing media on Saturday, Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane said that the Army will make sure that the newly created post of Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) "is a success". He added that CDS is a "big step" towards integration among three services (Army, Navy, Air Force). General Naravane's predecessor General Bipin Rawat was appointed as India's first CDS.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP asks Sitharaman to modernise madrasas & start mid-day meals
text: At the pre-budget meeting on Thursday, BJP suggested Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to consider starting mid-day meals in madrasas across India and modernising them. "Though [it] extends to madrasas...but there's no uniform scientific approach to it," an official said. "Finance Minister didn't object...but government will do what is fiscally prudent for it," a BJP official reportedly said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: PETA activist dresses up as bleeding bird to protest against kite manjha
text: A People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) activist dressed up as a bleeding bird to protest against the glass-coated manjhas used to fly kites. Birds get wounded and crippled by the manjhas during the festival of Lohri when people fly kites. "I appeal to...manufacturers...people...to stop using manjhas...[they cause] harm to birds, animals and even people," the activist said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 2 in UP get death penalty for Dalit minor's gangrape, murder in 2016
text: A POCSO court in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly awarded death sentence to two persons for raping and murdering a 12-year-old Dalit girl in 2016, in "rarest of the rare" case. During the post-mortem, a stick was found inserted in the victim's private part. The incident had happened when the victim had gone to a field for work with her mother.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Unscientific to marry within the same-gotra: Haryana CM Khattar
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has said that Khap panchayats' stand against same-gotra marriages has a scientific basis. Terming marrying in the same gotra, "a crime", Khattar said, "It is a belief in...Khap panchayats that there is a relationship of brother and sister between men and women of same gotra." Khap panchayats claim that such marriages weaken the generation genetically.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Boeing's ousted CEO leaves with $62 million despite no severance package
text: Boeing's ousted CEO Dennis Muilenburg departed the company with $62 million in compensation and pension benefits, even without a severance package. The revelation comes hours after a parts supplier, which earned half of its revenues from 737 MAX, laid off 2,800 workers. Boeing recently halted the production of 737 MAX, which has been grounded since March following two fatal crashes.
author: Dharna

headlines: Iran admits it 'unintentionally' shot down Ukrainian plane carrying 176 people
text: Iran on Saturday announced that its military "unintentionally" shot down a Ukrainian plane, killing all 176 aboard. The statement blamed "human error" for the incident. The aircraft, a Boeing 737 operated by Ukrainian International Airlines, crashed after takeoff from Imam Khomeini International Airport just hours after Iran launched over a dozen missiles at US forces in Iraq.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Iran apologises for downing plane, says 'crisis caused by US led to disaster'
text: Apologising for unintentionally downing the Ukrainian plane carrying 176 people, Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif on Saturday tweeted, "A sad day. Human error at time of crisis caused by US adventurism led to disaster." "Our profound regrets...and condolences to our people, to the families of all victims, and to other affected nations," he further wrote.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: What reason did Iran give for downing Ukrainian plane carrying 176 people?
text: Iran has said that after it hit US troops with missiles, warplanes belonging to the US increased flights in the airspace surrounding the country. The Ukrainian airliner carrying 176 people was shot down as it moved very close to a sensitive military spot, it added. The altitude and direction of the flight's movement were like an enemy target, it stated.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Deeply regret this disastrous mistake: Iran Prez on downing of plane carrying 176
text: After Iran admitted that it unintentionally shot down the Ukrainian plane carrying 176 people, President Hassan Rouhani tweeted, "Iran deeply regrets this disastrous mistake." "My thoughts and prayers go to all the mourning families. I offer my sincerest condolences," he added. "Investigations continue to identify & prosecute this great tragedy & unforgivable mistake," he further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Shahid gets 13 stitches on lips after ball hits him during Jersey shooting: Report
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor got injured while shooting for his upcoming film Jersey at the Mohali Stadium on Friday, when he was hit by a cricket ball on his lips, according to PTI report. Shahid was reportedly rushed to a hospital as his mouth started bleeding and received 13 stitches. The actor will reportedly take a break for a few days.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Segway's wheelchair-like vehicle crashes into wall during 1st public demo
text: Segway's transportation pod that resembles an egg-shaped wheelchair crashed into a wall during the first public demonstration of the prototype, that cost an estimated multi-million dollars in development. The journalist at CES, who accidentally accelerated the 'S-Pod', did not suffer any injuries in the incident. The "self-balancing" S-Pod can ferry people around enclosed campuses like airports.
author: Dharna

headlines: 80-year-old man develops 'eggshell' of calcium around his swollen testicle
text: Doctors at Lucknow's King George's Medical University found that an "eggshell" of calcium had developed around the swollen testicle of an 80-year-old man. Doctors described it as a case of "longstanding hydrocele". "A hydrocele is an abnormal fluid collection within the tunica vaginalis of the scrotum. Calcification of hydrocele sac is a rare complication," the doctors stated.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Agra police perform last rites of rape victim after no one claims her dead body
text: Police officers in Uttar Pradesh's Agra performed the last rites of a rape victim on Friday, days after nobody claimed her body after she died at a hospital. The last rites were performed as per Hindu rituals and a 'Bhoj' was also organised by the police officers. The officers were praised by senior officials for the act.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 19-storey apartment building demolished with controlled explosion in Kerala
text: A video has surfaced online, showing H2O Holy Faith apartment complex being demolished within seconds with controlled explosion in Kerala's Kochi on Saturday. The building, which had 91 apartments and 19 floors, was razed using 212.4kg explosives. It is first of the four apartment complexes in Maradu Municipality that have to get demolished as per Supreme Court order.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: IAF officer poses as Amit Shah on phone, asks MP Guv to appoint friend as V-C
text: Madhya Pradesh Police has arrested IAF Wing Commander Kuldip Vaghela for allegedly posing as Union Home Minister Amit Shah in a phone call to state Governor Lalji Tandon to influence his friend's appointment as a medical university's Vice-Chancellor. His friend and Dental Surgeons Association of India's President Dr Chandresh Shukla, who allegedly posed as Shah's assistant, has also been arrested.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: DNA will reveal death toll in UP bus fire as bones are scattered: Police
text: After a bus carrying around 45 people in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj caught fire following collision with a truck, police said, "The bodies are badly burned, their bones are scattered, so only a DNA test will determine the death toll." Adding that 25 people were rescued, the police stated, "18-20 are missing, maybe they died but it is not certain yet."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: India's DGCA called 'stupid', 'fools' by Boeing staff in internal messages
text: Internal messages released by Boeing showed employees ridiculing India's Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) while discussing the approval process of 737 MAX. "The DGCA is apparently even stupider," an employee said, after calling another regulator's officials "idiots". On 'convincing' DGCA of not mandating simulator-based training, another said, "I just Jedi mind tricked (these) fools."
author: Dharna

headlines: Varun spends 2 days with Indian Air Force, says 'most magical days'
text: Varun Dhawan took to Twitter to reveal that he spent the "most magical" two days with Indian Air Force and also shared pictures of himself with the soldiers. "Best experience of my life. I've so much gratitude for men...women who serve our nation," he said. Varun will portray Param Vir Chakra recipient, Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal, in an upcoming film.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I don't give them time and attention: Shibani Dandekar on trolls
text: Actress-singer Shibani Dandekar, while talking about how she tackles trolling on social media, said that she doesn't give time and attention to people who write "nasty things". "I just skim and read but don't go through the comments completely," she added. Shibani further said she remembers only good things as there are many people who have nice things to say.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Cong showing solidarity to Deepika: Shashi on Chhapaak's free tickets
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said they're showing solidarity to Deepika Padukone by distributing free tickets of her recent release, 'Chhapaak'. This comes after a section of BJP leaders gave a call to boycott the film after Deepika made a visit to the JNU. "We don't want anyone to be boycotted because of showing courage to stand with...students," said Shashi.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Happy to be compared: Saif on comparison with Ranveer in Tanhaji
text: Actor Saif Ali Khan, while talking about his role in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' being compared with Ranveer Singh's in 'Padmaavat', said that he's happy to be compared with another actor's performance. He further appreciated Ranveer for setting the "bar high for essaying a historical character in Hindi films". However, he added that both roles are completely different.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Facebook rolls out 'The New Facebook' to some users: Report
text: Latest updates on redesigned version of Facebook's web interface, "The New Facebook",  say it has been rolled out to a "small percentage" of users, a report said. The users having access to the version will be testing the interface and providing feedback for a widespread release. The new interface features a less cluttered background and brighter colours.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Arnold Schwarzenegger humanoid robot answers questions at CES
text: A humanoid android called Robo-C, of Arnold Schwarzenegger, answered questions and told jokes at CES 2020. Russian startup Promobot, which made the robot, said Robo-C isn't confined to a particular form and can be made as per the users' preferences. Promobot also said that Robo-C could work as an office/personal assistant or a tour guide.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Amazon fires employees for leaking customer email ids, phone numbers
text: Amazon has fired several of its employees after they were found to be leaking customer information like email addresses and phone numbers to a third-party, in violation of Amazon's policies. Amazon notified the affected users via email and said, "This isn't a result of anything you have done." Recently, Amazon subsidiary Ring fired four employees for improperly accessing user videos.
author: Dharna

headlines: IFC to put $30 million in Sachin Bansal's Navi at $650 million valuation
text: World Bank arm International Finance Corporation (IFC) is looking to invest $30 million (₹210 crore) to pick a 4.5% stake in Navi Technologies, co-founded by Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal. The transaction would value Navi at $650 million. IFC said the investment would help Navi transform microlender CIFCPL, which Bansal acquired last year, into a technology-led universal bank or Navi Bank.
author: Dharna

headlines: Researchers make model to predict a language's risk of disappearance
text: A team of researchers affiliated with multiple institutions in New Zealand has developed a mathematical model that can be used to predict whether a language is at risk of disappearing. The team used their model to measure the likelihood of the Welsh language, finding the language to be robust and very likely to survive well into the future.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Call off agitation, basic demands met: MHRD to JNU students
text: After meetings with the JNU V-C, students' unions and the UGC, the HRD Ministry appealed to the students to call off agitation, adding that their basic demands have been met on the JNU fee hike issue. This comes after it was announced on Friday that hostel students will not have to bear utility and service charges in the winter semester.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: SC to hear curative petitions of 2 Nirbhaya convicts on Jan 14
text: A five-judge bench of Supreme Court on January 14 will hear curative petitions filed by two death row convicts Vinay Kumar Sharma and Mukesh involved in 2012 Nirbhaya gangrape case. The bench will include Justices NV Ramana, Arun Mishra, RF Nariman, R Banumathi and Ashok Bhushan. In his curative petition, Vinay has said that he was only 19 in 2012.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Hyderabad MP Owaisi manages traffic after rally leads to jam
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and his party members on Friday were seen managing traffic in Hyderabad after a rally led to traffic jam. To protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens (NRC), AIMIM organised 'Tiranga Yatra' which led to congestion on road. On people holding tricolours, Owaisi said, "Sanghis...won't be happy...not be able to digest this."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Govt should print notes, put it in hands of people: Swamy on economy
text: BJP MP Subramanian Swamy, while commenting on India's economy, said that it is going through "dire times" and added that government needs to print notes and "put it in the hands of people to boost demand". He further said that "tax terrorism" should be controlled to encourage investors. "Everything...downwards, if [this] continues banks will close...it'll lead to disaster," he added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Deeply saddened: PM Modi after 20 killed in UP bus fire
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday condoled the bus accident in UP's Kannauj in which 20 people are feared dead. "I'm deeply saddened...express my condolences....and wish a speedy recovery to the injured persons," he tweeted. A double-decker bus carrying 45 passengers en route Jaipur from Kannauj on Friday collided with a truck on GT Road, following which both caught fire.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Rana Kapoor, family firms sell all remaining shares in Yes Bank
text: Rana Kapoor and his family-run companies Yes Capital and Morgan Credits have exited their stake in Yes Bank, losing all control and voting rights. By the end of December, their stake in the private lender, that Kapoor co-founded in 2003, came down to 'nil'. The three offloaded most of their shares in Yes Bank in September, with only 4.72% remaining.
author: Dharna

headlines: Bus with 50 passengers, truck catch fire after collision in UP, several feared dead
text: A double-decker bus carrying 50 passengers and a truck caught fire after colliding on GT road in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj at around 8.30 pm on Friday. "The fire tenders are trying to control the fire. There could be casualties as people are inside. It will be clear only after the fire gets under control," a police official said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: US tried to kill a second Iranian military official on the day it killed Soleimani
text: The US carried out a secret operation in Yemen that targeted, but failed to kill, an Iranian military official last week, two US officials told Reuters. The strike was carried out on the same day that the US killed top Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani. One of the US officials named the Iranian who had been targeted as Abdul Reza Shahlai.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: J&K administration revokes detention orders of 26 PSA detainees
text: The Jammu and Kashmir administration on Friday revoked detention warrants against 26 people who were held under the Public Safety Act (PSA) after abrogation of Article 370 last year. Several people were booked under PSA following Centre's decision to revoke special status of the erstwhile state of Jammu and Kashmir and bifurcate it into two Union Territories.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Police fired without provocation: Kumaraswamy on Mangaluru violence
text: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Friday demanded setting up of a House committee to probe violence during anti-CAA protest in Mangaluru. He also released videos of clashes during the protest and accused the police of selective targeting and firing without provocation. "The police in Mangaluru have lied to people and are not trustworthy," he said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bumrah overtakes Chahal, Ashwin to become India's top wicket-taker in T20Is
text: Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has become the highest wicket-taker for India in T20I cricket, achieving the feat during the third T20I against Sri Lanka. The 26-year-old pacer has now taken 53 wickets in T20I cricket, one more than both leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal and off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin. Bumrah has taken 53 wickets in 45 matches.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 6-time F1 champ Hamilton donates ₹3.5 crore to Australian wildlife rescue
text: Six-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton said on Thursday that he was donating $500,000 (₹3.5 crore) towards the rescue and care of wildlife caught in bushfires ravaging southeast Australia. "It saddens me deeply to know that over 1 billion animals in Australia died a painful death, no way out, not their fault," he said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Mark Waugh labels Marnus Labuschagne as no. 1 Test batsman
text: Ex-Australia batsman Mark Waugh has labelled Marnus Labuschagne as the number one Test batsman. "I think he can carry his form in...white-ball format as well. I think he should bat in top 4, with Aaron Finch and David Warner opening, Steve Smith at 3 and Labhushagne at 4," he added. India-Australia three-match ODI series will begin on January 14.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: ICC shouldn't push four-day Tests if it is a hard sell: Andrew Strauss
text: Ex-England captain Andrew Strauss said ICC shouldn't go through with their proposal of four-day Tests if the idea ends up being difficult to sell to stakeholders. "We shouldn't assume Test cricket is healthy just because it's popular in England. In lots of parts of the world, boards are struggling financially and Test cricket isn't paying the bills," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Income tax officials conduct surprise search at OYO
text: SoftBank-backed hotel chain OYO on Friday said income tax authorities had carried out a surprise search at one of its four offices in Haryana's Gurugram. "There is a routine TDS survey in progress in one of our offices. We are cooperating with the authorities," a spokesperson said. It was not clear what prompted the search and the company didn't elaborate.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Who is Pawan Jallad, the man who will hang all 4 Nirbhaya case convicts?
text: Pawan Jallad, who'll hang all four Nirbhaya gangrape case convicts on January 22, is a fourth-generation jallad (hangman) of Kallu Jallad. His original name is Sindhi Ram and lives in a one-room set house, allotted to him by the Meerut administration under the Kanshiram Awas Yojna, with his wife and seven children. He will get ₹1 lakh for the execution.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Will use ₹1L I get from hanging Nirbhaya convicts for daughter's marriage: Jallad
text: Pawan Jallad, the hangman who has been chosen to execute all the four Nirbhaya gangrape convicts, has said he'll be awarded ₹1 lakh by the government and he'll use it for his daughter's marriage. He added, "My daughter is grown up. But I have no money to marry her off...Believe me, this money gives me a new lease of life."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Deepika put Chhapaak at risk, she inspires us: Rajan on actress' silent protest
text: Speaking about Deepika Padukone joining protesting students at Jawaharlal Nehru University on Tuesday, ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that she "inspires us all to take stock of what is truly at stake". Rajan added the actress put attendance at her latest movie 'Chhapaak' at risk by "registering her silent protest by meeting with the victims of the attack on JNU".
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Meghan flies to Canada after stepping back from royal duties
text: The Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle has returned to Canada to join her son after she and Prince Harry announced that they were stepping back as senior members of the Royal Family and wanted to become financially independent. Meanwhile, the Queen, Prince Charles, Prince William and Harry have asked senior aides to find a "workable solution," reports said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 13 killed, 20 injured in blast at mosque in Pakistan
text: At least 13 people were killed and 20 others were injured in an explosion at a mosque in Quetta, Pakistan. An improvised explosive device went off during evening prayers on Friday. This comes days after two men were killed and over 12 others were injured in an explosion near a vehicle of the security forces in Quetta.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US Navy says Russian warship 'aggressively approached' destroyer, shares video
text: A Russian warship "aggressively approached" a US Navy destroyer in North Arabian Sea on Thursday, nearly causing a collision, the US Navy said. USS Farragut sounded five short blasts- the international maritime signal for danger of a collision. "The Russian ship initially refused but ultimately altered course and the two ships opened distance from one another," the US Navy added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Only 17 people remain poor in Chinese province with population of 8 crore
text: Only 17 people from six families remain poor in China's Jiangsu province which has a population of eight crore, government data showed. More than 99.99% of Jiangsu's 25.4 lakh poor people had been lifted out of extreme poverty, an official said. Absolute poverty is defined in China as per capita net income of 2,300 yuan (nearly ₹23,600).
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: No evidence of CEO calling directors 'madrasis' and 'diva': Infosys
text: India's second-largest IT firm Infosys on Friday said that an independent investigation found no evidence that CEO Salil Parekh made inappropriate personal comments with respect to other board members. Whistleblowers alleged that Parekh referred to directors DN Prahlad and D Sundaram as 'madrasis' and Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw as 'diva'. Infosys also found no evidence of financial misconduct by Parekh.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: What was the emergency on August 4: Sibal after SC's order on J&K
text: Congress leader Kapil Sibal asked Home Minister Amit Shah what the emergency was behind imposing Section 144 on August 4 in J&K, a day before Article 370 was abrogated. The government cannot use Section 144 to suppress the freedom of speech, he added. This came after the Supreme Court directed J&K administration to review internet restrictions within seven days.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Navigation system that tells driver local traffic rules unveiled
text: HERE Lanes, a 3D road model unveiled at CES 2020, provides driver with accurate information of various conditions like the local traffic rules while navigating. It gathers data on lane topology including curvature of roads, and informs driver about vehicle restrictions and number of lanes. The system continues assisting even when vehicle's optical sensors are blocked by snow or fog.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Apple sued for allegedly stealing Watch's health monitoring technology
text: Masimo, a medical technology company, filed a lawsuit against Apple for allegedly stealing its inventions related to health monitoring for Apple Watch. Masimo and its spin-off Cercacor stated Apple used its technology for non-invasive monitoring using light to overcome issues with its Watch. The companies sought orders to block further use of their inventions in Apple Watch 4 and 5.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: On whose orders is Delhi CM Kejriwal silent on JNU violence: Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of staying silent on the violence in JNU and questioned who had stopped him from "standing up for citizens' rights". Talking about an old tweet by Kejriwal on late former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit wherein he'd said "we don't want a weak CM", Tharoor asked Kejriwal to "read that tweet today."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Grey parrots found to share currency to help partners get food
text: Scientists claim on the basis of observed behaviour that African grey parrots (Psittacus erithacus) may be the first avian known to engage in helpful behaviour towards partners in different cages. The parrots, trained to transfer tokens in exchange for food, were found to spontaneously and voluntarily help their partner in a neighbouring compartment by providing it with tokens.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Cuttlefish wearing 3D glasses tried to attack projected prey: Study
text: Scientists have observed that cuttlefish fastened with 3D glasses extended their tentacles and attacked the shrimp that was projected on screens in front of their tanks. The researchers successfully demonstrated that, like humans, cuttlefish brains can compute distance using incoming information from both eyes at once. For the study, researchers used 11 different European cuttlefish.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Body temperatures lower than they were 2 centuries ago: Study
text: A new study has determined that mean body temperature in men and women in the USA, after adjusting for age, height, and weight has decreased monotonically by 0.03°C per birth decade. The study, which analysed 677,423 human body temperature measurements from three different cohort populations spanning 197 birth years, found men's average temperature to be 36.38°C, while women's reached 36.66°C.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: US imposes fresh sanctions on Iran for missile attacks
text: The United States has imposed new sanctions on Iran in retaliation for its missile attack on US forces in Iraq this week. The targets of the sanctions include Iran's manufacturing, mining, textile sectors and 8 senior Iranian officials. "The United States is targeting senior Iranian officials for their involvement and complicity in Tuesday's ballistic missile strikes," US Treasury Secretary said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Yes Bank's head of audit committee quits, cites governance concerns
text: Yes Bank's audit committee chairman Uttam Prakash Agarwal stepped down from his post and resigned as independent director citing "serious concerns" over deteriorating corporate governance standards and failure of compliance at the bank. Agarwal also raised concerns over management practices of the bank's senior leadership in his resignation letter. He was appointed to the board in November 2018.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's oil demand growth to overtake China by mid-2020s: IEA
text: The International Energy Agency (IEA) has said India's oil demand growth is set to overtake China by mid-2020s as its demand is expected to reach 6 million barrels per day (bpd) by 2024 from 4.4 million bpd in 2017. However, IEA also said India could become more reliant on imports and more vulnerable to supply disruptions in the Middle East.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India clinch T20I series 2-0, record 19th straight unbeaten series vs SL in 11 yrs
text: India defeated Sri Lanka in third T20I in Pune on Friday to clinch the three-match series 2-0. With this, India are now unbeaten in 19 series (won 17, drawn two) across formats against Sri Lanka dating back to August 2008. The match witnessed Virat Kohli become the fastest batsman to score 11,000 runs in international cricket as captain (196 innings).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Citizenship (Amendment) Act comes into effect
text: The Ministry of Home Affairs has notified January 10 as the date from which provisions of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019, shall come into force amid nationwide protests against the law. CAA aims to fast-track citizenship for Hindus, Parsis, Sikhs, Buddhists, Jains and Christians who arrived in India before December 31, 2014, from Muslim-majority Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Go to police to clear CAA doubts: Court to Seemapuri violence accused
text: A Delhi court on Friday granted bail to 12 people arrested in connection with violence in Delhi's Seemapuri area during anti-CAA protests on December 20. The court while granting the bail asked all the accused to appear before the Seemapuri police on January 19 where the "Investigating Officer/Station House Officer shall endeavour to remove their doubts in respect of CAA".
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Gujarat Assembly passes resolution congratulating PM, Shah for CAA
text: Gujarat Legislative Assembly on Friday passed a resolution in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). The resolution was passed with a majority vote after a two-hour discussion. It congratulated PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah for their "bold and historic decision" to bring in Citizenship (Amendment) Bill and secure its passage in the Parliament.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: You can't curse: 15-yr-old Coco Gauff after her father uses 'damn' word
text: US' 15-year-old tennis player Coco Gauff told her father not to curse after he used the 'damn' word while giving her a pep talk during her match. "You can’t curse...You said the D-word," she said. Her father replied, "Oh, that one doesn’t really count." "In some places it does," she added. "OK, I’m sorry about that," he said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: We are looking gora: Ex-Pak captain Sarfaraz trolled for comment in viral video
text: A video has gone viral, wherein former Pakistan cricket team captain Sarfaraz Ahmed can be heard saying, "We are looking gora bro." Reacting to Sarfaraz's remark, a user wrote, "Sarfaraz's inferiority complex with kala and gora is real, and it is very backwards." Another wrote, "Sarfaraz paida hi memes banne ke liye hua hai."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Virat Kohli becomes fastest batsman to score 11,000 int'l runs as captain
text: Virat Kohli has become the fastest batsman to score 11,000 runs as captain in international cricket, achieving the feat in his 196th international innings as captain during the third T20I against Sri Lanka on Friday. Kohli overtook former Australia captain Ricky Ponting, who took 252 innings to score 11,000 international runs as captain. Kohli scored 26 runs off 17 deliveries.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sanju Samson sets Indian record for longest gap between 2 T20I matches
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson has set the record for the most consecutive T20I matches missed between two appearances for India. The 25-year-old is playing his first T20I since July 19, 2015, missing 73 T20I matches in between. Pacer Umesh Yadav held the previous record, missing 65 T20Is between two appearances. Samson scored six runs off two deliveries against Sri Lanka today.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Cong UP chief accompanying Priyanka Gandhi in Varanasi falls in river
text: Congress' UP Chief Ajay Kumar Lallu on Friday tripped and fell into river Ganga, while attempting to board a boat with party General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. Lallu was helped on-board by Congress workers present on the boat. The incident took place because the boat was overcrowded. Priyanka was in Varanasi on Friday to meet activists held during anti-CAA protests.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Child escapes unhurt after falling out of moving car; IPS officer shares video
text: A child escaped unhurt after falling out of a moving car reportedly in Kerala, a video of which was shared on Twitter by IPS officer Pankaj Nain. A mishap was avoided after other vehicles stopped immediately. "Child lock and child seats are very important when travelling with children. Check all doors are closed properly," Nain wrote sharing the video.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Yes Bank rejects $1.2 billion investment from Erwin Singh Braich & SPGP
text: Yes Bank on Friday rejected the $1.2 billion investment offer it had received from Canada's Erwin Singh Braich and Hong Kong-based SPGP Holdings. From a list of potential investors that the lender had mentioned, Yes Bank said only investments from Citax Holdings are still being considered. Further, its board approved fundraising of up to $1.4 billion through debt and equity.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi understands pain selectively: BJP's Sambit Patra
text: On Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's visit to family members of those who have been arrested or have died during anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests in Uttar Pradesh,  BJP's Sambit Patra said she understands pain "selectively". "When she visited AIIMS trauma centre she chose to look away from the injured students who differed from her ideology. This reeks of selectivism," Patra added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Spinners to play big roles in ODI series against India: Pat Cummins
text: Talking about the upcoming ODI series against India, Australia pacer Pat Cummins said that the spinners will play a "bigger part" in the series. Cummins explained the rationale stating that the ball gets softer as the game progresses on Indian tracks, making it easier for spinners. "They [spinners] are certainly important, especially in the middle overs," he added.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Rani Rampal nominated for 'World Games Athlete of the Year'
text: The Indian women's hockey team captain Rani Rampal has been nominated for the 'World Games Athlete of the Year' by the sport's governing body FIH. Overall 25 athletes have been nominated for this award from their respective sports by their international federations. The winner will be decided by online voting which closes on January 30.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Important that we don't overplay the Bumrah factor: Finch
text: Speaking about Jasprit Bumrah, Australian batsman Aaron Finch said, "[T]he more the guys face him, the more exposure you get, the more you start to understand how he bowls... [I]t is important that we don't overplay that too much." "[Y]ou love watching him bowl. He is fast and aggressive and his execution is pretty spot on," Finch added about Bumrah.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: World number one Nadal upset by David Goffin at ATP Cup
text: Spanish world number one men's singles player Rafael Nadal suffered a loss to Belgium's David Goffin at the ATP Cup on Friday. Nadal, who had not dropped a set this year before meeting Goffin, lost the match with a scoreline that read 4-6, 6-7 (3-7). "I had to hold my nerve for a long time, which wasn't easy," Goffin said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Liverpool winning PL will help how I feel: Ex-skipper Gerrard
text: Former Liverpool captain Steven Gerrard said that if the Reds win the Premier League then it'll help him with how he feels about their 2014 campaign. In their 36th match, Gerrard had slipped in midfield, losing the ball to Chelsea's Demba Ba, who scored. Liverpool lost the match 0-2 and then went on to finish the season at number two.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Microsoft releases tool that scans chats to detect sexual predators
text: Microsoft shared release of a free tool which will help companies detect online child abuse by scanning online text chats and identifying online predators. Named "Project Artemis", the tool will search through historical messages and look for indicative patterns and characteristics before assigning a probability rating. The companies can use these ratings to flag conversations on their platform.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Sachin Bansal's Chaitanya India Fin Credit seeks universal bank licence
text: Flipkart Co-Founder Sachin Bansal's Navi Technologies has said its microfinance firm Chaitanya India Fin Credit submitted an application to RBI for a universal bank licence. The proposed Navi bank would provide "mass market banking solutions for individuals, MSMEs and select corporates". Chaitanya currently has operations in Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Maharashtra and Jharkhand.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Restaurants tell CCI about issues they face on foodtech platforms
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) released a study which listed out the issues that restaurants face on foodtech platforms. While platforms claimed participation in discount schemes was voluntary, partners said their non-participation affected visibility on platforms. The partners also told CCI that over the years the burden of funding discounts gradually shifted from platforms to them.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: China develops world’s first mobile quantum satellite station
text: The world's first portable ground station for sending and receiving secure quantum communications is up and running in China. The portable satellite station the properties of photons for establishing a secure channel for transmitting and receiving quantum communications. The station has been successfully connected to Mozi, the world's first quantum communications satellite developed back in 2016.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Copper-based nanomaterials found to kill cancer cells in mice
text: A team of researchers has succeeded in killing tumour cells in mice using nano-sized copper compounds together with immunotherapy. The team found that tumours are sensitive to copper oxide nanoparticles, while the compound does not affect healthy cells. The cancer returned after treating with only the nanoparticles, after which the team combined the nanoparticles with immunotherapy.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: BJP announces 15-member election committee for Delhi polls
text: Delhi BJP on Friday announced its 15-member election committee for the upcoming February 8 Delhi Assembly polls. The committee includes BJP's Delhi President Manoj Tiwari, all BJP MPs from Delhi and former Delhi BJP president Vijay Goel among others. In December, the party had announced a poll management committee and 35 other panels for election-related works.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Modi's Budget meet with economists for capitalist friends: Rahul
text: On Prime Minister Narendra Modi's meeting with economists and industry experts at NITI Aayog ahead of Union Budget, Congress' Rahul Gandhi said, "Modi's most extensive Budget consultation ever, is reserved for crony capitalist friends & the super rich." Rahul also said that Modi has no interest in the views or voices of people like farmers, students, employees and small businessmen.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: What kind of party is scared of film on acid attack: AAP to BJP
text: Commenting on Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's tweet to boycott Deepika Padukone's 'Chhapaak', Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that it's "disgraceful" to see people "fearing certain films". "How can [BJP] be scared of movie...based on...acid attack victim?" he added. "What kind of party [gets]...intimidated...and fears...films that invoke a sense of social responsibilities?" he added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: INS Vikramaditya deployed amid Pak-China naval drill: Report
text: India has deployed aircraft carrier INS Vikramaditya in the Arabian Sea after Pakistan and China launched a naval exercise in the region, a news agency has claimed. Some of the top Navy officials are onboard the aircraft carrier, it further said. Pakistan and China on Monday this week launched a nine-day exercise 'Sea Guardians' to increase cooperation between their navies.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: JNUSU President suspect in JNU violence case, Delhi Police releases pic
text: Addressing a press conference on JNU violence, Delhi Police said JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh is among the suspects in violence that took place inside the campus on January 5. Delhi Police released a picture showing Aishe inside the campus with the description, "Aishe leading her masked violent comrade gang in hostels." Police also named eight other suspects in the case.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: NSUI gives out free 'Chhapaak' tickets, BJP free 'Tanhaji' tickets in Bhopal
text: National Students' Union of Indian (NSUI) workers were seen distributing free tickets for 'Chhapaak' movie and BJP workers were seen distributing free tickets for 'Tanhaji' movie in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. This comes amid protests against Deepika Padukone and boycott calls against 'Chhapaak' after the actress visited JNU to express solidarity with protesting students earlier this week.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Gang war common in college, people were openly killed near my hostel: Kangana
text: Reacting to violence at JNU, Kangana Ranaut said, "I must tell you that gang war is quite common during college life." "I used to stay at a girls hostel alongside a boys hostel where people were followed and murdered in broad daylight," she added. She recalled that once her hostel manager had saved a boy from being killed by mob.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Hrithik's mother shares actor's pics from his brain surgery on his 46th birthday
text: On the occasion of Hrithik Roshan's 46th birthday, his mother Pinkie Roshan shared pictures from the day he underwent brain surgery. "Before Duggu was going for his brain surgery, I was almost fainting," she wrote on Instagram. "As he saw the sadness in my eyes, he winked and as if by magic he made me smile," she added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 'Chhapaak' makers challenge order asking them to give credit to victim's lawyer
text: Fox Studios and the director of 'Chhapaak' Meghna Gulzar have filed an appeal in the Delhi High Court, challenging a lower court's order asking them to give due credit to lawyer Aparna Bhat. Bhat was the legal representative of Laxmi Agarwal, the acid attack survivor on whom the film is based. The High Court will announce its verdict on Saturday.n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pak should bring CAA-like law, take away India's aggrieved Muslims: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA from Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh, Vikram Saini, has said that Pakistan should also introduce the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and take away India's persecuted Muslims to their country. "Do an exchange. People who are persecuted there (Pakistan) should come to India and those who are oppressed here (India) should go to Pakistan. Who is stopping them?" he said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rohit Sharma mocks proposal of 4-day Test matches
text: Team India opener Rohit Sharma mocked the proposal of four-day Test cricket. "If it is a four-day, it is not a Test match. Four-day means a first-class match. It is as simple as that," he added. Earlier, Team India head coach Ravi Shastri and captain Virat Kohli had expressed their disapproval for making four-day Tests mandatory.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kya merit hai aapke lalla ka: Kanhaiya to Shah on his son being BCCI secretary
text: Taking a dig at Home Minister Amit Shah on questioning the 'merit' of the students who come to study at JNU, ex-JNUSU President Kanhaiya Kumar said, "You talk of merit. Kya merit hai aapke lalla ka? How has [Jay Shah] been made...BCCI secretary?" "Except the fact his face is a carbon copy of Amit Shah's...what's that man’s merit?" he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: OYO fires 1,200 employees in India, to dismiss another 1,200: Reports
text: SoftBank-backed hospitality startup OYO has fired 1,200 of its 10,000 staff in India and is planning to let go of another 1,200 as it undergoes a restructuring, according to reports.
