The company has also reportedly dismissed 5% or 600 of its 12,000 employees in China partly due to non-performance. Notably, OYO has projected losses in India and China until 2022.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Deepika was patriot before visiting JNU, now she's being called traitor: Kanhaiya
text: Taking a dig at BJP, ex-JNUSU President Kanhaiya Kumar said actress Deepika Padukone was a patriot when she was an ambassador for a PM Narendra Modi-led government initiative, but is being called traitor after visiting JNU. "She didn't raise slogans, didn't take Modiji's name...She just came and met the injured...but calls were given to boycott her film," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: BJP, ABVP were blamed for JNU violence, but Left responsible: Javadekar
text: After Delhi Police on Friday released the names of nine suspects including JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh for the JNU violence, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said, "The chorus that was created deliberately to blame ABVP, BJP and others, wasn't true." "It is the Left organisations that pre-planned violence, disabled CCTV and destroyed server," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Seeing is believing, saw normalcy in daily lives: Vietnamese envoy on J&K visit
text: Vietnamese Ambassador to India, Pham Sanh Chau said that he saw a "normalcy in the daily lives of the people" in J&K. "It was a very worthwhile trip. Seeing is believing...I see signs of happiness on the faces of people when I talk to them." Chau added. A delegation of 15 envoys from different countries is visiting J&K.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: There's a conducive environment, I appeal students to be back: JNU V-C
text: JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar has said that there's a conducive environment in the university and has appealed students to be back. "Thousands of students are registering for winter semester exams. The JNU admin is very flexible and we are doing everything to facilitate the students," he added. "We hope the culprits in JNU violence case be punished," he said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: We're not scared, have proof of how I was attacked: JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh
text: After being named as one of the suspects in the Jawaharlal Nehru University violence case, JNU Students' Union President Aishe Ghosh said, "We have not done anything wrong. We are not scared of Delhi Police." "I also have evidence to show how I was attacked... We'll stand by the law and take our movement ahead peacefully and democratically," she added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 18-yr-old fiancée hired killer to murder Pak's 1st Sikh anchor's 25-yr-old brother
text: Ravinder Singh, the 25-year-old brother of Pakistan's first Sikh anchor Harmeet Singh, was shot dead by contract killer hired by his fiancée Prem Kumari, Peshawar Police told media on Friday. She allegedly didn't want to marry Ravinder and had promised the hitmen PKR 7 lakh for his murder. Prem Kumari has been taken into police custody.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 3 UP policemen seen in video beating a theft accused suspended
text: Three UP policemen were suspended and an FIR was registered against them after a video surfaced of them beating up a mobile phone theft suspect in Deoria, said a senior police official on Thursday. The theft accused was picked up by police on Wednesday after a complaint. Three constables then took him to the police station and beat him up.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Left design unmasked: Smriti after suspects named in JNU violence
text: Reacting to Delhi Police's press conference revealing names of the suspects of JNU violence, Union Minister Smriti Irani on Friday said that the "Left design in JNU" has been "unmasked". "They led mobs of mayhem, destroyed public property paid for by taxpayers, disallowed new students from being enrolled, used the campus as a political battleground," she said on Twitter.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: DU prof shares poster calling him 'JNU traitor', says 'Left doesn’t like my dissent'
text: Assistant Professor at Delhi University, Abhinav Prakash, has shared a picture of a poster calling him a 'Traitor of JNU'. Asking JNU Student Union to "stop cheap theatrics", Prakash tweeted, "I know JNU Left doesn't like my dissent & challenge to their narrative but this is new low even by ur standards." He also threatened to take legal action.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Infosys gives CEO Salil Parekh clean chit after interviewing 77 persons
text: Infosys on Friday gave a clean chit to CEO Salil Parekh after an independent investigation found no evidence of financial impropriety or executive misconduct. The company said it interviewed 77 people and reviewed 2.1 lakh documents since late October when the allegations were made public. Anonymous whistleblowers had accused Parekh of "unethical practices" to boost short-term revenue and profits.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Congress with anti-CAA protesters: Priyanka Gandhi in Varanasi
text: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday visited Varanasi and interacted with anti-CAA protesters who were jailed in December last year. "There has been sheer injustice with them. I am with them. I am proud of them. I thank them for raising their voice," she said. "Police did injustice with them at the instance of the government," she added.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Verona fan gets banned for 5 yrs over racial abuse of Balotelli
text: A 38-year-old Italian man has been handed a five-year stadium ban after being found guilty of directing racial abuse at Italian striker Mario Balotelli in November. Balotelli, playing for Brescia, had threatened to walk off the pitch after hearing monkey chants from the stands. The man was identified by Verona police after they reviewed CCTV footage and eyewitness accounts.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Tottenham's Kane ruled out for 3 months with hamstring injury
text: Tottenham's striker Harry Kane will undergo surgery on his hamstring and is expected to be out of action until April, the Premier League club said on Thursday. Kane, who has scored 27 goals for Spurs and England this season, suffered the injury during Tottenham's 1-0 Premier League defeat at Southampton on New Year's Day.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Messi, Joao Felix square up in Barca-Atletico Spanish Super Cup semis
text: Barcelona forward Lionel Messi and Atletico Madrid forward Joao Felix entered into a heated exchange during their Spanish Super Cup semi-final clash on Thursday. The incident happened when the two players were walking off the pitch after a goalless first-half. In the second-half, Koke, Alvaro Morata and Angel Correa helped Atletico beat Barcelona 3-2 to enter the tournament's final.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: India lost over $1.3 bn due to internet shutdowns in 2019: Report
text: Among the worst-hit economies in the world due to internet shutdowns, India stood third with over $1.3-billion loss to economy in 2019, a report by UK-based Top10VPN revealed. India logged around 4,196 hours of internet shutdowns in 2019. States and union territories like Assam, and Jammu and Kashmir were among the worst affected due to the shutdowns, the report added.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Rajasthan village with no school gets first girl matriculates
text: Three girls from Bhadla village in Rajasthan passed their tenth class exam and became the first female matriculates from the village. The news came to light when results of Rajasthan State Open School were declared on Monday night. The girls studied at a learning centre opened in the village by a local organisation, as there was no school there.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Trump sends birthday wishes to North Korea's Kim through South Korea
text: US President Donald Trump asked South Korea to deliver a birthday greeting to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. South Korea's national security adviser Chung Eui-yong, who met Trump in Washington on Wednesday, said Trump "remembered" that it was Kim Jong-un's birthday and asked him to give him his message. Kim's birthday is believed to be on January 8.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US House votes to restrain Trump's military actions against Iran
text: The US House of Representatives has voted in favour of a resolution which asserts that President Donald Trump cannot take military actions against Iran without Congress' approval, except when there's a need to defend an "imminent" attack against the US. The Democrats introduced the resolution after Trump's order to kill Iran's commander led to retaliatory missile attacks by Iran.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Kochhar's Mumbai home, husband's farm houses among assets worth ₹600 cr attached
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday attached former ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar and her husband Deepak Kochhar's assets worth ₹600 crore in connection with a money laundering case. The assets include her Mumbai apartment, shares held by her and 3 properties including farmhouses of her husband. Kochhar has been accused of irregularities while granting loans to Videocon Group.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Are you mental: Sonam Kapoor to man trolling her after she loses her bag
text: After Sonam Kapoor said that British Airways lost her luggage, a Twitter user trolled her by quoting Siddhant Chaturvedi's remark, "Their struggle begins where our dreams are fulfilled." Replying to him, Sonam said, "Are you mental? Privilege is our parents' hard work, who worked...whole lives to give their children everything. Why do people insist on shaming...children and...parents for it."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Video shows anti-CAA protestors raising 'Jinnah waali azadi' slogan in Delhi
text: BJP leader Tajinder Bagga has shared a video on Twitter, wherein anti-CAA protestors could purportedly be seen raising slogans of "Lekar rahenge, Jinnah wali azadi, Gandhi wali azadi, Nehru wali azadi" in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh. In the video, a man could be seen on the stage shouting slogans on mic, while the crowd repeats after him.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: SC didn't come under any pressure: Ghulam Nabi Azad on J&K order
text: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Friday praised the Supreme Court order calling for review of internet restrictions in Jammu and Kashmir. Calling the order "historic", Azad said, "This is the first time SC has talked about how [Jammu and Kashmir people] feel." He added, "Government...misled the entire country. This time...SC was forthright and they didn't come under any pressure."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: No. 11 batsman ends chase with a six for the first time in ODI cricket history
text: Batting at number 11, West Indies pacer Sheldon Cottrell slammed a six off the penultimate delivery to help his team chase down 238 in the second ODI against Ireland. With this, the 30-year-old became the first number 11 batsman to finish a chase in an ODI with a six. West Indies took an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who is 'MC from Sydney' who bought Shane Warne's cap for ₹5 crore?
text: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne's 'baggy green' cap was bought by 'MC from Sydney' for AU$1,007,500 (₹5 crore) in an auction to raise money for bushfire victims. The successful bidder has been revealed as Commonwealth Bank, with the initials belonging to CEO Matt Comyn. Comyn said the cap would be taken on a national tour to help raise further funds.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Hubble Telescope detects smallest known dark matter clumps
text: Astronomers used data from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope and the gravitational lensing effect to detect the smallest clumps of dark matter ever found. The dark matter concentrations detected by Hubble are 1/10,000th to 1/100,000th times the mass of the Milky Way's dark matter halo. Dark matter concentrations have usually been detected around large- and medium-sized galaxies.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: There are no takers for your malware: India tells Pakistan at UN
text: India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Syed Akbaruddin, criticised Pakistan for peddling falsehoods about the situation in Kashmir. "One delegation that epitomises the dark arts has, yet again, displayed its wares by peddling falsehoods...My simple response to Pakistan is even though it is late, neighbour, heal thyself of your malaise. There are no takers here for your malware," he added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 19-yr-old gangraped and hanged in Gujarat; family accuses police of inaction
text: People in Gujarat have staged a protest after a 19-year-old girl was allegedly gangraped and found hanging on a tree in Modasa on January 5. Her family has accused an inspector of neglecting duties after they came to file a missing complaint on January 1. Police have booked four people after CCTV footage showed her in a car with them.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 27-yr-old's breast implants 'fall out of her chest' after ₹5 lakh surgery in Turkey
text: A 27-year-old woman's breast implants "fell out of her chest" weeks after a £6,000 (over ₹5 lakh) surgery at a clinic in Turkey. Angelica Isaksen, from Sweden's Stockholm, said she wanted to get her body back in shape for bikini competitions. Isaksen added that she chose the unnamed clinic after seeing celebrities promote it on a social media site.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 21-yr-old woman poses as 16-yr-old boy to sexually assault 50 girls in UK
text: A 21-year-old UK woman posed as a teenage boy to sexually assault up to 50 girls, police have revealed. Gemma Watts tied her long hair into a bun and wore a baseball cap, and a hoodie to convince them she was a 16-year-old boy named 'Jake Waton'. She used Snapchat and Instagram to target girls by liking their profiles.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Indian rupee to beat baht, ringgit this year, says top forecaster
text: India's rupee will likely beat most Asian peers in 2020, according to Rabobank, the top rupee forecaster for the December quarter in Bloomberg's rankings. "India's economy already has faced most of the economic pain in 2019," it said. The rupee could weaken less than 1%, while Indonesia's rupiah may fall 7%, Thai baht 11% and Malaysian ringgit 9%, Rabobank added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: How does video-based KYC process allowed by RBI work?
text: The RBI has allowed banks to onboard customers through video-based KYC where the live photo of the customer is matched with their photo in Aadhaar/PAN. Banks must ensure that sequence and type of questions are varied to prevent spoofing and establish that the video interaction is real-time. Geotagging has been made compulsory to ensure that customer is present in India.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: China Mobile may partner with Airtel, Vodafone Idea for cloud services in India
text: China's biggest telecom operator China Mobile is reportedly in talks with Airtel and Vodafone Idea to jointly develop a cloud network in India. China Mobile wants to enter India by forming a holding company with either of these two companies or both, reports said. Top executives from China Mobile met senior officials of Airtel and Vodafone Idea separately in December.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Filmmaker Scott quits as director of Marvel's 'Doctor Strange'
text: Filmmaker Scott Derrickson, who directed Marvel's 2016 film 'Doctor Strange', has announced that he is stepping down as the director of its sequel, citing "creative differences". "I'm thankful for...collaboration and will remain on as EP (executive producer)," he said. Featuring Benedict Cumberbatch in the titular role, 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is set to release in May 2021.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: It shouldn't be made into a national issue: Kangana on JNU violence
text: Kangana Ranaut has said the violence on the JNU campus shouldn't be made into a national issue. "I must tell you...gang war is quite common during college life," she added. "Police should take perpetrators into custody and give...four slaps each. Such people are found everywhere...and they shouldn't be made [a] national issue because such issues don't deserve it," said Kangana.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: PV Sindhu, Saina Nehwal knocked out of Malaysia  Masters
text: Shuttlers PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal have been knocked out of the Malaysia Masters after suffering defeats in their respective quarter-final matches. While PV Sindhu was defeated by world number two Tai Tzu Ying of Chinese Taipei 16-21, 16-21 in 36 minutes, Saina Nehwal suffered defeat against world number 10 Carolina Marin of Spain 8-21, 7-21.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Amazon calls PayPal's discount browser extension Honey a 'security risk'
text: Amazon recently began warning shoppers who use Honey, a browser extension that automatically finds and applies coupon codes at checkout and tracks prices, labelling it as a "security risk". Honey was recently acquired by PayPal for $4 billion. Amazon warned, "Honey tracks your private shopping behaviour, collects data like...order history...can read or change your data on any website you visit."
author: Dharna

headlines: PayU buys Indian consumer lending platform PaySense at $185 mn valuation
text: Naspers-owned digital payments company PayU is acquiring a controlling stake in Mumbai-based fintech startup PaySense at a valuation of $185 million. PayU said it plans to merge the five-year-old consumer lending platform with its own credit business LazyPay. PayU said that it will invest $200 million, $65 million of it immediately, into the new entity over the next two years.
author: Dharna

headlines: Researchers observe expansion of plant life in Everest region
text: A new research has shown that plant life is expanding in the area around Mount Everest. Using data from 1993 to 2018 from NASA's Landsat satellites, researchers measured small but significant increases in subnival vegetation cover across four height brackets from 4,150-6,000 metres above sea level. Researchers claim that global warming could be one of the reasons behind the expansion.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Punjab approves 7 fast track courts for rape cases, 3 for POCSO cases
text: The Punjab cabinet has approved setting up seven fast track courts to adjudicate rape cases within two months. It has also decided to set up three special courts for trying offences under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences' (POCSO) Act. A total of 115 new posts, including judges and support staff, will be created for these courts.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: SC order on J&K reminded PM that nation doesn't bow before him: Cong
text: Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala has said that Supreme Court's order to review restrictions in Kashmir has reminded PM Narendra Modi that "nation bows before Constitution and not him!" "Double shock for Modi-Shah...dissent cannot be oppressed by...section 144," he added. Calling SC's ruling "first big jolt of 2020", Surjewala stated that restrictions on internet services is an "illegal activity".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Pak's ISI training 40 Rohingyas in Bangladesh against India
text: Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) with the help of terror outfit Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) is training 40 Rohingya Muslims in Bangladesh's Cox's Bazar to carry out terror activities in India, intelligence agencies warned Indian armed and border guarding forces. "In the first instalment, JMB has received funds worth one crore takas for terror training," agencies said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Court rejects NGO's plea to meet Nirbhaya rape convicts for organ donation
text: A Delhi court on Friday dismissed an NGO's plea seeking permission to meet the four death row convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape case. As per the plea, the NGO wanted to motivate the convicts to donate their organs. "This will not only benefit them in dying peacefully, but some persons could get actual benefits from their organs," the petition read.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I'll send Trump impeachment articles to Senate when I'm ready: Pelosi
text: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has said she will send the two articles of impeachment against President Donald Trump to Senate when she is ready, which "will probably be soon". "I'm not holding them indefinitely," she added. The articles, which accuses Trump of obstruction of Congress and abuse of power, will permit the Senate to begin a trial against him.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: UK's House of Commons passes PM Boris Johnson's Brexit deal
text: The UK's House of Commons passed PM Boris Johson's Brexit deal, allowing the country to leave the European Union by end of January. As many as 330 MPs voted in favour and the bill will now go to House of Lords for vote. The bill sets an 11-month transition period during which EU and the UK will discuss future partnership.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: We feel this tragedy: Iran on Ukrainian plane crash
text: Expressing condolences to the relatives of 176 people killed in the Ukrainian plane crash, Iran's representative at UN's International Civil Aviation Organization said, "As Iranians we feel this tragedy and disaster for us and for the families." The US National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) on Thursday accepted an invitation from Iran to take part in its investigation into Wednesday's crash.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: SC stays order restoring Cyrus Mistry as Executive Chairman of Tata Sons
text: The Supreme Court on Friday stayed National Company Law Appellate Tribunal's (NCLAT) order restoring Cyrus Mistry as Executive Chairman of Tata Sons. The NCLAT had ruled that his ouster in 2016 was illegal. Mistry, who has said he won't pursue the Executive Chairmanship, had taken over as Tata Sons' sixth chairman in 2012 after Ratan Tata announced his retirement.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Deepika sided with people who hit girls on their private parts: Smriti Irani
text: While talking about actress Deepika Padukone attending JNU protests earlier this week, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "She sided with people who hit girls on their private parts with lathis. I can't deny her that right." "It's Deepika Padukone's freedom to stand next to people who say 'Bharat tere tukde honge'," she added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Deepika made it clear in 2011 that she supports Congress: Smriti
text: Speaking about actress Deepika Padukone attending JNU protests in Delhi earlier this week, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "She made her political affiliation known in 2011 that she supports the Congress Party." She further said that people and her admirers were surprised by her attending the protests because they didn't know about her political position.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Ranveer hugs fan with 'Ranveerian' tattoo on his back at Chhapaak screening
text: Actor Ranveer Singh hugged his fan with 'Ranveerian' tattoo at Deepika Padukone-starrer Chhapaak's screening recently. The video of the incident shows Ranveer passing by the crowd when he spots the fan showing the tattoo on his back. Ranveer then hugs the man and poses for the cameras with him while pulling down the man's shirt.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Arrow pierces shoulder of 12-year-old archer during training, airlifted to AIIMS
text: Shivangini Gohain, a 12-year-old archer from Assam, was airlifted to Delhi and admitted to AIIMS Trauma Centre on Thursday night after an arrow accidentally pierced through her shoulder. The incident happened during a regular training session at an SAI centre in upper Assam's Chabua. The Sports Ministry has announced that SAI will bear all the expenses incurred in her treatment.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ball out of bowler's hand, chholle bhature for cheat meal deserve same focus: Kohli
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli took to social media to share a picture of himself batting in the nets ahead of the Pune T20I against Sri Lanka. Kohli, who can be seen looking at the bowler's hand, captioned the picture, "Ball out of the bowler's hand and chholle bhature for a cheat meal deserve the same kind of focus."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Shane Warne's 'baggy green' cap sells for record ₹5 crore, says 'I am blown away'
text: The bidding for ex-Australia spinner Shane Warne's 'baggy green' cap ended today, with the successful bid being a record AU$1,007,500 (nearly ₹5 crore). Sir Donald Bradman's 'baggy green' cap held the previous record for the highest price (AU$425,000 in 2003). "Congrats to the successful bidder...you've blown me away with your generosity and this was way...beyond my expectations!" Warne wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pakistan is one of the safest places for cricket in the world right now: Gayle
text: West Indies opener Chris Gayle, who is currently playing in the Bangladesh Premier League for Chattogram Challengers, has said that Pakistan is one of the safest places for cricket in the world right now. "They say you will get presidential security so you are in good hands," he added. Notably, PCB has invited Bangladesh for three T20Is and two Tests.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: At 5,433, MP registered maximum rape cases for 3rd yr in a row: NCRB
text: The National Crime Records Bureau's (NCRB) has released its latest data according to which 5,433 rape cases were registered in Madhya Pradesh in 2018. This makes MP the state with maximum registered rape cases for three years in a row. Out of 5,433 registered rape cases, 54 involved victims who were below six years of age and 142 between 6-12.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: How to help victims when I'm not safe: Policewoman accuses seniors of harassment
text: A video of a Lucknow policewoman has surfaced online, wherein she has accused her seniors of harassing her. The policewoman can be seen crying and saying, "How can I console other victims when I am not safe in my own police department?" She also alleged that the Senior Superintendent of Police's PR officer didn't allow her to file the complaint.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 3 unemployed people committed suicide every 2 hours in India in 2018
text: According to National Crime Records Bureau data, a total of 12,936 unemployed people committed suicide in India in 2018, with around three people taking the extreme step every two hours. The unemployed people's suicide represented 9.6% of the total suicides, as compared to 10,349 in the farming sector which made for 7.7%. Over 1.3 lakh people committed suicide in 2018.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: We're not breaking country but will break BJP: Kanhaiya on 'tukde tukde' tag
text: CPI leader and former JNU Students' Union (JNUSU) President Kanhaiya Kumar on Thursday said that they are "not breaking the country" but they will "break the BJP". "They call us members of the 'tukde tukde gang'...[I'm] admitting that...we'll break the BJP," he added. Kanhaiya further said that there was no 'tukde tukde' government in India before 2014.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: What are some of the 31 questions Indians will be asked in Census 2021?
text: Indians will be asked 31 questions in Census 2021, including the cereal consumed by a household, predominant material of floor, wall and roof of the house and availability of drinking water source. Questions about the ownership of vehicles, television, laptop/computer, radio,  and access to the Internet will also be asked. Mobile numbers will be asked only for census-related communications.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Harry ignored UK Queen's order to not announce decision to step back: Report
text: UK Queen Elizabeth II had asked Prince Harry not to issue the statement announcing that he and his wife Meghan Markle would be pulling back from royal duties, but he reportedly went ahead with it anyway. "We intend to step back as 'senior' members of Royal Family and work to become financially independent," Harry and Meghan have said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Canadian coffee chain offers free coffee to Harry and Meghan, gets criticised
text: Canadian coffee chain Tim Hortons has been criticised for offering UK Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle free coffee for life if they move to the country. This comes after Harry and Meghan announced their decision to step back from royal duties. "They can afford to buy the company. Your employees can't afford rent," a Twitter user wrote.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: N Korean mom faces jail for saving her kids from fire instead of Kim portraits
text: A North Korean mother is facing jail for saving her two children from a house fire but allowing portraits of North Korea's former leaders to burn. North Korea demands that every home should display paintings of its past leaders, Kim Il-sung and Kim Jong-il, and sends inspectors to ensure that they do. The woman has been placed under investigation.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Clowns overseen by monkeys designed 737 MAX: Boeing staff in internal texts
text: In one of the internal communications released by Boeing, an employee ridiculed the development of 737 MAX saying it was "designed by clowns who in turn are supervised by monkeys." Another employee stated Boeing would go against any attempts by regulators to mandate simulator pilot training. "Would you put your family on MAX simulator trained aircraft? I wouldn't," read another.
author: Dharna

headlines: Arjun, Kriti's Panipat declared tax-free in Maharashtra
text: Arjun Kapoor and Kriti Sanon-starrer 'Panipat' has been declared tax-free in Maharashtra. Director Ashutosh Gowariker took to Twitter to thank Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and wrote, "Heartfelt Gratitude! Thank you Hon'ble CM...for imparting tax-free status in our attempt of bringing the Maratha Glory to...screen!" The film, which is based on the third battle of Panipat, also stars Sanjay Dutt.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: CBFC announces implementation of its new certificate design
text: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) on Thursday announced the implementation of its new certificate design, which was showcased in August last year, in all its nine regional offices across India. The new design underlines the positive, user-friendly and dynamic approach of CBFC and its board, Chairperson Prasoon Joshi said. It'll have a new and modern look, he added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Ajay shares pic with Dhoni, says 'cricket, films uniting religion of India'
text: Ajay Devgn on Thursday took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with former India cricket captain MS Dhoni and wrote, "Cricket and films...the uniting religion of our country." Ajay, who portrays 17th-century Marathi military leader Tanhaji Malusare in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', received a comment from Suniel Shetty which read, "The very best for...film...know [you're] gonna kill it."n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Deepika visits Siddhivinayak on release day of Chhapaak, pics surface
text: Pictures of actress Deepika Padukone at Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai have surfaced online. She visited the temple on Friday, which also marks the release of her film, 'Chhapaak'. In the pictures, Deepika is seen praying inside the temple in an off-white salwar-kurta. 'Chhapaak', which is directed by Meghna Gulzar, is based on the life of acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Robot cat functions without commands, plays with toys and real cats
text: Chinese startup Elephant Robotics, at CES 2020, displayed the world's first fully autonomous robot cat, named 'MarsCat'. While MarsCat is capable of responding to human touch and voice commands like "run" or "come here", the robot can function independently including playing with real cats and toys and stretching. Its personality develops over time, based on how owners interact with it.
author: Dharna

headlines: Sachin Bansal acquires DHFL General Insurance for ₹100 crore: Report
text: Flipkart Co-founder and former CEO Sachin Bansal has acquired DHFL General Insurance from Wadhawan Global Capital (WGC) for about ₹100 crore, Economic Times reported. The deal is seen as a distress sale for the Kapil Wadhawan-led financial services group, whose flagship company DHFL is facing bankruptcy resolution proceedings. The sale was routed through Bansal's investment firm Navi Technologies.
author: Dharna

headlines: 18th accused in Gauri Lankesh's murder arrested in J'khand
text: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the murder of journalist Gauri Lankesh has arrested "accused number 18" in the case who was absconding in Jharkhand. "His house is being searched for clues. He will be produced before the jurisdictional Judicial Magistrate on Friday," the SIT said. Gauri Lankesh was shot dead at her doorstep in Bengaluru on September 5, 2017.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: AAP tweets spider-man meme, asks BJP 'who will contest against Kejriwal?'
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Friday took to their Twitter handle to ask the BJP about their Chief Ministerial candidate for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections. AAP tweeted a spider-man meme, which they captioned, "Who will contest against Arvind Kejriwal?" Earlier, AAP on Wednesday had challenged BJP by sharing another meme, asking them, "Does your party have a CM face?"
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Murugappa Group's female heir threatens legal recourse over board seat
text: Valli Arunachalam, late patriarch MV Murugappan's daughter, said she would be forced to take legal recourse if no amicable settlement is reached soon with her extended family regarding her demand for a board seat in Murugappa Group's holding firm. Together with her mother and sister, Arunachalam inherited 8.15% stake in Ambadi Investments. "I have...patience but it's not infinite," she said.
author: Dharna

headlines: Nifty hits record high at 12,311, Sensex surges by 300 points
text: Equity index Nifty 50 crossed the 12,300-mark for the first time on Friday to reach a record high of 12,311, amid dissipating tensions in the Middle East. Meanwhile, Sensex surged by over 300 points to 41,755. On NSE, Coal India, GAIL, Tata Steel, SBI and Infosys were among the gainers, while ICICI Bank and Yes Bank were the top losers.
author: Dharna

headlines: Springboard offers mentor-led and career-centric courses in Data Science
text: US-based and San Francisco-headquartered online education platform Springboard has launched its first batch of 2020 in India. It offers courses in Data Science, AI/ML and Data Analytics for professionals who are tied to a personal mentor who helps them with industry insights to build projects. Springboard promises money-back to learners who can't transition to a new career post-course completion.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Edwise to host Australia Education Fair across 17 cities in India
text: Edwise is hosting Australia Education Fairs from January 12 to February 16 across 17 cities in India including Mumbai, Kolkata, Delhi, Bengaluru etc. The fairs will help students find out about academic programs, loans, scholarships & admissions requirements in Australian institutions. Students can work for 2-4 years post-studies & proceed towards permanent residency, says Edwise.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Access to internet fundamental right, review all restrictions in Kashmir: SC to J&K
text: While delivering the judgement on the restrictions in Kashmir after Article 370 revocation, the Supreme Court directed the Jammu and Kashmir administration to review all restrictive orders within a week. The court also called access to internet a fundamental right. It further asked the administration to restore internet services in institutions like hospitals and educational centres.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Video appears to show plane carrying 176 people being hit by 'Iranian missile'
text: A newly surfaced video appears to show the moment a Ukrainian airliner carrying 176 people was hit by a missile after takeoff from Iran's Imam Khomeini International Airport on Wednesday. Earlier, Canada, the US and the UK said that an Iranian missile brought down the airliner citing intelligence. Iran has dismissed the claims as "psychological warfare".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Akhilesh Yadav books cinema hall for 'Chhapaak' screening amid boycott calls
text: On Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's directive, the party has organised a screening of the Deepika Padukone-starrer Chhapaak for its workers on Friday. A cinema hall in Lucknow has been booked for the screening. This comes amid boycott calls against the film after Deepika attended JNU protest earlier this week to express solidarity with protesting students.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Netflix allowed to show gay Jesus film: Brazilian Supreme Court
text: Brazil's Supreme Court has overturned a ruling that TV streaming service Netflix must remove a film depicting Jesus as gay. Two million people signed a petition calling for 'The First Temptation of Christ' to be removed, and the production company was attacked with Molotov cocktails last month. A judge had temporarily banned the film on Wednesday.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Chhapaak made tax-free in MP, Chhattisgarh amid protests against Deepika online
text: Deepika Padukone-starrer Chhapaak, which is based on the real life story of acid-attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal, was declared tax-free in Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh on Thursday. This comes amid protests against Deepika and boycott calls against the movie after the actress visited the Jawaharlal Nehru University to express solidarity with protesting students earlier this week.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: I once stole a pillow for Janhvi Kapoor from a hotel in Oman: Ishaan Khatter
text: During his appearance on actress Neha Dhupia's chat show, actor Ishaan Khatter revealed that he once stole a pillow from a hotel for actress Janhvi Kapoor. "I stole a pillow for Janhvi in Oman as she couldn't do it," he said. When asked who among Sara Ali Khan and Janhvi is a better actor, Ishaan chose the latter.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 'UFO on a stick' antenna to connect users to Starlink internet: Musk
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has revealed that users will need antennas that look like a "thin, flat and round UFO on a stick" to access the low-cost internet beamed across Earth by Starlink satellites. Musk tweeted, "Instructions are simply: Plug in socket; point at sky." The terminal would have motors to self adjust the optimal angle to view the sky.
author: Dharna

headlines: No more annual goals: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg's New Year's resolution
text: In a Facebook post, CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced he will no longer set yearly challenges for himself. Discontinuing the tradition he started in 2009, Zuckerberg added he would take a longer-term focus this decade. He said the past resolutions helped him learn Mandarin, to hunt and cook, code an AI assistant for his home, and grow comfortable with public speaking.
author: Dharna

headlines: MP Azam Khan, wife declared absconders; police make announcements on roads
text: Samajwadi Party's Rampur MP Azam Khan, his wife Tazeen and his son Abdullah have been declared 'absconders' by an Uttar Pradesh court. The police also made announcements on the streets of Rampur for the trio to appear before the court. They've been accused of cheating and forgery after they allegedly made fake documents related to Abdullah's date of birth.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Zomato raises $150 million from Ant Financial at $3 billion valuation
text: Online food delivery unicorn Zomato has raised $150 million from existing investor Ant Financial, the payments affiliate of Chinese e-commerce conglomerate Alibaba Group. The fundraise, which values Zomato at $3 billion, is part of a larger $500 million round announced in December last year, the Economic Times reported. Zomato was last valued at $2 billion in March 2019.
author: Dharna

headlines: Businessman loses ₹45 lakh in 30 mins after hacker deactivates his sim card
text: Miscreants transferred ₹45.7 lakh from a Bengaluru engineering firm's bank accounts in five branches within 30 minutes on Monday after deactivating it's proprietor's mobile number. Police said the accused must have deactivated the sim card after hacking the victim's email account to generate a replacement request. They would've also hacked the firm's internet banking credentials, they added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: After US, Canada PM says plane carrying 176 was likely hit by Iranian missile
text: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Thursday said that a Ukrainian airliner that crashed in Iran, killing all 176 people aboard, was likely brought down by an Iranian missile. The destruction of the airliner, which carried 63 Canadians, "may well have been unintentional", Trudeau added. Earlier, US officials said the country believes that Iran mistakenly shot down the Ukrainian plane.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Harry, Meghan's waxworks separated from rest of the family at Madame Tussauds
text: The wax figures of UK's Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle have been removed from the royal family display at Madame Tussauds London. The museum shared a picture on Twitter and wrote, "We've got to respect their wishes #Megxit." "Alongside the rest of the world, we are reacting to the surprising news," the waxwork museum's GM Steve Davies said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: We fired 13 missiles, were ready to fire hundreds more had US retaliated: Iran
text: Senior Iranian commander Amir Ali Hajizadeh has said strikes against US forces in Iraq could have been just the beginning of a major operation across the region if the US had responded. "We fired 13 missiles and were ready to fire hundreds more in case of any US response," he added. Iran claimed the missiles killed 80 US soldiers.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: It feels like my journey has just begun: Hrithik Roshan
text: Hrithik Roshan said in an interview that he started feeling "more assured as an actor" only in the last couple of years. "'Kaabil' was that turning point for me and it was followed by 'Super 30' and 'War'," he added. Hrithik further said that he's loving this "phase of his career", adding, "It feels like the journey has just begun."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: If story requires it, I might do it: Actress Pankhuri on exposing onscreen
text: Actress Pankhuri Awasthy has said she's not comfortable when it comes to exposing onscreen. However, she added that she might do it if the story requires it and if it's "aesthetically shot". Talking about making her Bollywood debut in Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan', Pankhuri said the entire selection process for the film went on for almost a month.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: It has moved me: Ranveer on Deepika's performance in Chhapaak
text: Ranveer Singh on Thursday took to Instagram to appreciate Deepika Padukone's performance in 'Chhapaak' and wrote, "My baby. I've witnessed you toil relentlessly to create this special piece of work." "It has moved me, stirred me and stayed with me," he added. "A glowing gem in your repertoire. I love you baby...never been more proud of you," Ranveer further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I'm pro-peace, I don't endorse violence: Sunny Leone on JNU violence
text: Sunny Leone, while speaking about the violence on the campus of JNU, said that she doesn't endorse violence as she's "pro-peace". "I think...there are many things that we can do if we put our fist down...because violence is something...our children see and learn," she added. "I'm sure that there's some resolution that will come without violence here," Sunny further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Scrap CAA; it's not in tune with the Constitution: Amartya Sen
text: Nobel laureate Amartya Sen has said that Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) should be scrapped because it is "not in tune with the Constitution". "Under this Act, whether citizenship will be given or not will be decided after ascertaining the religion of a person," he added. Sen further said that such an Act "shouldn't have been passed in the first place."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Facebook refuses to ban political ads, says private firms have no say in it
text: Despite facing criticism over its policies, Facebook has again refused to ban political advertisements, including ones that contain false or misleading information. In a blog post, Facebook said that decisions about political ads shouldn't be made by private companies. It added it would instead give people the option to see fewer political and social issue ads on Facebook and Instagram.
author: Dharna

headlines: Upper-caste Hindus hold 41% of India's wealth, Muslims 8%: Owaisi
text: Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday cited 'empirical data' and claimed that upper-caste Hindus hold about 41% of India's wealth, which is double than their population of 22.28%. He added that Muslims own 8% of the country's total assets while their share of households stands at nearly 12%. Owaisi also claimed that Hindu OBC holds 31% of India's wealth.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: No plans to join hands with Raj Thackeray: Devendra Fadnavis
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis has said that his party has no plans to "join hands" with Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray. Citing ideological differences between the two parties, Fadnavis added, "If they (MNS) consider expanding their outlook towards various issues, we may join them." Reportedly, Fadnavis met Raj Thackeray but the former has denied the same.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: JNU to not charge hostel students for utility, services for winter sem
text: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) administration on Thursday said that hostel students will not be charged for services and utility during the current registration for 2020 winter semester. It added that University Grants Commission (UGC) will bear the cost till further orders. This comes after HRD Ministry in November 2019 formed a committee to resolve the fee hike issue in JNU.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: May reopen Judge Loya death case: Maharashtra Home Minister
text: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has said that the CBI court Judge BH Loya's death case could be reopened, if there is substantial evidence. At the time of his death in 2014, Judge Loya was handling the Sohrabuddin Sheikh fake encounter case. Questions were raised over Judge Loya's death, however, SC in 2018 ruled that Loya died of "natural causes".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: If that's all Ghosn had to say, could have said it in Japan: Ex-Nissan CEO
text: Former Nissan CEO Hiroto Saikawa has called former chief Carlos Ghosn's escape from Japan a "betrayal", adding Ghosn fled from fear of being found guilty at trial. "If that's all he was going to say, he could've just said it in Japan," Saikawa said, referring to Ghosn's press conference, wherein he named Saikawa among those who plotted to oust him.
author: Dharna

headlines: US believes Iran mistakenly shot down Ukrainian plane carrying 176 people
text: The US believes that Iran mistakenly shot down a Ukrainian plane that was carrying 176 people on board on Wednesday, officials said. "Somebody could've made a mistake on the other side," US President Donald Trump said, adding the crash was not due to technical reasons. The plane crashed in Iran hours after Iran fired missiles towards US bases in Iraq.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Article claims BJP enlisted Shaan to counter Deepika, singer responds
text: After an article claimed BJP enlisted singer Shaan to counter Deepika Padukone after her visit to JNU, the singer issued a clarification. "I am not enlisted by BJP...was invited to understand, clear doubts and share...thoughts on CAA," he wrote. "The article is totally distorting facts and connecting 2 narratives that have nothing to do with each other," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Man who lost his family home in Australia bushfires wins ₹4.9 cr lottery
text: A man who lost his uninsured family home in Australia bushfires won a $1 million AUD (nearly ₹4.9 crore) lottery on Wednesday. The man, who wished to remain anonymous, said he didn't think his family would ever be able to rebuild their home. He was at his workplace when he got the call informing him of his win.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Buttler fined 15% of match fee for calling Philander a ‘f***ing knobhead’
text: England wicketkeeper Jos Buttler has been fined 15% of his match fee and given one demerit point for abusing South Africa's Vernon Philander in the Cape Town Test. "F***ing move. No one is going to f***ing give it to you, just move...F***ing knobhead. Can’t get past that f***ing gut!" Buttler was heard telling Philander after the latter blocked his view.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kroos scores directly from corner to send Real Madrid into Super Cup final
text: Real Madrid's German midfielder Toni Kroos scored directly from a corner kick on Wednesday, helping his team beat Valencia 3-1 in the Spanish Super Cup semi-final. Kroos spotted Valencia's keeper off his line in the 15th minute, before bending the ball directly into the net. Isco and Luka Modric scored Madrid's two other goals.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Think Indian, there must be benefits for everybody: Ravi Shastri on CAA
text: Speaking about the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Team India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "Think Indian, don’t think I am this, I am that." He added, "I am sure the government has thought about it properly. There are still certain things to be tweaked here and there and they will do it for the benefit of Indians."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Shastri calls 4-day Tests nonsense, gives suggestion to preserve Test cricket
text: India head coach Ravi Shastri has called four-day Test cricket 'nonsense'. "There's no need to tamper with five-day Tests," he added. "If you want preserve Tests then let the top six play more against each other," he further said. "If at all they want to tamper, then let top six sides play 5-day Tests and next six four-day," he suggested.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Body is feeling good, I am getting younger as days go on: Chris Gayle
text: West Indies opener Chris Gayle has said that he would love to carry on as long as possible in competitive cricket. "The body is feeling good. And I am sure I am getting younger as days go on," he added. "Forty-five is a good number. Yeah, we can target 45. Let's target 45, that's a good number." he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Amazon CEO Bezos may meet PM next week during his visit to India after 5 years
text: Amazon CEO and the world's richest person Jeff Bezos will be visiting India next week and is likely to meet PM Narendra Modi, PTI reported citing sources. Bezos will also attend an Amazon event focussing on small and medium businesses slated for January 15-16 in Delhi. He met PM Modi in October 2014 during his last visit to the country.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Entrepreneurs unaware of AI same as those who ignored internet in 1999: Cuban
text: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban, who attended CES 2020, said, "If you're an entrepreneur and if you don't know about Artificial Intelligence, then you're the equivalent of somebody in 1999 saying, 'I'm sure this internet thing will be okay but I don't give a sh**.'" "Going forward, the world will quickly be defined by 'AI haves' and 'AI have-nots'," he added.n
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Monitoring situation, hope it de-escalates quickly: India on US-Iran tensions
text: Speaking on the recent US-Iran tensions, Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said that India is closely monitoring the situation and hoped for it to de-escalate quickly. He added, "Peace, security and stability...are of utmost importance to us...we have important interests in the region." External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has spoken to his counterparts in the US and Iran.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Woman bites police officer's thumb during JNU students' protest in Delhi
text: A woman protestor on Thursday bit Additional DCP Southwest Ingit Pratap Singh's thumb while he was trying to stop protestors from marching towards the Rashtrapati Bhavan. The protestors were marching towards Rashtrapati Bhavan to demand the removal of JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar. The protestor is yet to be identified.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Accused who ran Mercedes over man days before turning 18 to be tried as juvenile: SC
text: A man accused of running over a 32-year-old with his Mercedes in Delhi will be tried as a juvenile as the alleged crime doesn't fall under 'heinous' offence category under Juvenile Justice Act, the Supreme Court said. The 2016 incident occurred four days before accused turned 18. The Juvenile Justice Board had said he should be tried as an adult.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Absconding Maharashtra DIG accused of molesting 17-year-old girl suspended
text: Absconding Maharashtra DIG Nishikant More, who's been accused of molesting a 17-year-old girl, has been suspended by the state government. The girl went missing earlier this week and a suicide note was recovered wherein she blamed constant pressure from the policeman. According to the complaint registered by her family, the police officer and the girl's father were friends.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: One woman reported a rape every 15 minutes in India in 2018
text: One woman reported a rape every 15 minutes on an average in the country in 2018, according to the annual National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data released on Thursday. Women reported almost 34,000 rapes in 2018. About 85% led to charges, while the conviction rate dropped to 27.2% from 32.2% in 2017.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: TN youths make TikTok video sitting on police van, made to regulate traffic
text: Three youths in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin who made a TikTok video sitting on the bonnet of a police van were made to regulate traffic, supervised. Police said it was not a punishment but to motivate them after they expressed their wish to join the police force. "They said they didn't intend to tarnish image of the police," an official said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Prince Harry, Meghan were upset over pic of UK's 3 future kings: Reports
text: UK's Prince Harry and Meghan Markle were reportedly upset over pictures featuring the Queen with the three future kings- Prince Charles, Prince William and six-year-old Prince George. The photograph, released to mark the new year, was taken in the Buckingham Palace in late December while Harry and Meghan were in Canada.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Prince Harry, Meghan's pic was missing from Queen's Christmas portrait
text: The picture of UK's Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle was missing from the portrait released when the Queen delivered her Christmas message. "No photo of them during her speech. The clues were right there," a Twitter user wrote. Prince Harry and Meghan have announced their decision to step back from royal duties.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: NPR, NRC unnecessary, wasteful: 100 ex-bureaucrats in open letter
text: Over 100 retired civil servants have written an open letter to people saying that NPR and NRC are "unnecessary and wasteful exercises". The letter urged people to ask the government to repeal the latest amendments to the Citizenship Act. India can't afford "confrontation" between the government and citizens at a time when the economy "warrants the closest attention", it added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: LG booth at CES displays robots that cook, take orders
text: LG has created a restaurant-like set up managed by its CLOi robots for people attending the CES show in Las Vegas. The robots are capable of making a cup of coffee, taking food orders and cleaning utensils. Potential diners can make reservations remotely through LG's ThinQ app and browse the menu on a smart speaker, smart TV or smartphone.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Twitter lets pedophiles publicly discuss their sexual attraction: Aus academic
text: A policy by Twitter lets users have "discussions over child sexual exploitation as a phenomenon" and express attraction towards minors, as Australian academic pointed out. "The sexual desires and social inclusion of pedophiles have been prioritised by Twitter over the safety of children," tweeted Michael Salter. He claimed that no child protection experts were consulted before framing the policy.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: SoftBank looking to sell 70% stake in India's renewables JV: Reports
text: SoftBank may sell a 70% stake in SBG Cleantech, its renewable JV in India, to bring another partner on board, reports said. It's looking to team up with a firm that can bring an equity commitment worth up to $2 billion. SoftBank is in discussions with sovereign and pension funds, of which some are limited partners with SoftBank Vision Fund.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Pak woman declared dead comes to life at funeral bath; dies later
text: Fifty-year-old Rasheeda Bibi, who was pronounced dead at Abbasi Shaheed Hospital in Pakistan's Karachi, reportedly came back to life at her funeral bath. When Rasheeda's relatives started to give her a funeral bath at the morgue, her limbs started to move. The woman was then shifted to the hospital where she underwent treatment but later passed away.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: China's pneumonia outbreak could be due to new virus: WHO
text: After an outbreak of over 50 pneumonia cases in China's Wuhan, World Health Organization (WHO) said it could be caused by a new strain of coronavirus. WHO also said it needed more comprehensive information to confirm the type of pathogen. Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses that can cause infections ranging from common cold to Severe acute respiratory syndrome.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Fresh plea to sue Libya for supplying explosives to Irish group
text: A fresh attempt is being made in a Northern Ireland court to sue Libya for supplying the paramilitary group Provisional Irish Republican Army (IRA) with plastic explosives between the 1970s and 1990s. Reportedly, US victims of terrorism were compensated by Libya but UK victims were left out of the deal. IRA later joined the peace process and disarmed in 2005.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Growth in India projected to decelerate to 5% in 2019-20: World Bank
text: The World Bank has predicted India's growth rate at 5% for the fiscal year 2019-20 and projected it to increase to 5.8% in the next fiscal year. "In India, activity was constrained by insufficient credit availability, as well as by subdued private consumption," it said. It added that regional growth in South Asia is expected to be 6% by 2022.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Lebanon bans Ghosn from travel over Interpol 'red notice': Reports
text: Ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn has been banned from foreign travel by Lebanon after he was questioned over Interpol's "red notice" issued by Japan seeking his arrest, reports said. Ghosn has also been asked to inform the authorities of his place of residence. The 65-year-old businessman fled Japan last month where he was awaiting trial on charges including under-reporting earnings.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Took British Airways flight 3rd time this month, they lost my luggage twice: Sonam
text: Actress Sonam Kapoor on Thursday criticised British Airways, alleging that the airline lost her luggage. "This is the third time I've traveled @British_Airways this month and the second time they've lost my bags...I'm never flying @British_Airways again," she tweeted. The airline apologised and asked her if she has been provided with a tracking reference at the airport.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: When was the last time PM couldn't visit a state due to public anger: Yechury
text: Amid reports of PM Narendra Modi cancelling his visit to Assam over anti-CAA protests, CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury said, "When was the last time a PM could not even visit a state, which is also ruled by his party, because of public anger?" PM Modi was scheduled to inaugurate the Khelo India Youth Games 2020 in Guwahati on January 10.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: It's called Test cricket for a reason, call 4-day thing 'easy cricket': Stokes
text: Talking about four-day Test cricket, England all-rounder Ben Stokes said, "Test cricket isn't made for four days." He added, "It's called Test cricket for a reason. They should change it to 'easy cricket' if they make it four days." He stated, "The fact [Cape Town Test]...went all the way to the wire proves why Tests should always stay five days."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: MS Dhoni may end his ODI career soon: Ravi Shastri
text: Talking about ex-India captain MS Dhoni's cricket future, India head coach Ravi Shastri said the 38-year-old may soon end his ODI career. "I've had a conversation with MS and that's between us. He has finished his Test career...In all probability, he'll finish one-day cricket," he added. "At his age...probably the only format he’ll want to play is T20," Shastri said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Shubman fined 100% match fee for arguing with umpires in Punjab-Delhi match
text: Punjab batsman Shubman Gill has been fined 100% of his match fee for arguing with the umpires in the Ranji Trophy match against Delhi. Shubman did not walk after being given caught behind by the umpire. He then argued with the umpire and asked him to reverse his decision. The umpire reversed the decision after consulting with square-leg umpire.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Maruti under scanner for forcing customers to buy its car insurance: Reports
text: The Competition Commission of India is reportedly looking into allegations that Maruti Suzuki pushes buyers to purchase insurance policies offered by the carmaker. A complaint alleged that insurance plans recommended by Maruti while selling cars resulted in customers paying more compared with other options, reports said. The regulator can order a deeper probe if it finds merit in the allegation.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: JNU V-C shouldn't be allowed to continue: BJP's Murli Manohar Joshi
text: Senior BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi said JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar shouldn't be allowed to continue after he didn't implement the government's reported proposals to resolve the issue of hiked fee. "(Kumar) was also advised to reach out to the teachers and students...It's shocking that the V-C is adamant for not implementing the proposal," Joshi said in a tweet.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Andhra launches scheme to give ₹15k to mothers for sending kids to school
text: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has launched 'Jagananna Amma Vodi' scheme under which the government will transfer ₹15,000 to each mother for sending kids to government and private schools. The scheme, for which ₹6,455 crore has been allocated in current year budget, would cover 42 lakh mothers to benefit over 81 lakh children from Class 1 to 12.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Noida SSP suspended after his letter alleging corruption by IPS officers leaked
text: Noida SSP Vaibhav Krishna has been suspended after a letter written by him to the Chief Minister's Office alleging corruption by five IPS officers got leaked. Earlier, a sex chat video featuring his picture had gone viral. Krishna had said that the video featuring his picture and a woman's voice in the background is "morphed".
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: What's going on: Tharoor on Sitharaman's absence in PM's meeting with economists
text: Reacting to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's absence from PM Modi's meeting with economists on Thursday, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor asked, "What's going on here? Finance Minister indisposed?" Her office replied to Tharoor saying Sitharaman had already met industrialists, experts, and economists during pre-Budget consultations. She held pre-Budget consultations with BJP office-bearers today.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 26-yr-old German man dies 4 years after colleague poisoned his lunch
text: A 26-year-old man in Germany has died four years after being poisoned by his 57-year-old colleague and falling into a coma. The convicted colleague, who poisoned co-worker's food with mercury and other substances, was sentenced to life in prison last March. He was arrested in May 2018 after surveillance video showed him putting a suspicious powder on a colleague's sandwich.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: One billion animals may have been killed in Australia bushfires
text: As many as a billion animals may have been killed in Australia's wildfires since September, Chris Dickman, an ecology professor at the University of Sydney, estimated. This includes mammals, birds and reptiles directly killed by the fires or indirectly through loss of habitat. Australia's bushfires have burnt more than 25 million acres of land - the size of South Korea.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Ukraine to probe missile attack, terrorism angles into plane crash
text: Ukraine will investigate a range of angles into the plane crash in Iran on Wednesday, including terrorism, missile attack and a drone collision, a Ukrainian security official said. Debris from a Russian-made missile was found at the crash site, he said quoting reports. Iranian investigators said that the plane was trying to turn back to the airport when it crashed.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Rahul Jinnah & Priyanka Jinnah scaring Muslims on CAA: Uma Bharti
text: BJP leader Uma Bharti said that Pakistan's founder Muhammad Ali Jinnah was no more but Congress leaders Rahul (Gandhi) Jinnah and Priyanka (Gandhi Vadra) Jinnah were instilling fear among Muslims on CAA. Referring to Congress President Sonia Gandhi as the country's daughter-in-law, Bharti said, "We respect her from the bottom of our hearts."
author: Shailesh

headlines: US footballer leaves Qatar over safety amid US-Iran tensions
text: Dutch-born US footballer Sergino Dest left his club Ajax's winter training session in Qatar over safety issues amid tensions between US and Iran over the killing of Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani in American airstrikes. "He didn't feel comfortable, Ajax understand his request," the club said. Notably, the US national team has also cancelled their planned training camp in Qatar.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: A lot of spots need to be filled: Rohit Sharma on T20 World Cup squad
text: Talking about the team composition for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia, Rohit Sharma said, "There are a lot of spots we need to fill". "The 15-20 guys we have are all really good and have performed really well," he added. India have won the T20 World Cup once, in 2007, and made it to the final in 2014.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Medvedev hits umpire's chair twice in ATP Cup, gets point penalty
text: World number five Daniil Medvedev got a point penalty after he slammed the umpire's chair with his racket twice during Russia's quarterfinals clash with Argentina in the ATP Cup. Medvedev was given a code violation after he exchanged words with opponent Diego Schwartzman. Later in the game, Medvedev approached the umpire and slammed his racket during the conversation.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Liverpool's Henderson best midfielder in world: Flamengo coach Jesus
text: Brazilian club Flamengo coach Jorge Jesus termed Liverpool's captain and midfielder Jordan Henderson "best midfielder in the world". Flamengo were defeated by Liverpool 0-1 in the FIFA Club World Cup final last year. Under Henderson, who has 26 goals and 47 assists for the Reds, Liverpool have won the UEFA Champions League and are currently leading in Premier League standings.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: India a notch ahead than Aus in talent, confidence: Irfan Pathan
text: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said that India are "a notch ahead" than Australia in "terms of talent, cricket and confidence". "In the past, that wasn't the case because they were doing really well. We were trying to match that level," he added. In 2019, India and Australia won ODI series in each other's backyard.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Smart delivery box can keep couriers safe when owners are away
text: US-based locks manufacturing firm Yale Home has launched a smart delivery box to store couriers when owners are away and can allow users remote access using a phone. Users can get notifications when a delivery is made and also share information with trusted members. The delivery box has three variations - standalone, with Wi-Fi and Wi-Fi with a cooler bag.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Apple customers spent record $1.4 bn on the App Store in a week
text: Customer spending on the App Store between Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve grew by 16% to a record $1.4 billion, compared to 2018, Apple announced. Further, App Store spending on the first day of 2020 grew by 20% to a single-day record of $386 million. App developers have earned $155 billion since the inception of App Store in 2008.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Name one freedom fighter from your party: MP CM Nath to PM Modi
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath said that the BJP should not lecture the Congress on nationalism and PM Narendra Modi should instead name one person from the BJP party who participated in India's freedom struggle. Nath added, "If not from your (PM Modi's) party, name one relative of yours who participated in the freedom struggle."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Delhi Police ordered from top not to prevent violence: Kejriwal
text: Speaking about Delhi Police, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said they are sometimes "ordered from the top" not to prevent incidents of violence and if they disobey, they are suspended. He was reportedly speaking about the incident of violence in JNU campus on Sunday. Kejriwal further said that if given a chance, Delhi Police will "risk their lives" to prevent violence.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Blast in WB after seized firecrackers go off while being diffused
text: Several houses were damaged in West Bengal's Naihati on Thursday after a blast took place when the police were disposing illegal firecrackers seized on the bank of a river. Protesting against the authorities over the explosion, locals set two police vehicles on fire and also blocked some roads in the area, police said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Matter of improving economy put in cold storage by govt: Priyanka
text: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Thursday said that the BJP government should have paid maximum attention to the economy, but the matter of improving economy has been "put in cold storage". "Estimates of GDP growth show that situation isn't good," she said. She added the "biggest impact" of this is being borne by trade, the poor and daily wage labourers.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: UK PM Johnson one of Europe's bravest politicians: Hungarian PM
text: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban has said UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is "one of Europe's bravest politicians". He said that post-EU UK would be successful and it had opened a "fantastic door, a fantastic opportunity" for itself. "I believe a generous and strategic cooperation is needed with the British...when they are no longer members of the EU," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Religare Finvest aims to restructure ₹5,850 cr debt by March
text: Religare Finvest, which is being acquired by TCG advisory services, said it is "hopeful" of restructuring its ₹5,850 crore debt by March. The company added that it is in talks with banks to declare 51% of its debt as payable through cash flows and the rest as "unsustainable". Under RBI's corrective action plan, Religare has been restricted from lending activity.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: BYJU's India's 3rd most valuable startup at $8 bn after latest funding: Report
text: Byju Raveendran-led edtech startup BYJU's on Thursday announced raising a new round of funding from Tiger Global Management. The Bengaluru-based startup raised $200 million at a valuation of $8 billion, Financial Express Online reported quoting sources. With the latest round, BYJU's has become India's third most valued startup following Paytm valued at around $16 billion and OYO at $10 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: JNU students marching towards Rashtrapati Bhavan lathicharged, detained by police
text: The Delhi Police on Thursday lathicharged and detained Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) students marching towards the Rashtrapati Bhavan to demand the removal of university Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar. The JNUSU president along with other members held a meeting with the Ministry of Human Resource Development earlier today seeking Kumar's removal following an attack by a masked mob on Sunday.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Rangoli says college mate Avinash threw acid on her, reveals attack story
text: Rangoli Chandel has revealed that a person named Avinash Sharma threw acid on her and they used to be in the same friend circle in college. "He proposed to me...I didn't share same feelings," she added, saying he got more persistent after her engagement. Rangoli further revealed that he attacked her by visiting her at her PG.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Fan tries to kiss Sara's hand, bodyguard scares him away; video surfaces
text: A video shared by photographer Viral Bhayani shows a fan trying to kiss actress Sara Ali Khan's hand as she posed for paparazzi outside her gym. The fan asked for Sara's hand and after she extended it to greet him, he can be seen trying to kiss her hand. Her bodyguard then immediately intervened and scared the fan away.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 101-yr-old freedom fighter & anti-CAA protestor ends hunger strike; pics viral
text: The pictures of a 101-year-old freedom fighter, who joined anti-CAA protesters in Bengaluru for a hunger strike, have gone viral on social media. Harohalli Srinivasaiah Doreswamy broke his fast by drinking coconut water along with fellow protesters at Freedom Park. Other protesters broke their fast through his hands as 'Raghupati Raghava Raja Ram' played in the background.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Fielder jumps from outside rope to throw ball for relay catch, confuses umpires
text: Brisbane Heat's Matt Renshaw threw the ball towards Tom Banton to complete a relay catch after jumping from outside the rope to dismiss Hobart Hurricanes' Matthew Wade. Third umpire declared Wade not out before changing the decision to out. The catch was deemed legal as per laws updated in 2013. "It was pretty good work," Wade said about Renshaw's effort.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: How are crown jewels: Female presenter asks batsman hit in private parts twice
text: Perth Scorchers' English batsman Liam Livingstone was hit in his private parts twice while batting against Melbourne Renegades in a Big Bash League match. "How are the crown jewels feeling?" presenter Erin Holland asked him on the sidelines during the match. Responding to her, Livingstone said, "They are alright now. I wouldn’t advise getting hit in the same place twice."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Uber to let riders, drivers record audio of their trips in India for safety
text: Uber will allow riders and drivers in India to record the audio of their trips if they're feeling uncomfortable and send it to the company. The feature will be in the testing phase later this year. Additionally, Uber announced two more safety features - Uber intervention when there's a long unplanned stop in a ride, and a four-digit authentication code.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Security of US & Israeli envoys, assets in India increased: Report
text: Security of the US and Israeli diplomats and their assets, including embassies, trade interests and personnel in India have been increased on the suggestions of Intelligence Bureau (IB), ANI reported. IB stated that terrorist attacks, vandalism, and demonstrations at such locations cannot be ruled out. Iran threatened retaliation against the US after its top General was killed by the US.
author: Shailesh

headlines: ISIS terror module busted in Delhi, 3 suspects arrested
text: The Special Cell of Delhi Police on Thursday busted a terror module associated with the ISIS and arrested three suspects. The three men were held from Wazirabad area in North-East Delhi. The police said that the three men were planning to carry out an attack in Delhi or western Uttar Pradesh and were to get instructions from a foreign handler.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: We are not breaking the country, we will break BJP: Kanhaiya Kumar
text: Former Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) President Kanhaiya Kumar on Thursday said that activists and those protesting against the attack on students and teachers of JNU were not breaking the country but would break the BJP instead. Kanhaiya was referring to being called a member of tukde tukde gang. He was addressing the reports outside the HRD ministry office.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Iran may have intentionally avoided US casualties in missile strikes: Reports
text: Iran is believed to have intentionally avoided any US military casualties in missile strikes on US bases in Iraq to prevent the crisis from escalating out of control, Reuters said quoting US and European government sources. The US had received an early warning from intelligence sources and Iraq that conveyed Iran's intentions to launch the strikes, another report said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Malaysia body says India palm oil import curbs to start price war with Indonesia
text: India's restrictions on imports of refined palm oil will start a price war with rival supplier Indonesia, the Palm Oil Refiners Association of Malaysia said. It added that Malaysia will now have to compete on crude palm oil sales to India, where Indonesia has traditionally been more cost competitive. Malaysia is the main supplier of refined palm oil to India.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: India's expected nominal GDP growth for this fiscal lowest in 44 years
text: India's nominal Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth is expected to fall to 7.5% in 2019-20, the lowest since 1975-76, according to first advance estimates released on Tuesday. This is the first time since 2002-03 that nominal GDP growth would be in single digits. After adjusting for inflation, GDP is forecast to grow at 5%, the slowest pace in 11 years.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Mamata to skip anti-CAA meet by Oppn over 'violence' by Left, Cong
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said she will boycott Opposition's anti-CAA meeting on January 13. Banerjee added that she decided to skip the meet over the violence that was done in the state allegedly by Left Front and Congress workers during the trade union strike on Wednesday. Banerjee said she won't tolerate "double standards" of Left and Congress.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: He's been unbelievable, hope he continues: Finch on Labuschagne
text: Talking about Marnus Labuschagne's expected ODI debut against India in the three-match ODI series, Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has said that Labuschagne has been "unbelievable" and "hopefully he can continue that."
