Labuschagne has scored 1459 runs in 14 Tests for Australia at an average of 63.43. He has slammed four tons and three half-tons in his last five Tests.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: India here we come: David Warner ahead of ODI series
text: Ahead of the three-match ODI series against India, David Warner posted on Instagram, "India here we come!!…Looking forward to seeing all our Indian fans." Australia have won their last four series including two T20I series against Sri Lanka and Pakistan and two Test series against Pakistan and New Zealand. The ODI series against India will start on January 14.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: AAP govt constructed 20,000 classrooms in 5 yrs: Delhi CM Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said the AAP government constructed 20,000 classrooms in five years which are equivalent to opening 500 new schools. People have to choose if they want the AAP government model or BJP's governance model in which "109 MCD schools were closed in 9 years", Kejriwal added. "Our students are better than those of private schools," he claimed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Official sponsored goondaism: Jairam Ramesh on JNU violence
text: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh claimed the attack on students in JNU campus by masked miscreants was planned and termed it "official sponsored goondaism". He alleged Home Minister Amit Shah and Human Resource Development Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal were behind the attack. Jairam alleged the Delhi Police was aware of who was involved in the attack but it is "purposely being negligent".
author: Shailesh

headlines: B'luru bike rental startup Bounce raises $97M led by Accel, Eduardo's VC firm
text: Bengaluru-based bike rental startup Bounce has raised $97 million in Series D funding led by Accel Partners and Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin's B Capital. Existing investors including Chiratae Ventures and Sequoia Capital also participated in the round. As per Entrackr, Bounce's valuation has grown 2.8 times to about $453.5 million from $160.1 million in November, as per a valuation report.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Ola confirms exit of 2 top-level execs amid reports of IPO in 2021
text: Amid reports of Ola going public in 2021, it has announced the exit of two top-level executives and the appointment of Ridlr co-founder Brijraj Vaghani as its CTO. Ola has been focusing on restructuring its workforce to narrow losses before filing for IPO. The ride-sharing app plans to formally begin the IPO process by end of 2021 fiscal.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: No trees were cut for Defence Expo in Lucknow: UP govt to SC
text: The Uttar Pradesh government has said to the Supreme Court that it hasn't and will not cut trees for the Defence Expo in capital Lucknow. SC was hearing a petition filed against the Uttar Pradesh government's proposal to cut 64,000 trees for Defence Expo. Following Uttar Pradesh counsel's statement, the court asked the petitioner's lawyer to withdraw the plea.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: JNU students hold protest march in Mandi House, demands VC's removal
text: JNU students on Thursday gathered at Delhi's Mandi House to hold a protest march towards HRD Ministry against the violence that took place in the varsity on January 5. They were demanding Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar's removal over the violence. The protesters were joined by RJD leader Manoj Jha, CPI(M) leaders Sitaram Yechury, Brinda Karat, LJD's Sharad Yadav, among others.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Truck with LPG cylinders explodes in Guj, students in nearby bus rescued
text: Multiple explosions occurred on Thursday after a truck carrying LPG cylinders overturned in Gujarat's Surat. At least 26 students were safely evacuated from a school bus which was in close proximity to the truck before it was engulfed in flames because of the explosions. The reason as to why the truck overturned is yet to be ascertained.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Killing of Iran's top commander was self-defence: US tells UN
text: In a letter to the United Nations, the US justified the killing of Iran's top commander Qassem Soleimani as "self-defence" under Article 51 of the UN Charter. US Ambassador Kelly Craft said the country is "prepared to take additional actions in the Middle East as necessary". Iran had also justified its missile attacks on US bases in Iraq as "self-defence".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Vow to get answers: Trudeau as 63 Canadians die in Ukraine plane crash
text: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau vowed that his government will get answers after a Ukrainian plane crashed in Iran on Wednesday, killing 63 Canadian nationals. Trudeau expressed his "deepest condolences" to the families of the victims and ensured that the "crash will be thoroughly investigated". All 176 people on board the Boeing 737 jet were killed in the crash.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Cabinet approves strategic sale of govt stake in Neelachal Ispat
text: The Union Cabinet approved government's stake sale in four PSUs in Neelachal Ispat Nigam Limited (NINL), namely, MMTC, NMDC, BHEL and MECON. The buyer will be selected through a two-stage auction process and is expected to "bring in new investment for the company". NINL is a JV in which the four PSUs and two PSUs of Odisha government are shareholders.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Why talk about my husband being a divorcee? I'm not a virgin either: Nehha
text: Bigg Boss 12 contestant Nehha Pendse, who got married to businessman Shardul Singh Bayas, questioned why people are talking about her husband being a divorcee while adding, "It's not that I'm a virgin either." "I appreciate...that he took chances with women he was in love with," she added. "If a marriage isn't working out, one should end it," said Nehha.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Court directs 'Chhapaak' makers to credit acid attack survivor Laxmi's lawyer
text: A Delhi court has directed the makers of Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Chhapaak' to give lawyer Aparna Bhat credit in the film.  Bhat was the legal representative of Laxmi Agarwal, the acid attack survivor on whom the film is based. Bhat had filed a plea seeking a stay on the film, saying the makers haven't mentioned her name or given her credit.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Jharkhand govt to drop sedition charges against 3,000 CAA protesters
text: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren said the state government has recommended dropping of sedition charges filed against 3,000 people for protesting against CAA in Dhanbad. He added that the administration has asked for action against the concerned official. Soren also urged the people of Jharkhand that it is their state and abiding by the law and order is their duty.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Shane Warne's cap breaks auction records of Don Bradman, MS Dhoni
text: The bid for ex-Australia spinner Shane Warne's 'baggy green' cap has reached AU$680,500, surpassing the final auction price of the 'baggy green' cap of batting legend Sir Don Bradman which was sold for AU$425,000 in 2003. The bid is also way above the price of MS Dhoni's 2011 World Cup final bat, which was sold for £100,000 in July 2011.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sachin Tendulkar trolls Ganguly over 'fitness session in cold morning' pic
text: Sachin Tendulkar trolled Sourav Ganguly after the latter shared on social media a picture of himself training with the caption, "A good fitness session in a cold morning is very freshening". Addressing Sachin, Ganguly wrote, "I always was a fitness freak...You remember the great training days." Sachin replied, "Yes Dadi...We all know how much you enjoyed training! Especially 'Skipping'."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Twitter's Design Lead shares pic after beating lung cancer, tweets 'f*** cancer'
text: Twitter's Design Lead Mike Kruzeniski on Thursday took to the microblogging platform to reveal that he beat lung cancer. Sharing a picture of himself, Kruzeniski tweeted, "My most recent scans show I'm now in full remission...F*** cancer." He also tweeted, "2019 was rough! I don't know what the future holds but I'm soooo happy to still be alive and kicking."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Amazon's video doorbell company fires 4 employees for watching customer videos
text: Amazon subsidiary Ring, which makes smart doorbells with security cameras, has fired at least four employees for improperly seeking access to customer data over the last four years. "The attempted access to the data exceeded what was necessary for their job functions," Amazon said about the fired employees. Amazon had acquired the video-capturing doorbell maker in 2018.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Not interested in buying stake in Yes Bank: Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar
text: Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma told Livemint he's not interested in buying a stake in Yes Bank and denied holding any talks with Yes Bank's Founder Rana Kapoor. "If we as a group have a bank and, I as a chair of the bank, own 51% of the bank, it sounds too far-fetched for an individual or company," Sharma added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: State can't deprive citizens of their property without legal sanction: SC
text: The Supreme Court said the state can't forcibly dispossess citizens of their private property without following due process of law or else it'd be a violation of human and constitutional rights. The court was hearing a case filed by a widow whose land was acquired in 1967-68 for construction of a road by Himachal Pradesh government without following acquisition proceedings.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: I was just 19: Nirbhaya convict in curative petition in SC days before hanging
text: In his curative petition in the Supreme Court, Nirbhaya gangrape convict Vinay Sharma has said the court should've considered he was only 19 at the time of the crime. "The petitioner's parents are old and extremely poor. If the petitioner is executed, his entire family will be destroyed," the petition stated. All four convicts will be hanged on January 22.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Justice Dilip B Bhosale resigns as Lokpal member
text: Justice Dilip B Bhosale has resigned from the post of Lokpal member citing personal reasons. "I have tendered my resignation from the post of judicial member Lokpal on January 6, with effect from January 12, 2020," he said in a tweet. Justice Bhosale along with the other seven Lokpal members was administered the oath of office last year in March.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Trump doesn't want to degrade India's defence capabilities: US on sanctions
text: US President Donald Trump's administration does not want to degrade India's defence capabilities, a US official said on the issue of sanctions applied on countries engaging in defence trade with Russia. India signed a $5 billion deal with Russia to purchase five S-400 surface-to-air missile systems. "There's a case-by-case analysis on where CAATSA sanctions could be applied," the official added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Ukrainian plane was trying to return to airport when it crashed: Investigators
text: The Ukraine International Airlines plane with 176 people on board was trying to return to the airport when it crashed in Iran on Wednesday, Iranian investigators said. The plane did not make any radio call for help, they added. Iran has said that it won't hand over both the black boxes of the plane to Boeing or to the US.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Iran asked its militias not to move against US targets: US VP Pence
text: US Vice President Mike Pence said the US received "encouraging intelligence" that Iran asked its militia not to move against American targets or civilians. However, Pence added that the US will continue to confront Iran the way US President Donald Trump has done "since early in this administration". Iran fired over 12 missiles targeting two US military bases in Iraq.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Complicated issue: Buckingham Palace as Harry, Meghan step back from duties
text: The Buckingham Palace has issued a statement after Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle announced their decision to step back from royal duties. "We understand their desire to take a different approach but these are complicated issues that'll take time to work through...Discussions with the Duke and Duchess of Sussex are at an early stage," the palace said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Sensex records best single-day rally in 3 months as US-Iran tensions ease
text: Indian equity benchmark Sensex rose 635 points (1.55%) on Thursday to close at 41,452 as US-Iran tensions eased, logging its best single-day gain in three months. "The fact that we have this great military and equipment...does not mean we have to use it," US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday, adding that Iran appears to be standing down.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: PM interacts with economists ahead of Budget, FM not present in meeting
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday interacted with economists and industry experts at NITI Aayog in Delhi ahead of the Union Budget. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman was not present at the meeting, which was attended by Union Ministers Amit Shah, Piyush Goyal and Nitin Gadkari. On Monday, PM Modi discussed ways to improve growth with India's top business leaders.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 15,000 Axis Bank employees resign in a few months: Reports
text: At least 15,000 Axis Bank employees, mostly at the branch level and some at the senior level, have reportedly quit in the past few months. The resignations come as employees struggled to cope with the growth targets of the new management led by CEO Amitabh Chaudhry, reports said. However, the bank said it had already hired 28,000 people this fiscal.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I roasted Hollywood for wearing their liberalism like a medal: Gervais
text: Commenting on his monologue at the Golden Globes 2020, which he hosted, comedian Ricky Gervais said that he didn't roast Hollywood for "being a bunch of liberals". He took to Twitter and wrote that he roasted them for "wearing their liberalism like a medal". Gervais added that his job is to "take the piss" and he "did that".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: SC refuses hearing on plea seeking to declare CAA constitutional
text: A Supreme Court bench headed by CJI SA Bobde has refused an urgent hearing on plea seeking to declare Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) constitutional. The CJI said that this is the first time a plea has been filed to declare an Act constitutional. "This court's job is to determine validity of a law...not declare it as constitutional," the CJI added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Australia defeat Britain 2-1 to enter ATP Cup semi-finals
text: Australia defeated Britain 2-1 on Thursday to enter the semi-finals of the ATP Cup. In the singles matches, while Nick Kyrgios defeated London-based Cameron Norrie 6-2, 6-2, Britain's Dan Evans beat Alex de Minaur 7-6(7-4), 4-6, 7-6(7-2) to set up a quarter-final decisive doubles. In the deciding match, Kyrgios and Minaur defeated Jamie Murray and Joe Salisbury 3-6, 6-3, 7-6(18-16).
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: James Anderson ruled out of last 2 Tests against SA after rib injury
text: England pacer James Anderson has been ruled out of the last two Tests against South Africa after he injured his left rib during the second Test. Anderson, who finished the second Test with match figures of 7-63, had returned to cricket with the South Africa series after a four-month gap due to a calf injury.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: PV Sindhu, Saina Nehwal enter Malaysia Masters quarterfinals
text: Shuttlers PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal have entered the quarterfinals in the women's singles of Malaysia Masters. In the pre-quarterfinals, while Sindhu defeated Japan's Aya Ohori 21-10, 21-15, Nehwal beat South Korea's An Se Young 25-23, 21-12. In men's singles, HS Prannoy lost to Japan's Kento Momota and Sameer Verma was defeated by Malaysia's Lee Zii Jia.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Warner Bros to use AI to decide the best time to release movies
text: Warner Bros. has announced that it has partnered with LA firm Cinelytic to use its artificial intelligence platform to decide the best time to release a movie. Cinelytic's system will help in determining how much revenue a movie would earn or when a title should premiere. The system is under trial run and only involves movies on the international side.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: UK forex firm Travelex hit with $6 million ransomware attack
text: UK-based foreign exchange company Travelex has become victim to Sodinokibi ransomware, with attackers reportedly requesting $6 million in cryptocurrency. The attackers hacked 5GB of sensitive data, telling Travelex that their network will be restored if the payment is made in time. The attackers threatened to sell the entire data in case the payment isn't made in seven days.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: UK must compromise to get Brexit trade deal: EU chief
text: Ahead of the 31 January Brexit deadline, European Commission Chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said the UK won't get the "highest quality access" to its market after Brexit unless it makes major concessions. "The transition time is very, very tight...so it's basically impossible to negotiate all that I have been mentioning, so we'll have to prioritise," she added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: World can't afford another war, show maximum restraint: UN chief
text: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday asked to make every effort to avoid a war in the Gulf, which the world cannot afford. He re-iterated the "passionate appeal for peace" he made on Monday to world leaders to "stop escalation, exercise maximum restraint, re-start dialogue" and "renew international cooperation". Guterres said ordinary people pay the highest price of war.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Nirbhaya convict files petition in SC after Delhi court fixes date of execution
text: One of the Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts, Vinay Kumar Sharma, on Thursday filed a curative petition before the Supreme Court. This comes after a Delhi court issued a death warrant against all the four convicts and fixed January 22 as the date of execution. The curative petition is filed to seek a second review of the top court's judgement.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Lawyer of acid attack survivor Laxmi sues Chhapaak makers, says she got no credit
text: Lawyer Aparna Bhat, who represented acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal, the inspiration behind Deepika Padukone starrer 'Chhapaak', has filed a plea seeking stay on the film. She wrote that she's "disturbed after watching the film" as the makers haven't given her credit. "I cannot match the powers of these mighty producers of Bollywood but keeping quiet will...endorse injustice," Aparna added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Was pregnant during 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie...', but had a miscarriage: Kajol
text: Speaking to Humans of Bombay, actress Kajol revealed she was pregnant while shooting for the 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' but suffered a miscarriage. "I was in the hospital–the film had done so well, but it wasn't a happy time. I had another miscarriage after that," she added. "But eventually it worked out...and our family is complete," said Kajol.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: How many of you haven't taken leave in 5yrs? PM Modi hasn't: Juhi at pro-CAA rally
text: Speaking at a pro-CAA rally on Wednesday, Juhi Chawla said, "How many of you haven't taken even a single leave in last five years? PM Narendra Modi hasn't." "I'm not talking about any party or politics. I'm talking about a person who's our PM and who always thinks what he should do for India next," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Justin Bieber reveals he is suffering from Lyme disease, denies he is on meth
text: Singer Justin Bieber has revealed he's suffering from Lyme disease, an infectious disease spread by ticks. "While...people kept saying Justin...looks like shit, on meth etc. they failed to realise I've been recently diagnosed with Lyme disease," he wrote. "Not only that but had a serious case of chronic mono which affected my, skin, brain function...and overall health," Bieber added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Will decide on CAA petitions only when the violence stops: CJI SA Bobde
text: While hearing a petition in the Supreme Court seeking an order to declare Citizenship (Amendment) Act as constitutional, CJI SA Bobde said, "Country is going through difficult times...The object should be to bring about peace. Such petitions don't help." He also asserted that the court will decide on the Act's constitutional validity only when the violence over it will stop.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: BJP MP in WB university to give lecture on CAA locked up by students for 6hrs
text: BJP MP Swapan Dasgupta was locked up by the student protesters for six hours at the Visva Bharati University in West Bengal where he was to deliver a lecture on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "How does it feel to have a mob attack a peaceful meeting on CAA and [intimidating] students...Locked into room now with mob outside," Dasgupta had tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 9 out of top 10 and 17 out of top 20 Test bowlers are fast bowlers
text: In latest ICC rankings for Test bowlers, India's Ravichandran Ashwin (9) is the only spinner in the top 10. The rankings are topped by Australian pacer Pat Cummins, who's followed by New Zealand pacer Neil Wagner and West Indies' Jason Holder. Further, Australia's Nathan Lyon and Indian all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja join Ashwin as the only three spinners in top 20.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I will never be able to fill MS Dhoni's shoes: Hardik Pandya
text: On being asked whether he had thought about playing the finisher role in case MS Dhoni isn't part of India's T20 World Cup squad, Hardik Pandya said, "I'll never be able to fill MS' shoes...so I don't even think that way." He added, "I'm quite excited for the challenge to be honest. Whatever I do...it'll be always for the team."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Air taxi startup EHang flies autonomously in US for first time
text: China-based aerial passenger drone startup EHang flew its EHang 216 two-seat self-flying taxi fully autonomously in North Carolina, a first for the company both in the US and North America. EHang is currently working towards getting an approval to fly with passengers on board.  The startup has also delivered around 40 of its aircraft to paying customers.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Printing mistake changed Cong leader's ministry and he got upset: Ajit Pawar
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Wednesday said that Congress Minister Vijay Wadettiwar was supposed to get 'Relief and Rehabilitation' Ministry, but due to a "printing mistake", the list mentioned 'Earthquake Rehabilitation' as his portfolio. Wadettiwar got upset with it, Pawar added. Meanwhile, CM Uddhav Thackeray has assured the leader of making the necessary correction.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Boycott Deepika, her films: BJP MLA over actress joining protest in JNU
text: BJP MLA Raja Singh on Wednesday criticised actress Deepika Padukone over going to the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) for participating in the protest and called for boycotting the actress and her upcoming film 'Chhapaak'. "She stood with the same people who attacked our jawans and police," Singh said. "She should've inquired about JNU's history once before going there," he added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Fire breaks out at Noida's ESIC Hospital, all patients evacuated
text: A fire broke out at the ESIC Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Noida on Thursday and six fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the blaze, officials said. The fire broke out in the basement of the hospital building, a police official said. All the people, including the patients, were evacuated and no casualties have been reported so far.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Patients evacuated, made to lie on ground after fire in Noida hospital
text: Patients were evacuated after fire broke out in ESIC Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Noida on Thursday. The patients were seen lying on the ground while their families stood surrounding them outside the hospital. No casualties have been reported so far and at least six fire engines are present at the spot to contain the situation.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Showed goons 'Hindu nationalism' book I was reading to escape: JNU student
text: A JNU student told Congress' fact-finding committee that when a masked mob surrounded him in his hostel room on January 5, he told them he's a part of ABVP to escape unhurt. "They then asked for proof. I showed them the book I was reading 'Hindu Nationalism: A Reader'," he added. The student said they read the title and left.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Underworld don Ejaz Lakdawala arrested by Mumbai Police
text: The Mumbai Police on Thursday announced that it has arrested underworld don Ejaz Lakdawala in Patna. Lakdawala has over 30 cases pending against him with the crime branch. This comes after Ejaz's daughter Sonia Lakdawala was recently arrested at the Mumbai airport while she was allegedly attempting to fly to Nepal.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Don't bite: Pope Francis to nun after he agrees to kiss her on the cheek
text: After a nun requested Pope Francis for a kiss, he agreed to kiss her on the cheek, saying, "Stay calm! I will give you a kiss but you stay calm. Don't bite!" A video shows the nun jumping with happiness after the kiss. This comes after the Pope had slapped a woman's hand when she forcefully pulled him towards her.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Chris Hemsworth pledges to donate $1 mn to fight Australian bushfires
text: Australian actor Chris Hemsworth has announced that he and his family are donating $1 million to "support the fight against the Australian bushfires". "Hopefully you guys...chip in too. Every penny counts...whatever you can muster up is greatly appreciated," Chris wrote. Reportedly, at least 24 people have died and nearly 15 million acres of land destroyed due to the bushfires.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Tanushree compares Nana Patekar to Asaram Bapu, demands lie detector test
text: Tanushree Dutta has compared Nana Patekar, whom she had accused in the #MeToo movement, to self-proclaimed saint Asaram Bapu. She has demanded a lie detector and narco-analysis test against Nana after Mumbai's Oshiwara Police Station sought closure of the case on grounds of no evidence. "It's easy to fool people...just wear...white kurta. Asaram Bapu also wore one," Tanushree added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Karan Johar announces film on RAW founder RN Kao
text: Karan Johar has announced a film based on the life of India's Research and Analysis Wing (RAW) founder RN Kao. "Turning pages into frames....an adaptation of Nitin Gokhale's book 'R.N.Kao: Gentleman Spymaster' to the silver screen," Karan tweeted. "The film will tell the story of Kao...and how he [became] a success story in the world of international espionage," he added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Oscars to go without a host for 2nd straight year
text: Oscars 2020 will have no host, ABC Entertainment head Karey Burke announced on Wednesday. She added that the telecast, scheduled for February 9, will focus on "huge entertainment value, big musical numbers, big comedy and star power". This would be the second straight year that Oscars will have no host as the 2019 ceremony also went without a host.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Don't know what BJP trolls would have done to Gandhiji: Shatrughan
text: Commenting on "BJP trolls", Congress' Shatrughan Sinha said what would've they done to Mahatma Gandhi and Jayaprakash Narayan. "Fortunately, Gandhiji and JP aren't among us," he added. "Trolls...doing things which...anti-national would do, but...seeing others as anti-nationals," he further said. This comes after Sonakshi Sinha got trolled for praising Deepika Padukone for supporting JNU students.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Ananya is 21, would be abnormal if she didn't have a boyfriend: Chunky
text: Actor Chunky Panday, while talking about his daughter Ananya Panday's love life, said in an interview that she is 21 and it would be "abnormal" if she didn't have a boyfriend. "I've been through this in my time so I know how much of it is true," he added. "You're ready for these things as an insider," Chunky further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Sequoia India leads ₹130 cr round in personal care brand Mamaearth
text: Gurugram-based personal care brand Mamaearth on Wednesday raised ₹130 crore (about $18.14 million) in a round led by Sequoia Capital India. Existing investors Fireside Ventures, Stellaris Venture Partners and Sharp Ventures also participated in the round. The startup was founded in 2016 by husband-wife duo Varun Alagh and Ghazal Alagh.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Man poses as UP Minister for 'free holiday' in Goa, arrested
text: Goa Police arrested a man for allegedly posing as a minister from Uttar Pradesh by submitting fake documents and staying at a state guest house for over 10 days. Police said the man was in Goa to enjoy a free holiday. After the man's behaviour was found to be suspicious, Goa CM Pramod Sawant alerted the police to arrest him.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: UP govt to construct 'holy path' in Varanasi connecting 108 religious sites
text: Uttar Pradesh government has decided to construct a "holy path" in Varanasi which will connect around 108 religious sites in the city. Religious sites including Kashi Vishwanath, Manas Jyotirlinga will be connected to the new path. This will facilitate tourists and devotees to visit various holy sites following one route only, Culture and Tourism Minister Neelkanth Tiwari said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: PM Modi cancels Assam visit for 2nd time in a month amid CAA protests
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has cancelled his Assam visit to inaugurate the Khelo India Youth Games 2020 in Guwahati on January 10. This makes PM's second visit to Assam in a month getting cancelled amid anti-CAA protests across the state. Earlier, the India-Japan summit in Guwahati was cancelled, wherein PM Modi was scheduled to meet Japan PM Shinzo Abe.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: People claim they cancelled Chhapaak tickets, pics show same seats being cancelled
text: After Deepika Padukone on Tuesday joined a protest against violence at JNU, several social media users claimed they cancelled their bookings for her film 'Chhapaak'. However, another Twitter user shared a thread that showed tickets for the same seats of the same show at the same theatre being supposedly cancelled. #BoycottChhapaak had started trending on Twitter after Deepika's JNU visit.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Claims of Chhapaak changing villain from Muslim man to Hindu turn out to be fake
text: After Deepika Padukone attended a protest in JNU on Tuesday, several social media users on Wednesday claimed that her film 'Chhapaak' changed the villain's name from 'Nadeem Khan' to 'Rajesh'. "Makers changed his name...to suit their agenda," a user tweeted. However, Nadeem has been changed to 'Basheer' and 'Rajesh' is Deepika's character's boyfriend in the film, said PTI.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Ladkiya itna weight uthati hai: Jadeja trolls Umesh over 'weightlifting' video
text: After fast bowler Umesh Yadav shared a video of himself lifting weights on Instagram, all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja trolled him by commenting on his post, "Ladkiya itna weight uthati hai (Even girls can lift this)." Responding to Jadeja, Umesh wrote, "Yeh toh sirf teaser tha, picture abhi baaki hai mere dost (This was just a teaser, wait for the movie)."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: US startup shows ₹28,600 'reverse microwave' that chills beer in under 1 min
text: US-based startup Matrix showcased a prototype of 'Juno', a ₹28,600 device dubbed as 'reverse microwave', that claims to chill beer and some other beverages in under 1 minute. Showcased at CES 2020, it uses thermoelectric cooling technology. The startup further claims that Juno can chill a bottle of wine to 50º F in 3 minutes.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mamata criticises Left and Cong over trade unions' strike in Bengal
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has criticised the Left and the Congress over their support to the trade unions' strike. She said that those who don't have any political existence in the state are trying to ruin its economy by pursuing "cheap politics" of strikes. Banerjee said she supported the cause of strike but won't allow strike in West Bengal.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Airbnb makes fun of its logo, compares it to cookies that look like ballsack
text: US-based home-renting marketplace Airbnb on Wednesday compared its own logo to macaroon cookies baked by a woman that accidentally turned out in the shape of ballsack. Emma Plummer, a 23-year-old self-taught baker, had tweeted a picture of the cookies and wrote, "I tried to make hearts and they turned out like ballsacks." In response, Airbnb tweeted, "This looks oddly familiar."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nobel laureate's boat blocked in Bharat Bandh, says 'it was like I was at gunpoint'
text: Nobel laureate Michael Levitt's houseboat was blocked in the backwaters in Kerala by trade union activists during Bharat Bandh on Wednesday. Levitt, who was in Kerala as a state guest, said, "It is as if a bandit stopped us (him and his wife) at gunpoint." "Being stopped by criminals...sends a very bad message to tourists," Levitt wrote in an email.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Chandrababu Naidu detained for protesting 3 state capitals in Andhra
text: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) President and former Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu was on Wednesday detained by police in Vijayawada. Police detained Naidu ahead of the flagging-off ceremony of Amaravati Parirakshana Samiti's bus yatra against CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led state government's proposal of three state capitals for the legislature, the executive and the judiciary.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Diplomats from 16 countries to visit J&K on Thursday
text: The government will take a group of 16 foreign envoys for a two-day visit to Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday to review the ground situation. The envoys will be meeting Lieutenant Governor GC Murmu as well as civil society members during their visit. The delegation will include diplomats from the US, Bangladesh, Vietnam, Maldives, South Korea and Nigeria, among others.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Patparganj Industrial area, one dead
text: One person has died in a fire that broke out in Delhi's Patparganj Industrial area in the wee hours of Thursday. As many as 35 fire tenders have been rushed to the spot to douse the blaze. This comes weeks after a fire broke out at a cloth godown in the capital's Kirari area, killing as many as nine people.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Communicate more with students and faculty: HRD Ministry to JNU V-C
text: The HRD Ministry officials have "advised" JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar to increase communication with students and take faculty into confidence, days after violence on the campus. JNU is a premier university and it should be maintained that way, directed the officials. Jagadesh Kumar told the officials that efforts were being made to facilitate semester registration for "willing" students.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 26-year-old stalker kidnaps and kills 17-yr-old girl, dumps body in tea plantation
text: A 26-year-old Kerala man named Safar kidnapped a 17-year-old girl and murdered her after having stalked and harassed her for a long time. The accused dumped her body in a tea plantation in Tamil Nadu's Valparai. The victim's father said when he went to pick her up from school, he couldn't find her and then filed a missing person's complaint.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pakistan, China deploy submarines in Arabian Sea during joint drills
text: Pakistan and China have deployed submarines in the Arabian Sea amid the ongoing nine-day exercise aimed at enhancing their partnership. The exercise started in Karachi and will be held until January 14, the Chinese state media reported. The Arabian Sea region is strategically important for India as major ports, including Nhava Sheva and Kochi are located there.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Will step back from royal duties, be financially independent: Prince Harry & Meghan
text: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, have announced they'll step back as "senior" royals and work to become "financially independent". In a statement, they said they intend to balance their time between UK and North America. "This geographic balance will enable us to raise our son with an appreciation for the royal tradition," they stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Kicking US troops out of Middle East final answer to Soleimani's killing: Iran
text: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani has said that "kicking all US forces" out of the Middle East will be the "final answer to the assassination" of General Qassem Soleimani. "General Soleimani fought heroically against ISIS, Al-Nusrah, Al-Qaeda (and others). If it weren't for his war on terror, European capitals would be in great danger now," Rouhani added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 2 rockets fall in Baghdad's area housing US Embassy a day after Iran strike
text: A day after Iran attacked US military bases in Iraq with over 12 missiles, two Katyusha rockets fell inside Baghdad's Green Zone without causing any casualties, the Iraqi military said. The zone houses government buildings and foreign missions. Reportedly, at least one of the rockets fell 100 metres from the US Embassy.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Iran appears to be standing down after missile strikes: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said that "Iran appears to be standing down" following the missile strikes on US bases. "It's a good thing for all parties concerned and a very good thing for the world," he added. "We want you to have a great future. The US is ready to embrace peace," he further told the Iranian leadership and people.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Billionaire to give ₹65.5 cr to Twitter followers to see if it boosts happiness
text: Japanese fashion billionaire Yusaku Maezawa is giving away ₹65.5 crore to his Twitter followers in a "serious social experiment" to see if the payment boosts their happiness. Maezawa will give about ₹6.55 lakh to 1,000 followers selected at random from those who retweeted a January 1 post. The impact of the money will be tracked through regular surveys.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Govt restricts refined palm oil imports after Malaysia's criticism of India
text: The government on Wednesday banned imports of refined palm oil and palmolein without obtaining a permit. The move will hit Malaysia, the main supplier of refined palm oil to India but may help Indonesia, the biggest exporter of crude palm oil. This comes after Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad criticised India's actions in Kashmir and the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA).
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Have seen my photographs being thrown into garbage: Manoj Bajpayee
text: Manoj Bajpayee, while talking about his "initial days", said that he had seen his photographs "being thrown into garbage". "You would give your photographs...be sure they will be thrown into garbage...I've definitely seen this. As soon as I turned...many times, not once or twice," he added. "I've also been chucked...as soon as I've given my first shot," Manoj further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: You'll see Muslim warriors fighting alongside Tanhaji: Ajay on his film
text: Ajay Devgn has said that in his upcoming film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', the audience will get to see "Muslim warriors fighting alongside Tanhaji". "We're not fighting for religion. When we talk about country, then there is no religion," he added. Ajay further said that his film doesn't portray any religion in negative light and that there is no 'Hindutva'.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Sonakshi praises Deepika for JNU visit, says 'not the time to stay quiet'
text: Sonakshi Sinha on Wednesday took to Twitter to praise Deepika Padukone for her support to JNU students. "Kudos to @deepikapadukone for showing up...all those who spoke for speaking up," she tweeted. Adding that this is not the time to stay quiet, Sonakshi further wrote, "Don't visuals of bleeding students...shake you up? We can't sit on the fence any longer."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: You aren't Indians: BJP workers to students opposing pro-CAA banner
text: In a women's college in Bengaluru, BJP workers allegedly shouted at the students that they were not Indians, after party workers put up a pro-CAA banner and students opposed them. Allegedly, BJP workers also called students "Pakistanis" and asked them to "go to Pakistan". "You [students] are not concerned about citizenship, you are concerned about yourself," said a BJP worker.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Gujarat school asks students to write pro-CAA letters to PM, apologises later
text: A school in Gujarat's Ahmedabad asked its students, from Classes 5th to 10th, to write postcards to PM Narendra Modi saying that they and their family support the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. However, the parents of the students protested after they came to know about the incident. The issue was sorted out after the school management apologised.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 100 MPs will write to President Kovind to sack JNU VC: Yechury
text: Around 100 Members of Parliament will be writing to President Ram Nath Kovind demanding that Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar be sacked, CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said. The JNU Students' Union had held Kumar responsible after a masked mob attacked the campus and injured more than 18 students. President Kovind is the visitor to the university.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Cong wins 30 seats in Nagpur Zilla Parishad polls, BJP wins 15
text: BJP won 15 seats in the 58-seat Nagpur Zilla Parishad while Congress won 30 seats in the recently held polls. Reportedly, NCP won 10 seats and Shiv Sena won 1 seat in the local body polls. BJP candidate Maruti Somkuvar lost to Congress candidate Mahendra Dongre in Dhapewada, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari's native village.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 1 killed, 3 injured in shooting near Canada's parliament
text: One person died and 3 others suffered serious injuries in gunfire in the Canadian city of Ottawa, less than a kilometre away from the parliament, the police said. Police responded to reports of multiple gunshots early Wednesday morning and said that it appeared to be a "targeted shooting". Police were seeking a suspect, a statement added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No Americans harmed: Trump after Iran says '80 US terrorists' killed in strikes
text: US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that no Americans were harmed in the missile strikes by Iran targeting US bases in Iraq. "All our soldiers are safe, only minimal damages were sustained at our military bases," he added. Iran had earlier claimed that "80 American terrorists" were killed in the missile strikes.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pak Major General praises Deepika for joining protest at JNU, deletes tweet later
text: Pakistan Army spokesperson Major General Asif Ghafoor tweeted in support of actress Deepika Padukone, who had visited Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) in Delhi and joined students protesting against the recent violence on the campus. He hailed her for "standing with both youth and truth" and called her a "brave person". However, he deleted the tweet later.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Toddler climbs out of 4th floor hotel window in Spain, walks on ledge; video viral
text: A video of a toddler climbing out of the fourth-floor window of a hotel in Spain and walking along the ledge has gone viral online. The toddler's mother was thought to have been in the shower when the child climbed out of the balcony, according to reports. The hotel's managers sent a report to the town hall over the incident.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Ross Taylor breaks down in tears in press conference after creating record
text: Ross Taylor broke down in tears during press conference after becoming the highest run-scorer in Test cricket for New Zealand. He said, "My mentor [late] Martin Crowe, one of the goals he put down for me was to be New Zealand’s highest Test run-scorer. To be honest, I didn’t believe him, but I’d have loved for him to be here."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Work starts tomorrow: Australian spinner Green after ban from bowling for 90 days
text: South Africa-born Australian spinner Chris Green, who represents Sydney Thunder in BBL, has been banned from bowling for 90 days due to an illegal action. Green was cited during Thunder’s loss to Melbourne Stars last week and underwent testing on his action. "I'll do everything...to get back to doing what I love with ball in hand...Work starts tomorrow," Green said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rauf unveils 'adaab' celebration after being criticised for throat-cutting gesture
text: Melbourne Stars' Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf, who was criticised for celebrating wickets by doing 'throat-slashing' gesture, has unveiled a new 'adaab' celebration. Rauf, who took a hat-trick against Sydney Thunder, celebrated his wickets by doing the 'adaab' (greeting) gesture. The 26-year-old had earlier apologised for doing the throat-cutting celebration.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Bid for Shane Warne's 'baggy green' cap reaches ₹2.5 crore within 2 days
text: The bid for ex-Australian spinner Shane Warne's 'baggy green' cap has reached ₹2.5 crore within two days. Warne has put up the cap for auction to raise money for the Australian bushfire victims. Warne had worn the cap throughout his 145-match Test career wherein he took 708 wickets. Warne was presented with the cap ahead of his debut in 1992.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: England wicketkeeper Buttler sledges Philander, calls him 'f***ing knobhead'
text: England wicketkeeper Jos Buttler sledged South Africa's Vernon Philander on the last day of the Cape Town Test. "F***ing move. F***ing knobhead. Can’t get past that f*****g gut!" Buttler was heard telling Philander. The incident happened after Philander almost came in the way of a throw directed towards Buttler. Commentator Mike Atherton then apologised on air for the foul language.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: KL Rahul can get a 50-ball 100 in Tests: Gautam Gambhir
text: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has said that KL Rahul is in unbelievable form. He added, "It amazes me every time I see Rahul bat that why didn’t he play the same way in Test cricket." He further said, "With the kind of quality Rahul possesses, he's someone who can get you a 50-ball 100 in Tests as well."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Words can't describe how shattered I am: Shane Watson shares pics of bushfire
text: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson took to Instagram to share pictures of Australian bushfire. "Words cannot describe how shattered I'm to see the country that I love so much continue to burn out of control," he wrote. "I'm in awe of all of the firefighters who continue to put their lives at risk to save so many others," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Apple returns to tech show CES after 28 years, talks about privacy
text: Apple made an appearance at tech show CES in Las Vegas after 28 years earlier this week when Jane Horvath, Apple's senior director for global privacy, appeared on a panel discussing consumer privacy. "Consumers should have control over their data," Horvath said. Apple last attended CES in 1992 when former CEO John Sculley debuted the Newton personal digital assistant.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I revived Nissan but Japan media painted me as 'cold, greedy, dictator': Ghosn
text: Former Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn on Wednesday said the media in Japan has painted him as "cold, greedy, dictator" despite him reviving the carmaker. "Why Japan is repaying me with evil, for the good that I did to the country, I don't understand," Ghosn added. He accused prosecutors in Tokyo of conspiring with Nissan to oust him as Nissan's head.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: US offered me double pay to run GM, made mistake of not accepting it: Ghosn
text: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn on Wednesday said that he made a mistake of not accepting an offer by the Obama administration in 2009 to run General Motors (GM) on double his salary. Adding that he likes Japan and its people, Ghosn said he was the first foreign business leader to return to the country after the 2011 tsunami.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Ashok Khemka alleges fraud in IAS issuing sports certificate to son
text: Former Haryana Principal Secretary (Sports) Ashok Khemka has alleged that IAS officer Jagdeep Singh fraudulently issued Grade-A sports gradation certificate to his shooter son. Khemka has written to the state government, citing the alleged anomalies in the certificate. Singh's son used the certificate to take Haryana Civil Services Main examination and was declared successful for the appointment.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: We can never again be part of any war: Pak PM amid US-Iran tensions
text: Amid the ongoing US-Iran tensions, Pakistan PM Imran Khan said, "Pakistan is ready to play its role for peace but it can never again be part of any war." He further said he has asked Pakistan's Foreign Minister to visit Iran, Saudi Arabia and the US, and Army chief General Bajwa to contact relevant military leaders to convey the message.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Federer, Nadal, Williams to play fundraiser for Australia bushfire
text: Ahead of the Australia Open, world top tennis players including Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Serena Williams will play an exhibition match on January 15 to raise funds for Australia bushfire relief and rescue efforts. Australia's Nick Kyrgios, who recently broke down while talking about the bushfire, will also play along with Caroline Wozniacki, Stefanos Tsitsipas and Naomi Osaka.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: I don't think about it: Nadal on matching Federer's Grand Slam record
text: Ahead of the first Grand Slam of the season, Australia Open, world number one tennis player Rafael Nadal has said that matching Roger Federer's Grand Slam record isn't on his mind. "My only goal is to keep playing good tennis," he added. Nadal, who has won 19 Grand Slam titles, is only one title behind Federer's all-time record of 20.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: I struggled to buy gloves, now we've come a long way: Mary Kom
text: Talking about sports, six-time world champion boxer Mary Kom has said that it has come a long way with many athletes getting financial backing. "In my early days, I'd struggle to buy even a pair of gloves," she added. Kom's remark came on the sidelines of an event on Khelo India Youth Games, which are to begin from January 10.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Joe Root, Faf du Plessis both back 5-day Tests
text: England skipper Joe Root and South Africa captain Faf du Plessis have backed the five-day Test format amid reports of ICC considering four-day Tests from 2023. On being asked about it, while Root said, "I like five-day test cricket", Plessis said he's a fan of the five-day Test cricket. South Africa and England are currently playing a four-match Test series.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Tom Latham ruled out India-NZ T20I series, Boult doubtful
text: New Zealand wicketkeeper-batsman Tom Latham has been ruled out of the five-match T20I series against India due to a fracture in his little finger during the third Test against Australia. Further, it's reportedly doubtful whether Trent Boult, who fractured his non-bowling hand during the 2nd Test against Australia, will feature in the series. The series will start on January 24.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Should she go to Nagpur to promote film: Cong on Deepika's JNU visit
text: Reacting to reports of some BJP leaders calling for a boycott of Deepika Padukone's upcoming film 'Chhapaak', Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera said, "Should she go to Nagpur, the Sangh (RSS) headquarters, to promote her movie?" Padukone on Tuesday joined the protest at JNU over violence in campus. "PM Narendra Modi should go there...and listen to the youth," Khera further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Game streaming platform Rheo raises $2 mn led by Surge, Lightspeed
text: Online e-sports streaming and community platform Rheo has raised $2 million in seed funding led by Sequoia Capital India's programme Surge and Lightspeed Venture Partners. Unacademy Co-founders Gaurav Munjal and Roman Saini, RedBus Co-founder Phanindra Sama, and others also participated in the funding. The Bengaluru-based startup is founded by Saksham and Prakash Kumar.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm launches one QR code for all digital payments for merchants
text: Paytm on Wednesday launched an all-in-one QR for businesses across India on its 'Paytm for Business' app. This QR will enable all merchants to accept unlimited payments through Paytm Wallet, Rupay Cards and all UPI based payment apps directly into their bank account at 0% fee. The application already has 10 million merchant users, Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Violence in West Bengal during Bharat Bandh, 55 arrested in Kolkata
text: Incidents of violence and arson were reported in West Bengal during a Bharat Bandh called by the members of 10 central trade unions against Union government's 'anti-worker' policies. In response to violence, the police baton-charged the mob and used rubber bullets, officials said. At least 55 people were arrested from Kolkata for allegedly trying to disrupt normal life, police said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Crashed plane built in 2016, serviced 2 days ago: Ukraine Airlines
text: The Boeing 737-800 that crashed in Iran had been built in 2016 and was serviced two days ago, a statement from Ukraine International Airlines read. Later, airline officials claimed that the plane was one of the best in its fleet and the pilots were very experienced. The crash killed all 176 people on board the plane.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Withdrawal of US troops will be worst thing for Iraq: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said that US troops leaving will be the "worst thing that can happen to Iraq". He added, "[T]hat would mean that Iran would have a much bigger foothold, and the people in Iraq don't want to see Iran running the country." He further said that the current time isn't right for US troops to leave Iraq.
author: Shailesh

headlines: India opens coal mining to FDI and sectors other than power, steel
text: The Cabinet has approved an ordinance that will pave the way for the growth of the coal sector and allow foreign direct investment, Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said. It allows sectors other than steel and power to mine coal and removes end-use restrictions. In 2019, India imported 235 million tonnes of coal, though 135 million tonnes was substitutable, Joshi added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: St Stephen's College students boycott classes to protest against CAA, JNU violence
text: St Stephen's College in Delhi on Wednesday joined other institutions in showing solidarity with other students in condemning Sunday's violence at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). The students boycotted classes and were seen carrying placards and shouting slogans during the protest. The protesters also opposed the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) passed by Parliament last month.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Yuvraj uses 'Tom and Jerry' cartoon to welcome Kiwi Carter to 'six sixes' club
text: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh congratulated Canterbury batsman Leo Carter for hitting six sixes in an over in a New Zealand T20 league match. "Welcome...Leo Carter to six sixes club! That was some epic hitting...now please sign your jersey and give it to Devcich as a mark of respect," he tweeted, uploading a photo from 'Tom and Jerry' cartoon.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 2 hat-tricks occur in BBL in 2 hrs in 2 different cities, both by Asian bowlers
text: Two hat-tricks were taken in the BBL on Wednesday within two hours in two different cities. Adelaide Strikers' Afghan all-rounder Rashid Khan registered his third T20 hat-trick by dismissing Sydney Sixers' James Vince, Jack Edwards and Jordan Silk in Adelaide, while Melbourne Stars' Pakistani pacer Haris Rauf dismissed three Sydney Thunder batsmen in a row in last over in Melbourne.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: TikTok security flaw that could've allowed hackers to SMS malware
text: Chinese app TikTok confirmed that a security flaw could have let hackers text links containing malware to users via SMS after cybersecurity firm CheckPoint Research reported about the same on Wednesday. Attackers could've also published or deleted videos, made private videos public, and accessed personal user information. The issues were disclosed and they were fixed by TikTok.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Porsche owner in Ahmedabad fined ₹27.68L, one of the highest ever in India
text: A businessman was fined a total of ₹27.68 lakh for not having required documents for his Porsche 911 said to be worth over ₹2 crore, Ahmedabad Traffic Police said today. It's one of the highest fine amounts levied in India ever. In November 2019, police had impounded the car and fined ₹9.80 lakh for no number plate and valid documents.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Prosecutors told me 'confess or it will get worse for you': Ex-Nissan boss
text: Ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn, who fled Japan where he was awaiting trial for financial crimes, said he had been treated brutally and ruthlessly by prosecutors there. "'It will get worse for you if you don't just confess', the prosecutor told me repeatedly," Ghosn said in Lebanon today. He added he was interrogated for up eight hours a day without lawyers.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Give Bhim Army chief urgent medical treatment: Delhi court to Tihar
text: A Delhi court has directed the Tihar jail authorities to give immediate medical treatment to Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad on an application filed by his counsel. Azad's application said he was suffering from polycythemia, a blood disease that may lead to cardiac arrest if not treated. Azad was arrested on December 21 for allegedly inciting violence during anti-CAA protests.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 2 civilians injured as militants hurl grenade at security forces in J&K
text: At least two civilians were injured after militants threw a grenade at security forces in Zakura area of Srinagar on Wednesday, police said. The grenade missed the intended target and exploded on the roadside, resulting in injuries to the civilians, they added. A search operation was launched to catch the assailants, police said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Karnataka man arrested for issuing death threat to PM Modi, Amit Shah
text: A Karnataka man has been arrested on charges of issuing death threats to PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah. The accused was allegedly spreading audio messages which went viral on WhatsApp groups provoking people to indulge in communal violence. In an audio note, he threatened to kill PM Modi and Shah "if Muslims were affected by CAA".
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Owaisi criticises Cyberabad Police for 'jihadis' in Hyd IT firms tweet
text: AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised Cyberabad Police for responding to a tweet by a BJP IT cell member who purportedly called Muslims "jihadis" and asked if Muslims working in American software companies in Hyderabad were screened after tensions between Iran and US. Cyberabad Police replied, "Yes sir...Thanks for alerting us. Please keep us updated if you find anything suspicious."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Why will Kerala police stations display cartoons on their walls?
text: Authorities have decided to put up positive cartoons about police at Kerala police stations seeking to change the conventional perception of police stations and to make them more people-friendly. All the 481 Kerala police stations would have at least one positive cartoon within the next two months. Cartoons carrying the messages of anti-corruption and humanity would also be put up.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Won't give crashed Ukrainian plane's black box to US firm Boeing: Iran
text: Iran will not give the black box of the crashed Ukrainian plane to American firm Boeing, the head of Tehran's Civil Aviation Organization Ali Abedzadeh said. It was not clear which country Iran would send the box to for analysis of its data, he added. All 176 people aboard the plane were killed after it crashed in Iran.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Smoke from Australia bushfires visible in Chile 12,000 km away
text: The smoke emitted by the bushfires raging in Australia has arrived in Chile after crossing more than 12,000 kilometres. The smoke also reached Brazil's Rio Grande do Sul state, the Brazilian National Institute for Space Research said. The smoke was also visible in Argentina, Chile's meteorological service said, adding that it won't negatively affect the health of South America's inhabitants.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Iran informed us about attacks against US forces: Iraqi PM
text: Iraqi PM Adil Abd Al-Mahdi received a message from Iran that its response to the US' killing of General Qassem Soleimani had started or was imminent, his spokesperson said. Iran told Mahdi it would only target locations where US forces were present but did not specify the locations, he added. There have been no reports of casualties, he further said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 'Ashamed' of India's image abroad: Kishore Mariwala shares incident
text: Narrating an incident from Thailand, industrialist Kishore Mariwala said he's "ashamed" of India's reputation abroad. Mariwala said a yacht chartering company asked if he'd be comfortable with a Muslim skipper since he's a Hindu. "I asked 'Why should I mind?'...Manager said, 'we read in newspapers that Hindus don't want Muslims near them so we were worried about it'!" Mariwala wrote.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Doing 'Zero', 'Bharat' gave me a sense of fulfilment: Katrina
text: Katrina Kaif has said that acting gives her "an incredible amount of satisfaction" and being part of films is "indescribable and an intrinsic part" of her. "[P]laying characters in films such as 'Zero' or 'Bharat' has given me...incredible sense of fulfilment," Katrina further said. "I feel...grateful...to have had the audience's support...They've...[helped] in my growth as an actor," she added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Judge threatens Weinstein with jail for repeated use of phone in court
text: The judge in Harvey Weinstein's New York trial on sexual assault charges threatened to jail the movie producer for his repeated use of cell phone during court on Tuesday. "Is this...[how] you want to end up in jail for...rest of your life?" the judge asked. When Weinstein's lawyer apologised on his behalf, the judge said, "I'm looking for compliance...not...for apologies."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: I respect what she did: Kartik on Deepika joining protest at JNU
text: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said that he "respects" actress Deepika Padukone for visiting Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Tuesday and extending her support to people protesting against JNU violence. "I hope...people would stand up...The way these things are happening, this is not our country," Kartik said. "[C]itizens should come ahead and talk about it. Strict actions are needed," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Only one Indian umpire to officiate in upcoming Under-19 World Cup
text: Anil Chaudhary is the only Indian named in the list of match umpires to officiate in the upcoming Under-19 World Cup in South Africa. The 54-year-old Indian umpire, who hails from Delhi, has so far officiated in 20 ODIs and 27 T20Is. A total of 16 umpires along with three match-referees have been named in the list.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Weightlifter Sarbjeet Kaur banned for 4 years for doping violation
text: Weightlifter Sarbjeet Kaur has been banned for four years by the National Anti-Doping Agency for failing a dope test. Kaur's sample, that was collected during 34th Women Senior National Weightlifting Championship, tested positive for "intake of prohibited non-specified substance". Earlier, 2017 Commonwealth Championships silver medallist weightlifter Seema faced similar ban for doping violation.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Now I know how to build my innings: KL Rahul
text: India opener KL Rahul has said that he has got "a lot better" at reading the game and "knowing how to build" his innings. "I always knew I had the game to get runs," he added. Rahul has crossed the 50-run mark thrice in his last five T20Is and has slammed two tons, one half-ton in his last five ODIs.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Amazing to see how India nurtures young players: SL coach Arthur
text: Sri Lanka coach Mickey Arthur has said that India is in "really, really good shape at the moment". "It's interesting to watch them [India] to introduce young players….and seeing those young players respond has been amazing," he added. In the second T20I against Sri Lanka, while KL Rahul scored 45 runs off 32 balls, pacer Shardul Thakur picked three wickets.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Tourists asked not to go to Shimla, Manali as snow blocks 250 roads
text: Tourists have been advised not to travel to Shimla and Manali after over 250 roads were blocked due to heavy snowfall in Himachal Pradesh, officials said. Shimla police shared pictures of roads covered in thick snow on Facebook after the city received 20 cm snowfall in 15 hours. Meanwhile, Manali received 22 cm snowfall, the Meteorological Department said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Air India reroutes flights after Iran's missile attack on US bases
text: Air India rerouted its flights flying over Iran to Europe and the US after Iranian missiles struck two US military bases in Iraq. The airline said rerouting may lead to an increase in flying time by about 20 minutes for flights from Delhi and 30-40 minutes for flights from Mumbai. Passengers' and crew members' safety comes first, Air India added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Some of our troops in Iraq to be moved to Kuwait: Canada
text: Some of Canada's 500 troops posted in Iraq will be "temporarily" moved to Kuwait due to an "operational pause", Canada's Chief of the Defence Staff General Jonathan Vance said. He added, "We are doing this to ensure their safety and security." The decision was taken due to the recent rise in tensions between US and Iran, General Vance further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Philippines orders 'mandatory evacuation' of citizens from Iraq
text: The Philippines has ordered a "mandatory evacuation" of around 1,640 Filipinos in Iraq, the country's foreign ministry said. The country will also deploy two battalions of its soldiers in the Middle East to facilitate evacuations, Defence Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said. Iran fired over 12 missiles on US forces in Iraq in response to US' killing of its top General.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Japanese man accused of killing 19 claims he is mentally ill
text: A Japanese man, 29-year-old Satoshi Uematsu, accused of stabbing 19 disable people to death has pleaded not guilty and his lawyer claimed he was suffering from a mental illness. His lawyer added that Uematsu's abuse of marijuana led to his "psychiatric disability". The incident, that also left 26 others wounded, took place in 2016 in Sagamihara, southwest of Tokyo.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Complaint filed against Akshay for allegedly mocking Maratha warriors in ad
text: A complaint has been filed against actor Akshay Kumar for allegedly hurting sentiments of the Maratha community in an advertisement for a detergent brand. The advertisement shows him and other artistes as Maratha warriors, who have come back after defeating enemies, after which a woman points out their dirty clothes. They are then seen washing the clothes with the detergent.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: We condemn hate against Deepika Padukone: JNU Students' Union
text: Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) has released a statement on Twitter as online campaigns called for boycotting Deepika Padukone's movie after she protested against the JNU violence. "We condemn the hate being spewed against Deepika Padukone. It is a sad testament to where we stand as a society," said JNUSU. "It was an act of humane concern," JNUSU added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: When Deepika was attacked over Padmaavat, few came out to support: Shabana
text: Actress Shabana Azmi on Wednesday praised Deepika Padukone for joining a protest at JNU on Tuesday against violence in the campus. "When Deepika was attacked over 'Padmaavat', very few came forward to support her," Shabana tweeted. "She knows what it feels to be targeted and she has shown exemplary courage by supporting the JNU students with quiet grace," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer's reactions go viral after Shreyas' 101-m six hits roof
text: Reactions of India captain Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer to the latter's 101-metre six which hit the Holkar Stadium's roof have gone viral. Shreyas slammed the six over long-on on the bowling of Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga. The ball hit the roof before landing back on the ground. Both Kohli and Iyer seemed surprised at the ball going the distance.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Saba Karim's son hits 22-year-old girl with his car, booked for rash driving
text: Former Indian cricketer Saba Karim's 28-year-old son Fidel Saba was arrested by Gamdevi Police in Mumbai for rash and negligent driving on Tuesday after he knocked down a 22-year-old woman, who sustained injuries. As per police, Fidel rushed the woman to a nearby hospital, where X-Ray examination confirmed that the girl broke her hip bone and fractured her shoulder.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India need to look beyond Shikhar Dhawan in T20I cricket: Gautam Gambhir
text: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has said that India need to look beyond Shikhar Dhawan in T20I cricket. "He has not done a lot in T20 cricket," Gambhir added. He further said, "I am not a big believer in number and stats, Dhawan hasn't had that impact, kind of impact that people like Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul have had."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Samsung copies Apple's Face ID, Touch ID logo in its CES keynote
text: During its keynote presentation at technology event CES 2020, Samsung displayed an icon for facial recognition on the screen, which was almost identical to Apple's logo for Face ID. On the same slide, Samsung's icon for fingerprint recognition appeared to be similar to Apple's Touch ID icon. The South Korean smartphone maker was discussing its biometric authentication service "Samsung Pass."
author: Dharna

headlines: Dutch startup shows prototype of ₹10,000 lunchbox that reheats food
text: Dutch startup Heatbox at tech show CES 2020 showcased a near-final prototype of its rechargeable lunchbox that uses steam to reheat food while maintaining important nutrients. Water needs to be added to lunchbox for reheating purpose and its 18,000 mAh battery needs a recharge after three operations. It's activated by a button on the front or through a companion app.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No suggestions made to HRD for temporarily shutting campus: JNU V-C
text: JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar, who met Human Resource Development Ministry officials on Wednesday over the violence on campus on Sunday, has said that the university has not made any suggestions to temporarily shut the campus. "There is no move to do so. Efforts are on to facilitate a conducive environment for students," Jagadesh Kumar added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: IIT-Guwahati prof who alleged corruption sent on compulsory retirement
text: An IIT-Guwahati Assistant Professor, Brijesh Rai, who spoke out against alleged corruption in the institution, has been ordered to go on "compulsory retirement" on grounds of "misconduct". Rai has been charged for "altercation", "dereliction of duty" and "not maintaining the channel of official protocol". IIT-G Director TG Sitharam said that charges against Rai were proved after investigation.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 20-30 people dragged me behind car, hit me with rods: JNUSU Prez in complaint
text: Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) President Aishe Ghosh has filed an attempt to murder complaint following the attack at the university. "The mob of 20-30 persons dragged me behind a car...I was hit on the head multiple times with iron rods," Ghosh wrote in her complaint. "The intention of the group of men...was definitely to murder me," she added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: West Bengal BJP chief refuses to let ambulance pass through rally
text: West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh on Monday refused to let an ambulance pass through a road in Krishnanagar, Nadia where he was addressing a rally on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "Divert the route of the ambulance as hundreds of people are sitting here," Ghosh said. He alleged that it was a tactic by the TMC to disrupt his rally.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Not looking to start a war with Iran, but prepared to finish one: US
text: US Defence Secretary Mark Esper said on Tuesday that the US doesn't want to start a war with Iran but is prepared to finish one. The US military wouldn't violate the laws of armed conflict by attacking Iranian cultural sites, he added. His statement comes amid the rising US-Iran tensions following Iranian General Qassem Soleimani's killing in a US strike.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Iran will suffer huge blow if it attacks us: Israel after missile strikes on US bases
text: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday warned that Iran will suffer a "resounding blow" if it attacks Israel. "We're standing steadfast against those who seek to kill us. We're standing with determination and with force," he added. Netanyahu's remarks came after Iran launched missiles against US bases in Iraq in response to the killing of General Qassem Soleimani.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Investigation against Adani Group in coal import case revived by SC
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday revived the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence's (DRI) attempt to investigate Adani Group companies for allegedly getting undue tax benefits by overvaluing coal imports. It ordered a stay against a Bombay High Court judgment, thereby allowing DRI to seek information on the case from overseas. The investigation is part of a larger probe against power companies.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Wadia Group's GoAir gets warning notice for overworking 150 pilots
text: Aviation regulator DGCA on Tuesday issued a warning notice to GoAir for overworking more than 150 pilots by not adhering to flight duty time limitation (FDTL) norms. The notice covers about a quarter of the Wadia Group-owned airline's pilots. The airline was warned after an audit showed the pilots worked for "more consecutive night periods than mandated", an official said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Too many trolls, can't do Twitter sh*t anymore: Singer Lizzo
text: American singer-songwriter Lizzo has said that she will be taking a break from Twitter because the microblogging website has "too many trolls". "Yeah I can't do this Twitter sh*t no more. I'll be back when I feel like it," the eight-time Grammy nominee announced on Monday. However, Lizzo's Twitter account is still active.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: None of them have told me: Kareena on whether Kartik, Sara are dating
text: Kareena Kapoor, when asked if her stepdaughter Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan are dating, said, "I honestly wouldn't know as none of them have told me that." "In fact that was one of my questions...and [Kartik] was like he's dating his work," Kareena added. When asked about Varun Dhawan and Natasha Dalal, Kareena said, "They make a cute pair."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Happy I got to direct Rajinikanth, it's a dream come true: Murugadoss
text: Filmmaker AR Murugadoss, when asked why it took him nearly two decades to collaborate with Rajinikanth, said, "Good things take time...I would say 'Darbar'...happened at the right time." "I'm happy that I finally got to direct Rajinikanth. Dreams do come true," he added. Talking about 'Darbar', Murugadoss said, "[It] is not a political film, but it is filled with Rajini-isms."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: I hope those involved in JNU violence get severe punishment soon: Varun
text: Varun Dhawan has condemned the violence which happened in JNU on Sunday night and said that "we cannot stay neutral on such issues". "I hope those involved in this incident get severe punishment as soon as possible," he added. "It's dangerous and sad if masked people enter an educational institution and all this happens," Varun further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: PV Sindhu, Saina Nehwal advance to Malaysia Masters 2nd round
text: Shuttlers PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal have advanced to the second round of women's singles in the Malaysia Masters. While Sindhu defeated Russia's Evgeniya Kosetskaya 21-15, 21-13 in 35 minutes, Nehwal bested Belgium's Lianne Tan 21-15, 21-17 in 36 minutes. In men's singles, B Sai Praneeth, Kidambi Srikanth and Praupalli Kashyap have crashed out of the tournament.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: City defeat United 3-1 at League Cup 1st-leg semis
text: Manchester City defeated Manchester United 3-1 on Tuesday night in their first-leg of League Cup semi-finals. While Bernardo Silva put City ahead in the 17th minute, Riyad Mahrez doubled the lead in the 33rd minute. Five minutes later, Andreas Pereira's own goal made United concede three goals in the first half at home for the first time since 1997. n
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Just look up, you'll see them: Sisodia to Shah over no CCTVs in Delhi remark
text: Delhi's Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said that while BJP chief Amit Shah has been saying there were no CCTVs in the city, all he needs to do is look up and he'll find one. Sisodia said they have CCTV footage of Shah campaigning in Lajpat Nagar. "He visited eight houses...there were 16 cameras on that street," Sisodia added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Missile attacks on US military bases were in self-defence: Iran FM
text: Iran's Foreign Minister Javad Zarif has said the missile attacks on two US military bases in Iraq were "proportionate measures in self-defence under Article 51 of UN Charter". "We do not seek escalation or war but will defend ourselves against any aggression," Zarif posted on Twitter. Iran launched the attack days after the US killed its General Qassem Soleimani.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Urge Iran not to repeat reckless attack on US bases in Iraq: UK
