text: The United Kingdom has condemned Iran's missile attacks on two US military bases in Iraq and urged Iran "not to repeat these reckless attacks". Iran must pursue urgent de-escalation as a war in the Middle East would only benefit terrorist groups, UK Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab said. Iran claimed that 80 "American terrorists" were killed in the missile strikes.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 6,000 killed by measles in DR Congo since start of 2019: UN
text: Since the start of 2019, the measles outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) has killed 6,000 people, the United Nations (UN) said. Around 3,10,000 suspected cases of the disease have been reported since then, the World Health Organization (WHO) said. "Lack of funds, low routine vaccination coverage and malnutrition hamper the response," WHO added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Bindiya Sharma and Pragya Pathak crowned Ms India Curvy 2020
text: Mumbai's Bindiya Sharma and Delhi's Pragya Pathak have been adjudged as Ms India Curvy 2020, a platform which aims at "motivating plus size women". Commenting on her win, Pragya said, "It's going to change the course of my life for sure." "They made sure to give us all the grooming...nutritional guidance to make us shine like a star," Bindiya said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Roadies creator Raghu Ram, wife Natalie welcome baby boy; name him Rhythm
text: 'Roadies' creator Raghu Ram and his wife Natalie Di Luccio welcomed a baby boy on Monday, whom they have named Rhythm. "It can't be linked with any religion," said Raghu while speaking about the name. Raghu further revealed that Natalie opted for a water birth with hypnobirthing techniques "for a beautiful, calm and natural process".nnn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Boycott against Deepika actually making me watch her films: Kanimozhi
text: DMK MP Kanimozhi on Wednesday said that the social media campaign to boycott Deepika Padukone's movie after she supported JNU students is making her support Deepika. Kanimozhi said, "I don't watch many Hindi movies, they're actually making people like me go and watch her movies." Kanimozhi also met JNU Students' Union President Aishe Ghosh who was injured in JNU violence.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Kashyap changes Twitter profile & cover pic to Deepika's photos from JNU protest
text: Anurag Kashyap has changed his Twitter profile picture and cover picture to Deepika Padukone's photos from the protest at JNU on Tuesday. Praising her, Kashyap tweeted, "The female of the species is, and was, and will always be the strongest of the two." "Mad respect for Deepika," he wrote while reacting to a journalist's tweet that lauded the actress.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: How many will you hang? Death not a solution: Tanushree on Nirbhaya verdict
text: After a Delhi court on Tuesday ordered the hanging of all four Nirbhaya gangrape convicts, actress Tanushree Dutta said, "How many will you hang?" "I'm trying to look for a solution. Death is never a solution," Tanushree added. She further said that "of course it's justice for Nirbhaya's family, all this is good" but added that "the problem is elsewhere".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: India is a democracy, anyone can go anywhere: Javadekar on Deepika's JNU visit
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Wednesday responded to the campaign on social media wherein people are calling to boycott Deepika Padukone's movie 'Chhapaak' after the actress joined the protesting JNU students. "This is a democratic country, anyone, any artist can go anywhere and put forth his or her view," Javadekar said. Several Bollywood celebrities praised Deepika after her JNU visit.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: What is the story behind Stokes' folded middle finger gesture after victory?
text: All-rounder Ben Stokes' folded middle finger gesture after England's Cape Town Test victory against South Africa was a tribute to his father, Ged. Ged got part of his finger amputated instead of getting it operated to continue his rugby league career in 1980s as he couldn't afford to miss matches. Ged is currently hospitalised in Johannesburg following a sudden illness.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ronaldo seen with iPod shuffle that Apple released in 2010, pic viral
text: A picture of Cristiano Ronaldo has gone viral, in which he appeared to be wearing Apple's 4th generation iPod shuffle. The first generation of the device was released in 2005, 4th generation in 2010, and Apple discontinued the device in 2017. "Cristiano Ronaldo has a top knot and an iPod Shuffle...what year is it?" a person joked on Twitter.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Akram tweets about losing family heirloom watch on flight, fans say 'Nayi le lo'
text: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram took to Twitter on Wednesday to post about his family heirloom watch that he lost on Karachi-Dubai Emirates flight. Akram sought Emirates' help, saying he was not satisfied after "exercising all customer service points" in Dubai. Reacting to his tweet, several fans wrote, "Nayi le lo." Another fan wrote, "Utari kyun thi?"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Latest Test rankings for batsmen out; 3 Australians in top 5, Kohli remains on top
text: Australian batsman Marnus Labuschagne, who scored 896 runs in Australian home summer, has toppled New Zealand captain Kane Williamson to become the third top-ranked Test batsman. Australian opener David Warner jumped two places to be ranked fifth. Team India captain Virat Kohli has retained the top spot, while Steve Smith is second, 17 rating points behind Kohli.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who are Samsung's 'artificial humans' that speak in Hindi & what do they do?
text: Samsung STAR Labs' project NEON unveiled artificial intelligence-enabled avatars or 'artificial humans', trained for different professions, at tech show CES 2020. NEON described them as "computationally created virtual being that looks and behaves like humans, with the ability to show emotions and intelligence." The humanoid chatbots can converse in multiple languages including Hindi and Spanish.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Facebook caused Trump's win in 2016, must not stop his re-election: Exec
text: Facebook Vice President Andrew Bosworth, in a leaked internal memo that he later publicly posted, said he believes Facebook was responsible for Donald Trump's presidential election victory in 2016. He added that morally, Facebook must not tilt the scale against Trump's re-election in 2020. Trump won, not from Russian interference, but a great digital ad campaign on Facebook, Bosworth said.
author: Dharna

headlines: Trying to increase my Pornhub followers: Musk jokes on his striptease video
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday joked about his video that showed him dancing and stripping off his jacket during a ceremony at the company's new $2-billion plant near Shanghai. When a Twitter user joked Musk did it "for the memes", Musk responded, "Just tryin to grow my follower count on Pornhub." "That would be TeslaPorn then?" another user joked.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No girl was murdered in Bihar shelter home, bones were of adults: CBI
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday informed the Supreme Court that no girl was killed in Muzaffarpur shelter home in Bihar. The investigating agency said skeletons found at the shelter home were not of minor inmates. Attorney General KK Venugopal, appearing for the CBI, said the girls who were earlier suspected to be dead, have been found alive.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Iran welcomes any initiative by India to de-escalate tensions with US: Envoy
text: Iranian envoy to India, Ali Chegeni on Wednesday said Iran will welcome any peace initiative by India for de-escalating its tensions with the United States. "We're not for war, we're looking for peace and prosperity for everybody," Chegeni added. Tensions between the US and Iran escalated after the US confirmed it killed the Iranian General Qassem Soleimani in an airstrike.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 17-yr-old who accused policeman of molesting her goes missing; suicide note found
text: A 17-year-old girl, who was allegedly molested by a DIG level officer on her birthday last year, went missing from her home in Navi Mumbai. A suicide note has been recovered, wherein she blamed constant pressure from the policeman and also apologised to her family. The note indicated that she'll be committing suicide by jumping in front of a train.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: India under PM Modi 5th biggest geopolitical risk of 2020: Eurasia Group
text: India under PM Narendra Modi is the fifth biggest geopolitical risk of 2020, according to political risk consultancy Eurasia Group. "PM Modi spent much of his second term promoting controversial social policies at the expense of an economic agenda," Eurasia said. "The impacts will be felt...with intensified communal and sectarian instability, (and) foreign policy and economic setbacks," it added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Hanging Nirbhaya rape convicts will bring me great relief: Meerut hangman
text: Meerut hangman Pawan Jallad, who is being considered to carry out the execution of the four convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case, said, "Hanging the...convicts will certainly bring great relief to me, her parents and everybody else." He added that their hanging will "send out a strong message in the society". The convicts will be executed on January 22.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Maha govt to review FIR against girl holding 'Free Kashmir' poster
text: Maharashtra minister Anil Deshmukh on Wednesday said that the government will review the FIR lodged against Mehak Mirza Prabhu, the Mumbai-based writer who held a 'Free Kashmir' placard. An FIR was filed against Prabhu for holding the 'Free Kashmir' poster at a protest rally organised in solidarity with the students of Jawaharlal Nehru University who were attacked by masked goons.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Video of Ukraine plane crash surfaces, shows crash site covered in fire
text: A video on Iran state TV shows the moment the Ukraine International Airlines' Boeing 737 plane crashed in Tehran, killing all the people onboard on Wednesday. The plane, which was carrying over 170 people, can be seen catching fire before it crashed to the ground and exploded. The other half of the video shows the crash site covered in fire.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 82 Iranians, 63 Canadians among those killed in Ukraine plane crash
text: The Ukraine International Airlines plane that crashed in Iran on Wednesday was carrying 82 Iranians, 63 Canadian nationals and 11 Ukrainians on board, a Ukrainian minister said. Ten Swedish, four Afghan, three German and three British nationals were also among more than 170 people aboard. Ukraine's embassy in Iran said that the Boeing 737 plane had suffered engine failure.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Missile attacks a slap on the face for US: Iran's Supreme Leader
text: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said Iran's missile attacks on US bases in Iraq were "a slap on the face" for the US. "Military action like this isn't sufficient. What's important is ending corrupting presence of America in the region," he added. Iran's attack came in retaliation for the killing of Iranian General Qassem Soleimani in a US strike.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Aramco loses $240 bn in value from peak, shares hit new low on US-Iran tensions
text: Saudi Aramco shares opened at their lowest level on Wednesday since the oil giant began trading, after Iran launched missiles on US targets in Iraq. The company's market value has dropped about $240 billion from its peak of $2.05 trillion on December 12. Aramco shares are still trading above the IPO price that valued the company at $1.7 trillion.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I'm uncertain of what the future holds for my child: Sonali Bendre
text: Actress Sonali Bendre on Tuesday took to Instagram to comment on the "repeated attacks on educational institutions". "As a parent as I look out...I am uncertain of what the future holds for my child," she wrote. Sonali added that "what should have been a chance for an open dialogue turned into a violent push of certain ideologies".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I've worked with four generations of actors: Designer Manish Malhotra
text: Commenting on his 30-year-long journey as a costume designer, Manish Malhotra said that it's "overwhelming" as he has "worked with four generations of actors". "I've seen the industry evolve...been absolutely in love with the constant change that's happening," he added. Manish further said that one thing that has always worked for him is "being himself and not changing that ever".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Films with parts without voice of their own don't excite me: Bhumi
text: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that she has never chosen a film in which her part "had nothing important to say". "Such films don't excite me...don't connect with [them]. My characters have always had a voice of her own," she added. "I think audiences too expect to see me play such parts that represent today's women," Bhumi further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Google Assistant to read out articles, stories to users in 42 languages
text: Google, at CES 2020, announced a new feature that will let users ask Google Assistant to read webpages out loud including articles, blogs and short stories in a "natural-sounding" voice. The feature, meant for Android smartphones, is activated by saying "Hey Google, read it," or "Hey Google, read this page". Google Assistant would read out in 42 languages including Hindi.
author: Dharna

headlines: Ed-tech startup Testbook secures ₹60 crore funding
text: Mumbai-headquartered ed-tech startup Testbook has raised ₹60 crore in a Series-B round of funding. The round was led by growth-stage investor Iron Pillar, with participation from existing backers Matrix Partners India, Better Capital, AngelList and Reliance Jio President Vikas Choudhury. The online test preparation platform was launched by a team of IIT graduates.
author: Dharna

headlines: All 170 people onboard Ukrainian passenger plane killed after crash in Iran
text: All passengers and crew members on a Ukraine International Airlines' Boeing 737 plane carrying at least 170 people died after it crashed in Iran's capital Tehran on Wednesday. The plane crashed due to technical problems minutes after take-off from Imam Khomeini International Airport in Tehran, the state media reported. An investigation team was sent at the site of the crash.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 80 'American terrorists' killed in missile strikes in Iraq: Iran state media
text: Iranian state television has said that at least 80 "American terrorists" have been killed in Iran's strikes involving over 12 missiles on US military bases in Iraq. The media reported that US helicopters and military equipment were "severely damaged" in the attack. Further citing a source, the media said Iran had 100 other targets in its sights if US retaliated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Inshorts launches location-based social network Public
text: Inshorts has launched Public - a location-based social network allowing people to record and share happenings around them through short videos. Public has registered 10 million users within 6 months of launch, becoming the fastest Indian social app to cross the milestone. Witnessing tremendous growth in Tier 2-3 cities, Public has become No.1 app on Play Store in the category.n
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Avoid non-necessary travel to Iraq: Indian govt after Iran's missile attack
text: After Iran attacked US military bases in Iraq with missiles, External Affairs Ministry issued a travel advisory asking Indian nationals to avoid "all non-essential travel to Iraq until further notification". It also asked Indian nationals residing in Iraq to be "alert" and avoid travel. It further notified that India's embassy in Baghdad and consulate in Erbil will continue to function.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Of course Salman will wash dishes on Bigg Boss, he gets ₹600cr: Contestant
text: A video shows Bigg Boss 13 contestant Himanshi Khurana allegedly mocking host Salman Khan after he entered the house and did chores including washing dishes and cleaning the toilet. "Of course he'll wash dishes on Bigg Boss, he gets ₹600 crore for the show," said Himanshi. She later clarified she meant it as a joke and not as a jibe.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Deepika was here? I couldn't talk to her: Kanhaiya on actress joining protest in JNU
text: Former JNUSU President Kanhaiya Kumar, when asked about Deepika Padukone joining the protest in JNU on Tuesday, said, "Acha aayin thi? Hum nahi dekh paaye (She was here? I couldn't see her)." "I couldn't talk to her. I didn't meet her," he added. Deepika had come to express solidarity with students against the violence in the university campus on Sunday.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Going to college not always needed for jobs: Ivanka Trump at tech event
text: Ivanka Trump, at CES 2020, said the commonly held belief that college degrees were needed to enter the workforce was misplaced. While it's a "great" path, it's not right for many and not chosen by most Americans, Trump added, while favouring skill-based hiring. Notably, she was criticised for being made a keynote speaker instead of women with credentials in technology.
author: Dharna

headlines: West Bengal to soon get 2 new districts: CM Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday announced that Sundarbans and Basirhat will be made new administrative districts in the state. Banerjee said the formation of the new districts will help the locals as they would not have to travel long distances to avail government services. Currently, Sunderbans and Basirhat are police districts.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 10 central trade unions go on nationwide strike, 25 crore likely to protest
text: Members of 10 central trade unions have called for a Bharat Bandh against Central government's 'anti-worker' policies. Around 25 crore workers are expected to participate in the strike, the unions said. "The attitude of the government is that of contempt towards labour as we interpret from its policies and actions," the central trade unions said in a joint statement.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: CRPF DIG allegedly throws boiling water on mess staff's face in Bihar
text: CRPF Deputy Inspector General (DIG) DK Tripathi allegedly threw boiling hot water on the face of the mess staff and also poured it inside his jersey after he was served that water for drinking. The incident took place in Bihar's Rajgir on January 2 and the victim has suffered severe burn injuries. An inquiry in the matter has been initiated.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India tells airlines to avoid airspace of Iran, Iraq & Gulf: Reports
text: India has asked all its airlines to avoid the airspace of Iran, Iraq and the Gulf following tensions in the region, reports said. Tensions between Iran and the United States escalated after killing of the Iranian General Qassem Soleimani. The US confirmed it killed Soleimani, head of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps' Quds Force, in an airstrike in Baghdad.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: I beg you for my son's life: Convict's mother to Nirbhaya's mother in court
text: Before the court issued death warrants against Nirbhaya rape-murder case convicts, mother of convict Mukesh Singh pleaded with the court and the victim's mother, "Please forgive my son. I'm begging you for his life." The victim's mother replied, "I had a daughter too. What happened with her, how can I forget? I've been waiting for justice for seven years."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: US aviation authority bans airlines from flying over Iran, Iraq
text: The US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is prohibiting US airlines from flying in the airspace over Iran, Iraq and waters of the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman. The restrictions come in response to Iranian missile attacks on two bases housing US-led troops in Iraq. The order reportedly aims to prevent civilian planes from being mistaken for military aircraft.
author: Dharna

headlines: Boycott Deepika's films: BJP leader after actress joins protest at JNU
text: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga has asked people to boycott Deepika Padukone's films after she joined a protest against the attack on the students and teachers of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). "RT if you will Boycott Movies of @deepikapadukone for her Support to #TukdeTukdeGang and Afzal Gang," Bagga tweeted. Many Bollywood personalities praised her after she attended the protest.n
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Me, my family thank Deepika, Meghna for making film on acid attack: Kangana
text: Rangoli Chandel on Wednesday posted a video wherein her sister, actress Kangana Ranaut, said that Chhapaak's trailer reminded her of Rangoli's acid attack. "Me and my family thank Meghna Gulzar and Deepika (Padukone) for making a movie on this issue (acid attack)," Kangana said. She added that she hopes acid sales will stop and India will become "acid attack free".
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: News on JNU attack is conflicting, don't know how to comment: Ajay
text: Actor Ajay Devgn on Tuesday said that he found the news about JNU attack to be "very conflicting", adding, "Till now, we don't know who has done what." "So till the time this isn't clear, I don't know how to comment," he added. "What's the agenda behind it, if you know, then please tell me because...news isn't clear," Ajay said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: It's a relief my fans have kept me relevant: Rani on 'Mardaani 2' response
text: Talking about the response 'Mardaani 2' received, actress Rani Mukerji said "[I]t's a relief...fans have kept me relevant even though I'm not on social media, which is essential these days." "[I]f I still have a fan following that means I've probably earned it through my work," she added. "[Fans'] excitement towards my work has always been...positive critic in...life," Rani said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: The ball was in someone else's court: Hardik on Koffee With Karan row
text: Commenting on 'Koffee With Karan' controversy, cricketer Hardik Pandya said in an interview, "We [Hardik and KL Rahul] as cricketers didn't know what was going to happen." "The ball...was in some else's court... that's a very vulnerable place you don't want to be," he added. Hardik and Rahul were suspended for their controversial remarks on the chat show.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: This wasn't the foundation our country was built on: Deepika on JNU violence
text: Speaking about violence in JNU, Deepika Padukone said in an interview that she is "scared and upset". "This wasn't the foundation our country was built on," she added. Deepika further said that the "fact that no action is being taken" is what we all must think about. She joined the protests at JNU on Tuesday evening.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: #BAFTASSoWhite trends after no actor in colour gets nomination
text: After the nominations for the BAFTA Awards 2020 were announced on Tuesday, #BAFTASSoWhite started trending on Twitter, as no actor in colour got a single nomination. "Y'all got black people to promote...but nominated not one person of colour," a user wrote. In four acting categories, all 20 names are white, with Margot Robbie and Scarlett Johansson's names appearing twice.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Women who held anti-CAA banner during Shah's rally evicted from rented house
text: Two women who held up anti-CAA banner during Home Minister Amit Shah's Lajpat Nagar rally on Sunday have been evicted from their rented house. The women said they were exercising their constitutional and democratic right to protest. On being asked about the reason of their eviction, their landlord said he should have "never made them his tenants".
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Furniture rental startup RentoMojo raises ₹14 crore funding
text: Furniture and appliance rental startup RentoMojo has raised ₹14.27 crore in a debt funding round from Japan-based GMO Payment Gateway, as per regulatory filings. The startup was co-founded in 2014 by IIT Madras graduates Geetansh Bamania and Ajay Nain. RentoMojo claims to have almost tripled its revenue in 2018-19 to ₹110 crore compared to the preceding financial year.
author: Dharna

headlines: Cookies baked in space, mighty mice back on Earth aboard SpaceX capsule
text: Experiments including cookies baked in space and genetically enhanced 'mighty mice' on Tuesday returned to Earth from the International Space Station (ISS) aboard the SpaceX Dragon capsule. The capsule parachuted into the Pacific Ocean, a month after launching. The 40 female mice flown to space will be compared to normal 40 female mice to study zero gravity's effect on muscles.
author: Dharna

headlines: Tihar Jail to conduct dummy execution of Nirbhaya convicts before Jan 22
text: Tihar Jail authorities will conduct dummy execution of Nirbhaya gang-rape convicts in coming days ahead of their execution on January 22. "It will be done in Jail 3, where the (actual) execution will take place," the authorities said. All four convicts will be executed on January 22 at 7 am, the same place where Afzal Guru was hanged.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: YSRCP MLA's car damaged in attack by protesting farmers in Andhra
text: Farmers protesting in Andhra Pradesh against three capitals proposal on Tuesday threw stones at the car of YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) MLA Pinnelli Ramakrishna Reddy. The incident took place when Reddy was passing from the National Highway-16 which was blocked by farmers. Reddy has alleged that Telugu Desam Party (TDP) chief N Chandrababu Naidu had instigated the attack.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India close to tipping point of major recession: Nobel laureate Banerjee
text: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee said that India was "extremely close" to a tipping point of a major recession and compared the slowdown to the 1991 Indian economic crisis. He added that corporate tax cuts to boost investments wouldn't alone save the economy, adding "the sector is sitting on a bunch of cash". The critical problem is falling demand, Banerjee said.
author: Dharna

headlines: Master AI with Deep Learning module designed by IIT-B faculty
text: Great Learning's PG Program in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning includes Deep Learning modules designed by IIT-B faculty, and is offered in collaboration with The University of Texas at Austin. It has been ranked as India's #1 AI program by AIM. Professionals can build AI skills without quitting their jobs in weekend classroom or online with mentorship formats.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Ukrainian passenger plane carrying 180 people crashes in Iran
text: A Ukraine International Airlines' Boeing 737 plane reportedly carrying 180 passengers and crew members crashed in Iran's capital Tehran on Wednesday. Reportedly, the plane crashed due to a technical issue shortly after the take-off from Imam Khomeini International Airport. This comes amid tensions between Iran and US over killing of Iran's elite Quds Force head Qassem Soleimani in air strike.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Kareena's pic criticised over photoshop, fans write 'She has no knees?'
text: After a fashion magazine shared a picture of Kareena Kapoor on Instagram, several users commented that it's photoshopped. While some users commented, "She has no knees?" and "You can't even see her knees", others wrote her calf has been made to look thinner as it doesn't match the shadow. Instagram account Diet Sabya also shared the photo and wrote, "Why?"
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Popcorn stuck in UK man's tooth leads to infection, open-heart surgery
text: A firefighter in the UK underwent open-heart surgery as he developed an infection after he tried to remove a piece of popcorn stuck in his tooth using several objects, including a metal nail. Using the objects had caused a gum infection that spread to his heart. He underwent surgery to replace his heart's aortic valve and repair the mitral valve.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: UP to build ₹234-cr zoo named after freedom fighter Ashfaque Ullah Khan
text: The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday approved a proposal to set aside ₹234 crore for construction of a zoological garden named after freedom fighter Ashfaque Ullah Khan in Gorakhpur. The zoo will come up across over 121 acres of land. "The purpose of this project is wildlife conservation...Gorakhpur will be...recognised internationally with this project," Cabinet Minister Shrikant Sharma said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Don't know if it was blood or paint on JNUSU Prez's head: BJP leader
text: Stating that the mob attack in JNU could be "staged", West Bengal BJP unit chief Dilip Ghosh said, "We're yet to know whether it was blood or some red paint that was smeared on the forehead (of JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh)." Aishe had suffered head injuries after she was allegedly hit with an iron rod by masked goons.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Elon Musk-led Tesla becomes most valuable US carmaker of all time
text: Elon Musk-led Tesla has become the most valuable American automaker of all time, after it closed at a market value of $81.39 billion on Monday. This surpasses the $80.81-billion peak value set by Ford in 1999. The automaker's shares continued to rise on Tuesday and hit another record high of $469 apiece, at a market value of nearly $85 billion.
author: Dharna

headlines: Binary star will explode like a bright nova by 2083: Astronomers
text: American astronomers have predicted that Sagitta constellation's faint star V Sagittae will explode and appear brighter than the brightest known nova from around a century ago. The astronomers predict that the binary star will be the most luminous star in the Milky Way galaxy and will become as bright as Sirius, the brightest star visible in the night sky.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: NASA discovers a potentially habitable Earth-sized planet
text: NASA's planet-hunting satellite TESS has discovered its first Earth-sized planet, within the habitable range of its star where conditions could allow liquid water's presence on the surface. The 'TOI 700 d' is located 100 light-years away and has about half the surface temperature of Sun. It is the outermost planet in its system and orbits its star every 37 days.
author: Dharna

headlines: 2 FIRs against Umar Khalid for 'unlawful assembly' at Gateway of India
text: Two FIRs have been lodged against former JNU student and activist Umar Khalid for allegedly holding protest from Hutatma Chowk to Gateway of India and for unlawful assembly at Gateway of India, Mumbai Police said on Tuesday. People have been protesting after the reports of violence in JNU came to light. Celebrities from the film industry also joined the protests.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Not affiliated with RSS, never agreed to attend its event: Accenture exec
text: Accenture executive Rama S Ramachandran denied agreeing to attend an RSS event in Chennai after an invite naming him as 'Guest of Honor' created a backlash. "I'm not sure how this misunderstanding happened. I have no affiliation with this group and never agreed to speak at or attend this event," he said. However, RSS said Ramachandran informally confirmed his participation.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Centre warns its employees of 'consequences' if they go on Jan 8 strike
text: As per a Personnel Ministry order, the Centre had warned its employees of "consequences" if they go on the proposed nationwide general strike on January 8. Issued to all central departments, the order warned employees of wage deduction and "appropriate disciplinary action", and temporarily barred casual leaves. "There's no statutory provision empowering the employees to go on strike," it read.
author: Dharna

headlines: Mad respect for Deepika Padukone: Anurag after actress joins JNU protests
text: Journalist Rana Ayyub praised Deepika Padukone for joining protests at Jawaharlal Nehru University,  tweeting, "It takes guts to do this two days before the release of a high stake, important film." Reacting to Ayyub's post, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap tweeted, "Let’s not forget she is also the producer of the films .. stakes are even higher. Mad respect for Deepika."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who is Esmail Qaani, new chief of Iran's Quds Force after Soleimani's death?
text: Esmail Qaani has been named as the new head of Iran's Quds Force after his predecessor  Qassem Soleimani was killed in a US strike. Qaani had joined Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) in 1980. He was described by Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei as one of the "most decorated commanders" of the Guards during the 1980-88 Iran-Iraq war.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Iran releases video of missile attack on US military bases in Iraq
text: Iranian state television has released video of what it says is a ballistic missile attack launched at US military forces in Iraq. Over 12 missiles were fired at two bases in al-Asad and Irbil. This comes days after the US confirmed it killed Qassem Soleimani, the head of Iran's elite Quds force, in an air strike in Baghdad.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: ISI seized Urdu versions of my satirical novel, says Pakistani author
text: Pakistani author Mohammed Hanif said people claiming to be from intelligence agency ISI raided a publisher's office and confiscated the Urdu translations of his satirical novel 'A Case of Exploding Mangoes'. They also sought a list of the novel's distributors and sellers, Hanif added. The book satirises Pakistani dictator General Zia-ul-Haq and the circumstances surrounding his death in 1988.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Russian President Putin meets Bashar al-Assad on visit to Syria
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Damascus, Syria on Tuesday and held talks with his Syrian counterpart Bashar al-Assad. The Russian leader had previously visited Syria in 2017. Putin arrived in the Middle East amid rising US-Iran tensions following the killing of Iranian General Qassem Soleimani last week.
author: Shailesh

headlines: No plans for 4-day work week: Finland after fake news citing PM goes viral
text: Finland has clarified that a four-day work week isn't on the agenda and "there hasn't been any recent activity" on the topic. Media outlets in several countries including India reported fake news crediting Finland's 34-year-old Prime Minister Sanna Marin for looking into such a plan. Finland's government said Marin discussed the idea last August, months before she became the PM.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: All is well, tweets Trump after Iran fires missiles at US military bases in Iraq
text: US President Donald Trump tweeted "All is well!" after Iran fired over 12 missiles at 2 US military bases in Iraq over the killing of a top General. Trump added, "Assessment of casualties & damages taking place now. So far, so good!" "We have the most powerful and well equipped military anywhere in the world, by far!" he further wrote.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Akshay Kumar forgets his character's name: Director Rohit Shetty
text: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty on Neha Dhupia's show '#NoFilterNeha' said that Akshay Kumar forgets his character's name. "Now when we're doing the last schedule in Hyderabad, he will be 'naam kya hai mera? Sooryavanshi'. He forgets everything," the filmmaker added. Akshay and Rohit have collaborated for 'Sooryavanshi', written by Karan Johar, which is scheduled to release on March 27, 2020.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: No copyright on true events: 'Chhapaak' director Meghna Gulzar
text: 'Chhapaak' director Meghna Gulzar has told the Bombay High Court that copyright cannot be claimed on true events and incidents. This comes after writer Rakesh Bharti filed a suit claiming that 'Chhapaak' is based on a script that he originally wrote on the life of an acid attack survivor. Meghna has sought the dismissal of the suit filed by Bharti.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Have no idea about 'Inception' ending, depends on the viewer: DiCaprio
text: Actor Leonardo DiCaprio has said that he "has no idea" when it comes to explaining the ending of Christopher Nolan's 'Inception' and added that "it depends on the eye of the beholder". "I do get involved...but when it came to Nolan and...how 'Inception' was...pieced together, everyone was trying to constantly put that puzzle together," DiCaprio said on a podcast.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Bath mat that monitors weight, posture & body composition unveiled
text: Mateo Smart Bathroom Mat that captures and tracks health data of the user including weight, posture and body composition, was unveiled at CES 2020. The $179-worth smart bath mat features a scale that is inserted into a machine-washable cover. The mat connects to an app and can identify different users by their footprints and also offers "posture score" using pressure-mapping.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Cradle that mimics parents' moves and lulls babies to sleep made
text: The mamaRoo sleep bassinet presented at CES 2020 makes movements similar to motions that parents make while trying to soothe their babies. The $330-worth bassinet's base stays still while the basket moves in various motions including "dreamy motions". It connects to the 4moms app and allows parents to adjust the bassinet remotely and even customise sleep settings.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Samsung's chef robot makes salad on command
text: Samsung has unveiled a chef robot, named "Bot Chef", which creates salads from 35 different recipes at a simple voice command. Consisting of two robotic arms slung down from kitchen cabinets, the AI-powered robot during the unveil rummaged through cabinets, diced a block of soft tofu, tossed ingredients in an oiled-up pan and mixed them to create a tofu salad.
author: Dharna

headlines: Study finds music evokes 13 key emotions, scientists map them
text: Scientists at the University of California, Berkeley, surveyed over 2,500 people in the United States and China about their emotional responses to diverse music and found that music evokes 13 overarching emotions. The researchers translated the data into an interactive audio map, where visitors can move their cursors to listen to music snippets to find out about their emotional responses.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Video of old man dancing to 'Azadi' slogans amid protest goes viral
text: Amid the ongoing protests in Mumbai against the violence in JNU on Sunday, a video of an old man dancing to the 'Azadi' slogans has gone viral. The unidentified elderly man was dancing while the people sitting around him raised the slogans. People across the country have been protesting after the violence in JNU left over 30 people injured.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India beat SL to extend 100% win record at Holkar, Kohli becomes top run-getter
text: India defeated Sri Lanka in the second T20I on Tuesday to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series after the first match got abandoned in Guwahati. With this, India extended their 100% winning run in international cricket at Indore's Holkar Stadium to nine matches. The match witnessed Virat Kohli overtake Rohit Sharma to become highest run-scorer in T20I cricket.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Iran fires over 12 missiles against 2 military bases housing US forces in Iraq
text: Iran has fired over 12 ballistic missiles from its territory against at least two military bases hosting US military and coalition personnel in Iraq, the US Defence Department has said. Iran's Revolutionary Guards confirmed they fired the missiles over the killing of a top General, according to state TV. "We are working on initial battle damage assessments," the US added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Deepika doesn't owe anyone an explanation for joining JNU protest: Cong's Deora
text: Defending actress Deepika Padukone joining protest inside JNU campus, senior Congress leader Milind Deora said that Deepika does not owe an explanation for her visit. "Neither does @akshaykumar [owe an explanation] for waving an ABVP flag," he added. "Tough being an artist these days: damned if you do & damned if you don't," he added referring to actors facing criticism.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Salman is a superstar who still lives in a one-bedroom apartment: Suniel
text: Suniel Shetty, while talking about Salman Khan in an interview, said that he's a superstar who still lives in a one-bedroom apartment. "[He's] someone who's...content with 'Mumma Papa upstairs and me downstairs'," he added. "His drivers, staff...till date are...same. You cannot...doubt such people; whether it's this case or that case, half the time he's taking blame for others," said Suniel.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Supreme Court Bar Association condemns JNU violence
text: The executive committee of the Supreme Court Bar Association on Tuesday released a statement resolving to "strongly condemn" Sunday night's violence inside the campus of JNU. "It further resolved to condemn the inaction on the part of Delhi Police and called upon authorities to act and ensure that the Rule of Law prevailed," the statement added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Students surrounded, humiliated wardens; they haven't resigned: JNU VC
text: Jawaharlal Nehru University Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar has said that it was a rumour that hostel wardens have resigned and no such resignation has taken place. "Some protesting students surrounded our wardens, shouted on them and humiliated them. Is it a way to have any dialogue?" added Kumar. Reports said that two wardens resigned after masked men attacked JNU students.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 14 newborns die at Ahmedabad hospital in 5 days
text: As many as 14 newborns died at the Ahmedabad Civil Hospital in the first five days of January. While seven infants died due to congenital abnormalities, five died due to premature birth and two due to respiratory problem, hospital authorities said. This comes after more than 200 infant deaths were reported at civil hospitals in Rajkot and Ahmedabad.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Need to see intent: Aaditya Thackeray on 'Free Kashmir' poster row
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Tuesday said that it was important to know the intent of the girl who held the 'Free Kashmir' poster at Gateway of India on Monday. "Look at the larger picture...we need to see her intent. Was it to remove internet blockade? If it was to free Kashmir from India, then it is wrong."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 10,000 camels to be shot from helicopters for drinking too much water in Aus
text: Over 10,000 feral camels in South Australia will be killed to stop them from drinking water in the drought-hit region, The Australian reported. They'll be culled by shooters in helicopters from Wednesday after an order from Aboriginal leaders in the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara lands. The culling comes as communities complained of animals invading their properties in search of water.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 2 Pakistan Air Force pilots killed as jet crashes during training
text: A Pakistan Air Force jet crashed during a routine operational training mission on Tuesday in the Punjab province, killing both pilots aboard. The PAF FT-7 aircraft crashed near Mianwali, some 300 kilometres from Lahore. "A board of inquiry has been ordered by Air Force Headquarters to determine the cause of the accident," the Pakistani Air force said in a statement.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Mallya can't use pending cases in India to delay proceedings in UK: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Monday said that fugitive liquor baron Vijay Mallya cannot use cases pending against him before it to delay proceedings in the UK courts. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta said Mallya stalled a ruling in an insolvency case filed by Indian banks in London arguing that the court should first wait for Supreme Court's decision on the issue.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Illegal immigrants can't be allowed to protest against CAA: Tiwari
text: Delhi BJP chief leader Manoj Tiwari said that illegal immigrants can't be allowed to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 (CAA). He added, "I request those protesting at Shaheen Bagh...that if you're born here and are a citizen of India, you need not fear anything." Tiwari further said, "if you are not a citizen of India then you must...leave."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Siraj's delivery sends Rahul's middle and off stumps flying
text: Hyderabad pacer Mohammed Siraj dismissed Kerala opener, Ponnam Rahul, for a seven-ball duck in the second innings, uprooting his middle and off stumps and sent them flying. Siraj bowled a good length delivery which jagged back and moved through a gap between Rahul's bat and pad. Siraj finished the game with a total of seven wickets.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: 22-yr-old Max Verstappen extends deal with F1 team Red Bull to 2023
text: After finishing the 2019 Formula One Season at third spot in the overall standings, 22-year-old Max Verstappen has extended his contract with Red Bull until the end of 2023. "I want to win with Red Bull and our goal is of course to fight for a World Championship together," he said. Verstappen has 31 career podium finishes including eight wins.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: PopSockets unveils a wireless charger that works with its PopGrips
text: PopSockets has developed a wireless charger called PopPower Home Charger which can be used to charge a phone with the PopGrip attached, which normally had to be removed every time. However, phones with metal PopGrips and grips from third-party companies can't be charged. The wireless charger is now available for sale in three colors and will cost $60.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Anti-pollution mask that creates clean air on its own unveiled
text: US-based health and wellness device making startup Aō Air unveiled the Atmōs, a $350 anti-pollution mask worn around the face, at the CES 2020. The mask uses small fans and filters to create a high-pressure pocket of clean air and requires no seal. The plastic device is transparent and has sensors that measure users' respiration rate.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: CCTVs installed in Delhi by AAP are recording you: Sisodia to Shah
text: After Union Minister Amit Shah questioned AAP on its promise to install CCTVs in Delhi, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said CCTVs have not only been installed but have also recorded Shah while he was campaigning for polls. On Shah's 'durbeen' remark, Sisodia said Shah only needs to raise his eyes to find that CCTVs have been installed in every lane.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Those condemning JNU violence silent on Jadavpur varsity: Bengal Guv
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar tweeted, "Silence of those in authority (who severely condemned JNU violence) over what happened at Jadavpur University (JU) a fortnight ago is painfully worrisome." He added, "Why this selective approach to violence and disruption on JU campus! Fire at home ought to be first priority." Reportedly, Dhankhar's tweets were directed towards CM Mamata Banerjee.
author: Shailesh

headlines: SoftBank backed out from investing in many startups after initial nod: Report
text: SoftBank has backed out from investing in several startups even after submitting non-binding agreements, an Axios report said. It walked away from investing millions in US startups Honor and Seismic after an initial nod. In reply, SoftBank said, "Given we're a fiduciary and investing large amounts of capital, our investment process is more rigorous than unregulated investors and typical VCs."
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Investors sue Daimler for $1 billion over diesel-emission scandal
text: Over 200 investors have sued Daimler for $1 billion in Germany for not disclosing risks and costs associated with the use of emissions cheating software. The lawsuit further accused the German automaker of violating capital markets law by not revealing the cost. Daimler plans to challenge the suit, adding that it was without merit.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Indian-origin physician gets 2-year jail for healthcare fraud in US
text: An Indian-origin physician, Kain Kumar, has been sentenced to two years in prison for defrauding a medical healthcare scheme and illegally prescribing opioid painkillers and muscle relaxers. Kumar pleaded guilty in the case and admitted to having prescribed drugs that were not "medically necessary". He also submitted false reimbursement claims under the scheme for patients he didn't examine.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: 64% Maharashtra ministers have self-declared criminal cases: ADR
text: In Maharashtra, 27 out of 42 of the newly-appointed ministers have criminal cases pending against them, non-profit organisation Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) report stated. The report is based on data available on affidavits filed by the ministers with the Election Commission ahead of contesting elections. Maharashtra government's 18 ministers have a criminal case of serious nature.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Odisha to begin exercise to update NPR from mid-April
text: The process to update the National Population Register (NPR) will start in Odisha from April 16, a census official has said. According to reports, people will be asked date and place of birth of their parents, Aadhaar number, mobile number, voter ID and driving licence details. Notably, the exercise has been suspended in West Bengal and Kerala.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Big Ben must ring on Jan 31 to mark Brexit from EU: UK MPs
text: A group of MPs in the United Kingdom are demanding that Big Ben should be sounded to mark Brexit from the European Union. Conservative lawmaker Mark Francois said that he and 50 MPs signed an amendment to the Brexit bill to enshrine the Big Ben demand in the law. The bell has mostly been silent since 2017 due to renovations.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 1 person killed as 6.4-magnitude earthquake hits Puerto Rico
text: At least one person was killed after a 6.4-magnitude earthquake struck Puerto Rico on Tuesday, knocking out power and causing severe damage. It was the largest among a series of earthquakes that have struck the region in the recent days and was followed by strong aftershocks. Governor Wanda Vazquez declared a state of emergency and activated the National Guard.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt may cut FY20 spending by as much as ₹2 lakh cr: Reports
text: The government is likely to cut spending for this financial year by about ₹2 lakh crore to keep fiscal deficit within "acceptable limits" as it faces a revenue shortfall of ₹2.5 lakh crore, reports said. The deficit is likely to be kept under 3.8% of GDP, reports added. The government spent about 65% of the year's expenditure target till November.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Japan seeks Lebanon's help over Ghosn, issues arrest warrant for his wife
text: Japan has sought Lebanon's help over ex-Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn, a government official said, calling his escape to Beirut "regrettable". Japanese authorities said they were looking into Lebanese laws to find a way for Ghosn to face trial as Lebanon doesn't extradite its citizens. Meanwhile, Japanese prosecutors issued an arrest warrant for Ghosn's wife Carole for allegedly lying in testimony.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US woman accidentally drives car into hotel's swimming pool, police share pics
text: A Florida woman accidentally drove her car into a hotel's swimming pool last week while driving it backwards, the pictures of which were shared by the police on social media. She and a passenger were able to leave the car from the back window and escaped unhurt. "Gives a new definition to carpooling," a person joked on Facebook.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Deepika Padukone joins protest at JNU over violence in campus, pics surface
text: Actress Deepika Padukone on Tuesday joined a protest rally at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) against the attack that took place on students and teachers inside the campus on Sunday. She was spotted standing alongside JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh at the Sabarmati T-point. Deepika has been in Delhi since Monday to promote her upcoming film.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Salman gifts ₹1.54cr BMW car to actor Sudeep who played Dabangg 3 villain
text: Actor Salman Khan has gifted a BMW M5 car worth ₹1.54 crore to Kiccha Sudeep, who played the villain in 'Dabangg 3'. Sharing a collage, Sudeep wrote, "Good always happens when you do good. @beingsalmankhan sir made me believe this line further when this surprise landed at home along with him." "Thank you for the love you've showered," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Was kicked in stomach by male police officers in jail: Actress-activist Sadaf
text: Congress worker, activist and actress Sadaf Jafar, who was released on bail in connection with anti-CAA protests in Lucknow, said she was beaten by police in custody. She alleged that male police officers kicked her in the stomach and called her "Pakistani". "The fear of being jailed and beaten up has now gone away because of Yogi Ji," she said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Right now, there are a few World Cups to be won: Rohit on his cricket future
text: On being asked whether fans would get to see him play for another six-seven years, India opener Rohit Sharma said, "I don't make such plans. Right now...there are a few World Cups to be won." "At no stage of my career has personal glory been important," he added. The 32-year-old was the highest run-scorer for India in 2019 World Cup.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Started Virgin Atlantic after my flight to meet girlfriend was cancelled: Branson
text: British airline Virgin Atlantic's Co-founder Richard Branson in a blog said that he started the airline 36 years ago after his flight to the British Virgin Islands, where he was supposed to meet his girlfriend (now wife), was suddenly cancelled. "I hired a plane, borrowed whiteboard and scrawled 'Virgin Airlines' on it as a joke, advertising $39 fares," Branson added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: She's my entrepreneur of the year: Mahindra on 94-yr-old sweet maker
text: Mahindra Group's Anand Mahindra has called Harbhajan Kaur, a 94-year-old sweet maker from Chandigarh, "entrepreneur of the year". She started making sweets four years back. "When you hear the word 'start-up' it brings to mind images of millennials in Silicon Valley or Bengaluru trying to build billion-dollar 'unicorns'. From now on, let's also include a 94-year-old woman," Mahindra tweeted.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Iltija accuses security of manhandling, to seek security cover removal
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti's daughter Iltija has accused her security personnel of manhandling her and stopping her from visiting her grandfather's grave on his death anniversary on Tuesday. "I have suffered bruises on my arms and legs," Iltija said. She added that she will write to the Special Security Group's Director to withdraw her security cover.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Hangman from Meerut to execute Nirbhaya gangrape convicts: Tihar Jail
text: Delhi's Tihar Jail will seek the service of a hangman from Meerut to hang all four Nirbhaya gangrape convicts, an official said. "We have proper arrangements at the jail to execute all the 4 convicts together," the official added. A Delhi court issued a death warrant today against the convicts who will be hanged on January 22 at 7 am.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: AAP challenges BJP to reveal CM candidate on Twitter; BJP responds
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Twitter challenged the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) to reveal the latter's CM candidate for the upcoming Assembly polls in Delhi. "Does your party have a CM face?" AAP tweeted. BJP responded by sharing a photo of CM Arvind Kejriwal and said, "We have a lot of faces better and more truthful than this face."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: FIR against girl seen holding 'Free Kashmir' poster at Gateway of India
text: An FIR has been registered against Mehek, the girl who was seen holding a poster with slogan 'Free Kashmir' at Gateway of India in Mumbai during protests against JNU violence. This comes after Mehek faced criticism over the poster. She had clarified that she was talking about the internet shutdown in Kashmir and the freedom of basic Constitutional rights.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Spiritual body not above law: HC to Isha Foundation on Cauvery Calling
text: The Karnataka High Court has asked Jaggi Vasudev's Isha Foundation to disclose how much funds it has collected for its Cauvery Calling initiative. The court was hearing a petition filed against Isha Foundation collecting money from farmers to fund the initiative. "Don't be under the impression that if you're a spiritual organisation, you aren't bound by law," the court said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Javadekar criticises NYT for claiming JNU attackers chanted ‘Jai Shri Ram’
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Tuesday criticised New York Times for its report on JNU violence that claimed that the attackers chanted 'Jai Shri Ram'. "It seems [NYT] consists of the most ardent bhakts of Lord Ram as they seem to find him everywhere," Javadekar tweeted. "Waiting to read [NYT's] ground reporting of...religious persecution from Shri Nankana Sahib," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Will send US troops back in coffins if they don't leave Iraq: Iran-backed militias
text: Iran-backed militias in Iraq said they will "send American soldiers back in coffins" if the US doesn't withdraw its troops from Iraq. The militias said that "all retaliation options are on the table", adding they had "no red lines hindering their revenge" for the killing of Iranian General Qassem Soleimani. The US had earlier carried out strikes against Iran-backed militias.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: You both are mature people, why don't you settle your dispute: SC to Tata, Wadia
text: The Supreme Court on Monday asked Ratan Tata and Nusli Wadia to resolve a defamation case initiated by Wadia against Tata. "You both are mature people. You both are leaders of the industry. Why don't you both settle the matter?" it said. Wadia had alleged that Tata made defamatory statements against him after Cyrus Mistry's removal as Tata Sons Chairman.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Timothée Chalamet to play Bob Dylan in 'Going Electric': Reports
text: Actor Timothée Chalamet will reportedly play musician Bob Dylan in a Fox Searchlight film titled 'Going Electric', directed by 'Ford v Ferrari' filmmaker James Mangold. The film is based on music historian Elijah Wald's book 'Dylan Goes Electric!', as per a report. Dylan will be executive producer of the film and is working on it with Mangold, the report said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: It's the way forward: Irfan Pathan on four-day Tests
text: With the ICC considering the four-day Test format from 2023, former all-rounder Irfan Pathan has termed it "the way to go forward". "We play four-day cricket in Ranji Trophy, we get results, so why not Test matches?" he asked. Earlier, India skipper Virat Kohli had said that the four-day Tests won't be "fair to the purest format of the game".
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Rishabh Pant is a special talent: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly
text: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has called the wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant a "special talent". "We saw how he played well in the two matches he played against West Indies," he said. During the three-match ODI series, Pant scored 71 runs off 69 balls in the first match, 39 off 16 in second, and was dismissed for seven runs in the third.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Mozilla, GitHub ask Govt to be transparent about new Internet laws
text: Companies including Mozilla and GitHub have written an open letter to IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad seeking transparency in the final amendments of the intermediary liability rules. They have said that the amendment would affect companies and make information access difficult. The new rule requires intermediaries with over 50 lakh Indian users to set up a registered office in India.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Want our games to be playable even on a toaster: Zynga CEO
text: Mobile and online games maker Zynga CEO Frank Gibeau said he wanted the company's games "to be playable on anything, even if it's a toaster or refrigerator". Talking about the changing scenarios of the gaming world, he said platforms like video-game consoles might not exist in a decade. "We have a saying, 'Make platform transition your friend'", Gibeau added.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Kejriwal protects students who said 'Bharat tere tukde honge': Shah
text: Union Minister Amit Shah said that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is protecting students who raised "Bharat tere tukde honge" slogans. He added, "Chargesheet filed by Delhi Police to put them in jail isn't being recommended by Kejriwal, he's not allowing the case to move forward." Kejriwal asked for proof when India conducted a "surgical strike" on Pakistan, Shah further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: IIT grad-led US-based startup HighRadius enters unicorn club
text: Houston-based software servicing startup HighRadius entered unicorn club after it raised $125 million in Series B funding round. The round, led by ICONIQ Capital, also saw participation from existing investors Susquehanna Growth Equity and Citi Ventures. Co-founded by Sashi Narahari, an IIT Madras graduate, the artificial intelligence-based startup has offices in Hyderabad, London and Amsterdam.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Will ask airlines to give honey sachets instead of sugar: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has said he would request airlines to provide honey sachets or cubes as a sweetener while serving tea or coffee to passengers in flights. "I am going to call Air India, IndiGo, SpiceJet and GoAir and also chairperson of the Khadi Gramodyog Commission, and request them to make both the choices available in flights," he said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Few anarchists raising 'Free Kashmir' slogans: Prakash Javadekar
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said a few selective "anarchists" were raising 'Free Kashmir' slogans while the entire country has supported Article 370 revocation in Jammu and Kashmir. He was referring to a 'Free Kashmir' placard shown at a protest against JNU violence in Mumbai. "Now if someone outside the region gives such a slogan, that makes no sense," Javadekar added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: JNU VC must resign if he has any shame left: AIMIM chief Owaisi
text: After a masked mob entered Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) and attacked students, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "If the Vice-Chancellor has any shame he should leave JNU". "The attack was carried by aliens who had come in spaceships from Mars and Venus," Owaisi added. More than 30 students were injured in the attack.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US has made no decision to leave Iraq: Defense Secretary
text: United States Defense Secretary Mark Esper has denied that the US troops are leaving Iraq. The statement was made after a US military official in a letter to Iraqi officials said the US forces would be relocating "to prepare for onward movement". "I don't know what that letter is...But there's been no decision made to leave Iraq. Period," Esper said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Government approves draft for inviting bids for Air India
text: The central government's Group of Ministers (GoM) has approved the draft for inviting bids for stake sale in Air India and the Expression of Interest document will be out by January end. The panel also approved proposals for debt transfer of around ₹60,000 crore to a special purpose vehicle (SPV). Around ₹29,400 crore has already been transferred to the SPV.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: All 4 Nirbhaya gangrape convicts to be hanged on January 22 at 7 am
text: A Delhi court has issued death warrant against all four Nirbhaya gangrape convicts and said they will be hanged on January 22 at 7 am. Earlier, SC rejected review petition filed by convict Akshay Thakur. Last year, Delhi HC rejected plea of convict Pawan Kumar, who had moved the court claiming he was a juvenile at the time of offence.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Actress shares video of Bigg Boss' Sidharth holding down female contestant
text: Actress Shruti Seth has shared a clip that shows Bigg Boss 13 contestant Sidharth Shukla forcibly holding down co-contestant Shehnaz Gill and twisting her arms. "What the hell is this??? Why are we promoting this kind of barbaric violence? This man needs professional help," Shruti tweeted. Shehnaz had slapped Sidharth and thrown a slipper at him earlier in the episode.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Director says 'Swara Bhasker is cheaper than Dainik Bhaskar', actress replies
text: Swara Bhasker has responded to 'Dream Girl' director Raaj Shaandilyaa after he took a jibe at her. "Don't pay attention to cheap items. Dainik Bhaskar is sold at...higher price than Swara Bhasker," Shaandilya wrote. "Next time, before offering role and sending messages requesting to share your films' trailers, you also think again about committing 'cheap acts'," replied Swara.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: World no. 6 injures his father while smashing racquet, gets scolded by mother
text: World number six tennis player Stefanos Tsitsipas accidentally injured his father while smashing his racquet in frustration during an ATP Cup match on Tuesday. Playing a singles match against Nick Kyrgios, Tsitsipas smashed his racquet into his bench after losing the first set. After his father's arm started bleeding, his mother came down from the stands and scolded him.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Mercedes-Benz unveils 'Avatar' inspired self-driving electric car concept
text: Mercedes-Benz on Monday night unveiled AVTR, a self-driving electric car concept inspired by the 2009 Sci-Fi/Fantasy film 'Avatar', at tech show CES 2020 in Las Vegas. The concept car has no steering wheel or pedals and the user can control the vehicle by touching the center console. The car can recognise the driver's pulse and breath.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk strips off jacket and dances at Tesla's Shanghai plant, shares video
text: Elon Musk danced on stage during a ceremony at Tesla's new $2-billion plant near Shanghai where it handed over the first China-made Model 3 sedans to the public on Tuesday. The billionaire also stripped off his jacket to reveal a T-shirt with a cartoon of the factory. He labelled the video "NSFW" or not safe for work in a tweet.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Jan 22 a big day, hanging of convicts will empower women: Nirbhaya's mother
text: After a Delhi court ordered that all four Nirbhaya gangrape convicts be hanged on January 22, Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi said, "My daughter has got justice. Execution of the convicts will empower the women of India." She added, "January 22 is going to be a big day for me. This decision will strengthen the trust of people in judicial system."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Why did it take 7 yrs to punish Nirbhaya gangrape convicts: DCW chief Maliwal
text: After a Delhi Court ordered that Nirbhaya gangrape convicts should be hanged on January 22, Delhi Commission for Women Chairperson Swati Maliwal said, "I strongly welcome this decision." She added, "It's a win for all 'Nirbhayas' living in this country." She further asked, "Why has it taken 7 years to punish these people? Why can't this time period be reduced?"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Girl apologises for 'Free Kashmir' placard, says she is misunderstood
text: Mehak Mirza Prabhu, the Mumbai-based writer who held the 'Free Kashmir' placard at Gateway of India on Monday, has apologised after facing criticism over the poster. However, Prabhu said that the narrative put out was misinterpreted. She explained that she was talking about the freedom of basic Constitutional rights and the Internet shutdown in Kashmir for the last five months.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Avoided parenting fail: Ivanka as Secret Service stops her son from exiting plane
text: US President Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump thanked the Secret Service for helping her avoid a "major parenting fail" as they prevented her son from exiting the Air Force One plane. "Theo busted attempting a stealth exit from AF1 last night while I was distracted prying melted M&Ms out of my daughter's hands," she wrote on Instagram.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Burial of Iranian General postponed after 35 die in stampede at his funeral
text: The burial of Iranian General Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in a US strike, was postponed on Tuesday after 35 people died in a stampede at his funeral procession in the city of Kerman. Forty-eight others were injured in the stampede. Soleimani's body had been taken to several Iranian cities before arriving in his hometown Kerman for burial.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: India's GDP growth to be lowest in 11 years this fiscal, says govt
text: The Indian economy is expected to grow at 5% in the ongoing financial year, according to the first advance estimates released by the National Statistical Office (NSO) on Tuesday. This would be the lowest since 2008-09 when the GDP growth was at 3.1%. Asia's third-largest economy expanded by 6.8% last financial year and by 7.2% in 2017-18.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Govt asks palm oil refiners to boycott Malaysia after political row: Reports
text: The government has informally asked palm oil refiners and traders to avoid buying Malaysian palm oil following Malaysia's criticism of India's actions in Kashmir and CAA, reports said. It reportedly held a meeting with over 20 vegetable oil industry officials in Delhi on Monday. Commenting on CAA, Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad recently said, "People are dying because of this law."
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 'Frozen II' beats 'Frozen' to become highest-grossing animated film ever
text: Animated film 'Frozen II', with a worldwide collection of over $1.3 billion, has beaten its 2013 prequel 'Frozen' to become the highest-grossing animated movie ever. 'Frozen II' is in its seventh week of release and has grossed $450 million domestically, Box Office Mojo said. 'Frozen' had a worldwide collection of $1.2 billion and collected $400 million domestically, it added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Pooja Batra, Nawab Shah attend Golden Globes after-party, share pics
text: Actress Pooja Batra attended the 77th Golden Globe Awards after-party along with her husband, actor Nawab Shah on Monday. Sharing her pictures from the red carpet on social media, Pooja wrote, "Thank you @HBO @goldenglobes for an awesome evening." Nawab shared a picture with 'The Dictator' actor Sacha Baron Cohen on Instagram and wrote, "Dictator blues."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: How the f**k is teasing the rich right wing: Golden Globes host on his speech
text: Comedian Ricky Gervais who hosted the Golden Globes 2020 took to Instagram on Tuesday to comment on his monologue. Sharing a picture of himself from the show, he wrote, "How the f**k can teasing huge corporations...richest, most privileged...be considered right wing?" He also thanked his fans on Twitter and urged them to "make jokes, not war".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I'm your 'pehredar', won't let anyone take your rights: Mamata
text: Speaking on CAA and NRC, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "I'm your 'pehredar' (custodian), if anyone comes to take away your rights, he'll have to do it over my dead body." She added, "We do not live at the mercy of anyone." She further said, "[S]tay well and leave your worries to me. I'll guard you day and night."
author: Shailesh

headlines: I'd rather live in Maldives than coach Man Utd after City: Guardiola
text: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that he would rather live in the Maldives than coach the club's rival Manchester United. "It is like I would never train [Real] Madrid [after Barcelona]," he added. Guardiola coached Barcelona after replacing Frank Rijkaard in 2008 and won 14 trophies across competitions till 2012. He moved to Manchester City in 2016.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Hyundai, Uber unveil their S-A1 flying taxi concept
text: Hyundai and Uber unveiled its flying taxi concept S-A1 at the CES show which will be used for Uber Air trips by 2023. The taxi, developed as a part of Uber Elevate initiative, can carry up to four passengers and fly about 1,000-2,000 feet above ground. Hyundai said the taxi will initially be piloted but will eventually be fully autonomous.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Delhi HC seeks Twitter, IT Min's response on social media censorship plea
text: The Delhi High Court has sought views of IT Ministry and Twitter over a petition filed by advocate Sanjay Hegde demanding Twitter to frame censorship guidelines as per Indian Constitution. The petition was filed after Hegde's Twitter account was suspended last year for re-tweeting inappropriate posts. He challenged the suspension deeming it 'illegal' and added it bans freedom of speech.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: NPR is a disguised attempt to do Assam-like NRC: Chidambaram
text: The National Population Register (NPR) is a "disguised attempt" to do an Assam NRC-like exercise throughout India, former Home Minister P Chidambaram said. The Congress leader claimed that there was a "world of difference" between NPR 2010 and NPR 2020. The NRC-CAA-NPR exercise is part of the RSS-BJP plan to push its "divisive agenda of a Hindu Rashtra", Chidambaram added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Zoomcar in talks to acquire Gurugram car rental startup Revv: Report
text: Zoomcar is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire Gurugram-based self-drive car rental startup Revv, months after its merger with Drivezy fell through. Entrackr reported that the two startups are in talks over share swap ratio. Earlier, the deal between Zoomcar and Drivezy could not go through because Drivezy was not interested in taking it further.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: SpaceX launches 3rd batch of 60 Starlink satellites into orbit
text: SpaceX launched its third batch of 60 small satellites into orbit atop SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket, part of its plans to construct a giant constellation of thousands which will form a global broadband internet system. The batch brings the total number of satellites launched under the project to 180. SpaceX plans to place over 1,500 satellites by end of 2020.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Centre orders removal of speed breakers on national highways
text: The central government has initiated a special drive to remove all speed breakers along the national highways "with immediate effect", said a press release on Tuesday. "This initiative will save time, money and facilitate smooth vehicular movement especially to ambulances, elderly and unwell people," it added. It also said that speed breakers cause discomfort and damage to vehicles.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Muslim nations must unite after Iran General's killing: Malaysia PM
text: Malaysia's PM Mahathir Mohamad reportedly said that the Muslim countries must unite after the US' killing of Iran's top General, Qassem Soleimani, to protect themselves from external threats. He added, "We're no longer safe now. If anybody...says something that somebody doesn't like, it's all right for that person from another country to send a drone and perhaps shoot at will."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Mexico objects to US sending Mexican asylum seekers to Guatemala
text: Mexico "disagreed" with the United States' (US) plan to send some Mexican asylum seekers to Guatemala, the country's foreign ministry said. Under a bilateral agreement signed last year, the US can send asylum seekers from Honduras, El Salvador and Mexico to Guatemala. Mexico also said that it will work for "better options" for Mexicans affected by the provision.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Germany to cut troops in Iraq after Iranian General's killing
text: Germany has said that it is cutting its troop numbers in Iraq due to security concerns after Iranian General Qassem Soleimani was killed in a US drone strike. The government said that the drawdown was ordered by the US-led joint command for fighting Islamic State. Out of 120 German soldiers, about 30 will be redeployed to Jordan and Kuwait.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Muthoot Finance MD suffers head injury after stones pelted at his car
text: Gold loan financer Muthoot Finance's MD George Alexander Muthoot sustained injuries to his head after miscreants pelted stones at his car on Tuesday morning in Kochi. The company blamed ruling CPI(M)-affiliated Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) for the attack but the trade union rejected the allegation. Muthoot Finance in December sacked 166 employees from 43 branches across Kerala.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: How dare she stop a desh premi iron rod: Akhtar mocks FIR against JNUSU Prez
text: Lyricist Javed Akhtar mocked Delhi Police for filing an FIR against JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh, who was injured during Sunday's violence in JNU. "The FIR...is totally understandable. How dare she stop a nationalist, desh Premi iron rod with her head," Akhtar tweeted. The FIR was filed against Aishe and 19 others for allegedly destroying the university's property on Saturday.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Ex-Australia coach Lehmann quits social media after Twitter account gets hacked
text: Ex-Australia head coach Darren Lehmann has taken a break from social media for the foreseeable future after his Twitter account got hacked on Monday. "To see such vile and horrendous opinions used in my name has caused great upset to me and my family," he wrote. "The words...used were definitely ones...I do not endorse or promote," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ganguly said he wouldn't take a 19-yr-old to Australia: Irfan on first tour
text: All-rounder Irfan Pathan, who recently retired from all forms of cricket, revealed that then captain Sourav Ganguly in 2003 said that he wouldn't take a 19-year-old to Australia. "He hadn't seen me play. Then during the Australia tour, he told me that I would do good in the future," he added. He further said, "I played really well under Ganguly."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Samsung unveils ‘artificial humans’ that can talk like humans with emotions
text: Engineer Pranav Mistry-led Samsung's STAR Labs unveiled artificial intelligence-enabled avatars called 'NEON' at tech show CES 2020 in Las Vegas on Tuesday. "NEON is a computationally created virtual being that looks and behaves like a real human, with the ability to show emotions and intelligence," the company said. The AI also understands Hindi, Spanish, Japanese and other languages.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Clash between NSUI & ABVP workers in Guj; man seen bleeding from head
text: A clash broke out between workers of NSUI and ABVP in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Tuesday, following which police resorted to lathi charge to disperse the crowd.
