A video of the incident showed a man bleeding from his head, while it also showed a group of men cornering a man and thrashing him. Around 10 people have been injured.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: JMM's Rabindra Nath Mahato elected as Jharkhand Assembly Speaker
text: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) MLA Rabindra Nath Mahato was on Tuesday unanimously elected as the Jharkhand Assembly Speaker. Chief Minister Hemant Soren proposed Mahato's name for the post which was seconded by JMM MLA Champai Soren. Mahato was first elected in 2005 from Nala seat but lost the subsequent elections before winning it again in the 2014 and 2019 polls.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Study shows animal life thriving around Fukushima
text: University of Georgia researchers have found that nearly a decade after the nuclear accident in Japan's Fukushima, wildlife populations are abundant in areas void of human life. Photographic data was gathered from 106 camera sites from three zones for 120 days. The species seen in higher numbers in the uninhabited or restricted zones included raccoons, Japanese marten and Japanese macaque.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: 9-judge Supreme Court bench to hear Sabarimala issue from Jan 13
text: A nine-judge Constitution bench of the Supreme Court will begin hearing the issue of entry of women of all ages in Sabarimala temple from January 13, along with the issues of entry of women in Muslim and Parsi places of worship. Earlier, a five-judge bench had referred to a seven-judge bench the pleas seeking review of the 2018 judgement.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Masked men involved in JNU attack will be exposed soon: Javadekar
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Tuesday said that masked men involved in the JNU attack on Sunday will be exposed soon as the Home Ministry has ordered an inquiry into the incident. "Also, misunderstandings are deliberately being spread in JNU and in others parts of the country to incite violence, which will also be exposed," Javadekar added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Let's make a new beginning; violence not a solution: JNU VC
text: JNU VC M Jagadesh Kumar on Tuesday said that registration process for the winter semester has been restarted. "Let us make a new beginning and put the past behind," he added. Calling the recent incident of violence on university campus "unfortunate", Kumar said, "Our campus is known for debates and discussions to resolve any issues. Violence is not a solution."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Won't tolerate talks about freedom of Kashmir from India: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that if anyone talks about "freedom of Kashmir from India", it won't be tolerated. He was referring to the controversy over a 'Free Kashmir' placard spotted at a protest organised against JNU violence in Mumbai. However, he said the protester has clarified the poster was demanding freedom from internet restrictions in Kashmir.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Jamia VC handled violence on campus better than JNU VC: HRD Ministry
text: The Human Resource Development (HRD) Ministry has conveyed its "displeasure" to the officers of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) over the insensitivity towards the students injured in Sunday's violence. "The Jamia Millia Islamia Vice-Chancellor...seems to have handled the matter better," said an official. The Ministry has also advised the university not to file police cases against the students.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: National interest issue: SC on plea over Kashmir group defacing notes
text: The Supreme Court has asked Solicitor General Tushar Mehta to examine a plea alleging that the Jammu branch of Reserve Bank of India (RBI) allowed the exchange of currency notes worth ₹30 crore which were allegedly stamped with anti-India slogans by Kashmiri Graffiti, a separatist group. The bench comprising CJI SA Bobde said, "It is a matter of national interest".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Air hostess broke leg in 7 places as Thomas Cook plane rose 500 ft in turbulence
text: An air hostess broke her leg in seven places when a Thomas Cook plane rose 500 feet during turbulence caused by a hail storm. Eden Garrity was pushing a catering trolley aboard the flight from Cuba to Manchester, UK, in August 2019 when the plane encountered the storm. She was taken to hospital when the plane landed seven hours later.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pak National Assembly passes bill to extend Army chief's tenure by 3 yrs
text: Pakistan's National Assembly, the lower house of the Parliament, has passed a bill to extend Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa's tenure by three years. In November 2019, Pakistan's Supreme Court had granted a six-month extension to Bajwa on a condition that the Parliament would pass a law on the extension/reappointment of an Army chief within six months.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Archaeologists unearth ancient wine measuring table in Jerusalem
text: Israeli archaeologists unveiled an ancient table on Monday that was used to measure wine and olive oil, which they said helps prove a market once stood at the site in occupied east Jerusalem. The Israel Antiquities Authority (IAA) said the 2,000-year-old table was unearthed in the City of David National Park, between the Old City and Silwan.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Incidents like JNU attack happening due to upcoming Delhi elections: Kashyap
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has said that incidents like JNU attack are happening due to the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections in February. "This government is controlling the police, it has only one ambition that is to win elections," he added. This comes after some masked miscreants armed with sticks and rods attacked students and teachers inside JNU campus on Sunday night.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Akshay Kumar becomes 1st actor to cross ₹700 cr in India in a year
text: Akshay Kumar has become the first actor whose films have earned over ₹700 crore in a year at the Indian box office. His 2019 films 'Kesari', 'Mission Mangal' and 'Housefull 4' grossed ₹154.4 crore, ₹202.9 crore and ₹194.6 crore, respectively, with 'Good Newwz' crossing ₹100-crore mark within six days of its release. 'Good Newwz' collected nearly ₹162 crore till Sunday.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: 'Joker' gets 11 nominations at BAFTA, 'The Irishman', 'Once Upon...' 10 each
text: Joaquin Phoenix-starrer 'Joker' has been nominated in 11 categories at the 2020 British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA), including Best Director, Best Film and Best Actor. 'Joker' is followed by 'The Irishman' and 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' with 10 nominations each. The three films will compete with '1917' and 'Parasite' in the Best Film category.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Shreyas Iyer will bat at no. 4 for years to come: Rohit Sharma
text: Talking about Team India's youngsters, Rohit Sharma said that they need to make their respective spots their own. "Shreyas Iyer knows that he will now bat at number four for years to come. He feels secure and can now execute his plans freely," he added. "Rishabh Pant did well in Windies ODIs. Shivam Dube has started doing well," he added.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Natural geyser in Iceland shoots boiling water as high as 130 ft every 5 mins
text: Strokkur, the most active geyser in Iceland's Geysir geothermal area, shoots up boiling hot water into the sky to heights of 50-60 feet every five-ten minutes. Occasionally, the eruptions go as high as 130 feet. Natural geysers are periodically-spouting hot springs, created when water meets magma-heated rock, boils and then erupts under pressure. There are about 1,000 natural geysers worldwide.
author: Dharna

headlines: Bengaluru IT company's owner donates ₹1 crore to Tirupati Balaji temple
text: A Bengaluru-based devotee, who owns an IT company, has donated ₹1 crore to the Tirupati Balaji temple. Amarnath Chowdary requested that the funds be used for temple-run Sri Venkateswara Gosamrakshana Trust meant for the welfare of cows. Officials said the donation was the fulfilment of a vow made by Chowdary for "fruitfully running a software company" floated nine years ago.
author: Dharna

headlines: Andhra farmers block highway while protesting 3 capital cities' proposal
text: Farmers in Andhra Pradesh's Amaravati blocked NH-16 while staging a sit-in against the state government's proposal of having three capital cities. Vehicular traffic for several kilometres came to halt due to the protest. Earlier, CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy had said that decision of setting up a legislative, an executive and a judicial capital was for the state's decentralised development.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 60,000 people disappeared amid Mexico's drug war since 2006
text: Mexican authorities on Monday said that 61,637 people have "disappeared" since 1964, over 95% of them went missing after the then-president Felipe Calderon began a war against drugs in 2006. Around 53% of those who disappeared were between the ages of 15 and 35, officials said. "These are statistics of horror behind which lie so many stories," an official added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: UK teen who lied about rape gets suspended sentence in Cyprus
text: A court in Cyprus sentenced a UK teenager convicted of lying about being gang-raped to four months in jail, suspended for three years. The teenager alleged that she was gang-raped by 12 Israeli tourists in a hotel room. The teenager later retracted her allegation which she claimed was done under pressure from the police.nn
author: Shailesh

headlines: US denies visa to Iran's Foreign Minister for UNSC meeting
text: The United States has denied visa to Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif to attend a United Nations Security Council (UNSC) meeting in New York, US official said. "We have not received any official communication from either the US or the UN," Iranian mission to UN said. Tensions between Iran and the US escalated after killing of an Iranian General.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Iran designates all US forces 'terrorists' for killing top commander
text: Iran has designated all US forces "terrorists" under an urgent motion passed by lawmakers, who earlier branded the killing of the Quds Force commander "state-sponsored terrorism". Qassem Soleimani was killed in an air strike ordered by US President Donald Trump at the Baghdad International Airport last week. US said Soleimani was targeted as he was planning to attack Americans.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 35 killed in stampede at funeral procession for Iran General killed in US strike
text: Iran state TV has said that 35 people have been killed and 48 others have been injured in a stampede that erupted at funeral procession for General Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in a US air strike at Baghdad International Airport last week. Soleimani's body had arrived in his home town of Kerman in southeast Iran for burial.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: His highness will oblige us with a challan: Pune Police on crown on number plate
text: Pune Police on Tuesday responded to a man's complaint who tweeted about a scooter's number plate carrying the symbol of a crown. "His highness will unfortunately have to oblige us with a Challan soon!" official Twitter handle of Pune Police tweeted. Users appreciated the response, with one tweeting, "Promptness of Pune Police - 100% Humor of Pune Police - 1000%."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Hrithik makes fun of his acting in 'Main Prem Ki...', says 'I failed terribly'
text: Hrithik Roshan, during an interview with Film Companion, was asked by a fan about the most difficult role he played. Recalling his 'Main Prem Ki Diwani Hoon' character, Hrithik said he found it difficult to play an "uppity and happy person". "I tried too hard and I failed terribly," said Hrithik while imitating his character and making fun of it.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Hardik meets fiancée Nataša's family for dinner in Mumbai, pic surfaces
text: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya met his fiancée Nataša Stanković's family for dinner at a suburban restaurant in Mumbai. Hardik was clicked outside the restaurant with Nataša and her parents. Nataša also shared a picture with Hardik from the day in her Instagram Stories. Hardik and Nataša got engaged on January 1 in Dubai.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Activist Sadaf Jafar arrested during CAA protests released from jail
text: Activist Sadaf Jafar and former IPS officer SR Darapuri, arrested allegedly in connection with violence during anti-CAA protests in Lucknow last month, were released from jail on Tuesday. A local court gave them bail on Saturday. Jafar said she was arrested on December 19 while she was peacefully protesting and "exposing the inaction of the police through a Facebook live".
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Ranveer would play for 8 hours constantly, I feared for his fitness: Kapil
text: Referring to actor Ranveer Singh preparing for his role for '83 movie, India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev said, "I have seen him work so hard on bowling." He added, "He'd bowl and play for eight hours constantly to understand the rhythm, and would do so in the peak of summer." "I feared for his fitness," Kapil further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I said 'I'll eat my d*** if Bitcoin doesn't hit $1 mn' to get new users: McAfee
text: Three years after first saying that he'll eat his d*** on national television if Bitcoin doesn't hit $1 million by 2020 end, computer programmer and businessman John McAfee has said that it was a trick. "Eat my d*** in 12 months? A ruse to onboard new users. It worked," McAfee tweeted. "Bitcoin was first. It's an ancient technology," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Have taken oath as minister, yet to fill my pockets: Maharashtra Cong MLA
text: Addressing a rally, Congress MLA Yashomati Thakur said, "Our government wasn't in power till now. But now I've taken oath as the Maharashtra Minister. We're yet to fill our pockets." The video of the minister also surfaced online. Thakur, however, clarified her statement later, saying it was a "sarcastic" remark and she was repeating a BJP leader's statement.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: India suffers hottest decade on record
text: India Meteorological Department said on Monday that the last decade was India's hottest decade since the records began in 1901. The department called the impact of global warming "unmistakable" and revealed that extreme weather killed more than 1,500 people last year. Temperatures between 2010 and 2019 were found to be 0.36 degrees Celsius above the long-term average.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Police look for girl with 'Free Kashmir' poster; girl clarifies in video
text: Mumbai Police on Tuesday said they have taken serious cognizance regarding the 'Free Kashmir' poster shown during a protest on Monday and is searching for the girl holding it. Meanwhile, the girl with the poster released a video saying she was voicing her solidarity for basic constitutional rights. "Placard meant freedom to express themselves, freedom from internet lockdown," she added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Retd Lt Gen Hoon, who led operation to secure Siachen in 1984, dies at 90
text: Retired Lieutenant General PN Hoon, who led the Operation Meghdoot to capture the Siachen Glacier in 1984, passed away at the age of 90 on Monday evening. He had served the Army for four decades before retiring in 1987. His son Ronny Hoon said the Lieutenant General died after suffering brain haemorrhage.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Idli, halwa for astronauts in space for Mission Gaganyaan, pics surface
text: For the Indian astronauts, scheduled to go on to India's first manned space mission Gaganyaan, a menu has been prepared by Defence Food Research Laboratory with food items like egg and veg rolls, idli-sambar and halwa. Food heater will also be provided to the astronauts. A special container has also been developed for them to consume liquids in space.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: BJP leader arrested on rape charges, party says falsely implicated
text: BJP's Devendra Tamrakar was arrested in Madhya Pradesh after a Dalit woman accused him of raping her, police said on Monday. The woman claimed that Tamrakar raped her in November after getting her husband drunk. However, BJP's Lokendra Parashar with other leaders met the police on Monday and submitted a memorandum, which said Tamrakar was implicated in a false charge.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Popular tourist rock formation collapses as earthquake hits Puerto Rico
text: A popular tourist rock formation known as Punta Ventana collapsed after a 5.8-magnitude earthquake hit Puerto Rico on Monday, damaging homes and causing power cuts. The earthquake struck at a depth of 6 km, off the Caribbean island's southern coast. No tsunami alerts were issued and no casualties have been reported.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: In pictures: Animals affected by bushfires in Australia
text: The bushfires in Australia have killed an estimated 50 crore animals and destroyed over 15 million acres of bushland. In the gallery, a kangaroo can be seen in bushland surrounded by smoke haze. Other images show a volunteer holding a severely burnt brushtail possum and a koala drinking water offered from a bottle by a firefighter.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: IKEA to pay $46 million to parents of 2-yr-old killed by falling dresser
text: Swedish furniture retailer IKEA has agreed to pay $46 million (₹330 crore) to settle a wrongful-death lawsuit filed by parents of a two-year-old who died after an IKEA dresser tipped over and fell on him in 2017. Before the incident, IKEA had recalled the model after several children died similarly. The family said IKEA never alerted them to the recall.
author: Dharna

headlines: India's market cap growth lowest among top 10 stock markets in 2019
text: India's aggregate market capitalisation grew just 3.43% last year in dollar terms, the lowest among the world's top 10 stock markets. China saw the highest market cap growth of 36.5%, followed by the US at 27.92%, according to Bloomberg data. India's stock market is the world's ninth-largest with a market cap of $2.15 trillion at the end of December.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Before I'm kicked out, I want to walk out myself: Ajay on acting career
text: Ajay Devgn said in an interview that he'll become a "full-fledged producer" in the future as he "might not be a mainstream actor" after a couple of years. He further said that the "limelight" is "very addictive" while adding that he cannot keep holding onto it forever. "Before I'm kicked out, I want to walk out myself," said Ajay.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kabir Khan to collaborate with Salman for the fourth film: Reports
text: Filmmaker Kabir Khan, who has previously worked with Salman Khan in 'Ek Tha Tiger', 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' and 'Tubelight', will reportedly collaborate with the actor for the fourth time. They have been discussing several scripts, which includes an action-thriller and a social drama about an Indian zookeeper who travels to China, reports stated. An announcement will reportedly be made in March.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: What's happening in India seems alien, not sure how we got here: Sonam
text: Actress Sonam Kapoor on Tuesday reshared a note penned by her sister Rhea Kapoor on Instagram, which was about the violence on the campus of Jawaharlal Nehru University. "What's happening in our country seems alien...unrecognisable...not sure how we got here," it stated. "My thoughts are with...students at JNU, you're so much braver than I could ever be," it further read.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Changed my name immediately after wedding: Bigg Boss 12 contestant Nehha
text: 'Bigg Boss 12' contestant Nehha Pendse, who got married to her boyfriend Shardul Singh Bayas on Sunday, has said that she "couldn't wait" to change her name. She revealed that immediately after the rituals, she added Bayas (husband's surname) to her last name. "I'm proud to be Shardul's wife...more than happy that Shardul came into my life," she further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I always tell Aamir that he should not leave Rajkumar Hirani: Anil
text: Anil Kapoor has said he always tells Aamir Khan that he shouldn't stop working with his '3 Idiots' director Rajkumar Hirani, stating, "I feel whenever you make...good team...you should hold on to it." "If you see Martin Scorsese, Robert De Niro, Leonardo DiCaprio they do...many films together. They can work with others...but they keep working with each other," he added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Samsung unveils ball-shaped robot that follows owner, manages smart homes
text: Samsung has unveiled a tennis ball-shaped robot companion that follows and helps owners around the house and manages their smart homes. Named "Ballie", the AI-powered rolling robot, can patrol the house, act like a fitness assistant and turn on smart devices like lights, vacuums when it notices a spill and TV for dogs when the owners are away.
author: Dharna

headlines: New imaging system, AI algorithm accurately identify brain tumors
text: A new study has found that a new system of combining advanced optical imaging with an artificial intelligence algorithm produces an accurate, real-time intraoperative diagnosis of brain tumours. After testing the system, the AI-based diagnosis was found to be 94.6% accurate, while the pathologist-based interpretation was found to be 93.9% accurate.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Man posing as NRI promises marriage, dupes woman of ₹3.9 lakh
text: Man posing as an NRI cheated a woman of ₹3.9 lakh after contacting her through a matrimonial website and promising marriage. On December 30, the man, Arman Malik, called the woman saying he has landed in Delhi and have to pay Customs officials for carrying excess baggage and diamonds. After the transfer of money, Malik switched off his phone.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Shiv Sainiks are Sonia Sainikis: Patra after Raut's 'Free Kashmir' remark
text: BJP's Sambit Patra has called Shiv Sena leaders "Sonia Sainiks" after Sanjay Raut's remark on the "Free Kashmir" poster at Mumbai protests. "These 'Sonia Sainikis'...show their allegiance to #TukdeTukdeGang...may soon turn up with their...version of 'Hindu Terrorism'," Patra tweeted. Earlier, Raut said that the poster meant "Kashmir wants freedom from restrictions on internet and mobile services".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 'Hindu Raksha Dal' claims responsibility for JNU violence, threatens more attacks
text: 'Hindu Raksha Dal' national convenor Pinky Chaudhary has claimed responsibility for the attack on students and teachers of Jawaharlal Nehru University on Sunday night. "JNU is a hotbed of anti-national activities, we can't tolerate this," he stated. In a video message, Chaudhary said more such attacks will take place in the future if anyone speaks against Hinduism.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Supreme Court orders Centre to refund ₹104 crore to Anil Ambani's RCom
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday ordered the Centre to refund around ₹104 crore to Anil Ambani-led Reliance Communications (RCom). The apex court rejected the Centre's plea challenging a tribunal's ruling. In December 2018, the tribunal had directed the Centre to return the amount after encashing bank guarantee of ₹908 crore against spectrum charges of ₹774 crore.
author: Dharna

headlines: Why are you saying 'ah ah' on seeing my name: BJP leader to Swara on her remark
text: After actress Swara Bhasker tweeted 'Ahahahahahahaa' while sharing a post which mocked BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, the latter replied to the actress. "Why you doing ah ah ah after seeing my name," Tajinder wrote in response to Swara's tweet. "Don't flatter yourself Baggey!" Swara wrote while further replying to him.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Do I have to show my documents to you? Taapsee to man asking if she's Indian
text: Taapsee Pannu has responded to a Twitter user who asked, "Are you Indian?" He questioned her nationality after she shared an article about the arrest of the main accused in the violence at Pakistan's Gurdwara Nankana Sahib and wrote "Now it's our turn", seemingly referring to JNU violence. Taapsee tweeted, "Do I have to show my documents to you also?"
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Anurag Kashyap, Taapsee Pannu, Dia Mirza attend protest against JNU violence
text: Celebrities including filmmakers Anurag Kashyap, Zoya Akhtar and Anubhav Sinha as well as actresses Taapsee Pannu, Swara Bhasker and Dia Mirza attended a protest against JNU violence in Mumbai on Monday. "We aren't fools...We know how riots are caused, how these situations are created," said Kashyap. "We've reached that stage...where we've shown enough respect to the government," said Swara.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Rahul Bose attends protest against JNU violence despite eye injury, pic surfaces
text: Actor Rahul Bose on Monday attended a protest against violence in JNU despite suffering from an eye injury. A picture of him at the site of the protest shows him with a bandaged eye. "Is Rahul Bose a reel life hero or real life hero," a user tweeted. Many other celebrities attended the protest including Anurag Kashyap and Taapsee Pannu.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 1,999 stone-pelting cases in 2019 in J&K, 1,193 after Art 370 revocation
text: Jammu and Kashmir witnessed an increase in stone-pelting incidents in 2019 as compared to 2018 recording 1,999 cases, according to official data. Out of the total cases in 2019, 1,193 were reported after Centre revoked Article 370 in J&K on August 5. The data further stated that the highest number of 658 stone-pelting incidents took place in August last year.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Zuckerberg told me I was 'number one' on Facebook at a dinner, says Trump
text: During a telephonic interview with radio show host Rush Limbaugh, US President Donald Trump claimed Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg congratulated him for being the "number one" on the social media platform a while ago. Trump claimed Zuckerberg made the revelation when they had dinner together, reportedly in October when Zuckerberg was in Washington DC to testify on Facebook's cryptocurrency Libra.
author: Dharna

headlines: BJP leader allegedly beats up man, molests his girlfriend in pub over selfies
text: BJP leader Anupam Hazra has been booked for allegedly beating up a man and molesting his girlfriend at a pub in Kolkata after the man clicked selfies with him. The complainant said the leader asked him the reason for clicking selfies and punched him after verbally abusing him. The victim alleged that Hazra even snatched his gold chain.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Goons followed me inside my bedroom, said 'surrender kijiye': JNU professor
text: JNU professor Shiv Prakash, who was with his wife and two children at his home in the varsity campus during the Sunday's mob attack, said the goons broke the latch of his door and entered inside. "We ran to the bedroom but they followed us inside. I asked them why they were doing this, they said, 'Surrender kijiye'," Prakash recalled.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: JNU prof quits govt's statistics committee citing 'situation in university'
text: JNU professor and economist CP Chandrasekhar on Monday said he has withdrawn from the government's newly-constituted Standing Committee on Statistics, citing the situation in the university. Chandrasekhar also said he lacks faith in the committee's mission to restore credibility to the country's statistical system. This comes after the violence at JNU on Sunday where about 30 people were injured.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: US Defence Department contradicts Trump, says won't break law of war
text: US Defence Secretary Mark Esper on Monday said the US military would not violate the laws of armed conflict by striking Iranian cultural sites, a move threatened by President Donald Trump. Targeting cultural sites with military action is considered a war crime under international law, including a UNSC resolution and the 1954 Hague Convention for the Protection of Cultural Property.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Schoolgirl made to clear snow for 3 hours in -1°C in China, her fingers turn black
text: The fingers of a 13-year-old schoolgirl in China, who was ordered by her teacher to sweep snow off the school campus, turned black and may have to be amputated due to severe frostbite. The girl said she was made to sweep for three hours in -1°C. I could not feel my fingers after I completed the task, the girl added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 'Bigg Boss 12' contestant Nehha Pendse shares official pics from her wedding
text: 'Bigg Boss 12' contestant Nehha Pendse, who got married to boyfriend Shardul Singh Bayas on Sunday in Pune, has shared the first pictures from her wedding on Instagram. The actress can be seen dressed as a Maharashtrian bride in a pastel pink-coloured Nauvari saree with a nose ring and half-moon-shaped bindi. More pictures from the couple's wedding have surfaced online.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Infrastructure-wise, we're disaster for visually impaired people: John
text: John Abraham said at an event that infrastructure-wise, India is a disaster for the visually impaired and differently-abled people. "We don't have [the] infrastructure for regular people, so we are very far away from it," he added. "This is not my way of criticising the government but I think we must move in a certain direction," John further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I feel proud that we aren't scared: Deepika on protests across India
text: Deepika Padukone, while talking about the ongoing protests against violence on the campus of JNU and Citizenship (Amendment) Act, said, "I feel proud that we aren't scared to express ourselves." "If we want to see any change in our life or our society, it is extremely important to keep all points of view on the table," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Shah Rukh, Aamir were right about intolerance: Anubhav Sinha
text: 'Article 15' director Anubhav Sinha said that Shah Rukh Khan and Aamir Khan were right about intolerance. Anubhav was referring to incidents when Aamir had said that his wife "wanted to leave India" and Shah Rukh had said that "religious intolerance is the worst kind of crime". "I...understand why they may not be able to speak out," Anubhav added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: It's their choice, we don't know their fears: Kabir on stars' silence on CAA
text: Referring to Bollywood stars who have maintained their silence on CAA, filmmaker Kabir Khan said, "It's their choice. How do we know what their fears are?" "[In the past], those who have spoken up have been attacked and no one was there to defend them," he added. "If you can't defend them, don't push them to talk," Kabir further said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Something similar to Hyderabad encounter shown in 'Darbar': Murugadoss
text: Ahead of the release of actor Rajinikanth starrer 'Darbar', filmmaker AR Murugadoss has revealed that the film will show "something similar" to the police encounter of four men who raped and murdered 27-year-old Hyderabad veterinarian. "We...shot the episode months before the incident took place in Hyderabad," Murugadoss said. "Rajini sir...talked about that scene after the encounters," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Made 'Maa Tujhe Salaam' as song for one's mother not for country: AR Rahman
text: Singer-composer AR Rahman has said that his song 'Maa Tujhe Salaam' from 1997 album 'Vande Mataram' was created "as a personal song, like singing a song for one's mother". "I was...objective about it, thinking whether patriotism will work or not," the Oscar award-winning singer said. "So, I was like, forget about the country, let's do it as...personal song," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Zuckerberg's a naive child who spreads Nazi propaganda: Actor at Golden Globes
text: Actor Sacha Baron Cohen, during the introduction for Taika Waititi-directed film 'Jojo Rabbit' at Golden Globes, called Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg "a naive, misguided child who spreads Nazi propaganda". "Hero of this...movie is a...child who spreads Nazi propaganda and...has imaginary friends," Cohen said. "His name is Mark Zuckerberg. Sorry, this is...intro for 'The Social Network'," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Sony unveils electric concept car with self-driving capabilities
text: Sony, at CES 2020, unveiled an electric concept car, named "Vision-S". The prototype, built in partnership with companies like Magna, Bosch and Qualcomm, houses 33 different sensors on the exterior and interior for "Safety Cocoon Concept", capable of detecting 360 degrees around the car for autonomous driving. It also features 360-degree audio and a screen nearly as wide as dashboard.
author: Dharna

headlines: Pharma startup Generico raises ₹10 crore from Alteria Capital
text: Mumbai-based pharmaceutical retail startup Generico has raised ₹10 crore in venture debt financing from Alteria Capital's ₹962 crore venture debt fund. The transaction is a part of Generico's larger series-A funding round, which saw a ₹100 crore ($14 million) investment led by Lightbox Ventures. Generico was co-founded by IIT Bombay alumni Siddharth Gadia and Girish Agarwal.
author: Dharna

headlines: You are a broker of Muslim votes: BJP MP to AIMIM Chief Owaisi
text: BJP MP from Telangana's Nizamabad Arvind Dharmapuri has attacked AIMIM Chief Asaduddin Owaisi saying, "You [Owaisi] are a broker of Muslim votes, earlier Congress used to pay you more for your brokerage, now TRS (Telangana Rashtra Samithi) pays more." Dharmapuri added, "You look like a clown, so you will be hung upside down, clowns do this in circuses."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: FIR against injured JNUSU Prez for vandalism in JNU a day before mob attack
text: Delhi Police have filed an FIR against JNU Students' Union leader Aishe Ghosh and 19 other people for allegedly vandalising the university's server room on Saturday, a day before masked goons' attack. Ghosh was among several students and teachers who were injured in the attack. The complaint was filed by the JNU administration and the case was registered on Sunday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Sensex surges more than 500 points, Nifty above 12,100
text: Indian market rebounded on early Tuesday, with benchmark index Sensex surging over 500 points to 41,204, amid easing fears of a Middle East conflict and steadying crude oil prices. The Nifty 50 index which slipped below the 12,100 mark on Monday, surged by nearly 150 points to 12,150. Among the top gainers were HDFC Bank, Tata Steel and UltraTech Cement.
author: Dharna

headlines: Admissions open for IIIT- B & upGrad's PG Diploma in ML & AI 2020 batch
text: The PG Diploma course in Machine Learning & AI by IIIT-Bangalore & upGrad is designed for working professionals and has empowered 3000+ students with an average salary hike of 47%. The program offers personalized 1:1 sessions with industry experts and access to 25 personalized live sessions in groups of 8 students, hiring drives, hackathons every quarter and career support.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Producer denies attending CAA meet after BJP leader thanks him for attending
text: Producer Bhushan Kumar has denied reports that said he was among the Bollywood celebrities who attended government's meeting in Mumbai to discuss CAA. "I was in Grand Hyatt (the venue of the meeting), that doesn't mean that I was in a meeting," said Bhushan. This comes after BJP leader Tarun Rathi thanked him and other celebrities for attending the meeting.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: BJP leader claims protestors raised 'Hinduo se Aazadi' slogan; celebs call it a lie
text: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga on Monday shared a video of a protest in Mumbai and claimed, "Muslim and Leftist students...raised slogans 'Hinduo se Aazadi'." Actress Konkona Sensharma commented, "You're spreading lies! It's a doctored video! We were there...it was a peaceful protest which spoke of unity, not hate mongering." "Shame isn't in their DNA," Sonam Kapoor tweeted.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Toyota to build 175-acre smart city near Japan's Mount Fuji
text: Toyota has revealed its plans to build a 175-acre smart city near Japan's Mount Fuji. The 'Woven City' ecosystem would be powered by hydrogen fuel cells, have zero-emission and fully autonomous transport, sustainable housing with robots assisting residents in daily life and sensor-based AI to monitor their health. It would let scientists test technology like robotics in a real-world environment.
author: Dharna

headlines: I do what my conscience says: Zoho CEO on backlash for being guest at RSS event
text: Software startup Zoho Corporation's Co-founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu faced backlash on Twitter after a guestlist indicated he would be the chief guest at upcoming RSS event 'Resurgent Bharath'. Responding to the criticism, Vembu tweeted, "I don't decide my views based on Twitter attacks. If you dislike which events I attend...please do what your conscience dictates...I'll do what mine dictates."
author: Dharna

headlines: Indian-origin billionaire Vinod Khosla sued by California over beach access
text: In a dispute spanning 12 years, California officials are suing Indian-American billionaire businessman Vinod Khosla to ensure public access to Martins Beach, a stretch of coastline Khosla claims to be his personal property. In 2008, the Sun Microsystems founder bought an 89-acre property including Martins Beach Road for $32.5 million and gated off the road, cutting public's access to beach.
author: Dharna

headlines: 2010-2019 hottest decade in India; 2019 7th warmest year in 119 years
text: The decade 2010-19 was the warmest on record for India as the annual mean temperature was 0.36 degree above normal, the India Meteorological Department stated. The IMD report also mentioned that 2019 was the seventh warmest year since 1901. "The impact of global warming on India is unmistakable," IMD head Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Over 3 lakh 'ghost children' identified in Assam govt schools
text: There are over 3 lakh 'ghost children' in Assam government schools who were registered during the erstwhile Congress government, an official release said on Monday. Congress had shown these fake figures to embezzle public money sanctioned for books, mid-day meals and uniforms of the non-existent students, it added. CM Sarbananda Sonowal said strict action will be taken against the guilty.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India-US ties have grown from strength to strength: PM in new year call to Trump
text: India-US ties have grown from strength to strength, Prime Minister Narendra Modi told US President Donald Trump in a new year greeting call. "The PM highlighted significant progress made in deepening strategic partnership in the previous year and expressed desire to continue to work with President Trump for enhancing cooperation in areas of mutual interest," the Prime Minister's Office said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: People with sticks entered our home, looked for someone: JNU's S Korean prof
text: Myung-e Lee, Visiting Faculty at the Centre of Korean Studies, said people with sticks were hitting at doors of faculty members' homes in JNU campus during the Sunday's violence. "My son...a Class IX student, opened the door and they came in. They said they were looking for someone specific," she recalled. The South Korean professor said all intruders weren't masked.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: People protesting against JNU violence at Gateway of India relocated by police
text: Mumbai Police on Tuesday evicted people gathered at Gateway of India to protest against violence at JNU and took them to Azad Maidan to hold the demonstration. "Roads were getting blocked and common Mumbaikar and tourists were facing problems. We had appealed to protesters many times [and] have now relocated them to Azad Maidan," a police officer said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Man saves baby kangaroo from Australian fires that have killed 50 crore animals
text: A man shared a video of him saving a kangaroo from bushfires that have killed around 50 crore animals in Australia. "Australia is on fire! This is heart breaking. Please donate. We need your help!" he wrote along with the video. Nearly 15 million acres of bushland and over 1,000 homes have been destroyed by the fires.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Iran Minister tweets pics, asks Trump 'Have you ever seen such a sea of humanity'
text: Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif shared pictures from General Qassem Soleimani's funeral procession and asked US President Donald Trump, "Have you ever seen such a sea of humanity?" "Do you still want to listen to the clowns advising you on our region? Do you still imagine you can break the will of this great nation & its people?" he tweeted.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Student from Indonesia jailed for life for sexually assaulting 48 men in UK
text: Reynhard Sinaga, a 36-year-old student who came to the UK from Indonesia on a student visa in 2007 and never left, was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum term of 30 years on Monday. He was found guilty of raping or sexually assaulting 48 men in Manchester. Police have found evidence linking over 190 potential victims to him.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Trump should remember the number 290: Iran Prez on US Prez's '52 sites' tweet
text: Responding to a tweet by US President Donald Trump in which he threatened to attack 52 Iranian sites, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani tweeted, "Those who refer to the number 52 should also remember the number 290. #IR655." Rouhani was referring to the 1988 shooting down of an Iranian airliner by a US warship in which 290 people were killed.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Iran Prez's advisor tweets list of Trump properties after US Prez threatens attack
text: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani's advisor Hesameddin Ashena tweeted a list of properties belonging to Donald Trump after the US President threatened to attack 52 Iranian sites. "We have zero problems with American people. We...achieved deals with previous US administrations. Our sole problem is Trump. In the event of war, it's he who'll bear full responsibility," Ashena wrote in another tweet.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I could see the effect it was having on my mom: Kabir on JNU violence
text: Filmmaker Kabir Khan, while talking about the violence on the campus of JNU, said that it was heartbreaking for him. "I was sitting...with my mother and...could see the effect it was having on her," he added. "She's 86 and...I get very emotional...I could see what she was going through. That's not the India she brought us up in," said  Kabir.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Virat is confident, aggressive, he's Tanhaji of team India: Ajay
text: Ajay Devgn, who'll portray 17th-century Marathi military leader Tanhaji Malusare in his upcoming film, has said India cricket captain Virat Kohli is Tanhaji of team India. "He's confident, aggressive and wants to win at any cost," he added. Ajay further shared his own cricket memories and said, "My finger...chipped when I tried to catch the ball, it's still twisted."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kashyap, Dadlani join students protesting JNU attack at Gateway of India
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap and music composer Vishal Dadlani joined the protest at Gateway of India organised by students protesting the JNU attack. "The government doesn't want to arrest...perpetrators because they're their own people," Kashyap said. "We're here in support of...one India for all," Dadlani added. Taapsee Pannu, Zoya Akhtar and others joined the students at Carter Road.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Xerox secures $24 billion financing for proposed HP takeover
text: Xerox Holdings announced on Monday that it has secured $24 billion funding from Citigroup, Bank of America and Mizuho for its takeover offer for HP. Earlier, HP had unanimously turned down a $33.5 billion buyout offer from Xerox, saying it significantly undervalued the company. HP has a market value of about $27 billion, about three times the size of Xerox.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: BJP's ally JD(U) seeks removal of JNU VC, demands SC probe
text: BJP's ally JD(U) on Monday demanded the removal of the JNU Vice-Chancellor and a probe by a Supreme Court judge into the Sunday night violence in the university. "Police officials too failed in performing their duties," JD(U) leader KC Tyagi said. Tyagi termed the violence at JNU as an act of "cowardice of those ideologically defeated in a debate".
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Kejriwal failed to deliver promises, Delhi needs BJP: Gambhir
text: Ahead of the Delhi Assembly elections, BJP MP from East Delhi Gautam Gambhir has said that the national capital needs BJP alleging that current CM Arvind Kejriwal has "failed to deliver his promises". "Delhi will get better government once BJP comes to power," he added. "We will...make Delhi a better place...we can get better air quality, water...infrastructure," Gambhir further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Echoes of Germany's Nazi rule: Abhijit Banerjee on JNU violence
text: Nobel laureate and JNU alumnus Abhijit Banerjee, while commenting on JNU violence, said that it has "too many echoes of the years when Germany was moving towards Nazi rule". He has urged the government to establish the truth and not let it "get drowned in the chorus of counter accusations". "I'm really concerned about those who were injured," Banerjee added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Congress President post 'a family matter': BJP's Smriti Irani
text: BJP leader Smriti Irani on Monday said that the post of Congress President is "a family matter". On being asked if she thinks that Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will become Congress president, Irani added, "Only Sonia Gandhi (Congress Interim President) could answer." Commenting on Priyanka's attacks on the BJP, Irani further said, "Amethi and its people can tell everything about this."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: UK will not lament death of Iranian General Soleimani: PM Johnson
text: UK PM Boris Johnson has said the UK will not lament the death of Iranian General Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in an air strike by US last week. He added that Soleimani played a role in the "deaths of thousands of innocent civilians and Western personnel". He further said that "calls for retaliation will simply lead to more violence".
author: Shailesh

headlines: Teenagers in Italy 'force' ambulance staff to treat friend: Doctors
text: A few teenagers entered a hospital in Naples, Italy and forced the ambulance staff to drive to their friend to treat him for a knee sprain, Italian doctors said. The incident was reported on a Facebook page, Nobody Touches Hippocrates, established by doctors to highlight violence against staff. The boy was given on-the-spot treatment by the medical staff.
author: Shailesh

headlines: UP's anti-CAA protester was shot in eye from close range: Autopsy
text: The post-mortem report of Anas, one of the two men who was killed in the anti-Citizenship Act protest in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor, said that he was shot in the left eye from a close range, reported the Hindustan Times. Anas' family has accused the police of shooting him dead, however, the police say that he was shot by the protesters.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 52.72 lakh missed calls received on CAA no. from verifiable phones: Shah
text: BJP President and Home Minister Amit Shah has said that 52,72,000 missed calls have been received on the special toll-free number in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act from verifiable phone numbers. He further said a total of 68 lakh calls were received on the number. BJP had launched the number on January 2.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Put CAA aside, can't let a country burn to save ego: Chetan Bhagat
text: Tweeting in support of activists protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and NRC (National Register of Citizens), author Chetan Bhagat urged the Centre to put CAA aside officially as it has "major communication gaps." "Announce NRC won’t come...Focus on upcoming budget," he tweeted. He further wrote, "It’s not worth it. Can’t let a country burn to save ego."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: KKR's new recruit Tom Banton smashes 5 sixes in a row in BBL match
text: KKR's new recruit Tom Banton smashed five sixes in a row in an over for Brisbane Heat against Sydney Thunder in a rain-curtailed BBL match. During the fourth over of Heat's innings in the eight-over-per-side match, the 21-year-old batsman couldn't score a run off the first delivery but slammed five sixes in a row, reaching his fifty off 16 deliveries.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Lehmann's Twitter account hacked during BBL match, hacker writes 'F**k Iran'
text: BBL side Brisbane Heat head coach Darren Lehmann's Twitter account was hacked during his side's match against Sydney Thunder on Monday. The hacker changed his name on Twitter to "Qassem Soleimani | F**k Iran". Further, in a now-deleted tweet, the hacker responded to Brisbane Heat's tweet, writing, "I am not hacked. What the f**k. I quit my job as coach..."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Special chemical being sprayed to blunt dew impact at Indore stadium
text: In an effort to counter the effects of dew ahead of India-Sri Lanka T20I, the Madhya Pradesh Cricket Association (MPCA) has been spraying a special chemical on the outfield at Indore's Holkar Stadium. MPCA chief curator Samander Singh Chauhan said the grass on ground was also not being watered since the last three days to minimise the effects of dew.n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: How does World Test C'ship table read after Australia whitewash NZ 3-0?
text: After completing a 3-0 whitewash over New Zealand at home, Australia have reduced the gap with table-toppers India in the World Test Championship table to 64 points. India and Australia are followed by Pakistan and Sri Lanka, who have 80 points each. New Zealand are fifth on the table with 60 points from five matches.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: How will digital photo voter slips with QR codes for Delhi Assembly polls work?
text: Voters in Delhi Assembly Elections, which will be held on February 8, will be entitled to digital photo voter slips containing QR codes for the first time. Voters can download their digital photo voter slip from 'Voter Helpline' app available for Android and iOS smartphones. At polling booths, voters will be able to scan QR codes to mark their attendance.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: JNU was a safe space for dissent: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee
text: Speaking on the violence at the Jawaharlal Nehru University on Sunday, Nobel laureate and JNU alumnus Abhijit Banerjee said the university was a safe space for dissent. "It is important for all of us to lay claim to that safe place. It is important to have a place where we can disagree and still hold discussions," he added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: ABVP claims JNUSU President Aishe was leading masked goons, shares video
text: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) on Monday claimed JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh was leading masked thugs into the university and shared a video reported by a journalist. "Any more doubt left as to who really are the masked goons spreading terror on campus?" ABVP asked. However, JNUSU denied the allegations stating that Aishe and others were trying to clear goons.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 312 tonnes of banned plastic seized in Chennai in 2019, ₹1.05-cr fine collected
text: The Greater Chennai Corporation (GCC) seized around 312 tonnes of banned plastic items and collected ₹1.05 crore as fine. GCC officials conducted searches in 3,88,315 establishments in the city between January 1, 2019 and December 31, 2019. The government of Tamil Nadu, in December 2018, announced a ban on single-use plastic items across the state from January 1, 2019.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Jadavpur University students protesting JNU violence lathi-charged
text: Police reportedly lathi-charged Jadavpur University students after a student-led rally and BJP supporters' rally came face-to-face in Kolkata on Monday. The incident took place near the University campus. Jadavpur University students were protesting against the violence that took place in JNU campus on Sunday night. At least four students were reportedly injured in the lathi-charge.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: JNUSU denies ABVP's claim of Aishe Ghosh 'guiding' masked goons
text: The ABVP on Monday claimed that Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) President Aishe Ghosh led masked "Red Goons" inside JNU campus on Sunday. The ABVP retweeted a video which purportedly showed Ghosh following masked men. The JNUSU said that Ghosh and others went after the masked goons "trying to clear them out, clearly alarmed at the situation".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Did not see 'tukde-tukde' gang when I studied in JNU: S Jaishankar
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said that when he studied in Jawaharlal Nehru University, he did not see any "tukde-tukde" gang there. His statement comes after nearly 35 students and teachers were injured by masked men wielding sticks and rods in JNU. Jaishankar condemned the violence in JNU, saying it was against the tradition and culture of the university.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 25 crore people likely to take part in nationwide strike on Jan 8
text: Ten Central Trade Unions on Monday said that around 25 crore people will participate in a nationwide strike on Wednesday, January 8. The strike will be followed by "many more actions seeking reversal of...anti-worker, anti-people, anti-national policies of the Government", a joint statement by the unions said. "[Labour Ministry] failed to assure on any...demands of workers," it added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Room air conditioners to now come with default temperature setting of 24°C
text: The Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) on Monday said that all room air conditioners will now come with a default temperature of 24 degrees Celsius. The central government in consultation with BEE had notified new energy performance standards for room air conditioners on October 30, 2019. The new rule was made effective from January 1, 2020, a government statement said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: John, Aditya Roy Kapur to feature in 'Ek Villain' sequel: Report
text: A sequel to Mohit Suri-directed film 'Ek Villain', featuring Shraddha Kapoor, Riteish Deshmukh and Sidharth Malhotra, is reportedly in the works. It will be titled 'Ek Villain 2' and produced by Bhushan Kumar and Ekta Kapoor with Mohit as director, a report said. Aditya Roy Kapur and John Abraham have signed the film after hearing final narration, the report added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Elton, lyricist partner Bernie win their first Golden Globe together
text: Singer Elton John and songwriter Bernie Taupin, who have collaborated for over five decades, won their first Golden Globe Award together on Monday. Their song 'I'm Gonna Love Me Again' from 'Rocketman', a biographical film on Elton, won 'Best Original Song' at the 77th Golden Globe Awards. The song, performed by Elton and singer Taron Egerton, has lyrics by Bernie.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Content coming before star power is biggest change in B'wood today: Bhushan
text: Producer Bhushan Kumar has said that audience has grown "intelligent" and "calculative", adding, "They don't...wanna see a movie because big stars are attached to it." "They are...choosing only...films that truly entertain them," he added. "[Filmmakers] have become...conscious of...content they are putting out...Content over star power is the biggest...change in the industry today," Bhushan said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: I'm bisexual, faced biphobia but I'm confident with who I am: Vishaal
text: Indian-American actor-writer Vishaal Reddy, who appears in mini-series 'Insomnia', said that "society has built up this idea that we must be straight or gay". "[W]hen people don't fit into this box, they begin to question the mere existence of the entity," he added. "I'm a bisexual...and have experienced...biphobia through the years but I'm confident with who I am," Vishaal said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Shraddha called out for wearing outfit allegedly copied from Miley's
text: Shraddha Kapoor was called out on social media as her outfit resembled the black leather two-piece Miley Cyrus wore at 2014 MTV Video Music Awards' red carpet. While Shraddha wore a black latex set by Deme, Miley's two-piece was by Alexandre Vauthier. Diet Sabya posted an Instagram story comparing their looks with a poll that read "Déjà vu" or "Copy".
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: 4-day Test proposal to be discussed in ICC meeting: Kumble
text: Former India captain Anil Kumble, who heads the cricket committee of ICC, said the four-day Test proposal will be discussed in the next round of the ICC meetings, to be held in Dubai from March 27-31. "Since I am part of the committee, I can't tell what I am thinking about it (proposal) at the moment," Kumble added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Aus a different side than the one India faced last year: Paine
text: After leading Australia to clean sweeps over Pakistan and New Zealand, captain Tim Paine spoke about the series against India next year, saying, "We're certainly a different side than what they played against last year." "[Y]ou're potentially talking about the top two teams in the world so it's going to be an awesome series," Paine added about the series.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: AI can help improve ease of living, doing business: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has said that the adoption of AI can help India improve ease of doing business and ease of living as well. He further added, "Use of AI in different forms can help achieve the target of making India a $5 trillion economy in the coming years." Notably, over 1,000 startups are working in the AI space. nn
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: US has signed treaties not to harm cultural heritage: UNESCO
text: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) has said that the US has signed treaties committing it to not harm cultural heritage in the event of an armed conflict. US President Donald Trump had stood by his threat to target Iran's "cultural sites" in case of Iranian retaliation to US' assassination of its top General in Iraq last week.
author: Shailesh

headlines: UK's Prince Charles to visit Israel & Palestinian territories
text: United Kingdom's Prince Charles will visit Israel and occupied Palestinian territories later this month, said his office, adding that this is the "first time" the Prince will undertake engagements there. During the visit, he'll be attending the World Holocaust Forum on January 23 to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz concentration camp during the Second World War.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Tata Sons can't keep funding losses at UK's Port Talbot plant: Chairman
text: Tata Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran said that the firm cannot be in a place where India keeps funding its loss-making Port Talbot steelworks in UK. "I need to get to a situation where the plant is self-sustaining," he said. Chandrasekaran refused to commit to continuing to make UK steel after the plant's losses grew to £371 million in 2019.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Couldn't sleep at night thinking about JNU violence: Anil Kapoor
text: Bollywood actor Anil Kapoor on Monday said that Sunday night's violence on campus of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) "has to be condemned." Terming the incident as "shocking" and "disturbing" he said, "I could not sleep the whole night thinking about it." He added, "Violence is not going to get us anything and those who have done it should be punished."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: A woman's character, Muslim's patriotism always questioned in India: Chinmayi
text: Singer Chinmayi Sripaada on Monday posted a message on Twitter that read, "A woman's character, a Dalit's merit and a Muslim's patriotism are always questioned in this country." "Can't get more specific than this," a user responded to her tweet, while another asked, "Then why you’re living in this country?" Previously, Chinmayi accused National Award-winning lyricist Vairamuthu of molesting her.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Dissent is necessary, listen to youth: Irom Sharmila on CAA row
text: Activist Irom Sharmila joined a protest rally against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Bengaluru on Sunday and said that protests are necessary in a democratic country. She said that the youth's voice and the opinion of the students are more reasonable and should be heard. She criticised the Centre, saying that the current government is "blind in governance and dictatorial-type".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Not a single Tata Nano produced in 2019, only 1 unit sold throughout the year
text: Tata Motors didn't produce a single unit of Nano car in 2019 although it sold just one unit in February, according to several regulatory filings by the company. However, Tata Motors produced 82 units and sold 88 units in December 2018. Tata Motors has so far been maintaining that no decision has been made yet on the future of Nano.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: CBI books 48 firms for transferring ₹1,038 cr black money to Hong Kong
text: CBI has booked 48 firms for allegedly transferring ₹1,038 crore of black money to Hong Kong during 2014-15, said officials on Monday. Money was transferred with help from unidentified officials of three government banks- BOI, SBI and PNB. CBI had learned that 51 current accounts of the firms were opened in these banks solely for purposes of making the transfers.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Goons of RSS, ABVP attacked JNU, we want removal of VC: Aishe Ghosh
text: Talking about Sunday's violence inside the university campus, Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union President Aishe Ghosh said they condemn it and want immediate removal of Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar. She added, "Yesterday's attack was an organised attack by goons of RSS and ABVP. Since past 4-5 days, violence was being promoted in the campus by RSS-affiliated professors and ABVP."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: US couple given 48 hours to change wedding venue due to Prez Kovind's visit
text: US resident Ashley Hall took to Twitter to reveal she planned her destination wedding in a Kochi hotel since last eight months but due to President Ram Nath Kovind's trip, she was given a 48-hour notice to change the venue. She then approached President on Twitter after which his security was scaled down to avoid any inconvenience to wedding party.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Chennai woman dies as clothes catch fire after spark from power box on road
text: A 38-year-old woman died after her polyester nightie caught fire when she was walking past an electricity junction box in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Saturday night. An eyewitness said one of the onlookers brought a blanket and covered her burning body after the woman called out for help. She suffered almost 80% burns to her body.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Delhi Police denies allegations of late action during violence in JNU
text: Delhi Police on Monday denied allegations of not responding quickly enough to stop attacks on students and teachers in JNU campus. "We responded as soon as a PCR call was received. We sanitized the area after...university staff called us," said Delhi Police spokesperson MS Randhawa. He added that police was requested to intervene by JNU administration around 7.45 pm.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: $5 trillion economy just a phase, targets bigger and higher: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that the target to nearly double the size of the economy to $5 trillion is just a phase and the targets are bigger and higher. Speaking at the centenary celebrations of Kirloskar Brothers, he also said that action against a few corrupt entities shouldn't be seen as the government crackdown on the corporate sector.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Crazy Trump, don't think that everything is over: Qassem Soleimani’s daughter
text: In her address broadcast on Iranian state television, daughter of General Qassem Soleimani said, "Crazy Trump, don’t think that everything is over with my father's martyrdom." She added, "The families of US soldiers in the Middle East will spend their days waiting for the death of their children." Soleimani was killed by a US air strike on Friday last week.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Australia bushfires turn New Zealand skies bright orange 2,000 km away
text: Smoke from Australian bushfires blanketed parts of neighbouring New Zealand on Sunday, turning the skies over Auckland bright orange. The city is more than 2,000 kilometres from southeastern Australia, parts of which have been devastated by bushfires that have raged for months. The NZ police urged the public "not to call 111 emergency number to report the orange haze".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Why did Iran choose Swiss Embassy to register protest over Soleimani killing?
text: Iranian government registered its protest with Swiss Embassy in Tehran over the killing of General Qassem Soleimani. Switzerland is the 'Protecting Power' of US' interests in Iran as US itself doesn't have an embassy there. It allows the two countries to maintain a diplomatic channel of communication and also provides consular services to Americans living in or travelling to Iran.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Just because I'm a hero, doesn't mean I'll roam around bare-chested: Vivian
text: Actor Vivian Dsena, while talking about working in web shows, said that he won't do any "bold" or "intimate" scenes. "Just because I'm the hero doesn't mean I'll roam around bare-chested," he added. Vivian further said it's a personal choice he made at the beginning of his career while adding that the makers have also respected his decision till now.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Anderson goes past Ashwin, Botham to set five-for record
text: England fast bowler James Anderson surpassed former England cricketer Ian Botham and Team India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin to record his 28th Test five-wicket haul in Test cricket. The 37-year-old registered figures of 5/40 on Day 3 of the second Test against South Africa on Sunday. Anderson is seventh on the list of the most five-wicket hauls in Test cricket.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: S Korea starts Internet service with 100 Mbps transmission speed for citizens
text: South Korea has become the eighth country in the world to offer universal high-speed Internet to the whole country, the government said on Sunday. However, the transmission speed of 100 Mbps is the fastest by far, it added. The decision aims to focus on Internet dead spot issues and end the "data divide" among people in South Korea.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: AI-enabled sun visor for cars to block sun glare unveiled by Bosch
text: Bosch unveiled its AI-enabled "Virtual Visor" aimed at preventing drivers from sun glare at the CES 2020. The sun visor is made of LCD panel which uses a tracking system to sense where the sun glare is hitting the driver's face and darkens the section using 'liquid crystal technology'. Bosch's spokesperson said that the company plans to commercialise the visor. nn
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: New lithium-sulfur battery can keep smartphones charged for 5 days
text: Researchers from Australia's Monash University claim to have created a lithium-sulfur battery that can keep smartphones charged for five days. Researchers created the battery by modifying sulphur particles which usually break when they expand and contract. They have filed a patent on the manufacturing process and Germany's Fraunhofer Institute has already made prototype cells to use in cars.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Clusters of gold atoms found to form pyramidal shape
text: Researchers at KU Leuven have discovered that freestanding clusters of 20 gold atoms take a pyramidal shape. This is in contrast with most elements, which organise themselves by forming shells around one central atom. The cluster has a triangular ground plane made up of 10 atoms, with additional triangles of six and three atoms, topped by a single atom.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Scientists observe supermassive black holes caught in a galaxy merger
text: Astronomers used the Atacama Large Millimeter/submillimeter Array (ALMA) to create the most detailed image yet of the gas surrounding two supermassive black holes in a merging galaxy. The merger of the galaxies, 400 million light-years away from Earth, in the constellation of Ophiuchus, is likely to result in the creation of a single larger black hole.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Projected in wrong manner: H'yana Minister on defaulters' kids remark
text: Haryana Power Minister Ranjit Chautala responded to criticism over his purported statement suggesting that kids of those who don't pay power bills won't be able to take government competitive exams. He said that his comments were projected in the "wrong manner". "I said that in order to encourage the people to pay their electricity bills on time," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: China's People's Liberation Army begins military exercises in Tibet
text: China's People's Liberation Army has begun "major" military exercises in Tibet, state-run Global Times (GT) said. It claimed China's "latest weapons" Type 15 tank and 155-millimetre vehicle-mounted howitzer were also deployed in the exercises. Reportedly, the PLA has deployed helicopters, armoured vehicles, heavy artillery and anti-aircraft missiles across Tibet as part of the military exercises.
author: Shailesh

headlines: US military adventurism increases tensions in Middle East: China
text: Speaking on US' assassination of top Iranian General in Iraq, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Geng Shuang said, "The US military adventurism...aggravates tensions...in the region (Middle East)." He added, "China consistently opposes the use of force in international relations." Shuang further said, "We urge the US not to abuse force and call on relevant parties to exercise restraint."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Pak arrests main accused in Gurdwara Nankana Sahib incident
text: Pakistan Police on Sunday arrested the main accused, identified as Imran, in the recent incident of vandalism of Gurdwara Nankana Sahib near Lahore. The accused has been charged under Section 7 of the country's Anti-Terrorism Act, an official said. A violent mob had reportedly attacked the Gurdwara and pelted it with stones on Friday.
author: Shailesh

headlines: PM meets industrialists including Ambani, Tata, Mahindra ahead of Budget
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday met some of the top industrialists including Mukesh Ambani, Ratan Tata, Anand Mahindra and Gautam Adani to talk about ways to improve the Indian economy. The meeting, which comes a month ahead of the Budget, discussed issues like employment. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to present the Union Budget on February 1, 2020.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Synergy Group submits fresh bids for Jet Airways as Jan 15 deadline nears
text: Synergy Group's legal adviser Antonio Guizzetti has confirmed that the firm has submitted fresh bids for Jet Airways. However, Guizzetti did not specify whether Synergy has teamed up with another company for the bid. It was also reported earlier that the Hinduja Group and a Dubai-based fund are planning to submit their Expression of Interest (EoI) for the carrier.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Do I look pregnant? Deepika to journalist who asked about pregnancy rumours
text: Actress Deepika Padukone, during the promotions of her upcoming film 'Chhapaak', was asked by a journalist about rumours suggesting she is pregnant. "Do I look pregnant? I will ask you when I will plan (a family). If you give me permission then I will plan," she said. "If I become pregnant then you'll see that in nine months," Deepika added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Brad jokes about girlfriend rumours at award show; Jennifer's reaction goes viral
text: Actor Brad Pitt, during his acceptance speech at Golden Globe Awards, joked about his relationship rumours. "I wanted to bring my mom, but I couldn't because any woman I stand next to, they say I'm dating. It would just be awkward," Brad joked. His ex-wife, actress Jennifer Aniston was seen smiling at the joke, clips of which later went viral.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Brad Pitt calls ex-wife Jennifer Aniston 'good friend' at award ceremony
text: Actor Brad Pitt referred to his ex-wife, actress Jennifer Aniston, as a "good friend" at Golden Globe Awards. When asked if he's worried about running into her, Brad said, "I'll run into Jen, she's a good friend." "The second most important reunion of her year?" he added, referring to Jennifer's first Instagram post, showing her with her former 'Friends' co-stars.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: You talk about me but don't drag my family: Rohit Sharma tells media
text: Referring to stories about senior players extending their families' stay beyond the designated number of days at the 2019 World Cup, Team India opener Rohit Sharma said, "Our families are there to support us, make us feel happy." He added, "You talk about me but don’t drag my family as they genuinely don’t care about anything else."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Current took us, water was black; I almost died: Osaka on paddle boarding accident
text: Two-time Grand Slam champion, 22-year-old Naomi Osaka has revealed she had a near-death experience in off-season while paddle boarding while visiting Turks and Caicos Islands. She added that she got caught in the current and it took her farther from land. "The water was black and the house was like a tiny dot...Then I fell in the water," she said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rohit Sharma plays Nataraj shot the best: Kapil Dev
text: On being asked who plays his signature version of the pull shot, Nataraj shot, the best among current cricketers, ex-India captain Kapil Dev said, "They can all play it better than I did." He added that opener Rohit Sharma plays it the best. "Current lot of cricketers are very smart...talented and they know how to do things," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I am in a great space, don't think about X, Y, Z's comments about me: Rohit
text: India opener Rohit Sharma, who's currently on a break, has said that he is a "different Rohit" in terms of how he thinks. "I'm in such a great space in my life...My wife and daughter fill me with love and I try to stay within that rather than thinking about X, Y or Z making comments about me," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Well-planned attack by BJP: Akhilesh Yadav on JNU violence
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday accused BJP of "unleashing a well planned and articulated attack on the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU)". He further said, "The police kept waiting for permission to enter the...campus...Those who were sitting inside the institution knew how much time the attackers will take to flee." He added, "BJP wants to destroy...democracy and institutions in [India]."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Will PM Modi visit JNU?: Umar Khalid after violence on campus
text: Activist Umar Khalid on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi goes to America and says everything is fine but will he visit JNU and see for himself the state of affairs. This comes after masked goons assaulted students inside the campus. Khalid added that the motive behind the attack was to stop the students from protesting against the fee hike.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Drunk goons beat me, broke things in my room: Visually-challenged JNU student
text: Surya Prakash, a visually-challenged JNU student, has alleged he was beaten up by masked people during Sunday's violence in the campus. "Foul liquor smell was coming from their mouth. The attackers were heavily drunk," he said. "My body's completely bruised and I've injuries all over my body. They were carrying iron rods and broke everything in my room," Surya added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 20-year-old stalker kills 19-year-old girl in Kerala; commits suicide
text: A 19-year-old girl was killed by her 20-year-old stalker, who then committed suicide, in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram. The stalker reportedly barged into the girl's house, attacked her and then slit her throat. The girl's grandparents rushed to her room after hearing her scream and saw both of them dead. The girl's mother said that the two were in a relationship earlier.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: JNU Vice-Chancellor complicit in attack on students: Sitaram Yechury
text: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury on Monday said that the attack on the students of  Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Sunday was "clearly a pre-planned attack from outsiders". Yechury added that for nearly five hours, the Vice-Chancellor did not respond and did not ask the police to come and restore normalcy which also makes him complicit in the attack.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Want to pursue PhD in Economics from IIM, not MBA: CAT 2019 topper Debarshi
text: West Bengal's 22-year-old Debarshi Chanda, one of the 10 CAT 2019 toppers who scored 100 percentile, has said he wants to pursue PhD in Economics, not MBA, from IIM. He said India needs proper economic reforms to overcome severe slowdown. He completed BTech in Electrical Engineering in 2018 and is currently pursuing Masters from School of Energy Studies, Jadavpur University.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Fascist surgical strike: Mamata Banerjee on attack on JNU students
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has said that the attack on the students of the JNU on Sunday was a "fascist surgical strike". "It is very disturbing, it is a dangerous attack on democracy," said Banerjee. She added that anyone who speaks against the central government is labelled as a "Pakistani" and an enemy of the country.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Pakistan Minister slaps journalist over show linking him to TikTok star
text: Pakistan Minister for Science and Technology Fawad Chaudhry slapped journalist Mubasher Lucman during a wedding ceremony in Lahore. A large number of journalists and members of the ruling PTI were present at the wedding ceremony of Punjab Irrigation Minister Mohsin Leghari's son. In one of his shows, Lucman had invited another journalist who linked Chaudhry to a TikTok star.
author: Shailesh

headlines: True North to buy 2.44% stake in Biocon Biologics for ₹536.25 crore
text: Biopharmaceuticals firm Biocon Biologics on Monday announced that private equity fund True North will acquire a 2.44% stake in the company for ₹536.25 crore. The infusion is at a valuation of around ₹21,450 crore or about $3 billion. It is the first stake dilution by Kiran Mazumdar Shaw-led parent Biocon after hiving off the biopharmaceutical firm in March 2019.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: After 'Malang', Aditya and Disha will become big stars: Anil Kapoor
