text: Actor Anil Kapoor, who stars in upcoming film 'Malang' along with Aditya Roy Kapur, Kunal Kemmu and Disha Patani, has said that he believes Disha and Aditya "will become big stars" after its release. "Every frame I've seen, inn dono ko dekhke mazaa aaya (I really enjoyed watching these two)," Anil said. "I feel like falling in love...again," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: He's a professional: Rami Malek on working with Craig in James Bond
text: Rami Malek, while talking about working with Daniel Craig in James Bond film 'No Time To Die', said, "He's...consummate professional." He added there were times when Craig would leave him speechless with his performance. "Watching Bond do it first hand and there's something that it took a second to step back and go, ''What's my first line again?'," said Rami.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: We must oppose ideology that seeks to oppress: Alia on JNU violence
text: Condemning the attack on Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University students and professors on Sunday, Alia Bhatt said, "When students, teachers and...civilians become victims of...assault...it's time to stop pretending that all is fine." "We...must find a human solution to...our complex problems," she added. "Any ideology that seeks to...oppress and promote violence is one we must...oppose," Alia said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Never experienced such fear before: 15-year-old writes to UP CM over CAA
text: The 15-year-old son of an activist who was arrested by UP police amid violence during anti-CAA protests, has written a letter to CM Yogi Adityanath. "Congratulations on every undemocratic thing you've done and still managed to call yourself democratic," wrote Sufi. Talking about police action on protesters, he wrote, "I've never ever experienced such fear in the hearts of people."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Taylor goes past Fleming to become NZ's leading Test run-getter
text: New Zealand batsman Ross Taylor got past former captain Stephen Fleming to become the all-time leading run-getter for New Zealand in Test cricket. Taylor achieved the feat on the fourth day of the third and final Test against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG) on Monday. Taylor now has 7,174 runs in 99 Tests for New Zealand averaging 46.28.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Balotelli once again target of racist chants by Lazio fans
text: Brescia's Italian footballer Mario Balotelli was once again the target of racist chants by Lazio fans in Brescia's 2-1 home defeat on Sunday. The Serie A match was halted for a few minutes after the half-hour mark and an announcement made to fans. Lazio coach Simone Inzaghi was seen gesticulating to the visiting fans to stop the chants.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Rivigo raises ₹25 crore from Trifecta Capital
text: Gurugram-based logistics startup Rivigo has raised ₹25 crore in Series F funding from Trifecta Capital along with existing investors. With the latest investment, the startup has raised a total of ₹141.97 crore in Series F from investors including SAIF Partners and Spring Canter Investment. This comes after Rivigo crossed $1 billion valuation in 2019 from the $950 million in 2018.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin invests in VC firm Antler
text: Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin and his wife Elaine Saverin have invested in Singapore-based startup generator and venture capital firm Antler which has raised a total of $50 million. Other investors including philanthropist Christen Sveaas and Canica International also participated in the round. The startup claims to have invested in over 120 firms in fintech, spacetech and robotics space.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Study describes 1st ever spaceflight treatment of medical condition
text: A new study has described the previously unrecognised risk of developing venous thrombosis during spaceflight. The study details how an obstructive jugular-vein thrombosis developed in an astronaut two months into a six-month space mission. The thrombosis was managed with enoxaparin, followed by apixaban, which was discontinued four days before Earth landing.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Trump threatens Iraq with sanctions if US troops asked to leave
text: After Iraqi Parliament passed a resolution calling for foreign troops to leave the country, US President Donald Trump threatened Iraq with sanctions. "We will charge them sanctions like they've never seen before, ever. It'll make Iranian sanctions look somewhat tame," he added. Trump also said that Iraq will have to pay the US for a "very extraordinarily expensive" airbase there.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 3 Americans killed in Kenya attack by al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab
text: One US military service member and two Department of Defense (DoD) contractors were killed in the attack on a military base used by Kenyan and US forces. It also said that two  DoD members were also injured and were being evacuated. Reportedly, a Kenyan police report said that militants destroyed two planes, two US helicopters and multiple US military vehicles.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Delhi Assembly elections to be held on Feb 8, counting on Feb 11
text: The Election Commission of India on Monday announced that Delhi Assembly elections will be held on February 8. The elections will be held in a single phase for 70 seats. The counting of votes will take place on February 11. Aam Aadmi Party had won 67 of 70 seats in 2015, with the remaining three going to the BJP.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Iran offers ₹576 crore bounty for Donald Trump's head after General's killing
text: Iran has offered $80 million (over ₹576 crore) for US President Donald Trump's head over the killing of General Qassem Soleimani in a US air strike. The bounty was announced during televised funeral of Soleimani, in which Iranian official state broadcasters said that $1 would be tabled by each Iranian. Meanwhile, Trump threatened to attack Iran in a "disproportionate manner".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I was once threatened 'kaat denge tujhe' over phone for a tweet: Bhuvan Bam
text: YouTube personality Bhuvan Bam on Monday tweeted that he was once threatened over the phone and told 'kaat denge tujhe (will cut you into pieces)' for a tweet. He said he kept mum as he belongs to the middle-class and has no security. "I might be abused again today, but I love my country," he further tweeted against JNU violence.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Arjun Rampal shares pics of Australian bushfires taken from space
text: Actor Arjun Rampal on Monday took to Instagram to express his concern over the bushfires in Australia. He wrote, "Infrared pictures taken from space, as Australia burns...How many more devastating disasters will it take for governments and citizens to make that change?" "Let's make 2020 that turning point to do our bit and give back to Mother Earth," Rampal added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Congress, AAP responsible for anti-CAA riots in Delhi: Amit Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and the Congress were misleading minorities of the country over the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and they were responsible for the riots in the national capital. "Nobody's citizenship will be revoked under the Citizenship (Amendment) Act...it's an act to give citizenship," Shah said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Oppn protesting CAA walks out of TN Assembly during Guv's speech
text: The DMK, the Congress and the IUML MLAs walked out of the Tamil Nadu Assembly on Monday in protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). The Assembly session had begun with an address by Governor Banwarilal Purohit, which was interrupted by DMK President and Leader of Opposition MK Stalin. Stalin called for a resolution to be passed against the CAA.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Guwahati crowd sings 'Vande Mataram' during rain delay, BCCI shares video
text: The BCCI has shared a video of the crowd at Guwahati's Barsapara Cricket Stadium singing 'Vande Mataram' in synchronisation during rain delay ahead of the first India-Sri Lanka T20I. "Guwahati, you beauty," the BCCI captioned the video. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "Goosebumps moment." "2020? All I can see is the 2011 World Cup final," wrote another.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Broadcasters make Bairstow look like he was checking out women using binoculars
text: The official broadcasters of the ongoing South Africa-England Test made England wicketkeeper Jonny Bairstow look like he was checking out women using binoculars. Whenever Bairstow put the binocular to his eyes, the camera panned to women in the crowd, who waved after seeing themselves on the big screen in the ground. "SA camera crew are world’s finest," a user tweeted.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Warne auctions 'baggy green' cap he had for 28 years for bushfire victims
text: Ex-Australia spinner Shane Warne has put up his 'baggy green' cap which he had for 28 years for auction to raise money for bushfire victims. "Horrific bushfires in Australia have left us all in disbelief. The impact [fires] are having on so many people is unthinkable," he wrote on social media. Current bid for the cap has reached ₹1.5 crore.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Instagram deactivates account of model who raised ₹2.5cr for fire relief via nudes
text: Instagram has deactivated the account of 20-year-old American model Kaylen Ward, who claims she raised ₹2.5 crore ($500,000 AUD) for Australia bushfire relief by offering to send a nude photo of herself to anyone who donated at least $10. In a screenshot posted by Ward, Instagram said she posted "sexually suggestive content". She's calling herself 'The Naked Philanthropist' on Twitter.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: JNU incident proof we're descending into anarchy: P Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Monday said that JNU violence was "perhaps the most clinching evidence that we are rapidly descending into anarchy." He said, "We demand that the perpetrators of violence (in JNU) be identified and arrested within 24 hours and brought to justice." Chidambaram added, "We also demand that accountability on officers be fixed and action taken immediately."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Blatant display of intolerance: Kerala CM Pinarayi on JNU violence
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has condemned the attack on the students and professors of Jawaharlal Nehru University which took place on Sunday. "The attack against students is a blatant display of intolerance. Those who have attacked the teachers and students inside the JNU campus in Nazi-style are out to create a dangerous environment and riots in the country," Vijayan said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Campuses shouldn't be made political battlefields: Smriti on JNU violence
text: Talking about violence in JNU campus on Sunday night, Union Minister Smriti Irani said on Monday, "Educational institutions should not be made 'rajniti ka akhada' (political battlefields)." She also said she hoped students will not be used as "political tools". She added, "Probe has started...[it's] not justified for me to comment on it as I am in a constitutional post."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: We have practically lost Kashmir: P Chidambaram
text: Ex-Home Minister P Chidambaram, while commenting on BJP-led government's Kashmir policy, said India has practically lost Kashmir. He added that "no democratic country can keep an entire population under siege". "BJP looks at entire 7.5 million people in Kashmir as militants, as anti-nationals, as pro-Pakistanis," he added. He further said that BJP has committed "constitutional desecration" in J&K.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Investors lose ₹3 lakh crore in a day as Sensex falls 788 points
text: Investors lost nearly ₹3 lakh crore on Monday as Sensex fell 788 points to close at 40,676.63 amid rising tensions between the US and Iran. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies slumped to around ₹154 lakh crore, down from Friday's close of around ₹157 lakh crore. Just two stocks among the Sensex 30 closed in the green.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'm in midlife crisis, it has started reflecting in my work: Anurag
text: Director Anurag Kashyap has said his midlife crisis "has kicked in big time", adding, "It has started reflecting in my work...stories and...choice of things...I'm trying to do." "I think I'm getting more condense and complex...the ideas are complex, but I'm able to simplify them," he added. Talking about digital platforms, he said, "I would never want it to be censored."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Female actors might soon do ₹200 cr film without an Akshay: Vidya
text: Talking about her film 'Mission Mangal', Vidya Balan said that Akshay Kumar's star status headlined the film and it helped them immensely. "Today we might still need that and...in...few years...that might change. Tomorrow we might do ₹200 crore...₹500 crore without an Akshay Kumar," she added. Vidya further said more female-centric films are being made today and they're doing better business.n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: If there's a man who says I'm depressed, he's called mad: Vikrant
text: Vikrant Massey, while speaking about how one can tackle mental issues, said that talking is the solution to combat such strong emotions. He added that in his experience, talking about such things in our society is still a taboo. "If...a man...says...I'm depressed and I have issues, the people consider it as a mental issue. He is called mad," said Vikrant.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Media said I called Big B's Badla credit undue, when did I say that? Taapsee
text: Actress Taapsee Pannu has said, "[News portals] are indifferent to [celebrities] in terms of quoting us." "I've realised no matter [what] you say, it will be interpreted by people according to their convenience," she added. "For instance...headlines of a lot of portals read that I said (Amitabh) Bachchan sir's credit [in 'Badla'] was undue...[W]hen did I say that?" Taapsee asked.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Legend, you made us proud: Ranveer on Kapil Dev's birthday
text: Ranveer Singh on Monday took to Instagram to wish former India cricket captain Kapil Dev on his 61st birthday and wrote, "Happy Birthday, legend!" "Thank you for showing us the way. You made us proud. Now it's our turn," he added. Ranveer will portray Kapil in his upcoming film '83, which is based on India's first cricket World Cup victory.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: McGregor looks like a blew-out balloon: Khabib's manager
text: Irish former UFC champion Conor McGregor's last opponent, Khabib Nurmagomedov's manager termed McGregor a 'liar' and commented on the Irishman's physique ahead of his return, saying, "He looks like a blew-out balloon". McGregor has challenged Khabib to a rematch this year after the pair had previously fought at UFC 229, where Khabib won by submission in the fourth round.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Smart wearable detects dog's mood, tells owner how it's feeling
text: Inupathy, a smart wearable showcased at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2020, can detect a dog's mood and display the same to the owner through coloured lights. The device monitors the dog's heart rate and deduces how it is feeling. An LED display then either shows green denoting relaxation, red for excited, purple for stressed or rainbow for overall happiness.
author: Dharna

headlines: Kids excluded from Assam NRC won't be sent to detention centres: Govt to SC
text: Attorney General KK Venugopal on Monday told the Supreme Court that children who have been excluded from NRC in Assam, but whose parents have been granted citizenship, shall not be sent to detention centres. The SC was hearing an application that complained there were 60 children in detention centres. "I can't conceive children being sent to detention centres," Venugopal said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: NCLAT rejects RoC plea, refuses to alter judgment in Tata-Mistry case
text: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has dismissed a plea filed by the Registrar of Companies (RoC) seeking the modification of its December 18 judgment. The judgment directed the reinstatement of Cyrus Mistry as Tata Sons Executive Chairman and ruled that the conversion of Tata Sons from a public to private company "with the help of RoC" was "illegal".
author: Dharna

headlines: Properties worth ₹20,000 cr identified for monetisation: BSNL CMD
text: BSNL has submitted papers mentioning details of 14 properties worth ₹20,160 crore for its asset monetisation plans, its Chairman PK Purwar said. The properties are located in cities including Mumbai and Ghaziabad and the Ministry of Skill Development has shown interest in a property worth ₹2,000 crore. BSNL further plans to monetise assets worth thousands of crores in three years.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Gold prices surge to record high of ₹41,096 per 10 grams
text: Gold prices in India surged by over 2% to a record high on Monday, with local gold futures rising to ₹41,096 per 10 grams. The surge was driven by investors rushing to safe-haven assets globally amid tensions in the Middle East. This reportedly takes gains registered by local gold futures to over 5% in 2020, after rallying 25% in 2019.
author: Dharna

headlines: Sensex falls 700 points as tensions between US and Iran rise
text: The benchmark BSE Sensex fell 700 points to 40,750 as crude oil prices hit a near nine-month high due to increased tensions between the US and Iran. India imports nearly 80% of its crude oil consumption. The rising tensions could threaten global oil supplies and push prices higher, leading to a jump in India's import bill.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: You're an attention seeker: Vaani to man who commented 'manly' on her pic
text: Actress Vaani Kapoor has responded to a man on Instagram who commented "manly" on her picture. "I hope you're aware you're nothing but an attention seeker...don't go all hopeless on yourself, you...can get necessary help," she replied. Responding to another comment which read, "Suffering from malnutrition", Vaani wrote, "Why don't you find something productive to do?...Stop reflecting hate."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 65-yr-old producer asked me to lift my top: Actress on facing casting couch
text: Actress Malhaar Rathod has revealed she faced casting couch as an aspiring teenage actress during a meeting with a 65-year-old Indian film producer. "He...asked me to lift my top. I got so scared, I didn't know what to do at first," she said. Malhaar has appeared in the shows 'Hostages' and 'Tere Liye Bro'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: India, where cows seem to get more protection than students: Twinkle on JNU violence
text: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna on Monday shared a newspaper article on Sunday's JNU violence. "India, where cows seem to receive more protection than students, is also a country that now refuses to be cowed down," she wrote. "You can't oppress people with violence-there will be more protests, more strikes, more people on the street. This headline says it all," Twinkle added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Attack on JNU students reminded me of 26/11 terror attacks: Maharashtra CM
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday condemned JNU violence and said the mob attack reminded him of "26/11 terror attacks". "Students are feeling unsafe...I don't want to politicise the matter. But the faces behind the mask needs to be revealed," Thackeray added. He further said students in Maharashtra are safe and he won't tolerate any move to hurt them.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 23 cellphones, 16 chargers, 11 SIM cards found during raid in Bihar jails
text: Officials recovered 23 cellphones along with chargers and other banned items during a raid in all Bihar jails on Sunday. "As many as 23 cellphones along with 16 mobile chargers and 11 SIM cards besides tobacco products were recovered," Prison IG Mithilesh Mishra said. Departmental actions would be intimated against concerned jail staffs on their failure, Mishra added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Violent messages posted on WhatsApp groups before JNU violence: Report
text: Violent messages urging people to "thrash the anti-nationals" in JNU allegedly surfaced on some WhatsApp groups hours before the violence on Sunday, an Indian Express report said. "Abhi nahi marenge...toh kab marenge," a JNU student, claiming to be a part of ABVP, wrote in one of the groups. "Maza aa gaya. In...deshdrohiyo ko maarke," student from a Haryana college wrote.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Students protest in parts of country against violence in JNU
text: Students in several parts of the country have come out to protest against the violence at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Sunday. Students from different colleges in Mumbai assembled near the Gateway of India to condemn the violence. While students in Hyderabad held an impromptu demonstration, students of Pune's FTII and Kolkata's Jadavpur University also protested against the violence.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: I appeal all students to maintain peace: JNU VC Jagadesh Kumar
text: JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar on Monday appealed students of the university to maintain peace and stated that the top priority is to protect the academic interests of students. This comes a day after masked miscreants entered the campus and attacked students and teachers. "The University stands by all the students to facilitate their pursuit of academic activities," Kumar said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: If you're Indian, you can't tolerate armed goons: Mahindra on JNU violence
text: Mahindra Group's Executive Chairman Anand Mahindra on Sunday night tweeted on JNU violence. "It doesn't matter what your politics are. It doesn't matter what your ideology is. It doesn't matter what your faith is. If you're an Indian, you cannot tolerate armed, lawless goons," his tweet read. Several masked and armed goons attacked JNU students, teachers and hostel on Sunday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: IPS officer allegedly molests 13-yr-old daughter of fellow officer at party
text: A Superintendent of Police in Assam has been booked under Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act for allegedly molesting the 13-year-old daughter of a fellow police officer during a party on December 31. A senior police officer said a case was registered against the IPS officer in Guwahati on January 3 based on a complaint by victim's mother.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Ola driver misbehaves with woman passenger, Ola asks her to call police
text: An Ola cab driver in Bengaluru misbehaved with a 34-year-old woman passenger and threatened to kill her if she raised an alarm. However, when she pressed the emergency button on the Ola app she received a message asking her to dial 100. "Ola didn't make any efforts to reach out to the police or do anything...to help me," she said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Iran Supreme Leader cries at funeral of General killed in US air strike
text: A video showing Iran Supreme Leader Sayyid Ali Khamenei crying at General Qassem Soleimani's funeral ceremony has surfaced online. Khamenei has vowed "severe revenge" over Soleimani's killing. The head of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps' Quds Force was killed in a US air strike at Baghdad International Airport last week.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Won't abide by restrictions imposed under nuclear deal: Iran after Trump's warning
text: Iran has declared it will no longer abide by any of the restrictions imposed under the 2015 nuclear deal. This comes after US President Donald Trump said that the country will "hit Iran harder than it has ever been hit before" if the Middle Eastern country retaliates. Tensions have been high over killing of an Iranian General by the US.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Trump is 'terrorist in a suit', he will learn no one can defeat Iran: Iran Minister
text: Responding to Donald Trump's tweet about targeting 52 Iranian sites, Iranian Information and Communications Technology Minister MJ Azari Jahromi called the US President "terrorist in a suit". "Trump...will learn history very soon that nobody can defeat the great Iranian nation & culture," Jahromi tweeted. Trump had threatened to target sites that are "important to Iran & the Iranian culture".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: There is no honour in this: Riteish Deshmukh on JNU violence
text: Actors including Riteish Deshmukh, Dia Mirza and Sonam Kapoor condemned the assault of several students and professors by a masked mob at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus. "Why [did] you...cover your face? Because you know you're doing something...punishable. There is no honour in this," Riteish said. "How long will...defenceless be attacked in...name of politics or religion?" tweeted Dia.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Tom Hanks receives lifetime achievement award at Golden Globes 2020
text: Actor Tom Hanks was honoured with a lifetime achievement award for his "outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment" at the Golden Globes 2020. Hanks, who has worked in more than 80 films and series, was presented with the Cecil B. DeMille award. He was also nominated in the Best Actor in a Supporting Role in a Motion Picture category.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I hope the focus is not just on me in '83: Kapil Dev
text: Former India cricket captain Kapil Dev has said he's hoping that the focus isn't just on him in Ranveer Singh-starrer '83, which is based on India's first cricket World Cup victory. "Everybody should get their performance to look at," he added. Kapil further said he's worried about how the film will come out, adding, "But I...hope everything will be okay."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Deepika celebrates 34th b'day with acid attack survivors in Lucknow
text: Deepika Padukone on Sunday celebrated her 34th birthday at a cafe run by acid attack survivors in Lucknow. She cut a cake and clicked some pictures with the women. Deepika, who'll portray acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal in 'Chhapaak', was joined by Ranveer Singh and Laxmi. The director of the film, Meghna Gulzar, and co-star Vikrant Massey also joined her.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Australia deploys medical assistance team for the first time
text: In order to lend support to the bushfire evacuation and relief efforts, the Australian government for the first time in its history has deployed its medical assistance team, normally sent to other nations following disasters. Notably, according to the official figures, the bushfires in Australia have now destroyed an area the size of Ireland.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Robot that fetches toilet paper for person using bathroom debuts at CES
text: At CES 2020, American toilet paper brand Charmin unveiled a robot named 'RollBot', which can retrieve and deliver a fresh toilet paper roll to a person who has run out of it while using the bathroom. The bear-faced robot is controlled via a smartphone's Bluetooth. Another product by Charmin warns users whether a bathroom has unpleasant smells before they enter.
author: Dharna

headlines: Smart sex toy startup banned from CES last year returns to the event
text: Lora DiCarlo, an American startup that creates smart sex toys, is participating in the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2020, after being banned from the annual technology conference last year. Notably, the two products it is showcasing have won CES innovation awards. They include Onda, a "robotic g-spot massager," and Baci, a "robotic clitoral stimulator", designed to produce "blended orgasms".
author: Dharna

headlines: Ola to standardise commissions to attract more drivers: Report
text: Ola is standardising the commissions it charges its drivers while moving away from an incentive-driven model, the Economic Times reported. The move would help drivers clearly ascertain their earnings and differentiate it from variable incentives, and also help bring more driver-partners on the platform. For the last two months, Ola has reportedly been standardising commissions from drivers at 25%.
author: Dharna

headlines: Today my daughter, tomorrow maybe me: Injured JNUSU Prez's father
text: Father of JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh, who was attacked by a masked mob on campus on Sunday, called the situation across the country "volatile", adding that even he is at risk of getting beaten up. "There were five stitches on her head. We're worried," he added. "I won't ask my daughter to back out of the protests," Ghosh's mother said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Unable to give security: JNU hostel wardens resign after violence
text: Two wardens of the Jawaharlal Nehru University's Sabarmati Hostel submitted their resignations on Monday, on moral grounds, citing that they tried but couldn't provide security to the students. Violence broke out at JNU on Sunday night, as masked miscreants armed with sticks and rods attacked students and teachers on the campus. At least 28 were reportedly injured in the violence.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Only jobs with reasonable income can tackle inequality in India: Murthy
text: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy on Sunday said that the only way to tackle the issue of inequality in India is to create jobs that give a reasonable income. He added that people from agriculture should be moved to low-tech services and manufacturing, to boost their per capita income and ultimately increase their contribution to the GDP from the current 14%.
author: Dharna

headlines: My family has been a guardian of Tata Group for decades: Cyrus Mistry
text: While declaring his unwillingness to regain Tata Sons executive chairmanship as directed by NCLAT, Cyrus Mistry said his family-run Shapoorji Pallonji Group has been a guardian of Tata Group for over five decades. Mistry added that as a minority shareholder, it was in their interest to ensure Tata Group's long-term success, even as Tata leadership neglected interests of minority shareholders.
author: Dharna

headlines: Police file FIR in JNU violence case; 23 hospitalised students discharged
text: The Delhi Police on Monday registered an FIR in connection with the violence at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). Moreover, 23 students who were admitted to a hospital after sustaining injuries during the violence have also been discharged. Masked miscreants, allegedly from ABVP, entered the JNU campus on Sunday and attacked students and teachers.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Great Learning launches M.Tech degree in Data Science and ML
text: Great Learning launches M.Tech degree in Data Science and Machine Learning in collaboration with PES University, ranked #1 under the New Universities category by KSURF. The full-time 2-year classroom program at the PES campus in Bangalore features world-class faculty and placement assistance with 150+ hiring partners like Uber, Swiggy, IBM, KPMG etc, and offers a degree from PES University.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Succession wins Best Drama show at Golden Globes, Fleabag wins Best Comedy show
text: HBO's 'Succession' won the Golden Globe for Best TV Series - Drama, beating shows including 'The Crown' and 'The Morning Show'. Best TV Series - Musical or Comedy went to 'Fleabag', whose lead actress Phoebe Waller-Bridge also won Best Actress in a Musical or Comedy Series. Olivia Colman won Best Actress in a Drama Series for 'The Crown'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Joaquin Phoenix wins Best Actor at Golden Globes, Renée Zellweger wins Best Actress
text: Joaquin Phoenix won Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture - Drama for 'Joker' at Golden Globe Awards. Best Performance by an Actress in a Motion Picture- Drama went to Renée Zellweger for the Judy Garland biopic 'Judy'. Taron Egerton and Awkwafina won Best Actor and Best Actress respectively in the Best Motion Picture- Musical or Comedy category.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: War film '1917' wins Best Picture at Golden Globe Awards 2020
text: Sam Mendes-directed war film '1917', starring George MacKay and Dean-Charles Chapman among others was named the Best Motion Picture-Drama at 77th Golden Globe Awards held on Monday. The award for Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy went to Quentin Tarantino's directorial 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood'. Sam Mendes also won Best Director award for '1917'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Which Bollywood celebs attended govt's meeting on CAA held on Sunday?
text: Government's meeting with members of the film industry on Sunday, to discuss CAA was attended by actors Ranvir Shorey and Urvashi Rautela. Censor Board chief Prasoon Joshi, filmmakers Rahul Rawail and Kunal Kohli, producer Ritesh Sidhwani and singer Kailash Kher were also among the attendees. The meeting was organised at a Mumbai five-star hotel and was an invitation-only affair.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Comedian jokes about DiCaprio dating younger women; actor laughs at joke
text: Comedian Ricky Gervais, host of the 77th Golden Globe Awards, joked about Leonardo DiCaprio dating much younger women, during his monologue at the award ceremony. "Leonardo DiCaprio attended the premiere of three-hour-long 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' and by the end, his date was too old for him," said Ricky. DiCaprio, sitting among the audience, was seen laughing.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: World's oldest person, Japan's Kane Tanaka, turns 117
text: Japan's Kane Tanaka, the world's oldest person, recently celebrated her 117th birthday at a nursing home. She was officially confirmed as the oldest person living at 116 years 66 days old as of March 9, 2019, by Guinness World Records. Kane was born prematurely on January 2, 1903, the same year Wright brothers became the first to achieve powered flight.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Hair dryer, steam iron used to dry pitch for T20I in Guwahati; fans troll BCCI
text: The first India-Sri Lanka T20I at Guwahati's Barsapara Cricket Stadium was called off due to wet outfield and partially wet pitch. Groundsmen were seen using hair dryer and steam iron to dry the pitch. Trolling BCCI, a fan tweeted, "BCCI is the richest board...but why can't they afford covers that are used in England." Another wrote, "Creative yet poor measures."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: CES awards cannabis startup, bans it from saying 'cannabis' at exhibit
text: Keep Labs, named an Innovation Award Honoree by the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) for its discreet cannabis storage device, is banned from using the word "cannabis" while exhibiting at CES 2020. Deciding not to attend CES, the co-founders said it shouldn't be lumped in with "home storage solutions". This is the first time a marijuana-centred company was awarded at CES.
author: Dharna

headlines: Burnt body of retired Navy officer found in Thane flat, wife goes missing
text: The burnt body of a retired Navy officer was found in his flat in Badlapur township of Maharashtra's Thane on Sunday, the police said. The deceased, who has been identified as Guddu Singh, had come to Badlapur with his wife three days ago to sell off his flat. The police added that his wife was missing.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 26 injured as masked miscreants cause violence in JNU campus for 3 hours
text: Nearly 26 people, including 22 students, were injured after masked miscreants with sticks and rods caused violence inside Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) for close to three hours on Sunday evening. "A large crowd with covered faces abused us in Hindi. When I started retorting, they hit me with a metal rod on my head," a student said.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: JNUSU holds VC responsible for violence, demands resignation
text: After the violence in JNU on Sunday, JNU Students Union (JNUSU) has demanded the resignation of Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar. "This VC is a cowardly VC who introduces illegal policies through the backdoor, runs away from the questions...and then manufactures a situation to demonize JNU," JNUSU said in a statement. "He's using henchmen to perpetrate violence on students," JNUSU added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Three missiles fall in Baghdad, two near US Embassy as tensions rise
text: Three missiles fell in Baghdad on Sunday, including two near the US Embassy, the Iraqi military said. This comes amid rising tensions over killing of a top Iranian commander in a US air strike at Baghdad International Airport last week. Besides the two rockets that fell in the Green Zone, another fell in the nearby Jadriya area, the military added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Plane loses wheel after take-off from Canada airport, passenger captures video
text: An Air Canada Express flight lost a wheel shortly after take-off from Montreal-Trudeau International Airport, forcing the plane to turn back. The flight was heading to Bagotville when the incident occurred. One of the 49 passengers on board captured video of the wheel detaching from the plane's left main landing gear and shared it on social media.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Iran's missile forces at heightened state of alert after Trump's warning: Report
text: The US has detected a heightened state of alert by Iran's missile forces across the country, according to a Reuters report quoting a US official. This comes after US President Donald Trump's warning to "hit 52 Iranian sites very hard". "Don't know if that heightened state of alert is to be better prepared defensively or offensively," the official reportedly said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Finland's 34-year-old PM proposes 4-day working week and 6-hour working day
text: Finland's 34-year-old PM, Sanna Marin, has called for the introduction of a flexible working schedule in the country that would involve a four-day-week and six-hour working day. "I believe people deserve to spend more time with their families, loved ones...and other aspects of life, such as culture. This could be the next step for us in working life," she said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Why did Trump threaten to specifically attack 52 Iranian sites?
text: US President Donald Trump on Sunday tweeted, "Let this serve as a warning that if Iran strikes any Americans, or American assets, we have targeted 52 Iranian sites." The reason behind Trump threatening to specifically hit 52 Iranian sites was that Iran had held 52 Americans hostage 40 years ago. The Americans were held hostage for 444 days.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Credit goes to Mukherjee, Chidambaram, Jaitley for strong action on Sahara: Sinha
text: Former SEBI Chief UK Sinha credited former finance ministers - Pranab Mukherjee, P Chidambaram and late Arun Jaitley - for SEBI's strong action against Sahara Group. He said they stood their ground and didn't interfere in the matter despite repeated attempts by vested interests. Sinha also praised former PM Manmohan Singh for advice on how to balance SEBI's multiple roles.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex falls 500 points amid tensions in Middle East, Nifty below 12,100
text: Indian equity benchmark Sensex fell nearly 500 points on early Monday to 40,963, amid rising tensions in the Middle East after a US airstrike killed a top Iranian commander. The broader Nifty 50 index slipped past 12,100 mark, falling over 1.2% to 12,077. State Bank of India, Hero Moto Corp, NTPC and Maruti Suzuki India were among the top losers.
author: Dharna

headlines: South Korea's 'Parasite' wins Best Foreign Language Picture at Golden Globes
text: Bong Joon Ho-directed South Korean film 'Parasite' has won 'Best Foreign Language Picture' award at the 77th Annual Golden Globe Awards. Other films that were nominated in the category included France's 'Les Misérables' and 'Portrait of a Lady on Fire', USA's 'The Farewell' and Spain's 'Pain and Glory'. Bong was nominated in 'Best Director' and 'Best Screenplay' categories for 'Parasite'.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Priyanka Chopra attends Golden Globes 2020 with Nick Jonas
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra and her husband Nick Jonas attended the 2020 Golden Globe Awards ceremony in Beverly Hills, Los Angeles. Priyanka opted for a floor-length pink off-the-shoulder gown and accessorised her look with a necklace and earrings. Meanwhile, Nick wore a double-breasted suit and paired it with a Prada bolo tie.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Apple runs sweatshops in China: Actor at Golden Globes in CEO Tim Cook's presence
text: Actor-comedian Ricky Gervais, while hosting the 2020 Golden Globe Awards, targetted Apple even as CEO Tim Cook sat in the audience. He said, "Apple rolled into TV game with a superb drama about...importance of dignity and doing the right thing, made by a company that runs sweatshops in China." Gervais was referring to Apple TV+ flagship series 'The Morning Show'.
author: Dharna

headlines: There was this strange inherent comfort: DiCaprio on working with Pitt
text: Leonardo DiCaprio has said working with Brad Pitt in 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' was an incredible experience. He added that they both clicked instantly as there was a "strange inherent comfort and ease" while working with Pitt. "It didn't need a lot of prep work. We talked about...script, and we instinctively knew that dynamic and relationship," said DiCaprio.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Jennifer Aniston, Taylor Swift walk on red carpet of Golden Globes 2020
text: Jennifer Aniston and Taylor Swift were among the celebrities who walked on the red carpet of the 2020 Golden Globe Awards ceremony in Los Angeles. Jennifer, who has been nominated for 'The Morning Show', opted for a Dior Haute Couture gown that featured ruffles. Meanwhile, Taylor wore a sleeveless floral gown, which featured a cut on the midriff.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Scientists to count whales from space
text: In a project named 'Counting Whales From Space', US-based engineering firm Draper and an aquarium will count and monitor whales globally from space through satellites. "If whales are moving out of one area...into another...What's the reason? Is it due to ocean warming?" scientists said. The data will let scientists understand the reasons and help conservation groups protect whales from extinction.
author: Dharna

headlines: Spoke to Jaishankar about Iran's continued provocation: Pompeo
text: United States' Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar spoke on the phone about the situation in the Middle East after US' assassination of a top Iranian General. Pompeo tweeted, "Jaishankar and I spoke just now regarding Iran's continued threats and provocations." He added, "The Trump Administration won't hesitate to act to keep American lives...safe."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Rain, leaking covers force abandonment of 1st India-SL T20I in Guwahati
text: The first India-Sri Lanka T20I was called off without a ball being bowled due to wet patches on the field caused by rain just after the toss on Sunday. The umpires held several inspections but the damp patches on the pitch did not allow the match to start. India had won the toss and elected to field first.n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Modi sarkar must answer why cops are siding with goons: Asaduddin Owaisi
text: Following violence inside Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi tweeted, "In solidarity with the brave students of JNU...This cruel attack is meant to 'punish' JNU students because they dared to stand up." He added, "It's so bad that even Union Ministers are tweeting helplessly. Modi Sarkar must answer why cops are siding with goons."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Masked miscreants armed with sticks roaming around: JNU Registrar
text: Amid violence in Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus, JNU Registrar Pramod Kumar said in a statement, "This is an urgent message for the entire JNU community that there is a law and order situation on campus." "Masked miscreants armed with sticks are roaming around, damaging property and attacking people," he added. Delhi Police entered the campus after JNU administration's request.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: JNU student told me police kicked him several times on head: Priyanka Gandhi
text: After visiting AIIMS to meet injured JNU students and teachers, Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that one of the students told her that the police kicked him several times on his head. "Many had broken limbs and injuries on their heads," she added. As many as 18 students and teachers were admitted to AIIMS after being injured in violence.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Those responsible for JNU violence must be booked immediately: MK Stalin
text: Condemning the violence inside JNU campus, DMK chief MK Stalin tweeted, "Shocked to see visuals of masked miscreants attacking JNU students inside the campus." "All those who are responsible for these incidents must be...booked immediately," he added. Meanwhile, senior Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "What we are seeing on live TV is shocking and horrifying."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: JNU violence highly condemnable; directed police to take action: Delhi LG
text: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) Anil Baijal condemned violence on the campus of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Sunday. "Directed Delhi Police to take all possible steps in coordination with JNU Administration to maintain law and order and take action against the perpetrators of violence," he tweeted. "The situation is being closely monitored," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Shah orders enquiry over JNU violence, asks for report to be submitted immediately
text: Home Minister Amit Shah's office has released a statement following violence inside Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus. Shah instructed Delhi Police Commissioner to take necessary action, the statement said. He has also ordered an enquiry to be carried out by a Joint CP level officer and asked for a report to be submitted as soon as possible, the statement added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra visits those injured in JNU violence at AIIMS
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra arrived at AIIMS trauma centre, where 18 people who were injured during violence in JNU campus on Sunday night, have been admitted. Several students and teachers were injured when masked miscreants attacked them with sticks and rods. Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi had earlier expressed shock at the incident.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: These are tactics from Germany in 1930s not India in 2020: Tharoor on JNU violence
text: Reacting to a group of masked people attacking JNU teachers and students, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "This is unbelievable. These are tactics from Germany in the 1930s, not India in 2020. I implore the authorities to stop this." He added, "They are destroying Indian democracy as well as what remains of our nation's image in the democratic world. #StopJNUAssaultsNow!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Situation inside JNU campus normal, all hostel areas have been secured: DCP
text: Deputy Commissioner of Police South West Devender Arya has said that the situation inside Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus is normal now. "Extensive flag march is being conducted by police. All hostel areas have been secured. Police deployment has been done at strategic points," he added. This comes after masked miscreants attacked students and teachers inside the campus.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Such acts of violence, anarchy won't be tolerated: HRD Ministry on JNU violence
text: Ministry of Human Resource Development has condemned the violence inside the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), saying, "This is very unfortunate and highly condemnable, such acts of violence and anarchy will not be tolerated." Meanwhile, Home Minister Amit Shah has called for enquiry into the incident. A group of masked people entered the campus and attacked students and teachers today.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Large stones that could've broken our skulls were thrown at us: JNU professor
text: Referring to violence inside JNU campus, professor Atul Sood said that the group of masked persons hurled large stones at students and teachers. "These were not small stones, these were big stones that could have broken our skulls," he added. "I fell on the side and when I came out, I saw cars completely vandalized including my car," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: This is against culture of JNU: S Jaishankar on violence on campus
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar "unequivocally" condemned the violence that took place on the campus of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) in Delhi on Sunday. "Have seen pictures of what is happening in JNU," Jaishankar tweeted. "This is completely against the tradition and culture of the university," he added. Students and teachers were attacked by a masked mob inside campus.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Modi government seeking revenge on students: Congress on JNU violence
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala criticised BJP-led central government in the wake of violence on the campus of JNU. "Is this how Modi government seeks revenge against students and youth?" he tweeted. He also shared a video statement saying, "Modi ji and Amit Shah ji, don't harass the students and youth so much that the whole country stands against you."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 25 of our members injured, 11 missing in JNU violence: ABVP
text: The ABVP has alleged that its members, including its JNU unit secretary, were attacked by members of the Left-backed students' outfits and 11 of their members were missing, while 25 were injured. "Masked goons of Left entered JNU today and beat up the students who went for registration. The JNU students affiliated to ABVP were brutally attacked," it added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Desperate attempt by forces of anarchy: BJP on JNU violence
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party on Sunday said that it strongly condemns the violence on JNU campus and called it a "desperate attempt by forces of anarchy who are determined to use students as cannon fodder and create unrest to shore up their shrinking political footprint." "Universities should remain places of learning and education," tweeted BJP's official handle. n
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Doctors who went to JNU attacked, ambulance windows broken: AIIMS doctor
text: A team of doctors, nurses and medical volunteers who reached JNU to give first aid to injured students and teachers was attacked by hundreds of goons, Harjit Singh Bhatti, a doctor at AIIMS, Delhi alleged on Sunday.  "Mob manhandled doctors, nurses and threatened them," he tweeted. He also said that the ambulance's glass and windows were broken and shared pictures.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Those disrupting peaceful academic atmosphere of campus won't be spared: JNU
text: Releasing a statement following violence in the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus, the university said, "Violators of university rules who are trying to disrupt peaceful academic atmosphere of campus will not be spared." "It is unfortunate that violence took place in JNU campus this evening...JNU administration feels great pain and anguish for students who've sustained injuries," it added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Japan to make stricter immigration rules after Ghosn flees country
text: Days after Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn fled from Japan, the country said on Sunday that it will take measures to make immigration rules stricter. Ghosn, who was awaiting trial for financial crimes, fled to Lebanon saying he wouldn't be "held hostage" by a "rigged" justice system. He was arrested in 2018 for financial misconduct and was released on bail.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Horrifying images from JNU: Sitharaman on violence
text: Reacting to the violence in JNU, Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tweeted, "Horrifying images from JNU...the place I know & remember was one for fierce debates & opinions but never violence." She added, "I unequivocally condemn the events of today. This govt, regardless of what has been said the past few weeks, wants universities to be safe spaces for all students."
author: Shailesh

headlines: A shame on our democracy, tweets Mamata on JNU violence
text: Reacting to the violence inside JNU campus, West Bengal CM and Trinamool Congress Party (TMC) chief Mamata Banerjee tweeted, "No words enough to describe such heinous acts. A shame on our democracy." she added, "Trinamool delegation [is] headed to Delhi to show solidarity with...JNU." Banerjee further said, "We strongly condemn brutality unleashed against students/teachers in JNU."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Protests against JNU violence start in Aligarh Muslim University
text: Protests against the violence in Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) started in the Aligarh Muslim University (AMU), reports said. Armed masked miscreants entered the JNU campus and beat up several students there. Some students were also seen protesting against the JNU violence outside the headquarters of Delhi police. Around 18 people from JNU arrived at AIIMS for treatment, an official said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Protest outside Delhi Police headquarters against JNU violence
text: Students are protesting outside the headquarters of Delhi Police against the attack on students of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). A video of the incident shows armed masked miscreants barging into the university campus and beating up students. Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) later tweeted, "ABVP terrorists from DU have entered campus in large numbers with iron rods."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Govt sends goons to attack students: Kanhaiya on JNU violence
text: Reacting to the violence in JNU, ex-President of Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) Kanhaiya Kumar said that the government has sent goons to attack students. He added, ever since this government came to power, they have waged a war against the students in every corner of the country. Masked miscreants entered the campus and attacked students on Sunday.
author: Shailesh

headlines: JNUSU Prez Ghosh got lacerations on forehead: AIIMS official
text: Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) President Aishe Ghosh has got lacerations on the forehead and is undergoing investigations, AIIMS Trauma Centre official said. A video of Ghosh emerged in which she can be seen bleeding from the head. "I have been brutally attacked by goons wearing masks. I was brutally beaten up," she says in the video.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Iraqi MPs pass resolution to end presence of foreign troops in Iraq
text: Iraqi MPs passed a resolution in the Parliament calling for foreign troops to leave the country after the US' strike that killed Iranian General Qassem Soleimani in Iraq. "The government commits to revoke its request for assistance from...international coalition fighting Islamic State on end of military operations," the resolution read. The US reportedly has over 5,000 troops in Iraq.
author: Shailesh

headlines: At least 30 killed in bombing of military academy in Libya
text: At least 30 people were killed and 33 others were injured in an "aerial bombing" attack on a military academy in Tripoli, Libya, officials said. General Khalifa Haftar-led Libyan National Army (LNA) launched an offensive in April to seize Tripoli from the internationally-recognised Government of National Accord (GNA). Death toll to rise further, GNA Health Minister Hamid bin Omar.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Masked goons attack students, teachers at JNU campus; several injured
text: A masked mob on Sunday entered the Sabarmati Hostel in the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus and assaulted several students and professors with sticks and rods. Several students and teachers have been injured in the violence. The students' union claimed that its president Aishe Ghosh and many other students were injured in stone-pelting by ABVP members.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: No grounds to keep Chandrashekhar Azad in jail: Priyanka Gandhi
text: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday criticised central government for "denying medical treatment" to arrested Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad. "Government's policy of oppressing...expressions of dissent and protest has reached the point of cowardice...There are absolutely no grounds to keep Chandrashekhar in jail," she tweeted. Azad was arrested for leading anti-CAA protest at Jama Masjid.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Mark Waugh uses word 'c**k' on air to describe Labuschagne's backswing
text: Cricketer-turned-commentator Mark Waugh used the word 'c**k' to describe Australia batsman Marnus Labuschagne's backswing while discussing his batting with fellow commentators on air. Kerry O'Keeffe commented on how Labuschagne lifts the toe of his bat up high during his backswing after which Waugh lifted his hands up mimicking his action and said "Just like a c**k."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I never lost my swing, blaming Greg Chappell a cover-up: Irfan Pathan
text: Talking about people blaming former India coach Greg Chappell for losing his swing, former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said, "All these discussions...people talking about Chappell...they are just covering up." He added, "People need to understand that you are not going to get the same kind of swing that you get in first 10 overs...I was still getting the swing."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: How will WhatsApp advertisements set to be released this year work?
text: WhatsApp is introducing advertisements through Status this year, a revelation that was made by the company at Facebook Marketing Summit in the Netherlands in 2019. The company had said that in the ads, users will be able to see the name of the advertiser along with their associated advert. However, users won't able to see the advertiser's contact profile picture.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Delhi Police providing cover to goons inside JNU campus: Yogendra Yadav
text: Swaraj India national President Yogendra Yadav said on Twitter that roads leading to Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) have been blocked by Delhi Police. He further claimed that "Complete cover [is] being provided to goons inside the campus." Yadav's tweet came amid violence on JNU campus following an alleged clash between JNU Students' Union (JNUSU) and Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP).
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: JNU violence reflection of fascists fearing students' voices: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday reacted to the JNU violence and tweeted, "The fascists in control of our nation, are afraid of the voices of our brave students. Today’s violence in JNU is a reflection of that fear." He added, "The brutal attack on JNU students & teachers by masked thugs, that has left many seriously injured, is shocking."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: How will country progress if students are not safe: Kejriwal on JNU violence
text: After masked men barged into Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) and beat up students and teachers, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "I am so shocked to know abt the violence at JNU. Students attacked brutally."  He added, "Police shud immediately stop violence and restore peace. How will the country progress if our students will not be safe inside univ campus."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Secularism a western concept, not needed in India: RSS leader
text: RSS leader J Nandakumar has said India should reconsider the inclusion of the word 'secular' in Preamble to the Indian Constitution as it's a "western" concept. "Secularism is a western, Semitic concept. It came into existence in the West," he said in an IANS interview. He added that India doesn't need secular ethos as we have moved "way beyond secularism".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: India releases statement after killing of Sikh youth in Pakistan's Peshawar
text: After a 25-year-old Sikh man was shot dead in Pakistan's Peshawar, India released a statement condemning the killing. India calls upon Pakistan to stop prevaricating and take immediate action to apprehend and give exemplary punishment to perpetrators, the statement read. Pakistan should act in defence of their minorities instead of preaching sermons about it to other countries, it added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Suspected ISIS terrorists enter UP, alert along Nepal border: Police
text: Two terrorists, suspected to be part of ISIS, have entered UP, following which high alert has been sounded along Indo-Nepal border, a top police official confirmed on Sunday. Alert has been sounded in Maharajaganj, Kushinagar and Siddharthnagar districts of UP. IG (Basti range) Ashutosh Kumar said, "Two wanted terrorists Abdul Samad and Iliyas can try to enter Nepal from UP."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Yogendra Yadav manhandled outside JNU campus amid violent clashes
text: Swaraj India president Yogendra Yadav was manhandled outside the campus of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) in Delhi. A video of the political leader being pushed around and dragged was shared by ANI. Yadav reached the campus after violence was reported there following an alleged clash between JNUSU and ABVP members during a JNU Teachers' Association meeting.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Masked goons attacked me brutally: JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh in video
text: A video of Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) President Aishe Ghosh, wherein her forehead can be seen bleeding, has surfaced online. In the video, Aishe can be heard saying, "I have been brutally attacked by goons wearing masks. I have been bleeding." JNUSU later tweeted, "ABVP terrorists from DU have entered campus in large numbers with iron rods."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Swara breaks down over JNU violence, says her parents live on campus
text: After masked men attacked students and teachers at JNU campus, actress Swara Bhasker urged Delhiites to gather in large numbers at JNU campus to "pressurise the government and Delhi Police to stop the rampage". Sharing a video on Twitter, Swara broke down and said her parents live in the campus. She also claimed masked mob is attacking teachers' houses.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 18 from JNU arrive at AIIMS with complaints of bleeding in head and abrasions
text: As many as 18 people from Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) have gone to AIIMS Trauma Centre with complaints of bleeding in the head and abrasions among others, an AIIMS official has said. This comes after masked miscreants entered the campus and attacked teachers and students. JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh is among the injured in the violence.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Video showing masked male and female goons attacking JNU hostel surfaces
text: A video has surfaced on the internet showing masked male and female goons attacking one of the JNU hostels in Delhi on Sunday. "Female students have locked themselves up inside the girls' wing in Sabarmati Hostel. These attackers are roaming the corridors armed with rods and sticks," the JNUSU twitter handle said. Masked goons attacked students and teachers at JNU.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 37-year-old Layla Moran comes out as UK's first 'pansexual' MP
text: Britain's 37-year-old Liberal Democrat politician Layla Michelle Moran has become the UK's first Member of Parliament to come out as 'pansexual'. "About six months ago I started a relationship with a woman, and that was quite surprising because before that I'd only ever had boyfriends," Layla said. Someone who is pansexual is attracted to people of any gender.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 2 men who accused Michael Jackson of sexual abuse allowed to sue his companies
text: James Safechuck and Wade Robson, who accused Michael Jackson of sexual abuse, can sue two of the late singer's companies, a US court ruled. A lower court had dismissed their lawsuits as California's statute of limitations required childhood sexual abuse claims to be filed before accuser's 26th birthday. However, a new law extended it up until victim's 40th birthday.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Airbnb claims its AI tech can detect customers' personality traits
text: Airbnb claims to have developed a "trait analyser" software that will scan the internet, including customers' social media profiles, to calculate risks of a guest trashing a host's home. The programme uses artificial intelligence to mark people "associated" with drugs and alcohol, hate websites or sex work. The company uses predictive analysis to evaluate and flag probable suspicious activities.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Kohler unveils smart shower with Alexa-powered speaker
text: Kohler unveiled a showerhead with a smart speaker powered by Amazon's artificial intelligence assistant Alexa that will cost between $99 (over ₹7,100) and $229 (₹16,450) as part of CES 2020. The speaker, attached to showerhead magnetically, charges with a bundled, cordless dock, and claims playback time of 6-7 hours. Kohler Moxie Showerhead will be available to order later this year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bug similar to 2-decade-old Y2K bug malfunctions NY parking meters
text: A software glitch, similar to 20-year-old Y2K bug which could crash computer systems, caused parking meters in New York to malfunction and reject credit cards and prepaid parking cards. The meters, however, continued to accept coins, and the parking meter app remained unaffected. Transportation authorities informed the people via Twitter that repairs were expected to finish by January 9.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: User loses $16K crypto due to malicious Google Chrome extension
text: A malicious Google Chrome extension called 'Ledger Secure' has caused a user to lose nearly $16,000 in cryptocurrency by pretending to be a cryptocurrency wallet. The extension shared the user's seed phrase, a kind of a recovery password to access funds, by copying it using a WiFi-connected printer. It is unknown how the seed phrase was leaked by the extension.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: InMobi reports 53% increase in losses to ₹54 crore in FY19
text: Bengaluru based unicorn startup InMobi has reported a 53% year-on-year increase in losses at ₹54 crore during the financial year ended March 2019, reports said. The company's expenses stood at ₹440.53 crore compared to ₹351.3 crore expenses reported in FY18. The startup's revenue grew 20% to ₹384.21 crore in FY19, compared to ₹317.81 crore in FY18.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: In a slip of tongue, PM Netanyahu refers to Israel as nuclear power
text: Israel's PM Benjamin Netanyahu, in a slip of the tongue, referred to Israel as a nuclear power while talking about a gas pipeline deal with Cyprus and Greece. "We are turning Israel into a nuclear power," said Netanyahu, before correcting himself to say "energy power". Reportedly, Israel has maintained ambiguity on whether it possesses nuclear weapons or not.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Saudi not consulted over US strike to kill Iranian General: Official
text: Saudi Arabia was not consulted by the US before conducting a strike that killed the head of Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps' Quds Force General Qassem Soleimani, an official said. "In light of the rapid developments, the kingdom stresses the importance of exercising restraint to guard against all acts that may lead to escalation, with severe consequences," the official added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 8 lions killed, mutilated at private game farm in S Africa: Police
text: Poachers killed and cut off the snouts and paws from all the carcasses at a private game farm in South Africa, local media reports said. Police spokesman Sabata Mokgwabone said that the police suspect the lions may have been poisoned as some chicken carcasses were found nearby. "This matter [is] still under investigation," Mokgwabone said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Saudi Aramco's shares fall 1.7%, lowest since IPO
text: Saudi Aramco's shares fell 1.7% on Sunday afternoon to 34.55 riyals, still above the IPO price of 32 riyals. The fall in share comes following the killing of Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani in a US drone strike. The most valued oil firm debuted on Saudi stock exchange on December 11 with its share price trading at a 10% increase.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: ISRO to send 22 dishes including dal, parathas for Gaganyaan mission
text: The Defence Food Research Laboratory will provide 22 dishes and fruit juices, overall weighing 60 kg and 100 litres of water, for the Indian astronauts during their week-long stay in outer space as a part of ISRO's Gaganyaan mission. The food, expected to follow standards set by NASA, has been sent to ISRO for palatability and microbial tests.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: The largest specimen of world's biggest flower found in Indonesia
text: Indonesian conservationists have claimed that they've spotted the biggest specimen ever of what is known as one of the world's largest flowers, the Rafflesia tuan-mudae. The record-setting Rafflesia flower measured 111 centimetres (3.6 foot) in diameter, which is 4 centimetres larger than the one found in the jungles of West Sumatra several years ago.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: US does not have the guts to go to war with Iran: Iran Army Chief
text: The US does not have the guts to go to war with Iran, Iranian Army Chief Major General Abdolrahim Mousavi has said. This comes after US President Donald Trump tweeted, "If Iran strikes any Americans, or American assets, we've targeted 52 Iranian sites...those targets will be hit...hard." Tensions between Iran and the US escalated after killing of an Iranian General.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I won't pursue Tata Sons' Executive Chairmanship: Cyrus Mistry
text: Cyrus Mistry on Sunday said he will not be pursuing the executive chairmanship of Tata Sons, or directorship of TCS, Tata Teleservices or Tata Industries. His statement comes despite National Company Law Appellate Tribunal's (NCLAT's) order in his favour. However, Mistry added that he will pursue all options to protect the rights of minority shareholders.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Felt ashamed instead of feeling sorry on hearing about Kushal's suicide: Actress
text: Actress Aartii Naagpal, who was working with Kushal Punjabi on a web series, has said she felt "ashamed instead of feeling sorry" on hearing about his suicide. "Had he been daring enough to show his wounds, he would have been alive," she added. Aartii further revealed she had also considered committing suicide once due to a "toxic relationship".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Thought of stripping when I was broke, friends said I won't have to be topless: Lopez
text: Actress Jennifer Lopez has revealed she once considered stripping at the start of her career. "My friends, who were also dancers, told me about making thousands of dollars at clubs...They said, 'You won't need to be topless'," she added. "It sounded awfully good when I was broke and eating pizza every day. But I never did it," said Lopez.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Bhumi Pednekar takes part in beach cleaning drive in Mumbai; shares pics
text: Actress Bhumi Pednekar on Saturday shared pictures from a cleanliness drive at Mumbai's Versova beach that she took part in. The drive was part of her environment conservation campaign 'Climate Warrior'. "It's our mess to clean. India generates 25940 tonnes of plastic waste everyday, of [which] 10376 tonnes is uncollected plastic," she wrote while sharing the pictures.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Rumours being spread that CAA no. belongs to some channel called Netflix: Shah
text: After a Twitter user asked people to call 8866288662 to get free Netflix subscription for six months, Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing 'Booth Karyakarta Sammelan', said, "Since yesterday, rumours are being spread...the number belongs to some channel called Netflix." "I'd like to clarify that the number never belonged to Netflix. Rather, it is the BJP’s toll-free number," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Madarsa students held amid CAA violence in Muzaffarnagar granted bail
text: Ten students from a Madarsa in Muzaffarnagar, UP, who were jailed amid violence during anti-CAA protests on December 20, were granted bail on Saturday. The bail was granted on the basis of a Special Investigation Team (SIT) report that found no evidence against them. The SIT found the students weren't involved in any serious offence.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Stoinis fined ₹3.7 lakh for homophobic slur against Kane Richardson in BBL
text: Melbourne Stars all-rounder Marcus Stoinis has been fined AU$7,500 (₹3.7 lakh) for directing a homophobic slur at Melbourne Renegades fast bowler Kane Richardson during their Big Bash League match. "I got caught in the moment and took it too far. I realised immediately I was in the wrong and I apologise to Kane and to the umpires," Stoinis said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Yusuf Pathan pens farewell note for brother Irfan Pathan, Irfan responds
text: All-rounder Yusuf Pathan took to social media to share a farewell note he penned for his brother Irfan Pathan, who retired from cricket on Saturday. "Irfan always held his head high in the ups and downs during his career," part of his note read. Irfan responded to the note, writing, "My brother and my friend without you nothing is possible."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ganguly was special but Dravid utilised me the best as captain: Irfan Pathan
text: Talking about playing under various captains in international cricket, Irfan Pathan, who retired on Saturday, said that Sourav Ganguly was very special but Rahul Dravid utilised him the best as captain. "My batting average improved immensely and my average as a No. 3 batsman was 32. After Dravid, I never got a chance to bat up the order," Irfan said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Schools in New York begin using ₹10-crore facial, gun recognition system
text: Schools that fall under the Lockport City School District, New York, have begun using a ₹10-crore facial and gun recognition system to look for threats. The system can alert staff of guns and individuals who pose a potential threat, including level 2 or 3 sex offenders. Civil rights activists objected to the system, arguing that it compromises student privacy.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Probe finds 2 Delhi Police personnel fired at protestors at Jamia: Report
text: A Delhi Police investigation into the violence during protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act has revealed three bullets were fired by two police personnel at protestors at Jamia in front of an ACP-rank officer, The Indian Express reported. Earlier, Delhi Police had claimed that not a single bullet was fired by them during the protests.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: NPR data collection in Bihar to be done in May 2020: Sushil Modi
text: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Sushil Modi on Saturday said that the state government will collect data for the updation of National Population Register (NPR) between May 15 and May 28. "The Centre is just updating the NPR 2010 in 2020 just before the 2021 census," he said. Modi also criticised CMs of Opposition-led states for refusing to implement NPR.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Passports globally are very poorly designed: Kiran Mazumdar Shaw
text: India's richest self-made woman and Biocon's Chairperson & Managing Director Kiran Mazumdar Shaw tweeted that passports globally are very poorly designed as they don't capture previously issued passports. "Why can't they have a page with previous passports issued?" she asked. "I travel with 4 bundled passports but with technology, we need to do away with this archaic method," she tweeted.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I don't pay much attention to pay parity in Bollywood: Kajol
text: Actress Kajol has said that she doesn't "pay much attention to pay parity" in Bollywood because she believes that the wage gap "has to do with the economics of the industry". However, she added, "[F]ilms on all kinds of subjects...are working. Audience has been changing...things are getting better." "The audience needs to let...women-oriented film earn ₹200-300 crore," Kajol further said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Come together, act on climate: Dia Mirza on Australia's bushfires
text: Actors including Kunal Kemmu, Dia Mirza, Diana Penty, Tiger Shroff and Disha Patani took to Instagram to react to Australia's bushfire. While Dia said, "We can stop this. Come together...Act on climate," Kunal wrote, "We only have this planet and it's been burning." Diana reposted environmental activist Greta Thunberg's Instagram post that read, "My thoughts are with...those affected by...fires."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Golden Globes 2020 to serve only vegan food for first time ever
text: The Golden Globes 2020 award ceremony for the first time ever will serve only plant-based food for the pre-show dinner at The Beverly Hilton Hotel, Hollywood Foreign Press Association said. The decision was taken to raise environmental awareness about food consumption and waste. Guests will be served with chilled golden beet soup and wild mushroom risotto, among other things.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: You played this game with lot of passion: Rohit's tribute to Irfan
text: Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma paid tribute to former Indian pacer Irfan Pathan, writing, "Happy retirement @IrfanPathan you played this game with lot of passion and courage." "No one has hat-trick in the first over of the test match. Best wishes for your next chapter," read the rest of the Rohit's tweet.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Ridiculous idea: Gambhir on 4-day Test match proposal
text: Reacting to proposals of holding 4-day Tests, former Indian cricketer Gautam Gambhir wrote, "At the outset, let me say that I think four-day Test matches are a ridiculous idea and should be dropped immediately." "It will invite drawn games, will have no place for spinners and will take away the charm of playing on a wearing fifth-day pitch," Gambhir added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Austrian ministry faces 'serious' cyberattack, suspects foreign nation
text: Austria is suspecting a foreign country to be behind a "serious" cyberattack carried out on the information systems at its Foreign Ministry. "Given the type and seriousness of the attack we assume this probably concerns a state actor and not criminals," a spokesperson said. Austria said countermeasures were taken against the attack which was reported on Saturday and remains active.
author: Dharna

headlines: Samsung to provide foldable phone panels to Xiaomi, Huawei: Reports
text: Xiaomi and Huawei will use Samsung's foldable smartphone panels, reports say. Previously, Huawei got its foldable panels from China's BOE and LG for its Mate X foldable smartphone while Xiaomi got them from Visionox. Reportedly, Huawei made the decision due to quality and quantity concerns from its current provider. Notably, Samsung has already started developing the panels for the firm.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: AI cannot hold patents, only humans can: European Union Patent Office
text: The European Union's Patent Office has issued a ruling while rejecting two patent applications submitted on behalf of an artificial intelligence called DABUS. The patents were rejected on the grounds that the inventors designated in the applications have to be human beings.
