The first application was for a beverage container while the second was related to a signalling device.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Drunk driver crashes into crowd in Italy, 6 German tourists killed
text: Six German tourists were killed and 11 others were injured when a drunk driver crashed into a crowd of tourists in the town of Luttach in Italy, the police said. The accused failed breath alcohol test and has been arrested on suspicion of vehicular manslaughter, a police spokesman said. Two of the injured were taken to Austria for treatment.
author: Shailesh

headlines: New Zealand to send military to help fight Australian bush fires
text: New Zealand will send some of its military personnel to Australia to help fight the bush fires raging in the country. New Defence Minister Ron Mark said that three NH90 helicopters and crew, two combat engineer sections and a command element will be deployed. Australia has struggled to contain bush fires in its states of Victoria and New South Wales.
author: Shailesh

headlines: GST compensation removal may make states face ₹1.23 tn revenue gap: Report
text: States may incur GST revenue gap of ₹1.23 trillion due to withdrawal of compensation at the end of the five-year transition period, a NIPFP report said. The gap depends on expected tax buoyancy and states can "either generate revenue from exiting sources and/or cut down expenditures". Withdrawal of GST compensation will affect state finances of Punjab and Karnataka, among majors.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Fan makes Kohli's portrait using old mobile phones, wires; BCCI shares video
text: Ahead of India's first T20I against Sri Lanka in Guwahati, a fan presented captain Virat Kohli his portrait made using old mobile phones and wires. Kohli signed the portrait, writing, "Dear Rahul, This is an outstanding creation, Well done." In the video shared by BCCI, the fan said it took him three days and three nights to create the art.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: People start their career at 27-28, mine ended at that age: Irfan Pathan
text: After announcing his retirement from cricket aged 35 on Saturday, Irfan Pathan said, "People start their career at 27-28, mine ended at that age." Irfan, who played his last international match in 2012, added, "People go on to play till 35. When I was 27, I had taken 301 international wickets." He further said, "I wish I would've played more."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Carter 4th batsman to slam 6 sixes in an over in T20s, all 4 are left-handers
text: Canterbury batsman Leo Carter smashed six sixes in an over off Northern Districts' Anton Devcich in a Super Smash match on Sunday. The 25-year-old became the fourth cricketer in T20 history to slam six sixes in an over. All the four batsmen to achieve the feat are left-handers, with the other three being Yuvraj Singh, Ross Whiteley and Hazratullah Zazai.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rich should pay more taxes than they currently do, including me: Bill Gates
text: Bill Gates, Microsoft Co-founder and the world's second-richest person with a net worth of $113 billion as per Bloomberg, has said that the rich should pay more taxes than they do, and that includes his wife Melinda and himself. "The wealth gap is growing," he wrote in his blog. "I've been disproportionately rewarded for the work I've done," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Days were very busy there: Groww Co-founder on leaving Flipkart to build Groww
text: Mutual fund investment platform Groww's Co-founder and CEO Lalit Keshre in an interview to YourStory said he was working with Flipkart as Group Product Manager when he decided to become an entrepreneur. "At Flipkart, days were very busy. You can't do anything outside while you are still there," he said. Keshre, an IIT Bombay alumnus, quit Flipkart in 2016.n
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla's m-cap doubles Ford's, 8 months after Ford's m-cap surpassed Tesla's
text: Elon Musk-led electric carmaker Tesla's market cap is now about $80 billion, more than double that of American carmaker Ford's, at $37 billion. In the beginning of 2018, both the companies had nearly the same market cap, with Ford valued at $52 billion and Tesla at $54 billion. Ford's market cap last surpassed Tesla's in April 2019.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Pakistan Minister invites Elon Musk to build Tesla cars in his country
text: Pakistan's Science and Technology Minister Fawad Chaudhry has invited Tesla CEO Elon Musk to build electric cars in Pakistan. He tweeted, "Dear Musk your next destination may be Pak...We offer ten years zero tax facility...custom free import for factory setup...no other country may offer." Chaudhry was responding to an article about Tesla's plans to build 500,000 vehicles yearly near Berlin.
author: Dharna

headlines: JNU admin says protesting students damaged server room
text: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) administration said that students protesting against hike in hostel fees "ransacked" the server room and "intimidated" technical staff on Saturday. This was allegedly done to obstruct semester registration process that will end on January 5. JNU Students' Union (JNUSU) meanwhile alleged that the administration used "masked" security guards to attack students.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Gujarat CM evades question about 200 child deaths in 2 govt hospitals
text: Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani on Sunday refused to answer questions from journalists regarding the death of almost 200 children in two government hospitals in Rajkot and Ahmedabad. Rupani was speaking to the media on the sidelines of an event in Vadodara. He walked away from reporters when asked about the deaths of children and infants in state-run hospitals.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Blast tore Iran General's body into pieces, was identified by red ring on his hand
text: The body of the head of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps' Quds Force, General Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in a US air strike at Baghdad International Airport, was identified through the prominent red ring on his severed hand. The blast tore Soleimani's body into pieces. The attack took place after Soleimani got off from a plane.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Hundreds of thousands mourn death of Iranian General, shout 'Death to America'
text: Hundreds of thousands gathered in Iran to mourn the death of General Qassem Soleimani and shouted "Death to America" after his body arrived from Iraq. People held up portraits of Soleimani, seen as a hero of the 1980-88 Iran-Iraq war. Soleimani was killed in an air strike ordered by US President Donald Trump at the Baghdad International Airport on Friday.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Man pays ₹13 crore for bluefin tuna fish at Japan auction
text: A Japanese sushi restaurant chain's owner has paid $1.8 million (nearly ₹13 crore) for a bluefin tuna in the year's first auction at Tokyo's Toyosu fish market. The 276 kg tuna was caught off northern Aomori Prefecture. Kiyoshi Kimura had also bought a bluefin tuna for a record $3.1 million last year.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I'm way too privileged to talk about political situations: Saif
text: Actor Saif Ali Khan, when asked if he doesn't speak about political situations because that is "safer", said, "I...feel that I'm...way too privileged to...enter into that conversation with any relevant point of view." "I understand, that I'm not only privileged but my wants...are...irrelevant to people with...issues," he added. Saif also said that he has "never been happier" living in India.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: First pics of Bigg Boss 12 contestant Nehha Pendse as a bride surface online
text: First pictures of 'Bigg Boss 12' contestant Nehha Pendse dressed as a bride in a pastel pink-coloured Nauvari saree have surfaced online. In the pictures, Nehha, who is marrying her boyfriend Shardul Singh Bayas on Sunday in Pune, can be seen sporting a traditional Maharashtrian look with a nose ring. Pictures and videos from their engagement ceremony also surfaced online.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: British singer accused of hitting guard outside US kids' party
text: British singer-songwriter Rod Stewart has been charged with simple battery for allegedly punching a security guard outside a children's party in Florida, US, police said. Rod was refused access to the party when he was trying to enter the event with his son, Sean, and other family members. He's scheduled to appear in court, along with Sean, on February 5.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I ran away from home, was taken care of by other people: Vijay Varma
text: Vijay Varma, known for playing Moeen in 'Gully Boy', has revealed he ran away from his home in Hyderabad to study at Film and Television Institute of India in Pune. "It was difficult to support myself. I was being taken care of by other people," he added. Vijay further said post 'Gully Boy', his personal life has taken a backseat.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Declined Superman film for 'The Suicide Squad': Filmmaker Gunn
text: Filmmaker James Gunn has revealed that he was given a free hand by DC to choose a film he'd like to make, including "some sort of Superman film", but he opted for 'The Suicide Squad'. "It's the story I wanted to tell more than any other," he added. "It's one of my favourite properties in the world," Gunn further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Playing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj comes with responsibility: Sharad
text: Sharad Kelkar, who'll portray Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', has said playing such characters come with a lot of responsibility. He added that one cannot go wrong with any of the factors around him like, "his look, way of walking, lines and attitude". Sharad further said he was shocked when the role was offered to him.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Sonam says 'beware of fake propaganda', user tweets 'share it in B'wood groups'
text: Sonam Kapoor in a series of tweets on Saturday said, "[J]ust a piece of advice. Don't vote for...conservatives...They will be responsible for...[world's] demise," adding, "Beware of fake propaganda. Social media can be poison." A user in reply to one of her tweets wrote, "Copy-paste this message in...Bollywood groups." To which Sonam replied, "I'm sure they are reading this on Twitter."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Man City make a winning start to title defense in the FA Cup
text: Manchester City saw off Port Vale 4-1 in the FA Cup third-round tie at the Etihad Stadium. Oleksandr Zinchenko opened the scoring for City before Sergio Aguero; 17-year-old Taylor Harwood-Bellis and Phil Foden also found their names on the scoresheet. Meanwhile, Manchester United were held to a 0-0 draw against Wolves in the FA Cup.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Australian Open delay valid if it affects player health: Djokovic
text: Serbian tennis player Novak Djokovic has said that a delay in the Australian Open 2020 due to the ongoing bushfires in Australia would be valid if it threatens players' health. "They're obviously tracking the situation every single day as it's evolving and hopefully calming down with the smoke and fire," Djokovic said about the bushfires.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Varane helps Real Madrid register 3-0 win against Getafe
text: French defender Raphael Varane scored a goal and forced another to help Real Madrid register a 3-0 win against Getafe in the La Liga on Saturday. Real Madrid were without captain Sergio Ramos due to suspension for Saturday's match, which saw Varane partner Eder Militao in the centre of defence. Luka Modric scored the third goal of the match.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Apple to let users get AirPods case engraved with emojis including poop
text: Apple now lets users engrave an emoji or text on AirPod cases when purchased from the online store. However, users can only choose from a limited number of emojis ranging from fist bump, all the Zodiac animals to the poop emoji and get a single one on a case. Apple had started offering text engraving on Airpod cases in March.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Faulty sunroofs force recall of 7,44,000 Mercedes-Benz vehicles in US
text: German carmaker Daimler AG said on Saturday that it will recall 7,44,000 Mercedes-Benz vehicles in US sold between 2001-2011 as the sunroof panel could come off and be hazardous to users. The models recalled will include C-Class and CLK-Class lines and the roof will be replaced if required. The owners are entitled to receive reimbursement for repairs from Daimler.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Targeting cultural sites is a war crime: Iran to US Prez Trump
text: After US President Donald Trump threatened to target cultural sites in Iran, Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif said targeting of such sites is a war crime. Trump had said that if Iran retaliated to US' killing of top Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani it would target 52 sites in the country. Targeting of cultural sites "breaches international red lines", Zarif added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab attacks base used by US forces in Kenya
text: The al-Qaeda-linked group al-Shabaab attacked Manda Bay Airfield, Kenya used by US and Kenyan military, Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) said. "Four terrorists' bodies have so far been found...Arising from the unsuccessful breach a fire broke out affecting some of the fuel tanks located at the airstrip," KDF added. Al-Shabaab said, "Seven aircraft and three...vehicles were destroyed in the attack."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Govt unlikely to announce capital infusion for banks in Budget: Report
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is unlikely to announce a capital infusion for public sector banks in the upcoming Union Budget, expected to be presented on February 1, reports said. Banks will instead be encouraged to speed-up recovery of bad loans and raise capital from the market. Last year, the government announced a capital infusion of ₹70,000 crore in state-run banks.
author: Dharna

headlines: Missiles hit area near US Embassy and air base housing US troops in Iraq
text: A missile fell inside heavily guarded Green Zone near the US Embassy in Iraq's Baghdad and another hit the nearby Jadriya neighbourhood on Saturday. Two more missiles were fired at the Balad air base, which houses US troops, but no one was killed, the Iraqi military said. There was no immediate claim of responsibility.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Fan waits overnight with b'day cake at airport, Deepika cuts it on arriving
text: A video shared by photographer Manav Manglani shows Deepika Padukone cutting a cake brought by another photographer at Mumbai airport on her 34th birthday on Sunday. "Ma'am he is a huge fan of yours. He has been waiting for you all night," other photographers can be heard saying. Deepika was reportedly heading to Lucknow with husband Ranveer Singh.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Kushal wasn't serious about family, I was looking after his expenses: Wife
text: Speaking about actor Kushal Punjabi's suicide, his wife Audrey Dolhen said, "We had problems in our marriage but it wasn't a failed marriage." "It was Kushal who wasn't serious about his family...In fact, it was me who was looking after his expenses," she added. "I don't know why I'm being blamed...It was Kushal who failed in our relationship," said Audrey.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Actress defends tweet apologising to Iran, says 'I don't support Iran over US'
text: Hollywood actress Rose McGowan in an interview defended her tweet in which she apologised to the people of Iran after their General was killed in a US airstrike. "I don't support Iran over America. I want America to be better," she said. McGowan further said her tweet was "unusual", adding, "I woke up, I stupidly looked at Twitter...and...was like, 'what?'."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Makeup artist Daniel Bauer gets married to his boyfriend in Goa; shares pics
text: Celebrity makeup artist Daniel Bauer got married to his boyfriend Tyrone Braganza in a traditional Hindu wedding ceremony in Goa on Saturday. He took to Instagram Story to share pictures and a video of the baraat, mehndi and haldi ceremonies. The couple, who first met in Mumbai, earlier got married in a Christian wedding ceremony in Frankfurt, Germany.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Swara trolled for saying she's scared as she has no birth certificate; responds
text: Swara Bhasker was trolled over a viral video in which she said she's scared as she has no birth certificate or property documents to prove she's Indian. "Baseless attacks are the only thing they know...We'll continue to resist [CAA and NRC]," she tweeted. "I hope #Bollywood will...not allow itself to become a pawn in bigoted propaganda for...unethical...laws," Swara added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Had crush on girl named Kiran in school; SRK made film on it, jokes Salman
text: Salman Khan, during an episode of Bigg Boss 13, said he had a crush on a girl named Kiran during school. Referring to Shah Rukh Khan's 1993 film 'Darr', which featured the character 'Kiran', Salman joked, "That's where it all began." "I told about my crush to Shah Rukh Khan and he made a film about it," he jokingly added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: What is the guarantee Pak won't send spies under CAA: Delhi CM Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that there is no guarantee that Pakistan would not send spies as Hindus under the amended Citizenship Act. Replying to Kejriwal's statement former Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Kumar Vishwas tweeted, "Fir saboot chahiye? Yu na sudhrey (Need proof again… won’t mend his ways)."
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: 'Iranian hackers' breach US govt agency website in retaliation for airstrike
text: A website run by a US government agency was breached and defaced by hackers claiming to be Iranian. The hack appeared to be a retaliation for the airstrike conducted by the US which killed Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani. A message on the website read "in the name of God" and depicted US President Donald Trump being punched by Revolutionary Guard.
author: Dharna

headlines: Chat app ToTok accused of spying for UAE reinstated on Google Play Store
text: Calling and chatting app ToTok, accused by the US of spying for UAE government, has been reinstated on the Google Play Store after being removed over "a policy issue". ToTok's developers had termed the allegations as "manufactured lies". Earlier, the app's Co-founder Giacomo Ziani told the Khaleej Times that it was caught up in "some vile conspiracy against the UAE".
author: Dharna

headlines: 'Do Hazar Bees, Hatao Nitish', tweets Lalu Prasad Yadav
text: RJD chief Lalu Prasad, who is in Ranchi jail in connection with fodder scam cases, on Saturday tweeted, "Do Hazar Bees, Hatao Nitish". Replying to the tweet BJP's National Media Co-Head Sanjay Mayukh tweeted, "Do Hazar Bees, fir se Nitish." Earlier, Lalu Yadav had criticised the state government over Bihar's last rank in Niti Aayog's SDG Index report.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: IAF flew 625 tonnes of new notes after demonetisation: Ex-IAF Chief
text: Former Air Chief Marshal BS Dhanoa has said that the Indian Air Force (IAF) transported 625 tonnes of new currency notes to various parts of the country after demonetisation in 2016. "If one crore comes in a bag of 20 kg, I do not know how many crores we moved," he further said while speaking at an IIT Bombay event.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: If Abhinandan had flown Rafale, outcome would've been different: Ex-IAF Chief
text: Former Air Chief Marshal BS Dhanoa has said that if Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman had been flying a Rafale during the India-Pakistan stand-off after the Balakot strike, the outcome would have been different. "Why was he not flying a Rafale? Because you took 10 years to decide which aircraft to buy. So, it (the delay) affects you," he added.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Maharashtra govt announces portfolios, Aaditya gets Environment, Tourism
text: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has approved the allocation of portfolios as proposed by Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray. Ministry of Finance & Ministry of Planning has been allocated to Deputy CM Ajit Pawar and Aaditya Thackeray has been given the portfolio of Environment, Tourism and Protocol. CM Uddhav Thackeray will hold the charge of Ministry of General Administration.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Man tries to smuggle 460 bottles of liquor in ambulance; arrested
text: A man tried to smuggle 460 bottles of liquor in an ambulance, which the police said is among private vehicles used by Safdarjung Hospital in Delhi to transport patients. The bottles were being smuggled via the Kundli-Manesar-Palwal expressway. Police added that the man was arrested after being chased as he tried to escape on foot when the ambulance was stopped.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: NPR in Bihar will be carried out from May 15: Deputy CM Sushil Modi
text: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Sushil Kumar Modi on Saturday said that the National Population Register (NPR) will be carried out between May 15 and May 28 in the state. BJP ally JD-U has said that there was no problem in going ahead with the exercise as PM Modi had clarified that there is no proposal to implement NRC across India.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: 9-year-old boy kidnapped, stoned to death in Gurugram
text: A 9-year-old boy was kidnapped and stoned to death in Haryana's Gurugram. The boy's body was found at a vacant plot close to a liquor shop in Manesar on Saturday. CCTV footage showed an unknown person walking away with the child when he was playing outside his house. Efforts are on to nab the accused, police said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Will use brand new military equipment without hesitation if Iran attacks: Trump
text: Following his warning to strike 52 Iranian sites, US President Donald Trump said that the country will use "brand new beautiful military equipment without hesitation" if Iran attacks. "The US just spent two trillion dollars on military equipment," Trump tweeted. "We will hit Iran harder than they have ever been hit before!" he further wrote.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I definitely want it to happen: Deepika on collaboration with Salman
text: Deepika Padukone has said she'd "definitely" like to work with Salman Khan in a film, adding, "It's important for us to come together for a right kind of film also." She further said Salman has been seen in "certain types of films" while adding that she'd like to see him doing something different from what he has done before.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Two booked for false molestation allegation against Tanushree's lawyer
text: Two people, including a woman, were arrested on Saturday after Mumbai Police found during investigation that the allegation of molestation against Tanushree Dutta's lawyer Nitin Satpute was false, an official said. The woman had filed a complaint in November, alleging that Satpute used abusive language with intent of outraging her modesty. The names of the arrested people were not revealed.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Deepika emptied herself to create 'Chhapaak' character Malti: Vikrant
text: Vikrant Massey has said that Deepika Padukone gave "her all and emptied herself to create" the character of Malti, an acid attack survivor in 'Chhapaak'. "[Deepika] internalises the character she portrays...and...it takes a toll on her," Vikrant said, adding, "There were days when she would respond like Malti even off-camera." "Malti is special for her and...impacted her as...performer," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: One can't open up about depression in TV industry: Actor Arjun
text: Actor Arjun Bijlani has said one cannot open up about depression in the TV industry, adding, "People won't give you work because they...think you're depressed." "You feel then whatever little chance you've of getting work, you'd lose it," he added. "They want to open up but they can't, they don't trust anybody, it's a sad state actually," Arjun further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I'd love to make a comedy film as that takes talent: Meghna
text: Director Meghna Gulzar, who has directed films like 'Talvar', 'Raazi' and upcoming film 'Chhapaak', has said, "I do wish to make a comedy, I really would love to, because that takes talent." "I don't think I have it...in my mind...right now," she added. "Also, I don't think I have...craft for it. But I would love to!" Meghna further said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Prithvi Shaw rushed to NCA after injuring shoulder in match
text: Indian batsman Prithvi Shaw was rushed to National Cricket Academy (NCA) for an assessment of his shoulder injury. Shaw, who had hurt his left shoulder while saving an overthrow on the opening day of Mumbai's Ranji Trophy match against Karnataka on Friday, neither fielded during the second day nor he came out to bat.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Google backs startup building AI to identify users based on typing style
text: Google's AI-focused venture fund Gradient Ventures led a $7-million Series A round of funding in biometrics startup TypingDNA. The startup develops artificial intelligence (AI) technology that can recognise and authenticate users based on how they type. TypingDNA was founded in the year 2016 in Romania but later moved its headquarters to New York, US.
author: Dharna

headlines: BSNL gets ₹30,000 crore letter of comfort from govt: Report
text: The government has reportedly provided a letter of comfort of ₹30,000 crore to BSNL to enable the telecom operator to raise loans to meet its capital expenditure. This comes as BSNL plans its 4G network rollout, which would require nearly ₹12,000 crore. Before the rollout, BSNL reportedly intends to pay the ₹2,000-crore dues that it owes to its vendor Nokia.
author: Dharna

headlines: TCS moves SC against reinstatement of Cyrus Mistry as director
text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has filed an appeal in the Supreme Court against the NCLAT judgment restoring Cyrus Mistry as the director of the company. Earlier, Tata Sons had moved the apex court against the reinstatement of Mistry as its Executive Chairman. Separately, Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, two Tata trusts and Tata Teleservices (TTSL) also challenged the order.
author: Dharna

headlines: Trump threatens to strike 52 sites in Iran if Americans are attacked
text: US President Donald Trump has threatened to strike 52 Iranian sites if the Middle Eastern country attacks any Americans, or American assets over the killing of a top commander in a US air strike. "The sites will be hit very fast and very hard. The USA wants no more threats...Iran has been nothing but problems for many years." Trump tweeted
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I must have had 5 girlfriends, but I'm a virgin till I'm not married: Salman
text: Salman Khan revealed he must've had "only 5 girlfriends" during a 'lie-detector test' on a Bigg Boss 13 episode, which had Ajay Devgn and Kajol as guests. He was responding to Kajol's question 'Have you had less than five girlfriends?' When Ajay pointed out he once said he's a virgin, Salman added, "Yes. I'm a virgin till I'm not married."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Aamir shoots 'Laal Singh...' running scenes for 10 days on painkillers: Report
text: Aamir Khan was on constant dose of painkillers while shooting a running sequence for 'Laal Singh Chaddha', to prepare for which he used to jog for 10-13 km every day, said Mid-Day. The sequence required him to run "across the country", the report added. Due to the fixed schedule, Aamir continued shooting on painkillers for around 10 days, it stated.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Full statehood will be part of AAP Assembly poll manifesto: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that full statehood for the national capital will be a part of AAP manifesto for the upcoming Assembly elections. "The party will keep fighting for it," he said, adding that this was the only promise AAP failed to fulfill. AAP is expected to release its Assembly poll manifesto between 15 and 20 January.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: What led to the birth of One Day International cricket?
text: The first-ever One Day International was an impromptu one, played between England and Australia in Melbourne on January 5, 1971. The 40-overs-per-side (eight balls per over) match was played on what would have been the fifth day of the washed-out third Ashes Test. It was played to appease the crowd and recover financial losses for the Don Bradman-led Australian board.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Lara named daughter after Sydney where he hit 277 as 1st hundred
text: Former Windies' captain Brian Lara named his first daughter as Sydney after the city where he went on to convert his maiden Test ton into a double hundred on January 5, 1993. Lara, who began the day four of the Test against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground at 121*, scored 277 in the innings, helping Windies draw the Test.n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Musk hints Tesla Cybertruck may be sent to Mars in 2022 mission
text: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has hinted that the automaker's Cybertruck could be on board the Starship spacecraft during its cargo mission to Mars in 2022. When a Twitter user questioned him on such a possibility, Musk replied with the 'smiling face with sunglasses' emoji. Earlier, Musk said that Starship "definitely" had the payload capacity to carry a Cybertruck.
author: Dharna

headlines: 2 injured as portion of railway station building in West Bengal collapses
text: Two people were injured and others are feared trapped after a portion of the railway station at West Bengal's Bardhaman collapsed on Saturday night. People felt a tremor after which most of them ran away from the station premises before the front portion of the Bardhaman station building collapsed, averting a major tragedy, officials said.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Tough question to answer: SBI boss on if India can become $5tn economy by FY25
text: SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar on Saturday said the country can become a $5-trillion economy but was uncertain if that is achievable by 2024-25 as envisaged by the government. "Whether we'll achieve in five years, it is like, a very difficult question to answer." He added that growth will come on the back of revival in private sector investments.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Rumours of Air India shutdown baseless, will continue to expand: CMD
text: After reports claimed that Air India may be forced to shut down by June 2020 unless it finds a private buyer, the national carrier's Chairman and MD Ashwani Lohani dismissed the 'rumours', deeming them "baseless". "Air India would continue to fly and expand," he added. Lohani further said there should be "no cause for concern to travellers, corporates or agents".
author: Dharna

headlines: It was very emotional: Daniel on filming final scene as James Bond
text: Daniel Craig, who'll make his last appearance as James Bond in 'No Time to Die', has said shooting the final scene of the film was a "very emotional" moment for him. "The whole crew came round and gathered outside. Everybody was hugging each other," he added. "I tried to make a speech and couldn't get it out," Daniel further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Shah Rukh to join Kabir Khan for 'The Forgotten Army': Reports
text: Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly join filmmaker Kabir Khan as a narrator for his upcoming series 'The Forgotten Army - Azaadi Ke Liye'. "Kabir wanted a narrator for the series and felt...Shah Rukh is a perfect fit and when he narrated the script, SRK said yes," reports added. Shah Rukh had earlier made a cameo in Kabir's 2017 film 'Tubelight'.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Seven whales rescued from mass stranding in New Zealand
text: Seven whales were successfully herded back to sea after they survived a mass stranding at a New Zealand beach on Saturday. The marine conservation group Project Jonah had earlier appealed for trained medics to go to Matarangi Harbour to assist with the rescue. Long-finned pilot whales are regularly involved in mass strandings in New Zealand waters.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Was such joy to see him evolve: Laxman on Irfan Pathan’s retirement
text: After all-rounder Irfan Pathan announced his retirement from all forms of cricket, former India batsman VVS Laxman tweeted, "Was such a joy to see Irfan Pathan evolve from [an] aspiring 17yr old cricketer when I first saw him into a mature International Cricketer." Irfan played 173 international matches, picking up 301 wickets and scoring 2821 runs.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Won't mind retiring if SL makes T20 World Cup knockouts: Malinga
text: Sri Lanka T20 captain Lasith Malinga has said that he won't mind retiring from the T20 cricket if the team qualifies for the knockouts of the upcoming T20 World Cup. "My only target is to play qualify round in T20 World Cup," he added. In November last year, he had said he wants to play T20Is for another two years.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: I took it as opportunity to build strength: Bumrah on 4-month break
text: Talking about his four-month gap due to a stress fracture, Jasprit Bumrah said that it was not difficult for him as he was never in pain and he used it as an opportunity to build his strength. "I was looking at how to bring the strength back, how to improve upon the things I wanted to improve," he added.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: HP wins $439 mn as judge triples jury award in price-fixing case
text: HP was awarded $439 million in damages against Quanta Storage over a scheme to inflate the price of optical disk drives. A jury in 2019 ordered Quanta to pay HP $176 million, but on Friday a judge tripled the amount to $528 million. The judge later deducted $89 million paid in settlement by other firms HP accused of being involved.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Tesla aims to build 5,00,000 vehicles per year near Berlin: Report
text: Tesla plans to build 5,00,000 electric vehicles per year at its first European factory near Berlin, a report said. As per its documents posted online, Tesla aims to make Model Y and Model 3 vehicles at the site in Grünheide along with its "future models". The new gigafactory, Tesla's fourth, will include facilities to assemble entire e-vehicles.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Aakash to buy majority stake in ed-tech startup Meritnation for ₹50 cr
text: Test preparation company Aakash Educational Services is buying a majority stake in ed-tech startup Meritnation, as per a stock exchange filing. Aakash would buy Info Edge India's entire 66% stake in Meritnation for as much as ₹50 crore. Founded in 2008 by IIM-Bangalore alumni Pavan Chauhan and Ritesh Hemrajani, Meritnation offers online study material to school students.
author: Dharna

headlines: Tesla's short sellers lose $2.9 bn in a year as stock hits new highs
text: Traders shorting Tesla have lost $2.9 billion since the end of 2018, including a $500 million hit on Friday after the company announced record delivery numbers for 2019, according to analytics firm S3 Partners. Tesla beat estimates after delivering around 367,000 vehicles in 2019, 50% more than in 2018. Its shares have surged 150% since June 2019 to fresh highs.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: NASA loses contact with satellite that was probing unseen planets
text: NASA has revealed that it has lost contact with its Arcsecond Space Telescope Enabling Research in Astrophysics (ASTERIA), a briefcase-sized spacecraft designed to study planets outside our solar system. The agency revealed that communications were lost on December 5 and that they will continue trying to reach it until March 2020.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Iran hoists blood-red 'flag of revenge' atop mosque over top commander's killing
text: A blood-red flag, symbolising the call for avenging the dead, has been hoisted on the top of a mosque in Iran over the killing of head of Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps' Quds Force Qassem Soleimani. The hoisting ceremony was aired by Iranian state TV on Saturday. Soleimani was killed in a US air strike at Baghdad International Airport on Friday.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 4 generations of UK royal family pose for photo to mark new decade
text: A new portrait of the United Kingdom's royal family's Queen Elizabeth, Prince Charles, Prince William, and Prince George was released on Friday by Buckingham Palace to mark the beginning of a new decade. This is only the second time a portrait of the 93-year-old queen and the three future monarchs has been released, according to the palace.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 10 dead, 23 injured after building collapses in Cambodia
text: At least 10 people were killed and 23 injured after a seven-storey concrete building collapsed in Cambodia's Kep, officials said on Saturday. Prime Minister Hun Sen said on Saturday that rescuers were still "working on the removal of the concrete slab, cutting through iron fittings" to reach the missing workers in the rubble.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Thousands join funeral of Iranian general Soleimani in Iraq's Baghdad
text: Tens of thousands on Saturday joined the formal funeral procession in Iraq's capital Baghdad for Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani who was killed on Friday in an airstrike ordered by US President Donald Trump. Suleimani's body will be flown to Iran's Tehran on Sunday. On Tuesday, in his home province of Kerman in Iran, the burial will take place.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Vogue Italia to launch Jan issue without photos due to sustainability
text: Vogue Italia will launch its January 2020 issue without photographs in order to make a statement about sustainability. Vogue previewed seven illustrated covers on Instagram, which were created by artists "without travelling, shipping clothes or polluting in any way". The money saved from the production will go towards the restoration of Fondazione Querini Stampalia which was damaged by floods.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Murugappa Group's woman heir seeks seat in holding firm's all-male board
text: Late patriarch MV Murugappan's daughter Valli Arunachalam has sought a seat on the male-only board of Ambadi Investments, ₹37,000-crore (revenue) Murugappa Group's holding company. Along with her mother and sister, Valli inherited 8.15% stake in Ambadi, whose promoter stake is owned by seven branches of the family. She demanded that female heirs be given equal opportunity in the family business.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Miley Cyrus settles ₹2,150 crore lawsuit claiming she stole 'We Can't Stop'
text: Miley Cyrus has settled a $300 million (₹2,150 crore) copyright infringement lawsuit by a Jamaican songwriter who accused the US pop star of stealing her 2013 hit "We Can't Stop". Michael May sued Cyrus in March 2018, claiming that "We Can't Stop" closely resembled his 1988 reggae song "We Run Things". May said his song reached number one in Jamaica.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Singular 'they' voted as Word of the Decade by US linguists
text: The American Dialect Society has chosen singular "they" as the Word of the Decade, recognising its growing use to refer to people whose gender identity is non-binary (neither entirely male nor entirely female). The other contenders in the category included climate, #MeToo, meme, selfie and woke. The singular use of "they" was previously designated the 2015 Word of the Year.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Lakhs in UP get New Year cards from Priyanka with Preamble on them
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra sent lakhs of noteworthy people in Uttar Pradesh New Year greeting cards with Preamble to the Indian Constitution printed in Hindi on them. The cards were sent to poets, writers, social workers, etc amid anti-CAA protests. They bore the signature of Priyanka Gandhi, who is the All India Congress Committee General Secretary of Eastern UP.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Yashwant Sinha announces 3000 km-long anti-CAA yatra through 6 states
text: Former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha on Saturday announced 'Bharat Jodo Yatra 2020' to protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). The yatra, organised under the banner of Rashtra Manch, will begin on January 9 from Mumbai and will cover six states- Maharashtra, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana and Delhi. It will cover a total distance of 3,000 km.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Jamia Millia to re-open on Monday, 3 weeks after anti-CAA violence
text: Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) University in Delhi is set to re-open after winter break on Monday, January 6. The semester exams will commence soon after. The University was closed on December 16, 2019, following police action and violence on the campus amid anti-CAA protests by students on December 15. It had also cancelled examinations and declared vacation till January 5.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Kiran Bedi responds after being trolled over fake NASA video of Sun chanting Om
text: After being trolled for sharing a fake video with the caption "NASA Recorded Video of Sun Chanting Om", Puducherry Lt Governor Kiran Bedi said, "Even if it's fake...it's worth listening to it. It's good and soothing" She added, "NASA factor may be fake but the vibrations one can get by listening to it are not. I believe in sharing energy."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What are the various records set by Irfan Pathan, who retired today?
text: All-rounder Irfan Pathan, who retired from all forms of cricket today, is the only cricketer to take nine wickets in a Youth ODI.  The 35-year-old is the only bowler to take a hat-trick in the first over of a Test. Irfan is the only Asian player to win a Man of the Match award in a Test at WACA, Perth.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rowdy behaviour unpardonable, remove him as India A captain: Bedi on Shubman
text: Reacting to Punjab opener Shubman Gill refusing to walk after being given out and forcing umpires to change their decision, former India captain Bishan Singh Bedi tweeted, "This kind of rowdy behaviour by anyone is unpardonable." Adding that no player is bigger than the game, Bedi added, "Let a more balanced person lead India A before the referee's intimidated too."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Woman dies after doctors leave cloth inside her body after Caesarean delivery
text: A 24-year-old woman, died after doctors at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Virudhachalam who performed Caesarean delivery left a cloth inside her body cavity and stitched her up. Her husband claimed she started forgetting and vomited whatever she ate. He took her to JIPMER, where doctors diagnosed her with severe infection and showed the cloth left inside her body.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who was Muhandis, Iraqi commander killed with Soleimani in US air strike?
text: Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis, who was killed along with Iran's General Qassem Soleimani in a US airstrike on Friday, was the second-in-command of Iraq's Popular Mobilisation Forces who had helped Iraq defeat ISIS. Born in Iraq's Basra in 1953, Muhandis was the founder of Kataib Hezbollah militia which was attacked by the US on December 29.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Passengers threaten to break cockpit door, misbehave with Air India crew
text: Passengers aboard an Air India flight on Thursday allegedly threatened to break open the cockpit door and misbehaved with the crew after the Delhi-Mumbai flight was delayed by a few hours due to technical reasons. An official claimed that passengers grabbed a crew member's arm and "taunted" the pilots. A video of a few passengers shouting inside the plane surfaced.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: ESA releases calendar showcasing 12 lesser-known Hubble images
text: A commemorative calendar has been published by the European Space Agency showcasing 12 lesser-known images captured by the Hubble Space Telescope, marking 30 years since its launch. The images, dubbed 'hidden gems' by the ESA, show galactic mergers, dying stars and diamond-like clusters. The Hubble Telescope was launched in April 1990 as a joint NASA and ESA mission.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: BJP doing dirty politics for Hindutva vote bank: Sitaram Yechury
text: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury on Friday said the "BJP is deliberately indulging in communal polarisation and dirty vote bank politics" with an intent to consolidate "Hindutva vote bank". "This is dangerous for both the present and the future of the country," Yechury added. He was addressing an anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act rally.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Let Nitish pass resolution against CAA in Bihar Assembly: RLSP chief
text: RLSP chief Upendra Kushwaha claimed that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar lost credibility since JD(U) voted in favour of Citizenship (Amendment) Bill in Parliament. He challenged Kumar to convene an Assembly session to pass resolution opposing CAA. "Such a step has been taken in Kerala...If Kumar does the same, he might be able to redeem some of the credibility," Kushwaha said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Sonam defeats Olympic medallist Sakshi in Asian Championships trials
text: Two-time World Cadet champion wrestler Sonam Malik on Saturday outclassed Rio Olympic bronze medallist Sakshi Malik to qualify for the upcoming Ranking Series and Asian Championships. Sonam, who was trailing by 4-6 in the second period, made it 10-10 just before the end of the bout by pulling a four-point move. She won on criterion of scoring the last point.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Aus' Matthew Wade's helmet breaks after ball hits him while fielding
text: Australia batsman Matthew Wade underwent a concussion test at the end of second day of the third Test against New Zealand as he was struck in the head while fielding at short leg. The incident took place in the 28th over when Tom Latham smashed the ball right where Wade was standing, breaking the side grill of Wade's helmet.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: He doesn't have right to criticise: Ole on van Persie's remark
text: Reacting to former Manchester United player Robin van Persie's remark that he shouldn't smile after a loss, the Red Devils manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said that Persie doesn't have right to criticise his "management style". "I don't know Robin and Robin doesn't know me," he added. "He took my No 20 shirt and that's...all he's going to take," he stated.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Google News to discontinue print-replica magazine subscriptions
text: Google has decided to discontinue the print-replica magazines in Google News and has reportedly conveyed the same to users via an email. Users won't be able to purchase new issues anymore but will be able to access old issues of the magazines in Google News. All the latest payments made will be refunded within 30 days, Google News said.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Govt may let e-comm firms upload GST e-invoice for vendors: Reports
text: E-commerce platforms like Flipkart might be allowed to upload e-invoice for vendors under the GST framework, a report said. The report quoted a government official stating that the government had taken up the matter and might allow once its trials are over. GST Council had allowed the introduction of e-invoicing for B2B transactions from January 1, 2020.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Skill development a must for sustainable growth: Microsoft India Head
text: Microsoft India Head Anant Maheshwari said skill development to match the growing demand for new skills from the workforce was the need of the hour for India's sustainable and inclusive growth. He added digital literacy has now become a gateway to employability. Maheshwari further said workplaces today demand digital fluency while some demanded digital mastery.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: New lithium-sulfur battery made that charges a phone for 5 days
text: Scientists have developed a new lithium-sulfur battery with a capacity five times higher than that of lithium-ion batteries. Researchers state the battery maintains an efficiency of 99% for more than 200 cycles, which for a smartphone-sized battery would result in keeping a phone charged for five days. Researchers fabricated four types of thick sulfur cathodes to use in the prototypes.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Man, missing for 6 yrs after Kedarnath floods, reunited with family
text: Jameel Ahmed Ansari from Uttarakhand's Udham Singh Nagar, who had gone missing after the 2013 Kedarnath floods, was reunited with his family by Uttarakhand police under ''Operation Smile''. Ansari, who was presumed to be dead by his family, was found at an old age home. Police had put his photos on social media where he was identified by his nephew.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Terrorism threatening peace, need a Mahatma Gandhi: HRD Minister
text: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank has said that at a time when terrorism is threatening peace across the globe, the world needs a Mahatma Gandhi. Under such circumstances, the world needs Mahatma Gandhi's principles of truth, love, and non-violence, the minister added. He was addressing a gathering at the launch of 'World Book Fair 2020' in Delhi.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 3 arrested with snake venom worth ₹1.5 crore in West Bengal
text: Three people have been arrested in Malda district of West Bengal with snake venom worth ₹1.5 crore in the international market, said the police on Saturday. The trio were arrested from a hotel in English Bazar town on Friday night. They have been booked under sections of the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972, said a top police official.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Attack on Gurdwara Nankana Sahib in Pak reprehensible: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi called the attack on Gurdwara Nankana Sahib in Pakistan "reprehensible". "Bigotry is a dangerous, age-old poison that knows no borders. Love + Mutual Respect + Understanding is its only known antidote," he added. On Friday, reports had emerged of stone pelting at the Sikh shrine with Punjab CM Captain Amarinder urging Pakistan PM Imran to intervene.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Bolivia to hold presidential election re-run on May 3
text: Bolivia will hold the presidential election on May 3 to elect a new government to replace ousted President Evo Morales. The voting will be held almost seven months after the results of the October elections that handed the fourth term to Morales. The election results were later discredited following allegations of fraud and Morales left office in November.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Niti Aayog, Railways present ₹22,500 cr plan for private trains
text: Niti Aayog and Indian Railways have come up with a ₹22,500 crore investment plan to allow private operators to run 150 trains while collecting market-linked fares. A paper titled 'Private Participation: Passenger Trains' identified 100 routes to be discussed with stakeholders. Privatisation will provide world-class service experience to passengers and reduce supply-demand deficit, the paper said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Writer files case against Deepika, says Chhapaak copied from his script
text: Film producer and writer Rakesh Bharti has filed a copyright violation case against Deepika Padukone, other producers and director of her upcoming movie Chhapaak. Bharti alleged the film is based on a script he wrote. He added that he even registered the film under the title 'Black Day' in 2015 and approached actresses like Kangana Ranaut and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: H'wood actress apologises to Iran for US air strike, says 'Please don't kill us'
text: Hollywood actress Rose McGowan took to Twitter to apologise to Iran for the US air strike that killed an Iranian commander. "Dear #Iran...52% of us humbly apologize. We want peace with your nation...Please do not kill us," she wrote. "Ok, so I freaked out because we may have any impending war. Sometimes it's okay to freak out," she later tweeted.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Man declared 'foreigner', who was lodged in Assam detention camp, dies
text: A man in Assam, declared a 'foreigner' and sent to a detention camp, died at Gauhati Medical College and Hospital on Friday. Naresh Koch, was admitted to the GMCH ten days ago after he had fallen sick at the Goalpara detention camp. Naresh was declared a foreigner by a foreigners' tribunal and sent to the detention camp in March 2018.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Gurdwara incident proves minorities persecuted in Pak: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Saturday said the incident of vandalism at Nankana Sahib Gurdwara was proof that "persecution of minorities in Pakistan is for real." "Murderous mob which laid siege to Sri Nankana Sahib...also threatened to change the name of this holiest of holy places to Ghulam-e-Mustafa," he said. "Do those opposed to CAA...need more proof?", Puri added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Irfan Pathan announces retirement from all cricket 16 years after int'l debut
text: All-rounder Irfan Pathan has announced his retirement from all forms of cricket aged 35, 16 years after making his international debut. "I'll keep contributing to Indian cricket, but it's always better if someone else takes my place in domestic cricket," he said. Pathan, only cricketer to take a hat-trick in Test's first over, took 301 international wickets in 173 matches.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Not in favour of 4-day Tests, not fair to purest format of the game: Kohli
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has said that he is not in favour of four-day Tests adding that it is not fair to the purest format of the game. "I think the intent won't be right then because then you will speak of three-day Tests. I mean where do you end. Then you'll speak of Test cricket disappearing," Kohli added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Don't want to comment irresponsibly without full knowledge: Virat Kohli on CAA
text: On being asked about his opinion about the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Team India captain Virat Kohli said, "I don't want to be irresponsible and speak on something that has radical opinions on both sides." He added, "I need to have total information and knowledge of what it means and what's going on, then be responsible to give my opinion."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Won't take even one dollar back to Argentina: Fighter who won $1 mn in US
text: Argentine MMA fighter Emiliano Sordi, who won a $1-million prize in New York, said he isn't going to be "so stupid as to take even one dollar" home. Argentines have stashed over $300 billion abroad to protect savings from crises. Sordi also said the prospect of taxes as high as 50% made him want to keep the money in US.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Blaming previous govt serves no purpose: Dy CM on Kota infant deaths
text: Rajasthan Deputy Chief Minister and state Congress President Sachin Pilot on Saturday said that Ashok Gehlot-led state government's response to infant deaths at Kota hospital "could have been more compassionate and sensitive." "After being in power for 13 months I think it serves no purpose to blame the previous government's misdeeds," he said. "Accountability should be fixed," Pilot added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist arrested in Jammu and Kashmir: Police
text: A Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist has been arrested in Jammu and Kashmir said the police on Saturday. The apprehended man named Nisar Dar was arrested in a joint operation by Jammu and Kashmir police and security forces. A top police official said that Dar had escaped from an encounter in Kullan village of Ganderbal district in November.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Man asks people to call BJP's CAA no. for free Netflix subscription, Netflix responds
text: A Twitter user asked people to call 8866288662 to get free Netflix subscription for six months. However, the particular number was launched by BJP urging people to give a missed call to show their support for CAA. In response, Netflix India tweeted, "This is absolutely fake. If you want free Netflix please use someone else's account like rest of us."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: TV actress claims she was molested by a cab driver on New Year's Eve in Kolkata
text: A TV actress has claimed that she was harassed and molested by a taxi driver in Kolkata on New Year's Eve. The actress alleged that the driver cancelled the trip moments after she got into the taxi. She also alleged that the driver was drunk and tried to speed the vehicle without paying heed to her pleas to stop.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Bengaluru man says fianceé broke up over his 'long' nose, goes to court
text: A Bengaluru-based techie has accused his US-based fianceé, whom he met on a matrimonial site, of cheating after she broke up saying his nose was "long and warped". He approached a court, which ordered registration of a case against the woman, who insisted that he get plastic surgery. The man said he spent ₹5 lakh so far on wedding arrangements.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: India will face international isolation because of NRC-CAA: Ex-Foreign Secy
text: India will face diplomatic isolation because of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 and the National Register of Citizens (NRC), former National Security Adviser and Foreign Secretary Shivshankar Menon has said. "India has isolated itself through the move. Perception of India has changed in the last few months. Even our friends have been taken aback," he added.nn
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: IndiGo's Rakesh Gangwal seeks to ease rules on buying and selling of shares
text: IndiGo Co-Founder Rakesh Gangwal is seeking to delete provisions in the Articles of Association that give partner Rahul Bhatia the right of first refusal if Gangwal decides to sell his shares. He also wants to remove an article preventing either from buying IndiGo shares and potentially triggering an open offer. Gangwal owns 37% of IndiGo while Bhatia controls about 38%.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Priyanka ranks 4th in Yahoo India's most searched people of 2019
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra has attained the fourth spot in Yahoo India's Top 20 Most Searched Personalities of 2019. PM Narendra Modi, who took the first spot, was followed by former India cricket captain MS Dhoni. IAF Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman bagged the seventh spot while West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and Congress' Rahul Gandhi were ranked fifth and sixth, respectively.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I don't wake up every morning thinking I'm some superstar: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone has said she doesn't wake up every morning thinking that she's a "superstar", adding, "That's the audience's perception of me." "Perception is based on...work...I do. So, my only endeavour when I wake up...is to continue doing such work," she added. "I think, where I'm in life today is to do work that can positively impact...lives," Deepika further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Actress Cameron Diaz, husband Benji Madden blessed with a baby girl
text: Actress Cameron Diaz on Friday took to Instagram to announce that she and her husband, guitarist-songwriter Benji Madden, have been blessed with their first child, a baby girl. Cameron, who named her daughter Raddix Madden, added that they "won't be posting pictures or sharing details, other than the fact that she's really cute". Cameron and Benji got married in 2015.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Cong files complaint against BJP MLA over his 'we're 80%, you're 17%' remark
text: A Congress delegation has filed a complaint with the police against BJP MLA G Somasekhara Reddy over his "We're 80%, you're just 17%" remark. In an apparent communal threat to Muslims protesting against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Reddy had said, "We're 80%...if we turn against you, what will your situation be?" "Most divisive speech inciting violence," a Youth Congress leader said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Klopp created a fantastic team: Ancelotti ahead of Liverpool clash
text: Everton manager Carlo Ancelotti has said that Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has created a "fantastic team" with "fantastic players". "They are...in really good shape, really good condition," he added. Everton, who haven't beaten Liverpool at Anfield since 1999 and lost 2-5 against them in Premier League last month, will face the Reds on Sunday in the ongoing FA Cup.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: US govt limits exports of artificial intelligence software
text: In a bid to stop sensitive technologies from falling into the hands of its rivals, the US government has limited the exports of artificial intelligence software. The new rule will require companies shipping geospatial imagery software overseas to apply for a license. The rule will be effective only in US, but US authorities could submit it to international bodies later.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Scientists find evidence that Venus has active volcanoes
text: New research led by Universities Space Research Association (USRA) and published today in Science Advances shows that lava flows on Venus may be only a few years old. The find suggests that Venus could be volcanically active today, making it the only planet in our solar system, other than Earth, with recent eruptions.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: China's inland surface water quality improved from 2003-2017
text: A new study shows that China's inland surface water quality improved significantly from 2003-2017, coinciding with the country's efforts to reduce water pollution beginning in 2001. The improved inland surface water quality across the country is mainly attributable to reduced pollution emissions in the industrial, rural, and urban residential sectors.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Shia group protests in Kargil over killing of Iranian commander by US
text: A protest rally was organised in Ladak's Kargil on Saturday by a Shia group, Anjuman Jamiyat Ullama Isna Ashriya Kargil, against the killing of top Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani by the US. On Friday, prayers were reportedly offered for the Iranian commander in several areas of Kashmir. Soleimani was killed in a US airstrike at Baghdad's international airport on Friday.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: BJP turned Kashmir into graveyard after Article 370 repeal: CPI(M)
text: CPI(M) leader Mohammad Yusuf Tarigami on Friday said that the BJP government turned Kashmir into a virtual prison by locking up leaders of different political parties after the abrogation of Article 370. "He (Amit Shah) says every day there has been no firing...You have made Kashmir a graveyard. What is the point of firing then?" he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: World cannot afford another war in the Gulf: UN Secretary-General
text: A statement from the United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned that "the world cannot afford another war in the Gulf" and the leaders must "exercise maximum restraint". This comes after tensions escalated between Iran and the US over Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani's killing. Iran vowed to seek revenge after the US air strike killed Soleimani in Baghdad on Friday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Future Retail to raise up to $500 million through dollar bonds
text: The board of Kishore Biyani-led Future Retail has approved its plan to raise up to $500 million (about ₹3,590 crore) through US dollar-denominated bonds. The long-term borrowings will fund the company's acquisition of the retail infrastructure assets of Future Enterprises for up to ₹4,000 crore. The acquisition would reportedly help Future Retail save ₹650 crore on lease rental payments annually.
author: Dharna

headlines: Police asks Sapna Choudhary to join investigation after SUV accident
text: Haryanvi singer and BJP member Sapna Choudhary has been asked by the police to join the investigation into an accident involving her SUV. The incident occurred on the intervening night of December 25 and 26, when her SUV allegedly overtook a truck in Gurugram's Hero Honda Chowk flyover, following which the truck hit her vehicle from behind.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Police jailed minor Madarsa students amid anti-CAA protests: Priyanka
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Saturday said Madarsa students, including minors, were picked up by police and put behind bars in Muzaffarnagar during protests against CAA. "Students of Madarsa including minors were picked up by police without any reason. Of them, some were released and some are still in jail," she said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: We're 80% & you're just 17%: K'taka BJP MLA warns those opposing CAA
text: A video has surfaced online, showing Karnataka BJP MLA G Somasekhara Reddy warning anti-CAA protestors. In an apparent communal threat, Reddy said, "We're 80%. You're just 17%. If we turn against you, what will your situation be?" "I want to caution those who're protesting...This (crowd at pro-CAA rally) is just 5%...If 100% people come, just imagine your situation," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: No posters, banners including 4, 6 boards allowed in India T20I in Guwahati
text: Assam Cricket Association Secretary Devajit Saikia has said that posters, banners and message boards including placards showing '4' and '6' will not be allowed inside the Barsapara Cricket Stadium during India-Sri Lanka T20I on Sunday. He added that no marker pens will be allowed inside the stadium as well. Saikia added the directive had nothing to do with anti-CAA protests.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Didn't know Hardik, Nataša were going to Dubai for engagement: Hardik's father
text: All-rounder Hardik Pandya's father has revealed they knew that Hardik and Nataša Stanković were going on a vacation to Dubai but had no clue they were going to get engaged. "This took us by surprise. We came to know about it after they got engaged," he added. "Nataša's a very nice girl, and we've met her in Mumbai," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kiran Bedi shares fake NASA video of 'Sun chanting Om', gets trolled
text: Puducherry Governor Kiran Bedi was trolled on social media on Saturday after she posted a fake video with a caption "NASA Recorded Video of Sun Chanting Om". NASA, however, had in 2018 released a video of "low, pulsing hum" coming out of the Sun. Reacting to Bedi's video, a user tweeted, "When you're...a big fan of Koi Mil gaya."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 8 out of 9 Indian Nobel Prize winners are Brahmins: Gujarat Speaker
text: Speaking at the 'Mega Brahmin Business Summit', Gujarat Assembly Speaker Rajendra Trivedi claimed eight of nine Indian Nobel Prize winners are Brahmins. "Do you know a ninth Indian recently received Nobel? Yes, he is Abhijit Banerjee, a Brahmin," he said. Trivedi added that Delhi firefighter Rajesh Shukla, who saved 11 people during a fire last month, is also a Brahmin.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: CAT 2019 results out, all 10 toppers are male from tech background
text: The Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) today declared the results of the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2019, which was held on November 24 last year. As many as 10 candidates scored perfect 100 percentile, with all of them being male and from engineering or technology background. Further, a total of 21 candidates scored 99.99 percentile.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Two friends from IIT-Bombay score 99.99 and 100 percentile in CAT
text: Two friends from IIT-Bombay Rahul Manglik and Somansh Chordia, who are in the final-year of mechanical engineering programme, are among the top scorers in the Common Admission Test 2019. While Rahul who hails from Delhi has scored 99.99 percentile, Somansh from Nagpur scored 100 percentile. Rahul said he had attempted at least 30 mock tests during his CAT preparations.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Horse helps woman escape Australian bushfires to find safety at pub
text: A horse named Charmer helped its owner escape Australian bushfires to find safety at a pub. "I could feel heat and I don't know whether that was from the Sun or the fire...it was terrifying," Bec Winter said. "I had so much faith in Charmer to get me out safely and she did that. She is my hero," Winter added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Mistry's handling of DoCoMo case brought disrepute to group: Ratan Tata
text: In his Supreme Court plea, Ratan Tata has claimed that Cyrus Mistry "brought disrepute to the Tata Group" by the way he handled the DoCoMo litigation. DoCoMo had decided to sell its stake in Tata Teleservices in 2014 but Tata Sons failed to find a buyer as per an agreement. Tata said Mistry was resisting paying arbitration money to DoCoMo.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: My companies will fail: Africa's richest woman after court freezes assets
text: Isabel dos Santos, Africa's richest woman and the daughter of ex-Angolan President, said her Angolan businesses are set to fail after a court froze her assets in the country in a corruption case. Dos Santos lives outside Angola and holds a significant portion of her $2 billion wealth offshore. The 46-year-old's father ruled Angola for nearly four decades until 2017.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Late YouTuber Danish inspired my look in Street Dancer 3D: Varun
text: Actor Varun Dhawan on Friday took to Instagram to reveal that late YouTuber Danish Zehen was the inspiration behind his look in Remo D'Souza directorial film, 'Street Dancer 3D'. Varun also shared a collage of himself with Danish and wrote, "@remodsouza sir suggested this look." Danish passed away at the age of 21 in a car accident in Mumbai.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Disgraceful: Swara on mob attack on Gurdwara Nankana Sahib in Pak
text: Actress Swara Bhasker on Saturday took to Twitter to condemn the mob attack on Gurdwara Nankana Sahib in Pakistan and wrote, "Attack on #NanakanaSahib is shameful, disgraceful and utterly vile and unjustifiable." "Shame on the vandals and hope they are brought to book immediately," she added. As per reports, a group of people pelted stones at the Gurdwara.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: It's a subject which had to be shared with audience: Akshay on Good Newwz
text: Talking about his recent release 'Good Newwz', Akshay Kumar said the subject of the film had to be shared with the audience. "With this film, I'm confident that...movie with good messaging...will...fetch...appreciation," he added. 'Good Newwz', which is about two couples who are trying to have a baby through In-Vitro Fertilisation (IVF), has earned ₹136 crore up till now in India.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Harry Kane suffers torn hamstring, confirms Tottenham Hotspurs
text: Tottenham Hotspur captain Harry Kane suffered a tear in his left hamstring during Wednesday's 0-1 loss to Southhampton, the club has confirmed. Kane had limped off the field after his 74th-minute attempt to score a goal that was ruled out for offside. "Everybody knows importance of Harry in squad. He's irreplaceable," manager Jose Mourinho had said after the match.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Nobel Prize-winning scientist Frances Arnold retracts paper
text: Frances Arnold, who won the Nobel Prize for chemistry, has retracted her latest paper as the results were not reproducible, and data was found missing from a lab notebook. "I was a bit busy when this was submitted, and did not do my job well," Arnold tweeted. Arnold's paper was based on the enzymatic synthesis of beta-lactams.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Scientists estimate timing of lunar dynamo's end
text: Scientists from MIT have pinned down the timing of the lunar dynamo's end, to around 1 billion years ago. The lunar dynamo is the name given to the phenomenon in which the moon exhibited a magnetic field like Earth due to the churning of its core. Researchers analysed the magnetic fields of lunar rocks to determine the estimated time.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Kejriwal's health, education initiatives inspiration for J'khand: Soren
text: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Friday met Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Tweeting the pictures from their meeting, Soren wrote that he was inspired by Kejriwal-led Aam Aadmi Party's "stellar public education and health initiatives" and added that he wishes to "implement similar initiatives in Jharkhand". Soren was sworn in as the 11th CM of Jharkhand on December 29.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Will hang Owaisi by crane, shave his beard & stick it to CM: BJP MP
text: BJP MP from Telangana's Nizamabad D Arvind Kumar has warned that he would "hang" Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi by a crane, "shave off his beard" and stick it to state CM K Chandrashekar Rao. "Nine years ago, Asaduddin's brother [Akbaruddin] was stabbed 50 times...in his own turf," Arvind added. This comes after Owaisi called Citizenship (Amendment) Act "unconstitutional".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Wearing saffron not enough, follow religion too: Congress on Yogi
text: After Uttar Pradesh CM's office said that Yogi Adityanath wore saffron robe for "public service after sacrificing everything", Congress on Friday said wearing saffron wasn't enough as one has to follow the religion too and not rip it apart. "Saffron is not an indulgence of power but its renunciation. Alas, those in power would understand this," Congress' chief spokesperson tweeted.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Peace returning to J&K after Article 370: Army chief Naravane
text: Indian Army chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane said that peace was returning to the Jammu and Kashmir after the government abrogated Article 370 in August. "Terror activity and stone-pelting have reduced drastically. The law-and-order situation is improving and we expect it to improve further," he said. "Infiltration attempts are being made every day, but we are thwarting them," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Puducherry govt to provide welfare for 29,000 NGO workers
text: After a three-hour-long Cabinet meeting on Friday, V Narayanasamy-led Puducherry government on Friday decided to provide welfare for 29,000 NGO workers in the Union Territory. Narayanasamy also told reporters that around 66,000 houses would be benefitted as the Cabinet decided to no longer charge the public for the discharge of wastewater in their sewers.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Iran's retaliation for commander's death would be 'poor decision': US
text: The White House has said Iran's retaliation for the US air strike which killed Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani would be a "very poor decision". Meanwhile, Iran has told the United Nations Security Council that "it reserves its right to self-defence" as US made a "gross violation" of the international law. US-Iran tensions have escalated since Soleimani was killed on Friday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: SBI invites bids to sell 1% stake in National Stock Exchange
text: India's largest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has invited bids to sell 1.01% stake in the National Stock Exchange (NSE), as part of its capital raising exercise. The bank currently holds a 5.19% stake in the exchange. The submission of bids for the 50,00,000 equity shares would be open until January 15, 2020.
author: Dharna

headlines: We'll launch an attack if Americans are threatened anywhere in the world: Trump
text: In a video posted by the White House on Twitter, US President Donald Trump said, "If Americans anywhere are threatened, we have all of those targets already fully identified, and I am ready and prepared to take whatever action is necessary." "The US has best military by far, anywhere in the world. We've best intelligence in the world," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Hollywood actor-singer leaves ₹1.4 lakh tip for waitress on bill of ₹5,600
text: American singer-actor Donnie Wahlberg left a $2,020 (₹1.4 lakh) tip for a server at an Illinois restaurant on a bill of $78 (₹5,600). "Thanks Bethany, Happy New Year. 2020 Tip Challenge," he wrote on the bill receipt. Sharing the picture of the receipt, his wife Jenny McCarthy tweeted, "[Donnie] starting 2020 off like the amazing man he is."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: I'm comfortable in a saree: Akshay Kumar on Laxmmi Bomb look
text: Akshay Kumar, who'll portray a man possessed by a transgender's spirit in 'Laxmmi Bomb', has said he was comfortable in the saree and faced no problems while shooting in it. He said he loves doing "tricky stuff" while adding that the character is one of the most difficult he has played. "I had to...get the body language right," he added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Anup Jalota holds gun while lip syncing song with Jasleen Matharu; video viral
text: A video of bhajan singer Anup Jalota lip syncing with Jasleen Matharu on the Bollywood song 'Aap Yahan Aaye Kis Liye' has gone viral. Jalota can also be seen holding a revolver in the video, which was posted by Matharu on social media. The duo had participated in Bigg Boss 12 as a couple.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Actress poses in torn clothes with blood on body in post on violence against women
text: In an Instagram post on violence against women, actress Bidita Bag posed in torn clothes with blood all over her body. She can be seen holding a placard reading 'Let's bring consent in fashion again'. "Consent?...what's consent he said...my might is my right...I begged, I cried. Rape?...when rape is inevitable lie back and enjoy it..thats what he said," she wrote.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: My father Aditya Pancholi has been a troublemaker: Sooraj on controversies
text: While talking about controversies and his family being in limelight, actor Sooraj Pancholi said, "That's because my father (Aditya) has made those mistakes. He has been vocal, aggressive and a troublemaker in his own way." "People relate me to his personality...I'm more like my mother, but I've my father's last name and I cannot do anything about it," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Actor Richard Gere attends Dalai Lama's teaching session in Bodh Gaya
text: Hollywood actor Richard Gere on Thursday attended the opening ceremony of the teaching session of The Dalai Lama at the Kalachakra ground in Bihar's Bodh Gaya. The 'Pretty Woman' actor had earlier attended The Dalai Lama's session in 2017 as well. Hollywood actor Gerard Butler and 'Game of Thrones' actress Emilia Clarke are also in India currently.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Bhim Army chief may suffer cardiac arrest, police denying medical care: Doctor
text: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad's physician Harjit Singh Bhatti tweeted that Azad is suffering from a disease which requires biweekly phlebotomy from AIIMS. If it's not done, he may suffer a sudden cardiac arrest, the doctor added. "I was told that...the police authorities are not allowing him to visit AIIMS," he wrote, requesting the authorities to bring him to AIIMS.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Apple CEO Tim Cook's annual pay drops to ₹83 crore in 2019
text: The annual compensation of Apple CEO Tim Cook dropped to ₹83 crore ($11.56 million) in 2019, down 26% from ₹113 crore ($15.7 million) in 2018. It comprises a $3 million base salary, $885,000 benefits for expenses such as use of private jets and $7.7 million incentive bonus, which was lower due to Apple exceeding its sales target by only 28%.
author: Dharna
