"What we've to say is a little more emotional," she added. "'Dostana' (2008) became a cult classic and I hope we match that standard, fun, energy and glamour," Janhvi further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: If Cong not behind CAA violence, why haven't they condemned it: Nadda
text: BJP National Working President JP Nadda said that if Congress is not behind the violence during protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), then why haven't they condemned it. Nadda was addressing a seminar on CAA at Swaminarayan Mandir in Gujarat's Vadodara. This comes a day after BJP launched a toll free number to get support in favour of CAA.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Google chased bigger profits, ignored human rights issues: Former exec
text: Ross LaJeunesse, Google's former International Relations Head, has alleged that while the company leadership made plans for a censored Chinese search engine, they ignored his call for a company-wide Human Rights program. He said the company soon replaced him with another colleague to oversee policy issues for 'Project Dragonfly'. Google decided to chase higher profits and stock price, he said.
author: Dharna

headlines: Bug in Xiaomi security camera shows user live feed from other homes
text: A Reddit user has alleged that when he asked Google Assistant to show him the live feed from Xiaomi security camera in his house, he was shown stills from cameras inside other people's houses. The surveillance feed included stills of people sleeping including an infant in a crib. Google has since disabled Xiaomi integration for Google Home devices and Assistant.
author: Dharna

headlines: Workers say Amazon threatened to fire them for raising climate concerns
text: Several Amazon employees, who called for the company to combat climate change, have alleged that Amazon threatened to fire them if they continued to discuss internal affairs with the media. In September, a day after workers announced a climate walkout, Amazon allegedly changed a related policy and mandated workers to seek its approval for speaking about it in public forums.
author: Dharna

headlines: Uber driver earns college degree after passenger pays off her debt
text: A 43-year-old US-based Uber driver earned a degree in criminal justice after a passenger paid off her $700 college debt. During the ride, the mother-of-three had revealed the difficulties she had faced like dropping out of high school after pregnancy. She resumed her classes in 2018 after stopping in 2010, when the college refused to let her pay in instalments.n
author: Dharna

headlines: Kerala Guv cannot walk on streets if he doesn't resign: Congress MP
text: Congress MP from Kerala's Vadakara K Muraleedharan has said that Governor Arif Mohammad Khan cannot walk on the streets if he doesn't resign from his post. This comes after Khan said that the Kerala Assembly resolution demanding withdrawal of Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) is "valueless". "CAA is against democracy...Kerala assembly brought a unanimous resolution on it," Muraleedharan said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Top Iranian, Iraqi commanders killed in air strike ordered by US Prez Trump
text: Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of elite Quds Force, and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis were killed in an air strike, ordered by US President Donald Trump, on their convoy at Baghdad International Airport on Friday. The rockets landed near air cargo terminal, burning two vehicles. "The strike was aimed at deterring future Iranian attack plans," the Pentagon said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Rishabh Pant should stay away from opinions: Parthiv Patel
text: Talking about India's 22-year-old wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant, veteran wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said, "When you are struggling for form, you get opinions from all quarters. It’s about keeping yourself away from opinions and focussing on your game." Parthiv added, “Opinions should not matter when you know that the team management and selectors back you."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Michael Schumacher got kart license aged 12 from another country
text: German Formula One legend Michael Schumacher, who won record seven championships, obtained his kart license from Luxembourg aged 12. The minimum age for karting license in Germany was 14, while the limit in Luxembourg was 12. Schumacher won the German Junior Kart Championship aged 13 in 1982 and gained his German license the following year.n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: First-ever hat-trick in a Cricket World Cup was taken by an Indian
text: Former Indian pacer Chetan Sharma bowled out three New Zealand batsmen in three successive deliveries on October 31, 1987, in Nagpur, becoming the first bowler to take a hat-trick in World Cup. It was the first hat-trick taken by an Indian and the first all-bowled hat-trick in international cricket. Sharma, who turns 54 today, played 23 Tests and 65 ODIs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Scrapping five-day Tests a 'ridiculous' idea: Nathan Lyon
text: Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon has labelled the concept of four-day Tests as "ridiculous". "I'm totally against it and I hope ICC aren't even considering it," he added. "You look at all the big games around the world and some of the best Test matches I've been part of, they go down to the last [fifth] day," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 27-yr-old Ish Sodhi, who went unsold in auction, roped in by RR for dual staff role
text: New Zealand's 27-year-old leg-spinner Ish Sodhi, who went unsold in IPL auction, has been roped in by his former team Rajasthan Royals for a dual staff role. Sodhi has been hired as spin consultant and Operations Executive. "His T20 experience, mentoring skills and motivational personality will be immensely valuable for our young Indian spinners," RR COO Jake Lush McCrum said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Savarkar had physical relationship with Godse: Congress Seva Dal booklet on RSS
text: A booklet on Veer Savarkar and RSS has claimed the Hindu Mahasabha co-founder had physical relationship with Nathuram Godse. Referring to an incident mentioned in Dominique Lapierre and Larry Collins's 'Freedom at Midnight', the booklet said, "Before adopting brahmacharya...there's only one mention of Nathuram Godse's physical relationship. His partner in homosexual relationship was Savarkar."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: ₹1 crore ex-gratia announced for family of fireman who died at Delhi factory
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday announced an ex-gratia of ₹1 crore to the family of the fireman who died in a fire incident at a factory. "Amit Baliyan laid down his life while serving the people of Delhi. Nothing can bring back a loved one lost," Kejriwal tweeted. Twelve other firefighters were rescued after the factory collapsed.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Man depressed over dad's death lives with body for 5 days, doesn't tell family
text: Police on Thursday recovered the semi-decomposed body of an 85-year-old man from a house in Kolkata where his 52-year-old son was living with the corpse for the last five days. The police said the son was "very depressed" and he did not even inform his family about the death. The 52-year-old was mentally unstable, his elder brother informed the police.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 16-yr-old Indian-origin climber falls 500 feet from mountain in US; survives
text: Gurbaz Singh, a 16-year-old Indian-origin mountain climber from Canada survived after a 500-feet fall from the 11,240 feet Mount Hood in Oregon, US. Singh suffered a broken leg which required surgery. It took rescue crews about four hours to reach the teen and another four to carry him down the mountain on a stretcher.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Canada ordered officers to play Pokémon Go as civilians trespassed military bases
text: At least three officers at different military bases in Canada were ordered in 2016 to play Pokémon Go after civilians playing the game trespassed bases. They were tasked with logging the appearance of every 'PokeStops/Gyms' and wild monster. "We should almost hire a 12-year-old to help us out with this," a security expert had said in an internal email.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US warns air carriers to avoid Pak airspace, cites threat of militant attacks
text: The US has issued a warning to all air carriers and commercial operators to avoid Pakistani airspace, citing a possible threat of attacks on US airlines by extremist and militant groups. "There continues to be a risk to US civil aviation from attacks against airports and aircraft, particularly at low altitudes," the US said in an advisory.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 3 women hand themselves in to police after 30 animals die in German zoo fire
text: A mother and her two daughters turned themselves in to the police over a fire that killed over 30 animals at a zoo in Germany on New Year's Eve. Orangutans, chimpanzees, marmosets and a gorilla were among the animals who had died. The women are under investigation for lighting illegal sky lanterns that are believed to have caused the fire.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: I wish corporates took more money for working capital needs: SBI Chairman
text: State Bank of India (SBI) Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said that credit growth will remain an issue in 2020, with the industry expecting growth of just 7-8%. "I wish corporates (took) more money for working capital needs. Then we are alright," he said. Kumar added that 2020 will be the best year in terms of bad loan recoveries.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I alone arranged for my departure from Japan, wife had no role: Ghosn
text: Former Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn has said that his wife Carole and other family members played "no role" in his departure from Japan, where he was out on bail. "All such speculation is inaccurate and false. I alone arranged for my departure," Ghosn added. Japanese authorities have issued an Interpol wanted notice for Ghosn, who is now in Lebanon.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: UPI transactions cross ₹2 lakh crore mark for first time in December
text: The value of transactions made through the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) breached the ₹2 lakh crore mark for the first time in December 2019, reaching ₹2,02,526 crore. The number of transactions on the platform rose 7.3% from November to 131 crore during the month. The UPI network had crossed the ₹1 lakh crore transaction value mark in December 2018.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: No talk on NRC now, CAA has been brought: Amit Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah said that there is no talk on National Register of Citizens (NRC) and added that discussions should be on the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA). "There is no provision in the CAA that talks about NRC," he added. Commenting on the National Population Register (NPR), Shah said, "No document would be sought...only data will be collected."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP launches toll-free number to gather support for CAA
text: The BJP on Thursday launched a toll-free number for people to register their support for CAA by giving a missed call on it. The BJP recently announced that it will undertake a mass contact programme "to expose Opposition's lies" on CAA. People will be urged to show their support for CAA on social media, BJP General Secretary Anil Jain said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: We haven't really achieved anything as Test team: Faf Du Plessis
text: Ahead of the second Test against England, South Africa skipper Faf Du Plessis has said that if "complacency creeps in" then the team "would go back to playing just ordinary cricket." "We haven't really achieved anything as a Test team…there's a lot that still needs to happen," he added. South Africa won the first Test by 107 runs.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Happy New Year to all 7 CM candidates of Delhi BJP, tweets AAP
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday tweeted, "A very Happy New Year to all 7 CM candidates of Delhi BJP." The party mentioned the names of Gautam Gambhir, Manoj Tiwari, Vijay Goel, Hardeep Singh Puri, Harsh Vardhan, Vijender Gupta and Parvesh Singh in the tweet. "But the question is who will contest against Arvind Kejriwal?" the party asked.
author: Shailesh

headlines: DoT to use 5G trials to evaluate security risks from Huawei, others: Report
text: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) will conduct a security check on 5G trials to look for vulnerabilities before choosing the final vendors for 5G deployment in India, reports said. Evaluations will also be carried out for Huawei, which has already been banned in US over security concerns. IT Minister had allowed Chinese firms to participate in 5G trials in India.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: 'Tau' protein tangles may predict brain shrinkage during Alzheimer's
text: California University researchers suggested that tangles of the protein 'tau' found inside the brain of Alzheimer's patients can be used to predict future brain shrinkage. Chemical changes cause 'tau' to form tangles that disrupt the cells in Alzheimer's patients, which have previously been linked to a loss of brain cells. Notably, drugs targeting tau tangles are currently in clinical trials.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Section 144 in Varanasi 359 out of 365 days: Priyanka criticises PM
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Thursday said that in PM Narendra Modi's constituency Varanasi, Section 144 was imposed 359 out of 365 days in the year 2019. "He (PM) has the gall to say that people have nothing to fear?" she added in her tweet. Section 144 of the CrPc prohibits public gathering in an area.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Number of infant deaths least in past 6 yrs in Rajasthan: CM Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the number of infant deaths in the state has steadily been declining and the figure is currently at its lowest in the past five to six years. "Excellent medical arrangements are available in the hospitals," he added. The death toll of children at JK Lon Hospital in Kota, Rajasthan has risen to 103 since December.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Bus accident leaves 7 dead, 24 injured in Jammu and Kashmir
text: A bus accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district left seven people dead and injured 24 others after the bus skidded off the road and fell into a gorge. "The bus was on its way to Jammu from Surankote in Poonch. The...cause of the mishap...as of now it appears to be a case of negligence," a police official said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Jet Airways gets 3 bidders including Hinduja Group, Dubai fund: Report
text: Jet Airways has got three bidders - Hinduja Group, Synergy Group and a Dubai-based fund, reports said. The Dubai fund may bid along with the Hinduja Group, which had previously shown interest in buying Jet but had backed out. Reportedly, Co-Chairman Gopichand Hinduja had earlier said that the group would buy Jet Airways "if indemnified from the airline's legal liabilities".
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: HDFC, subsidiary get approvals to acquire 51.2% stake in Apollo Munich
text: HDFC and its subsidiary HDFC ERGO have got approvals to acquire 51.2% stake in Apollo Munich Health Insurance for ₹1,347 crore and will merge it with HDFC ERGO. HDFC will buy 50.8% stake from Apollo Hospitals for ₹1,336 crore and 0.4% employees' stake for ₹10.84 crore. The acquisition of shares by HDFC is expected to be completed by January 9.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Kerala woman claims Anuradha Paudwal is her mom; files case & demands ₹50cr
text: A 45-year-old woman from Kerala has filed a case in the district family court, claiming she's the daughter of singer Anuradha Paudwal. She claimed Paudwal handed her over to her foster parents when she was four days old as she did not want to raise a child at the time. The woman has also sought a compensation of ₹50 crore.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: GoT actress Emilia Clarke visits India to celebrate New Year: Reports
text: 'Game of Thrones' actress Emilia Clarke is currently in India to celebrate New Year, as per reports. Photographer Viral Bhayani shared a picture of a woman standing in a queue and wrote, "Emilia Clarke snapped...at the Jaipur airport. She was snapped with her mom as she boarded a flight to Delhi." Emilia had previously visited India in August 2019.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Organiser calls off CAA protest at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, locals continue protest
text: Sharjeel Imam, one of the organisers of the anti-CAA protest at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, called off the protest on Thursday to avoid "impending violence from party goons and politicisation of the stage by parties". However, some locals refused to leave and said that the protest would continue. Locals have staged a sit-in against CAA in the area since December 15.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Reached out to nations on CAA, told them it doesn't alter Constitution: Govt
text: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said on Thursday that the government reached out to countries across the world on the issues of the Citizenship Amendment Act and the National Register of Citizens. "We emphasised that CAA just expedites consideration for Indian Citizenship to persecuted minorities...It doesn't change basic structure of the Constitution," he added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Australia's Kyrgios promises to donate ₹10,000 for every ace to bushfire victims
text: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios will donate AU$200 (around ₹10,000) for each ace he hits in tournaments this summer to the bushfire victims. Fellow Australians Alex de Minaur and John Millman pledged AU$250 and AU$100 per ace respectively. Kyrgios is one of the leading servers on the ATP Tour, averaging 16.6 aces per match in 2019.nn
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pakistani pacer celebrates wicket with throat-slashing gesture, gets criticised
text: Big Bash League side Melbourne Stars' Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf celebrated each of his three wickets against Sydney Thunder with throat-slashing gesture. "Throat-slashing celebration should have no place in a cricket ground. Someone needs to guide this young lad," a fan wrote reacting to the video of the celebration. Rauf has taken 10 wickets in 3 BBL matches.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Suzuki-led joint venture to invest ₹3,715 cr in 2nd phase of Guj battery plant
text: Japan's Suzuki Motor, Toshiba and Denso will jointly invest ₹3,715 crore in the second phase of their lithium-ion battery plant in Gujarat's Hansalpur, according to a company presentation seen by Livemint. Their joint venture, Automotive Electronics Power, is currently building the first phase at ₹1,214 crore. The first phase is expected to start production by end-2020, the presentation showed.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Big relief when PM Modi hugged me: ISRO chief K Sivan on Chandrayaan-2
text: ISRO Chairman K Sivan said that the hug by Prime Minister Narendra Modi after the space agency lost contact with Chandrayaan-2 lander 'Vikram' taught him many lessons. "PM understood what really happened in my mind. He showed leadership...It was a great thing that the Prime Minister himself consoled me. That gave us big relief," Sivan said in an interview.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Mangaluru Police to take Interpol's help to probe users inciting hatred online
text: The Mangaluru City Police will enlist the help of Interpol to investigate people who incite communal hatred on social media. Mangaluru Police Commissioner PS Harsha said several phone numbers of users sharing such posts are from abroad. "We want to enlist Interpol's help to issue lookout circulars, revoke passports of these persons living abroad and issue Letters Rogatory," he added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: What services can passengers avail by calling integrated Railway helpline 139?
text: Passengers will no longer have to call multiple numbers to seek assistance or register complaints as Railways has converted 139 into an integrated helpline number. Passengers can call 139 to get information related to tickets, train status and rail accidents, lodge complaints related to catering and corruption, and seek medical help. The helpline number is available in 12 languages.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Mufti's daughter says she was detained on way to grandad's grave; police deny
text: Iltija Mufti, the daughter of PDP President Mehbooba Mufti, said that she was detained at her residence after she tried to visit the grave of her grandfather and former J&K CM Mufti Mohammad Sayeed. However, ADGP (Law and Order) Munir Khan denied that Iltija was detained and said the Anantnag district administration did not give clearance for her visit.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 4.43 lakh rode B'luru Metro on New Year's Eve; 32,393 from 11.30 pm to 2 am
text: As many as 4,43,865 passengers rode Bengaluru Metro on the New Year's Eve. Out of this, 32,393 rode the Metro in the extended hours. The Metro timings were extended till 2 am on New Year's Eve to help revellers. Namma Metro is yet to see the ridership cross five lakh, the target it has set for itself.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kerala Assembly resolution against CAA has no legal validity: Guv
text: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Thursday said that the Kerala Assembly resolution demanding withdrawal of Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) has no legal or constitutional validity. "Citizenship is exclusively a central subject," he added. Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan had moved the resolution in the Assembly saying that the Assembly needs to keep Kerala's "tradition of inclusiveness alive".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 4 Goa Cong leaders resign, say party misleading minorities on CAA
text: Goa Congress' four leaders resigned from the party on Thursday saying that party was misleading minorities on the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) for "political mileage". After quitting the party, one of the four leaders said, "As an Opposition, we need to be critical and not just oppose something for the sake of opposing. The CAA needs to be welcomed."
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: We'll see new Grand Slam champion in 2020: World no. 4 Dominic Thiem
text: World number four Dominic Thiem has said that a new player will win a Grand Slam title in 2020 as the younger players are getting close to Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer. "I think we challenged them already a lot," he added. Last year, 26-year-old Thiem was the runner-up in the French Open.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Uncapped player called up for 3rd Test as NZ's Williamson falls sick
text: Ahead of the third Test against Australia, New Zealand have called up uncapped Glenn Phillips to their squad as the skipper Kane Williamson and batsman Henry Nicholls have fallen ill. Both the players were missing from practice sessions on Wednesday and Thursday. Phillips averages 42.54 from 23 first-class matches and recently scored 116 for New Zealand A against England.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Not performing to the standards, trying to improve: Jos Buttler
text: England wicketkeeper-batsman Jos Buttler has said that he's not performing to the standards and is "trying to improve" and "affect games in positive ways". In 2019, Buttler played 10 Tests and scored 502 runs at an average of 25.10, crossing fifty thrice. In 2018, he was the fifth-highest run-scorer in Tests, having scored 760 runs in same number of matches.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Xiaomi to invest $7 billion towards 5G, AI over next 5 years
text: Xiaomi's CEO Lei Jun has announced that the smartphone maker will invest more than $7 billion over the next five years towards enhancing its 5G, AI and IoT capabilities. Xiaomi plans to roll out more than 10 5G phone models in 2020, the company had said in 2019. The planned investment builds on Xiaomi's $1.4 billion "All in AIoT" strategy.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Don't politicise infant deaths in Rajasthan hospital: CM Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot tweeted, "The government is sensitive to the deaths of...infants at JK Lon Hospital, Kota (Rajasthan). There shouldn't be politics on this." Reportedly, 100 babies died at the hospital in December 2019. Earlier, UP CM Yogi Adityanath tweeted, "It's extremely sad that Congress President Sonia Gandhi...despite being a woman, could not understand the grief of mothers."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Friends, family main source of funding for Indian startups: RBI
text: An RBI survey has revealed that out of the 1,246 startups surveyed, nearly 43% of them said friends and family contributed the maximum amount of funds, compared to other sources. About 11.3% of the total startups raised funding from angel investors while 9.7% raised funding from incubators. Notably, 58% of respondents plan on getting listed on the Indian stock exchanges.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Dinosaurs shrank in size as they developed higher metabolism: Study
text: Chile University researchers claimed that dinosaurs shrank in size while adapting to have higher metabolism. This allowed dinosaurs to burn energy from food at a faster rate and help regulate their own body temperature, eventually paving the way for warm-blooded animals including humans. Metabolic rates rose steadily from early to mid-Jurassic period, around 180 million years ago, scientists said.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: We don't oppose any govt step to strengthen security: Cong on CDS
text: On the appointment of Bipin Rawat as the Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), Congress party said it doesn't oppose any step taken by the government to strengthen security of the country. "We only expect that he (Rawat) will fulfil his responsibilities as the chief of staff," a party spokesperson said. Earlier, Congress' Manish Tewari raised questions on the CDS appointment.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Uttarakhand's proposed tableau at Republic Day parade rejected
text: Uttarakhand's all three proposed tableau for this year's Republic Day parade on January 26 have been rejected, state Information Department Deputy Director KS Chauhan said. Reportedly, the state had proposed tableau with themes of Anduri Utsav (Butter Festival) of Uttarkashi region, Lakhamandal temple and water conservation. Tableau proposals of 16 states and Union Territories were shortlisted.
author: Shailesh

headlines: PM Modi inaugurates 5 Young Scientists Laboratories of DRDO
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated five Young Scientists Laboratories of Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) on Thursday. These labs are located in Bengaluru, Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata and Hyderabad. "These labs will help in preparing the nature of research and development in the field of emerging technologies in the country," PM Modi said at the event.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Manipur govt implements Inner Line Permit in state
text: Manipur state government implemented the Inner Line Permit (ILP) regime from January 1 in the entire state and the authorities have begun issuing the document. Any non-indigenous or non-permanent resident of Manipur will have to obtain ILP, which is an official travel document, to visit the state. Outside travellers to Nagaland, Mizoram, Arunachal Pradesh are also required to obtain ILP.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Jio may soon sell mutual funds, financial products via JioMoney: Report
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Jio may sell mutual funds and other financial products through its digital payments app JioMoney this year, reports said. The company has been testing the service among its employees for a couple of quarters and the system is still in its early stage. The report comes days after Jio announced the launch of online grocery platform JioMart.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Ranveer's pants tore at fest, I stitched it while people danced around me: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone revealed on The Kapil Sharma Show that she often carries her sewing kit while travelling with husband Ranveer Singh. Narrating an incident, Deepika said, "We were at a music festival in Barcelona. Ranveer was doing a weird dance step...[and] his pants had ripped." "I was stitching his pants while people danced around me," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Malaysian couple arrives at wedding reception in ambulance; criticised
text: A Malaysian couple was criticised on social media for arriving at their reception venue in an ambulance. In a video, the groom appeared to be dressed as a paramedic and was seen bringing the bride into the hall on a stretcher. An investigation revealed that the emergency vehicles were private ambulances and, therefore, didn't constitute abuse of public property.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: What does the word 'twenty-twenty' mean in English?
text: As per Merriam-Webster, one meaning of 'twenty-twenty' is associated with the human eye. It means "meeting a standard of normal visual acuity", for instance, "I had twenty-twenty vision". Another meaning is- "marked by facilely accurate discernment, judgement, or assessment". The idiom 'twenty-twenty hindsight' means "the full knowledge that one has about an event only after it has happened."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Why are you silent on Pak's atrocities on minorities: PM to Opp'n on CAA
text: Questioning the Opposition over their protest against CAA, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Pakistan was formed on the basis of religion, religious minorities were being persecuted there. Why are these people silent on Pakistan which committed atrocities against these people?" "If you have to raise slogans, do it to highlight the way minorities are being tortured in Pakistan," he added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Frustrating that local B'deshi players don't know English, they just nod: Gibbs
text: Bangladesh Premier League side Sylhet Thunder's head coach Herschelle Gibbs has said it's frustrating for him that a lot of local players don't understand English. Gibbs added, "Other day Rubel Mia was opening and he was on 14(28). I walked on to the field during time-out and said, ‘What's happening, you got 14(28)?'...in reply, he just shook his head!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Warner shares pic of a man and a dog looking at bushfires from beach
text: Australia opener David Warner took to social media to share a picture of a man and a dog sitting and looking at Australian bushfires. "I just saw this pic and I’m still in shock...These fires are beyond words. To every Firefighter, volunteer to every family, we are with you. You are the real heroes. You do us proud," he wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Welcome to the madness: Krunal Pandya to Nataša on getting engaged to Hardik
text: Cricketer Krunal Pandya took to Twitter to congratulate his brother Hardik and Nataša Stanković on getting engaged. "Big, big, congratulations @hardikpandya7 and Nataša...Nataša, we're so happy to have you join our crazy fam...Welcome to the madness!! Love both of you guys," he wrote. Hardik and Nataša got engaged in Dubai on January 1.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ab teri baari: Chahal trolls Kuldeep after Hardik Pandya gets engaged
text: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal trolled his fellow spinner Kuldeep Yadav after the latter congratulated Hardik Pandya on getting engaged to Serbian actress Nataša Stanković. Commenting on Kuldeep's reply, Chahal wrote, "Ab teri baari" followed by laughing emoji. Hardik and Nataša got engaged on a yacht in Dubai on Wednesday in presence of their close family and friends.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Husband didn't escape Japan in musical instrument box: Ex-Nissan chief's wife
text: Former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn's wife Carole described reports claiming her husband was carried out of his Tokyo home in a musical instrument box as "fiction". However, she declined to provide details of how her husband managed to leave Japan months before his trial. Ghosn, who fled to Lebanon, will speak to the media in capital Beirut on January 8.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: How are intense Australian bushfires creating their own weather?
text: Australia's Bureau of Meteorology detailed how widespread intense bushfires in Australia are creating their own weather. Bushfires generate 'pyrocumulonimbus' clouds and storms which can cause dangerous and unpredictable changes in fire behaviour, the bureau said. "These fire-induced storms can spread fires through lightning, lofting of embers and generation of severe wind outflows," it added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Indians study in IIT, go abroad & most of them start eating beef: Giriraj
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh has said that the Bhagavad Gita should be taught in schools to "teach students about our culture". "We send our children to missionary schools...they get through IIT...go abroad...most of them start eating beef...because we didn't teach them...traditional values," he added. "In a survey of 100 houses...Gita, Ramayana...found only in three houses," Giriraj further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 19-month-old son receives medal for firefighter father killed in Aus bushfires
text: The 19-month-old son of a firefighter killed in the Australian bushfires received a medal on behalf of his father on Thursday. Geoffrey Keaton was posthumously honoured for bravery and service, with the pin being pressed onto his son Harvey's Rural Fire Services shirt. Two other firefighters have lost their lives while battling the bushfires in Australia.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Taiwan's military chief among 8 people killed in helicopter crash
text: Taiwan's military chief General Shen Yi-ming is among eight people killed when their helicopter crashed in mountains near the capital Taipei on Thursday. The Black Hawk helicopter was carrying 13 people. The helicopter had left from Taipei to visit soldiers at an army base in the county of Yilan.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: What are the arguments made by Tata Sons against Mistry's reinstatement?
text: Tata Sons, in its petition to Supreme Court, has argued that Cyrus Mistry didn't seek reinstatement as Chairman but the NCLAT ordered it. He was fired because there was "an untenable trust deficit" between him and Tata Trusts, the petition said. It added the judgment is untenable in law and undermined "corporate democracy" and rights of the board of directors.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Actress Ihana Dhillon to feature in Devgn's 'Bhuj: The Pride of India'
text: Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Bhuj: The Pride of India' has roped in actress Ihana Dhillon to play Air Force officer. "Essaying [this] role...is...challenging...I'm...proud to be associated with this project," Ihana said. Earlier, sharing actor Ajay Devgn's first look from the film, director Abhishek Dudhaiya wrote, "It's a privilege to present @ajaydevgn sir's first look as Sq. Ld. Vijay Karnik."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Time really is flying: Saif on daughter Sara doing 'Love Aaj Kal 2'
text: Actor Saif Ali Khan, when asked how he feels about his daughter Sara Ali Khan doing the sequel of his film 'Love Aaj Kal', jokingly said, "Even I could have acted in ['Love Aaj Kal 2']." "I don't know how to feel about it...but...it's lovely and I wish her all the best," Saif stated. "Time really is flying," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: IIT Kanpur calling Faiz anti-Hindu is absurd and funny: Javed Akhtar
text: Javed Akhtar has said that IIT Kanpur calling Pakistani poet Faiz "anti-Hindu" is "absurd and funny". This comes after the institute set up a panel to decide if Faiz's poem 'Hum Dekhenge' hurts Hindu sentiments and its Deputy Director said that the poem could be "perceived as being anti-Hindu". It was recited at anti-CAA protests on December 17, 2019.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: UP govt adopted British ways to suppress anti-CAA satyagrahis: SP
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA and Leader of Opposition Ram Govind Chaudhary on Wednesday said that the rule of law and democracy has ended in Uttar Pradesh and the government has adopted British ways to suppress anti-CAA protesters who wanted freedom from "misgovernance". He also said that the state government should withdraw cases against the anti-CAA "satyagrahis".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Jose Mourinho gets yellow card for 'spying' on opponent
text: Tottenham manager Jose Mourinho was shown a yellow card after he went to the Southampton bench during their match on Wednesday. In a video that surfaced online, he was seen trying to look at Southampton's tactics that were being written down. On being asked about it, Mourinho said, "I was rude. But I was rude with an idiot."
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Arsenal manager Arteta earns 1st win as Gunners defeat Man Utd 2-0
text: Mikel Arteta has earned his first win as Arsenal manager after Gunners defeated Manchester United 2-0 on Wednesday. Playing their third game under Arteta, Nicolas Pepe and Sokratis Papastathopoulos scored the goals to secure Arsenal's first win in the last five games in Premier League. While the Gunners are now placed on the 10th spot, Manchester United are on fifth.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Sushil Kumar to miss trials for Olympic Qualifiers
text: Two-time Olympic medallist wrestler Sushil Kumar will miss the selection trials for the Tokyo Olympic Qualifiers event, scheduled to be held in China in March, reportedly due to a shoulder injury. Sushil had requested the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) to postpone the 74kg category trials scheduled this Friday. However, WFI president has said the trails will not be postponed.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Xiaomi in talks with ISRO to add chips for Indian version of GPS
text: Xiaomi is in advanced talks with ISRO to add NavIC chipsets, the Indian version of GPS, in its smartphones in India. The chips will be manufactured by Qualcomm and aim to provide accurate location data to users and distance of regions up to 1,500 km from India's boundary. Notably, last year, Qualcomm had tested processors that support NavIC, ISRO announced.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: 6 unicorns in India fired about 3,200 employees last year: Report
text: India's top six unicorns including Ola, Oyo and Zomato have laid off nearly 3,200 employees in 2019, a report by Livemint stated. Each of the six startups fired at least 500 employees reportedly in order to cut costs, restructure operations and due to funds shortage. Moreover, top 16 tech unicorns saw their losses increase by 80% year-on-year in FY 2019.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Northeast monsoon ends as India records 30% surplus rain
text: The Northeast monsoon ended with the season's total rainfall recorded remaining 30% surplus. Lakshadweep and Karnataka recorded 172% and 70% excess rainfall in particular while 27% excess rainfall was recorded in Kerala, till December end. India Meteorological Department recognizes October to December as the period for Northeast monsoon where rainfall is experienced over southern states of India.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Drug lord 'El Chapo' was once as powerful as prez: Mexico Prez
text: Mexico's President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said that there was a time when Mexican drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman was as powerful as the country's president at that time. He added, "That made it hard to punish those who had committed crimes. That is now history." Guzman was convicted of drug smuggling charges in the US last year.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Israel's PM seeks immunity from Parliament in corruption cases
text: Israel's PM Benjamin Netanyahu said that he will approach the Parliament to seek immunity from corruption charges that he termed as being fabricated. PM Netanyahu was charged by Israel's Attorney General Avichai Mandelblit with bribery, fraud and breach of trust in three different cases in November last year. Reportedly, immunity may delay the trial until after Israel's March general elections
author: Shailesh

headlines: Won’t extradite Carlos Ghosn if he arrives in country: France Minister
text: France's junior economy minister Agnès Pannier-Runacher has said that former Nissan Chief Carlos Ghosn, who holds French citizenship, won't be extradited if he arrives in the country. Ghosn fled Japan earlier this week to take refuge in Lebanon. Ghosn, who was arrested in 2018 for financial misconduct, was later released under bail conditions that he would not leave Japan.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Delhi Metro launches free WiFi services on Airport Express Line
text: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Thursday launched free high-speed WiFi services in train coaches on its Airport Express Line. "This is for the first time in India that the free WiFi facility on moving Metro Trains has been launched. Delhi Metro currently provides WiFi facility at many major stations, including those on yellow and blue lines," DMRC tweeted.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 1 firefighter dies in Delhi factory blaze and collapse, 12 other firefighters injured
text: A firefighter, who sustained injuries during the rescue operation after a battery manufacturing factory collapsed in Delhi's Peeragarhi, has died. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal condoled his death, tweeting, "Our firemen save their lives by putting their lives under extremely risky conditions. May his soul rest in peace." As many as 12 other firefighters were rescued and taken to hospital.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Their struggle begins where our dreams are fulfilled: Siddhant on nepotism
text: 'Gully Boy' actor Siddhant Chaturvedi responded to actress Ananya Panday's take on nepotism during an interview with Rajeev Masand. Ananya, daughter of actor Chunky Panday, said, "It isn't as easy as people say...My dad hasn't been in a...Dharma film. He has never been on 'Koffee with Karan'." "The difference is their struggle begins where our dreams are fulfilled," Siddhant replied.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: My dad never went on Koffee With Karan so it isn't as easy as people say: Ananya
text: During the Newcomers Roundtable 2019 hosted by Rajeev Masand, actress Ananya Panday talked about struggle while speaking on nepotism. "It isn't as easy as people say...My dad (Chunky Panday) hasn't been in a Dharma film. He hasn't been on 'Koffee with Karan'," she said. "Just because my father is an actor, I won't say no to an opportunity," Ananya added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Actress shows hands which had 'CAA', 'Unnao' written on them during interview
text: Actress Geetika Vidya Ohlyan, who starred in the 2018 film 'Soni', showed her hands which had 'CAA?', 'Unnao' and 'Jamia?' written on them during her appearance on Newcomers Roundtable 2019. The episode was recorded on the day the verdict on Unnao rape case was pronounced. "We hope we don't get disappointed more by...Unnao verdict...We hope the times improve," said Geetika.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Drunk driver 6 times over the limit caught with no front tyres, police share pics
text: The Greater Manchester Traffic Police caught a drunk driver after spotting his car which was missing both front tyres. The police reported that the unidentified motorist was "struggling to drive" and pulled over on a highway outside Bury. Sharing pictures on Twitter, the police wrote, "No surprise when the driver was arrested after providing a roadside breath test of 196!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Indian who hit ton in U-19 WC final banned from Ranji for 1 year for age fraud
text: Manjot Kalra, who slammed a hundred in 2018 Under-19 World Cup final, has been banned by Delhi and District Cricket Association Ombudsman for one year from playing in Ranji Trophy. Kalra has been suspended for an alleged age fraud during his Under-16 and Under-19 days. As per reports, Kalra is at least one year older than he claims to be.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Auto parts supplier Bosch India to fire 2,000 employees
text: The Indian unit of Germany's Robert Bosch, the world's largest auto parts supplier, said it will cut about 2,000 jobs in the next four years. About 10% of 3,700 white-collar jobs and 26% of 6,300 blue-collar jobs will be cut, Bosch India MD Soumitra Bhattacharya said. The company expects auto sales to only recover in the next two-three years.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: High-phosphorus lakes likely gave birth to all life on Earth: Study
text: Washington University researchers claimed that lakes rich in phosphorus, one of the six main chemical elements of life, likely gave birth to all life on Earth. "Extremely high phosphate levels...would've driven reactions that put phosphorus into molecular building blocks of RNA, proteins and fats," a researcher said. Researchers examined water from carbon-rich lakes in India, the US and Kenya.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 14 people, including 13 firefighters, injured in Delhi factory collapse
text: At least 14 people, including 13 firefighters, were injured after a battery manufacturing factory collapsed in Delhi's Peeragarhi on Thursday, following a fire break out. "Those injured...taken to Sanjay Gandhi hospital and Balaji Action hospital," an official added. The fire services personnel received a call around 4.30 am and later, an explosion led to the collapse of the factory.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 30 vehicles collide into each other on Jaipur-Delhi highway due to dense fog
text: Around 12 people have been injured after over 30 vehicles collided on Jaipur-Delhi National Highway due to low visibility caused by dense fog on Thursday morning. The incident took place in Dooghera in Rajasthan's Alwar district. The injured have been shifted to the hospital and the damaged vehicles are being removed from the road.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 30-yr-old woman doctor secretly filmed inside hospital changing room by cleaner
text: Police on Wednesday arrested a Mumbai hospital's employee, who worked as a cleaner, for allegedly filming a 30-year-old plastic surgeon in a changing room. The doctor said she spotted a mobile phone with the camera facing towards her in the room and found out that its video recording mode was on. She informed her superiors, who called the police.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Internet services restored in Kashmir's 80 govt hospitals: Official
text: Broadband high-speed internet connectivity has been restored at 80 government hospitals, including health centres and offices linked to the department of health, across Kashmir on Thursday, an official said. This comes after the government restored mobile messaging services in Kashmir nearly five months after its suspension. Internet services were suspended in the Valley on the night of August 4.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Where will they go, to Italy: Minister on non-Muslims from Pak, B'desh
text: Amid criticism over the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Union Minister G Kishan Reddy said that it is India's "moral responsibility to give citizenship" to the minorities in neighbouring Muslim countries, namely, Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. "If they don't come to India, where will they go? To Italy? Italy will not accept Hindus or Sikhs as they are poor people," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Delhi man fined for riding without helmet sets bike on fire, arrested
text: A 20-year-old man on Wednesday set his motorcycle on fire after he was challaned in Delhi's Greater Kailash area for riding without a helmet. The traffic police had impounded the motorcycle of Vikas who is a resident of Delhi's Sangam Vihar. Delhi Deputy Commissioner of Police (South) said that he was later arrested.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: New Zealand glaciers turn brown due to Australian bushfires
text: Pictures on social media showed glaciers in New Zealand turning brown due to the smoke from the bushfires in Australia. "Smoke which has travelled around 2,000 km across the Tasman Sea can clearly be seen," New Zealand's official forecaster MetService tweeted. At least 18 people in Australia are confirmed to have been killed by the bushfires which began in September.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Fertilizer firm with ₹750 crore profit told to pay ₹15,000 crore telecom dues
text: Gujarat Narmada Valley Fertilizers & Chemicals (GNFC) on Wednesday said the Telecom Ministry has ordered it to pay ₹15,020 crore in overdue fees by January 23. The dues pertain to licences for satellite phones and Internet services the company held between 2005 to 2019. The amount sought is 20 times Gujarat Narmada's nearly ₹750 crore consolidated net profit for 2018-19.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Like marriage, you can't cheat on your diet and expect it to work: Shilpa
text: On Kareena Kapoor Khan's radio show 'What Women Want', Shilpa Shetty compared diet to marriage and said that "you can't cheat on your diet, it's like a marriage". "You can't cheat on your marriage...expect it to work," she added. Shilpa further said that people try to get fit by "getting gym memberships and working out, but neglect their diet".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 'Good Newwz' becomes Akshay's 6th consecutive film to cross ₹100 cr
text: Akshay Kumar's 'Good Newwz', which also stars Kareena Kapoor, Kiara Advani and Diljit Dosanjh, has become his sixth consecutive film to cross ₹100 crore at the box office. "#GoodNewwz is 100 Not Out...Total: ₹117.10 cr," trade analyst Taran Adarsh tweeted. 'Housefull 4', 'Mission Mangal', 'Kesari', 'Gold' and 'Housefull 3' were his last releases to cross ₹100 crore box office mark.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: You have woken up the entire country: Swara Bhaskar to Jamia students
text: Actress Swara Bhaskar on Wednesday joined the students of Jamia Millia Islamia university who are protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 (CAA). "We've woken up late but now we've woken up. You have woken up the entire country," she said to the students. Swara added that CAA is a "targeted" law and an "attack on the Constitution of India".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Vadodara Police to recover damages from anti-CAA protesters
text: Vadodara Police has said that it will recover damages to public property during anti-CAA protests last month in its area from the guilty. Vadodara Police Commissioner Anupam Singh Gahlaut said that the damage was around ₹40,000 due to stone-pelting by protesters. He also said that the police will approach the court to recover the amount.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 2020 is about Tokyo Olympics, it's the ultimate aim: PV Sindhu
text: Talking about tournaments in 2020, world number six PV Sindhu said that the year is about Tokyo Olympics. Sindhu, who won silver in 2016 Rio Olympics, said that every year she's "improving step by step" and she has been working on all her strokes. In 2019, Sindhu became the first Indian to win gold at the BWF World Badminton Championships.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Apple signs new deal with its former graphics chip designer
text: UK-based chipmaker Imagination Technologies Group, which designed graphics chips for Apple until 2017, has struck a multi-year deal with the tech firm. Imagination used to make Graphics Processing Units (GPU) for iPhones and iPads until Apple decided to make its own GPUs starting with iPhone X. Under the deal, Apple will use Imagination's intellectual property in exchange for license fees.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Startups write to finance min seeking equal tax advantage as global tech firms
text: Online community Local Circles wrote a letter to CBDT and finance ministry on behalf of Indian startups demanding equal tax advantages as other tech giants. The letter seeks parity on permanent establishment rules because global firms pay only 10% tax on total revenue as they structure their investments through subsidiaries outside India. However, Indian startups have to pay 35% tax.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Only 13% Indian startups among 1,246 got foreign funding: RBI
text: RBI's pilot survey on the Indian startup sector between November 2018 and April 2019, covering 1,246 startups, revealed that only 13.2% of the startups received international funding. Families and friends emerged as the largest source of funding, at about 43%. Separately, around 36% of the startups availed institutional loans to finance their activities, the survey added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Chennai fashion startup Fashor raises $1 mn led by Sprout Venture Partners
text: Chennai-based fashion startup Fashor has raised $1 million in a Pre-Series A funding round led by Sprout Venture Partners. The round also saw participation from IP Ventures and Venture Catalysts. Founded by Vikram Kankaria and Priyanka Kankaria, Fashor had raised seed funding from Venture Catalysts in 2019, making its total amount raised to about $1.8 million, as per Crunchbase.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: At least 21 dead in Indonesia floods, over 62,000 evacuated
text: At least 21 people have died in Indonesia after heavy rainfall flooded the country's capital Jakarta and nearby areas, authorities said. Over 62,000 people have been evacuated in Jakarta alone, disaster mitigation agency spokesman Agus Wibowo said. Indonesia President Joko Widodo said the delay in land acquisition had hampered the building of flood control infrastructure since 2017.
author: Shailesh

headlines: People including firefighters trapped as burning Delhi factory collapses after blast
text: A fire broke out at a factory in Delhi's Peeragarhi on Thursday morning, which further led to a blast at the premises during rescue operations. Several people, including fire brigade personnel got trapped after the factory building collapsed following the blast. Meanwhile, efforts to rescue the people are underway.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: This wasn't forced upon me: Actress on criticism for wearing veil on wedding
text: Television actress Mohena Kumari has responded to an Instagram user who criticised her for wearing a veil in a picture from her Rajput wedding. A user had commented, "Why is your face under veil?", to which another user replied, "Because these are people who follow...male dominated rituals." "It's an age-old Rajput tradition...This wasn't forced upon me," Mohena responded.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Rajkummar shares look dressed as woman for film; fans mistake him for Alia
text: Actor Rajkummar Rao on Wednesday took to social media to share two looks from his upcoming film 'Ludo', directed by Anurag Basu. One of the looks shows him sporting a drag look, dressed in ghagra-choli with long hair. While several users commented, "I thought it's Alia Bhatt", some users also said he is looking like Kriti Sanon.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Ranveer rents flat in Deepika's building for ₹7.25 lakh per month: Report
text: Actor Ranveer Singh has rented a flat in Beaumonde Towers in Mumbai for three years, as per an Indian Express report. He'll be paying rent of ₹7.25 lakh per month for the first 2 years and ₹7.97 lakh per month for the last 12 months, the report stated. Ranveer's wife, actress Deepika Padukone, owns a 4BHK flat in the building.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Actress with role in 'Captain America' charged with killing her mother
text: Actress Mollie Fitzgerald, who appeared in 'Captain America: The First Avenger', was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly killing her 68-year-old mother on December 20 at her home in Kansas' Olathe, US. Mollie has reportedly been jailed on $500,000 bond and charged with second-degree murder. As per Olathe Police, the victim had a stab wound and "was pronounced deceased on scene".
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Was worried about my 1-yr-old baby: UP activist released 2 weeks after protests
text: Mother of a one-year-old girl, who had to stay with her relatives after both her parents were arrested during anti-CAA protests in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, has been released after almost two weeks in jail. "She's dependent on my milk, I was worried about her. It was...tough for me," the woman activist said. There's no information on her husband's release yet.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Global tech event CES invites Ivanka Trump as speaker, criticised
text: Consumer Electronics Show (CES), one of world's biggest annual technology conference in Las Vegas, was heavily criticised after it named US President Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump as keynote speaker. Technology experts claimed that several women in technology trumped Ivanka's limited experience in the field. CES has been accused of overlooking the role of women in technology several times.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: What is 'anti-robocall' US TRACED Act which Trump signed into law?
text: US President Donald Trump signed the TRACED Act against illegal robocalls into law on the last day of 2019. The law extends US agency FCC's statute of limitations on robocall offences and increases potential fines to up to $10,000 per call (over ₹7 lakh). It also comprises provisions to curb 'spoofing' calls to look like they come from genuine numbers.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Volkswagen's Bentley may launch its first all-electric car in 2025
text: Volkswagen Group's ultra-luxury car brand Bentley Motors' Chairman and CEO Adrian Hallmark said that the automaker's first all-electric car could roll out as soon as 2025. In a recent interview about the company's long-term plans, Hallmark said, "It's all about electrification." Notably, Bentley unveiled its first hybrid car, the Bentayga Hybrid, at the 2018 Geneva Motor Show.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: US to probe if 'Autopilot' was on in Tesla car crash that killed 2
text: US auto-safety regulator NHTSA said it's investigating an accident involving a high-speeding Tesla Model S from December 29, 2019, which killed two people in the other car. The two occupants inside the Tesla car, which is being probed for likely 'Autopilot' use, sustained non-life threatening injuries. NHTSA initiated probes in 13 past cases involving Tesla vehicles likely involving Autopilot use.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: There will be over 25 space missions this year: ISRO Chief K Sivan
text: ISRO Chairman K Sivan said that the nation will have more than 25 space missions this year. "2020 will be the year of Chandrayaan-3 and Gaganyaan," Sivan said on India's third Moon mission and its first-ever human space mission. "The missions that were planned in 2019 and couldn't be completed would be finished by March this year," he added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Letter shows CDS Rawat saying Army better than Air Force, PIB calls it fake
text: Press Information Bureau (PIB) of India has busted a fake letter purportedly written by the Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat. The letter claims him as saying that he will "try to run Navy, Air Force on Army Lines". "I feel we defend our country...more professionally [than] Air Forces," the letter, undersigned by General Rawat, further reads.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Centre implements 'One Nation One Ration Card' scheme in 12 states
text: Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan has said that ''One Nation One Ration Card'' scheme has been implemented in 12 states, effective from Wednesday. Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Haryana, Madhya Pradesh, Tripura are some of the states where the scheme has been implemented. Under this scheme, beneficiaries can buy subsidised food grains from ration shops in any of these 12 states.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: They saw our faces & wrote we're Nepali: H'yana sisters on being denied passport
text: A woman in Haryana's Ambala said she and her sister were denied passports by the concerned authorities in Chandigarh, citing that they looked like Nepali. "They saw our faces and wrote that we're Nepali," she recalled, adding that the authorities started processing their passports after she took the matter to Minister Anil Vij. Ambala Police said they're investigating the matter.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Liquor worth ₹380 cr sold on New Year's eve in Telangana
text: Despite the hike in prices by 10%, liquor worth ₹380 crore were sold in Telangana on Monday and Tuesday owing to New Year's eve, officials said. As against the daily liquor sale of ₹60 crore, these two days witnessed sales worth around ₹200 crore each. Notably, liquor shops were allowed to sell liquor till 1 am on New Year's eve.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: PM Modi phones 5 neighbouring nations to wish on New Year Day; skips Pak, China
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday made separate phone calls to leaders of Bhutan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal and the Maldives to convey his New Year greetings. PM Modi focused on the "vision of shared peace, security, prosperity and progress for all of India's friends...in the region," a government statement read. However, no calls were made to Pakistan and China.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Pak refugee denied permission to appear in class 12 exams in Rajasthan
text: Pakistani refugee girl Dami Kohli was allegedly asked to provide eligibility certificate by the Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education in order to appear for her 12th standard board examination.  The state board allegedly rejected her examination form because she had cleared her 10th standard from Pakistan. State Education Minister said she would be allowed to appear for the examination.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Irresponsible: Pak on new Indian Army chief's 'preemptive strike on terror' remark
text: Reacting to Indian Army chief MM Naravane's remarks, Pakistan said, "We reject the new Indian Army Chief's irresponsible statement regarding preemptive strikes across the LoC." Giving examples of Balakot and surgical strikes, General Naravane had said, "If Pakistan doesn't stop its policy of state-sponsored terrorism, we reserve the right to preemptively strike at the sources of terror threat."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Viral sex chat video with my pic & woman's voice is edited: Noida policeman
text: After a purported video of his sex chat surfaced on social media, Noida SSP Vaibhav Krishna said the video having his picture and a woman's voice in the background is "morphed". "I myself have studied the video that is viral on social media. It appears that it is a conspiracy by criminal elements to damage my personal image," he stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Centre rejects West Bengal's tableau proposal for Republic Day parade
text: Union Ministry of Defence on Wednesday rejected West Bengal's tableau proposal for the Republic Day parade on January 26. The proposals of 16 states and Union Territories and six ministries/departments have been shortlisted to take part in this year's parade. The Centre received a total of 56 tableaux proposals from states and departments.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Tata Sons moves SC against Cyrus Mistry's reappointment as Executive Chairman
text: Tata Sons has approached the Supreme Court against Cyrus Mistry's reappointment as the Executive Chairman of the company by the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT). The tribunal in December had ruled that his ouster in 2016 was illegal. Mistry had taken over as Tata Sons' sixth chairman in 2012 after Ratan Tata announced his retirement.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Want to push Batman's character as far as possible: Robert Pattinson
text: Robert Pattinson, who'll play the titular role in 'The Batman', has said that he wants to push the Batman's character "as far as it can possibly go". "You can do crazy stuff with that part," he added. Making a case for an R-rated version of the film, Pattinson further said, "You're freed up to do so much stuff."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I treat them as an equal: Dibakar on directing kids in 'Ghost Stories'
text: When asked if directing kids in 'Ghost Stories' was challenging, director Dibakar Banerjee said, "[A] child is an adult with...undeveloped mind and past...they can make...same connections as anyone of us." "On set, I treat them as an equal, and that...[brings] a lot of change," Dibakar said. "Being an involved parent, I knew [some] talking points, so it was...smooth," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Kevin Spacey settles sexual assault case after accuser's death
text: American actor Kevin Spacey has settled the sexual harassment case brought against him by an anonymous massage therapist who died in September 2019. The settlement terms between Spacey and the accuser's son hasn't been revealed and a judge is yet to sign the same. The accuser had alleged that the actor forcibly grabbed his genitals during a massage session.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Hope to see change for acid attack survivors with 'Chhapaak': Deepika
text: Calling cinema "a powerful medium" that can impact society, actress Deepika Padukone said that she hopes 'Chhapaak' will bring about "change for ourselves as a society and for acid attack survivors". "If we don't, then we've done something wrong as a society," she further said. "I hope we won't have to constantly tell stories on...survivors...to see change," Deepika added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Delhi fintech startup WealthBucket raises ₹18 crore in pre-Series A
text: New Delhi-based fintech platform WealthBucket has raised ₹18 crore in a pre-Series A round of funding from NorthStar Ventures and a few other high net worth individuals (HNIs). Devnagri Founder Vinod Khatumal also participated in the round. Founded by Himanshu Jain and Pulkit Jain, WealthBucket is an online marketplace that provides mutual funds investment options and other investment tools.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: IIT Kanpur panel to decide if Faiz's poem hurts Hindu sentiments
text: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kanpur has set up a panel to decide if Pakistani poet Faiz Ahmed Faiz's poem 'Hum Dekhenge' hurts Hindu sentiments. This comes after some students sung the poem at a protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act on December 17. The complaint objects to two lines, "Bas naam rahega Allah ka" and "Jab arz-e-Khuda ke...uthwaye jayenge".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Coal power plants around Delhi running despite missing emissions deadline
text: Coal-fired power plants around Delhi were still operating on Wednesday despite threats from authorities to close them down if they had not installed equipment to cut emissions of sulfur oxides by December 31. Only one out of the 11 utilities in the region had installed the equipment. Private producers like Vedanta and L&T argued for another extension to the deadline.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Who is Hardik Pandya's fiancée Nataša Stanković?
text: Cricketer Hardik Pandya got engaged to Nataša Stanković on January 1. Nataša is a Mumbai-based model, actress and dancer, who was born in Serbia on March 4, 1992. Nataša came to Mumbai in 2012 and was first seen in a song titled 'Aiyo Ji' in Prakash Jha directorial Satyagraha. She rose to fame with Badshah's music video DJ Wale Babu.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: US mom gifts doll to daughter on X-mas, later discovers it's stuffed with cocaine
text: Elizabeth Faidley from US has written in a December 2019 Facebook post that she gifted a doll to her daughter for Christmas in 2015, and later discovered it was stuffed with cocaine. This was discovered after Elizabeth sent the doll to a 'doll hospital' to alter its appearance. Elizabeth said a detective later called her and informed her about it.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 30 animals killed in fire at German zoo on New Year's Eve
text: More than 30 animals were killed after a fire destroyed a monkey house at a German zoo on New Year's Eve. Orangutans, chimpanzees, marmosets and a gorilla were among the animals who died, while two chimpanzees had survived. Police said that the fire may have been caused by sky lanterns lit to celebrate the New Year.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Shane Warne gave 150 runs, took only Shastri's wicket on Test debut
text: Former Australian leg-spinner Shane Warne was smashed for 150 runs by the Indian batsmen in his debut Test, which started on January 2, 1992, in Sydney. Ravi Shastri, who slammed 206 runs off 477 balls, was Warne's only dismissal in the match. Warne went on to take 708 wickets in Test cricket, the highest by any Australian bowler.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Paine's captaincy has been excellent, no change in Australia leadership: Langer
text: On being asked if Tim Paine would remain captain if Australia reach the final of the ICC World Test Championship, Australia coach Justin Langer said, "I hope he plays as long as he possibly can because his leadership's been brilliant." He added, "He is the best wicketkeeper in the world and he's as fit as anyone in the group."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: PCB withdraw Naseem from U-19 WC squad to give opportunity to another player
text: Pakistan Cricket Board have withdrawn 16-year-old fast bowler Naseem Shah from the country's Under-19 World Cup squad "to provide opportunity to another promising cricketer". "Naseem has recently broken that glass ceiling and has established his credentials as an international cricketer," PCB CEO Wasim Khan said. Naseem has been replaced by Mohammad Wasim Junior from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Google claims its new AI beats experts at spotting breast cancer
text: Technology giant Google announced its new AI breast cancer detection system, which it claimed has greater accuracy than experts. The AI system outperformed specialists by spotting cancers which the radiologists missed in the mammograms while ignoring what they falsely flagged as potential tumours. Google said the model, when making its decisions, received less information than human experts.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 246 witnesses named in 1st chargesheet filed in Kerala cyanide murder case
text: The Special Investigation Team probing the deaths of six members of a family in Kerala submitted the chargesheet in the murder of Roy Thomas. His wife Jolly Joseph has been named as the main accused and the chargesheet lists 246 witnesses, including Joseph's two children. Joseph had confessed to killing six family members using cyanide in 14 years.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Consumers can get all free-to-air channels at ₹160 per month from March
text: TRAI on Wednesday capped the amount that consumers have to pay monthly for all free-to-air channels combined at ₹160. It also increased the number of free-to-air standard definition channels to be provided at ₹130 to 200 from the current 100. Further, only those priced at ₹12 or less will be permitted to be part of bouquets offered by broadcasters.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: RBI launches MANI app to help visually impaired identify currency notes
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday launched the MANI (Mobile Aided Note Identifier) mobile app to help visually-impaired people identify the denomination of currency notes. The app can scan the notes using the phone's camera and give audio output in Hindi and English. It is available on both Google Play and the Apple's App Store.n
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Kota hospital death toll rises to 100 after 9 more newborns die in 2 days
text: At least nine more infants died in the last two days of December 2019 at the JK Lon Hospital in Rajasthan's Kota, with the death toll rising to 100 in the month. A Rajasthan government committee ruled that the infants were given the right treatment. The children died mainly due to low birth weight, the hospital's superintendent said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Congress leader arrested over speech calling for PM Modi, Amit Shah's murder
text: Congress leader and Tamil author Nellai Kannan was arrested on Wednesday over his speech wherein he'd called for PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah's murder. Kannan's arrest came after BJP leaders staged protests in Chennai demanding his arrest. "If Shah is finished off, Modi is finished too. But no one of you are doing it," Kannan had said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Twitter user asks PM Modi to follow him, PM Modi replies 'done so'
text: A Twitter user named Ankit Dubey on Tuesday requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to follow him back as a "gift" saying he was a big fan of him. PM Modi then followed the user today and replied, "Done so. Have a great year ahead." PM Modi followed several people on Twitter on Wednesday, including some journalists.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: If you were logical, you'd see your crimes made nations hate you: Iran to Trump
text: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei criticised the US' air strikes against Iran-backed militia. "If you were logical, which you're not, you'd see your crimes in Iraq, Afghanistan...made nations hate you," Khamenei told US President Donald Trump. "You can't do anything," he further said after Trump threatened to make Iran pay for any attack on the US' embassy in Iraq.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Taiwan rejects China's offer to unify under Hong Kong model
text: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen has rejected China's offer to unify under the 'one country, two systems' model, saying such an arrangement had failed in Hong Kong. The model's credibility has been tarnished by the Chinese government's abuse of power, Tsai added. China claims Taiwan as part of its territory, but the island has been independently ruled since 1949.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Jamia students' alumni association protests against CAA, NRC, NPR
text: Delhi's Jamia Millia Islamia University students' alumni association participated in a candlelight protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), the National Register for Citizens (NRC) and the National Population Register (NPR). "Alumni from across the country have gathered and we urged others to support us," an alumnus said. Protests in the university erupted after the enactment of CAA.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Angelo Mathews returns to Sri Lanka's T20I squad for India tour
text: Sri Lanka have named 16-member squad for the upcoming three-match T20I series against India this month. Veteran all-rounder Angelo Mathews has made a comeback to the shortest format of the game after almost 16 months. The series will begin from Guwahati on January 5 with the second and third T20Is scheduled on January 7 and 10 respectively.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Archer misses bowling practice due to injury ahead of 2nd Test vs SA
text: England fast bowler Jofra Archer missed the practice on Wednesday due to a sore right elbow. Archer, who finished the first Test against South Africa with match figures of 6-167, might miss the second Test due to this, reports claimed. The 24-year-old took 30 wickets in seven Test matches in 2019, becoming the second-highest wicket-taker for England for the year.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: CBI arrests DRI ADG Chander Shekhar in ₹25 lakh bribery case
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday arrested an Additional Director General of Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) Chander Shekhar and a middleman in connection with ₹25 lakh bribery case, officials said. The agency arrested the middleman while he was allegedly receiving the bribe on behalf of the officer, officials added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Redress Armed Forces personnel's complaints on priority: Haryana govt
text: Haryana government has issued an order directing departments to redress complaints of members of serving Indian Armed Forces and paramilitary personnel on "high priority". "When a soldier or his family member approaches government office, they should be treated with love and respect," the order said. "This will ensure that soldier is care free from his family problems," the order added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 150 BJP leaders detained for protest demanding arrest of TN author
text: Tamil Nadu Police detained around 150 BJP workers including H Raja, La Ganesan, Pon Radhakrishnan, and CP Radhakrishnan on Wednesday when they were protesting on Marina Beach. The protesters were demanding arrest of Tamil author Nellai Kannan for his remarks against PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah. Kannan had made the remarks during an anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act meeting.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Mixed-sex civil partnerships come into effect in England and Wales
text: Civil partnerships for mixed-sex couples came into effect from Tuesday in England and Wales, which offer similar rights as marriage. The registration of intent for it began on December 2, 2019, with a minimum notice period of 28 days. Earlier, only same-sex couples could be civil partners after it was introduced in 2005.nn
author: Shailesh

headlines: Iraqi militias protesting outside US embassy left: Iraqi military
text: Members of Iraqi militias and their supporters who were protesting outside the US embassy in Iraq have withdrawn, the Iraqi military said. "Tents dismantled, and other forms of demonstration that accompanied these protests have ended and Iraqi security forces have completely secured the embassy perimeter," it added. Violent protests erupted outside the embassy after US strikes on a militia group.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Death toll in Australia's bushfires rises to at least 18
text: The death toll in this season of Australia's bushfires rose to at least 18 people while several others were missing, media reports said. Recently, the Australian government deployed the military for rescue and relief efforts including supplying essentials to areas cut-off due to fires. Thousands of people have remained stranded after fires forced the closure of major roads.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Walmart India appoints Sameer Aggarwal as Deputy CEO
text: Walmart India has promoted Sameer Aggarwal to the post of Deputy CEO, which will come into effect from January 1. Aggarwal was previously Walmart India's Chief Business Officer for over a year and had joined the company in 2018 as EVP, Chief Strategy and Administrative Officer. He will report to Krish Iyer, the President and CEO of Walmart India.nn
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Hero Electric puts ₹700 cr investment on hold after FAME II fails to deliver
text: Hero Electric has put its ₹700 crore investment on hold for a year after its scheme to push EVs in India called FAME II failed to take off. Sale of FAME II-qualified two-wheeler EVs fell by 93.5% to 3,000 units in April-December 2019. Hero was planning to invest the amount to increase the production of two-wheeler EVs by five times.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Hardik gets engaged in Dubai hours after making relationship public, shares pics
text: All-rounder Hardik Pandya got engaged to Mumbai-based Serbian actress Nataša Stanković in Dubai on Wednesday, hours after making his relationship public. The 26-year-old shared pictures and a video, which showed the couple on a boat with performers singing Bollywood song 'Sun Mere Humsafar' in background. "Mai tera, Tu meri jaane, saara Hindustan. 01.01.2020," Hardik captioned his Instagram post.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Neena Gupta starrer film eligible to contend for Best Picture at Oscars 2020
text: Vikas Khanna directorial 'The Last Color', starring actress Neena Gupta, has made it to the list of feature films that are eligible to contend for Best Picture at the 92nd Academy Awards.
