Sharing the news, Vikas wrote, "I need sometime to absorb this. Holyyyyy Godddd." The film portrays the lives of widows in Varanasi.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: What a pleasant surprise: Kohli congratulates Pandya on getting engaged
text: Congratulating all-rounder Hardik Pandya on getting engaged to Serbian actress Nataša Stanković, India captain Virat Kohli wrote on Hardik's Instagram post, "Congratulations H. What a pleasant surprise. Wish you guys great times ahead. God Bless." Hardik and Nataša got engaged today on a yacht in Dubai. Nataša has worked in Indian reality shows like Bigg Boss and Nach Baliye.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I'd swap everything that happened to me in 2019 for my dad to be healthy: Stokes
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes said he's finding it "quite hard" to sum up 2019. "To see out the year with my dad in hospital has put things into perspective," Stokes said. He added, "If someone could say 'I’ll take everything away from you that happened [in 2019]...but your dad's happy, healthy and watching you play'...then I’d say yeah, swap it."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Michael Vaughan shares pic of Australian bushfire, says 'thinking of all affected'
text: Former England captain Michael Vaughan took to Instagram to share a picture from Australian bushfire. The picture taken by Sydney-based photographer Matthew Abbott shows a kangaroo jumping with fire in the background. "The bravery being shown by the firefighters is beyond human bravery...Thinking of all affected!" he wrote. "My last day of the decade felt like the apocalypse," Matthew wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Nataša Stanković shares video of Hardik Pandya proposing to her on yacht in Dubai
text: All-rounder Hardik Pandya's fiancée Nataša Stanković took to Instagram to share a video of the cricketer proposing to her on a yacht in Dubai. In the video, Hardik can be seen going down on one knee and putting a ring on Nataša's finger. "Forever yes," Nataša captioned the post. Hardik and Nataša got engaged today.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I hope it rains in Sydney during NZ Test, Sydney needs the rain: Langer
text: Referring to the bushfires ahead of the Sydney Test against New Zealand, Australia head coach Justin Langer said, "It will be the first time I'll ever say this in my life, but I hope it rains a bit during the Test because Sydney needs it." He added, "I hope it rains at night so we can keep playing."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Palau world's 1st country to ban toxic sunscreen products to protect coral reefs
text: The Pacific nation of Palau has become the world's first country to ban toxic sunscreen products in an effort to protect its coral reefs. The ban restricts the sale and use of sunscreen products that contain ten different chemicals, including oxybenzone and octinoxate, which are harmful to corals and marine life. Stores selling them will face fines of $1,000.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 1,200-year-old gold coins found in ancient 'piggy bank' in Israel
text: Archaeologists found 1,200-year-old 'Early Islamic Period' gold coins in an ancient 'piggy bank', a small clay juglet discovered in Israel on the Jewish festival Hanukkah's fourth day. Among the coins was a gold Dinar from the reign of the Caliph 'Harun al-Rashid', on whom the 'Arabian Nights' story is based. The coins were likely a potter's personal savings, archaeologists suggested.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Bangladesh reverses decision to suspend telecom services along India border
text: The Bangladesh government has revoked its decision to suspend telecom services along the border with India. A Bangladeshi official had said the Bangladeshi government had taken the decision over concerns that Indian Muslims might seek to enter Bangladesh following CAA's enactment. The decision had affected about one crore users in 32 districts that share a border with India and Myanmar.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: What happens if the FASTag reading machine is faulty?
text: If the FASTag reading machine is non-functional at a toll plaza, users will be allowed to pass through without having to pay any fee provided they have a valid and functional FASTag. Such vehicles will also be issued a zero transaction receipt. FASTag, which is affixed on the windscreen of the vehicles, is mandatory on national highways from January 15.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: NASA satellite captures picture of 'Marree Man' artwork in Australia
text: NASA shared a new picture of 'Marree Man' artwork in South Australia taken by the Operational Land Imager satellite. It was discovered for the first time in 1998 by a pilot flying over the outback territory north of Adelaide. The 3.5-kilometre tall figure is believed to depict an Aboriginal hunter and it remains unclear who created the artwork and why.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pope apologises for slapping hand of woman who pulled him towards her
text: Pope Francis on Wednesday apologised for slapping a woman's hand as he attempted to free himself from her grip. The Pope was turning away after greeting a crowd when the woman pulled him towards her. "We lose patience many times. It happens to me too. I apologise for the bad example given yesterday," he said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Anand Mahindra babysits his grandson on New Year's Eve, shares pic
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Wednesday revealed that he and his wife spent New Year's Eve babysitting their grandson. Sharing a picture on Twitter, the billionaire wrote, "Some asked how I spent my New Year's Eve. Well not with much noise or fireworks...But I can't remember a better-spent & happier New Year's eve! I guess you mellow with age!"
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Pakistan should learn from BCCI: Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar
text: Days after former Pakistan cricket team captain Javed Miandad said that ICC should declare India unsafe for foreign tours, India captain Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma termed Pakistan "desperate" and added that, "We have no intention to tell any nation whether to play or [not] play in Pakistan." "They should learn from BCCI how to manage cricket," he stated.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Pakistan to host all PSL 2020 fixtures for the 1st time
text: Pakistan will host all the matches of the Pakistan Super League (PSL) for the first time since its inception in 2015. The T20 competition will begin from February 20 with the final scheduled on March 22. While the first season of PSL was entirely held in UAE, matches in all seasons since then were held in both Pakistan and UAE.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Venus Williams pulls out of Brisbane International
text: Seven-time Grand Slam Champion Venus Williams has pulled out of the season-opening Brisbane International following a "setback" in training. Williams was given a wild card for the Brisbane event which starts from January 6 and features world number one Ashleigh Barty and 2019 Australian Open champion Naomi Osaka. Tournament organisers will name a replacement for Williams on Thursday.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: 2,300 Google cafeteria workers in US form union claiming they're underpaid
text: Around 2,300 cafeteria workers at Google offices across San Francisco have unionised, which has been in the works for two years, claiming that they're overworked and underpaid. The workers added that they do not receive equal benefits that are given to full-time Google employees. "The disrespect from management is just adding insult to injury," a worker was quoted as saying.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Instagram starts fact-checking posts, videos to hide misinformation
text: A month after Instagram announced teaming up with fact-checking services, the platform has started rolling out the feature and warning users by blurring posts and videos containing misinformation. The blurred posts show a 'False Information' warning with an option to view details of the reason and who the fact-checker is. Instagram says it uses "image-matching technology" to find false content.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Apple patents speakers that can simulate sound from anywhere in the room
text: Apple has been granted a patent that would enhance sound quality on MacBooks by splitting the audio, making it feel as if the sound is coming from around a room instead of the speakers directly. The system works by cancelling out overlapping soundwaves heard from the left and right speakers and letting the sound be placed virtually in a space.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: CollegeDekho names ex-McKinsey exec as product, engineering head
text: Gurugram-based education technology startup CollegeDekho has named Nikunj Bhatter as its head of product and engineering. Bhatter has previously worked as an Advisor at McKinsey & Company for over a year and has also worked with Monstor.com and HT Media in the past. Notably, earlier this year, CollegeDekho acquired Delhi-based education consulting services firm Scholarship Facilitation Services.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: BJP ally PMK against NRC implementation in Tamil Nadu
text: The Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK), which supported the Citizen (Amendment) Act in Rajya Sabha, said that National Register of Citizens (NRC) should not be implemented in Tamil Nadu. In a resolution, the party said the state does not share land borders with any country and hence, there was no scope for people from other countries to illegally enter Tamil Nadu.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: India, Pakistan exchange list of their nuclear facilities
text: India, Pakistan on Wednesday exchanged a list of their nuclear facilities under Article II of the 'Agreement on the Prohibition of Attack against Nuclear Installations and Facilities'. The agreement was signed on December 31, 1988. Under the agreement, the two countries agreed to exchange the details on January 1 of every year with the first one taking place in 1992.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Rawat an outstanding officer who served India with zeal: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed 'delight' over the appointment of former Army chief Bipin Rawat as first Chief of Defence Staff. He said Rawat is an "outstanding officer who has served India with great zeal". "I recall the valiant personnel who fought in Kargil, after which many discussions on reforming our military began, leading to today's historic development," Modi added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: I don't see that happening: US Prez Trump on war with Iran
text: When asked if tensions with Iran would spiral into a war, US President Donald Trump said, "I want to have peace. I like peace...I don't see that happening." Reacting to violent protests outside the US embassy in Iraq, Trump tweeted, "Iran will be held...responsible for lives lost...They will pay a very BIG PRICE! This isn't a Warning, it's a Threat."
author: Shailesh

headlines: I think North Korea's Kim is a 'man of his word': US Prez Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said that North Korean leader Kim Jong-un signed an "agreement" on denuclearisation and "I think he's a man of his word." Kim had accused the US of making "gangster-like demands" and maintaining a "hostile policy" towards the country. Kim also said that North Korea will get a "new strategic weapon" in the near future.
author: Shailesh

headlines: GST collection in December rises to ₹1.03 lakh crore
text: GST revenue collection grew 9% in December 2019 to ₹1,03,184 crore as compared to December 2018 which stood at ₹94,726 crore. Of the total revenue collected in December, CGST is ₹19,962 crore, SGST is ₹26,792 crore, IGST is ₹48,099 crore. The revenue earned by central and state governments in December is ₹41,776 crore for CGST and ₹42,158 crore for SGST.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: In pictures: New Year celebrations around the world
text: The New Year was celebrated around the world on Wednesday with firework displays from Sydney to New York. Thousands in Delhi marked the New Year by demonstrating against CAA while anti-government protestors marched in Hong Kong. In Australia, a million people gathered at Sydney harbour and nearby districts to watch fireworks. Crowds also gathered in European capitals for firework displays.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Eminem has a little penis, writes hacker from US singer's Twitter account
text: American singer Mariah Carey's Twitter account got hacked on New Year's eve and several tweets were posted from her account. One of the now-deleted tweets read, "Eminem has a little penis", in light of the feud after Eminem claimed he had dated Mariah. The hackers claimed to be The Chuckling Squad that earlier hacked Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey's account.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: It was a conscious decision to bring Ayat into the world on Salman's b'day: Aayush
text: Speaking about the birth of his daughter Ayat on Salman Khan's birthday, Salman's brother-in-law Aayush Sharma revealed it was a conscious decision to bring her into the world on Salman's birthday. "Due date was last week of December or first week of January....Bhai (Salman)...said 'give me a gift'," Aayush added. He further said, "It saves me from giving multiple parties!"
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Sachin shares video of boy unable to walk playing cricket, says 'It warmed my heart'
text: Former India batsman Sachin Tendulkar took to social media to share a video of specially-abled boy, who cannot walk, playing cricket with his friends. "Start your 2020 with the inspirational video of this kid Madda Ram playing cricket with his friends. It warmed my heart and I am sure it will warm yours too," wrote Sachin.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Fire on Moon may be more dangerous than on Earth: USRA scientist
text: Universities Space Research Association (USRA) scientist Dr Paul Ferkul detailed experiments currently being undertaken in space to study the behaviour of flames in zero gravity. "There's reason to believe that fires could be more dangerous on Moon than on Earth," Ferkul said on the experiments. NASA can use the knowledge to improve material selection and fire safety strategies, Ferkul added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Businessman, wife and daughter found dead inside car on Yamuna Expressway
text: A Delhi-based businessman allegedly shot dead his wife and minor daughter before killing himself inside a car that was found on the Yamuna Expressway in Mathura, police said. His minor son was found alive and was hospitalised. The man was disturbed due to family issues and was under debt, which could have led him to take the step, police added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 60-year-old man inserts candles in 25-year-old help's private parts, rapes her
text: A 60-year-old businessman has been arrested for allegedly raping his 25-year-old domestic help and inserting candles in her private parts while she was asleep. The police visited the accused's residence in Bandra and recovered candles, which had blood on it. In her complaint, the woman, who is being treated, said the accused kept asking her if she was enjoying it.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 400 held for drinking, possessing liquor on NYE in dry Gujarat's Ahmedabad
text: Over 400 people were arrested for consumption or possession of liquor during the New Year celebrations in Ahmedabad city in Gujarat. The manufacture, sale, consumption and storage of alcohol is illegal in Gujarat. "No untoward incident was reported from any part of the city and the celebrations went off peacefully," Deputy Commissioner of Police (Control Room) Vijay Patel said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Car in K'taka CM's convoy jumps to opposite lane, hits vehicles; 4 injured
text: A Toyota Innova belonging to Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa's convoy rammed into a road median, jumped to the opposite lane and hit two other vehicles on the Yeshwantpur flyover in northern Bengaluru. As many as four men, including the driver of Innova, sustained injuries in the accident. A senior police officer suspected that Innova driver was driving at 100 kmph.nn
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What changes have been made by India's largest bank SBI from today?
text: In order to withdraw more than ₹10,000 between 8 pm and 8 am at SBI ATMs, customers of India's largest bank will have to enter an OTP received on their registered mobile number. As per RBI guidelines, SBI has replaced magstripe debit cards with EMV Chip and PIN-based cards. Customers with older cards can visit their home branch for replacement.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: My song 'cold/mess' is a bit personal and more intense: Prateek
text: Singer Prateek Kuhad has said 'cold/mess' is "a bit more personal", "more intense" and has a narrative in comparison to songs in his debut album 'In Tokens & Charms'. Calling himself "more of a songwriter", Kuhad said, "[In Tokens...]...was light-hearted...I did better as...artiste on this." The song was included in ex-US President Barack Obama's list of favourite songs in 2019.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Acid attack survivors should be treated equally, without sympathy: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone, while talking about why she chose 'Chhapaak', said, "I wanted...to show what [acid attack] survivors...made out of their [lives] after...such incidents." "Society...[does] not treat them equally...[but] as disabled...and we should treat them like we want to be treated," Deepika said. She added that it's important for the survivors to be "treated without sympathy and equally".
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Loving yourself for who you are is the best thing you can do: Shruti
text: Actress Shruti Haasan on Tuesday took to Instagram and wrote, "Remember that loving yourself for...who you're is...best thing you can do for yourself". She added that the "biggest life lesson" she learned in 2019 was that "angels appear in one's life in the form of friends to guide them". "I'm...thankful to my friends who lift me up," Shruti further wrote.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Ben Laughlin becomes 1st bowler to take 100 wickets in BBL
text: Australia pacer Ben Laughlin has become the first bowler to take 100 wickets in the Big Bash League (BBL). Playing currently for Brisbane Heat, Laughlin achieved the feat in 79 matches and is followed by Sydney Sixers' pacer Sean Abbott with 96 wickets in 74 matches. Laughlin, 37, has played five ODIs, three T20Is for Australia, taking 6 wickets.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: We can finish in top 4 at Tokyo Olympics: Hockey skipper Manpreet
text: India men's hockey team captain Manpreet Singh has said that the team "strongly" believes that they can finish in top four at the Tokyo Olympics. "We have nine months to prepare for Olympics and the plan is to get better...each day," he added. India finished eighth with two wins, three losses, and one draw at Rio Olympics in 2016.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Trying to structure Arsenal around Mesut Ozil: Manager Mikel Arteta
text: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has said that he's trying to structure the team around striker Mesut Ozil. "The structure has to help him to take everything that he has inside," he added. "On his own, he [Ozil] can't do it, he needs collective structure, organisation, and his teammates," Arteta stated. Ozil hasn't scored for Arsenal this season in Premier League.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: US Army bans soldiers from using TikTok
text: After the US Navy and Department of Defense told its members to remove TikTok from government-issued phones, the US Army has been given similar instructions over security concerns. "It is considered a cyber threat. We do not allow it on government phones," an Army spokeswoman told Military.com. It was earlier reported that the US Army used TikTok to recruit soldiers.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Workers file lawsuit against Tesla over racism at California factory
text: A federal judge has allowed a lawsuit, filed by two ex-Tesla workers against the carmaker alleging racism by colleagues in Tesla's California factory, to move forward. The plaintiffs, who are black, claimed they faced "severe and pervasive racial harassment" in the form of name-calling and no action was taken by management. The plaintiffs are seeking damages in millions of dollars.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: FDA to ban sale of fruit, mint flavoured e-cigarette pods in US: WSJ
text: Aiming to curb teen vaping, the FDA is planning to ban the sale of mint, fruit and dessert-flavoured e-cigarette pods but keep menthol and nicotine flavours available, WSJ reported. However, restrictions on flavoured liquid nicotine in 'open-tanks' - where people can mix their own flavours - won't be applied. Reportedly, the rule will be applicable on pod-based vaporizers like JUUL.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: US software firm VMware acquires cloud startup Pivotal for $2.7 bn
text: US-based software company VMware has completed the acquisition of cloud-native startup Pivotal Software for $2.7 billion and will operate as VMware's wholly-owned subsidiary. Pivotal will join VMware's earlier acquired companies Heptio and Bitnami for its project VMware Tanzu. In 2015, Dell bought EMC for $67 billion, along with its consortium of companies that included VMware and Pivotal.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: 600 tiger, leopard deaths reported in India in 2019: Wildlife NGO
text: As many as 110 tigers and 493 leopards died in 2019, Delhi-based Wildlife Protection Society of India report stated. Leopard deaths in train and road accidents have also increased over the past 10 years with at least 250% rise from 2010 to 2019. Maharashtra recorded highest number of leopard deaths in accidents among all states with 22 cases in 2019.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: J&K HC withdraws notification for filling posts on pan-India basis
text: Amid criticism from opposition parties, High Court of Jammu and Kashmir has withdrawn its advertisement notification to fill up 33 non-gazetted posts in District Courts for eligible candidates from all over the country. No reason was given by the government for the withdrawal of notification. Earlier, National Conference had said that J&K government jobs should be reserved for local youth.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: No building in new Central Vista to be taller than India Gate
text: The new buildings under the redevelopment plan of Central Vista will be lower than India Gate, government officials said on Tuesday. Buildings such as Shastri Bhawan, Udyog Bhawan and Krishi Bhawan will be demolished and eight seven-storey buildings will be constructed to accommodate offices of various ministries. The redevelopment plan is estimated to cost about ₹12,000 crore.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Court allows banks to utilise seized assets of Vijay Mallya
text: A Mumbai court has allowed banks which lent money to the fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to utilise his seized assets. The ruling has been stayed till January 18 so that the parties affected by the court's order could appeal to the Bombay High Court. Last year, the ED had said it had no objection to the liquidation of confiscated assets.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: World will witness N Korea's 'new strategic weapon': Kim Jong-un
text: Addressing top Workers' Party officials, North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un said, "The world will witness a new strategic weapon to be possessed by North Korea in the near future." He also said the country is no longer bound by moratorium on testing nuclear bombs. The country will continue to bolster its nuclear deterrent, the North Korean leader further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Rahul Mishra 1st Indian designer invited for Paris Haute Couture Week
text: The governing body of the French fashion industry, The Fédération de la Haute Couture et de la Mode has invited designer Rahul Mishra as a guest member to showcase at the January 2020 Paris Haute Couture Week. This makes him the first Indian designer to receive this distinction. "In my understanding, 'Couture' stands for more than just 'handmade'," Rahul said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Phase-One trade deal with China to be signed on Jan 15: President Trump
text: US President Donald Trump announced that 'Phase-One' of the US-China trade deal will be signed on January 15 at the White House. The details of the agreement were not disclosed but it is expected to increase China's purchase of US agricultural goods and boost intellectual property protections while US reduces tariffs. The Phase-One deal was struck earlier in December.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Sheep pregnant with triplets made to wear bra in NZ; picture goes viral
text: A farm in New Zealand has shared pictures of a sheep named 'Rose', who was pregnant with triplets, wearing a bra. Rose was made to wear the garment as she had heavy udders which touched the ground and its weight was damaging the Suspensory Ligaments. "Unless the situation can be corrected, it's a cause for euthanasia," the post read.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Will people like if 6 ft tall man charges up against a woman? Krushna on Sidharth
text: Criticising Sidharth Shukla's alleged aggressive behaviour towards women in Bigg Boss 13, Krushna Abhishek said, "Will people like if a 6 feet tall man charges up against a woman and hurls abuses?" "Men should be careful, I wouldn't have done it if I were in his place," he added. Krushna's sister Arti Singh is also a contestant on the show.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Hardik makes his relationship with Serbian actress Nataša public, shares pic
text: All-rounder Hardik Pandya took to social media to make his relationship with Mumbai-based Serbian actress Nataša Stanković public. The 26-year-old shared a picture of himself with Nataša with the caption, "Starting the year with my firework." Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal commented on the picture with heart emoji, while batsman KL Rahul reacted with fire emoji.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Google search for Prateek Kuhad rises in US after Obama includes his song in list
text: Google Trends chart shows that search for Indian singer Prateek Kuhad rose in the US on Tuesday after former US President Barack Obama included his song 'cold/mess' among his favourite songs of 2019. The list included singers Bruce Springsteen and Beyoncé among others. "This just happened and I don't think I'll sleep tonight. Totally flipping out," Kuhad had earlier tweeted.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Google to end 'Double Irish, Dutch sandwich' tax loophole
text: Google will start licensing its intellectual property from the US and not Bermuda, ending a tax loophole known as the "Double Irish, Dutch sandwich", which has saved American companies hundreds of billions of dollars. The tax strategy, which is legal, allowed the search giant to channel international profits through Ireland and on to Bermuda, where companies don't pay income tax.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 13-yr-old designs glasses to help people with visual, hearing issues
text: A 13-year-old grade VIII student in Odisha, Priyabrata Sahoo, designed special glasses that would give out signals and alert users about obstacles in their path. "I got the idea when I saw a visually impaired elderly person of my village facing difficulty in moving around without support," Priyabrata said. The glasses comprise ultrasonic sensors, buzzers and also vibrator motors.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Supporters of Maha Cong MLA smash party office after he's not made minister
text: The supporters of Congress MLA Sangram Thopte vandalised the party's office in Maharashtra's Pune district on Tuesday evening after he didn't get a ministerial post in the newly expanded Maharashtra Cabinet. Around 40 supporters smashed glass panes and broke furniture inside the office and shouted slogans against the party and its leaders. Thopte is an MLA from Bhor.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Astronauts celebrate New Year in space at 5:30 AM IST: Space Station
text: The International Space Station's (ISS) official Twitter page posted an update which revealed that astronauts aboard the space lab celebrated New Year at 5:30 AM as per Indian Standard Time (IST). "The space station operates in Greenwich Mean Time or GMT," ISS tweeted. "We're usually counting down to liftoff, but today, we're counting down to 2020," it had said.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Govt has approved Chandrayaan-3, the project is ongoing: ISRO Chief
text: ISRO Chairman K Sivan on Wednesday said the government has approved India's third Moon mission Chandrayaan-3 and that the project is ongoing. "We've made good progress on Chandrayaan-2...even though we couldn't land successfully, the orbiter is still functioning," Sivan added. He also said that land acquisition for a second spaceport has been initiated, which will be in Thoothukudi, Tamil Nadu.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 4 astronauts identified for 'Gaganyaan' mission: ISRO Chief K Sivan
text: ISRO Chairman K Sivan on Wednesday revealed that the space agency has identified four astronauts to undergo training for the country's first human space mission Gaganyaan. "We had good progress on Gaganyaan in 2019. The training for four astronauts has been planned in the third week of January," Sivan said. The mission is aimed to be launched by 2022.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: My head feels lighter as I took off the Gorkha hat: Gen Rawat on becoming CDS
text: When asked about his reaction on becoming the country's first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), General Bipin Rawat said, "My head is feeling lighter." "I have taken off the angled Gorkha hat that I wore for 41 years. I am wearing a peaked cap, it shows the CDS will remain neutral to all three services," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Car bursts into flames at Hyderabad petrol pump after driver goes to washroom
text: A video shows a car bursting into flames while fuel was being refilled at a Hyderabad petrol pump on Tuesday. The driver had gone to the washroom and one of the staff members noticed that fuel was leaking from the tank. "The...management reacted quickly and called 100 and fire service. Both reached within 5-10 minutes," a police official said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Thief breaks into East Delhi post office, could find only ₹487 inside
text: An unidentified person broke open a hole in the wall of a post office in East Delhi but could find only ₹487 in the cash chest, police said on Tuesday. Whoever carried out the heist, left without spotting a bag containing about ₹5,000 lying in a bag nearby, said Amit Sharma, deputy commissioner of police.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: We keep ourselves away from politics: CDS General Bipin Rawat
text: Chief of the Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat has said that armed forces stay away from politics and work as per the directives of the government. His remarks come amid allegations that the forces were being politicised. He further said that as a CDS he will focus on ensuring the best use of resources allocated to the three services.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Will work towards a goal where 1+1+1 is 5 or 7, not 3: CDS General Rawat
text: The first Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat has said, the CDS' task is to make all three military services to work in "cohesive manner".  "As team, we'll work towards a goal where 1+1+1 is either five or seven...not three. What I mean is, the synergised effort shouldn't be the sum of the whole, it should be much more."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: DCW chief loses her phone while helping a lady; police catch thief within hours
text: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal's mobile phone was stolen from her pocket when she was at Paharganj to rescue an elderly woman on Monday evening. Maliwal then informed the police, who recovered her phone and nabbed the 25-year-old thief within hours. Maliwal thanked the Delhi Police for the "quick action" in a Twitter post.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Policeman steals constable's car, says depressed people do such things
text: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad on Tuesday arrested a Sub-Inspector, who is under suspension, for stealing a constable's car from the police lines. "He stole the car...when he was stopped by the police ahead he met an accident in haste," police said. "I'm disturbed and under depression. People under depression do such type of things," said the accused.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Non-subsidised LPG price hiked by ₹19 per cylinder
text: The price of non-subsidised LPG (Liquefied Petroleum Gas), commonly called the cooking gas, was on Wednesday hiked by ₹19 per cylinder, and that of Jet fuel or ATF (Aviation Turbine Fuel) by 2.6%. This makes the cost of non-subsidised 14.2 kg LPG cylinder stand at ₹714 per cylinder in Delhi, at ₹684.50 in Mumbai and at ₹747 in Kolkata.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Increased railway passenger fares to be applicable from today
text: The Indian Railways on Tuesday announced a hike in passenger fares for the first time in five years. In the new fares, effective from Wednesday, the hike is 4 paise per kilometre for all AC classes and 1 paisa per kilometre for all non-AC and unreserved classes. "No change in charges for superfast charge, reservation fee," said the official statement.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Hoping 2020 marks the continuation of people powered efforts: PM Modi
text: Replying to a tweet which included a recap of 2019, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Lovely compilation! Covers quite a lot of the progress we achieved in 2019." He further tweeted, "Here is hoping 2020 marks the continuation of people powered efforts to transform India and empower the lives of 130 crore Indians."
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Bangladeshi artists apologise over video of semi-naked man being led by dog leash
text: Two Bangladeshi artists featuring in viral videos of a semi-naked man being led in street by a dog leash have apologised for offending the country's "culture" after being summoned by police. The duo explained they were re-enacting "From the Portfolio of Doggedness", a 1968 feminist art performance staged in Vienna. They "expressed their sorrow" and promised not to repeat it.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Pope Francis slaps woman's hand as she pulls him towards her
text: Pope Francis slapped a woman's hand to free himself after she pulled him towards her in Saint Peter's Square. Pope Francis was walking through the square and greeting pilgrims as he made his way to the Nativity scene at the centre of Vatican City. It was not clear what the woman was saying as she pulled Pope Francis toward her.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 'Deadpool 3' in the works at Marvel Studios: Ryan Reynolds
text: Canadian-American actor Ryan Reynolds on the chat show 'Live With Kelly and Ryan' confirmed that the third instalment in the superhero film franchise 'Deadpool' is in the development at the Marvel Studios. "We're working on it right now with the whole team. We're over at Marvel, which is like the big leagues all of a sudden," he said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: My roles in 'Bala', 'Uri...' helped me evolve as an actor: Yami
text: Actress Yami Gautam, when asked if playing different characters in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' and 'Bala' helped her as an actor, said, "I would...say it...helped me evolve...as an actor." "I always wanted...to do versatile roles. I'm glad...they came my way finally," Yami added. "The role of Pari [in 'Bala']...added confidence and faith in myself as a performer," she further said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: No one's coming to my home to offer films: Actress Nia Sharma
text: Actress Nia Sharma, when asked if she aspires to be in Bollywood, said that TV has given her work "back to back" that she doesn't "have time to meet anyone in that aspect". "And no one is coming to my home to offer...films," she added. "[Y]ou should wait for...right project to come your way as ['Naagin 4'] did," Nia said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Was attacked with dagger for protesting against CAA, claims Kolkata filmmaker
text: Kolkata-based filmmaker Ronny Sen on Tuesday claimed on Facebook that he was attacked with a dagger on Monday night for protesting against CAA and NRC. Sen told The Hindu that "on several occasions" he was threatened by the attacker, who described himself as a "Hindu nationalist". "He...asked me to refrain from posting against the CAA and the NRC," Sen added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Voters' slips to have QR codes in 2020 Delhi Assembly elections
text: In the 2020 Delhi Assembly elections, voters' slips will carry QR (Quick Response) codes to speed up the process of identification of electors, an official said on Monday. "This latest technological innovation will make the poll process fast," the official added. Earlier, the Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) had said that every polling station will have a booth app.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Gen Rawat takes charge as Chief of Defence Staff after retiring as Army chief
text: General Bipin Rawat has taken charge as the first Chief of Defence Staff, a day after retiring as the Indian Army chief. General Rawat paid tribute at the National War Memorial before receiving the guard of honour. As CDS, he'll look over all three of the Indian military forces and act as a single point military advisor for the government.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: SRK promised me selfie on flight, he later came up to me and clicked a pic: Hina
text: Actress Hina Khan has revealed that her first celebrity encounter was with actor Shah Rukh Khan on a flight. "I remember I had gone to him to ask for a picture and he promised me to give one once we land," she added. "Later, he came up to me and gave me the picture. He was so humble," said Hina.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Anti-CAA protestors began New Year by singing National Anthem at 12am in Delhi
text: Thousands of people protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, began the New Year by singing the National Anthem at 12 am. The National Anthem was followed by the slogan "Inquilab Zindabad". Several people were seen roaming around waving the National Flag while some displayed placards against the new Act.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: It is all about how he performs in IPL: Anil Kumble on MS Dhoni's future
text: Former India coach Anil Kumble has said MS Dhoni's future with the Indian team will depend upon how he performs in the IPL 2020. "It's all about how Dhoni goes about IPL and if at all Team India believes they need his services for World Cup, then from there on he may be a part of the team," Kumble said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Indian Olympic Association ends boycott threat, to take part in 2022 CWG
text: The Indian Olympic Association (IOA) has withdrawn its 2022 Commonwealth Games withdrawal threat and said that the Indian contingent will compete in the quadrennial games to be held in Birmingham. The IOA, after its annual general meeting, not only confirmed India’s Birmingham participation but also revealed plans to bid for the 2026 or the 2030 edition of the Games.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Canadian scientists to plant 1 billion trees using drones by 2028
text: Canadian scientists announced a new initiative to use specially designed drones to plant one billion trees by 2028. Called 'Flash Forest', the group started testing its drone systems in August, successfully planting over 100 trees with a drone in a test flight. The group also claimed it uses a unique blend of acids to help plants grow faster.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: India made most requests for user info, content removal from TikTok
text: ByteDance-owned TikTok, in its first transparency report for first-half of 2019, revealed that India topped both legal requests for user information as well as government requests for content removal. The lip-syncing platform revealed that 107 requests in total pertained to information while that for content removal was 11. The US followed India in both requests at 79 and six, respectively.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: I'll pay ₹6,300 challan: Man after Priyanka rode on his scooter without helmet
text: The owner of the scooter on which Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra sat pillion in Lucknow, has said, "I'll myself pay the challan...of ₹6,300." The challan was issued against the owner as Congress leader Dheeraj Gurjar, who drove the vehicle, and Priyanka were not wearing helmets. The leaders had borrowed the man's vehicle to go to former IPS officer's house.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: FIR against Tamil writer for remarks against PM Modi, Amit Shah
text: Tirunelveli police have registered an FIR against Tamil writer and orator Nellai Kannan for his speech during a protest meet against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act held on Sunday. "If Amit Shah is finished off then Modi is finished too. Leave that be to one side," Kannan said in his speech. "But none of you are finishing it," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Tiger Global made 29 India deals in 2019, up 262% from 2018: Report
text: American hedge fund firm Tiger Global Management made a total of 29 deals last year in a mix of new and follow-on investments in the Indian startup ecosystem, as per TechCircle. This marked a rise of 262.5% relative to just eight deals in 2018. Tiger Global first entered India in 2005 and had struck 38 deals in 2015, its highest.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: How did ex-Nissan chief escape house arrest in Japan and reach Lebanon?
text: Ex-Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn's escape from house arrest in Japan was reportedly masterminded by his wife with the help of a music band and ex-special forces officers. After the band's performance at his Tokyo home, Ghosn slipped into a musical instrument case and was taken to a local airport. He was then flown in private jets to Lebanon via Turkey.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Tea is my bread & butter, ironic I stopped drinking chai: Teabox CEO
text: Ratan Tata-backed premium tea-selling platform Teabox's founder and CEO Kausshal Dugarr, in an article in Mint Lounge, said, "Tea is my bread and butter, so I guess it is ironic that...I stopped drinking chai (last year)." Dugarr explained how he did so not just for his health but also for his startup. The Bengaluru-based platform was launched in 2012.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: We lacked in financial processes, budgets, control: Innov8 CEO Malik
text: Co-working space provider Innov8's founder and CEO Ritesh Malik, in a piece by Mint Lounge, said, "We've always been an extremely frugal firm, but we somehow lacked in financial processes, budgets and control." He added he has realised that great results can be achieved in short time with proper metrics and processes in place, along with a "well-intended diligent team".
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Ban on single-use plastic in Kerala comes into effect from today
text: A blanket ban on single-use plastic in Kerala came into effect from midnight today. The decision was taken by the state government in November 2019. Through enforcement of the ban, production, sale and storage of single-use plastic items like cups, bottles, carry-bags etc is prohibited. Cling film and plastic items used in healthcare are among items exempted from the ban.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 6 of family die as lift at MP businessman's farmhouse falls during New Year party
text: Six members of a family died after a lift installed at the farmhouse of businessman Puneet Agrawal in Patalpani area of Madhya Pradesh fell on Tuesday night, a police officer said. The police added that a party was organised at the farmhouse on New Year's eve. Another person has several spinal injuries and is admitted in hospital.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Wishing New Year from 'iconic' desk where Bengal partition was signed, tweets Guv
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was criticised after he described the table on which Lord Curzon signed the order on Bengal's Partition in 1905 as "iconic". "Recording of New Year Message...in the historical Raj Bhawan Library while sitting on the iconic table from which Lord Curzon signed first Partition of Bengal in 1905," Dhankhar had tweeted before deleting it.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Highest number of babies born globally on January 1 will be in India: UNICEF
text: According to UNICEF, out of 3,92,078 babies to be born globally on the New Year's Day, the highest number of 67,385 will be born in India. Meanwhile, China is set to witness 46,299 births, followed by Nigeria with 26,039 births. Fiji in the South Pacific is expected to deliver the first baby of 2020.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: US police apologise over 'quilt' made of cardboards confiscated from beggars
text: The Mobile Police Department in Alabama has apologised after two of its officers made a "quilt" out of cardboard signs confiscated from beggars and shared it in a post on Facebook. "It is never our intent or desire as a police department to make light of those who find themselves in a homeless state," Police Chief Lawrence Battiste said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US registers slowest population growth in a century
text: The US registered the slowest population growth in a century over the past year, growing by less than 0.5%. This was attributed to the decline in births, increasing deaths and the slowdown of international migration. Natural increase – the number of births minus the number of deaths, dropped below one million in 2019 for the first time in decades.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Indian-origin ecologist helped create scientist Barbie dolls
text: Nalini Nadkarni, an Indian-origin forest ecologist, has been part of a team of female scientists advising Barbie dolls' maker Mattel on the line of dolls that includes a marine biologist, astrophysicist, photojournalist, conservationist and entomologist. Nadkarni re-fashioned a Barbie doll as a scientist-explorer for the first time after her 6-year-old daughter had asked for a Barbie doll.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Kartik Aaryan will do whatever it takes to be successful: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone has said in an interview that she finds Kartik Aaryan "extremely hardworking" and added that he will do whatever it takes to be successful. "He's not apologetic about the fact that...as an outsider, he's extremely focused, and driven," she further said. "From the sidelines I've just been watching him," Deepika added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Why should he read it if he understood it: Rangoli on Sadhguru's CAA remark
text: After Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev said that he hasn't read the Citizenship (Amendment) Act fully, Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel tweeted, "If he has understood without reading, why [does] he need to read?" "If Home Minister and PM [agree] with his understanding...why make fun of his clothes...his past?" she added. "Kuch humans manual hain kuch automatic," Rangoli further wrote.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Finally doing the kind of work I always wanted to do: Richa Chadha
text: Richa Chadha has said in an interview that she is finally able to do the kind of work she always wanted to do. She added that the year 2019 was "busy for her and it was full of travel, work and personal growth". "And I look forward to some changes in my personal life in 2020," Richa further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Apple patent reveals new iPhone design with no Face ID, notch: Report
text: Apple has filed for a new patent spotted by LetsGoDigital, which showed sketches of an upcoming iPhone. The sketches showed a phone with a rectangular display with square corners that seemed to have no notch, front camera or Face ID. According to LetsGoDigital, the patent has been filed for the design for the 2020 iPhone.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: ByteDance's TikTok claims it got no takedown request from China
text: Chinese startup ByteDance's lip-syncing video platform TikTok, in its first transparency report, claimed that it did not receive a single takedown request from the Communist Party of China in the first half of 2019. Reports have claimed that the startup is facing scrutiny in the US over allegations of sharing data with China. It was also accused of censorship.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 2 Army soldiers martyred during gunfight with infiltrators in J&K
text: Two Indian Army soldiers lost their lives during a cordon and search operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Nowshera, Indian Army Public Relations Officer (PRO) Lieutenant Colonel Devender Anand said. The operation was carried out following information on movement of suspected terrorists trying to sneak in from Pakistan. Infiltrators opened fire on Indian soldiers, as soon as the operation was launched.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Bihar to celebrate Jaitley's birth anniversary as state function
text: Late former Finance Minister Arun Jaitley's birth anniversary on December 28 will be celebrated as a state function every year in Bihar, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said. The decision was reportedly taken during a cabinet meeting presided over by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. Reportedly, Jaitley had served as the party functionary for the BJP in Bihar for a long time.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Shastri posts pic with SRK, gets champagne New Year wish from Vaughan
text: Team India head coach Ravi Shastri took to social media to share a picture of himself with Shah Rukh Khan and Raveena Tandon. "Alibag is heaven. Great conversations with some brilliant minds of our times," Shastri captioned the picture. Former England captain Michael Vaughan commented on the picture, writing, "Happy New Year Ravi", followed by champagne emoji.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Regret what happened: AMU VC on police action on students
text: AMU Vice-Chancellor Tariq Mansoor on Tuesday penned an open letter to students saying that he regretted police action on campus during anti-CAA protests. He also sought to assure students of their safety and right to protest peacefully. Referring to the decision to call in police on December 15, he said it was taken in "good faith and a clear conscience".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Assam tourism suffered ₹1000 cr loss due to violent anti-CAA protests
text: Assam Tourism Development Corporation (ATDC) Chairman Jayanta Malla Baruah said on Tuesday that tourism in the state suffered an estimated loss of ₹1,000 crore due to violent protests against CAA. "Peak season of tourism is from December to March...We estimate that the loss in December and January will be ₹500 crore each," he said at a press conference in Guwahati.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: ICC considering making four-day Tests compulsory from 2023
text: The ICC is considering making four-day Tests mandatory from 2023 as part of the World Test Championship, primarily to free up the crowded calendar. Hosting four-day Tests will allow ICC to stage more global events. If four-day Tests were held during the 2015-2023 cycle, it would have freed up 335 days of scheduled cricket.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: It’s too early to say: Sourav Ganguly on four-day Tests
text: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly on Monday said it’s “too early” to comment on the ICC’s proposal to make four-day Tests mandatory as part of the World Test Championship from 2023. “First we will have to see the proposal, let it come and then we will see. It’s too early to say. Can’t comment just like this,” Ganguly said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ashish Nehra reveals his pick for 'Performance of the Decade'
text: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra picked his compatriot VVS Laxman's 96-run knock against South Africa during the second Test in Durban in 2010 as 'Performance of the Decade'. "I opted for VVS, because of the circumstances. When India reached Durban, they were behind in the series already. They had lost badly by an innings in Centurion in first Test," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 2019 the worst year for me as analyst and commentator: Sanjay Manjrekar
text: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has labelled 2019 as the worst year for him as a cricket analyst and commentator. "I started this profession in 1997-1998, so it’s been about 20-21 years. It’s been the worst year," he said. He referred to his spat with Ravindra Jadeja during the World Cup and the "indecent" comment he made about Harsha Bhogle.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who were the highest wicket-takers in international cricket in 2019?
text: Australia fast bowler Pat Cummins ended 2019 as the highest wicket-taker in international cricket. The 26-year-old finished the year with 99 wickets, 22 more than compatriot Mitchell Starc and Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami. Australia's Nathan Lyon and Afghanistan's Rashid Khan took the most wickets in the year among spinners at 56 each.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Bumrah shares collage of pics from 2019, says it has been a year of learning
text: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took to Instagram to share a collage of pictures from 2019. "2019 has been a year of accomplishments, learning, hard work and making memories, on the field and off it too. And on the last day of the year, I’m looking forward to everything that 2020 has to offer!" he wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: IAF chief formally inducts Dornier aircraft into No. 41 Squadron
text: IAF chief RKS Bhadauria on Monday formally inducted light utility aircraft Dornier into No. 41 'Otters' Squadron during a ceremony held at Air Force station at Palam in Delhi. IAF had signed a contract to purchase 14 Dornier aircraft from state-run Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) in 2015. The first aircraft was delivered on November 19, 2019.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 4 earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir last night
text: Four medium intensity tremors with magnitudes ranging between 4.7 and 5.5 hit Jammu and Kashmir in a span of less than two hours on Monday night, National Centre for Seismology said. The first quake with a magnitude of 4.7 hit at 10:42 pm, followed by one measuring 5.5 six minutes later. The two occurred at a depth of 10 kilometres.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pune Police's reply to man who trolled its 'say no to drugs' tweet goes viral
text: The Pune Police's reply to a user who trolled its tweet advising people to stay away from drugs has gone viral. When Pune Police asked where to find LSD, the user replied asking if he could get "10 pudiya (doses)" as a reward for the information. To this, the police said, "You can keep the (stash), we will keep you".
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Goldman, Varde-led consortium to buy RattanIndia's ₹6,575 cr debt at 38% discount
text: A consortium led by Goldman Sachs and Varde Partners has agreed to buy ₹6,575 crore of RattanIndia Power's debt from its lenders for ₹4,050 crore, a 38% discount. This is one of the largest restructuring deals outside the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT), India's bankruptcy court. RattanIndia owns two coal-based power plants in Maharashtra with a total capacity of 2,700MW.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Quit BJP-led NDA, we will support you: Owaisi to Bihar CM
text: While addressing an anti-CAA rally in Bihar, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi asked Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar to disassociate from BJP-led NDA for the "sake of country". He said that if Kumar breaks his alliance, then they will support him. "Now, it is not a Hindu-Muslim fight; it has become a fight for saving the country," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: India U-19 lose to SA by 5 wickets in last ODI, win series 2-1
text: India Under-19 lost their third ODI against South Africa Under-19 by 5 wickets but won the series 2-1 after winning the first two matches. Batting first after losing the toss, India posted 193-run target with skipper Priyam Garg slamming half-ton. Chasing the target, South Africa's Jonathan Bird scored 88* to help his team win the third ODI.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: West Indies appoint Penney as assistant coach for ODIs, T20Is
text: Former India fielding coach Trevor Penney has been appointed as the assistant coach of West Indies cricket team for limited-overs formats. Penney has been handed a two-year contract by Cricket West Indies. "I'm thrilled and excited to be given this opportunity to work with this brilliant bunch of cricketers and staff led by Kieron Pollard and Phil Simmons," Penney said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: We played Jofra Archer very well: South Africa coach Boucher
text: On the Test win against England in the first match of the series, South Africa coach Mark Boucher said he's happy with the way the team played England pacer Jofra Archer. "He [Jofra Archer] was under a little bit of pressure because he was going for quite a few runs," he added. Archer finished match with figures of 6-167.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Tencent Group buys 10% stake in Universal Music for $3.4 billion
text: A consortium led by Tencent Holdings has purchased a 10% stake in Vivendi's Universal Music Group (UMG) for about $3.4 billion, valuing UMG at nearly $34 billion. The consortium has the option to buy an additional 10% stake in UMG until January 15, the companies said. Tencent Music Entertainment will also buy a minority stake in UMG's operation across China.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Samsung to unveil 'artificial human' NEON which can act as an AI companion
text: Samsung will unveil its 'artificial human' called NEON at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2020, which will appear human in both its image and communication. It's reported that NEON will be smart enough to act as an AI companion or a 'best friend' and communicate in multiple languages. Samsung stated that NEON won't be similar to its virtual assistant Bixby.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Google Maps gets 'hyperdrive' effect while switching between planets
text: The web version of Google Maps now uses 'hyperdrive' animation while switching between planets and moons. In 2017, Google had introduced a feature to Maps for web which would allow users to virtually visit many planets and moons in the solar system. The new feature can be used by zooming out map's satellite view completely till space exploration option appears.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Amazon to open homeless shelter inside Seattle HQ: Reports
text: Amazon has reportedly planned to open homeless shelter inside its Seattle headquarters which is expected to become the largest such facility in the US' Washington state. The shelter home will offer individual, private rooms for families and will be able to accommodate over 200 people each night. It is expected to serve 6,00,000 meals per year.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: BJP wins 29 of 33 seats in Gujarat panchayat bypolls, Cong wins 3
text: In the bypolls for 33 taluka and district-level seats, the BJP won 29 seats, three of them unopposed. The Congress managed to win three seats and one seat was won by an independent candidate. Thanking the people for the BJP's performance, CM Vijay Rupani said, "The victory is a precursor to upcoming district and taluka panchayat polls."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Hope people-powered efforts to transform India continue in 2020: PM
text: Commenting on a video listing NDA's achievements in 2019, PM Narendra Modi said, "[H]oping 2020 marks the continuation of people-powered efforts to transform India and empower the lives of 130 crore Indians." He added, "Lovely compilation! Covers quite a lot of the progress we achieved in 2019." The video titled "Year 2020 Song" was uploaded on Youtube on Tuesday.
author: Shailesh

headlines: PM asks startups for inputs to reverse economic slowdown: Report
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked startups, software makers, and electronics manufacturers to give their inputs on how to reverse the slowdown in the economy, a report said. He also urged participants to share problems that they face in terms of policies. Representatives from the startup ecosystem told him that startups in India faced difficulties in raising funds from the banks.n
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Indore declared cleanest city in cleanliness survey
text: In the Quarter 1 and Quarter 2 results of Swachh Survekshan League 2020 (SS League 2020), Indore ranked first among the cities where the population is more than 10 lakh. Bhopal stood second in Quarter 1 results, while Rajkot grabbed the second spot in Quarter 2 results. Indore has retained the title of the Cleanest City in last three years.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Reserve right to strike at terror source: Army Chief Naravane
text: Army chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane said India reserves the right to preemptively strike at the sources of terror threats. He added, "The Pakistan Army's proxy war design received setback due to elimination of terrorists and decimation of terror networks (by India)." The situation in Jammu and Kashmir improved significantly after the revocation of Article 370, General Naravane further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Australia to deploy military for evacuations amid bushfires
text: Australia is deploying its military to conduct firefighting and evacuation operations amid large bushfires in the states of Victoria and New South Wales, officials said. The military will also bring medicines, food and water to areas cut-off due to fires. Around 4,000 people were stranded on a beach in the town of Mallacoota, Victoria after the fires encircled them.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Thisara Perera joins Sri Lanka Army as a Major in Gajaba Regiment
text: Sri Lanka's 30-year-old all-rounder Thisara Perera has joined the Sri Lanka Army as a Major. The cricketer confirmed the news via Twitter and said that he accepted an invitation of Army Commander Lieutenant General Shavendra Silva. "I look forward to contributing my best to Army Cricket," he further wrote on Twitter.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who were the highest run-scorers in international cricket in 2019?
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli ended as 2019's top run-getter in international cricket, scoring 2,455 runs in 44 matches at an average of 64.60. Kohli was followed by his compatriot Rohit Sharma, who slammed 2,442 runs in 47 matches in the year. Pakistan's Babar Azam was the third highest run-getter this year with 2,082 runs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Original Shiv Sainiks lost chance: Saamana on Maha Cabinet expansion
text: An editorial in the Shiv Sena mouthpiece Saamana on Tuesday said that "original Shiv Sainiks lost the opportunity" during Maharashtra Cabinet expansion. "Diwakar Raote, Ramdas Kadam, Tanaji Sawant, Deepak Kesarkar, Ravindra Waikar did not get another chance," read the editorial. However, it explained the decision to the need to accommodate Independent lawmakers who support the Sena-led coalition.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Chandrayaan-3 likely to be launched in 2020: Union Minister Jitendra Singh
text: India will likely launch Chandrayaan-3 in 2020, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said on Tuesday, adding that the mission will be cost-effective. "The Chandrayaan-2 mission cannot be called a failure as we have learnt a lot from it...There has not been a single country which could achieve a soft landing on the moon in less than two attempts," he further said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Railway fares hiked, AC journey to cost 4 paise per km more from tomorrow
text: The Railway Ministry on Tuesday announced a hike in rail fare, which will be applicable from January 1, 2020. An additional 4 paise per kilometre will be charged on AC ticket, while an additional 1 paisa/kilometre will be charged on ordinary non-AC trains and 2 paise for Express non-AC trains. Suburban trains have been left out from the revised fare.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Indian Army shares first pics of uniform components of Chief of Defence Staff
text: The official Twitter handle of Indian Army shared first pictures of various components of the uniform of Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat. The Army also shared the picture of CDS' car flag. "Rank badges & accoutrements of #CDS reflect jointness, integration and Synergy," Army wrote. It further said that CDS will have his office in South Block.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Hearing police siren, 2 thieves die after falling from bike in Haryana
text: Haryana Police has said that three men, who broke the locks of a few shops in Hisar on Monday, fell from their speeding motorcycle while trying to flee on hearing the police siren and two of them died. Police said they were alerted by an outlet owner who was sleeping inside the store when the three tried to break inside.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Don’t touch kids, you pervert: Man tells US' ex-VP Joe Biden
text: During an election rally in New Hampshire, US, a man told former Vice President Joe Biden, "You touch kids on video and women...Don't touch kids, you pervert." "This is not a Trump rally. This is a democracy," Biden said in response to the man. Biden has in the past been accused by several women of touching them inappropriately.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: My Kannada is rusty right now, I loved speaking it: IMF's Gita Gopinath
text: International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Chief Economist Gita Gopinath, who grew up in Karnataka's Mysuru, said her Kannada sounds "rusty" right now but she loved speaking the language. She said Kannada was a big part of her growing up. "And I like Mysuru. It's a very special city. I think it's a great place to grow up in," the 47-year-old added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Very surprised: French minister as ex-Nissan boss escapes from Japan to Lebanon
text: French Junior Economy Minister Agnes Pannier-Runacher said she was "very surprised" to hear that former Nissan and Renault Chairman Carlos Ghosn left Japan and flew to Lebanon. Ghosn, who was awaiting trial for financial crimes, said he wouldn't be "held hostage" by a "rigged" justice system. He surrendered his French, Brazilian and Lebanese passports as part of his bail conditions.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I feel like 'failure' when an actor rejects Marvel film: Kevin Feige
text: Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige said that whenever an actor rejects a Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) film, he feels like a "failure". "It happened...there's an actor we want for something, they come in...you can...tell they're not into it," he added. He further said that what he usually tries to do then is resolve to cast an "even better" actor.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Akshay is like Mr Bean, his comedy timing is very good: Diljit
text: Actor Diljit Dosanjh has said the best part about doing 'Good Newwz' was that he got to learn from his co-stars including Akshay Kumar. "Akshay sir's comedy timing is very good...He not only expresses with his dialogues but also [with] his body. He is like Mr Bean," Diljit said. "It's...difficult to pull...off and Akshay...can do it extremely well," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Sharon Stone's Bumble account restored after being blocked
text: American actress Sharon Stone's Bumble account was restored hours after she took to Twitter on Monday to report that the dating app had closed her account. Talking about why users possibly viewed her profile as fake, a Bumble representative said, "[It] wasn't photo verified...users felt it was too good to be true." Bumble has apologised to Sharon, the representative added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Adopt resolution demanding withdrawal of CAA in TN: DMK to AIADMK
text: Welcoming Kerala state Assembly's adoption of a resolution demanding the withdrawal of CAA, DMK Chief MK Stalin urged the ruling AIADMK party to do the same in Tamil Nadu Assembly on January 6. "It's the overwhelming desire of the people of India that every state assembly should adopt such a resolution to guard basic features of the Constitution," Stalin said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: State Assemblies have no power: Prasad on Kerala's resolution on CAA
text: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday said that only Parliament can pass laws regarding citizenship and "not any Assembly, including Kerala". Prasad's comment came hours after the Kerala Assembly passed a resolution seeking withdrawal of Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "I would…urge the [Kerala] CM to kindly have better legal advice," said Prasad. n
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: CAA violence supporters should drown if Pak doesn’t take them: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA from Rajasthan, Madan Dilawar, on Monday criticised violent anti-CAA protesters and those 'supporting' them by saying that those "burning the country over CAA" have "no right" to live here. "If they love Pakistan they should go there, if they love Bangladesh they should go there, and if both...countries don't want them, they can drown in...Indian Ocean," he said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Jadavpur University prof alleges attack by women BJP supporters
text: An assistant professor of English at Jadavpur University in Kolkata has alleged that she was attacked by women supporters of the BJP while returning from a protest against CAA and NRC. Doyeeta Majumder claimed in a Facebook post that she was "roughed up and hit by BJP 'bhodromohilas' (ladies)". Majumder said that she lodged an FIR after the incident.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Not afraid of taking big decisions: Eng coach after Test defeat vs SA
text: On being asked whether England can drop Stuart Broad or James Anderson in the second Test against South Africa, coach Chris Silverwood said that the team was not afraid to take big decisions. In the 1st Test, while Anderson ended the match with figures of 2-116, Broad finished with 5-100. Notably, England went with no spinner in first Test.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Stokes dismissal was huge: Faf Du Plessis on winning 1st Test vs Eng
text: South Africa skipper Faf Du Plessis has said that the dismissal of England all-rounder Ben Stokes in the second innings by Keshav Maharaj was "huge". "Stokes has proven in the Ashes that if he is around, he can win games on his own," he added. Chasing 376 runs, England were bundled out for 268 in their second innings.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: We thank the Indian govt for continued faith: Huawei on 5G trials permission
text: After the Indian government gave Huawei permission to conduct 5G trials in the country, the Chinese firm thanked PM Narendra Modi for "their continued faith". "We have our full confidence in the Modi government to drive 5G in India. Huawei is always committed to India," said Cyril Xu, Senior Manager at Huawei. 5G trials are expected to begin in January.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Survival is our first priority in 2020: Huawei as sales fall
text: Huawei Chairman Eric Xu said the company's top priority is "survival", adding that its sales in 2019 were expected to fall short from projections amidst US ban. Sales are expected to be up 18% to $121 billion but will fall short from the $125 billion estimated earlier, he said. Huawei sold 240 million smartphones this year, up 17% from 2018.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: SPG chief Arun Kumar Sinha gets tenure extension
text: Director of Special Protection Group (SPG) officer Arun Kumar Sinha on Monday was given over a one-year extension, an order by the Personnel Ministry stated. The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has approved extension in deputation tenure of Sinha from March 19, 2020 to July 30, 2021.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Punjab CM urges UP CM to review FIR against 55 religious devotees
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh urged UP CM Yogi Adityanath to review FIRs registered against 55 religious devotees in UP's Pilibhit for violating prohibitory orders under Section 144. CM Singh said the devotees were participating in the "customary Nagar Kirtan to observe the martyrdom of the Sahibzadas". Sahibzadas refers to sons of tenth Sikh Guru, Gobind Singh.
author: Shailesh

headlines: J&K HC opens vacancies to outsiders after Article 370 abrogation
text: The High Court of Jammu and Kashmir has announced recruitment on 33 vacant posts in different categories (non-gazetted) for eligible candidates from all over the country. After the abrogation of Article 370, this is the first recruitment process in the newly created Union Territory. National Conference provincial president said that J&K government jobs should be reserved for the local youth.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: SP MLAs take out cycle march against NRC, NPR, CAA in UP
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLAs on Tuesday took out a cycle march, flagged off by party chief Akhilesh Yadav, against the National Register of Citizens (NRC), the National Population Register (NPR) and the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). Sharing visuals, Akhilesh wrote on Twitter, "Don't need NRC-NPR, we need employment." Earlier, he had said that he won't fill the NPR form.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: UK Royal Family worked an average of 84.5 days in 2019: Docs
text: Official records show that the United Kingdom's Royal Family's prominent members worked an average of 84.5 days in 2019 out of the 253 working days in the country. Queen Elizabeth II worked a total of 67 days while her daughter Princess Anne worked 167 days, the highest among the royals. Prince Charles, heir to the throne, worked 125 days.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Hong Kong protests caused sadness, anxiety & even rage: HK Leader
text: Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam said that protests that began in Hong Kong over a now-cancelled extradition bill have "caused sadness, anxiety, disappointment and even rage". She added, "We all want to see an end to this predicament." "I'll not shy away from my responsibilities. I'll listen humbly to find a way out," she further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Pragati Maidan Metro Station renamed as Supreme Court Metro Station
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has announced Pragati Maidan Metro Station has been renamed as Supreme Court Metro Station "after multiple requests". "The changes will reflect in Delhi Metro's systems in a month's time," he added. He further said that Mukarba Chowk and flyover have been renamed as Shaheed Captain Vikram Batra Chowk "in retrospect to the Kargil War martyr".
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kim criticises report saying she gifted Kennedy's 'bloody' shirt to daughter
text: Television personality Kim Kardashian criticised a publication over a story that claimed she purchased the blood-stained shirt that former US President John F Kennedy was assassinated in as a Christmas gift for 6-year-old daughter North. "This is...fake! I didn't get JFK's shirt. That's a sick joke that someone tweeted as a fake [Instagram] story that I never posted," Kim tweeted.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I go to award shows only if they pay me to host or give my film an award: Rohit
text: Director Rohit Shetty revealed on No Filter Neha that he attends award shows only if he's paid to host or if his film is getting an award. "Otherwise no. Because it's...fake. It's all a TV show," he added. Rohit said he feels commercial entertainers aren't given their due at award functions, despite the fact that they're "more difficult" to make.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi should change her name to Feroze Priyanka: Union Minister
text: After Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's "saffron belongs to India's religious spirit" remark on UP CM Yogi Adityanath, Union Minister Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti on Tuesday said Priyanka should change her name to "Feroze Priyanka". "She can't understand saffron because she is a fake Gandhi," Jyoti added. "She has problems with Adityanath as he is taking action against criminals," Jyoti added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Tamil Nadu govt school damaged in Cyclone Gaja rebuilt by volunteers
text: A Chennai-based volunteers group, Direction for Volunteers (D4V), crowd-funded ₹8 lakh and rebuilt a school building in Tamil Nadu's Vandal. With this, they completed their target of rebuilding three schools damaged by Gaja Cyclone in 2018. The Direction for Volunteers had earlier rebuilt two schools in Thalaignayiru and in Kovilpathu at the cost of ₹7.7 lakh and ₹11.7 lakh respectively.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Railways to invite bids from private companies to run 150 modern trains
text: The Indian Railways will invite bids from private companies to run 150 modern trains based on a revenue-sharing model, Railway Board chairman Vinod Kumar Yadav said. The private trains will run on 100 routes, ending the Railways' monopoly in running trains. According to Railways' plan, private train operators can take trains on lease and provide better on-board experience and services.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Chhota Shakeel plans to kill Chhota Rajan, security tightened at Tihar
text: The security was increased in Delhi's Tihar jail where gangster Chhota Rajan is lodged after reports that underworld don Dawood Ibrahim's aide Chhota Shakeel is planning to kill Rajan inside the jail. According to reports, Rajan's three cooks have been changed and a distance of at least 10 metres is being strictly maintained between him and others inside the jail.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Police reimpose restrictions on movement of Cong leaders in Jammu
text: The police asked Jammu and Kashmir Congress President GA Mir, former Deputy CM Tara Chand and three more Congress leaders to stay inside their houses in Jammu on Tuesday. Mir said that the leaders had planned to hold meetings over the next two days. They were earlier confined to their homes till October after Article 370 revocation on August 5.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: SMS services to be restored in Kashmir from January 1 after 5 months
text: J&K Principal Secretary Rohit Kansal has announced that SMS services in Kashmir valley will be restored from midnight. Further, broadband internet services in all government-run hospitals in Jammu and Kashmir will also be restored. The Valley had been without internet and SMS connectivity since August 5, when the Centre abrogated Article 370.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 4 AP policemen given notice for mistreating undercover trainee IPS
text: Andhra Pradesh's Prakasam district SP Siddharth Kaushal has suspended a station writer and served show-cause notices to four, including SHO of Ongole Taluk police station, for misbehaving with a trainee IPS officer posing as a complainant. After receiving complaints against the station staff, Kaushal sent the trainee IPS officer dressed in civilian clothes to observe how they treated complainants.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: US embassy stormed in Iraq in protest against air strikes on Iran-backed militia
text: Demonstrators stormed the US embassy in Iraq's capital Baghdad on Tuesday in protest against the US' air strikes on Iran-backed militia. Security forces used tear gas to disperse the crowd. The US had carried out strikes against the Kataib Hezbollah in Iraq and Syria in retaliation to the killing of an American civilian contractor.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Talking to Trump on climate change would've been waste of time: Greta
text: Climate change activist Greta Thunberg has said that talking to US President Donald Trump at a UN summit on global warming would have been a waste of time.
