"I don't think I would have said anything because obviously he's not listening to scientists and experts, so why would he listen to me? I probably wouldn't have said anything," she said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: It was a tough year for Pakistan in Tests: Misbah-ul-Haq
text: Speaking about the Pakistan cricket team's performance this year, head coach Misbah-ul-Haq said, "Pakistan ended 2019 on a high note with victory against Sri Lanka, but, overall, it was a tough year for Pakistan in Test cricket." "Going further, we have to improve a lot of things in both red-ball and white-ball cricket," Misbah added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Sharapova to return next month at Brisbane International
text: Russian tennis player Maria Sharapova is set to return to professional tennis at the Brisbane International next month. Sharapova has been awarded a wildcard to play in the Australian Open warm-up tournament. The 32-year-old Russian will join current world number one Ash Barty, Naomi Osaka and Karolina Pliskova in Brisbane from January 6.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Focusing on process not results: Australia's Marnus Labuschagne
text: Australia batsman Marus Labuschagne, who has achieved his career-best rank of number four in Tests, has said that he's focusing on the process and not on the results. "[I'm] playing what's in front of me and not what's happened in the past and not what I want to achieve," he added. Labuschagne is the highest Test run-scorer for 2019.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: North Korea withdraws from women's 2020 football Olympic Qualifiers
text: North Korea has pulled out its women's football team from the Olympic Qualifiers set to be held in South Korea and China in February. North Korea's women's team were drawn in Group A along with South Korea, Myanmar and Vietnam. While the team didn't qualify in 2016, it had played in 2008 and 2012 Olympics Games.n
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Bengal keep Dinda out of Ranji squad against Gujarat
text: Bengal pacer Ashoke Dinda has been kept out of the squad for their upcoming Ranji Trophy Elite Group A fixture against Gujarat that is scheduled to start from January 3. The pacer, who has represented India in 13 ODIs and 9 T20Is, was dropped after he "abused" bowling coach Ranadeb Bose after a pre-match practice session and refused to apologise.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Russia starts antitrust investigation into Booking.com
text: Russia's Federal Antimonopoly Service (FAS) has opened an investigation into hotel reservation website Booking.com. FAS stated the website's contract terms with hotels and hostels didn't allow them to offer better rates on rival websites. The company could face a fine of up to 15% of its revenue generated in Russia if found to be in breach of Russian anti-monopoly laws.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Uber sues California over law classifying contract workers as employees
text: Uber and US-based delivery service Postmates have filed a lawsuit against a California law that classifies contract workers as employees, adding that it violates the US Constitution. The law states that companies will have to give contractual workers employee benefits and higher pay. The opponents argue that it would restrict them from job opportunities and flexibility to earn money. n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: New US law requires probe of Marshall Islands nuclear dump
text: The United States' Congress is demanding that the Department of Energy investigate an aging, cracking US nuclear waste dump threatened by climate change and rising seas in the Marshall Islands. As part of the new National Defense Authorization Act, signed last week by President Donald Trump, the energy agency must submit a report by mid-June.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: 2019 was Russia's hottest year on record: Weather agency head
text: Russia's Gidromedtsentr weather service's head Roman Vilfand has revealed that the year 2019 was the hottest ever registered in Russia. Vilfand said Moscow's average temperature for 2019 had hit 7.6-7.7 degrees Celsius, beating the previous record by 0.3 degrees. Weather records have been kept since 1879 in Moscow and since 1891 in Russia as a whole.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: 15 injured as bus falls into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh
text: As many as 15 people were injured when a bus carrying 57 passengers fell into a gorge near Bilaspur in Himachal Pradesh on Tuesday. The bus rolled down from a National Highway before plunging into the gorge, said the police. The injured have been shifted to a hospital in Bilaspur for treatment.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Indonesia protests to China on intrusion on its maritime border
text: Indonesia claimed that it has protested to China over the presence of a Chinese Coast Guard vessel in its Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) off the Natuna islands in the South China Sea (SCS). Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Geng Shuang said that China has sovereignty over islands near Natuna. He added that the two countries have "normal" fishing activity in SCS.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Al-Qaeda ally claims Somalia bomb attack that killed 90
text: The al-Qaeda-linked group al-Shabaab on Monday claimed responsibility for the Saturday blast in Somalia's Mogadishu that killed at least 90 people. "The blast targeted a convoy of Turkish and Somali forces and they suffered great loss," Ali Mohamud Rage, al-Shabaab's spokesman said. Earlier, Somalia's National Intelligence & Security Agency said that a foreign country had helped plan the attack.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: UK proposed NATO membership for Russia, files reveal
text: UK officials suggested inviting Russia as an "associate member" to join NATO to "integrate" it into the West after the end of the Cold War, documents released by the UK's National Archives revealed on Tuesday. The 1995 proposal, presented by the then Defence Secretary Malcolm Rifkind, was later dismissed at a meeting in January.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Sensex falls 300 points in year's last session, gained 14% in 2019
text: Indian equity benchmark index Sensex fell by 304 points in the year's last trading session to settle at 41,253. The broader Nifty 50 index ended at 12,168 on Tuesday, declining by 0.7% or 87 points. While Sensex rose over 14% in 2019, Nifty registered gains of 12% in the calendar year.
author: Dharna

headlines: Axis Bank appoints Amit Talgeri as its Chief Risk Officer
text: Axis Bank has appointed Amit Talgeri as its Chief Risk Officer (CRO) for the next three years starting January 1, 2020, replacing Cyril Anand. The bank has also appointed Naveen Tahilyani as the Group Executive - Head Banking Operations and Transformation. Notably, Axis Bank's shares rose 1.21% to about ₹763.30 following the announcement of the appointments.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Karnataka to allow non-IT sector women employees to also work night shifts
text: The Karnataka Cabinet on Monday approved an amendment to the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishments Act to permit women to work night shifts. However, employers have to obtain written consent from women willing to work at night and provide transport facilities. Notably, women employees in the IT and ITeS sectors have been allowed to work night shifts since 2002.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Deepika tags Priya Varrier in video of herself winking; Priya responds
text: Actress Deepika Padukone has shared a promotional video for 'Chhapaak', in which she can be seen winking towards the end. The video says, "Take that Priya Varrier!", while referring to the viral clip of Malayalam actress Priya Prakash Varrier winking in a song. Responding to this, Priya wrote, "Did the Goddess herself wink???!!! No better way to end 2019."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Bangladesh shuts down telecom services along border with India over CAA
text: The Bangladesh government has ordered telecom operators to shut down services for one kilometre along the entire border with India, citing security reasons. The decision was taken out of concerns that Indian Muslims might seek to enter Bangladesh following the enactment of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in India, a Bangladeshi official told Reuters.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Fan asks Ashwin who he will mankad in IPL 2020, spinner responds
text: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked Delhi Capitals' off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, "Who are the potential batsmen you can Mankad this IPL?" Responding to him, the 33-year-old cricketer wrote, "Anyone that goes out of the crease." Kings XI Punjab, who had bought Ashwin in IPL 2018 auction for ₹7.6 crore, traded the spinner to Delhi Capitals in November.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 6,500 under-14 children probed for 'sexting' in UK: The Guardian
text: Between 2017 and August 2019, nearly 6,500 children under the age of 14 were investigated for 'sexting' nude media in Wales and England where it's illegal, The Guardian reported citing police data. 306 cases of children under 10 included some as young as four, Guardian added. They were investigated on suspicion of sharing indecent images of themselves or other minors.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: It's not ready yet: Musk on SpaceX internet satellite constellation
text: SpaceX Founder and CEO Elon Musk, responding to a Twitter user enquiring about the aerospace startup's Starlink internet satellite connectivity, said, "It's not ready yet." The Twitter user had said that parts of Australia are about to lose "communications phones and internet", adding, "Is there anything you can do? Starlink?" Notably, SpaceX is aiming to launch about 42,000 Starlink satellites.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Govt has started on the wrong foot: Cong on appointment of CDS
text: Congress spokesperson Manish Tewari on Monday said that the central government has "started on a very wrong foot" with regards to appointment of General Bipin Rawat as India's first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS). In a series of tweets on Tuesday, he also raised questions on the appointment of a CDS indicating that it was "fraught with difficulties and ambiguities."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: In a first, Andhra government to deliver sand at doorstep from 2020
text: Andhra Pradesh government on Monday announced that it will provide door-to-door delivery of sand to consumers. The move will be piloted in Krishna district from January 2, and slowly expand to all 13 districts of the state by January 20. This comes amidst a shortage of sand in the state after the implementation of a new sand policy in September.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 13 people trapped in hospital lift with capacity of 7 in Pune rescued after 2 hours
text: As many as 13 people, who were trapped in a hospital lift in Pune for almost two hours on Tuesday morning, have been rescued by fire brigade personnel. According to fire officer Shivaji Chavan of Kondhwa fire station, the lift in the annexe wing of Noble Hospital, malfunctioned due to overloading as the lift had a capacity of seven people.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: UP MLA allegedly beats constable with shoes, forces him to drink urine
text: Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Kishan Lal Rajpoot and 50 others have been booked for allegedly thrashing a police constable with shoes and robbing him of his wallet and gold chain. The constable also alleged that the MLA asked his supporters to force him to drink urine. The constable reportedly had a conflict with a man known to the MLA's nephew.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: TV actress kills ex-boyfriend in front of husband at sister's house in Chennai
text: A 42-year-old woman, who worked in TV serials and ran a small tailoring business, allegedly killed her ex-boyfriend in the presence of her husband at her sister's residence in Chennai. The 38-year-old victim, who worked as a film technician, had allegedly asked her to get back into relationship with him. A hammer was used to smash the victim's head.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Railway Protection Force renamed as Indian Railway Protection Force Service
text: The Railways has renamed its security force Railway Protection Force (RPF) as Indian Railway Protection Force Service. As per an order issued on Monday, the railway ministry accorded organised Group A status to RPF and renamed it. The force was established by Railway Protection Force Act, 1957, enacted by the Parliament for "the better protection and security of railway property".
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 30 US prison guard trainees fired over Nazi salute in class photo
text: Thirty prison guard trainees in West Virginia, US have been fired for performing the Nazi salute in their class photograph. Investigation revealed a cadet had encouraged his classmates to use the salute "as a sign of respect for Byrd", a reference to instructor Karrie Byrd. "This kind of behaviour won't be tolerated on my watch," Governor Jim Justice said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Nirmala Sitharaman unveils ₹102 lakh crore national infrastructure plan
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday unveiled a report by a high-level task force which recommended ₹102 lakh crore spending on infrastructure. The projects will be spread across 22 ministries, 18 states and Union Territories, she said. "Power, railways, agriculture, irrigation, mobility, health, water and digital sector form the bulk of the pipeline project," she added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Nehha Pendse to tie the knot, shares pics from pre-wedding festivities
text: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant and actress Nehha Pendse is set to tie the knot with her boyfriend Shardul Singh Bayas. Nehha's pre-wedding festivities began with 'grahmukh puja' and she shared the pictures from the same on Monday, wherein, she could be seen dressed in a traditional Marathi outfit. "I'm marrying the man of my dreams," she said in an interview.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Trailer of Kangana's 'Panga' impressed me a lot: Deepika Padukone
text: Deepika Padukone said at an event that the trailer of Kangana Ranaut's 'Panga' has impressed her a lot. "Looking at this trailer, which is painted by Kangana Ranaut's performance, it seems that this film will also be very good," she added. Kangana's sister Rangoli Chandel acknowledged Deepika's comment with a tweet that has a series of folded hands emoji.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Was a nobody in 2010, now I'm shooting my 14th film: Arjun
text: Actor Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram to wish his fans a happy new year and said that 2019 reminded him "what a roller coaster life is". "[A]t...start of 2010, I was...nobody...today...I'm shooting my 14th film," Arjun wrote. Adding that people should "never give up" or "listen to naysayers", Arjun said, "[W]hen...underdog wins, it's...a story worth telling...follow your dreams this decade."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: This decade changed my life: Kriti Sanon on her acting journey
text: Actress Kriti Sanon took to Instagram on Tuesday and wrote, "This decade is when it all happened! This decade completely changed my life!!" "I learned so much, got over some of my fears, opened up as a person, broadened my perspective, realized my wings," she added. "This decade has given me experiences...ME...standing tall (literally) with no regrets," Kriti further wrote.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Sonia, Rahul are India’s enemies for supporting CAA violence: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA from Rajasthan, Madan Dilawar, on Monday criticised violent anti-CAA protesters and those 'supporting' them, saying, "Those burning the country and killing police over [CAA], and those...supporting them, are enemies of the country, be it Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi or Rahul Gandhi." He added, "They do not have the right to live in this country."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Zlatan Ibrahimovic set for AC Milan presentation on January 3
text: Italian club AC Milan on Monday confirmed that Swedish striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic will be officially presented as an AC Milan player on January 3. The six-month deal is reported to be worth around €3.5 million ($3.9 million) alongside bonuses, with the option of a further year. This will be the 38-year-old's second stint at the Italian club.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Bitcoin, dubbed the decade's best-performing asset, grew 90,00,000%
text: Cryptocurrency Bitcoin has posted gains of over 90,00,000% through the decade, as per data compiled by Bloomberg. This makes Bitcoin, which was trading at more than $7,200 on Tuesday, the best-performing asset of the decade with the highest return-on-investment (ROI). Created in 2008 by someone named Satoshi Nakamoto, Bitcoin's price reached a record high of $19,783 per bitcoin in 2017.
author: Dharna

headlines: Flipkart partners with govt to help SHGs sell products online
text: Flipkart partnered with the government's Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM) to support self-help groups (SHGs) and bring their products online.  It will also collaborate on other projects under the scheme to establish Flipkart Samarth programme in 22 states. Flipkart would provide market access, training and support to SHGs which includes local businesses.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Return of Chinese scientists from USA doubled from 2010 to 2017: Study
text: A new study has found that over 4,500 left the US for China in 2017, nearly double the number that left in 2010. The researchers made use of a scientific publisher's database that allowed them to track researchers based on their publications in scientific journals. China ranked second in the number of papers published in indexed scientific journals in 2017.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Number of youths joining terrorist organisations has declined: J&K DGP
text: Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh on Tuesday said that as per their record, around 130 people managed to infiltrate this year, compared to last year's figure of 143. "Number of youths joining terrorist organisations has also gone down," Singh added. While 218 people joined in 2018, this year the number was 139, the DGP further said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: US airstrikes in Iraq and Syria acts of terrorism: Iran
text: Iran on Monday said that strikes by the US against five targets of Iranian backed paramilitary groups in Iraq and Syria are an act of terrorism. "US military aggression against Iraqi soil and Iraqi forces is strongly condemned," the Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman said. At least 25 people were killed and 55 were wounded in the US airstrikes.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Putin lying that Poland responsible for WWII outbreak: Polish PM
text: Poland's Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki issued a four-page statement on Sunday stating that Russian President Vladimir Putin has been lying by blaming Poland for the outbreak of World War II. He said Putin was doing it to 'cover up' recent Russian political failures. "The Russian leader is well aware that his accusations have nothing to do with reality," Morawiecki added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Air India to be up for sale in coming weeks: Hardeep Singh Puri
text: Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said that Air India will be up for sale in the next few weeks and was optimistic about getting investors. Puri added that Air India won't shut down, after previous reports said that the national carrier may be forced to stop operations. Reportedly, IndiGo and Etihad have expressed interest in bidding for Air India.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Flipping out: Indian singer on his song featuring among Obama's favourites
text: Singer Prateek Kuhad has reacted to his song 'cold/mess' featuring in former US President Barack Obama's list of favourite songs in 2019. "This just happened and I don't think I'll sleep tonight. Totally flipping out," tweeted Kuhad. "I have no idea how cold/mess even reached him but thank you @barackobama, thank you universe...What an honour," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I'm not brave, I do cry but it's normal: Shweta on separation from 2nd husband
text: Television actress Shweta Tiwari has said after her separation from her second husband Abhinav Kohli, many women sent her messages, praising her for being brave. "There are so many women...who are going through this situation," she added. "I'm not brave. I'm very weak. I'm trying to overcome my problems. I do cry...but I think that's normal," said Shweta.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Kerala Assembly passes resolution for withdrawal of CAA
text: Kerala Assembly on Tuesday passed a resolution demanding the withdrawal of Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Earlier today, Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has moved the resolution in the Assembly, saying that the Assembly needs to keep Kerala's "tradition of inclusiveness alive". The CM also affirmed that no detention centres will be made in the state for illegal immigrants.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Manjrekar responds to insulting Harsha during commentary, says 'I regret it'
text: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar, who had insulted fellow commentator Harsha Bhogle on air for not having played cricket, has said he regrets doing it. "It was me losing control and I was unprofessional...I was wrong," he added. "It was wrong of me, so that is what really bothers me that I let my emotions get the better of me," said Manjrekar.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Nagaland declared 'disturbed area', AFSPA extended for 6 months
text: The Centre on Monday declared the whole of Nagaland as a "disturbed" area under the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act, 1958, for a further period of six months till June 2020. Nagaland has been under AFSPA for almost six decades now. The Act empowers security forces to conduct operations anywhere and arrest anyone without any prior notice.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Woman pours ink on man for criticising CM Uddhav; he keeps talking on phone
text: A woman, who was reportedly a Shiv Sena worker, poured ink on a man allegedly over his social media post criticising Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray in Beed on Monday. A video of the incident showed that the man continued talking over the phone to someone even as the woman emptied the bottle of ink on him and yelled at him.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: JUUL fails to stop own staff from vaping in offices despite ban: WSJ
text: Several employees of American e-cigarette startup JUUL continue to use e-cigarettes at their desks, in hallways and even in meetings in the office despite a ban imposed last year, The Wall Street Journal reported. An unnamed employee alleged the office looks like a scene from 1960s-based TV drama 'Mad Men', where characters obsessively smoke in the office, cars and home.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Tesla's biggest China rival Nio's stock rises 53% after Q3 results
text: Elon Musk-led electric carmaker Tesla's biggest Chinese competitor Nio's shares rose 53% on Monday after it reported a smaller-than-expected loss for its third quarter. Loss-making Nio said it delivered 4,799 vehicles in the quarter compared with 3,553 deliveries in the second quarter. However, Tencent-backed Nio warned it didn't have adequate cash for "continuous operation in the next 12 months".
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: $7-billion NASA telescope to hunt for 'second Earth' over 10 years
text: NASA has proposed a 10-year Habitable Exoplanet Observatory (HabEx) mission, estimated to cost about $7 billion, to find a "second Earth". The telescope will be aided by a 52-metre flower-shaped disk "Starshade", which will fly nearly 77,000 km from it to block light from stars. Relative to the Hubble Space Telescope, HabEx telescope will have a 66.6% larger mirror.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: States can't refuse to conduct NPR: MoS Home G Kishan Reddy
text: Union Minister of State for Home G Kishan Reddy has said that states cannot refuse to carry out the National Population Register (NPR) exercise. Reddy said that the proposed NPR would be almost the same as the one in 2010, with some more details being sought to implement welfare measures. The census and NPR would be done simultaneously, he said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: General MM Naravane takes charge as India's 28th Army Chief
text: General Manoj Mukund Naravane took over as the 28th Army Chief on Tuesday. General Naravane succeeded General Bipin Rawat who has been appointed as Chief of Defence Staff, overlooking all three branches of defence services. General Naravane was commissioned in the 7th battalion of The Sikh Light infantry in 1980 and is an alumnus of the National Defence Academy.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Chennai metro to operate till 1 am for New Year's Eve celebrations
text: The Chennai metro will operate till 1 am on January 1 to help the people return home after New Year's Eve celebrations. Police said that after 9 pm on Tuesday, vehicle checks will be conducted at 368 places. The names of those who are caught drunk driving will be added to serious offenders' list and their licenses will be cancelled.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Headless body of woman wrapped in bed sheet found in Mumbai
text: Headless body of a woman, believed to be in her mid-thirties, was found near a drain by the road in Mumbai's Ghatkopar on Monday, police said. The body, which also had the legs from beneath the knees missing, was found wrapped in a bed sheet. "Efforts are on to establish her identity," the police said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: PM used the word 'India' 220 times in 9 Mann Ki Baat episodes in 2019
text: In his monthly radio show 'Mann Ki Baat', Prime Minister Narendra Modi used the word 'India' 220 times in nine episodes which aired in 2019, making it the most used word. He used the word 'nation' 94 times and 'water' 73 times. PM Modi used 'mitron' 48 times, while 'young' and 'youth', 54 and 30 times respectively.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Pigs, broken windows found in Kota hospital where 940 kids died in 2019: NCPCR
text: A National Commission for Protection of Child Rights team has found broken windows, pigs roaming inside hospital campus and acute shortage of staff during the inspection of Kota's JK Lon Hospital, where 940 children died in 2019. Children were facing extreme weather conditions due to broken windows, an official said. Over 90 children died in the hospital in December.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Epstein made me get naked & give him massage when I was 14: Woman in lawsuit
text: A US woman has filed a lawsuit against the estate of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, who allegedly committed suicide, alleging that he sexually assaulted her when she was 14 in 2003. She said Epstein told her to get naked and give him a massage in his mansion. He touched her private parts and masturbated during the massage, she added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Deepika is going to win the National Award for 'Chhapaak': Himesh
text: Sharing a picture with Deepika Padukone from sets of Indian Idol, Himesh Reshammiya on Instagram wrote, "Deepika is going to [win]...National Award and every award of...country for Chhapaak." "[S]he is historic...so proud of her," he added. During the show's episode wherein she came to promote 'Chhapaak', Himesh performed 'Naam Hai Tera', whose music video marked Deepika's first on-screen debut.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: No one's asking you to be like Kabir, Preeti: Kiara on 'Kabir Singh'
text: Kiara Advani, when asked about 'Kabir Singh' and her character 'Preeti', said, "[I'm]...very different from Preeti. I wouldn't have done...things...she did." She further called Kabir and Preeti's characters "extremely flawed" and said, "No one is asking you to be like [them]." "[A]t the end of...day, everything is fictional...I think it's the love story...everyone related to," Kiara added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Mere rumours: Deepika on Hrithik playing Lord Krishna in 'Mahabharata'
text: Deepika Padukone has called the reports claiming that Hrithik Roshan will portray the role of Lord Krishna in 'Mahabharata' "mere rumours". "I have no clue about who is spreading it...[W]e haven't finalised...script of the movie yet," Deepika, who is also producing the film, said. She added the film is "being worked upon" and filmmakers are "looking for a talented director".
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Huawei revenue hits record $122 billion in 2019 despite US sanctions
text: Chinese handset and telecom equipment maker Huawei said its revenue rose to a record high of $122 billion in 2019, registering an 18% year-on-year growth. However, the revenue was lower than initial projections, Huawei added. It forecasted that the trade restrictions placed upon it by the US would present a "difficult" 2020 for the company and likely slow down growth.
author: Dharna

headlines: Reliance enters e-commerce space with grocery delivery venture: Report
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries has entered the e-commerce segment with the pilot launch of its e-tail platform JioMart in some parts of Mumbai, Livemint reported. The platform reportedly lets users shop grocery items sourced from nearby merchants and promises free home delivery. The venture would compete with the likes of grocery delivery startups like Bigbasket, Grofers and Amazon Pantry.
author: Dharna

headlines: Owner sues Airbnb for ₹6.7 crore after 500 party at mansion booked by 4
text: A UK-based property developer is suing home-renting startup Airbnb for ₹6.7 crore (£723,000) after his mansion, booked by a family of four, was instead used by 500 people for a party in 2017 and left "wrecked". The 67-year-old said he spent two-and-a-half months repairing the property which suffered damages worth ₹4 crore, for which Airbnb allegedly only offered ₹1 crore.
author: Dharna

headlines: Rajasthan Transport dept to observe No Vehicle Day on 1st day of every month
text: In a bid to reduce the vehicular pollution, Rajasthan Transport Department will observe a 'No Vehicle Day' on the first working day of every month. "All officers and employees...will come to their offices as pedestrians or via bicycle or by a public transport service," state Transport Minister Pratap Singh said. However, the order won't be applicable to the checking squad.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Over 40,000 policemen to be deployed in Mumbai for New Year's eve
text: Over 40,000 policemen will be deployed to maintain law and order during New Year celebrations in Mumbai, an official said. These will include personnel from Special Branch, State Reserve Police Force, Quick Response Team, commando unit Force One, and Riot Control Police. The authorised establishments have been allowed to serve liquor till 5 am on January 1, the official added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: All is well: Nitish on Prashant Kishor's comment on BJP-JD(U) rift
text: On being asked about the reports of "rift" between his party JD(U) and its alliance BJP, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said "Sab theek hai" to reporters on Tuesday. This comes after JD(U) Vice-President and political strategist Prashant Kishor said that that "only Nitish Kumar can tell as to how JD(U) supported the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill in the Parliament".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: PMO proposes waiving carbon tax levied on coal, says report
text: The Prime Minister's Office (PMO) has proposed waiving a ₹400-per-tonne carbon tax levied on the production and import of coal, Reuters reported citing documents. The move would help power plants finance the installation of pollution-curbing equipment. Over half of India's coal-fired power plants are reportedly set to miss the phased deadline starting December to cut emissions of sulphur oxides.
author: Dharna

headlines: Businesses not accepting RuPay card, UPI payment to be fined ₹5,000 a day
text: The Finance Ministry has said that businesses in India, with over ₹50-crore sales, will be compulsorily required to offer certain electronic payment facilities to customers from January 2020. It prescribed businesses to accept digital transaction modes such as UPI and debit cards powered by RuPay. A penalty of ₹5,000 a day would be imposed in case of defaults starting February.
author: Dharna

headlines: Uber Premier aims to make your New Year celebrations hassle free
text: With New Year around the corner, Uber is promising to make your celebrations hassle free with Uber Premier, featuring select sedans and top rated drivers, so that everyone can enjoy premium experiences with their friends and family at affordable prices. Riders can now rely on Uber Premier for a comfortable, convenient & safe ride back home, says Uber.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: No entry for vehicles in Delhi's Connaught Place after 8pm on New Year's Eve
text: Delhi Traffic Police have issued an advisory, stating that traffic restrictions will be imposed from 8pm onwards in central Delhi on December 31. It stated that no vehicles will be allowed in inner, middle or outer circle of Connaught Place. Traffic arrangements have also been made at places like Saket, Hauz Khas, Nehru Place, Rajouri Garden, Model Town among others.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Sona shares more pics in swimsuit after trolls write 'slut clothes' on previous pics
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra on Tuesday shared more pictures of herself in a swimsuit after trolls commented 'wearing slut clothes' on her previous swimsuit pictures. "Some felt let down, 'Thought you were a serious person?!'," she added. Sona also got into an argument with hairstylist Sapna Bhavnani, who tweeted she's "tired of women posing in skimpy clothes and thinking it's feminism".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Male Pakistani filmmaker names CEO of media house as his rapist
text: Pakistani filmmaker Jamshed Mahmood Raza, who in October alleged being raped by a media giant 13 years ago, has revealed the accused to be Hameed Haroon, CEO of Pakistan's newspaper Dawn. Haroon has denied the allegations, saying he's initiating legal action to clear his name. Raza later stated that coming forward with his story was not about "[bringing] down Dawn".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Ex-Pak Minister praises ex-pornstar Mia Khalifa for showing 'Indian Muslim solidarity'
text: Former Pakistan Interior Minister Rehman Malik on Monday tweeted "God bless her" for ex-pornstar Mia Khalifa after a tweet stated she was an Indian actress showing solidarity with Indian Muslims. He, however, deleted the tweet later. When people pointed out that the women in the post are pornstars, Malik replied, "We will get them - it's against UN charter also."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Assam education department warns staff against criticising government
text: The Assam government's Higher Education Department on Monday warned its employees against criticising the government. Earlier, the Elementary Education Department ordered disciplinary action against employees posting "political" posts on social media. The order by the Higher Education Department comes amid the ongoing protests across Assam against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Will recover damages during anti-CAA protests from guilty: Railways
text: Railway property worth ₹80 crore was damaged during protests across the country against the amended Citizenship Act, Railway Board Chairman Vinod Kumar Yadav said. Its recovery will be made from those found involved in arson and violence, Yadav added. While the Eastern Railway suffered damages worth ₹70 crore, the Northeast Frontier Railway suffered damages worth ₹10 crore, Yadav further said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Website calculates people's age on any planet in Solar System
text: San Francisco-based museum of science, technology and arts, The Exploratorium, features a website that calculates users' age on any of Solar System's planets, as per their birthdate on Earth. The site also tells users when they can celebrate their next birthday as per a different planet. The age is calculated based on the planets' rotation and revolution around the Sun.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: ₹3.5 crore motorcycle that turns into 'hover-cycle' nears production
text: French automaker Lazareth's over ₹3.5-crore (about £380,000) motorcycle LMV 496, which can turn into a 'hover-cycle', has neared production. Powered by four 96,000-rpm jet turbines, the motorbike's kerosene tank is large enough to enable it to hover above the ground for around 10 minutes. Just five units will be produced worldwide, with four of them being sold to the public.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: N Korea hackers stole sensitive data from govts, academics: Microsoft
text: Microsoft has said it seized control of 50 web domains run by a hacking group called 'Thallium', believed to be operating from North Korea. It said Thallium targeted government employees, think tanks, university staffs and people working on nuclear proliferation issues, among others. The hackers used 'spear phishing' with legitimate-looking emails to direct the victims to those malicious domains.
author: Dharna

headlines: Woman lists 19-yr-old disabled daughter on dating app in blackmail scheme
text: A 39-year-old mother was arrested from her Bangkok apartment on Christmas over an alleged extortion scheme by listing her 19-year-old specially-abled daughter on dating app Badoo. The mother allegedly blackmailed seven men by accusing them of luring her daughter for sex. The woman and her aide also allegedly wore fake government uniforms to threaten victims with arrest and extorted money.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Chinese startup says its 2 lakh bikes were stolen, damaged in 2019
text: Chinese startup Meituan Bike or 'Mobike' revealed that it lost over 2 lakh of its "dockless" bikes to theft and vandalism in 2019. As per its blog, police in Beijing arrested 2,600 people in relation to bike theft and vandalism. Notably, the startup confirmed in March that it would exit several more Asian countries after downscaling India operations in 2018.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Astronaut Peggy congratulates Koch on breaking her space record
text: Former NASA astronaut and first female Space Station Commander Peggy Whitson congratulated astronaut Christina Koch for breaking her record for the longest single female spaceflight of 288 days. In a video message, Whitson can be seen floating in zero gravity. Sharing a photo from her first spacewalk training run, Koch said, "It's beyond an (honour) to follow in her footsteps."
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Man ignores 'horn' on back for 3 years, it turns out to be cancer
text: A 50-year-old British man ignored a growing 'cutaneous horn' made of skin and hair protein keratin until when it measured 14 cm in length and 5.8 cm in width. Tests revealed the growth to be squamous cell carcinoma (SCC), a slow-growing, curable skin cancer. Doctors said that they were surprised to see that it had not spread to other parts.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Gen Rawat receives farewell as Army Chief, pays tribute at National War Memorial
text: General Bipin Rawat on Tuesday received his farewell as the Indian Army chief after completing a three-year term. He paid tribute at the National War Memorial and said, "I wish to convey my gratitude to the soldiers, rank and file of Indian Army who've stood steadfast under challenging circumstances." He was named the first Chief of Defence Staff on Monday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Kerala tops Niti Aayog's SDG Indian Index 2019, Bihar ranked last
text: Kerala retained the top rank while Bihar was ranked at the bottom in Niti Aayog's Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) India Index 2019. According to SDG India Index, states like Uttar Pradesh, Odisha and Sikkim have shown maximum improvement in their rankings since 2018. The SDG index evaluates the progress of states and union territories on social, economic and environmental parameters.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: US congratulates Gen Rawat over his appointment as India's first CDS
text: The United States on Tuesday congratulated General Bipin Rawat on his appointment as India's first-ever Chief of Defence Staff (CDS). The post will help in catalysing greater joint cooperation between the militaries of the two countries, the US said. As CDS, General Rawat's role would be to create synergy in operations and finances of the Army, Navy and Air Force.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 4,000 trapped on Australia beach encircled by fire; skies turn 'red'
text: Around 4,000 holidaymakers and locals were trapped on a beach in the Australian town of Mallacoota after fire encircled a tourist area. While people said they are witnessing embers falling around them, videos show skies turning red in the town. Authorities had asked around 30,000 tourists to leave the area as the bushfires engulfed several regions in the country.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Ex-Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn 'flees' to Lebanon amid pending Japan trial
text: Former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn, who is facing charges of financial misconduct in Japan, has 'fled' the country to take refuge in Lebanon's Beirut. Ghosn, who was arrested in 2018 and released under bail conditions that he would not leave Japan, was supposed to face trial in 2020. Ghosn said, "I haven't fled justice, I've escaped injustice and political persecution."
author: Dharna

headlines: Indian film 'Josef - Born in Grace' to contend for Best Picture at Oscars
text: Indian film 'Josef - Born in Grace' has been selected to contend for Best Picture at Oscars 2020. It is among 344 films selected by the Academy and is based on short story 'Joseph' by Umakanta Mahapatra. The film, directed by Susant Misra and produced by Umakanta's son Ashok Mahapatra, revolves around a missionary doctor played by actor Victor Banerjee.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: 'Not so innocent people' also died in anti-CAA protests: BJP leader
text: BJP's National General Secretary Ram Madhav on Monday said that both "innocent" and "not so innocent" people have died in the protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "The protests by the Opposition have led to violence and unrest in several parts of country," he added. "The mind of Opposition leaders...is knowledge proof and information proof," Madhav further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BMW files patent to charge electric motorcycle through its kickstand
text: German automaker BMW has filed a patent for a technology that wirelessly charges electric motorcycles through their kickstands. It depicts the bike's stand being placed on a charging pad on the ground that has a coil of wire running AC current. The kickstand's tip is also equipped with an AC coil, converting electromagnetic current from the pad into electric current.
author: Dharna

headlines: People see line of white dots in sky, mistake SpaceX satellites for aliens
text: After people in the UK spotted a straight line of white lights in the night sky, several of them mistook Elon Musk-led SpaceX's internet satellites for alien spacecraft. SpaceX has launched a total of 120 Starlink 'micro' satellites so far. "Why is there a straight line of stars moving in convoy overhead at high altitude? #UFO," a Derbyshire resident tweeted.
author: Dharna

headlines: Cong General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi tweets Goddess Durga mantra
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Tuesday took to Twitter to post a Goddess Durga mantra. This comes a day after Priyanka said, "Yogi Ji (Adityanath) wears bhagwa (saffron)...it's a symbol of the Hindu religion...no place for revenge...in that religion." Earlier, Adityanath had said that his government will take "revenge" from those damaging public properties during anti-CAA protests.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Rahul Gandhi wants to walk with 'Ghazwa-e-Hind' of Pak: Giriraj Singh
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Sunday took to Twitter and wrote that although Prime Minister Narendra Modi has "shattered Pakistan's dream of 'Ghazwa-e-Hind' (a war of conquering India)", Congress leader Rahul Gandhi "wants to walk with it". "It's not an attempt to oppose the CAA, NPR and NRC....but [Rahul wants] Rohingya and Pakistani Muslims come to India," Giriraj added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Ghaziabad DM places 'Black Box' at office for complaints against officials
text: A complaint box named "Black Box" has been placed at Ghaziabad District Magistrate's office for people to drop their complaints against government officials or employees who demand a bribe or other forms of gratification. "In order to bring transparency, we have placed the complaint box here," said DM Ajay Shankar Pandey. Government officials can also drop their complaints, Pandey added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Shehla misspells 'Chitrangada' while correcting her name in a tweet
text: Activist Shehla Rashid took to Twitter to respond to a user who misspelled her name as 'Shela', while asking, "How did Shela Rashid move from far-Left AISA to Muslim identity politics?" Shehla responded, "Why do they always misspell...Muslim names...never getting Chitranganda...or Kshitij wrong?" A user replied to her, "You spelt 'Chitrangada' wrong! You're habituated to make everything communal."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Fan says Shraddha Kapoor should marry Varun Dhawan; actors respond
text: Actors Varun Dhawan and Shraddha Kapoor were asked to respond to a comment, wherein a fan urged Shraddha to marry Varun. "That's a compliment...We've been getting that a lot," said Shraddha. However, Varun said it's difficult to translate off-screen romance into onscreen chemistry and added, "I don't think if people are actually very romantically inclined, they can behave like that."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Raveena criticises person who called her 'MILF', Twitter user says she criticised Aditi
text: Criticising an unnamed person, Raveena Tandon tweeted, "Even though you don't follow, you sure are interested. I remember you'd called me 'milf'." A Twitter user speculated it is directed at comedian Aditi Mittal, who called Raveena a 'MILF' in 2011. On Wednesday, Aditi tweeted that one of Raveena's posts appeared on her timeline even though she doesn't follow her.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Will drag MP CM by collar if he addresses Cong rally in Delhi: SAD leader
text: Shiromani Akali Dal leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa on Wednesday said, "We challenge Congress party that...(Madhya Pradesh) CM Kamal Nath will not be allowed to address any public rally in any corner of Delhi." "We will drag him by his collar and bring him down," he added. This comes ahead of Assembly elections in the National Capital on February 8.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Give Western UP quota in Jamia, JNU to stop anti-India slogans: Union Min
text: Union Minister Sanjeev Balyan on Wednesday said if people from Western UP are given 10% reservation in Delhi's JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia, then nobody will be able to make anti-national slogans. "We'll fix them all alone, no one will be needed," Balyan added. Compared to JNU and Jamia, there're more students in Meerut College who support CAA, he said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Tragedy that players who can be better than Kohli are neglected in Pak: Razzaq
text: Former Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq has said that Team India captain Virat Kohli is lucky as the BCCI supports him well and instils the confidence in him that any player needs to succeed. He added, "I do believe that even in Pakistan we've players who could become better than Kohli, but they're neglected by our system which is a tragedy."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I created 'sexual game' WhatsApp group, it was a terrible idea: England Lions' Tom
text: England Lions batsman Tom Kohler-Cadmore has revealed he was the one who created the 'sexual conquest game' WhatsApp group, which led to his teammate Alex Hepburn getting jailed for five years for raping a woman. "I know it was a terrible idea but...it was just messages between me and some friends. Obviously it was in really bad taste," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Arguing with woman like reading License Agreement: Saudi prince told Bezos
text: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman sent an image on WhatsApp to Jeff Bezos before his divorce, according to an investigation. It showed a woman's picture and read, "Arguing with a woman is like reading Software License Agreement. In the end you have to ignore everything and click I agree." Bezos was in a secret relationship with Lauren Sanchez then.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 644 militants surrender in Assam along with 177 arms: Police
text: A total of 644 militants of eight banned insurgent outfits surrendered in Assam on Thursday along with 177 arms, police said. The members of the insurgent groups ULFA (Independent), NDFB, RNLF, KLO, CPI (Maoist), NSLA, ADF and NLFB surrendered in presence of Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal. We hope all of them create an atmosphere of peace in Assam, Sonowal said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: No role for any third party: India after Trump offers help on Kashmir
text: Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said "there's no role for any third party" over the issue of Kashmir. "If there are any bilateral issues between India and Pakistan, it should be discussed between the two under provisions of Simla Agreement and Lahore Declaration," he added. His statement comes after US President Donald Trump offered help on Kashmir issue.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Farmers get Candy Crush link instead of loan waiver info; official suspended
text: Farmers in Maharashtra were directed to the game 'Candy Crush Saga' after clicking on a link supposed to contain information about farm loan waiver. A top official has been suspended for "negligence and irresponsible conduct". "It needs to be found out if the action was unintentional or deliberate and hence he is suspended with immediate effect," a statement said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: ICJ orders Myanmar to protect Rohingya Muslims from genocide
text: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Thursday ordered Myanmar to prevent the genocide of Rohingya Muslims. ICJ said that it has jurisdiction to hear a case against Myanmar which was brought by the African nation of The Gambia. The African nation had accused Myanmar of genocide against Rohingyas in violation of the 1948 genocide convention.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: India can grow at 7-8% for a long time, China cannot: Harvard's Kenneth Rogoff
text: Kenneth Rogoff, professor of economics at Harvard University, said India has the potential to grow at 7-8% for a long time but China does not. "India has a young population, it has a lot of potential in its infrastructure, to catch up. China is at the other end of the curve. It's reaching the end of the line," he added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: There are a lot of difficulties to enter any market in India: Emirates
text: Emirates COO Adel Ahmad Al Redha has said there are a lot of trade rules and difficulties to enter any market in India. "As far as investment (in Air India) is concerned, there's nothing yet on the table," he added. Meanwhile, Chief Commercial Officer Adnan Kazim said "restricted" bilateral air services agreement between India and UAE is affecting both nations.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Pak govt suspends release of 'Zindagi Tamasha' fearing religious unrest
text: Pakistan government has suspended the release of the film 'Zindagi Tamasha' after Islamist political party Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) objected to the portrayal of a man who is "shunned after a video of him at a wedding goes viral". TLP claimed that the film "might lead (people) to deviate from Islam", with officials warning that it could lead to religious unrest.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Have reserved it for the best films of my life: SRK on this decade's plans
text: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked Shah Rukh Khan about his plans for this decade. "I've reserved it for the best movies of my life," SRK replied. Another fan wrote to him, "Sir, lots of rumors about your next project...you please announce yourself." To this, Shah Rukh replied, "Main hi announce karunga aur kaun karega mere bhai."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: States' resolutions against CAA a political gesture: Shashi Tharoor
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said states' resolutions against the CAA were more of a "political gesture" as citizenship is granted by the Centre and states hardly have any role in it. However, he added that "states can say they won't implement NPR-NRC" because they have a vital part in it as their officials will be conducting the exercise.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Instagram testing payment options for its 'shop' tab in India: Report
text: Instagram is planning to test payment options for its 'shop' tab in India so that users can complete transactions on the app itself unlike, being directed to the brand's website, Entrackr reported. Instagram has been testing the tab with brands for six months. Users can go to the 'shop' tab and tap on the post to see the product price.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: NDA govt eroded democracy: Chidambaram on India's democracy index rank
text: Former Home Minister P Chidambaram accused the ruling NDA government of eroding democracy and weakening democratic institutions after India dropped 10 places in the latest Democracy Index released by Economist Intelligence Unit. "Those who are in power are the real tukde tukde gang," Chidambaram added. India ranked 51 out of 167 and was listed among countries where there were "regressions".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Netaji Bose opposed Hindu Mahasabha's divisive politics: Mamata
text: Paying tributes to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his 123rd birth anniversary, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that Netaji Bose had opposed the Hindu Mahasabha's "divisive politics". She described Hindu Mahasabha as one of BJP's organisation. "Netaji Bose had fought for a secular India. Now efforts are on to oust those who follow secularism," Mamata further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: He never compromised with ideals: Shah in tribute to Bal Thackeray
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday paid tribute to Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray on his birth anniversary. Shah took to Twitter and wrote, "Balasaheb Ji was a brilliant intellect of his time, always mesmerised the masses with his oratory skills." "He always stood firm and never compromised with his ideals," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Raj Thackeray unveils new saffron MNS flag, son Amit joins party
text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray unveiled the party's new saffron-coloured flag and his son Amit was formally inducted into the party however his exact role wasn't announced. The new MNS flag features the seal of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj with the party's name displayed below it. Reportedly, this has been perceived as MNS' drift towards Hindutva ideology.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Training aircraft makes emergency landing on expressway near Delhi
text: A National Cadet Corps (NCC) training aircraft on Thursday made an emergency landing on the Eastern Peripheral Expressway near Ghaziabad's Sadarpur village. The aircraft, enroute to Hindon airbase from Bareilly, made the landing after it faced a technical problem. The 135-km-long Eastern Peripheral Expressway connects Haryana and western Uttar Pradesh.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Maha govt holds review meeting with police on Bhima-Koregaon case
text: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Thursday met Maharashtra Police to review the case of violence at Koregaon Bhima in Pune on January 1, 2018. Last month, NCP chief Sharad Pawar demanded that a Special Investigation Team be set up to probe the action taken by Pune Police in the case.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Air tanker crashes in Australia while fighting bushfires, 3 dead
text: A Canadian-owned C-130 Hercules aerial water tanker crashed while fighting bushfires in Australia, leaving its three American crew members dead. "There's no indication at this stage of what caused the accident," a fire services official said. "Initial reports are that there was a large fireball associated with the impact of the plane as it hit the ground," the official added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Yes Bank won't be allowed to fail, solution will emerge: SBI Chairman at WEF
text: State Bank of India Chairman Rajnish Kumar said that he has a "feeling" that Yes Bank "will not be allowed to fail" and was certain that "some solutions will emerge". "Yes Bank is a significant player in the market with an almost $40 billion balance sheet," Kumar said at the WEF. Yes Bank has been unable to raise fresh capital.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: You married outside your religion, no one said a word: Swaraj's husband to Shah
text: Late External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal defended Anupam Kher after Naseeruddin Shah called him a "clown". He wrote that as Kher's contemporary, he could confirm Kher "is an honest" man. Swaraj further questioned, "You married outside your religion. No one ever said a word...Have you not been given more than an equal opportunity?" and called Shah "ungrateful".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: It's only buzz: Shraddha on reports of marriage with rumoured boyfriend Rohan
text: Actress Shraddha Kapoor, on being asked about reports of marriage with rumoured boyfriend Rohan Shrestha during an interview with Times of India, said, "Like you said, it's only 'buzz'". "Right now, I don't have the time to think about anything apart from...movies," she added. Rohan is a celebrity photographer and son of Rakesh Shrestha, who's also a Bollywood photographer.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: US Senator Elizabeth describes favourite Indian dish; journalist asks people to guess
text: US Senator Elizabeth Warren, who's campaigning for the upcoming Presidential elections, described her favourite Indian dish during an interaction with a news website. Tweeting the description, campaign reporter Zohreen Shah wrote, "If you know what she's referring to, feel free to chime in." While a user wrote she meant 'kheer', others commented that it could be 'malai kofta' or 'paneer'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Mob snatched my phone, deleted apps: Woman mistaken of conducting CAA survey
text: A mob allegedly stopped a woman, Nazeeran Bano, from collecting data for the Economic Census and manhandled her in Rajasthan's Kota on Wednesday, police said. Bano was manhandled by people who alleged that the survey was for CAA. "They snatched my phone and deleted mobile application containing data entry of about 1,000 households," Bano said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: They are so nice, you can't even think of revenge: Kohli on New Zealand
text: On being asked if he was thinking about avenging the World Cup semi-final defeat against New Zealand, Virat Kohli said, "Honestly...even if you want to think of revenge, these guys are so nice, you can't get into that zone." "We get along really well with all these guys and it's all about just being competitive on the field," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: He did not have to do that: Steve Smith on Virat Kohli's World Cup gesture
text: Talking about Team India captain Virat Kohli's gesture during 2019 World Cup that won him the 'ICC Spirit of Cricket Award', Australia batsman Steve Smith said, "It was really nice of him." He added, "He didn't have to do that and yeah it was lovely gesture and I really appreciated that." Kohli had asked the crowd to not boo Smith.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: FIR against Azharuddin for allegedly cheating travel agent of ₹21 lakh
text: An FIR has been registered against ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin and two others for allegedly cheating a Maharashtra travel agent of nearly ₹21 lakh. The agency owner alleged that he booked various international flight tickets for Azharuddin and others but he wasn't paid. Azharuddin dismissed the allegation and said he'll file a defamation case worth ₹100 crore against the complainant.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: He is free to go: Nitish to JD(U) leader who questioned alliance with BJP
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday criticised party leader Pavan Varma for questioning JD(U)'s tie-up with BJP for Delhi elections, saying he's "free to go" wherever he likes. Varma on Tuesday shared a letter wherein he mentioned that Kumar has expressed apprehensions "in private" about BJP's "divisive" agenda. "If anyone has issues they should discuss within the party," Kumar added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Was told 'throwbacks' occur on Thursdays: Tata shares pic of himself from 1962
text: Tata Trusts Chairman Ratan Tata on Thursday shared a picture of himself from his days in Los Angeles. "I was going to post this yesterday, but I was told about 'throwbacks' and how they occur on Thursdays," Tata wrote. After completing B.Arch in 1962, Tata worked with an architecture firm in Los Angeles before returning to India in late 1962.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Bike rental startup Bounce raises $105 mn from FB Co-founder's VC firm, others
text: Bengaluru-based bike rental startup Bounce has raised $105 million at a valuation of $520 million in Series D funding round led by Accel Partners and Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin's B Capital Group. Other existing investors including Falcon Edge and Chiratae Ventures also participated in the round. Notably, Asia Co-head at B Capital Group, Kabir Narang, will be joining Bounce's board.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Delhi court acquits man accused of rape, says 'woman was his wife on that day'
text: A man accused of rape by his estranged wife has been acquitted by a Delhi court, observing that "the complainant was married to the man on that day". The woman had left the accused after he was convicted and jailed for theft. She complained about him after he allegedly visited and made physical contact with her repeatedly after his release.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Pak spews venom, takes to hate speech like fish takes to water: India at UN
text: India criticised Pakistan at the United Nations for raking up the Kashmir issue at the international forum. India's Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN K Nagaraj Naidu said Pakistan spews venom and takes to hate speech like fish takes to water. "Pakistan needs to reflect that there are no takers for its false rhetoric," Naidu added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Who was 16-yr-old Muhsin, honoured with bravery award posthumously?
text: President Ram Nath Kovind honoured 16-year-old Muhammed Muhsin from Kerala's Kozhikode with ICCW National Bravery Award (Abhimanyu Award) posthumously on Wednesday. Muhsin had saved three of his friends from drowning in a sea but lost his life in the process. "I'm proud of Muhsin. I'm not sad at all. He gave his life for a good cause," his father said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 8-yr-old hospitalised with swollen legs after teacher makes her do 450 sit-ups
text: A tuition teacher in Maharashtra's Thane has been booked for allegedly making an eight-year-old student do 450 sit-ups for not completing her homework, police said. The girl had swelling in her legs and was admitted to a hospital. The teacher, identified as Lata, has allegedly stripped the girl last month as well and beat her for not completing her homework.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Tihar asks Nirbhaya convicts their last wish, says 'they haven't responded yet'
text: Tihar Jail authorities in Delhi have asked the four Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts to list their last wish before they are hanged to death on February 1. "We're awaiting a reply from them. None of them have responded so far," an officer said. The convicts have also been asked to name anyone they wish to meet one last time.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: White House confuses Iraq with Iran, says Trump met Iranian President
text: The White House confused Iraq with Iran and mistakenly captioned its video on YouTube writing that US President Donald Trump met with Iranian President instead of Iraqi President. Trump met Iraqi President Barham Salih in Davos on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum. "We've been friends and the relationship is very good," Trump said about Salih at the meeting.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US mother kills her 3 kids, puts bodies on sofa to make it look like they're asleep
text: A 22-year-old woman has been arrested in US' Arizona for allegedly killing her three children and then propping their bodies on a sofa to make it look like they were sleeping, authorities said. Police said the woman confessed to the crime and sang to two of the kids while smothering them. She had a drug addiction.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Through my production house, I want to make landmark films: Kangana
text: Kangana Ranaut who recently inaugurated the studio of her production house Manikarnika Films said that she "wants to make landmark films". "The idea is...not to get carried away by the pressure of making film after film or remakes," she added. Kangana further said that she is getting into production because by being "only a director, [there is no] creative liberty".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Deepika 1st Indian actress to star in Louis Vuitton Pre-Fall 2020 campaign
text: Deepika Padukone has become the first Indian actress to star in Louis Vuitton's Pre-Fall 2020 campaign. Deepika took to Instagram to share the look which features her with Stranger Things-inspired cover titled 'Don't Turn Around'. "I'm...thrilled to [join] the Louis Vuitton family...[being] a part of Nicolas Ghesquière's vision...is not only exciting but also very humbling," Deepika wrote.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I agree with Kangana: Nirbhaya's mother on actress' comment on Jaising
text: Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi has said that she "fully agrees" with actress Kangana Ranaut's remark against advocate Indira Jaising who had said that Nirbhaya's mother should forgive her daughter's rapists. Kangana had said that Jaising should be jailed with the rapists for four days. "I'm glad...someone has spoken against [Jaising] and has stood with me," Asha Devi further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Jackie, Tiger Shroff to play father-son for 1st time in 'Baaghi 3'
text: The father-son duo Jackie Shroff and Tiger Shroff will be seen together on-screen in 'Baaghi 3'. "Everyone has been waiting to see Tiger team up with his 'Hero' father Jackie since we launched him," said co-producer of the film Sajid Nadiadwala. The third instalment in 'Baaghi' franchise, directed by Ahmed Khan, will also star actresses Shraddha Kapoor and Ankita Lokhande.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Don't have to show documents: Andhra on conducting NPR
text: Andhra Pradesh government issued an order stating that the state will carry out an exercise to update the National Population Register (NPR) for a period of 45 days. During this exercise, people will not be required to submit any document. "Enumerators are...not to press for any further answers to any query if they (people) don't intend to give," it said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: India to get 1st war memorial for animals in Meerut: Report
text: India's first war memorial for service animals including dogs, horses and mules is being planned at Meerut's Remount and Veterinary Corps Centre and College, according to a report. The memorial will recognise their outstanding contribution to military service alongside soldiers, officers said. "Land has already been identified...and the preliminary design has been frozen," an officer said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Find out who ordered demolition of Bellandur houses: K'taka HC to police
text: Karnataka High Court on Wednesday directed Bengaluru City Police Commissioner to conduct an inquiry into which authority ordered the demolition of makeshift houses in Bellandur. The court has also restrained authorities from evicting the residents of makeshift homes in Bellandur ward. This comes days after over 100 houses were demolished allegedly by Bengaluru municipal corporation and police.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: K'taka boy who guided ambulance on flooded bridge wins Bravery Award
text: A 12-year-old boy named Venkatesh from Karnataka's Raichur will be awarded the Indian Council for Child Welfare National Bravery Awards 2019 on Republic Day. During the floods in Karnataka last year, when an ambulance driver couldn't find the road due to floodwater, Venkatesh had jumped into the water to guide the ambulance by wading through the flooded bridge.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: MHA to take charge of J&K police transfers, postings: Report
text: Ministry of Home Affairs will take charge of all transfers and postings of J&K police personnel, including junior postings such as that of Station House Officers, a report said. The MHA order reportedly states that RR Bhatnagar, advisor to the Lieutenant Governor, "will suggest appropriate measures for effective policing and intelligence gathering for effective policing at police station level".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: US drone strike killed 10 civilians in Herat: Afghan officials
text: At least 10 civilians, including three women and three children, were killed in a drone attack carried out by the US forces earlier this month in Afghanistan targetting Taliban group, Afghan officials said on Wednesday. The strike which took place in Shindand's Herat on January 8 also killed Taliban commander Mullah Nangyalay, along with 15 other militants.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Which roads in Delhi are closed today ahead of Republic Day rehearsals?
text: The Delhi Traffic Police on Wednesday issued an advisory ahead of full dress rehearsal for Republic Day which will start at 9.50 am on January 23. Police said no traffic will be allowed on Rajpath, Rafi Marg, Janpath and Man Singh Road till the parade is over. Also, traffic won't be allowed on Tilak Marg, BSZ Marg and Subhash Marg.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Registrations closing soon for WeSchool's PGDM Programs
text: Welingkar Education offers 8 AICTE approved PGDM programs across two campuses - Bengaluru & Mumbai. The 2020 admission process will have one phase of selection. Interested candidates can apply with scores from the following tests: CAT (2019), XAT (2020), CMAT (2020), ATMA (Feb 2020) & GMAT (2017 onwards).
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Man steals speaker & gets arrested on purpose to avoid getting married to lover
text: A man in China stole a ₹20,000 speaker and got arrested on purpose to avoid getting married to his girlfriend. The man confessed to the crime and said he knew that police will find him and that would trigger his girlfriend to break-up with him. "My girlfriend wants to marry me, but I don't want to marry her," he said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Brad called out 'Aniston!' & they embraced: Photographer who took their pics
text: Photographer Emma McIntyre, who clicked ex-couple Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston's viral pictures at SAG Awards, has revealed what happened in the build-up to the moment. "He called out 'Aniston!' and she turned around and they embraced and congratulated each other," Emma recalled. "[They] genuinely [seemed] happy to see one another...You could sense the respect between [them]," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: He used injection for erection before assault, says lawyer during Harvey's rape trial
text: During rape-accused producer Harvey Weinstein's trial which began on Wednesday, prosecutor Meghan Hast told jury that he screamed at one victim that she "owed" him sex and used injections to induce an erection before an assault. "He ripped [a woman's] jeans off so forcefully that it left scratch marks," the lawyer added. "He must be held accountable," Hast further said.nn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Women like her give birth to monsters: Kangana on Jaising's 'forgive rapists' advice
text: Reacting to advocate Indira Jaising's statement that Nirbhaya's mother should forgive her daughter's rapists, Kangana Ranaut said, "That lady (Jaising) should be kept in jail with those convicts for four days." "Women like her give birth to such monsters and murderers," she added. Jaising had said Nirbhaya's mother should follow Sonia Gandhi's example, who forgave husband Rajiv Gandhi's killer.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Raising 'azadi' slogans during protest will result in sedition charges: Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said shouting 'azadi' slogans during CAA protests would amount to treason and attract strict punishment. "Staging a peaceful protest is everyone's right. But...if anyone resorts to violence, we would recover damages from them," he added. This comes at a time when women in several parts of UP have been staging protests against CAA.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: I have more money than Sehwag has hair on his head: Shoaib Akhtar
text: Shoaib Akhtar took to his YouTube channel to respond to Virender Sehwag's old remark that the ex-Pakistani fast bowler praises India as he wants to make money. "I've more money than Sehwag has hair on his head," he said. Akhtar added, "I don't understand if I'm giving my analysis why it bothers people. I didn't become famous due to YouTube."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: My son was born at mid-day: PM shares quote from diary of Netaji Bose's father
text: PM Narendra Modi offered tribute to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose on his 123rd birth anniversary and shared a page of Netaji's father Janakinath Bose's diary recorded on the freedom fighter's birth. "I rose early but found Prabha was still suffering. A son was born at mid-day. Prabha felt very ill but thank God she somehow got strength," it read.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Law student in Delhi alleges sexual assault by Tihar counsel
text: A law student in Delhi has accused a lawyer working as a legal aid counsel at Tihar of sexually assaulting her by luring her to his home. The student who works as an intern at Tihar's legal aid department said the accused forced himself on her and kissed against her consent. However, she managed to escape by pushing him away.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: US is a developing nation like India: Trump on WTO status
text: Stating that US isn't treated fairly by the World Trade Organisation as it's not viewed as a developing nation, President Donald Trump said that according to him US is a developing nation too like India and China. "[China and India] got tremendous advantages by the fact that they were considered 'developing' and we weren't. And they shouldn't be," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Woman who accused ex-CJI of sexual harassment gets job back in SC: Report
text: The Supreme Court has reinstated in service a woman staffer who had accused former Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi of sexual harassment, The Indian Express reported. The woman had alleged that she was transferred and then terminated after she resisted the ex-CJI's advances. However, the top court's in-house inquiry committee had found "no substance" in her charges.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Wife of Atlas Cycles co-owner found hanging; half-page suicide note found
text: Natasha Kapur, Atlas Cycles co-owner and promoter Sanjay Kapur's wife, allegedly committed suicide by hanging herself from a ceiling fan at home in Delhi. Police also recovered a half-page suicide note purportedly written by the 57-year-old, wherein she wrote, "I'm taking my...life, I just can't live anymore." "The exact reason behind her extreme step is not known," police said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Trump tweets record 131 times on impeachment trial day
text: Amid impeachment trial against US President Donald Trump in Senate, he posted on Twitter 131 times, breaking his earlier record for tweets posted on a single day. The posts including 36 original tweets and 110 retweets made the day his most active on Twitter since he became president. Trump's tweets on Wednesday were on impeachment hearing, his successes as president.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: ‘Shubh Mangal...' is about embracing LGBTQ community: Ayushmann
text: Ayushmann Khurrana has said that his upcoming film 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan' is about "celebrating inclusivity, uniqueness, and individuality among the people of our country, embracing the LGBTQ community". He added that it's "a very important film for India" and that it will deliver a "positive social message". 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan'  is scheduled to release on February 21.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: To play a policeman will be the most challenging role for me: Hrithik
text: Actor Hrithik Roshan at 'Umang: A Mumbai Police Welfare Fund's Initiative' said that a police officer's role will be the "most challenging role of his life". "I have essayed all kinds of roles...haven't got a chance to play a policeman's character," he added. "I would urge the filmmakers to write a police officer's role for me," Hrithik further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I only gave my opinion: Kangana on replying to Saif's 'India' remark
text: Commenting on her reply to Saif Ali Khan's 'India' remark, Kangana Ranaut said that she was "just expressing her point of view". "I read...headlines which said 'lashed out'...seemed like I had spoken harshly," Kangana added. Earlier, Saif had said that "a concept of India" wasn't there, to which Kangana had replied, "If there was no Bharat then what was Mahabharat?"
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Comedy group Monty Python's member Terry Jones dies at 77
text: Terry Jones, one of the founding members of the British comedy group Monty Python, has died aged 77 on Tuesday night in North London. Jones' family released a statement which stated, "Terry passed away...after a long...but always good humoured battle with a rare form of dementia." Monty Python are best known for creating the television show 'Monty Python's Flying Circus'.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I find the question insulting: Shakti on being asked if she wants to act
text: Dancer Shakti Mohan, on being asked if she wants to act in Bollywood films, said that she finds this question "offensive and insulting for a dancer". "Do we ask an actress...if she will...debut as...choreographer? So, why ask such a question to us?" she added. "Am I not good enough as a dancer to prove my creativity?" Shakti further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: CAA can be described as world's most important human rights law: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Roopa Ganguly on Wednesday said Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) should be regarded as the world's most important human rights law. "CAA will not have any adverse impact on Indian citizens. Opposition parties are spreading lies and misleading people," she added. "Despite all hue and cry over the issue, the fact remains that CAA symbolises humanism," Ganguly further said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Gujarat BJP MLA resigns, says many MLAs feeling 'frustrated' like him
text: BJP MLA from Gujarat, Ketan Inamdar, forwarded his resignation to Legislative Assembly Speaker on Wednesday alleging that senior officials and ministers are ignoring him and his constituency. Inamdar also claimed that many MLAs in BJP are feeling "frustrated" like him. "It seems that honour and respect of an MLA are not maintained in this government," the MLA said.
author: Jigyasu
