headlines: Tata Motors’ Jaguar Land Rover to cut up to 500 jobs at SUV factory
text: Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) said on Wednesday that it will fire about 500 employees at its northern England Halewood factory to improve efficiency and cut costs. The decision comes amid a £2.5 billion cost savings drive planned by JLR. The carmaker had announced in 2019 that it plans to cut 4,500 jobs around the world due to fall in sales. nnn
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: 3 cameramen booked for filming woman constable changing clothes in AP
text: Three cameramen from different news channels have been booked for allegedly filming a video of a woman constable in Andhra Pradesh while she was changing her clothes. The woman constable complained to her higher authorities after which videos and photos shot by the three were confiscated. "This is indecent behaviour. We never expected such things from media," police said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Hong Kong airline to let crew wear surgical masks amid virus outbreak
text: Hong Kong's Cathay Pacific Airways will allow all crew members and frontline employees to wear surgical masks due to concerns over a new coronavirus. The passengers to and from China's Wuhan would also be allowed to change or cancel flights for free through March 31. The virus has been detected in the United States, Thailand, Japan and South Korea.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Told Trump war with Iran will be disastrous: Pak PM Imran Khan
text: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Wednesday said he has told US President Donald Trump that a war with Iran would have disastrous consequences. "If there is conflict between Iran and the Western world it will be a disaster...In my opinion it would be insanity," Imran Khan said. He met Trump on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum summit.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: China locks down Wuhan after Coronavirus outbreak
text: China on Wednesday suspended all transport networks into and out of Wuhan, the epicenter of the new coronavirus. The city's airport and train stations will be closed to outgoing passengers due to the outbreak that has killed 17 and infected nearly 600. The World Health Organisation (WHO) on Thursday will decide whether to declare a global emergency over the outbreak.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Springboard offers outcome led courses in Data Science and UI/UX
text: San Francisco headquartered online learning platform, Springboard offers outcome and mentor-led courses in Data Science, Data Analytics and UI/UX for Indian professionals. Learners are paired 1:1 with personal mentors to work on projects and a career coach to help get a job. If learners don't get a job post 6 months of course completion, Springboard refunds 100% fee.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Mahindra shares video of Math teacher's shortcut method, SRK says 'wow'
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has shared a video which shows a teacher teaching students a method to memorise multiplication table of 9. He tweeted, "Whaaaat? I didn't know about this clever shortcut. Wish she had been MY math teacher." Replying to his tweet, Shah Rukh Khan wrote, "Can't tell you how many of my life's issues this...has solved wow!"
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Fan asks about rent of one room in Mannat, SRK says ‘30 years of hard work'
text: A fan took to Twitter and told actor Shah Rukh Khan that he wants to rent one room at his sea-facing bungalow 'Mannat' and asked how much it will cost. Responding to the fan, Shah Rukh Khan wrote, "30 saal ki mehnat mein padega. (It will cost 30 years of hard work)." Mannat is estimated to be worth ₹200 crore.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Russell Crowe shares pics showing how rain helped his bushfire-affected property
text: Oscar-winning actor Russell Crowe took to Twitter to share before-and-after pictures of his property affected by bushfire in Australia. "My place 10 weeks ago after the fire had gone through, and this morning after a big weekend of rain," he captioned the pictures. Crowe's property was ravaged by the bushfire in November while he was overseas.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: AAP asks EC to cancel candidature of BJP's Kapil Mishra
text: AAP has written to Delhi Chief Election Officer demanding cancellation of BJP leader Kapil Mishra's candidature. AAP alleged that Mishra's nomination papers were accepted despite not providing a 'No-Dues' certificate pertaining to electricity, water and telephone expenses incurred during stay at a government accommodation. Mishra has been staying in a government house for 10 years, AAP claimed.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Punjab CM Amarinder sends Hitler's 'Mein Kampf' to SAD chief over CAA
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has sent Adolf Hitler's 'Mein Kampf' book to Shiromani Akali Dal chief Sukhbir Singh Badal. Singh said it was shocking that SAD was supporting the Citizenship (Amendment) Act to save Union Cabinet berth. Singh asked Badal to read the book and learn from history to decide whether the country should come first or political expediency.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Longest Test innings was longer than 10 football games
text: Former Pakistani cricketer Hanif Mohammad batted for 970 minutes in a Test against West Indies, during his knock of 337 runs, which ended on January 23, 1958. The innings, covering nine consecutive sessions and enough to encompass over 10 football matches, included 24 boundaries, 105 singles, 44 twos and 16 threes. The 337-run knock helped Pakistan draw the match.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Tesla hits $100 billion value, Elon Musk now eligible for $346 million bonus
text: Tesla has become the first listed US carmaker to hit a market capitalisation of $100 billion. If the market value stays above that level for both a one-month and six-month average, CEO Elon Musk will receive the first $346 million instalment of a potential $50-billion share-based pay package. Musk has already hit an operational target that's necessary for the award.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: #Jamal: Bezos tweets Khashoggi memorial pic after reports Saudi prince hacked his phone
text: Washington Post owner Jeff Bezos tweeted a photo of himself at a memorial service for journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was murdered in October 2018 by Saudi government agents in Istanbul. The tweet comes after reports that Bezos' phone was hacked by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in May 2018. Khashoggi wrote pieces critical of Saudi government for Washington Post.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: UN calls for investigation into alleged Saudi hacking of Jeff Bezos' phone
text: UN experts called for an immediate investigation into the "possible involvement" of Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in the hacking of Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' mobile phone. The hacking was "an effort to influence, if not silence, The Washington Post's reporting on Saudi Arabia", experts said. The hack is in contravention of "fundamental international human rights", the UN said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Tesla value overtakes Volkswagen, which sold 30 times more cars last year
text: Tesla on Wednesday overtook Volkswagen Group as the world's second most valuable carmaker with a market value of $106 billion, $7 billion more than its German rival. Volkswagen delivered almost 11 million vehicles last year, 30 times more than Tesla's 367,500 cars. The Elon Musk-led carmaker trails only Japan's Toyota, which is valued at around $200 billion.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Kerala RSS worker arrested for allegedly throwing bomb at police post
text: A Kerala RSS worker has been arrested for allegedly throwing a bomb at a police picket post in Kannur. The accused's real aim was to attack RSS party office and make it seem like an attack by CPI(M), police said. Another reason behind attack could've been that he wanted to scare police with whom he had an issue, police added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 630 passengers to get ₹100 each after Tejas Express gets delayed by over 1hr
text: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has decided to pay ₹100 as compensation to each of around 630 passengers of the Mumbai-Ahmedabad Tejas Express after it was delayed by over an hour on Wednesday. As per the IRCTC's policy ₹100 are paid for a delay of over an hour and ₹250 for a delay of over two hours.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Sitharaman should be replaced if PM not happy with her work: Chavan
text: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan has alleged that 13 pre-budget meetings headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah were held at the Prime Minister's Office but Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman wasn't invited to any of them. "If PM Narendra Modi is not happy with Sitharaman's performance, she should be replaced with a more competent person," said Chavan.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: South Korea discharges its first transgender soldier
text: South Korea's military has discharged its first transgender soldier who was enlisted as a man and underwent gender reassignment surgery last year, claiming Byun Hui-su's case "constitutes a reason for being unable to continue service". Byun, who holds the rank of staff sergeant, said she was recommended the surgery by doctors at a military hospital after suffering from gender dysphoria.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Please don't touch me: Senators get phrase cards to use amid Trump impeachment trial
text: Amid US President Donald Trump's impeachment trial, US Senators have been given phrase cards to use while dealing with reporters or protesters at Capitol Hill. "Please do not touch me" and "You are preventing me from doing my job" are among some of the phrase cards given to the Senators. The senators will serve as jurors in the impeachment trial.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Always opposed CAA but Delhi polls to be fought on local issues: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said he has always opposed the CAA-NRC issue and AAP voted against it in Parliament. However, he added that the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections will be fought on local issues. Kejriwal urged people of Delhi, especially BJP and Congress workers to vote for AAP on the basis of work they have done in last five years.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Facebook trains AI robot to navigate 'without a map'
text: Facebook has developed a reinforcement learning algorithm which it claims lets a robot find its way in an unfamiliar environment "without using a map". The algorithm uses a depth-sensing camera, GPS and compass to get a robot to its goal with a "success rate of 99.9%". The robot navigates close to shortest possible path with "no backtracking and wrong turns".
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Bengaluru, Delhi lead digital merchant payments in 2019: Report
text: Bengaluru topped the list of cities in terms of digital merchant payments in 2019, with 23.31% of the peer-to-merchant transactions, a report by Razorpay said. It was followed by Delhi with 10.44% share of such transactions. Hyderabad came in at third with 7.61% of transactions. Karnataka saw the highest adoption of digital payments at 26.64% followed by Maharashtra at 15.92%.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: PM Modi's younger brother part of Gujarat tableau team for Republic Day
text: PM Narendra Modi's younger brother, Pankaj Modi, is in Delhi as part of the Republic Day tableau team from Gujarat, officials said on Wednesday. "Our tableau will showcase Gujarat's architectural and cultural heritage. The main piece will be the 'Rani Ki Vav: Jal Mandir'," Pankaj said. "We're delighted and excited to represent our culture on the Rajpath," he added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Startup that analyses foot traffic for businesses raises $12 mn
text: California-based location and foot traffic analysing startup Placer.ai raised $12 million in Series A led by JBV Capital. Other investors including Aleph and Reciprocal Ventures also participated in the round. Launched in 2013, Placer.ai helps its clients, like retailers, with renting or buying properties. It provides real-time data of foot traffic, location and helps with ad spending decisions.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: We have it under control: Trump as 1st case of coronavirus reported in US
text: Speaking on the new coronavirus being detected in the US' Washington state, President Donald Trump said, "We have it totally under control. It's one person coming in from China." The US President added, "It is going to be just fine." The new virus outbreak began in China's Wuhan city and has claimed the lives of nine people.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Nearly 450 schools shut in Bangkok due to high pollution level
text: Nearly 450 schools in Thailand's capital Bangkok were shut by authorities due to an increase in the pollution level. The particulate matter (PM2.5) in Bangkok increased to 78.3 pg per metre cube, according to an air quality monitor, a level above 35 is considered unhealthy. A teacher said that students get affected by air pollution because they are often outdoors.
author: Shailesh

headlines: US Prez candidate Tulsi Gabbard sues Hillary Clinton for $50 mn
text: US Presidential candidate Tulsi Gabbard sued former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton for defamation and is claiming $50 million in damages. Gabbard claimed that Hillary had described her as a "Russian asset" and that she was being supported by Russia in her campaign. "No one, Russia or anyone else, controls her or her presidential campaign," Gabbard's lawsuit said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: We're adding a couple of countries to US travel ban list: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said that a few more countries will be added to the list of countries whose nationals face a travel ban to the US. He added that the names of the countries will be announced "very shortly". Trump had first announced a travel ban in 2017 that included mainly Muslim majority countries.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Aramco overseas listing still on the cards: Saudi Finance Minister
text: Saudi Aramco's international listing is "still on the cards" but it won't happen "anytime soon", Saudi Finance Minister Mohammed al-Jadaan told Bloomberg. Aramco made its debut on Saudi stock exchange in December after raising $29.4 billion through its IPO by selling a 1.725% stake. It overtook Microsoft and Apple to become the most valuable listed company at $1.88 trillion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I was fired after I reported sexual harassment: Grammys Ex-CEO
text: Former Grammys CEO Deborah Dugan has alleged she was fired from the Recording Academy after complaining about sexual harassment and pay disparities. Dugan's lawyers have filed the discrimination complaint with the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission five days before the Grammy Awards, scheduled for January 27. She alleged she was sexually harassed by the Academy's general counsel Joel Katz.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Riteish asks SRK one life lesson he has learnt from AbRam, actor responds
text: During a question-answer session on Twitter, actor Riteish Deshmukh asked Shah Rukh Khan about the one life lesson he has learnt from his six-year-old son AbRam Khan. "Whenever you are sad, hungry or angry...cry just a little bit while playing your favourite video game," Shah Rukh responded after which Riteish wrote, "Hahahaha.... Will surely implement this."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: If you can criticise Big B & Kohli,  I'm in good company: Kher to Shah
text: After Naseeruddin Shah called Anupam Kher a "clown who doesn't need to be taken seriously", the latter responded to the statement. "This isn't you talking but all the substances you've consumed for years. They've clouded your judgement," he said. "If you can criticise...Amitabh Bachchan, Rajesh Khanna, Shah Rukh Khan and Virat Kohli, then...I'm in great company," Kher added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Mayawati, Akhilesh accept Amit Shah's challenge for public debate on CAA
text: BSP supremo Mayawati and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav have accepted Home Minister Amit Shah's challenge to Opposition leaders for a debate on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Mayawati tweeted, "The BSP accepts the challenge to debate at any forum and at any place." "As far as debate is concerned, finalise the venue. Select your favourite channels and anchors," said Akhilesh Yadav.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Gandhis, Tharoor, Sidhu among Cong star campaigners for Delhi polls
text: Congress has released a list of 40 star campaigners for Delhi Assembly elections, which includes interim chief Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. The list also includes Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, who recently criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for not taking action against CAA. Navjot Singh Sidhu and Shatrughan Sinha will also campaign for Congress candidates in Delhi.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Fan asks Shah Rukh Khan when will Shubman Gill captain KKR, actor responds
text: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked actor Shah Rukh Khan when will batsman Shubman Gill captain Kolkata Knight Riders. The actor responded, saying, "As soon as KKR makes you the Head Coach my friend." KKR commented on the post, writing, "Savage replies," and shared the picture of current head coach Brendon McCullum.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Winning World Cup remains obsession, will do all to fulfil that ambition: Shastri
text: Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that winning World Cup remains an obsession for Team India and they will do all to fulfil that ambition. He added, "That toss will be taken out of the equation, we'll play well irrespective of conditions, opponents and venue. That's what our aim is and that is what we are chasing."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I had put cream on my hands: Player on why he asked ball girl to peel banana
text: France's 21-year-old tennis player Elliot Benchetrit, who was criticised for asking a ball girl to peel a banana during his match, has claimed he asked the girl as he had put cream on his hands. He added the chair umpire told him that the ball girl wasn't his slave. "I couldn't believe that the umpire said that," he stated.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Revenue comes from men's cricket, unfair if women ask for same pay: Mandhana
text: Referring to the pay gap between Indian men and women cricketers, opener Smriti Mandhana said, "We need to understand...the revenue which we get is through men's cricket." "It's unfair on our part to say...we need same pay, it's not right," she added. Notably, Indian men and women cricketers in the topmost grade get ₹7 crore and ₹50 lakh each, respectively.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: BCCI asks Saha to skip Ranji Trophy match ahead of New Zealand tour
text: BCCI has asked wicketkeeper-batsman Wriddhiman Saha to skip Bengal's next Ranji Trophy match against Delhi to keep himself fit ahead of the Test series in New Zealand. Saha is recovering from a finger injury which he picked up during the Day/Night Test against Bangladesh in November. This comes after Shikhar Dhawan and Ishant Sharma recently suffered injuries.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: WhatsApp rolls out Dark Mode in latest beta version on Android
text: WhatsApp has started rolling out Dark Mode feature for Android users, as spotted by WABetaInfo. However, only users enrolled for the beta programme will receive the update. Users can enable Dark Mode from the "Chats" section of WhatsApp's settings menu, which includes four options in the Display setting - Light Mode, Dark Mode, Set by Battery Saver and System default.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Kejriwal govt burned corruption proof before polls: Tajinder Bagga
text: BJP candidate from Hari Nagar seat for Delhi Assembly polls, Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, has alleged AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal-led Delhi government was behind the fire that broke out at Delhi Transport Department office on Monday. "All the evidence of corruption is being burnt by the Delhi government," he tweeted. "There were scams in DTC, CNG and transport," said Bagga.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Smriti alleges developer used photo in ad without consent; FIR lodged
text: An FIR was lodged on a complaint by Union Minister Smriti Irani's aide that her picture was used by a developer without her consent in a newspaper advertisement, police said on Wednesday. Irani's private secretary Vijay Gupta had complained that Sai Green City, Jagdishpur used the pictures, names and designations of some eminent people including Irani to sell plots.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: What is WiFi calling, recently launched by telecom companies in India?
text: WiFi calling allows users to make calls through any broadband connection, anywhere, when the signal is weak. The receiver need not be connected to WiFi and can be on a regular cellular connection. The free service requires no app and can be enabled from settings on supported devices. The phone will automatically toggle between WiFi and VoLTE for seamless connectivity.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Vodafone leaves Facebook's Libra project over regulatory scrutiny
text: Vodafone has backed out of Facebook's cryptocurrency project Libra reportedly over continuous regulatory scrutiny, the tech giant said, adding that the makeup of the Association members may change. The list of 29 partners has reduced to 20 with MasterCard, Visa, among others also leaving the association. Notably, the Libra Association said over 1,500 entities are interested in joining the project.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: We will do well only if others do well alongside us: Sundar Pichai at WEF
text: Commenting on whether there is a risk that Google may become too powerful, its CEO Sundar Pichai said at the WEF that the company will do well only if other firms around it flourish. "With our scale rightly comes scrutiny. Yes, we've bought start-ups, but we also invest every year in hundreds of startups through our venture arms," he said.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: India may force WhatsApp, Telegram, others to trace messages' origin
text: India may soon have regulations which would force social media companies and instant messaging apps like Facebook and Telegram help agencies identify the origin of sensitive content. The government will submit the suggested change to local intermediary liability rules to the Supreme Court later this month. Media reports said agencies would need court orders before exercising such requests.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: AI leader in 2030 will rule the world until 2100: Brookings report
text: A report by economist Indermit Gill published by Brookings Institution said that the nation leading in artificial intelligence (AI) in 2030 would go on to rule the world until at least 2100. "The race seems now to be mainly between the US and China," it said. The report added China may already be spending more on R&D than the US.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Tencent offers $148 mn to take over computer game maker Funcom
text: Tencent has offered to buy Norwegian computer game developer Funcom for $148 million in cash, a 27% premium to its current value. The board of Funcom unanimously supported the bid. Last year, Tencent had bought a 29% stake in Funcom, making it the largest shareholder. In case of full acquisition, there will be no changes in Funcom's management.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: California-based marketing analytics firm AppsFlyer raises $210 mn
text: Mobile attribution and marketing analytics startup AppsFlyer, based in California, raised $210 million in series D led by New York-based General Atlantic. Existing investors including Qumra Capital and Goldman Sachs also participated in the round which brought the company's total funding to $294 million. Founded in 2011, the startup allows advertisers to see which campaigns are driving results.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Maharashtra cabinet approves 24x7 access to Mumbai malls, eateries
text: The Maharashtra cabinet has approved a plan that allows malls, multiplexes, shops and eateries to stay open 24x7 in specific non-residential areas of Mumbai starting January 27. "This move will increase jobs for people and revenue for the government," the state Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray said. The policy won't be imposed on anyone, whoever wants can comply, Thackeray added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 3 Punjabi-origin men stabbed to death in UK over ongoing dispute: Police
text: Scotland Yard said three Punjabi-origin men were stabbed to death in London last week as a result of an "ongoing dispute" involving men from Sikh and Hindu communities. All those involved were known to each other, police added. Two men were arrested, including a 29-year-old Indian-origin man who was charged with possessing a weapon in a public place.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I would have loved to see Greta Thunberg speak: Donald Trump
text: US President Donald Trump said that he would have loved to see climate activist Greta Thunberg speak while he was in Switzerland, attending the World Economic Forum. He added that the US has one of the "cleanest air on earth" and the country is "clean". Trump further said that Greta should focus on places where pollution continues to rise.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Kosovo, Serbia agree to resume direct flights after two decades
text: Kosovo and Serbia agreed to launch direct commercial flights after they were halted due to a war between Kosovo insurgents and Serbian forces in 1998. Kosovo President Hashim Thaci said, "This event marks another step...to normalise relations between Kosovo and Serbia." Thaci said that the deal was mediated by US President Donald Trump's National Security Adviser Robert O'Brien.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Lebanon forms new government under PM Hassan Diab amid protests
text: Lebanon has formed a new government under PM Hassan Diab who was appointed with the backing of Iran-backed Hezbollah and President Michel Aoun last month. This comes after Hezbollah and its allies agreed on a deal to tackle the country's financial and monetary crisis. Saad Hariri resigned as PM in October 2019 amid mass protests against country's ruling elite.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Embassy Group to invest ₹2,000 cr to develop co-living spaces
text: Bengaluru-based Embassy Group said it will invest ₹2,000 crore to develop co-living facilities in six cities across India under the brand Olive. It is planning to launch around 20,000 beds in the first phase with each project comprising 500-5,000 beds. The company said it wants to cater to needs of 30 million people who are moving into metros every year.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Shriram Capital halts merger with 2 listed arms after RBI request: Report
text: Shriram Capital has reportedly paused plans to merge with its lending arms, Shriram Transport Finance and Shriram City Union Finance, after RBI told it to reduce its stake in the insurance business. The merger would've created an entity with 77% stake in life and general ventures. RBI suggested non-bank financiers including Shriram to lower their stake to 50% or below.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Neha Kakkar gifts ₹2 lakh to firefighter on Indian Idol 11
text: Singer Neha Kakkar has gifted ₹2 lakh to a firefighter named Bipin Ganatra on the sets of Indian Idol 11. This happened during the shooting of an episode ahead of 71st Republic Day in which several Army men, police personnel, lifeguards and firefighters were invited as guests. Ganatra has been working as a firefighter for 40 years.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: My son has saved my number as 'police' on his phone: Twinkle Khanna
text: Twinkle Khanna on Wednesday shared a post in which she revealed that her 17-year-old son Aarav has saved her number as 'Police' on his phone. Sharing a picture of herself with a police van in the backdrop, Twinkle wrote, "Considering my son has saved my number as 'Police' on his phone I suppose this is rather apt."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: PM Modi, Hema, Sunny Deol among 40 BJP star campaigners for Delhi
text: BJP has named 40 star campaigners for the Delhi Assembly elections. Apart from PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah, the list includes Hema Malini, Sunny Deol, Gautam Gambhir, singer Hans Raj Hans and Bhojpuri actors Ravi Kishan and Dinesh Lal Yadav 'Nirahua'. Union Ministers Rajnath Singh, Nitin Gadkari and UP CM Yogi Adityanath will also campaign for BJP.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Honoured: Kumble as PM uses 'broken jaw' example during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha'
text: Former Team India captain Anil Kumble took to Twitter to react to PM Narendra Modi motivating students by giving example of him bowling with a broken jaw in a Test against West Indies in 2002 during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha'. "Honoured to have been mentioned in #ParikshaPeCharcha2020 Thankyou Hon. PM ⁦@narendramodi⁩ ji. Best wishes to everyone writing their exams," Kumble wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Gibbs reveals why he called a section of Pakistani fans 'animals' in 2007
text: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked former South Africa batsman Herschelle Gibbs what comments he had made which led to him getting banned in 2007. "Called some rowdy Pakistan supporters animals. They forced my son and his mother out of their seats in front of the players viewing area," Gibbs responded.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Club cricketer in Australia dislocates jaw while sledging his opponent
text: Hastings Cricket Club captain Jayden Regan dislocated his jaw while sledging his opponent after dismissing him for 99. "We got a bit excited and started to carry on...and then I thought, nah I'll give it a bit more and then the jaw just fell out of place,” Regan said. He left the field and drove himself to a hospital.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Google develops envelope that hides phones from the users
text: Google has created an experimental app, Envelope, that helps seal a phone and cut down users' screen time. Users will have to download the app and later print an envelope that conceals the phone. Together, they make users use their phones only for calls, speed dial and for knowing the time. Currently, the app only works with a Pixel 3A.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: ISRO unveils 'Vyommitra', its first half-humanoid to be sent into space
text: ISRO has unveiled a prototype of the half-humanoid, named Vyommitra, that will soon be sent into space. The humanoid can operate switches, receive voice commands, respond via speech, can speak in two languages and can lip-sync to speech. "It'll try to simulate a human and report back to us. We're doing this as an experiment," ISRO scientist Sam Dayal said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Shiv Sena rejects Chavan's claim of coalition talk after 2014 polls
text: Shiv Sena has denied Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan's claim that it had approached the Congress after the 2014 Assembly polls to form a coalition to keep BJP out of power. An editorial in Sena's mouthpiece Saamana said, "There is no logic in what Chavan has said." However, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said Chavan's remarks revealed the "true face" of Sena.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Interpol notice issued against rape-accused self-styled godman Nithyananda
text: The Interpol has issued a Blue Notice against rape-accused self-styled godman Nithyananda who fled India last year. The notice was issued against the self-styled godman on the request of the Gujarat Police. Nithyananda has also been booked on charges of kidnapping and wrongful confinement of children to make them collect donations from followers.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Indian medical interns advised to stay away from China hospitals over Coronavirus
text: Indian medical students completing their internships in China's Wuhan city have been advised to stay away from their hospital residencies following the outbreak of the Novel Coronavirus. The new virus is said to have originated in a seafood/animal market in Wuhan. The death toll from the virus has risen to nine and over 450 others have been infected in China.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Set 7-day limit for death row convicts to file mercy plea: Centre to SC
text: The Centre has asked the Supreme Court to set a seven-day time limit for death-row convicts to file mercy petitions after receiving death warrant. The Centre sought the imposition of a time limit on filing curative petition after a review was rejected. A death row convict is given 14 days' time after the mercy petition is rejected by the President.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 9,156 people from 43 flights screened for Coronavirus in India, all negative
text: As per Ministry of Health, 9,156 passengers from 43 flights have been screened for novel Coronavirus illness. No case of novel Coronavirus has been detected through these screening efforts, the ministry added. The ministry also stated that passengers travelling from China are being requested to report to the nearest public health facility in case they feel any symptoms.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Katerina Sakellaropoulou elected Greece's first female President
text: Katerina Sakellaropoulou has been elected as Greece's first female President by the ruling and opposition parties, getting the support of 261 MPs in the 300-member parliament. In 2018, she was elected as President of Greece's top administrative court, the Council of State, becoming the first female to be elected to the position. She will succeed Prokopis Pavlopoulos.
author: Shailesh

headlines: India's economy will be a blockbuster film with happy ending: Mahindra
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has said the Indian economy will turn out to be a "blockbuster film" with a "happy ending" despite its current challenges. "The Prime Minister has been quite obsessed about the kind of growth he wants: transparent, free of corruption and any rent-seeking," Mahindra said. He added the Indian auto industry is showing signs of revival.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Coca-Cola says it won't stop using plastic bottles as customers still want them
text: Coca-Cola on Tuesday said it will not abandon single-use plastic bottles because customers still want them as they are resealable and lightweight. "Business won't be in business if we don't accommodate consumers," Coca-Cola's head of sustainability Bea Perez said. The US drinks giant had revealed it produces three million tonnes of plastic packaging a year, or 200,000 bottles a minute.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: US-China mistrust will sacrifice global economic growth: Microsoft CEO
text: Microsoft Corporation CEO Satya Nadella said US-China mistrust will lead to an increase in technology costs and urged the two countries to find ways to work together. He said that creating a separate supply chain for each country will ultimately hurt global economic growth. "All you are doing is increasing transaction costs for everybody if you completely separate," Nadella said.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Don't update app as it crashes on opening: Twitter to Android users
text: Twitter on Wednesday warned millions of users worldwide not to update their Android app as it is crashing immediately once opened. "We're investigating a problem with the latest version of our Android app," Twitter wrote. "We suggest not updating it until we let you know it's fixed," it added. Some users tweeted their own experience with the malfunction.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Rajini should talk on JNU if he wants to enter into public debate: Karti
text: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram said that Rajinikanth should talk about issues like Kashmir, CAA protests and JNU attack if he wants to enter into a public debate. His comments came after Rajinikanth said "effigies of Ram and Sita were paraded without clothes" in Periyar's 1971 rally. "Is a debate on Periyar the most relevant topic today for Rajinikanth?" Karti asked.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Edtech startup Konfinity raises seed funding from AngelList India
text: Noida-based edtech startup Konfinity has raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding led by AngelList. Other investors including Jugnoo and ClickLabs CEO Samar Singla, mCarbon Founder Rajesh Razdan and Harvard Business School faculty Amit Kapoor also participated in the round. Founded by Navratn Singh, Konfinity provides AI-based software programming courses for students.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Indian-American becomes 1st Sikh Deputy Constable in Harris County
text: A 21-year-old Indian-American law enforcement officer has become the first turban-wearing Sikh to be sworn in as Deputy Constable in Texas' Harris County. Amrit Singh's swearing-in coincided with the adoption of a new policy which allows Harris County's constables to wear articles of faith in uniform. Singh will retain his turban, beard, and uncut hair in the line of duty.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 16 charged with murder over Brazil dam collapse which killed 270
text: Brazilian prosecutors charged 16 people for murder and environmental crimes over the dam collapse at an iron ore mine which killed 270 people on January 25, 2019. Those charged included former CEO of mining firm Vale which operated the dam and five others from German company TÜV SÜD. Prosecutors said the two companies systematically concealed "real gravity of the situation".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: We've never sought nuclear weapons: Iranian Prez to Europe
text: Speaking in reference to the 2015 nuclear deal between Iran and major powers, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said, "We've never sought nuclear weapons...With or without...nuclear deal we'll never seek nuclear weapon." He added that European countries part of the deal, France, Germany and the UK, should not violate the deal and they'll be responsible for the consequences of violating it.
author: Shailesh

headlines: World doesn't celebrate India's work in climate tech enough: COP26
text: President of 2020 UN Climate Change Conference (COP26) Claire O'Neill said that the world doesn't celebrate some of India's climate change technological solutions enough. She mentioned India's efforts to produce low carbon cement and work in areas like cooling, "which is a huge global need for the world". COP26 will take place in Glasgow, UK in November 2020.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Adani Capital acquires Essel Finance's MSME loan business
text: Adani Capital, the non-banking financial arm of Adani Group, has acquired Essel Finance's micro, small and medium enterprises (MSME) loan business. Adani Capital secured a loan book of about ₹145 crore, 1,100 customers and 40 employees with this acquisition, the company said. Adani Finserve CEO, Gaurav Gupta said, "The acquisition...helps us expand to new geographies, including Noida and Chennai."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: IKEA recalls 'Made in India' mugs from UAE over safety concerns
text: To ensure customer safety, IKEA has announced the recall of TROLIGTVIS travel mugs marked "Made in India" after it was reported that it consisted of harmful chemicals. "We urge customers to return the product to any of our stores for a full refund. We apologise for any inconvenience this recall may cause," IKEA wrote in an Instagram post. nn
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: CBI books Frost International, its directors in ₹3,592 cr bank fraud
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation has registered a criminal case against Mumbai-based Frost International and its directors for allegedly cheating a consortium of 14 banks to tune of over ₹3,592 crore. The probe agency also booked 11 other individuals and companies in the case. "The directors worked in the guise of undertaking merchanting trade without genuine business," the FIR said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: It's the worst thing in the world: Saif on breaking news of divorce to his kids
text: Saif Ali Khan, on being asked about breaking the news of separation and subsequent divorce with Amrita Singh to his children Sara and Ibrahim, said, "It's the worst thing in the world." "I try my best to make peace...with myself saying that I was [only] 20," he added. Saif further said no child should be "deprived of a warm home".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Anupam Kher is a clown, shouldn't be taken seriously: Naseeruddin Shah
text: Naseeruddin Shah said in an interview that Anupam Kher has been "very vocal" about Citizenship (Amendment) Act and added that he is "a clown who doesn't need to be taken seriously". "Any numbers of his contemporaries from FTII and NSD can attest to his sycophantic nature," Shah added. "It's in his blood. He can't help it," he further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Actor Rahul, who starred in 'Arjun Reddy', reveals he was raped during childhood
text: Telugu actor Rahul Ramakrishna, who played Vijay Deverakonda's friend in 'Arjun Reddy', has revealed he was raped during his childhood. "I live with the crime perpetrated upon me...Teach your men to be nice," he added. "I request all of you to closely guard your children and look out for sudden behaviour changes," the actor further wrote.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: SC to hear CAA petitions related to Assam and Tripura separately
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said that it will hear CAA petitions related to Assam and Tripura separately as the problem with CAA in these two states is different from the rest of the country. The top court refused a stay on CAA's implementation and said that no high court would hear pleas on CAA till it decides on petitions.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Counsel kids in Shaheen Bagh, may suffer mental trauma: NCPCR
text: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has issued an order to the District Magistrate of South East Delhi to identify the children involved in anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests in Shaheen Bagh and send them for counselling. In its order, the NCPCR said the children "may suffer from mental trauma" because of "rumours and miscommunication" regarding the CAA.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Walk the talk: Amarinder challenges SAD to quit NDA over CAA
text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has challenged the Shiromani Akali Dal to quit the NDA at the Centre, a day after SAD claimed it wasn't contesting Delhi Assembly polls because BJP asked it to change its stand on the citizenship law. Singh said, "Why don't you walk the talk and show...that you really stand against the divisive and destructive CAA?"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: What is the eligibility criteria for Team India national selectors' job?
text: According to the eligibility criteria for Team India national selectors' job, a candidate should've played 7 Tests or 30 first-class matches, or 10 ODIs and 20 first-class matches. He should've retired at least five years previously. Further, the candidate should be below 60 years of age. The main responsibility includes selecting best possible teams in a fair and transparent manner.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: McEnroe to give $1,000 to charity for each set Kyrgios wins at AO 2020
text: Former American tennis player John McEnroe has pledged to give $1,000 for bushfire relief efforts for every set won by Australia's Nick Kyrgios at the Australian Open 2020. McEnroe made the announcement while talking to Kyrgios after his win over Italian Lorenzo Sonego. Kyrgios previously pledged to donate $200 for every ace he hits across all events in the summer.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Japan qualified for U-19 WC after their opponents were found guilty of shoplifting
text: Japan Under-19 team, whom India defeated by 10 wickets in the 2020 Under-19 World Cup on Tuesday, had qualified for the tournament after their opponents were found guilty of robbery. Papua New Guinea had failed to field their team in the final of the qualifiers after their cricket board suspended most of the players because of shoplifting in Japan.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: It's a clear message: Sehwag on Dhoni's exclusion from BCCI annual contract list
text: Reacting to MS Dhoni being dropped from the annual contract list by BCCI, former India opener Virender Sehwag said that it's a clear message for MS Dhoni that he can call it quits whenever he feels like. "Selectors have probably made up their mind that they will not select MS Dhoni. So BCCI also made its mind," Sehwag added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: New low-cost iPhone to enter mass production in February: Report
text: Apple suppliers are planning to start assembling a new low-cost iPhone in February, Bloomberg reported. Apple is expected to officially unveil the new iPhone in March. It will look similar to iPhone 8 from 2017 and will include a 4.7-inch screen. The iPhone is expected to have Touch ID built in the home button but no Face ID biometric authentication.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Chandrashekhar Azad, Swami Agnivesh file plea in SC against CAA, NRC
text: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad, Swami Agnivesh and former Chairperson of the National Commission for Minorities Wajahat Habibullah have filed a petition in the Supreme Court against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, National Register of Citizens and National Population Register. The Supreme Court refused to stay CAA today and gave Centre four weeks to respond on pleas related to the matter.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India drops 10 places in Democracy Index, retains 'flawed democracy' status
text: India dropped 10 places in the latest Democracy Index released by Economist Intelligence Unit, and retained its status as a "flawed democracy". India ranked 51 out of 165 independent states and two territories. According to the index, India's overall score fell from 7.23 out of 10 in 2018 to 6.90 in 2019, mainly due to an "erosion of civil liberties".
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Adani's bid for ₹45,000-crore submarine project rejected
text: The Defence Acquisition Council has rejected a joint bid by Adani Defence and state-owned Hindustan Shipyard for the Indian Navy's ₹45,000-crore submarine project, an official said. It has shortlisted state-run Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders and L&T for the final bids to construct six conventional submarines. The two companies will now partner with foreign technology collaborators for the final bids.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: China will keep buying our palm oil, says Malaysia
text: Malaysia has said that it won't suffer any loss in its palm oil business from China despite the country pledging to boost soybean purchases from the US. "The Chinese have continued to be a good friend," Malaysia trade minister Darell Leiking said. Speaking on India's restriction on imports of refined palm oil, he said Malaysia has not been singled out.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: We'll not do a scripted 'Friends' reunion: Co-creator Marta Kauffman
text: American writer Marta Kauffman, who co-created the sitcom 'Friends', has said that the team will never do a "scripted" reunion of the show. Kauffman said that she is up for an unscripted reunion of the team. "If it was the right thing...[the cast] reflecting, talking about their experiences, and the episodes, then I'm totally behind it," she added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: We don't have time for marriage, we're chilling: Richa on marrying Ali Fazal
text: On her plans of marrying her boyfriend Ali Fazal, actress Richa Chadha said in an interview that they "don't have time" for the same and that they're "chilling". "If...we talk about marriage, it will be like...I don't have dates in March, May is too hot...it'll become...line production job," she added. "We're in...happy space...our relationship is...creative partnership," Richa further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Maharashtra government declares 'Tanhaji' tax-free in the state
text: Maharashtra government on Wednesday declared Ajay Devgn, Kajol and Saif Ali Khan starrer 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' tax-free in the state. This comes after former CM Devendra Fadnavis, along with few other leaders, wrote to the current CM Uddhav Thackeray to make the film tax-free. It was earlier declared tax-free in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Shabana Azmi will be home soon, reports positive: Javed Akhtar
text: Veteran lyricist Javed Akhtar on Wednesday said that his wife Shabana Azmi will return home soon from Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital where she is admitted following an accident last week. He added that all her reports are positive and no serious harm was done. The incident took place on Mumbai-Pune Expressway when her car rammed into a truck.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Debate with a bearded man on CAA, NPR and NRC: Owaisi to Shah
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi challenged Union Home Minister Amit Shah for a debate on the CAA, NPR and NRC. "You should debate with me. I am here. Why debate with them? The debate should be with a bearded man," Owaisi said. Shah had earlier challenged opposition leaders like Mamata Banerjee, Rahul Gandhi and Akhilesh Yadav for a debate.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: ODIs this year could be used for World T20 preparation: Shastri
text: Indian coach Ravi Shastri has said the upcoming six ODIs against New Zealand and South Africa could be used as a platform to prepare for the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "[T]he World Cup remains an obsession and we will do all to fulfil that ambition... The word 'I' is not there in our dictionary," Shastri added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Brawl breaks out at end of Kansas State-Kansas game
text: A brawl erupted at the end of the rivalry game between Kansas and Kansas State basketball teams on Tuesday. Referees had to sort out the situation after the players were eventually separated by coaching staff and security. Kansas' Silvio De Sousa picked up a stool with an intention to attack but an intervention by KU assistant coach stopped him.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: J&K kids are nationalists, but sometimes wrongly motivated: Rajnath
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said that the children of Jammu and Kashmir are nationalists, but they are sometimes being motivated in the wrong direction. "They shouldn't be seen in any other way. Youngsters are youngsters only," he added. He also said the ones who are motivating them in the wrong direction are the culprits.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: N Korea bans foreign tourists due to virus outbreak: Tour companies
text: North Korea has banned foreign tourists from entering the country from Wednesday due to the new coronavirus outbreak in China, several tour companies said. However, one of the operators said that the ban will last until a vaccine for the virus is developed. Tourism is a major source of foreign currency for North Korea since the imposition of international sanctions.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Companies blacklisted by World Bank given CPEC contracts: US envoy
text: Senior US diplomat Alice Wells said that the contracts for the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) projects were awarded to companies blacklisted by the World Bank. She also alleged that CPEC lacked transparency and the debt burden of Pakistan was growing due to China's financing. CPEC aims to connect China's Xinjiang region with Pakistan's Gwadar and Karachi ports through overland routes.
author: Shailesh

headlines: India seeks fairer, more equitable terms in trade deals: Goyal at WEF
text: Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos Union Minister Piyush Goyal said India will look for fairer trade terms with countries that cannot be dictated by diplomacy. His comments come after India opted-out of the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership as it didn't address key climate concerns. "India is grappling with a huge trade deficit, particularly with China," he said.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Govt may raise FY21 disinvestment target to ₹1.5 lakh crore
text: Ahead of the Union Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman may increase the government's disinvestment target to ₹1.5 lakh crore from ₹1.05 lakh crore for the fiscal year starting April 1. The raise is attributed to the delay in the government's multiple sales which were planned for this year. The FY20 divestment target is expected to fall short by ₹50,000 crore.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Max Fashion presents all-new Spring 2020 Collection
text: With its Spring Collection 2020, Max Fashion seeks to add colours into your life. As we're welcoming Spring, Max Fashion presents floral dresses, polka perfect, bright blushes, statement t-shirts, neon patterns, printed shirts and breezy fabrics for your wardrobe. The collection is now available at all Max stores and also on www.maxfashion.com. n
author: Aarish

headlines: I fainted, luckily house help came and saw me on floor: Deepika on depression
text: Speaking at the World Economic Forum 2020 about suffering from depression, Deepika Padukone said, "One morning I woke up and...fainted." "Luckily the house help came and saw me on the floor. I was taken to a doctor and I was told it was nothing and probably...blood pressure fluctuation or...tiredness," she added. Deepika further said those were the first physical signs.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Pamela gets married for 5th time to producer whom she 1st dated 30 yrs ago
text: Model-actress Pamela Anderson got married to producer Jon Peters in a private ceremony, a representative for Anderson said on Tuesday. It's the fifth marriage for both 52-year-old Anderson and 74-year-old Peters, who recently reunited after first dating more than 30 years ago. Peters had produced 2018's 'A Star Is Born', 2006's 'Superman Returns' and 1989's 'Batman'.nnnn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Lesbian couple refused permission to marry at South African wedding venue
text: The owners of a wedding venue in South Africa refused to host wedding ceremony of a lesbian couple, Megan Watling and Sasha-Lee Heekes. The owners informed the couple that based on their beliefs, they don't host weddings between couples of same gender. Megan said that she was 'overwhelmed with anger'. The couple has complained to South Africa Human Rights Commission.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 10,000 black balloons with anti-CAA-NRC banners released in Delhi
text: Around 10,000 black balloons were released with the messages of 'No CAA NPR NRC' at a protest in Delhi's Khureji Khas on Tuesday. As per reports, more than a hundred women were present at the rally. Earlier on Tuesday, a few Shaheen Bagh protesters met Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal and discussed the opening of the road blockade.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: JJP to not contest Delhi Assembly elections after failing to get desired symbol
text: The Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) has declared that it would not contest the Delhi Assembly elections as it failed to get any of the three desired election symbols (key, cup and saucer, and pair of slippers) it had applied for. The JJP had earlier expressed its desire to contest 18 Assembly seats in Delhi, reportedly in alliance with the BJP.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Smart parking startup Park+ raises $11 mn from Sequoia, Matrix
text: Delhi-based smart parking app Park+ has raised $11 million in a funding round led by Sequoia Capital and Matrix Partners. Other angel investors including MakeMyTrip founder Deep Kalra and Snapdeal Co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal also participated in the round. Founded by ex-Paytm employee Amit Lakhotia, Park+ lets drivers and vehicle owners find and book open parking spots.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: SoftBank appoints Manoj Kohli as its India head
text: SoftBank Group has appointed Manoj Kohli as its India head. Prior to the appointment, Kohli served as the Executive Chairman of SoftBank's renewable energy firm SB Energy and has also been Airtel India's MD. Kohli, with over 40 years of work experience, will support SoftBank, its Vision Fund, their portfolio companies and look after government relations and public policy efforts.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: First US case of Wuhan coronavirus confirmed by health officials
text: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has announced the first known case of a new strain of the coronavirus in the US. The CDC revealed that a male US citizen in his 30s returning from a trip to Wuhan had been diagnosed in Seattle. Over 300 cases have been reported in China, Thailand, Japan and South Korea.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Gang attempts to rob SBI branch, runs away after welding machine sparks fire
text: A gang, which attempted to rob an SBI branch in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district, ran away after the welding machine used by them set ablaze some papers in the bank premises. The gangsters were trying to enter the ATM room by drilling through window bars with the help of a welding machine. Police suspect four people were involved.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pak has limited options to respond to India's decision on J&K: US report
text: US Congressional Research Service (CRS) report has said that given Pakistan's long history of supporting militant groups, many analysts view that they have "little credibility" on J&K issue. "Pakistan's leadership has limited options to respond to India's actions," the report added. It also said that post-August 5, Pakistan "appeared diplomatically isolated" with only Turkey showing its support.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Class 2 girl dies after almirah falls on her at school in Uttar Pradesh
text: A Class 2 girl died after an almirah fell on her at school in Uttar Pradesh's Ambedkar Nagar district. The deceased has been identified as Payal. District Magistrate RK Mishra said that an FIR has been registered in the incident and he will write to the concerned authorities to provide financial assistance to the victim's family.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Boy kills self, alleges sexual assault by students & hostel staff in 18-page note
text: An 18-year-old Class 12 boy committed suicide by hanging himself in his hostel after he was sexually assaulted allegedly by his schoolmates and hostel staffers in Maharashtra's Chandrapur. In his 18-page suicide note, he has given explicit details of the sexual assaults, police said. We have arrested the 14 boys staying in the same hostel and its watchman, police added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Prince Harry, Meghan warn media after photographers 'spy' on them for pics
text: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle issued a legal warning to the media for taking their pictures without consent. The couple's lawyers said photos of Meghan walking her dogs and carrying her son in Canada were taken without consent by photographers hiding in bushes and spying on her. Photographers also allegedly tried to take pictures inside their home using long-range lenses.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: What are some assets of PNB scam accused Nirav Modi that will be auctioned?
text: The Enforcement Directorate will auction PNB scam accused Nirav Modi's seized assets over the next two months. These include artworks like a 1935 masterpiece by Amrita Sher-Gil worth ₹12-18 crore, an oil-on-canvas by MF Husain of similar value, luxury wristwatches like Girard-Perregaux Opera One and over 80 luxury handbags. His Porsche Panamera and Rolls Royce Ghost will also be auctioned.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Cut in duty-free liquor quota will cause ₹650 cr loss to airports: Industry body
text: Airports would see a revenue loss of ₹650 crore if the government's proposal to halve duty-free liquor quota to 1 litre is implemented, the Association of Private Airport Operators said. The loss will have to be compensated through increased aeronautical charges, leading to higher fares, the industry body said. The move would have "disastrous effects on Indian aviation", it added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Mass hero is required for subject like 'Shubh Mangal...': Ayushmann
text: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who will next be seen in 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan' wherein he plays a homosexual, has said that a "mass hero is required for such a subject to normalise it". "It's a character I'm playing. What's the qualm or negative side in this?" he added. Ayushmann further said that he had no apprehensions in playing the part.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Lawyer moves court against Chhapaak makers over international credits
text: Lawyer Aparna Bhat has filed a contempt petition against makers of 'Chhapaak' and Deepika Padukone for not giving her credits in the international screenings, despite the Delhi High Court's order. Bhat has said that credits were given to her in the movie which is screening in India. Bhat represented acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal on whose life 'Chhapaak' is based.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Bellerín's late goal secures 10-man Arsenal a draw at Chelsea
text: Héctor Bellerín's 87th-minute curler secured 10-man Arsenal a draw at Chelsea in the Premier League on Wednesday. Arsenal were left with 10 men in the 26th minute when David Luiz was sent off. Chelsea opened the scoring with a 28th-minute Jorginho penalty before 18-year-old Gabriel Martinelli's 63rd-minute solo equaliser. Cesar Azpilicueta scored Chelsea's second goal in the 84th minute.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Sonia Gandhi dissolves Punjab Congress committee
text: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has dissolved Punjab's Congress committee and all district committees in the state. However, Sunil Jakhar will be retained as state unit chief, the party's statement said. An 11-member committee was also set up for ensuring better coordination between the party and Punjab government. The announcement came a day after Punjab CM Amarinder Singh met Sonia Gandhi.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: NIA raids Davinder Singh's residence in Srinagar
text: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted raids at the residence of suspended DSP Davinder Singh who was arrested with terrorists while travelling in his car to Jammu. The raids are reportedly being conducted to establish links between Singh and terrorists. Earlier, the J&K administration "forfeited" the Sher-e-Kashmir Police Medal for Gallantry awarded to him.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Scientists discover new shark species that walk in shallow water
text: Four new species of tropical sharks that use their fins to walk have been discovered by scientists in waters off northern Australia and New Guinea. Researchers state that the species are no threat to humans but instead prey on small crustaceans and molluscs. The four new species have increased the total number of known walking sharks to nine.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Nepal forms committee to investigate death of 8 Indian tourists
text: Nepal's Department of Tourism on Tuesday formed a probe committee to investigate the death of eight tourists from India who were found dead in a hotel room in Daman. The tourists, who were part of a group of 15 people, were using gas heater in the room. The police said that suffocation might have caused their death.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Nobody likes Bernie Sanders, he got nothing done: Hillary Clinton
text: Speaking on her former Democratic presidential rival Bernie Sanders, former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton said, "Nobody likes him, nobody wants to work with him, he got nothing done." She added, "He was in Congress for years. He had one senator support him...It's all just baloney and I feel so bad that people got sucked into it."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Taiwan calls on China to share 'correct' info on coronavirus
text: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday called on China to share "correct" information about a new coronavirus and urged the World Health Organisation not to exclude Taiwan over political reasons. "We believe that political considerations shouldn't come before safeguarding people," she added. Taiwan on Tuesday confirmed the first coronavirus case in a woman who had returned from China's Wuhan.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Delhi CM's moveable assets increased by ₹7.6L in 5 yrs, wife's by ₹41.79L
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has declared that his movable assets have gone up by ₹7.6 lakh since 2015. In the previous Assembly elections, Kejriwal declared his movable assets at ₹2.26 lakh which increased to ₹9.95 lakh in 2020. The CM's wife Sunita Kejriwal's movable assets increased by ₹41.79 lakh from ₹15.28 lakh in 2015 to ₹57.07 lakh in 2020.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: MoneyTap aids Hyd resident with ₹3 lakh credit for medical purposes
text: Vineet Singh, a Hyderabad resident, was struggling to pay bills for his father's unexpected surgery. Having heard of MoneyTap from a colleague, Vineet applied for loan and got a credit line of ₹3 lakh. The amount aided his father's surgery, helping him recover successfully. MoneyTap, through its credit line aims to provide financial backup for such emergency situations for customers.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Saudi Crown Prince hacked Jeff Bezos' phone through WhatsApp file: Report
text: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' mobile phone was hacked in 2018 after he received an infected WhatsApp message from the number used by Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, according to the Guardian. Large amounts of data were exfiltrated from Bezos' phone within hours of receiving the file on May 1, 2018, when they were having a "friendly" WhatsApp exchange.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: If there was no Bharat, what was Mahabharat? Kangana on Saif's remark
text: Reacting to Saif Ali Khan's "I don't think there was a concept of India until perhaps the British gave it one" remark, Kangana Ranaut said, "If there was no Bharat then what was Mahabharat?" "That 5,000-year-old text that was written, what was it?" she added. Kangana further said "some people have just created these narratives that suit them".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Don't blame a clown for acting like a clown: Pak's Sana Mir after T20 WC snub
text: After being left out of Pakistan's squad for Women's T20 World Cup, ex-captain Sana Mir tweeted, "Don't blame a clown for acting like a clown. Ask yourself why you keep going to the circus." Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "She's referring to the chief selector of women team, who despite of her performance ignored her for WT20 WC."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: World's richest man Jeff Bezos, girlfriend Lauren visit Taj Mahal; pics surface
text: Amazon CEO and world's richest man Jeff Bezos, along with girlfriend Lauren Sanchez, visited the Taj Mahal on Tuesday. Pictures that surfaced online show them posing together with the Taj Mahal in the backdrop. On Monday, he had unveiled a fleet of fully electric delivery rickshaws and shared a video that showed him driving an e-rickshaw with Amazon's delivery partners.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 15 watch solar eclipse with naked eyes; vision affected as part of retina burnt
text: The vision of 15 youngsters, aged 10-20 years, were affected due to watching the December 26 solar eclipse with naked eyes, said Kamlesh Khilnani, head of the ophthalmology department at SMS Hospital in Jaipur. "Our examination has found that a part of their retina had been burnt," he stated. He added that their normal vision was unlikely to be restored.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Who is Sunil Yadav, BJP's candidate against Kejriwal in Delhi polls?
text: BJP's Sunil Yadav, who is standing against Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal from the New Delhi constituency, is the President of the Delhi unit of the BJP's Yuva Morcha. The 44-year-old advocate, who studied from Kirori Mal College, started his political career as the 'Mandal president' of Yuva Morcha. Yadav is contesting the Assembly elections for the first time.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Closely following Kashmir issue: Trump on meeting Pak PM
text: During a bilateral meeting with Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday, US President Donald Trump said he is "closely" following the Kashmir issue in relation to what is going on with Pakistan and India. "If we can help, we certainly will be helping. We have been watching that and following it very very closely," Trump added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: SC refuses to stay CAA without hearing Centre, grants it 4 weeks to reply
text: Supreme Court on Wednesday said it won't grant any stay on Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) without hearing the Centre and said it may refer pleas challenging its validity to a larger Constitution bench. It further gave the central government 4 weeks to file a reply. The court also said it will hold in-chamber hearing on procedural issue of the case.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Reading Preamble made mandatory in Maharashtra schools from Jan 26
text: Students in schools across Maharashtra will have to compulsorily read-out the Preamble to the Constitution during their morning assemblies from January 26 onwards, School Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad said on Tuesday. The aim of this is to make students aware of the core values of the Constitution, Gaikwad added. In February 2013, the then Congress-NCP government issued the same order.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Suspect in Mangalore Airport bomb case, Aditya Rao, surrenders before police
text: Two days after an abandoned bag with components of low intensity improvised explosive device (IED) was found at the Mangalore Airport, the suspect in the case, Aditya Rao, has surrendered before police. Mangaluru Police had earlier released photos captured by the CCTV, which showed the suspect and the autorickshaw he was leaving in. Police had also said he's mentally disturbed.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Reports suggesting Crown Prince behind hacking Bezos' phone absurd: Saudi
text: Saudi Arabia on Wednesday said that reports stating that Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' mobile phone was hacked in 2018 after he received an infected WhatsApp message from Saudi Crown Prince are "absurd". "We call for an investigation on these claims so that we can have all the facts out," Saudi Arabia's US embassy said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Chinese city shames people for wearing pyjamas in public, apologises
text: Government officials in Chinese city of Suzhou have apologised for shaming people for wearing pyjamas in public. The officials had released pictures of people wearing their nightwear, calling it an "uncivilised behaviour". The government also revealed the person's name, ID card and other information as part of shaming. Several people had accused the government of infringing upon people's privacy.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray to watch 'Tanhaji' with other ministers
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has said that he will watch actor Ajay Devgn's latest release 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' along with other ministers. Thackeray was at a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) event where teaser of a movie 'wild Mumbai' was launched. 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' is the first Bollywood film in 2020 to cross ₹100-crore mark at the box office.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Salman has liked the idea of my next film: Sooraj Barjatya
text: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya on Tuesday said that he is writing his next film and Salman Khan has "liked the idea". "In a year or two, I'll be done...it's in my space- family...and emotions," he added. Salman Khan and Sooraj Barjatya have previously worked together in 'Maine Pyar Kiya', 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!', 'Hum Saath-Saath Hain' and 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo'.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I thought 'Did I work hard?': Alia on guilt over praise for Gully Boy
text: Alia Bhatt in an interview said that when people praise her for 'Gully Boy', she feels guilty and thinks 'Did I work hard?' or 'Why do I deserve this kind of appreciation?'. "Personally, I too enjoyed watching my performance which usually doesn't happen," she added. "I am self-critical and don't like talking too much about my work," Alia further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: We filed for legal separation, are cordial: Shweta on divorce from Rohit
text: Actress Shweta Basu Prasad, known for starring in the 2002 film 'Makdee', has revealed that she and her filmmaker husband Rohit Mittal have filed for a legal separation. "Rohit and I are perfectly cordial and friendly," she added. "We had 5 years of a very loving, healthy...relationship, we just decided to end the marriage and remain friends," she further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I am not meant to be a director but might write someday: Kajol
text: Actress Kajol has said that she is "not meant to be a director but might write someday". "Writing is a solitary process and needs commitment...I always think there are not enough hours in a day to do all that I wish to," she added. Kajol was recently seen in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' along with her actor husband Ajay Devgn.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Go ahead and try implementing CAA: Prashant Kishor to Amit Shah
text: JD(U) leader Prashant Kishor on Wednesday tweeted and asked Home Minister Amit Shah to "try implementing" the CAA and NRC in the chronology that he "so audaciously announced to the nation". "Being dismissive of citizens' dissent couldn't be the sign of strength of any government," Kishor wrote. This comes a day after Shah reiterated that CAA will not be revoked.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 2 crore Bangladeshi Muslims have entered India: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
text: West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh on Tuesday said that two crore Bangladeshi Muslims have entered India and he plans to send them back. "Out of the two crore, one crore are in West Bengal and one crore have spread across the country," he added. "If their names are in voters' list then it will be removed," Ghosh further said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Tukde-tukde gang exists, it's running govt: Tharoor on HM's RTI reply
text: After Home Ministry's reported reply to an RTI query that there is no information available on the 'tukde-tukde gang', Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said it does exist and is running the government. Tharoor added that the 'tukde-tukde gang' which is running the government is also dividing the nation. The RTI query was filed by activist Saket Gokhale.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Scientists create 3D printed parts that resist bacteria
text: Researchers from the University of Sheffield have, for the first time, manufactured 3D printed parts that show resistance to common bacteria. The research combined 3D printing with a silver-based antibacterial compound in order to produce the parts. The discovery could help stop the spread of infections in high-risk places like hospitals and care homes.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Chemicals in sunscreens get absorbed into the blood: USFDA
text: A US Food and Drug Administration study has found that the active ingredients in sunscreens can be absorbed into the blood at levels that exceed the FDA's presumed-safe threshold. "[A]n ingredient is absorbed through the skin and into the body does not mean the ingredient is unsafe," said Dr Janet Woodcock, director of FDA's Center for Drug Evaluation and Research.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: New molecule found that collects energy from entire visible spectrum
text: Scientists for the first time have developed a single molecule that can absorb sunlight efficiently and also act as a catalyst to transform solar energy into hydrogen. In the study, the researchers used LEDs to shine light onto acidic solutions containing the active molecule, which resulted in the production of hydrogen.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: 9 dead, 440 infected from coronavirus in China
text: The new coronavirus has killed nine people and 440 have been infected due to its outbreak in China, Chinese health officials said on Wednesday. China's National Health Commission also said that another 2,197 cases of close contact with patients have been confirmed. The virus has been detected in the United States, Thailand, Japan and South Korea.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 36 civilians killed in terrorist attack at Burkina Faso market
text: At least 36 civilians were killed and several others were injured in a terrorist attack on a market in Burkina Faso's Sanmatenga province on Monday, the government said. "These repeated attacks on innocent civilians call for real cooperation between defence and security forces," the government added. President Roch Marc Kaboré called for two days of national mourning.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Kaushal brothers pay tribute to the Army in Prime Video's new video
text: Amazon Prime Video released a video with brothers, Vicky and Sunny Kaushal where they're seen asking stirring questions about soldiers of the Indian National Army who fought for Independence during WWII. While Vicky pays tribute to the Indian Army, Sunny pays tribute to the forgotten INA. The video showcases our rich army heritage and celebrates both the remembered and forgotten.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Great Learning & PES university offer M.Tech in Data Science and ML
text: Great Learning's M.Tech in Data Science and Machine Learning is offered in collaboration with PES University, ranked #1 under the New Universities category by KSURF. Available in full-time & part-time weekend formats, the 2-year classroom program at the PES campus in Bangalore features world-class faculty and placement assistance with 250+ hiring partners, along with a degree from PES University.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Mom was diagnosed with brain tumour during breast cancer treatment: Taylor
text: American singer Taylor Swift revealed in an interview that while her mother Andrea Swift was going through breast cancer treatment, the doctors "found a brain tumour". "The symptoms...when they have brain tumor is nothing like...her cancer," she said. Calling her mother "the guiding force", Taylor added that every decision that she makes, she talks to her mother about it first.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Even my parents used to see my face and faint: Rangoli on acid attack
text: Sharing an article wherein Kangana Ranaut talked about rehabilitating her sister Rangoli Chandel after an acid attack, Rangoli tweeted, "I can never pay [you] back." "[E]ven our parents...used to see my face and just faint," she added. "They left but you stood by my side washed my wounds, worked day and night to pay for my treatment," Rangoli further tweeted.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Letters claim that George Orwell’s wife let him offer sex to female friend
text: Late British author George Orwell wrote to a female friend named Brenda Salkeld to say that they could have sex twice a year with his wife's approval, a set of letters bought by Orwell's son show. The letters showed George used Salkeld as a sounding board for his ideas. George continued to write to Salkeld until 1949, his son revealed.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Should I go and perform in India to be considered: Pak's Akmal criticises PCB
text: After not getting selected in Pakistan's T20I squad for Bangladesh series, wicketkeeper-batsman Kamran Akmal asked, "Should I go and perform in India or Australia to be considered?" He added, "I'm Pakistan’s player, I've been performing for 5 years...how much should I tolerate it?" "Should I go to Prime Minister and say this is my performance for 5 years?" he asked.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India had better clarity about batting positions under MS Dhoni: Sehwag
