text: Former India batsman Virender Sehwag has said that Team India had better clarity about batting positions under the captaincy of MS Dhoni. "He had an eye for talent and had identified individuals who would take Indian cricket forward," he added. He further said that middle-order batsmen need to be backed by the captain.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Football fan caught kissing woman during match admits he was cheating on partner
text: The football fan who was caught kissing a woman during a football match in Ecuador has admitted that he was cheating on his partner. He and the woman appeared to be uncomfortable after noticing that their kiss was captured by cameras. He later said that his relationship has been destroyed and apologised to his partner.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Unacademy extends ESOP pool to ₹1,392cr, Founders get phantom stock: Report
text: Bengaluru-headquartered edtech startup Unacademy had bought 30% of the vested stocks from its employees a month after raising $50 million in Series D funding in June 2019, Entrackr reported. Unacademy expanded its ESOP pool from ₹1,228 crore to ₹1,392 crore, it added. Unacademy also executed a 'phantom stock' agreement with its Co-founders Gaurav Munjal, Roman Saini and Hemesh Singh.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Man stabbed 30 times by 6 men outside dance bar in Maharashtra
text: A man, identified as Deepak Bhoir, was stabbed to death outside a dance bar in Maharashtra's Ulhasnagar on Tuesday. The incident took place after Bhoir and his friend left the bar and were confronted by six people who later stabbed him 30 times on his chest, stomach and back. A previous enmity is suspected to be the motive, police said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Black ring seen floating in sky in Lahore; video surfaces
text: Videos on social media showed a black ring floating in the sky in Pakistan's Lahore. A similar black ring spotted by a 16-year-old girl in the UK's Leamington Spa was formed due to testing of fireworks in the nearby area. Reacting to it, a Twitter user wrote, "There's so much smog in Lahore, the entire city is blowing smoke rings."
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: We love each other: Trump on relationship with Chinese President Xi
text: Speaking on the relationship he shares with Chinese President Xi Jinping, US President Donald Trump said, "My relationship with Xi is extraordinary...We love each other." "Our relationship with China has never been better. We went through a rough patch, but things are good now," he added. Trump announced negotiations for the second phase of US-China trade deal would begin soon.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Titanic to be protected under treaty between US and UK
text: The wreckage of the Titanic will be protected under a treaty signed between the US and UK. The agreement gives US and UK power to grant or deny licences to enter the ship and remove artefacts. Signed by UK in 2003, the agreement comes into force now following its ratification by US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo in November 2019.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Why is palladium getting more expensive?
text: The price of palladium, used in emissions-control devices, has risen 400% in four years as countries around the world enforce stricter rules to tackle vehicular pollution. The demand for the precious metal has outstripped supply for eight straight years, helping drive prices to records. Produced primarily in Russia and South Africa, Palladium is extracted as a byproduct of platinum mining.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: India needs to accept even its top firms won't create enough jobs: Adair Turner
text: Institute for New Economic Thinking's Chairman Adair Turner has said India needs to accept that even its world-class companies in sectors like manufacturing, IT and pharmaceuticals won't create required number of jobs. "India (should) wake up to the severity of the challenge and not tell itself silly stories that it's getting a major advantage from a demographic dividend," he added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: India faces shortage of IMO-compliant fuel, ships may 'come to standstill'
text: India is facing a shortage of cleaner-burning fuels compliant with the International Maritime Organization's new rules. "Adequate quantities...are not available, especially on eastern coast. If the problem isn't resolved, I think ships will come to a standstill," Essar Shipping CEO Ranjit Singh said. Only two state-run refiners, HPCL and Indian Oil, announced they're producing IMO-compliant fuel.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Amrita Sher-Gil, MF Husain paintings worth ₹18 cr each owned by Nirav to be sold
text: Auction house Saffronart will conduct two auctions of Nirav Modi's assets seized by Enforcement Directorate. The artworks for sale include a 1935 masterpiece by Amrita Sher-Gil valued at ₹12-18 crore and an oil-on-canvas by MF Husain of similar value. The auctions will also feature luxury wristwatches, luxury handbags and two cars - a Porsche Panamera and a Rolls Royce Ghost.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Govt allows 100% foreign investment in Airtel
text: Telecom giant Airtel has received the telecom department's approval to raise foreign investment in the company to up to 100%. The move would enable Airtel to raise more funds from foreign investors. Bharti Telecom's 41% stake in Airtel will be classified as foreign investment if Singapore's Singtel increases its holding in the promoter entity to above 50% from 48% currently.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Sorry we made you cry: Football player to 9-yr-old fan after defeat
text: Italian football club Napoli skipper Lorenzo Insigne has posted a video apologising to a nine-year-old fan whose crying photo went viral after the club's 0-2 defeat last week. "I'm sorry that the result made you cry," Insigne said in the video. Napoli, who were runners-up in the three of the last five Serie A seasons, are currently 11th in standings.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: UK begins testing unsupervised driverless transport pods
text: A mall in the UK will be holding trials for autonomous transport pods this week, operating without any supervision. The driverless pods will run in between 10 AM and 7 PM every day for a week transporting passengers around the premises. The pods use sensors, radar and vision processing to navigate areas crowded with pedestrians, push-chairs and bikes.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Tencent, Black Shark to team up to make gaming phones: Report
text: Gaming company Tencent Games is reportedly going to team up with gaming smartphone manufacturer Black Shark. The phone may have a 120Hz display which can be a shift between 60Hz, 90Hz, and 120Hz Quad HD, 2K resolution or 1080p depending on the user's requirement. It will also include Qualcomm's latest Snapdragon 865 SoC along with an improved cooling mechanism.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Biometric sensor that measures veins and pulse waves developed
text: An ultrathin image sensor which measures fingerprints, veins and pulse waves has been developed by a company called Japan Display. The sensor is as thin as paper, light-weight and bendable. It makes use of both biometric signals(pulse waves) and biometric information(fingerprints and veins) and the company claims that it is well-suited to security applications and data-sensitive wearables.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Protests at Goa University over stabbing of Afghan student
text: Students of Goa University gathered on Tuesday to protest hate crime against a 24-year-old Afghan student Maitulla Ari and called for action against the men who stabbed him. Ari was attacked by four youths on a motorcycle and was taken to a local hospital. An FIR was filed under Section 326 of the Indian Penal Code, officials said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 'Major renewal': Putin appoints new Cabinet after PM's resignation
text: A week after Russian PM Dmitry Medvedev and the entire Russian government resigned, President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday appointed a new government. The newly formed government includes a new Deputy Prime Minister and Economy Minister. Putin earlier also proposed constitutional amendments in which the President's broad powers would be cut and parliament's powers will be expanded.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: The world is on fire: Greta Thunberg at World Economic Forum
text: Climate activist Greta Thunberg said world leaders failed to tackle climate emergency because of which "the world is currently on fire". "Without treating this as a real crisis, we cannot solve it," she added, speaking at the World Economic Forum. Thunberg warned political leaders, media to listen to scientists as time was running out to tackle global warming.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Global unemployment to increase by 2.5 million: UN report
text: According to a report by the UN's International Labour Organization (ILO), global unemployment is expected to increase by 2.5 million per year, adding to the current figure of 188 million. "Total labour underutilisation is affecting over 470 million people," it states. "For millions of...people, it's increasingly difficult to build better lives through work," ILO Director-General Guy Ryder said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: India's thermal coal imports have dropped for 3 months running
text: India's thermal coal imports fell 10.7% to 15.62 million tonnes for the third time in a row in October. However, imports for the 10 months to October were 12.6% higher at 163.86 million tonnes. The fall imports reflect wider weakness in the Indian economy, projected to expand by 5% in 2019/2020 fiscal year, the lowest pace in 11 years.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: It's OK, it's just an exam: Principal's letter to parents before exams goes viral
text: A letter by the Principal of International Indian School -Dammam in Saudi Arabia, to students' parents ahead of CBSE Board exams 2020, has gone viral. "If your child doesn't get top marks...Tell them it's OK, it's just an exam," the letter read. "And please, don't think that doctors and engineers are the only happy people in the world," it added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Challenge Rahul, Mamata, Akhilesh to debate on CAA: Amit Shah
text: Union Home Minister on Tuesday challenged Mamata Banerjee, Rahul Gandhi and Akhilesh Yadav to a debate on the newly enacted Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). He also said that the opposition is spreading "falsities" against the Act. "Unrest is being caused in the country by opposition parties," he added. Shah was speaking at a rally in support of CAA in Lucknow.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: India squad for NZ ODIs out, Samson back in T20I squad as Dhawan's replacement
text: The BCCI on Tuesday announced the 16-member Team India squad for the ODI series against New Zealand. Prithvi Shaw, who last represented India in a Test in 2018, has been included as replacement of Shikhar Dhawan, who recently sustained a shoulder injury. Meanwhile, Sanju Samson, who was initially dropped from the T20I squad, has replaced Dhawan for New Zealand T20Is.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Cong joined Sena as Muslims asked to keep BJP out: Ashok Chavan
text: Maharashtra minister Ashok Chavan has said that his party agreed to be a part of the Shiv Sena-led government on the insistence of Muslims. Speaking at an anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act rally, he said Muslims called upon the Congress to stop BJP from coming into power. He added that CAA would not be implemented in Maharashtra until they are in power.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Uber to let California drivers set own fares: WSJ
text: Uber is testing a new feature to allow some California drivers to decide on their own fares, up to five times of Uber's base price, The Wall Street Journal reported. When a ride is requested, Uber will match the rider with the driver with the lowest price. Drivers charging higher fares will gradually be dispatched as demand for rides increases.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Will allow passage to school buses: Shaheen Bagh protesters after meeting LG
text: A delegation of Shaheen Bagh protestors on Tuesday met Lieutenant Governor of Delhi, Anil Baijal, and said that they would allow passage to school buses despite the protest being continued. "Assured [protestors] to convey their concerns to appropriate authorities. Appealed to call off their agitation in view of continued inconvenience," Baijal tweeted after the meeting.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Think and speak: MK Stalin to Rajinikanth over Periyar comment
text: DMK President MK Stalin on Tuesday asked actor-politician Rajinikanth to rethink his remark on a rally taken out by social reformer Periyar in 1971. Stalin said, "My friend Rajinikanth is not a politician, he is an actor. Please think and speak about Periyar. I appeal to you." Stalin added that Periyar had lived for 95 years, working for the Tamilians.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Magsaysay awardee booked for 'using foul language' for Savarkar in UP
text: Activist and Magsaysay Award winner Sandeep Pandey was booked by UP Police for allegedly using objectionable language against Veer Savarkar while addressing an anti-CAA protest in AMU on Sunday. The complainant said that through media reports he came to know that Pandey also disrespected Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha President Chakrapani Maharaj. The police said that they are probing the matter.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Not funds, Centre lacks courage to take decisions: Nitin Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has said that the Centre lacked the courage to take decisions. "In five years I have awarded work worth ₹17 lakh crore, this year I wish to award projects worth ₹5 lakh crore. There's no lack of funds," he said. "The only thing which is lacking is the intention and courage to take decisions," he added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Age of two kids printed over 100 years on birth certificates over no bribe in UP
text: A Bareilly court has ordered police to lodge a case against a village development officer and a village head who allegedly issued wrong documents after the children's family refused to give them a bribe. Two-year-old Sanket and four-year-old Shubh are 102 and 104 years old, respectively, according to their birth certificates. The accused demanded ₹500 for each birth certificate.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: NCP releases list of 7 candidates for Delhi polls
text: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Tuesday released a list of seven candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections. The list includes Chaudhary Fateh Singh (Gokulpur), Zahid Ali (Babarpur), Prashant Gaur (Gonda), Rana Sujeet Singh (Chhattarpur), Mayur Bhan (Mustafabad) and Asim Baig (Chandni Chowk). The list also featured former Delhi Cantonment MLA from AAP Surender Singh.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 2 militants killed, 1 Army jawan, 1 SPO martyred in J&K encounter
text: Two militants were killed and one Army jawan was martyred during an encounter that broke out between militants and security forces in Awantipora town of Pulwama district in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday. One Special Police Officer (SPO) of J&K Police was also martyred in the encounter. The militants were reportedly hiding in a house.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Jharkhand's Jharia most polluted city in India, 6 of top 10 are in UP: Report
text: The city of Jharia in the coal-mining belt of Jharkhand is India's most polluted city, according to the 'Airpocalypse-IV report' released by Greenpeace India. Six of the top 10 most polluted cities are in Uttar Pradesh- Noida, Ghaziabad, Bareilly, Prayagraj, Moradabad and Firozabad. Among the 287 cities from where data was collected, Mizoram's Lunglei is the least polluted.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: I don't know: Sharapova on future plans after Aus Open 1st round loss
text: After being knocked out of Australian Open, five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova said, "I don't know...what's going to happen in next 12 months." The former world number one had made a comeback in 2017 after a 15-month doping ban and since then hasn't made it past Grand Slam quarterfinals. Sharapova lost the first-round match 3-6, 4-6 against Donna Vekic.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Man Utd charged over players' misconduct in 0-2 Liverpool defeat
text: Manchester United have been charged over players' misconduct in their Premier League defeat to Liverpool last week. In the 26th minute, United players had confronted the on-field referee after he allowed a goal by Roberto Firmino. While VAR ruled out the goal for a foul by Virgil van Dijk, the United went on to concede second goal in stoppage time.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Pak's 2nd highest woman wicket-taker left out of T20 WC squad
text: Pakistan's second-highest woman wicket-taker in T20Is, Sana Mir, has not been included in the 15-player squad for the Women's T20 World Cup. The 34-year-old Mir is Pakistan's joint most capped T20I woman player with Bismah Maroof, having played 106 T20Is and country's most capped ODI woman player, having played 120 ODIs. Last year, she played nine T20Is picking eight wickets.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Ex-employee fights Apple lawsuit forbidding staff to plan startup on payroll
text: After Apple sued its ex-employee Gerard Williams III for starting his own rival startup, his attorneys will convince the judge that employees can plan a new business while still working. Williams allegedly spent time planning his startup Nuvia while working for Apple and hired former Apple employees. He argued that Apple's contract was unenforceable and non-abiding to California law.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Devil's Pool near Victoria Falls lets visitors experience a 100-metre drop
text: Devil's Pool near the Victoria Falls at the Zambia/Zimbabwe border offers tourists to experience a drop of 100 meters. It takes a rocky walk and a swim in the Zambezi river to reach the pool before slipping into the swimming hole. Victoria Falls is considered to be one of the 'seven natural wonders' of the world.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bengaluru-based MyGate's revenue up 4 times to ₹6 cr in FY19
text: MyGate, the Bengaluru-based security management service for guard-gated apartments, registered nearly 4 times growth in operating revenue in FY19 to ₹5.83 crore from ₹1.51 crore in FY18, its annual report revealed. Its losses jumped to ₹25.33 crore from ₹2.73 crore. Among other expenditures, the startup spent ₹1.3 crore on advertisement and promotions, 7.6 times up from ₹17.12 lakh in FY18.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Srinagar declared 'Open Defecation Free' by central government
text: Srinagar Mayor Junaid Azim Mattu on Tuesday tweeted that the city has joined the list of 'Open defecation free' (ODF) cities of India. "Srinagar receives its Swachhata Certificate from Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, Central Government," he said, sharing an image of the certificate. "Another achievement after Srinagar gets 45th Rank in Cleanest Cities in the country!", he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Taiwan under harsh suppression from China: Taiwanese Prez to Pope
text: In a letter to Pope Francis, Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen wrote about her country facing "harsh suppression" from China, including undermining of democracy, freedom, and human rights in the island nation. She wrote the letter in response to Pope's message for the World Day of Peace on January 1. China considers Taiwan as its 'wayward province' and seeks reunification.
author: Shailesh

headlines: First case of new coronavirus from China detected in Taiwan
text: Taiwan detected its first case of coronavirus in a woman who returned to the country after working in China's Wuhan city, where the outbreak began, Taiwan Centres for Disease Control said. CDC urged the public to not panic as the woman had been identified soon after her arrival. The virus has been detected in Thailand, Japan and South Korea.
author: Shailesh

headlines: India plans to mandate cybersecurity measures for power grids
text: The Central Electricity Regulatory Commission published draft rules under which grid operators will have to install firewalls and other measures to prevent cyberattacks and check hacking of power networks. The report advised all transmission utilities to ensure the protection of sensitive data. This comes months after the Nuclear Power Corporation of India admitted its system had been breached.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Dish TV, Airtel Digital merger talks on hold over deal differences: Report
text: Merger talks between Dish TV and Airtel Digital TV have been put on hold over differences in the deal structure, people familiar with the matter said. Dish TV has opted for an all-cash deal but an arm of Bharti Airtel has been committed to offering shares. Notably, Subhash Chandra and his Essel Group have been selling assets to reduce debt.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Aramco IPO proceeds to fund Saudi local economy, including defence
text: Saudi Arabia will pump funds raised from state oil giant Saudi Aramco's IPO in December 2019 into the local economy, including the defence industry over several years amid Iran tensions, Finance Minister Mohammed al-Jadaan said. "Our focus is firmly on non-oil GDP growth," he added. Aramco raised $29.4 billion through its initial public offering by selling a 1.725% stake.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI cancels PPI license of Vodafone M-Pesa
text: The Reserve Bank of India cancelled digital wallet Vodafone M-Pesa's license after it surrendered its certificate of authorisation in 2019. RBI added that "customers having a valid claim on the company as an operator can approach the company for settlement of their claims within three years" from the cancellation date. M-Pesa shut down operations due to losses and regulatory curbs.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Telcos should run media campaign to check spam calls, SMS: TRAI
text: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has asked operators to run media campaigns to spread awareness among consumers on ways to register their consent and preferences in the case of spam calls and text messages. TRAI gave the companies a 15-day deadline to follow this direction and create a facility for lodging complaints, if such calls persist.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Signature Masterclass S4 invites storytellers to showcase their talent
text: Signature Masterclass Season 4, in search of India's best storytellers, aims to offer a platform for your unique story. Storytellers can submit their stories at signaturemasterclass.co.in and stand a chance to be mentored by India's finest actors. The Signature story which wins hearts will be made into a film, giving storytellers around the country an opportunity to showcase their talent.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: 71-yr-old US singer David Olney dies on stage after apologising mid-song
text: America's 71-year-old singer-songwriter David Olney died on stage during a performance at a festival in Florida on Saturday. "Olney was in the middle of his third song when he stopped, apologised and shut his eyes," musician Amy Rigby, who was performing alongside him on the stage said. Olney suffered an apparent heart attack during the show, a statement said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Torn lip still raw but doesn't show much now: Shahid on recovering from lip injury
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor on Tuesday shared his picture on Instagram Story while recovering from his lip injury. He captioned it, "Thank you for all your wishes. The torn lip is still a bit raw but doesn't show much now. So back on set." The actor got 13 stitches after a ball hit his lower lip while shooting for 'Jersey'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Quinton de Kock named South Africa's ODI captain, Du Plessis dropped from side
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Quinton de Kock has been named as new captain of South Africa's ODI side. The 27-year-old takes over from Faf du Plessis, who has been dropped for the three-match series against England. "He has a unique outlook and manner in which he goes about his business and is tactically very street smart," CSA director of cricket Graeme Smith said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India U-19 team poses with Japan team after win, praised for 'Spirit of Cricket'
text: India Under-19 cricket team captain Priyam Garg called the Japan team for a group photograph after their 2020 Under-19 World Cup match on Tuesday. Players from both the teams were seen interacting with each other before posing for the group picture and were praised for 'Spirit of Cricket'. India defeated Japan by 10 wickets, chasing down 42 in 4.5 overs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal files nomination after waiting for 6 hours
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday filed his nomination for the Assembly elections after waiting for more than six hours. The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) had accused the BJP of 'deliberately delaying' the filing of nomination by the Delhi CM. Kejriwal could not file his nomination yesterday because of his roadshow.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: We doubt IMF projections: BJP leader on slashed growth rate
text: BJP leader Gopal Krishna Agarwal on Tuesday reacted to International Monetary Fund (IMF) cutting India's growth rate, by saying that he has "doubts on IMF projections." He said on Twitter, "We have doubts...whether they have [considered] the impact of Modi government initiatives like NIP, credit line for MSME and NBFC and mega exercise on Budget, IBC and GST reforms."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Disclosing information in NPR is voluntary: MoS Home
text: Minister of State for Home, G Kishan Reddy on Tuesday said, "Disclosing information for National Population Register (NPR) is voluntary." However, he added that NPR's implementation is a constitutional obligation for all the states. "They (states) should not object to this. We will continue to sensitise them," Reddy said. Kerala and West Bengal governments have announced they won't implement NPR.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Will offer ₹22 crore cash reward to whoever kills Trump: Iranian MP
text: Iranian MP Ahmad Hamzeh has offered a $3 million (nearly ₹22 crore) cash reward to anyone who kills US President Donald Trump. Hamzeh told the parliament that the reward would be given "on behalf of the people of Kerman". The city of Kerman is the hometown of General Qassem Soleimani, who was killed by the US in a drone strike.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Iran confirms 2 missiles shot down Ukrainian plane carrying 176 people
text: Iran has confirmed that two Russian-made Tor-M1 missiles were fired at the Ukrainian aircraft which was brought down on January 8, killing all 176 people on board. Authorities said the impact of these missiles on the accident was under investigation. Iran initially claimed the Boeing 737 flight experienced engine failure but later admitted to accidentally shooting down the plane.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's air passenger traffic growth falls to 3.7% in 2019 from 18.6%
text: India's domestic air passenger traffic growth slowed to 3.74% in 2019 from 18.6% the previous year, data released by DGCA showed. Domestic scheduled airlines carried 14.42 crore passengers during 2019 against 13.9 crore passengers in 2018. As of December 2019, India's largest airline IndiGo had a market share of 47.5%, followed by SpiceJet (16.5%) and Air India (11.9%).
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Middle East share of India's oil imports falls to 4-yr low in 2019: Report
text: Middle East's share of India's crude oil imports plunged to a four-year low of 60% in 2019, according to Reuters data. India imported 2.68 million barrels per day of oil from the Middle East in 2019, down about 10% from 2018. US oil accounted for about 4% of India’s overall imports, up from 2.5% a year earlier, the data showed.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: There's no other firm like Reliance, it's one of the most diversified: Bernstein
text: Bernstein Research has said Reliance Industries is one of the most diversified conglomerates in India, if not the world, adding "there is simply no other company like it". "In India, Reliance dominates energy, telecom and retail in the same way ExxonMobil, AT&T and Amazon do in the US. But...Reliance comprises all three of these businesses rolled into one," it added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: World no. 3 Halep injures wrist during Aus Open 1st round, still wins
text: World number three Simona Halep has advanced to the second round of the Australian Open despite suffering a sore wrist after falling down during the first round clash. Halep defeated American Jennifer Brady 7-6(7-5), 6-1 in a contest that lasted one hour and 36 minutes. She will now face Britain's Harriet Dart who entered the tournament through qualifiers.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Bowlers don't get ignored if they can bowl at 140 kmph: Pak debutant
text: Pakistan's 26-year-old pacer Haris Rauf, who earned his maiden T20I call-up for the upcoming three-match series against Bangladesh, has said that a bowler is not ignored "if he can bowl at 140 kmph plus." Rauf is currently playing for Melbourne Stars in BBL and has picked 16 wickets in seven matches. He has also picked a hat-trick in BBL.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Labuschagne ready for T20 cricket, suggests Steve Smith
text: Talking about Marnus Labuschagne, who is yet to feature for Australia in T20Is, former skipper Steve Smith said the 25-year-old has a "bright future". On Labuschagne playing the shortest format, Smith said, "I certainly don't see why not." "We saw how he grew in Test cricket over the summer…now it's (about) taking that to next level in T20," Smith added.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Google sells 'Not Pink' colour variant of Pixelbook Go in select markets
text: Google has begun selling a 'Not Pink' colour variant of its Chromebook Pixelbook Go in select markets including the US. Earlier, only 'Just Black' variant was available. The 'Not Pink' variant is available at a starting price of $849, higher than that of the base model. It comes with an Intel Core i5 with 8GB RAM and 128GB storage.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Remarks on Amazon won't send wrong signal to investors: Piyush Goyal
text: Commenting on his previous statement about Amazon not doing any favour by investing $1 billion in India, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said that those remarks won't send a wrong signal to international investors. Last week, Jeff Bezos announced investing $1 billion in India to digitise small businesses. Goyal replied that Amazon was doing the investment to primarily fund its losses.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: London startup that helps travellers store luggage safely raises $2.5mn
text: London-based luggage storage solution startup Stasher raised $2.5 million in additional funding led by VentureFriends, former president of Hotels.com Johan Svanstrom, and other angel investors. Stasher connects travellers, rental guests and others with local shops and hotels who store their luggage for a short span. Some of the cities where it serves include Rome, Paris and Sydney.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Singer Sukhbir invests in international music startup Flutin
text: Sukhbir Singh has infused an undisclosed amount in international music startup Flutin and is also looking to collaborate with the app. The singer had started investing in several startups last year with his first one being a Gurugram-based beverage startup LQI followed by MEngage and eBikeGo. Flutin recommends new music and independent artists by studying user behaviour.nn
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Belly fat linked with repeat heart attacks: Study
text: A research study published in the European Journal of Preventive Cardiology has found that heart attack survivors who carry excess fat around their waist are at increased risk of another heart attack. The study followed more than 22,000 patients after their first heart attack and investigated the relationship between abdominal obesity and the risk for recurrent cardiovascular disease events.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Opp'n blocks tabling of Andhra's 3-capitals Bill in Legislative Council
text: The opposition Telugu Desam Party (TDP) on Tuesday blocked tabling of the Andhra Pradesh Decentralisation and Inclusive Development of All Regions Bill, 2020 in the Legislative Council, citing rules. The Bill, that is related to development of three capitals for the state, was passed by the state Assembly on Monday night.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Manish Malhotra designed mounted unit's uniform, reveals Mumbai Police
text: The uniform of Mumbai Police's mounted unit has been designed by fashion designer Manish Malhotra, Mumbai Police has revealed. "Regal in stature, Formidable in form, the 'Mounted Police Unit' returns to Mumbai Police. Thank you Manish Malhotra for designing such an elegant uniform for our Riders," Mumbai Police wrote on Twitter while sharing a video of the mounted unit.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: More support from US to Venezuela's opposition leader: Pompeo
text: The US will take further action to support Venezuela's opposition leader Juan Guaido, US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said after meeting Guaido in Colombia. Guaido had defied a court order to attend a regional conference in Colombia. Guaido declared himself Venezuela's interim President in 2019 and is recognised by over 50 countries, including the US, Brazil, Germany and France.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Iran seeks equipment from US, France to analyse downed plane data
text: Iran has requested equipment from US and France to be able to download data from downed Ukrainian plane's black boxes after it was reportedly damaged in the crash. Iran admitted that the plane was unintentionally shot down while the country was on a high alert after targeting US forces in Iraq. All 176 people aboard were killed in the crash.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Trump's lawyers call for immediate acquittal in impeachment case
text: US President Donald Trump's lawyers rejected House of Representatives' impeachment charges and called for their immediate dismissal by the Senate in a 116-page memo. The memo offered a legal and political defence against his removal, saying Trump was "within his rights as president" to make foreign policy decisions. It also said the House pursued a "one-sided process" before Trump's impeachment.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Thousands who went missing during civil war are dead: Lankan Prez
text: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said thousands of people who went missing during the civil war involving separatist rebels Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) are dead. A statement from Rajapaksa's office said, "Most of them had been taken by the LTTE or forcefully conscripted." It added that steps would be taken to provide death certificates for those reported missing.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Uber to get 9.99% stake in Zomato valued at $300 mn after deal: Report
text: As part of the all-stock deal of Zomato taking over Uber Eats' India business, America's Uber will hold a 9.99% stake in Gurugram-based Zomato. As per the latest round of fundraising for Zomato, it's reportedly valued at around $3 billion, valuing Uber's stake in Zomato at close to $300 million. Uber Eats will cease to exist as a separate entity.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Scientists discover immune cell which kills most cancers by accident
text: A new type of immune cell which kills most cancers has been discovered by accident by British scientists. That new T-cell was discovered when the team was analysing blood from a bank in Wales, looking for immune cells. The new T-cell carries a never-before-seen receptor which acts like a grappling hook, latching on to cancers, while ignoring healthy cells.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Akshay celebrates mother's birthday in casino, says it's her favourite place
text: Akshay Kumar has shared a video of himself with his mother during her birthday week. The video shows Akshay wheeling his mother towards a casino. "Do more of what you love doing and that's exactly what the birthday girl did. Spent the past week in Singapore taking mom to her favourite place in the whole world- the casino," he wrote.nn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Censor Board mutes word 'a**hole' in 'Street Dancer 3D': Reports
text: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has asked the makers of Varun Dhawan and Shraddha Kapoor starrer 'Street Dancer 3D' to mute the word 'a**hole', which has been mentioned once in the film, as per reports. Apart from that, the liquor brand's logo on alcohol bottles was blurred and an anti-alcohol disclaimer in Hindi was added, reports further said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: India needs register of unemployed youth, not NRC: Prakash Raj
text: Actor and politician Prakash Raj on Monday said that if government wants to prepare a register, then it should make one on India's unemployed youths and uneducated children in an apparent jibe at the proposed National Register of Citizens (NRC). He also urged anti-CAA protesters to confine themselves to non-violent protests claiming that the government wanted protests to turn violent.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Protest as much as you can, CAA won't be taken back: Amit Shah
text: Addressing a rally in Lucknow in CAA's support, Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said, "Whoever wants to protest against CAA, can do it as much as they can, the law won't be scrapped". Shah criticised the Opposition for "misleading" the people on the CAA and added that there was no provision in the law to take away anyone's citizenship.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Shaheen Bagh protesters send ₹1cr defamation notice to BJP IT cell head
text: The anti-CAA protesters at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh have sent a defamation notice to BJP's IT cell head Amit Malviya, demanding an apology and ₹1 crore in damages. The notice said that Malviya falsely accused the protesters of taking ₹500-700 to be part of the protests. It added that Malviya was misleading the general public through this "exercise of mass misinformation".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: K'taka association fined ₹50,000 for using plastic cups in India-Australia ODI
text: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on Karnataka State Cricket Association (KSCA) for using single-use plastic cups during India-Australia ODI. BBMP Commissioner BH Anil Kumar said that plastic cups were used in the stadium despite repeated instructions and holding awareness meetings. CM BS Yediyurappa had ordered a ban on single-use plastic in Karnataka last year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India beat Japan with 271 balls left after bowling them out for 41 in U-19 WC
text: India defeated Japan by 10 wickets and 271 balls remaining to register their second successive victory in the 2020 Under-19 World Cup on Tuesday. The victory is India's biggest in terms of balls remaining in the history of Under-19 World Cup. India had bowled out Japan for 41 in 22.5 overs, with leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi registering figures of 8-3-5-4.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: KL Rahul is an invaluable asset, but what about Rishabh Pant: Gautam Gambhir
text: Gautam Gambhir praised KL Rahul for taking multiple roles in Team India during the three-match ODI series against Australia, calling him "an invaluable asset". Virat Kohli also hinted he'd persist with Rahul as wicketkeeper. However, Gambhir said, "What happens to Rishabh Pant?...His confidence is already eroding under constant scrutiny of his technique...Not sure how he'll perceive this move."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Countries that fail to attract immigrants will lose in tech industry: Microsoft CEO
text: Microsoft's India-born CEO Satya Nadella on Tuesday told Bloomberg that the countries that fail to attract immigrants will be in a loss as the global technology industry continues to grow. "Every country is rethinking what is in their national interest," said Nadella. Governments need to "maintain that modicum of enlightenment and not think about it very narrowly," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: BJP deliberately delaying Kejriwal's nomination filing: AAP
text: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj accused the BJP of 'deliberately delaying' the filing of nomination by Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for the Assembly elections. "Around 35 candidates are sitting at RO office without proper nomination papers...They're insisting unless their papers are complete and file nomination, they won't allow CM Kejriwal to file nomination. BJP is behind these people," Bharadwaj said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: AAP MLA quits after not getting ticket, to contest Delhi polls from NCP
text: Sitting AAP MLA from Delhi Cantonment seat, Surender Singh, who was denied party ticket for upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, has said that he has resigned from the party. He announced that he would contest elections from the NCP. Sharing his resignation letter on Twitter, Singh wrote, "Today, I'm sad and I'm giving my resignation letter from the Aam Aadmi Party."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Which are some of Zomato's biggest acquisitions?
text: Zomato has acquired Uber Eats India in an all-stock deal reportedly valued between $300-$350 million. Zomato has made 13 acquisitions so far including New Zealand's MenuMania in 2014, US-based restaurant search guide Urbanspoon for $50-60 million in 2015 and Bengaluru-based Runnr in 2017. In 2018, Zomato acquired Bengaluru's TongueStun Food and Lucknow-based drone startup TechEagle Innovations.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Man says food on Swiggy 25-50% costlier than restaurant price, Swiggy responds
text: Swiggy on Tuesday responded to a user who claimed that the prices of food items on apps like Zomato and Swiggy menu are 25-50% more than the actual price of the same item at the restaurant. Swiggy tweeted that online and offline pricing is the sole right of the restaurant. "We don't intervene with the same," Swiggy added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bhim Army chief allowed to enter Delhi after court modifies bail conditions
text: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad has been allowed to enter Delhi after a court modified his bail conditions. Azad can visit Delhi for medical and electoral purposes but he'll have to give his schedule to the authorities in advance. Azad was granted bail last week after he was arrested for organising an anti-CAA march from Jama Masjid to Jantar Mantar.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Tulsi's character influenced Afghan society after Taliban's fall: Envoy on Smriti
text: Tahir Qadiry, the Chargé d'Affaires at Afghanistan's embassy in India, recently met Union Minister Smriti Irani at the Delhi airport. "Told (Smriti) about her influence in the Afghan society shortly after fall of the Taliban through her character of Tulsi in 'Kyunki... Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. Such a humble and beautiful human being!" Qadiry tweeted while sharing a picture.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Biometric systems, CCTVs not broken at server room: JNU in reply to RTI query
text: JNU said in response to an RTI query that the biometric systems and CCTV cameras at the server room weren't vandalised in January first week. JNU added that the university's main server was shut down on January 3 "due to power supply disruption". The JNU administration had said in an FIR earlier that students had destroyed them on January 3.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Municipal official suspended after houses of 'illegal Bangladeshis' razed in B'luru
text: Bengaluru municipal corporation suspended an official after 100 makeshift houses were demolished, with a BBMP engineer claiming the residents were illegal Bangladeshi immigrants. BBMP chief called the demolition "unauthorised" and said charges were being framed against the official. Several residents said their homes were razed even as they held up their identity cards to prove they are Indians.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: SC asks Parliament to rethink power of Speakers to disqualify MLAs
text: The Supreme Court has suggested the Parliament to reconsider the power of Assembly Speakers in deciding petitions seeking disqualification of lawmakers as they also belong to a political party. This came in a judgement wherein the court asked the Manipur Assembly Speaker to decide within four weeks the plea seeking disqualification of BJP lawmaker and Manipur Forest Minister Th Shyamkumar.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India's NSE becomes world's largest derivatives exchange
text: India's National Stock Exchange (NSE) has surpassed US-based CME Group to become the world's largest derivatives exchange by volume, according to data published by Futures Industry Association (FIA). Contracts traded on NSE jumped 58% to 5.96 billion in 2019 surpassing CME's 4.83 billion. Notably, India's stock market is valued at $2.2 trillion compared with the US' $35.5 trillion.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Why did JD(U) ally with BJP in Delhi: JD(U) leader asks Nitish Kumar
text: Janata Dal (United) leader Pavan K Varma has asked party chief Nitish Kumar to explain why the party allied with the Bharatiya Janata Party for the Delhi Assembly elections on February 8 amid protests against CAA. In a letter to Kumar, Varma sought "ideological clarity" and quoted private conversations where the Bihar CM had been critical of the BJP.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Used to idolise Zidane, Cristiano when I was a child: Mbappe
text: Paris Saint-Germain's Kylian Mbappe revealed that the current Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane and Juventus' Cristiano Ronaldo were his idols when he was a child. The 21-year-old forward, who has scored 21 goals in 22 appearances for PSG this season, also revealed that he later idolised Brazilian Ronaldo for 'the way he played'.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Shooters Apurvi Chandela, Divyansh Panwar win golds at Meyton Cup
text: Shooters Apurvi Chandela and Divyansh Singh Panwar have won gold medals while Anjum Moudgil and Deepak Kumar have won bronze in the Meyton Cup. Apurvi finished on top in women's 10m air rifle event with a score of 251.4 and Moudgil on third in the same event. In men's 10m air rifle, Divyansh finished on top and Deepak on third.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Japan to create plan to launch 6G wireless communication by 2030
text: The Japanese government is planning to create a comprehensive plan to introduce 6G by 2030, set to be 10-times faster than 5G, according to the Internal Affairs and Communications Ministry. A panel including university researchers and private sector officials will be created by January end to discuss its implementation. 6G networks will have the ability to connect multiple devices simultaneously.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Few traitors keep weapons inside mosques instead of praying: BJP leader
text: Karnataka BJP MLA MP Renukacharya has said that there are a few "traitors" who "keep weapons inside mosques" instead of praying. "You killed our youth who opposed cow slaughter and...expect us to be silent? It is impossible," he added. "You support the minority community and mock Modiji, Yediyurappa, and Kateel. You expect us to stay mum?" Renukacharya further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: China sentences ex-Interpol chief to 13 years in prison for graft
text: A Chinese court sentenced ex-Interpol chief Meng Hongwei to 13 years and 6 months in prison and fined him over $200,000 for taking bribes worth over $2 million. Hongwei had resigned as Interpol chief in 2018 after being missing for days while on a trip to China. Hongwei was detained as part of China's President Xi Jinping's drive against corruption.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Bollywood movies responsible for sex crimes, paedophilia in Pak: PM Khan
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said that Hollywood and Bollywood movies are responsible for the rise in sex crimes and paedophilia in Pakistan. Talking about problem of drugs in schools, Khan said, "Pakistan is facing a huge challenge because of mobile phones. Mobile phones have enabled availability of such content to children that was never available in entire human history."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Most beautiful supermassive black hole: Rhea on rumoured boyfriend Sushant's b'day
text: Actress Rhea Chakraborty on Tuesday took to Instagram to share pictures with rumoured boyfriend, actor Sushant Singh Rajput on the occasion of his 34th birthday. "Happy birthday to the most beautiful 'supermassive black hole' that is known to mankind!nShine on you crazy diamond," she wrote. Replying to the post, Sushant commented, "Thank youuuuuuu my Rockstarrrr."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Some people named their kids Taimur: BJP leader on Saif's 'concept of India' remark
text: After Saif Ali Khan said, "I don't think there was a concept of India till British gave it one", BJP leader Meenakashi Lekhi took a dig at him. "Even Turks find Taimur a brute! But some [named] their children Taimur," she tweeted, referring to the conqueror Taimur. Earlier, Saif said he chose the name Taimur as he loved its meaning.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Edited 'Tanhaji' video shows PM Modi as Chhatrapati Shivaji, criticised
text: An edited video of the film 'Tanhaji' was criticised online after it showed PM Narendra Modi as Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and Home Minister Amit Shah as Tanhaji Malusare. The now-deleted video was posted by a Twitter handle in reference to Delhi elections. Criticising the video, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said, "Shivaji Maharaj is our idol...we'll not tolerate his insult."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Peace Party files curative petition against Ayodhya verdict in SC
text: Peace Party of India President Dr Mohammad Ayub on Tuesday filed a curative petition in SC against its November 9 verdict on Ayodhya land title suit. Dr Ayub's petition said, "Hindus were never able to prove unimpeded possession with respect to outer or the inner courtyard". SC judgement cleared way for construction of Ram Temple on the disputed land.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Clear road ahead of Board exams: Police to Shaheen Bagh protesters
text: Delhi Police on Monday appealed to anti-CAA protesters in Shaheen Bagh to "clear the road and restore normal traffic" citing complaints from parents about inconvenience to school kids. "Parents have expressed deep anxiety in view of forthcoming Board examinations," Police said on Twitter. "Daily commuters, local residents and businesspersons are also facing acute harassment," they added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: India has finally got MS Dhoni's replacement: Shoaib Akhtar on Manish Pandey
text: Talking about Manish Pandey, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "India has finally got MS Dhoni's replacement." "They have found a good fit in Manish Pandey," he added. He further said that Pandey has played a lot in IPL and knows how to handle pressure. Pandey has scored 450 and 618 runs in 25 ODIs and 33 T20Is, respectively.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India dismiss Japan for joint-second lowest ever Under-19 World Cup total
text: India bowled out Japan for 41 in 22.5 overs in their second match of the 2020 Under-19 World Cup. The total is the second-lowest total in the history of Under-19 World Cup. None of the Japanese batsmen managed to score in double-digits, while five of them were dismissed for ducks. Indian bowlers gave away 19 extras.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ishant slips, plunges to ground while appealing for an LBW, injures his ankle
text: Pacer Ishant Sharma sprained his ankle and hobbled off during Delhi's Ranji match against Vidarbha. While appealing for an LBW against Vidarbha opener and captain Faiz Fazal, the 31-year-old slipped and twisted his right ankle when back-pedaling. He plunged to the ground and had difficulty in getting up, before Delhi physio and support staff lifted him back to his feet.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: If IPL Best XI faces PSL Best XI, PSL Best XI will win: Abdul Razzaq
text: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq has said if a team of the best players from IPL faces a team made up from the best players from PSL (Pakistan Super League), the PSL side will win. Reacting to the statement, a fan tweeted, "Pakistanis are obsessed with India and IPL." Another fan wrote, "Yeah...just like Pakistan wins...against India in every World Cup."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kids risking lives to deliver pizza within 30 mins: B'luru Police Commissioner
text: Bengaluru's Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao on Tuesday tweeted, "Do we have the heart to get a free pizza from a kid risking his life just because he crossed over 30 minutes?" He said he's considering to ask pizza companies to increase the delivery time to 40 minutes. He also called out Swiggy saying that they're the biggest traffic violators.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indian airports to screen travellers from China for deadly Coronavirus
text: The Health ministry (MoHFW) has asked the Ministry of Civil Aviation to screen travellers from China at seven international airports for the deadly Coronavirus. The virus has claimed at least four lives in China and infected nearly 300 others. The Indian government had earlier issued a travel advisory for China's Wuhan city, where more than 500 Indian students study.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: JNU fee hike demand met, calls to remove V-C not reasonable: Pokhriyal
text: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal 'Nishank' has said that the calls to remove JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar are not reasonable now as the basic demand of students on hostel fee hike was met. HRD Ministry had directed the University Grants Commission to fund the utility and service charge of students after meetings with the JNU Students' Union and JNU administration.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: She got every girl's dream but tossing it away for money: Meghan's father
text: Meghan Markle's estranged father, Thomas Markle, criticised his daughter and Prince Harry over their decision to step back from royal duties. "She actually got every girl's dream. Every young girl wants to become a princess...and now she's tossing that away for money," he said. "They are destroying (the royal family), they are cheapening it, making it shabby," he further said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Oil India told to pay ₹48,000 crore telecom dues, 3 times its market value
text: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has slapped a ₹48,000-crore demand notice on Oil India for using optic fibre network for internal communication. The state-owned oil and gas explorer said it plans to challenge the order in Telecom Disputes Settlement and Appellate Tribunal (TDSAT). The dues sought are 3 times the company's market value of ₹15,900 crore.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Asked Boeing to get rid of that word MAX: Buyer with 200 MAX orders
text: Boeing should rename 737 MAX to help ease passengers' safety concerns when the jet flies again, said Steven Udvar-Hazy, Chairman of Air Lease Corp which ordered 200 MAX aircraft. "We've asked Boeing to get rid of that word MAX. I think that word MAX should go down in the history books as a bad name for an aircraft," Udvar-Hazy said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Don't care about 20: Nadal on aiming for Federer's Grand Slam tally
text: Speaking about rival Roger Federer's tally of 20 Grand Slams, Spain's Rafael Nadal said, "I don't care about 20 or 15 or 16. I just care about trying to keep going, keep enjoying my tennis career." "It's not like 20 is the number that I need to reach. If I reach 20, fantastic. If I reach 21, better," Nadal added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Nadal, Federer, Djokovic advance to Australian Open 2nd round
text: World top three tennis players Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer have advanced to the second round of the Australian Open. While Nadal defeated Bolivia's Hugo Dellien 6-2, 6-3, 6-0 to start his campaign on Tuesday, Djokovic and Federer won their respective first round matches on Monday. World number five Dominic Thiem has also advanced to the second round.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Barty, Pliskova advance to Aus Open 2nd round; Sharapova knocked out
text: World top two women tennis players Ashleigh Barty and Karolina Pliskova have advanced to the second round of the Australian Open. World number one Barty defeated Ukraine's Lesia Tsurenko 5-7, 6-1, 6-1 on Monday, while world number two Pliskova beat Kristina Mladenovic of France 6-1, 7-5 on Tuesday. Five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova lost in the first round.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: India's Gunneswaran crashes out of Australian Open in 1st round
text: India's top-ranked tennis player Prajnesh Gunneswaran crashed out of the Australian Open 2020 after losing to Japan's Tatsuma Ito in the first round on Tuesday. Prajnesh, who had entered the main draw of the men's singles event as a lucky loser in the qualifiers, went down 4-6, 2-6, 5-7 at Rod Laver Arena.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Man builds custom game controller for disabled daughter with spare parts
text: A Jersey-based man hand-built a custom video game controller for his nine-year-old daughter, who cannot use "fiddly" controllers because of a condition affecting her motor controls. Rory Steel used spare parts and built the ₹10,200 controller with two joysticks and flashing buttons, hooked to an Xbox adaptive controller. In a viral video, Ava is seen playing games using the device.
author: Dharna

headlines: 4.8L political posters, banners removed in Delhi ahead of poll
text: Delhi's three municipal corporations have removed around 4.8 lakh "poll-publicity related material" including political posters, banners and hoardings since the Model Code of Conduct for the Delhi Assembly Elections came into force on January 6. After Election Commission's orders, the NDMC removed 2,40,000 poll material, the SDMC removed 1,80,000 posters and the EDMC removed 64,000 such items.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Car rental startup Zoomcar raises ₹213 crore in Series D funding round
text: Bengaluru-based car rental startup Zoomcar has raised nearly ₹213 crore ($30 million) in its ongoing $100-million Series D round of funding. The investment round was led by Japan's Sony Innovation Fund, the corporate venture capital arm of Sony, alongside participation from some existing investors. The startup last raised ₹55.7 crore led by WeWork's India CEO Karan Virwani in October 2019.
author: Dharna

headlines: PM should do 'Naukri Par Charcha' and listen to the jobless: Yechury
text: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said that PM Modi should do a "Naukri Par Charcha" and listen to the "mann ki baat" of people who are jobless due to policies like "demonetisation and badly planned GST". Quoting a news report, Yechury tweeted, "unemployment rate is the worst-ever in independent India." He added that India's urban unemployment rate is 44%.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: People will vote for him on his performance as CM: Kejriwal's father
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's father on Tuesday said that people will vote for him in Delhi Assembly elections based on his performance as Chief Minister in the last five years. "People will vote on work. The issue will be his work...People are giving him all 70 seats," Govind Kejriwal said. The AAP leader is filing nomination from New Delhi seat.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: There'll be many Nirbhaya cases if alcohol culture gets popular: BJP leader
text: Maharashtra BJP leader Raj Purohit has said that if "alcohol culture becomes popular", it'll lead to "thousands of Nirbhaya cases". This comes before trials of Maharashtra Tourism Cabinet Minister Aaditya Thackeray's Mumbai 'nightlife' project, wherein malls and restaurants can be open for 24 hours. "Alcohol...will not lead to increase in tourism instead...crime against women," Purohit said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: SC agrees to hear modification plea by Vodafone, Airtel on AGR dues
text: Following Supreme Court's rejection of a plea by Vodafone Idea and Bharti Airtel to review the AGR verdict last week, SC agreed to hear a modification plea by the operators. The operators requested for more time to pay the ₹1-trillion AGR dues and come up with a "sustainable payment schedule". The deadline to pay off the dues is January 23.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Abdul Rahman al-Mawli al-Salbi confirmed by spies as new leader of ISIS
text: The new leader of the Islamic State has been confirmed as Amir Mohammed Abdul Rahman al-Mawli al-Salbi, according to officials from two intelligence services. He is one of the group's founding members. The Islamic State had announced Salbi as its leader using fake name 'Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Quraishi' hours after the death of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi in October 2019.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Could only afford lassi, bee fell into it but I still drank it: SRK on 1st Taj Mahal visit
text: Shah Rukh Khan has revealed he first visited the Taj Mahal with his first salary of ₹50. He added that after spending on the train ticket he was left with only enough money to afford a glass of 'pink lassi'. "A bee fell into it, but I still drank it and puked all through my return journey," the actor said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I don't bother if someone is making fun of me for no reason: Aamir on trolls
text: Aamir Khan has said he occasionally reads comments on his posts, while adding, "Especially around my film's release, because I want to know what people feel about the film and my character." However, he added he doesn't get affected by trolls. "If someone is just making fun of me or attacking me for no reason, I don't bother," said Aamir.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: No accident on film set, please clarify before writing: Alia on back injury
text: Alia Bhatt took to Instagram Story to clarify reports that said she injured her back on the sets of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. "They're not true. This is an old injury that has been acting up...No accident...Please do clarify next time before printing long long articles on what happened to me," she wrote. Alia earlier informed fans about the injury on Instagram.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Afzal Guru was made scapegoat: Soni after DSP Davinder's arrest with terrorists
text: Actress Soni Razdan on Tuesday shared an article about 2001 Parliament terror attack convict Afzal Guru's letter to his lawyer. In the letter, he wrote that he was tortured by DSP Davinder Singh, who was recently arrested with two terrorists. "This is why there... needs to be a solid enquiry into why Afzal Guru was made the scapegoat," she tweeted.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Poet Munawwar Rana's daughters booked in anti-CAA protests in Lucknow
text: Uttar Pradesh Police has booked Sumaiyya and Faujia, daughters of Urdu poet Munawwar Rana, for holding protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Lucknow. As per an FIR, Sumaiyya and Faujia allegedly misbehaved with a woman constable, and police booked them under IPC section 353 (deterring public servant from performing duties), among others.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Sachin to coach Ponting XI for match to raise money for bushfire rescue
text: Sachin Tendulkar will coach Ponting XI for their match against Warne XI that will take place on February 8 to raise money for bushfire rescue. Meanwhile, former West Indies fast bowler Courtney Walsh will coach Warne XI. "We can't wait to have them involved in what is going to be a special day," said Cricket Australia CEO Kevin Roberts.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Putting almost all of my money in Navi: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal
text: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal told the Times of India that he will invest all remaining proceeds from the sale of his Flipkart stake into his financial services venture Navi Technologies. "I'm putting almost all of mine (money)...whatever is left after Ola investment. All eggs in one basket," Bansal said. This amount is estimated to be between ₹2,850-3,200 crore.
author: Dharna

headlines: IAF deploys Sukhoi fighter jets armed with BrahMos missiles in TN
text: The Indian Air Force on Monday inducted the first six of 18 Russian Sukhoi-30 MKI fighter jets at Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur Air Force Station, boosting India's offensive capabilities in the Indian Ocean Region. The fighter jets of the new squadron are equipped with the air variant of the BrahMos cruise missile with a range of 290 km.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Kashmiri man makes car out of snow, says can build Taj Mahal also
text: A man named Zubair Ahmad in Srinagar has made a car out of snow, pictures of which have surfaced online. "I have been doing this since childhood. I can build anything using snow, even Taj Mahal. I just need resources. I want to create something for the world to see," Ahmad said. Many people gathered to see the 'snow car'.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 8 tourists from Kerala found dead in hotel room in Nepal
text: Eight tourists from Kerala have been found dead in a hotel room in Nepal's Daman. "They were using gas heater in the room, suffocation might have caused their death," a police official said. A total of fifteen tourists had booked two rooms at the hotel. The tourist were taken to a hospital after being found unconscious by the hotel staff.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Delhi devotee donates 35kg gold plating worth ₹14 crore to Siddhivinayak Temple
text: A devotee from Delhi has donated gold plating weighing around 35 kg and worth around ₹14 crore to Shri Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai. The donation was used to cover the wooden doors with golden leaves, and line the sanctum sanctorum and the inner ceiling of the main temple in gold. The entire process reportedly took around six months to complete.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Groom's father runs away with bride's mother in Guj, couple cancels wedding
text: A wedding has been called off in Gujarat's Surat after the groom's 48-year-old father and the bride's 46-year-old mother allegedly eloped with each other earlier this month. The family members told the police that both of them were last seen at their respective homes on January 10. Reportedly, the groom's father and the bride's mother dated each other years ago.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: What I look forward to everyday at office: Ratan Tata on picture with dog
text: Tata Sons' Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata shared a picture of himself with a dog on Instagram and wrote, "What I look forward to everyday at office, My friend Goa." In November last year, Tata had shared pictures of an abandoned dog on his Instagram account and had asked people to adopt the canine.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: US professor spends ₹1.3 crore of research money on strip clubs, iTunes
text: A US university professor is facing criminal charges for spending $185,000 (over ₹1.3 crore) research grant money on strip clubs, iTunes purchases, meals and other expenses. He has been charged with "theft by unlawful taking" and "theft by deception". He could face up to 14 years in prison and pay tens of thousands in fines if found guilty.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 56 journalists killed in 2019, none in India: United Nations
text: As many as 56 journalists were killed in 2019 around the world, with zero deaths being reported in India, UNESCO data stated. In 2019, 21 journalists were reported killed in the Latin America and Caribbean region, making it the 'deadliest' part of the world for the press. In total, 894 journalist killings were recorded from 2010 to 2019.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Pakistan to import 3 lakh tonnes of wheat as markets go out of flour stocks
text: Pakistan has approved the import of 3 lakh tonnes of wheat to meet a shortage of flour supplies after the ingredient went out of stock in shops and markets. Roti makers shut in protest against government's orders to sell the staple food at controlled prices. An opposition party leader said the wheat crisis might be the result of a scam.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Shikhar Dhawan ruled out of India's New Zealand tour
text: Opener Shikhar Dhawan has been ruled out of India's New Zealand tour due to a shoulder injury he sustained while fielding in Sunday's third India-Australia ODI. The selection committee is yet to name a replacement for Dhawan. Notably, it was against Australia in the World Cup that Dhawan sustained a fractured thumb after being hit by a rising delivery.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Utd keeper Romero crashes Lamborghini on way to training: Report
text: Manchester United goalkeeper Sergio Romero escaped unhurt after crashing his Lamborghini on his way to training on Monday, reports claim. Reports further claim that the Argentina international was able to take part in training on Monday. Romero had signed for United in 2015 and has made 53 appearances for the club since then.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Global corporate tax system should be overhauled: Apple CEO Cook
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook has said the global corporate tax system should be overhauled, saying "It's very complex to know how to tax a multinational...We desperately want it to be fair." In 2016, the European Union ruled that Apple saved $14.3-billion taxes by transferring its European profits to Ireland-based subsidiaries where it was allowed to avoid Ireland's 12.5% corporate tax.
author: Dharna

headlines: Kejriwal afraid BJP will win over 50 seats in Delhi polls: Bagga
text: Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, BJP's candidate for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections from Hari Nagar constituency, said that his party will win more than 50 seats in Delhi. "The BJP will win more than 50 seats...Kejriwal ji is afraid of this. That is why documents were burnt at Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) office, 15 days before the polls," Bagga said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Won't apologise for Periyar rally remark: Rajinikanth
text: Actor Rajinikanth has refused to apologise for his remark on EV Ramasamy 'Periyar' stating that it was something that he had read. He also showed news clippings to support the claim. Rajinikanth had said that nude images of Lord Rama and Sita garlanded with sandals were taken out at a rally led by Periyar in 1971 in Tamil Nadu's Salem.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Kerala, WB and Punjab doing political stunt over CAA: U'khand CM
text: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat on Monday said the Opposition ruled states of Kerala, West Bengal and Punjab are doing "political stunt" over the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) which is unconstitutional. Rawat added that when Parliament enacts laws, it has to be implemented in the country and these states should look at the national interest.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Several non-cancer drugs found to kill cancer cells: Study
text: A new study has found several non-oncological drugs that are capable of killing cancer cells. The research team tested the growth-inhibitory activity of 4,518 drugs across 578 human cancer cell lines and found 49 non-oncology compounds with selective and predictive biomarker-associated anticancer activity. Researchers note that six non-oncology compounds showed selective cancer-killing patterns.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Keep Muslim clerics away from anti-CAA protests: Ex-Delhi Lt Governor
text: Ex-Delhi Lieutenant Governor Najeeb Jung has said that protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act should remain secular and urged that "Muslim clerics should be kept away from such protests". "We don't have any space for their fatwas now. You give fatwa while sitting in the madrasas," he added. "This protest is not of Muslims, [it's] India's protest," Jung further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Journalists spreading fake news are taint to profession: Prez Kovind
text: Speaking at the Ramnath Goenka Excellence in Journalism Awards ceremony, President Ram Nath Kovind said that journalism has been passing through a "critical phase" and added that those who spread fake news are a "taint to this noble profession". He added that journalists these days "assume the role of an investigator, a prosecutor and a judge all rolled into one."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Railway official calls Goans 'Portuguese', BJP leader demands apology
text: A South Western Railway official on Monday called Goans 'Portuguese' while addressing a delegation led by BJP MLA Alina Saldanha. "We are not Portuguese, we're Indians...will raise the issue in Goa Legislative Assembly," she said. Goa BJP General Secretary Narendra Sawaikar demanded an unconditional apology. "When you all came...destroyed...houses...I meant Portuguese," the official had said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Bajaj Allianz Life invites you to support athletes with #PlankForIndia
text: Bajaj Allianz Life invites you to #PlankForIndia. For every plank you perform, and share on social media with #PlankForIndia, it will contribute to the training of future Indian athletes. Anil Kapoor, Mary Kom, Dutee Chand, Mithali Raj & Sunil Chhetri have contributed to this cause. Also, Bajaj Allianz Life is organising its largest #Plankathon yet on 26th January in Mumbai.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Interviewer says Brad cried while watching Jennifer's speech, actress says 'No!'
text: After Jennifer Aniston received the Best Actress in a TV series award at SAG Awards, she was told by an interviewer that her ex-husband, actor Brad Pitt was "crying" while watching her acceptance speech backstage. Reacting to this, Jennifer said "No!" after which the interviewer said, "I'm serious!" Jennifer added support from Brad and other colleagues means "everything" to her.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: As I speak, one more person has committed suicide: Deepika at WEF 2020
text: Deepika Padukone was honoured with the Crystal Award at World Economic Forum (WEF) Annual Meeting 2020 in Davos, Switzerland. During her acceptance speech, Deepika said, "In the time it has taken me to accept this award, the world has lost one more person to suicide." "I want to tell everyone suffering from [depression] that you are not alone," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Microsoft disagrees while Pichai backs temporary ban on facial recognition
text: After Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai backed the European Union's proposal to temporarily ban facial recognition technology, Microsoft President Brad Smith disagreed with the idea. Smith said it should not be banned if there's a reasonable alternative "that will enable...addressing this problem with a scalpel instead of meat cleaver". "Only one way...to make technology better...is to use it," he said.
author: Dharna

headlines: 17 TDP MLAs disrupt AP CM's speech on 3 capitals, suspended from Assembly
text: At least 17 MLAs of the opposition Telugu Desam Party (TDP) were suspended from the Andhra Pradesh Assembly on Monday for disrupting CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy's address on a Bill that proposes the creation of three capitals in the state- Visakhapatnam, Kurnool and Amaravati. "The government is arresting everyone. It's bad for democracy," said former CM N Chandrababu Naidu.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Be prepared for govt attack on IMF Chief Economist Gita Gopinath: Chidambaram
text: After the IMF lowered India's 2019-20 growth forecast to 4.8%, Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "We must prepare ourselves for an attack by government ministers on the IMF and (IMF Chief Economist) Dr Gita Gopinath." "Gita Gopinath was one of the first to denounce demonetisation," he tweeted. Gopinath said the slowdown in India will have an effect on global growth.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: AAP drops ex-minister Tomar over false affidavit, gives ticket to his wife
text: AAP has decided to drop former Delhi minister Jitender Singh Tomar from Tri Nagar Assembly constituency and give the poll ticket to his wife Preeti Tomar instead. This comes after the Delhi High Court had set aside the election of Jitender Tomar for giving false declaration regarding his educational qualification in his nomination papers for the 2015 Delhi Assembly polls.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Bus driver, cleaner put bottle in mentally-challenged girl's private parts, held
text: A bus driver and cleaner have been arrested for allegedly molesting a mentally-challenged schoolgirl in Mumbai last month. Police said the girl was returning from school when the accused removed her clothes and inserted a water bottle in her private parts. The driver said the cleaner used to show objectionable photos to boys and girls inside the school bus.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 7-storey textile market gutted in fire in Surat; 60 fire engines rushed to spot
text: A major fire broke out in a seven-storey Raghuveer Complex, which is a textile market, in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday morning. An official said several shops were gutted in the fire and as many as 60 fire engines have been rushed to the spot to douse the flames. The cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Giving birth to kids like animals harmful for nation: Shia Waqf board chief
text: UP Shia Waqf Board Chairman Wasim Rizvi on Monday said that giving birth to more children like "animals" is harmful to India. "Some...believe...childbirth is a natural process...shouldn't be interfered with," he added. This comes after RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat said that population growth is a "problem as well as a resource" and a policy on population control should be drafted.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Policeman steals 2 packets of milk during patrol in Noida, caught on CCTV
text: A CCTV footage has surfaced online, showing a Noida policeman stealing two packets of milk from crates kept outside a store during patrolling duty. The incident occurred during the early hours of January 19. The video of the incident shows the policeman handing over the milk packets to someone in the police vehicle parked nearby.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Take them out, I don't want convicts to cry: Judge in Muzaffarpur shelter case
text: The judge in the Muzaffarpur shelter home rape case directed the police to take all the convicts out of court after some female convicts started crying when one of the convicts threatened to commit suicide. "Please take them out. I don't want all the convicts to now start crying one by one," the judge said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 2 trained dogs save 7 koalas from bushfires in Australia; WWF shares pics
text: World Wildlife Fund for Nature (WWF) has shared a picture of two trained dogs who saved seven koalas from bushfires in Queensland, Australia. "Thanks to our supporters' urgent donations...we've been able to deploy vital emergency funds to Koala Detection Dogs - OWAD Environment who are working to locate surviving koalas," it wrote. WWF also shared a picture of rescued koalas.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: KFC apologises for ad showing young boys staring at woman's breasts
text: KFC has apologised for an ad showing two young boys staring with their mouths wide open as a woman adjusts her breasts. "Our intention wasn't to stereotype women and young boys in a negative light," KFC said.
