The ad features a woman checking her reflection in the tinted window of a car, apparently not realising anyone is inside the vehicle.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: India responsible for 80% of slashed global growth forecast: IMF's Gopinath
text: India's growth slowdown was the single biggest drag on global economic growth forecasts, responsible for 80% of the slashed estimates, IMF's Chief Economist Gita Gopinath told India Today. She said the downward revisions of 0.1% in global forecast for 2019 and 2020 were largely owed to downward revisions for India, whose 2019-20 growth estimate was cut to 4.8% from 6.1%.
author: Dharna

headlines: Govt-run railway financing arm IRFC files draft papers for IPO
text: Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC), the market borrowing arm of Indian Railways, has filed draft papers with markets regulator SEBI for an Initial Public Offering (IPO). The IPO comprises a fresh issue of 93.8 crore shares by the company and secondary market offering of 46.9 crore shares by the government. The overall IPO size could reportedly be over ₹2,500 crore.
author: Dharna

headlines: Delhi HC tells Twitter to remove 1,200 fraudulent Snapdeal links
text: The Delhi High Court has directed Twitter to remove nearly 1,200 fraudulent links pretending to be associated with Snapdeal after the e-marketplace filed a petition. The scammers allegedly misused Snapdeal's name to lure people into calling fake customer care numbers. The individuals who called these numbers were then asked to deposit money in scammers' accounts to claim rewards like cars.
author: Dharna

headlines: Call intellectuals opposing CAA 'monkeys', if not 'dogs': BJP leader
text: West Bengal BJP General Secretary Sayantan Basu said that those who have problem with BJP MP Soumitra Khan's remark that "intellectuals" opposing CAA and NRC are "dogs of CM Mamata Banerjee", they can call them "monkeys". "CAA...for common people...no point visiting places filled with dogs and monkeys," said Basu. He alleged that anti-CAA protestors received ₹500 from Banerjee's party.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Austrian scientists create record-breaking terahertz laser beam
text: Scientists at TU Wien have successfully developed a terahertz radiation source that is extremely efficient and results in a very broad spectrum, generating different wavelengths from the entire terahertz range. "It can easily penetrate many materials, but unlike X-rays, it is harmless because it is not ionizing radiation," a researcher from the Institute of Photonics at TU Wien said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Tuberculosis bacteria survive in amoebae found in soil: Study
text: Scientists from the University of Surrey and University of Geneva have discovered that the bacterium which causes bovine TB can survive and grow in small, single-celled organisms found in soil and dung. Researchers believe that the bacterium's ability to adapt to ambient temperatures and survive in amoebae may partially explain high transmission rates of the bacterium between animals.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Scientists create laser diode that emits deep-ultraviolet light
text: Japanese scientists have designed a laser diode that emits deep-ultraviolet light. "Our laser diode emits the world's shortest lasing wavelength at 271.8 nanometers (nm), under pulsed [electric] current injection at room temperature," a researcher said. These laser diodes could be used for disinfection in healthcare, treating skin conditions such as psoriasis, and for analyzing gases and DNA.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Prepare harder to fight terrorism: CM Uddhav Thackeray to Maha police
text: Speaking at a crime conference, attended by Maharashtra Police officers, CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday said that Maharashtra should prepare "even harder" to fight terrorism and Naxalism. "The state police force will be provided with the necessary cyber labs...advanced investigative materials," he added. Thackeray also talked about the Singapore-model where every citizen was given police training.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: No evidence of genocide against Rohingya Muslims: Myanmar
text: Myanmar's security forces likely committed war crimes against Rohingya Muslims in 2017 but weren't guilty of genocide as there was no evidence of it, a report by Myanmar's Independent Commission of Enquiry (ICOE) stated. "There's insufficient evidence to argue, much less conclude, that the crimes committed were undertaken with intent to destroy...ethnical, racial or religious group," ICOE said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Putin sends proposed constitutional changes to parliament
text: Russia's President Vladimir Putin on Monday submitted a constitutional amendments blueprint to parliament under which the President's broad powers would be cut and parliament's powers will be expanded. The reforms, which were first presented in Putin's state-of-the-nation address last week, will also allow the parliament the ability to select the Prime Minister.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: UK PM defeated on Brexit legislation for 1st time since election
text: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson's government on Monday witnessed first parliamentary defeat since December general election. The House of Lords voted in favour of an amendment to protect the rights of European Union citizens in the UK after Brexit. Under the move, eligible EU citizens will have an automatic right to stay in the UK after Brexit.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 7 killed after guest throws grenade at wedding party in Sudan
text: At least seven people, including three children, were killed and at least two dozen people were injured in a grenade explosion during a wedding party in Sudan's capital Khartoum on Monday. A fight between two people at the party escalated, with one of them throwing the grenade and causing the explosion, Sudan's Health Ministry said in a statement.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 30,000 tonnes of palm oil stuck at Indian ports after Malaysia curbs: Report
text: Around 30,000 tonnes of refined palm oil was stuck at various Indian ports after the country placed curbs on the imports of Malaysian refined palm oil, Reuters reported. The vessels were reportedly loaded before the restrictions were placed on January 8. Usually, customs officials allow unloading of commodities that are in transit before any change in regulations, sources said.
author: Dharna

headlines: Sunil Yadav fielded against Kejriwal in BJP's final list of candidates in Delhi
text: In the final list of candidates for Delhi Assembly elections, BJP has fielded Sunil Yadav against CM Arvind Kejriwal from the New Delhi constituency. Yadav is the President of Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha's Delhi unit. BJP has also named Tajinder Pal Bagga, who will contest from the Hari Nagar constituency. The voting will be held on February 8.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Female domestic help will take 22,277 yrs to earn tech CEO's annual pay: Oxfam
text: It would take a female domestic worker 22,277 years in India to earn what a top CEO of a technology company makes in one year, according to an Oxfam report on wealth inequality. With earnings pegged at ₹106 per second, the CEO would make more in 10 minutes than what the domestic worker would make in one year, Oxfam added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Zomato acquires Uber Eats India, says 'we are now undisputed market leaders'
text: Zomato on Tuesday said that it has acquired Uber Eats India in an all-stock transaction, which gives Uber 9.99% ownership in Zomato. "With this development, we are the undisputed market leaders in the food delivery category in India," Zomato said. "We have been very impressed by Zomato's ability to grow rapidly," Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Twin brothers who scored 100 & 99.9 percentile in JEE Main to take exam again
text: Nishant and Pranav Aggarwal, the 17-year-old twin brothers who scored 100 and 99.9 percentile, respectively, in JEE Main 2020, will take the exam again. "I will appear for the test again and try to improve my rank," said Pranav. Nishant too said that he will appear for the April session as he loves taking tests, The Indian Express reported.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 3 missiles hit area near US embassy in Baghdad; videos of sirens going off surface
text: Three rockets hit a high-security area near US embassy in Iraq's Baghdad, according to security sources. Videos showing sirens going off across the area immediately after the rockets made impact surfaced online. There were no immediate reports of casualties. This comes amid tensions between Iran and US over the killing of an Iranian General in a US strike in Iraq.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: England players once flew planes over stadium during their match
text: Former England players David Gower and John Morris flew WWII planes over the stadium after getting out in a warm-up match on January 21, 1991 in Australia. The planes were supposed to fly at over 2,000 feet above the ground but Gower convinced his pilot to hover at 200 feet. Both the players were fined £1,000 each for the incident.n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Deepika should apologise for 'Chhapaak look' TikTok challenge video: Kangana
text: Speaking about a TikTok video wherein Deepika Padukone challenged a makeup artist to recreate her look from 'Chhapaak', Kangana Ranaut said, "Sometimes, marketing teams tend to go overboard with their promotions." Adding that her sister, who's an acid attack survivor, was hurt on seeing the video, Kangana stated, "The people who're hurt...should be apologised to. This isn't a makeup look."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: India wins series but someone else takes headlines: Rohit on Rock-Chahal collage
text: Team India opener Rohit Sharma took to Twitter to share a collage which shows actor Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson and spinner Yuzvendra Chahal showing their tattoo. "Best picture I saw...India wins the series but someone else takes the headlines. Bravo!! @yuzi_chahal," Rohit jokingly captioned the picture. Reacting to the picture, a user wrote, "Apun ka limelight Apun khud banata hai."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: It was difficult to digest IPL snub: Manoj Tiwary after slamming triple hundred
text: After slamming his maiden triple century in first-class cricket, Bengal batsman Manoj Tiwary said IPL snub was difficult to digest for him. "Obviously...it feels bad when you see so many youngsters playing and I sit back at home watching," he added. "Anything is possible in the world," he further said about his chances of making a comeback to Team India.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 21-year-old tennis player asks ball girl to peel banana, gets criticised
text: France's 21-year-old tennis player Elliot Benchetrit asked a ball girl to peel a banana while he was sitting courtside in between sets during his final qualifying match at the Australian Open. The chair umpire then stepped in and asked Benchetrit to peel the banana himself. "She's not a servant. She's there to do a job," a fan tweeted.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Surrendered Maoists, Naxal victims to walk Bastar Republic Day parade
text: For the first time, surrendered Maoist cadres and victims of Naxalism who joined the forces would participate in the Republic Day parade in Chhattisgarh's Bastar. The Bastariya Battalion raised by the CRPF comprising only local tribals would also take part in the parade for the first time. Bastar IG Sunderraj P said Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel would attend the event.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Lawyer representing victims of 1984 anti-Sikh riots gets death threat
text: A Delhi court has informed senior advocate HS Phoolka, who represents victims of 1984 anti-Sikh riots, that the judge received a letter giving death threat to the lawyer. The CBI was asked to file a response in the matter by February 11. The court was hearing a case related to the riots wherein Congress leader Jagdish Tytler is an accused.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: De-radicalisation camps in Kashmir will help people: J&K DGP
text: Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh on Monday backed Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat's suggestion of de-radicalisation centres for radicalised youths in Kashmir valley. "It'll definitely help people, especially those who have gone astray," Singh said. "If any such facility comes up in Kashmir that will be a good sign, it should happen," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Iran's only female Olympic medalist moving to Germany, blames 'propaganda'
text: Iran's only female Olympic medalist Kimia Alizadeh will continue her career in Germany, her coach Mimoun el Boujjoufi said. In an Instagram post, Alizadeh had said that she "didn't want to be part of hypocrisy, lies, injustice and flattery" and "none of us matter for them, we are just tools". Alizadeh had won taekwondo bronze at the Rio 2016 Olympics.
author: Shailesh

headlines: China confirms new coronavirus that has killed 4 can spread from humans to humans
text: The new coronavirus that has killed at least four people and sickened more than 200 in China is capable of spreading from person to person, a Chinese government-appointed expert has said. Earlier Chinese President Xi Jinping said, "People's lives and health should be given top priority and the spread of the outbreak should be resolutely curbed."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I looked up to going to work every day, night outs were fun: Chandrasekaran
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran, who has had a 33-year-long journey with Tata Group, in an interview said, "It has been a career where I really looked up to going to work every day...Night outs were also part of all the fun." "(For) most part of my career, I really feel I have a very, very enjoyable profession," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Amazon VP challenges Facebook exec on user privacy during conference
text: Amazon's Vice President Werner Vogels challenged Facebook's global affairs Vice President Nick Clegg on user privacy record of Facebook. Standing in a conference audience Vogels asked Clegg how could Facebook claim to protect users if many weren't aware of how their data is being used. He further added, "If you don't pay for the product, you are the product."
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Scammers use UC Browser ads to direct users to fake Flipkart sites, dupe them
text: A tech expert on Twitter found that scammers were using advertisements on UC Browser to dupe users with lucrative offers on smartphones and laptops seemingly offered by Flipkart. However, the ads redirect users to fake websites imitating Flipkart's appearance. Kartic Rakhra realised his grandfather's attendant was being cheated when such a website offered only Paytm as a mode of payment.
author: Dharna

headlines: Telangana to try out facial recognition in civic polls
text: The Telangana government will be testing facial recognition for identifying voters on a pilot basis in the upcoming municipal polls on January 22. The pilot will be implemented for 10 polling stations and voters' pictures and IDs will be clicked and uploaded on server. However, data won't be stored or used for any other purpose, the state election commission said.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: BJP gives 2 seats to JD(U), 1 to LJP for Delhi Assembly polls
text: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has announced that it will allot two seats to Nitish Kumar-headed Janata Dal (United) JD(U) and one to Ram Vilas Paswan-headed Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) in Delhi Assembly elections. Reportedly, JD(U) will contest from Sangam Vihar and Burari, while LJP from Seemapuri. Earlier, BJP's alliance with Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) failed due to disagreements over seat-sharing.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: AI startup Samya.ai raises $6 million led by Sequoia India
text: Chicago-based artificial intelligence startup Samya.ai raised $6 million in seed funding led by Sequoia India. The startup's initial investors, including Junglee Co-founder Ashish Gupta, also participated in the round. Founded by Shailendra Singh, Deepinder Dhingra and Pavan Palety, Samya.ai helps FMCG brands boost revenue by improving visibility of demand and supply.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Tesla calls claims of cars accelerating on their own 'completely false'
text: After a petition filed with a US regulator claimed Tesla cars contain a defect that causes sudden unintended acceleration, the Elon Musk-led automaker called the claims "completely false". The petition had cited 127 consumer complaints of cars accelerating on their own which allegedly led to 110 crashes and 52 injuries. Tesla claimed the petition was submitted by a Tesla short-seller.
author: Dharna

headlines: Scientists use magnetised molecules to monitor breast cancer
text: According to new research, a new type of scan that involves magnetising molecules allows doctors to see in real-time which regions of a breast tumour are active. The technique, called 'carbon-13 hyperpolarised imaging', measures how fast the patients' tumours are metabolising a naturally occurring molecule called 'pyruvate' and were able to detect differences in the tumours' size, type and grade.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: NIA probing Davinder Singh's frequent Bangladesh visits: J&K DGP
text: Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh on Monday said that arrested DSP Davinder Singh made frequent visits to Bangladesh to meet his daughters who are studying there. He added that it is being investigated whether the DSP made these visits for other purposes as well. The DGP also said that the case is being investigated "in the right direction."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Nepal calls off search for missing trekkers after new avalanches
text: Rescuers in Nepal called off their search for seven missing trekkers, including 4 South Koreans and 3 Nepalis, after new avalanches in the Annapurna region. The trekkers went missing last week after being struck by an avalanche along a route to Mount Annapurna. Over 200 people, including 140 foreign hikers, evacuated from the area by the police over the weekend.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Norway minister quits over suspected ISIS woman's return from Syria
text: Norway's Finance Minister Siv Jensen and her Progress Party have announced their withdrawal from the ruling coalition over the government's decision to repatriate woman suspected to be part of Islamic State from Syria. The woman was allowed to return so that one of her two children could receive medical treatment. She was arrested by authorities on her arrival in Norway.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Bank of Baroda, Bank of India and Canara Bank get new MD & CEOs
text: The government on Monday appointed heads of  Bank of Baroda, Bank of India and Canara Bank for three years. The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) appointed Sanjiv Chadha as MD &  CEO of Bank of Baroda, Lingam Venkata Prabhakar as MD & CEO of Canara Bank and Atanu Kumar Das as MD & CEO of Bank of India.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: PM has never been a student, his disregard for them isn't surprising: Naseeruddin
text: Actor Naseeruddin Shah, while condemning violence against students, said, "It's not surprising that PM Narendra Modi has no...compassion for students...He himself has admitted that he has never been a student." "The contempt for students is what is hurting me the most," he added. Naseeruddin further said just like Anurag Kashyap, he'd also be interested in looking at PM Modi's degree.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: SAD won't fight Delhi polls over differences with BJP on CAA, NRC
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) on Monday said it will not be contesting Delhi Assembly elections due to disagreements with its ally BJP over seat-sharing, the newly enacted CAA and the proposed NRC. SAD leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa said that despite the party's old relationship with BJP, the former didn't want to change its stance on CAA and NRC.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: CAA needs a revamp, should be made inclusive: Ex-Delhi Lt Governor
text: Former Delhi Lieutenant Governor Najeeb Jung on Monday called for "revamp" of the newly enacted Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). He said that the Act needs to be made more "inclusive" by either including Muslims in it or removing other minorities. "How long will this protest go on? Economy is suffering, shops are closed...losses are being incurred," said Jung.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Mangaluru Police ask 2,000 Kerala locals to prove innocence in CAA row
text: Mangaluru Police have issued notices to 2,000 people from Kerala living near Karnataka border, asking them to prove they were not part of the violent anti-Citizenship Act protests in the city on December 19. Police said they identified them by obtaining their phone numbers from mobile towers at protest sites. "We have given them time to prove innocence," police said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: World record for most runs in an over in a Test equalled again
text: World record for most runs in an over in a Test was equalled again during third South Africa-England Test. As many as 28 runs were scored in England captain Joe Root's over. Ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara had scored 28 off South Africa's Robin Peterson's over in 2003, while Australia's George Bailey slammed England's Jimmy Anderson for 28 in 2013.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Latest rankings for ODI bowlers out; Bumrah on top, Cummins, Starc drop spots
text: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah, who returned to professional cricket after a long gap due to injury, remains on the top spot in the latest ODI rankings for bowlers. Further, Australian fast bowlers Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc dropped one spot and three spots to be ranked fifth and tenth, respectively. Bumrah is the only Indian in top 10.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sunil Chhetri, wife Sonam host Kohli, Anushka for dinner; Sonam shares post
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri and his wife Sonam Bhattacharya hosted Team India captain Virat Kohli and his wife, actress Anushka Sharma for dinner at their house in Bengaluru on Sunday. Sonam took to Instagram to share a picture from the night, writing, "Just four such different people speaking about everything under the sun."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rohit ne maar maar ke bharta nikal diya: Akhtar on Rohit's ton against Australia
text: Praising India opener Rohit Sharma for scoring 119(128) against Australia in the third ODI, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "You saw his ruthlessness today. Usne maar maar ke bharta nikal diya." "When Rohit is on song then he doesn’t care whether the ball is good or bad because he has so much of time," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: You wanted to ask a spicy question: Kohli to journo on question about keeper's slot
text: After a journalist asked him if the wicketkeeper's slot has opened up between Rishabh Pant, KL Rahul, MS Dhoni and Sanju Samson in T20s, Virat Kohli said, "You wanted to ask a spicy question, I could see." "Rahul really brings a good balance to the team, if he can keep that well and bat well at that position," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: JP Nadda an old friend, we used to travel together on scooter: PM Modi
text: During a felicitation ceremony for JP Nadda, who took over as President of BJP on Monday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "JP Nadda is an old friend." He added, "When I handled the party organisation, he was looking after the Yuva Morcha. We travelled together on scooter." He also asked the party workers to give all the support to Nadda.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Don't have info about tukde-tukde gang: Home ministry in reply to RTI query
text: Activist Saket Gokhale has revealed the Home ministry, in a reply to his RTI query, said it has no information about 'tukde-tukde gang' in India. Gokhale added that it proved that the gang was just a figment of Home Minister Amit Shah's imagination. He further said that he'd urge Election Commission to take cognisance of Shah's use of the term.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Modified Lamborghini worth $2.5 mn catches fire, burns beyond recognition
text: A limited-edition modified Lamborghini Aventador of a Czech man caught fire and burnt beyond recognition in Prague last week. Estimated to be worth $2.5 million, it was reportedly modified by modification firm Mansory to increase max power from 515 kW to 950 kW. "Addition of two turbos on the engine's top brings with it a lot of heat," reports said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 5 members of fringe Tamil outfit held for burning Rajinikanth's effigy
text: Five members of a fringe Tamil outfit, Athi Tamizhar Peravai, were arrested in Madurai on Monday for burning Rajinikanth's effigy, accusing the actor of spreading "false" information to defame EV Ramasamy 'Periyar'. Rajinikanth recently said that nude images of Lord Rama and Sita garlanded with sandals were taken out in a rally led by Periyar in 1971 in Salem.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bomb recovered from bag at Mangalore Airport defused in open field, video surfaces
text: ANI has shared a video which shows the improvised explosive device (IED) recovered from a bag at Mangalore Airport being defused in an open field. The bag carrying the bomb was found near a ticket counter at the departure terminal after which CISF and police personnel cordoned off the area. The passenger services at the airport were, however, unaffected.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Difficult to predict war scenario with Pak but we're ready: CDS Rawat
text: Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat has said it was "very difficult" to predict if a scenario of a war with Pakistan would emerge but all the defence services were prepared for any task. General Rawat said his new role was aimed at integrating defence systems and the three services (the Army, the Navy and the Indian Air Force).
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 82% students registered for winter sem: JNU V-C amid boycott by JNUSU
text: JNU Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar on Monday said that out of 8,500 students, 82% have cleared their hostel dues for winter semester registration. The remaining students are also expected to complete the registration process since it is still open with a late fee, he said. This comes amid registration boycott by the JNU students' union over hostel fee hike.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Woman held with 2 bullets at Delhi's Jama Masjid metro station
text: The CISF at Delhi's Jama Masjid metro station apprehended a 46-year-old woman and handed her to the police for carrying two live bullets on Monday. DCP (Metro) Vikram Porwal said the cartridges belonged to a relative of the woman. The relative visited her house recently and forgot the cartridges there and the woman kept them in her bag, Porwal added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 2 teachers among 5 booked for raping class 6 student in Maharashtra
text: Five people including two teachers were booked for gang-raping a class 6 student in Nanded district of Marathwada in Maharashtra. According to police, the minor girl was lured into a room on the pretext of showing video of cultural program in school and was instead shown pornographic clips and raped. She was found abandoned near the school by her parents.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Malaysia sends back plastic waste to 13 nations, says 'won't be world's waste bin'
text: Malaysia sent back 150 containers of plastic waste to 13 countries since the third quarter last year. "We want to give a message that Malaysia isn't the world's dumping ground," Malaysia's Environment Minister Yeo Bee Yin said today. Of 150 containers, 43 containers were returned to France, 42 to the UK, 17 to the US and rest to other countries.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I-T raids at premises of Jyotsna Suri, MD of group that owns LaLit Hotel chain
text: The Income Tax Department conducted raids at the premises of Jyotsna Suri, the Managing Director of Bharat Hotels, in a tax evasion case on Monday. The group owns The LaLit luxury hotel chain. An Income Tax official said that eight premises were searched, including that of Suri and her associate Jayant Nanda, reported news agency ANI.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Treat all minorities equally: Ex-Prez of Afghanistan Karzai
text: Commenting on CAA, former President of Afghanistan Hamid Karzai urged India to treat all of its minorities equally. He added, "We don't have persecuted minorities in Afghanistan...the whole country is persecuted. We have been in war and conflict for a long time. All religions in Afghanistan...have suffered."
author: Shailesh

headlines: FBI shuts down website selling user data obtained from data breaches
text: FBI seized and shut down a website called WeLeakInfo, which sold user data from over 10,000 data breaches, following an international operation. WeLeakInfo claimed to have over 12 billion indexed records including usernames and passwords obtained from its breaches. It sold subscriptions so that anyone could access the results of the breaches through unlimited searches during subscription period.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: No question that artificial intelligence needs to be regulated: Pichai
text: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai in an editorial in The Financial Times said, "There's no question in my mind that artificial intelligence needs to be regulated." He added that companies can not just build the technology and "let market forces decide how it will be used". He also called for a cautious approach regarding controls placed on artificial intelligence.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Tiger 'Zalim' who reared 2 orphaned cubs found dead in Ranthambore
text: A 15-year-old male tiger T-25 popularly known as Zalim, who got famous for rearing two orphaned cubs, died in a suspected territorial fight in Ranthambore Tiger Reserve in Sawai Madhopur, Rajasthan. It is thought that Zalim, also known as Dollar, got in a fight with a 10-year-old male tiger. His body was found with crushed head bones and canine marks.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Iran to quit global nuclear treaty if its case goes to UN
text: Iran will quit the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons (NPT) if Britain, France and Germany refer it to UN Security Council over 2015 nuclear deal, Iranian foreign minister said. The countries triggered dispute mechanism in the deal after Iran stepped further away from compliance. Failure to resolve the dispute will lead to reimposition of UN sanctions on Iran.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 5 ex-cops sentenced to death in B'desh for killing 24 in 1988
text: A court in Bangladesh sentenced five former police officials to death for killing 24 people in 1988 during an anti-government rally of then opposition leader and current PM Sheikh Hasina. The convicts had opened fire on the motorcade of Hasina at the rally in Chittagong city. Reportedly, members of Hasina's party Awami League saw this as an assassination attempt.
author: Shailesh

headlines: China to ban the use of most single-use plastics by 2025
text: China announced that the country aims to ban the use of most single-use plastics by 2025. Plastic bags will be banned in all major cities by the end of 2020 while the ban will come into effect in all cities and towns by 2022. Restaurant industry will be banned from using single-use straws by the end of 2020.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Why did Maxwell kiss the black armband after taking a wicket in BBL match?
text: Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was spotted kissing his black armband and pointing towards the sky after picking a wicket for Melbourne Stars against Adelaide Strikers. Maxwell did so in a tribute to his close friend, who passed away earlier this week. Maxwell also handed the captaincy to Peter Handscomb for the match.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: OnePlus 7 Pro price cut by ₹10,000 during Amazon Great Indian Sale
text: OnePlus 7 Pro is now available at a discounted price of ₹42,999, down from its original price ₹52,999 during the Amazon Great Indian Sale from January 19-22. Amazon is also offering an extra ₹2,000 discount on exchange and 12 months No Cost EMI on the smartphone. Moreover, SBI credit card users are eligible for an additional 10% additional discount.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: IMF cuts global growth forecast for 2020-21 over slowdown in India, other markets
text: In its half-yearly update, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Monday said the global economy will grow by an estimated 3.3% in 2020, down from a previous forecast of 3.4%, and will be 0.2% lower in 2021 to 3.4%. "The downward revision primarily reflects negative surprises to economic activity in a few emerging market economies, notably India," the IMF said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Men make 'Earth sandwich' by placing bread on exactly opposite points of planet
text: Two men in New Zealand and Spain have created an "Earth sandwich" by placing slices of bread on precise points, on either side of the planet. The men used longitude and latitude to make sure they were precisely opposite. They found the points by using online longitude and latitude tool called "tunnel to the other side of the Earth".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I feel the direction we're headed now, we won't be secular: Saif Ali Khan
text: Saif Ali Khan has said he thinks the direction India is headed now, it won't remain secular. "I feel the minute Pakistan was created out of this concept of India, this was bound to happen," he added. Saif further said he has never been happier in India, while adding, 'But...the India that embraced secularism...I think we're moving away from that."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Dwayne reveals cause of his father's death; says he died 'quick'
text: Dwayne Johnson has revealed the cause of his father, WWE legend Rocky Johnson's death in an Instagram video. "He had...been battling...cold and infection and on Tuesday he had...a deep vein thrombosis, which is essentially a blood clot in the leg," said Dwayne. "It...travelled up his body, and...clotted his lung and he died...quickly from a massive heart attack," the actor added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 17-yr-old bowls 175 kmph delivery against India in U-19 WC, shows speedometer
text: Sri Lanka's 17-year-old pacer Matheesha Pathirana bowled a 175-kmph delivery against India in 2020 Under-19 World Cup, speedometer showed. Bowling to opener Yashasvi Jaiswal in the fourth over, Matheesha bowled a wide bouncer on leg-side after which the broadcasters showed speed as "175 kmph (108 mph)". Shoaib Akhtar holds the record for fastest delivery in recorded history, clocking 161.3 kmph.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: He is like a bunny running around: Virat Kohli on Marnus Labuschagne
text: Talking about Australia's Marnus Labuschagne, who recently made his ODI debut against India, Virat Kohli said, "I think he's got the right mindset to be a consistent player...to be a top player in the world for a while." "He's always and always energetic. I really don't know where he gets it from. He's like a bunny running around," Kohli added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who is 59-year-old JP Nadda, BJP's 11th National President?
text: Jagat Prakash Nadda on Monday became BJP's 11th National President. The 59-year-old former Health Minister has a graduate degree from Patna and LL.B from Himachal Pradesh University. He became BJP General Secretary in 2010 and Rajya Sabha member in 2012. He was BJP in-charge of UP in 2019 general elections. He is married to Mallika Nadda and has two sons.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Was advised not to attend Chandrayaan-2 landing, still went: PM Modi
text: During the 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' event, PM Narendra Modi said that some people advised him against going to Chandrayaan-2 landing event as there was no guarantee of success. "People said 'There is no surety', 'What if it fails?' I said that is precisely why I should go there. Even I was disturbed by the failure of Chandrayaan-2," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Gujarat's 17-yr-old girl with 6-ft 2.8-inch hair breaks own world record
text: Gujarat-based 17-year-old Nilanshi Patel has broken her own record with the Guinness World Records for the 'Longest Hair on a Teenager' with her hair now measuring at 190 cm (6 ft 2.8 in). Patel had previously set a record in 2018 with 170.5-cm-long hair. She said she has been growing her hair since she was six after a "bad haircut".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Railways cancelled 66 lakh tickets in 8 months due to non-confirmation
text: Nearly 65.69 lakh railway tickets booked online got automatically cancelled as they failed to get confirmed between April and November 2019, a reply to a Right to Information (RTI) query has revealed. Neemuch-based RTI activist Chandrashekhar Gaud said that after the waitlisted tickets fail to get confirmed, they automatically get cancelled during the chart preparation of the trains.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Can't do terror politics just because we've numbers: BJP leader on CAA
text: West Bengal BJP's vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's grandnephew Chandra Kumar Bose on Sunday said just because the party had numbers, it "can't do terror politics" over CAA. "Let us go to people explaining the benefits of CAA," he added. This came a day after state BJP President Dilip Ghosh said "intellectuals" opposing CAA were "devils and parasites".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: One room in our homes should be technology-free: PM Modi to students
text: While interacting with students during the third edition of 'Pariksha Pe Charcha', PM Narendra Modi said, "We shouldn't be slaves of technology but we should know how to use it well." "We should've the strength to keep technology under our control. One room in our homes should be technology-free. Whoever enters will not carry any gadgets," PM Modi added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: SC refuses stay on Electoral Bond scheme before Delhi Assembly polls
text: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to consider a plea seeking an immediate stay on Electoral Bond scheme. A bench headed by CJI SA Bobde asked the Election Commission to file a response within two weeks. Advocate Prashant Bhushan, representing an NGO, had sought an immediate stay on the scheme in the backdrop of Delhi Assembly elections on February 8.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bag with bomb components found at Mangalore Airport, police release suspect's pic
text: A bag was found abandoned outside the terminal building at the Mangalore International Airport on Monday with components of low intensitive improvised explosive device (IED). An alert was sounded at the airport. Mangaluru Police released photos captured by the CCTV, which showed the suspect and the autorickshaw he was seen leaving in.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 100 houses razed in B'luru, police claim tenants 'illegal Bangladeshis'
text: Bengaluru municipal corporation and police demolished around 100 makeshift houses in Bellandur on Sunday. The police claimed the tenants were "illegal Bangladeshi migrants" and that the landowner was sent an eviction notice. The landowner said that the residents are from North Karnataka, North India, and North East India and they have documents but they were evicted due to police notice.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Marks are not life anymore, world has changed a lot: PM Modi to students
text: While speaking to students during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha', PM Narendra Modi told students that marks and examinations aren't life anymore. "Today...the world has changed a lot. The opportunities have developed immensely. I'll urge parents not to tell children that exams are everything," PM Modi added. He further said that parents should let their child pursue whatever he or she likes.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What is new Novel Coronavirus outbreak that killed 3, infected 200 people in China?
text: A new Novel Coronavirus outbreak in China, first reported in Wuhan, has killed three and infected over 200 people so far. The family of viruses can cause diseases like common cold, Middle East Respiratory Syndrome and even Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome. The source and transmission routes of the novel coronavirus are still unknown, the National Health Commission said on Sunday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Apple tests switch to 'completely' turn off location tracking on iPhone 11
text: Apple is testing a feature that would allow iPhone 11 users to 'completely' turn off location tracking. Earlier, a researcher found that iPhone 11 Pro checks for location even with Location Services disabled. Apple explained it's because the newer phones, including iPhone 11, use an ultra-wideband chip that needs to be switched off in those locations where it isn't approved.
author: Dharna

headlines: Former Flipkart CTO Garikipati launches micro-credit startup
text: Flipkart's former CTO Ravi Garikipati has launched a financial services and micro-credit startup Davinta, along with Covansys Co-founder Raj Vattikuti. The duo, in personal capacity, seeded the venture with ₹140 crore and it already holds an NBFC licence with disbursed loans of ₹50 crore. Davinta provides short-term credit of up to 12 months to MSMEs and underserved families, among others.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Picture perfect mission: Musk on SpaceX rocket failure test
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk while interacting with the media called the test of emergency escape system on Crew Dragon a "picture perfect mission". "It went as well as one can possibly expect," he added. During the test, Falcon 9 rocket's engines were cut off to mimic a launch failure and Crew Dragon was able to successfully detach itself from it.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: FM Sitharaman attends 'Halwa Ceremony' ahead of Union Budget
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday attended the customary 'Halwa Ceremony' held at the Ministry of Finance, North Block, Delhi, ahead of printing of documents relating to Union Budget 2020-21. Minister of State for Finance and Corporate Affairs Anurag Thakur was also present there. The sweet confection halwa was prepared in a big vessel for distribution to the Ministry staff.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: It brings me great sadness: Prince Harry on end of royal role
text: United Kingdom's Prince Harry expressed sadness over the outcome of him and his wife's, Meghan Markle, decision to step down as "senior" royals. "It brings me great sadness that it has come to this," he said after Queen Elizabeth II announced that the couple will no longer use their "Royal Highness" titles and will no longer formally represent The Queen.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Golf-ball sized hailstones fall in Australia, damage cars & trees
text: Hailstorms lashed Australia's south-east region, with hailstones as big as golf balls killing and injuring several birds besides damaging cars, trees and buildings. The region recently experienced heavy rainfall and flooding after this season's bushfires destroyed large areas. Reportedly, 80 bushfires continued to burn in the states of Victoria and New South Wales (NSW) despite the recent rains.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Competition Commission allows Reliance Jio to sell tower assets
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI), which regulates fair trade, has approved the divestment of Reliance Jio's telecom tower assets to Canada's Brookfield Infrastructure Partners and other investors. The other investors include British Columbia Investment Management Corporation and two subsidiaries of GIC Infra Holdings. Brookfield will invest ₹25,215 crore towards the deal.
author: Dharna

headlines: Govt to take management control of Unitech: Supreme Court
text: Supreme Court on Monday accepted Centre's proposal to take over the management control of embattled realty firm Unitech Limited. It gave two months to the new board of Unitech to prepare the resolution framework of the company. The Centre told the apex court that it's ready to take over the management control of Unitech and complete its stalled projects.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Volvo installs air purifying devices in school buses with #BreatheFree
text: As a part of its #BreatheFree initiative, Volvo cars collaborated with Persapien to create and install a device in school buses which would reduce the PM 2.5, turning it into moving air purifiers. Aiming to help create a sustainable future, Volvo mobilised school buses as a symbol of children being the agents of change and future leaders.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: SC rejects Nirbhaya convict's plea claiming he was juvenile at time of offence
text: The Supreme Court has rejected a petition filed by Nirbhaya gangrape case convict Pawan Kumar claiming he was a juvenile at the time of the offence in 2012. Kumar had moved the SC after the Delhi HC dismissed his claim. He had also sought a direction restraining authorities from executing the death penalty, which has been scheduled for February 1.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Saif Ali Khan trolled for saying 'no concept of India till British gave it one'
text: Saif Ali Khan was trolled after he said in an interview, "I don't think there was a concept of India till...the British gave it one." "Yeah right. French East India Company was about China & [Vasco da Gama] went to Fiji," tweeted author Tarek Fatah. "When your student gives...duffer answer but teacher gives full marks," wrote filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I did tacky films to afford best surgeon for my sister: Kangana
text: Speaking about the acid attack on her sister Rangoli, Kangana Ranaut said, "I was just 19...when the attack happened and it was a long, hard struggle to deal with." "Financially too, I wasn't strong...I did tacky films, took on roles I didn't deserve, accepted guest appearances, so my sister could be treated by the best surgeon in India," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Every week I'm told when & where Varun is getting married: David on wedding rumours
text: Filmmaker David Dhawan, on being asked about rumours about his son Varun Dhawan marrying girlfriend Natasha Dalal in Goa in May, said, "How many dates and venues will I hear?" "Every week I'm told where and when Varun is getting married...This latest date and venue aren't true," he added. David further said there's no family pressure on Varun for marriage.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Some say I'm taking role of Home Minister explaining CAA: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday said that some people are saying she is taking the role of Home Minister going around the country and explaining the citizenship law. She said she was criticised for not participating in a pre-Budget meeting led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on reviving the economy. However, she added she was focused on her work.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Latest ODI rankings out; Kohli remains on top, Rohit 18 rating points behind
text: The latest ODI rankings for batsmen were released by ICC on Monday. India captain Virat Kohli, who was named Man of the Series against Australia for scoring 183 runs, remains on top with 886 points. Second-placed Rohit Sharma is 18 rating points behind Kohli. Further, Australia captain Aaron Finch entered into top 10 and is ranked 10th with 769 points.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Fan says Aakash Chopra is Virat Kohli's 'chamcha', commentator responds
text: A fan took to Twitter to complain to cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra about not tweeting about Manish Pandey's catch and called him Virat Kohli's 'chamcha'. In response, Aakash Chopra wrote, "Sorry. I pledge to tweet on every great catch taken in 2020...Get a life, dude. I was on commentary when Pandey ji took that catch and called it. And praised it."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who is 51-year-old Roh Tae-moon, Samsung's new mobile chief?
text: South Korean electronics maker Samsung has appointed its youngest President, 51-year-old Roh Tae-moon, as its new mobile chief. Roh championed Samsung's shift to outsourcing more handset production to cut costs and better compete with lower-priced Chinese smartphone makers like Huawei, Reuters reported. As former mobile development head, Roh led the development of Samsung's Galaxy mobile devices.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 'What is internet' was the first question every investor asked me: Jeff Bezos
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos during his recent India visit said, "When I went to meet investors, the first question I had to answer was what is the internet." He added, "None of my investors had ever heard of the internet." "I started studying computer science and fell in love with it...that's how I ended up doing Amazon," he further said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: How can I leave people & go: Kejriwal postpones nomination as roadshow causes delay
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal could not file his nomination from the New Delhi Assembly seat today after his mega roadshow caused delay. "I was supposed to file my nomination at 3 pm today but the office closes at 3 pm...How can I leave them (people at road show) and go? I'll go to file nomination tomorrow." he said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Eduwhere launches single access pass for all exam preparations
text: Eduwhere has launched a single access pass for all its exams. 'Eduwhere Edge Pass' will enable aspirants preparing for multiple exams to attempt all mock tests on Eduwhere. The platform believes it will inspire students to take mock tests prepared by expert faculty in an affordable way. All attempts will get calibrated against attempts of other aspirants on various parameters.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Can't create jobs by breaking law: Goyal on Amazon creating 1 mn jobs in India
text: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has said one cannot create jobs by breaking the law after Amazon announced it will create 1 million jobs in India by 2025. "I still look at the jobs from the perspective of jobs lost," Goyal told The Economic Times. "I cannot create jobs by breaking law, breaking anti-competitive restriction, monopolising certain markets," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 19 including man who ran Muzaffarpur shelter where girls were raped convicted
text: A Delhi court on Monday convicted 19 accused including NGO owner Brajesh Thakur in connection with sexual assault of girls at a shelter home in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. The court held that Thakur, the man who ran the shelter, was guilty of rape, gangrape and aggravated penetrative sexual assault. Over 30 minor girls were reported having suffered sexual abuse.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 3 Hizbul terrorists including police deserter killed in J&K encounter
text: Three terrorists belonging to Hizbul Mujahideen were gunned down in an encounter with security forces in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir on Monday. One of those killed was a former special police officer who had deserted the force in 2018. The neutralised terrorists were identified as Wasim Ahmed Wani, Adil Sheikh and Jahangir, said J&K DGP Dilbag Singh.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet clears 3-capital proposal amid protests
text: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet on Monday cleared the proposal for decentralisation of state capital's administration. The YSRCP government is going ahead with its plans to develop Amaravati, Visakhapatnam and Kurnool as the legislative, executive and judicial capitals of Andhra Pradesh. The Bills related to the move were also tabled in the Assembly amid protests by opposition party leaders and farmers.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 34-year-old Tasneem elected as 1st Muslim woman Mayor of Mysuru
text: Tasneem, the 34-year-old JD(S) corporator, was elected as the first Muslim woman Mayor of Mysuru. She defeated BJP candidate Geetha Yogananda by a margin of 24 votes. "Mysuru is known for cleanliness. Thus, my first priority is to maintain cleanliness and I will work towards retaining the 'Clean City' tag," Tasneem said after being elected the 22nd Mayor of Mysuru.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: PM should let students be alone, it's boards' time: Sibal on 'Pariksha Pe Charcha'
text: Taking a dig at PM Narendra Modi's 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' event, Congress' Kapil Sibal said, "I suggest PM should let students be alone as this is time for boards preparation. He shouldn't waste their time." "Discussion should be held on 'openness' in degrees after it's obtained...it should be known to everyone. That's 'Mann Ki Baat' he should do," Sibal added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Russian hotel in residential building's basement flooded with boiling water, 5 killed
text: Five people died in the Russian city of Perm on Monday after a hot water pipe exploded in the night and flooded a hotel with boiling water, officials said. Three other people were taken to hospital suffering from burns after the incident in the Mini Hotel Caramel, which is located in the basement of a residential building, officials added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Africa's richest woman exploited country's wealth: Leaked documents
text: Africa's richest woman, 46-year-old Isabel dos Santos, exploited country's wealth and her father's position as Angola President to amass $2 billion fortune, ICIJ investigation citing leaked documents claimed. She was made state oil firm Sonangol's head in 2016 by her father. Sonangol's bank account reduced from $57 million to just $309 within a day in November 2017, the investigation claimed.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Pics of 'starving' lions at Sudan zoo surface online, people ask PM to help
text: People have asked Sudanese Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok to help after pictures showing "starving" lions at a zoo in the country surfaced online. "Mr Prime Minister...I am sorry for bothering you but I did not know to whom I address my appeal and scream out loud to save the lions...Please help," a Twitter user wrote.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Not a single paisa paid: Justice Nariman on Vijay Mallya's loan default case
text: Justice Rohinton Nariman remarked, "Not a single paisa has come," in the Supreme Court on Monday in relation to money fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya's defunct airlines Kingfisher owes to banks. He remarked this as a bench led by CJI SA Bobde took up Mallya's petition to stop proceedings to confiscate his assets. Justice Nariman recused from the case soon after.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: New York-based startup's app lets strangers see people's public pics: NYT
text: New York-based Clearview's facial recognition app lets strangers upload a person's pictures and see public photos of that person along with links to where those photos appeared, New York Times reported. The system uses database of over three billion images collected from Facebook, YouTube and other websites. US law enforcement agencies admitted they used the app to solve cases.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Govt may demand GST number of service professionals for user safety: Report
text: Government is reportedly working to make it compulsory for service professionals engaged with online marketplaces such as UrbanClap and HouseJoy to have a valid GST number to ensure user safety. "These professionals go into people's houses and there's...no way...to identify them," an official told The Economic Times. He added the move would help trace the professionals in any untoward event.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: First-ever video of individual atoms bonding filmed by scientists
text: For the first time, scientists have filmed the bond formation between two individual atoms in real-time. Such chemical bonds occur on a small scale, about half a million times smaller than a human hair's width. Scientists trapped a pair of rhenium (Re) atoms in a nanotube and filmed the two atoms bonding to form Re2 and later breaking the bond.
author: Dharna

headlines: 436-million-year-old scorpion becomes oldest known scorpion species
text: Scientists have discovered that two fossilised scorpions, discovered in 1985 but studied recently, lived about 436.5-437.5 million years ago, making it the oldest-known scorpion species. The aquatic 'Parioscorpio venator' could also live on land and is now one of the earliest air breathers known to science. Scorpions were among the first animals to fully transition to terrestrial mode of life.
author: Dharna

headlines: 139 cases of new coronavirus reported over the weekend in China
text: Chinese authorities claimed 139 cases of new coronavirus were reported over the weekend in the country, including two in capital Beijing and one in Shenzhen. Wuhan city authorities said that 136 cases were reported, adding to 62 already known cases. South Korea reported its first case of the new virus, making it the fourth case to be reported outside China.
author: Shailesh

headlines: JP Nadda replaces Amit Shah as BJP National President
text: JP Nadda was on Monday appointed as BJP National President. Nadda, who replaces Amit Shah, was appointed as the Working President of the BJP in June 2019. Last year, Amit Shah had written to PM Narendra Modi requesting that the role be given to someone else as he had responsibilities of being the Home Minister to fulfil.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: SC notice to UP Govt over changing the name of Allahabad to Prayagraj
text: Supreme Court has issued notice to the Uttar Pradesh Government after a plea filed in the court challenged the validity of changing the name of Allahabad to Prayagraj. The state government had officially changed the name of the Allahabad district to Prayagraj in 2018, saying that the name change was a longstanding demand of the people.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Had I not been successful, I might've lost out on my family: Kangana
text: Recalling how she left home at the age of 15 to be an independent woman, Kangana Ranaut said, "Today, fortunately, I've got my family back." "But I know...somewhere success had a huge role to play in the reconciliation," she added. "Had I not made it in films, I might've lost out on both my family and my dream," said Kangana.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Shabana Azmi is sedated but talking normally and recognising people: Boney
text: Producer Boney Kapoor, who visited Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital to check on actress Shabana Azmi after her accident, said, "She's sedated as there is some pain but everything is fine." "Shabana Ji is coherent, talking normally, recognising people," he added. "For now, she is under observation and the doctors are making sure there is no internal injury," Boney further said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Brad jokes about playing character who 'doesn't get along with wife', Jennifer claps
text: Actor Brad Pitt, during his acceptance speech at Screen Actors Guild Awards 2020, joked about his character in 'Once Upon A Time...In Hollywood'. "It was a difficult part. A guy who gets high, takes his shirt off and doesn't get on with his wife," he joked. While the audience laughed, his ex-wife, actress Jennifer Aniston was seen smiling and clapping.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Missing your laughter: SRK to world's richest man Jeff Bezos on their video
text: After Amazon founder and world's richest man Jeff Bezos shared a video of his interaction with Shah Rukh Khan, the latter replied, "Missing your uninhibited laughter and candid conversation." "Lots of fun on stage," Bezos captioned the video. It shows him calling Shah Rukh "humble", to which the actor responded, "That's only because my last few films didn't work well."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Kumble had bowled despite injury, this is the power of motivation: PM Modi
text: Speaking at the 'Pariksha Pe Charcha 2020' event, PM Narendra Modi on Monday cited the example of former cricketer Anil Kumble who was injured during a match but still played with motivation. "Do you remember the India-Australia Test series in 2001? Our cricket team was facing setbacks. But... Rahul Dravid and VVS Laxman turned the match around," PM further said.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Kohli records most international runs by an Indian captain, breaks Dhoni's record
text: Virat Kohli has set the record for scoring most international runs by an Indian captain, achieving the feat during his 89-run knock against Australia in the third ODI. The 31-year-old, who has scored 11,208 international runs as captain, overtook the previous record held by MS Dhoni (11,207 runs). Kohli has played 199 innings as captain, while Dhoni had played 330.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 11 held in Delhi for placing bets on India vs Australia Bengaluru ODI
text: The Delhi Police Crime Branch arrested 11 people and recovered 70 mobile phones and seven laptops for placing bets on the final ODI between India and Australia played in Bengaluru. Police said that bets worth ₹2 crore had already been placed for the match held on Sunday. India defeated Australia by seven wickets in the match.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: TikTok can grow bigger than Instagram: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel
text: Evan Spiegel, the CEO of Snapchat's parent company Snap, has said he "loves" the video-sharing app TikTok, adding it may possibly grow to be bigger than its rival Facebook-owned Instagram. Notably, China's ByteDance, that owns TikTok, emerged as the world's most valuable startup. In terms of monthly active users in 2019, analytics firm App Annie ranked TikTok close behind Instagram.
author: Dharna

headlines: Samsung appoints its youngest President Roh Tae-moon as mobile chief
text: South Korean electronics maker Samsung on Monday appointed its youngest-ever President Roh Tae-moon, aged 51, as its new mobile chief. The reshuffle comes amid a series of court cases involving some of its top executives including leader Lee Jae-yong. Former mobile chief DJ Koh will continue to lead Samsung's IT & mobile communications division.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos drives e-rickshaw; shares his video
text: Amazon Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos on Monday posted a video on social media that showed him driving an e-rickshaw with Amazon's delivery partners. The video showed Bezos driving an e-rickshaw that carried his own first name. Through the video, Bezos revealed that Amazon is rolling out its new fleet of fully electric delivery rickshaws.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: OYO firing 1,800-2,400 of its 12,000 employees: CEO for India & South Asia
text: OYO is firing about 15-20% of its 12,000 employees, impacting roughly 1,800-2,400 people, the hospitality startup's CEO for India and South Asia, Rohit Kapoor confirmed to the Economic Times. Earlier, reports said OYO would fire nearly 2,000 employees and may conduct another round of layoffs. However, Kapoor said that this was a "complex one-time exercise" that would end "very soon".
author: Dharna

headlines: Wealth of 63 Indian billionaires higher than total 2018-19 Union Budget: Oxfam
text: The combined total wealth of 63 Indian billionaires is higher than the total Union Budget of the country for the fiscal year 2018-19 which was at ₹24,42,200 crore, an Oxfam report stated. The report said India's top 1% of population holds over four times the amount of wealth held by 953 million people or the bottom 70% of the population.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Woman allegedly gang-raped by jailed husband's 4 friends in UP
text: A woman was allegedly gang-raped in Uttar Pradesh by four friends of her husband who has been jailed. In her complaint, the victim said that the four men, who are her neighbours, came to her house when she was alone and raped her at gunpoint. She further said that they tried to slit her throat but she managed to escape.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Congress leader Surjewala's father and 5-time MLA Shamsher Singh dies aged 87
text: Veteran Congress leader Shamsher Singh Surjewala, father of party leader Randeep Surjewala, has passed away at the age of 87 following a prolonged illness. Shamsher Surjewala, a five-time MLA and one-time Rajya Sabha MP, had been admitted to Delhi's AIIMS. His funeral will take place on Monday afternoon in Haryana's Narwana.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Fire breaks out at Delhi Transport Department Office, 8 fire engines reach spot
text: A fire broke out in an office of the Delhi Transport Department near the Civil Lines Metro Station on Monday, an official said. According to Delhi Fire Services, a call about the fire was received at 8:38 am, following which eight fire tenders rushed to the spot. The cause of the fire is not known yet, the official added.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Let's talk #WithoutFilter & if I make a mistake media will love it: PM to students
text: While addressing students during 'Pariksha Pe Charcha" event in Delhi, PM Narendra Modi said, "Let's talk #WithoutFilter. We'll talk like friends, mistakes can happen. And...if I make a mistake the media will love it." PM Modi added that interacting with children through the annual event "touched his heart the most". This is the third edition of 'Pariksha Pe Charcha'.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 55-yr-old teacher dies during Bihar govt's ‘Human Chain’ awareness event
text: A 55-year-old government teacher, Mohd Daud, passed away reportedly due to cardiac arrest in Darbhanga while taking part in ‘Human Chain’ awareness event organised by the Bihar government on Sunday. Daud was rushed to a hospital after he collapsed but was declared brought dead. Over five crore people participated in the 18,034-km long human chain, Chief Secretary said.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: 24-yr-old allegedly gang-raped by 3 men, boyfriend beaten up at park in TN
text: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped and her boyfriend was beaten up by three men at knifepoint at a public park adjoining the Vellore Fort in Tamil Nadu on Saturday. The incident came to light when the woman approached the police and lodged a complaint. This comes a day after police conducted a campaign to protect women and girls.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Dust storm 'similar to those in Middle East' hits Australia, videos surface online
text: Videos showing a massive dust storm hitting Australia's New South Wales have surfaced online. The dust cloud first hit the town of Narromine, before descending on Dubbo and then arriving in Parkes. Many towns were left without power "for hours". The Bureau of Meteorology said the dust storm was similar to those experienced in the Middle East.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Govt to decriminalise Income Tax Act, anti-money laundering law: FM
text: The government is working to decriminalise the Income Tax Act and the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), said Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. She added the government will also remove criminal provisions, relating to penalty and jail terms, in the Companies Act, to improve the ease of doing business. The steps are aimed at helping India achieve a $5-trillion economy.
author: Dharna

headlines: We're too small to retaliate: Malaysia PM on India's curbs on palm oil
text: Malaysia is too small of a nation to respond to India's boycott of Malaysian palm oil with retaliatory trade action, said its Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad. "We have to find ways...to overcome that," he added. India, the world's largest edible oil buyer, had restricted the imports of Malaysian refined palm oil after Mahathir criticised India's actions in Kashmir and CAA.
author: Dharna

headlines: Kishore Biyani-led Future Group fires 350-400 employees: Report
text: Kishore Biyani-led Future Group has fired 350-400 employees across various roles as it scales down its e-commerce venture 'Retail 3.0', some former employees told Livemint. A company spokesperson confirmed the layoffs without providing specifics. Last year, the group had reportedly shut down 140 Easyday physical grocery stores as part of the same restructuring exercise in order to cut costs.
author: Dharna

headlines: Facebook must disclose app records for Massachusetts probe: Judge
text: A Massachusetts Superior Court Judge directed Facebook to hand over material to the state's Attorney General Maura Healey regarding all the apps that it suspected might have misused customer data. Healey, the judge said, had demonstrated a "substantial need" for the material for her investigation in Facebook's privacy practices. Her investigation revolves around Cambridge Analytica data scandal.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Samsung invests ₹3,550 crore to build smartphone display plant in India
text: Samsung is investing around ₹3,550 crore ($500 million) to set up a manufacturing plant in India to produce smartphone displays. The facility would be built in Noida, where the South Korean company already has a smartphone factory. This follows reports that India was considering incentives for handset makers to attract Apple and Samsung's suppliers to open factories in the country.
author: Dharna

headlines: 23-year-old arrested in UP for passing sensitive info to ISI agents
text: A 23-year-old man was arrested in Varanasi, UP on Sunday for allegedly passing sensitive information to agents of Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI). The man named Rashid Ahmad was arrested in a joint operation by UP Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) and military intelligence sleuths. A mobile phone, allegedly used to send photos and videos to ISI agents, was seized from Ahmad's possession.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Springboard offers mentor-led, career transition courses in Data Science
text: US-based and San Francisco-headquartered online education platform Springboard has launched its inaugural batch of 2020 in Data Science, AI/ML and Data Analytics for professionals. Learners are tied to a personal mentor to help them with industry insights to build projects. Springboard promises money-back to learners who can't transition to a new career post-course completion.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Would love to see female singer join family: Udit on Neha-Aditya's marriage rumours
text: Singer Udit Narayan, when asked about rumours about the marriage of his son Aditya Narayan and singer Neha Kakkar, said, "Neha is a very sweet girl...I like her very much." "If they get married, I'd love to see a female singer joining my family," he added. While Neha is a judge on Indian Idol 11, Aditya is the show's host.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Brad, ex-wife Jennifer meet backstage at award ceremony; pics viral
text: Photos of Hollywood actor Brad Pitt and his ex-wife, actress Jennifer Aniston meeting backstage at the Screen Actors Guild Awards 2020, held on Monday, have gone viral. The pictures show them smiling at each other and Brad holding Jennifer's hand. Both Brad and Jennifer won awards for 'Once Upon A Time In Hollywood' and TV series 'The Morning Show' respectively.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I don't think there was a concept of India till the British gave it one: Saif
text: Speaking about 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' propagating the idea of Swaraj as early as 17th century, Saif Ali Khan said, "I don't think there was a concept of India till perhaps the British gave it one." He added that the film's altered political narrative is 'dangerous'. "I don't think this is history. I'm quite aware of what...history was," said Saif.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Deputy Collector beats participants at pro-CAA rally, protestor pulls her hair
text: A clash broke out during a demonstration in support of Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh district on Sunday. In a video shared by ANI, a protestor can be seen pulling hair of Rajgarh Deputy Collector Priya Verma after she hit BJP workers and dragged them. District Collector Nidhi Nivedita said the entire incident has been videographed.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Eminent citizens opposing CAA are Mamata Banerjee's dogs: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Saumitra Khan on Sunday called prominent personalities who are opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and the National Register of Citizens as "dogs" of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. Khan added that the same people had remained silent on the gangrape cases at Kamduni and Park Street and incidents of bomb blasts.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sachin Tendulkar gifts a bat to specially-abled kid, writes a note for him
text: Former India batsman Sachin Tendulkar has gifted a bat to a specially-abled kid named Maddaram Kawasi and wrote a note for him. The 46-year-old had shared a video of the boy, who cannot walk, playing cricket with his friends on January 1. In the note, Sachin said that he liked the boy's spirit and added, "Keep playing."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 8 Indians bowl as defending champs beat SL by 90 runs in U-19 WC opener
text: India began their 2020 Under-19 World Cup campaign by defeating Sri Lanka by 90 runs in Bloemfontein. India set a target of 298 for Sri Lanka driven by fifties from opener Yashasvi Jaiswal, captain Priyam Garg and Dhruv Jurel. India used eight bowlers, with six taking wickets, as Sri Lanka were bowled out for 207 runs in 45.2 overs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: KL Rahul a better keeper than Dravid but can't be a permanent choice: Aakash
text: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said KL Rahul is a better wicketkeeper than what Rahul Dravid was but he wouldn't want him to keep on a regular basis. "Keeping takes toll. He can't be keeping for 50 overs and then batting higher up the order," he added. He further said that Rahul's workload will increase if he keeps in every match.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Man plugs PS4 to airport monitor, plays game until officials intervene in US
text: A man travelling through the Portland International Airport in the US took over an airport monitor displaying airport's map and plugged in PlayStation 4 to play 'Apex Legends' earlier this week. On being interrupted by airport officials, he requested them to let him finish the game but was denied permission. The incident didn't result in any confiscation, dispute or arrest.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Facebook's WhatsApp buyout should've been blocked: France antitrust watchdog
text: France's antitrust watchdog head Isabelle de Silva in an interview to Reuters said that Facebook's $22 billion buyout of WhatsApp six years ago should have been blocked. She also said Facebook's success wasn't only a result of buying WhatsApp and Instagram. Isabelle also attributed Facebook's success to being able to aggregate the users by merging three separate communities.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: WhatsApp services resume after three-hour outage, say users
text: WhatsApp on Sunday evening faced an outage in India and other parts of the world with users complaining they were unable to send pictures, videos, voice messages, stickers and GIFs across the platform. After roughly three hours, users in India claimed the service resumed and they were able to send different media across the platform.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: SpaceX launches and intentionally blows up own rocket to test escape system
text: Elon Musk-led SpaceX on Sunday successfully launched and later blew up its own rocket to test its Crew Dragon spacecraft's emergency abort system. The test involved launching its Crew Dragon using a Falcon 9 rocket, without any actual crew on board. After liftoff, Crew Dragon intentionally ejected itself from the rocket to simulate how it would carry passengers to safety.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Manufacturing isn't the most-sexy sector, but GST gave us boost: Moglix Founder
text: Talking about his Noida-based B2B e-commerce company Moglix, Founder Rahul Garg told YourStory, "Manufacturing is not the most-sexy sector." He added, "With the GST coming in, there was a significant shift in terms of how companies would have to think about supply chain elements. It gave us a good boost." The IIT Kanpur alumnus founded Moglix in 2015.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: AAP trying to save convicts in Nirbhaya case, alleges Manoj Tiwari
text: BJP leader Manoj Tiwari on Sunday blamed Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for stalling process of justice in the Nirbhaya gangrape case and trying to 'save' the convicts. Speaking at a press conference in Delhi, Tiwari said that AAP government deliberately delayed informing convicts about their sentences for two years. He said that the information was to be given in 2017.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Ex-IAS Gopinathan sent back from UP, joins protest in Shaheen Bagh
text: Former Indian Administrative Service officer Kannan Gopinathan, who resigned from his service after the revocation of Article 370 last year, was on Saturday detained by Uttar Pradesh Police at Prayagraj airport and sent back to Delhi. Gopinathan was to address an event related to the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in Prayagraj. He later joined the anti-CAA protest in Shaheen Bagh.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Kerala mosque hosts Hindu couple's wedding, gifts 10 gold items, ₹2 lakh
text: The Cheruvally Muslim Jamaat mosque near Kerala's Alappuzha hosted the wedding of a Hindu couple in its premises on Sunday. The bride's mother Bindu, who was in a financial crisis following her husband's death, had approached the mosque committee for help and they readily agreed. The mosque committee also gifted 10 sovereigns of gold and ₹2 lakh to the couple.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Mumbai police to patrol city on horses for the first time in 88 years
text: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Sunday said that Mumbai will get a mounted police unit for traffic and crowd control for the first time since 1932. The horses will be deployed on duty after taking part in the Republic Day parade this year. The mounted police unit was disbanded in 1932 due to growing vehicular traffic, Deshmukh added.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Govt must clarify Gen Rawat's 'deradicalisation camps' claim: Yechury
text: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has asked the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led central government to "come clean" on the statement by Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat about deradicalisation camps for radicalised Kashmiri youth. Yechury said, "If [such camps] exist, is the Army running them? This sort of instrument is the biggest one that has been used globally against minorities."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: World's 2,153 billionaires have more wealth than 60% of Earth's population: Oxfam
text: Ahead of World Economic Forum, an Oxfam report has said that world's 2,153 billionaires have more wealth than 4.6 billion people who make up 60% of Earth's population. Citing World Bank estimates, the report stated that almost half of the world's population lives on less than $5.50 (over ₹390) a day, and rate of poverty reduction has halved since 2013.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Sensex hits record high of 42,273, Nifty crosses 12,400 for first time
text: Indian benchmark equity index Sensex hit a record high of 42,273.87 in early trade on Monday, while Nifty crossed the 12,400-mark for the first time to reach an all-time high of 12,430.5. Among the Sensex 30 stocks, Power Grid Corporation, ITC, Asian Paints and HDFC were the top gainers. Kotak Mahindra Bank and TCS were among the worst stock performers.
author: Dharna

headlines: SpaceX's 1st crewed mission to space station likely in April-June: Musk
