text: After SpaceX successfully tested the emergency escape system on Crew Dragon, CEO Elon Musk said he expects the spacecraft's first crewed flight to happen in the second quarter, likely between April-June. SpaceX is "highly confident" the hardware would be ready within the first quarter, probably in February, Musk added. SpaceX will carry NASA astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS).
author: Dharna

headlines: Let Hyperloop be tested somewhere abroad first: Maharashtra Dy CM
text: Talking about Hyperloop transportation system in Maharashtra, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said, "Let it happen somewhere else. Let it become successful for at least 10 km somewhere abroad." BJP-led Devendra Fadnavis government had proposed Mumbai-Pune Hyperloop system to reduce travel time between the two cities. It had said Maharashtra would get the world's first Hyperloop transportation system.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: India pledges $50 mn assistance to Lanka during NSA's visit
text: India pledged to provide Sri Lanka with $50 million in assistance to purchase security equipment during a meeting between National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. "Strengthening of bilateral cooperation on...security, intelligence sharing, maritime security and fostering of regional collaboration, were some of the key points of discussion," Rajapaksa tweeted.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Forces of eastern commander shut Libya's major oil fields
text: Libya's National Oil Corporation claimed major oil fields were closing after forces loyal to eastern commander General Khalifa Haftar shut a pipeline. However, Libyan warring factions are expected to meet in Germany for a summit to arrange a ceasefire. Haftar-led Libyan National Army launched an offensive in April 2019 to seize capital Tripoli from the UN-recognised Government of National Accord.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Whole country wishes Harry & Meghan the very best: UK PM Johnson
text: Speaking of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's decision to step back from royal duties, UK PM Boris Johnson said, "I think the whole country will want to join in wishing them the very best for the future." He added, "As I said before...I was sure...the royal family, which has been around a very long time, will find a way forward."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Over 370 people injured in clash at Lebanon protest: Rescuers
text: Over 370 people were injured in clashes between protesters and security forces in Lebanon's capital Beirut, first responders claimed. "We're not scared. This is all for our future and our children," a protester said. The protests were triggered in October 2019 by the government's plans to impose taxes on WhatsApp calls and other apps, with demonstrators demanding broader economic reforms.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Rohit, Kohli help India beat Australia to win 200 ODIs at home
text: India defeated Australia in the third ODI to clinch the three-match ODI series 2-1 and win their 200th ODI at home. This is India's seventh straight international series victory across formats dating back to October 2019. India's chase was driven by Rohit Sharma, who slammed his 29th ODI hundred and Virat Kohli, who recorded his 100th 50+ score in ODIs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: CAA protests could reduce if govt assures NRC won't happen: Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor criticised PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah by saying that ongoing protests could be defused if people are assured NRC will not happen. "But they (Modi and Shah) aren't prepared to give [these] assurances," he said. "They must assure they [won't] give power to officials to write 'dubious citizenship' against your names," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: PM only sees white cap, not tricolour at protests: Yogendra Yadav
text: Swaraj India President Yogendra Yadav on Sunday criticised PM Narendra Modi saying it was "unfortunate" that the latter could only see "white cap and hijab" and not tricolour in the hands of anti-CAA protesters. "The suffocation in the country has come out through these agitations," Yadav said. He also said the agitation at Shaheen Bagh "proved the power of women".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Kerala Guv seeks report from state govt over moving SC against CAA
text: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has sought a report from the state government for challenging the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in the Supreme Court without informing him. Khan said, "I will not sit like a mute spectator...will ensure that the rules and law are upheld." "The Constitution has to be upheld and this is not a personal fight," he added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: West Bengal Police lathi-charge BJP workers taking out pro-CAA rally
text: West Bengal Police on Saturday lathi-charged on BJP workers in front of the party's state President Dilip Ghosh in East Medinipur district during a pro-Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) march. Police had not given permission for the march. Ghosh said, "Police beat our district President and General Secretary. They grabbed their collars which we didn't expect."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Kohli fastest to hit 5,000 ODI runs as captain, breaks Dhoni's record by 45 innings
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli on Sunday became the fastest batsman to score 5,000 runs in ODI cricket as captain. The 31-year-old reached the milestone in 82 innings, breaking former India captain MS Dhoni's record. Dhoni had taken 127 innings to score 5,000 ODI runs as captain and is followed by Ricky Ponting, who took 131 innings.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rohit equals Kohli to score 8 hundreds against Australia in ODI cricket
text: Team India opener Rohit Sharma slammed his 29th ODI hundred off 110 deliveries against Australia in the third ODI in Bengaluru on Sunday. The 33-year-old equalled Team India captain Virat Kohli to score eight hundreds in ODI cricket against Australia. Only former India batsman Sachin Tendulkar has scored more hundreds (nine) against Australia than Rohit and Kohli.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Viral Facebook video helps Bangladeshi man reunite with family after 48 years
text: A viral Facebook video helped a 78-year-old Bangladeshi man named Habibur Rahman reunite with his family 48 years after he went missing, according to the Daily Star. The wife of Habibur's grandson saw a video post of a man seeking financial help for a patient. It contained Habibur's name, his wife's name, and hometown, which she recognised.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Two wives? One is enough for me: Owaisi denies Cong's claim of having 2 wives
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi, while speaking at a public gathering in Telangana on Saturday, denied Congress party's claims of him having two wives. "Two wives? One is enough for me," Owaisi said. He also announced a reward for the person who finds his second wife, as per the claims made by Congress party.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bezos calls meeting deaf Amazon staff 'moving experience'; shares video
text: World's richest man and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, who recently visited India, shared a video on Sunday that showed him interacting with hearing-impaired Amazon associates at delivery stations. "Meeting this group was a moving experience for me," Bezos captioned video on Instagram. During his visit, he met actor Shahrukh Khan and businesspersons including Mukesh Ambani and Narayana Murthy.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: JNUSU to move Delhi High Court against new hostel manual on Monday
text: The Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) has said it would approach the Delhi High Court on Monday, seeking directions for quashing the new hostel manual which has provisions for fee hike. JNUSU said that the Inter-Hall Administration manual was passed "illegally" in October without taking its feedback. The petition would also seek registration at "old rates without late fines".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Kashmir traders seek NITI Aayog member's ouster for 'dirty films' remark
text: Kashmir Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KCCI) has demanded NITI Aayog member VK Saraswat's removal, condemning his reported remarks that data service in J&K was only used to watch "dirty films". KCCI President Sheikh Ashiq said that the losses to the business sector have amounted to over ₹18,000 crore in the past nearly six months due to the internet shutdown.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Why is govt launching drive against polio despite India being free from it?
text: The Union Health Ministry launched the Pulse Polio Programme on Sunday to check the disease that impairs children at a young age. The National Health Portal stated that although India is free from polio, there is a possibility that the poliomyelitis virus might make a comeback as the neighbouring countries like Pakistan haven’t officially eradicated the disease.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Keen on pursuing higher education in India, not abroad: JEE Main topper Parth
text: Rajasthan's Parth Dwivedi, one of the nine students who topped JEE Main 2020 by scoring 100 percentile, has said that he is keen on pursuing higher education in India and not abroad. The 17-year-old aims to pursue Computer Science from IIT Bombay. "I'll work for the nation's development, maybe as a civil servant or as a researcher," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Centre to announce industrial package for J&K soon: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has said that the Centre would announce an industrial package for Jammu and Kashmir soon and called the Union Territory a "jewel" of the country. "We hope to see large amounts of investment coming to Kashmir," he said. Goyal added that Kashmir would be linked with the rest of the country by train by December 2021.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Goyal not to meet Malaysian counterpart at Davos: Reports amid palm oil row
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will not meet with his Malaysian counterpart Darell Leiking in Davos next week because of his tight schedule, Reuters reported on Sunday quoting a ministry official. However, a Malaysian government spokesman said on Friday that the trade ministers could meet in Davos. India imposed curbs on import of refined palm oil from Malaysia earlier this month.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: CPI(M) to launch door-to-door campaign on CAA, NRC, NPR 'link'
text: CPI(M) on Sunday announced that it will soon launch a nationwide house-to-house campaign to explain the "link" between Citizenship (Amendment) Act, National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR). The central committee also asked people "not to answer any questions concerning the NPR" when officials come to their houses, said party general secretary Sitaram Yechury.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Ridiculous: Brett Lee on ICC's decision to ban Rabada
text: Reacting to ICC's decision to ban to Kagiso Rabada, former Australian pacer Brett Lee tweeted, "I understand that cricket needs to be played in the spirit of the game but to ban... for over-celebrating to me is ridiculous." Rabada was handed a demerit point for his celebration after dismissing England skipper Joe Root in the ongoing third Test.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Can't do more than what I did: Federer on being called selfish
text: Responding to criticism aimed at him for not supporting his fellow players in speaking out against the playing conditions in Australia due to the bushfires, Swiss tennis player Roger Federer said that he cannot do more than what he did. Federer added that he cannot go onto the court and tell the players to stop playing.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: You have to do it again and again and again: Solskjaer
text: Speaking about ranking the current Liverpool team alongside Manchester United's greatest teams, United's coach Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said, "I would say our 1999 team was the best... You have to do it again and again and again." "I'm sure Liverpool can win all three, so I'm not going to say yes or no, but let's see in May," Solskjaer said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Right time for Kashmiri Pandits to be back in Kashmir: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday said that it was the "right time" for Kashmiri Pandits to "be back in Kashmir". "It's not only time but they (Kashmiri Pandits) have lost everything in life," he said. "They didn't deserve to go through the treatment they have gone through. They have hope now," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 19 Indians kidnapped by pirates off West Africa released, 1 dead
text: India's High Commission in Abuja, Nigeria tweeted that 19 of 20 Indian seafarers kidnapped by pirates on December 15, 2019 from MV Duke off the coast of West Africa were released on Saturday. "One of them had died in captivity in adverse conditions," the mission added. "Our deepest condolences. Mission assisting in speedy return," the High Commission further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Grand message: Swaraj Kaushal on Bru-Reang refugee agreement
text: Former Mizoram Governor Swaraj Kaushal on Sunday welcomed central government's agreement to settle 34,000 Bru-Reang refugees in Tripura. "The agreement reflects [India's] foresight about national security and compassion. It is a grand message that the country cares," he said. He also termed the Bru-Reang tribe as India's first line of defence along Bangladesh border.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: RJD to contest on 4 seats in alliance with Congress in Delhi polls
text: Lalu Prasad Yadav-led Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has forged an alliance with Congress for the Delhi Assembly polls with the former contesting on four seats. RJD leaders will contest the elections from Burari, Kirari, Uttam Nagar and Palam seats. This came a day after Congress announced its list of 54 candidates for election to the 70-member constituent assembly.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 185 climate change protesters detained at Belgium car show
text: Police detained 185 climate change protesters, for protesting the industry's impact on the environment, at a car show in Belgium. The protest was organised by activist group Extinction Rebellion, with one of its spokesman claiming that the car industry told "a lot of lies in order to sell more cars". Organisers said they expect 5,00,000 people to visit the show.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Bodies of Ukrainian victims of Iran plane crash brought home
text: The bodies of 11 Ukranian citizens who died in a passenger plane mistakenly shot down by Iran this month returned to Ukraine on Sunday. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, relatives of the victims and Ukraine International Airlines staff attended the solemn ceremony. Ukraine had demanded that Iran compensate the victims' families and punish those responsible for downing the plane.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Gulf airlines continue flying in Iran, Iraq despite military action
text: Some of the airlines from the Gulf have continued to operate in Iran and Iraq, even as other international airlines have rerouted their planes after military exchanges between the US and Iran recently. "Iranian airspace is important for all carriers in this region," an Emirates' senior official said. Analysts claim Gulf airlines have fewer alternative routes in the region.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Urvashi Rautela copies PM Modi's tweet for Shabana Azmi, gets trolled
text: Actress Urvashi Rautela was trolled on Twitter after she copied PM Narendra Modi's tweet for Shabana Azmi, who was injured in an accident on Saturday. A user commented, "Why did you copy PM Modi's tweet?? You can retweet it!!" while another comment read, "Nicely copy paste[d]." Urvashi had earlier tried to pass off model Gigi Hadid's statement as her own.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 3,924 including Muslims given citizenship in last 6 yrs: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that in the last six years, 2,838 Pakistani refugees, 914 Afghanistani and 172 Bangladeshi refugees were given Indian citizenship, which also included Muslims. She added that between 1964 and 2008, over four lakh Sri Lankan Tamils were given citizenship. Sitharaman said it was unconstitutional for states to say they will not implement the CAA.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Allegations of snatching blankets from protestors not true: Lucknow Police
text: Lucknow Police on Sunday issued a clarification on the allegations that they took away blankets meant for anti-CAA protesters, saying that it's a rumour. "Some organisations were distributing blankets and those who weren't protesting were coming to collect them. Police removed those distributing blankets," they added. "Action is being initiated against those distributing blankets," police said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Jayalalithaa would not have supported CAA: Kanimozhi
text: DMK leader MK Kanimozhi on Saturday said that if late former Tamil Nadu CM Jayalalithaa was at the helm of affairs in AIADMK today, she would not have supported Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). Referring to AIADMK's support for CAA, Kanimozhi said, "Whatever she (Jayalalithaa) stood for, her party is failing her." She added that AIADMK has let Tamil Nadu down.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: ICC shares pic of fan with 'I can bowl like Bumrah' banner, trolls him
text: The ICC took to Twitter to share a picture of a fan in the stands holding a placard that read, "I can bowl like Bumrah". Trolling him, the ICC wrote, "We'd like to see video proof." Reacting to the picture, a fan tweeted, "Pehle apna pet aur Bumrah ka pet dekho." Another fan wrote, "I can act like Tom Cruise."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Praveen Kumar reveals he played his entire career being partially blind
text: Ex-India fast bowler Praveen Kumar has revealed that he played his entire career being partially blind. "I can't see properly with my right eye. I was hit by a ball while playing junior cricket," he added. He further said, "I often got bowled by slower balls. It's because I couldn't see the ball. I faced the same issue with bouncers."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rohit, 3rd slowest Indian to 2,000 ODI runs, becomes 3rd fastest to 9,000 ODI runs
text: Team India opener Rohit Sharma, who is the third slowest Indian to score 2,000 runs in ODI cricket, has become the third fastest batsman to reach 9,000 ODI runs in ODI cricket. Rohit took 217 innings to reach the milestone. Virat Kohli, the fastest batsman to reach 9,000 ODI runs, had taken 194 innings.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: WhatsApp down in India, users unable to send photos and voice messages
text: Facebook-owned messaging platform WhatsApp suffered an outage in India and some other regions including Brazil, Middle East and Europe on Sunday, with users complaining they were unable to send photos, videos and voice messages across the platform. WhatsApp users started reporting the outage after 4:00 PM in the evening. WhatsApp, Facebook and Instagram experienced a day-long outage in July 2019.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nothing wrong with organisation learning from past: Innov8 CEO on OYO firings
text: Delhi-based co-working space startup Innov8's Founder and CEO Ritesh Malik wrote a blog on recent firings at OYO where he said there's "nothing wrong" about an organisation's decision to revamp strategies or learn from the past. "Such decisions, however hard they may be, represent basic truth for every organisation," he said. OYO announced the acquisition of Innov8 in July 2019.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: RSS believes in Constitution, no other power centre: Mohan Bhagwat
text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has elaborated on his earlier remark about 130 crore Indians being Hindus saying, "We don't want any power centre other than the Constitution because we believe in it." He added that RSS doesn't want to change "anyone's religion, language or caste". "[India] belongs to us...and we have to live together despite our diversity," Bhagwat said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Karnataka to get 4 new airports in next 2 years: Aviation Secretary
text: Aviation Secretary Pradeep Singh Kharola has said that four more airports will become operational in Karnataka in the next two years apart from the Bidar airport, which is expected to start operations on January 26. The four airports will come up at Vijayapura, Shivamogga, Karwar and Chikkamagaluru. Kharola said, "We have airports in all directions of the state now."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Ready to hold referendum on PoK, let Kashmiris decide what they want: Pak PM
text: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has said he is ready to hold a referendum in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) to give people the right to decide whether they want to remain in the country or be independent. On human rights situation in PoK, Khan said, "We invite anyone from anywhere in the world to visit PoK. Let them decide."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: BJP MP threatens Nizamabad Police Commissioner over phone
text: A video of BJP MP from Telangana’s Nizamabad, Arvind Dharmapuri, has surfaced wherein the lawmaker can be seen threatening the Police Commissioner of Nizamabad over the phone during a rally. He was angry with the police for giving permission to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi to hold rallies, while his party MLA, Raja Singh, had been denied permission.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Just another day in life of soldier: Indian Army as jawan misses his wedding
text: The official Twitter handle of Chinar Corps - Indian Army tweeted, "Don't worry, life will wait...Just another day in life of a soldier," on Sunday, after one of its jawans missed his own wedding. The jawan, Suneel, missed his wedding in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi due to heavy snowfall in Kashmir valley. The bride's family agreed to a new wedding date.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indian school teacher becomes first foreigner to contract coronavirus in China
text: Preeti Maheshwari, a 45-year-old teacher at an international school in Shenzhen, has become the first foreigner to contract the SARS-like coronavirus. She is undergoing treatment at a hospital after she fell seriously ill last Friday. Her husband said that she was being treated in the ICU and is currently on a ventilator and other supporting systems.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Saving designing costs: US Space Force on being trolled for camouflage uniform
text: The US Space Force (USSF) after being trolled for its camouflage uniform said, "[We are] utilising current Army/Air Force uniforms, saving costs of designing/producing a new one. Members will look like their joint counterparts they'll be working with, on the ground." The uniform was unveiled on January 18. President Donald Trump had signed order to create USSF in February 2019.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Shah Rukh, Kareena to star in Rajkumar Hirani's film: Reports
text: Shah Rukh Khan, who was last seen in 2018 film 'Zero', will be seen alongside Kareena Kapoor in a film by Rajkumar Hirani, as per reports. The actors have previously worked together in films like 'Ra.One' and 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. Kareena, whose 'Good Newwz' earned ₹197.10 crore in India, will be seen in 'Angrezi Medium' and 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I make sure not to use plastic bags and travel in private jets: Gal Gadot
text: Hollywood actress Gal Gadot has said she doesn't use plastic bags and travel in private jets as she wants to do her part in saving the planet for the sake of her two daughters. "I think...being a role model and actually doing...things and showing...how it should be done is...big thing, because then it's being incorporated into their [lives]," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Ex-Aus cricketer Slater calls dropping Pant for 3rd ODI 'unfair'
text: Reacting to Rishabh Pant not being part of the Indian team for the third ODI against Australia, former Australian cricketer Michael Slater said, "I think leaving out Pant was unfair." "[B]ecause [he] was hit on the helmet and someone else took his place and kept well, so he has to miss out? That's not logical," Slater said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Weak as f*ck: Nate Diaz tweets after Conor McGregor's comeback win
text: Following Conor McGregor's 40-second TKO win at UFC 246, his former opponent Nate Diaz tweeted, "Weak as f*ck" and "This sh*ts all fake". Making his octagon return after 15 months out of action, McGregor beat Donald 'Cowboy' Cerrone inside the first minute of their welterweight main event at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Scientists building oxygen plant to make breathable air out of moondust
text: Scientists at the European Space Agency have set up a prototype oxygen plant in the Netherlands to produce breathable air out of moondust. The facility would help Moon settlers breathe and produce rocket fuel locally. It uses 'molten salt electrolysis' method to extract oxygen from lunar regolith, loose deposits on the Moon's surface made up of 40-45% oxygen by weight.
author: Dharna

headlines: Instagram removes IGTV button, says very few users click the icon
text: Facebook-owned Instagram is removing the IGTV icon, present on the top right corner, from the app as very few users click on it. "Most people are finding IGTV content through previews in Feed, the IGTV channel in Explore, creators' profiles and the standalone app," a Facebook spokesperson told TechCrunch. The IGTV app was introduced in 2018.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: People in Bihar form human chain on boats to support 'Jal, Jeevan, Hariyali'
text: Residents of Bihar's Athar village formed a human chain on boats in Gandak river on Sunday. The state government organised the human chain formation in support of Jal, Jeevan, Hariyali Abhiyan. As per reports, the government claims that the human chain was 16,443 km long, and around 4.29 crore people participated in it.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Scientists generating oxygen from simulated moon dust
text: European researchers are working on a system that can create breathable oxygen from simulated samples of moon dust. The oxygen extraction is taking place using a method called molten salt electrolysis, in which electricity is passed through the rocks to gather oxygen and metal alloys. Notably, research has found that simulated moon dust can kill human cells and alter DNA.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Donald Trump, Angela Merkel, Imran Khan to attend WEF 2020 at Davos
text: World leaders including US President Donald Trump, German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan will attend the World Economic Forum's (WEF) 50th Annual Meeting. The four-day event begins on Monday in Davos, Switzerland and will see up to 3,000 participants from 117 countries. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will lead the Indian delegation to the event.
author: Dharna

headlines: 17 new cases of coronavirus reported in China: Officials
text: Chinese officials said that 17 more people, three of them seriously ill, had been infected with the new coronavirus strain. All 62 reported cases of the new virus in China have occurred in Wuhan city. The outbreak of the new virus comes ahead of the Lunar New Year holidays when millions of Chinese will travel domestically and overseas.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Don't support unlimited Soviet-style terms for President: Putin
text: Russia's President Vladimir Putin said that he opposes the idea of no term limits for the country's President, similar to Soviet-era practice of lifelong rulers who died in office. He added that those leaders left office without ensuring the necessary conditions for a transition of power. Putin recently proposed constitutional reforms that will allow the Parliament to elect the PM.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Shabana is in ICU but all scan reports are positive: Javed Akhtar
text: Lyricist Javed Akhtar, while speaking about his wife Shabana Azmi who has been admitted to Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital following an accident, said, "She's in the ICU but all the scan reports are positive." "It seems there's no serious harm done," he added. Shabana was injured after her car rammed into a truck on Mumbai-Pune Expressway on Saturday.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Fast & Furious actor Paul Walker's 21 vehicles sold for ₹16cr 6yrs after his death
text: Twenty-one vehicles owned by late actor Paul Walker, who starred in the 'Fast & Furious' film franchise, sold for a combined $2.33 million (over ₹16 crore) during bidding at an annual car auction in the US, officials said. Proceeds from the sale will go to a trust for Walker's daughter, Meadow. Walker passed away in a car crash in 2013.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Will miss you dearly: Shweta shares pic with mother-in-law after her death
text: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's daughter Shweta Bachchan Nanda on Sunday took to Instagram to share a picture with her mother-in-law Ritu Nanda following the latter's demise on Tuesday. "Will miss you dearly," she captioned the photo which also features her daughter Navya Naveli Nanda. Ritu, who was married to late industrialist Rajan Nanda, was suffering from cancer.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: No right to live in India if you don't accept Vande Mataram: Sarangi
text: Union Minister Pratap Chandra Sarangi on Saturday said, "Those who do not accept India's freedom, unity, Vande Mataram, have no right to stay in the country." He added, "Those who set the country on fire are not patriots." While speaking at a press conference in Gujarat, Sarangi also said that people should be thankful to the PM for bringing CAA.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Sec 144 imposed in Lucknow ahead of Republic Day amid CAA protests
text: Amid ongoing protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in Uttar Pradesh, Section 144 of the CrPC was imposed in the state's capital city of Lucknow on Saturday night. This comes ahead of Republic Day, as well as Defence Expo 2020. A protest against the CAA was organised by women at the Ghanta Ghar (Clock Tower) in Lucknow.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Steve Smith slams hundred in ODI cricket exactly 3 years after his last
text: Australia batsman Steve Smith on Sunday slammed his ninth hundred in ODI cricket off 117 deliveries in the third ODI against India in Bengaluru. The hundred is Smith's first in ODI cricket since his 108*(104) against Pakistan at Perth on January 19, 2017. The 30-year-old also crossed 4,000 runs in ODI cricket, reaching the milestone in 106 innings.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Why are Team India cricketers wearing black armbands in the Bengaluru ODI?
text: Team India players are wearing black armbands in the ongoing third and final ODI against Australia in Bengaluru. This is in tribute to former all-rounder Bapu Nadkarni, who passed away aged 86 on Friday. Nadkarni was best known for bowling 21 maiden overs in a row in a Test match in 1964, which is still a world record.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Karun, 2nd Indian to slam Test triple ton, marries long-time girlfriend Sanaya
text: Batsman Karun Nair, the second Indian to slam triple hundred in Test cricket, tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Sanaya Tankariwala. Nair had proposed to Sanaya in 2019 before they got engaged on a vacation in June last year. Varun Aaron, KL Rahul, Shreyas Iyer and Ajinkya Rahane were among the cricketers seen at Nair's wedding and post-wedding celebrations.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: EVs will be cheaper than regular cars a misconception: Maruti Suzuki Exec
text: Maruti Suzuki India's Executive Director Shashank Srivastava at a recent event by The Economic Times said, "It is a misconception that electric vehicles will come at a lower cost." He added, "HEV/PHEV provides scales for EV component manufacturing, business case viability for 'Make in India' and bring down the cost of EV in the long term."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: WhatsApp becomes 2nd non-Google app to reach 500 cr installs on Android
text: With over 500 crore downloads on Google Play Store, Facebook-owned WhatsApp has become the second non-Google app to have reached the mark. Last year Facebook had become the first non-Google app to have joined the 500 crore downloads club. Prior to that, only pre-installed Google apps like Google Play, Google Maps and others had reached the milestone.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Ola driver asks jeweller for ₹40L claiming to have kidnapped his brother; held
text: The Mumbai Police arrested an Ola driver for allegedly demanding ₹40 lakh from a jeweller after claiming to have kidnapped his 39-year-old mentally challenged brother, who went missing in November. Police said Amir Shaikh knew the jeweller and made the extortion plan after learning about the disappearance. Shaikh made a series of internet calls, saying, "He's...not eating, what to do?"
author: Dharna

headlines: OYO employee seeks jobs for fired staff on LinkedIn, hundreds share openings
text: OYO's head for enterprise sales Jasmit Singh took to LinkedIn earlier this week asking people to share job opportunities for the employees who were fired by OYO recently. "A few candidates are asked to seek a career outside OYO...These candidates are brilliant with their work," Singh wrote. Hundreds of people including recruiters commented on his post sharing job openings.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sea lions yawn due to anxiety: Researchers
text: Spanish researchers have concluded that sea lions yawn due to anxiety after finding that sea lions' frequency of yawns increases immediately after a social conflict among members of a group. "Our next step is to analyse whether sea lions also have the contagious effect of yawning, which can be attributed to empathy among equals," the study's authors state.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Cong sins forced Kashmiri Pandits to escape 30 years back: UP CM
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday criticised Congress during a pro-CAA rally in Varanasi saying, "Congress only cares about vote bank in this country." He added, "Kashmiri Pandits were forced to escape 30 years back due to Congress' sins." Adityanath also blamed Opposition parties for anti-CAA protests, calling them "conspiracy against the country."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Nirbhaya rape convict's lawyer issued notice for filing 'forged' papers
text: The Bar Council of Delhi has issued notice to Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convict  Pawan Kumar Gupta's lawyer AP Singh for filing "forged" documents and not appearing for the hearing. The Delhi High Court had last month dismissed Pawan's claim that he was a juvenile at the time of the offence. It also imposed ₹25,000 as costs on Singh.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Don't know why India brought CAA but it is country's internal matter: B'desh PM
text: Terming the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC) as "internal matters" of India, Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina said, "CAA is unnecessary." "We don't understand why (the Indian government) [brought CAA]," she added. "There is no reverse migration from India. But within India, people are facing many problems," she further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 2,299 CAPF personnel lost lives in accidents, suicides in 2014-2018
text: According to the National Crime Records Bureau data, 2,299 Central Armed Police Forces (CAPF) personnel died in accidents and suicides between 2014-2018. While 1,902 CAPF personnel died in accidents, 397 personnel committed suicide. The data revealed that the number of casualties was coming down in recent years, with 104 personnel dying in accidents in 2018 and 28 due to suicide.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Pilot who asked female trainee about 'sex, masturbation' reinstated by Air India
text: An Air India pilot, who was suspended in May last year after being accused of sexual harassment by a woman colleague, has been reinstated. The woman, who had been training under the pilot, had said he asked her "if she didn't need to have sex every day and if she masturbated". The pilot has appealed against the punishment awarded.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Commerce Min wants duty-free alcohol purchase limited to 1 bottle: Report
text: The Commerce Ministry has recommended restricting the purchase of tax-free alcohol to one bottle at duty-free shops in order to reduce import of non-essential goods, PTI reported on Sunday quoting sources. It added that the Commerce Ministry has also recommended to the Finance Ministry that purchase of cigarette cartons at duty-free shops should be prohibited.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Singer Celine Dion performs in Miami a day after mother's death
text: Singer Celine Dion on Friday performed in Miami, a day after her mother, Thérèse Tanguay Dion, passed away in Montreal at the age 92. While performing at the concert, she paused and paid tribute to her mother. "My mom loved to laugh...to dance...so tonight, on behalf of my...family, we'd love to dedicate this show to her," Celine told the crowd.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie...' is the single biggest slap on my face: Karan
text: Talking about his 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham', Karan Johar said, "It's...single biggest slap in my face and my biggest reality check." Johar added he made it "mush of a film" by taking the storyline of 'Kabhie Kabhie' and family values of 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!'. "I thought...I'm making...biggest film in Hindi...since 'Mughal-e-Azam' until...'Lagaan' and...'Dil Chahta Hai'," said Johar.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: The hand that wrote genius: Big B on father's 17th death anniversary
text: Amitabh Bachchan on Sunday took to Twitter to share a picture of his father, Harivansh Rai Bachchan, on his 17th death anniversary. "A few moments ago he'd breathed his last...my father...had held his hand...soft...the hand that wrote genius," he wrote. Amitabh then shared his look from his upcoming film and wrote, "But work continues, he'd have wanted it that way."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: 70% refugees are Dalit, those opposing CAA are anti-Dalit: Amit Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that those opposing Citizenship (Amendment) Act are anti-Dalit. "Around 70% of the refugees are Dalits. I want to ask the protesters that are against CAA, what will you benefit from protesting against these Dalits?" Shah added. The Home Minister said this at a Jan Jagran Abhiyan meeting in Karnataka's Hubballi.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Casemiro's brace helps Real Madrid beat Sevilla 2-1
text: Real Madrid registered a 2-1 win over Sevilla following a brace from Brazilian midfielder Casemiro in the La Liga on Saturday. Casemiro broke the 0-0 deadlock for Madrid in the 57th minute when the Brazil midfielder was set up by Luka Jovic. Casemiro doubled his tally and regained the lead for his side with a header in the 64th minute.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Tesla is stealing our water: Germans protest against its Gigafactory plans
text: Around 250 people in Germany on Saturday protested against Tesla's plans to build a Gigafactory near Berlin. The protestors claimed its construction will endanger local water supply and wildlife in the forested area, chanting, "We are here, we are loud, because Tesla is stealing our water." The three-square-kilometre Gigafactory would reportedly need more than 3,00,000 litres of water per hour.
author: Dharna

headlines: Railways to replace Urdu with Sanskrit on station signboards in U'khand
text: The Urdu language on signboards at railway platforms in Uttarakhand will be soon replaced with Sanskrit, state's second official language. As per the Railway Manual, the name of a railway station should be written in the state's second official language after Hindi and English, an official said. Dehradun, Roorkee and Haridwar are among the first stations to undergo the change.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Iran-backed Houthi rebels kill at least 70 Yemeni soldiers
text: Iran-backed Houthi rebels have killed at least 70 Yemeni soldiers and injured dozens of others in an attack on a mosque in the military training camp, medical and military sources claimed. The attack confirms that the Houthis have no desire for peace, Yemen President Abdrabuh Mansour Hadi said. Ballistic missiles and drones used in attack, Al Ekhbariya TV quoted sources.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Delhi CM releases 'Guarantee Card', promises free bus travel for students
text: Ahead of the Assembly elections, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday released a 10-point 'Guarantee Card'. In the 'Guarantee Card', the CM has promised free bus travel for students, 24-hour drinking water, reducing air pollution by three times, among other things. Kejriwal said that it is different from the party's manifesto which will also be released soon.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: My English isn't good, Jerry is in my room: Man tells hotel on finding mouse in room
text: A man staying at a hotel in the UK called the reception after spotting a mouse in his room. Letting the hotel staff know that his "English is not good", the man said, "You know Tom & Jerry?...Jerry is here in my room...When you come here bring Tom with you." A video of the man's conversation has gone viral.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Deepika turns 'Chhapaak' acid attack 'look' into TikTok challenge, criticised
text: Deepika Padukone was criticised on Twitter after she turned her acid attack survivor look from 'Chhapaak' into a TikTok challenge. The actress tells a makeup artist, "I want to challenge [her] with 3 of my most favourite looks." "She...dismissed the entire trauma behind it," a user commented while another comment read, "This is demeaning [towards] every acid [attack] victim."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Raghu's ex-wife congratulates him on birth of son with 2nd wife; shares pic
text: 'Roadies' creator Raghu Ram's ex-wife Sugandha Garg has shared a picture on Instagram to congratulate him and his second wife Natalie DiLuccio on the birth of their son Rhythm. "A photo to commemorate the passing of time...Welcome Rhythm...You've been born to warriors," she wrote. Replying to the post, Raghu commented, "Lots and lots of love."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Raza Murad says 'If Adnan can be citizen, why can't other Muslims under CAA?'
text: Actor Raza Murad has called CAA "unconstitutional" while adding, "I've no objection to the law. But it should be equal for all." "Didn't [government] give citizenship to [singer] Adnan Sami?...He's a Muslim. He was resident of Pakistan," he stated. Responding to this, Adnan, a supporter of CAA, said, "I thought...this guy was a villain and talked crap only in movies!!"
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Took a revolver, sped to the highway at 5 am to end my life: Praveen Kumar
text: Ex-India pacer Praveen Kumar has revealed he took his revolver, got into his car and sped to the highway at 5 am to end his life two months ago. "I told myself...what's all this? Let me just end it," he said. He added that he saw the photo of his smiling children and realised he can't do this to them.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Conor McGregor defeats Cowboy in 40 seconds on return to UFC after 15 months
text: Irish mixed martial artist Conor McGregor, the first-ever two-division UFC champion (lightweight and featherweight), earned a technical knockout win against Donald 'Cowboy' Cerrone in 40 seconds in the first round on his return to UFC after 15 months. With this, the 31-year-old became the first fighter in UFC to secure knockout victories in featherweight, lightweight, and welterweight divisions.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Apple may launch MacBook with touchscreen display, hints new patent
text: A new Apple patent which has surfaced online suggests that the company may consider making a touchscreen MacBook. Titled 'Cross-Device Interactions', the patent describes the screen as "a touch-sensitive display" on which the user can perform "a variety of finger inputs" depending on their purpose. In 2018, Apple's Senior VP of Software Engineering Craig Federighi had dismissed the idea.
author: Dharna

headlines: YouTuber says he faked broken ankle for free business class upgrade, criticised
text: YouTuber and Instagram influencer Jamie Zhu was criticised after he posted a video of himself faking a broken ankle to get his economy class flight seat "successfully" upgraded to business class for free. Zhu is seen limping and telling the attendants the boot for his injury doesn't fit in his seat. A user commented, "The airline should ban you permanently."
author: Dharna

headlines: Speed of world's fastest spinning object reaches 300 billion rpm
text: Purdue scientists, who created the fastest spinning object in 2018 in the form of a dumbbell-shaped silica nanoparticle suspended in a vacuum rotating at 60 billion rpm, have increased the object's speed to 300 billion rpm. Researchers state that the spinning nanoparticle can be used to study nanoscale magnetism and the quantum geometric phase.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: All 6 death warrants in 2019 were stayed or cancelled by SC, HCs: Report
text: All the six death warrants issued in 2019 by various courts across India were eventually stayed or cancelled by the Supreme Court or high courts, said a report by NLU, Delhi. Out of the six, one was cancelled and three were stayed by the SC since convicts were left with lawful remedies. One warrant was quashed by the Bombay HC.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 7 people suffer heart attack while running Tata Mumbai Marathon, 1 dies
text: As many as seven people have suffered cardiac arrest while running the Tata Mumbai Marathon on Sunday, Bombay Hospital PRO said. Moreover, a 64-year-old participant died of cardiac arrest while running the marathon, the PRO added. The run is a part of the ongoing 17th edition of the Tata Mumbai Marathon and is about 6-kilometre long.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Kashmiri man with name similar to wanted criminal wrongfully held in Iraq
text: A Kashmiri man has been wrongfully detained in Iraq as he shares the same name and year of birth as a wanted criminal against whom there is a red corner notice by Interpol. Nazir Ahmad Dar has been detained despite his address on his passport listed as Srinagar, and that of the criminal on the red corner notice being Sopore.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Class 11 student gives birth to stillborn baby in school hostel in Chhattisgarh
text: A Class 11 student gave birth to a stillborn baby in the hostel of her school in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada, saying she was in a relationship with a boy from her village. Authorities said the hostel supervisor was immediately suspended and further action will be taken based on investigation. School administration handed over the stillborn baby to girl's parents, authorities added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Aus drivers could face ₹5L fine for throwing lit cigarette in wake of bushfires
text: Amid bushfires in the country, drivers in Australia's New South Wales can now face fines of up to $11,000 (over ₹5 lakh) for throwing lit cigarettes out of their vehicles when officials in the state have declared a total fire ban. "I hope this move makes people think very carefully about the consequences of their actions," officials said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Anurag wanted to cast older actors in 'Saand Ki Aankh': Neena
text: Neena Gupta has revealed that Anurag Kashyap wanted to cast older actors in Bhumi Pednekar and Taapsee Pannu-starrer 'Saand Ki Aankh' but the financers wanted younger actors. "So it's business, who is suited...is taken," she added. Neena had earlier expressed her views on the casting of Taapsee and Bhumi and said, "At least cast us for...roles that suit our age."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Ranveer can't get Kapil Dev's action as perfectly as I can: Actor Varun
text: Actor Varun Badola said in an interview that Ranveer Singh has done a "fabulous job" with Kapil Dev's look in his upcoming film '83. However, he added that Ranveer cannot pull off Kapil's bowling action as perfectly as he can. "I've had...same bowling action since childhood. In fact, in a friendly match...S Sreesanth...said...my action is exactly like...Kapil paaji," said Varun.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I'll never direct a horror film again: Karan Johar on Ghost Stories
text: Filmmaker Karan Johar, while talking about his latest anthology 'Ghost Stories', said that he will never direct a horror film again. "Horror and I don't connect at all...This is my first and only horror story that I've made for Netflix," he added. "It's not a genre that I enjoy watching, so why should I enjoy making it," Karan further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Shabana Azmi is stable and under observation: Doctor
text: Shabana Azmi, who was injured in a car accident on Pune-Mumbai Expressway, is stable and under observation, Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital CEO & Executive Director Dr Santosh Shetty said. She was travelling with her husband, Javed Akhtar, when their car rammed into a truck near Khalapur toll plaza. The driver of the car was also injured, while Javed escaped unhurt.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Priyamani replaces Keerthy Suresh in Ajay's 'Maidaan'
text: Actress Priyamani has replaced Keerthy Suresh in Ajay Devgn's sports drama 'Maidaan'. "Keerthy shot for the film for a day. After the shoot, the makers and Keerthy...felt...she looked too young...to authentically portray...a mother," statement from the makers read. Priyamani, who predominantly works in the South industry, recently featured alongside Manoj Bajpayee in web series, 'The Family Man'.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: FIR against over 60 women for protesting against CAA in Aligarh
text: An FIR has been filed on Saturday against over 60 unknown women in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh for allegedly staging a protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Population Register (NPR). Police said that the protest organised by the agitated women violated Section 144. Women have been protesting in several parts of the country against the CAA, NRC and NPR.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Amazon to link credit cards to palms, let shoppers pay by waving hand: Report
text: Amazon is planning to develop terminals that would allow customers to make payments in stores with a simple wave of their hand, the Wall Street Journal reported. The company will pitch these terminals to coffee shops, restaurants and other merchants. For the technology, Amazon will link clients' credit card information to their hands, allowing payment after palm scans at checkout.
author: Dharna

headlines: Era of classic carmakers over, need reforms to avoid fate like Nokia: VW CEO
text: Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess has said the era of classic carmakers is over. He added that Volkswagen needed to accelerate its transformation to avoid becoming another Nokia, which lost its dominance in the handset market to Apple. The German automaker is reportedly looking to double market valuation, cut costs and expand into new technologies like connected, electric and self-driving cars.
author: Dharna

headlines: Internet used in J&K to watch dirty films: NITI Aayog member
text: NITI Aayog member VK Saraswat on Saturday said internet suspension in J&K was justified since it's only being used to watch "dirty films". Saraswat then clarified saying internet suspension in J&K didn't have a "significant" effect on the economy. He further said that some politicians want to go to J&K for protesting and use social media to fuel their protest.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Arnab-led news broadcasters' body meets FM, seeks GST parity with print media
text: Members of the News Broadcasters Federation (NBF) executive body met Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, requesting that TV news channels be treated on par with print media under the Goods and Services Tax regulations. Presently, GST on TV news channels stands at 18%, while print media faces a 5% GST. NBF President Arnab Goswami highlighted the similarity in their business models.
author: Dharna

headlines: 6 of top 10 Indian firms add ₹62,773 crore in m-cap; HUL and RIL lead gains
text: Six of the 10 most valued companies in India collectively added ₹62,773 crore in market valuation last week, with Hindustan Unilever (HUL) and Reliance Industries (RIL) emerging as top gainers. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys, Kotak Mahindra Bank and ITC also witnessed gains in their market capitalisation. Of the remaining, HDFC Bank, HDFC, ICICI Bank and SBI suffered losses.
author: Dharna

headlines: Hardik Patel arrested for failing to appear before court in sedition case
text: Congress leader Hardik Patel has been arrested from Gujarat's Ahmedabad for failing to appear before a court in connection with the trial of 2015 sedition case. The prosecution said Patel intended to delay the trial by seeking regular exemption from appearance. The sedition case was filed after violence broke out during the Patidar community's quota agitation in Ahmedabad in 2015.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle lose 'His and Her Royal Highness' titles
text: Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle will lose their "His and Her Royal Highness" titles as they are no longer working members of the Royal Family, the Buckingham Palace announced. The couple will stop receiving public funds and will repay ₹22.2 crore spent on the refurbishment of their cottage at Windsor. They will also no longer formally represent The Queen.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Had crush on Vicky's girlfriend before I got to know they were dating: Brother Sunny
text: Actor Sunny Kaushal, when asked in an interview if he ever liked any of his brother Vicky Kaushal's girlfriends, said, "Yes, but before I knew she was his girlfriend." "I came to know later that they were dating," he added. On being told that Vicky would know this after watching the interview, Sunny jokingly remarked, "He wouldn't know which one."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Actress Shabana Azmi's driver charged with rash driving after her accident
text: An FIR has been registered against actress Shabana Azmi's driver after the car she was travelling in met with an accident on Mumbai-Pune expressway on Saturday, police said. Azmi's driver was identified as Amlesh Yogendra Kamat. The complaint was registered by Rajesh Pandurang Shinde, the truck driver whose vehicle was hit from behind by Azmi's car.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Union Minister Joshi ready to debate with you on CAA: Shah to Rahul
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday challenged Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to prove that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) would take away citizenship from Indian Muslims. "Read the CAA completely, if you find anything that takes away the citizenship of Indian Muslims....our Pralhad Joshi (Parliamentary Affairs Minister) is ready to debate with you," Shah told Rahul.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: In a first, BCCI wants national selectors to attend team meetings
text: The BCCI on Saturday said the new national selection panel will have to officially attend team meetings as and when required. "Normally...the touring selector meets coach and captain...to discuss about tactics and strategy. But this is new development," a senior BCCI official said. He added, "It’s a good thing if touring selector is allowed to sit in team meetings."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What a comeback, being a mother makes you stronger: Yuvraj Singh to Sania
text: Congratulating Sania Mirza on winning Hobart International tournament on her return to tennis, former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Congratulations! What a comeback. I guess being a mommy makes you stronger...Proud of you my friend." Sania, who had given birth to her son Izhaan Mirza Malik in October 2018, made a comeback to tennis after 2 years.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pune man suffers intracerebral haemorrhage while playing PUBG, dies
text: A 25-year-old man who suffered an intracerebral haemorrhage while playing PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) on Thursday in Maharashtra's Pune died on Saturday, police said. Intracerebral haemorrhage is a life-threatening type of stroke caused by bleeding within the brain tissue. "It seems the stroke occurred because the victim was over-excited while playing online game PUBG," an official said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Viral image shows 'Walking Buddy' option in Uber; company responds
text: An edited screenshot from the Uber app which shows a 'Walking Buddy' option among choices like 'Pool' and 'UberX' has gone viral. Featuring an icon with two people holding hands, the option cost $7.5 (about ₹533). Reacting to the image, Uber said, "Gotta get those steps in," while a user commented, "Why do you hold hands with the walking buddy?"
author: Dharna

headlines: Facebook translates Xi Jinping's name to 'Mr S**thole', apologises
text: Facebook has blamed a technical error for Chinese President Xi Jinping's name appearing as 'Mr S**thole' in posts on its platform when translated into English from Burmese. The social media platform apologised for any offence caused and said that the problem has been fixed. The error came to light on the second day of Xi's visit to Myanmar.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Twin brothers score 100 and 99.9 percentile in JEE Mains 2020
text: Twin brothers Nishant and Pranav Aggarwal have scored 100 and 99.9 percentile, respectively, in the JEE Mains 2020. "I...will appear for the test again and try to improve my rank," Pranav said. The brothers, who said that they love taking tests and aim to study at the IITs, devoted 10-12 hours daily for preparation.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: No state can deny implementation of CAA, it’s unconstitutional: Kapil Sibal
text: Days after Kerala moved Supreme Court against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Saturday stated that no state can deny the implementation of the CAA. "If CAA is passed no state can say 'I will not implement it'. It's not possible and is unconstitutional. You can oppose it, you can pass a resolution in the Assembly," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Man sexually abuses 4 minor daughters, held after one of them tells her teacher
text: A 47-year-old man in Kerala has been arrested for allegedly sexually abusing his four minor daughters aged 17, 15, 13 and 10. The younger siblings stay at a charitable boarding school while the elder one lives in the house. The abuse came to light after the 15-year old revealed it to her teacher who then informed the Child Protection Unit.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 10 musicians shot dead, bodies burned in attack by drug cartel in Mexico
text: Ten musicians were shot dead and their bodies were burned in an attack believed to have been carried out by a drug cartel in western Mexico, officials said. The members of the Nahuas indigenous group were returning from a party when they were attacked in Guerrero state. The victims, all men, were aged between 15 and 42.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Thought it was terrorist attack: US teachers sue airline over fuel dump on school
text: Four teachers sued Delta Air Lines after its jet dumped fuel over a school in California, US. The fuel dump had caused skin and lung irritation to around 60 people. "I thought...it must be a terrorist attack. All I could do was think of making sure my students were safe...they were screaming and crying," one of the teachers said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US Prez candidate Tulsi Gabbard defeats man who challenged her to push-up contest
text: US Presidential candidate Tulsi Gabbard defeated a man who challenged her to a push-up contest, a video of which has surfaced online. The man asked 38-year-old Gabbard whether she could beat fellow candidate and ex-Vice President Joe Biden in a push-up contest. Gabbard is a combat veteran who served in Iraq and a member of the Hawaii Army National Guard.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: They've 1 min to live...30 secs...boom: Trump recalls op to kill Iran General
text: While recalling the operation to kill Iranian General Qassem Soleimani in Iraq, US President Donald Trump said, "Military officer told me, 'Sir, they have approximately one minute to live, sir... 30 seconds, 10, 9...then all of a sudden boom. They're gone, sir.'" Trump acknowledged that the US strike "shook up the world" but said Soleimani "deserved to be hit hard".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Bhushan Power ex-MD bought ₹162 cr London house using laundered money: ED
text: The Enforcement Directorate has alleged that Sanjay Singal, the ex-MD of Bhushan Power and Steel, bought a house worth ₹162 crore in London's One Hyde Park complex using laundered money. He allegedly bought another house in Delhi's Jor Bagh for ₹74 crore using laundered money. Singal was the "mastermind" behind the diversion of loans taken by the company, ED said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter's maternal grandmother passes away
text: Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter's maternal grandmother Khadija Azeem, the mother of Neelima Azeem, has passed away. Condoling her death, Ishaan on Saturday took to Instagram to share some of her pictures and wrote, "Ammi...you instilled wit, fire, knowledge, perseverance, purpose and meaning in all of us." "You'll never be forgotten by anybody whose life you deeply impacted," he added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Impossible to show proof of religious persecution under CAA: Assam Minister
text: Assam Finance Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said under the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, it's impossible for someone to go back to their country and collect a copy of police report to show the proof of religious persecution. "Why would the police station...give that proof?" he added. However, the government will work out a process to verify their claims, Sarma further said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: CAA is a way to atone for the sins of Partition: Union Minister
text: Minister of State for MSME Pratap Chandra Sarangi claimed that the CAA was a way to "atone for the sins of Partition committed by our forefathers, a select few leaders", adding it should've been passed 70 years ago. Sarangi said Partition wasn't "unavoidable" and questioned why then-PM Jawaharlal Nehru entered into an agreement with those who proposed a two-nation theory.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: There's lot of competition between us: Sindhu on Saina
text: Talking about sporting rivalry with compatriot shuttler Saina Nehwal, PV Sindhu has said, "There is a lot of competition between us". "At the end of the day, she does her own things and I do my own," she added. On reports of rift with national coach Pullela Gopichand, Sindhu, who is currently world number six, said that nothing is wrong.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: E-mail chain on Cambridge Analytica data scandal released: Report
text: Brittany Kaiser, a Cambridge Analytica whistleblower, has released new documents which she claims is a copy of an e-mail chain exchanged between the company and Facebook, TechCrunch reported. The e-mails discussed the need for Cambridge Analytica to delete data associated with 87 million Facebook users. Facebook had also asked the company for a confirmation of the deletion, the report added.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Startup develops smart contact lens with screen, night vision, zoom-in feature
text: Silicon Valley-based startup Mojo Vision is prototyping a smart contact lens with an embedded display that utilizes augmented reality (AR) to show useful information like the weather, health data and notifications. Equipped with various sensors, the lenses will enhance the vision of wearers, with capabilities like zooming in and night vision. The display will be visible even with eyes closed.
author: Dharna

headlines: IIT Kharagpur develops AI-powered tech for reading legal cases
text: IIT Kharagpur has developed an artificial intelligence-powered method to automate the reading of legal case judgments. The researchers developed two deep neural models to understand the rhetorical roles of sentences in a legal case judgment. It segmented 50 judgments from the Supreme Court by labelling sentences and then performed extensive analysis of the human-assigned labels. nn
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Non-bailable warrant issued against BJP MP for evading court proceedings
text: A special court on Saturday issued non-bailable warrants against BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi and others for evading court proceedings in a case related to Congress' agitation in 2015 during which stone-pelting was reported. Joshi, a Congress leader back then, reportedly participated in the agitation. Apart from her, warrants have been issued against Congress leader Ajay Rai and four others.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Material made which is heat-insulating, heat-conducting at same time
text: Scientists have developed an extremely thin and transparent material that has different thermal conduction properties depending on the direction. The material can conduct heat extremely well in one direction while showing good thermal insulation in the other direction. The material consists of alternating layers of wafer-thin glass plates between which individual polymer chains are inserted.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Cong's 1st list of candidates for Delhi polls out, Alka to fight from Chandni Chowk
text: Congress today announced their first list of 54 candidates for the 70-seat Delhi Assembly elections. Alka Lamba will contest from Chandni Chowk, while former Delhi minister Ashok Walia has been fielded from Krishna Nagar and Arvinder Singh Lovely will fight from Gandhi Nagar. The elections will take place on February 8, while the counting will be held on February 11.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: My family doesn't want me to go to Pak, cricket is not bigger than life: Rahim
text: Bangladesh wicketkeeper-batsman Mushfiqur Rahim, who has refused to tour Pakistan with the team, has said that his family is not permitting him to go to Pakistan. "Cricket is not bigger than life. My family is afraid of the security condition in Pakistan. In this situation, I can’t go to Pakistan and play cricket there," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Dhoni man of his words, had said he would start training in Jan: J'khand coach
text: Reacting to MS Dhoni training with Jharkhand team, the team's coach said, "The last time we had spoken...he had said that he'd start in January and here you go. He's a man of his words." He added, "I'll be honest. I thought there will be a bit of rustiness...but what surprised me most was how he middled almost every ball."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Dhoni will play IPL 2020, CSK will retain him in IPL 2021 auction: Srinivasan
text: N Srinivasan, during a recent event, said that MS Dhoni will play in the upcoming IPL season. "He will go to the IPL 2021 auction and CSK will retain him," Srinivasan added. This comes after BCCI omitted Dhoni from the annual contract list and the latter was seen practising with the Jharkhand Ranji team.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Title town after more than 2 yrs: Sania after winning Hobart International
text: After winning the Hobart International women's doubles title with Nadiia Kichenok, Sania Mirza tweeted, "Gosh that felt good...Title town after more than 2 years." She added, "What an amazing week in Hobart...what a journey it has been." The title is Sania's 42nd WTA doubles title. The tournament was her first in two years.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 'Unending love for Amazon': RSS economic wing criticises Niti Aayog CEO
text: RSS economic wing Swadeshi Jagran Manch's co-convener Ashwani Mahajan criticised Niti Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant after he tweeted an article on Amazon's plans to export $10 billion worth of India-made goods by 2025. "We are perturbed by your unending love for Amazon, given the scenario that crores of small traders are on streets persecuted by deep discounts," Mahajan said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Dept of Military Affairs to oversee all border matters with China, Pak
text: The Department of Military Affairs (DMA), headed by Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat, will oversee key matters relating to India's neighbouring countries including border disputes, deployment of forces and border intelligence. These countries include Pakistan, China and Nepal, among others. The Defence Ministry order states that DMA will also oversee administration of Siachen matters.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: What are the powers granted to Delhi Police under the National Security Act?
text: The National Security Act (NSA) allows preventive detention of an individual if he/she is deemed a threat to national security and law and order. An individual can be detained without a charge for up to 12 months under NSA and need not be informed of the charges for 10 days. The detained individual isn't allowed a lawyer during the trial.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: News of Shabana's injury in accident distressing, I pray for her recovery: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to wish speedy recovery to actress Shabana Azmi, who was injured in a car accident on Mumbai-Pune Expressway. "The news of Shabana Azmiji’s injury in an accident is distressing. I pray for her quick recovery," he wrote. She was rushed to MGM Hospital in Navi Mumbai and is said to be out of danger.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Shabana Azmi shifted to Mumbai's Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital
text: Actor Shabana Azmi, who was injured in a car accident near Khalapur on Mumbai-Pune Expressway, has been shifted to Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital in Mumbai and is said to be stable. She was earlier admitted to Navi Mumbai's MGM hospital. The car she was travelling in rammed into a truck near Khalapur toll plaza earlier on Saturday.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Naked, acid-burnt body of woman found near wildlife sanctuary in UP
text: The naked and burnt body of a woman was found in a bush near the Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary in UP's Bahraich district. Her body was found by some herdsmen who informed the police. The face and other body parts of the woman, whose identity has not yet been ascertained, bore burn marks of acid or some other chemicals, officials said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Greenpeace, PETA named in UK counter-terror list
text: Environmental organisation Greenpeace and animal rights group PETA have been named in a UK counter-terrorism document distributed to medical staff and teachers. The document aims to catch those who could be at risk of committing terrorist offences. "We produce these documents to help officers...make informed decisions, including protecting crowded places at times of protest," officials said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: India's largest private lender HDFC Bank's Q3 profit rises 33% to ₹7,416 crore
text: India's largest private lender, HDFC Bank, on Saturday posted a nearly 33% jump in profit to ₹7,416 crore for the October-December quarter helped by growth in its loans portfolio. The lender’s core income, or net interest income, rose 12.6% to ₹14,172.9 crore. Gross bad loans as a percentage of total loans increased to 1.42% from 1.38% in the previous quarter.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Shikhar, Rohit progressing well, final call before 3rd ODI: BCCI
text: BCCI on Saturday said that injured openers Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma are "progressing well". "A call on their participation in the third ODI against Australia will be taken tomorrow before the match," it added. During the second ODI, while Dhawan was hit on rib-cage during the run-chase, Sharma picked up a shoulder injury during fielding on the boundary.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Bess youngest England spinner to take Test 5-wicket haul overseas
text: England spinner Dominic Bess has become England's youngest spinner to take five-wicket haul overseas during the ongoing third Test against South Africa. Notably, the 22-year-old scalped the top-five South African batsmen with the hosts going for lunch on 113 for five on the third day. Overall, Bess is the third-youngest England spinner to achieve the feat.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: I've played lesser and lesser in past 2 years: Umesh Yadav
text: Talking about playing for India, pacer Umesh Yadav said that he has played lesser and lesser cricket in the last two years. "The more I bowl, the better I will get," he said while adding that there hasn't been "optimum workload" for him. Umesh, who played his last ODI in October 2018, has played nine Tests since 2018.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Fitbit data can predict flu outbreaks: US study
text: Heart rate and sleep data from Fitbit fitness watches can help predict and alert public health officials about real-time flu outbreaks, a US study revealed. The study added this prediction was more accurate than the current surveillance methods. More than 47,000 Fitbit users' data was used for the study which showed the system helped improve and accelerate state-wide predictions.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: SC seeks details from govt on steps taken to implement e-mobility plan
text: The Supreme Court has sought details on the steps taken by the government to implement the National Electric Mobility Mission Plan 2020 (NEMMP 2020). A bench headed by Chief Justice SA Bobde asked the government to submit the details in four weeks. The move followed a petition filed by an NGO represented by senior advocate Prashant Bhushan.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: SpaceX simulated rocket failure test delayed due to bad weather
text: Elon Musk's SpaceX had to delay its test of an emergency abort system on an unmanned astronaut capsule until Sunday due to bad weather. SpaceX will destroy one of its own rockets in the test. It is meant to see Crew Dragon capsule's ability to separate from Falcon 9 in an emergency and carry astronauts safely.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: US-based Falcon Edge raises $46 mn for its first India-focussed fund
text: New York-based hedge fund Falcon Edge Capital has raised around $46 million for its first India-focussed fund called Falcon Edge India I LP. As per filings, it has raised the capital from nine investors. However, Falcon Edge did not reveal the names of its investors. The filings also stated that Falcon Edge India l LP was incorporated in 2018.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: 10 children die of 'mysterious' disease in J&K's Udhampur: CMO
text: At least 10 children have died and six others taken seriously ill due to a 'mysterious' disease in the 40-kilometer radius in Ramnagar block in Jammu and Kashmir, Udhampur's Chief Medical Officer KC Dogra said on Saturday. "The symptoms of the disease are routine that include fever and vomiting followed by a renal problem," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: India saw 1.3 lakh suicides in 2018, housewives accounted for 17.1%
text: Out of the 1,34,516 suicides reported in India in 2018, housewives accounted for 17.1% of the victims, the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) said. On an average, 35 unemployed and 36 self-employed people ended their lives daily in 2018 and accounted for 26,085 suicides. They outnumbered the figures of farmer or cultivator suicides which stood at 5,763.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No other way than implementing CAA: Kerala Governor
text: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan said that there is no way other than implementing Citizenship (Amendment) Act as it's a subject of Union List and not a state subject. He said CAA will be implemented under (Article) 254. "You may give your arguments by using your intellect, you have the right to challenge it in the Supreme Court," Khan said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Varsities shouldn't function like assembly line production unit: CJI
text: Chief Justice of India SA Bobde on Saturday said that Universities are not about brick and mortar only and must not function as an assembly line production unit. CJI Bobde, while addressing students at a convocation function, added that the idea of a university reflects what we want to achieve as a society.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Surrender first: Pak SC rejects Musharraf's plea in treason case
text: The Pakistan Supreme Court refused to entertain former President Pervez Musharraf's appeal against his death sentence in a high treason case, saying he must surrender himself first. Musharraf's attorney said his client will be filing another appeal within a month. The former Pakistani President was found guilty of treason in December 2019 over his imposition of emergency rule in 2007.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Trump rolls back Michelle Obama-promoted school lunch rules on her b'day
text: The Trump administration announced plans to further roll back healthy school lunch standards, promoted by former first lady Michelle Obama, on her 56th birthday. The new proposals would make it easier for schools to serve pizza, meat and potatoes over fresh vegetables, fruits and grains. The agriculture department said it was aimed at reducing food waste while maintaining nutritional integrity.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Piyush Goyal to lead Indian delegation at WEF 2020 in Davos
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will lead the Indian delegation at the 50th World Economic Forum at Davos, scheduled to be held from January 20-24. The Commerce Ministry said Goyal will also participate in an informal WTO ministerial gathering during his visit. He will be accompanied by a ministerial delegation including CMs of Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh and Finance Minister of Punjab.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Shabana Azmi injured as car rams into truck; Javed Akhtar unhurt
text: Actress Shabana Azmi was injured in a car accident on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway on Saturday. The car she was travelling in rammed into a truck near Khalapur toll plaza, a police official said. She has been admitted to MGM Hospital in Navi Mumbai, the official added. Javed Akhtar, who was also present along with her in the car, was unhurt.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Rihanna, Saudi businessman boyfriend break up after 3 yrs of dating: Reports
text: Singer Rihanna and her Saudi businessman boyfriend Hassan Jameel have broken up, according to reports. The two were first rumoured to be dating in June 2017. Jameel is the Deputy President and Vice Chairman of Saudi Arabia operations of family-owned business Abdul Latif Jameel, which owns the exclusive distribution rights to Toyota in Saudi Arabia.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Shivnarine Chanderpaul's son Tagenarine bats for entire day, scores 66*(274)
text: Former West Indies captain Shivnarine Chanderpaul's 23-year-old son Tagenarine Chanderpaul batted for an entire day in a four-day match to score an unbeaten 66 off 274 deliveries for Guyana against Barbados. Tagenarine batted for a period of 394 minutes. The 23-year-old has a batting average of 31.03 in first-class cricket prior to the ongoing match.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: My comments were cherry-picked: Guha on calling Rahul '5th-gen dynast'
text: Historian Ramachandra Guha on Saturday tweeted that his remarks on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi were part of "one-hour talk". "I am sorry that a reporter cherry-picked two sentences…to distort its meaning," he added.
