Speaking at Kerala Literature Festival, Guha had said that Rahul Gandhi, a "fifth-generation dynast" will be at disadvantage against PM Narendra Modi, who is a "self-made" person.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Rapes keep happening because of women like lawyer Jaising: Nirbhaya's mother
text: After senior advocate Indira Jaising advised Nirbhaya's mother to forgive her daughter's rapists, Nirbhaya's mother said, "Just because of women like [Jaising] and people who think like her, incidents like rape keep happening. She's a disgrace to women." "People like her keep earning money under the garb of human rights. I don't need her suggestions," she added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Burnt body of woman tied to a cot found in UP; bullet cartridges recovered
text: The burnt body of a woman tied to a cot was found near a tubewell in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor district on Friday. Empty bullet cartridges were also found near her body and the police said they're collecting her DNA samples to ascertain her identity. The post-mortem report will reveal if the woman was sexually assaulted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Man travelling on roof of train electrocuted to death in Mumbai
text: An unidentified man who was travelling on the roof of a train died of electrocution in Mumbai's Ghatkopar. The man "came in contact with high voltage OHE wire and burnt severely", Shivaji Sutar, Central Railway's Chief Public Relations Officer said. Services on the route towards Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus were brought to a halt for a while.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 2 men convicted of raping 5-yr-old girl, rapist attacks journalists in court
text: A Delhi court on Saturday convicted two men of raping a five-year-old girl in East Delhi in 2013. The child "experienced exceptional depravity and extreme brutality", Additional Sessions Judge Naresh Malhotra said. The convicts had raped the girl and inserted objects in her private parts. One of the convicts attacked journalists in court and tried to snatch their mobile phones.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US to screen travellers from Chinese city after 45 reported cases of new virus
text: The US authorities will at three airports begin screening people arriving on direct or connecting flights from the Chinese city of Wuhan who may have symptoms of a new virus that has infected 45 people. Two people have died in China from the new virus, known as Novel Coronavirus. The virus has spread to Japan and Thailand.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Trudeau pledges ₹13L compensation each to Canadians killed in Iran crash
text: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau pledged interim compensation of ₹13 lakh to each family of 57 Canadians who were killed when Iran accidentally shot down a Ukrainian plane, adding that he expected Iran to compensate them. The aid was being provided to assist with funeral arrangements and travel to Iran, among other costs. No Canadian's remains have been repatriated so far.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: China's per capita GDP crosses $10,000 for 1st time, 5 times that of India
text: China's per capita GDP surpassed $10,000 for the first time in 2019, reaching $10,276, and the country is on track to become a high-income economy by 2024. The world's second-largest economy expanded 6.1% last year, its slowest growth in 29 years. India is in the lower-middle-income category with a per capita GDP of $2,010 in 2018.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Ministers including me have hidden numbers, this govt crossed limits: Chidambaram
text: Ex-Finance Minister P Chidambaram has acknowledged that every minister, including himself, has "hidden some numbers" but this government has "gone beyond all limit". Talking about off-budget borrowings, he said, "One or two months you can adjust it...But these guys are doing it wholesale which is questionable." Nobody believes the numbers released by the Indian government, he added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I don't think Marvel and I are suitable for each other: Parasite director
text: Filmmaker Bong Joon Ho, whose 'Parasite' received six nominations for Oscars 2020, has said he "intuitively feels" that he and Marvel Studios aren't "suitable for each other". "It's just best to do what you're good at," he added. Bong had previously said he hoped to maintain a distance from superhero films, stating that he "can't stand people wearing tight-fitting clothes".
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: NPR is nothing but NRC in disguise: P Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday said that the National Population Register (NPR) is "nothing but National Register of Citizens (NRC) in disguise". "We will not agree to NPR being rolled out from April 2020," he added. The former finance minister also appealed to all parties opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act to come together on one platform.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Harry Maguire named new Manchester United captain
text: Defender Harry Maguire has been named the new Manchester United captain, six months after his £80 million move from Leicester. Maguire will take over as skipper from Ashley Young, who completed his move to Inter Milan on Friday. "He's come in and been a leader in the group," United coach Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: It's easy to point the finger at me: Moeen Ali
text: Speaking about his break from Test cricket, England all-rounder Moeen Ali said, "I feel like sometimes it's easy to point the finger at me... [That] was one of the reasons why I... needed to step back from Test cricket." Talking about support from ECB, Ali said, "They've just said, 'Whenever you're ready, mate. We'll be here for you'."
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Sania Mirza wins doubles title after returning from maternity break
text: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza won the Hobart International doubles title after returning to tennis after a two-year-long maternity break. The unseeded Indo-Ukrainian pair of Sania and Nadiia Kichenok defeated the second seed Chinese team 6-4, 6-4 in one hour 21 minutes. This is Sania's 42nd WTA doubles title and her first since Brisbane International trophy in 2017.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Vinesh Phogat wins gold at Rome ranking series
text: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat on Friday won gold in the ongoing Rome ranking series Matteo Pellicone. Vinesh defeated Ecuador's Luisa Elizabeth Valverde 4-0 to secure the first position in the 53kg category. On her way to the gold medal bout, she defeated Ukraine's Khrystyna Bereza and China's Lannuan Luo by technical superiority. She defeated Chinese wrestler Qianyu Pang 4-2 in semis.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: CAIT to launch individual e-stores for traders, says not against e-comm
text: Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said it will soon launch individual e-stores for traders at the national level under which it has completed a pilot in Madhya Pradesh. CAIT Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said the traders' body had nothing against e-commerce and was trying to align traders with the industry. CAIT was against platforms "flouting" FDI norms, he added.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Study shows risks associated with cannabis exposure during pregnancy
text: A new study from researchers at Western University and Queen's University has definitively shown that regular exposure to THC, the main psychoactive ingredient in cannabis, during pregnancy has a significant impact on placental and fetal development. In an experimental rat model, the researchers noted a reduction in birth weight of 8% and decreased brain and liver growth by over 20%.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Male sparrows less intimidated by songs of aging rivals: Study
text: A new study has found that male sparrows show more aggressive behaviour towards younger-sounding male rivals. The team had set up a speaker in the territories of 35 male swamp sparrows in a Pennsylvania marsh and played them five-minute audio clips of stranger males recorded at age two and again at the age 10.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Pakistan-origin woman elected sarpanch in Rajasthan panchayat polls
text: A Pakistani immigrant has been elected sarpanch of Natwara gram panchayat in Rajasthan, five months after she received her Indian citizenship. Neeta Kanwar came to Jodhpur from Sindh 18 years ago and had been seeking citizenship since 2011 after she got married into a Rajput family. Neeta said that her father-in-law, who has been a three-time sarpanch, was her inspiration.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Osmania University professor arrested for alleged Maoist links
text: The Telangana police on Saturday arrested an Osmania University professor, Chintakindi Kasim, on charges of allegedly working for the banned outfit CPI(Maoist). The police have alleged that Kasim was "actively recruiting cadre for the Maoist outfit". Kasim is an accused in a 2016 case when the police had seized some documents being transported to Maoist party leaders.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: US govt dumping sand on Miami Beach to tackle beach erosion
text: As part of US government measures to protect Florida's tourist destinations against the effects of climate change, the US Army Corps of Engineers began dumping hundreds of thousands of tons of sand on eroded areas of Miami Beach. The $16 million project is part of a $158 million federally funded plan to protect Miami from hurricanes and control beach erosion.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Will give you another chance: Ukraine Prez rejects PM's resignation
text: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday rejected Prime Minister Oleksiy Honcharuk's resignation following the release of audiotapes wherein PM purportedly criticised the President's understanding of the economy. "I decided to give you and your government another chance if you can solve some problems that our people are worried about," Zelenskyy said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 86 people jailed for 55 yrs in Pak over protests against Asia Bibi
text: A Pakistani court in Rawalpindi sentenced 86 members of an Islamist party Tehreek-e-Labbaik to 55-year prison terms each for taking part in rallies in 2018 over the acquittal of Christian woman Asia Bibi in a blasphemy case. Charges against those sentenced include damaging public property, beating people up and disrupting normal life.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: My 16-yr-old son donated ₹28k from pocket money for Aus bushfire relief: Juhi
text: Juhi Chawla has revealed that her 16-year-old son Arjun Mehta, who is currently studying in a boarding school in the UK, donated £300 (around ₹28,000) from his pocket money for Australian bushfire relief. "I am really happy and grateful to God. I feel so good knowing his heart is in the right place," Chawla said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Understand sufferings by the blockade: Delhi Police to Shaheen Bagh protesters
text: The Delhi Police has appealed to anti-CAA protesters at Shaheen Bagh to clear the Kalindi Kunj-Shaheen Bagh stretch in larger public interest. "We appeal to agitators...to understand the sufferings that the complete highway blockade is causing to residents of Delhi and NCR, Senior Citizens, emergency patients and school going children," the Delhi Police tweeted.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Voice call, SMS services to be restored for prepaid users across J&K
text: Voice call and SMS facilities will be restored for prepaid mobile users in Jammu and Kashmir, Principal Secretary Rohit Kansal said on Saturday. Kansal added that 2G mobile data on postpaid mobiles for accessing whitelisted websites shall be allowed in all 10 districts of Jammu and Kupwara, Bandipora in Kashmir division. The services have been suspended for almost five months.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: ICC shares latest pic of world's largest cricket stadium under construction
text: The ICC took to social media to share the latest picture of the largest cricket stadium which is under construction in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. "A glimpse of Motera Cricket Stadium under construction in Ahmedabad. When complete, it will be the largest in the world, holding 110,000 fans," ICC captioned the picture. The stadium will likely open in March this year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What is the concept of lucky loser via which Prajnesh entered Australian Open?
text: India's top-ranked men's singles player, Prajnesh Gunneswaran, qualified for the Australian Open men's singles main draw despite losing the qualifier. Prajnesh will enter the Grand Slam as 'lucky loser' after a few direct entrants withdrew due to injuries. A lucky loser is one who loses in qualifying round but enters the main draw before when another player withdraws.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Bezos meets rival Ambani and other business leaders, concludes India visit
text: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos met India's top business leaders including Mukesh Ambani and Adi Godrej on Friday, concluding his 3-day India visit. Ambani's Reliance Industries is testing e-commerce venture JioMart, which will compete with Amazon and Flipkart. Others in the meeting included Infosys CEO Salil Parekh, Hindustan Unilever MD Sanjiv Mehta and Standard Chartered Bank India head Zarin Daruwala.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Bezos doesn't tell us what to say: Washington Post journo after BJP alleges bias
text: After BJP leader Vijay Chauthaiwale called Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post's editorial policy "highly biased" and "agenda-driven", a senior editor at the publication, Eli Lopez tweeted, "Bezos doesn't tell [us] what to write." He said, "Independent journalism isn't about charming governments." "The work of our correspondents and columnists fits within India's democratic traditions," Lopez added.
author: Dharna

headlines: Band member collapses on stage during bushfire relief concert in Australia
text: A member of a music group collapsed and went into cardiac arrest at a bushfire relief concert in Australia on Friday. He is recovering following surgery for obstruction of blood flow in a coronary artery. Paramedics said the member was alive because of actions of an off-duty nurse who was attending the concert and rushed to the stage to assist.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Make Iran great again: Trump tells Iranian leaders
text: US President Donald Trump called upon Iranian leaders to "Make Iran Great Again", adding that Iranians "who love America deserve a government that's more interested in helping them achieve their dreams than killing them for demanding respect". This comes after Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said that the US stands by the Iranians "to stab them in the heart".
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Lawyer who led trial to impeach Clinton to defend Trump in impeachment trial
text: US President Donald Trump's defence team for the impeachment trial in the US Senate will include Kenneth Starr who was a prosecutor for former US President Bill Clinton's impeachment in 1999. Starr was an independent counsel whose investigation led to Clinton's impeachment for lying under oath about an affair with White House intern Monica Lewinsky.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: $8bn J&J award to man for not informing drug could grow breasts cut to $6.8mn
text: A US judge slashed from $8 billion to $6.8 million the punitive damages award against Johnson & Johnson to a man who claimed it failed to warn boys that using its antipsychotic drug Risperdal could grow breasts. The 26-year-old was prescribed Risperdal in 2003 for autism-related symptoms. The pharma giant earlier said it faced lawsuits by 13,600 people over Risperdal.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: We are ready to handle India's restrictions: World's biggest palm oil planter
text: Malaysia's Sime Darby, the world's largest palm oil planter, said it could export more crude palm oil to India and divert refined oil to other markets. This comes after India said traders will now require permits to import refined palm oil, whose main supplier is Malaysia. "Regulatory challenges are part and parcel of the palm oil industry," Sime Darby said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Closure of Anu's case is another example of NCW's inefficiency: Tanushree
text: Reacting to the closure of sexual harassment case against Anu Malik by National Commission for Women (NCW), Tanushree Dutta said it's just another example of NCW's inefficiency and redundancy. "Like...[others], [NCW] is susceptible to heavy corruption [and] biased influence," she added. Dutta, who'd accused Nana Patekar in the #MeToo movement, said, "They never...summoned the accused in my case."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I won't be doing Apu's voice in 'The Simpsons' anymore: Actor Hank
text: Actor Hank Azaria, who voiced Indian shopkeeper Apu in animated series 'The Simpsons', has said he won't be doing the voiceover anymore "unless there's some way to transition it". This comes after years of criticism and accusations of racism against the makers. Addressing the criticism, show's creator Matt Groening had earlier said, "I'm proud of what we do on...show."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Vadodara residents write over 42,000 letters in support of CAA to PM
text: BJP workers sent over 42,000 letters written by residents of Vadodara to PM Narendra Modi to show their support for the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. BJP workers on Friday took out a rally to the local post office before sending the letters. "The letters said CAA is good for the country's security and they support it," senior postmaster MD Shukla said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Bhim Army chief moves Delhi court seeking modification of bail conditions
text: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad, accused of inciting crowd during anti-CAA protest in Delhi, on Friday moved Delhi court seeking modification of bail conditions imposed on him. Azad was released on bail from Tihar Jail on condition that he will leave Delhi for the next four weeks and was also directed not to hold any dharna till the Delhi elections.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Things would've been different had we not lost 3 quick wickets: Smith
text: On the 36-run defeat in the second ODI against India, Australia batsman Steve Smith said they lost the match when they lost "three wickets in between 30 and 40 overs". "If we had someone that had been out there for a while...things may have been different," he added. Australia were 178/2 and then lost next three wickets for 43 runs.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Mastercard to invest $1 bn in India for technological development
text: Mastercard plans to invest nearly $1 billion over the next five years for its technology research and development (R&D) efforts in India. The investment will cover an R&D facility at Pune and another centre at Vadodara, Mastercard Customer Delivery South Asia Head Amitabh Khanna told Business Standard. Khanna added that both the facilities catered to Mastercard's global operations.n
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Xiaomi spins off POCO as an independent company
text: Chinese electronics company Xiaomi has announced it is spinning off its premium smartphone sub-brand POCO as a standalone company. POCO, which was created in 2018 and shared Xiaomi's supply chain, will operate independently with its own team and market strategy in India. This comes months after POCO's head of product Jai Mani, a former Google executive, left the company.
author: Dharna

headlines: Astronauts on Moon, Mars may grow homes out of fungi, says NASA
text: Instead of habitats made of metal and glass, NASA is prototyping technologies that could grow structures out of fungi on Moon and Mars to house astronauts. With the concept, explorers would take a compact habitat built of lightweight material with dormant fungi to Mars. When they add water, the fungi would grow around the framework into a functional human habitat.
author: Dharna

headlines: Asteroid, not volcanic eruptions, led to dinosaurs' extinction: Study
text: A Yale-led team of researchers has discovered that a 10-kilometre-wide asteroid that crashed into modern-day Mexico was the sole driver of the mass extinction that killed dinosaurs. Gas emissions from the volcanic eruptions in India, thought to have contributed to the event, instead happened 200,000 years before asteroid's impact, the team said. The extinction event occurred 66 million years ago.
author: Dharna

headlines: Study on mice finds soybean oil causes genetic changes in brain
text: A new research study on mice has shown that soybean oil not only leads to obesity and diabetes, but could also lead to neurological conditions like autism, Alzheimer's disease, anxiety, and depression. According to the US Department of Agriculture, soybean oil is by far the most widely produced and consumed edible oil in the US.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: MP ATS detains doctor over suspicious envelopes to Sadhvi Pragya
text: Madhya Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has detained a doctor from Maharashtra's Nanded district for allegedly sending envelopes containing photos of PM Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah crossed with a pen to BJP MP Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur. The accused was already on police radar. He has earlier been arrested for writing letters to officials, claiming his brother has terror links.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: 4 South Koreans, 3 guides missing in Nepal avalanche
text: At least seven people went missing, including four South Koreans and three Nepali guides, after an avalanche hit in Nepal's Annapurna region. The South Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs said the avalanche hit at an altitude of 10,600 feet on Friday. Nepal police said that poor weather was hampering rescue efforts in the region.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Jean Paul Gaultier announces retirement after 50 yrs in fashion
text: Designer Jean Paul Gaultier has announced that he's retiring from fashion and that his upcoming show on January 22, which will celebrate 50 years of his career, will be his last. He added his high-end fashion and perfume business will continue "with a new concept". Jean, who showcased his first collection in 1976, is known for designing Madonna's "cone bra".
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw conferred Australia's highest civilian honour
text: Biocon founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has been conferred with Australia's highest civilian honour, the Order of Australia, for her significant service to advancing the country's partnership with India. "Dr Mazumdar-Shaw is a tireless champion of commercial, educational, and people-to-people links between our two countries," Australia's High Commissioner to India Harinder Sidhu said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: In school, I used to grab boys and kiss them when teacher was out: Kalki
text: Talking about her school days in an interview, actress Kalki Koechlin said she was "very naughty" in class and used to 'grab boys and kiss them' when their teacher went out. "You know, how boys have that phase, right before puberty, where they hate girls? I would find it really fun to...chase them, and try to kiss them," she added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Author jokes about Kohli's batting position involving Anushka; fans say 'Not funny'
text: Joking about India captain Virat Kohli shuffling his batting position, author Bhaavna Arora tweeted, "Anushka is angry as Kohli is trying new positions with Australians but not with her." Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "This isn't funny at all." Another wrote, "Just because she's an actress married to a cricketer doesn't give you a license to crack these jokes."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: NCW has no concern for women: Sona on closure of Anu's sexual harassment case
text: Sona Mohapatra has reacted to the closure of sexual harassment case against Anu Malik by National Commission for Women, citing "lack of communication and substantial evidence from the complainant." Sona said it was "untrue", adding that she collated multiple testimonies and mailed it to NCW when they asked for it. "[It has] zero concern...no real interest in women," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Maharashtra Minister gets detained in K'taka, escorted back till state border
text: Maharashtra Minister Rajendra Patil Yadravkar was detained in Karnataka's Belagavi on Friday where he had gone to participate in Martyrs Day programme of Maharashtra Ekikaran Samiti. Police later escorted Yadravkar back till the state border. "We didn't allow him to deliver a speech as it would have vitiated law and order situation," police said while denying that they detained Yadravkar.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Kerala did a disastrous thing by electing Rahul Gandhi: Ramachandra Guha
text: Speaking at the Kerala Literature Festival, historian Ramachandra Guha said Kerala did a "disastrous thing" by electing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to the parliament. "If you Malayalis make the mistake of re-electing Rahul Gandhi in 2024 too, you are merely handing over an advantage to Narendra Modi," he added. Rahul had won from Wayanad constituency in the Lok Sabha elections.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Jeff Bezos delivers package from kirana store in Mumbai, shares pictures
text: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos delivered a package from a kirana store and shared pictures on Instagram. "Amazon partners with thousands of kirana stores all over India as delivery points. It's good for customers, and it helps the shop owners earn additional income. Got to visit one in Mumbai. Thank you, Amol, for letting me deliver a package," Bezos wrote.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: How dare she suggest this: Nirbhaya's mom on Jaising's 'forgive rapists' advice
text: After senior advocate Indira Jaising advised Nirbhaya's mother to forgive her daughter's rapists like Sonia Gandhi forgave Rajiv Gandhi's assassination convict, Nirbhaya's mother said, "I can't believe how Jaising even dared to suggest such this." "Whole country wants the convicts to be executed. Just because of people like her, justice is not done with rape victims," she added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Dancer says her act was stopped at UP govt event, told 'Qawwali nahi chalegi'
text: Delhi-based Kathak dancer Manjari Chaturvedi, who performed at an event organised by Uttar Pradesh government recently, said the music was paused midway during her Sufi-Kathak performance. Chaturvedi said that next act was announced while she was still on stage. She claimed that event officials rushed to the front row and told her, "Qawwali nahi chalegi, stage par qawwali nahi hogi."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Policemen, villagers carry sick policeman to hospital in snow for 7 kms
text: Police personnel and local villagers from Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul-Spiti district carried a sick policeman on shoulders through the snow for seven kilometres to reach a hospital. The incident took place on the morning of January 17. Recently, a video of jawans carrying a pregnant woman to a hospital through thick snow in Kashmir was tweeted by PM Narendra Modi.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 'Howdy, Modi!'-style event being planned for Trump's India visit: Report
text: US President Donald Trump may hold an event similar to PM Narendra Modi's 'Howdy, Modi!' in Houston when he visits India next month, according to a Hindustan Times report. Americans of Gujarati origin are likely to join the event which will reportedly be held in Ahmedabad. PM Modi is also expected to participate in the event, the report stated.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 250-kg ISIS leader 'Jabba the Jihadi' arrested, taken away in pickup truck
text: Shifa al-Nima, an Islamic State leader also known as 'Jabba the Jihadi' has been arrested in Iraq. Shifa, who weighs over 250 kilograms, was taken away in a pickup truck. Security forces said he was responsible for a fatwa to bomb a mosque, which was destroyed by Islamic State in 2014 after they took over Mosul.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 14-year-old girl kidnapped in US, uses Snapchat to share location with friends
text: A 14-year-old girl who was kidnapped in US' Northern California used Snapchat to share her location with her friends, who then informed police. The girl was drugged by a man before being sexually assaulted by him in a vehicle. The man along with two others then drove the girl to a motel where he sexually assaulted her again, police said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: City makes bricks from volcanic ash to help those hit by disaster in Philippines
text: The Philippine city of Biñan, which has been covered in ash from the Taal volcano, is making bricks from the ash to help neighbouring towns hit by the natural disaster. The mayor of Biñan has ordered residents to collect ash on homes, cars and roads and put it in sacks to be sent to a state-owned factory.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Ranbir is one of the best actors of our generation: Shraddha
text: Shraddha Kapoor, who'll be seen alongside Ranbir Kapoor in Luv Ranjan's film, has said Ranbir is one of the best actors of this generation. Adding that she's "super excited" to work with Ranbir, Shraddha said, "Nothing was offered to me earlier with [him], I'm looking forward to this film." The yet-to-be-titled comedy film is scheduled to release in March 2021.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kind of like my film's trailer more: Saif on Sara's Love Aaj Kal trailer
text: Saif Ali Khan, while talking about the trailer of Kartik Aaryan and Sara Ali Khan-starrer 'Love Aaj Kal', said, "I kind of like my film's (Love Aaj Kal with Deepika Padukone in 2009) trailer more." "What to say, but I wish them all the best," he added. "I wish Sara...best for everything she does because she's my daughter," said Saif.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Really glad that Ranveer introduced me and Sara to each other: Kartik
text: Kartik Aaryan said at an event that he's "really glad" that Ranveer Singh introduced him and Sara Ali Khan to each other. "I'm...thankful to Ranveer for...becoming a link between our friendship," he added. Kartik and Sara will be seen together in Imtiaz Ali's directorial film 'Love Aaj Kal', which is a successor of Imtiaz's 2009 film by the same name.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Aishwarya in talks to portray courtesan-turned-actor Binodini: Reports
text: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, who was last seen in 2018 film 'Fanney Khan', is in talks with filmmaker Pradeep Sarkar to portray courtesan-turned-theatre actor Binodini Dasi in his film, as per reports. The actress has reportedly given a "verbal nod" but will sign the film only after reading the final script. Earlier, Vidya Balan was approached to play Binodini, reports said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Vikrant's 'Cargo' to be screened at South by Southwest festival in US
text: Vikrant Massey's sci-fi film 'Cargo' will have its North American premiere at the 2020 edition of South by Southwest festival. Directed by Arati Kadav, the film will be premiered under the Global section of the film festival. Talking about it, Vikrant said, "I feel blessed for receiving so much applause not just from the country but across the world."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Laughed, cried, had goosebumps: Cricketer Jonty Rhodes on Gully Boy
text: Former South African cricketer Jonty Rhodes on Friday took to Twitter to laud Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gully Boy'. "Been listening to the #GullyBoy soundtrack ever since meeting @SiddhantChturvD (Siddhant Chaturvedi) last year...finally got to watch the entire movie on my [flight] to India last night," he said. "Thanks to subtitles, I laughed; cried and had goosebumps," he added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Stokes 2nd to register 4,000 runs, 100+ wickets in Tests for Eng
text: All-rounder Ben Stokes became only the second cricketer after Ian Botham to have over 4,000 runs and over 100 wickets in Tests for England after scoring his ninth Test ton while facing South Africa on Friday. Behind Stokes in the list is former England all-rounder Andrew Flintoff, who took 226 Test wickets but fell short of 4,000 runs.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: He has to learn: Holding on Rabada's celebration
text: Former West Indies pacer Michael Holding criticised South African pacer Kagiso Rabada's celebration after a wicket against England that led to him being handed a ban for the Wanderers Test. "He has to learn. You can't keep making the same mistakes. He has to remember he is damaging his team," Holding said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Tesla faces US probe over 127 claims of cars accelerating on their own
text: A US agency is evaluating a petition which claims that Tesla cars contain a defect causing sudden unintended acceleration. The petition for investigation cited 127 consumer complaints involving 123 unique vehicles, 110 crashes and 52 injuries. In one of the complaints, the owner said his closed and locked Model S began accelerating on its own, crashing into a parked vehicle.
author: Dharna

headlines: Send those opposing Bharat Ratna for Savarkar to Andaman jail once: Raut
text: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut on Saturday said those who believe that Bharat Ratna shouldn't be conferred on Veer Savarkar should be put in Andaman's cellular jail for two days where Savarkar was once lodged. "They will then realise his sacrifice," Raut added. "We may have different views...but this is what democracy is," Shiv Sena's Aaditya Thackeray said on Raut's remarks.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: SpaceX plans to send a million people to Mars by 2050 via Starship: CEO Musk
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has revealed the company's goals around Starship spacecraft and Mars-colonising missions. Musk tweeted that building 100 Starships per year may send 100,000 people from Earth to Mars every time the planets' orbits line up favourably. When a user questioned if the goal meant a million people could be sent to Mars by 2050, Musk replied, "Yes".
author: Dharna

headlines: Delhi man offers jobs at fake Thailand airline 'Yo Air', gets arrested
text: Delhi Police has arrested a man for cheating people on the pretext of providing them employment in a Thailand-based airline 'Yo Air', which does not exist. Sanket Jha, originally from Mumbai, was arrested after a Noida-based woman realised she was being cheated when Jha, during the job interview, asked her for a demand draft of ₹2.55 lakh before her selection.n
author: Dharna

headlines: 97-year-old woman elected sarpanch in Rajasthan panchayat polls
text: Vidya Devi, a 97-year-old woman, was elected as sarpanch in the panchayat election in Rajasthan's Sikar, the result of which was declared on Friday, an official said. Vidya Devi was declared the winner from Purana Bas gram panchayat after she defeated her nearest rival by 207 votes. Devi's husband was a sarpanch from the panchayat for 25 years before 1990.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: United Nations cuts India's GDP growth forecast for 2019-20 to 5%
text: The United Nations on Friday cut its GDP growth forecast for India in 2019-20 to 5%. This comes a day after its World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP) 2020 report projected the country's economy to expand at 5.7%, compared to 7.6% estimated earlier. The WESP report hadn't taken into account the latest growth numbers released by India's National Statistical Office.
author: Dharna

headlines: UrbanClap unveils Republic Day sale, offers complimentary services
text: UrbanClap has launched its largest ever Republic Day Sale. Customers can avail unique deals like free sofa deep cleaning and bathroom deep cleaning service on buying select packages and one plus one deals on servicing of appliances like AC and Geyser. The special offers will be valid till 26th January only.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: JEE Main 2020 result announced, 9 students top with 100 percentile
text: The result of Joint Entrance Exam (JEE) Main 2020, which took place earlier this month, has been announced and as many as nine candidates have scored 100 percentile. A total of 8.69 lakh students, including 6.04 lakh male, 2.64 lakh female and three transgenders, had appeared for the exam. It's mandatory to clear JEE Main to appear for JEE Advanced.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: AB de Villiers hit ODIs' fastest hundred in 40 minutes
text: Ex-South Africa batsman AB de Villiers slammed the fastest ODI hundred off 31 balls against Windies in 40 minutes on January 18, 2015. He came to bat in the 39th over and scored a 44-ball 149 in 59 minutes, hitting 16 sixes and 9 fours. De Villiers overtook New Zealand's Corey Anderson, who had smashed a 36-ball ton in 2014.n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Delhi Police given power to detain under NSA for 3 months amid CAA protests
text: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal has given Delhi Police Commissioner the power to detain under the National Security Act (NSA) from January 19 to April 18. Under the Act, an individual can be detained without a charge for up to 12 months. This comes amid protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act in the National Capital.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: I grew up hearing about his world record: Sachin on Bapu Nadkarni's demise
text: Condoling the death of former India all-rounder Bapu Nadkarni, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Very sad to hear about the demise of Shri Bapu Nadkarni." He added, "I grew up hearing about the record of him bowling 21 consecutive maiden overs in a Test. My condolences to his family and dear ones. Rest in Peace Sir." Nadkarni died on Friday aged 86.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Panic button was pressed too early due to social media: Kohli on batting shuffle
text: On being criticised about changing his batting position in the Mumbai ODI, Team India captain Virat Kohli said, "We live in the days of social media and panic button was pressed too early." He added, "We know exactly what we're doing in the dressing room. On the outside there's a lot of panic that we don't really focus on."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: World has gone mad, cricket has shot itself in the foot: Vaughan on Rabada ban
text: Reacting to South Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada getting banned for his celebration of England captain Joe Root's wicket, former England captain Michael Vaughan said, "Cricket really does know how to shoot itself in the foot." "The world has gone mad if a bowler cannot celebrate dismissing the opposition captain with a snorter," he added, terming the ban as "ridiculous".
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sourav Ganguly refuses to comment on MS Dhoni not being awarded annual contract
text: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly on Friday refused to comment on former India captain MS Dhoni's omission from the annual central contract list. Dhoni, who last played for India in the 2019 World Cup, hasn't been given a contract for 2019-20 season despite being in Grade A for 2018-19 season. The 38-year-old was recently seen practising with Jharkhand state team.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Four tech firms sue Facebook, accuse it of running worst 'anti-competitive scheme'
text: Four technology companies are suing Facebook for allegedly running "the most brazen, willful and anti-competitive scheme in a generation". The federal lawsuit termed Facebook's ownership of Whatsapp and Instagram as "one of the US' largest unlawful monopolies" and warned against its planned integration of the apps. They called for CEO Mark Zuckerberg to give up his majority stake in Facebook.
author: Dharna

headlines: '5th-gen dynast' Rahul has no chance against 'self-made' PM Modi: Guha
text: While speaking about Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, historian Ramachandra Guha said that India doesn't want a "fifth-generation dynast". Adding that PM Narendra Modi is "self-made" and his "great advantage" is that he's not Rahul Gandhi, Guha said that as a fifth-generation dynast, Rahul "will be at a disadvantage against a self-made person". Guha was recently detained while protesting against CAA.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Former Chhattisgarh CM Ajit Jogi, son booked after domestic help's suicide
text: Chhattisgarh Police on Thursday registered a case against former CM Ajit Jogi and his son Amit for allegedly abetting the suicide of domestic help, identified as Santosh Kaushik. The case was registered after Santosh's brother claimed that Santosh was falsely accused of theft and tortured. Santosh allegedly hanged himself in the parking area outside Jogi's residence on January 15.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Ex-Paytm executive Sonia, accused in CEO extortion case, joins SAIF Partners
text: Former Paytm Vice President of Communications, Sonia Dhawan, has joined private equity firm SAIF Partners as an Advisor of Corporate Communications. After receiving bail in the data theft and extortion case at Paytm in March, Dhawan joined Sheroes, where Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma is an early investor. She later joined Paytm First Games as the communications and marketing head.
author: Dharna

headlines: 4 men accused of molesting 13-yr-old beat her mother to death while out on bail
text: A 40-year-old woman, whose daughter was allegedly molested at the age of 13 in 2018 by six men, was beaten to death by four of them while they were out on bail in Kanpur. Police said the incident took place on January 9 and they've arrested three of the attackers. The woman's sister, who's a BJP leader, was also injured.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: SC to hear farmers' petitions to stop land acquisition for bullet train project
text: The Supreme Court will hear petitions from a group of farmers seeking to halt land acquisition for India's first bullet train project on March 20. The court issued notices to the Centre, Gujarat government and others seeking their view on the petitions. The farmers' allegations that the land acquisition process is illegal was rejected by a lower court in September.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Shirdi to remain shut from Jan 19 amid row over Sai Baba's birthplace
text: The administrative body of Sai Baba's Samadhi called for the indefinite closure of the Shirdi temple after Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray reportedly said Pathri is Sai Baba's birthplace. "We have announced to close Shirdi from January 19," said Bhausaheb Wakchaure, member of Saibaba Sansthan Trust. "A meeting of villagers will be convened Saturday evening to discuss the issue," Wakchaure added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Forgive rapists like Sonia forgave husband's killer: Jaising to Nirbhaya's mom
text: Senior advocate Indira Jaising has advised Nirbhaya's mother to forgive the men who've been convicted of gangraping her daughter. "While I fully identify with the pain of Asha Devi, I urge her to follow the example of Sonia Gandhi who forgave (Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict) Nalini and said she didn't want the death penalty for her," Jaising tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: US nurse kills husband by poisoning drinking water with eye drops; jailed for 25 yrs
text: A nurse in South Carolina, US, has been sentenced to 25 years in prison after she pleaded guilty to killing her husband by poisoning his drinking water with eye drops. Lana Clayton said that she was abused by her husband, claiming that she had poisoned him in 2018 to make him sick and didn't intend to kill him.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pak man fakes death and poses as wife to claim ₹9 crore insurance; jailed in UK
text: A Pakistani man has been sentenced in the UK after he impersonated his wife on the phone to try and fake his own death and make a false insurance claim worth a total of ₹9 crore. The 39-year-old, who is already serving seven years and 11 months in prison, has been sentenced to five years and seven months in jail.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Deaf man sues porn site, says he can't enjoy videos as they lack subtitles
text: A deaf man has sued a porn site for violating the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) by not having subtitles on its videos. Yaroslav Suris has filed a class-action lawsuit against the porn site claiming its lack of subtitles is a denial of access, saying he can't enjoy the videos. Suris added he had purchased the porn site's premium subscription.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: World's shortest man, who measured 67.08 cm, passes away aged 27
text: World's shortest man Khagendra Thapa Magar, who stood at 67.08 cm (2 ft 2.41 in) tall when measured in 2010, has passed away at the age of 27 in Nepal. Magar died of pneumonia at a Pokhara hospital. "He had been in and out of hospital because of pneumonia. But this time his heart was also affected," his brother said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Singer Ariana Grande sued for copyright infringement over '7 Rings'
text: American singer Ariana Grande has been sued by artist Josh Stone, who claims that singer's Grammy-nominated song '7 Rings' was plagiarized from his 'You Need I Got It' which he recorded two years ago. The suit alleges that the producer of the song lifted "key elements" for Grande. It further alleged that her song has a similar rhythm and notes.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Intellectuals opposing CAA are parasites, devils: WB BJP Prez Dilip Ghosh
text: BJP West Bengal's President Dilip Ghosh criticised intellectuals opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and called them "creatures, devils and parasites". Referring to a protest march by theatre personalities in Kolkata, he called them "devils who live on our food and oppose us". Ghosh recently said that anti-CAA protesters were shot like dogs in BJP-ruled states like UP, Assam and Karnataka.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Only time they aren't together is when they're asleep: Finch on Smith, Labuschagne
text: During the presentation ceremony after second India-Australia ODI, commentator Harsha Bhogle jokingly asked Australia captain Aaron Finch, "Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne are long lost brothers. Aren't they?" Responding to Bhogle, Finch said, "They certainly are. They love batting together. They spend every minute of the day together. I think the only time they don't is when they're asleep."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Icelandic singer Björk uses AI to create music that changes with the sky
text: Icelandic artist Björk is using artificial intelligence (AI), created with Microsoft's help, to play a non-stop composition in the lobby of a New York hotel. The AI plays selections from Björk's choral music based on what it sees in the sky through a rooftop camera. The 'Kórsafn' alters according to different cloud types, birds' behaviour, passing aircraft and barometric pressure.
author: Dharna

headlines: You've raised bar for us: Mahindra praises Microsoft's carbon negative plans
text: Praising Microsoft's plans to go 'carbon negative' by 2030, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Bravo Satya Nadella...You've raised the bar for us all." He added, "When I announced [the group's] intention to be carbon neutral by 2040—10 years ahead of deadline—I thought we were being bold." 'Carbon negative' means a company removes more carbon than it emits each year.
author: Dharna

headlines: PM Modi, Shah probably not on talking terms: NCP leader Supriya Sule
text: NCP leader Supriya Sule on Friday said PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah are giving contrasting statements over NRC and she doubts whether they're on talking terms. "I was in Parliament when Shah said he'll implement NRC across India while PM says there is nothing like that," Sule added. She further criticised the government over the economic slowdown.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India beat Australia to level series 1-1 as Kuldeep, Rohit set records
text: India defeated Australia in the second ODI on Friday to level the three-match series 1-1. This was India's first ODI victory at home against Australia after losing four consecutive matches. The match witnessed Rohit Sharma become the fastest batsman to score 7,000 runs as opener in ODIs, while Kuldeep Yadav became the fastest Indian spinner to reach 100 ODI wickets.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I buy books on Amazon, my groceries come from Big Basket: SRK
text: In a conversation with Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos in Mumbai on Thursday, Shah Rukh Khan said, "I do all my book shopping at Amazon. My groceries come from Big Basket." However, he added that he is still not comfortable with buying his underwear online. "It is a boy thing," the actor further said.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: The Rock shares old video watching his late father fight, writes 'I love you'
text: Actor Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson took to Instagram to share a video of himself watching his late father Rocky Johnson fight in the WWE. He wrote, "I love you. You broke color barriers, became a ring legend and trail blazed your way through this world. I was the boy sitting in the seats...watching and adoring you, my hero from afar."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Let's have 11 robots out there: Nasser Hussain criticises ICC for punishing Rabada
text: Former England captain Nasser Hussain has criticised ICC for punishing South African fast bowler Kagiso Rabada for 'provocative' celebration of England captain Joe Root's wicket. "I want my kids to celebrate with emotion. Otherwise let's have 11 robots out there, who don't show any emotion," said Hussain. "What did he do wrong? Was there any physical contact? Hussain asked.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Nadkarni, who bowled record 21 maidens in a row in a Test, passes away at 86
text: Ex-India all-rounder Bapu Nadkarni, who once bowled a record 21.5 overs (131 balls) without conceding a run in a Test against England in 1964, passed away aged 86 due to age-related ailments. Nadkarni, who made his India debut in December 1955, played 41 Tests, scoring 1,414 runs at 25.70 and taking 88 wickets at 29.07.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Possible for humans to tweet from Mars in 5-9 yrs: Musk to Dorsey
text: In a video chat with Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said the first tweet by a human from Mars would be possible in five years at the earliest. "I think the earliest date...is five years from now...but not more than nine years," Musk said. Dorsey also requested "direct feedback" from Musk about Twitter.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Porn cam network leaks data of 4,000 models including pics, videos
text: Researchers at vpnMentor reported PussyCash, a porn cam affiliate network, leaked nearly 20GB of sensitive data of over 4,000 models among more than 875,000 files through its Amazon S3 bucket. Data left exposed on the server includes models' videos, signatures, passport/ID numbers, and driver's licence images. PussyCash told vpnMentor that it would take care of the issue.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: We're low on cash: Marijuana startup Eaze that raised $167 mn so far
text: US-based Eaze, a platform to sell pot and other cannabis products from dispensaries to customers, that has raised around $167.5 million till date, said it is running low on cash. An Eaze spokesperson also confirmed people have been fired from the startup.  Advertisements, such as on billboards, had become a huge expense for Eaze at one point, sources told TechCrunch.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: China's Great Wall enters India, to buy General Motors' plant near Pune
text: China's biggest SUV maker Great Wall Motors has agreed to buy General Motors' (GM) car plant in Talegaon near Pune for a reported ₹2,100 crore. GM already sold its other plant in Gujarat's Halol to China's SAIC, where it builds cars under its British brand, MG Motor. Great Wall plans to enter India with its Haval and electric vehicle brands.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Nirbhaya gangrape convict moves SC against HC's rejection of juvenile claim
text: Pawan Kumar, one of the four convicts in the Nirbhaya gangrape case, has moved the Supreme Court challenging the Delhi High Court's order dismissing his claim of being a juvenile at the time of the offence in 2012. He has also sought a direction restraining the authorities from executing the death penalty, which has now been scheduled for February 1.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: No politics, should work together for Nirbhaya convicts' hanging: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has called for "no politics on Nirbhaya" in a video posted on Twitter. "I'm sad politics is happening on such a sensitive matter," said Kejriwal. He criticised Union Ministers Prakash Javadekar and Smriti Irani for blaming AAP for delaying convicts' hanging. He added that central and Delhi governments should come together to ensure convicts are hanged.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Delhi HC refuses to suspend Unnao rape convict Sengar's jail term
text: Delhi High Court (HC) on Friday refused to suspend the life sentence of expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar for raping a minor girl in Unnao, UP, saying, "Too much tragedy happened with the  survivor in this case." The court also sought the  survivor's reply on Sengar's appeal challenging his conviction and life imprisonment.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Kashmir issue got lukewarm response by international community: Pak PM
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan said that the Kashmir issue got a "lukewarm response" from the international community. "Unfortunately, commercial interests are more important for Western countries. India is a big market," he added. "India is supposed to be a counterbalance to China...therefore you see a completely different approach to the two," he said about Kashmir and protests in Hong Kong.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Germany tweets 'Your visa got approved' on #SeduceSomeoneInFourWords, apologises
text: Germany's Foreign Office has apologised for tweeting "Your visa got approved" as part of the #SeduceSomeoneInFourWords trend. "Being funny is apparently not always our strong suit...We know the visa process is complex, and visa decisions can deeply affect peoples' lives. Our colleagues take these decisions very seriously," it said. The tweet has now been deleted.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: India to have 2nd biggest contingent of billionaires at Davos this year
text: At least 119 billionaires are expected to attend the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Switzerland's Davos next week. India's contingent of 19 billionaire attendees is second only to the US, which has 33 going to Davos. "I've been going since 1979," said Bajaj Group Chairman Rahul Bajaj, who will be making his 40th appearance at the event.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I dare Rahul Gandhi to speak 10 sentences on CAA: BJP's Nadda
text: BJP working president JP Nadda dared Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to speak 10 sentences on the CAA and accused him of misleading the country without the knowledge of the issue. "He should tell us in two sentences what is his problem with the CAA," Nadda added. The BJP leader claimed that there was no one in Congress who understood CAA.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: UP university launches awareness courses on CAA, Article 370
text: Uttar Pradesh Rajarshi Tandon Open University (UPRTOU) has launched two short-term awareness courses on the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and Article 370. "There is no age bar for joining the courses...There will not be any exam, but the students will have to submit a project on the conclusion of the course," RB Singh, Regional Coordinator of UPRTOU, Bareilly said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Congress passes resolution demanding restoration of statehood to J&K
text: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said the J&K Congress unanimously passed a resolution demanding restoration of statehood, job guarantee and property rights for the local people of J&K. The party also demanded the release of all political leaders to pave way for early Assembly polls. "The government hurt people's self-esteem by reducing J&K's status to a Union Territory," Azad added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Microsoft aims to be carbon negative by 2030, unveils $1bn climate fund
text: Microsoft announced its plans to become carbon negative by 2030 and remove all the carbon it has put in the environment, directly or indirectly, since it was founded in 1975. It also announced plans to create a $1-billion 'Climate Innovation Fund' to accelerate the development of carbon removal technology. Microsoft will also release an annual report on its progress.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Twitter apologises for letting ads target homophobes, other hate groups
text: Following a BBC investigation, Twitter has apologised for letting ads to be micro-targeted at homophobes, neo-Nazis and other hate groups. The investigation found it was possible to "target users who had shown an interest in keywords including 'transphobic' and 'anti-gay'".  It also found Twitter allowed ads to be directed at users who had posted or searched for specific topics.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Who'll de-radicalise likes of Meerut SP: Owaisi on CDS Rawat's remark
text: Addressing a public meeting, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi asked who will de-radicalise the likes of Meerut SP who was caught on video asking anti-CAA protesters to "go to Pakistan". Owaisi made the remark in reference to Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat's comment that there's a need to take radicalised people to de-radicalisation camps operating in the country.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Human ancestors could eat hard plant tissue without dental damage: Study
text: A new study has found evidence that human ancestors could eat hard plant tissue without damaging their teeth. Researchers made the discovery after using experiments looking at microscopic interactions between food particles and enamel. The team found that even the hardest plant tissues scarcely wear down primate teeth.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Rare giant squid's genome published for the first time
text: An international team of researchers have fully mapped the genome sequence of the rare giant squid. The giant squid, named Architeuthis dux scientifically, has eyes that have a diameter of 10 inches, tentacles capable of snatching prey from 10 yards away, an average length of around 33 feet and a brain that is one of the biggest amongst invertebrates.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Two-child law need of the hour in India: RSS chief
text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Friday said that a law restricting number of children born per couple to two should be brought in to ensure proper development of the country. Bhagwat said that the RSS feels such a law is the need of the hour though it is up to the government to "take the final call" on it.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 19,959 people committed suicide in Japan in 2019, lowest in 41 yrs
text: Suicides in Japan in 2019 fell down to the lowest number since record-keeping began in 1978 which marks the 10th straight year of declines, according to Japan government data. A total of 19,959 took their lives in 2019, out of which 13,937 were men and 6,022 were women. Japanese suicides peaked at 34,427 in 2003.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Trump is a clown who pretends to support Iranian people: Khamenei
text: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei called US President Donald Trump a "clown" who pretends to support Iranian people while preparing to stab them in their backs. Khamenei said US' killing of commander Qassem Soleimani was "cowardly" and Iran's retaliatory strike was a blow to America's image. Forcing the US' withdrawal from Middle East would be the real punishment, he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Piramal Enterprises to sell healthcare analytics biz for ₹6,750 cr
text: Piramal Enterprises has signed a deal for the sale of its healthcare analytics business Decision Resources Group (DRG) to US-based Clarivate Analytics for about ₹6,750 crore. The transaction is likely to be completed by the end of February, Piramal said. The company will receive ₹6,396 crore on closure of the deal and the rest after 12 months.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: World’s richest man Bezos calls SRK one of most humble people, actor responds
text: Amazon CEO and the world's richest person Jeff Bezos, at an event in Mumbai on Thursday, called Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan one of the most humble people he had ever met. To this, Shah Rukh responded, "It's only because my last few films have not done well." The actor also made Bezos deliver a dialogue from his movie 'Don'.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Kartik Aaryan gifts his mother Mini Cooper on her birthday, pics surface
text: Actor Kartik Aaryan gifted his mother Mala a Mini Cooper convertible car on her birthday. As per reports, Mala had expressed her wish to buy the same car when the actor was in his struggling days. Taking to Instagram to wish his mother on her birthday, Kartik wrote, "Happy Birthday to my Fav Hairstylist."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: In pictures: Anti-CAA protest in Shaheen Bagh enters its 2nd month
text: The ongoing protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and the National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh entered its second month on Wednesday. The protest that is witnessing large participation by women began on December 15. The round-the-clock Shaheen Bagh protest has inspired similar sit-ins in Kolkata, Prayagraj and Kota.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Directed SAI to dispose pending sexual harassment complaints in 4 weeks: Rijiju
text: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju has said all pending complaints of sexual harassment at Sports Authority of India (SAI) institutes will be disposed within four weeks to ensure a zero-tolerance approach. This comes after a report claimed that 45 cases of sexual harassment were reported from 24 SAI institutes over last 10 years in which little or no action was taken.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rohit reaches 7,000 runs as opener in ODI cricket, breaks world record
text: During his knock of 42 runs off 44 deliveries in the second ODI against Australia at Rajkot, Rohit Sharma reached 7,000 runs as an opener in ODI cricket. The 32-year-old broke the world record for being the fastest batsman to reach the milestone. Rohit scored 7,000 ODI runs as opener in 137 innings, breaking Hashim Amla's record (147 innings).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rabada banned for one Test over provocative celebration of Root's wicket
text: South Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada has been banned for one Test match after his celebration of England captain Joe Root's wicket in the third Test. The celebration was deemed "overly aggressive and provocative" by the ICC. Rabada was seen roaring in triumph after dismissing Root. He has also been fined 15% of his match fee.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: SoftBank offers to invest $40 billion in Indonesia's new capital
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank Group has offered to invest up to $40 billion towards the development of Indonesia's new capital, senior cabinet minister Luhut Pandjaitan said. The details of SoftBank's investments will be finalised in February by President Joko Widodo. Notably, Indonesia has estimated the cost of building the new capital from scratch on Borneo island at about $34 billion.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: What would you do if you were running Twitter: Jack Dorsey asks Elon Musk
text: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey in a video chat with Tesla CEO Elon Musk asked him what he would have done if he were running Twitter. Musk suggested that identifying real users from bots and "troll armies" would be helpful. "Basically, how do you tell if the feedback is real or someone trying to manipulate the system," he added.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Jaguar developing shape-shifting seat that makes body think it's walking
text: Jaguar Land Rover is working on a shape-shifting seat system designed to prevent health risks caused by sitting down for too long by simulating walking feeling. The system uses a series of actuators in the seat to create micro-adjustments to make the brain think the person is walking. The "morphable" seat could be tailored to suit each driver and passenger.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: I'm an Amazon customer but Bezos' Washington Post highly biased: BJP leader
text: BJP's Foreign Affairs Department head Vijay Chauthaiwale said there was "a lot of problem" with Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post's coverage of India, adding that its editorial policy is "highly biased and agenda-driven". "I'm not opposing Amazon as a company, in fact, I'm a regular customer...Jeff Bezos should go home tell Washington Post what is his impression about India," Chauthaiwale said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Startup that provides indoor location without GPS raises $120 mn
text: California-based NextNav, a startup which provides indoor location without GPS, has raised $120 million in debt and equity financing led by funds managed by affiliates of Fortress Investment. Existing investors like Columbia Capital, Telcom Ventures and others participated in the round. NextNav works on technology to locate people and objects inside enclosed spaces where GPS doesn't work.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Amazon statement misconstrued, govt open to investments within rules: Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said his statement regarding Amazon was misconstrued and asserted that government welcomes all investments within the regulations. Goyal on Thursday said Amazon isn't doing any favour by investing $1 billion in India. Notably, Amazon's Founder Jeff Bezos on Friday said his company plans to create 10 lakh new jobs in India by 2025.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: No reason to go to Kashmir, it’s India’s internal matter: Russia envoy
text: Russian ambassador to India Nikolay Kudashev on Friday said he didn't have a reason to travel to Kashmir as it was India's internal matter. "Those who are concerned about situation in Kashmir, those who put in doubt the Indian policies in Kashmir, they could travel if they wish," he said. He added that Russia "never doubted" India's approach to Kashmir.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia owns no car, wife's property worth ₹65L: Affidavit
text: In affidavit papers submitted during the nomination for 2020 Delhi polls on Thursday, Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia declared that he does not own any car. His wife's self-acquired immovable property was worth ₹65 lakh in 2020, as compared to ₹8.7 lakh in 2015. Sisodia's self-acquired immovable property remained roughly the same as in 2015.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Nirbhaya gangrape convicts moved to cells near hanging courtyard
text: The four convicts in the Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case were on Thursday moved near the hanging courtyard. They have been shifted to four separate single cells inside jail number 3 of Tihar. The single cells they are lodged in have at least two CCTV cameras and are guarded by 2-3 jail guards round-the-clock.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Govt issues alert after virus detected in Chinese city with 500 Indian students
text: The Indian government has issued a travel advisory for those travelling to China amid outbreak of the novel coronavirus there. The advisory was especially issued for those travelling to China's Wuhan, where more than 500 Indian students study. It further asked travellers feeling sick on the flight while returning back to India to inform the airline's crew about the illness.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Putin, Syrian President Assad mock Trump; video surfaces
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Syrian counterpart Bashar al-Assad mocked US President Donald Trump during a visit to a Greek Orthodox church in Syria. In a video, the two leaders referenced the Biblical story of St Paul's conversion to Christianity on the road to Damascus. "If Trump also travelled on this road, it would fix him," Assad said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez to retire after T20 World Cup
text: Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez on Friday said that he will retire from international cricket after the T20 World Cup in Australia this year. Hafeez, who made his debut in 2003, has played 55 Tests, 218 ODIs and 89 T20Is for Pakistan. He last played a T20I in November 2018 but has been recalled for the upcoming T20I series against Bangladesh.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: World no. 1 shuttler discharged from hospital days after car crash
text: World number one shuttler Kento Momota has been discharged from hospital after being treated for injuries sustained during a car crash in Malaysia. Momota was travelling to the airport in a hired van when it crashed into the back of a 30-ton truck killing the driver of the van. The 25-year-old was discharged with "no physical problems".
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: No Indian in Aus Open singles as no. 1 Prajnesh fails to qualify
text: India's top-ranked tennis player in men's singles Prajnesh Gunneswaran on Friday lost in the Australia Open qualifiers final. Prajnesh went down 6-7(2-7), 2-6 against Ernests Gulbis of Latvia. With his defeat, the Indian campaign in the Australia Open singles has ended. Earlier, Sumit Nagal,  Ramkumar Ramanathan and Ankita Raina were knocked out of the singles qualifiers.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Mamata, Dhankhar 'two jokers of circus', says Adhir Chowdhury
text: In an apparent target at Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and the state's Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar, Congress' leader in Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Friday called them "two jokers of circus". "In Bengal, a circus is going on at Raj Bhavan (Governor's House) and Nabanna Bhavan (State Secretariat). The heads there are the two jokers of the circus," he said.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Scientists use bacteria to make 'living' concrete that can heal itself
text: Scientists have created a 'living building material' (LMB) that can heal itself by introducing inert structural sand-hydrogel scaffold with Synechococcus sp. PCC 7002, a photosynthetic cyanobacterium. The bacteria in the material absorbs sunlight, nutrients, and carbon dioxide and releases calcium carbonate, the rigid compound found in seashells and cement.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: All 5 S-400 missile systems to be delivered to India by 2025: Russia
text: All five S-400 air defence missile systems will be delivered to India by 2025, Russian Deputy Chief of Mission Roman Babushkin said, adding that production had begun. India and Russia signed the $5 billion S-400 deal in October 2018. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will be visiting Russia from March 22-23 for a Russia-India-China trilateral meeting, a Russian official added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Taliban offers US 10-day ceasefire in Afghanistan: Reports
text: The Taliban has offered the US a 10-day ceasefire in Afghanistan and to meet the Afghan government if a deal is reached with US negotiators, reports said. The US had been pressing for a ceasefire in order to formally resume the US-Taliban peace talks to end the 18-year conflict in Afghanistan.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sri Lanka lifts 25-yr ban on private helicopter flights from Colombo
text: Sri Lankan government on Thursday lifted a 25-year ban on the operation of helicopter flights by private operators from Colombo. Now, private tourist helicopters will be able to use the Defence Ministry grounds on Galle Face in Colombo, Sri Lanka. Four operators have been given permission by the government to re-start flights.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Jet Airways to sell Netherlands business to Dutch airline KLM
text: Jet Airways has said that it has agreed to sell its assets in the Netherlands to Dutch airline KLM. The deal will only involve a sale of part of its business and won't impact the shareholding pattern, the company said. The Indian carrier shut operations in April 2019 after running out of money and is undergoing insolvency resolution process.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Reliance Industries posts record profit of ₹11,640 cr in Dec quarter
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries on Friday posted a record quarterly profit of ₹11,640 crore for the October-December period, up 13.5% from last year. However, the company's revenue from operations fell 2.5% per cent to ₹1.57 lakh crore. Reliance's telecom unit Jio's profit surged 62% to ₹1,350 crore during the quarter.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: BJP's 1st list of candidates for Delhi polls out, Kapil to fight from Model Town
text: The BJP on Friday released their first list of candidates for the upcoming 70-seat Delhi Assembly elections. As many as 57 candidates have been named with rebel AAP leader Kapil Mishra to fight from Model Town. Further, Vijender Gupta will contest from Rohini, Rekha Gupta from Shalimar Bagh and Suman Kumar Gupta will fight the elections from Chandni Chowk.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Nirbhaya gangrape convicts to be hanged on February 1 at 6 am: Delhi court
text: A Delhi court on Friday issued fresh death warrants for the four convicts in the Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case. The convicts will now be hanged on February 1 at 6 am. The Delhi government had earlier said that the convicts won't be hanged on January 22 as a mercy plea has been filed.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: A stolen cycle motivated Muhammad Ali to become a boxer
text: Muhammad Ali was inspired to become a boxer after his red-and-white Schwinn bicycle was stolen in 1954. The then 12-year-old reported the theft to a policeman and told him he wanted to beat whoever stole it. Joe Martin, the policeman, who was also a boxing trainer, suggested Ali to first learn how to fight and began his boxing training.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sexual harassment case against Anu Malik closed by NCW
text: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has closed the sexual harassment case against Anu Malik "due to lack of communication/substantial evidence sought from the complainant". "This is not a permanent closure...If...complainant comes forward or brings more evidence...we can reopen it," Chairperson Rekha Sharma said. He'd earlier stepped down as the judge of 'Indian Idol' due to the allegations.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Jeff Bezos arrives with girlfriend Lauren Sanchez at Mumbai Amazon event
text: Amazon CEO and world's richest person Jeff Bezos arrived with his girlfriend TV presenter  Lauren Sanchez at a company event in Mumbai on Thursday. Various Indian film industry personalities including Madhavan, Kamal Haasan, Vidya Balan and Farhan Akhtar attended the event organised by Amazon's streaming service. Bezos held a 30-minute informal chat session with Shah Rukh Khan and Zoya Akhtar.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: When I started working, I was told hero will decide who heroine will be: Priyanka
text: During an interview, Priyanka Chopra Jonas said, "When I first started working, we were told, 'Heroes will decide who the heroine is going to be'." Adding that her life's dream is that people should stop referring to films as 'female centric', actors as 'female actors' or athletes as 'female athletes', Priyanka said, "It's just athlete, director, actor!"
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: UP couple gets 'We support NRC, CAA' printed on their wedding card
text: A couple in Uttar Pradesh showed their support for the National Register of Citizens (NRC) and the Citizenship (Amendment) Act by getting "We support NRC and CAA" printed on their wedding cards. This comes amid the ongoing demonstrations for and against the CAA in several parts of the country. Punjab government on Friday passed a resolution against the CAA.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Hindi teacher suspended for saying 'go to Pakistan' to students in Kerala school
text: Kaleshan KK, Hindi teacher at Government Girls Higher Secondary School in Kerala's Kodungallur, has been suspended by Deputy Director of Education for telling students they could "go to Pakistan" over a discussion on Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA). Several parents had complained to the authorities. According to officials, the suspension will only be revoked after a detailed probe on the matter.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Zampa dismisses Kohli for 7th time in int'l cricket after relay catch at boundary
text: Australia leg-spinner Adam Zampa on Friday dismissed Team India captain Virat Kohli for fifth time in ODI cricket and seventh time in all internationals. Kohli lofted the ball towards the long-off, where Ashton Agar caught it and lobbed it towards Mitchell Starc before crossing the rope. The 31-year-old got out for 78 runs off 76 deliveries.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Heroes are not humiliated like this: Kamran Akmal to fan who called him 'hero'
text: Reacting to veteran Pakistan wicketkeeper-batsman Kamran Akmal's post about him not getting selected in Pakistan's T20I squad, a fan wrote "You are hero." Responding to the fan, Akmal wrote, "Hero aise zaleel nahi hotey (Heroes are not humiliated like this)." The 38-year-old last represented Pakistan in 2017. "Hurt and heart-broken for not being considered for the team," Akmal had tweeted.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Bezos promises 10L jobs in India after Goyal says $1bn investment not favour
text: Jeff Bezos on Friday said Amazon plans to create 10 lakh new jobs in India by 2025, a day after Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said the e-commerce giant's fresh $1 billion investment was no big favour. "If they make a loss of a billion dollars every year then they jolly well have to finance that billion dollars," Goyal had said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Turkey ends ban on Wikipedia after nearly 3 years
text: Turkey is restoring access to Wikipedia after a ban that lasted almost three years. The country's Constitutional Court had ruled that the ban violated freedom of expression. The online encyclopaedia was blocked in the country after it refused to delete articles that said Turkey's government had cooperated with the ISIS and al-Qaeda in Syria.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Hardly had any role in Nirbhaya case, never delayed it: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that his government wanted convicts of the 2012 Nirbhaya rape case to be hanged at the earliest. "We never delayed any work related to this case. Delhi government hardly has any role in it," Kejriwal said. This came after BJP claimed that AAP's negligence lead to delay in hanging of Nirbhaya case convicts.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Haven't spoken to anyone in Cong: Nirbhaya's mother dismisses reports
text: Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi on Friday dismissed the reports of her contesting in the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections on a Congress ticket and said she has no interest in politics. "I only want justice for my daughter and execution of the convicts," she added. Earlier today, Asha Devi accused BJP and AAP of playing politics over her daughter's death.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Mumbai blasts convict 'Doctor Bomb' arrested a day after jumping parole
text: Jalees Ansari, a 68-year-old 1993 Mumbai blasts convict, who had gone missing on Thursday after he jumped parole, was arrested in Kanpur on Friday. Ansari, also known as Doctor Bomb, was leaving a mosque in the city when he was caught, police said. Ansari was on 21-day parole from Ajmer Central Prison in Rajasthan.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: US military contradicts Trump, says 11 soldiers injured in Iran attack
text: The US military has said that 11 US soldiers were treated for concussions after Iran fired missiles towards two American bases in Iraq. This contradicts earlier statements by US President Trump wherein he claimed that no US troops had been injured.
