The injured soldiers were taken to US facilities in Germany or Kuwait for follow-on screening, the US military added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Not ready for peace with India without resolving Kashmir issue: Pakistan
text: Pakistan is not prepared to pay any price for peace with India without resolving the Kashmir issue, Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi said. "Our government wants peace in the neighbourhood. We...need peace to focus on achieving our domestic agenda for economic reform and development," he added. US President Donald Trump should mediate to resolve the Kashmir issue, he further said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Asif Ghafoor replaced as Pakistan military's spokesperson
text: Pakistan's Major General Asif Ghafoor has been replaced as the Director-General of the Inter-Services Public Relations, Pakistan military's media wing. He has been replaced by Major General Babar Iftikhar. Ghafoor has now been posted as the general officer commanding (GOC) of the Pakistan Army's 40th Infantry Division in Okara in Punjab province.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Jailed Mexican drug lord El Chapo's daughter launches 'El Chapo' beer
text: Mexican drug lord Joaquín El Chapo Guzmán's daughter Alejandrina has launched 'El Chapo' beer at a fashion trade show in Guadalajara. The beer is part of the 'El Chapo 701' brand, which has already launched a clothing line. El Chapo was extradited to the US in 2017 and sentenced to life in prison for drug trafficking.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Keerthy Suresh to not make her B'wood debut with Ajay's Maidaan: Reports
text: South actress Keerthy Suresh will not make her Bollywood debut in Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Maidaan', as per reports. Producer Boney Kapoor and Keerthy mutually agreed to part ways as she looked "too young" for the role, reports added. The 27-year-old actress, who was supposed to play Ajay's wife, felt she could be typecast and be offered only older roles, reports said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Scientists unexpectedly witness 3 wolf puppies play fetch
text: Scientists were able to find that wolves can interpret human social communicative cues after three 8-week-old wolf puppies spontaneously showed interest in a ball and returned it to a perfect stranger upon encouragement. Scientists earlier hypothesised that cognitive abilities necessary to understand cues given by a human arose in dogs only after humans domesticated them at least 15,000 years ago.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Russia looking forward to training Indian astronauts: Russian diplomat
text: Russian diplomat Roman Babushkin said on Friday that Russia is "ready and looking forward" to training a team of Indian astronauts for the Gaganyaan mission. "A team of Indian astronauts is going to Russia this month. We have very good expertise in Russia on how to train astronauts which we have developed over decades," Babushkin said during his India visit.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Fossils of largest theropod to date found in Australia
text: Researchers have identified fossils found near Winton as remains of the largest theropod found to date in Australia. Theropods are a group of large, bipedal, carnivorous dinosaurs, with both Tyrannosaurus rex and Velociraptor being part of the group. The fossil size suggests the creature was approximately two meters tall and five to seven meters long.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: SC allows Karti to withdraw his ₹20 cr deposit for travelling abroad
text: SC on Friday allowed Congress MP Karti Chidambaram to withdraw the ₹20 crore deposited with the apex court registry as a condition for allowing him to travel abroad. He was granted permission to travel abroad after depositing ₹10 crore each in January and May last year. There was no objection from ED to plea seeking withdrawal of money by Chidambaram.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: SC refuses to stay annulling of Azam Khan's son's election as MLA
text: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to stay the Allahabad High Court verdict that annulled the election of Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's son Abdullah Azam Khan as MLA. The Supreme Court has, however, agreed to hear Abdullah's plea challenging the verdict that found him underage and not qualified to contest election. The case will be heard on March 25.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Guatemala cuts off diplomatic ties with Venezuela
text: Guatemala's newly elected President Alejandro Giammattei on Thursday cut diplomatic ties with Venezuela and ordered the closure of its embassy in there. Giammattei's announcement came after a meeting with the Secretary-General of the US-based Organization of American States. Venezuelan Foreign Minister said that Giammattei was bowing down to the administration of US President Donald Trump.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Versace bans kangaroo skin after pressure from activists
text: Italian luxury brand Versace has banned the use of kangaroo skin for its leather products after the brand was pressurised by the animal rights' group LAV. The group stated that more than 2.3 million kangaroos in Australia were killed each year for commercial purposes. "We welcome Versace's announcement as a sign of responsibility," LAV said in a statement.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Impeachment trial of US President Trump officially begins
text: The US Senate on Thursday officially began the impeachment trial of US President Donald Trump, with the 100 lawmakers of the Senate being sworn in as jurors for the trial. Democrat Adam Schiff read the two impeachment charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress against Trump in the chamber. Opening statements are due to start next week.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Everybody will be my friend if I move to Manali: Kangana on having 'enemies'
text: During an interview, Kangana Ranaut said that her mother keeps asking her why there are so many conflicts always in her life. "I say, 'Mumma, if I pack my bags and I go to Manali right now, everybody will be my best friend...if I'm successful and if I keep at it, of course I am gonna have enemies'," she added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: I was like I can't feel this empty: Alia's sister Shaheen on suicide attempt
text: Shaheen Bhatt, Alia Bhatt's sister, opened up about her battle with depression and the time she attempted suicide. When asked what she was thinking when she tried to end her life, Shaheen said, "I wasn't thinking. I was just like, I can't do this anymore. I can't look out of the window for one more second and feel this empty."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: This is what married life looks like: Akshay shares 2.0 pic with Twinkle
text: Akshay Kumar shared a picture with Twinkle Khanna on their 19th wedding anniversary and wrote, "Visual representation of what married life looks like...some days you wanna cuddle and some days look like...as you can see". "All said and done, I wouldn't have it any other way," he added. The picture shows Akshay in the get-up of his '2.0' character Pakshirajan.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: BCCI threw out MS Dhoni like many other players, tweets KRK; criticised
text: Reacting to MS Dhoni being dropped from BCCI's annual contract list, actor Kamaal R Khan tweeted, "BCCI threw out Dhoni like many other players in the past." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "Why do you have to be so negative?" Another wrote, "If you can't match him...you don't have right to comment on him. He'll come back."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: J&K administration releases 4 more politicians from house arrest
text: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has released four politicians, one each from the NC, PDP, PC and Congress, from house arrest. The politicians were kept under detention for over five months following the abrogation of Article 370, officials said on Friday. This comes a day after the release of five politicians who were also detained after Article 370's revocation.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Azad reaches Jama Masjid amid CAA protests, police says he's not protesting
text: A day after getting released from Tihar, Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad on Friday reached Jama Masjid amid the ongoing anti-CAA protest. Azad was released on bail on a condition that he will leave Delhi for the next four weeks. "He has 24 hours since his release yesterday...to leave Delhi. He's not holding any protest," police said on Azad's visit.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: BYJU'S gave ₹2,230 crore returns to four investors who put in ₹158 crore
text: Edtech unicorn BYJU'S gave a return of ₹2,230 crore to four investors who invested a combined ₹158 crore in a partial exit scheme in 2018-19, Entrackr reported. Sequoia received 21.13 times its ₹78.8 crore investment while Times Internet made a 7 times return on ₹29.2 crore investment. The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative got ₹167.7 crore as return on ₹22.86 crore investment.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Facebook drops plan to show ads on WhatsApp which made co-founders quit: WSJ
text: Facebook has decided not to sell ads on WhatsApp and disbanded a team that was formed to find the best ways to integrate ads into the messaging service, The Wall Street Journal reported. In 2018, Facebook announced it was going to show ads in WhatsApp's Status feature. WSJ said that led WhatsApp founders Jan Koum and Brian Acton to resign.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Nirbhaya's mother breaks down, says 'Hanging being postponed deliberately'
text: Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi on Friday accused BJP and AAP of playing politics over the death of her daughter and said the hanging of the convicts was being postponed deliberately. "I want to say that those people who held protests on streets in 2012, today the same people are only playing with my daughter's death for political gains," she added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Senior Advocate Harish Salve appointed as Queen's Counsel
text: Senior Advocate Harish Salve has been appointed as Queen's Counsel (QC) for the courts of England and Wales. "The title of QC is awarded to those who've demonstrated particular skill and expertise in the conduct of advocacy," UK's Justice Ministry said. Salve had previously served as Solicitor General for India and represented India before the ICJ in Kulbhushan Jadhav's case.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Snub more people to boost economy: Chidambaram on Goyal’s Amazon remark
text: Congress leader and former Finance Minister P Chidambaram on Thursday criticised Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal for snubbing Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos saying "it makes for a great headline in the world's media." He added, "After Bezos, he (Goyal) should snub Sundar Pichai and Satya Nadella in order to make India a $5 trillion economy."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Malls, eateries in Mumbai can stay open 24x7 from January 27
text: Malls, multiplexes, shops and restaurants with CCTV surveillance, parking facilities and security in Mumbai can stay open 24x7 from January 27. The decision was made in a meeting called by state Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday. As per an official, most of the malls will stay open 24x7 on weekends.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: He's much higher than Bharat Ratna: SC on PIL seeking honour for Mahatma Gandhi
text: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to direct the Centre on a PIL seeking to confer the Bharat Ratna on Mahatma Gandhi. The apex court said that Mahatma Gandhi is much higher than Bharat Ratna, India's highest civilian honour. "Mahatma Gandhi is the father of the nation, beyond such formal recognition," Chief Justice of India SA Bobde said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: China's birth rate in 2019 hits lowest level since its founding
text: China's birth rate in 2019 dropped to its lowest level since the country's founding in 1949, according to government data. The birth rate stood at 10.48 per 1,000 people as it fell for three consecutive years despite the government's relaxation of one-child policy in 2016. The number of births dropped from 15.23 million in 2018 to 14.65 million in 2019.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Plane crash should not overshadow killed General's 'sacrifice': Iran Leader
text: Iranian Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei on Friday said that the downing of the Ukrainian aircraft carrying 176 people should not overshadow killed General Qassem Soleimani's "sacrifice". Khamenei added that the US killing of Soleimani, commander of the Quds Force, showed the country's "terrorist nature". Iran recently admitted that it unintentionally hit the Ukrainian aircraft with a missile.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Ukraine PM submits resignation after audio criticising President leaked
text: Ukrainian Prime Minister Oleksiy Honcharuk has tendered his resignation to President Volodymyr Zelenskyy following the release of audiotapes wherein he purportedly criticised the President's understanding of the economy. "I've come to this post to fulfil the president's programme...However, to cast any doubt in our respect and trust in the president, I have written a resignation request," he said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Before and after images show damage done by Australian bushfires
text: Before and after images showing the damage done by Australian bushfires have surfaced online. More than 10.7 million hectares of land has burnt so far in Australia's bushfires – larger than the total area of South Korea, or Portugal, and 1.3 times the size of Scotland. The ongoing bushfire crisis has spread across six states.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Vodafone Idea shares drop by record 39% after SC rejects review petition
text: Vodafone Idea's shares tumbled as much as 39% on Friday in its largest intraday fall ever after the Supreme Court said it must pay ₹28,000 crore by next week, rejecting a review petition on an earlier judgment. The stock later recovered to trade 27% lower. Meanwhile, Airtel shares rose 5.5% as the company raised ₹21,700 crore it needs to pay.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I've learnt all sorts of things on 'Sex Education': Actress Gillian
text: Actress Gillian Anderson, who plays a sex therapist in web series 'Sex Education', has said she's learnt "all sorts of things" from the series. She added the learning has made her less afraid about  "discussing things" with her sons. Gillian further said she would not watch the series with her children, adding, "I'm...cringing at them even watching it at all."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Gender parity is one topic that's significant to me: Bhumi Pednekar
text: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said she's glad to be working in times where similar opportunities have opened up for both male and female actors. "Gender parity is one topic that's significant to me," she added. Talking about another cause which is close to her heart, Bhumi said, "Belonging to...industry where...physical appearance is always under scrutiny, nutrition is...closest to my heart."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kangana and I never discussed politics on the sets of Panga: Richa
text: Actress Richa Chadha, who'll be seen alongside Kangana Ranaut in 'Panga', has said they never discussed politics on the sets of the film. "It really doesn't matter...which political ideology we subscribe to," she added. Richa further said she doesn't want to change anyone's political opinion while adding, "Everyone has their own beliefs and I'm vocal about things...I strongly believe in."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Sania Mirza enters women's doubles final in Hobart International
text: Sania Mirza, who's playing her first tournament after a gap of two years, on Friday entered the women's doubles final in Hobart International with her Ukrainian partner Nadiia Kichenok. Sania and Kichenok defeated Slovenian-Czech pair of Tamara Zidansek and Marie Bouzkova 7-6(7-3), 6-2 in the semifinals. They will now face the second-seeded Chinese pair of Shuai Peng and Shuai Zhang.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Billions of quantum entangled electrons found in 'strange metal': Study
text: In a new study, physicists observed quantum entanglement among "billions of billions" of flowing electrons in a ytterbium, rhodium and silicon compound, which is a quantum critical material. Researchers found that at absolute zero temperature, the ultrapure films of the material was found to undergo a transition from one quantum phase that forms a magnetic order to another that doesn't.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Case against DSP Davinder Singh good as dead under NIA: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress' Rahul Gandhi has claimed that Centre is trying to "silence" arrested J&K DSP Davinder Singh's case by transferring it to the NIA. "The NIA is headed by another Modi - YK, who investigated the Gujarat Riots and Haren Pandya's assassination. In YK's care, case is as good as dead," Rahul tweeted while referring to NIA chief Yogesh Chander Modi.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: West Bengal to skip MHA conference on census, NPR
text: Mamata Banerjee-led West Bengal government will not take part in Friday's conference of State Chief Secretaries and Directors of Census to discuss Census and National Population Register (NPR), ANI quoted Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) sources as saying. Representatives of all other states will be in attendance at the conference at Ambedkar Bhawan in Delhi.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Don't turn Ukrainian plane crash into political issue: Iran
text: All countries involved in the Ukrainian plane crash in Iran should not make "human issues" into "an excuse for political gesture", Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Abbas Mousavi said on Friday. Iran's semi-official ISNA news agency quoted him saying that Iran had cooperated "beyond expectations" with the five countries whose citizens were killed in the crash.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Orient launches Eleganza - Air Circulating Luxury Chandelier
text: Orient Electric, recently unveiled its super-premium Air Circulating Luxury Chandeliers - Eleganza. The chandelier comes in three variants and is equipped with high quality crystals and features like noiseless operation, multi-color mood lighting, designer transparent retractable fan blades and is remote controlled, seeking to provide you the exquisite luxury experience you deserve.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Alphabet becomes 2nd company with India-born CEO to hit $1 trillion value
text: Sundar Pichai-led Alphabet on Thursday became the fourth US company to hit $1 trillion in market value and the second overall led by an India-born CEO after Satya Nadella-led Microsoft. The company joined Amazon and Apple in crossing the milestone. Pichai, who was appointed Google CEO in 2015, was given the additional responsibility as head of Alphabet in December 2019.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: President Kovind rejects mercy plea of Nirbhaya convict Mukesh Singh
text: President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday rejected the mercy petition filed by Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convict Mukesh Singh. This comes after the Home Ministry sent the mercy plea to the President and recommended him to reject it. Singh had filed the plea after the Supreme Court rejected his curative petition.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Actress who worked in 'Savdhaan India' rescued from sex racket in Mumbai
text: Police have busted a sex racket operating in a three-star hotel in Mumbai and arrested a 29-year-old woman and rescued three actresses, including a minor who worked in web series. One of the rescued actress has worked in crime show 'Savdhaan India' while another worked in a Marathi movie and serials, police said. The accused ran a travel agency.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 1,500 chefs in Kerala bake 6.5-km long cake, make Guinness World Record
text: About 1,500 bakers and chefs in Kerala baked the world's longest-ever cake measuring about 6.5 kilometres and created a new Guinness World Record on Thursday. The cake was four inches wide and thick and weighed in at about 27,000 kilograms. The previous world record was held by Chinese bakers who made a fruitcake almost 3.2 kilometres long in 2018.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Punjab Assembly passes anti-CAA resolution, 2nd state after Kerala to do so
text: The Punjab government on Friday moved a resolution in the state assembly against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. The anti-CAA resolution was later passed by the state assembly, making Punjab the second state in the country to do so. This comes days after Kerala became the first state to pass an anti-CAA resolution.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: KS Bharat named back-up wicketkeeper for Rajkot ODI after Pant ruled out
text: Andhra wicketkeeper-batsman KS Bharat has been named as India's back-up wicketkeeper for second ODI in Rajkot against Australia. The call was taken after Rishabh Pant flew to Bengaluru to undergo his rehabilitation protocol in the National Cricket Academy. Pant was hit on the helmet while batting in the first ODI in Mumbai and was ruled out of the Rajkot ODI.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi sends gift to boatman who invited her to his daughter's wedding
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi has sent a gift and a letter to a boatman after he invited her to his daughter's wedding when she travelled on his boat during her visit to Varanasi on January 10. Senior Congress leader Ajai Rai had visited the boatman to give him Priyanka's gift, which was a saree.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Talk to your employees, otherwise this charm will be wasted: BJP leader to Bezos
text: BJP Foreign Affairs Department's head Vijay Chauthaiwale commented on a video posted by Jeff Bezos and wrote, "Jeff Bezos please tell this to your employees in Washington DC. Otherwise your charm offensive is likely to be waste of time and money." Chauthaiwale apparently said this over Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post's coverage of Article 370's abrogation.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Write in 100 words why you weren't wearing helmet: MP Police to violators
text: The traffic police in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal has been asking riders caught without helmets to write a 100-word essay explaining the reason for not wearing the headgear. Over 150 violators of helmet rule have written a 100-word essay each explaining the reason, police officials said. The initiative has been launched during the Road Safety Week that ends on Friday.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Woman immigrant from Pak to contest panchayat elections in Rajasthan
text: Neeta Sodha, an immigrant from Pakistan who was recently given Indian citizenship is contesting panchayat elections in Rajasthan's Natwara. "I came to India 18 years back but I got the citizenship four months ago and now I'm fighting the Sarpanch elections," she said. Neeta added that she wants to work for women empowerment and better education in the village.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Mumbai labourer earning ₹300 per day served ₹1 crore I-T notice
text: Bhausaheb Ahire, a labourer in Mumbai who earns around ₹300 per day, has received an Income-Tax notice asking him to pay over ₹1 crore. Ahire had recently approached the police complaining that fraudsters had created a fake bank account in his name. "I've not seen even ₹1 lakh in my life, how can I pay ₹1.05 crore?" Ahire said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 1993 Mumbai blasts convict 'Doctor Bomb' goes missing on last day of parole
text: Jalees Ansari, a 68-year-old 1993 Mumbai blasts convict, went missing on Thursday morning while being on a 21-day parole from Ajmer Central Prison in Rajasthan. Ansari, who is also known as 'Doctor Bomb', is serving a life term and was expected to surrender before the prison authorities on Friday. The missing complaint was filed by Ansari's son.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Woman shot in face & head drives 7km to police station, accuses Class 10 nephew
text: A 42-year-old woman in Punjab's Muktsar drove for 7km to a police station after receiving three gunshot wounds to her head and one to her face. The woman alleged her nephew, who's in Class 10, shot at her over a land dispute and also accused her brother of attempting to grab her land. Her elderly mother also received bullet injuries.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Pics of 'bruised' Sonia, Michelle used by Italian artist to show gender violence
text: Italian artist aleXsandro Palombo has used pictures of female world leaders, including Sonia Gandhi, Michelle Obama and Hillary Clinton, on posters to highlight gender violence. The posters have been edited to make the leaders look bruised and have 'Just Because I Am A Woman' written on them. "Violence against women is a global issue that affects everyone," Palombo said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Reject Nirbhaya convict's mercy plea: Home Ministry recommends President
text: The Home Ministry has sent the mercy petition of Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convict Mukesh Singh to President Ram Nath Kovind and has recommended its rejection. Delhi Government had recommended the Centre to reject the petition on Wednesday, a day after Singh's appeal. The convicts were earlier scheduled to be hanged on January 22.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Doctor undressed me and sexually assaulted me: US prez candidate's wife
text: Evelyn Yang, the wife of US presidential candidate Andrew Yang has revealed she was sexually assaulted by her doctor while she was pregnant with the couple's first child. She said the doctor pulled her to him, undressed her and then used his fingers to examine her internally. Yang added that she "just kind of froze" and didn't react.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Billionaire trying to smuggle a Picasso worth ₹205 crore jailed, fined ₹410 crore
text: A Spanish billionaire has been jailed for 18 months and fined ₹410 crore for trying to smuggle a Picasso worth ₹205 crore to sell at an auction. The 'Head of a Young Woman' was seized from Jaime Botín's yacht in France in 2015. The 83-year-old was forced to forfeit the painting, which has now been given to a Madrid museum.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Why did Nancy Pelosi use so many pens to sign Trump impeachment articles?
text: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi used several pens to sign the impeachment articles against US President Donald Trump on Wednesday. Since Franklin Roosevelt, US Presidents have frequently used multiple pens to sign high-profile pieces of legislation, so they can be offered as souvenirs and historical keepsakes. Pelosi picked up each pen, signed a bit, and handed each one to a lawmaker.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: And I thought I'd done a good job 40 yrs ago: Mahindra on man's proposal video
text: Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video showing a man who "hack-animated a Disney movie" to propose wedding to a woman. "And I thought I had done a good job 40 years ago with my proposal. Now I have an inferiority complex!" Mahindra wrote. Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "Post your love story sir."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: There was hidden fondness between me and Shraddha in school: Varun
text: Varun Dhawan, who'll be seen alongside Shraddha Kapoor in film 'Street Dancer 3D', has said there was some hidden fondness between him and the actress when they were in school. On being asked why he didn't express his feelings to Shraddha, Varun said, "I think at that age, boys don't like girls. We were too young, I didn't understand it."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: For 1st time responsibility will be on my shoulders: Bhumi on Durgavati
text: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said her upcoming film 'Durgavati' will be the most challenging and special film for her as "for the first time the responsibility will be on her shoulders". "'Durgavati' is something I'm most pressured and excited about," she added. Directed by G Ashok, the film is said to be the Hindi remake of Telugu horror film 'Bhaagamathie'.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Farhan, Rajkummar attend Jeff Bezos' welcome event
text: Actors Farhan Akhtar and Rajkummar Rao were among the celebrities who attended an event organised to welcome the world's richest person and Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos on Thursday. Farhan was accompanied by Shibani Dandekar, while Rajkummar attended the event with actress Patralekhaa. Other celebrities who attended the event include, Vidya Balan and Arshad Warsi. Jeff arrived in India on Tuesday.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I'm still not comfortable in shopping underwear online: Shah Rukh
text: Shah Rukh Khan has said he's still not comfortable in ordering his underwear online, adding, "It's a boy thing." He made the revelation during a conversation with Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos in Mumbai. On being asked about women, who played an influential role in his life, the actor said, "There are four...My mother, my sister, my wife and my daughter."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Out of 75 years, my 10 years were wasted in drinking: Javed Akhtar
text: Lyricist Javed Akhtar, who turned 75 on Friday, has said he has regrets in his life, adding, "I really believe...out of these 75 years, my 10 years were totally wasted in drinking." "I could have used those years, which I scattered all over my life, in a more constructive manner by learning one more language or...musical instrument," said Javed.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: It is slowly returning to normal: Comedian Rohan on life after AIB
text: Comedian-writer Rohan Joshi, while talking about his life after the disbanding of All India Bakchod (AIB), said that it's slowly returning to normal. He added that he's discovering new things about himself both as a writer and as a performer. Talking about the future of Indian stand-up comedy, Rohan said, "I think we will soon have a breakout transgender comedian."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Jeff ko pakadna mushkil nahi namumkin hai: SRK makes Bezos say Don dialogue
text: In an event hosted by Amazon in India, Shah Rukh Khan made Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos say a dialogue from his film Don. In a video shared by Riteish Deshmukh, Bezos can be seen repeating after Shah Rukh, "Jeff ko pakadna mushkil nahi namumkin hai." Several Bollywood personalities like Vidya Balan, Zoya Akhtar and Farhan Akhtar also attended the event.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Pak's Amir praises Kohli for winning Spirit of Cricket award, calls him 'great'
text: Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir praised India captain Virat Kohli for winning 'ICC Spirit of Cricket' award for urging fans to not boo Steve Smith during a World Cup match. Reacting to Kohli's reaction video after the win, Amir tweeted, "Great words from great player." "That moment was purely understanding an individual’s situation," Kohli said about his gesture in the video.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: You should be ready to bat at any position for India: Shreyas Iyer
text: Team India batsman Shreyas Iyer has said that one should be ready to bat any number for Team India. "Because it is really important to play in the team, (considering) the competition which we have right now," he explained. "Experimentation is something we are looking forward to. Hopefully, we will get a good number for each batsman," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I don't think MS Dhoni will play for India again: Harbhajan Singh
text: Reacting to ex-India captain MS Dhoni being dropped from BCCI's annual contract list, off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said he doesn't think MS Dhoni will play for India again. "I heard 2019 World Cup was his last event...after that he won't play for India again. He had made up his mind long back...that's why he hasn't made himself available," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Annual contracts for India Women out, Mithali dropped to ₹30 lakh from ₹50 lakh
text: BCCI on Thursday announced the annual contract list for India Women for the 2019-20 season. India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj has been downgraded to Grade B (₹30 lakh) from Grade A (₹50 lakh). Further, 15-year-old Shafali Verma became the youngest woman cricketer to break into BCCI's annual contract list. Shafali has been added to the Grade C (₹10 lakh).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I made two films that didn't work: Big Bazaar's Biyani on craziest mistake
text: Big Bazaar's Founder Kishore Biyani recently spoke at an Amazon event where he said that his craziest mistake was making two films that did not work. "I made two films in one year...which was a record in itself," said Biyani. "That taught us don't get attached to what you create. The customer can reject it in one hour," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: ISRO's communication satellite GSAT-30 launched from South America
text: India's communication satellite GSAT-30, aimed at providing high-quality television, telecommunications and broadcasting services, was successfully launched onboard Ariane-5 rocket from French Guiana on Friday. French Guiana is an overseas department of France on the northeast coast of South America. ISRO's UR Rao Satellite Centre Director P Kunhikrishnan was also present at the launch site.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Give us Delhi Police for 2 days, will hang Nirbhaya convicts: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has demanded Delhi Police under AAP government for two days to hang convicts of Nirbhaya gangrape case. This comes after Union Minister Prakash Javadekar blamed the Delhi government for the delay in hanging. Javadekar said AAP government took 2.5 years to give notice to convicts after the Supreme Court upheld their death sentence in 2017.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: In a first, Census data collection to include families headed by transgenders
text: For the first time, the government will collect data on households headed by a person from the transgender community and members living in the family, Home Ministry officials said. The previous census had only 'male or female' options under the head of the household. People will be asked 31 questions for Census 2021 exercise scheduled to begin from April 1.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Why are PM, Home Minister silent on Davinder Singh: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has asked that why are Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and National Security Advisor silent on suspended DSP Davinder Singh who was arrested with terrorists. Gandhi also questioned Singh's role in Pulwama attack and asked who was protecting him. He added that Singh must be tried by a fast-track court within six months.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Medical fraternity takes out anti-CAA rally in Karnataka's Kalaburagi
text: Hundreds of medical fraternity members in Karnataka's Kalaburagi held a protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), the National Register of Citizens (NRC) and the National Population Register (NPR) in front of the Deputy Commissioner's office on Thursday. This comes days after a rally carried a 2,000 metre-long Tricolour flag in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in the city.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: File report on status of Nirbhaya convicts' execution: Court to Tihar Jail
text: A Delhi court has directed the Tihar Jail to file a report by Friday on the status of the scheduled execution of the Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts. The court's order came after jail authorities wrote to the Delhi government for a new date of execution due to mercy plea. The convicts are scheduled to be hanged on January 22.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 5 Pakistani men indicted in US for aiding Pak's nuclear weapons programme
text: Five Pakistani businessmen have been indicted in the US for allegedly smuggling US-origin products to Pakistan for use in the country's nuclear weapons programme. They allegedly tried to hide destinations of the exports by using a network of front companies. "The defendants smuggled goods to entities that have been designated as threats to US national security," the Justice Department said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US state stops distribution of 1 lakh free condoms over phrases on wrappers
text: Utah Governor Gary Herbert has halted distribution of 1 lakh free condoms in the US state. Utah Department of Health apologised for "offensive" phrases on the wrappers of the condoms distributed as part of an HIV campaign. The wrappers featured phrases like "SL,UT", a wordplay on Utah and its capital, Salt Lake City, "Enjoy Your Mountin" and "Explore Utah's Caves".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I would pee on Taal volcano to extinguish it: Philippine President
text: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte said that he would pee on the Taal volcano to extinguish it. Duterte visited areas affected by the Taal Volcano eruption, claiming that he made the visit despite warnings by his doctors about the volcanic ash fall. While visiting one of the affected areas, Duterte said that "beautiful women" there made his problems disappear.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Mallya let 17-bedroom French island mansion 'fall into disrepair': Bank
text: Vijay Mallya let his mansion with 17 bedrooms and a nightclub in a French island "fall into disrepair", a bank alleged. Mallya defaulted on the $30-million loan he took to buy it. The bank is seeking a London court's order to force Mallya to sell his superyacht impounded in England because a $5.6-million mortgage on the boat serves as security.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Mumbai cheapest among world's most expensive cities for luxuries: Swiss bank
text: India's financial capital Mumbai was ranked last in a list of the world's 28 most expensive cities for luxury living compiled by Swiss private bank Julius Baer. The Julius Baer Lifestyle Index tracked the price trends for a variety of luxury goods and services including watches, ladies' handbags, men's suits and pianos. Hong Kong emerged as the priciest city overall.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Jio becomes India's largest operator with 37 crore users 3 years after launch
text: Asia's richest person Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Jio has become India's largest telecom operator by subscribers overtaking Vodafone Idea, achieving the milestone three years and three months after commencing operations. Jio had 36.99 crore subscribers as of November 30 last year, while Vodafone Idea and Airtel's subscriber base stood at 33.62 crore and 32.73 crore respectively, TRAI data showed.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Kerala govt asks officials not to carry out NPR process, warns of action
text: Kerala government has asked its district collectors to ensure that the National Population Register (NPR) process isn't carried out in the state. "It has come to the notice...that some Census functionaries are mentioning NPR operations while sending communications," Principal Secretary (General Admin), KR Jyothilal wrote. The government warned of strict action against officials who defy the order.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim refuses to play in Pakistan
text: Bangladesh wicketkeeper-batsman Mushfiqur Rahim has reportedly denied visiting Pakistan to play the upcoming three T20Is, two Tests and one ODI between January and April. On Tuesday, the Pakistan Cricket Board had announced that Bangladesh have agreed to play all the matches in Pakistan. Initially, Bangladesh had only agreed for the T20I tour and not the Tests due to security reasons.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Mohun Bagan merges with ATK FC, will compete in ISL 2020-21
text: Football club Mohun Bagan on Thursday merged with two-time Indian Super League (ISL) winner ATK FC after RPSG Group, which owns and runs ATK, announced acquiring majority shares in Mohun Bagan. The newly formed entity will compete in the 2020-21 ISL season and all other competitions organised by the All India Football Federation. ATK is currently third in ISL standings.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Raut's remark on Indira taken out of context: Aaditya Thackeray
text: Amid controversy over Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's "Indira Gandhi used to meet don Karim Lala" remark, Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray said that Raut's statement was taken out of context. "With the kind of respect late Balasaheb Thackeray had for late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, I do not think there will be any unpleasant remark from Sena workers," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Will give 20,000 litres water for free in Delhi if in power: Cong
text: Ahead of Delhi assembly election, Delhi Congress on Thursday said that they will provide 20,000 litres of water a month for free and will also give 30 paise cashback for each litre of water saved by Delhi residents if they come back to power. "If a family saves 10,000 litres, it will get ₹3,000," Delhi Congress President Subhash Chopra said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Madhya Pradesh govt to start campaign against open sale of acid
text: The Madhya Pradesh government will start a campaign against the open sale of acid, days after it became the first state to declare 'Chhapaak' tax-free. "It's not enough to declare the movie based on acid attack survivors tax-free," CM Kamal Nath tweeted. The incidents of acid attacks were "a sign of barbarism, brutality" and they'll not be tolerated, he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: SC allows resuming construction of Mopa international airport in Goa
text: The Supreme Court allowed resumption of construction of an international airport in Goa's Mopa, by lifting the suspension on environmental clearance (EC) granted to it. The SC had asked the Expert Appraisal Committee to revisit its recommendations for the EC, citing concerns over ecological impact. GMR Goa International Airport Ltd gave an assurance that it would adopt a "zero-carbon programme".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Airtel, Vodafone Idea consider curative petition as SC rejects AGR plea
text: Bharti Airtel expressed disappointment after the Supreme Court rejected the telecom companies' review plea against its October 24 judgment on the definition of Adjusted Gross Revenue. Airtel said the disputes raised were "bonafide and genuine", adding that it may file a curative petition. Vodafone Idea also said that it was exploring further options, including the filing of a curative petition.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 'Dear Comrade' actress Rashmika Mandanna's house raided by income tax officials
text: Around 10 income tax officials on Thursday raided the house of 'Dear Comrade' actress Rashmika Mandanna in Virajpet Taluka of Karnataka's Kodagu district. As Rashmika was in Hyderabad for shooting, information on her investments were collected from her father Madan Mandanna. Her manager said the raid would not yield any result as all the taxes have been paid off.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I didn't try to be open, but I didn't hide it either: Aamir's daughter on relationship
text: Speaking about her relationship, Aamir Khan's daughter Ira said, "I wasn't trying to be open...I was just posting what I felt like posting [online]." "If you feel like being open, you should be open about it, and if you don't, then don't. I wasn't trying to be open, but I was also not trying to hide anything," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Add WhatsApp University to Oxford dictionary, just like Bollywood: Abhay Deol
text: Actor Abhay Deol took to Instagram to share a picture which read, "WhatsApp University, Where Ignorance is Bliss". "This word needs to be added to the #oxforddictionary. Just like they added #bollywood. Both of them are propaganda tools too! Any of you alumni?" he captioned the picture. "Where everyone is a part of the faculty," a user wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Some fear Dhoni is finished, I would love him to have a big IPL: Bhogle
text: Reacting to ex-India captain MS Dhoni being dropped from the BCCI's annual contract list, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "The biggest news...is that there is none for MS Dhoni; which suggests, as some fear, that he may have come to the end." He added, "I would love him to have a big IPL with CSK though. And after that...who knows!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 4 elderly women scrub grass clippings off the pitch ahead of Rajkot ODI
text: Four elderly women scrubbed grass clippings off the pitch to prepare the surface at Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Rajkot ahead of second India-Australia ODI. The women were seen using handheld brushes and collecting the trimmings in dustpans before the pitch was rolled sideways by curators.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Only 2 wicketkeepers get annual contracts from BCCI; Karthik also out
text: After former India captain MS Dhoni and 34-year-old Dinesh Karthik were not retained by BCCI in their annual contracts for 2019-20 season, Rishabh Pant and Wriddhiman Saha remained the only two specialist wicketkeepers in the list. Dinesh Karthik, who leads Kolkata Knight Riders, scored 136 runs in 10 innings for India in 2019, remaining unbeaten on four occasions.
author: Utkarsh Kumar

headlines: Musk's mother shares his childhood pic with toy truck, cracks Cybertruck joke
text: Elon Musk's 71-year-old mother and model Maye Musk on Thursday posted a picture on Twitter, that showed the Tesla CEO when he was three years old. "@elonmusk 3-years-old 'I can build a better truck than this'," she captioned the picture in reference to Tesla's Cybertruck unveiled last year. "They're making trucks for Earth, Elon made for Mars," a user commented.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Goldman Sachs sells off its entire stake in Uber: Report
text: Goldman Sachs, one of Uber's key investors, sold off its entire holdings in the company in the last few months of 2019, CNBC reported on Wednesday. The sale likely resulted in a large gain for the early Uber investor, the report added. In the past, Goldman's public and private holdings in companies like Uber and WeWork affected its quarterly results.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Need to put people who've been radicalised in de-radicalisation camps: CDS Rawat
text: Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat said there's need to start a "counter-radicalisation programme" and young people who've been radicalised need to be identified and "possibly be taken in de-radicalisation camps". "Radicalisation is happening from schools, universities, religious places," he added. "Girls and boys as young as 10 and 12 are now being radicalised," he further said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 5 dead, 2 injured after train collides with bullock cart in Bihar
text: At least five were killed and two others were injured after a train collided with a bullock cart in Bihar's Samastipur district on Thursday, officials said. An accident relief medical van carrying a team of doctors was rushed to the spot. "Prima facie, it is a case of negligence on part of the person driving the bullock cart," officials added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: LeT associate who threatened civilians, gave logistics held: J&K Police
text: An associate of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists was arrested from Pulwama district in Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Thursday. Police identified him as Ishfaq Ahmad Dar alias Maheed resident of Dangerpora-Padgampora in Pulwama district. As per the investigation, Dar was involved in threatening and intimidating civilians and was also involved in providing logistic support to LeT, police said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 30,000 Bru refugees from Mizoram to permanently settle in Tripura
text: Over 30,000 Bru refugees from Mizoram will be permanently settled in Tripura as part of an agreement signed between the Union Government and stakeholders from Tripura, Mizoram and members of the Bru community. The Bru tribals have been living in Tripura after they fled Mizoram in 1997 following ethnic clashes between them and the Mizo community.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 5 more J&K leaders detained post Article 370 abrogation released
text: Jammu and Kashmir administration has released five politicians including three former legislators after keeping them in preventive detention for over five months following the abrogation of Article 370. The released leaders included former Mayor of Srinagar Municipal Corporation Salman Sagar, National Conference leaders Altaf Kaloo and Showkat Ganaie and PDP's Nizamuddin Bhat and Mukhtar Bandh.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Odisha railway station inaugurated by PM Modi gets only 2 passengers daily: RTI
text: The Bichhupali railway station in Odisha that was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi last year gets only two passengers daily and Railways earn a daily revenue of ₹20 from the station, an RTI query revealed. Two trains run between Bichhupali and Bolangir station twice every day. The monthly maintenance cost for the station is about ₹3.5 lakh, according to reports.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Iran detains person who shared video of missile downing Ukranian plane
text: Iran's elite Revolutionary Guards detained a person for posting a video of a missile shooting down the Ukrainian plane killing all 176 people on board, Iran's semi-official Fars news agency reported. The person will reportedly face charges related to national security. Earlier, Iran had admitted that its military had "unintentionally" shot down the Ukrainian plane.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Prince William congratulates deaf winner using sign language; video surfaces
text: Prince William used sign language to congratulate TV interpreter Alex Duguid, a video of which was shared by the Kensington Palace. William could be seen honouring the deaf Member of the Order of the British Empire recipient. "He's an example of how profoundly deaf people can have an impact on their community, peers and country," the Palace said about Duguid.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pak's ex-President Musharraf moves SC against high treason case verdict
text: Pakistan's former President Pervez Musharraf has moved the Supreme Court challenging the special court's verdict that found him guilty of high treason and handed him a death sentence. In his 90-page appeal, he said that the trial was completed "in sheer violation" of the Constitution and the Code of Criminal Procedure and therefore, the judgment should be set aside.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: I can be blamed for only 5,000 out of 17,000 deaths in civil war: Nepal's ex-PM
text: Former Nepal Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda' said that he is ready to take the blame for the death of only 5,000 out of more than 17,000 people killed during the decade-long civil war. "What is true is that the state forces killed 12,000 people...the 'kings' of yesterday should take (the blame) for 12,000 others," he added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: CBI files case against Adani Enterprises in 6 lakh tonne coal supply deal
text: The CBI has filed a case against Adani Enterprises for alleged irregularities in the award of contract for supplying six lakh tonnes of coal to Andhra Pradesh in 2010. Three former officials of National Cooperative Consumers' Federation have been accused of favouring Adani despite it being ineligible. The CBI also alleged that Adani used a proxy company in the tender.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Games with Madrid were special when Ronaldo was there: Messi
text: Talking about the sporting rivalry with former Real Madrid forward Cristiano Ronaldo, Barcelona forward Lionel Messi said that El Clasicos were "special" when Ronaldo was in Madrid. "Competing head to head for so many years will be remembered forever," he added. Ronaldo, who has moved to Juventus in Serie A, played with Real Madrid from 2009 until 2018.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: 20-yr-old no. 1 Australian player out of Aus Open due to injury
text: The 20-year-old local tennis player Alex de Minaur has pulled out of the Australia Open with an abdominal injury that he suffered during the recently concluded ATP Cup. De Minaur, who's also Australia's number one player, had earlier this week pulled out of the Adelaide International. "Even though it killed me, it's the right decision," he said.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Williamson returns to T20Is as NZ name squad for India series
text: New Zealand have announced a 14-member squad for the upcoming five-match T20I series against India scheduled to start from January 24. Kane Williamson, who last played a T20I in February last year, will be making a comeback in the shortest format of the game. Pacer Hamish Bennett, who hasn't played a T20I for New Zealand, is also in the squad.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: PV Sindhu knocked out of Indonesia Masters
text: Shuttler PV Sindhu on Thursday was knocked out from the Indonesia Masters after she lost in the quarterfinals. After winning the first game 21-16, Sindhu lost the next two 16-21, 19-21 against Japan's Sayaka Takahashi. Earlier in the tournament, Saina Nehwal was knocked out by the same Japanese shuttler. With Sindhu's defeat, the Indian campaign in Indonesia Masters has ended.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Nirbhaya convicts' hanging delayed due to AAP's negligence: Javadekar
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar blamed AAP government's "negligence" for delay in the hanging of the convicts in the Nirbhaya gangrape case. He said AAP took 2.5 years to give convicts the mercy plea notice after their death sentence was announced in 2017. The Delhi government said the convicts won't be hanged on January 22 as mercy plea has been filed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Students of select universities talking of dividing India: Rijiju
text: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju has said that while Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set the target of 'Ek Bharat, Shreshtha Bharat', some students of select universities in the country are talking of doing 'tukde-tukde' (dividing) of the country. He said the youths of the country shouldn't pay heed to "anti-national slogans" and put their energy towards India's development.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia files nomination for Delhi Assembly election
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader and Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday filed his nomination from the Patparganj constituency for the Delhi assembly elections. Ahead of filing nomination papers, Sisodia said that his party is fighting to cross 68 seats in the upcoming polls. The Delhi election is slated to be held on February 8.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: ED summons AirAsia CEO Tony Fernandes, management on January 20
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned AirAsia CEO Tony Fernandes and the entire top management on January 20 in connection with a money laundering case. ED had registered a case in May 2018 under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act over allegations that the airline tried to manipulate government policies to obtain the license for its Indian venture, AirAsia India.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon not doing any favour by investing $1 bn in India: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday said Amazon isn't doing any favour by investing $1 billion in India, at a time when Amazon's Founder and world's richest person Jeff Bezos is on a visit to India. "If they are getting a billion dollars to finance losses then question to be raised is where the loss came from," Goyal said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: It took time: Kalki on being friends with ex-husband Anurag Kashyap
text: Kalki Koechlin, while speaking about being friends with her ex-husband Anurag Kashyap, said, "It just sort of happened organically. It took time." "We did take a lot of time apart in the beginning," she added. "You can still love a person and not be able to live with them, and I think we were able to recognise that," said Kalki.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Audience give up seats for kids with cancer during Tanhaji show, praised by Kajol
text: Kajol on Wednesday shared an article about audience members giving up their seats for young cancer patients who went to watch 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. The article stated that the children had turned up for the regular show instead of their special show due to miscommunication. "That's humanity. That's what we should be working towards. Getting it back," Kajol tweeted.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Which players have received pay hike in BCCI's latest annual contract list?
text: Batsman KL Rahul and wicketkeeper-batsman Wriddhiman Saha have received pay hike in the BCCI's latest annual contract list. Saha, who was included in Grade C (₹1 crore) for 2018-19, has been moved to Grade B (₹3 crore) for 2019-2020 season, while Rahul has been moved to Grade A (₹5 crore) from Grade B (₹3 crore).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Amir takes a dig at PCB for not selecting him in T20I squad, deletes tweet later
text: Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir, who retired from Test cricket in July last year to concentrate on white-ball cricket, has been dropped from the T20I series against Bangladesh. Reacting to his omission, the 27-year-old fast bowler tweeted, "Reason Test cricket." Amir later deleted the tweet and wrote, "No worries chill everyone I will come back stronger InshAllah."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Which players have been given annual contract by BCCI for the first time?
text: As many as six new players feature in the annual contract list for Team India for the period of October 2019 to September 2020. Fast bowlers Shardul Thakur, Navdeep Saini and Deepak Chahar, batsman Shreyas Iyer and off-spinner Washington Sundar have been included in Grade C (₹1 crore). Meanwhile, Mayank Agarwal has been included in Grade B (₹3 crore).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I'm out: World's most-followed YouTuber PewDiePie in last video before break
text: World's most-followed individual YouTuber Felix Kjellberg, known as 'PewDiePie', posted his last YouTube video before taking a break, titled, 'It's been real, but I'm out!' The 30-year-old Swedish YouTuber with 102 million subscribers, said, "I love making videos...I just feel like I need to do this." Last year, he announced he'll be "taking a break" from YouTube in early 2020.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: BJP and JD(U) will contest Bihar Assembly elections together: Amit Shah
text: Addressing a crowd in Bihar's Vaishali, Home Minister Amit Shah said that BJP and JD(U) will together contest the state Assembly elections. "It will be fought under Nitish Kumar ji's leadership," he added. Commenting on Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Shah further said, "I've also come to tell Rahul Gandhi and Lalu Prasad Yadav to not mislead the people."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Pawan Kalyan's Jana Sena forms alliance with BJP in Andhra Pradesh
text: Actor-politician Pawan Kalyan's Jana Sena Party (JSP) has decided to ally with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Andhra Pradesh, to "protect the interests of the state and its people." The announcement came after a meeting in Vijayawada on Thursday, in the wake of the ongoing protests in Andhra Pradesh's Amaravati region, over the YSRCP government's proposal for three capitals.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India-born Co-founder's AI automation startup Zinier raises $90 million
text: Silicon Valley and Bengaluru-based AI automation startup Zinier has announced it has raised $90 million in Series C funding led by investment firm ICONIQ Capital. Tiger Global Management and existing investors, including Accel, Founders Fund, NGP Capital, Newfund Capital, and Qualcomm Ventures also participated in the round. The startup was founded in 2014 by Andrew Wolf and India-born Arka Dhar.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 2019 second hottest year on record, extreme weather ahead: UN
text: The year 2019 was the second warmest year on record after 2016, UN's World Meteorological Organisation report said. The past decade was the hottest on record, the UN added, stating that they "expect to see much extreme weather throughout 2020 and coming decades". An official said this will be "fuelled by record levels of heat-trapping greenhouse gases in the atmosphere".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Terror attack averted ahead of R-Day after 5 Jaish terrorists arrested in J&K
text: The Jammu and Kashmir Police said on Thursday that a major terror attack ahead of the Republic Day has been averted after the Srinagar Police busted a Jaish-e-Mohammed module and arrested five terrorists. "Two grenade blasts in Hazratbal area worked out," the Jammu and Kashmir Police further said in a tweet.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: India to invite Pakistan PM Imran Khan to attend SCO summit
text: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said that India will invite Pakistan PM Imran Khan for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Delhi later this year. "As per the established procedure within SCO, all eight members as well as four observer states and other international dialogue partners will be invited to attend the meeting," Kumar added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Delhi govt rejects mercy plea of Nirbhaya gangrape convict Mukesh
text: Delhi government has rejected the mercy plea of Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case convict Mukesh Singh. The mercy plea was then forwarded to Delhi Lieutenant Governor, who has sent it to Union Ministry of Home Affairs. President Ram Nath Kovind will make a final decision on the basis of recommendations by the Delhi government and the Ministry of Home Affairs.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Cong corporator hits female journo at Mumbai metro station; she shares video
text: A female journalist shared an incident wherein Congress corporator Vikrant Chavan hit her hand to stop her from recording a video at a metro station in Mumbai. Tabassum Barnagarwala said she intervened as Chavan was shouting at Metro staffers and security personnel. "Tu ja yahan se. Mein Vikrant Chavan hun. Corporator," he said when Barnagarwala asked him to calm down.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Govt understating fiscal deficit, real shortfall will be 4.5% of GDP: SC Garg
text: Former Finance Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg has claimed the government is understating fiscal deficit, the difference between total revenue and expenditure. Garg estimates real shortfall, which includes on- and off-budget borrowings, widening to at least 4.5% against 3.55% estimated previously for 2019-20. He further said it's unlikely that headline fiscal deficit would be less than 3.5%.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Telecom firms must pay ₹92,000 crore in a week, SC rejects review petition
text: The Supreme Court has rejected the petitions of telecom operators to review its October 24 judgment upholding the government's definition of Adjusted Gross Revenue, which includes non-core revenue. The companies now have until January 23 to pay over ₹92,000 crore in overdue levies and interest. Telcos pay 3-5% of their AGR as spectrum usage charges and 8% as licence fees.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: An ideal in-law: Big B after daughter's mother-in-law Ritu's demise
text: Amitabh Bachchan took to his blog to mourn the demise of his daughter Shweta Nanda's mother-in-law and Rishi Kapoor's sister, Ritu Nanda. "An ideal daughter, an ideal sister, an ideal wife, an ideal mother, an ideal in-law, an ideal mother-in-law...an ideal friend...left us...in...distance we cannot cover...for now," he wrote. Ritu passed away on Tuesday at the age of 71.nn
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Iulia Vantur to make her B'wood debut in 'Laila Majnu': Reports
text: Salman Khan‘s rumoured girlfriend Iulia Vantur will reportedly make her Bollywood debut in Prem R Soni's comedy film 'Laila Majnu'. The film, which will revolve around two men trying to win over the same woman, also features Shashank Vyas, Abhimanyu Tomar and Nehal Chudasama in the lead roles, reports added. Earlier, Iulia's 'Radha Kyun Gori Main Kyun Kaala' was shelved.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I would've been very vocal: 4-time Grand Slam champ on Aus bushfires
text: Four-time Grand Slam champion Kim Clijsters has said had she been in Australia, she would've been "very vocal" over the bushfires. "I would have…at least talk to the...tournament directors to try and think about the solutions," she said amid criticism over Australia Open being organised in poor air quality. "If it's not possible to play...then what's the point?" she asked.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Paul Stirling scores 95 off 47 as Ireland defeat WI by 4 runs
text: Ireland on Wednesday defeated West Indies by four runs in first T20I of the three-match series. Batting first, Ireland posted 208/7 on the board with opener Paul Stirling slamming 95 off 47 balls. Chasing the target, Windies, who needed 13 to win from the last over with five wickets in hand, ended their innings on 204/7.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: We want dialogue, working to prevent war: Iran President
text: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani has said his government is working daily to prevent military confrontation or war. He added that dialogue with the international community was difficult but remained "possible". Rouhani's remark comes amid tensions between US and Iran over the killing of Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani in US airstrikes and Iran's downing of Ukrainian plane killing 176 onboard.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Aus govt used funds to target marginal voters for 2019 poll: Auditor
text: Ahead of May 2019 election, Australia government used $69 million sport development fund to target voters in marginal electorates, Australian National Audit Office report said. The government also awarded grants to favour "targeted" Coalition seats. The report also suggests the grant scheme could have been illegal, with no apparent legal authority for Sports Minister to make such considerations.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: US efforts to rebuild Afghanistan worse than D-minus: Govt watchdog
text: The US efforts in Afghanistan to reconstruct the country and train its military has been hit by lies, constant turnover of US personnel and politically-driven timelines, US Special Inspector General for Afghan Reconstruction said. The worse than "D-minus" efforts were weakened by lack of understanding of "historical, social, legal and political traditions" of Afghanistan, the watchdog added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Ready to make Harris running mate in US presidential polls: Biden
text: Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden said Kamala Harris is "qualified to be president" and he was ready to make her his running mate in the 2020 elections, if nominated by the party. "I'd consider her for anything she would be interested in", including for Vice President, Biden added. The Indian-American senator ended her presidential campaign last year citing financial pressure.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Iran's nuclear enrichment higher than before 2015 deal: Prez Rouhani
text: Iran is now enriching more uranium than it did before the nuclear deal was reached in 2015, the country's President Hassan Rouhani said, adding that Iran was continuing to make progress despite pressure from world leaders. Iran announced on January 5 that it was ending its commitments under the deal after US killed its top commander in an air strike.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US military resumes joint operations in Iraq to fight ISIS: Report
text: The US resumed joint military operations in Iraq in order to continue their fight against the Islamic State, the New York Times reported. The operations had been put on hold after the US killed Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani in a drone strike in Baghdad. Iraq's Parliament had voted to remove all the American troops from the country after the strike.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I only eat 7 meals in a week, just dinner: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey
text: Twitter Co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey said that he eats "seven meals every week, just dinner," while answering Twitter users' questions in a video by Wired. Dorsey said this in response to a user who asked if he has only five meals a week citing an old article. Dorsey added that he tries to meditate for two hours every day.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US House sends Trump impeachment articles to Senate for trial
text: The US House of Representatives sent two formal impeachment articles against President Donald Trump to the Senate for trial. Trump has been charged with abuse of power for asking Ukraine to investigate political rival Joe Biden and with obstruction of Congress for preventing his administration from cooperating with the impeachment investigation. Seven House Democrats will prosecute Trump.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: I shouldn't be having opinion on what Deepika is doing: Kangana on her JNU visit
text: Kangana Ranaut, when asked to comment on Deepika Padukone's JNU visit to express solidarity with students, said, "I think she's exercising her democratic right and she very well knows what she's doing." "I shouldn't be having an opinion on it," she added. "I can say what I want to do. I won't stand behind 'tukde-tukde' gang," Kangana further said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Dog howls as man sings Ranu Mondal's song; video goes viral
text: A video of a dog howling as a man sings Ranu Mondal's song 'Teri Meri Kahani' has gone viral. Sharing the clip on Facebook, user Subir Khan said the dog was named 'Bagha' and urged people "not to laugh", while adding, "Today morning Bagha and I practiced songs for a while." The original video has over 2 million views.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Hrithik was crying after becoming a star overnight, said he can't handle it: Rakesh
text: Rakesh Roshan has revealed it was difficult for his son Hrithik Roshan to handle sudden fame after 'Kaho Naa...Pyaar Hai' released. "Hrithik was crying in his room. He was like, 'I can't handle it. I can't work...There are buses full of girls and boys coming to meet me," he added. "I...explained, 'You should take this as a blessing'," said Rakesh.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I'm not rubber stamp: Guv after Kerala moves SC over CAA without consent
text: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has alleged that Kerala government's decision to move the Supreme Court (SC) against CAA is a "breach of protocol and courtesy". Adding that he isn't "just a rubber stamp", Khan said he came to know about it "through newspapers". "I'll look into it whether...state government can go to SC without Governor's approval," he further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: NZ women cricketers Satterthwaite, Tahuhu announce birth of baby girl
text: New Zealand Women captain Amy Satterthwaite and her wife and teammate Lea Tahuhu have announced the arrival of their first baby girl, Grace Marie Satterthwaite. "Amy and I are excited to announce the arrival of Grace Marie Satterthwaite, born 13th January. We are so grateful and couldn't be happier #babysatterhuhu," Lea wrote on Instagram, sharing a picture.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I am waiting for Virat Kohli to invite me for dinner: David Warner
text: In an interview with SunRisers Hyderabad, Australia opener David Warner said he is waiting for India captain Virat Kohli to invite him for dinner. "Got my phone waiting here, Virat," he added. "The biggest thing I think is he's a competitor. The way he goes about it, you know he's got a humble nature about him," he added about Kohli.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Applications to become billionaire's girlfriend for Moon trip cross 20,000
text: Applications to become Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa's girlfriend to join him on a trip around Moon have crossed 20,000. The 44-year-old is seeking single females aged over 20 and the selection process will be the subject of a documentary called "Full Moon Lovers". Maezawa is due to fly around the Moon in 2023 as the first private passenger of SpaceX.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Mozilla fires 70 employees, programmer tweets 'No idea who I'll be reporting to'
text: Mozilla fired about 70 employees on Thursday, TechCrunch reported citing an internal memo by Mozilla Chairwoman mentioning slow rollout of Mozilla's revenue-generating products as the reason. Chris Hartjes, a Mozilla programmer, tweeted, "No idea what I'll be working on or who I'll be reporting to. Some good work friends let go." In 2018, Mozilla said it has 1,000 employees worldwide.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Apple buys on-device AI startup in a reported $200 million deal
text: Apple has acquired Seattle-based AI startup Xnor.ai for a reported $200 million. Apple said, "Apple buys smaller technology companies from time to time and we generally don't discuss our purpose or plans." Spun off in 2017 from non-profit Allen Institute for AI, Xnor.ai specialises in low-power edge-based tools that allow AI to operate on devices, rather than in the cloud.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I once met Dawood Ibrahim and scolded him: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has revealed that he once met underworld don Dawood Ibrahim, the key accused in the 1993 Mumbai serial blasts. "I have not just seen him (Dawood) but I have met him and I have also admonished him," he said. Raut had also claimed that former PM Indira Gandhi used to meet don Karim Lala.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: MCC mustn't stop Centre from making Budget promises for Delhi: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that the Model Code of Conduct in Delhi should not stop the Centre from making announcements in the Union Budget that would benefit the national capital. "Delhi's development shouldn't stop at any cost," Kejriwal said, declaring that he disagreed with advice that the AAP should get the Union Budget postponed after the Assembly elections.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Cards never used for online payments to be disabled for this purpose
text: The RBI has told banks that existing debit and credit cards which have never been used for online or contactless transactions should be mandatorily disabled for this purpose. To increase the security of card transactions, banks have also been asked to give cardholders the facility to enable or disable cards and modify transaction limits within the overall card limit.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Jawans aim pellets at legs, stone-pelters get hit on face when they bend: CDS
text: Stating that pellet guns are supposed to be a non-lethal weapon system, Chief of Defence Staff Bipin Rawat explained how stone-pelters receive pellet injuries in eyes and on face. General Rawat said that the Army soldiers aim for the leg with pellet guns but the pelters get hit on their faces when they are bending down to pick stones.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Woman IAS officer criticised for driving bus, BMTC issues clarification
text: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has issued a clarification after its Managing Director C Shikha was criticised for driving a bus allegedly without the requisite licence. BMTC said it was done in a controlled environment and there was no harm to people. Pictures and videos of Shikha, a 2004 batch IAS officer, driving the bus surfaced on social media.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 17-yr-old missing girl who accused DIG of molestation found; boy with her held
text: A 17-year-old girl, who had accused DIG Nishikant More of molestation in Maharashtra, has returned to Navi Mumbai after being missing for days. The girl was traced in Dehradun along with a 19-year-old boy, who has been arrested by police on charges of kidnapping and sexual assault. The girl had allegedly left a suicide note before leaving home.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Many 'visionary initiatives' undertaken by PM Modi govt: Ratan Tata
text: After laying the foundation stone of the Indian Institute of Skills (IIS) in Gujarat's Gandhinagar, Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata on Wednesday said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led BJP government has undertaken many "visionary initiatives" for India. "I wish I was 20 years younger...I could contribute more [to]  this initiative (to develop IIS)," he added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Who is Mikhail Mishustin, Russia's next PM chosen by Putin?
text: Mikhail Mishustin, who has been chosen as Russia's next PM by President Vladimir Putin, is the head of the Federal Tax Service. The 53-year-old worked in the computer and IT sector before joining the tax service as a civil servant in 1998. He holds a doctorate in economics and oversaw the opening of the first special economic zones in Russia.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pak bans news show, anchor for 60 days after minister displays army boot on air
text: Pakistan's media watchdog has banned a news show and its anchor for 60 days after Cabinet Minister Faisal Vawda displayed an army boot on live TV to criticise the Opposition. Vawda had criticised Pakistan Peoples Party and Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) for voting in favour of the Army Act and said that (PML-N) was "lying down to kiss the boot".
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Say 'thank you, Mr President': Trump asks top JPMorgan executive
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday asked a JPMorgan executive to thank him for the bank's "incredible" earnings. "Will you say, 'Thank you, Mr President?' I made a lot of bankers look very good," Trump told Mary Erdoes, CEO of JPMorgan Asset & Wealth Management. Trump thanked some of the biggest US companies after signing a trade deal with China.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: When I saw Monsoon Wedding, I thought Indians are loving: Director Destin
text: Hollywood filmmaker Destin Daniel Cretton has said the first time he watched Mira Nair's 'Monsoon Wedding' he thought, "people in India are loving and laughing" just like him. "It made me...feel connected to people...I think it allows me to grow as...person," he added. Destin further said when he was growing up, films made him feel less alone in the world.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I want to be in back to back films for my fans: Shraddha
text: Actress Shraddha Kapoor has said she wants to be in back to back films as much as possible for her fans and audiences. "As long as my sleep isn't compromised, I'm happy to be crazy busy...I love doing things non-stop," she added. Shraddha's 'Street Dancer 3D' and 'Baaghi 3' are scheduled to release on January 24 and March 6 respectively.n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Amit confirms breaking up with Annabel, says 'I'm ready to be taken'
text: Actor Amit Sadh, known for his roles in 'Super 30' and 'Kai Po Che', has parted ways with Mumbai-based Brazilian fitness model and girlfriend, Annabel DaSilva. Confirming his breakup, the 36-year-old actor told Mumbai Mirror, "It's absolutely true. I am absolutely single and ready to be taken." The actor has also deleted all of her pictures from his Instagram account.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Mbappe scores brace as PSG defeat Monaco 4-1 in Ligue 1
text: PSG on Wednesday defeated Monaco 4-1 to move eight points clear at top of the Ligue 1. The 21-year-old, Kylian Mbappe, who was with Monaco when they lifted the title in 2017, scored a brace while Neymar and Pablo Sarabia scored the other goals for PSG. Tiemoue Bakayoko was the lone scorer for Monaco who are ninth in the standings.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Sania Mirza enters women's doubles semis in Hobart International
text: Sania Mirza, who has returned to tennis after two years, on Thursday entered the women's doubles semifinals in the Hobart International with Ukrainian partner Nadiia Kichenok. Sania and Kichenok defeated the American pair of Vania King and Christina McHale 6-2, 4-6, 10-4 to enter the semifinals.
