They will now face Slovenia's Tamara Zidansek and Czech Republic's Marie Bouzkova.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Our votes will not be affected if Congress leaves: DMK's Durai Murugan
text: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) leader Durai Murugan has said that his party won't face any loss if Congress decides to leave the alliance in Tamil Nadu. "We're not worried about the Congress leaving...votes we get will not be affected," he further said. Congress leader KS Alagiri had earlier alleged that the DMK is not distributing rural local body posts equitably.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: upGrad's PG Diploma in Data Science introduces 5 specializations
text: upGrad has introduced 5 specializations within its PG Diploma in Data Science to align with the career outcomes a learner aspires. Learners can choose from 5 specializations - Deep Learning, Nature Language Processing, Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Engineering. It's an initiative to provide more personalized learning for data aspirants coming from different bands of experience, says upGrad.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Casting director arrested for running sex racket; charged ₹60k for each victim
text: The social service branch (SSB) of Mumbai Police has arrested a casting director, Navin Kumar Premlal Arya, for allegedly running a prostitution racket. Two women aged 18 and 25, working as junior artistes, were found to be involved, and both were rescued. Acting on a tip-off, the SSB arrested him while he was pimping the two victims for ₹60,000 each. nn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: WWE legend Rocky Johnson, father of Dwayne Johnson, passes away aged 75
text: WWE legend Rocky Johnson, father of Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson, passed away aged 75, announced WWE on Thursday. "Rest in peace, Rocky Johnson. #RIPRocky," WWE tweeted along with a picture of the wrestler from his younger days. Rocky had retired from wrestling in 1991 and was inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame in 2008.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Fan sleeps on footpath for 5 days to meet Pooja Hegde, actress shares video with him
text: Actress Pooja Hegde on Wednesday shared an Instagram video with a fan who slept on the footpath for 5 days after coming to Mumbai to meet her. "I'm so touched but...I'd NEVER want to see you [all] sleeping on the road...to [meet me]," she wrote. The actress can be seen interacting and shaking hands with the fan in the video.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Charulata, Team India fan who went viral during World Cup, passes away at 87
text: Charulata Patel, Team India fan who had gone viral during 2019 World Cup, passed away aged 87. A video of her blowing a horn in the stands to cheer for India against Bangladesh in the tournament was widely shared. "Meeting Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma was the best day of her life," a statement on her official Instagram account read.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: MS Dhoni dropped from annual Team India contract list by BCCI
text: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni has been dropped from the annual Team India contract list by the BCCI. Dhoni, who hasn't played an international match since the 2019 World Cup, was in Grade A (₹5 crore) for the 2018-19 season. Meanwhile, KL Rahul has been upgraded to Grade A from Grade B (₹3 crore) for the 2019-20 season.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Dilip Ghosh re-elected as West Bengal BJP President
text: BJP MP Dilip Ghosh was re-elected as West Bengal BJP unit President on Thursday. Ghosh, who was appointed to the post in December 2015 for three years, received an extension in December 2018 ahead of the Lok Sabha elections. Following an internal meeting today, the BJP appointed Ghosh as its West Bengal President for another three years.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sanjay Raut withdraws 'Indira met don' remark, says 'Cong need not feel hurt'
text: After controversy over his "Indira Gandhi used to meet don Karim Lala" remark, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut withdrew his statement on Thursday. "Our friends from Congress need not feel hurt. If someone feels that my statement has hurt the image of Indira Gandhi ji or hurt someone's feelings, I take back my statement," Raut said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Supermodel says man tagged her in pics from porn sites; files FIR
text: Supermodel and former Miss India (World) Natasha Suri has filed an FIR against a man named Flynn Remedios, alleging he tagged her in objectionable content. "He has taken out pictures with no heads from porn sites and written @NatSuri on them. It's...appearing under my Google name," she said. Natasha added he also ran fake articles about her on his portals.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Man who confessed on live TV to killing nurse had promised her job at AIIMS
text: Maninder Singh, who was recently arrested for killing a nurse at a Chandigarh hotel in December, had duped her and her family of ₹3.50 lakh after sending a fake email. He promised her a job as a nurse at AIIMS. Maninder confessed to his crime on live television and said victim was having an affair with her sister-in-law's brother.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Modi's eyes bulged out after Trump said 'India & China don't share border': Book
text: A book by two Pulitzer-winning journalists, 'A Very Stable Genius', has claimed that US President Donald Trump had once said to PM Narendra Modi, "It's not like you've got China on your border." PM Modi's eyes "bulged out in surprise" in reaction to Trump's statement, the book stated. "Modi's expression gradually shifted, from shock and concern to resignation," it added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: MP man earning ₹6k monthly claims he got tax notice to pay ₹3.49 cr
text: A man from Madhya Pradesh's Bhind has claimed that he received an income tax notice to pay ₹3.49 crore despite earning a monthly income of ₹6,000. He said that an account was opened using his PAN card and photo in 2011, and claimed that transactions worth ₹132 crore were done from it. "I haven't opened the account," he further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Will have to deal with terror like US did after 9/11 attacks: CDS Bipin Rawat
text: Chief of Defence Staff Bipin Rawat on Thursday said, "We have to bring an end to terrorism and that can only happen the way Americans started after 9/11." "As long as there are states which sponsor terrorism, we will have to live with the menace. We need to take the bull by its horns," General Rawat added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: SC sets 3-month deadline for smog towers in Delhi's CP, Anand Vihar
text: The Supreme Court has directed the Centre and Delhi government to install smog towers at Connaught Place and Anand Vihar within three months. "The project...funded by [Centre]...Ministry of Environment and Forests...to monitor the project," the SC said. It further directed the Delhi government to provide space of 30x30 metres for installation of experimental tower at Anand Vihar within seven days.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Man kills pregnant wife, grinds her body in flour mill fearing another girl child
text: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli has been arrested for allegedly killing his 27-year-old wife, grinding her body parts in a flour mill and burning them. The couple's elder daughter had witnessed the crime and informed her maternal grandmother. Police said the couple have two daughters and the accused suspected that his wife would deliver a girl again.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: PMC bank scam accused's house arrest put on hold by SC, to remain in jail
text: The Supreme Court has stayed the Bombay High Court order directing authorities to shift PMC bank scam accused and HDIL promoters Rakesh and Sarang Wadhawan from jail to their residences under 'house arrest'. This comes after the Centre moved the top court asking for an urgent hearing against the High Court's order. The accused will remain in a Mumbai jail.n
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Kangana carved a place for herself in B'wood on her own: Anurag Basu
text: Talking about Kangana Ranaut, filmmaker Anurag Basu said that the actress carved a place for herself in Bollywood on her own. "It's very difficult for an actress to carve a place in this industry, and especially for...outsider," he added. He further called Kangana a "very fast learner" and "very ambitious girl". "She knows where she is going," said Anurag.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I give more importance to style than I do to fashion: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone has said she gives more importance to style than she does to fashion, adding, "Because style is what you make of it." "I do keep up with...trends...I do read about what is in fashion...and what's going on globally," she added. "But I don't necessarily do it because everybody's doing...I only do something I feel...connection with," Deepika further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: After UP, Ajay's 'Tanhaji...' declared tax-free in Haryana
text: After Uttar Pradesh, the Haryana government on Wednesday declared Ajay Devgn's 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' tax-free in the state. It's based on the life of Tanhaji Malusare, who was the military leader of Maratha king Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. The film on Wednesday crossed ₹100 crore mark at the box office, becoming the first Bollywood film of 2020 to do so.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Decided to date Nick after seeing his music video 'Close': Priyanka
text: Priyanka Chopra said in an interview that she decided to date her now-husband, Nick Jonas, after she saw his 2016 music video 'Close', in which "his shirt comes off". "My life has...been pretty musical, and...with Nick, it's completely musical," she added. Priyanka further said both of them didn't know about each other's careers before they came into each other's lives.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Watched Ananya, Janhvi's interviews to learn from their mistakes: Alaya
text: Pooja Bedi's daughter and actress Alaya F, who'll make her debut in 'Jawaani Jaaneman', has said she watched all the interviews of Sara Ali Khan, Ananya Panday and Janhvi Kapoor to "learn from their mistakes". Talking about nepotism, Alaya said, "We need to realise...even in our struggle, we're privileged." "But...because I'm privileged, doesn't mean...[I won't]...do what I love," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: We'll probably never do it: Twitter CEO on edit button
text: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey in a Wired Q&A round, where he answered questions from Twitter users, said the platform would "probably never" have an edit button. "Can we get that edit button in 2020?" a user asked, to which Dorsey said "No". He also mentioned Twitter's origin as an SMS-like service as the reason for declining an edit button option.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: J-K administration strips Davinder Singh of Sher-e-Kashmir Police Medal
text: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has "forfeited" the Sher-e-Kashmir Police Medal for Gallantry awarded to DSP Davinder Singh, who was arrested with terrorists while travelling in his car to Jammu. The administration said that Singh's act brought "disrepute" to the police. This comes a day after J&K Police said that Singh has not been awarded any gallantry or President's medal.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP cutting education budget to make youth 'powerless': Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has said that BJP is reducing education budget both at the Centre and in the states being run by them, to ensure that "youth remains powerless". "BJP's mindset is...investing in education isn't smart....[as youth in future will]...question governments," he added. Sisodia further said that Delhi's education budget increased from 16% to 26% in six years.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Man commits suicide at Delhi metro's Dwarka Mor station
text: A 50-year-old man allegedly committed suicide at Delhi Metro's Dwarka Mor metro station, as per reports. "Delay in services between Dwarka Sector 21 and Rajiv Chowk due to a passenger on track at Dwarka Mor. Normal service on all other lines," Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) tweeted around 10 am. "Normal services have resumed," DMRC tweeted 15 minutes later.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: PM Modi isn't worried about Indian minorities and dalits: Owaisi on CAA
text: Commenting on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), AIMIM Chief Asaduddin Owaisi alleged that PM Narendra Modi "isn't worried about Indian minorities and dalits". He added that PM "cares about the minorities of Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan". "The people who voted for you (PM Modi) are Indians. People of Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh haven't voted for you," he further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Screaming Bharat Mata Ki Jai isn't true patriotism: BJP leader
text: BJP Vice President for West Bengal Chandra Kumar Bose has said that "obsession with nationalism does not make individuals true nationalists". "Screaming Bharat Mata Ki Jai also doesn't reflect true patriotism," he tweeted. He further wrote that "following the inclusive ideology of Swami Vivekananda and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose" is "true nationalism".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Upcoming Tata Altroz awarded 5-stars in Global NCAP adult safety rating
text: Tata Altroz has received a 5-star adult safety rating from Global NCAP, a global car assessment program, cementing its position as the safest India-made hatchback. "We would like to encourage all other car manufacturers in India to follow TATA's example and bring affordable 5-star cars to Indian consumers," said President, Global NCAP. Tata Altroz is launching on January 22, 2020.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Pakistani journalist dresses up as emperor to report news, video goes viral
text: A video showing Pakistani journalist Amin Hafeez dressed up as an emperor to report a story has gone viral on social media. Hafeez was covering a controversy that broke out after a wedding at the Lahore Fort, which has been recognised by the UNESCO. Hafeez had earlier sat on a donkey while reporting about animal trade.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 27-yr-old imam finds out his wife is a man 2 weeks after wedding in Uganda
text: A 27-year-old imam in Uganda discovered that his wife is a man two weeks after their wedding. He found out the truth after his "wife" stole a television set and clothes from their neighbour's house and was searched by police. The accused later confessed that he was pretending to be a woman to steal the imam's money.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Maharashtra Police uses 3 Idiots pic to warn against triple riding
text: Maharashtra Police on Wednesday shared a picture from '3 Idiots' to warn people against triple riding. The photo shows actors Aamir Khan, R Madhavan and Sharman Joshi riding a single scooter, without any helmets. Madhavan replied with his picture from real life, which shows him riding a bike by himself with a helmet on and wrote, "I agree WHOLE heartedly."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Akon signs deal to build his own city in Africa powered by his cryptocurrency
text: American Singer Akon, known for songs like 'Lonely', 'Smack That' and 'Don't Matter', has signed a deal to build his own 'Akon City' in Africa's Senegal. He originally announced the plan for the city in 2018 saying that it would be built on a 2,000-acre land gifted by Senegal's President. The city would trade exclusively in his own cryptocurrency 'Akoin'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Australian bowler took a hat-trick in his 3rd ODI, never played again
text: Australia's Anthony Stuart took a hat-trick in his third ODI against Pakistan on January 16, 1997, becoming the second Australian to register an ODI hat-trick. Stuart dismissed Ijaz Ahmed, Mohammad Wasim and Moin Khan on consecutive deliveries, registering figures of 10-1-26-5. However, he was never selected again and thus became the first player with a hat-trick in his last ODI.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: David Warner shares pic with kite and umpire, asks fans to caption it
text: Australia opener David Warner shared a picture of himself on Instagram holding a kite and standing alongside the umpire during first ODI against India. He asked his followers to caption the picture. "There's another one coming in to us make sure you catch that," Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan wrote. "That's how high us Aussies are right now!" a fan commented.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison's $1 bn stake in Tesla now worth $1.6 bn
text: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison's $1 billion stake in his friend Elon Musk-led Tesla is now worth over $1.6 billion after the stock surged 25% in 2020. Ellison had revealed he bought 3 million shares of Tesla before joining Tesla's board in December 2018. At the time, the stake was worth $1 billion, making Ellison Tesla's second-biggest individual investor after Musk.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indira Gandhi used to visit Mumbai don Karim Lala: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
text: Stating that underworld has lost its influence in today's Mumbai, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said there was a time when don Haji Mastan used to visit Mantralaya and "Indira Gandhi used to visit (don) Karim Lala". Raut later said he thinks Gandhi met Lala because he was a respected figure in the Pathan community, not because he was a don.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Rahul Gandhi should spend at least 15 hours in Cong's office: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is a "very hard-working man" and added that he doesn't "have the right to give PM Modi any advice". On being asked about Congress' Rahul Gandhi, Raut added, "He is good at heart...should spend at least 15 hours in...office." He called Home Minister Amit Shah a "staunch nationalist".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Our flag is flying high at UN: India after closed-door UNSC meeting on J&K
text: After China raised Kashmir issue at a UN Security Council (UNSC) closed-door meeting, India's Ambassador Syed Akbaruddin said, "Today [at UN] our flag is flying high. Those that launched a "False Flag" effort got a stinging response from our many friends." "Neither the alarming scenario painted by...Pakistan nor any of the baseless allegations...were found to be credible," he stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: J&K Police seeks Davinder Singh's dismissal, case transfer to NIA
text: Jammu and Kashmir Police chief Dilbag Singh on Wednesday said that the force has recommended dismissal of suspended DSP Davinder Singh and handing over the case to the National Investigation Agency (NIA). He said the police has also recommended for taking back the gallantry medal awarded to Singh by the erstwhile Jammu and Kashmir state on Independence Day in 2018.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: MP school principal suspended over distribution of Savarkar notebooks
text: Madhya Pradesh government has suspended the principal of a Ratlam school over distribution of notebooks with Veer Savarkar's photo to students. He was suspended two months after the notebooks were distributed by Veer Savarkar Manch. "I'm disturbed to hear the news of the suspension of the principal, who was honoured with the President's Award," tweeted former state CM Shivraj Chouhan.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Goddess Lakshmi on banknotes may improve rupee's condition: Swamy
text: BJP leader and Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy on Wednesday said he is in favour of inscribing the picture of Goddess Lakshmi on banknotes as this may "improve the condition of Indian currency". "Nobody should feel bad about this," Swamy added. He said this in response to a question about the picture of Lord Ganesha printed on the Indonesian currency.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 8 coaches of Mumbai-Bhubaneswar train derail in Odisha, 20 injured
text: At least eight coaches of Mumbai-Bhubaneswar Lokmanya Tilak Express derailed near Odisha's Cuttack on Thursday after it had hit a guard van of a goods train. Over 20 people have been injured in the accident. According to reports, there was dense fog in the area at the time of the accident.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 7 Democratic lawmakers to prosecute impeachment case against Trump in Senate
text: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi revealed the names of the House Democrats who will prosecute President Donald Trump at his impeachment trial in the Senate. Adam Schiff, the House Intelligence Committee chairman, will lead the House 'managers' who will present the case. Jerrold Nadler, head of the House judiciary committee, is also part of the seven-member team that'll prosecute Trump.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 12-yr-old girl found alive after being buried under avalanche in PoK for 18 hrs
text: A 12-year-old girl was found alive on Wednesday after being buried for 18 hours under an avalanche in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. "I thought I would die there," said Samina Bibi who lost a brother and sister in the avalanche and also suffered a leg fracture. The death toll from the avalanche in PoK on Monday has risen to 74, officials said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US President Trump signs phase 1 of trade deal with China
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday signed phase one of the trade deal with China. The US and China had imposed tit-for-tat tariffs that hit billions of dollars in goods in the trade war. Under the deal, China will purchase an additional $200 billion worth of US farm products and other goods and services over two years.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Sensex crosses 42,000 for first time after US and China sign trade deal
text: Sensex on Thursday crossed the 42,000 mark for the first time and Nifty hit its record high at 12,389 a day after the US and China signed the first phase of a trade deal. Sensex rose as much as 186.72 points to touch 42,059.45 in the first hour of trade. Sun Pharma was among the top gainers, rising 1.30%.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Investor cuts Indian govt bond holdings over CAA, Kashmir
text: US-based Western Asset Management, which manages $453 billion in assets, is reducing its Indian government bond holdings, saying tensions around CAA and Kashmir could negatively impact economic outlook. "It certainly distracts Prime Minister Modi's government from making necessary economic policy and reform to focus on the economy," senior portfolio manager at Western Asset, Desmond Soon, said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: India plans to cut imports from Malaysia, Turkey in Kashmir row: Officials
text: India is planning to cut some imports from Turkey and Malaysia after they criticised India's policy in Kashmir, two officials told Reuters. The government is planning to cut imports of oil and steel products from Turkey. It is also planning to restrict buying of petroleum, LNG, computer parts and microprocessors from Malaysia, the officials said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I had the scariest experience with Uber London, I am shaken: Sonam
text: Sonam Kapoor on Thursday tweeted she was "shaken" after having "the scariest experience" with Uber in London. "Please please be careful. The best and safest is just to use...local public transportation or cabs," she added. After a user asked what happened, Sonam replied, "The driver was unstable and was yelling and shouting. I was shaking by the end of it."nn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Alaya F has the same energy as Shah Rukh Khan: Saif
text: Saif Ali Khan, who'll be seen alongside Tabu and Alaya F in the upcoming film 'Jawaani Jaaneman', has said Alaya has the same energy as Shah Rukh Khan. He added she had no problems doing "really long scenes" at one go. "I really felt that she was like the best I have ever worked with...it was incredible," Saif further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Being called Vicky's brother is a proud thing for me: Sunny Kaushal
text: Vicky Kaushal's brother, actor Sunny Kaushal has said being referred to as Vicky's brother is a proud thing for him. "This shows how well Vicky has made his mark," he said. However, Sunny added that he's a "strong urge" to create his own identity in society. "It's something you should always have no matter who you are," he further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Damages worth ₹88 cr to be recovered from 21 held over CAA violence
text: At least 21 people have been arrested by the Railway Protection Force (RPF) for allegedly being involved in vandalism and arson during the anti-CAA protests in West Bengal, Assam and Bihar. An official said damages worth ₹88 crore will be recovered from them. The Government Railway Police registered 27 cases and RPF filed 54 cases over damage of railway property.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: App stores saw record 204 bn downloads worldwide in 2019: App Annie
text: According to an App Annie report, app stores saw a record 204 billion app downloads worldwide in 2019, up 6% from 2018 and up 45% since 2016. It also mentioned app stores' consumers spent $120 billion on apps, subscriptions and in-app spending. The average time spent per day on mobile by users stood at 3.7 hours per day, it added
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Flying kites in support of CAA 'slap' on face of anti-nationals: Pragya
text: BJP MP Pragya Thakur on the occasion of Makar Sankranti on Wednesday flew kites in support of Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), the abrogation of Article 370 and Ram Temple. She called it a "slap" on the face of "anti-nationals opposing the CAA". "This symbolises...victory of our country flying high. I'm sending...best wishes on Makar Sankranti to the countrymen," Pragya said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: This royal family has part-time positions: Burger King offers Prince Harry job
text: Days after UK's Prince Harry and Meghan Markle announced they will be financially independent, Burger King on Tuesday tweeted, "Harry, this royal family offers part-time positions." "You always have a job in our kingdom," Burger King had tweeted after the royal couple had announced their decision. Users reacted with tweets like, "You win the Internet today," and "Chicken Royale".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Kapil shares pic with daughter for 1st time, says 'Meet our piece of heart'
text: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to social media to share pictures of his newborn daughter for the first time. "Meet our piece of heart Anayra Sharma," he captioned the post. As per reports, the photos were clicked during birthday celebrations of Kapil's mother Janak. Kapil had announced the birth of his daughter on December 10.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Anurag Kashyap insults PM Modi as he can't digest his own failure: Suchitra
text: Singer Suchitra Krishnamoorthi, in a now-deleted tweet, wrote that filmmaker Anurag Kashyap keeps insulting PM Narendra Modi as he can't "digest his own failure". She added that Kashyap should first do his own work properly. Later, Suchitra shared an article about it and wrote, "Ya I deleted this tweet because I didn't want the stress of tu tu main main."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: After Kolkata & Prayagraj, Shaheen Bagh-like anti-CAA protest in Kota
text: After Kolkata and Prayagraj, Delhi's round-the-clock Shaheen Bagh protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC) inspired a similar indefinite sit-in in Kota. More than a hundred Muslim women began the sit-in outside the Eidgah grounds on Tuesday night. Shaheen Bagh protest in Delhi has been going on for more than a month now.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Tremendous respect: Ganguly on pic with former Australia captain Steve Waugh
text: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly took to social media to share a picture of himself with former Australia captain Steve Waugh. In the picture, the duo can be seen watching the first India-Australia ODI at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. "Competed with this man for a long period...tremendous respect," BCCI President Ganguly captioned the picture.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Last 12 months best in my career: Stokes on winning Cricketer of the Year award
text: Reacting to winning ICC Cricketer of the Year award, England all-rounder Ben Stokes said, "The last 12 months have been the best in my career." He added, "This award is testament to my teammates and...support staff that have been there every step of the way." He further said, "To lift World Cup for the first time was our greatest achievement."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 4 Indians, 1 Pakistani included in ICC ODI Team of the Year
text: The ICC on Wednesday announced the ICC ODI Team of 2019, naming Virat Kohli as the captain of the side. Opener Rohit Sharma, fast bowler Mohammad Shami and Kuldeep Yadav are the other three Indians who made it to the Team of the Year. Batsman Babar Azam is the only Pakistani in the side, which includes two Englishmen.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Naomi Osaka shares picture with Serena Williams, writes 'me and my mom lol'
text: Two-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka of Japan took to Twitter to share a picture of herself with 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams. "Me and my mom lol," the 22-year-old jokingly captioned it. "Beautiful and iconic sight...moment to treasure!!" a fan commented. The picture was taken during 'Rally for Relief' event which was held to raise money for bushfires.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Bumrah snapped kite that stopped play, I said 'that's some poor kid's': Warner
text: Talking about the play being stopped due to a kite during India's innings in the first ODI at Wankhede Stadium, Australia opener David Warner said, "It's very bizarre. It got caught on the Spidercam and I thought it was dangerous." "Jasprit Bumrah came and snapped it after which I said 'that's some poor kid's kite'," Warner added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Opposition could not find solution to job issue in 60 years: Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said the Opposition didn't find any new solution to deal with unemployment during its 50-60 years of rule. Shah was speaking at the foundation stone laying ceremony of the Indian Institute of Skills in Gujarat. He added that the Skill India programme will become a solution to the unemployment problem in the coming days.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 17-year-old UK girl collapses every time she laughs due to neurological disorder
text: Billie Hodgson, a 17-year-old teen in the UK collapses every time she laughs due to a neurological disorder known as cataplexy. It's characterised by sudden, uncontrollable muscle paralysis when a person experiences a strong emotion, according to the National Sleep Foundation. There is no cure for cataplexy and the only available treatment involves taking daily medication to manage the symptoms.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Centre relaxes FASTag norms for 65 toll plazas for 30 days
text: The Centre on Wednesday said that to facilitate the smooth flow of traffic, FASTag norms for 65 toll plazas with high cash transactions have been relaxed for 30 days and up to 25% FASTag lanes at these plazas can be converted into hybrid lanes. These plazas are located pan-India including in Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Punjab, Chandigarh and Andhra Pradesh.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Govt closely tracking Kanhaiya Kumar's personal life, funding: Reports
text: The government is closely tracking Communist Party of India (CPI) leader Kanhaiya Kumar's personal life and his funding, a senior aide to PM Narendra Modi told Reuters on condition of anonymity. Kumar's appeal to young and first-time voters has worried PM Modi, the aide said. He lost to BJP's Giriraj Singh from Bihar's Begusarai in the recent Lok Sabha elections.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 31 participants injured during Jallikattu in Tamil Nadu's Madurai
text: At least 31 participants were injured during Jallikattu competitions in Madurai's Avaniyapuram in Tamil Nadu, Madurai Assistant Director said on Wednesday. Earlier, Supreme Court refused to entertain a plea challenging the Madras High Court order for conducting Jallikattu in various districts of Tamil Nadu. Jallikattu is organised in Tamil Nadu as a part of Pongal, the harvest festival.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Dawood Ibrahim still living in Karachi: Underworld don Ejaz Lakdawala
text: Underworld don and former member of the D-Company, Ejaz Lakdawala has said that Dawood Ibrahim is still living in Karachi, Pakistan. Dawood has a base in Nepal's capital Kathmandu, that he uses for pushing Fake Indian Currency Notes into the Indian territory through the porous border, Lakdawala added. He also disclosed two addresses of Dawood in Karachi.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Are Trump, Pompeo, ISIS strange bedfellows? Iran's Foreign Minister
text: Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif has said that only US President Donald Trump, US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and the Islamic State were celebrating "assassination" of Iranian Major General Qassem Soleimani by the US. "Are they strange bedfellows?" Zarif asked. He also said that the war against the Islamic State had suffered a major setback due to Soleimani's death.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Ready to buy as much stake as IndiGo 'can give us': Qatar Airways
text: Qatar Airways on Wednesday said talks about investing in India's IndiGo are continuing. The Doha-based carrier is ready to buy as much stake as IndiGo "can give us", CEO Akbar Al Baker said. Qatar Airways signed a codeshare agreement with IndiGo in November, under which it will place its code on IndiGo flights between Doha and Delhi, Mumbai and Hyderabad.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: ₹205 crore cash found hidden in Chinese banker's flat, picture surfaces
text: Chinese authorities uncovered over 200 million yuan (₹205 crore) in cash hidden inside an apartment of the ex-head of bad loan manager China Huarong Asset Management. Lai Xiaomin confessed to taking millions of yuan in bribes in a state TV documentary. "I got the money and just left it there, just like making regular trips to the supermarket," Lai said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Men who aren't ready to be fathers create children that need therapy: Saif
text: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said, "I think the father is one of the most important people in our lives." "A lot of people mess up being a father...because they are not ready to be responsible fathers," Saif said. He added, "[They] create children that need therapy...friendship and...all kinds of things to fix their problems."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Vidya to star in film on man-eating tigress Avni's killing: Report
text: Production company Abundantia Entertainment's CEO Vikram Malhotra is reportedly planning to make a film about Maharashtra's man-eating tigress Avni's killing and has cast Vidya Balan in the lead role for the project. "Vidya will play a forest officer in the movie," a report said. "They wanted...a great performer...strong actress who can shoulder the film completely," the report added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Jamia University to move court over Delhi Police action on Dec 15
text: Jamia Millia Islamia University will move to a Delhi court for registration of FIR against Delhi Police's action on the campus on December 15, officials said. The decision was taken at an Emergent Executive Council meeting after 170 students lodged complaints with Jamia's legal desk saying that police refused to listen to their grievances when violence erupted amid anti-CAA protests.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Mani Shankar Aiyar is Pak's official representative in India: BJP
text: After Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar's "qaatil" (killer) remark at an anti-CAA, NRC  protest in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, BJP's Karnataka unit called him "Pakistan's Official Representative in India". Aiyar had said he was ready for whatever sacrifice is needed and added that it needs to be seen who is stronger, the protesters or that "killer".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: IIT Delhi gets ₹1 cr from alumnus to set up a chair in Quantum Computing
text: An alumnus of the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi has donated ₹1 crore for the creation of a chair in Quantum Computing at the institute. Prashant Gupta, a 1995 batch alumnus, made the donation in the name of his mother and elder siblings. Gupta studied computer science engineering at the IIT.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: One of Uber's first employees quits to start venture capital firm
text: One of Uber's first employees and its Head of New Mobility, Rachel Holt, announced her departure from the ride-hailing company to start a venture capital firm, Construct Capital. She will be starting the firm with Dayna Grayson, a venture capitalist from New Enterprise Associates. Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi called Holt's exit "bittersweet".
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Humans could become vectors for new coronavirus: China health authorities
text: Chinese health authorities have said that it is possible that the new coronavirus could be passed through human contact but the risk of person-to-person transmission is low. Officials state that so far at least one person has been killed and dozens infected by the new virus, which can cause respiratory illness and has influenza-type symptoms.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Bank unions call for 2-day strike from Jan 31 over wage hike demand
text: Bank employees' unions have called for a two-day nationwide strike on January 31 and February 1 after the Indian Banks' Association rejected the demands for wage hike, merger of special allowance with basic pay and a uniform 5-day work week. Bank operations are expected to be impacted on Budget day. This would be the second such strike this month.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India may offer subsidised loans to attract Apple, Samsung suppliers
text: The government is considering offering subsidised loans to mobile handset manufacturers to attract Apple and Samsung suppliers to open factories in the country, an official said, adding this may be announced during the Union Budget. India is planning to manufacture ₹13.44 lakh crore worth of mobile phones by 2025 from ₹1.7 lakh crore worth of phones currently, the official said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Entire Russian govt resigns after Putin proposes changes to constitution
text: Russian PM Dmitry Medvedev and the entire Russian government resigned on Wednesday to let President Vladimir Putin carry out constitutional reforms. Putin has proposed a nationwide referendum on the reforms that would grant more powers to the Parliament, including the ability to select the Prime Minister. Putin will name Medvedev as deputy chairman of the security council, reports said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: First pics of Kapil Sharma's newborn daughter surface online
text: The first pictures of comedian Kapil Sharma's newborn daughter are being shared on social media by his fan accounts. The pictures seem to have been clicked at the birthday celebration of his mother. On December 10, Kapil had announced the birth of his daughter with the tweet, "Blessed to have a baby girl. Need your blessings."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Bhim Army chief gets bail after 25 days, barred from staying in Delhi till polls
text: A Delhi court granted bail to Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad, 25 days after he was arrested during anti-CAA protests at Daryaganj. The court directed him to leave Delhi for four weeks with the judge saying she doesn't want any interference with the elections. It further ordered Delhi Police to escort him to Saharanpur within 24 hours of his release.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I didn't know whether to sit, stand, run or jump: Kohli on maiden India call-up
text: Virat Kohli has said the favourite moment of his career will always be the day when he was picked for Team India for the first time in 2008. "I was at home with my mother, watching news...and as my name flashed I had no idea what to do. I didn't know whether to sit, stand, run or jump," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: ICC announces Test Team of 2019; Kohli named captain, Agarwal opener
text: The ICC on Wednesday announced the Test Team of 2019, with two Indians making the list. Team India skipper Virat Kohli has been named the captain of the team, while Mayank Agarwal has been named the opener. Other than Kohli and Agarwal, the team features five Australians, three New Zealanders and one English player.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Virat Kohli can't come to bat in the 28th over: Shoaib Akhtar
text: Criticising India captain Virat Kohli's decision to bat at number four in the first ODI defeat against Australia, ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "It's a very embarrassing loss for India." "Kohli cannot come to bat in 28th over. Kohli needs to come earlier than this," he further said. "Really sad to see...India were hammered by Australia," Akhtar added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Can't preserve data: WhatsApp to Delhi HC on info on JNU violence
text: Facebook-owned messaging platform WhatsApp on Tuesday told Delhi High Court (HC) that due to end-to-end encryption it cannot preserve data related to the January 5 JNU violence. This comes after HC directed WhatsApp, Apple and Google to preserve data related to the same. The court further asked Google to preserve information on JNU violence as per law from Google Drive.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I'd be a software programmer: Bezos on what he had done if Amazon failed
text: World's richest man and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, who is currently on an India visit, said on Wednesday that he would have been "an extremely happy software programmer somewhere" in case Amazon had failed to become a successful company. On being asked about failures, Bezos said, "Amazon is the best place in the world to fail."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: OYO to fire 50% of its employees in its cloud kitchen business: Report
text: OYO is firing about 45-50% of its total 300 employees in cloud kitchen vertical, Entrackr reported on Wednesday quoting sources. OYO launched brands like Adraq, O'Biryani under its cloud kitchen business last year and partnered with aggregators like Zomato, Swiggy and Uber Eats for distribution. The report comes after OYO CEO Ritesh Agarwal e-mailed to employees on company firings.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: UNSC to hold closed-door meeting on Kashmir tonight on China's request: Reports
text: The UN Security Council will hold a closed-door meeting on Kashmir tonight on China's request, reports quoting French diplomatic sources said. "France's position is unchanged- Kashmir issue must be settled bilaterally as we've stated on several occasions and will continue to reiterate to our UNSC partners," French diplomatic sources said. France vetoed China's move to hold a meeting last month.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: PM tweets clip of jawans carrying pregnant woman in snow on Army Day
text: PM Narendra Modi on January 15, which is celebrated as Army Day, retweeted a video of Army jawans carrying a pregnant woman on a stretcher in Kashmir amid heavy snowfall. Over 100 Army personnel and 30 civilians walked for four hours to a hospital, where Shamima gave birth. "Our Army is known for its valour and professionalism," tweeted PM Modi.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sikhs to be counted as separate ethnic group in US census for 1st time
text: Sikhs in the US will for the first time be counted as a separate ethnic group in 2020 census, the United Sikhs, a non-profit organisation said, calling it a "milestone". The organisation has pushed for separate coding for Sikhs living in the US for over two decades so that issues like bullying, intimidation and hate crimes can be addressed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sengar moves Delhi HC against conviction, life term in Unnao rape case
text: Expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar on Wednesday moved the Delhi High Court challenging his conviction and life term for raping a minor girl in Unnao in 2017. Sengar challenged the December 20 verdict of a trial court which had sentenced him to life imprisonment and had imposed a fine of ₹25 lakh in the case.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Israeli jets attacked our airbase with 4 missiles: Syrian Army
text: The Syrian Army on Tuesday said Israeli jets attacked their airbase with four missiles in Syria's Homs province. "Israeli Air Force conducted new aerial aggression and immediately our air defences confronted enemy missiles," Syrian Army said. The Israeli war jets flew from Tanf, to the southeast, where the US has set up a base near the Iraqi-Jordanian border, they added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Not used to delays: Murthy cuts short his speech at event attended by Bezos
text: Infosys Co-Founder Narayana Murthy said he was not used to delays after an Amazon summit in Delhi began nearly an hour-and-a-half late. "I was supposed to speak for 20 minutes, but will now try and finish it in five minutes," Murthy said. Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos invited Murthy back after his speech to present him with a token of appreciation.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: JPMorgan posts most profitable year for any US bank in history
text: JPMorgan Chase & Co on Tuesday posted the biggest-ever annual profit for any US bank in history. The largest US bank reported a profit of $36.4 billion for 2019, up 12% from the previous year. "We certainly don't think this is as good as it can be," JPMorgan's Chief Financial Officer Jennifer Piepszak said after the results.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 'Chhapaak' has given acid attack survivors place in people's hearts: Laxmi
text: Acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal, on whom Deepika Padukone starrer 'Chhapaak' is based, said, "Those residing in Chandni Chowk...generally make fun of people [like me]." "But, today...shop owners...saluted me...when I was there," she further said, adding, "The film has given us...place in people's hearts." She also revealed that her daughter showered her with love after watching the film.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Called Shashank 109 times in 2 days after reading 'Mr. Lele' script: Varun
text: Varun Dhawan, who will star in Shashank Khaitan-directed upcoming film 'Mr. Lele', has said, "After reading the script, I called Shashank 109 times in two days." "I'm looking to explore the comic thriller genre...in 'Mr. Lele'," he added. When asked about doing an action film, Varun said, "Talks are on," adding, "I'm getting back to the commercial child-friendly genre."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Pant not travelling with team to Rajkot, not ruled out of 2nd ODI yet
text: Indian wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant isn't a part of the Indian travelling squad to Rajkot after having suffered a concussion following a hit on the helmet during the first ODI against Australia on Tuesday. Pant, who departed the field after the hit and didn't come out to keep wickets, has not yet been ruled out of the second ODI against Australia.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: We complement each other well: Warner on partnership with Finch
text: Speaking about his opening partner Aaron Finch, Australian opening batsman David Warner said, "We complement each other on the field and we're great mates off the field as well." Warner added that they know each other's games and personalities well. "We have honest conversations. If we're playing shots that we wouldn't, we reassure each other about that," Warner added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Marnus Labuschagne named '2019 ICC Men's Emerging Cricketer'
text: Australian batsman Marnus Labuschagne on Wednesday was named as the 2019 ICC Men's Emerging Cricketer. Labuschagne recently reached his career-best ranking and moved to the third place in the latest ICC Test player rankings after a match-winning double-century against New Zealand in Sydney. Labuschagne averaged 64.94 with the bat in Test cricket in the year 2019.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Instagram begins testing DMs on desktop
text: Instagram announced it is testing direct messages (DMs) to the web. On Tuesday, Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri said that a "small percentage" of global users will be able to access their DMs from Instagram's website. The service will essentially be similar to that in mobile app and users will be able to create groups and do other things.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Genetic element responsible for dogs' intensity of coat color found
text: UC Davis School of Veterinary Medicine geneticists have found that the coat colour in dogs is related to a region of DNA on the dog chromosome 15 that can have multiple copies related to coat colour. When researchers looked across a range of breeds, dogs with a higher number of copies of this region had more intense coat colours.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Normal communication channels to be opened after review: J&K LG
text: J&K Lieutenant Governor GC Murmu has said normal communication channels will be opened in the region after review. "We're reviewing continuously, and accordingly we are relaxing everything. In coming days, normal communication technology and communications channels will be opened," he said. On Tuesday, the administration issued orders to partially allow 2G mobile connectivity on postpaid mobiles.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Nehru was responsible for delay in Goa's independence: CM Sawant
text: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said that India's first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru was responsible for the delay in Goa's independence by 14 years. "If Nehru had the political will...he would have wanted Goa to be free of Portuguese rule," he said. "Why did we have to suffer Portuguese rule even after India had got independence," Sawant added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: US Prez Trump agrees with UK PM on new 'Trump deal' for Iran
text: US President Donald Trump said on Twitter that he agreed with UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson's comment that the 2015 Iran nuclear deal should be replaced with Trump's deal. Johnson referred to Trump as a "great dealmaker" and called upon him to form his own new pact so that Iran could be stopped from acquiring a nuclear weapon.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Boeing loses largest plane-maker title to Airbus amid 737 MAX crisis
text: Boeing has been overtaken by Airbus as the world's largest plane-maker after it reported net negative orders in 2019 for the first time in three decades amid the grounding of 737 MAX. Boeing's deliveries fell to 380 jetliners last year compared to Airbus' record of 863. Boeing reported a loss of 87 airplane orders as cancellations surpassed new purchases.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Won't have child without marriage if I could turn back time: Neena Gupta
text: Actress Neena Gupta, when asked about a decision she'd rethink if she could turn back time, said, "I wouldn't have a child outside marriage." "I was...honest with Masaba, so it didn't affect our relationship, but I know she suffered," she added. Neena was in a relationship with former cricketer Viv Richards, with whom she has a daughter, designer Masaba Gupta.nn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Devgn's 100th film Tanhaji crosses ₹100cr; 2020's 1st film to enter ₹100cr club
text: Ajay Devgn's 100th film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', has hit the ₹100 crore mark within 6 days of its release, Bollywood trade analyst Taran Adarsh tweeted. It's the first Bollywood film of 2020 to enter the ₹100 crore club. This is Devgn's fifth consecutive film to cross ₹100 crore after 'De De Pyaar De', 'Total Dhamaal', 'Raid' and 'Golmaal Again'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Union ministers to visit J&K for first time after abrogation of Article 370
text: In a first after abrogation of Article 370, several Union ministers will visit Jammu and Kashmir later this week to spread a word about government policies. The ministers will visit different districts in both the divisions of the UT starting January 18 to January 24. They will cover multiple districts over the period of a week.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Langar made at Shaheen Bagh after anti-CAA protesters refuse to leave
text: Sikh community volunteers on Wednesday prepared langar for protesters at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, where a round-the-clock protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and the National Register of Citizens has been going on for over a month. Shaheen Bagh protesters on Tuesday refused to leave after Delhi Police requested them so that the road blockade can be cleared for the traffic.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Won't move an inch: Anti-CAA Shaheen Bagh protesters to Delhi Police
text: Protesters against the Citizenship Act and National Register of Citizens at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Tuesday told the police that they would not move an inch. The protesters said they would, however, cooperate with police to ease the traffic. Police engaged in dialogue with the protesters on Delhi High Court's order on a plea about traffic restrictions in the area.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I am not really your team's fan: Kid trolls George Bailey after getting autograph
text: Big Bash League side Hobart Hurricanes' batsman George Bailey was trolled by a kid after giving him his autograph. While giving the kid an autograph Bailey asked him, "Are You a Hurricanes' fan?" to which the boy replied, "Not really." Bailey then asked him, "Do you like cricket?" with the boy responding, "Sometimes my brother forces me."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Federer, Nadal criticised for not protesting against Australian Open conditions
text: World number one Rafael Nadal and world number three Roger Federer have been criticised for not protesting against Australian Open conditions, which have been affected by bushfires. World number 103 Brayden Schnur, who is playing the tournament qualifiers said, "Roger and Rafa are a little bit selfish in thinking about themselves and their careers...all they’re thinking about is their legacy."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Be happy and do what you want to do: Pietersen to Prince Harry and Meghan
text: Backing Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's decision to start an independent life, former England captain Kevin Pietersen tweeted, "Go and be happy & go and do what you want to do." He added, "It's your life and no one who criticises you understands what you guys want/need to be happy. Be free, be you!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Tesla sells T-shirt showing cracked Cybertruck window, Musk cracks joke
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday joked, "T-shirt is bulletproof & makes u buff," after Tesla began selling T-shirts showing Cybertruck's cracked window from the vehicle's unveiling ceremony for $45 (around ₹3,200). During Cybertruck's unveiling in November, Musk invited Tesla lead designer on stage to test Cybertruck's durability. Cybertruck's windows shattered on being hit by a steel ball bearing.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Captain Tania Shergill becomes 1st woman to lead all-men contingent at Army Day parade
text: Captain Tania Shergill, on Wednesday, became the first woman adjutant to lead an all-men contingent at the Army Day parade. Commissioned in March 2017 from the Officer Training Academy, Chennai, Captain Shergill hails from Punjab and is an electronics and communications graduate. Her father, grandfather and great-grandfather have also served in the Army.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Chhattisgarh govt moves Supreme Court in 1st challenge to NIA Act
text: Congress-led Chhattisgarh government has moved the Supreme Court against the National Investigation Agency (NIA) Act, stating that it violates the Constitution. It said that the NIA should have no power over state policing matters. "The NIA Act...confers discretionary and arbitrary powers on the Centre. The NIA Act is against the idea of state sovereignty," added Chhattisgarh government.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's relative killed in car accident
text: The husband of Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's sister-in-law Vina Karande died in a car accident. Ajay Karande and Vina were returning from Shirdi in an SUV. The accident took place at Sinnar in Nashik after the car driver reportedly lost control over the wheels while passing through a narrow bridge, resulting in the vehicle overturning.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Don't get into our music cases: Yamaha warns after ex-Nissan chief's escape
text: Yamaha Music Japan has warned people not to try and squeeze themselves into its large boxes for musical instruments after reports that ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn fled Japan inside one. "A warning after any unfortunate accident would be too late, so we ask everyone not to try it," it said. Ghosn had declined to explain how he escaped to Lebanon.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Kangana inaugurates production house's studio; Rangoli shares pics
text: Kangana Ranaut on Wednesday inaugurated the studio of her production house Manikarnika Films in Mumbai's Pali Hill. Sharing pictures from the inaugural puja, Rangoli Chandel wrote, "[S]he saw this dream 10 years ago...people can achieve everything with honesty and truth." Rangoli also shared the three-storey building's picture and a video showing one of its floors' interior.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Hope Oscar nomination will shine light on Syria: 'For Sama' director
text: Director Waad al-Kateab, whose documentary 'For Sama' has been nominated at Oscars 2020, said, "I hope this is [an]...opportunity to shine...light on the things that sadly continue to happen in Idlib (Syrian city)." "About three years ago...I didn't know if I'd be alive," Waad said. "Now I'm under all the light, just trying to tell the story," she added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Kohli needs to give more respect to Zampa: Steve Waugh
text: After Indian captain Virat Kohli got dismissed by Adam Zampa for the fourth time in ODIs, former Australia captain Steve Waugh said Kohli paid the price for not giving enough respect to Zampa. "[W]e have to be respectful but at the same time have belief in our game to be able to play well against them," Kohli had earlier said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Major Windows 10 flaw found by NSA, Microsoft says it's fixing it
text: Microsoft is patching a serious flaw in Windows 10, detected and reported by the National Security Agency (NSA), that could carry out serious data breaches. It also affects Windows Server and applications that rely on Windows for trust functionality. The flaw affects encryption of digital signatures of authentic content and could lead to malicious content with fake signatures being circulated.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Trump asks Apple to unlock iPhones of Florida attack shooter
text: US President Donald Trump called for Apple to unlock iPhones of the gunman involved in the December 6 terrorist attack on Florida Navy base. "We are helping Apple all of the time...yet they refuse to unlock phones used by killers," he tweeted. Earlier, US Attorney General William Barr and FBI had asked Apple to unlock the iPhones of the attacker.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Amazon to export $10 bn worth of Make in India goods by 2025: Bezos
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos on Wednesday said the company would use its global footprint to export $10 billion worth of 'Make in India' goods by 2025. He also said Amazon would invest $1 billion over the next five years to digitally enable Indian MSMEs and traders. Bezos added that the US-India alliance would be most important in the 21st century.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Analysing DNA in soil could help track animals: Study
text: A new Stanford study has outlined how studying environmental DNA (eDNA) from the soil and other environments can help with tracking animals. After analysing soil eDNA at a biological preserve, researchers identified almost every animal that the nearby camera traps spotted in four years. Researchers also found genetic evidence of a number of small mammals, rarely seen by the cameras.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Schizophrenia related to reduced links between brain cells: Study
text: A new brain-scanning technique has uncovered evidence that suggests schizophrenia is linked to a loss of connections between brain cells. Researchers found the link after measuring a protein found in synapses called 'SV2A', which has been shown to be a good marker of the overall density of neural connections in the brain.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Animals reduce symmetry of markings to improve camouflage: Study
text: University of Bristol researchers have published a study that describes how animals have evolved by reducing the bilateral symmetry of their markings in order to mitigate this defensive disadvantage in their colouration. Researchers claim changes have occurred as the symmetrical midline makes the animals more noticeable to predators who can compare closer together symmetrical patterns more easily.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Brazil to open new Antarctic base, 8 yrs after previous base got burnt
text: Officials have revealed that Brazil will open a new research base in Antarctica this week, eight years after a fire destroyed its original scientific outpost. The base, which consists of 17 laboratories and accommodation for 64 people, has been built on the site of the previous facility. Brazil's Vice President Hamilton Mourao will attend the official opening ceremony.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: JNU's DNA anti-India, reform it or close it: RSS ideologue Gurumurthy
text: RSS ideologue Swaminathan Gurumurthy has alleged that formation of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) was to "oppose India's forefathers and its traditions". He further alleged that JNU's DNA is anti-India and that it should either be "reformed or closed down". "In 1969, Communist party [told] Indira Gandhi to take [anything] but give us (Communists) education department," Gurumurthy further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: India is a prisoner of its past image, we've to get over it: Jaishankar
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar at the Raisina Dialogue in Delhi on Wednesday said that India is a "prisoner of its past image" and "we have to get over it". Commenting on India's relations with China, he added that it is important that two countries find "equilibrium". "Neither India nor China can get India-China relations wrong," Jaishankar further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: North Korea forced me to admit spying: Australian student
text: An Australian student named Alek Sigley, who went missing while studying at a University in North Korea in June 2019, said he was forced to admit guilt during an "unpleasant" nine-day interrogation by North Korean authorities. "From my point of view, I wasn't guilty but was falsely accused by the authorities," he said. North Korea had accused Sigley of spying.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: France, Germany, UK trigger dispute mechanism in Iran nuclear deal
text: France, Germany and Britain triggered dispute mechanism in the 2015 nuclear deal after Iran stepped further away from compliance. The signatories to the deal will review the situation and if it isn't resolved, it could lead to the reimposition of UN sanctions. The European countries clarified that the EU wasn't joining US campaign to exert pressure on Iran through sanctions.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nirbhaya gangrape convicts won't be hanged on Jan 22: Delhi govt to High Court
text: Delhi government on Wednesday told Delhi High Court the 4 convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape case won't be hanged on January 22 as mercy plea has been filed. "[Execution] can only take place 14 days after...mercy plea is rejected," said an advocate appearing for Tihar jail. One of the convicts filed a mercy petition before President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday.nn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 41-yr-old Mumbai man convicted for molesting former actress when she was a minor
text: Vikas Sachdev, a 41-year-old Mumbai businessman accused of molesting a former Bollywood actress on a flight when she was a minor, was awarded 3 years imprisonment on Wednesday by a special POCSO court. In 2017, she alleged that Sachdev, who was sitting behind her, placed his leg on her armrest and rubbed his foot against her back and neck.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Who was Gangubai Kathiawadi, the brothel owner Alia will portray in new film?
text: Alia Bhatt's look in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' was released on Wednesday. Called Gangubai Kothewali, she was considered to be the matriarch of Mumbai's Kamathipura in the 60s. According to S Hussain Zaidi's book Mafia Queens of Mumbai, she eloped with her father's accountant at 16 but was sold into prostitution and went on to run a brothel.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Chahar recognised by ICC for world record performance against Bangladesh
text: Team India fast bowler Deepak Chahar has won ICC's T20I Performance of the Year award for his world-record figures of 3.2-0-7-6 against Bangladesh in November 2019. Chahar's figures included the first-ever hat-trick by an Indian in T20I cricket. "It was a dream performance for me and will always remain close to my heart," Chahar said about his performance.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What purpose is served by making extra insurance mandatory for all: Rajiv Bajaj
text: Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj has said that "overregulation" is killing the two-wheeler industry. "This started in September 2018 when insurance costs went up," he said, referring to a court order that made five-year third-party insurance cover for two-wheelers mandatory. "What purpose is served by making additional insurance mandatory for all, as if people can't think for themselves?" Bajaj asked.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I wrapped, took Amazon packages to post office myself 25 yrs ago: Bezos
text: Talking about Amazon's early days, the world's richest person Jeff Bezos on Wednesday in Delhi said, "What happened over the last 25 years is way beyond my expectations." "I remember wrapping and taking packages to the post office myself," Bezos said. "We were hoping to build a company but not a company like what you see today," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I predict the 21st century is going to be the Indian century: Jeff Bezos
text: World's richest person and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos on Wednesday said, "I predict the 21st century is going to be the Indian century." "The dynamism, the energy, the people; this country has something special. And it's a democracy," Bezos said. "And the most important alliance of the 21st century will be the alliance between India and the US," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Man goes on live TV and confesses to killing his lover; police enter studio
text: A man, who was being hunted by Chandigarh Police for killing a nurse at a hotel on New Year's Eve, confessed to his crime on live television. He said that he killed his lover as she was having an affair with her sister-in-law's brother. He was arrested while the programme was still on air as police rushed to the studio.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Delhi HC rejects Nirbhaya gangrape convict's plea to stay death warrant
text: The Delhi High Court today rejected Nirbhaya gangrape convict Mukesh Singh's petition seeking a stay on the death warrant, saying there's nothing wrong with the trial court's order. It asked Mukesh's counsel to approach the trial court and apprise the court about the pending mercy plea. The trial court had ordered all four convicts to be hanged on January 22.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 29-yr-old Punjab woman set on fire 3 days before marriage
text: A 29-year-old woman in Punjab's Ludhiana was set on fire allegedly by two masked men three days before her marriage. Reportedly, the men entered her home, poured diesel and set her ablaze. Police said that no one was seen entering the house in CCTV footage but victim's father claimed that family members saw two masked men fleeing after the incident.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Muslim population went up in India as they got special rights: UP CM Yogi
text: Addressing a rally in Gaya, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said Muslim population increased manifold in India since 1947 as Muslims have been given special rights and facilities. "No one has any objection. If they...as Indian citizens work for development...they're welcome," he added. "All possible steps were taken to ensure their growth in India. But what happened in Pakistan?" he asked.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I request President to immediately reject convict's mercy petition: Nirbhaya's mother
text: Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi on Wednesday requested President Ram Nath Kovind to immediately reject the mercy petition of Mukesh Singh, the death row convict in the gangrape case. Mukesh had filed a mercy petition before President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday. "They will be hanged on the decided date, no matter which court they approach," Asha Devi said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Man arrested for ringing doorbells of residents to disturb their sleep
text: Mumbai Police has arrested a 37-year-old man for ringing doorbells at residential buildings in the early hours of morning and then running away from the spot. Police said that his intention was to disturb people while they were asleep. The accused, identified as Prem Lalsingh Nepali, confessed to troubling residents and claimed he did so under the influence of alcohol.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I'll quit as CM: Yediyurappa to seer who demanded ministership for MLA
text: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa had an argument with a Panchamasali Lingayat seer after he demanded a ministerial post for his community's MLA. Yediyurappa said, "Seventeen legislators had quit for me to become the Chief Minister. You can suggest me how to govern...but if you are not willing to accept my request, then I'm ready to quit and go home."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 22-year-old DJ, friend forced to perform sexual acts on each other in Nashik
text: A 22-year-old disc jockey (DJ) and his 24-year-old friend were allegedly forced to perform sexual acts on each other by nine men at the birthday party of one of the accused in Nashik. Police said that the accused started fighting with the victims over the quality of music and gave them electric shocks using a battery kept nearby.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Man dressed as Hitler rides around on motorbike in Germany; probe launched
text: German police have launched an investigation after a man dressed as German dictator Adolf Hitler rode around on a motorbike sidecar at a bike festival in Saxony. He was driven by a man dressed as a World War II-era German soldier. The prosecutors are considering whether the stunt is a public order violation or an act of incitement to hatred.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Never said that no woman can become US President: Bernie Sanders
text: US Presidential candidate Bernie Sanders has denied reports that he had told Senator Elizabeth Warren that he didn't believe a woman could defeat US President Donald Trump in 2020 elections. "Do I believe a woman can win in 2020? Of course! After all, Hillary Clinton beat Donald Trump by three million votes in 2016," Sanders said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 60 suffer skin, lung irritation after plane dumps fuel over US schools
text: A Delta Airlines jet making an emergency landing at Los Angeles International Airport dumped fuel over several schools, causing skin and lung irritation to around 60 children and adults. The vapor fell on five elementary schools, but all injuries were minor and no one was taken to hospital, an official said. The airline released fuel to reduce its landing weight.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India has not closed door on China-backed mega trade deal: Jaishankar
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday said India hasn't closed the door on China-backed Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership though it pulled out of the deal. In November, 15 countries agreed terms for the Asia-Pacific trade pact, while India said it would hurt its farmers, businesses, workers and consumers. "We'll evaluate RCEP on its economic and trade merit," he added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: It helped sustain my career: 'Joker' actor Joaquin on Oscar nomination
text: Joaquin Phoenix, who has been nominated at Oscars 2020 for his performance in 'Joker', said, "The Academy's encouragement helped ignite and sustain my career." "I'm incredibly grateful for that support...I feel...humbled to have been nominated," he added. Joaquin is contending with actors including Leonardo DiCaprio and Antonio Banderas in 'Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role' category.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Sequel to 'Go Goa Gone' announced; Saif, Kunal, Vir to reprise roles
text: Eros International and Maddock Films have announced 'Go Goa Gone 2', the sequel to 2013 comedy film 'Go Goa Gone' wherein the film's leads deal with zombies. Dubbing the sequel as "zom-com", the makers said that it will take off from the point where the original ended. Actors Saif Ali Khan, Kunal Kemmu and Vir Das will reprise their roles.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Priyanka, GoT actor Richard to star in series by Avengers: Endgame directors
text: Priyanka Chopra and 'Game of Thrones' actor Richard Madden will star in a drama series titled 'Citadel' by 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Anthony Russo and Joe Russo. "['Citadel' is] a multi-layered global franchise with interconnected local language productions from India, Italy and Mexico," Priyanka said. Writers of 'Citadel' include Josh Appelbaum, André Nemec, Jeff Pinkner and Scott Rosenberg.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: It's a huge honour: Billie on writing 25th James Bond film's theme song
text: American singer Billie Eilish has said that "it feels crazy" that she will write the theme song for the 25th James Bond film, 'No Time To Die'. "To be able to score the theme song...is a huge honour...I'm still in shock," Billie said. Billie is the youngest artist in history to write and record a James Bond theme song.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Google to acquire Dublin-based startup Pointy
text: Dublin-based startup Pointy that helps local retail businesses come online has announced entering into an agreement to be acquired by Google. The startup said the deal is expected to close in the coming weeks, pending "customary closing conditions". Founded in 2014, Pointy develops hardware and software technology to help local shops enhance their products' online presence.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: We show courtesy even to enemies: Mamata on criticism for meeting PM
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has said that it is the culture of Bengal to "welcome and extend courtesy even to the enemies". "But...[BJP] didn't allow our party (TMC) leaders to enter Jammu, Uttar Pradesh, Guwahati and JNU," she added. This comes after she was criticised by the Opposition parties for her meeting with PM Narendra Modi on Saturday.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Abrogation of Article 370 'historic step': Army Chief General Naravane
text: Speaking at 72nd Army Day function in New Delhi on Wednesday, Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane called the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir in August 2019 a "historic step". "It has disrupted proxy war by our western neighbour," he added. "Indian Army has zero-tolerance...towards terrorism...have several options to...reply to such activities," Army Chief further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: China must face reality of our independence: Taiwan's President
text: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen, who returned to office after landslide victory, said China needs to face reality and there was no need for Taiwan to formally announce independence as the island already runs itself. "We are a successful democracy," she said. "If they (China) aren't prepared to face reality, then whatever we offer won't be satisfying to them," she added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Canara HSBC OBC Life Insurance offers ₹1cr life cover at ₹365*/month
text: Canara HSBC OBC Life Insurance iSelect Term Plan is an online plan that provides enhanced protection options such as Life Cover, Terminal Illness Cover and cover against death/disability. It gives you the option to cover your spouse, ensure regular income for your family in case of unforeseen circumstances, avail tax benefits up to ₹46,800* and flexible multiple payout options.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: I once lost a role because I was told I am too fair: Actress Divya Dutta
text: Actress Divya Dutta has revealed she once lost a role because she was told she was "too fair". "They were looking for a village woman who's darker. They told me 'you suit the role completely'," she added, stating her complexion was cited as the reason behind rejecting her. Divya further revealed she had to darken her skin for 'Delhi-6'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I admire Deepika, named daughter after her YJHD character: Union Minister Supriyo
text: Responding to a query about Deepika Padukone being trolled for her JNU visit, Union Minister Babul Supriyo said, "I'm a big admirer of Deepika." "I've named my...daughter...'Naina' after Padukone's character in 'Yeh Jawaani hai Deewani'," he added. Stating that her JNU visit didn't go down well with some people, Supriyo said, "Despite that if anyone abused [her], I condemned them."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Sona invited for ISRO satellite launch, to speak about importance of science
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra has been invited by a France-based space agency for ISRO satellite GSAT-30 launch on January 17. She'll represent India and speak about importance of space and science in daily life. "I'm at the event to provide [the perspective of a musician] who has...an academic background in science (I hold a BTech in I&E degree)," said Sona.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Students demanding 'Jinnah-wali azadi' should be jailed: Baba Ramdev
text: Yoga Guru Baba Ramdev has said that the students demanding 'Jinnah-wali azadi' should be put behind bars. "Country has been burning for one month. Universities are meant for research but students are demanding 'azadi bhai azadi'," he added. Ramdev further said that those who are protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act "don't even know its full form".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Kohli wins award for stopping fans from booing Smith, says 'Surprised I got it'
text: India captain Virat Kohli has won the ICC's Spirit of Cricket Award for stopping the fans from booing Australia batsman Steve Smith during India-Australia match in 2019 World Cup. "I'm surprised that I've got it, after many years of being under the scanner for wrong things," he said. "Booing someone is not in the spirit of any sport," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rohit Sharma becomes 3rd Indian to win ICC ODI Cricketer of the Year award
text: Rohit Sharma has become the third Indian after MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli to win ICC ODI Cricketer of the Year award. Rohit won it for scoring 1,490 runs in 28 matches with seven hundreds last year. "It's great to be recognised in this fashion. We're very happy with the way we performed as a team in 2019," he said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Dhoni trends on Twitter after India suffer 10-wicket defeat against Australia
text: After India suffered their first-ever 10-wicket ODI defeat against Australia, 'Dhoni' trended on Twitter. "Be it Mohali, Mumbai, Kerala or any other place...Dhoni is missed everywhere.
