This defines his legacy," a user tweeted. Another wrote, "No one can fill the shoes of Dhoni." Another fan shared a picture of a spectator with a banner reading, "We miss you on field."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: World's richest man Jeff Bezos flies kites with kids during his India visit
text: World's richest man and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, who arrived in India on Tuesday as the country celebrated Makar Sankranti, flew kites with kids. Sharing a video of his kite flying on social media on Wednesday, Bezos wrote, "Any day is a good day when you get to fly a kite." Bezos also paid his tributes to Mahatma Gandhi.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Failing DU exam was a jolt, parents gave silent treatment: AI startup's Co-Founder
text: Noida-based AI startup CogniTensor's Co-Founder and CTO Ashish Airon in an interview to YourStory said failing a Delhi University exam in fourth semester was a jolt for him and he received a silent treatment from parents. However, he graduated with first-class honours and earned a Master's in Computer Science from Oxford University. Airon co-founded CogniTensor with two others in 2018.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nirbhaya convicts broke prison rules 23 times, earned ₹1.37L in labour wage: Report
text: The four convicts in 2012 Nirbhaya gang-rape case who are scheduled to be hanged on January 22, reportedly broke prison rules 23 times during their stay at Tihar. While one of the convicts chose not to do any labour work, three of them reportedly earned ₹1,37,000 from prison wages. Three convicts took admission for Class 10th but couldn't pass.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Police asked me 'Why are you friends with Muslims?': Detained UP activist
text: Activist Robin Verma, who was detained during anti-CAA protests in UP's Lucknow on December 20, has alleged that police asked him why he was friends with Muslims after accessing contacts and messages on his phone. He further alleged that the police made "degrading remarks" about his family, adding they allegedly said to him, "We'll push your wife...daughter into prostitution."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I am not the masked woman: DU student suspected in JNU violence
text: Delhi University student Komal Sharma, who is suspected to be the masked woman in JNU violence, approached the National Commission for Women complaining that she is not the woman in the video. "I am being framed. I have started receiving calls from my relatives/friends who are expressing their dismay considering me as the said alleged lady in mask/scarf," she said.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: 15-year-old girl dies after her bathroom geyser emits carbon monoxide
text: A 15-year-old girl in Mumbai died of carbon monoxide poisoning after oxygen levels in her bathroom dropped due to emission from a geyser. The girl was having a bath and her parents started knocking on the door after noticing she was taking a lot of time. They broke the door and found her unconscious. She died in a hospital.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India to invite Pak PM Imran Khan for SCO meet: Reports
text: India in 2020 will host the annual meeting of the Council of Heads of Government of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) for the first time and will reportedly invite Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan. "It's up to Pakistan whether their PM...other representative attends the meeting," reports said. SCO Secretary-General Vladimir Norov had earlier said that India will host the meeting.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Flying objects existed during Ramayana days, Arjuna's arrow had atomic power: WB Guv
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday said that flying objects (Uran Khatola) existed during the period of Ramayana and the arrows of Arjuna of Mahabharata had atomic power. Sanjay had narrated what was happening in the battlefield of Mahabharata (to Dhritarashtra, who was blind) not from TV, he further said.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: 19 of 107 in Muzaffarnagar CAA protests freed over lack of evidence
text: At least 19 of 107 accused of rioting and attempt to murder in connection with anti-CAA protests in UP's Muzaffarnagar have been freed due to lack of evidence. Police themselves granted bail to five out of the 19, while the others were released by the sessions court as police were "able to prove only violation of prohibitory orders under CrPC".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Ukraine plane was hit by 2 missiles within 30 seconds: New York Times
text: A new video, verified by The New York Times, shows that the Iranian military launched two missiles in around 30 seconds at the Ukrainian passenger jet that crashed last week. The first strike had disabled the plane's transponder, the report said. The plane was shot down shortly after takeoff, killing all 176 passengers and crew on board.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Model Gigi Hadid among potential jury members in rape-accused Harvey's trial
text: Supermodel Gigi Hadid, who has studied criminal psychology, is among 35 potential jury members for Harvey Weinstein's rape trial who've been asked to appear in court on Thursday. During the proceedings for jury selection on Monday, Gigi had told the judge she will "keep an open mind on facts" despite having met Weinstein and potential witness, actress Salma Hayek before.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Scorsese becomes most-nominated living director with 9 Oscar nominations
text: Director Martin Scorsese has become the most-nominated living director with nine Oscar nominations, surpassing late director Billy Wilder's record of eight Oscar nominations. Scorsese received his ninth nomination in 'Best Achievement in Directing' category at the 92nd Academy Awards for his film 'The Irishman'. 'The Irishman' has been nominated in a total of ten categories at the Oscars 2020.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Jacqueline shares 1st pic from 'Attack' sets with co-star John
text: Jacqueline Fernandez, who has been roped in to star in Lakshya Raj Anand-directed upcoming film 'Attack', on Tuesday shared a picture with co-star John Abraham from the film's set. Sharing the picture, wherein both actors are laughing, Jacqueline wrote, "[B]ack with the awesomest @thejohnabraham." 'Attack' will be the two actors' fourth film together after 'Housefull 2', 'Race 2' and 'Dishoom'.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Tinder, Happn, other apps leaking personal data: Report
text: Norwegian Consumer Council's report on the transmission of user data by 10 apps, including Tinder and Happn, stated they were observed sharing data to at least 135 different third parties. The third parties were involved in advertising and/or behavioural profiling, it added. Most of the apps were found sharing the IP address, GPS location and personal attributes of the users.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Theme park in Japan to let visitors compete using smart bands, app
text: Universal Studios Japan's Super Nintendo World park will feature a "Power Up Band" wearable which will allow users to compete while exploring the environment, Bloomberg reported. The wearable will allow them to battle other attendees via a smartphone app, it added. Universal Studios Japan also released a video which hinted that visitors will experience a life-sized video game.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Looking forward to contesting in alliance with Cong in Delhi: RJD
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that his party is looking forward to contesting the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections in alliance with the Congress. "There are seats...where Biharis and Purvanchalis are in significant numbers. We'd like to contest some of these," he said. "Our in-charge for the polls...is in touch with the Congress," Yadav further added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I don't think law & order situation will improve in UP: Mayawati
text: BSP Chief Mayawati on Wednesday said that she thinks that law and order situation in Uttar Pradesh is not going to improve. "There are several criminal elements in BJP but no action is taken against them. UP mein kanoon ka raj nahi, 'jungle raj' hai," she added. Notably, Mayawati is celebrating her 64th birthday on Wednesday.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Nowadays, caste determines if we're united or separated: RSS Chief
text: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat on Tuesday said that these days "our caste or political allegiance determine whether we are united or separated". "The world is plagued by this wrong approach. Indians have to correct this trend," he added. Bhagwat further said that Indians don't search for diversity in unity but understand that there is unity in diversity.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: West Bengal has become a hub of anti-nationals: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
text: West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh has said that the state has become a "hub of anti-nationals" and added that Mamata Banerjee is "backing those people". "People who live in...land of Swami Vivekananda...have no courage to say go back to...Rohingyas, but...ask the PM to go back," he further said. Trinamool Congress condemned Ghosh's remarks and called him the "biggest mafioso".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Master CyberSecurity with Stanford's course delivered by Great Learning
text: The Advanced Computer Security Program by Stanford Center for Professional Development, delivered by Great Learning helps working professionals meet the demand for cybersecurity experts, which would be 1 mn by 2020, says NASSCOM. Professionals can learn industry-relevant skills via this 6-month online program to become cybersecurity architects, who earn ₹22.2 LPA median salary, according to Payscale.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Sec 144 imposed in WB, BJP leaders detained for pro-CAA rally
text: West Bengal Police enforced Section 144 to stop the BJP from holding rallies in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. BJP leaders Sayantan Basu and Malati Rava Ray were detained on their way to a rally on Sunday. Police also registered a case against Basu and Bengal Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha President Debjit Sarkar for holding a meeting on Monday.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: People need to relax and not panic: Virat Kohli on his batting position
text: India captain Virat Kohli, who batted at number four in the first ODI against Australia, has said people need to relax and not panic about his batting position. "Today was one of the days it didn't come off," he added. "Because of the way KL has batted, we've tried to have him bat up in the lineup," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Footballer who led Turkey to 3rd place in 2002 FIFA WC reveals he now drives Uber
text: Hakan Sukur, who led Turkey to third position in 2002 FIFA World Cup, revealed he now drives Uber and sells books in US to earn a living. Sukur fled Turkey in 2017, taking up self-exile in San Francisco. He had a falling out with Turkey President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and was accused of participating in a failed coup.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Students hide t-shirts with shirts, later display anti-CAA messages at Wankhede
text: As many as 25 students from various Mumbai colleges protested against CAA at Wankhede Stadium during Tuesday's India-Australia ODI. While entering the stadium, they hid their t-shirts displaying "No NRC, No NPR,  No CAA" messages with shirts. "We opened our outer shirts...around 20th over. We chanted slogans such as 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram'," a student said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: If I feature in 2023 WC in India, it'd mean I've a good wife, jokes David Warner
text: Australia opener David Warner has joked if he features in 2023 World Cup in India, it'd mean he has a good wife. "I think we'll (Finch and myself) speak to our wives first [about playing in the next World Cup]. We'll both be 36-37, I've got three kids," he added. "Looking forward, I'd love to be there," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I don't have any apps on my phone: US Presidential candidate Bernie Sanders
text: US Democrat presidential candidate Bernie Sanders in an interview to The New York Times said he does not have any apps on his phone. The 78-year-old said he reads a lot and finds progressive publications in his "own way". He said he has a woman named Melissa at his office who works on his phone, iPad and computer.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World's richest man Bezos lands in India, pays respects to Mahatma Gandhi
text: World's richest person and Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos landed in India on Tuesday and paid floral tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Delhi's Raj Ghat. "Just landed in India and spent a beautiful afternoon paying my respects to someone who truly changed the world," Bezos tweeted. He is expected to attend an Amazon event for small businesses in Delhi on Wednesday.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: All smartphones should have a common charging port: European lawmakers
text: European lawmakers have called for developing a common charger to fit all mobile phones, tablets, and other portable devices to reduce electronic waste. The move also aims to help consumers by ensuring interoperability between chargers and mobile phones, reducing their need to continuously buy chargers and cables. A vote on the proposal will be held in the upcoming parliament session.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 2019 warmest year for oceans in recorded history: Study
text: The world's oceans were warmer in 2019 as compared to any other year in recorded human history, said a study published in the journal Advances in Atmospheric Sciences. Researchers said 2019 ocean temperature was about 0.075 degree Celsius over the average ocean temperature in 1981-2010. The oceans would have taken in 228 Sextillion Joules of heat to reach this temperature.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Some people didn't like Deepika meeting a select JNU group: Supriyo
text: Union Minister Babul Supriyo has said that Deepika Padukone meeting a specific group of JNU students and "ignoring" others has "not gone down well" with some people. He was responding to a query on Padukone getting trolled on social media. Supriyo added that Padukone met those students whose names are now being surfaced as accused in JNU violence.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: CAA ploy to give citizenship to those who funded BJP: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday alleged that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) is a "ploy" to take away citizenship from those who hold it legally and give it to foreigners who have funded the BJP. Banerjee also alleged that those who are helping the BJP get foreign funds and turn black money into white are being given citizenship.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: MHA never awarded any gallantry medal to DSP Davinder Singh: J&K Police
text: The J&K Police has clarified that DSP Davinder Singh, who was arrested with terrorists, hasn't been awarded any gallantry or meritorious medal by Ministry of Home Affairs as reported by some media houses. "J&K Police is known for its professionalism and doesn't spare anyone including its own cadres if found involved in any unlawful act or unbecoming conduct," it added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I'm being targeted for restoring discipline: JNU V-C M Jagadesh Kumar
text: JNU Vice-Chancellor Mamidala Jagadesh Kumar has said that he was being targeted for attempting to restore discipline. "In every institute, a professor is supposed to apply for leave before going abroad...When I asked them to apply for leave, it annoyed them," said Kumar. "The teachers skipped the campus when they didn't have lectures...I stopped that," he added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: New China coronavirus could spread, WHO warns hospitals worldwide
text: An outbreak of the new coronavirus is possible as "limited human-to-human transmission among families" was confirmed by World Health Organisation (WHO) on Tuesday. It further said that it is preparing for a wider outbreak and has given guidance about infection control to hospitals worldwide, in case the virus spreads. However, WHO said it doesn't have a clear clinical picture yet.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: World's most precious metal, 5 times more costly than gold, surges 222% in a year
text: The world's most precious metal rhodium, used in engines to curb harmful emissions, has surged 222% in one year to its highest since 2008. According to chemicals company Johnson Matthey, rhodium was at $7,925/ounce on Tuesday, over five times more costly than gold. South Africa mines 80% of the world's rhodium, which is mainly a by-product of platinum mining.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: CAA is perfectly constitutional: BJP leader after Kerala moves SC
text: BJP's National General Secretary Ram Madhav said that the Citizenship Amendment Act is "perfectly legal and as per Constitution" and is meant to provide shelter to refugees. "The Opposition is indulging in violence...and we will tell people the truth," Madhav added. His comments came after Kerala government moved the Supreme Court against the Act saying that it was against secularism.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Warner hits 18th ODI ton, only Ponting has scored more for Australia
text: Slamming 128* off 112 balls in the first ODI against India, David Warner on Tuesday scored his 18th ODI hundred. Warner is now at joint second position with former Australia cricketer Mark Waugh in the list of Australia's all-time highest ODI hundred scorers. Former captain Ricky Ponting is at the top with 29 ODI hundreds in 374 matches.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: We lost 4 wickets in a go, it changed the game: Dhawan on 1st ODI
text: After Australia defeated India by 10 wickets in the first ODI, opener Shikhar Dhawan said, "Where we lost four wickets in a go, that's where the game changed". After Rohit Sharma's wicket, Dhawan and KL Rahul had stitched a 121-run partnership for the second wicket. India were 134/1 at one stage and lost their next four wickets for 30 runs.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: AB de Villiers takes diving catch, scores 40 runs on BBL debut
text: AB de Villiers on Tuesday made his Big Bash League (BBL) debut against Adelaide Strikers. Playing for Brisbane Heat, the former South Africa captain took a catch by diving forward to dismiss Jonathan Wells for 14 runs and help teammate James Pattinson pick a five-wicket haul. While batting, De Villiers smashed five fours in his 40-run innings off 32 balls.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Raj govt to encourage women to not wear 'ghoonghat' when casting vote
text: After Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot's call for eradicating the custom of 'ghoonghat' or veil, the state government has decided to encourage women to not wear 'ghoonghat' when they go to cast their vote during Panchayat elections this month. An official said posters have been prepared which will be pasted in villages and social media will be used for creating awareness.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Military veterans wanted creation of CDS post: Rajnath Singh
text: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said that military veterans had asked the government to create the post of Chief of Defence Staff. While speaking at an event in Jaipur, Singh added, "After becoming Defence Minister, I discussed the proposal with Prime Minister Narendra Modi who gave his instant approval for the same without wasting any time."
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Railways to offer 'Content on Demand' on trains, stations from 2022
text: Indian Railways has announced that it'll provide 'Content on Demand' service on trains and stations from 2022. With this service, passengers will be able to watch uninterrupted free/subscription-based content such as movies, shows, educational programs among others on their personal devices through media servers installed in trains, according to a statement by Railway PSU RailTel.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Kerala challenged CAA in SC as it's against constitutional ethos: CM
text: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday said the state moved the Supreme Court against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) as it was contradictory to the "constitutional ethos". "It is part of our intervention to protect civil rights from within the constitution,"  Vijayan added. The Kerala government's plea has been filed under Article 131 of the Constitution.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Europeans, Chinese, Americans to fly less to fight climate change: Survey
text: Most Chinese, Europeans and US citizens plan to fly less for holidays in 2020 to reduce aircraft carbon dioxide emissions and help prevent climate change, showed a new survey on Tuesday. Conducted by the European Investment Bank (EIB), the survey was based on 30,000 respondents from 28 European Union countries, in addition to US and China.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Vodafone Idea to not use ₹2,826 cr from rights issue for spectrum payments
text: Vodafone Idea's board has approved the modification of the usage of its ₹25,000-crore rights issue proceeds to pay ₹2,826 crore towards loan repayment and redemption of non-convertible debentures. Earlier, this amount was to be a part of the ₹18,674.7-crore deferred payment liability to the Department of Telecommunications but the government deferred the spectrum payment for two years.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt selling onion at ₹22/kg after importing 18,000 tonnes: Paswan
text: Consumer Affairs Minister Ram Vilas Paswan said that the government has imported 18,000 tonnes of onion and is selling it for ₹22/kg, but the states have bought only 2,000 tonnes. Paswan added that the government was working on a "no profit, no loss" policy. This comes a day after government data revealed that onion prices jumped 455.8% in December 2019.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Australia defeat India by 10 wickets in an ODI for the first time in history
text: Driven by hundreds from David Warner and captain Aaron Finch, Australia chased down the target of 256 without losing a wicket in the first ODI against India at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai on Tuesday. This was the first time in ODI cricket history that Australia defeated India by 10 wickets. Shikhar Dhawan top-scored for India, scoring 74(91).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: AAP releases list of candidates for Delhi polls, Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) released the list of candidates for the 70-seat Delhi Assembly elections. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal will fight the elections from New Delhi, while Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia will contest from Patparganj. Further, Delhi Health Minister Satyendra Jain and Atishi will contest the elections from Shakur Basti and Kalkaji respectively.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: KL Rahul keeps wickets for India as Rishabh Pant suffers concussion
text: KL Rahul is keeping wickets for India in the ongoing ODI against Australia at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai after regular wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant suffered concussion. Pant was hit on the helmet on a delivery bowled by Pat Cummins which led to his dismissal. Pant scored 28 runs off 33 deliveries in the match.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Warner-Finch set world record for highest ever partnership vs India in ODIs
text: David Warner and Aaron Finch set the world record for the highest-ever ODI partnership against India. The duo shared an unbeaten 258-run stand to help Australia register their first-ever 10-wicket ODI victory over India. The previous record for the highest-ever ODI partnership against India was held by Australia's George Bailey and Steve Smith (242 runs for third wicket in 2016).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Tennis player suffers coughing fit due to poor air from bushfires, drops to knees
text: Slovenian tennis player Dalila Jakupović suffered a coughing fit due to poor air from bushfires during her qualifying match at the Australian Open on Tuesday. Jakupović dropped to her knees while she was trailing 5-6 in the second set. "I was scared that I would collapse. That’s why I went on the floor. Because I couldn’t walk anymore," she said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Big e-commerce firms should not offer heavy discounts: India competition chief
text: Ahead of Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' visit to India this week, Competition Commission of India Chairman Ashok Kumar Gupta has said that big e-commerce companies should not offer heavy discounts. He also said they must disclose discounting policies on websites. The competition watchdog has launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart after allegations of deep discounting and promoting "preferred sellers".
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Why is India investigating Flipkart and Amazon?
text: India ordered an investigation of Amazon and Flipkart over alleged violations of competition law. A trader body alleged many of their preferred sellers were affiliated with or controlled by the firms either directly or indirectly. The probe will cover four alleged anti-competitive practices - exclusive launch of phones, promoting preferred sellers, deep discounting and promotion of private labels.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: AAP MLA resigns from party, says Kejriwal sold ticket for ₹20 crore
text: Sitting AAP MLA from Badarpur ND Sharma on Tuesday said that he has resigned from the party and accused party leaders Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia of taking ₹20 crore for giving the election ticket to a "land mafia". The AAP is fielding former Congress leader Ram Singh Netaji, who joined the party on Monday, from Badarpur in Assembly elections.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Swiggy's early investors received nearly ₹1,600 crore in exits
text: Swiggy's early investors like SAIF Partners, Accel, Bessemer Venture Partners and others collectively received nearly ₹1,600 crore in exits over the last few years, Entrackr said citing regulatory filings. Their shares were transferred to late-stage investors like Naspers, DST Euro Asia and others. SAIF Partners received highest ₹439 crore exit in FY19 from their ₹42.15 crore investment.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Man gets ₹26,000 challan for letting minor boy drive his bike in Odisha
text: The transport department of Odisha has imposed a penalty of ₹26,000 on the owner of a two-wheeler for allowing a minor boy to ride his motorbike in Pallahara town in Angul district. The boy was nabbed during a regular checking while he was riding the motorbike without a helmet. The boy also did not have a driving license.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nirbhaya gangrape convict moves Delhi HC against death warrant
text: Mukesh Singh, one of the four death row convicts in the 2012 Nirbhaya gangrape and murder case, on Tuesday approached the Delhi High Court seeking to set aside the order of the trial court which issued the death warrant. The High Court will hear the matter tomorrow. Singh reportedly also filed a mercy petition before President Ram Nath Kovind today.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Mani Shankar Aiyar joins anti-CAA protest in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh
text: Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar on Tuesday joined the protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and the National Register of Citizens in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh. Aiyar said he was ready for whatever sacrifice is needed and added that it needs to be seen who is stronger, the protesters or "that murderer". Shashi Tharoor had joined Shaheen Bagh protest on Sunday.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: US President Donald Trump may visit India next month
text: US President Donald Trump is considering a visit to India next month in what would be his first trip to the subcontinent after assuming office three years ago, reports said on Tuesday. The visit could be scheduled in the second half of February and Trump may visit a second city, besides the national capital of Delhi.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Lot to discuss over Harry, Meghan's move to Canada: Trudeau
text: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Monday said in an interview that there was much to discuss about Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's move to Canada. This came after questions were raised over costs of the couple's security in North America and who would pay for it. "Most Canadians are...supportive of having royals...here, but...there are...lots of discussions to have," he said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Federer said he would donate to Australia bushfires appeal
text: Swiss tennis player Roger Federer said he would donate to the Australia bushfires appeal on Monday. "If anyone can chip in, that's great because it's nice to show solidarity and help in a situation, which has become quite incredible in this country," the 38-year-old said. Notably, players on the men's tour have donated US$500,000, the ATP said on Sunday.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Test cricket should continue to be played over five days: MCC
text: The Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) has backed the continuation of the five-day Tests. In a statement, MCC said that while "they can see some benefits of the four-day Test cricket", the MCC Cricket Committee and MCC World Cricket committee believe that five-day Test "should continue". The International Cricket Council is set to discuss introducing four-day Tests in World Test Championship.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Labuschagne is going to be a huge player for Australia: Smith
text: Talking about Marnus Labuschagne, Steve Smith said, "Thing I like about Marnus is his willingness to learn and how quickly he picks things up, and if he continues to do that, he's going to be a huge player for Australia for a long time." "He's got a good head on his shoulders, he's got that belief in himself," Smith added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Zampa takes reflex catch to dismiss Kohli for the fourth time
text: Australian spinner Adam Zampa took a reflex catch off his own bowling to dismiss Indian captain Virat Kohli for the fourth time in ODIs where they have faced each other. Kohli's dismissal left India at 156/4 in the 32nd over. Earlier in the over, Kohli had smashed a delivery from Zampa for a six.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: World no. 1 shuttler to be out of hospital tomorrow after car crash
text: World number one shuttler Kento Momota of Japan could be released from the hospital in Malaysia on Wednesday, reports have claimed. Momota, who was travelling to Kuala Lumpur International Airport on Monday after winning the Malaysia Masters, suffered cuts and bruises after his hired van crashed into a truck. Malaysia's deputy PM visited the hospital to check on Momota.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: NZ spectator banned for 2 years for racially abusing Jofra Archer
text: A man from Auckland has been banned for two years from attending international and domestic matches in New Zealand for racially abusing England pacer Jofra Archer last year. Archer was subjected to abuse when he was walking back to pavilion during the final day of the first Test of the two-match series. The New Zealand Cricket again apologised to Archer.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Apple gets regulatory nod for MacBook with Magic Keyboard: Report
text: The Eurasian Economic Commission (EEC) has given Apple a go ahead for its next MacBook laptop with a redesigned Magic Keyboard and scissor switches, 9to5Mac reported. The probable 13-inch device will have scissor-switch keyboard like Apple's new 16-inch MacBook Pro. Prior to this all the other MacBook devices have had butterfly keyboard.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: New climate models suggest Paris goals may be out of reach
text: Climate scientists have revealed that according to new climate models the goals aimed for under the Paris climate treaty may be out of reach. Scientists state that the change in predictions is because there is more data and computing power available since the current Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) projections were finalised in 2013.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Research identifies possible on-off switch for plant growth
text: New research from the University of California Riverside has identified a protein that controls plant growth. Researchers found the protein, IRK, in the root cells of a plant related to mustard. The research demonstrated that turning off the gene that produces IRK causes an increase in the number of times the plant's root cells divide.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Scientists should conduct more research on cow dung: Giriraj Singh
text: Union Minister and BJP leader Giriraj Singh on Monday urged scientists to conduct more research on cow dung and urine. He said that this could make it financially viable for farmers to keep their cows and can make money out of it even after they have stopped producing milk. "Stray cattle is a major problem in Uttar Pradesh," Singh said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Congress best at attacking India, protecting Pak: Sambit Patra
text: BJP's Sambit Patra said that the Congress party has been reduced to giving oxygen to Pakistan and attacking India. "I challenge the Congress leadership to come on camera and say if they have any doubts about the Pulwama attacks," he added. After J&K DSP Davinder Singh's arrest, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury had demanded "fresh look" in 2019 Pulwama attack.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Over 38k people evacuated as Taal volcano erupts in Philippines
text: Amid ashes, dust and lava from Taal Volcano in the Philippines, at least 38,200 people have been evacuated and several flights have been cancelled. The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology has raised the alert level to four, meaning an "explosive eruption" could happen from the volcano in the coming hours or days.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Blackstone to invest ₹380 cr in Allcargo's warehousing business
text: US-based Blackstone Group is investing up to ₹380 crore in the form of debt and equity in Allcargo Logistics' warehousing business to develop industrial and logistics parks across India. Allcargo said it will become a minority shareholder in the various logistics assets. The transaction is expected to conclude in a phased manner over the next 12 months.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Hrithik's dad offered to launch me after seeing me dance at a wedding: Ameesha
text: Ameesha Patel has revealed Hrithik Roshan's father Rakesh Roshan offered to launch her after seeing her dance at a friend's sangeet when she was 14 or 15. She said her father, who was Roshan's schoolmate, initially said no. Adding that the Roshans later invited them for lunch, Ameesha stated, "After we got done, Rakesh uncle offered me 'Kaho Naa...Pyaar Hai'".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Decided to be single after adopting a son, texted DJ Diplo for casual sex: Sia
text: 'Cheap Thrills' singer Sia revealed she texted American DJ Diplo for casual sex. "I said, now that I've decided to be single for the rest of my life and I just adopted a son, I don't have time for a relationship," she said. "If you're interested in some no-strings sex, then hit me up," Sia added while recalling the text.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Hayden criticises Virat Kohli's decision to bat at no. 4, cites statistics
text: Ex-Australia opener Matthew Hayden has criticised India captain Virat Kohli's decision to bat at number 4 against Australia in the first ODI. "You've got someone like...Kohli who has played 230-odd ODIs and 180 of those have been at no. 3 and has scored almost 10,000 runs. Why is there even any debate...He should just be batting no. 3," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sania returns to tennis after 2 yrs, shares pic of her high-fiving son after win
text: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza played her first professional match after a gap of two years with an opening-round win in women's doubles at the Hobart International tournament on Tuesday. The 33-year-old took to Twitter to share a picture of herself high-fiving her 14-month-old son Izhaan Mirza Malik after the win, writing, "Yes my baby boy, we did it."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Encryption is vital: Apple as US asks to unlock Saudi shooter's iPhones
text: US Attorney General William Barr and FBI have asked Apple to unlock two iPhones of a Saudi Air Force cadet. He killed three sailors and wounded eight others in a shooting on December 6, 2019. Responding to the requests, Apple said, "We feel strongly encryption is vital to protecting our country and our users' data."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indo-American student fell to death while jumping between rooftops: US Police
text: Vivek Subramani, a 23-year-old Indian-American medical student at Drexel University College of Medicine, fell to his death while jumping between rooftops in Philadelphia, according to US Police. His friends told them they were jumping between rooftops of their apartment building when he plummeted, police said. However, university said that Subramani fell from a balcony and was with two friends.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: NCW sends notice to TN college for expelling girls for drinking beer
text: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has sent a notice to a college in Tamil Nadu's Nagapattinam district for expelling four girl students for consuming beer along with their male friends during a birthday party. The NCW asked the principal to take action as per law and send a report on the action taken by the college within 30 days.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: If Davinder Singh was 'Khan', RSS trolls would be more strident: Adhir
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Tuesday said that the reaction of "troll regiment of the RSS" would have been more strident and vociferous towards suspended J&K DSP Davinder Singh had he been "Davinder Khan". Chowdhury added that now the question will arise as to who were the real culprits behind Pulwama attack. Singh was also the DSP in Pulwama.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: DSP Davinder Singh struck a ₹12 lakh deal with terrorists to help them: Report
text: DSP Davinder Singh, who was arrested with terrorists while travelling in his car to Jammu, had struck a ₹12 lakh deal with them, as per Hindustan Times. An AK-47 rifle, two pistols, two grenades and lakhs of rupees were recovered from Singh's residence, an officer told Hindustan Times. "Singh was providing hideout to militants for several years," the official added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Delhi HC rejects ED plea to cancel Ratul Puri's bail in VVIP chopper case
text: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday dismissed a plea by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seeking to set aside the bail granted to Ratul Puri in a money laundering case related to the AgustaWestland VVIP chopper scam. The ED plea claimed that Puri can influence witnesses and tamper with the evidence. A trial court had granted bail to Puri last month.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: CCTV footage shows sinkhole swallowing bus in China, 6 dead, 10 missing
text: At least six people were killed and 10 others went missing after a sinkhole swallowed up a bus in China's Xining. After the incident, which occurred on Monday, as many as 16 people were taken to hospital. CCTV footage reportedly showed an explosion inside the sinkhole after the bus fell inside the hole.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Let's dial this thing down: Boris Johnson on US-Iran tensions
text: British PM Boris Johnson has called for 'dialing down' of US-Iran tensions. "The most important thing now is that tensions in the region calm down," he said in a television interview. Johnson also defended his handling of Iran crisis after being criticised for not cutting his holiday short. "I [wasn't] in this country but I worked very hard," he said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Australia very much open for business: PM amid raging bushfires
text: Australian PM Scott Morrison said on Tuesday that the country was "very much open for business" amid concerns of bushfires damaging its tourism and economy. This came after US downgraded the travel warning for Australia from 'Level Two' to 'Level One'. Melbourne was blanketed in hazardous smoke on Tuesday despite cooler temperatures easing fire dangers.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: YouTuber with 12 million subscribers comes out as trans in new video
text: Popular YouTuber Nikkie De Jager, known as NikkieTutorials, has come out as a transgender woman in a new video. The beauty blogger, who has over 12 million subscribers on YouTube, said that she was forced to come out after being blackmailed. "When I was younger I was born in the wrong body, which means that I am transgender," she said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: IndiGo pilot said he'll put us in jail after I asked for wheelchair for mom: Woman
text: A journalist claimed that an IndiGo pilot threatened her and her 75-year-old diabetic mother with jail after she requested a wheelchair for her mother. "(Captain Jayakrishna) came barging out...yells at me for pressing the assistance button and annoying him and his crew," Supriya Unni Nair said. He allegedly threatened Supriya with consequences if she posted about the incident online.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: India will create 15.8 lakh fewer jobs across low-paying sectors in FY20: SBI
text: India will create 15.8 lakh fewer formal jobs across low-paying sectors in 2019-20, an analysis by SBI showed. In 2018-19, India had created 89.7 lakh new payrolls, as per EPFO data. There is also evidence that people who migrate within the country for employment are sending less money home to states like Assam, Odisha, Bihar and Uttar Pradesh, SBI added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 'The Falcon...' series shoot in Puerto Rico cancelled due to earthquakes
text: The shoot of 'The Falcon and the Winter Soldier' in Puerto Rico was cancelled after the island was hit by 5.9 and 6.4 magnitude earthquakes on Saturday and Tuesday, respectively. Marvel Studios' upcoming TV series' shoot was set to be shot across two weeks in Arecibo, a report said. Production is likely to continue elsewhere, the report added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Barcelona sack Ernesto Valverde; appoint Quique Setién as new coach
text: Barcelona have sacked their coach Ernesto Valverde and have appointed Spanish club Real Betis' former coach Quique Setién as his replacement. While Barcelona are currently on top in La Liga, they lost in the Spanish Super Cup semi-final and have won one of their last five matches. Setién has been given a two-and-a-half-year contract until June 2022.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Agritech startup Ninjacart gets $10 million from Flipkart, others
text: Bengaluru-based agritech startup Ninjacart has raised $10 million in a Series C funding led by Flipkart and Singapore-based GEC3. The round, which also saw participation from Minu Kataria, is said to be the first tranche of the $50-million investment committed by Walmart in August 2019. Ninjacart had raised $90 million from Tiger Global in April last year.n
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Australia fire smoke will complete a full circuit of Earth: NASA
text: According to NASA scientists, the smoke from Australia's bushfires has made its way halfway around the world and will make at least one full circuit around the globe. NASA has also revealed that the uplift of smoke and ash from the fires has triggered fire-induced thunderstorms, which provide a pathway for the smoke to travel upwards into the stratosphere.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Oldest matter on Earth found inside meteorite that hit Australia
text: Scientists revealed on Monday that a meteorite that crashed into rural southeastern Australia in a fireball in 1969 contained the oldest material ever found on Earth. Researchers said that the 40 tiny dust grains trapped inside the meteorite fragments dated from about 7 billion years ago, about 2.5 billion years before the sun, Earth and rest of our solar system.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Machine made that repairs, keeps human livers alive for a week
text: Researchers from the University Hospital and ETH Zurich have developed a machine that repairs injured human livers and keep them alive outside the body for one week. The development of the machine may increase the number of available organs for transplantation. The machine uses a complex perfusion system that mimics the most core body functions close to physiology.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Scientists name new virus after catchphrase from Seinfeld
text: Scientists have discovered a new alphavirus in Australian mosquitoes and have provisionally named it Yada Yada virus, after the 'Yada Yada' catchphrase from the American TV show Seinfeld. Researchers claim that the virus, which is a mosquito-specific virus, can help us understand how viruses evolved and can be useful for vaccine production and diagnostics
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Calling someone Janata Raja is belittling Shivaji Maharaj: Udayanraje
text: BJP leader Udayanraje Bhonsle in an apparent target at NCP chief Sharad Pawar said, "Calling someone 'Janata Raja' is belittling Shivaji Maharaj". Pawar is reportedly known as the 'Janata Raja' in political circles. This comes amid a controversy over a book titled 'Aaj ke Shivaji: Narendra Modi' which has been criticised by the Shiv Sena, NCP and Congress.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Nepal to make yoga education compulsory in school curriculum
text: The Nepal government has decided to introduce certain topics about yoga as a compulsory subject for school children to promote a healthy lifestyle. The students will also be allowed to make a choice between Yoga, Ayurveda and Natural Medicine as an optional subject at the school level, a Ministry of Education, Science and Technology official said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Confident that Harry, Meghan's roles will be sorted out: British PM
text: British PM Boris Johnson on Tuesday said he was "absolutely confident" that the royal family was going to "sort out" a future role for Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle after they decided to step back from royal duties. "I think they'll sort it out all the easier without any commentary from me," he said in a television interview.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Let's replace Iran nuclear deal with a new Trump deal: UK PM
text: UK PM Boris Johnson said that the 2015 nuclear deal with Iran should be replaced with the US President Donald Trump's own new deal to stop Iranians from acquiring an atomic weapon. His comments came after Iran abandoned the deal over US' killing of its top commander. Johnson said he doesn't want a "military conflict" between the three countries.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 5,000 camels shot dead for drinking too much water in drought-hit Australia
text: Helicopter-borne shooters killed over 5,000 feral camels in five days for drinking too much water in drought-stricken areas of southern Australia, officials said on Tuesday. They said herds of camels were driven towards rural communities by drought, threatening scarce food and drinking water. They added that weakened camels frequently got stuck and died in water holes, contaminating water sources.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Britain secretly funded Reuters in 1960s and 1970s via BBC: Documents
text: The British government secretly funded Reuters in the 1960s and 1970s and hid the funding by increased subscription payments to Reuters from BBC, declassified government documents showed. The news agency expanded its coverage of Middle East and Latin America using the money and produced anti-Soviet material. "The government's interests should be well served by the arrangement," a document said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Huge week, potty-trained my child and got Oscar nomination: Director
text: Indian-American director Sami Khan, whose film 'St Louis Superman' earned an Oscar nomination in the Documentary Short Subject category, reacted to the news on Twitter. He wrote, "Yes, I was nominated for an Academy Award but did you know we also successfully potty-trained our toddler?! Huge week!" The film has been co-directed by Smriti Mundhra, another Indian-American director.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Couple gets married while Taal volcano erupts in background, pics go viral
text: Pictures of a Philippines couple getting married while Taal volcano spewed smoke in background have gone viral on social media. Chino Vaflor and Kat Bautista Palomar were at a resort 10 km away from the volcano, located about 60 km south of Manila on the island of Luzon. The resort posted a picture of the couple, captioned, "The wedding continues!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kaif shares video of mother bowling to her son on street, calls it 'beautiful'
text: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter to share a video of a mother and a son playing cricket on a street. "Mother bowling, Child batting. Just one word- Beautiful," he captioned the video. Reacting to the video, a user tweeted, " Amazing sir...Speechless...The boy is trying helicopter." Another wrote, "It has really touched my heart."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Thinking of throwing my name in the hat: ABD hints at comeback for T20 WC
text: AB de Villiers, who had announced his retirement from international cricket in 2018, has said that he would love to come back from retirement and represent South Africa in the T20 World Cup. "It’s a long way away still...I've still got to be in form at that time. So I'm thinking of throwing my name in the hat," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: We take all allegations very seriously, looking into each & everyone: OYO CEO
text: OYO's Founder and CEO Ritesh Agarwal on Monday wrote an e-mail to his employees where he talked about firings in the organisation and addressed to "questionable claims" against OYO in a recent article. "The article described behaviour that would violate our Code of Conduct. We take all the allegations very seriously and are looking into each and everyone," Agarwal said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 10 vehicles collide on Chennai highway due to low visibility on Bhogi
text: Over 10 vehicles collided on the Chennai-Vellore National Highway due to poor visibility during the early hours on Tuesday, owing to Bhogi celebrations in Tamil Nadu. At least 10 people were injured and admitted to a hospital. Bhogi is the first day of the harvest festival Pongal in Tamil Nadu, in which people burn old articles.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Mirrors put up on walls to shame people urinating in public in B'luru
text: In a bid to prevent people from urinating in public places, the Bengaluru civic body has installed mirrors on walls at five locations. The mirrors have a QR code that can be scanned to find the nearest public toilet. The idea is to shame the offenders by making them reflect on their actions when they see themselves in the mirror.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 18-yr-old UP boy poses with gun for TikTok video, shoots himself in the head
text: An 18-year-old boy died after he accidentally shot himself in the head from a pistol while shooting a TikTok video in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. The boy's mother said she gave her licensed pistol to him after he kept insisting. She rushed to him after hearing a gunshot and found him "lying on the floor in a pool of blood".
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 17-yr-old Pak boy sent home 2 yrs after he accidentally entered India
text: A 17-year-old Pakistani boy, Mubarshar Bilal, was repatriated on Tuesday, almost two years after he accidentally crossed over to the Indian territory in 2018. Bilal said he inadvertently crossed the border after he left home in anger over a fight with his family. He praised Indian authorities for treating him well and said he was indebted to them for that.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Soleimani killing part of bigger strategy to deter US foes: Pompeo
text: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Monday said Iranian General Qassem Soleimani was killed as part of a broader strategy to block challenges posed by US' enemies. He said this in his speech at Stanford University's Hoover Institute. This weakens US' initial assertion that the strike was due to threat of imminent attacks planned on US targets by Soleimani.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: If something goes wrong, we have to say it: Malaysia PM on India's palm oil curbs
text: Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad said his country is concerned about India's restrictions on imports of refined palm oil, which came after his criticism of CAA. "But on the other hand we need to be frank and see that if something goes wrong, we'll have to say it," he added. Malaysia is the world's second-biggest exporter of palm oil after Indonesia.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 'Some' people arrested over Ukrainian plane crash, says Iran
text: Iran on Tuesday said that an undisclosed number of people have been arrested over accidental shooting down of a Ukrainian passenger plane by Iranian military. This came after President Hassan Rouhani called for setting up of a special court to investigate the plane crash that took place last week. However, identities of the detainees have not been revealed.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I will be looking for only lead roles now: Siddhant
text: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi has said that he "never expressed it" but he "always wanted to be a hero". "I found...this...little tunnel to get here, so from now on I want to only concentrate on my dream," Siddhant said. When asked if by "dream" he meant "playing lead roles", Siddhant replied, "Yes, will be looking for only lead roles now."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: It's nothing short of a miracle: Richa on relationship with Ali Fazal
text: Talking about her boyfriend Ali Fazal, Richa Chadha said, "[I]t's nothing short of a miracle...[t]hat...We found each other and we are happy." She further said that when they found each other, there wasn't just attraction but they "understood each other on a fundamental level". When asked about marriage, Richa said, "You should get married...only if you decide to have children."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Gully Boy makers share deleted scenes ahead of film's 1st anniversary
text: Production house Tiger Baby has shared a video on its YouTube channel which contains deleted scenes from Zoya Akhtar-directed film 'Gully Boy'. "A year since we came to your Gully, now we're coming to YouTube," Tiger Baby wrote in its Instagram story. 'Gully Boy', starring Ranveer Singh, Alia Bhatt and Siddhant Chaturvedi, was released in India on February 14, 2019.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Oscar-nominated film '1917' to release in India on January 17
text: Sam Mendes-directed war film '1917', which has received ten Oscar nominations at the 92nd Academy Awards, will be released in India on January 17. The film has received nominations in categories including 'Best Motion Picture of the Year' and 'Original Screenplay'. '1917' had won in 'Best Motion Picture - Drama' category at the 77th Golden Globe Awards.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Delhi HC asks police to 'look into' road closure at Kalindi Kunj
text: Disposing of a plea seeking reopening of the Kalindi Kunj-Shaheen Bagh stretch in the New Delhi, the High Court has directed the police to "look into" the road closure in the area. The stretch connects Delhi, Faridabad and Noida and was closed on December 15, 2019, due to ongoing protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Israeli startup claims its screen fixes lazy-eye while kids watch TV
text: Israeli startup NovaSight has developed a screen which it claims can treat Amblyopia (lazy-eye) in kids while watching TV. The system helps with alignment by selectively blurring content being watched to make the affected eye do the work while the other rests. It doesn't require one to wear a patch, but instead, use glasses with blue and red lenses.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Christian hymn 'Abide With Me' dropped from Republic Day: Reports
text: The Beating Retreat ceremony held annually on January 29 at Delhi's Vijay Chowk, which marks the closing of the four-day-long Republic Day celebrations, will reportedly not have the Christian Hymn 'Abide With Me' in 2020. "This year 'Vande Mataram'...likely to replace 'Abide With Me'," said an official. "It's always good to repackage...ceremony with new Indian tunes," said another official.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: India asks Pakistan to return Samjhauta Express coaches lying at Wagah
text: India has asked Pakistan to return Samjhauta Express coaches lying at Wagah border for the past five months, a railway official said. Train services were suspended between India and Pakistan after the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir in August 2019. Pakistan had stopped Samjhauta Express at Wagah border on August 8, 2019, leaving nearly 117 passengers stranded.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: WB Guv's Wiki bio changed to Jadavpur University's ex-chancellor
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's Wikipedia bio was reportedly edited wherein he was depicted as 'ex-chancellor' of Jadavpur University. The error on the page has been corrected, but it remains semi-locked till January 15. The comes after Dhankhar was shown black flags and posters of 'BJP Activist Mr Jagdeep Dhankhar Go Back' by Jadavpur University students before the convocation ceremony.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: At least 57 dead in avalanches in PoK over 24 hours
text: At least 57 people were killed and several went missing after avalanches in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) over the last 24 hours, Pakistan government officials said on Tuesday. Avalanches in the Neelum valley area were reported following heavy rains that also triggered landslides. Many people were reported missing and feared dead as rescue operation got underway, an official said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Crash victims would be alive if not for US-Iran tensions: Trudeau
text: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said that the 176 people including 57 Canadians, who died when a Ukrainian plane was shot down by Iran, would have been alive if tensions in the region hadn't escalated. Trudeau added that he did not receive a heads up from the US before Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani's killing but would have preferred one.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Saudis withdraw 21 cadets from US after Navy base shooting probe
text: Saudi Arabia will withdraw 21 cadets receiving military training in the US following a US investigation into a Saudi officer's shooting of three US citizens at a Florida naval base. The Saudi cadets were "disenrolled from their training curriculum" after an investigation showed that they either had child pornography or social media accounts containing Islamic extremist or anti-American content.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Madonna is my favourite when it comes to fashion: Designer Anamika
text: On being asked to choose between Madonna and Michael Jackson when it comes to fashion, designer Anamika Khanna said she'd choose Madonna. "Because...over the years she's been able to reinvent herself and yet be so powerful at her age," she added. Talking about her position in the fashion industry, Anamika said that she worked non-stop for the last 20 years.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: SC dismisses curative petitions filed by 2 Nirbhaya convicts days before hanging
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday dismissed the curative petitions filed by Nirbhaya gangrape and murder convicts, Vinay Kumar Sharma and Mukesh Singh, days before their execution. In his petition, Sharma had stated that he was only 19 at the time of the crime. All the four convicts are scheduled to be hanged on January 22 at 7am in Tihar Jail.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: AAP, BJP, Congress use same 'Baazigar' meme to troll each other
text: Ahead of Delhi Assembly Elections, AAP shared a meme based on film Baazigar, showing Kajol as 'Delhi', Shah Rukh Khan as 'Kejriwal' and Siddharth Ray as 'Manoj Tiwari'. BJP replied to AAP's meme, saying SRK was killed "for his sins" in the movie. Later, Congress added Ajay Devgn's image in the meme and tweeted, "Congress wale Dhulaniya Le Jayenge".
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: We won't show papers: Bengali celebrities in video against CAA and NRC
text: Fourteen Bengali film personalities including actors Konkona Sensharma, Nandana Sen and Sabyasachi Chakraborty, have featured in a video against CAA and NRC. "We won't show papers," they can be heard saying in the video. "We thought we must do something to register our protests through social media as it can be the most powerful tool," said actor Dhritiman Chatterjee.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Bezos to chat with B'wood celebs in Mumbai, Rahman to perform at event: Report
text: World's richest person and Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos will participate in an informal chat with Bollywood celebrities at a hotel in Mumbai during his India visit, according to reports. Music composer AR Rahman will reportedly perform at the event. Bezos is also expected to participate in an Amazon event for small and medium businesses in Delhi slated for January 15-16.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Literate need to be educated: BJP's Lekhi on Microsoft CEO's CAA statement
text: BJP's Meenakashi Lekhi tweeted, "How literate need to be educated! Perfect example," after Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said he was "sad" about what's happening on CAA. "Precise reason for CAA is to grant opportunities to persecuted minorities from Bangladesh, Pakistan & Afghanistan," Lekhi said. She also asked, "How about granting these opportunities to Syrian Muslims instead of Yezidis in USA?"
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Every country should set its immigration policy accordingly: Satya Nadella
text: In a statement released by Microsoft, CEO Satya Nadella has said, "Every country will and should define its borders...and set immigration policy accordingly." "My hope is for an India where an immigrant can aspire to found a prosperous start-up or lead a multinational corporation benefitting Indian society and the economy," he added. The statement comes after his remarks on CAA.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Colour black banned at Wankhede Stadium for India-Australia ODI
text: Mumbai Cricket Association has banned the colour black for spectators at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. A spectator claimed the colour has been banned as it's a "symbol of protest". A Twitter account named 'North Stand Gang- Wankhede' wrote, "Those who are coming for #INDvAUS match...kindly don't wear black colour T-shirts. Entries are restricted for some security reasons for the same."n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Economist Amit Bhaduri resigns as JNU Emeritus prof in protest against VC
text: Economist Amit Bhaduri resigned on Monday as Professor Emeritus from JNU in protest against Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar's handling of the ongoing protests. Bhaduri alleged that there is "a deliberate attempt to throttle the free and lively atmosphere of debate and discussion in JNU". Protests are taking place in JNU after the January 5 violence on the campus.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: You can't defend govt, get out: Akhilesh to doc on emergency duty in UP hospital
text: A video of former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav scolding a doctor on emergency duty after the latter talked about financial compensation given to victims of Kannauj bus accident. "You cannot defend the government...You can be from the RSS. You can be from the BJP....Go away. Get out of here," Akhilesh can be heard saying in the video.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 25-year-old man suffers seizure, his Fortuner flies into air and lands on 2 cars
text: Rajinder Singh, a 25-year-old man, suffered a major seizure while driving and lost his balance after which his Toyota Fortuner flew into the air and landed on parked Honda City and Hyundai Verna in Chandigarh's Sector 37. Rajinder received minor injuries in the accident, while cars suffered damages. The owners of the parked cars made a written compromise with Rajinder.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Same-sex marriage becomes legal in Northern Ireland
text: Same-sex marriage got legal recognition in Northern Ireland from Monday. This effectively means that same-sex couples will now be able to register to marry in the country and those already married will now be able to have their union recognised by law. Same-sex marriages have been legal in England, Scotland and Wales since 2014.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: JPMorgan has a lot of properties in India, seize them: Supreme Court to ED
text: The Supreme Court has directed the Enforcement Directorate to seize the local assets of JPMorgan for allegedly violating foreign investment rules. The agency is investigating the bank's role in allegedly helping Amrapali Group divert ₹140 crore from housing projects. "They have a lot of properties in India. We want you to attach their office or corporate properties," the court said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Jennifer Lopez inspires 'Fleabag' in a way she'll never know: Actress Phoebe
text: Actress-writer Phoebe Waller-Bridge, while accepting an award at the 25th Annual Critics' Choice Awards, said, "JLo (Jennifer Lopez)...inspires [TV series 'Fleabag'] in a way [she] will never know." Phoebe added she made Lopez's song 'Jenny from the Block' one of 'Fleabag' character's favourite and that "opened the entire character up". "I don't know where she is, but...thank you," Phoebe said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Rashmika Mandanna refutes rumours of being highest-paid actress in South
text: South Indian actress Rashmika Mandanna in an interview refuted the rumours of being the highest-paid actress in the South industry. "When people say I'm the highest-paid, I wonder from where [the news] is spreading," she added. "I wonder 'dude, from where it (money) is coming and where it's going.' I don't have...money in...bank. I still feel like...debutant," Rashmika further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: American director Spike Lee becomes first black to lead Cannes jury
text: American director Spike Lee, known for films like 'Malcolm X' and 'Inside Man', was named the president of the 2020 Cannes Film Festival jury, making him the first black head of the panel. "I'm honoured to be...first person of...African diaspora (USA) to be named president of...Cannes jury," he said. Lee will succeed Mexican film director Alejandro González Iñárritu.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I've 4 National Award-winning films, which is unheard of: Ayushmann
text: Ayushmann Khurrana, while talking about his journey, said that "some fantastic" scripts helped him create a space for himself in the film industry. "Plus, in all these years, my filmography boasts of four National Award-winning films, which is unheard of," he added. Ayushmann's 'Vicky Donor', 'Dum Laga Ke Haisha', 'Andhadhun' and 'Badhaai Ho' have won National Awards in different categories.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Boman to play Ranveer's father in 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'
text: Boman Irani has been roped in to play Ranveer Singh's father in the comedy film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. Talking about his collaboration with Ranveer, Boman said, "Working with [him] is always fun. He's...powerhouse performer who gives his all in every scene." Directed by Divyang Thakkar, the film is set in Gujarat and Ranveer will portray the role of a Gujarati man.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Sonakshi to make digital debut with show titled 'Fallen': Report
text: Sonakshi Sinha has been roped in by a digital platform to make her digital debut in a web show titled 'Fallen', a report said. The report added that the show will be a dark thriller and in the same space as American TV show 'Dexter'. "Sonakshi immediately got drawn towards this because it's something she hasn't...tried before," the report stated.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Ajay Devgn's 'Tanhaji' declared tax-free in UP, actor thanks UP CM
text: Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday made Ajay Devgn starrer 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' tax-free in the state. Thanking CM Yogi Adityanath, Ajay reacted to the news tweeting, "Thank you Shri Yogi Adityanathji...I would also be delighted...if you watched our film." He also used the hashtag 'TanhajiUnitesIndia' in his tweet.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: E-mail scam offers MacBook, says 'Start your 2020 with a gift from us'
text: Hackers have been sending an authentic-looking e-mail to users, part of a scam called 'Start your 2020 with a gift from us', which comes with a clickable link and a MacBook offer. Experts said such e-mails talked about delayed items and ultimately directed users to fake pay pages. The hackers specifically targeted users expecting a courier from people overseas.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Scientists harvest cells from frogs to build first-ever 'living robot'
text: US-based scientists have created the first-ever 'living robot', made entirely of living cells harvested from African clawed frog embryos. Smaller than a millimetre, the 'xenobots' contain 500-1,000 cells and can perform tasks like move across a petri dish, self-organise and transport tiny payloads. The robot configurations are designed by an 'evolutionary' algorithm that runs on a supercomputer.
author: Dharna

headlines: Mamata has demon-like traits, she is like Lankini of Sri Lanka: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Surendra Singh alleged that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is protecting terrorists who killed thousands of Hindus and said she has demon-like traits. "In a democratic society, Mamata Banerjee has traits of a demon. She has no human values and no women characteristics," he said. "She is like the Lankini of Sri Lanka," Singh added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Tree grown from seeds of Isaac Newton's apple tree planted at his home
text: British astronaut Tim Peake on Monday planted a tree sapling grown from the seeds of Isaac Newton's famed apple tree at the physicist's former house in England. In 2015, Peake took the seeds to the International Space Station, where they spent six months before returning. The apple tree is said to have inspired Newton to formulate his theory of gravity.
author: Dharna

headlines: Case filed against 29-yr-old woman for raping 14-yr-old boy in Haryana
text: Haryana's Palwal Police has registered a case against a 29-year-old woman for allegedly raping a 14-year-old boy. Notably, the woman had earlier accused the boy for allegedly raping her, police said and added that he was sent to judicial custody and released later as he was a minor. Court later ordered the police to file a case against the woman.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Judgment on Muzaffarpur shelter home rape case pushed to 20 Jan
text: A Saket court has adjourned its judgment till January 20 in the case of alleged rape of over 40 girls at a shelter home in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, which was run by former Bihar People's Party (BPP) MLA Brajesh Thakur. A total of 20 people (eight females and 12 males) have been accused who are currently lodged in Tihar jail.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 3 soldiers martyred as avalanche hits Army post in J&K: Reports
text: At least three soldiers were martyred after an avalanche hit an Army post along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Machil sector in Kupwara on Tuesday, reports said. One soldier has reportedly gone missing after the avalanche. Out of five soldiers who got trapped under the avalanche, one was rescued after Army launched rescue operations, reports added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India's wholesale inflation rises to seven-month high of 2.59% in December
text: India's wholesale inflation, measured by the Wholesale Price Index (WPI), rose from 0.58% in November to 2.59% in December, the highest level in seven months. It was driven by a surge in prices of food items such as onions. The rate of increase in the price for food articles rose to 13.24% during December, against 11.1% in the preceding month.
author: Dharna

headlines: Who is this man? Hrithik after watching TikTok video of dancer
text: Actor Hrithik Roshan on Tuesday shared a TikTok compilation video of a dancer on Twitter and praised him by saying, "Smoothest airwalker I have seen." He further asked, "Who is this man?" while reacting to the video, which shows the boy dancing to songs including 'Mukkala Mukkabala'. Several Twitter users commented that he is a dancer named Yuvraj Singh.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Raj Kapoor's daughter & Shweta Bachchan's mother-in-law Ritu dies aged 71
text: Ritu Nanda, daughter of late Bollywood actor-filmmaker Raj Kapoor and mother-in-law of Amitabh Bachchan's daughter Shweta Bachchan Nanda, passed away on Tuesday in Delhi aged 71. "She was suffering from cancer. We are in Delhi. The funeral is today," said her brother Randhir Kapoor. Ritu was an entrepreneur and was married to late industrialist Rajan Nanda.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Police behaving as if Jama Masjid is Pak: Delhi court on Bhim Army chief's arrest
text: While hearing the bail application of Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad, who led anti-CAA protests at Jama Masjid, Tis Hazari Court told Delhi Police, "You're behaving as if Jama Masjid is Pakistan." "Even if it was Pakistan, you can go there and protest," it added. The court also said there's nothing in protesting, adding, "It's one's constitutional right to protest."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Tharoor apologises after comparing Kejriwal to 'eunuch', withdraws remark
text: After saying Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal "really wants power without responsibility, which we all know has been the prerogative of eunuchs for ages", Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has issued an apology. "Apologies to those who found my quote about 'power without responsibility' offensive," Tharoor tweeted. "It's an old line from British politics...its use...was inappropriate & withdraw it," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 10-year-old Odisha boy with rare skin condition sheds his skin every month
text: Jagannath, a 10-year-old boy from Odisha's Ganjam district sheds his skin every 4-6 weeks due to a rare skin condition called Lamellar ichthyosis, affecting one in 6,00,000 people. It causes the skin to form scales, dry out and eventually shed, alongside drying of eyelids, hair loss and overheating. Jagannath moisturises every three hours and bathes frequently to relieve the symptoms.
author: Dharna

headlines: Dog enters operation theatre of private hospital in UP, kills newborn
text: A dog entered the operation theatre of Akash Ganga Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad and mauled a newborn baby to death on Monday. The baby's father, Ravi Kumar, said that after hearing a dog has entered the operation theatre, he rushed there. Kumar saw his child lying in the operation theatre with bite marks on his chest and left eye.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Got envelopes with crossed pictures of PM, Shah in them: Pragya Thakur
text: BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur on Monday filed a police complaint alleging that she received envelopes with pictures of PM Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and others crossed with a pen. Police said they have seized the envelopes which also contained letters written in Urdu. These enemies are trying to target people working for the country's welfare, Thakur said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Class 6 student critical after javelin pierces his skull during sports event
text: A Class 6 student in West Bengal's Howrah was injured when a javelin pierced his skull during a sports event in his school. The incident took place after the boy suddenly entered a side of the ground where the event was being held. According to reports, he is being kept under observation at the hospital and is in critical condition.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Policeman rapes Mumbai taxi driver after he refuses ride to red-light area
text: A 29-year-old Indian Railway Protection Force constable has been arrested on charges of raping a taxi driver in Mumbai, police said. The driver had refused to take the constable to a red-light area, stating he already has passengers. "He then hit the driver with a stick...beer bottles and took him to a railway area where he sodomised him," police said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Japanese woman forced to take pregnancy test before boarding flight to US
text: A 25-year-old woman from Japan was forced to take a pregnancy test before she was allowed to board a flight to US island Saipan. The airline said it was required to ensure "US immigration laws weren't being undermined". Saipan has seen a growth in "birth tourism", whereby pregnant women intentionally give birth there to gain US citizenship for their children.n nnn
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: US drops China 'currency manipulator' label ahead of trade deal
text: The Trump administration on Monday removed China's designation as a currency manipulator, ahead of signing a phase one trade deal with China this week. The US said it made the change as China had agreed to refrain from devaluing its currency to make Chinese goods cheaper for overseas buyers. The trade deal would de-escalate the two nations' tit-for-tat tariff war.
author: Dharna

headlines: Michael Patra appointed as RBI Deputy Governor for 3 years
text: The Centre on Tuesday appointed Michael Debabrata Patra as the Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for a term of three years. Patra is currently an Executive Director at the central bank and has a seat on the six-member Monetary Policy Committee (MPC). His appointment comes six months after former Deputy Governor Viral Acharya's pre-mature resignation.
author: Dharna

headlines: Saoirse Ronan 2nd youngest 4-time nominated actress in Oscars history
text: Saoirse Ronan, who earned a nomination for Best Actress at Oscars 2020, has become the second-youngest actress to get nominated four times in the history of Oscars. Jennifer Lawrence, who bagged her fourth Oscar nomination in 2016, is the youngest actress to do so. Ronan has been nominated for 'Little Women' and will compete with Renée Zellweger and Charlize Theron.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Had no plans to make a career in acting: Taapsee Pannu
text: Taapsee Pannu has said she had no plans to make a career as an actor, adding, "I entered films with...intention of experimenting with life." Taapsee, who started her acting career in the South film industry, further said she never used the industry as a stepping stone to Bollywood. "Never wanted to choose between...two...wanted to work in both simultaneously," said Taapsee.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Bieber asks fans to manipulate charts to get song to top spot, says use VPN
text: In a now-deleted repost on Instagram, musician Justin Bieber shared a fan-made guide to streaming his new song 'Yummy' so as to get it to number one spot on music charts. It included suggestions like buying song multiple times, using VPN to stream and letting the song play while fans sleep. Several people criticised the method, deeming it "chart manipulation".
author: Dharna

headlines: Wanted to see it with public: Meghna's mom on skipping 'Chhapaak' previews
text: Veteran actress Rakhee Gulzar has said that she skipped watching previews of daughter Meghna Gulzar's film 'Chhapaak' as she wanted to see it with the public, who are "the most honest and unforgiving judge of films".
