"What [Meghna]...achieved in 'Chhapaak' isn't easy...I'm...proud of my daughter," Rakhee said. "It's a true story, faithful to facts but still so cinematic," she added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Actors should be known for their work, not for social media activity: Ajay
text: Ajay Devgn has said that "stardom era" has been washed away by social media and by actors "who constantly keep sharing information about their lives". "Earlier, we would imagine how [stars] lived, what they did but now people think they are just like them," Ajay said. He added, "[Actors] should be known for their work...not for social media activity."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: We should separate personal from professional: Meghna on Deepika's JNU visit
text: Meghna Gulzar, when asked to comment on Deepika Padukone's visit to Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), said, "We have to be able to separate between...What somebody does in...personal life and...as a professional." Meghna added that people should divert their attention to the reason why they made 'Chhapaak'. Deepika had visited JNU to extend her support to students against violence in campus.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: It's a very rare thing: Parasite's director on film's Oscar nomination
text: Bong Joon Ho, the director of South Korean film 'Parasite', has said it's a very rare thing that an Asian or Korean film gets nominated at Oscars. He further said it's almost like a national celebration, adding, "The Korean press, they're all...excited." 'Parasite' became the first South Korean film to be nominated for Best Picture and Best International Feature Film.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Casual sex is not spoken about in open but it exists: Actor Amol
text: Amol Parashar, known for his role in series 'TVF Tripling', said at an event that casual sex is not talked about openly but it exists in our society. "There are...few mainstream conversations around it...therefore there's...hesitation," he added. On being asked if Indian society is judgemental towards casual sex, Amol said, "I think they're...little unsure about how to react to it."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Sharad Kelkar replaces Rana Daggubati in Ajay Devgn's 'Bhuj...'
text: Sharad Kelkar has been roped in to play Rana Daggubati's role in Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Bhuj: The Pride of India'. Rana opted out of Abhishek Dudhaiya's directorial film due to health issues. Talking about the same, Sharad said, "The movie has a lot of action sequences, and Abhishek offered me the part since it might take months for Rana to recover."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Visa buys fintech startup Plaid for $5.3 billion
text: Payments giant Visa has announced it is acquiring US-based fintech startup Plaid for $5.3 billion (around ₹37,580 crore). Launched in 2013, Plaid provides software that allows digital payment platforms like Venmo and cryptocurrency exchanges like Coinbase to securely connect to users' bank accounts. The startup will continue to operate as an independent entity after the deal closes.
author: Dharna

headlines: Man killed in firing by forest officials in West Bengal, probe ordered
text: A man was shot dead allegedly by forest officials at West Bengal's Jaldapara National Park on Sunday who reportedly mistook him as a poacher. According to a report, the incident took place when Forest Department personnel during routine patrolling found some suspicious movements and later opened fire. The state government has ordered a high-level probe into the incident.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Water, electricity at ₹1 for poor if we win: Delhi BJP leader
text: West Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Singh Verma has said that if his party wins in the February Assembly elections, they will charge ₹1 for water and electricity from the poor in Delhi. He added that the token charge will honour the "self-respect" of people. Verma further said that BJP will give three seats to alliance party Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD).
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Naidu, TDP leaders burn copies of GN Rao Committee report
text: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) Chief and former Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu and his party members on Tuesday celebrated the Bhogi festival, wherein they burnt copies of GN Rao Committee report. GN Rao panel has recommended three capitals for Andhra Pradesh proposing Visakhapatnam to be the executive capital, Kurnool to be judicial and Amaravati to be legislative capital.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Seize phones of JNU linked WhatsApp group members: HC to Delhi Police
text: The Delhi High Court has asked Delhi Police to seize the mobile phones of members of two WhatsApp groups, 'Friends of RSS' and 'Unity against Left'. The groups were allegedly related to the January 5 JNU violence when a masked mob attacked students and teachers. The court also directed JNU to provide CCTV footage to police as soon as possible.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: B'luru bank restricted by RBI blames 62 dud loans for crisis, says money safe
text: After the RBI restricted Sri Guru Raghavendra Co-operative Bank in Bengaluru from doing business over alleged irregularities, the bank blamed 62 dud loans for the issue. A withdrawal limit of ₹35,000 was also imposed on bank's customers. Its Chairman K Ramakrishna said these loans had locked up ₹300 crore of deposit, while assuring the depositors their money was "100% safe".
author: Dharna

headlines: Kerala govt challenges CAA in Supreme Court, first state to do so
text: Kerala government has challenged the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in the Supreme Court on Tuesday, becoming the first state to do so. The plea has been filed under Article 131 of the Constitution, which empowers Supreme Court to hear disputes between Government of India and one or more states. The Kerala Assembly had earlier also passed a resolution against CAA.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Microsoft ends Windows 7 support 10 years after its launch
text: Microsoft will stop supporting its Windows 7 operating system from Tuesday, the company announced previously, stating that the move is aimed to help the company focus on "newer technologies". Windows 7 users will no longer receive important security updates and patches that keep their machines safe. Microsoft's Windows 7 operating system made its global debut on October 22, 2009.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indian-American director duo's film gets nominated for Oscars 2020
text: 'St Louis Superman', a documentary film by two Indian-American filmmakers, Smriti Mundhra and Sami Khan, has earned a nomination in the Documentary Short Subject category at Oscars 2020. The film revolves around activist Bruce Franks Jr's journey to becoming a state lawmaker. "I am shell-shocked, overwhelmed and profoundly grateful," Mundhra tweeted after the nominations were announced on Monday.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Faced rejections on the basis of looks, lost out to some star kids: Siddhant
text: 'Gully Boy' actor Siddhant Chaturvedi has revealed that he faced multiple rejections based on his looks. "They thought I was very unconventional, with tiny eyes, curly hair, not the hero types...They used to stereotype me to be from Delhi, Haryana," he said. "At times I even lost out to some star kids," said Siddhant.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Kabir says India didn't win any WC match till 1983, Twitter users say it's incorrect
text: Filmmaker Kabir Khan was trolled on Twitter after he said India had never won a match in World Cup history till 1983. "India...won against East Africa in 1975 World Cup by 10 wickets!" a user pointed out. "Don't pay your research team a single penny," another comment read. Khan has directed '83, a film on India's 1983 World Cup victory.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Pakistani cab driver returns Indian girl's lost wallet; family praises
text: Modassar Khadim, a Pakistani taxi driver in Dubai, was praised by the family of an Indian girl for returning her lost wallet. Khadim noticed the wallet in his cab after completing a few trips. When his next passengers said it wasn't theirs, Khadim reported the matter to the police and later went to the girl's house to drop the wallet.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: I'd love to see B'deshi immigrant in India become next Infosys CEO: Nadella on CAA
text: Amid unrest over CAA, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said, "I'd love to see a Bangladeshi immigrant who comes to India and creates the next unicorn in India or becomes the next CEO of Infosys." In a statement released by Microsoft later, Nadella said, "Every country will and should define its borders, protect national security and set immigration policy accordingly."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: My wife got a million new Indian followers after 'babysitter' pic with Pant: Paine
text: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has said that his wife Bonnie Paine got a "million new Indian followers" after she uploaded a picture with Team India wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant on Instagram with the caption 'best babysitter'. "She panicked a little bit that it was on the news," he added. Paine had called Pant 'babysitter' while sledging him in a Test.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Missed this amazing feeling: Hardik trains with India after months, shares pics
text: All-rounder Hardik Pandya, who underwent a back surgery in October last year, trained with Team India in Mumbai on Monday. The 26-year-old, who last played an international match in September last year, took to Instagram to share pictures from the training. "Back training with the team...Missed this amazing feeling," he captioned the post.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Doctor who treated Unnao rape survivor's father dies day before court hearing
text: The doctor who treated the Unnao rape survivor's father, who died after he was beaten up in police custody, passed away on Monday. The doctor's family said he was having difficulty in breathing and was declared brought dead in hospital. Notably, the case related to the death of survivor's father was scheduled to come up in court on Tuesday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Pakistan minister poses with shotgun to threaten Indian Army chief, gets trolled
text: After Indian Army chief MM Naravane said the Army will take over Pakistan-occupied Kashmir if the Parliament wants it, Pakistan Minister Mushtaq Minhas tweeted a picture of himself holding a shotgun and wrote, "We are waiting". Trolling him, a person tweeted, "We need a security guard for our society, send resume." Some compared him with Looney Tunes character Elmer Fudd.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: No dress code in Kashi Vishwanath Temple: UP Religious Affairs Minister
text: UP Religious Affairs Minister Neelkanth Tiwari has clarified no dress code has been imposed in Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath Temple. He said there's no plan to implement it as well. "Scholars suggested it but no decision has been made on it," he added. Earlier, reports said dhoti and kurta for men and saree for women had been implemented as dress code.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 5-year-old Hyderabad boy makes Guinness World Record in Taekwondo
text: Aashman Taneja, a five-year-old boy from Hyderabad, has made a Guinness World Record in Taekwondo for the most full-contact knee strikes in one hour (team). Taneja successfully made around 1,200 knee strikes in an hour. "When my sister got two Guinness World Records, I too wanted to secure it. She is my inspiration and so is my teacher," Taneja said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Don't panic: BJP MP to depositors after RBI sets withdrawal limit in B'luru bank
text: After the RBI asked Sri Guru Raghavendra Co-operative Bank in Bengaluru to stop doing business and imposed a cash withdrawal limit of ₹35,000 on customers, BJP MP Tejasvi Surya tweeted, "I want to assure all depositors...to not panic." Adding that the government will protect interests of depositors, Surya said Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is "personally monitoring the issue".
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Fee issue sorted, JNU students' protests not justified: HRD Minister
text: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal has said the issue regarding JNU hostel fee hike had been resolved and added that carrying on of student protests wasn't justified. Pokhriyal said the service and utility charges wouldn't be borne by students for the winter session. However, the revised hostel room charges would be borne by the students, with 50% concession for BPL students.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Supportive of Harry, Meghan's desire to create new life as young family: Queen
text: Queen Elizabeth II has accepted Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle's decision to step down as senior royals. "My family and I are entirely supportive of Harry and Meghan's desire to create a new life as...young family," she said. She added there would be a "transition period" during which the couple would spend time in Britain and Canada.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What is the Adani coal-mining project in Australia, which Greta is opposing?
text: Sweden's 17-year-old climate activist Greta Thunberg has opposed $16.5-billion Carmichael Coal Mine and Rail Project by Germany's Siemens and India's Adani Power at Galilee Basin in Australia's Queensland. The coal from the project is meant for export and would be burned in India, Reuters reported. Protesters say it can increase global warming and threaten the Great Barrier Reef.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: National Award-winning filmmaker Manmohan Mahapatra passes away aged 69
text: Filmmaker Manmohan Mahapatra, who was undergoing treatment for age-related complications, passed away on Monday in Bhubaneswar at the age of 69. Considered the 'Father of New Wave Odia Cinema', Mahapatra's film 'Seeta Raati' was the first Odia film to be screened at an international film festival. It also won 'Best Feature Film in Odia' at the 29th National Film Awards.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Deepika should understand India, needs an advisor like me: Ramdev
text: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev has said that Bollywood actress Deepika Padukone needs people like him to give her "the right piece of advice". "Deepika should first study social, political and cultural issues and understand more about our country," Ramdev added. This comes after her visit to the JNU last week after the January 5 violence inside the university campus.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Spanish startup makes vegan 'steak' with peas, seaweed through a 3D printer
text: Spanish startup Novameat has created a new plant-based 'steak', 3D printed from items like peas, seaweed and beetroot juice. The startup claims the 'Steak 2.0' replicates the firm and fibrous textures of real meat, which was achieved by using 3D printing technology to cut the substitute into fine fibres to mimic muscle tissue. Its taste is still being experimented with.
author: Dharna

headlines: Even PM doesn't talk of 'achhe din' anymore: Cong leader Salman Khurshid
text: While talking about the current economic situation in the country, Congress' Salman Khurshid said that PM Narendra Modi himself doesn't talk of 'achhe din' anymore. "How long we will be told that inflation is under control? When will we get to know about 'achhe din'?" he asked. Khurshid further said that the rising inflation will impact the poor the most.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Two GM engineers held for street racing cars at 160 kmph in a 70 kmph zone
text: Two General Motors engineers were arrested by the US police after being caught street racing in two 2020 Corvette Stingrays at 160 kilometres/hour in a 70 kilometres/hour speed limit zone. One of the cars even reached a speed of 194 kilometres per hour. The men were charged with reckless driving, racing on public highway and driving over the speed limit.
author: Dharna

headlines: Oldest material on Earth, older than Solar System, found in a meteorite
text: In a meteorite that fell in Australia in 1969, scientists have discovered stardust that formed 5-7 billion years ago, the oldest solid material ever found on Earth. The stardust grains, termed 'presolar grains', are older than the Solar System itself which formed around 4.6 billion years ago. Stardust grains originate from a star's supernova explosion and eventually form new stars.
author: Dharna

headlines: RSS termed Tiranga 'inauspicious' when it was made National flag: Owaisi
text: AIMIM Chief Asaduddin Owaisi has alleged that RSS had termed the tricolour as "inauspicious" when it was declared as India's National flag. "I dare BJP to refute this fact," he added. This comes after AIMIM organised a 'Tiranga rally', about which Owaisi said, "We organised...because those who held tricolour before had it in their hands but Godse on their minds."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 2 Congress leaders join AAP ahead of Delhi Assembly elections
text: Ahead of Delhi Assembly elections, two Congress leader Ram Singh Netaji and Vinay Mishra on Monday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in the presence of Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. Notably, Vinay Mishra is the son of former Congress MP Mahabal Mishra and Ram Singh Netaji is a former MLA. Reportedly, Mishra might contest from Dwarka and Netaji from Badarpur.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 'Three-wheeler' govt functioning properly: Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday said that his 'three-wheeler' government in the state (Shiv Sena-NCP-Congress coalition) is "functioning properly". This comes after former CM Devendra Fadnavis compared the Thackeray-led government with a three-wheeler auto-rickshaw. Thackeray added that "the balance of a vehicle when riding is important as bumps are experienced even in four-wheelers".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Chhapaak’s IMDb rating falls to 4.4/10 with over 4000 one-star ratings
text: Deepika Padukone-starrer Chhapaak's rating on IMDb fell to 4.4/10 after receiving over 4,000 one stars. As of 10.30 pm on Monday, as many as 7,844 IMDb users have rated the movie, with 4,529 (57.7%) giving one star to it. As many as 2,236 users have given 10/10, while 277 gave 9/10 and 262 users gave 2/10.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Scarlett Johansson gets 1st ever Oscar nomination after 26 yrs in Hollywood
text: Scarlett Johansson on Monday received her first-ever Oscar nomination after a 26-year-long Hollywood career, including her early years as a child actress. She bagged nominations in both the Best Actress and Best Supporting Actress categories, a first in thirteen years. In 2007, Cate Blanchett was nominated in both categories for 'Elizabeth: The Golden Age' and 'I'm Not There'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: People raising slogans against PM, Yogi will be buried alive: UP Minister
text: Uttar Pradesh Minister Raghuraj Singh on Sunday said people raising slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath "will be buried alive". "Yogi and PM Modi will run the country and run it like this only," he added. Singh was reportedly referring to slogans raised during the recent anti-CAA protests at Aligarh Muslim University.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 32,000 refugees identified in 21 UP districts under CAA: Minister
text: Uttar Pradesh minister Shrikant Sharma on Monday said that following the notification for the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), more than 32,000 refugees have been identified in 21 districts in the first list. Sharma added that the refugees are from Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. He said that all district magistrates in the state have been asked to collect data for CAA.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Now accepting applications for my team: Ponting on Ponting XI vs Warne XI
text: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with ex-Australian cricketers Shane Warne and Alex Blackwell, who'll be participating in Ponting XI vs Warne XI match for raising funds for bushfire rescue. "I can't wait to play my part in helping raise critical funds. Now accepting applications for my team...fast bowlers get preference," he wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Agüero breaks record for scoring most hat-tricks in Premier League history
text: Manchester City forward Sergio Agüero broke former Newcastle United forward Alan Shearer's record for scoring the most number of hat-tricks in Premier League. Shearer had scored 11 hat-tricks while Agüero struck his 12th Premier League hat-trick as Manchester City routed Aston Villa 6-1. Agüero also overtook Thierry Henry to become the highest-scoring overseas player in Premier League era.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who won what at the BCCI annual awards 2018-2019?
text: Pacer Jasprit Bumrah and spinner Poonam Yadav won the best male international cricketer and best female international cricketer awards respectively. Krishnamachari Srikkanth won the lifetime achievement award among male cricketers while lifetime achievement award for women went to Anjum Chopra. Mayank Agarwal and Shafali Verma won the best international debutant awards in respective categories.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sonia asks all senior Delhi Cong leaders to fight Assembly polls
text: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Monday held a party meeting and asked all the senior leaders of Delhi Congress, including those who had contested the Lok Sabha polls, to contest the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections. Senior Congress leaders from Delhi Ajay Maken, JP Agarwal, Rajesh Lilothia, Naseeb Singh and Arvinder Singh Lovely were present in the meeting.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Not hesitant to admit our growth pace pressure-tested organisation: OYO CEO
text: OYO Founder and CEO Ritesh Agarwal in an e-mail to employees said that he has no hesitation in admitting that at the pace at which OYO grew in the past few years, they sometimes went ahead of themselves and "pressure-tested organisation", YourStory reported. "We're taking steps to address this," Agarwal added. Agarwal wrote this to employees on the recent firings.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Apple employee from Hyd missing after leaving home, untraceable for 15 days
text: Rohitha Kuthuru, a 34-year-old employee of Apple India who lived in a rented apartment in Hyderabad's Gachibowli, went missing after leaving home on December 26. Cyberabad Police began searching her after her brother lodged a missing complaint on December 29. Police probe has found she withdrew ₹80,000 on December 23, but found no evidence of her spending the amount.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Davinder introduced me to one of the Parliament attackers: Afzal in 2004 letter
text: Parliament terror attack convict Afzal Guru, in a letter to his lawyer from Tihar Jail in 2004, had alleged Davinder Singh, DSP who was caught with terrorists recently, introduced him to one of the men who attacked Parliament. Afzal also claimed it was Davinder who asked him to arrange for a car and a place to stay for the attacker.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who is Davinder Singh, the policeman from J&K caught with terrorists?
text: Davinder Singh, who was caught allegedly ferrying terrorists, had joined the J&K Police as a sub-inspector and rose to the rank of Deputy Superintendent of Police. The winner of President’s Gallantry Medal, Singh was posted with anti-hijacking unit at Srinagar Airport. He was among the officials who received the 16-member delegation of foreign ambassadors which visited Kashmir on Thursday.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: K'taka Cong leader detained for protesting BJP MLA's anti-muslim comment
text: Karnataka Congress leader Zameer Ahmed Khan was detained on Monday when he was going to stage a protest against BJP MLA Somashekara Reddy. Reddy was recently booked for his anti-Muslim remarks during his speech at a pro-Citizenship (Amendment) Act rally. Reddy had said, "We are 80%. You are just 17%. If we turn against you, what will be your situation?"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Finance Minister Sitharaman responds to man who called her 'sweetie' on Twitter
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday responded to a man who called her "sweetie" on Twitter while commenting on a Swami Vivekananda quote posted by her. "Awake, arise, and dream no more!" Sitharaman had tweeted, to which he replied, "Sweetie it's 'cease not until your goal is reached'." Sitharaman said the verse she had excerpted was from 'The Awakened India'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: First case of mystery SARS-like virus found outside of China: WHO
text: World Health Organisation (WHO) on Monday confirmed the first case in Thailand of a new virus from the family of the SARS virus. SARS is behind the pneumonia outbreak in China. This is the first case of the virus going international. A woman carrying the mystery virus travelled from China and was identified by officials and quarantined on January 8.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Prince William, Harry issue joint statement, say 'bullying' story is false
text: Prince William and Prince Harry issued a joint statement, saying 'The Times' article claiming Harry and Meghan Markle were pushed out by William's "bullying" attitude is "false". It described the story's "inflammatory language" as "offensive". “For brothers who care so deeply about...issues surrounding mental health, the use of inflammatory language in this way is...potentially harmful," it added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: British makeup artist dies after falling 100ft at Sydney selfie spot
text: A 21-year-old British make-up artist died in Australia after falling from a popular selfie spot which she visited with her friends. Madalyn Davis visited Diamond Bay Cliffs in Sydney on Sunday when she fell from a height of 100 feet. Emergency services were alerted by a group of people who could not find Davis after taking photos at the spot.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Grieving nations may sue Iran for shooting down plane: Report
text: The five nations whose citizens died in the Ukrainian passenger plane shot down by Iranian military will meet in London to discuss legal action against Iran, Ukraine's foreign minister told Reuters. "We have created...group of foreign ministers from...grieving nations," said Vadym Prystaiko. He added that the meeting to discuss ways of prosecuting Iran will take place on January 16.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Register drones, operators by Jan 31 or face action: Aviation Ministry
text: The Aviation Ministry announced that all drones and their operators not complying with civil aviation requirements (CAR) will have to be registered by January 31. India has about 50,000-60,000 illegal drones and noncompliance with the rule will result in action under Indian Penal Code and Aircraft Act. The DGCA issued the CAR for use of drones in India in 2018.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: No second round of firings in India: Walmart India CEO
text: Walmart India's CEO has said it does not plan to carry out a second round of employee layoffs, as speculated by reports, after it fired over 50 senior executives at its corporate office in Gurugram. "A report appearing in the section of the Press speculating second round of layoffs in April is baseless and incorrect," Krish Iyer said.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Chennai-based logistics startup Pando raises $9 million
text: Chennai-based logistics startup Pando has raised $9 million in Series A funding led by Chiratae Ventures alongside existing investor Nexus Venture Partners. The round also saw participation from Siemens-backed Next47. Founded in 2015, the startup helps businesses automate and optimise their supply chain. The startup's clients include Britannia, Marico, Philips, and Tata.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: India to have 100 unicorns by 2025: Sequoia India's Rajan Anandan
text: Talking about India's startup ecosystem, Sequoia India Managing Director Rajan Anandan said India was on track to have 100 unicorns by 2025. India went on to witness over 20 unicorns in comparison to zero five years back, he added. On startups failing, Anandan said India should have a massive number of startups but not all need to become unicorns.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Thai elephants march for awareness on animals killed in Aus fires
text: A troupe of elephants and students held a silent march on Monday to raise awareness about the animals that died in the ongoing Australian bushfires. Placards saying "Pray For Australia" with pictures and cartoons of animals were held up by the elephants. The Australian government has called the bushfire crisis in the country "an ecological disaster".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Former Pope warns against relaxing priestly celibacy rules in new book
text: Former Pope Benedict has spoken against allowing married men to become priests in a new book. The book urges Catholic church not to be swayed by "bad pleas, theatrics, diabolical lies and fashionable errors that want to devalue priestly celibacy". This comes after Pope Francis agreed to consider a request from some bishops to allow married men to become ordained.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: New Boeing CEO takes over amid 737 MAX crisis
text: David Calhoun has assumed the role of Boeing's new CEO after Dennis Muilenburg exit, while the 737 MAX planes crisis continues. Calhoun has previously served as a long-time Boeing director and later the chairman. Boeing spiralled into crisis after two fatal crashes of its 737 MAX planes killing 346 people in five months and was grounded globally in March 2019.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Chanda Kochhar should pay back bonuses: ICICI Bank in petition to Bombay HC
text: ICICI Bank has appealed to Bombay HC that Chanda Kochhar should pay back bonuses given between April 2006 and March 2018. The bank added that Kochhar's petition challenging her sacking is a "mala fide attempt" to secure valuable stock options of the bank. Kochhar had reportedly received ₹343 crore in ESOPs since FY09 and about ₹10 crore as cash bonus.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Who are the Best Actor nominees at Oscars 2020?
text: Actor Leonardo DiCaprio is among the Best Actor nominees for 'Once Upon a Time...in Hollywood' at Oscars 2020. While Joaquin Phoenix has received a nomination for 'Joker', Adam Driver bagged a nomination for the film 'Marriage Story'. The other nominees are Spanish actor Antonio Banderas for his performance in 'Pain and Glory' and Jonathan Pryce for 'The Two Popes'.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Retail inflation surges to 7.35% in December, highest since July 2014
text: Retail inflation in December 2019 rose to 7.35% as against 5.54% in November and 2.19% in December 2018. The December 2019 retail inflation is the highest since the retail inflation of 7.39% in July 2014. December 2019 retail inflation breached the upper end of the Reserve Bank of India's 2-6% target band for the first time since July 2016.n
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 100-year-old tortoise retires after his sex drive helps to save his species
text: A 100-year-old giant tortoise named Diego, who has been credited with helping to save his species from extinction, is set to return to the wild on the Galápagos Islands in Ecuador. Diego was among the male tortoises who were selected to take part in a breeding programme on Santa Cruz Island. Diego alone is believed to have fathered 800 tortoises.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who are the nominees for Best Actress at Oscars 2020?
text: Scarlett Johansson earned her first-ever nomination in the Best Actress category for 'Marriage Story'. Scarlett has also been nominated in the Best Supporting Actress category for 'Jojo Rabbit'. Saoirse Ronan has received her fourth Oscar nomination for her role as 'Jo' in 'Little Women'. The other nominees include Renee Zellweger (Judy), Charlize Theron (Bombshell) and Cynthia Erivo (Harriet).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Oscar nominees for Best Picture out; Joker, Once Upon a Time in Hollywood included
text: Joaquin Phoenix-starrer 'Joker' and Quentin Tarantino directorial 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' have been nominated in the Best Picture category at Oscars 2020. Matt Damon and Christian Bale-starrer 'Ford v Ferrari' has also been nominated. Meanwhile, 'Parasite' became the first South Korean movie to be nominated for Best Picture and Best International Feature Film.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: We're apolitical, can't comment on PM's CAA speech: Ramakrishna Math
text: Ramakrishna Math and Mission on Sunday distanced itself from PM Narendra Modi's remarks on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, saying that it was an apolitical body which does not respond to "ephemeral" calls. PM Modi, during his address at Belur Math, said that the new law would not take away anybody's citizenship, and some youth were being misguided about the CAA.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I am not insecure or possessive about where I bat: Virat Kohli
text: Ahead of the first ODI against Australia, Team India captain Virat Kohli said he is willing to change his batting position to fit in Rohit Sharma, Shikhar Dhawan and KL Rahul in playing XI. "I'd be very happy to do so. Look I am not possessive about where I play. I am not insecure about where I bat," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: OYO to fire over 1,000 people in India, CEO apologises to staff in e-mail: Reports
text: OYO is planning to fire over 1,000 employees in India as part of its restructuring and reorganisation of teams, reports said on Monday. Reports also cited an internal e-mail by OYO Founder & CEO Ritesh Agarwal to employees. Reports quoted him as saying, "I want to thank them (employees) for their efforts and apologise for the impact this is causing."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Inventus Capital sells 1.67% stake in Policybazaar for $25 mn: Report
text: Venture capital firm Inventus Capital has disinvested 1.67% stake in Policybazaar for $25 million through a secondary transaction, Entrackr reported. The stake has likely been purchased by several family offices, PE firms and FIIs and is the second secondary transaction at Policybazaar in the last seven-eight months. Inventus, which had invested $5 million in 2013, retained the remaining stake.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Amazon, Flipkart to be investigated for alleged competition law violations
text: Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Monday ordered an investigation into alleged competition law violations by Amazon and Walmart's Flipkart. The development comes ahead of Amazon's Founder Jeff Bezos' visit to India later this week. The CCI said that exclusive arrangements between mobile phone brands and e-commerce platforms and alleged preference to certain sellers "merits investigation".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Chennai airport urges locals living nearby to not burn items on Bhogi
text: The Chennai International Airport has requested residents living near the airport to not burn objects which create thick smoke on Bhogi, the first day of Tamil Nadu's annual harvest festival Pongal. The announcement said that in 2018 the airport faced extensive cancellations, delays and diversions of flights due to a thick blanket of smoke that reduced visibility around the airport.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Jamia students surround V-C's office, semester exams cancelled
text: Hundreds of Jamia Millia Islamia students protested outside the office of Vice-Chancellor Najma Akhtar on Monday demanding registration of an FIR against Delhi Police in connection with last month's violence on the campus. The Jamia administration cancelled the ongoing semester exams on the demand of the protesting students and said that a new schedule for exams will be announced.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP Kerala Secretary attacked in mosque after attending CAA event
text: BJP Kerala State Secretary AK Nazeer was allegedly attacked inside a mosque in Idukki district on Sunday after he participated in a programme on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. BJP alleged Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) and the pro-CPI(M) Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) were behind the attack. However, police said it was not clear who had attacked Nazeer.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: PM Modi doesn't have guts to stand in front of students: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi today said that PM Narendra Modi doesn't have the guts to stand in front of students. Adding that PM Modi should've the courage to tell youngsters why Indian economy has become a disaster, Rahul said, "I challenge him to go to any university...stand there without police and tell people what he's going to do for India."n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: SUV flips over and falls into lake after driver tries to avoid stray dog, 4 dead
text: Four Bengaluru men drowned to death on Sunday evening after their SUV flipped over and fell into the Bychaguppe lake near Tavarekere. The vehicle landed up in the lake after hitting a stone when the driver was trying to avoid a stray dog which had come near its path. The deceased were aged between 28 and 36.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Australia's largest 'megablaze' brought under control after 3 months
text: Australia's largest 'megablaze' which has been burning for almost three months, was finally brought under control on Monday, firefighters said. New South Wales firefighters said that they have brought the vast Gospers Mountain fire on Sydney's northwestern outskirts under control. There was a small area still to be extinguished, said New South Wales Rural Fire Service commissioner.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Koalas could be declared 'endangered' due to Australian bushfires
text: Australian government on Monday said it could declare koalas 'endangered' after their population took an "extraordinary hit" in bushfires. Environment Minister Sussan Ley said, "It maybe necessary...to see whether in certain parts of the country koalas move from where they are, which is often vulnerable, up to endangered." She announced $35 million package to protect wildlife and restore habitats.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Taiwan separatists will stink for 10,000 years: China
text: Chinese State Councillor Wang Yi said on Monday that Taiwanese separatists will "leave a stink for 10,000 years". This came after Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen returned to office after a landslide election win and sent a message of standing up to China. Yi further said 'one China' principle recognising Taiwan as China's part has long become consensus of international community.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Pak court annuls death sentence handed to Musharraf, calls it unconstitutional
text: The Lahore High Court on Monday annulled former President Pervez Musharraf's death sentence, ruling that the special court which had found him guilty of treason last year was unconstitutional. The special court of Islamabad on December 17 had handed down the death penalty to 76-year-old Musharraf after six years of hearing the high-profile treason case against him.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: US has asked North Korea to resume talks: White House
text: White House National Security Advisor Robert O'Brien said in an interview that US had reached out to North Korea seeking to resume talks. "We've...let [North Koreans] know that we would like to continue the negotiations...last undertaken in...October," said O'Brien. "We've been letting them know, through various channels, that we would like to get those back on track," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Won't rest till there's justice: Trudeau on 57 Canadians killed in Iran crash
text: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Sunday talked about crash of Ukrainian passenger plane in Iran saying, "This tragedy should never have occurred." He added, "We [won't] rest until there are answers. We will not rest until there is justice and accountability." Trudeau further said it was 'gut-wrenching' to hear stories from relatives of 57 Canadians who died in the crash.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I'm aware of what stereotypes say, want to act for as long as I want: Rani
text: Actress Rani Mukerji has said, "I'm aware of loose conversations like...[an actress] can say bye to her career if she becomes a mother. It's regressive thinking." Rani further said she doesn't pay heed to what "stereotypes" say about actresses and believes in letting her "work do the talking". "I love...being an actor...and...want to continue...for as long as I...want," she added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Disha is more than just a pretty face and hot body: Mohit Suri
text: Talking about actress Disha Patani and her role in 'Malang', filmmaker Mohit Suri said, "Disha is...strong and fearless girl...[who] suited this character the best...[S]he comprehended the character's qualities...smoothly." He further said, "The whole world feels that Disha is just a pretty face and hot body." "She has something more in her. She's got head and heart too," Mohit added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Akshay to do a cameo in Aanand L Rai film featuring Sara, Dhanush: Report
text: Actor Akshay Kumar has agreed to do "an extended cameo" in Aanand L Rai-directed untitled film that will reportedly feature actors Dhanush and Sara Ali Khan, a report said. It added that the fact that Akshay won't have to shoot for long hours, as it's only a guest appearance, appealed to him. Akshay likes the film's story, the report stated.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: 'Shopper' app infected 14.2% Indian phones, posted fake app reviews
text: A new Trojan malware application called 'Shopper' infected 14.2% of Indian smartphone users by sending their information to hackers. It showed ads to users when their phones were unlocked and the information was shared with hackers who then sent commands which ultimately boosted app ratings and posted fake reviews. The 'Shopper' app automatically turned off Google Play Protect as well.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Shift to e-vehicles to cost 4 lakh jobs in Germany by 2030: Report
text: A switch to electric vehicles could cost Germany over 4 lakh jobs by 2030, a report citing government advisers said. Around 88,000 jobs would be at risk in engines and transmissions alone. A report by an advisory council for government cited electric cars needing fewer parts and less maintenance than combustion vehicles as a reason for the lay-offs.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Channels charging ₹12 or less to be included in bouquet: TRAI
text: TRAI Chairman RS Sharma announced that bouquet cap has been reduced from ₹19 to ₹12 as part of amendments in the New Tariff Order. The move aims to remove distortions and misuse of ceiling rule as broadcasters priced both HD and SD channels at ₹19. Moreover, consumers will have 200 channels instead of 100 at the same price of ₹130.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Sensex, Nifty close at record highs; Infosys leads gains in IT stocks
text: Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty closed at record highs of 41,859.69 and 12,329.55 respectively on Monday. Among the Sensex 30 stocks, Infosys was the top gainer, rising over 4%. The gain in Infosys stock came after the IT company announced strong third-quarter earnings and found no evidence of financial misconduct by its executives following an investigation into whistleblower complaints.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Krushna & I have no idea about it: Sister-in-law Kashmera on Arti facing rape attempt
text: After Bigg Boss 13 contestant Arti Singh revealed on the show that she faced a rape attempt in her house at the age of 13, her sister-in-law Kashmera Shah said, "I want to kill the person who tried to molest her. I am devastated." "I'm totally blindsided. Krushna [Abhishek] (Arti's brother) and I have no idea about this," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Harbhajan Singh makes Sourav Ganguly dance to 'Senorita' on national TV
text: Cricketer Harbhajan Singh made BCCI President Sourav Ganguly dance to Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara song 'Senorita'  in an episode of the latter's show 'Dadagiri Unlimited'. Singer Usha Uthup, who was also a part of the episode, sang the song. The episode also featured Virender Sehwag, VVS Laxman, Mohammad Kaif, Zaheer Khan and Ravichandran Ashwin.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Tried making those, kept burning my b*lls: Dwayne on 'Smells Like Vagina' candles
text: After actress Gwyneth Paltrow's company sold a candle named 'This Smells Like My Vagina', comedian Adam Ray joked on Instagram, "Time to get Dwayne Johnson to sell candles that smell like his b*lls." Dwayne jokingly replied, "Brother I tried to make those candles. But I kept burning my b*lls." The candle has been listed as 'sold-out' on Paltrow's company's website.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: BCCI shares Team India's group picture, fans ask 'Where is Virat Kohli?'
text: The BCCI took to Twitter to share a group picture of Team India from the annual award ceremony with the caption, "Team India all smiles at Naman." However, Team India captain Virat Kohli was missing from the picture. "Where is our champ," a user commented, while another wrote, "Is Kohli clicking the picture?" "Everyone is searching Kohli, right??" another tweeted.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Elon Musk says Tesla cars will soon talk to people, shares video
text: Electric carmaker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk has said that the company's cars will soon talk to people if the owners want. He also shared a video on Twitter where a Tesla car can be seen talking to pedestrians. The video showed Tesla's Model 3 car driving past people, saying, "Well, don't just stand there. Hop in!"
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Book comparing PM Modi with Shivaji insulting, ban it: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Monday criticised the book comparing PM Narendra Modi with Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and demanded that it should be banned. "A BJP leader has written the book titled 'Aaj Ke Shivaji: Narendra Modi', which we find insulting," Raut said. Raut added that it seems like some "bootlickers" have published the book to appease the PM.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Kashmir figured during talks between PM Modi and Prez Macron: France
text: France on Monday said the government was following the situation in Kashmir after the issue was discussed during a telephonic conversation between PM Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron last week. A statement issued by France said the two leaders discussed the situation in the region of Kashmir in the "spirit of trust and frankness" that characterises bilateral ties.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Nationwide NRC needless, has no justification: Nitish Kumar
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has said that nationwide implementation of National Register of Citizens (NRC) was needless and had no justification. He made the remarks in the state Assembly and said the NRC was an exercise confined to Assam as part of the accord signed by the Rajiv Gandhi government. "PM Narendra Modi has also clarified on it," Kumar added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Uttarakhand govt mulls pension up to ₹10,000 for acid attack victims
text: Uttarakhand Minister for Women's Welfare and Child Development Rekha Arya on Monday said that the government has a proposal to provide a pension between ₹7,000 and ₹10,000 every month to acid attack victims. Arya said that it will help them to be independent and financially strong. She added, "With this initiative, I believe that their life will be better."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bihar Police candidate caught cheating in exam after earphones get stuck in ears
text: A candidate was caught cheating during Bihar Police examination in Muzaffarpur after the earphones he was using to cheat in the examination got stuck in his ears. The candidate had taped the earphones' wires to his vest. The candidate was in "terrible pain" as the earphones got stuck in his ears and he was sent to the hospital, officials said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Iranian protesters reportedly face gunfire in Tehran, govt denies
text: People in Iran's Tehran protesting against shooting down of Ukrainian plane by the military, were reportedly fired upon by the police. Videos posted on social media on Sunday recorded gunshots at the protest site and also showed blood on the ground and wounded people. Iranian police, however, on Monday denied the allegations that their officers fired on demonstrators.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Teacher in S Korea shows kids 'How does human flesh taste' video, booked
text: An English teacher from Canada is facing child abuse charges in South Korea for showing a group of kids a BBC documentary titled "What does human flesh taste like?" Footage from cameras in the classroom reportedly showed shocked children as young as six years old, burying their heads in their arms while watching the programme.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Put my arm around Harry all our lives, can't do it any more: Prince William
text: After Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle announced their decision to step back from royal duties, Prince William said, “I’ve put my arm around my brother all our lives and I can’t do that any more; we’re separate entities." He added, “I’m sad about that. All we can do, and all I can do, is try and support them."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: SRK did 'Karan Arjun' after learning Aamir, Salman showed interest: Rakesh
text: Producer-director Rakesh Roshan has revealed that Shah Rukh Khan had "backed out" of 1995 film 'Karan Arjun' as he wanted to essay Karan's role instead of Arjun's. "Shah Rukh found out...Salman (Khan) and Aamir (Khan) have shown interest. This is when he came back," Roshan said. "He said sorry and insisted that he wants to do the film," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Mrunal Thakur in talks to feature in 'Bell Bottom' opposite Akshay: Report
text: Actress Mrunal Thakur is in advanced talks to play the female lead opposite Akshay Kumar in Ranjit Tiwari-directed film 'Bell Bottom', a report said. "If...Mrunal signs 'Bell Bottom', she will play Akshay's romantic interest...whom his character meets in the course of his life as a cop," the report added. The film is written by Ranjit, Aseem Arora and Prashant Singh.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: My self-belief has grown: Vikas on Last Color making it to Oscar list
text: Vikas Khanna has said his "self-belief has grown manifold" after his directorial film 'The Last Color' made it to the list of feature films that are eligible for Oscars 2020. Khanna said he made the film by his own expense, adding, "I...picked up...camera and started filming." 'The Last Color' is one of the 344 films running for Best Picture nomination.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I listen to everyone but do what I want: Arjun on pressure to settle down
text: Arjun Kapoor said in an interview that his family doesn't pressurise him to settle down. "The thing is, a lot of my family members realise that main sunta sabki hoon, karta apni hoon (I listen to everyone but do what I want)," he added. "They've implicit faith that if I'm making a choice or...decision, it comes from...practical side," said Arjun.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Late TV actress Jade's son makes runway debut at Milan Fashion Week
text: Late TV actress Jade Goody's 16-year-old son, Bobby Brazier, made his runway debut at Milan Fashion Week on Saturday. Brazier walked the runway for an Italian fashion house, Dolce & Gabbana, in an oversized blazer, matching trousers and a white shirt, which featured the brand's logo on its collar. He paired his outfit with black boots and a chain.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Hrithik approached to play RAW founder RN Kao in Karan's film: Reports
text: Hrithik Roshan has been reportedly approached to portray the founder of India's Research and Analysis Wing (RAW), RN Kao, in a film. The actor has shown interest in the film, reports added. The film, which is an adaptation of Nitin Gokhale's book 'R.N. Kao: Gentleman Spymaster', will be jointly produced by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions and Still and Still Media.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: It's good to see filmmakers invest in stories on sports: Richa
text: Talking about upcoming film 'Panga' where she plays a sportswoman, Richa Chadha said, "I'm glad...films are being made on sporting icons." "[H]owever, 'Panga' is a fictional story...it's good to see filmmakers investing in stories on sports that aren't considered glamorous," she added. Richa also said that she sees how "critical" her role is to a story before picking a project.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Govt questions Twitter, Google over efforts to control porn on platforms
text: A Parliamentary panel met representatives of Twitter and Google regarding its lack of effort to control pornographic and child abuse content on its platforms. Last week, Twitter informed that its policies allow users to post consensually filmed porn and not revenge porn or child abuse content. Meanwhile, Google replied that adult content is blocked for users below 18 years.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: 19th-century temple in UP creates illusion of frog carrying temple on its back
text: The Frog Temple, located in Oel town of Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri, was built in the 19th century on the back of a large frog sculpture and is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Its architecture is based on 'Tantra Vidhya'. Locals believe the temple was built in the honour of a divine frog which once blessed a king named Bakhat Singh.
author: Dharna

headlines: Shuttl valued at ₹1,500 crore after raising ₹57 crore funding
text: Gurugram-based bus service startup Shuttl has raised ₹57 crore from SIG Global at a valuation of about ₹1,500 crore as part of its ongoing Series C funding round. The startup had recently raised over ₹127 crore from SPARX Group and Toyota Tsusho Corporation at ₹1,328 crore valuation. The Amazon-backed startup was founded by Amit Singh and Deepanshu Malviya.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Elon Musk-led SpaceX blows up Starship tank on purpose
text: SpaceX engineers have intentionally blown up a miniature Starship tank in order to test manufacturing and assembly methods that were upgraded recently. CEO Elon Musk, on Twitter, shared the overpressurisation test's results, indicating that it was a success. SpaceX requires Starship rockets to survive a minimum of 140% of the operating pressure to allow its use for future crewed flights.
author: Dharna

headlines: Infosys right to conceal whistleblower complaints: Chairman Nilekani
text: Infosys was right to conceal the whistleblowers' complaints from regulators and media, said Chairman Nandan Nilekani. He added, "It's not the job of companies to take a whistleblower's complaint coming every morning and issue...media release on it...That's going to create a new set of issues." Infosys had in October disclosed the whistleblower complaints made against its executives a month prior.
author: Dharna

headlines: BSE, NSE to suspend trading in Coffee Day Enterprises, CG Power from Feb 3
text: BSE and NSE will stop stock trading in Coffee Day Enterprises and CG Power from February 3 for not submitting financial results for June 2019 and September 2019 quarters. The exchanges further said that the fine imposed on the companies for noncompliance was unpaid. However, trading won't be suspended if they comply with the provisions on or before January 29.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Noida, Lucknow to now have Commissioner of Police: UP CM Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday announced that his government has approved the proposal to set up police commissioner system in Lucknow and Noida. Following the decision, Sujeet Pandey was appointed as Lucknow Police Commissioner and Alok Singh as commissioner of Noida. Two women officers of SP and ASP rank each will also be deployed in Lucknow and Noida.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 'Missing' posters of Sunny Deol surface in Punjab; actor calls it nonsensical
text: Posters with "Gumshuda ki Talash" message for actor-politician Sunny Deol have surfaced near railway station in Pathankot. "I have heard that my detractors are coming up with nonsensical things against me," the actor said in response to the posters. Earlier, Deol was criticised for nominating his personal assistant in his parliamentary constituency to "follow important matters" on his behalf.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Gwyneth's company sells candle called 'This Smells Like My Vagina'; item sold out
text: Hollywood actress Gwyneth Paltrow's company Goop is selling a scented candle named 'This Smells Like My Vagina'. The item started as a joke between perfumer Douglas Little and Paltrow when they were testing scents and Paltrow said, "Uhhh..this smells like a vagina." "We did a test run...and it sold out within hours," the website said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Star Wars actor Mark deletes Facebook account; criticises Zuckerberg
text: Actor Mark Hamill, known for playing 'Luke Skywalker' in 'Star Wars' films, tweeted on Monday that he has deleted his Facebook account. He added he took this decision as he's "disappointed" that Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg "values profit more than truthfulness". Many celebrities deleted their Facebook accounts to protest Zuckerberg's decision to allow political advertisements on the platform.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Anushka shoots at Eden Gardens with cricketer Jhulan, pics surface
text: Anushka Sharma, who'll reportedly portray former India women cricket captain Jhulan Goswami in her biopic, has started shooting for the film's teaser at Kolkata's Eden Gardens, as per reports. Pictures of the actress dressed in a cricket jersey and walking alongside Jhulan have surfaced online. Anushka was also joined by 10 real-life women cricketers for the shoot, reports added.n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Bhim Army chief files bail plea in anti-CAA protest violence case
text: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad on Monday filed a bail plea in a Delhi court in connection with the violence during anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protest in Daryaganj area. Azad said that there was no evidence against him in the FIR which states that he had instigated the crowd to march to Delhi Gate from Jama Masjid and indulge in violence.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Our govt in UP, Assam shot those damaging property like dogs: WB BJP Prez
text: West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh on Sunday said that the people who are damaging public property in the state should be shot down the same way Uttar Pradesh, Assam and Karnataka government did. "Our government in UP, Assam and Karnataka shot these people like dogs," he said. Ghosh also called for identifying those "sabotaging the interests" of Hindu Bengalis.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Hardik can pass Yo-Yo in sleep, just wants more time to return: BCCI official
text: After all-rounder Hardik Pandya was withdrawn from India A squad, a BCCI official said, "Yo-Yo Test and all he can clear in his sleep. He doesn't wish to take any half measures." This comes after reports said Hardik failed mandatory fitness tests ahead of India A's tour to New Zealand. Hardik had undergone back surgery in October last year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Amazon package had used diapers with poop in it, claims US woman
text: A US woman claims she received used diapers covered in what appeared to be faecal matter in her Amazon package last week. She said she ordered two boxes of diapers from Amazon's Warehouse section where open-box and returned items are sold at a discounted rate after inspection. The woman took extra measures to clean her 19-month-old daughter after the incident.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No changes in zero MDR policy, no refunds for fintech companies: FM
text: The government will not change its policy revoking Merchant Discount Rates (MDR) on payments via UPI and RuPay, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told digital payment companies. Neither would fintech companies and banks be compensated for lost charges, Sitharaman said, adding the amount saved by banks in handling less cash would be used to partner with fintech companies to acquire merchants.
author: Dharna

headlines: Chicken bone gets stuck in boy's throat for 2 days, hole formed in food pipe
text: A hole was formed in the food pipe of a 10-year-old boy in Hyderabad after a chicken bone got stuck in his throat. The boy was taken to the hospital two days later. The doctors conducted an endoscopic clipping after removing the bone from the esophagus. The functionality of the boy's food pipe was fully restored with stenting, doctors said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Wadia withdraws all defamation cases, ₹3,000cr suit for damages against Tata
text: Bombay Dyeing Chairman Nusli Wadia withdrew all defamation cases including the ₹3,000-crore lawsuit for damages against Tata Group's Ratan Tata and others. A bench headed by CJI SA Bobde allowed Wadia to withdraw the petition after Supreme Court recorded Tata and others had no intention to defame Wadia. The SC had earlier asked Wadia and Tata to resolve their differences.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Man sues Tesco for ₹64L, says guard's mistreatment dislodged kidney stones
text: A 63-year-old London-based Indian-origin lawyer has sued UK's supermarket chain Tesco over his alleged mistreatment which, he claimed, dislodged his kidney stones. Lalu Hanuman, who's seeking over ₹64 lakh in damages, claimed he was accused of stealing a chocolate bar he paid for and was pushed by store's security guard. Tesco admitted that the chocolate had already been paid for.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Putting on so many kilos is a challenge: Kriti on gaining weight for 'Mimi'
text: Actress Kriti Sanon, who has to gain about 15 kg for Laxman Utekar-directed film 'Mimi', said, "For me, putting on so many kilos is...a challenge as it's...new for my body." "But I'm excited to see the transformation," she added. Talking about her role in 'Mimi', Kriti said, "It's a role...close to my heart...I want to give it everything I can."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: RLD Vice President organises special screening of Chhapaak in Meerut
text: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) Vice President Jayant Chaudhary on Sunday organised a special screening of Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Chhapaak' for his family and supporters in Meerut. This comes amid boycott calls against the film after Deepika visited the Jawaharlal Nehru University. Earlier, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav organised a special screening of the film for its supporters in Lucknow.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Dharma Productions announces new film 'Mr Lele' featuring Varun
text: Dharma Productions has announced a new film project titled 'Mr Lele', which will feature Varun Dhawan. Shashank Khaitan, who's also the writer of the film, will direct it and produce it along with Karan Johar, Hiroo Yash Johar and Apoorva Mehta. 'Mr Lele' will be Varun and Shashank's third film together after 'Badrinath Ki Dulhania' and 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania'.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Kriti didn't walk out of 'Malang', dates didn't work out: Mohit Suri
text: Filmmaker Mohit Suri has said that Kriti Sanon, who was offered Disha Patani's role in 'Malang', did not walk out of the project. "Kriti...wanted to do 'Malang'...She would have had to waste six months to be...part of my film, as I was figuring out...dates," Mohit said. "[So] she had to let go...and choose ['Housefull 4' and 'Panipat'] instead," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: My daughters & I have conversation about having right to say 'no': Nicole
text: Actress Nicole Kidman, while talking about sexual harassment, said that she and her daughters have conversations about the "right to say no to many different things". She further said her recent film, 'Bombshell', "aims to educate and encourage" people to talk about sexual harassment. "A lot of it is making it safer for people so...we've a safer world," said Nicole.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Hrithik and Ranbir or Ranveer can pull off 'Karan Arjun' roles: Rakesh Roshan
text: Producer-director Rakesh Roshan, when asked which actors he would like to see playing the roles of Karan and Arjun in the remake of his 1995 film 'Karan Arjun', said, "[A]ll actors today are good enough to play these roles." "Hrithik (Roshan)...and...Ranbir Kapoor...can do a tremendous job," he added. "Or even Hrithik and Ranveer Singh can pull it off," Roshan said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: A monkey attacked and injured me during filming of Frida: Salma Hayek
text: Actress Salma Hayek has revealed that a monkey named Tyson, with whom she worked in her 2002 film 'Frida', attacked and "severely injured" her during the shooting of the film. "But I was brave enough to let him come back and work again in the movie," she added. Salma later did a photoshoot with the monkey for fashion magazine Vogue.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Didn't get roles in England due to my skin colour: 'Black Panther' actor Daniel
text: British actor Daniel Kaluuya has revealed that he moved from England to the US as he was repeatedly turned down for roles in England "because of the colour of his skin". "It happened a few times, and I went, 'Nah. I'm not an idiot'," Daniel said. "It wasn't fair. It was a trap," the 'Black Panther' actor added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Smart tools let carpenters measure, cut materials with precision
text: Canada-based startup ShapeMeasure's automated measuring and cutting device allows carpenters to measure their work area like stairs by scanning. The measurement tool then sends the data to an automatic cutting tool that cuts the material with precise measurements. After that, the installer simply has to put the material in place using glue or nails.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: HC notice to WhatsApp, Google on plea seeking to preserve JNU violence data
text: The Delhi High Court has issued notices to Apple, WhatsApp and Google, seeking their response to a plea moved by three JNU professors to preserve evidence like CCTV footage and WhatsApp conversations related to the campus violence. The petitioners also sought collection of data like texts, videos and members' numbers from WhatsApp groups 'Unity Against Left' and 'Friends of RSS'.n
author: Dharna

headlines: Tesla challenges hackers to find bug in car; sets ₹7 crore, Model 3 as reward
text: Electric automaker Tesla will participate in the 'Pwn2Own' hacking competition, challenging hackers to find and exploit bugs in the systems on its Model 3 vehicle. Nearly ₹7 crore and Model 3 cars will be set aside as rewards for the winners. Last year at Pwn2Own, a duo won ₹2.6 crore and Model 3 for hacking into the car's infotainment system.
author: Dharna

headlines: Rename Victoria Memorial to Rani Jhansi Smarak Mahal: Swamy to PM Modi
text: After the Kolkata Port Trust was renamed by PM Narendra Modi, BJP leader Subramanian Swamy has asked the PM to rename Victoria Memorial in Kolkata to Rani Jhansi Smarak Mahal. "Queen Victoria took over India after betraying Rani Jhansi in 1857 and looted India for 90 years," Swamy tweeted. PM Modi renamed Kolkata Port Trust to Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: SC grants 3 weeks to lawyers to frame issues on Sabarimala
text: The Supreme Court on Monday gave three weeks to all the lawyers for framing the issues related to women's entry into Sabarimala temple and all other religious matters. The lawyers will meet on January 17 after the court's order to discuss the framing of issues. The order was given by the nine-judge Constitution bench led by CJI SA Bobde.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Great Learning’s PGP-DSBA is India’s #1 Program: AIM
text: For the 5th consecutive year, Great Learning's PG Program in Data Science & Business Analytics has been ranked as India's #1 program by AIM. Offered in classroom and online modes, with The University of Texas at Austin, it has enabled 4,000+ professionals to upskill in this field with 200+ hiring partners. Alumni have achieved an average salary hike of 48%.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: England once played Test matches in 2 continents on same day
text: England is the only country to appear in two Test matches in two countries of two different continents on the same day. England beat New Zealand in Christchurch on January 13, 1930, the same day another England team was playing a Test against West Indies in Barbados. England had sent different teams to Caribbean and New Zealand to promote cricket.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I'm Indian, that's my faith: Chef Vikas to trolls over Asim feeding him in Bigg Boss
text: Chef Vikas Khanna on Sunday said that he received several "hate messages" after he shared a picture of Bigg Boss 13 contestant Asim Riaz feeding him in the Bigg Boss house. Adding that people "questioned his faith", Vikas wrote, "I'm an Indian and that's my faith." "Humanity and Humility Shine even when they are silent and small," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Director called me to read script, started moving hand over my head & back: Actress
text: Bengali actress Rupanjana Mitra has accused filmmaker Arindam Sil of sexual misconduct during a meeting to read a script. "Surprisingly there was nobody in his office...at 5 pm...Suddenly he got up from his seat and started moving his hand over my head and back," she alleged. "I don't know why she's saying all this. We're old friends," Arindam stated.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Jasprit Bumrah shares his pic with BCCI trophies, Yuvraj Singh trolls him
text: Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with trophies he won at the BCCI annual awards on Sunday. "Grateful and honoured to be taking these two awards home tonight," Bumrah captioned the picture. Commenting on the picture, former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh wrote, "Jassi has de thoda no ones taking your trophies away!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sehwag says 5-day Test cricket is romance, compares it to baby diapers
text: While delivering the Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi lecture at BCCI awards on Sunday, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag opposed four-day Test cricket, saying, "I've always supported change but five-day cricket is romance." "Innovations like names in jerseys and pink-ball Tests are fine. But diapers and five-day Tests should only be changed when they cannot be used anymore," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India's squad for 5 T20Is vs NZ out, Samson dropped after playing 1 match
text: The BCCI on Sunday announced India's squad for the upcoming five-match T20I series against New Zealand. Sanju Samson, who played one match in the recently concluded series against Sri Lanka, has been dropped. Meanwhile, Rohit Sharma and Mohammad Shami have returned to the 16-member T20I squad. The series will begin on January 24.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Jasprit Bumrah named BCCI's best male international cricketer, receives ₹15 lakh
text: Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah received the Polly Umrigar award at the BCCI's annual award function on Sunday for being the best male international cricketer for India in 2018-19. He was presented with a trophy, a citation and a cash prize of ₹15 lakh. The 26-year-old also won the Dilip Sardesai award for taking most wickets in Test cricket in 2018-19.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pichai asked to act against 'bloatware' on Android devices by 50 privacy groups
text: Over 50 privacy groups have asked Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai to act against pre-installed apps that cannot be deleted (also called 'bloatware') from Android devices. They argued these apps pose a security risk to customers. Devices by Android Partners carry 'Google Play Protect' branding, but research shows 91% of pre-installed apps don't appear in Google Play, organisations said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Watching or touching cows drives away negativity: Maharashtra Minister
text: Addressing a gathering, Maharashtra Minister Yashomati Thakur said that touching or watching a cow "drives away the negativity". This comes days after Thakur said she has taken oath as the Minister and is yet to fill her pockets. "Be it a cow or any other animal, touching them brings a feeling of love...What's wrong in what I said?" Thakur asked.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Walmart fires over 100 senior executives at Gurugram HQ: Report
text: Walmart announced it is firing over 100 senior employees including VPs at its Gurugram headquarters across verticals like sourcing, agri-business and fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), the Economic Times reported. To cut costs, the world's largest retailer will also shut its Mumbai fulfilment centre, its largest warehouse in India. The Flipkart owner would also pause new-store expansion in India.
author: Dharna

headlines: Tihar jail uses sandbags in trials ahead of hanging Nirbhaya gangrape convicts
text: Delhi's Tihar jail officials on Sunday held mock hanging sessions using sandbags, ahead of the hanging of the four convicts in Nirbhaya gangrape case. Prison administration had noted the convicts' weights and prepared the sandbags based on their weights. This will reportedly be the first time in the jail's history when four convicts will be hanged at the same time.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: J&K DSP caught with two terrorists to be treated as terrorist: Police
text: Jammu and Kashmir Police have said that DSP Davinder Singh, who was caught along with two terrorists while travelling in his car, is being treated like a terrorist. "Singh has worked on several anti-militancy operations. But the circumstances under which he was arrested...is a heinous crime," police added. Singh was awarded the President's Police Medal for Gallantry last year.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Police identify masked woman in armed group at JNU as DU student
text: The Delhi Police on Sunday identified the woman, who was seen with two masked men allegedly involved in January 5 violence in JNU, as a student of a Delhi University college. Special Investigation Team (SIT) officials said she will be asked to join the probe and identify the two masked men. The officials didn't comment on the woman's political affiliation.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Army Havildar slips in snow in J&K while on duty, falls in Pakistan
text: Indian Army Havildar Rajendra Singh Negi allegedly slipped in the snow at Gulmarg, Jammu and Kashmir, while he was on duty and fell in Pakistan. Negi's family has urged the government for his safe and early return from Pakistan to his homeland. According to reports, the search and rescue operation of Negi is underway.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 185 mobile phones stolen from police station's storeroom in Maharashtra
text: As many as 185 mobile phone handsets kept in a storeroom at the Jaysingpur police station in Maharashtra's Kolhapur district were stolen on Thursday night, police said on Sunday. The stolen mobile phones were seized by the police in various cases of theft and kept in the special room. Unidentified persons broke into the room and escaped with the mobiles.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Driverless train with 350 km/h speed launched in China, covers 174 km in 47 min
text: A driverless bullet train capable of reaching a top speed of up to 350 km/h has been launched in China. The train, which connects the Chinese cities of Beijing and Zhangjiakou, is capable of completing the 108-mile (nearly 174 km) journey in 47 minutes from the earlier three hours. The train also features 5G connectivity and smart lighting.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pic shows animal eating food dropped by helicopters amid Australian bushfires
text: Australian politician Matt Kean on Sunday took to Twitter to share a picture of rock-wallaby eating carrots dropped by helicopters under 'Operation Rock Wallaby' launched by NSW National Parks and Wildlife Service amid Australian bushfires. The operation aims to save the endangered brush-tailed animal in Australia. Over 2,200kg of fresh vegetables have been airdropped for the animals in a week.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Helicopter spots SOS message in snow, rescues man stuck for 23 days in Alaska
text: Alaska State Troopers have rescued a 30-year-old man named Tyson Steele who was stranded for 23 days in subzero temperatures after his cabin was destroyed in an accidental fire. Tyson, who built a snow cave and survived on canned food, was rescued after State Troopers helicopter spotted 'SOS' in large letters in the snow.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Sensex hits record high at 41,893; Nifty also at all-time high in early trade
text: Indian equity indices hit record highs on Monday in early trade, with Sensex rising by more than 250 points to reach 41,893 and Nifty 50 surging 0.5% to 12,337. The gains were led by banking, IT, metal and pharmaceutical shares. Among the top gainers on BSE were Infosys, Sun Pharma, Larsen & Toubro, HCL Technologies and Tata Steel.
author: Dharna

headlines: Wanted to highlight change a girl can bring about: Amjad on 'Gul Makai'
text: Talking about 'Gul Makai', based on Pakistani activist Malala Yousafzai, director Amjad Khan said, "I wanted to highlight revolutionary change and...impact a girl can bring about." He added that the film's release was delayed as "India-Pakistan relations got worse" whenever he thought of releasing it. "Eventually, I realised things [won't] change...so there was no point delaying," Amjad said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Didn't know what sexual harassment was before my film Bombshell: Margot
text: Actress Margot Robbie, while talking about her film 'Bombshell', said she didn't know what sexual harassment was until she read the script of the film. "One of the lines that shocked me...was...sexual harassment includes any unwelcome sexual advances," she added. 'Bombshell' narrates the story of women who brought down Fox News CEO Roger Ailes, who was accused of sexual harassment.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Were careful that we don't cross line of vulgarity: Good Newwz director
text: Raj Mehta, the director of Akshay Kumar and Kareena Kapoor-starrer 'Good Newwz', has said they were "very careful" from the scripting stage that the film doesn't cross the line of vulgarity. He further said the film's co-writer, Jyoti Kapoor, also went through the IVF process. "The sensitivity of...subject also came from [her] who has experienced it in real," Raj added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Joaquin Phoenix wins Best Actor for 'Joker' at Critics' Choice Awards
text: Joaquin Phoenix won Best Actor for his role in 'Joker' at the 25th Critics' Choice Awards on Monday. The award for Best Actress went to Renée Zellweger for 'Judy', while Laura Dern won Best Supporting Actress for 'Marriage Story'. Brad Pitt bagged the Best Supporting Actor for 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood', which also won the Best Picture award.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Stones hurled during pro-CAA rally in Jharkhand, police fire tear gas
text: The police in Jharkhand's Giridih on Sunday resorted to lathi-charge and firing of tear gas after stones were pelted during a rally in favour of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. The rally was organised by BJP. "Some anti-social elements pelted stones on a procession of BJP. Few policemen and some of those participating in the rally suffered minor injuries," police said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Google Pay Co-founders' startup EpiFi raises ₹93 crore seed funding
text: EpiFi, a fintech startup co-founded by former Google Pay executives and Co-founders Sujith Narayanan and Sumit Gwalani, has raised over ₹93 crore ($13.2 million) in a seed funding round.
