The round, led by venture capital firms Sequoia Capital and Ribbit Capital, valued the Bengaluru-based startup at $50 million. Founded in 2019, EpiFi is building a neo-banking platform focused on millennials.
author: Dharna

headlines: Siemens to not quit Adani mine contract, says no evidence links it to wildfires
text: German engineering group Siemens said it will not back out of its contract to supply rail infrastructure to Adani Group's Australian coal mine project. CEO Joe Kaeser said that even though they had no clear evidence that Australian wildfires and the project were directly connected, he had empathy for environmental concerns. Earlier, environmentalists called for Siemens to cancel the contract.
author: Dharna

headlines: Pai calls Deepika's JNU visit 'ill-advised', Shaw says 'respect individual rights'
text: Infosys' former board member Mohandas Pai on Sunday called Deepika Padukone's visit to JNU "ill-advised", alleging that she was "used by Lutyens Delhi and Khan Market Gang to further their fake narratives". In response, Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar Shaw tweeted that it was Deepika's own decision. She added that an individual's right to do what they want should be respected.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I congratulate Deepika for standing with truth: Jyotiraditya Scindia
text: Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that he congratulates actress Deepika Padukone for standing with the truth. Scindia said, "She has set an example of bravery by exercising her right of expression. Comments against her are not in lines with our country's ethos and should be condemned." Padukone had visited JNU after its students were attacked by a masked mob.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Tharoor protests against CAA in JNU, Jamia and Shaheen Bagh in a day
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday joined the protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens in Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University, Jamia Millia Islamia University and Shaheen Bagh. "It was fabulous to see the courage, passion & determination of the women of Shaheen Bagh. Including the nonagenarian 'dadis' who have held fast since the start," Tharoor tweeted.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Human Rights Commission's team to visit Jamia campus on Jan 14: V-C
text: Jamia Millia Islamia Vice-Chancellor Najma Akhtar has said that a team of National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) will visit the campus on January 14. The NHRC team would record statements of the injured students and witnesses in connection with the December 15 incident of alleged police excesses. Delhi Police had entered inside the campus amid anti-CAA protests on December 15.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Prashant Kishor thanks Congress leadership for protesting CAA, NRC
text: JD(U) leader Prashant Kishor has praised the Congress for protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and the National Register of Citizens. "I join my voice with all to thank Congress leadership for their formal and unequivocal rejection of CAA and NRC," Kishor tweeted. "Both Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi deserve special thanks for their efforts on this count," he added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sibal, stop as much as you can, Ram Temple will be built in 4 months: Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah, during a rally in Jabalpur on Sunday, said that Congress' advocate-turned-politician Kapil Sibal has said that Ram Temple shouldn't be built. "Listen clearly Sibal bhai, put as much strength and power as you can to stop the construction of the temple, but the grand sky-high Ram Temple will be built within four months," Shah added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Shehla Rashid criticises Tharoor for his 'Islamist extremism' remark
text: Activist Shehla Rashid has criticised Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, saying he would have asked Mahatma Gandhi to wear a British suit and Martin Luther King to wear light-coloured foundation before fighting for constitutional rights. Tharoor had said, "Our fight against Hindutva extremism should give no comfort to Islamist extremism either", on chanting of 'La ilaha illallah' in anti-CAA protests.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India Women's squad for T20 World Cup announced, Harmanpreet captain
text: The BCCI on Sunday announced India Women's 15-member squad for the 2020 Women's T20 World Cup, which will take place in Australia from February 21 to March 8. All-rounder Harmanpreet Kaur has been named the captain, while opener Smriti Mandhana has been named vice-captain. The team also includes 15-year-old batsman Shafali Verma.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Marcus Stoinis smashes highest ever score in history of Big Bash League
text: Melbourne Stars all-rounder Marcus Stoinis smashed an unbeaten 147 off 79 deliveries against Sydney Sixers to register the highest ever individual score in Big Bash League history. The 30-year-old broke the record of Hobart Hurricanes opener D'Arcy Short, who had made an unbeaten 122 off 69 deliveries two years ago. Stoinis slammed eight sixes and 13 fours in his knock.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Australia head coach camped out at Wankhede last night to observe dew
text: Australia pacer Kane Richardson revealed his team's stand-in head coach Andrew McDonald camped out at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium last night to observe dew. "[He wanted to] see what time the dew came in...Who knows, everyone is guessing. I think everyone is prepared," Richardson added. He further said that Australians would practise with wet balls to prepare for the first ODI.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: It started out as a WhatsApp group: Fitness startup Squats' Co-Founder
text: Pune-based fitness startup Squats' Co-Founder Jitendra Chouksey in an interview to YourStory said that the startup started as a WhatsApp group where he helped his friends and family members get fit. After creating a Facebook Group to extend his reach, Chouksey launched the online coaching platform in January 2016. The startup was backed by actor Suniel Shetty last year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt to remove NSG from VIP security duties after over 20 yrs: Reports
text: The Centre has decided to remove NSG commandos from VIP protection duties, reports said. This will be after over 20 years that the 'black cat' commandos of the elite counter-terror force will be taken out of security duties, a task not originally charted for it. The force provides security cover to 13 high-risk VIPs including Rajnath Singh and Yogi Adityanath.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP seeks ₹500 cr from AAP over video of Tiwari dancing to 'Lage Raho Kejriwal'
text: Delhi BJP today complained to the Election Commission and sent a defamation notice to AAP seeking ₹500 crore in damages after it tweeted a video showing Manoj Tiwari dancing to 'Lage Raho Kejriwal'. The video appears to be an edited version of Tiwari's Bhojpuri albums with AAP's poll soundtrack. "Who gave AAP the right to use my videos?" Tiwari asked.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: JNU just one college, there's a limit to how much attention it gets: Chetan
text: Author Chetan Bhagat on Sunday commented on JNU and tweeted, "JNU is just one college. There are nearly 40,000 colleges in India." He added, "I understand it's important. But there is a limit to how much importance and attention one college gets." "There are more important issues in a country of 1.2 billion people I'm sure," he further said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Philippine volcano throws up ash 15 km in sky, thousands evacuate
text: Taal volcano near the Philippine capital of Manila threw up ash upto 15 kms into the sky on Sunday, prompting evacuation of thousands of people. International and domestic flights were also cancelled amid warnings of possible explosive eruption and volcanic tsunami. Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology indicated that an explosive eruption is possible "within hours to days."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 8 rockets hit base housing US troops in Iraq, 4 Iraqi soldiers injured
text: At least four Iraqi soldiers have been injured in mortar shelling targeting Al-Balad airbase housing American troops. At least eight ‘Katyusha’ rockets hit the base located around 80 km north of Baghdad, Iraqi Prime Minister's office has confirmed. There have been no reports of any casualties among the US military personnel.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pics of firefighters battling bushfires projected onto Sydney Opera House
text: Images of firefighters battling Australian bushfires were projected onto the Sydney Opera House on Saturday. The projections were made as a tribute to the firefighters and the communities affected by the ongoing bushfire crisis which has claimed the lives of 28 people. One image showed a woman hugging a firefighter, while another showed a sign saying, 'Thank You Firies'.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 17 killed in a single day due to severe cold wave in Afghanistan
text: At least 17 people were killed in Afghanistan on Saturday as heavy snowfall and rain affected large parts of the country. Officials said that the death toll could rise, even as Afghanistan's Natural Disaster Management Authority said it did not know the exact number of casualties. Temperature in parts of the country dropped to minus 12 degrees Celsius.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Do not kill your protesters, US is watching: Trump to Iranian leaders
text: US President Donald Trump on Sunday addressed Iranian leaders in his tweet that said, "Do not kill your protesters." Protests erupted in Tehran after Iranian military admitted it had mistakenly shot down a Ukrainian plane. "Thousands have already been killed or imprisoned by you, and the world is watching. More importantly, the USA is watching," Trump said in his tweet.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 11 killed as severe weather targets millions in US
text: At least 11 people, including two first responders, have died as a result of severe storms in parts of Southern and Midwestern states of US. Deaths were reported in Texas, Alabama, Louisiana Oklahoma and Iowa. High winds, tornadoes and continuous rain were reported from affected areas. Thousands of people are also facing power cuts due to the storms.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I could've handled things better: Aus PM on bushfires that killed 28
text: Australian PM Scott Morrison on Sunday admitted that he fell short in his handling of the bushfires that killed 28 people and claimed 2,000 homes. "There are things I could have handled on the ground much better," he said in an interview. "There is obviously a need for a national review of the response (to bushfires)," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Shankar Mahadevan shares video of man playing flute outside Assam restaurant
text: Music composer Shankar Mahadevan on Instagram shared a video of an Assamese musician named Dileep Heera, whom he had noticed playing flute outside a restaurant, and wrote, "Talent undiscovered." In the video, Shankar introduces Dileep as "an amazing flautist" before asking him to play flute. Later in the video, Shankar can be heard singing.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Pics show Gigi, Zayn together for his b'day; reconciliation rumours surface
text: Pictures showing British singer Zayn Malik and supermodel Gigi Hadid together have surfaced online with several reports claiming that they are back together. The pictures that surfaced on Saturday show them walking arm in arm in New York City. The couple, who broke up in 2018, was on their way to dinner to celebrate Zayn's birthday.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: 8 Indian airports selected to test AI-run baggage screening system
text: Eight Indian airports including Pune airport have been selected by Airports Authority of India (AAI) for trials of an artificial intelligence-powered baggage-screening system. AAI officials said 'Baggage AI' would enhance security and act like a second pair of eyes. AAI picked Baggage AI from the innovations presented under 'Innovate for Airports' programme under Startup India initiative.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Jan Dhan-Aadhaar-Mobile behind Indian startups' global growth: Kant
text: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant said the global expansion of Indian startups like Ola, Oyo and Byju's is because of India's "JAM (Jan Dhan-Aadhaar-Mobile) trinity". He also said India's 1,200 million bank accounts, 1,200 million biometrics and 1,200 million mobiles would enable its transition to an advanced economy. Kant claimed India's data consumption stood larger than US and China combined.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Sadness, but not all negative emotions, heightens craving to smoke: Study
text: Researchers from Harvard University have found that sadness, but not all negative emotions, appears to be an especially potent trigger of addictive substance use. The study also examined the topography of actual smoking behaviour, finding that experimentally induced sadness (as compared to neutral emotion) causally increased the volume and duration of cigarette puffs inhaled.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: We're more interested in your number: Pune Police to man asking woman's number
text: Pune Police's official Twitter handle on Sunday tweeted, "Sir, we're more interested in your number currently, to understand your interest in the lady's number," after a man asked them for a woman's number. The woman had initially approached Pune Police on Twitter seeking Dhanori police station's number. Twitter users lauded the police's response with tweets like "Bohot hard" and "Savage".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ex-Bigg Boss contestants Ashmit, Mahekk call off engagement after 5yrs of dating
text: Actors Ashmit Patel and Mahekk Chahal, who appeared on Bigg Boss 4 and got engaged in 2017, have called off their engagement after five years of dating. "I left Ashmit. I had to take that step," Mahekk told Times of India. "They...were planning a destination wedding a year later. However, compatibility issues cropped up...Things gradually deteriorated," TOI reported.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: My Sudama moment with Lord Krishna: Mohammad Kaif on pic with Sachin
text: Former India all-rounder Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with Sachin Tendulkar. The 39-year-old captioned the picture, "My Sudama moment with Lord Krishna." Reacting to the picture, a user wrote, "Beautiful picture....both of you have made us Indians proud." Another fan wrote, "You are a humble man. Truly admirable."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ishant posts picture with caption 'You only live once', gets trolled by Kohli
text: Fast bowler Ishant Sharma took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with the caption, "You only live once." Trolling Ishant, Team India captain Virat Kohli commented, "Hamein toh pata hi nahi tha (We didn't know this only)." Ishant then responded, saying, "Maze mat le (Don't make fun)." Reacting to Kohli's remark, a fan wrote, "Chiku at his best."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Last of the 5 buildings in Kerala demolished in controlled implosion
text: Golden Kayaloram apartment complex in Kerala was the last of the five buildings that were demolished using controlled implosion technique on Sunday. Jain Coral Cove apartments were also demolished today, while H2O Holy Faith and the twin towers of Alfa Serene were razed on Saturday. These buildings were demolished for violating Coastal Regulation Zone rules on the Supreme Court's order.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bengaluru woman clicks on link sent by fake caller, loses ₹63,900 within minutes
text: A 35-year-old Bengaluru woman software engineer was cheated of ₹63,900 within minutes after she clicked on a link provided by a fraud. The techie found a customer care number claiming to be of FedEx as she had to send a courier to her husband in Canada. She followed instructions given on the call, losing money in instalments from Google Pay.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Student stuck in snow dies, 6 others rescued in Uttarakhand
text: A student stranded in heavy snowfall in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district died while six others were rescued by police and State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) personnel, officials said on Sunday. Eighteen-year-old Anuj Semwal died on the way to a hospital on Saturday after being rescued, Barkot SHO DS Kohli said, adding that the rest of the students are safe.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: JNU V-C should be dismissed and probed: Congress fact-finding team
text: A Congress fact-finding team which visited JNU and submitted its report to party chief Sonia Gandhi has said that the university's Vice-Chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar should be dismissed immediately. The fact-finding team further said that a criminal investigation must be initiated against JNU V-C, faculty members and the security company which allegedly conspired with the attackers on January 5.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Aspiring actress abandoned 2-yr-old son in train 38 yrs ago, son seeks ₹1.5 cr
text: A 40-year-old man has moved Bombay High Court against his biological mother and sought a compensation of ₹1.5 crore from her for abandoning him in Mumbai when he was two years old. In his plea, the man said his mother wanted to move to Mumbai to work in Bollywood. He added he was abandoned in train once they reached Mumbai.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Woman passenger says she has bombs, plane makes emergency landing in Kolkata
text: An AirAsia Kolkata-Mumbai flight made an emergency landing at Kolkata airport on Saturday night after a 25-year-old woman passenger said bombs were strapped to her body and she would detonate them any moment. An emergency was reportedly declared by ATC at 11 pm and the flight was taken to the isolation bay upon landing. The passenger was arrested by CISF.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 35-year-old woman strangled to death for resisting robbery in UP
text: A 35-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death by dacoits in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad district when she raised an alarm on Sunday, police said. Four armed robbers had barged into Samreen's home and held her family hostage at gunpoint. Samreen shouted and tried to resist but the robbers strangled her, before leaving with gold ornaments and cash worth ₹1.5 lakh.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Violation of int'l law: Britain on UK ambassador's arrest in Tehran
text: Britain's Foreign Secretary condemned the arrest of its ambassador to Iran in Tehran, calling it a "flagrant violation of international law". Rob Macaire was detained for over an hour on accusations of helping to organise demonstrations. Macaire however, denied taking part in protests saying that he was attending a vigil for those who died in the Ukrainian plane crash.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I stand with you: Trump to Iranians protesting Ukrainian plane shooting
text: US President Donald Trump has tweeted in support of Iranians protesting against Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei. Protests erupted in Tehran after Iran's military admitted it had mistakenly shot down a Ukrainian plane. "To the brave, long-suffering people of Iran: I've stood with you since the beginning of my presidency, and my administration will continue to stand with you," Trump said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Who was Oman's Sultan Qaboos for whom India will observe state mourning?
text: Government on Sunday declared one-day state mourning over demise of Sultan of Oman Qaboos bin Said Al Said. He was the longest-serving ruler of the Arab world with a reputation for quiet diplomacy. Qaboos had ruled Oman since 1970 after overthrowing his father in a coup. His cousin Haitham bin Tariq al-Said will be sworn in as the new Sultan.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Won't change position on Taiwan: China after Prez Tsai's election win
text: After Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen won a second term in office, China said it will not change its position that Taiwan belongs to it. Tsai on Saturday called for talks with China to resume, adding that Taiwan won't submit to intimidation. China's foreign ministry said in a statement that Taiwan was an internal affair for China.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: UK's 93-year-old Queen spotted driving Range Rover without seatbelt, video surfaces
text: A video of UK's Queen Elizabeth II driving a Range Rover without wearing a seatbelt has surfaced online. The 93-year-old was spotted for the first time since the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, revealed they were stepping down as senior royals. "How can a 93-year-old drive?" a user tweeted reacting to the video.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kiran Mazumdar shares Vivekananda's quote on religion, refugees
text: India's richest self-made woman and Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar Shaw shared a quote by Swami Vivekananda on religion and refugees from his 1893 addresses at the Parliament of the World’s Religions in Chicago. "I'm proud to belong to a nation which has sheltered the persecuted and the refugees of all religions," his quote read. Today marks Vivekananda's 157th birth anniversary.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Saudi Aramco raises IPO to record $29.4 bn through 'greenshoe option'
text: Saudi Aramco on Sunday said it exercised "greenshoe option" to sell an additional 450 million shares, raising the size of its IPO to a record $29.4 billion. Aramco initially raised a then-record $25.6 billion in its IPO in December. A greenshoe option, or over-allotment, allows companies to issue more shares in an IPO when there's a greater demand.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 'Tanhaji...' earns ₹35.67cr, 'Chhapaak' ₹11.67cr within 2 days of release
text: Ajay Devgn's 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' and Deepika Padukone's 'Chhapaak' collected ₹35.67 crore and ₹11.67 crore, respectively, in two days of release. The box-office earnings of 'Chhapaak' for Friday and Saturday stood at ₹4.7 crore and ₹6.9 crore, while 'Tanhaji...' collected ₹15.1 crore and ₹20.5 crore on respective days. 'Tanhaji...' is directed by Om Raut and 'Chhapaak' by Meghna Gulzar.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Passersby help woman deliver baby on roadside after hospital denies entry
text: A pregnant woman in Andhra Pradesh had to deliver the baby on the roadside after a state-run hospital denied entry to her on Saturday. The woman, who was identified as Mariyamma, then headed towards her home but went into labour on her way. Some passersby and local women then helped her deliver the baby on the side of the road.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Mobileye's self-driving car drives around Jerusalem using only cameras
text: Israel-based tech firm Mobileye shared a video of one of its autonomous vehicles, navigating through the streets of Jerusalem using only cameras, at CES 2020. The vehicle had 12 different video cameras mounted on it and didn't use sensors to drive. The video showed the sedan navigating intersections, turning into streets with heavy traffic, changing lanes and circling roundabouts.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Instagram removes posts supporting Iranian General Soleimani
text: Instagram removed posts speaking in support of slain Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani to comply with US sanctions. Iran's state media reported that the government called for nationwide legal action against Instagram in protest and created a portal for people to report examples of such posts. Iranian government's spokesperson Ali Rabiei had called the move "undemocratic".
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Startup India to showcase its 1st tableau at Republic Day: Report
text: Startup India, government's flagship programme aimed at promoting innovation and entrepreneurship, will reportedly have its own tableau parading the Rajpath on Republic Day for the first time this year. The tableau is said to depict the growing startup culture in the country. Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) will be responsible for the tableau.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Bacteria found to self-destruct to fight viral infections: Study
text: Researchers at the University of California San Diego have discovered a new immune system in bacteria, one that employs the abortive infection technique in which the bacterial cell self-destructs to keep a viral infection from spreading. Out of the 75,000 different bacteria that have had their genomes sequenced, researchers said that this new defence system is found in approximately 10%.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Man borrows Audi to take friends for ride, they kill him for refusing alcohol
text: Gurugram Police arrested three men for allegedly killing one of their friends after they went for a ride in an Audi he had borrowed. The victim, Arshad Khan, told a friend on the phone that his friends were forcing him to drink alcohol or they'll kill him. The police later found Khan's body with the car abandoned at some distance.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Israeli minister criticised for implying homosexuality is unnatural
text: Israel's Education Minister Rafael Peretz was criticised for implying that homosexuality was unnatural. When asked what he would do if one of his children had a "different sexual orientation", Peretz told a newspaper, "Thank God, my children grew up in a natural and healthy way." He added, "They are building their homes on the basis of Jewish values."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Shah a common surname, Sanjay Shah unrelated to me: Edelweiss' Rashesh Shah
text: Edelweiss Group Chairman Rashesh Shah denied having any business relationship with Capstone Forex and allegations of involvement in ₹2,000 crore foreign exchange violations. He also denied media reports claiming Sanjay Nathalal Shah, an independent director of multiple Edelweiss Group companies, was connected to Capstone. "Shah is a common name....he's not related to me in any way," Rashesh said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: RBI asks B'luru bank to stop doing business, sets ₹35,000 withdrawal limit
text: RBI has issued a notice asking Sri Guru Raghavendra Sahakara Bank, a co-operative in Bengaluru, to stop doing business with immediate effect, for alleged irregularities. The RBI, however, allowed the bank's savings and current account customers and depositors to withdraw cash up to ₹35,000 only till further notice. The bank has been operational since 1999, as per the bank's website.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Billionaire invites women to travel to Moon with him, become his life partner
text: Yusaku Maezawa, Japan's 44-year-old billionaire and Founder of online fashion store ZOZOTOWN, has announced a contest for single women aged above 20 to select a woman who will travel to Moon with him. He said he's looking to find a 'life partner'. Maezawa will take out selected women on dates and announce his final decision on a partner by March-end.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Woman sends fake pic of tyre punctured by nail to boss for leave; pic viral
text: A fake picture of a tyre punctured by a nail, sent by a woman employee to her boss in the US to get a leave, has gone viral. Users claimed she took the first images of a tyre and nail that she found on the internet and put them together. Photoshop maker Adobe jokingly tweeted about the picture, "Nailed it."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Not sure if Deepika is on Tinder, but I'd swipe right for her: Siddhant
text: 'Gully Boy' actor Siddhant Chaturvedi has said he is not sure if actress Deepika Padukone is on the dating app Tinder, but he would swipe right for her. The actor said this on being asked, "Who would you swipe right for on Tinder?" Siddhant will be seen opposite Deepika in 'Kapoor & Sons' director Shakun Batra's upcoming film.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Took a bit of my blood, but Jersey script deserves it: Shahid on 13 stitches
text: After actor Shahid Kapoor was spotted at Mumbai airport hiding his face following 13 stitches over a lip injury, he tweeted, "Yes I have got a few stitches but am recovering fast." Shahid, who got injured while shooting for 'Jersey', added, "#jersey has taken a little bit of my blood but a script this good deserves that in the least."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Pant, Urvashi blocked each other on WhatsApp mutually: Actress' spokesperson
text: After several reports said that cricketer Rishabh Pant has blocked actress Urvashi Rautela on WhatsApp, the actress' spokesperson told SpotBoyE, "It was a mutual decision to block one another." Earlier, it was reported that Urvashi had constantly tried to get in touch with Pant. The two were linked up after reportedly being spotted together for dinner.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Cardboard beds won't break during sex: 2020 Olympics bed makers to athletes
text: The official bed makers for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics have reassured athletes that their cardboard beds won't collapse during sex. "We've conducted experiments, like dropping weights on top of the beds," a spokesperson said. "As long as they stick to just two people in the bed, they should be strong enough to support the load," the spokesperson further added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Texted Virat 'I wish no one goes through back surgery': Hardik on injury
text: All-rounder Hardik Pandya, in a recent interview, revealed Team India captain Virat Kohli dropped a message asking him how he was after the back surgery. "I replied 'I am good but I just wish that no one in the world goes through a back surgery'," he added. He also added that the surgery was emotionally challenging for him.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: People find pictures of their dead loved ones on Google Maps' Street View
text: Hundreds of people are finding photos of their deceased loved ones using the Street View option on Google Maps. Earlier this week, a woman tweeted a 13-second screen recording of Google Maps Street View that showed her deceased grandfather at a Mexico farm. "Our tissue box is officially empty. Thank you for sharing this," Google Maps responded to her tweet.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Out on morning walk, Samajwadi Party leader shot dead in UP
text: A Samajwadi Party leader and former village head Bijli Yadav was shot dead in Uttar Pradesh's Mau district on Sunday when he was out for a morning walk, police said. Police added that unidentified assailants fired at Yadav's temple from point-blank range and fled. "Two teams have been constituted to arrest the assailants," Mau's SP Anurag Arya said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Queen calls Harry to discuss future arrangements for him and Meghan
text: Queen Elizabeth has summoned her grandson Prince Harry for a meeting after he and his wife Meghan Markle announced their decision to step back from royal duties. The Queen called the meeting to discuss future arrangements for the couple, officially called the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. Harry's father Prince Charles and brother Prince William will also attend the meeting.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: It reminded me of my journey: Acid attack survivor on 'Chhapaak'
text: Acid attack survivor Premlata, while talking about Deepika Padukone's 'Chhapaak', said that the film reminded her of her own journey. "The way...acid was thrown...way Malti has hidden her face, I used to do...same," she added. "Once when I stepped out...[and]...when I removed my veil, a woman fainted. Since that day, I didn't remove...veil till my face got...better," said Premlata.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I believe this will be a push in my career: Nora on Street Dancer 3D
text: Nora Fatehi, who'll be seen alongside Varun Dhawan and Shraddha Kapoor in 'Street Dancer 3D', has said she has a "very prominent and an important role" in the film. "I believe this will be a push in my career," she added. "I'm dancing...in...very different style...and there is so many elements in the movie which are new for me," said Nora.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I see similarities in Ranveer and Laxmi's ex-partner Alok: Deepika
text: Talking about her husband Ranveer Singh and acid attack survivor Laxmi Agarwal's ex-partner Alok Dixit, Deepika Padukone said, "I think there are similarities in their personalities." "I think Alok has been extremely supportive of Laxmi...Ranveer has been...[supportive] of my career," she added. "I don't mean it in...literal sense but...in a broader sense, there are similarities," Deepika said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Hope 'Chhapaak' starts conversation on solutions to acid attacks: Meghna
text: Calling 'Chhapaak' "an important story", director Meghna Gulzar said, "There is a lot of awareness on sexual assault and rape...but...there is lack of awareness about...acid violence." "Acid is going beyond crime against women and being weaponised," she further said. "Let's hope ['Chhapaak'] starts a conversation on what could be probable solutions," Meghna added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Kriti to star opposite Salman in Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali: Reports
text: Actress Kriti Sanon has been roped in to star opposite Salman Khan in his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', as per reports. Directed by Farhad Samji, the film will be produced and written by Sajid Nadiadwala. Salman is currently shooting for 'Radhe: Your Most Wanted Bhai', while Kriti will be seen alongside Akshay Kumar in 'Bachchan Pandey'.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Make films relevant to today's times, remakes aren't an answer: Rani
text: Actress Rani Mukerji, when asked whether her films 'Raja Ki Aayegi Baraat' and 'Mehndi' should be remade in today's time, said, "I don't think remaking something is an answer." "[I]t is important to make films which are relevant to today's times," she added. "[T]here are a lot of stories that need to be told and...come on celluloid," Rani further said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Do not fall for vicious campaigns against democratically-elected govt: Anupam
text: Actor Anupam Kher in "an appeal to fellow Indians" said they shouldn't fall prey to "vicious campaigns" run against democratically-elected government by a section of people. "These are the same people who...are hiding behind students to harm [India]...speak...about dividing [India]," Anupam said. "These people...asked for proof of authenticity...[of] surgical strike, Balakot airstrike," he added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: This is on us, we need to fix so much: Parineeti on Australian bushfire
text: Parineeti Chopra took to Instagram to share pictures of herself with kangaroos and koala bears amid bushfires in Australia. "I feel like it was yesterday when I was with these...babies," she wrote. "Cannot believe what's happening there! Make no mistake - this is because of climate change!!! This is on us. We need to fix so much, NOW," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Was so much happier when I was off social media: Selena Gomez
text: Singer Selena Gomez said in an interview that she was "so much happier" when she was out of social media. She added that there were accounts which were "dissecting her down to her body, to face, features and choices she's made". "It drove me crazy...and...just destroyed me. So I stopped, and I tell every...person [that] everything changed," Selena further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Protest in Delhi over traffic restrictions due to anti-CAA demonstrations
text: People in Delhi's Sarita Vihar staged a protest on Sunday demanding the removal of barricades that have been placed on the road for the past few weeks due to anti-CAA demonstrations. Road number 13A between Mathura Road and Kalindi Kunj has been closed for traffic movement due to the protests. People demanded the removal of blockages to ease traffic movement.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Would be a dream to coach Barcelona: Ex-Barca captain Xavi
text: Former Barcelona captain Xavi Hernandez said, "I cannot hide it's my dream to coach Barcelona... everyone knows I support Barcelona from the bottom of my heart." Xavi is currently coaching his former side, Qatari outfit Al Sadd. "There are negotiations between Xavi and Barcelona now and we wish him success wherever he decides to go," Al Sadd's sporting director said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Serena breaks three-year title drought to win in Auckland
text: American former world number one Serena Williams won her first title since the 2017 Australian Open with a 6-3, 6-4 victory over compatriot Jessica Pegula at the Auckland Classic on Sunday. The 38-year-old had the opportunity to sweep both titles at the Auckland Tennis Centre but failed to win the doubles final alongside Caroline Wozniacki.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Firmino's strike helps Liverpool beat Spurs and extend record
text: Roberto Firmino's strike helped Liverpool beat Tottenham 1-0 and extend their unbeaten run to 38 league matches, which is the equivalent of an entire season. Liverpool's haul of 61 points from a possible 63 since the beginning of this season represents the best ever start to a campaign by any club in any of Europe's top five divisions.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Uber to shut down its operations in Colombia
text: Uber will be shutting down its operations in Colombia starting February 1 following a court ruling that stated it violated competition rules. The ride-hailing company intends to appeal the ruling which it called "arbitrary" and a violation of its right to due process. Uber stated it has to defend the rights of its 88,000 drivers and two million customers.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: 5 injured as speeding car rams into bicycle, car in Haryana, video surfaces
text: A car hit two bicycle riders and then smashed into another car on the roadside before hitting a motorcycle in Haryana on Saturday. While five were injured in the accident, the driver and other occupants left the car and escaped. Police said they have found a hookah in the car and the driver may have been in a drunken state.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: PM touches feet of an elderly pensioner in Kolkata, felicitates him
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday touched the feet of one of the two oldest pensioners of Kolkata Port Trust while felicitating him for his contribution towards the Kolkata Port Trust. PM felicitated 105-year-old Nagina Bhagat and 100-year-old Naresh Chandra Chakraborty during the 150 years celebrations of Kolkata Port Trust. West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was also present on the occasion.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Shahid Kapoor hides face after getting 13 stitches on lip; pics surface
text: Pictures of actor Shahid Kapoor, who got 13 stitches on his lower lip after suffering an injury on the sets of film 'Jersey', surfaced online on Saturday. The pictures, taken at the Mumbai airport, show him hiding the lower half of his face with a mask. The actor was hit by a cricket ball on his lip.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Servant tried to rape me in my house when I was 13: Bigg Boss contestant Arti
text: Bigg Boss 13 contestant Arti Singh has revealed she faced a rape attempt when she was alone in her house, at the age of 13. "My servant tried to rape me...I cried, yelled, tore his clothes...I shouted and then somehow escaped and jumped from the second floor," she said. "I faced panic attacks that entire year," Arti added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Was told to take pills to shrink my penis: Actor who starred in Batman TV show
text: Actor Burt Ward, who played 'Robin' in the 1960s TV series 'Batman' has claimed the show's makers asked him to take pills to "shrink" his penis. "They thought Robin had a very large bulge for television," he added. "I took them for three days and then...I stopped doing that and I just used my cape to cover it," said Burt.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: You never know, kids can be secretive: Javed on Farhan-Shibani's wedding rumours
text: Lyricist Javed Akhtar, on being asked about rumours that suggested that his son, actor Farhan Akhtar will get married to Shibani Dandekar this year, said, "I have just heard it from you." "I was with Farhan on his birthday...He didn't tell me anything about this. But you never know, children can be very secretive," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: FIR against Amazon for selling toilet mats with Golden Temple's pic
text: Shiromani Akali Dal's National Spokesman Manjinder S Sirsa on Saturday filed an FIR against Amazon for allowing a seller to sell toilet mats with Golden Temple's image on them, which hurt Sikh sentiments. "This is deliberate & blasphemous...Amazon must ban this seller & issue a global apology," Sirsa tweeted. Following his tweets, #BoycottAmazon began trending on Twitter on Sunday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: SSB jawan fires 200 gunshots in air for 45 minutes on Indo-Nepal border
text: A Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) jawan named Abhay Kumar, posted along the Indo-Nepal border triggered panic after he fired more than 200 gunshots in the air for about 45 minutes, a police official said. SSB officials led by commandant Subhash Chand Negi rushed to the spot and overpowered the jawan who is said to be mentally unstable, the official added.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Indian govt declares state mourning on Jan 13 over Oman Sultan's demise
text: The Indian government has declared a state mourning on January 13 over the demise of Oman's Sultan Qaboos Bin Said Al Said. According to an order issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA), the national flag will be flown at half-mast and no official programmes will be held on that day. Qaboos passed away at the age of 79.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Saw a mob at 4 pm & alerted police, help came 4 hrs later: JNU wardens
text: Two wardens at JNU's Sabarmati Hostel said they alerted police and JNU security at around 4 pm when a masked mob with lathis was seen moving out of the hostel. However, no help arrived until almost four hours later, they claimed. Two other wardens wrote to Chief Security Officer at around 4.30 pm seeking extra security, an incident report said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: PM Modi renames Kolkata Port Trust after Dr Syama Prasad Mookerjee
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday renamed Kolkata Port Trust after Bharatiya Jana Sangh founder Dr Syama Prasad Mookerjee at an event to mark the 150 years of the Trust. "It is a historic port that saw India gain freedom and has been a witness to India's progress. This port represents industrial, spiritual and self-sufficiency aspirations of India," he said.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: French paintings looted by Nazis set to fetch £20m at auction
text: Three masterpieces that were looted by the Nazis from the homes of a Jewish collector during the German occupation of France are to be auctioned in London, where they are expected to fetch around £20 million. The works by Camille Pissarro and Paul Signac were recently handed back to the heirs of Gaston Lévy, an art collector in the 1930s.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Working with Ranbir is a wish come true: Choreographer Shakti Mohan
text: Choreographer-actress Shakti Mohan, who has choreographed a dance sequence for actor Ranbir Kapoor in 'Shamshera', said, "I had a wish to work with Ranbir...God is kind...that my wishes came true." "I love him...and I think he's one of the finest [actors] we have right now," she added. "Now, I want to work with Madhuri Dixit and Hrithik Roshan," said Shakti.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: BAFTA to review its voting process after diversity row in nominations
text: Days after BAFTA was criticised for the lack of diversity in this year's nomination list, the head of the film committee said they'll conduct a "careful and detailed review" of its voting process. He added that any changes agreed upon will be "in place in time for voting for 2021 awards". All the nominees in the acting category are white.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Felt like actual father-son relationship: Jaaved on his Jabariya Jodi role
text: Jaaved Jaaferi, who played Sidharth Malhotra's father in film 'Jabariya Jodi', has said his on-screen relationship felt like an actual father-son relationship. "While my relationship with my reel son is unique and real, we've our own unique opinions and hence not always get along," he added. Jaaved further said the role required him to step out of his comfort zone.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Short film 'Kamali', based on 10-yr-old Indian girl, gets BAFTA nomination
text: British short film 'Kamali', which is a documentary on skateboarding journey of a ten-year-old girl Kamali Moorthy from Tamil Nadu's Mahabalipuram, has been nominated for BAFTA. The film is directed by Sasha Rainbow, a London-based director from New Zealand. "To be longlisted for the Oscars is a huge honour and now we are BAFTA-nominated...We've gone further than...our expectations," Sasha said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: After making Chhapaak tax-free, MP govt to honour Deepika at IIFA
text: A day after declaring Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Chhapaak' tax-free in their state, the Madhya Pradesh government announced that they will honour the actress at the International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA). This comes amid boycott calls against the film after Deepika visited the Jawaharlal Nehru University. This will be the first time that Madhya Pradesh will host IIFA since 2000.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: SRK didn't take a fee for voiceover in The Forgotten Army: Kabir
text: Filmmaker Kabir Khan has said Shah Rukh Khan "very graciously" gave the voiceover for his upcoming web series, 'The Forgotten Army - Azaadi Ke Liye', which is based on the Indian National Army. "His father had involvement with this army," he added. "Don't know whether he would like me to reveal this, but he didn't take...fee from us," said Kabir.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Forever grateful: Vicky on 1 year of 'Uri: The Surgical Strike'
text: Vicky Kaushal on Saturday took to Instagram to share a post on the completion of one year of his film 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' and wrote, "From each one of us to each one of you...we thank you for everything you've given to...film." "Team URI is forever grateful," he added. Vicky won National Award for Best Actor for the film.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Cinema has always been instrumental in shaping society: Vikrant
text: Vikrant Massey has said cinema has always been instrumental in shaping the society, adding, "Not just in India but all over the world." He added that cinema played a huge part in the West in "ushering revolution and initiating conversations among people". "Very idea of taking up a topic can lead to...revolution, and cinema has...power to do so," said Vikrant.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Handwritten lyrics of The Beatles' song up for auction for ₹1.38 cr
text: Handwritten lyrics to 'While My Guitar Gently Weeps' from The Beatles' 1968 album 'The White Album' are up for sale for $195,000 (over ₹1.38 crore) through memorabilia company Moments In Time. The lyrics were scribbled by George Harrison and Ringo Starr on a studio recording sheet's back. The lyric sheet represents a working draft used during recording of the song.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: It's devastating: Actress Pooja on Australian bushfires
text: Pooja Hegde, while talking about the bushfires in Australia, said, "I just think we need to be a little more careful." "Whatever is happening in Australia is devastating. When I see the images coming from there, it makes me really sad. The animals are...suffering right now," she added. "Whatever can be done, should be done in...form of donations," said Pooja.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Ocean acidification leading to denticle corrosion in sharks: Study
text: According to a new study, global ocean acidification is having a negative effect on the growth rates and on denticle structure and composition in sharks. The researchers concluded that the denticle corrosion could, in turn, result in an increase in denticle turnover and compromise hydrodynamics and skin protection in the species.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Wildfires could turn Amazon into a carbon source by 2050: Study
text: A new study claims that wildfires could burn up to 16 percent of the Brazilian Amazon forest region by 2050 and release enough carbon dioxide to convert parts of the forest from carbon dioxide sponge to source. Researchers, however, report that avoiding new deforestation among other drying factors could slow or prevent that transition.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Long-term "allergy memories" are stored in bone marrow: Study
text: A new study has claimed that long-term exposure to allergens generates a "memory serum" stored in our bone marrow, flagging threatening allergens for the future. The findings suggest that if scientists can figure out a way to neutralize the memory serum, the body will forget its allergy and the subsequent reaction attached to the allergy.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: President's medal awardee policeman arrested with 2 terrorists in Kashmir
text: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Saturday arrested DSP Davinder Singh, a recipient of President's Police Medal for Gallantry, along with two terrorists in Kashmir's Kulgam. All of them were in a vehicle that belonged to the DSP when they were arrested, an official said. According to reports, the police intercepted the vehicle and recovered five grenades.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 37 identified in JNU linked WhatsApp group not from political outfits: Reports
text: Delhi Police has reportedly identified 37 students from a WhatsApp group allegedly created during the January 5 violence in JNU. Those identified don't belong to any political organisations but are students who were in favour of the semester registration process and wanted to enrol themselves. Earlier, JNU VC M Jagadesh Kumar said outsiders may have been involved in the violence.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Headless body of civilian found on LoC, Pakistan's role suspected
text: Pakistan's Border Action Team (BAT) is suspected of decapitating a porter, who was among two civilians killed along the LoC on Friday, and taking away the head, officials said. This is the first time that any civilian has been beheaded by BAT, officials added. Reacting on it, Army Chief General MM Naravane said they'll deal with this in "military manner".
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Light flashing from human eyes caught on camera for first time
text: Dartmouth scientists have for the first time ever captured light emission from the eye of a patient undergoing radiotherapy. The team collected real-time data to show that during head and neck radiation therapy, enough light is produced inside the eye to elicit a visual sensation. To capture the phenomenon, researchers used a special technology called the CDose camera imaging system.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: PM should first show his father's birth certificate, then ask for ours: Kashyap
text: Anurag Kashyap on Saturday tweeted, "CAA comes into effect. Tell [PM] Modi to first show...his father's and family's birth certificate to the entire nation. Then ask for our papers." In a separate tweet, he wrote, "I want to see the 'entire political science' degree of the PM who's enforcing CAA on us. First prove that [PM] Modi is literate."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Anushka Sharma to play the role of Jhulan Goswami in her biopic: Reports
text: Actress Anushka Sharma has been roped in to play the role of India Women fast bowler Jhulan Goswami, as per reports. Parts of the film will be shot at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata, the reports added. Goswami, who made her debut for India Women in 2002, has played 260 international matches so far.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Amit Shah unveils 5.5 lakh 'thank you' letters to PM Modi over CAA; shares pics
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday unveiled over 5.5 lakh postcards written by Ahmedabad residents to PM Narendra Modi, thanking him for CAA. "Addressed BJP workers' meet in Naranpura constituency. There was tremendous enthusiasm in support of CAA," Shah tweeted while sharing pictures. "Our public outreach programme is a reply to...lies being spread against CAA," he said at the event.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Maybe 1 day govt will be in detention centre, we'll be azad: Arundhati
text: Author Arundhati Roy on Saturday joined anti-CAA and NRC protesters at Jamia Millia Islamia University in Delhi. "If we all get together, there won't be a detention centre big enough for us," she said. "Maybe there will be a day when this government will be in a detention centre, and all of us azad (free)," she added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Hardik Pandya fails fitness tests, Vijay Shankar replaces him in India A squad
text: Hardik Pandya failed mandatory fitness tests in Mumbai and has been pulled out of India A squad for the tour of New Zealand. Tamil Nadu all-rounder Vijay Shankar has been drafted into the team as Hardik's replacement. Hardik, who recently recovered from his back injury, last played an international match in September last year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Does anybody keep himself away for this long: Gavaskar questions Dhoni's break
text: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has questioned MS Dhoni's sabbatical from cricket since the team's loss in the World Cup semi-final in July last year. "Does anybody keep himself away from playing for India for that long? That is the question and therein lies the answer," he said on being asked if Dhoni can make India's T20 World Cup squad.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I keep telling myself why didn't I dive: Dhoni on World Cup semi-final run-out
text: On being asked by India Today Consulting Editor (Sports) Boria Majumdar about his dismissal in 2019 World Cup semi-final against New Zealand, ex-India captain MS Dhoni said, "I keep telling myself...why didn't I dive." He added, "Those two inches I keep telling myself 'MS Dhoni, you should have dived'." India required 25 runs off 10 balls when Dhoni got run-out.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sachin's 'carried on shoulders' WC 2011 moment nominated for Laureus award
text: Sachin Tendulkar's 2011 World Cup win moment titled 'Carried on the Shoulders of a Nation' has been nominated for the greatest Laureus Sporting Moment Award in the last 20 years. The moment includes Team India members carrying Tendulkar on their shoulders across the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai following their 2011 World Cup victory.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Kohli a proper leader who gives away his own position to build team: Irfan
text: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan dedicated an Instagram post to Virat Kohli, who promoted youngsters and himself batted at number six in the third T20I against Sri Lanka. "Being a captain is one thing, being a leader is another & Kohli is proper...I mean proper...leader who gives away his own position to promote youngsters and build a team," he wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Got peace symbol tattoo on neck after 'Koffee with Karan' row: Hardik Pandya
text: All-rounder Hardik Pandya, in a recent interview, revealed that he got a peace symbol tattoo on his neck after he got suspended from Team India following the 'Koffee With Karan' controversy. "All my tattoos have meanings," he added. Pandya and KL Rahul were suspended in January last year for their comments on women on 'Koffee with Karan'.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 1 lakh small traders to protest against Jeff Bezos during his stay in India
text: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT), which represents around 7 crore retailers, said it will protest across 300 cities during Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' stay in India. "We expect to mobilise at least 1 lakh traders in the protests," CAIT said. Bezos will visit India next week for a company event in Delhi and potential meetings with government officials.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Indian-American among NASA's newly graduated batch of astronauts
text: Indian-American US Air Force colonel, Raja Jon Vurputoor Chari, on Friday was amongst the 11 new NASA graduates who are all set to be a part of NASA's future missions to the International Space Station, Moon and Mars. Chari said he was inspired by his father Srinivas Chari, who came to the US from Hyderabad, for an engineering degree.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: 20-yr-old Bihar woman seeks divorce from husband, says 'My husband stinks'
text: A 20-year-old woman from Bihar has sought divorce from her 23-year-old husband, saying, "My husband stinks as he won’t shave and bathe for nearly 10 days at a stretch." She added, "Moreover, he doesn’t brush his teeth. He also doesn’t have manners and follow etiquettes." The state women’s commission (SWC) has asked the man to act on his wife’s complaints.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 3rd Bangladesh minister cancels visit to India
text: Bangladesh's Deputy Foreign Minister Shahriar Alam has cancelled his visit to India as he has to accompany Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to the UAE, the foreign office said on Saturday. The foreign ministry described the media reports citing other reasons for Alam's cancellation as "misleading". This comes after Bangladesh Foreign Minister and Home Minister cancelled their trips to India recently.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Abhijit Banerjee hails Delhi govt schools for outdoing private ones
text: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee has praised Delhi government schools for "outperforming" private schools. Banerjee said that the agencies have been "generous" with resource allocation for education, which is visible in aspects like teacher salaries and the system, and the focus needs to shift to making them perform better. He added that private schools are "terrible" from an outcome perspective.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Told my husband 'don't fly' amid US-Iran tensions: Wife of Ukrainian pilot
text: The wife of the pilot of the Ukrainian passenger plane shot down by Iran said that she urged him not to fly the plane amid tensions between the US and Iran. "I told him: Don't fly, don't do it," the pilot's wife said. "But my husband said: We can't backtrack, if it's not me, there's no one else," she added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: All Indians living in Iraq are safe: Iraq envoy amid US-Iran tensions
text: Amid the ongoing tensions between the US and Iran, Iraq's ambassador to India, Falah Abdulhasan Abdulsada said Indians living in Iraq are safe and adequate measures are in place for their security. The tensions won't affect oil supplies to India, he added. Iran had fired missiles targeting US bases in Iraq after the US killed top Iranian General in Baghdad.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Chinese tycoon to buy 45-bedroom London mansion for record ₹1,900 crore
text: Chinese property tycoon Cheung Chung-kiu has agreed to buy a seven-storey 45-room mansion overlooking London's Hyde Park for $268 million (₹1,900 crore), setting a UK house price record. The previous owner had been late Saudi Crown Prince Sultan bin Abdulaziz Al Saud. The property could be worth up to $915 million if renovated as an apartment block, Cheung's spokesperson said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Monthly minimum wage hiked to ₹256 in Venezuela, 11th hike in 24 months
text: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro increased the monthly minimum wage by 67% to 250,000 bolivars (₹256 at official exchange rate), the first hike this year and the eleventh in the past 24 months. The increase is still below the 275% hike of October last year. According to the opposition-led National Assembly, Venezuela's annual inflation rate was 13,476% in November 2019.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Playing 2023 WC is a definite goal of mine: Australia captain Finch
text: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has said that playing the 2023 World Cup is a "definite goal" of his. Finch further said that his number one goal is to "get back into the Test side". The 33-year-old has scored 278 runs at an average of 27.80 in five Tests and 4,559 runs at an average of 40.34 in 119 ODIs.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Zlatan Ibrahimovic scores first goal since rejoining AC Milan
text: Zlatan Ibrahimovic on Saturday scored his first goal for AC Milan in Serie A since rejoining as they defeated Cagliari 2-0. The 38-year-old Swedish centre-forward scored in the 64th minute to double the lead after Rafael Leao had put Milan ahead in the 46th minute. Ibrahimovic played for Milan between 2010 and 2012 and scored 56 goals in 85 appearances.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Google removed 1,700 apps affected by 'Joker' malware from Play Store
text: Google revealed it detected and removed 1,700 malicious apps from the Play Store, which were affected by the 'Joker' malware, ever since it started tracking such apps in 2017. Such apps initially targeted users through SMS fraud but later resorted to billing fraud after new policies rolled out. Google had removed 24 apps infiltrated with 'Joker' malware in September 2019.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Scientists create carbon-based material called 'superdiamond'
text: American scientists predicted and managed to synthesise a carbon-based material called, "superdiamond", with tunable mechanical and electronic properties. The researchers predicted the first thermodynamically stable carbon-based clathrate and then synthesised the clathrate structure, comprised of carbon-boron cages that trap strontium atoms, under high-pressure and high-temperature.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: PM Modi inaugurates lights & sound show at Howrah Bridge
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated a light and sound show at the Howrah Bridge, as part of the 150th-anniversary celebrations of the Kolkata Port Trust. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar were also present at the venue. After the event, PM Modi departed for Belur Math by boat for his first visit since 2015.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia denies its ship 'aggressively approached' US Navy destroyer
text: Russia denied that its warship "aggressively approached" a US Navy destroyer in the Arabian Sea. The US destroyer "blatantly violated international collision prevention rules" by cutting across the course taken by their reconnaissance vessel, Russia said. "The crew of the Russian ship acted professionally by taking the manoeuvre which averted the collision with the destroyer," Russia added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 8 dead in explosion at chemical factory near Mumbai
text: Eight people have died in an explosion at a chemical factory in Maharashtra's Palghar, nearly 100 kilometres away from Mumbai. The production in the unit was going on at the time of the incident, according to reports. The explosion was so intense that it was heard within a 15-kilometre radius, police spokesperson Hemant Katkar said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Ugandan woman caught trying to smuggle illegal cosmetics stuffed in dummy baby
text: A woman in Uganda was caught trying to smuggle illegal cosmetics into the country from DR Congo by stuffing them inside a dummy baby behind her back. The authorities acted on an intelligence input received about this smuggling mode. Authorities monitored the woman and the bus she boarded from Congo into Uganda before apprehending her.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: You went to universities to study, please do that: Gavaskar to protesting students
text: Referring to the students protesting against CAA, former Team India captain Sunil Gavaskar said, "I would like to urge them to head back to the classrooms." He added, "You went to the universities to study, so please do that." He added, “India has overcome many crises’ in the past and it will overcome this one as well."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: CWC passes resolution asking govt to stop NPR, withdraw CAA
text: Congress Working Committee (CWC) on Saturday passed a resolution demanding rollback of Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), as well as stopping updation of National Population Register (NPR). "CAA has raised bonafide questions regarding its Constitutional validity and political morality," CWC said in its statement. "CAA and NRC have created an environment of fear and anxiety in [India]," it added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: CAA's aim to divide Indians on religious lines: Sonia at CWC meet
text: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Saturday chaired a meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) and discussed CAA as well as the party's future course of action over the issue. "CAA is a discriminatory and divisive law," Sonia said. "The sinister purpose of the law is clear...: It is to divide the Indian people on religious lines," she added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Who handles your handle: Fans troll ICC for writing SA instead of SL on Twitter
text: Sharing pictures from the India-Sri Lanka T20I,  the ICC mistakenly wrote 'SA' instead of 'SL' in its caption which read, "If you know the struggle." Fans mocked ICC for the gaffe, with one writing, "Who handles your handle?" Other fans wrote, "Stop drinking too much admin," and "#INDvSL not #INDvSA, I think you are struggling with it."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rajasthan Royals wish Dravid on his birthday with movie Deewaar-like poster
text: Indian Premier League side Rajasthan Royals wished former Team India captain Rahul Dravid with a Bollywood film 'Deewaar'-like poster. "All of India presents 'Deewaar-The Wall'," the poster read, adding, "Mere Paas...Technique Hai." "20 years of pure blockbuster performances! Happy Birthday, legend," Rajasthan Royals wrote alongside the poster. Dravid played for RR from 2011 to 2013.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Latest rankings for T20I batsmen out, no Indian in top 5; two in top 10
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has jumped one place to the ninth position in the latest rankings for T20I batsmen. KL Rahul, who is ranked sixth, remains the top-ranked T20I batsman among Indians. Rahul gained 26 rating points. Manish Pandey has advanced four places to be ranked 70th, while Shikhar Dhawan is ranked 15th.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Cong wins mayor post in all 10 Chhattisgarh municipal corporations
text: Congress party candidates won the post of mayor in all 10 municipal corporation elections in Chhattisgarh on Friday. State Congress president Mohan Markam said, "The results are an approval of (CM) Bhupesh Baghel('s) government's welfare policies." BJP, however, alleged that the ruling Congress government used money power and official machinery to win in the local body polls.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Piyush Goyal writes to Vijayan to share cost of Sabarimala rail line
text: Railways Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday wrote to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, stating that there was a lack of cooperation on the part of the state government on the issue of Angamali-Sabarimala new line project. Goyal urged Vijayan to share the 50% cost of long-pending Angamali-Sabarimala new line project, which proposes to provide railway connectivity to Sabarimala hill shrine.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 6 Apache attack choppers to be deployed on Pak Border: Army Chief
text: Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane on Saturday said that six Army Apache attack choppers would be given to a unit on the western borders (Pakistan Border) where there is a threat from armoured columns. Naravane also said that the Army will take steps to reclaim PoK if Parliament wanted it and if the Indian government gave such an order.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Plane received no warning from Tehran airport before crash: Ukraine airline
text: Ukraine International Airlines has said its plane from Tehran to Kiev that crashed had received no warning from Tehran airport about a possible threat to its safety before it took off. "If they (Iran's military) are shooting from somewhere to somewhere, they were obliged to close the airport," it added. The airline also said the aircraft followed its normal course.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 11-yr-old opens fire on teacher, classmates at Mexico school; kills self later
text: At least two people were killed after an 11-year-old boy opened fire on his teacher and classmates with two guns at his school in Mexico's Coahuila state on Friday. The teacher was killed and the boy later shot himself dead. Before carrying out the shooting, the boy, who has not been identified, told his classmates, "Today is the day".
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Gold bar found in Mexico was from Aztec treasure: Study
text: A new study has claimed that the gold bar found in a Mexico City park in 1981 was part of the Aztec treasure looted by Hernan Cortes and the Spanish conquistadors 500 years ago. The 1.93-kilogram bar, confirmed to be part of the treasure through the use of specialised X-rays, was found by a construction worker during excavations.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Nadal to face Djokovic as Spain enter ATP Cup final
text: World number one Rafael Nadal on Saturday defeated Australia's Alex de Minaur to send Spain into ATP Cup final. Nadal defeated de Minaur 4-6, 7-5, 6-1 in the match that lasted two hours and 13 minutes. In the first singles match, Bautista Agut had won against Australia's Nick Kyrgios 6-1, 6-4. Spain will face Serbia in the final on Sunday.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Four-day Tests will increase injury risk for pacers: Misbah-ul-Haq
text: On ICC's proposal of four-day Tests, Pakistan head coach and chief selector Misbah-ul-Haq has said that "duration of Tests should not be tinkered with". Misbah stated that it will increase the risk of injury to fast bowlers as their "workload will increase to 20 to 25 overs". "If they [pacers] have to bowl more...they will lose pace," he added.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Facebook planning to launch TikTok rival Lasso in India: Report
text: Facebook is planning to launch its version of TikTok-like short video app, Lasso, in India in May, Entrackr reported. Launched in the US in 2018, Lasso has over a million downloads on Google Play Store. However, certain media reports have quoted a Facebook spokesperson denying the report of the firm launching Lasso in India.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: CCI warns e-commerce portals of probe into 'unethical' practices
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Saturday warned e-commerce platforms of investigation into alleged "unethical" practices if they didn't refrain from such methods. CCI Chairman Ashok Kumar Gupta said, "The Commission’s observations are not mere observations which can be ignored without consequence." Earlier, CCI had urged e-commerce platforms to be more transparent regarding policies.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Instagram adds TikTok-like editing features to Boomerangs
text: Instagram has rolled out new editing features for Boomerangs, including SlowMo effect, similar to TikTok. Users can also add "Echo" blurring and "Duo" rapid rewind special effects to their Boomerangs and trim their lengths as well. While Echo helps create a 'double vision' effect, Duo affects the speed of the Boomerang and adds a 'texturised effect' at the end.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: China puts world's largest radio telescope into operation
text: China has officially launched world's largest radio telescope to help with its hunt for life beyond Earth. The formal operation follows a three-year trial and the telescope will gradually open to astronomers around the globe. The Five-hundred-meter Aperture Spherical radio Telescope (FAST) has a diameter of half a kilometre and a receiving area equivalent to about 30 football fields.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Scientists create a 18-carat gold nugget made of plastic
text: Researchers have created a lightweight 18-carat gold, using a matrix of plastic in place of metallic alloy elements. To create the material, the team of researchers used protein fibres and a polymer latex to form a matrix in which they embedded discs of gold nano-crystals. Traditional 18-carat gold's density is 15 g/cm3, while the new material's density is 1.7 g/cm3.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Fear threat to life: Aligarh Muslim University Vice-Chancellor to police
text: Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) Vice-Chancellor Tariq Mansoor has expressed fear of threat to his life and family in a letter to the city's police chief and demanded heightened security amid the students' anti-CAA protests. Mansoor wrote that "anti-social elements" could create a law and order issue on campus and "if any untoward incident occurs, it will have a nationwide impact".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Supreme Court seeks Centre's reply on PIL for two-child policy
text: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to the Central government on a PIL seeking enforcement of the 2-child policy to control the population explosion in our country. Delhi High Court had earlier dismissed the PIL, filed by BJP leader Ashwini Upadhyay, stating that it was for the Parliament and state legislatures to enact laws and not for the court.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Govt appoints 2 joint secretaries, 13 deputies to assist CDS
text: The government has appointed two joint secretaries,13 deputy secretaries and 25 under secretary-rank officials in the Department of Military Affairs headed by Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat. The appointments were made as per laid down roadmap to create an enabling set up for the CDS to implement the government's vision of ensuring tri-services synergy, official sources said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Tsai Ing-wen wins second term as Taiwan's President
text: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Saturday won a second term with about 57% of vote. After the victory, she said, "Taiwan is showing the world how much we cherish our free democratic way of life." Tsai said she hopes China understands that democratic Taiwan will not concede to threats and intimidation and that the island will decide its own future.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Northern Ireland assembly reopens after a 3-year suspension
text: Northern Ireland's assembly has reopened for the first time in three years after the country's two main parties, the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) and Sinn Féin, struck a power-sharing deal to restore the government. The coalition government had collapsed in January 2017 due to a row over a DUP leader's renewable energy scheme that had exceeded the budget.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: ED summons Edelweiss chief on January 13 in ₹2,000-cr FEMA case
text: The Enforcement Directorate has issued fresh summons to Edelweiss group Chairman Rashesh Shah to appear on January 13 in a ₹2,000-crore Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) case and provide information about the company's dealings with Capstone Forex. "None of our companies have any transactions with Capstone," Edelweiss said in a statement. Shah was earlier summoned on January 9.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Video: 2 of 4 luxury apartment towers in Kochi razed to dust in seconds
text: Two waterfront highrise luxury apartments, H2O Holy Faith and Alfa Serene, in Kochi's Maradu area were demolished in a controlled implosion on Saturday by authorities for violating Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) norms. Two more buildings, Jain Coral Cove and Golden Kayaloram, will be demolished on Sunday. The Supreme Court had ordered the demolition of these buildings in September last year.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: China reports first death from new virus
text: State media has reported the first known death from a new virus that has infected dozens of people in China. Forty-one people have been found to have the new virus, a coronavirus, and seven patients are still in severe condition, China's health commission said. There is no evidence that the virus can be spread between humans, according to the commission.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: 7,000 security personnel to be deployed in Bengaluru on New Year's Eve
text: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao has said that around 7,000 police personnel will be on extra vigil across the city to ensure peaceful New Year's Eve celebration.  "Traffic will be regulated and parking of vehicles, including two-wheelers will be banned on main streets in city centre from 8 pm tomorrow to 6 am on January 1 to prevent jams."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Filmmakers insisted on feeding hero 1st & I'd say I'm hungry: Neha on sexism
text: Speaking about facing sexism in the South film industry years ago, Neha Dhupia revealed, "[The filmmakers] always insisted on feeding the hero first and I'd just be like 'I'm hungry'." "They'd be like, 'But he's in a shot and he'll pick up the plate first'," she added. "But that was many years ago...Things like that don't happen anymore," said Neha.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Your art will endure: Musk on sci-fi visual artist Syd Mead's death
text: Tesla and SpaceX founder and CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to condole the death of sci-fi visual artist Sydney Jay Mead, or 'Syd Mead'. The industrial designer is best known for his concept art for sci-fi movies Blade Runner, Tron, Star Trek: The Motion Picture and Mission Impossible 3, among others. Mead died aged 86 after battling lymphoma.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: If BJP was against citizenship to Muslims, Adnan wouldn't have got it: Madhav
text: Amid anti-CAA protests, BJP National General Secretary Ram Madhav said that if the party was against giving citizenship to Muslims, it "wouldn't have given citizenship to singer Adnan Sami who's from Pakistan". Further giving an example of a "waterproof watch", Madhav said, "The mind of opposition leaders who are opposing the CAA is knowledge proof and information proof."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Dale Steyn criticises Indian fan for mocking South Africa's win vs England
text: Fast bowler Dale Steyn criticised an Indian fan for mocking South Africa's victory against England in Centurion Test. Commenting on Steyn's congratulatory tweet, the fan wrote, "Playing at home! Chill out for god sakes." In response, Steyn tweeted, "I guess India in India also doesn't count then either...And just by the way, God has nothing to do with this. Idiot."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: You need wicket-taking bowlers over all-rounders in T20 World Cup: Kumble
text: Ex-India captain and coach Anil Kumble has said India should have more wicket-taking bowlers over all-rounders at next year's ICC T20 World Cup. He added that Team India should explore more wicket-taking options even if it means playing more fast bowlers than all-rounders. "It’s very important that India starts thinking about who will perform in Australian conditions," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Your lovely advice can't be forgotten: Rashid on dad's 1st death anniversary
text: On his father's first death anniversary, Afghanistan's 21-year-old spinner Rashid Khan tweeted, "Your lovely advice and sweet corrections can’t be forgotten.I still feel your presence around me each time I am about to take every step in my life." He added, "You are part of my success story and I hope you remain happy even in death."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rashid Khan introduces his 'camel' bat in BBL, SRH ask him to carry it for IPL
text: Adelaide Strikers' Afghan spinner Rashid Khan introduced his newly designed bat dubbed 'The Camel' in Big Bash League. Unlike the regular bats, Rashid's bat has a small depression on back side and gives the look of a camel with two humps. SRH asked Rashid to carry the bat for IPL 2020 to which he replied, "Definitely...will be there as well."
author: Anmol Sharma
