headlines: Can't be overconfident: Delhi CM Kejriwal on Assembly elections
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that there should not be overconfidence during the time of the Assembly election. He said, "Within 24 hours, situations can change. Incidents can happen and there is always an element of uncertainty." The Aam Aadmi Party had won 67 out of 70 seats in the last Assembly elections in 2015.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 4 killed in blast at chemical storage terminal in Gujarat
text: Four persons were killed on Monday after a fire triggered by an explosion spread inside a methanol storage tank of a private firm near Kandla Port in Gujarat, a police officer said. The Deendayal Port Trust said that the roof of the tank blew away due to the blaze. The bodies of the victims were recovered and sent for post-mortem.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Government to create 1 lakh tonnes of onion buffer stock in 2020
text: In order to prevent onion crisis, Centre has decided to create a buffer stock of 1 lakh tonnes of onions in 2020, a senior government official said on Monday. The government had created a buffer stock of 56,000 tonnes for the current year but it wasn't sufficient to contain the prices. The government was compelled to import through state-run MMTC.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: CCTVs in all stations and coaches by 2022: Railway Board Chairman
text: Railway Board Chairman VK Yadav on Monday said that Indian Railways has floated tenders for installation of CCTV cameras at all stations and in all train coaches by 2022. "[Till] December this year...Railways has installed CCTVs at 503 railway stations across the country," he said. He added that ₹2,000 crore have been allotted for CCTV camera installation at 6,100 stations.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Centre alleges firm not returning data of 45 lakh ex-servicemen
text: The Delhi Police has filed an FIR against a private company on a complaint by the Defence Ministry for allegedly not returning a database containing personal information of 45 lakh ex-servicemen after it completed a contract for Ex-Servicemen Contributory Health Scheme (ECHS) smart cards. The case was revealed because of the RTI applications filed by activist Commodore Lokesh Batra (retired).
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: CAA will be implemented at any cost: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy
text: Union Minister of State for Home G Kishan Reddy on Monday said central government will go ahead with implementation of Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) despite protests against it. "CAA will be implemented at any cost as it is not against any Indian citizen," he said. He also criticised Congress, saying that it was dividing people in the name of religion.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Yogi gave free hand to cops to save chair: Akhilesh on CAA protests
text: Commenting on deaths of people protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Uttar Pradesh, SP leader Akhilesh Yadav has alleged that CM Yogi Adityanath "gave free hand to police to save his chair" because "over 200 MLAs were upset with him". "This state has seen great CMs...but none of them would've said 'thok do' on the House floor," Akhilesh added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Ex-East Bengal footballer dies while playing match in Kerala
text: Former East Bengal and Mohun Bagan defender Radhakrishnan Dhanarajan died on Sunday night while playing a 'Sevens' football match at Perinthalmanna in Malappuram. The 39-year-old suddenly collapsed while playing and was suffering from the loss of breath and chest pain. Dhanarajan was immediately taken to a hospital but doctors declared him brought dead.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Country proud of both Mary Kom and Nikhat Zareen: Rijiju
text: Writing about the spat between MC Mary Kom and Nikhat Zareen, India's Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju stated, "Nikhat Zareen is an amazing boxer who has the potential to follow the footsteps of Mary Kom. India is proud of both of them. Period..." Mary defeated Zareen 9-1 in the trials held on Saturday to make the squad for February's Olympic Qualifiers.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Govt launches portal for Delhi-NCR residents to block stolen phones
text: Government has launched a web portal for Delhi, Noida, Gurugram and Ghaziabad residents to request tracing and blocking stolen and lost phones. Through the portal, only the reported phone will be blocked and no other device having the same IMEI (International Mobile Equipment Identity) number would be affected. In case the phone is recovered, it will be unblocked.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Samsung patents phone with expandable display: Reports
text: Samsung reportedly filed a patent for a smartphone with an expandable display which will give users more screen when required. The patent stated a user would be able to increase or decrease size of display with help of a movable backside plate. The phone also has a sensor that calculates the degree of increase or decrease of the screen size.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Dating app TrulyMadly reports ₹19.6 lakh profit in FY19
text: Online dating platform TrulyMadly reported a profit of around ₹19.6 lakh in the financial year 2018-19, but saw a decline in its revenue. As per filings, its revenue from operations stood at ₹2.89 crore, down from ₹3.61 crore the year before. The platform's expenses declined as well. TrulyMadly's expenses reduced from ₹3.59 crore in 2017-18 to ₹3.22 crore in FY19.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: IAS officer arrested for taking ₹1 lakh bribe in Odisha
text: An IAS officer was arrested in Odisha's Bhubaneswar on Monday for taking ₹1 lakh in bribe for passing a bill. Bijay Ketan Upadhyaya, posted as Director of Odisha's Horticulture Department, was arrested by Vigilance Cell officers, after being caught red-handed. A vigilance officer said Upadhyaya was under the scanner due to allegations of illegal activities against him.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Foreign country helped plan blast that killed over 80: Somalia
text: Somalia's National Intelligence & Security Agency (NISA) said that a foreign country had helped plan the December 28 blast in Mogadishu that killed over 80 people. NISA added that it would investigate the incident with the help of a foreign intelligence agency. No one has claimed the responsibility for the blast however Mogadishu's Mayor blamed al-Qaeda-linked group al-Shabaab for it.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Bangladesh suspends plan to open human milk bank after protests
text: Bangladesh suspended its plans to open a human milk bank meant to feed up to 500 orphans and infants of working mothers after protests from clerics who said it would violate Islamic law. Critics of the plan said that Sharia law would be violated if two infants drank milk from the same donor and later married.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Tata Sons well-positioned, stronger and future ready: Chairman to staff
text: In a mail to employees, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran said that the group is "well-positioned" to build on its legacy and is "stronger" than before. "Macro uncertainties will persist in 2020, but they will also be accompanied by new opportunities," Chandrasekaran said. His comments come after the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal had termed his appointment illegal.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Army chief Bipin Rawat named India's 1st Chief of Defence Staff
text: Army chief Bipin Rawat has been named India's first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS). Rawat has been given the post just a day before he was to retire from service after completing a full three-year term as the Chief of Army Staff. He will also head Department of Military Affairs which will be created under Ministry of Defence.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Fire broke out in SPG reception area, very much under control now: PMO
text: Prime Minister's Office (PMO) has confirmed that a minor fire broke out at 9, Lok Kalyan Marg. It added that the fire was caused by a short circuit and is "very much under control now". "This was not in PM's residential or office area but in the SPG reception area of the LKM complex," PMO further said in its tweet.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Fire reported at PM Modi's residence, nine fire tenders rushed to spot
text: Fire has been reported at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's residence at 7, Lok Kalyan Marg in Delhi at around 7.25 pm today. As many as nine fire tenders have been rushed to the spot after an alarm of blaze was raised. As per initial reports, it is a minor fire and there have been no injuries.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Aadhaar-PAN linking deadline extended from Dec 31, 2019 to March 31, 2020
text: Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) on Monday extended the deadline for linking PAN with Aadhaar card from December 31, 2019, to March 31, 2020. This is the eighth time that the department has extended the deadline for the same. Earlier this month, the Income Tax Department tweeted to remind citizens of the deadline, stating that the linkage is "mandatory".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 66-year-old Romanian woman dies after 'igniting like torch' on operation table
text: A 66-year-old pancreatic cancer patient died in Bucharest, Romania on Sunday after she suffered 40% burns when surgeons used an electrical scalpel that came in contact with an alcohol-based disinfectant. The patient 'ignited like a torch', lawmaker Emanuel Ungureanu said, citing medical staff. A nurse threw a bucket of water onto the woman to prevent the fire from spreading.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Anti-CAA, NRC rangoli spotted outside DMK leaders' residences
text: Anti-CAA and NRC kolam or rangoli was spotted outside residences of DMK leaders MK Stalin and M Karunanidhi in Chennai. Alongside the kolam, a word was drawn which said "vendam (don't need/ no) CAA-NRC." This came a day after several people were detained by police for making rangoli against CAA and NRC. The detainees were released later in the day.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: ICC share latest Test batsmen rankings on Instagram, Chahal trolls them
text: The ICC took to Instagram to share the top 10 Test batsmen as per the latest rankings. Team India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal trolled ICC by commenting, "ICC, why you only showed 10 players list because my name is on 11th number." Reacting to Chahal's comment, a fan wrote, "Uske liye Test khelna padta hai India ke liye bro."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Faf Du Plessis criticises Sourav Ganguly’s idea of Super Series
text: South Africa captain Faf du Plessis has criticised BCCI President Sourav Ganguly's idea of having an annual Super Series. He said, "There's a lot of movement going towards that, a lot more matches being played against the top three, or big three. It’s probably better if you include more teams...the better to grow the game as much as you can."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kejriwal not like Castro, Guevara as was believed earlier: Javadekar
text: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Monday took a swipe at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal by saying, "In 2015, people believed him (Kejriwal) to be a...revolutionary, as Fidel Castro or Che Guevara." "But now they are fed up with lies," he added. Kejriwal's "empire of lies" will be finished and BJP will come to power after Delhi Assembly polls, Javadekar said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Srinagar records coldest night of season at -6.5 degrees Celsius
text: The cold intensified in the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir on Monday, with the minimum temperature in Srinagar dropping to the season's lowest of minus 6.5 degrees Celsius, four degrees below normal, the India Meteorological Department said. In Jammu, the minimum temperature was recorded at 2.4 degrees Celsius, five degrees below normal and the coldest in five years.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: What has led to Delhi's coldest December day in last 119 years?
text: Delhi experienced its coldest December day since 1901 today with the maximum temperature being 9.4 degrees Celsius. As per Skymet, Delhi has been reeling under both cold day and cold wave condition, an extremely rare phenomenon. A thick cover of fog, clouding, cold northwesterly winds and lack of sunshine forced day temperature in Delhi to create the record, Skymet added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rape accused beaten by mob, stabbed to death by minor victim's cousin
text: A 55-year-old man accused of raping an 11-year-old girl was allegedly stabbed to death by her cousin at a hospital in Karnataka's Navalgund on Sunday. The accused was brought to the hospital on Friday after he was beaten by the girl's father and others who caught him raping the girl. They had later handed over the accused to the police.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: How are trains running in J&K amid snow deposition on tracks?
text: The Northern Railway's Twitter handle has shared a video of how the Indian Railways is keeping train services running in Jammu and Kashmir amid snow deposition on rail tracks. The Railways has deployed a dedicated Loco Pilot, the WDS-4 locomotive and a Snow Cutter to clear the tracks before the arrival of passenger trains on the Banihal-Srinagar section.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Without buyer, Air India might be forced to shut down in 6 months: Official
text: Air India might be forced to shut down by June 2020 unless it finds a buyer as "piecemeal" arrangements cannot be sustained for long, a PTI report quoted a senior airline official on Monday. The official also said there's need for funds to restart operations of 12 grounded narrow-body planes. The airline has a debt burden of around ₹60,000 crore.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Want Bale to give an interview in Spanish: Courtois
text: Speaking about the allegations of avoiding speaking Spanish levelled against his Real Madrid teammate Gareth Bale, Thibaut Courtois said, "[H]e speaks better Spanish than people think. He could give an interview in Spanish perfectly well." "I want to see him go out and give an interview in Spanish because he speaks very well in the dressing room," Courtois added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Steyn shares video of Maxwell dousing fire before Big Bash game
text: Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell was seen dousing bushfire on the streets of Launceston ahead of his side Melbourne Stars' clash against Hobart Hurricanes in the Big Bash League. Maxwell was seen dousing a fire with a fire extinguisher on the street and the video of the incident was shared by his Thunders teammate Dale Steyn on Instagram.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Brazil fines Facebook $1.6 mn for improper sharing of user data
text: Facebook has been fined $1.64 million by Brazil for sharing user data improperly, Brazil's Ministry of Justice said. Data of over four lakh users was made available for "questionable" intentions by the US tech giant to developers of an app called 'thisisyourdigitallife'. The ministry said that an investigation was launched against Facebook following the Cambridge Analytica incident in 2018.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Govt decides to give 5G spectrum for trials to all players including Huawei
text: All telecom players, including Huawei, will be given 5G spectrum for trials which will be held in January, Telecom Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said on Monday. Telecom companies can partner with vendors including Nokia, Huawei and Ericsson. Earlier, Huawei had offered a 'no-backdoor' deal to the Indian government to ease security concerns after US banned the firm for similar reasons.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: 140 ft long 'Stairway To Heaven' hangs over a 2,296 ft abyss in Austria
text: 'Sky Ladder', also known as the 'Stairway To Heaven', is a 140-ft long ladder that stretches over a 2,296 ft gorge of the Grosser Donnerkogel mountain in Upper Austria. It bridges a giant gorge on the Donnerkogel via Ferrata (a protected climbing route found in the Alps). The ladder begins at a point that's already 700 metres above the ground.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Located at 12,073 ft, Tungnath temple is one of world's highest Shiva temples
text: Tungnath is one of the highest Shiva temples in the world and is the highest of the five Panch Kedar temples located in the mountain range of Tunganath in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag district. It is located at an altitude of 3,680 m (12,073 ft), and just below the peak of Chandrashila. The temple is believed to be over 1,000 years old.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No MDR on RuPay, UPI transactions will kill digital payments industry: PCI
text: Payments Council of India (PCI) Chairman criticised government's move which revokes merchant charges on digital transactions via RuPay and UPI platforms, saying it'll kill the digital payments industry. "It's like nationalisation of payments industry. If government wants to drive digitisation, then it should bear the cost," Vishwas Patel said. Government will revoke MDR charges from January 1.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Moscow authorities bring artificial snow for New Year festivities
text: Authorities in Moscow, Russia have placed artificial snow in parts of the city ahead of the New Year celebrations and as decorations for displays. Moscow recorded a temperature of over 5.3 degrees Celsius on December 18, the highest temperature recorded since 1886. The artificial snow will be used to create "a snowboarding hill" for New Year celebrations, an official said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Sudan sentences 29 officials to death for protester's killing
text: A Sudanese court sentenced 29 intelligence agents to death over the torture and killing of Ahmed al-Khair, a protester, in detention in February during mass protests against Sudan's ex-President Omar al-Bashir. Khair's family said that the security forces earlier claimed that he had died due to poisoning. The protests that began last December led to al-Bashir stepping down in April.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Turkey detains over 90 Islamic State suspects ahead of New Year
text: Turkey has detained over 90 people suspected of having ties with the Islamic State (ISIS) ahead of New Year celebrations, state media said. Reportedly, Turkey has been detaining ISIS suspects in late December ever since the terror group claimed an attack on a nightclub in 2017 that killed 30 people. Istanbul police said the detentions were to prevent potential attacks.
author: Shailesh

headlines: British woman found guilty of lying by Cyprus court in gang rape case
text: A Cyprus court found a British woman guilty of lying about being gang-raped by 12 Israeli tourists in a hotel room in July. The woman had retracted her accusation after a few days which she later claimed to have done so under pressure from local police. Dismissing the woman's claim, she was convicted of public mischief by the court.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Greta stopped talking to people: Father on illness before activism
text: Svante Thunberg, father of climate activist Greta Thunberg, said that his daughter had fallen ill "3-4 years" before she began her activism. Greta had stopped talking to people, except for her parents, sibling and one teacher during the time, he added. Svante claimed that Greta has been feeling better ever since she began her activism against climate change.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Hinduja Group working on bidding for Jet Airways: Reports
text: The Hinduja Group is preparing a bid to buy Jet Airways and is looking for an additional partner, reports said. The group has started working on an Expression of Interest (EoI) and plans to submit it before the January 15 deadline. Earlier, Hinduja had planned on bidding for Jet Airways along with Etihad but the UAE-based airline scrapped the deal.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Exit from Rajiv Chowk Metro Station to not be allowed after 9 pm on December 31
text: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has announced that exit from Rajiv Chowk Metro Station will not be allowed after 9 pm to ease overcrowding on New Year's Eve (December 31). However, the entry of passengers at the station will be allowed till the departure of the last train. Rajiv Chowk is one of the busiest stations on the Delhi Metro network.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: First time that a CM is talking about revenge from public: Priyanka on Yogi
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday criticised Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath for saying that his government will take "revenge" from those damaging public properties during anti-Citizenship Act protests. "It's probably the first time that any CM has made such a statement," she said. "There's no place of violence in the soul of this country," the Congress leader added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Why was Maharashtra Congress MLA KC Padavi made to take oath again?
text: Seven-time Congress MLA KC Padavi was halted midway into his oath as Maharashtra Cabinet minister by Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Monday. Towards the end of his oath, Padavi went on to speak a few lines beyond the text of the oath provided to him. The Governor refused to accept the swearing-in and asked Padavi to take the oath again.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Just ensure your name on voter list, leave rest on me: Mamata on CAA
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday continued her protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Purulia. "Just ensure your names are there on the voters' list. The rest will be taken care of by me," Banerjee said, adding, "No one will have to leave the country." She also urged the political parties to isolate the BJP across the country.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: DU makes prior intimation of any protest mandatory amid anti-CAA stir
text: Delhi University on Friday issued a notice saying it should be informed in advance about any "gathering/ protest/ demonstration", amid widespread student protests against the newly enacted Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). The notice also said that organisers should furnish details of the program to the Proctor's office, at least 24 hours in advance.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Ricky Ponting names his 'Test Team of 2010s'; includes 3 Australians, 1 Indian
text: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting took to Twitter on Monday to reveals his 'Test Team of 2010s'. The 45-year-old named Australia batsman David Warner and former England captain Alastair Cook as the openers. Virat Kohli has been named the captain and number five batsman. Steve Smith and Nathan Lyon are the other two Australians named in the side.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Put away your phones and communicate with your families: Pope Francis
text: Pope Francis urged people to stop using mobile phones at meal tables and have "silence like at a Mass", and instead spend time with families. "Fathers, parents, children, grandparents, brothers and sisters – this is a task to undertake today," he added. He had earlier criticised people for using their phones during a Mass, saying it's a "very ugly thing".
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: No decision on increasing passenger, freight fares: Railway Board Chief
text: Railway Board Chairman Vinod Kumar Yadav has said no decision has been taken to increase passenger and freight fares. Last week, Yadav said Indian Railways was in the process of "rationalising" its passenger and freight fares. "In the New Year, Railways will try to give better facilities to its passengers and also focus on running more trains," he had said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Complaint against RSS chief for '130 crore Indians are Hindus' remark
text: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao has filed a complaint against RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat for saying that Sangh considered all 130 crore Indians as Hindus. "The statement of Bhagwat not only hurts...sentiments...of Muslims, Christians, Sikhs, Parsis etc, but is also against the spirit and tenor of the Constitution of India," said Rao in his complaint.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: JD(U) bigger than BJP in Bihar, should fight more seats: Prashant
text: JD(U) Vice President Prashant Kishor has said that his party is bigger than the BJP in Bihar with more MLAs. Kishor said that the BJP and the JD(U) can fight the 2020 Assembly elections on 1:1.4 seat-sharing ratio like the last time the two parties had contested together in the Assembly polls. He added that it cannot be 1:1 ratio.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Delhi govt will pay board exam fees of NDMC school students: Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that his government will pay board exam fees of students of New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) and Delhi Cantonment schools. He announced that the decision was approved by his Cabinet. Kejriwal-led Delhi government had earlier said that it will pay the board exam fees of all government CBSE school students.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 20-yr-old dies during stunt on train, Railways shares video to warn youth
text: A 20-year-old youth died while performing stunts in a local train between Maharashtra's Diva and Mumbra after being hit by a pole on Thursday. Sharing a video of the accident, the Ministry of Railways tweeted, "Do not do stunts in the train, it's illegal and can prove fatal." MoS of Railways Suresh Angadi also released a video after the accident.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's forest, tree cover up by over 5,000 sq km since 2017: Govt
text: India's forest and tree cover went up by 5,188 square kilometres in two years, the government said on Monday. This was revealed in India State of Forest Report (2019), released by Union Minister of Environment, Forest and Climate Change Prakash Javadekar. Top three states that showed an increase in forest cover are Karnataka, followed by Andhra Pradesh and Kerala.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Coldest December day in last 119 years in Delhi recorded today
text: Delhi experienced its coldest December day since 1901 today with the maximum temperature being just 9.4 degrees Celsius, the IMD announced. The IMD said the Aya Nagar weather station recorded the day temperature at 7.8 degrees Celsius, followed by Delhi Ridge (8.4), Palam (9), Lodi Road (9.2). Delhi has been experiencing "severe cold days" since December 14, the IMD added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Varanasi-bound Cambodian monk caught with 3 wild boar teeth at B'luru airport
text: Chan Shopheap, a Varanasi-bound 44-year-old Cambodian monk was arrested after security personnel found three wild boar teeth in his bag at the Kempegowda International Airport. As per the security, Shopheap failed to produce documents for carrying the wildlife item. He was handed over to the jurisdictional international airport police which booked him under the Wildlife Protection Act.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 6 of UP family suffocate to death in sleep due to smoke after fridge, TV catch fire
text: Five children, aged between 5-12, and their 40-year-old aunt were suffocated to death in their sleep following a short circuit in which the refrigerator and TV caught fire in their house in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh on Sunday. "Their bodies...had minor burn injuries," said police. Neighbours stated they came to know about it when the children didn't get up for school.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: TN college expels female students for drinking at house party after video leaks
text: A college in Nagapattinam district of Tamil Nadu has expelled four of its female students for consuming alcohol along with their male friends during a party at one of their houses six weeks ago. The expulsion came after a video of them consuming beer started circulating on social media platforms. The group of students was reportedly celebrating a girl's birthday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 5 J&K leaders detained since abrogation of Article 370, released
text: The Jammu and Kashmir administration on Monday released five political leaders detained since the abrogation of Article 370 on August 5. These leaders belong to Jammu and Kashmir National Conference (NC), Jammu and Kashmir Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and Congress. The leaders included Ishfaq Jabbar and Ghulam Nabi Bhat (NC), Bashir Mir (Congress) and Zahoor Mir and Yasir Reshi (PDP).
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Farah, Raveena meet Cardinal, apologise for hurting religious sentiments
text: Farah Khan and Raveena Tandon met Indian Cardinal of Roman Catholic Church, Cardinal Oswald Gracias, after the duo, along with Bharti Singh were booked for allegedly hurting Christian community's religious sentiments on a web show. "He very graciously accepted our apology. He also issued...statement on our behalf," Farah said. Multiple FIRs were registered against them in Punjab for the same.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: West Ham re-appoint David Moyes for 18 month period
text: West Ham United have reappointed David Moyes as head coach on an 18-month deal to replace the sacked Manuel Pellegrini. Moyes, a former manager of Manchester United and Real Sociedad, returns to the Hammers for a second stint after he saved the club from getting dropped in the relegation in the 2017-18 campaign during a six-month deal.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Short replaces Abbott in Australia's ODI squad for India tour
text: Australia have announced the squad for the upcoming ODI series to be played in India. D'Arcy Short has been called up to replace injured seamer, Sean Abbott. "It is extremely unfortunate for Sean who is very much a part of our white-ball squad plans leading into the ICC T20 World Cup and the [2023] World Cup," selector Trevor Hohns said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Long-range EVs are worse for the planet than diesels: Mazda
text: Long-range batteries for electric cars are worse for the environment than a diesel car, Japanese automaker Mazda's European research director Christian Schultze said. Mazda claimed this by comparing the lifetime CO2 emissions of its shorter-range electric car Mazda's MX-30 (with a 35.5kWh battery) to a diesel Mazda 3 hatchback. Schultze said a 95 kWh battery would have higher CO2 emissions.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Notice to govt, Delhi Police for facial recognition at PM rally
text: Internet Freedom Foundation (IFF) sent a legal notice to the government and Delhi Police over mass surveillance by using facial recognition software, AFRS, at PM Narendra Modi's rally. IFF called the usage illegal and demanded a complete halt and recall of AFRS. It also added such use of technology for building database impaired rights of ordinary Indians.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Data of 2.4 million users leaked by US security camera startup
text: Personal information of over 2.4 million customers of US-based security camera startup Wyze was exposed in a data leak earlier this month, the startup confirmed. The data leak happened when Wyze's database was accidentally left open to the internet while transferring to a new database. Personal health details, usernames and e-mail addresses, among others, were exposed.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Kim urges 'positive & offensive' policy for N Korea's security
text: As the year-end deadline set by North Korean leader Kim Jong-un for nuclear talks with the US approaches, state media reported that he has called for "positive and offensive measures" for the country's security. Kim called a meeting of top Workers' Party officials recently, it said. Reportedly, Kim suggested action in areas of armed forces, munitions industry and foreign affairs.
author: Shailesh

headlines: BSNL clears November salaries worth ₹800 crore for employees
text: State-run telecom firm BSNL has cleared staff salaries amounting to ₹800 crore for November on Monday, BSNL's Chairman PK Purwar announced. "Stability in the salary payment schedule is expected to take two to three months more," Purwar said. BSNL has also cleared vendor dues worth ₹1,700 crore that were pending for over six months.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Creditors to DHFL claim dues of ₹87,905 cr under resolution process
text: The lenders, bondholders, employees and other creditors to Dewan Housing Finance (DHFL) have claimed dues worth ₹87,905.6 crore under the insolvency resolution process, documents showed. However, this excludes the holders of fixed deposits, to whom DHFL reportedly owed ₹6,188 crore as of July. Among financial creditors, the SBI, including SBI Singapore, had the largest claim worth ₹10,083 crore.
author: Dharna

headlines: Over 500 flights delayed, 21 diverted, 5 cancelled due to fog at Delhi Airport
text: As per a Delhi Airport official, over 500 flights have been delayed, 21 diverted and five flights cancelled due to dense fog at the airport. "Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information. Inconvenience caused to the flier is regretted," Delhi Airport authority said in a statement. Several airlines have issued travel advisories.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: First pics of Salman's newborn niece shared by her father Aayush Sharma
text: Actor Aayush Sharma took to Instagram on Monday to share the first pictures of his newborn daughter and Salman Khan's niece Ayat. "Welcome to this beautiful world Ayat. You've brought a lot of happiness into our lives. May you touch everyone's life with a lot of love and joy," he wrote. Ayat was born on Salman's birthday on December 27.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: FIR against 6 policemen for killing man in UP during anti-CAA protest
text: The family of a 20-year-old who was killed during anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protest in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor has filed a complaint against six policemen, claiming that he was shot by the police. "The complaint has been clubbed with the cases registered against the vandals," SP (rural) Vishwajeet Srivastava said. However, police have said that the 20-year-old was shot in self-defence.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Won't allow implementation of CAA in Punjab, will fight it tooth and nail: CM
text: While addressing Congress party leaders and workers at a protest march in Ludhiana, Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh said that his government will not allow implementation of Citizenship (Amendment) Act in the state. He added, "Congress would continue to fight it tooth and nail." State party president Sunil Jakhar and Asha Kumari also attended the protest.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Why did NZ opener raise his bat with handle upwards after ton vs Australia?
text: New Zealand opener Tom Blundell raised his bat with handle pointing upwards after scoring a ton against Australia in the Melbourne Test. The 29-year-old's bat featured a multi-coloured grip in support of six-year-old Hollie Beattie who suffers from neuroblastoma, a rare form of cancer. Blundell is raising money by helping sell 'Helping Hollie' bat grips.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 25 Cabinet Ministers & 10 MoS take oath in Maha Cabinet expansion
text: A total of 25 MLAs took oath as Cabinet Ministers and 10 as Ministers of State in Maharashtra on Monday. NCP leader Ajit Pawar took the oath as Deputy CM, while former Maharashtra CM Ashok Chavan from Congress took oath as a Cabinet Minister. Shiv Sena leader and CM Uddhav Thackeray's son Aaditya Thackeray was also included in the Cabinet.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Aaditya Thackeray takes oath by taking mother's name before father's
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's son Aaditya Thackeray took his mother Rashmi Thackeray's name ahead of his father's while taking oath as the state's Cabinet Minister on Monday. Taking the oath, Aaditya said, "I Aaditya Rashmi Uddhav Thackeray...". Notably, Aaditya is the first member of the Thackeray family to contest and win Maharashtra Assembly elections.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Everyone going vegan still wouldn't stop climate change: Elon Musk
text: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I support people choosing whatever diet makes them happy, but it's true that everyone going vegan still wouldn't stop climate change." He was responding to a Twitter user who called the vegans "insane". "Moving billions of tons of hydrocarbons from deep underground into atmosphere & oceans is fundamentally the issue," Musk added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 9 Indian tech startups became unicorns, 128 got acquired in 2019: Tracxn
text: As many as nine Indian tech startups became unicorns (achieved $1 billion and above valuation), 128 startups got acquired and four got publicly listed, Tracxn's India Tech 2019 report stated. Close to 1,894 startups were founded whereas 887 were funded this year, Tracxn added. Overall, Delhi-NCR has about the most number of unicorns in India at eleven, the report added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Scientist who created world's 1st gene-edited babies jailed for 3 years in China
text: He Jiankui, the scientist who created world's first gene-edited babies has been sentenced to three years in prison by a Chinese court. According to court's findings, he worked with two medical researchers, Zhang Renli and Qin Jinzhou, to use gene-editing technology to produce babies that were resistant to HIV. Jiankui has also been fined 3 million yuan (over ₹3 crore).
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Rare species of snake worth ₹1.25 crore rescued in Madhya Pradesh
text: A rare red sand boa snake, worth around ₹1.25 crore, was rescued from five persons, who were trying to sell it in Madhya Pradesh on Sunday, an official said. The five accused, including three minors, have been taken into custody, the official added. These rare non-poisonous snakes are used for making certain medicines, cosmetics and in black magic, police said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 24-yr-old man dies after complaining of 'uneasiness' at Goa's Sunburn Fest
text: A 24-year-old Bengaluru resident, who was in Goa to attend Sunburn Festival, collapsed and died after complaining of 'uneasiness' near the venue on Sunday, police said. On Friday, two tourists from Andhra Pradesh had collapsed at the entry gate after feeling uneasy and were later declared dead. Congress had alleged drug overdose as cause of death of the two tourists.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Delhi Metro use 'Power Rangers' meme to describe their 10-year journey
text: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation's official Twitter handle shared a collage of fictional characters from American action series 'Power Rangers' to describe their 10-year journey. The first image titled 'Beginning of the decade' showed three Power Rangers- red, blue and yellow- to depict three lines, while the second 'End of the decade' featured more colours showing lines added over the years.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: No security breach during Priyanka Gandhi's Lucknow visit: CRPF
text: Two days after Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra alleged that she was manhandled by a police officer in Lucknow, the CRPF on Monday said there was no breach in her security. The CRPF which provides Priyanka Gandhi armed commandos under the 'Z+' category of security cover, also blamed her for "violations" for travelling as a pillion rider on a scooter.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Mahindra shares pics he took in 1970s, says 'good life still dream for many'
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra recently took to Twitter to share three pictures from the early 1970s when he was studying photography. He tweeted, "These made me wonder whether a lot has changed...or not. For many, a good life is still a 'Sapna'...(dream)." Mahindra studied filmmaking from Harvard University, from where he graduated in 1977.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: SBI cuts external benchmark based rate by 25 bps, home loans to get cheaper
text: State Bank of India on Monday announced a reduction in its external benchmark based rate (EBR) by 25 bps to 7.80% per annum, from 8.05% per annum. With this cut, the interest rate for existing home loan customers would come down by 25 basis points. SBI said new homebuyers will get loans at an interest rate from 7.90% per annum.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: It was nostalgic: Ajay on working with Akshay in Sooryavanshi
text: Ajay Devgn, who has worked with Akshay Kumar in films like 'Insan' and 'Khakee', has said working with Akshay in 'Sooryavanshi' was nostalgic. "Felt like Akshay and I took off from where we left," he added. "We respect each other, and have [been witness to] one another's journey, because we started our careers only a year apart," Ajay further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: We need to look at terms 'hero', 'heroine' in gender-neutral way: Bhumi
text: Bhumi Pednekar has said the terms 'hero' and 'heroine' shouldn't be looked from the "lens of Bollywood" but in a "gender-neutral" way. "If someone asks me who my 'hero' is, I'll say, it's my mother. I wouldn't call her the 'heroine' of my life," she added. Bhumi will play the role of an IPS officer in an upcoming film, 'Durgavati'.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Jealous of girls doing such good work, wish I was younger now: Neena
text: Neena Gupta has said she got a new lease of life after getting the "substantial roles" in films like 'Badhaai Ho', 'Mulk' and 'Veere Di Wedding'. "But I'm also very sad, I wish I was much younger now," she added. "There are so many...possibilities, so I get jealous of all...young girls who are doing such good work," Neena further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Sack Army chief for remarks on protesters: Cong MP to President
text: Congress Lok Sabha MP from Thrissur TN Prathapan has written to President Ram Nath Kovind asking him to sack Army chief General Bipin Rawat for criticising people leading anti-CAA protests. Prathapan said in his letter that Rawat has violated code of conduct for defence personnel. He also urged Kovind to "take serious and stringent appropriate disciplinary action" against Rawat.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Tammy's late goal completes Chelsea's late win over Arsenal
text: Tammy Abraham's finish from under the legs of Bernd Leno helped Chelsea complete a late comeback win against Arsenal on Sunday. Arsenal had taken the lead through a 13th-minute header from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, after which it took Chelsea 70 minutes to register their first goal through Jorginho. Abraham's 87th-minute strike took his season's goal tally to 12.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Trump's whistleblower tweet temporarily blocked during Twitter outage
text: A tweet in which US President Donald Trump named the alleged whistleblower who was involved in disclosing Trump's call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was blocked during a Twitter 'outage'. The tweet was temporarily blocked on Saturday for all his followers and was visible again on Sunday. However, the account that originally shared the alleged whistleblower's name was deleted.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Tesla delivers the 1st Model 3 made at its new China factory
text: US-based electric automaker Tesla on Monday delivered its first China-made Model 3, within 357 days of starting the construction of its $2-billion Shanghai-based factory. The first batch of 15 cars was delivered to Tesla employees, one of whom proposed marriage to his girlfriend soon after receiving the Model 3. The China-made Model 3 sedan is priced at $50,000 before subsidies.
author: Dharna

headlines: 5 men chop off girl's nose after failing to kidnap her in Gurugram
text: A group of five men chopped off the nose of a girl after they failed to kidnap her in Gurugram on Sunday, police said. The girl's brothers resisted their attempt and when the men were unable to drag her out, they began beating up the family members. Police have registered a case but no arrests have been made so far.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 2 killed by gunman in US during live-streaming of church service
text: A gunman fatally shot two people in a church in Texas, US during a Sunday service, that was being live-streamed on social media. The two victims later died in a hospital while the attacker was killed by an armed volunteer security force of the congregation. Texas Governor expressed gratitude to church members "who acted quickly to take down the shooter".
author: Shailesh

headlines: Putin thanks Trump for info that prevented terror attacks in Russia
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin thanked US President Donald Trump over a phone call for providing information that prevented terrorist attacks in Russia, according to Russian authorities. Russia's Federal Security Service said that information received from the US led to the detention of two people on December 27 under suspicion of plotting attacks in St Petersburg during New Year festivities.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Ajit Pawar sworn in as Maharashtra Deputy CM for the 2nd time in 38 days
text: NCP leader Ajit Pawar has been sworn in as the Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra. Before Shiv Sena-NCP-Congress alliance formed government in the state, Ajit Pawar sided with BJP and was sworn in as Deputy CM on November 23. However, he resigned from the post on November 26 to be part of the Shiv Sena-NCP-Congress alliance.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Aaditya Thackeray takes oath as Cabinet Minister in Maharashtra government
text: Aaditya Thackeray on Monday took oath as Cabinet Minister in Maharashtra government. The 29-year-old won from the Worli Assembly constituency by defeating Suresh Mane of Nationalist Congress Party, which is now part of the alliance in Maharashtra, by a margin of over 70,000 votes. The Yuva Sena chief became the first member from the Thackeray family to contest an election.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I got sick but bounced back quick: Zac on reports of contracting deadly disease
text: Hollywood actor Zac Efron, who was flown to Australia after reportedly contracting a deadly disease while shooting in Papua New Guinea, shared a picture on Monday. "Very thankful to everyone who has reached out. I did get sick in Papua New Guinea but I bounced back quick," he wrote. Zac further said he is now in US for the holidays.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Kushal's mom said 'You're also Kushal, sit next to me': Kushal Tandon
text: Speaking about Kushal Punjabi's suicide, actor Kushal Tandon revealed he met Punjabi a day before his demise when he visited Tandon's restaurant. He added that he visited Punjabi's house after he heard about his death and also met his mother and sister. "I remember...his mother held my hands and said, 'You're also Kushal na, just...sit next to me'," said Kushal.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Why go to Switzerland, Delhi is freezing: Bhuvan Bam on Anushka's vacation pic
text: Comedian Bhuvan Bam has commented on a picture shared by Anushka Sharma from her vacation in Gstaad, Switzerland with her husband Virat Kohli. The picture features Varun Dhawan and his girlfriend Natasha Dalal, who are also vacationing in Gstaad. "Why did you go the hills? Delhi is freezing right now! You should've come here and eaten chole bhature," Bhuvan wrote.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 61-yr-old actress says dating app shut her account as users claimed it's fake
text: Hollywood actress Sharon Stone took to Twitter on Monday to reveal that Priyanka Chopra-backed dating app Bumble closed her account. "Some users reported that it couldn't possibly be me! Hey @bumble, is being me exclusionary? Don't shut me out of the hive," the 61-year-old tweeted. Sharon also shared a screenshot showing her account being blocked.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: PM Modi launches online campaign in support of Citizenship Act
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday launched a social media campaign on Twitter in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "#IndiaSupportsCAA because CAA is about giving citizenship to persecuted refugees and not about taking anyone's citizenship away," PM Modi tweeted. Notably, people in several parts of the country are protesting against the amended Citizenship Act.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: UP govt issues damage notices worth ₹15.35L to 59 people in Sambhal
text: Uttar Pradesh government issued notices worth ₹15.35 lakh to 59 people in Sambhal to compensate for damage to property caused during anti-CAA protests. A 57-year-old doctor, a 47-year-old activist and a 51-year-old businessman who runs two schools are among the 59 served notices. "Will [government] restrict our Constitutional right to a peaceful protest?" the 51-year-old businessman asked.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 60% decline in tourists at Taj Mahal in December due to CAA protests
text: There has been a 60% decline in visitors at Agra's Taj Mahal in December this year compared to last year due to the anti-CAA protests, an official said. Nearly 2,00,000 tourists cancelled or postponed their trip in the last two weeks. "Blocking the internet has affected tourism in Agra by about 50-60%," said Sandeep Arora, Agra Tourism Development Foundation's President.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Musk shares simulation video of 1st crewed Falcon 9 flight to space
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Monday tweeted a video simulating the first crewed flight of the Falcon 9 rocket to the Earth's orbit and back. Musk said the 'Crew Dragon' capsule, the section of the rocket which will carry astronauts and dock with International Space Station, could be "physically ready" by February but safety reviews will require another few months.
author: Dharna

headlines: Man shifts to house where 11 of family committed suicide, opens diagnostic centre
text: Dr Mohan Singh and his family have shifted to the house in Burari, Delhi where 11 members of a family committed suicide in July 2018. He has opened a diagnostic centre on the ground floor of the house. "I have no problem with it, this house is convenient as it's near the road. I am not superstitious," the doctor said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Man makes fake FB profiles of women, offers nude webcam sessions for ₹1,000 each
text: A Mumbai man has been arrested for creating fake Facebook profiles of women and offering webcam sex services. Police said he offered a 40-minute nude webcam session for ₹1,000 and a 20-minute nude video call for ₹1,500. Police further said that he used to block customers on Facebook after they paid him the money.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 3 girls found to be pregnant during check-up at college, allege sexual assault
text: Three students of a Telangana college have alleged that they were sexually assaulted by a man after they were found to be pregnant during a general health check-up at the institute. The victims have not revealed the identity of the man who had allegedly sexually assaulted them. During an investigation, they said the man lives close to their houses.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Will ensure that CRPF jawans spend 100 days a year with family: Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the government is committed to take holistic care of the CRPF jawans and their families. "We'll bring a plan wherein every jawan will be able to spend 100 days in a year with his family," Shah added. Medical check-up facility will also be made available for jawans and their families, he further said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 'Tanhaji...' not only grand but also educative: Ajay
text: Ajay Devgn, while talking about his upcoming film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', said the film is not only grand, but it's also educative and informative. "I hope [people] realise...freedom that we've achieved with such difficulties and sacrifices," he added. The film is based on the life of Tanhaji Malusare, who was the military leader of Maratha king Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I think I'm fascinated with slightly tragic characters: Janhvi
text: Talking about her upcoming horror anthology 'Ghost Stories', Janhvi Kapoor said she wanted to be part of this world and was curious about how such characters are made. Janhvi, who'll play a home nurse in Zoya Akhtar's story, further said the character resonated with her on a very "weird level". "I think I'm fascinated with slightly tragic characters," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Barack Obama shares list of his favourite movies of 2019
text: Former US President Barack Obama took to Twitter to share the list of his favourite movies of 2019. The list includes Martin Scorsese's 'The Irishman' and James Mangold's 'Ford v Ferrari' along with 'American Factory', which is a documentary from Barack and Michelle Obama's Higher Ground Productions. He also listed his three favourite TV shows, which include 'Unbelievable' and 'Watchmen'.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: 2nd FIR against Farah, Raveena, Bharti for hurting religious sentiments
text: The Punjab Police has registered a second FIR against Farah Khan, Raveena Tandon and Bharti Singh for allegedly hurting Christian community's religious sentiments on a web show. It has been registered on account of a video clip where they can be seen having trouble pronouncing the word 'Hallelujah'. On Wednesday, Amritsar Police had booked them on the same charges.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I want to survive until they shoot me down: Akshay
text: Akshay Kumar has said one has to keep up the pace as things are changing very quickly. "All you have to do is keep surviving...I've been surviving in...industry for 30 years and I want to survive more...till they shoot me down," he added. Akshay further said he feels good that all of his films have been loved by the people.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: PM shares video of Sadhguru supporting Citizenship (Amendment) Act
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday shared a video of Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev supporting the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. This comes after the PM earlier today launched a campaign on Twitter in support of the Citizenship Act. "Sadhguru provides historical context, brilliantly highlights our culture of brotherhood (and)...calls out the misinformation by vested interest groups," PM Modi tweeted.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Govt creating an all-in-one website for official data: Report
text: The government is developing an online portal that would act as a repository of all official statistics in India such as employment, industry, health, GST and trade, the Economic Times reported. Presently, data is spread across various ministries' websites. The National Integrated Information Portal (NIIP) will have a dashboard for socio-economic indicators to monitor economic health in real-time.
author: Dharna

headlines: Facebook grew 600% in last 10 yrs, gained 2.45 billion monthly users
text: Facebook grew nearly 600% in the last 10 years, with its monthly active users rising to 2.45 billion and making up almost one-third of the world's human population. At the end of 2009, Facebook had about 350 million monthly users. Two other apps owned by Facebook, namely WhatsApp and Instagram, crossed one billion monthly users in 2016 and 2018 respectively.
author: Dharna

headlines: WeWork's exit packages for co-CEOs worth $17 million: Report
text: WeWork will have to pay its co-CEOs, Artie Minson and Sebastian Gunningham, $8.3 million each if they are fired or leave WeWork for certain reasons, reported the Financial Times. The reasons include diminution of their duties, pay cuts or involuntary relocation. The co-working space startup's Chief Legal Officer Jennifer Berrent would get a $1.5-million exit package under the same conditions.
author: Dharna

headlines: GoMechanic raises ₹105 crore funding led by Chiratae, Sequoia
text: Automobile service and repair startup GoMechanic has raised ₹105 crore in a Series B round of funding led by Chiratae Ventures and Sequoia Capital. The Gurugram-based startup's existing investor Orios Venture Partners also participated in the round. Co-founded in 2016 by Amit Bhasin, Kushal Karwa, Rishabh Karwa and Nitin Rana, GoMechanic operates across nine cities in India with 215 workshops.
author: Dharna

headlines: Ghaziabad man kills 24-yr-old for not giving way to his car, arrested
text: A 24-year-old man Ashish was shot dead in Ghaziabad allegedly after he did not give way to a car, police said on Sunday. Police have arrested the car driver, identified as Krishna Pal, and recovered the weapon. The incident took place when Ashish was talking to a friend on the road and Pal asked him to make way for him.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: India needs very serious economic reforms: IMF's Gita Gopinath
text: India needs "very serious" economic reforms to deal with its growth slowdown, said International Monetary Fund (IMF) Chief Economist Gita Gopinath in an interview with the Deccan Herald. Gopinath suggested measures like quicker resolution of bad loans in the banking system, streamlining the GST regime, and labour and land reforms. She added that India is a country with tremendous potential.
author: Dharna

headlines: Private properties of former Amrapali chief to be auctioned on Jan 8
text: The private properties belonging to former Amrapali CMD Anil Sharma alongside several unsold flats in projects in Noida and Greater Noida will be auctioned online on January 8. This follows Supreme Court appointing state auctioneers to invite bids for the properties and deposit the proceeds with the court registry. The collected funds would go towards completing the stalled Amrapali projects.
author: Dharna

headlines: US strikes Iran-backed militia bases in Iraq and Syria
text: The US has conducted strikes against Iran-backed militia bases in Iraq and Syria over the death of a US contractor. The strikes targeted weapon storage facilities along with command and control locations belonging to Kataib Hezbollah, which is considered as a terrorist organisation by the US. The US contractor was killed in a rocket attack on an Iraqi military base.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Feel for his son & family: Kushal's ex-girlfriend Meghna on his suicide
text: Late actor Kushal Punjabi's ex-girlfriend, actress Meghna Naidu, while speaking about his suicide, said, "It's just tragic and shocking...He came across as a very happy and enthusiastic person, from what I saw on my friends' social media updates." "I feel for his son and family. I hope they stay strong," she added. Kushal and Meghna had broken up in 2010.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: We spend lakhs on bodies, take our minds for granted: Rohit on Kushal's suicide
text: Speaking about Kushal Punjabi's suicide, actor Rohit Roy said, "In today's age...we spend lakhs to fortify our bodies but take our minds for granted." "We treat a simple viral with medication but smile through mental ailments," he added. "Sadly, in India, people, especially actors, refuse to seek help because some believe seeing a psychiatrist is frowned upon," said Rohit.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Assam Minister takes 5-km chopper ride as anti-CAA protesters block road
text: Assam Finance Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday took a chopper ride for five-kilometre to attend a function as the Citizenship (Amendment) Act protesters blocked the road. Protesters blocked the National Highway-15 between Tezpur and Ghoramari opposing Sarma's visit and shouted slogans against CAA. He had to attend a function to pay tribute to deceased BJP MLA Rajen Borthakur.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Ex-police constable threatens to shoot anti-CAA protesters, arrested
text: Former police constable Rakesh Tyagi, who allegedly posed as a Delhi Police sub-inspector and uploaded a video threatening to shoot anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protesters, was arrested on Friday. In the video, Tyagi said, "We are following the orders of Home Minister and we will save the Constitution." "If someone pelts stone at me, I will shoot that person," he added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Work on NPR in Tamil Nadu will start in April 2020: CM Palaniswami
text: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami has announced that work on National Population Register (NPR) will begin in April 2020 in the state. Palaniswami said that it was just a population census and 34 different types of data will be collected in the first phase. He added that the NPR had no connection with the National Register of Citizens (NRC).
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Kerala CM holds all-party meeting on Citizenship Act
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Sunday called an all-party meeting on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). Opposition parties demanded a special Assembly session, a joint delegation to meet the President, legal fight in the Supreme Court and anti-CAA protests on ground. Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala said, "[We] will oppose it (CAA)...tooth and nail. It hurts crores...of people in India."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 2 Indians included in Wisden's T20I Team of the Decade, Aaron Finch named captain
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli and fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah are the only two Indians named in Wisden's T20I Team of the Decade. Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has been named captain of the side, while New Zealand's Colin Munro has been named his opening partner. Afghanistan's Mohammad Nabi and Rashid Khan have also been included in the side.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Father, son 3D-print Lamborghini replica; carmaker sends them a real one
text: After a US-based man and his 12-year-old son spent nearly two years 3D-printing a Lamborghini Aventador replica, the Italian carmaker sent them the luxury car's real version for two weeks. The duo, who had replicated the car's body panels and interiors, was also featured in a holiday commercial for the automaker. The lent Aventador model costs approximately $460,247 (₹3.3 crore).
author: Dharna

headlines: BJP lying about regularising unauthorised colonies: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has accused BJP of lying about the regularisation of 1,731 unauthorised colonies. Kejriwal said the Delhi Development Authority website states that PM-UDAY scheme will neither regularise the unauthorised colonies nor the houses there. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said, "If they really want to regularise the unauthorised colonies, why don't they give registry to the people?"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Left SA at 17 with backpack, books: Musk on 'privileged childhood' allegations
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk recently took to Twitter to deny some users' claim that he had a "privileged upbringing" as his father stole an emerald mine from the Black people. "I left South Africa by myself when I was 17 with just a backpack & suitcase of books," Musk tweeted. He also called emerald mine allegations "a pretty awful lie".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Car falls into canal due to dense fog in Greater Noida; 6 including 2 minors dead
text: Six people, including two minors, were killed when their car skidded off the road and fell into a canal in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, apparently due to fog, police said. Five other occupants sustained injuries in the incident that happened at around 11:30 pm on Sunday. The occupants were residents of Sambhal district who were on their way to Delhi.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Indian envoy who rented house for ₹15 lakh a month recalled for misuse of funds
text: Indian Ambassador to Austria, Renu Pall, who rented an apartment for herself at ₹15 lakh per month, has been recalled by External Affairs Ministry for financial irregularities and misuse of government funds. The ministry also restrained her from exercising any administrative or financial powers. An IFS officer of 1988 batch, Pall was to complete her tenure in Austria next month.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Central Excise Assistant Commissioner found hanging at his home in Odisha
text: Central Excise Assistant Commissioner AK Dhal was found hanging from a ceiling fan at his home in Odisha's Baramunda on Sunday, police said. Dhal's family said he was battling with anxiety and depression, and was undergoing treatment. He had applied for voluntary retirement around six months ago but was yet to be granted the same.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Indian-origin Ireland PM Leo Varadkar visits ancestral village in Maharashtra
text: Leo Varadkar, the Indian-origin Prime Minister of Ireland, visited his ancestral village in Malvan in the Sindhudurg district of Maharashtra on Sunday. It was his first visit to the village of Varad after becoming Ireland's PM in June 2017. The 40-year-old politician's father was born in Bombay (now Mumbai) and moved to the United Kingdom to work as a doctor.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Man cheated of ₹13 lakh on pretext of payment app KYC in Maharashtra
text: A 60-year-old man from Thane in Maharashtra was cheated of ₹13 lakh on the pretext of updating his KYC information on an e-commerce payment system. The victim received a call asking him to make a transaction of ₹1 for verification. On Tuesday, he received messages informing him about deduction of money from two bank accounts linked to the payment platform.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Indian Navy bans use of Facebook after 7 caught leaking sensitive information
text: The Indian Navy has banned personnel from using Facebook. It has also banned smartphones at naval bases, dockyards and on warships. The step has been taken after seven naval personnel were caught leaking sensitive information to enemy intelligence agencies through Facebook. They passed on information like locations of naval ships and submarines to a Pakistani handler.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: All schools & colleges to remain shut in Agra for 2 days due to cold
text: Agra District Administration on Sunday announced that all schools and colleges will remain closed on December 30th and 31st due to the cold weather. Earlier, all schools in Agra were closed on December 26th and 27th due to cold wave. Haryana also announced that schools will be closed in the state on December 30 and 31 due to severe cold.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India may surpass Germany to become 4th largest economy in 2026: Report
text: India is expected to overtake Germany to become the fourth-largest economy in 2026, according to the UK-based Centre for Economics and Business Research report. India has decisively overtaken France and the UK to become the world's fifth-largest economy in 2019, it said. India is set to reach $5-trillion GDP target by 2026, two years later than government's target, it added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: My inspiration, my hero: Abhishek on Big B's Dadasaheb Phalke Award
text: Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram to congratulate his father, Amitabh Bachchan, on receiving the Dadasaheb Phalke Award and wrote, "My inspiration. My hero." "Congratulations Pa...We are all so, so proud of you," he added. Amitabh, who earlier missed the 66th National Film Awards ceremony due to ill health, received the award from President Ram Nath Kovind on Sunday in Delhi.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: My journey has been nothing short of amazing: Salman on 30 yrs in B'wood
text: Salman Khan, while talking about completing 30 years in Bollywood, said many "brilliant people" carved him into the person he is today. "Most important thing in...actor's life is...journey and [mine] has been nothing short of amazing," he added. Salman, who made his debut as a lead in 'Maine Pyar Kiya', has acted in more than 100 films up till now.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: India's Koneru Humpy becomes women's World Rapid champion
text: India's Koneru Humpy defeated China's Lei Tingjie to win the Women's World Rapid Chess Championship in Moscow on Sunday. After the initial 12 rounds, Humpy accumulated nine points which left her tied with Tingjie. The duo then played an Armageddon game to break the deadlock. Norway's Magnus Carlsen claimed the men's title.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Peter Siddle retires from international cricket
text: Australian pacer Peter Siddle has announced his retirement from international cricket at the age of 35. Siddle, who took 221 wickets in 67 Tests, will continue to play domestic cricket for Victoria state and Twenty20 side Adelaide Strikers in the Big Bash League. Siddle was released from the squad for the third Test against New Zealand.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Turkish plane evacuates injured in blast in Somalia for treatment in Turkey
text: A Turkish military cargo plane arrived in Somalia to evacuate those injured in the blast in Somali capital Mogadishu for treatment in Turkey. The plane also brought in emergency medical staff and supplies at a Turkish-run hospital in Mogadishu, Turkey's embassy in Somalia tweeted. Bodies of two Turkish nationals killed in the attack were also flown home in the plane.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 2 killed in S Arabia last week were driving car bomb: State media
text: Two men killed by security forces last week in Saudi Arabia were driving a car loaded with explosives and were planning an "imminent terrorist operation", state-run Saudi Press Agency said. The two men had opened fire on security forces after their car was stopped, SPA added. SPA reported five kilograms of paste was found in the car that contained RDX.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Ukraine completes full prisoner swap with pro-Russian separatists
text: Ukraine and pro-Russian separatists completed a full prisoner swap in the country's eastern region. The office of Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that "76 detained Ukrainians" were returned while reportedly 124 separatists were released. Ukranian President and Russian President Vladimir Putin had prepared the ground for the exchange at a summit in Paris, France in early December.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Central, state govts to discuss restructuring GST slabs: Report
text: The finance ministers of central and state governments will reportedly hold discussions on restructuring the goods and services tax (GST) slabs and rates after the Union Budget is presented on February 1. Reports said the negotiations are aimed at fixing the structural flaws in GST that led to a tax collection shortfall and handling the GST compensation owed to states.
author: Dharna

headlines: Scientist ends meeting with MPs by playing flute in ISRO Chief's presence
text: P Kunhikrishnan, the Director of UR Rao Satellite Centre in Bengaluru, ended ISRO's last meeting with the Parliamentary Standing Committee with a flute performance. ISRO Chief K Sivan was also present at the meeting. Rajya Sabha MP Jairam Ramesh took to Twitter to share a snippet from the performance and tweeted, "He played the evergreen Vatapi Ganapatim Bhaje."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Couple mistakes new robot vacuum's noises for a thief, calls police in US
text: A couple in the US, Thomas Milam and Elisa, mistook their newly-purchased robot vacuum's noises for a thief and realised their mistake after police arrived at their house. "It had somehow turned itself on and was vacuuming without us having scheduled it," Thomas wrote on Facebook. "It had gotten stuck in the hallway...and kept bumping into our walls," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: And yet he got it: Florence Pugh to troll on 21-year age gap with boyfriend
text: English actress Florence Pugh, who appeared in 2016 film 'Lady Macbeth', responded to a troll who left a comment on her Instagram picture over the actress' 21-year age difference with her boyfriend. Pugh's boyfriend Zach Braff is also an actor. Tagging Braff, the troll wrote, "you're 44 yrs old," to which 23-year-old Pugh responded, "and yet he got it".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Kim, Kanye party with Elon Musk, Grimes on Christmas eve; Kim shares pics
text: American media personality Kim Kardashian West on Saturday shared pictures of Tesla CEO and his singer girlfriend Grimes from the Kardashian family's annual Christmas eve party on social media. The pictures also showed Kim's husband and rapper Kanye West and rapper Travis Scott among others. Singer Sia performed at the party while inside a life-sized gift box.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Kerala church lets in anti-CAA Muslim protesters who needed place to pray
text: The St Thomas Church, popularly known as Marthoma Cheriapally in Kerala's Kothamangalam, opened its doors to hundreds of Muslims protesting against the Citizenship Act and National Register of Citizens on Saturday. They were participating in a protest march in Kothamangalam and needed a space for evening prayers when the march ended, said All India Professionals Congress' Mathew Kuzhalnadan.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Parties opposing CAA are anti-Dalit: BJP leader JP Nadda
text: BJP Working President JP Nadda on Sunday said political parties protesting against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) are "anti-Dalits" as 70-80 per cent people who will benefit from the law are from the community. He said Dalit leaders opposing the law should be exposed. He also accused Indian National Congress of spearheading campaign to "mislead" minorities on CAA.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Need for constructive discussion on CAA, NPR: Venkaiah Naidu
text: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday said there was need for "an enlightened, meaningful and constructive discussion" on issues such as Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and National Population Register (NPR). "If we discuss this, then our system will be strengthened and the public will be enlightened," he said. "There should not be scope for violence during agitations," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: If Rahul Gandhi loves infiltrators he can take them to Italy: BJP Minister
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Saturday accused Congress of wanting to "divide the country by speaking lies" about the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). "If Rahul Gandhi has love for infiltrators (immigrants), let him take them to Italy," he added. He further asked Congress to refrain from "policy of double-standards" claiming that UPA government had earlier talked about the citizenship law.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: All I did was talk about one or two black sheep: Akhtar on Kaneria controversy
text: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that his comments about Danish Kaneria having been mistreated by Pakistani cricketers for being a Hindu were taken out of context. "All I did was talk about one or two black sheep that could be found in India or Pakistan or England or Holland anywhere in the world," Akhtar said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ganguly shares pic with caption 'Hate working on a Sunday', daughter trolls him
text: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly took to social media to share a picture of himself with the caption, "Hate working on a Sunday." Ganguly was trolled by his daughter Sana, who commented on the picture, writing, "Guess who is not working and in bed till 12...Way to go, dad." Another user commented, "Your workplace seems cool."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Fist fight breaks out during Delhi cricket body meet, Gambhir calls for life ban
text: A video of several Delhi & District Cricket Association (DDCA) members throwing punches at each other during the cricket body's annual general meeting (AGM) has surfaced. Reacting to the video, cricketer-turned-politician Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "DDCA GOES “ALL OUT”...AND DDCA IS ALL OUT FOR A SHAMEFUL DUCK." He further urged BCCI to dissolve DDCA and hand life bans to those involved.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Umpire raises his hand after LBW appeal, ends up rubbing his nose
text: Umpire Greg Davidson raised his hand to give the batsman out but changed his mind midway to end up rubbing his nose during a BBL match. Adelaide Strikers' Rashid Khan appealed for an LBW during 17th over and as Davidson started to raise his finger, Melbourne Renegades' Beau Webster started to walk. The umpire, however, declared him not out.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I don't know when I will get fit: Bhuvneshwar Kumar
text: Team India fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar has said that he doesn't know when will he get fit. "T20 World Cup is still good nine months away. I'm not thinking about that. First thing is getting fit," he said. "NCA must have tried their best but I don't know what went wrong and why they couldn't diagnose (sports hernia)," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Maximum age limit for CDS to be 65, 3 years more than service chiefs
text: The maximum age limit for Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) has been set at 65 years, which is three years more than the retirement age for the three service chiefs of the Indian military. Further, the CDS will not be eligible to hold any government post after demitting office. However, the tenure of the CDS is yet to be announced.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Telangana school's Class 10 students fail to tell India's capital
text: Telangana Finance Minister Harish Rao visited a Zilla Parishad High School in Sangareddy on Saturday and interacted with students of Class 10. However, he found that the students couldn't write the names of their teachers in Telugu, Hindi or in English. The students couldn't recite the multiplication table of 12 and many did not know the capital of the country.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: In first cabinet decision, Hemant Soren govt drops Pathalgadi sedition cases
text: In his first Cabinet meeting after becoming Jharkhand CM, Hemant Soren has decided to withdraw the sedition cases filed against the people under the Pathalgadi movement. The Cabinet also directed to create necessary posts for judicial officers for fast-track courts in every district dealing with cases pertaining to women and children, besides paying all dues to Anganwadi workers and para-teachers.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Man who gave Priyanka a ride issued ₹6,100 challan for not wearing helmet
text: Congress worker, who gave a lift to party general secretary Priyanka Gandhi on his two-wheeler in Lucknow on Saturday, was issued a challan of ₹6,100 for not wearing helmet. He gave Priyanka a ride to the residence of former IPS officer SR Darapuri, who is in jail for participating in anti-CAA protests, after Priyanka's car was stopped by police.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I was heckled on asking where Priyanka Gandhi was going: Policewoman
text: The policewoman who was fleet in-charge of Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi's convoy in Lucknow on Saturday said that she was heckled and she even fell in the scuffle when she enquired where Gandhi was going when she changed her itinerary. Archana Singh said she made the inquiry because Gandhi is a protectee. Singh said that no one misbehaved with Gandhi.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 'World's oldest' rhino passes away at 57 in Tanzania: Officials
text: The world's oldest rhino, Fausta, passed away at the age of 57 in Tanzania, Ngorongoro Conservation Area Authority said. She was a free-ranging eastern black rhino, first spotted in 1965 by a scientist from the University of Dar Es Salaam. Fausta was brought in captivity in 2016 after her health deteriorated and she sustained several hyena attacks, the authority added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Gavaskar India's best opener but Sehwag was not far behind: Ganguly
text: Former Indian cricket team captain Sourav Ganguly has said that according to him Sunil Gavaskar was India's best opener but former teammate Virender Sehwag was not far behind. Ganguly added, "Sehwag was the biggest match-winner in that generation as an opener... The best players are made when they come out of their comfort zone."
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Samsung to launch 'clamshell' foldable phone in February: Report
text: Samsung is expected to launch a clamshell-like foldable phone in February, reports said.
