The new phone will have a 6.7-inch display, will be shaped like a square when folded and may cost about $1,000. Samsung plans to sell six million units in 2020 and is currently in talks with South Korea's three mobile carriers for the release, the report said.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Edtech startup LeverageEdu raises $1.5 mn led by DSG and Blume
text: Delhi-based university admissions and career guidance platform LeverageEdu raised $1.5 million in a round led by DSG Consumer Partners and Blume Ventures. The round also saw participation from Saama Capital Co-founder Ash Lilani and PayU ex-CEO Amrish Rau. Founded in 2017, LeverageEdu helps school students, university students and working professionals with career guidance and mentorship.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: US witnessed 41 incidents of mass killings in 2019: Database
text: A database compiled by The Associated Press, USA Today and Northeastern University shows that there were 41 incidents of mass killings in 2019 that caused 211 deaths. The database defines mass killings as incidents where four or more people are killed excluding the perpetrators. It also claims 2019 may have witnessed the highest number of mass killings since the 1970s.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Dutch lawmaker ends Prophet Muhammad cartoon contest within hours
text: Dutch lawmaker Geert Wilders ended a contest for cartoons caricaturing Prophet Muhammad within hours after announcing the event. Speaking on the contest later, Wilders tweeted, "Fatwas remain unpunished and freedom of expression is not defended. The cowardice exposed. Mission accomplished. End of the contest." He tweeted a drawing of a bearded man, which he claimed had won the contest.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Uruguay seizes 4.4 tonnes of cocaine valued at over $1 bn
text: Uruguay's Navy seized around 4.4 tonnes of cocaine estimated to be valued at over $1 billion. It claimed that the cocaine was found hidden in soy flour shipping containers that were destined for Togo in Africa. The police arrested two people from a ranch where they suspected the seized cocaine in the port originated, Uruguay's Interior Ministry said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 10 killed in missile attack on military parade in Yemen: Reports
text: A missile attack on a military parade by forces killed 10 people and injured several others, the Security Belt group said. The separatist group, backed by the United Arab Emirates (UAE), claimed that Iran-aligned Houthi rebels were responsible for the attack. However, the Houthis haven't claimed the attack or responded to the accusations by Security Belt group.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Indian economy expected to gradually recover in 2020: CII
text: The Indian economy is expected to gradually recover in 2020, said the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII). "Nascent signs of recovery are noted in the form of improved Purchasing Managers' Index of manufacturing and services, jump in passenger air traffic, among others," said CII President Vikram Kirloskar. The chamber also suggested expanding the fiscal policy between the range of 0.5%-0.75%.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Just Indian things: Padma Lakshmi on being tagged as Priyanka by magazine
text: Model-turned-author Padma Lakshmi shared a screenshot on Instagram, which shows her being tagged as Priyanka Chopra by American weekly magazine New Yorker. "Thank you to the illustrious @nydailynews for the shoutout. I know to some we all look alike, but... #desilife #justindianthings," she wrote. The original post appears to have been removed by New Yorker.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Rangoli claims Forbes showed 'incorrect' income of Kangana, sends notice
text: Rangoli Chandel on Sunday revealed that she has sent a legal notice to Forbes India magazine, alleging that they ranked her sister, actress Kangana Ranaut, low in its 2019 Celebrity 100 List. Forbes India had ranked Kangana at 70th spot, stating that she earned ₹17.5 crore in 2019. "Kangana pays more tax than her entire income mentioned" Rangoli earlier tweeted.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Asked myself if Dadasaheb Phalke Award was a hint that I should retire: Big B
text: Amitabh Bachchan received the Dadasaheb Phalke Award from President Ram Nath Kovind in New Delhi on Sunday. On receiving the award, the 77-year-old actor said, "When this award was announced, I asked myself, 'Is this a hint that I should stop working and take rest at home?'" He added, "However, I still have some unfinished work I have to complete."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: BJP won't decide if we're Indians: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) President and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday said he will not participate in the National Population Register (NPR) exercise of the central government. "BJP won't decide if [we're] Indians...We don't want NPR," he said. "Mahatma Gandhi had shown the way in South Africa...Here, we'll be the first [to] not fill NPR forms," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP leader allegedly attacked for explaining CAA to locals in UP
text: A BJP leader has alleged that he was beaten up by locals when he tried to explain benefits of the newly enacted Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in Amroha district of UP. Murtaja Aga Qazmi is district general secretary of the party's minority wing. Qazmi said that he was first heckled and then beaten up at Lakada Mohalla in Amroha.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I broke TV after seeing daughter imitating 'aarti' while watching show: Afridi
text: A video of former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has gone viral, wherein he says that he once broke TV after seeing his daughter imitating 'aarti' while watching an Indian show. In the video, Pakistani audience can be seen applauding Afridi's remarks. Afridi added that he has told his wife that she can watch Indian dramas alone but not with children.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rahul, Mamata, Yechury show Oppn unity at J'khand CM's swearing-in
text: Several leaders came together on stage in a show of Opposition's strength as JMM chief Hemant Soren was sworn-in as Jharkhand CM on Sunday. Among those present were Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury, CPI's D Raja, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, RJD's Tejashwi Yadav and NCP's Sharad Pawar.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Priyanka Chaturvedi takes dig at Amruta Fadnavis over Axis Bank row
text: Shiv Sena leader Priyanka Chaturvedi on Sunday tweeted that teaching Maharashtrians what to do doesn't come under the purview of an Axis Bank employee. BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta, who is a senior executive at Axis Bank, has accused the Maharashtra government of targetting her over reports of government shifting salaried accounts of its employees from the bank.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Uber's acquisition of Careem approved by Egypt's competition watchdog
text: The Egyptian Competition Authority (ECA) said on Sunday it has approved ride-hailing group Uber's acquisition of its former regional rival Careem. The ECA added that the approval was given after the regulator agreed to a set of commitments proposed by Uber. Uber bought Careem for $3.1 billion in March in a deal expected to close in January.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Soren asks for books instead of bouquets, Manish Sisodia praises him
text: JMM chief Hemant Soren before taking oath as Jharkhand CM on Sunday tweeted to his supporters to gift him books instead of bouquets, which he said will be kept in a library. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia congratulated Soren and wrote, "If all the CMs of the country make education their priority, then the country will move forward very fast."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 3 Indians killed, 13 injured in bus accident in Egypt
text: Three Indians were killed and 13 others injured when two buses carrying tourists crashed into a truck in Egypt, said Indian Embassy on Sunday. The accident took place on Saturday and the injured are "receiving medical treatment at various hospitals in Egypt", said the Embassy in a tweet. "Relatives of the deceased and the injured have been contacted," it added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Indian companies garnered ₹8.7 lakh crore from markets in 2019
text: Indian companies garnered ₹8.7 lakh crore from domestic and overseas markets in 2019, up 20% from the previous year, according to data compiled by Prime Database. Debt instruments remained the most preferred route for financing business needs this year. Out of the cumulative ₹8.7 lakh crore garnered this year, over ₹6.2 lakh crore was raised from the Indian debt market.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Andrew Dunbar, body double for actor who played Theon Greyjoy on GoT, passes away
text: Andrew Dunbar, best known for playing actor Alfie Allen's body double in 'Game of Thrones', passed away at his home in Belfast, Ireland on Christmas Eve. The cause of his death has not been revealed. Allen, who played Theon Greyjoy in the series, condoled his death and wrote on Instagram, "I can only imagine what his family [is] going through."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: UK government apologises to singer Elton John after data leak
text: The British Government has apologised to singer-songwriter Elton John and several other celebrities, who were part of the annual New Year honours list, after accidentally posting their addresses online. The list was posted on the government website for a brief period of time, which allowed its visitors to download it as a spreadsheet. The list also included cricketer Ben Stokes.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Actress Sara Gilbert files for separation from wife Linda Perry
text: Actress Sara Gilbert has filed for separation from wife Linda Perry after almost six years of marriage. According to documents obtained by a website, Sara filed for legal separation on Friday in Los Angeles and has listed the date of separation as August 13. The couple, who got married in March 2014, share a four-year-old son, Rhodes Emilio Gilbert Perry.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: West Ham sack Manuel Pellegrini after loss to Leicester at home
text: West Ham United sacked manager Manuel Pellegrini on Saturday after a 2-1 home defeat by Leicester City. After the loss against Leicester left West Ham one place above the relegation zone in 17th place, joint-chairman David Sullivan released a statement that read, "It is with great disappointment that we've had to make this decision."
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: If I were Pukki, I’d be puking, tweets user on VAR armpit offside
text: Reacting to Teemu Pukki's goal being ruled offside by the VAR due to his armpit being ahead of Tottenham defender Jan Vertonghen, Gary Lineker tweeted, "If I were Pukki, I'd be puking. Awful decision." "VAR rules that Pukki has one really long nose hair which was marginally offside," reacted another user on the VAR decision.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Andy Murray pulls out of Australian Open 2020
text: Former world number one Andy Murray has pulled out of the Australian Open 2020, revealing that he has endured a recent setback and as a precaution, he will have to skip the tournament. Murray had surgery on his hip to repair a career-threatening injury after his first-round, five-set loss to Roberto Bautista Agut at the Australian Open last January.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Japan Display may sell smartphone screen plant to Apple for $820 mn: Report
text: Japan Display (JDI) is in talks to sell its smartphone screen plant to Apple or Sharp Corporation for up to $820 million, Nikkei Asian Review reported. JDI had borrowed $1.5 billion from Apple to build the LCD screen plant four years ago and still owes over $800 million. Moreover, Apple's shift to OLED screen has reduced demand for JDI's screens.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Google Search adds 'Watchlist' feature to bookmark movies, shows
text: Google has begun rolling out a "Watchlist" feature within Search that lets users bookmark movies and TV shows. Presently only available on phones, the bookmark icon is displayed underneath trailers when someone searches for a movie or show, alongside another icon to bookmark things user have already watched. The users are also shown a 'Watch now' or 'Get Tickets' option.
author: Dharna

headlines: Membrane that removes oil from water with 99.9% efficiency created
text: Researchers have created an ultra-thin membrane that is able to separate oil from water with 99.9% efficiency. Researchers state that the membrane can treat 6,000 litres of wastewater in one hour under an applied pressure of 1atm. To create the membrane researchers used porous polyketone (PK) support with a 10 nano-metre thick silica layer applied on the top surface.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: 51 IAS officers transferred in Haryana in late night reshuffle
text: Several Haryana Civil Services (HCS) officers and 51 IAS officers were transferred by the state government on Saturday night. IAS officer Vijai Vardhan of the 1985 batch replaced Rajesh Khullar as Haryana Additional Chief Secretary (Home). Khullar is the Principal Secretary to the Chief Minister. A 1991 batch IAS officer G Anupama has been posted as secretary to Haryana Governor.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: China scraps 'custody & education' system for prostitutes & clients
text: China abolished the "custody and education" system for prostitutes and their clients that allowed the police to keep them in custody for up to two years without a charge, the state media said. Director of NGO Asia Catalyst Shen Tingting said that prostitutes were subjected to "manual labour" at these centres. Abolishing it will be "significant positive step," Tingting added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Man stabs 5 at rabbi's house in US during Hanukkah celebrations
text: A man armed with a machete intruded into a rabbi's house in New York state, US and stabbed five people during Hanukkah celebrations. The suspect fled the scene, but he is in custody at this time, the Ramapo Police Department said. "[A]ntisemitism and bigotry...are repugnant to our values of inclusion and diversity," New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Ivanka suggests she may not work for her father after his re-election
text: Upon being asked if she'll continue to be a part of her father US President Donald Trump's administration if he is re-elected, Ivanka Trump said that she'll put her family's needs first. "I'm driven by my kids...so that is always going to be my top priority," she added. "So they will really drive that answer for me," she further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Getting Maharashtra economy past $1 tn mark in 6-7 years tough: Jayant Patil
text: Maharashtra Finance Minister Jayant Patil said that getting the state's economy past $1 trillion in six to seven years would be tough due to low growth rate. Maharashtra's economy has been growing at 7% and would have to accelerate to 15% to achieve the target, which would be "difficult". The target was given by former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Power distribution firms suffer ₹27,000 cr loss in 2018-19
text: Power distribution firms have suffered losses worth ₹27,000 crore in 2018-19, Union Power Minister R K Singh said, adding "discoms are under stress" due to this. The government aims to bring down these losses to 15% from the current 18.5% in the next two years. The minister stated that power discoms were under stress over purchase of power and maintenance.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Hemant Soren sworn-in as 11th Chief Minister of Jharkhand
text: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) chief Hemant Soren has been sworn-in as the 11th Chief Minister of Jharkhand at a ceremony in Ranchi. In the election results announced on December 23, the JMM won 30 seats while its alliance partners, Congress and RJD, won 16 and one, respectively. The BJP won 25 seats in the state Assembly election.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: All schools to remain shut in Haryana for 2 days due to severe cold
text: The Haryana government has announced that schools will be closed in the state on December 30 and 31 in view of severe cold. The circular added that the schools would re-open on January 16 after the winter break. Hisar and Narnaul towns in Haryana recorded minimum temperatures of 0.2 degrees and 1.5 degrees Celsius on Sunday, respectively.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: You know what one becomes when his wife leaves him? Ask Modi ji: Anurag
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap took a dig at PM Narendra Modi, while replying to a user's tweet which is no longer available. He wrote, "You know what happens to a man whose wife leaves him and who has no family, right? Ask Modi ji??" When another user commented, "Have you fixed 2 hours for heckling trolls?", Kashyap replied, "Only before sleeping."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Zac rushed to hospital after contracting deadly disease at shoot: Report
text: Actor Zac Efron, who reportedly contracted a disease in Papua New Guinea, had to be flown to Australia in a 'life or death' situation. He's said to be in stable condition now. Efron was there to shoot for 'Killing Zac Efron', which will show his journey "deep into the jungle of a remote, dangerous island" for 21 days.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: So rangoli is anti-national? Richa as protestors detained for anti-CAA rangoli
text: Actress Richa Chadha on Sunday questioned the detention of protestors in Chennai for making 'kolams' or rangoli in protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC). "So rangoli is anti-national now?...Wtf," the actress tweeted. A police official earlier said, "We never granted permission for their protest. Though it's a kolam protest, it's against law."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Salman cleans toilet, utensils in Bigg Boss house as contestants avoid duties
text: A promo for the upcoming episode of Bigg Boss 13 shows host Salman Khan entering the house with two helpers and doing the household chores including cleaning the toilet and dirty utensils. This was after the contestants avoided their duties assigned by new captain Shehnaaz Gill. The housemates, locked inside a room, shouted 'sorry' as Salman kept cleaning the house.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Tesla's Cybertruck appears in rapper Travis Scott's music video
text: Tesla's Cybertruck made an appearance in the music video of a song by American rapper Travis Scott named 'Gang Gang'. In several cuts, Scott is also seen riding the Elon Musk-led automaker's electric Cyberquad ATV and holding the 'Not a Flamethrower' flamethrower from Musk's The Boring Company. Tesla has insisted in the past that it does not spend on advertising.
author: Dharna

headlines: Ajay deletes 'Om' from Maratha flag in 'Tanhaji' after historians point out error
text: Actor Ajay Devgn has deleted the 'Om' symbol from the Maratha flag in the final edit of 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. This comes after historians pointed out the discrepancy following the trailer release, saying the original flag didn't have any symbol on it. "We removed 'Om' because it was a technical error...We realised that later," said Ajay.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: IIT Bombay's Techfest to host international concert night on January 5
text: Techfest, Asia's largest Science and Technology festival, would be conducting an international concert night at IIT Bombay headlining world's best visual DJ, Afishal. The night would be opened by Nina Suerte from Poland, and supported by Launchpad artist Julius Nox from Italy. Entry to the event is free and would open for all at 5:30 pm on January 5, 2020.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Protesters draw 'Rangoli' with anti-CAA slogans in Chennai, get detained
text: The Chennai police on Sunday detained four women and a man for drawing Kolam (Rangoli) outside people's house and common places with anti-CAA slogans. Police also detained two lawyers who went to the police station. The police cited 'unlawful assembly' as the reason for their detention and said that they didn't seek prior permission for the rangoli protest.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Not wrong: UP Deputy CM on Meerut  SP's 'go to Pakistan' remark
text: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya has said it was not wrong for Meerut (City) SP Akhilesh N Singh to ask anti-Citizenship Act protesters to go to Pakistan because he told it to those who were raising pro-Pakistan slogans and pelting stones. The SP had said that his comments were in reaction to some "anti-social elements making pro-Pakistan statements".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BSP MLA Ramabai Parihar supports CAA, gets suspended from party
text: BSP MLA Ramabai Parihar from Madhya Pradesh's Patharia has been suspended from the party for supporting Citizenship (Amendment) Act, party chief Mayawati has tweeted. She further tweeted that Parihar, who had been warned to walk the party line several times in the past, has been banned from participating in any party program.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: It was love at first sight: Ganguly on Harbhajan taking 13 wickets vs Australia
text: Recalling the 2001 Eden Gardens Test against Australia, BCCI President and former India captain Sourav Ganguly said that when he saw Harbhajan Singh take 13 wickets, it was love at first sight. He added that he believed that Harbhajan would go on to change things for Indian cricket. "I believed in match-winners, flamboyant players who were fearless," the 47-year-old added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Samsung announces project on hands-free typing using selfie camera
text: Samsung has announced that it's experimenting with hands-free typing technology called 'SelfieType', a virtual keyboard using the front-facing selfie camera. The technology uses a device's selfie camera and AI to translate a person's finger movements into keyboard input. SelfieType requires no additional hardware and it's adaptable to various mobile devices such as smartphones and tablets.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Greta takes viral #2019in5words challenge, tweets 'Our house is on fire'
text: Sweden's 16-year-old climate activist Greta Thunberg on Saturday took the viral Twitter challenge #2019in5words and tweeted, "Our house is on fire". Thunberg spoke these exact five words at the World Economic Forum in Davos earlier this year as she delivered a speech on climate change. A Twitter user reacted to her tweet, "Younger people gave me hope #2019in5words."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Rameshwar Oraon, Alamgir Alam, Satyanand Bhokta in J'khand Cabinet
text: JMM working president Hemant Soren on Sunday took oath as the 11th Chief Minister of Jharkhand. Jharkhand Congress chief Rameshwar Oraon, former Jharkhand Assembly Speaker Alamgir Alam from Congress party and RJD legislator Satyanand Bhokta also took oath as Cabinet Ministers during the swearing-in ceremony. The JMM-Congress-RJD alliance won 47 seats out of 81 in the Jharkhand Assembly elections.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Aise damage control nahin hota: Sinha on UP Police 'manhandling' Priyanka
text: Commenting on UP Police "manhandling" Priyanka Gandhi in Lucknow, Shatrughan Sinha tweeted, "This is highly condemnable...Aise damage control nahin hota." "Police misbehaving with the 'Beti' of the most prominent #NehruGandhi family in the country...dread to think what the commoners could face," he said. "UP Police under government's instructions dealt with her in most shameful manner," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: India's lobby in US far more powerful than Pakistan's: Pak PM Imran Khan
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Saturday said, "India's lobby in the US right now is far more powerful than Pakistan's." He added that the Indian lobby in the US was playing a key role in strengthening India's narrative against Pakistan. "India's viewpoint always overshadows that of Pakistan and US' policies for Pakistan are affected by that viewpoint," he further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Ajay doesn't discriminate between big and small artistes: Actor Bhavin
text: Actor Bhavin Bhanushali, who played Ajay Devgn's son in film 'De De Pyaar De', has said Ajay is the "best person" as he doesn't discriminate between big and small artistes. "We'd usually play snooker and table tennis together after pack-up," he added. Bhavin further said that Ajay used to give him tips on acting, adding, "That was...good learning experience."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kartik isn't contemporary, he's more like a brother: Sunny Singh
text: Actor Sunny Singh has said his comparison with Kartik Aaryan doesn't hold any importance, stating, "[He] isn't...contemporary. He's more like a brother." "I think I'm my sole competition and see only myself in my league," he added. "I'm really happy with...kind of work Kartik is doing...it gives me immense joy every time I see him on screen," Sunny further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Actresses should be paid as much as actors, it's terribly unfair: Saif
text: Saif Ali Khan has said female actors should be paid as much as their male counterparts and added that the film industry is "terribly unfair". "Industry is...economically driven, so...people that pull at...box office [gets]...more," he added. This comes after Kareena Kapoor talked about pay disparity in the film industry and said it's difficult for female actors to negotiate with producers.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Working with Zack Snyder in 'Army of...' was natural progression: Huma
text: Actress Huma Qureshi has said after working with Gurinder Chadha and Deepa Mehta, working with filmmaker Zack Snyder in 'Army of the Dead' was a "natural progression" in her career. She added that Zack is an "organic director" and gives everyone their space to perform. "He is instinctive, which is great because I am an instinctive actor," Huma further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Communal remarks by Meerut SP condemnable, unfortunate: Mayawati
text: BSP President and former UP CM Mayawati on Sunday condemned the remarks of Meerut SP Akhilesh Singh who was caught on video telling anti-CAA protesters to 'go to Pakistan'. "Muslims living in the country including Uttar Pradesh for years are Indians, not Pakistanis," she tweeted. "The communal language/remarks by...Meerut SP...are extremely condemnable and unfortunate," she added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I want to try acting in a film: Ronaldo on post retirement plans
text: Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo has said he wants to try acting in a film after retiring from football. The 34-year-old added that he also wants to continue his studies after hanging up his boots. "I hope I live more than 50 years to learn new things and face different challenges and try to find solutions for them," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: New e-commerce policies may be out by end of this fiscal: DPIIT
text: Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) Secretary Guruprasad Mohapatra said that e-commerce policies on data protection are expected to be released by end of this fiscal. Draft policies calling for legal framework for restriction on data sharing and storage overseas were released in February. The policies aim to cut regulatory issues and make India a manufacturing hub. n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: 6 of top 10 Indian firms lose ₹64,419 crore in m-cap, RIL worst hit
text: Six of the 10 most valued Indian companies lost ₹64,419 crore in market valuation last week, with Reliance Industries (RIL) emerging as the top loser. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), HDFC Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, SBI and ITC also witnessed a decline in their market capitalisation. Emerging as the gainers were HDFC, Hindustan Unilever (HUL), ICICI Bank and Infosys.
author: Dharna

headlines: FM launches 'eBkray' auction platform for assets attached by banks
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sithraman has launched 'eBkray', an online common platform for the auction of assets attached by public sector banks (PSBs). Aimed at increasing transparency, the site is equipped with property search tools and navigational links to all PSB e-auction sites and also contains photographs of uploaded properties. Over 35,000 properties have been uploaded to eBkray, she said.
author: Dharna

headlines: Salman tears up while greeting fans outside house on b'day, pics surface
text: Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani has shared a video and pictures that show actor Salman Khan greeting his fans outside his house in Mumbai on his 54th birthday on Friday. Several fans pointed out that the actor was seen tearing up while waving to his fans. Salman had also cut a cake with the paparazzi on his birthday.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Was about to address you as 'Mitron', but I stopped: Gulzar at award function
text: Speaking at a literature award function organised by media house Amar Ujala, lyricist Gulzar said, "I was about to address you as 'Mitron'. But then I stopped." This was purportedly a reference to PM Narendra Modi's way of addressing crowds. Gulzar added he fears Delhiites these days, as no one knows "what laws they can bring", amid protests against CAA.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Avengers, Ted Bundy, Eilish among most-read Wikipedia pages in 2019
text: Wikipedia has revealed its most popular pages in 2019, topped by the movie 'Avengers: Endgame', which garnered nearly 44 million views. Following it were the listicle 'Deaths in 2019' with 37 million views and article about American serial killer Ted Bundy, viewed 29 million times. Singer Billie Eilish, late Freddie Mercury and actor Keanu Reeves were among the top ten.
author: Dharna

headlines: We failed, you've served your time in hell: Ekta Kapoor on Kushal's suicide
text: Producer Ekta Kapoor, while sharing the last picture that late actor Kushal Punjabi posted on Instagram before committing suicide, wrote, "Just got to know we lost someone to depression!" "We failed, rest in peace! Hope your body joins your soul in heaven. You've served your time in hell," she added. Thirty-seven-year-old Kushal was found hanging at his residence in Mumbai.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: KL Rahul uses Hera Pheri dialogue in pic with Athiya; Suniel posts laughing emojis
text: Cricketer KL Rahul on Saturday posted a picture with actor Suniel Shetty's daughter, actress Athiya Shetty and captioned it, "Hello, devi prasad....?", a reference to a dialogue in the 2000 film 'Hera Pheri', which starred Suniel. The actor replied on the post with a series of laughing emojis. KL Rahul and Athiya are rumoured to be dating.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: BJP leader Naqvi criticises Meerut SP for telling anti-CAA protestors to 'go to Pak'
text: BJP leader and Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has criticised Meerut SP for telling anti-CAA protestors to "go to Pakistan" in a viral video. "If it is true that he made that statement in the video...Immediate action must be taken against him," he said. "Violence at any level, be it by police or by a mob, is unacceptable," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Should I finish myself off: Kaneria on being mistreated by ex-cricketers, media
text: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has alleged he has been mistreated by cricket community and television channels since retiring. He said, "You've cut off my hands and feet. I haven't been employed for so long. What else do you want...Should I finish myself off?” Earlier this week, Shoaib Akhtar claimed some cricketers refused to eat with Kaneria as he's a Hindu.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 69% want underground car tunnel, stop whining: Elon Musk conducts poll
text: After saying that he hoped his startup The Boring Company will start operating an underground commercial tunnel in Las Vegas in 2020, Elon Musk took to Twitter to conduct a poll on the concept. He captioned the poll, "Build super safe, Earthquake-proof tunnels under cities to solve traffic." "As expected, 69% want car tunnels! Stop whining, subway Stalinists!" Musk tweeted.
author: Dharna

headlines: Only those who say 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' can stay in India: Union Minister
text: Union Petroleum Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday said that only those who are ready to say "Bharat Mata Ki Jai" will be able to live in India. "Do we want to make this country an inn? Should anyone who comes to this country be allowed to live here? We have to face this challenge," he added.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Congress releases video showing UP Police 'manhandling' Priyanka Gandhi
text: Congress took to Twitter to release a video showing Uttar Pradesh Police "manhandling" Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. Priyanka was stopped by Lucknow Police while she was on her way to meet family members of former IPS officer SR Darapuri, who was arrested during anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests. Priyanka had accused the police of strangulating and pushing her.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Will consult states before nation-wide NRC: Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad
text: Speaking about the implementation of nation-wide NRC, Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has said that there will be a consultation with the state governments and feedback will be taken. "There is a legal process. If anything is to be done, it will be done publicly. Nothing will be a secret on an NRC," he further said.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: Parts of Nagaland witness snowfall for 1st time in 37 years; videos surface
text: Several parts of Nagaland received snowfall for the first time in 37 years, with videos of the same surfacing on social media. The Luvishe village in Zunheboto district and some villages under Kiphire and Tuensang districts were among the areas that received snowfall. "Indeed, Mother Nature showered her blessings upon Nagaland this Christmas," MLA from Suruhuto Constituency, H Khehovi said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Honesty as a policy comes with a price: Election Commissioner Lavasa
text: In an opinion piece for The Indian Express, Election Commissioner Ashok Lavasa wrote that honesty as a policy always comes with a price. "Honesty is not a fetish to be preserved... without being practised. It is like keeping a toilet clean without using it. Toilets are meant to be used; if kept clean they will be used more," he added.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: 67-yr-old man marries 65-yr-old woman at Kerala old age home; pics surface
text: A 67-year-old man named Kochaniyan Menon married 65-year-old Lakshmi Ammal at a government-run old age home in Kerala's Thrissur on Saturday, with pictures from their wedding ceremony surfacing online. Even before she came to the old age home, Lakshmi Ammal knew Kochaniyan for about 30 years. Kochaniyan worked as an assistant for her husband, who passed away 21 years ago.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Men use banned app to duplicate Shah's landline numbers, demand ₹3 cr from minister
text: Delhi Police has arrested two men for allegedly using a banned app to duplicate Home Minister Amit Shah's residential and office landline numbers and demanding ₹3 crore for "party funds" from a Haryana minister. The incident came to light when the minister received a call through the app named CrazyCall. The minister approached Shah's OSD after receiving repeated calls.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Boat with 5 bodies, 2 human heads washes up on Japan island
text: Five bodies and two human heads have been discovered inside a boat, suspected to be from North Korea, that washed ashore on Japan's Sado Island on Friday. Authorities gained access to the boat on Saturday. Authorities could not immediately confirm whether the heads belonged to the five bodies or were from two other people, saying that is being investigated.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Bankers need not fear 'three Cs' for taking genuine decisions: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that bankers taking "genuine, bonafide decisions" have no reason to fear the "three Cs", referring to CBI, Central Vigilance Commission, and Comptroller and Auditor General of India. She assured bankers that prudent commercial decisions would be protected. Sitharaman discussed banking issues with industry executives, government officials and CBI chief.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Health of public sector banks restored, 13 reported profit: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that the health of public sector banks (PSBs) has been restored due to extensive government reforms. Out of 19 loss-making PSBs, 13 had returned to profitability in the first half of 2019-20, she added. The bad loans or gross non-performing assets (NPAs) of the PSBs have fallen 18% since March 2018, Sitharaman further said.
author: Dharna

headlines: Celebrities attend Kushal Punjabi's funeral in Mumbai
text: Celebrities, including Sushant Singh, Karanvir Bohra and Drashti Dhami, attended Kushal Punjabi's funeral in Mumbai on Saturday. Kushal, known for starring in films like 'Lakshya' and 'Kaal', was found hanging in his apartment in the early hours of Friday. Police recovered a suicide note from his residence in which he said nobody should be held responsible for his death.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Off-camera, Dwayne is a lot like he's on-camera: Ryan Reynolds
text: On being asked about what Dwayne Johnson is like when cameras aren't rolling, actor Ryan Reynolds said, "Off-camera, he's sort of a lot like on-camera." "Less violent. As energetic and kind...just a genuine article," he added. Ryan will be seen alongside Dwayne in the film 'Red Notice'. Directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber, the film is scheduled to release in 2021.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Shah Rukh is an old friend, we share a very positive bond: Salman
text: Salman Khan, while talking about his equation with Shah Rukh Khan, said that they both share a "very positive bond" and have mutual admiration for each other. "Shah Rukh...is a very dear and old friend. Even if we don't meet on...daily basis, we're very much in touch," he added. Earlier, Shah Rukh attended Salman's birthday party in Mumbai.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: We're in democracy, govt has right to make decisions: Ajay on CAA
text: Talking about the ongoing protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in various parts of the country, Ajay Devgn said that people have every right to make an opinion but they shouldn't resort to violence. "There should be a debate, a conversation," he added. "We're in a democracy...the establishment also has...right to make decisions...as we've chosen them," Ajay further said. n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: China to launch its own version of US-operated GPS in 2020
text: China is developing its own space-based navigation system as its alternative to the Global Positioning System (GPS) operated by the US Air Force. The 'BeiDou Navigation Satellite System' will be launched in the first half of 2020 after China launches the final two satellites needed to make the system operational. The system will eventually consist of 35 satellites in total.
author: Dharna

headlines: YouTube criticised for mass deleting crypto videos, calls it 'error'
text: After YouTube faced backlash for mass deleting videos related to Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, the video-sharing platform admitted it had removed the videos mistakenly and has reinstated them since. The 'error' was reported to have affected over 25 YouTube creators. YouTube had flagged the videos saying they displayed "harmful or dangerous content" and content on "sale of regulated goods".
author: Dharna

headlines: Uber buys 600 acres of land in US to test self-driving cars
text: Through an affiliate, Uber has purchased almost 600 acres of land in Pittsburgh, US and confirmed that the land is for the purpose of building a test track. To be used for testing self-driving Ubers, the land was reportedly bought for as much as $9.5 million. As per reports, the area will employ 200 people and include an observation deck.
author: Dharna

headlines: Pejavara Mutt head Vishwesha Teertha Swami passes away at 88
text: Udupi's Pejavara Mutt head Vishwesha Teertha Swami passed away on Sunday at the age of 88 after he was hospitalised on December 20 due to breathing problems. He was the only seer to have ascended the 'Paryaya Peetha' five times since the system of transferring power between the eight mutts surrounding the Udupi Sri Krishna temple began in 1522.
author: Trivedi Bhutnath

headlines: New policy to ban power companies from passing losses to users: MoS
text: Union Minister of State for Power RK Singh has said that under a new tariff policy, power companies would be prohibited from passing on their losses to consumers beyond a limit. The policy will likely be unveiled within a month. "We're building the rights of the consumers. Right now there is no charter of rights of electricity consumers," Singh said.
author: Dharna

headlines: Kerala Governor says historian Irfan Habib disrupted his speech
text: Kerala governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Saturday said that historian Irfan Habib disrupted his inaugural address at 80th Indian History Congress at Kannur University. He said that this "intolerance" towards a different opinion was "undemocratic". Khan faced protests from students and delegates and he responded by saying, "You have every right to protest. But you cannot shout me down."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I inaugurated Ganguly's restaurant, he used to send me food: Inzamam
text: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has rubbished claims that Pakistani players did not eat with ex-spinner Danish Kaneria because he was a Hindu, saying religion and cricket don't mix. Citing an example, Inzamam said he inaugurated ex-Team India captain Sourav Ganguly's restaurant and Ganguly used to send him food. Inzamam added he gave Kaneria preference over his childhood friend Saqlain Mushtaq.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I didn't hug Nikhat, what's the big deal? I also get irritated: Mary Kom
text: Talking about not hugging Nikhat Zareen after defeating her in trials, six-time world boxing champion Mary Kom said, "Yes, I didn’t hug her, what’s the big deal? I didn't start this." Kom added, "I am also a human being, I also get irritated. Can’t I get angry when my credentials are questioned like this? And this wasn’t the first time."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: IPL snub not in my control but focus is now on NZ tour: Hanuma Vihari
text: Talking about going unsold in IPL 2020 auction, batsman Hanuma Vihari said, "It’s not in my control and I don’t really want to comment on it. My job is to play well and win matches." He added, "I've done well for the state team in white-ball cricket. So whenever I get an opportunity, I'll do well for India as well."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: We don't have small hearts, can't accept that we mistreated Kaneria: Inzamam
text: Days after Shoaib Akhtar claimed ex-spinner Danish Kaneria was mistreated by Pakistani players because he's a Hindu, ex-captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said, "I'm not ready to accept...we don't have such small hearts that we didn't accept someone." "I never noted even a single example of any such thing," he added. "I was saddened to hear about this...as I was captain," he stated.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Christina Koch breaks record for longest single spaceflight by a woman
text: NASA astronaut Christina H Koch on Saturday set a new record for the longest single spaceflight by a woman, after crossing the 288-day mark aboard the International Space Station (ISS). Koch broke the record previously set by former NASA astronaut and the first female Space Station Commander Peggy Whitson. Notably, Koch was also part of humanity's first all-woman spacewalk.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: IMD issues 'red' warning for Delhi as cold wave conditions continue
text: India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Saturday issued a 'red' warning for Delhi as cold wave conditions continued unabated. The red colour indicates extreme weather conditions. The warning pertained to the weekend after parts of the national capital recorded a temperature of 1.9 degrees on Saturday morning. Flight operations and train services in Delhi were also affected due to dense fog.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Salman Rushdie's ancestral bungalow valued at ₹130 crore by Delhi HC
text: Salman Rushdie's ancestral house in Delhi, which his father agreed to sell to late Congress leader Bhiku Ram Jain in 1970, was valued at ₹130 crore by Delhi High Court. The deal got stalled due to disputes until the Supreme Court in 2012 ruled in Jain's favour. It had directed Rushdie to hand over the bungalow at the market price.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Woman goes into premature labour on train, Army doctors help deliver baby
text: Two Indian Army doctors, Captain Lalitha and Captain Amandeep helped deliver the baby of a woman who went into premature labour aboard the Howrah Express. Sharing a picture on Twitter, the Indian Army wrote, "Both mother and baby are hale & hearty." Reacting to this, a user wrote on Twitter, "Salute Armed Forces. They're trained for any eventuality emergencies."
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 3,559 trees to be cut down in Bengaluru for road, metro projects
text: As many as 3,559 trees are set to be cut down in Bengaluru to facilitate five civil projects. The proposals include cutting down 1,822 trees for the Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project and 1,493 trees for the Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited's projects. The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited has proposed the cutting down of 244 trees.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: No extra charge on payments via RuPay, UPI from January 1
text: Payments made through homegrown RuPay cards and Unified Payments Interface (UPI) at businesses with annual turnover of over ₹50 crore will not attract Merchant Discount Rate (MDR) from January 1. Such businesses have been mandated to offer these modes of payment to customers. The discount rate is paid by the merchant to banks, card payment networks, and other financial intermediaries.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Netherlands to drop 'Holland' as nickname
text: The Netherlands has announced to officially drop the nickname 'Holland' as part of a rebranding campaign. Companies, embassies, ministries and universities will only be able to refer to the country as 'the Netherlands' from January. 'Holland' refers to just two of the 12 provinces in the Netherlands, but the two names are often used interchangeably to describe the European country.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Japan to send warship, aircraft to protect its vessels in the Middle East
text: Japan will send a warship and patrol planes to protect Japanese ships in the Middle East after a series of attacks on international merchant vessels in the region. A helicopter-equipped destroyer and two P-3C patrol planes will be sent for information-gathering. In case of any emergencies, a special order would be issued to allow forces to use weapons.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: T'gana Collector cycles to hospital for surprise visit days after taking charge
text: Narayana Reddy, the Collector of Telangana's Nizamabad district, made a surprise visit to a government hospital on a bicycle three days after taking charge. Reddy interacted with the patients and visited several wards. After noticing that several doctors were not present, he ordered the hospital authorities to issue memos to the absentee doctors.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: China sentences former bank head to death for stealing ₹770 cr, taking bribes
text: A Chinese court has sentenced the former chairman of a regional bank to death with a two-year reprieve for moving ₹770 crore of the bank's shares to his personal account. Jiang Xiyun was also convicted of taking bribes of ₹61 crore. If Jiang commits no further crimes over the next two years, his sentence will be commuted to life imprisonment.n
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Won't allow BJP to attack Assam's language, culture: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that the "Northeast has its own languages, cultures and history. They (BJP) have not recognised it". "We will not allow them to attack and trample Assam's language, culture and history," he added. Rahul Gandhi was speaking at an anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act rally in Assam's Guwahati.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Shubman slams his 1st ton of season, takes 1st class average to 67.32
text: Punjab batsman Shubman Gill slammed his first hundred of the season against Vidarbha in the Ranji Trophy to take his first-class average to 67.32. In response to Vidarbha's 338 runs in first innings, Punjab declared their first innings on 408/5 on the fourth day. Gill has been named India A skipper for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: India U-19 defeat SA by 8 wickets, take 2-0 lead in 3-match series
text: India Under-19 on Saturday defeated South Africa Under-19 by eight wickets to take 2-0 lead in 3-match ODI series. India bundled-out South Africa for 119 with Yashasvi Jaiswal picking four wickets. While batting, Jaiswal, who was bought by Rajasthan Royals for Rs 2.4 crore for IPL 2020, scored 89* to help India chase the target in 16.2 overs.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Ball gets stuck between Boult’s leg and pad, CA shares video
text: Cricket Australia shared a video of the Australia-New Zealand Boxing Day Test when pacer Trent Boult came out to bat at number 11 on the third day and the ball got stuck between his leg and the flap of the pad. None of the players including Boult seemed to know where the ball went. Kiwis were bundled out for 148.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Eagles' Ayew beats 3 defenders to net 90th-minute winner vs West Ham
text: Striker Jordan Ayew went past three defenders to score in 90th-minute to help Crystal Palace defeat West Ham United 2-1 in the Premier League. While Robert Snodgrass had provided lead to West Ham in the 57th minute, Eagles' Cheikhou Kouyate scored the equaliser in the 68th minute. Ayew's effort "will long live in memory," said Crystal Palace coach Roy Hodgson.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Cristiano Ronaldo teaches 'how to jump' to Djokovic, shares video
text: Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo shared a video where he can be seen teaching 'how to jump like him' to Novak Djokovic. "Was a pleasure to see you and train with you my friend!!" Ronaldo said while sharing the post. The Juve forward recently jumped to a height of 8.39 feet to score with a header against Sampdoria in Serie A.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Apple sued by New York doctor over Watch’s heart technology
text: A cardiologist from New York has sued Apple for alleged use of his patented heartbeat-monitoring invention in Apple Watch and sought compensation. Dr Joseph Wiesel, a professor at New York University, claims that Apple infringed his patent for a method to detect an irregular heartbeat. In the lawsuit, Wiesel alleged that Apple violated his patent rights "with knowledge and understanding".
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Amazon seeks to patent vein-scanning hand recognition technology
text: Amazon filed a patent for technology that could recognise an individual's hand by scanning the wrinkles and blood vessels. Hovering of one's hand in front of the scanner would produce two images, one derived by scanning the surface and other through "deeper characteristics such as veins". The system identifies current signature and compares it with a previously stored reference signature.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: IIT-Hyderabad researchers unravel protein that repairs damaged DNA
text: A team of IIT-Hyderabad researchers has unravelled the functioning of a protein that repairs damaged DNA in humans and helps prevent diseases like cancer. Nature has evolved techniques to repair a damaged one so that catastrophic damage can be averted, the institute stated. One such repair mechanism involves activation of a special class of proteins called 'DNA repair proteins'.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Indian polity misses him: Shah remembers Jaitley on birth anniversary
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday remembered late Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on his birth anniversary. "He (Jaitley) was an outstanding parliamentarian, one of our most valuable leaders...who could marshal up cogent arguments steeped in facts and history, effortlessly," he tweeted. "Indian polity misses him," he added. Jaitley passed away on August 24 this year.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Indian Army rescues 1700 tourists stranded due to snowfall in Sikkim
text: Indian Army rescued at least 1700 tourists stranded due to heavy snowfall in Sikkim, officials said on Saturday. "These tourists, travelling in nearly 300 taxis, were returning from Nathu La Pass - Tsomgo Lake on Friday evening and got stranded," an Indian Army officer said. Army earthmovers and bulldozers are working to clear the snow and restore connectivity.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Section 144 extended for security in Ayodhya till Feb 25
text: Authorities in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya have extended Section 144, which prohibits an assembly of more than 4 people in an area, till February 25. Ayodhya's District Magistrate Anuj Kumar Jha on Friday made the announcement amid violence across the state over the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. At least 19 people have been killed in the protests across Uttar Pradesh.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Take care of your health, we'll take care of Gabbars and lions: Anurag to Big B
text: After Amitabh Bachchan shared a joke on New Year, tweeting, "Don't worry...the difference is only of 19 and 20", filmmaker Anurag Kashyap wrote, "Sir...the difference is a huge one." He added, "Take care of your health....You've accomplished your part in 1970s...Since then we are roaming with our inner Bachchan within us. We will take care of Gabbar, lion or Shakal."nn
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kashyap calls his own animated movie 'terrible' after Twitter user praises it
text: Anurag Kashyap called his 2007 animated movie 'Return of Hanuman' a "terrible film" in response to a fan on Twitter who praised it on its 12th anniversary. The filmmaker said he was "incapable of doing animation". "Could have been so much better...I loved the script though...The very first thing as a filmmaker I would say it wasn't consistent," Kashyap added.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Mind your business: Chidambaram to Army chief on CAA protests remark
text: Senior Congress leader and former Finance Minister P Chidambaram on Saturday criticised Army chief General Bipin Rawat for his remarks on those leading anti-CAA protests. "Let me appeal to General Rawat, you head the Army and mind your business," he said. "It's not the business of the Army to tell politicians what we should do," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Situation was tense: Meerut ADGP defends SP’s ‘go to Pak' remark
text: Meerut ADGP Prashant Kumar on Saturday defended SP (City) Akhilesh Singh whose video asking locals to tell anti-CAA protesters to "go to Pakistan" had gone viral. "Yes, if the situation was normal then the choice of words could have been better but that day, the situation was extremely volatile," said Kumar. "Our officers showed a lot of restraint," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Mera gala dabaya: Priyanka Gandhi accuses UP Police of manhandling her
text: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra was stopped by Lucknow police while she was on her way to meet family members of former IPS officer SR Darapuri, who was arrested during anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests. "A policewoman stopped me by strangulating me (mera gala dabaya). I was pushed...then I went ahead with a party member on a two-wheeler," Priyanka added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I expect seniors to respect juniors, feel hurt: Nikhat on Kom not hugging her
text: After Mary Kom defeated Nikhat Zareen to book a place for next year's Olympic trials, the 23-year-old boxer said, "After the fight...she used foul language to me." She added, "When the decision was announced...I tried to hug her but she didn't hug me back. Being a junior I expect from seniors that they respect juniors too, so I felt hurt."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Apki ungli karne ki aadat gayi nahi: Kambli to Miandad on remark against India
text: Former India cricketer Vinod Kambli has criticised former Pakistan captain Javed Miandad for his demand that ICC must ban India from hosting international cricket. "Miandad aapki ungli karne ki aadat gayi nahin. Abhi retirement ke baad bhi chalu hai. Our country is safe. We have provided the best security to every touring nation coming to India," Kambli wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pujara shares video of him taking wicket in Ranji Trophy, Dhawan trolls him
text: Team India and Saurashtra batsman Cheteshwar Pujara took to Instagram to share a video of himself taking a wicket against Uttar Pradesh in a Ranji Trophy match. In the video, Pujara can be seen sprinting while celebrating the wicket. Trolling Pujara, his Team India teammate Shikhar Dhawan wrote, "Bhai kabhie itne tez sprint running karte waqt bhi maar liya kar."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Keep critics close: Kejriwal on BJP's 'chargesheet' against AAP govt
text: After Delhi unit of BJP released a 'chargesheet' listing 'failures' of the AAP government, CM Arvind Kejriwal responded by saying, "Our culture teaches us to keep our critics close." "We will go through their (BJP's) 'aarop patra'. We will implement the good suggestions in the next five years," said Kejriwal in a tweet. Delhi goes to polls next year.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 2 human arms, bracelet found in tiger shark's stomach
text: Two human arms and a bracelet were found in the stomach of a 3.4-meter-long tiger shark caught off the coast of the French island of La Reunion. The state of the human remains indicated that they were not ingested within the last 48 hours, officials revealed. The family of a man who went missing in mid-December reportedly identified the bracelet.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Man breaches Priyanka Gandhi's security to meet her at event in Lucknow
text: A man breached Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's security during an event to mark the 135th Foundation Day of the Congress in Lucknow on Saturday. He was stopped by security personnel after he climbed onto the stage. Priyanka asked the security personnel to step back and then interacted with the man and also shook hands with him.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Ex-Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu involved in insider trading: AP govt panel
text: Former Andhra Pradesh CM and TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu was involved in insider trading in the capital city Amaravati, a cabinet sub-committee said. "There were many irregularities in the land allotment and various laws were violated. Further, the then government cheated and intimidated assigned landholders in the land pooling scheme zone," the committee added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 2 men allegedly pose as CBI chief & threaten customs officials; arrested
text: The CBI has arrested two men for allegedly posing as agency director RK Shukla and threatening customs officials on behalf of companies that are under investigation. One of the accused had called the investigating officer of the case and told him that the CBI had received a complaint that he's blackmailing the companies and demanded case documents from him.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Editors Guild condemns BJP IT Cell head’s poll on Rajdeep Sardesai
text: Editors Guild of India on Saturday criticised BJP IT cell in-charge Amit Malviya after the latter put out a Twitter poll asking if journalist Rajdeep Sardesai should handle Public Relations for terrorist outfit ISIS. Calling the poll "deplorable", a statement by the Guild said, "The poll was not only tasteless, it also questioned the integrity and patriotism of Mr Sardesai."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Least in last 6 years: CM Gehlot on child deaths in Kota hospital
text: Talking about deaths of newborns at a hospital in Kota, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said, "This year has least deaths in last six years." "Even one child's death is unfortunate. But there have been 1500...deaths in a year in (the) past. This year figure is (around) 900," he added. Gehlot also said that deaths in hospitals were "nothing new".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Govt includes those who criticised it in statistics panel led by Pronab Sen
text: The government has constituted a 28-member "Standing Committee on Economic Statistics" headed by India's first Chief Statistician Pronab Sen. The panel includes three academicians who were among the 108 economists and social scientists who raised concerns over "political interference" in statistics-gathering agencies. It will also have representatives from the United Nations, RBI, and Tata Trusts.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Ratan Tata shares pic of him flying in F/A-18 Super Hornet on 82nd birthday
text: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata shared a picture of him flying in a Boeing F/A-18 Super Hornet at Aero India 2011 in Bengaluru on his 82nd birthday on Saturday. He said it was one of his favourite moments from this decade. He also thanked his followers on Instagram for their wishes on his birthday.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Sonam and Anushka are best-dressed in Bollywood: Actress Esha
text: Actress Esha Gupta said in an interview that Sonam Kapoor and Anushka Sharma are the best-dressed celebrities in Bollywood. On being asked if she's stolen anything from her mother's or sister's wardrobe, Esha said, "My mother's jewellery set that she wore for her wedding reception, it's so delicate and precious, I told her from the start that's all I need."n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Wagner 2nd fastest Kiwi to 200 Test wickets, breaks Boult's record
text: Neil Wagner has surpassed Trent Boult to become second-fastest New Zealand bowler to pick 200 Test wickets after Sir Richard Hadlee. While Hadlee achieved the feat in 44 Tests, Wagner took his 200th wicket in his 46th Test, dismissing Steve Smith in the second innings of the Boxing Day Test against Australia. Boult had taken 52 games for the feat.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Ex-Windies captain Clive Lloyd conferred with knighthood
text: Former West Indies captain Clive Lloyd will receive knighthood for his "outstanding service to cricket" as part of Britain's New Year's Honours. Lloyd led West Indies from 1974 to 1985 and won 26 matches without defeat including the 5-0 Test series win against England. He also led the team to consecutive victories in the first two World Cups.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Spotify to suspend political advertising in 2020
text: Music streaming service Spotify announced it would suspend selling political advertisements on its platform in early 2020. The suspension will be extended to Spotify original and exclusive podcasts as well. The platform said it does not have resources to "validate and review" political advertisements. It also added the decision would be reassessed as it continues to "evolve its capabilities".
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Indian Oil partners with 2 startups for doorstep delivery of fuel
text: Indian Oil Corporation has partnered with Delhi-based Pepfuels and Pune-based Repos Energy to make doorstep delivery of fuel through mobile dispensers. Orders will be placed through mobile apps and websites of the companies. While Pepfuels will be responsible for deliveries in Delhi-NCR, Repos Energy will take care of deliveries in Pune, Chennai, Bengaluru, Varanasi and Raigarh.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: CBSE asks schools to make campuses 'anger-free zones'
text: The Central Board of Secondary Education has issued an advisory to all its schools to make their campuses "anger-free zones" where everyone "will try to manage" anger. The board suggested schools set up signboard reading 'This is an anger-free zone'. "The best way to teach children the value of freedom from anger is by setting examples ourselves," the advisory stated.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Shah didn't answer single question on CAA in Parliament: Chidambaram
text: Congress' P Chidambaram on Saturday said that Home Minister Amit Shah "didn't answer a single question on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA)" in the parliament and now he is "challenging Rahul Gandhi for a debate". "Shah must...listen to the debates in Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha," Chidambaram added. He further alleged that CAA destroys the basis of our Constitution.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Nitish Kumar unveils Arun Jaitley's statue in Bihar
text: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Saturday unveiled a statue of late Union Minister Arun Jaitley in Patna on his birth anniversary. Kumar paid tribute to Jaitely who had passed away in August after prolonged illness. Earlier in August, Nitish Kumar had said that Jaitley's birth anniversary will be celebrated as a State function every year.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 2.35 lakh flee Syria's Idlib in 2 weeks amid attacks: UN
text: More than 235,000 people have fled from their homes in Syria's Idlib province, a UN humanitarian agency OCHA report said. The mass displacement between 12 and 25 December has left the Maaret al-Numan region in southern Idlib "almost empty", the report added. An increase in airstrikes and ground fighting since mid-December has accelerated civilian displacement from the area.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: UN condemns abuses against Myanmar's Rohingya Muslims
text: The UN General Assembly on Friday approved a resolution condemning human rights abuses against Muslim Rohingya and other minorities in Myanmar. Myanmar's UN ambassador said the resolution was designed "to exert unwanted political pressure on Myanmar". Earlier this month, Myanmar State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi had rejected allegations of genocide at the International Court of Justice.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Avail exclusive year end benefits on the Audi Q7
text: The Audi Q7 comes equipped with the best of what Audi has to offer which includes quattro technology - Audi’s exclusive all-wheel drive system, Cruise control and many more class leading features. This new year, along with extended warranty and 5 year service plan, Audi is offering exclusive ownership benefits for a limited period.
author: Aarish

headlines: B'luru Metro to be open till 2 am on New Year's Day; no breath analyser tests
text: Bengaluru Metro will be operational till 2 am on New Year’s Day, a Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) official said. He stated that security measures will be in place at all metro stations but added there are no plans to restrict passengers who are inebriated from boarding trains. There will be no breath analyser tests conducted on metro users.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: MP govt official Amita who won ₹50 lakh on KBC suspended for abusing man on FB
text: Madhya Pradesh revenue department official Amita Singh Tomar has been suspended after she posted an objectionable comment on Facebook, wherein she used religious expletive against a man on a post about encroachment removal. Tomar had won ₹50 lakh on Kaun Banega Crorepati almost a decade ago. In 2017, she had written to PM Narendra Modi complaining about her "repeated transfers".
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 2 Delhi U-23 cricketers follow women, knock their hotel room doors; sent back home
text: Two Delhi Under-23 cricketers have been sent back home for alleged misconduct during a Christmas party at a Kolkata hotel, ahead of their CK Nayudu Trophy match. The duo chased a couple of women, followed them to their rooms and constantly "harassed" them by knocking their doors. They were sent to a different hotel before being directed to return home.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: User terms Manjrekar's post on Kohli as tweet of decade, commentator responds
text: A Twitter user, 'Trendulkar', termed commentator Sanjay Manjrekar's 2012 post about Virat Kohli not having a future in Tests as 'tweet of the decade'. In response, Manjrekar said he was proud of that tweet. Adding that fans and media thought Kohli didn't belong to Tests as he scored less in Australia, Manrjekar wrote, "[Glad]...I said give him 1 more Test."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Assam ko RSS ke chaddi wale nahi chalayenge: Rahul Gandhi at Guwahati rally
text: Stating that he fears Assam is returning to path of violence because of BJP's policies, Rahul Gandhi at a rally in Guwahati said, "The BJP and RSS will not be allowed to attack culture, language and identity of Assam and Northeast." "Assam ko RSS ke chaddi wale nahi chalayenge. Assam ko Assam ki janta chalayegi," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Wow: Paytm CEO on Tesla building China factory, delivering cars in 357 days
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma praised Elon Musk-led Tesla after the automaker scheduled the delivery of first China-made Model 3 on December 30. Sharma tweeted, "In just 357 days from starting factory construction to handing over first car to customer! #WowProductivity." Tesla's Chinese factory, its first one outside the US, began construction in January and started car production in October.
author: Dharna

headlines: Attempt to recreate how astronauts feel on seeing Earth from space
text: Missouri University researchers aim to recreate the 'intense emotional experience', called "Overview Effect", which several astronauts reported on seeing Earth from space. About 100 volunteers will wear a VR headset and get into a dark, salt-laden flotation tank at a Missouri spa. Astronauts described it as a feeling of being humans above everything else, living on a planet without boundaries.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Trump retweets name of alleged Ukraine whistleblower
text: US President Donald Trump retweeted the name of the alleged whistleblower who had disclosed his phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Trump retweeted a post from a re-election campaign account which read, "It's pretty simple. The CIA 'whistleblower' is not a real whistleblower!" The call had triggered Trump's impeachment, with the US President being accused of abusing his power.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: New world of communication: Mahindra on man using sign language over video call
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra shared a video of a man using sign language over a video call to highlight the benefits of mobile phones. "We often criticise the way in which mobile devices have taken over our world…It's good to remind ourselves that these devices have also OPENED up a whole new world of communication," he captioned the video.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Man who claims he invented Bitcoin says $6 bn fortune may remain locked
text: Self-declared Bitcoin inventor Craig Wright said he may not be able to surrender half of his $6 billion holdings as ordered by a US court. Wright's late business partner Dave Kleiman owns half of all Bitcoins that Wright mined before his death, the court had ruled. Wright added he never said the "private keys" to those coins would become available.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Will definitely play an older woman who romances younger man: Kareena
text: Kareena Kapoor has said that she'll break the norm by taking such roles in films where an older woman romances a younger man. "Now when I am older, I will definitely do that kind of part," she added. "People do fall in love. Look at Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas, they're from different generations...What's the big deal?" Kareena further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Decided to make Naagin as film, approached Katrina, Priyanka for it: Ekta
text: Ekta Kapoor has revealed she'd decided to make Mouni Roy-starrer TV show 'Naagin' as a film first and had approached Katrina Kaif and Priyanka Chopra to star in it. "[Katrina]...looked at me and thought I'd smoked something," Ekta said. She added after Katrina declined her offer, she approached Priyanka for it, adding, "Both of them weren't sure if that'll work."n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: James Gunn's 'The Suicide Squad' is reinvention, not sequel: David Ayer
text: Filmmaker David Ayer has said the upcoming version of his 2016 directorial film, 'Suicide Squad', is a reinvention and not a sequel. Ayer added his film was a standalone project but some characters and elements will be used in the new version of the film. Directed by James Gunn, 'The Suicide Squad' will see Margot Robbie returning as Harley Quinn.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I wish Akshay's film does better than ours on Eid 2020: Salman
text: Talking about the clash of his film 'Radhe: Your Most Wanted Bhai' with Akshay Kumar's 'Laxmmi Bomb' on Eid 2020, Salman Khan said that he wants both the films to do well. "I wish his does better than ours," he added. Talking about the release of 'Good Newwz' right after his 'Dabangg 3', Salman said, "No better way to end...year."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: We've to be cool about it: Varun on his film's clash with Kangana's
text: Varun Dhawan, while talking about the clash of his upcoming film 'Street Dancer 3D' with Kangana Ranaut's 'Panga', said, "We're in 2020 we can't do this thing of clash...we've to be cool about it." He added that both films are very different and people should watch both of them. Talking about Kangana, Varun said he admires her work a lot.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: SA opener Aiden Markram out of England series after finger fracture
text: South Africa opener Aiden Markram has been ruled out of the rest of the England series after a fracture in his left ring finger during the first Test. Notably, he recently recovered from a self-inflicted wrist injury during the second Test against India. Markram scored 20 runs in South Africa's first innings and went for a 5-ball 2 in second.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Weightlifter Seema banned for 4 years for failing dope test
text: Weightlifter Seema, who won silver in 2017 Commonwealth Championships, has been banned by the National Anti-Doping Agency for four years for failing a dope test. Seema's dope sample, which was collected during the 34th National Weightlifting Championship, returned positive with the presence of banned performance-enhancing drugs. Seema had finished sixth in the women's 75kg at the Gold Coast CWG.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Manchester City lose 2-3 against Wolves in Premier League
text: Defending champions Manchester City on Friday night lost to Wolverhampton Wanderers 2-3 to leave them 14 points behind Premier League leaders Liverpool. The Wolves came from behind with Adama Traore, Raul Jimenez and Matt Doherty scoring to overcome Raheem Sterlings' brace. City were reduced to 10 men in the 12th minute after goalkeeper Ederson was shown red card. n
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Apple to donate funds to support Australian bushfires relief efforts
text: Speaking on the Australian bushfires, Apple CEO Tim Cook tweeted Apple will be donating funds to support relief efforts. "Our hearts are with those impacted...and with the courageous volunteer force fighting the unprecedented blazes across the country," he wrote in a tweet. For over two months, deadly bushfires have been burning across Australia and engulfing towns.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: WhatsApp changes purpose of 'disappearing' messages: Report
text: WhatsApp has reportedly changed the purpose of its 'disappearing' message feature that was expected to let each user set an expiration time on their messages in group chats. WABetaInfo reported the feature, currently being tested, can only be enabled by group chat admins as a "cleaning tool" to auto-delete older messages in groups. WhatsApp also renamed it to 'Delete Messages'.
author: Dharna

headlines: MPs get 24/7 call centre in Parliament House 'for better facilities'
text: A 24/7 call centre named, Information and Communication Centre, has been set up in room number 13 of the Parliament House to assist MPs in various aspects. This comes after Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla called for "better facilities" for MPs, including research assistants. "It's an excellent idea. MPs need information...to prepare for Question Hour, debates...bills," said an official.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Low visibility at Delhi airport leads to flight delays, diversions
text: Dense fog led to disruption of rail, road and air transport services in Delhi on Saturday. Several flights flying in and out of Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport were either delayed or diverted to nearby airports. This came as visibility reduced to zero near the airport. Delhi Airport Authority advised passengers to contact airlines for updated flight information.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bogus agenda of useless brigade will be over soon: Naqvi on CAA protests
text: In a veiled attack at Congress' Rahul Gandhi, TMC's Mamata Banerjee and other Opposition leaders, BJP's Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that "this useless brigade's bogus agenda will get over soon". "These people's brains are completely empty...Mamata Banerjee is one of the players of this...brigade," he added. This comes amid many Opposition leaders protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 6 killed, 1 missing in tour helicopter crash in US
text: Remains of 6 of the 7 people on board of a US tour helicopter that crashed in Hawaii were found on Friday. The operation to rescue the last remaining person was suspended due to bad weather conditions. The plane, with 2 minors, had crashed at the top of a mountain on the island of Kauai on Thursday.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Over 70 killed, 90 injured in Somalia car bomb blast
text: At least 70 people were killed by a car bomb blast in Somalia's capital Mogadishu on Saturday, police said. As many as 90 civilians, mostly students, were injured in the blast at the security and taxation checkpoint, Mogadishu Mayor added. Police said that the death toll is expected to rise. No group immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: China to scrap old benchmark lending rate starting next year
text: Scraping the old benchmark lending rates, China's central bank has asked lenders to use a new benchmark to price loans issued from January 2020. It also told banks to gradually convert existing loans to the Loan Prime Rate (LPR) from March to August. China had introduced the one-year LPR in August as a key step towards liberalising the financial system.
author: Dharna

headlines: TN policemen stop man on BMW superbike and take pictures; he shares video
text: Policemen in Tamil Nadu stopped a man on a BMW superbike at a check post and took pictures of themselves sitting on the bike. "Police asked for papers and after all the formalities they asked for a picture on my bike which I humbly (didn't deny)," the biker wrote sharing the video on his personal YouTube channel.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Trump blames Canada PM Trudeau for deleting his scene from Home Alone 2
text: Donald Trump blamed Canadian PM Justin Trudeau after Canada's national broadcaster CBC deleted the scene featuring the US President from the movie Home Alone 2.
