"I guess Justin T doesn't much like my making him pay up on NATO or Trade!" Trump tweeted. CBC said it had removed Trump's cameo in 2014 to make way for commercials.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Bas ab baap banna baki hai: Salman after birth of his niece on his birthday
text: Talking about birth of his niece, Ayat, on his birthday, Salman Khan said significance of December 27 has changed for him. "I saw her picture first thing in the morning," he added. When asked about becoming an uncle again, Salman said, "Abi hogeya mama ka, chacha ka, bas ab baap banna baki hai (Only becoming a father is left now)."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: FIR filed against 1,000 unidentified AMU students for Dec 15 violence
text: An FIR has been filed against 1,000 unidentified students of the Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) in connection with violence which broke out during protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act on December 15. Protesters at the Aligarh Muslim University had accused the police of indulging in "unprovoked violence, more brutal than even in Jamia Millia Islamia".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Mary Kom defeats 23-year-old Nikhat Zareen, refuses to shake hands with her
text: Six-time world boxing champion Mary Kom defeated 23-year-old Nikhat Zareen in the 51-kg category trial bout to qualify for Olympic qualifiers in China. The 36-year-old refused to shake hands with Nikhat. "Why should I shake hands with her? If she wants others to respect her then she should first respect others. I don't like people with such nature," Kom said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Vegas Hyperloop tunnel to 'hopefully' start in 2020: Elon Musk
text: Elon Musk tweeted that his tunnel-digging startup The Boring Company's Las Vegas Hyperloop tunnel will "hopefully" be fully operational in 2020. "Boring Co is completing its first commercial tunnel in Vegas, going from Convention Center to Strip, then will work on other projects," the startup's billionaire Founder and CEO said. The subterranean transit project contract costs about $48.7 million.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 'I don't know Prashant Kishor' says Minister; Kishor replies 'Why would he?'
text: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said, "Who's Prashant Kishor? I don't know him. There's a chap who [worked] in UN, then...joined one party". Responding to this, Kishor said, "He's a...minister. Why will he know an ordinary man like me? Over 50 lakh people like me from UP and Bihar...struggle to make a space for themselves in Delhi."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Committed to lend expertise: Russia on ISRO's 1st human Moon mission
text: Russia on Friday reiterated its commitment on sharing its expertise for India's first-ever human Moon mission with ISRO. "There's excellent cooperation between...Roscosmos and ISRO for the human space flight programme," Russian Federation Consulate General said. Separately, ISRO has set a target for the first unmanned flight under India's first human spaceflight mission Gaganyaan by December 2022.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: I don't believe in ghosts: Man who rented house where 11 of a family committed suicide
text: A man who has rented the Delhi house where 11 members of a family allegedly committed suicide, has said, "I don't believe in superstitions and ghosts. All I know is I am getting a house that fits my budget." Mohan Kashyap, who lives with his wife and two children in Bhajanpura, will move into the Burari house on December 30.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 'Happy Birthday Boss' FB user Shera Chikna shares post for Dawood; detained
text: A Facebook user named Shera Chikna shared a post for underworld don Dawood Ibrahim with a caption "Happy Birthday Boss" on Thursday. The post contained four pictures, the first one with five cakes and the rest three were of Dawood. The Mumbai Crime Branch has detained Shera and a few other people for allegedly celebrating the fugitive gangster's birthday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: MP policemen in civil clothes seen beating a boy; CM orders probe
text: Two Madhya Pradesh police officials in civilian clothes were seen beating a boy in a video which was taken in the city of Damoh. Chief Minister Kamal Nath took cognisance of the matter and ordered a probe into it. "Instructions have...been given to take strict action against those found guilty," he said on Twitter.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Govt rejected our proposal to strike Pak terror camps after 26/11: Ex-IAF chief
text: While addressing students at a college festival, former Indian Air Force chief BS Dhanoa said that the government had rejected IAF's proposal to strike Pakistan terror camps after 26/11 terror attack. "We knew where the terror camps were located in Pakistan and were ready. But it's a political decision whether to carry out a strike or not," he stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Gardener found to have 12 plots, 3-storey house and gold after raid in Odisha
text: A man working as a gardener-cum-horticultural extension worker in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district was found to have a three-storey house, 12 plots of land, a poultry farm, three two-wheelers, gold and ₹1.5 lakh in cash following a raid. Search operations were carried out after receiving complaints of disproportionate assets in excess of his known source of income, officials said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Police used facial recognition software to find protest suspects at PM's rally
text: Delhi Police used a facial recognition software, AFRS, to screen the crowd at PM Narendra Modi's Ramlila Maidan rally on December 22. This was the first time Delhi Police used facial images collected from footage filmed at various protests in Delhi to filter "law and order suspects" at PM's rally. Police had acquired AFRS to identify lost and found children.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Thai Navy officer dies of infection he got while rescuing 12 boys from cave
text: A Thai navy SEAL who took part in rescue of 12 boys and their soccer coach from a flooded cave in Thailand last year has died from a blood infection he contracted during the operation. Beiret Bureerak had been receiving treatment, but his condition worsened, the Royal Thai Navy said in a statement. Another rescuer had died during the operation.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Growing small amounts of marijuana at home not a crime: Italy's top court
text: Growing small amounts of marijuana at home for private use is not a crime, Italy's top court has ruled, putting an end to a years long legal dispute and adding Italy to the short list of countries that allow cultivation of recreational cannabis. "It's a very important decision," a representative of a drug policy advocacy group said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Domino's Pizza UK finance boss drowns while snorkelling in Mauritius
text: The Chief Financial Officer of Domino's Pizza Group, the franchise holder for the fast-food brand in the UK and Ireland, drowned in a snorkelling accident in Mauritius. David Bauernfeind was on holiday in Mauritius with his wife and daughter when the accident occurred. Local reports said Bauernfeind was found by a sailor off the coast of the island.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Ratan Tata, Anand Mahindra among India's 10 most Googled businesspeople
text: As per Google's Search trends for 2019, Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was the most searched businessperson in India. Former Wipro Chairman Azim Premji, ArcelorMittal chief Lakshmi Mittal, Poonawalla Group's Cyrus Poonawalla and Mahindra Group's Anand Mahindra came next. HCL Founder Shiv Nadar took the 6th spot, followed by Adani Group's Gautam Adani and Biocon Founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw.
author: Dharna

headlines: PIL filed against Akshay, Kareena's Good Newwz for 'misguiding people'
text: A PIL has been filed against Akshay Kumar and Kareena Kapoor-starrer 'Good Newwz' in Karnataka High Court for allegedly "misguiding people" and making them question the credibility of In-Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) centres. The film shows an IVF clinic accidentally interchanging the sperm of two couples with the same surname. The petitioner has sought a stay on its release. n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Going to learn a lot from her: Siddhant on working with Deepika
text: Talking about working with Deepika Padukone in an upcoming film, actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said that he is going to learn a lot from her as she is "talented and an amazing person". Talking about the film, which will be directed by Shakun Batra, Siddhant said that he is expecting something "quite intense". The yet-to-be-titled film will also feature Ananya Panday.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: NPR, NRC two sides of a coin: Asaduddin Owaisi
text: AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi has said that National Population Register (NPR) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) are "two sides of a coin". "These rules have been made as per the Citizenship Act, 1955...if NPR is done...NRC would also be done," he added. This comes after BJP's G Kishan Reddy said that there is no link between NPR and NRC.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Farmers use 'barking' drones to herd sheep instead of sheepdogs
text: Several farmers in New Zealand, Australia and the UK have begun using drones to herd their flock of sheep, saying the method saves time and was efficient on mountainous terrain. A farmer, whose sheep eventually stopped responding to drones, began playing dog barks on the drone to shepherd them, while another trained his sheep to follow the drone for treats.
author: Dharna

headlines: Youth who supported Modi, Shah worried due to surging prices: Cong
text: Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge has said that the youth who supported Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah are now 'worried' due to "surging prices and deteriorating economy". "Unemployment...on the rise...increasing prices...everyone is troubled," he added. Commenting on Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Kharge further said, "People across India...expressed how CAA can be misused."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: J&K govt drops Sheikh Abdullah's birth anniversary from its holidays
text: The Government of Jammu and Kashmir's General Administration department has dropped ex-Chief Minister Sheikh Abdullah's birth anniversary, observed on December 5, from its list of public holidays for 2020. Martyrs' Day, observed on July 13, has also been dropped. 'Accession Day', observed on October 26 to commemorate the signing of the Instrument of Accession by Maharaja Hari Singh, is included.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Cong takes out 'Save Constitution-Save India' march on foundation day
text: The Congress party on its 135th foundation day on Saturday is set to take out 'Save Constitution-Save India' flag marches across India. While Rahul Gandhi is in Assam's Guwahati to address a rally during the march, Priyanka Gandhi is in Lucknow. Congress' Maharashtra unit took out the march between Mumbai's August Kranti Maidan and Girgaum Chowpatty.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Delhi Police constable shoots himself dead with service pistol
text: A 33-year-old Delhi Police constable allegedly shot himself dead with his service pistol in Dhaula Kuan area on Saturday. "We received a call at 1.30 am...he shot himself in his right temple and died on the spot," said DCP Southwest. Although no suicide note has been recovered, the DCP said that the constable killed himself over a family dispute.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 2 Andhra tourists die after collapsing at EDM festival in Goa
text: Two tourists from Andhra Pradesh died on Friday after collapsing outside the venue of the ongoing Sunburn Electronic Dance Music (EDM) festival in North Goa, police said. They started to feel uneasy outside the gates and fainted, and were taken to a hospital where they were declared dead. "It can be a heart attack, drug overdose or anything," police said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Delhi records season's lowest temperature at 2.4°C today
text: Delhi recorded the season's lowest temperature of 2.4°Celsius on Saturday morning, with a forecast of "cold day to severe cold day conditions" over the next two days. The India Meteorological Department said a blanket of fog reduced the visibility to less than 150 metres in the National Capital. Delhi could see rise in temperature after December 29, IMD added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Kushal Punjabi's body kept at hospital till his wife arrives from China
text: Body of actor Kushal Punjabi, who was found hanging in his Mumbai house, has been kept at a hospital till his wife Audrey Dolhen arrives from China. A suicide note was also recovered and it did not blame anyone for the extreme step. Meanwhile, actor Chetan Hansraj said Kushal was in process of separating from his wife.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: When Kushal's parents and I opened his door, we saw him hanging: Actor Chetan
text: Actor Chetan Hansraj has revealed that late actor Kushal Punjabi's parents had called him up late at night, saying that Kushal wasn't opening his house's door. "We called a [lock smith] and when we opened the door, we found his body [hanging from] the ceiling," Chetan said. "We tried CPR but it was too late," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: UP CM Yogi's office calls him 'great', says 'violent protesters will cry'
text: After UP government announced seizure of properties of violent rioters during anti-CAA protests, CM Yogi Adityanath's office tweeted that protesters will cry now, because "there's Yogi government in UP". "Do whatever...damages will be paid by those who cause damages," the tweet read, along with the hashtag 'TheGreat_CmYogi'. "Looking at the strictness of Yogi...everyone is silent," it claimed.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: You eat here but sing praises of another place, go to Pak: Meerut SP to protestors
text: A video has surfaced online, showing a Meerut SP asking local residents to tell anti-CAA protesters to "go to Pakistan" during clashes on December 20. "Khaoge yahan ka, gaoge kahin aur ka (You eat here but sing praises of another place)", he was heard saying. Meanwhile, the officer defended himself saying that some protestors were raising 'Pakistan zindabad' slogans.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: PM lying, his govt gave ₹46 crore for a big detention camp in Assam: Ex-CM
text: Former Assam CM Tarun Gogoi has said that PM Narendra Modi is "lying" that there is no detention camp in the country. Gogoi claimed that the BJP government sanctioned ₹46 crore to build a big detention camp in Assam's Goalpara district. Gogoi added that his administration had constructed detention camps needed to house "declared foreigners" on Gauhati High Court's orders.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Programmer loses game he made as a kid, finds it online 25 yrs later
text: A programmer, Rick Brewster, shared online his discovery of a DOS-based roleplaying game inspired by a text adventure from a 1984 instructional book, which he had made in 1994 at the age of 12. After having lost it when young, Brewster found his game being streamed online after 25 years. "[F]inally found its way home on Christmas Eve," tweeted Rick.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: US man sues Amazon, says hacker spoke to kids via Ring security camera
text: A US-based man has filed a lawsuit against Amazon and its WiFi-enabled security camera system Ring, saying that its defective design leaves purchasers vulnerable to cyberattacks. John Orange said a stranger compromised his Ring outdoor camera and spoke to his three kids, beckoning them to come closer. He cited another recent incident where hacker spoke to an eight-year-old through Ring.
author: Dharna

headlines: Europe's 1st plastic-free ski resort made after microplastics found
text: After scientists discovered one of the largest Italian Alps valley glaciers contained microplastics heavily, a ski resort in northern Italy banned all single-use plastics, making it Europe's first plastic-free resort. The Forni Glacier was found to have around 131-162 million plastic particles. "Projects that aim to limit the use of plastic products are urgently needed," a glaciologist said.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Up all night with SpaceX team: Musk shares Starship progress video
text: Private spaceflight pioneer Elon Musk tweeted a video of his aerospace startup SpaceX's Starship rocket's tank dome production, which he called the "most difficult part of the primary structure". "Was up all night with SpaceX team working...Dawn arrives," the billionaire wrote. Notably, Musk has talked about working 80-100 hours per week on several occasions in the past.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: The most humble person I know: Paytm's Sharma on Innov8's Malik
text: Paytm's Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to share a photo of him with co-working space provider Innov8's Founder and CEO Ritesh Malik. "Just met the most humble person I know...A doctor, an (entrepreneur) and the most founder-friendly seed investor," wrote Sharma. Notably, the two recently joined cyber safety initiative Akancha Against Harassment's Board of Advisors.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Starship rocket will 'hopefully' fly in next 2-3 months, says Musk
text: Aerospace startup SpaceX's Starship rocket will "hopefully" fly in the next two to three months, Founder and CEO Elon Musk responded to a user enquiring the same on Twitter. SpaceX is presently building a flight design of Starship, a rocket aimed at transporting humans to Moon and Mars. "Starship will be the world's most powerful launch vehicle," as per SpaceX.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Congress leader shot dead by two bike-borne assailants in Bihar
text: Congress leader Rakesh Yadav was shot dead by two bike-borne assailants in Bihar's Vaishali on Saturday, police said. Police added that the reason behind Yadav's murder is yet to be ascertained, adding that the matter is being investigated from all angles. Footage from CCTVs installed in nearby areas is also being checked, police further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Guj teacher saves lives of 5 babies by donating 12 litres of her breast milk
text: A 29-year-old teacher in Gujarat's Ahmedabad saved the lives of five premature babies by donating 12 litres of her breast milk. The woman gave birth to her own son on September 20 this year and might continue to donate milk. The babies' biological mothers could not breastfeed them either because the women were too weak or at risk medically.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Koala stops cyclist to drink water from her bottle amid bushfires in Australia
text: A dehydrated koala approached a cyclist in what appeared to be a call for help amid bushfires in Australia. Anna Heuseler, who was with a group of cyclists heading towards Adelaide in temperatures of up to 40°C, shared a video of the koala. In the video, the koala can be seen drinking thirstily when offered a water bottle.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Bank frauds rise to record high of ₹1.13 lakh crore in FY20 H1: RBI
text: As per the RBI's Financial Stability Report, bank frauds rose to an all-time high amount of ₹1.13 lakh crore in the first half of the financial year 2019-20. The frauds, each valuing equal to or more than ₹1 lakh, were 4,412 in number. In the preceding financial year, banks in India had reported 6,801 cases of fraud involving ₹71,543 crore.
author: Dharna

headlines: I'm sad that he gave up: Ranvir Shorey on Kushal's suicide
text: Ranvir Shorey on Friday took to Twitter to condole the death of Kushal Punjabi and wrote, "I've known Kushal...since he was a kid." "He was always an all-rounder, a rare mix of talent and hard work. His commitment and dedication were an inspiration to everyone around him. I'm very sad...he's gone. I'm even sadder that he gave up," he added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: I don't like violence, don't destroy property: Akshay on CAA protests
text: Talking about the ongoing protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in India, Akshay Kumar urged people to stay away from violence, adding, "Don't destroy property." "Whether any side left side or right side, just don't do violence," he added. "Whatever you want to say to each other do it with positivity, talk to each other," Akshay further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Saddened that some sentiments were hurt: Farah after FIR against her
text: Farah Khan has apologised after the Punjab Police filed a case against her, Raveena Tandon and Bharti Singh for allegedly hurting Christian community's religious sentiments on a show. "I'm extremely saddened....some sentiments have been inadvertently hurt by a recent episode of my show," she said. "On behalf of...entire team, Raveena...Bharti...and myself...we do sincerely apologise," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Nehru, Indira had also taken steps to protect refugees: BJP's Pokhriyal
text: BJP leader and HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank has said that former PMs Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi had also taken steps to protect refugees facing religious persecution. "Nehru-Liaquat agreement...for the protection of minorities in India and Pakistan," he added. Calling Citizenship (Amendment) Act 'a need', Pokhriyal further said, "Historic work...done under PM Modi's leadership."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Facebook's Libra has failed in current form, says Swiss President
text: Switzerland's Finance Minister and outgoing President Ueli Maurer said that Facebook's to-be-launched cryptocurrency Libra has failed in its current form. "I don't think (Libra has a chance in its current form), because central banks will not accept the basket of currencies underpinning it," he said. Notably, Facebook has acknowledged that Libra's launch could be delayed over regulatory hurdles.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: View of Universe under threat: Astronomers against SpaceX satellites
text: Astronomers worldwide have warned that the launch of mega-constellations of internet-beaming satellites by Elon Musk's SpaceX and Jeff Bezos' Amazon threatens the view of Universe. Scientists said the "bright" satellites can get in the way of key observations such as a potentially hazardous asteroid. SpaceX has deployed 120 Starlink satellites so far, while Amazon's project is under development.
author: Dharna

headlines: Google Chrome faces new bugs, users lose secondary profiles' names
text: Several new bugs in Google's Chrome browser have been discovered, one of which deletes secondary profile names and renames them to 'Person 1' and so on. Meanwhile, cybersecurity researchers at the Tencent Blade Team found vulnerabilities that could allow hackers to enable remote code execution via WebSQL, potentially leaking programme memory or crashing the browser. The flaw was later fixed.
author: Dharna

headlines: Man gets 8 yrs imprisonment for killing his wife 4 yrs ago
text: A Telangana court on Friday sentenced a 24-year-old man to eight years of "rigorous" imprisonment and fined him for ₹2,000 for killing his wife by setting her ablaze on December 31, 2015. The accused had come home in a drunken state and after picking up a fight with his wife, locked the house from outside after setting her ablaze.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 'Paanch saal Delhi behaal, nahi chahiye Kejriwal': BJP's counter to AAP
text: BJP on Friday released its slogan for Delhi's 2020 Assembly elections to counter the ruling Arvind Kejriwal-led Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) slogan. BJP's slogan reads, "Paanch saal Delhi behaal, ab nahi chahiye Kejriwal," as against AAP's, "Acche beete paanch saal, lage raho Kejriwal". BJP also released a poster which states, "AAP government's report card...it's a bundle of lies."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP jealous of Sena, won't suggest them to use burnol: Aaditya Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena's Aaditya Thackeray on Friday said that their former ally BJP is jealous of them as they're out of power in Maharashtra. "They're sad...won't suggest them to use 'burnol'...we understand their pain but we're focused on our work as people have trusted us," he added. Commenting further on BJP, Aaditya said, "They don't only troll Sena...also troll women...women journalists."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Bad loans of banks to rise in 2020, projects RBI
text: The RBI has projected bad loans of scheduled commercial banks to rise further due to changes in the macroeconomic scenario and declining credit growth. It said the bad loans as a percentage of total loans of banks may increase to 9.9% by September 2020 from 9.3% in September 2019. In June, RBI projected the ratio to decrease by March 2020.
author: Dharna

headlines: Airtel launches Wi-Fi calling services in India
text: Airtel launched its Wi-Fi calling services starting with Delhi NCR which would gradually be introduced all across India. Customers can avail this feature by simply downloading the latest software on their smartphones, without paying an extra charge or downloading an additional application. "The decision to launch Wi-Fi calling is in keeping with the telco's customer-centric approach," says Airtel.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: 1,113 arrested in UP over CAA in biggest police crackdown since Muzaffarnagar riots
text: The UP Police has arrested 1,113 people over the protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, in the biggest police crackdown in the state since the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots when 1,480 people were arrested. The death toll from the protests in the state has risen to 19. More than 5,550 others have been put under preventive detention.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Decided to go on 1st date with my now husband when a cat ate tuna: Radhika
text: Actress Radhika Apte revealed she first went on a date with her now husband Benedict Taylor because a cat ate tuna fish. Apte said she was asked on a date by two men, so to decide whom to go out with, she kept tuna out for a cat and decided if the cat ate it, she'll go out with Benedict.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: I am so sorry you didn't feel we were there for you: Hazel on Kushal's suicide
text: Actress Hazel Keech took to Instagram to condole the death of actor Kushal Punjabi, writing, "You'll always be remembered as a kind and smiling soul. Rest in Peace Chimpoo." She added, "I'm so sorry that we failed you...I'm so sorry you didn't feel that we were there for you...We've failed you as friends, family...as a community of actors, as humans."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kushal was in process of separating from his wife, had financial issues: Chetan
text: TV actor Chetan Hansraj has revealed that Kushal Punjabi, who committed suicide on Thursday night, was in process of separating from his wife Audrey Dolhen. "He was living here while she was staying abroad with their son...He was going through depressed phase," Chetan added. He further said that Kushal was also stressed about his work and was facing financial issues.nn
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Muslim community voluntarily gives ₹6L for anti-CAA protests damages in UP
text: Members of the Muslim community in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr handed over a cheque of ₹6.27 lakh to the district administration after Friday prayers for the damages to public property during anti-CAA protests. DM Ravindra Kumar said the members came forward  on their own to pay for the damages. "We were saddened by the damage to...property," a member said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Telecom operators losing ₹2.4 crore for every hour of Internet shutdown
text: Indian telecom companies are losing around ₹2.45 crore in revenue every hour they are forced to suspend Internet services, lobby group COAI said. Internet shutdowns should not be the first course of action, added COAI, which counts Airtel, Vodafone Idea and Jio as its members. On Friday, mobile Internet was reportedly suspended in at least 18 districts in Uttar Pradesh.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: We may seize rioters’ properties like UP govt: K’taka Minister
text: Karnataka Revenue Minister Ramaiah Ashoka on Thursday said if anti-CAA protesters cause damage to public property, the state government will consider enacting legislation to seize their properties. "Everyone should abide by...law of the land," he said. This came after Yogi Adityanath-led UP government announced a move to confiscate properties of rioters to compensate for losses during protests.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Dhoni, Kohli included in Wisden's IPL team of the decade led by Rohit
text: Wisden has named its Indian Premier League (IPL) team of the decade, with Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma being named as its captain. The team includes Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni and Royal Challengers Bangalore captain Virat Kohli. Chris Gayle has been selected as Rohit's opening partner, while Suresh Raina has been named the number three batsman.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Bezos loses $9 bn in 2019, still set to end the year as world's richest man
text: Amazon Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos' net worth declined almost $9 billion in 2019 but he is still ending the year as the world's richest person. The 55-year-old's wealth dropped because of his divorce settlement with MacKenzie. The world's 500 wealthiest people tracked by the Bloomberg Billionaires Index added $1.2 trillion, boosting their collective net worth to $5.9 trillion.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 50 Hindus form human chain for Muslim man's baraat amid violence in UP
text: A group of around 50 Hindus formed a human chain and escorted a Muslim man's baraat to safety amid the violence in the anti-CAA protests in Kanpur. The chain was formed by the bride's neighbour and his friends. The group stayed back till the wedding was over and again escorted the baraat out of the area to safety.nn
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Russia deploys first hypersonic nuclear-capable missiles
text: Russia on Friday deployed its first regiment of hypersonic nuclear-capable missiles. The Avangard system comprises a hypersonic glide vehicle which is designed to sit on top an intercontinental ballistic missile and can make sharp manoeuvres on its way to a target. The Avangard system could penetrate both existing and any future missile defence systems, Russian President Vladimir Putin had said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: ISIS says it beheaded 10 Christians in Nigeria in revenge for Baghdadi's death
text: The Islamic State has released a video purporting to show the beheading of 10 Christians in Nigeria as part of its campaign to "avenge" the death of its leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. The video showed ISIS militants shooting another man to death. ISIS said the victims were captured in the past weeks in Nigeria's Borno State.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Disney employees in Minnie, Donald costumes say they were groped by tourists
text: Women who work as Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse and Donald Duck at US' Walt Disney World have filed police complaints accusing tourists of inappropriately touching them. The women who play Minnie Mouse and Donald Duck alleged they were groped. The woman wearing the Mickey Mouse costume said she was injured by a grandmother who patted her on the head.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Investment Advisers in India banned from providing free trials
text: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has banned Investment Advisers from giving free trials to prospective customers or accepting part payments for their services. They must also display complaints against them on their own websites and can only accept payments through banking channels. Further, Investment Advisers can only give advice after conducting risk profiling of clients.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Adani to acquire India's largest cold chain logistics company
text: Adani Logistics, a subsidiary of Adani Ports and SEZ, will acquire a majority stake in India's largest cold chain logistics provider Snowman Logistics. The company will first acquire a 40.25% stake from Gateway Distriparks for about ₹296 crore. It will then make an open offer to Snowman's public shareholders for as much as 26% more, spending up to ₹191 crore.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Not a bad thing: VK Singh defends Army Chief’s remarks on protesters
text: Union Minister VK Singh on Friday defended Army Chief General Bipin Rawat for criticising those leading anti-CAA protests "If he (Rawat) [gave] advice to students to not indulge in arson, it's not a bad thing," Singh said. "I don't see...politics in it. If I tell students don't unnecessarily damage property, is it politics?" he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Satwik-Chirag have capability to win Olympic medal: Coach Flandy
text: Doubles coach Flandy Limpele said that the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty "have the capability" to win India's first-ever doubles Olympic medal. This year, the duo won their maiden Super 500 title at Thailand Open and finished second at the French Open Super 750. They were also nominated for 'Most Improved Player of the Year' award.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Very poor: Kambli after Mumbai's first-ever 10-wicket defeat in Ranji
text: Mumbai on Friday lost to Railways by 10 wickets, their first-ever defeat by such wicket margin in the Ranji Trophy. Reacting to it, former India cricketer Vinod Kambli said, "Very poor from the team". Criticising the absence of players like Shreyas Iyer and Shivam Dube, Kambli said, "Would like to see the best team playing when possible."
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Ex-CSK spinner Jakati retires from all forms of cricket
text: Goa spinner Shadab Jakati on Friday announced retirement from all forms of cricket after playing for 23 years. Jakati debuted in first-class cricket in 1998/99 and played his last first-class match against Punjab in October 2017. He also played for Chennai Super Kings (CSK), Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) and Gujarat Lions in the Indian Premier League.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Teslasuit's VR gloves to let users feel virtual objects, track pulse
text: Full-body haptic feedback suit maker Teslasuit is introducing a VR-powered glove called 'Teslasuit Glove' that lets users feel virtual textures and gather biometric data. It combines several technologies to create an impression of touching and holding object, capture motion of users' hands and record pulse and other data. The glove will be showcased by Teslasuit at the CES 2020.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Tesla to begin delivery of cars built in China plant, its 1st outside US
text: Electric carmaker Tesla will begin delivering Model 3 cars built at its Shanghai plant, its first plant outside the US, from December 30. The first 15 units of the sedans will be delivered to company employees. On Friday, the China-made Model 3 was added to a list of vehicles exempted from a 10% purchase tax in China.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Turkey unveils $3.7-billion home-grown electric car project
text: Turkey unveiled its $3.7-billion home-grown electric car project under which it plans to produce up to 1,75,000 vehicles annually. A workforce of over 4,000 will produce five models of the car. TOGG, the consortium working on the project, said it would begin production in 2022 with compact SUVs. The government has guaranteed to buy 30,000 of the vehicles by 2035.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: China successfully launches its heaviest communications satellite
text: China launched its heaviest and most advanced communications satellite on its largest new carrier rocket Long March 5 on Friday. Shijian-20, a new technology test and verification satellite, successfully entered its orbit Friday night, state media reported. The satellite will carry out orbit experiments for a series of key technologies, its maker China Academy of Space Technology said.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: 'Tukde-tukde' gang has 2 people, both in BJP: Yashwant Sinha
text: Former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha on Friday said that the "most dangerous tukde-tukde gang" in India consists of two people and both are in the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). Sinha asked people to be "beware" of "Duryodhan and Dusshashan". Earlier, Amit Shah said that the tukde-tukde gang led by Congress is responsible for violence in Delhi.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Israel's Netanyahu wins party leadership ahead of general election
text: Ahead of Israel's general election in March, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu won a vote to keep the Likud party leadership, the party said on Friday. Netanyahu secured 72.5% as opposed to his rival Gideon Saar, a former education and interior minister, who polled 27.5%. "A huge win! Thank you to Likud members for their trust, support and love," Netanyahu tweeted.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 52-year-old Rahul Bose reveals he weighs 65.5 kg, his metabolic age is 27
text: Actor Rahul Bose took to social media to share a video showing his body composition. He revealed that he weighs 65.5 kg and his metabolic age is 27. "Thought I'd take stock of the body...and see what's up. Metabolic age is 27. Looking to bring that down to 24 in 2020. Fitness = cosmetic surgery for your insides," he wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Mumbai witnesses pro-CAA and anti-CAA rallies
text: Mumbai on Friday witnessed two rallies- one in favour of the newly enacted Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and the other against the law. Students and activists gathered in large numbers to protest against CAA at Azad Maidan. At August Kranti Maidan meanwhile, BJP's 'Sanvidan Sanman Manch' organised a rally in support of the CAA.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: No orders given on detention centres, clarifies Kerala CM
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday said that his government has no plan to build detention centres for illegal immigrants. "I have asked...social justice department to stop all work to clear the air (on detention centres)," he said. Media reports claimed that Kerala government ordered a headcount of foreigners overstaying in the state and identify suitable buildings to house them.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Challenge Rahul to show single line in CAA about citizenship withdrawal: Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday challenged Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to show him a single line in the Citizenship (Amendment) Act regarding the withdrawal of anyone's citizenship. "Don't misguide and divide people over the CAA," he further told Rahul. "The Congress and company (are) spreading rumours that Muslims may lose their citizenship," he added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Happy birthday to the world's greatest sibling: Mohammad Shami wishes Salman
text: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami took to Twitter to wish actor Salman Khan on the occasion of his 54th birthday. "Thank you for my great memories. Here's to many more memories to come. Happy birthday to the world's greatest sibling!" wrote Shami. Meanwhile, Kedar Jadhav tweeted, "Happy birthday to my childhood and all-time favourite HERO."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Warner refused X-ray on injured thumb in fear of being ruled out of NZ Test
text: Australia opener David Warner has revealed he refused a scan on his injured left thumb in fear of being ruled out of Boxing Day Test against New Zealand. "Once adrenaline kicks in you don't feel anything...Scans and X-rays only rule you out, they don't rule you in...so there was no chance I was going for an X-ray," he said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Was targeted for being a Hindu, but never felt need to change religion: Kaneria
text: Former Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has said that a few Pakistani cricketers targeted him for being a Hindu but he never felt pressure to change his religion. He added that there were several cricketers who supported him and backed him regardless of his religion. He further urged people to not portray Pakistan's cricket fraternity in a negative manner.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India not a safe country, ICC must stop international cricket there: Miandad
text: Former Pakistan cricket team captain Javed Miandad has said the ICC should declare that India is unsafe to tour for foreign countries. "India is no longer a safe country. Other countries are better than India because in India, they are fighting with the people, their own people. Look at that, what’s going on? ICC must take action," Miandad said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Not right to say all Indians are Hindus: Athawale on RSS Chief’s remark
text: Union Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment Ramdas Athawale on Friday reacted to RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat's statement that Sangh regards all Indians as Hindus. He said, "It's not right to say all Indians are Hindus." "In our country, people are from Buddhist, Sikh, Hindu, Christian, Parsi, Jain, Lingayat faiths and different communities live here," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: NASA features view of Morocco's Anti-Atlas Mountains in infrared
text: NASA featured a bird's-eye view image of Morocco's Anti-Atlas Mountain range that uses infrared bands to show different rocks and complex folding. The mountains formed after the collision of African and Eurasian tectonic plates about 80 million years ago, NASA said. The image was acquired by the ASTER instrument on the Terra satellite on November 5, 2007, NASA added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Malaria-carrying mosquitoes can sense toxins through legs: Study
text: Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine identified a new way by which mosquitoes that carry malaria are becoming resistant to insecticide. Researchers found that a particular family of binding proteins, situated in the mosquitoes' legs, were abundant in resistant mosquitoes. Reducing the protein level, by partial silencing of the gene, restored susceptibility to an insecticide.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 10 children die at Kota hospital in 2 days, 77 in December
text: At least 77 children have died at the JK Lone Hospital in Rajasthan's Kota in the first 24 days of December, with the death of 10 children being reported in 48 hours. "Mostly, infants and kids are referred to the hospital in terminal condition," hospital superintendent Dr HL Meena said, adding that equipment were properly functioning.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Everything was like in a movie: Kazakhstan plane crash survivor
text: Recounting the plane crash in Kazakhstan, a survivor said, "The plane was flying with a tilt. Everything was like in a movie: screaming, shouting, people crying." She added that she heard a "terrifying sound" before the plane started losing altitude. At least 12 people died and dozens of others were injured in the crash.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Reveal your assets for bailout: IMF to world's longest-serving ruler
text: The IMF has said Equatorial Guinea's President Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, the world's longest-serving ruler, should declare his assets before the oil-rich nation receives more financial support. Obiang, in power since August 1979, has been accused of misusing the country's oil wealth. In September, Swiss authorities raised $27 million by auctioning off 25 supercars seized from Obiang's son.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Delay in Airbus plane deliveries partly to blame for cancellations: GoAir
text: GoAir on Thursday said delays by Airbus in delivering new A320neo planes were partly to blame for dozens of flight cancellations this week. The budget carrier is the second biggest Airbus customer in India with 144 aircraft on order. The Wadia Group-owned airline also cited unavailability of Pratt & Whitney engines for the disruptions in November and December.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Moody's India arm, CARE Ratings fined ₹25 lakh each over IL&FS ratings
text: Market regulator SEBI has fined Moody's Indian arm ICRA and CARE Ratings ₹25 lakh each for their failure to carry out proper due diligence when assigning credit ratings to now-bankrupt IL&FS. The government took control of the IL&FS board last year. The infrastructure financier in October said it had identified resolution plans for all of its 302 entities.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: TMC to give ₹5L to kin of those killed in Mangaluru CAA protests
text: Trinamool Congress has announced a compensation of ₹5 lakh each to families of the two persons killed in Karnataka's Mangaluru during protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Earlier on Wednesday, Karnataka government withdrew ₹10 lakh ex-gratia it announced for families of those killed. CM BS Yediyurappa said compensation will only be given if they are found innocent after due investigation.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: NPR, NRC a tax on poor people like demonetisation: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday linked the National Population Register (NPR) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC) with demonetisation stating they are "tax" on the poor. "It is an attack on poor people, now the poor is asking how will we get jobs?" he added. He said the Centre failed to address the issues facing the common public.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Anti and pro CAA marches cancelled in South Mumbai
text: Mumbai Police has denied permission for both anti and pro Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) marches in South Mumbai citing law and order issues. "We...requested them to refrain from holding a march or protesting on the road as it will inconvenience the common man and public in general as it is a working day," Mumbai Police PRO Pranay Ashok said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Nikhat Zareen to face Mary Kom for Olympic Qualifiers berth tomorrow
text: Boxer Nikhat Zareen will face Mary Kom in the 51kg category final of the women's boxing trials for next year's Olympic Qualifiers. Earlier this year, Nikhat had written to Union Minister Kiren Rijiju demanding a trial against Kom after reports emerged that Kom might be sent directly to the Qualifiers. Zareen defeated national champion Jyoti Gulia to enter the final.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Boxer Sumit Sangwan banned for 1 year for failing dope test
text: Boxer Sumit Sangwan, who won silver in Asian Boxing Championship 2017, has been banned by the National Anti Doping Agency (NADA) for one year for failing a dope test. "His sample was collected on 10th October 2019 while...participating in the Elite Men Boxing Championship, 2019," NADA India tweeted. Sangwan will not be able to participate in Olympic qualifier trails.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: They just rolled over: McCullum on NZ bowling against Australia
text: Talking about New Zealand's bowling against Australia in the Boxing Day Test, former skipper Brendon McCullum said that the team "just rolled over". During the second day, Kiwi captain Kane Williamson gave the ball to opener Tom Blundell, which McCullum described as a "submissive move". "I don't think he [Blundell] would have even bowled in the nets," he said.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: We may never see player like Messi: Barcelona's Antoine Griezmann
text: Talking about teammate Lionel Messi, Barcelona striker Antoine Griezmann said there may never be a player like him. "What he can do with the ball is incredible...it's a sight to see him play and play alongside him," he added. Earlier there were reports that both players struggled to play with each other in the early days of Greizmann joining Barcelona.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Facebook account now mandatory for signing up for Messenger
text: Facebook has made it mandatory for users to have a Facebook account to be able to sign-up for Messenger. Previously, users with no Facebook account could sign-up with just their phone number. A spokesperson of the social media giant said the new rule applies to new Messenger users only and would not affect any of the existing ones.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Indian tech startups raised a record $14.5 bn in 2019: Report
text: Indian tech startups raised $14.5 billion in 2019, up from $550 million in 2010, a report by data analytics firm Tracxn showed. There were 1185 funding rounds, of which 459 were Series A and late-stage investments. Nine startups joined 'unicorn' club this year, while 60 'soonicorns' firms with the potential to become a unicorn in the near future, were formed.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: More than half of police force corrupt: Congress' Sandeep Dikshit
text: Congress leader Sandeep Dikshit on Friday said more than half of the police forces in India are "corrupt". "Now, how do they erase the allegation of corruption? Firstly, raise slogans on nationalism and show that we do such a job which cannot be questioned," Dikshit said. "The more corrupt an organisation is, the more nationalistic they will be," he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Armed forces have utmost respect for human rights: Army chief
text: Army chief General Bipin Rawat on Friday said the Indian armed forces have "utmost respect for human rights laws and international human rights laws". "The Indian armed forces not only ensure protection of human rights of our own people but also of adversaries," he added. Rawat also said they deal with prisoners of war as per the Geneva Conventions.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Canada's national broadcaster cuts Trump's scene from Home Alone 2; he responds
text: Canada's national broadcaster deleted the scene featuring US President Donald Trump from the movie Home Alone 2. CBC said it had removed Trump's cameo in 2014 to make way for commercials. "I guess Justin T doesn't much like my making him pay up on NATO or Trade!" Trump said, adding the movie "will never be the same(just kidding)!"
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Protests against CAA held outside Jama Masjid in Delhi
text: A large number of people gathered outside Jama Masjid in Delhi to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) on Friday. Congress leader Alka Lamba was also seen at the protest. Protesters were seen carrying placards that read, "Save The Constitution" and "We Condemn Communal Law." Security was beefed up across Northeast Delhi earlier today, to avoid any untoward incident.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi trolls Amit Shah over his 'Aap chronology samjhiye' remark
text: Congress' Priyanka Gandhi took a dig at Home Minister Amit Shah's 'Aap chronology samjhiye' remark on NRC and CAA. "Understand the chronology...First, they'll promise you two crore jobs. Then they'll form government. Then they'll destroy your universities. Then they'll destroy India's constitution. Then you'll protest. Then they'll call you a fool but youngsters will not budge," she tweeted.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: No CAA in Bengal as long as I'm alive: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal Chief Minister on Friday said that the newly enacted Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) won't be implemented in the state as long as she was alive. "No one has to leave the country or the state. There won't be any detention centre in Bengal," Banerjee said. This comes a day after she supported student protests against the CAA.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Azhar captained India for long time: Gambhir on Pak treating Kaneria unfairly
text: After ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria said that he was treated unfairly by some Pakistani cricketers because he is a Hindu, former India batsman and BJP MP Gautam Gambhir said, "This is the actual face of Pakistan." He added, "On the other side we've got people like Mohammed Azharuddin captaining India for such a long time, despite being a minority."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Akhtar shares Akram's leaked video criticising Pak cricket, says 'I support him'
text: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar took to Twitter to share a leaked video of ex-captain Wasim Akram wherein he can be heard criticising Pakistan cricket. "Those same old methods....To change something, one needs to change the methods and thought process. Do something new too," Wasim says in the video. "I support leaked video of Akram, We need a change," Akhtar wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Country can't benefit if people fight each other: Rahul Gandhi
text: Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that the "country cannot benefit by making people fight among themselves." "Unless you (Centre) take people along and unite the country, you cannot do anything to tackle the problem of unemployment and economy," Gandhi said. He was speaking at inauguration of the National Tribal Dance Festival 2019 held at Science College, Raipur.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Aalia-malia-jamalia used to enter from Pak daily during Cong's rule: Amit Shah
text: While addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, Home Minister Amit Shah said, "Aalia-malia-jamalia used to enter from Pakistan every day and behead Indian jawans during Congress' rule, but BJP put a stop to this." "The then Prime Minister Manmohan Singh didn't say a word...Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government taught Pakistan a lesson by striking on its territory," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Media looks for news that's why we allow people to make trouble: WB BJP chief
text: BJP's West Bengal unit President Dilip Ghosh on Friday said that his party "allows people to create trouble" because the media looks for news. "They (Trinamool Congress) will create trouble. We will create trouble. This is the character of Bengal's politics," Ghosh stated. The MP was speaking to media before addressing a rally in East Midnapore district.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Japan's richest man and Uniqlo founder quits SoftBank board after 18 years
text: Japan's SoftBank Group on Friday said Tadashi Yanai, the 70-year-old Founder and CEO of fashion chain Uniqlo's parent Fast Retailing, will resign as independent director after more than 18 years. Yanai, Japan's richest man, is one of the only three external members on SoftBank's board. He is leaving the post to focus on running his own business, the company said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Extensive hunting may make 'unicorns of sea' extinct: Scientists
text: Narwhals, known as 'unicorns of the sea', are facing a risk of extinction after their numbers shrunk drastically because of excessive hunting in Greenland, scientists warned. "The Greenland government has known since 2017 that the catch was too high, but has done nothing to save them," a scientist said. The World Wildlife Fund estimates fewer than 80,000 Narwhals remain worldwide.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: UP govt asks teachers to give CMO's certificate for sick leave in board exams
text: The UP government has asked teachers to produce a certificate issued by the district's Chief Medical Officer (CMO) if they wish to take sick leave during Board examinations. Last year some principals and teachers didn't want to take responsibility of centre administrator and invigilator and thus, took sick leave, UP Board Secretary Neena Srivastava said in a letter to CMOs.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: BJP IT Cell head asks if Sardesai should handle PR for ISIS, journalist replies
text: Rajdeep Sardesai replied to BJP's IT Cell head Amit Malviya after he asked if the journalist should handle public relations for ISIS. "My friend, carry on with this brazenly slanderous and incendiary campaign. My new year resolution is to stay calm!" Sardesai said. Malviya's poll came after Sardesai tweeted about the difference in flags seen at pro-CAA and anti-CAA rallies.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Tharoor tweets couplet on Ghalib's 222nd birth anniversary, Gambhir praises him
text: Shashi Tharoor shared a Ghalib's couplet on his 222nd birth anniversary and tweeted, "Likhte hum bhi hai...magar wo baat nahi hai...Alfaaz mai wo dard...wo jazbaat nahi...English mai soch Urdu mai likhta 'Tharoor' hai...Ghalib bata...Ab ismei mera kya kasur hai." Praising Tharoor, Gautam Gambhir wrote, "Hai aur bhi duniya mai Sukhanvar bahut achche...Kehte hai...'Tharoor' ka andaaz-e-bayaan aur!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Former Pak Prez Musharraf moves Lahore HC challenging death sentence
text: Former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf on Friday moved the Lahore High Court challenging the death sentence given to him by a special court. Musharraf, who has been in Dubai since 2016, was convicted of high treason for imposing emergency in 2007. The 86 page-long petition states that the "judgement contained a mix of anomalies and contradictory statements".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: IMF chief economist Gita Gopinath visits alma mater LSR; shares pics
text: IMF chief economist Gita Gopinath visited her alma mater Lady Shri Ram College for Women in Delhi. "Had a wonderful experience visiting LSR...where I began my journey in economics in 1989. Such an honour to spend time with some of my teachers and to hang out with future leaders! A huge debt of gratitude to LSR," she wrote sharing pictures.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: It's our lightest film together: Deepika on working with Ranveer in '83
text: Deepika Padukone, who'll be seen alongside her husband and actor Ranveer Singh in '83, said that the film is their lightest film together up till now. "This film was so different. It will be good to be just...boy and girl in a young, fresh film," she added. The couple has previously worked together in films like 'Padmaavat' and 'Bajirao Mastani'.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Saddens me to see violence, discrimination happening in India: Lilly
text: Indo-Canadian YouTuber Lilly Singh on Friday took to Twitter to express her opinion on the on-going protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in India and wrote, "It saddens me to see the violence and discrimination happening." "It's not right. Would be very grateful if anyone could send me any reliable sources of information so I can learn more," Lilly added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Film on Pakistani activist Malala Yousafzai to feature Pankaj, Divya
text: A film based on Pakistani activist Malala Yousafzai, titled 'Gul Makai', will feature Divya Dutta and Pankaj Tripathi. Malala, who became the youngest recipient of Nobel Peace Prize in 2014, was shot in her head by Talibani militants for going to school. Directed by Amjad Khan, the biopic has been majorly shot in Kashmir and will release on January 31.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Heavy police deployment in parts of Delhi amid anti-CAA protest calls
text: The police conducted flag marches in parts of Delhi ahead of Friday prayers and amid calls for protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). Additionally, police and paramilitary forces were deployed in the Northeast district to maintain law and order. Police said that they are also using drones to keep a vigil on the situation.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Felt like my debut: De Kock on his 1st match under coach Mark Boucher
text: Talking about changes in Cricket South Africa, Quinton de Kock, who scored 95 runs against England on the first day of the first Test, said it felt like playing his debut match again. "I feel re-energised with all the changes," he added. South Africa are playing their first match with Mark Boucher as coach and Jacques Kallis as batting consultant.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: India defeat SA by 9 wickets in 1st game of 3-match Youth ODI series
text: India Under-19 on Thursday defeated South Africa Under-19 by 9 wickets in the first ODI of the 3-match series. Batting first South Africa posted a total of 187 runs in 48.3 overs with Ravi Bishnoi taking three wickets. Chasing the target, while both openers, Divyaansh Saxena and N Tilak Varma, slammed fifties, Kumar Kushagra scored 43* to help India win.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Quikr posts 75% rise in revenues at ₹191 crore, cuts down losses
text: Online classifieds platform Quikr has posted a 75% rise in its revenues at ₹191.22 crore in 2018-19, compared to ₹109 crore in the preceding fiscal year, regulatory filings revealed. It marginally narrowed its losses to ₹230 crore during the period from ₹237.4 crore in 2017-18. Based in Bengaluru, Quikr started operations in 2008 and has acquired 15 companies since then.
author: Dharna

headlines: Aye Finance raises ₹107 cr in debt funding from Swiss investor
text: Gurugram-based microlending startup Aye Finance has raised ₹107 crore in debt funding from Switzerland-based impact investor BlueOrchard. In August, the startup had raised $10 million in debt funding from another Swiss investor responsAbility Investments. Since its founding in 2014, the startup claims to have provided ₹2,700 crore worth of credit to over 1.96 lakh grassroots businesses.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: India to carry action of some sort in PoK to divert attention: Pak PM
text: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan on Thursday claimed that "Modi-RSS government, in order to divert the world attention away from Kashmir and the protests against the (citizenship) law, will definitely conduct some sort of action" in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). Khan also said that Pakistan army was prepared for any such move.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Philippines bans US senators, to get new visa rules for US
text: The Philippines has banned two United States officials from visiting the country. They will impose requirements on US nationals to get visas if any Philippine officials involved in the detention of Philippine government critic Senator Leila De Lima be denied entry to the US. De Lima had led an investigation into mass killings during Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte's anti-drugs crackdown.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: GST officials bust ₹241 crore tax evasion racket, arrest one
text: The GST officials have busted a racket that involved fake invoicing worth ₹1,600 crore and a subsequent ₹241-crore tax evasion. Officials said that the accused's modus operandi entailed creating bogus firms and issuing fake invoices to generate and encash tax credits by exploiting a refund facility given by the government for inverted duty structure. The main accused has been arrested.
author: Dharna

headlines: No one responsible for my death: Actor Kushal Punjabi in suicide note
text: Actor Kushal Punjabi who was found hanging in his home in Mumbai wrote in his suicide note that no one is responsible for his death, police officials said. "We are conducting an inquiry," the police officials added. Meanwhile, actor Chetan Hansraj said Punjabi had been suffering from depression, adding, "I never imagined that he'll take such a step. It's heartbreaking."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Salman Khan's sister Arpita gives birth to baby girl on actor's 54th birthday
text: Salman Khan's younger sister Arpita Khan Sharma and her husband, actor Aayush Sharma, welcomed their second child together on Friday. The couple, who are already parents to three-year-old son Ahil, were blessed with a baby girl on Salman's 54th birthday. They have named their daughter as "Ayat". Arpita and Aayush had tied the knot on November 18, 2014.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Mona Singh ties the knot with investment banker boyfriend in Mumbai, pics surface
text: 'Jassi Jaissi Koi Nahin' fame actress Mona Singh tied the knot with her investment banker boyfriend Shyam in Mumbai today. Several pictures have surfaced from her wedding, which shows Mona wearing a traditional red lehenga and Shyam wearing a cream sherwani and pink turban. From the TV industry, Gaurav Gera, Rajesh Khera, Ashish Kapoor and Rakshanda Khan attended the wedding.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Had samosas, 8 gulab jamuns a day to gain 11 kg for Chhapaak: Vikrant
text: Vikrant Massey has revealed that Meghna Gulzar, the director of his upcoming film 'Chhapaak', signed him on the condition that he'd gain 11 kilograms in two-and-a-half months for his character. Vikrant added he started an "unhealthy diet" and had "samosas" and "eight gulab jamuns every day". "Every two-and-a-half hours, I'd to eat something, even when I wasn't hungry," he said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Salman copied the way I walk and call him 'maalik' in Bodyguard: Shera
text: On Salman Khan's 54th birthday, his bodyguard Shera revealed that the actor picked up his habits for the role in film 'Bodyguard'. "As Bhai and I always used to be together, he knew everything about me. Like the way I call him 'maalik'. He used that in the film also. Also, the way I walk," Shera said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Muslims stage anti-CAA protest, burn effigy of Ajmer Sharif Dargah's Dewan
text: Muslims staged a protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Ajmer and burnt the effigy of Ajmer Sharif Dargah's Dewan, Syed Zainul Abedin, for "misleading" the community. "The Citizenship (Amendment) Act is not against Muslims living in the country. Muslims living in the country need not fear as there is no danger to their citizenship," Abedin had earlier said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Youngsters sing carols in Kerala church wearing skullcaps, hijabs to protest CAA
text: A video of youngsters singing Christmas carols wearing skullcaps and hijabs in a Kerala church has gone viral. The youngsters wore Muslim attire to express their solidarity with the anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act movement. The father of the church said choosing Muslim attire was also a symbolic protest against PM Narendra Modi's statement that protestors can be identified by their clothes.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: He came like an angel: Policeman after 'Hajji sahab' saves him during protest
text: A man named Hajji Qadir rescued policeman Ajay Kumar, who was being thrashed by a mob during anti-CAA protests in Uttar Pradesh. "Hajji sahab came and rescued me. He came like an angel in my life. Had it not been for him, I would've been killed," Kumar said. Qadir gave him clothes and water before taking him to police station.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Mobile internet restored in Kargil 145 days after restrictions over Article 370
text: Mobile internet services have been restored in Ladakh's Kargil district 145 days after it was suspended. The restrictions were imposed after revocation of Article 370 and bifurcation of the state of Jammu and Kashmir into two Union Territories - Ladakh and Jammu and Kashmir. Several politicians were also kept under house arrest to prevent unrest after revocation.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Tesla raises $1.6 bn from Chinese banks for 1st factory outside US
text: Electric carmaker Tesla's regulatory filings confirmed that the Elon Musk-led automaker has raised a total of about $1.6 billion from Chinese banks for its Shanghai Gigafactory. The factory is Tesla's first car manufacturing site outside the US. Besides construction and production at the Shanghai factory, the loan may also be used to repay a debt due March 4 next year.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Europe's Mars lander successfully passes parachute test
text: The European Space Agency's (ESA) Mars lander's parachutes were successfully tested up to their expected extraction speed of just over 200 kmph with no sign of damage. The parachutes sustained damage during deployment earlier this year. The ExoMars 2020 mission is expected to be launched to the red planet sometime between 26 July and 11 August 2020.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: It could contain explosives: Aishwarya's father declines 'dowry' returned by Rabri
text: Former Bihar CM Lalu Yadav's daughter-in-law Aishwarya Rai's father refused to accept "dowry" articles returned by Rabri Devi, claiming they might contain contraband like liquor or explosives. "As per law, an inventory list shall be prepared in front of magistrate and police officer before dispatching the articles...His (Tej Yadav's) family hasn't followed the procedure," Chandrika Rai added.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Helper allegedly rapes 15-year-old inside bus; driver stands guard outside vehicle
text: A 19-year-old bus helper has been arrested for allegedly raping a 15-year-old girl inside a stationary bus in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh district, police said on Friday. The bus driver stood guard outside the vehicle while the helper raped the girl, police added. We have arrested two others, including the bus driver, for abetting the crime, police further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Keep petrol ready, set everything on fire in strike: Cong leader to party workers
text: Odisha Congress leader and former MP Pradeep Majhi was caught on camera directing party workers to keep petrol and diesel ready and set everything on fire during a strike after getting orders from him. The 12-hour strike was called by the Congress in Nabarangpur on Thursday to protest against the alleged rape and murder of a minor girl.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Father of accused in Hyd vet's rape case hit by ACP's car; condition critical
text: Days after all four men accused of raping and murdering 27-year-old Hyderabad veterinarian were killed in an encounter, father of one of the accused was hit by the Cyberabad Assistant Commissioner of Police's private car. He was hospitalised and is said to be in a critical condition. The victim was reportedly riding a bike when the accident took place.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 125 crore Indians now have Aadhaar cards: UIDAI
text: The UIDAI announced on Friday that registrations under its Aadhaar project have crossed the 125-crore mark, indicating that as many Indian residents now have the 12-digit unique identification number. "Aadhaar-based authentication services have been used close to 37,000 crore times since inception, " a press release said. UIDAI receives close to 3 crore authentication requests every day, it added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Chinese billionaire's son banned from taking trains and planes settles debts
text: A Chinese court has lifted restrictions on property billionaire Wang Jianlin's son after he settled with the creditors of his bankrupt Shanghai Panda Entertainment. Wang Sicong, known for his lavish lifestyle, was barred in November from taking trains and planes due to debts. The 31-year-old will bear ₹2,000 crore loss incurred by Shanghai Panda, his investment firm Prometheus Capital said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Saif to play Ananya's father in Rahul Dholakia's film: Reports
text: Saif Ali Khan will play Ananya Panday's father in an upcoming thriller film directed by Rahul Dholakia, according to reports. The film will reportedly be produced by Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani's Excel Entertainment and will go on floors in April 2020. Saif will be next seen in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', while Ananya will be seen in 'Khaali Peeli'. n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: People advised me to not to do women-centric films: Taapsee
text: Taapsee Pannu said in an interview that she's been advised by people from the film industry to shift her focus from the women-centric films and let men take the centre stage now. "When I tell them...I also did 'Mission Mangal', they say...that's...a strong female character," she added. "Toh kya karu? Kuch bhi flimsy sa role kar lun?" Taapsee further said.n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Indian techies from Google, TCS, others pen open letter against CAA
text: Indian employees of technology companies such as Google, Facebook, Accenture, Microsoft, TCS, HCL, Wipro and Amazon have signed an open letter against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, deeming it "fascist". They criticised the government for shutting down the internet despite pushing for a "Digital India" and called for leaders like Google's Sundar Pichai and Jio's Mukesh Ambani to voice dissent.
author: Dharna

headlines: Liverpool defeat Leicester 4-0 to go 13 points clear at top of PL
text: The first-placed Liverpool defeated second-placed Leicester City 4-0 to go 13 points clear at top of the Premier League. While Roberto Firmino scored a brace, James Milner and Trent Alexander-Arnold doubled the lead. Liverpool have 52 points from 18 games with Leicester City on 39 from 19 matches. Defending champions Manchester City are placed third, 14 points behind the Reds.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: India's AI workforce grows in 2019, large vacancies remain: Report
text: A study on the Indian artificial intelligence (AI) industry by edtech company Great Learning revealed the number of AI professionals in India increased from 40,000 in 2018 to 72,000 in 2019. It also stated the number of companies employing AI in their business grew to 3,000. The study, however, pointed out 2,500 vacancies remained due to lack of talent.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: AI control over nuclear weapons could 'spark a nuclear war': Study
text: A study published by Cornell University warned automation functionality in nuclear weapons could "spark a nuclear war". It talked about use of artificial intelligence (AI) in the military could bring "insidious risks that do not manifest until an accident occurs". It also discussed the possibility of countries developing unmanned vehicles carrying nuclear weapons and their chances of being hacked.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Indians used 54,917 million GB of mobile data in 2019 till Sept: TRAI
text: Indian mobile users consumed a total of 54,917 million gigabytes (GB) of wireless data in 2019 till the month of September, found an analysis by Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). The figure stood at 46,406 million gigabytes in 2018 and 828 million gigabytes in 2014. The number of wireless data subscribers increased by 15% to 664.8 million in 2019.n
author: Dharna

headlines: 990 Ola, Uber drivers caught breaking rules; 36 didn't have licence
text: Nearly 990 Uber and Ola drivers were caught violating various rules in a weeklong drive carried out at the Mumbai airport by Regional Transport Offices. The drive followed a rising number of complaints against rideshare drivers over cancellations and delayed pick-ups. Around 36 drivers were found without driving licences and 335 without badges, while 436 taxis contained expired fire extinguishers.
author: Dharna

headlines: Death toll reaches 28 in Philippines after Typhoon Phanfone
text: At least 28 people have been killed and 12 were reported missing in the Philippines after typhoon 'Phanfone' hit the country on Tuesday with gusts of over 190 kph. "The likelihood is present that the casualty count will still increase. We are hoping against it," a national disaster agency spokesman said. Over 58,000 people were evacuated before the storm.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: No plans to offer cannabis-infused drink: Coca-Cola denies rumours
text: After a YouTube video claimed that Coca-Cola plans to launch a new Coke drink with CBD (Cannabidiol) extract in Canada, the company said it has no plans to enter the cannabis market. CBD is a non-psychoactive ingredient in marijuana that treats pain. The user said his father, engineer at a bottling machine company, was asked to design a childproof cap.
author: Dharna

headlines: 37-year-old TV actor Kushal Punjabi found hanging at his Mumbai home
text: TV actor Kushal Punjabi has passed away at the age of 37 after he allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself at his home in Mumbai. Police has also recovered a suicide note from his residence. TV actor Karanvir Bohra expressed grief over his demise and tweeted, "[Your] demise has shocked the hell out of me."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Kushal Punjabi posted picture of his son hours before being found dead
text: TV actor Kushal Punjabi, who allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself, had posted a picture of his son on his Instagram story hours before his death. The 37-year-old, who was married to Audrey Dolhen, often shared pictures with his son on social media. Meanwhile, actor Chetan Hansraj said Kushal had been suffering from depression.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Internet suspended in 21 UP districts ahead of Friday namaz
text: The internet has been suspended in 21 districts of Uttar Pradesh and security has been increased to ensure peace ahead of the Friday prayers. Ghaziabad, Bulandshahr, Meerut, Muzaffarnagar and Shamli are among the districts where the internet has been suspended by the authorities. This comes amid violent protests across the state against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: UP Police say video of officers damaging cars is from Jabalpur; MP Police replies
text: Amid anti-CAA protests, Uttar Pradesh Police on Thursday clarified that video of the incident showing policemen vandalising vehicles isn't from the state but from Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. The city's police superintendent said they're probing the case, adding, "Instead of tweeting the video with the focus that it relates to Jabalpur, UP Police could've simply stated [it] doesn't relate to UP."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: My life not in good shape, urge Imran Khan to get me out of the mess: Kaneria
text: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has released a statement after Shoaib Akhtar alleged Danish was treated unfairly because he was a Hindu. He wrote, "I...thank Akhtar for telling the truth...I...request all not to politicise the issue." He added his life is not in good shape and urged "all legendary" players including PM Imran Khan to get him out of the mess.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Man learns video game making, creates one to propose to girlfriend
text: A man, Denis Wells, posted a 15-minute video on YouTube of a 2D video game built by him to propose marriage to his girlfriend. "I learned game development and pixel art, then completed my first 2D platformer in 9 months, all in the name of love," Wells said. Wells had recorded his girlfriend playing the game and reacting to it.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: YouTuber gets 4 years in jail for 'insulting the king' in Morocco
text: Moroccan YouTuber Mohamed Sekkaki, known as Moul Kaskita, was sentenced to four years in jail for criticising King Mohammed VI, who is considered "inviolable" under the nation's constitution. Sekkaki also allegedly referred to Moroccans as 'donkeys' in a video broadcast. Recently, Moroccan rapper Mohamed Mounir, 'Gnawi', was sentenced to a year in jail for allegedly 'insulting a public official'.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Astronauts bake cookies in space for the first time, won't eat them
text: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station (ISS) baked cookies in space for the first time ever as part of an experiment to test a new oven designed for microgravity. The cookies, which will remain sealed and uneaten, will be returned to Earth later for analysis. Astronauts revealed that the first three cookies were 'doughy', however, the last two were fine.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Anand Mahindra proposes turning coffee bean waste into car parts
text: After Ford announced it would turn coffee bean waste sourced from McDonald's to make auto parts, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra suggested replicating the same in India. Tweeting a video of the concept, Mahindra said, "This is...perfect example of a 'circular' economy." He also tagged Manoj Kumar in his tweet, whose Naandi Foundation produces coffee in Andhra Pradesh's Araku valley.
author: Dharna

headlines: Swiggy enters online payments space, launches own wallet
text: Foodtech unicorn Swiggy has made its foray into the financial services space with the launch of its own wallet, Swiggy Money. The wallet, an RBI-compliant Prepaid Payment Instrument (PPI), will only be used to credit amounts for the cancelled orders at the moment, as per the latest notification in Swiggy's FAQ column.
