author: Shailesh

headlines: Government to update NPR, says 'it is self declaration, no documents required'
text: The Union Cabinet on Tuesday approved over ₹3,900 crore for updation of National Population Register (NPR) and over ₹8,700 crore for the exercise of Census of India 2021. "NPR is self declaration, no documents, no biometric will be required for it," Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said. The exercise will be held between April and September 2020, Javadekar further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Will take bullet if he's asked to leave India: Raftaar on his bodyguard Arshad
text: A video shows rapper Raftaar introducing his bodyguard, Arshad on stage ahead of his concert on Monday. Speaking against CAA, Raftaar said, "Arshad takes care of me to the extent that nobody can even push me." "If anyone talks about asking him to leave [India], I'm ready to take...bullet." "I don't care what happens to my career," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 15 parties got lesser vote share than NOTA in J'khand Assembly polls
text: At least 15 political parties in Jharkhand Assembly elections received lesser vote share than None of the Above (NOTA). While NOTA received a vote share of 1.36%, AIMIM got highest vote share of 1.16% among the 15 parties followed by JD(U) which got a 0.73% vote share. CPI(M) got 0.32% vote share, NCP got 0.42%, SP got 0.11% among others.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Kashmiri man, detained in UP under PSA, dies in jail
text: A man from Kashmir Valley, booked under the Public Safety Act (PSA) in July 2019 and lodged in an Uttar Pradesh jail, has died. Ghulam Mohammed Bhat was reportedly a member of the banned Jamaat-e-Islami Jammu and Kashmir. Bhat's is reportedly the first death of a political prisoner from Kashmir Valley since the revocation of Article 370 on August 5.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Mangaluru Police release pics, videos of stone-pelting; ask citizens to send more
text: Mangaluru Police have released videos and pictures of stone-pelting and arson, claiming the visuals were of the protests that took place in the city on December 19. They also thanked the locals for helping them source "high quality" images of "riots" in the city. They further asked more people to come forward and share images, videos or any other evidence.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Jadavpur student tears CAA, chants 'Inquilab Zindabad' at convocation
text: A Jadavpur University student tore a copy of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and chanted 'Inquilab Zindabad' on the stage during the convocation ceremony on Tuesday. West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was forced to return from the university after he was shown black flags and his way was blocked by students protesting against the CAA and the National Register of Citizens.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I won't allow detention centres in Maharashtra for NRC: Uddhav Thackeray
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has assured Muslim community that he will not allow any detention camps to be set up in the state under the National Register of Citizens. "My government will ensure there would be no injustice to the Muslim community," he added. Thackeray added his government's main thrust is to provide livelihood to the youth of the community.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Complaint against Sonia, Priyanka over 'provocative' speeches against CAA
text: A complaint was filed in a court in Uttar Pradesh against Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra among others for giving 'provocative speeches' against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. The complaint, filed by advocate Pradeep Gupta, also includes the names of AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and journalist Ravish Kumar. This comes amid the ongoing nationwide protests against the Act.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: What wrong has Suryakumar Yadav done: Harbhajan on BCCI's selection policy
text: Off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has questioned selection policy of BCCI after Mumbai batsman Suryakumar Yadav wasn't included in India squad for upcoming limited-overs series against Sri Lanka and Australia. "I keep wondering what wrong has Suryakumar done...Apart from scoring runs like others who keep getting picked for India, India/A India/B, why different rules for different players?" he tweeted.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Australian Open 2020 to have record prize money of ₹350 crore
text: Tennis players will compete for a record AU$71-million (₹350 crore) prize money at Australian Open 2020, an increase of 13.6% on record purse in 2019. Australian Open prize money has increased by more than 412%, or AU$57.1 million in the 20 years since 2001, when it was AU$13.9 million. The men's and women's singles' champions will each receive AU$4.12 million.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Dhoni named captain of Cricket Aus' ODI XI of decade; Rohit, Kohli also included
text: Cricket Australia on Tuesday revealed their ODI XI of the decade, which includes three Indians. MS Dhoni has been named captain of the side, while Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have been included as number three batsman and opener, respectively. Fast bowler Mitchell Starc is the only Australian in the side. The side also includes Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Told Bill Gates I had grudge against him: Mahindra on old pic with Gates
text: Commenting on a photo of him with Bill Gates from 1997, Anand Mahindra recounted he told the Microsoft Co-founder, "I have a grudge against you." Mahindra told Gates, "My daughter asked which of my [Harvard] classmates were...famous." "Told her your name...She said: What a loser you are Dad...Thanks to you, I'll always be a loser to my kids," he continued.
author: Dharna

headlines: No plans to sell TikTok app, media report untrue: ByteDance
text: China's ByteDance, which owns TikTok, clarified on Tuesday that the company has no plans to sell part or all of its TikTok app. The response came as the company denied a media report which said the company was looking to sell part or all of TikTok stake to a US company. "These rumours are completely meritless," a ByteDance spokeswoman said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Humanoid robots will pose concerns over security, privacy: Pranav Mistry
text: Pranav Mistry, the President and CEO of STAR Labs (Samsung Technology & Advanced Research Labs), has said that humanoid robots will pose concerns over security and privacy. "Innovators, tech companies and policymakers will need to engage to make this world a better place for the intersection of intelligent machines and humans," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: What are the new prices of breakfast, meals provided by IRCTC at stations?
text: Ministry of Railways has revised tariff of IRCTC's standard meals at static units like refreshment rooms and Jan Ahaar stalls at railway stations. A Veg Breakfast will cost ₹35, Non-Veg breakfast ₹45, Standard Veg meal ₹70, Standard meal (Egg Curry) ₹80 and Standard Meal (Chicken Curry) ₹120. Additionally, Veg Biryani will cost ₹70, Egg Biryani ₹80 and Chicken Biryani ₹100.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 40 journalists killed in India since 2014: Study
text: A study commissioned by Thakur Family Foundation said that there were 40 killings of journalists in India between 2014 and 2019. It also said that out of over 30 journalist deaths in the country since 2010, only three have lead to convictions. There has been an increase in attacks on women journalists on the field in India, found the study.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Truck carrying abandoned plane of India Post gets stuck under bridge in WB
text: A truck carrying an abandoned India Post aircraft got stuck under a bridge in West Bengal's Durgapur on Tuesday. The incident took place on National Highway-2 in the city in Paschim Bardhaman district. "The truck has been stuck here since last night. The officials of India Post have reached here," a local present at the spot was quoted by reports.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bengaluru man arrested for allegedly hiring 2 men to kill his wife
text: Bengaluru Police on Monday arrested a man for allegedly paying ₹5 lakh to two men, who lived as tenants in the same house, to kill his estranged wife. The two men who allegedly killed his wife were also arrested. The couple had a troubled history and lived separately. The husband wanted to sell the house but his wife did not.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Govt approves creation of Chief of Defence Staff post, officer to be 4-Star General
text: The Cabinet today approved the creation of the post of Chief of Defence Staff (CDS). The post will be held by a 4-Star General with salary equivalent to Service Chiefs. The CDS will also head Department of Military Affairs which will be created under Ministry of Defence. Armed forces will fall under the ambit of the Department of Military Affairs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Tracking Santa, and 'Christmas gift' from North Korea: US military
text: The North American Aerospace Defence Command (NORAD) has said it's tracking "Christmas gift" from North Korea along with Santa. North Korea recently used the term "Christmas gift" for missile launch, saying, "It's up to US to choose what Christmas gift it wants." NORAD's Santa tracking website gets 1.5 crore unique visitors from over 200 countries and territories across the globe.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Lost 25 kgs after being called fat, chunky on internet: Ed Sheeran
text: Singer Ed Sheeran has revealed that he lost four stones (25 kilograms) after he was trolled and called "fat" and "chunky" on the internet. "I never had insecurities and people pointed them out," he added. Sheeran further said that he didn't feature in his first three-four videos as he didn't have six-packs like One Direction boys and Justin Bieber. n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: The worst fashion trend of 2019 is fur: Ananya Panday
text: Ananya Panday said in an interview that fur is the worst fashion trend of 2019. On being asked about her "low points" of 2019, Ananya said, "The week after my film releases, the week after the Friday, I just feel deflated." "There's so much excitement and then...film comes out and...it's like...balloon and all the air gets sucked out," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kay Kay Menon to portray Dawood's father in web series: Reports
text: Kay Kay Menon will reportedly portray underworld don Dawood Ibrahim's father, Ibrahim Kaskar, who was a head constable in the Mumbai Police, in an upcoming web series. "The makers were keen on Kay Kay as they felt he'd be able to bring grit...to...character," reports added. The 10-part series will reportedly be produced by Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani's Excel Entertainment.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Anti-CAA protesters stop WB Guv at Jadavpur University gate
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday was stopped by anti-CAA protesters from entering Jadavpur University, where he had gone to attend its annual convocation. "A painful scenario that the Jadavpur University Vice-Chancellor is oblivious deliberately of his obligations and looking for alibis," Dhankhar tweeted. This comes a day after he was shown black flags at the university.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Announce no NRC in Cong-ruled states: Kishor tells Rahul Gandhi
text: JD(U) vice-president Prashant Kishor on Tuesday thanked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Twitter for "joining citizens' movement against" CAA and NRC. He also urged the latter to "impress upon" party interim President Sonia Gandhi to "officially announce...there will be no NRC in Congress-ruled states". This came a day after top Congress leaders held a Satyagraha at Raj Ghat in Delhi.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: At least 27 dead in Indonesia as bus plunges into ravine
text: At least 27 people were killed and over a dozen others were injured in Indonesia when a bus plunged into a ravine and ended up in a river. Some passengers may have been carried away with the river's current, rescue team head Berty Kowaas said. Surviving passengers reportedly told the police that there were 50 people in the bus.
author: Shailesh

headlines: NZ suspends search for 2 victims missing since volcano eruption
text: New Zealand police have stopped searching for the bodies of two victims missing since the volcano on White Island erupted in early December. The two missing victims are Winona Langford, aged 17, a tourist from Australia and Hayden Marshall-Inman, aged 40, a New Zealander reportedly working as a tour guide. Since the volcano's eruption, 17 others have died.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Section 144 imposed in Mandi House ahead of anti-CAA protests
text: Section 144 has been imposed in Delhi's Mandi House ahead of the protests planned in the area against Citizenship (Amendment) Act on Tuesday. Heavy police force has reportedly been deployed in the area. Swaraj Abhiyan chief Yogendra Yadav, who has said that CAA is against every citizen of this country, was supposed to stage a protest in Mandi House today.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: I'm not silent on CAA: Adnan Sami to man who said he 'sold his soul to BJP'
text: Singer Adnan Sami has responded after a man tweeted that Adnan has "sold his soul to BJP" as he's silent on CAA. "I'm not silent! I've already stated...the #CABBill is for minority religions...being persecuted in 'Theocratic States'," Adnan tweeted. He also replied, "Saare Jahaan se acha, HINDUstan hamara" when another user wrote, "What will happen to Adnan Sami after CAA[?]"
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Kangana says only 3-4% of Indians pay taxes, Manish Sisodia responds
text: After Kangana Ranaut condemned violence during anti-CAA protests and questioned the "ruckus" by saying, "In our population, only 3-4% people pay tax, others are...dependent on them", Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia responded on Twitter. "Every Indian pays tax, from...daily wage worker to a rich person," he tweeted. "Income tax...from few rich people is not the only tax," Sisodia added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I'm flattered: Hrithik on Deepika saying he's like 'death by chocolate' in War
text: Actor Hrithik Roshan, while reacting to Deepika Padukone tweeting that he is like 'death by chocolate' in his latest film 'War', said, "I really don't know how to react to that. I'm quite flattered." "My thanks to her for complimenting me for 'War'. It's very encouraging when people from your own fraternity praise you," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: No one recognised me in prosthetics during 'Chhapaak' shoot in Delhi: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone has said no one recognised her due to her prosthetics while she was shooting for 'Chhapaak' in Delhi. "People would look at me, they were curious about my face but didn't recognise me," she added. "It was liberating because it has been a while since I have been able to just go out like that," said Deepika.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Salman & I joked 'If you're 45, say you're 50, you'll look younger': Anil
text: Anil Kapoor, who turned 63 on Tuesday, said he has never bothered to hide his age. He added, "As a matter of fact, Salman (Khan) and I used to always joke, 'Whatever your age is, exaggerate it, so you look younger. When you're 45, you should say you're 50!'" Anil further said it isn't possible to hide one's age today.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Rahul, Priyanka stopped on way to meet CAA protest victims' families
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra were stopped on Tuesday outside Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, where they were headed to meet the families of those killed in anti-CAA protests. As per reports, police urged them to postpone the visit due to sensitive law and order situation in the area currently. Priyanka and Rahul later returned to Delhi.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Why not include Muslims in CAA? BJP leader & Netaji's grandnephew Chandra Bose
text: BJP leader and Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose's grandnephew Chandra Kumar Bose on Monday questioned the Citizenship Act, saying that if it is not related to any religion then why Muslims have been excluded. "Why are we stating - Hindu, Sikh, Boudha, Christians, Parsis and Jains only," Bose tweeted. "India is a nation open to all religions and communities," he added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Student rejects gold medal to protest against CAA, says was 'kicked out' of convocation
text: A Pondicherry University student named Rabeeha Abdurehim refused to accept gold medal at the convocation ceremony to express solidarity with students protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. However, Abdurehim, who is from Kerala, accepted the degree. Abdurehim also said she was "kicked out" of the convocation hall when President Ram Nath Kovind, who was the chief guest, entered.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Girlfriend said we can buy our dog more toys: Cummins on ₹15.5 crore IPL deal
text: Australian pacer Pat Cummins, who became the most expensive overseas buy in IPL at ₹15.5 crore, said he doesn't know what to do with the money. "My girlfriend...said...'We can buy the dog a couple more toys now'. She has got her priorities sorted," he added. "I'm really fortunate and grateful for everything that has happened," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: At this time, India a far greater security risk than Pakistan: PCB chief
text: After Pakistan hosted a Test series at home after 10 years, Pakistan Cricket Board chief Ehsan Mani said, "We've proved that Pakistan is safe, if someone isn't coming then they should prove that it's unsafe." He added, "At this time...India is a far greater security risk than Pakistan." He further said, "No one should now doubt security arrangements in Pakistan."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: US man gets Tesla key embedded into hand at a piercing studio
text: A US-based man got a Tesla key embedded in the back of his hand at a piercing studio to be able to unlock his Model 3 by pressing it near the door. Ben Workman has three other microchip implants for things like unlocking doors at work and logging onto his computer. Workman said his family performed the first few procedures.
author: Dharna

headlines: EasyJet crew stops saying 'ladies & gentlemen' after a complaint on Twitter
text: UK-based airline EasyJet's crew has stopped greeting passengers by saying 'ladies and gentleman' on flights after a transgender university lecturer took to Twitter to complain about the airline's greeting. The lecturer had complained to the airline in August, alleging the greeting "reinforced gender binaries". EasyJet confirmed through a tweet on Tuesday that it tweaked its greeting.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Principal allegedly throws acid on 16-year-old girl's chest in Mumbai
text: A 16-year-old girl was allegedly attacked with acid by the principal of her alma mater in Mumbai. The principal threw acid on my chest and one leg while three others, including a teacher and two staffers, held me, she said. "She (principal) threatened me saying they will attack my father, mother and siblings in a similar manner," the girl added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Ex-Maruti MD Jagdish Khattar booked by CBI for alleged ₹110 cr bank fraud
text: The CBI has booked Maruti Udyog's former Managing Director Jagdish Khattar for alleged bank loan fraud of ₹110 crore by his new company, officials said on Tuesday. In its FIR, the CBI named Khattar and his company Carnation Auto India Limited for allegedly causing a ₹110 crore loss to Punjab National Bank. Khattar was with Maruti from 1993 to 2007.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Major awarded for making bulletproof jacket against sniper rifle bullets
text: Major Anoop Mishra was felicitated with the Army Design Bureau Excellence Award for developing 'Sarvatra' bulletproof jacket that provides full-body protection against various ammunition including that of sniper rifles even from 10m distance. Mishra said he decided to develop a full-body bulletproof jacket after he was hit by a bullet which didn't penetrate his armour but caused trauma to him.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Baba Ram Dass, who promoted psychedelic drugs in 1960s, dies aged 88 in US
text: Baba Ram Dass, a spiritual leader who in the 1960s promoted psychedelic drugs as the path to inner enlightenment, has died at his home in US' Hawaii at the age of 88. Dass, who began teaching and researching psychology at Harvard in 1958, was fired from the university after he gave LSD to an undergraduate student.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Asia's richest person Mukesh Ambani adds $17 billion to his wealth in 2019
text: Asia's richest person Mukesh Ambani added nearly $17 billion to his wealth in 2019, the most in Asia as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This took the Reliance Industries Chairman's net worth to almost $61 billion. In comparison, Alibaba Co-founder Jack Ma's net worth grew $11.3 billion, while Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos lost $13.2 billion wealth as of December 23.
author: Dharna

headlines: IMF says India must take 'urgent' action to reverse growth slowdown
text: India must take "urgent" policy actions to reverse its economic slowdown, said the International Monetary Fund (IMF). It, however, added the government has limited space to boost spending to support growth, given its high debt levels and interest bill. IMF had cut India's GDP growth forecast for 2019-20 to 6.1% in October and intends to cut it further in January.
author: Dharna

headlines: Writer moves HC against Deepika's Chhapaak, seeks credit for story
text: A writer has approached the Bombay High Court against Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Chhapaak', claiming he originally penned an acid attack survivor's story on which the film is based. The petitioner has sought that he should be given credit as one of the writers of the film. He's also sought a stay on film's release until the credit is given to him.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Hrithik to play Lord Krishna in Deepika's 'Mahabharata': Reports
text: Hrithik Roshan will reportedly portray the role of Lord Krishna in 'Mahabharata', wherein Deepika Padukone will be seen portraying the role of Draupadi. "Playing Lord Krishna is...welcome challenge for any actor. The logistics are being worked out for Hrithik's participation," reports said. The film will be made in multiple parts with the first part slated to release on Diwali 2021.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: It's good that people are talking about it: Kajol on rape cases
text: Actress Kajol has said that the "chatter" around rape cases in our country is good as it'll help change the mindset of the entire country and society. She added that people have recently started talking about it as "our society has been patriarchal for ages". "It's strange that parents earlier were hesitant to...bring such incidents out in...public," Kajol further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Twitter bans animated PNGs to stop trolls from triggering seizures
text: Twitter has banned the use of animated PNG image files (APNG), an alternative to GIFs, as a bug allowed them to bypass the platform's safeguards against autoplay. Last month, the Epilepsy Foundation's handle and hashtags were targeted and flooded with flashing animated images, designed to trigger seizures in epileptic individuals. Twitter said the latest move would help protect such individuals.
author: Dharna

headlines: ByteDance may have to sell TikTok over US security concerns: Reports
text: China's ByteDance is reportedly weighing the option to sell a majority stake in its short video-sharing app TikTok to remain in the US market where it faces security concerns from the government. Reports said ByteDance could get more than $10 billion from a potential sale. However, ByteDance would reportedly prefer to maintain full control over TikTok, given its profit potential.
author: Dharna

headlines: Politics of arrogance is ultimately defeated: Lalu Yadav on J'khand win
text: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav on Monday congratulated JMM chief Hemant Soren after the Jharkhand election results, saying that his wishes have been fulfilled. "The great people of Jharkhand have ensured that politics based on arrogance and hypocrisy is ultimately defeated after some time," Yadav tweeted. JMM was in alliance with RJD and Congress in the Jharkhand Assembly elections.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Snowfall results in 4-km long traffic jam in Himachal Pradesh
text: Tourists and locals in Himachal Pradesh were stuck in a four-kilometre long traffic jam on Manali-Solang-Nalla route on Monday due to heavy snowfall in the area for the past few days. The traffic movement on the Manali-Keylong route in Lahaul-Spiti district, which was stopped earlier, was resumed on Tuesday. The state transport corporation may resume bus service between Keylong-Kullu today.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: US stops sending bomb-detecting dogs to Egypt, Jordan after 7 die
text: The US has stopped sending bomb-detecting dogs to Egypt and Jordan after a report by the State Department's Office of Inspector General said seven dogs had died due to negligence and heat stroke. The dogs are deployed in eight countries as part of the US' Antiterrorism Assistance Program. An earlier report in September had said the deaths were "not accidental".
author: Shailesh

headlines: Fire breaks out at 2 factories in Delhi a day after a fire killed 9
text: Fire broke out at two factories in Delhi's Narela industrial area on Tuesday morning. Flames have been doused in one of the factories while fire fighting operations are underway at the other. This comes a day after a fire at a cloth godown in Kirari area killed nine people and left several others injured.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: UP Police admits IAS aspirant was shot dead by constable during anti-CAA protests
text: UP Police has admitted that a 20-year-old IAS aspirant who died during protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act in the state was shot dead by a constable in "self-defence". His family had said he had nothing to do with the protests. Earlier, UP DGP OP Singh had said none of the people, who died during protests, were killed in police firing.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: The word 'sperm' in film's promo was censored by a TV channel: Akshay
text: Speaking about his upcoming film 'Good Newwz' which deals with In-vitro Fertilisation (IVF), Akshay Kumar revealed that a TV channel censored the word 'sperm' in the film's promo. "If we'll do such things, then it defeats the purpose of the...promo," he added. Akshay further said that "unfortunately, even today people speak in hush tones about IVF".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Anurag deletes video comparing Hitler's speech to PM's after user says it's fake
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has deleted a video of Hitler's speech subtitled 'Hate me it is your wish but don't hate Germany' after a Twitter user pointed out that it's the wrong translation. He had shared the video after PM Narendra Modi said in his speech, "Burn my effigy if you hate me, don't mislead people" amid anti-CAA protests.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Celebrity chef and model Jagee John found dead in her flat's kitchen in Kerala
text: Television personality, model and celebrity chef Jagee John was found dead in the kitchen of her flat in Kerala's Kuravankonam on Monday, police said. Jagee was living with her mother in the flat. She used to run a cookery show called Jagee's Cookbook on Rosebowl, a television channel, and also used to judge beauty and personality shows.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Someone referred to me as 'Russian prostitute' after 'Dev.D': Kalki Koechlin
text: Actress Kalki Koechlin has revealed that a person referred to her as a "Russian prostitute" after she played a prostitute's role in 'Dev.D'. "Someone...said, 'Where did they get this Russian prostitute from?' I was like, 'Hey I'm not Russian'," she added. Kalki further revealed a producer didn't work with her after she refused to go on a date with him.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: German student at IIT Madras deported allegedly for protesting against CAA
text: Jakob Lindenthal, a German student in IIT Madras, was deported allegedly after he participated in anti-Citizenship Act protests. Lindenthal said he was called by the immigration department to discuss some issue regarding his residential permit. "They asked about...my participation in the protests. Towards the end...they said I may have to leave India for violating my student visa rules," he added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Russia says its internet can work even if it is cut off from World Wide Web
text: Russia has completed a series of tests checking that its internet services could function if the country were to get cut off from the World Wide Web, Deputy Communications Minister Aleksei Sokolov said. "Our goal was to provide an uninterrupted internet service on Russian territory under any circumstances," Sokolov added. The tests follow a "sovereign internet" bill introduced in November.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: JMM-led alliance will form govt in 2-3 days: JMM leader
text: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) leader Basant Soren on Tuesday said that JMM-Congress-RJD alliance will form the government in Jharkhand in two to three days. "People had decided what they have thought. Citizens had...removed the corrupted and arrogant government," he added. The alliance won on 47 seats in the 81-member Jharkhand Assembly while the BJP won on 25 seats.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Musk makes cannabis joke as Tesla stock hits all time high of $420
text: As Tesla stock climbed 3.7% to hit an all-time high of $420 on Monday, CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to make a cannabis joke about the milestone and said, "Whoa…the stock is so high lol." This also refers to Musk's tweet from 2018 that said he was "considering" taking Tesla private at $420-per-share and had the required "funding secured".
author: Dharna

headlines: Jamia student holds anti-CAA placard at her wedding; groom and family join her
text: A Jamia student held a placard to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act at her wedding, with the groom and family members joining her. "Being a concerned citizen of this country, I had to use my wedding as a platform to raise my voice against CAA as it will affect the secular fabric of our country," she said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: K'taka man in Saudi allegedly posts 'next Ram Mandir in Mecca', arrested
text: A Karnataka man in Saudi Arabia was arrested for an alleged Facebook post suggesting "next Ram Mandir" be built at Mecca. "Embassy is cognizant of the matter and would do all possible to help Harish (Bangera)," Indian Embassy in Riyadh said. Meanwhile, Harish in a video said, "I've done a mistake. I ask my Muslim brothers to forgive me."
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Unmarried Chinese woman sues hospital over refusal to freeze eggs
text: An unmarried Chinese woman has filed a suit against a hospital for rejecting her request to undergo a medical procedure to freeze her eggs due to her marital status. According to China's laws on human assisted reproduction, only married couples can use such health services, and they must be able to prove their marital status by showing a marriage licence.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Spanish reporter covering lottery finds out she won ₹4 lakh during live broadcast
text: A Spanish reporter covering the draw of a lottery found out that she was one of the winners during a live TV broadcast. Natalia Escudero won €5,000 (nearly ₹4 lakh) in the lottery which had a maximum prize of €4 million (nearly ₹32 crore). "I'm not coming to work tomorrow!" Escudero said after winning the lottery.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: I never understood wind: Donald Trump
text: While criticising windmills, US President Donald Trump said, "I never understood wind...I know windmills very much, I have studied it better than anybody. I know it is very expensive." "They are made in China and Germany mostly," he further said, adding that wind turbines spew fumes into the air and cause a large carbon footprint.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Roman kings had high risk of violent death in 1st yr of reign: Study
text: A new study based on the statistical analysis of the 69 rulers of the unified Roman empire has found that the emperors faced a high risk of violent death during their first year of reign. The study further states that the risk of death stabilised by the eighth year but increased again after 12 years of rule.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: I hated Black Panther, it's utter bulls**t: Actor Terry Gilliam
text: Actor-writer Terry Gilliam has criticised Marvel films for dominating the film business and "taking money that should be available for a greater variety of films". Terry added he hated Marvel's 'Black Panther', stating that it gave "young black kids the idea that this is something to believe in". "It's utter bulls**t. I think...people who made it...never [visited] Africa," he said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Amitabh Bachchan, others invest ₹200 crore in Mumbai startup Eduisfun
text: A group of angel investors, including actor Amitabh Bachchan and HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh, has invested nearly ₹200 crore ($28 million) in Mumbai-based ed-tech startup Eduisfun. Ogilvy Group Chief Creative Officer Piyush Pandey and PwC Partner Russell Parera were also among the investors. Founded in 2014, the startup offers game-based learning apps to school students.
author: Dharna

headlines: Glad I never got to direct Sridevi, was too much of a fan: Karan
text: Director Karan Johar has said he is "glad" he never got to direct late actress Sridevi because he would have given her a "bona fide failure". "I would have been too much of a fan...And maybe the film would have suffered as a result," he said. "[A] filmmaker has to be...objective about his...work...I would have lost complete objectivity," Karan added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Wrinkles, grey hair of women are frowned upon in B'wood: Kangana
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut has said women with "wrinkles, grey hair and intellectual growth" are frowned upon in Bollywood. The actress, who'll portray a Kabbadi player in an upcoming film 'Panga', further said that she has made such a place in the industry where her wrinkles will not be frowned upon. "I don't want others to decide my destiny," she added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Some actors are scared to speak on political matters: Naseeruddin
text: Talking about the Bollywood actors who refrain from speaking on political matters, Naseeruddin Shah said they don't speak up because they are scared of losing many things. "However, there are actors who're...raising their voices and I feel...the fear of facing...backlash will gradually fizzle out," he added. Naseeruddin further said actors should make films on things that they believe in. n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Phone is the last thing 80% Indian users see before sleeping: Survey
text: Smartphones are the last thing 80% of adult users in India see before sleeping, said a survey by Cybermedia Research. It found that 74% of the users checked their phones within 30 minutes of waking up. With Indians spending a third of waking hours or 1800 hours a year on phones, 25% experienced health effects like weak eyesight from over-usage.
author: Dharna

headlines: Tesla rival Rivian raises $1.3 billion from T.Rowe Price, others
text: Tesla competitor Rivian has raised $1.3 billion in a funding round led by T.Rowe Price. The round saw participation from Rivian's existing investors like Amazon and Ford Motor. This was Rivian's fourth investment round in 2019 alone. While Rivian raised $700 million in February in a round led by Amazon, Cox Automotive invested $350 million in the startup in September.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Around 20 held in Kerala for trying to show black flags to K'taka CM
text: Around 20 activists of Kerala Students Union (KSU) were held in Thiruvananthapuram on Monday for allegedly attempting to show black flags to Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa's convoy. They were protesting against the recent detention of Kerala journalists at Mangaluru while they were covering the death of two people during anti-CAA protest. The activists, reportedly, also tried to block his convoy.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Mastercard acquires security assessment startup RiskRecon
text: Mastercard has acquired security assessment startup RiskRecon which helps companies protect their cyber systems and infrastructure. Mastercard's President of cyber and intelligence Ajay Bhalla said with its advanced technology RiskRecon offered an opportunity to complement Mastercard's existing cyberspace strategy and technology. The financial details of the deal were not revealed.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Delhi Cabinet approves electric vehicle policy to tackle pollution
text: In a bid to tackle air pollution, the Delhi Cabinet has approved a policy on electric vehicles. Focusing on two-wheelers, shared transport and commercial vehicles, the policy aims to register five lakh electric vehicles within five years, said CM Arvind Kejriwal. The policy offers incentives of up to ₹10,000 on the purchase of battery-operated two-wheelers and ₹30,000 on electric autorickshaws.
author: Dharna

headlines: Brain's evolutionary changes made it more prone to anxiety: Study
text: A new study has found that VMAT1, a gene responsible for transporting and regulating neurotransmitters dopamine and serotonin, has undergone functional changes throughout the course of human evolution. The scientists found that the changes led to the creation of a gene variant that decreases the uptake of neurotransmitters and is associated with higher depression and/or anxiety.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Congress-JMM-RJD alliance secure majority in Jharkhand Assembly polls
text: The Congress-JMM-RJD alliance will form the government in Jharkhand after securing a required majority of at least 41 seats in the state Assembly elections. Meanwhile, BJP, which had formed government in the state with allies in 2014, has currently won 21 seats and is leading in four seats. RJD's Tejashwi Yadav said Hemant Soren will be the state's Chief Minister.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: J'khand caretaker CM, who never lost an election in 24 yrs, loses from Jamshedpur-East
text: Jharkhand caretaker Chief Minister Raghubar Das, who has never lost in state Assembly election in 24 years, has lost from Jamshedpur-East by margin of 15,833 votes. Das has been defeated by Independent candidate and former BJP leader Saryu Roy. Roy contested as Independent candidate after he was denied a BJP ticket from his seat Jamshedpur-West in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: How many states in India are currently being ruled by the BJP and its allies?
text: BJP and its allies now rule 16 states in India, as compared to 21 states in March 2018. The NDA lost power in Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh last year and in Maharashtra and Jharkhand this year. Some of the states where the NDA is currently in power include Assam, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Gujarat, Karnataka and Bihar.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: If no nationwide NRC, Assam to go to SC for revised list: Himanta
text: Assam minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Monday said that if a nationwide NRC is not implemented, the government of Assam would approach the Supreme Court to seek revision of the current National Register of Citizens (NRC) in the state. Sarma said several pleas seeking re-verification of citizens are already pending in the Supreme Court.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sachin reveals teammates sang 'Tujh mein rab dikhta hai' for him after WC win
text: Ex-India batsman Sachin Tendulkar has revealed his teammates sang and danced on 'Tujh mein rab dikhta hai' for him while celebrating 2011 World Cup victory. "So I also danced, I normally don't dance much. But I danced with my wife. It was the greatest moment of my life," Sachin added. "In every room, there was champagne flowing," he further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Dhoni completes 15 years in int'l cricket, Styris reveals favourite Dhoni moment
text: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni completed 15 years in international cricket on Monday. Dhoni's ex-CSK teammate Scott Styris revealed his favourite Dhoni moment on the occasion. "My favourite MS Dhoni moment is at CSK. From day one...'My hotel room door will never be closed until I go to sleep (2 am) come in at any time for a chat!'" he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Don't rely on digital age proof while serving liquor: Delhi govt
text: Delhi's clubs, hotels, and bars will now have to check physical age proof of suspected "underage" customers for consuming alcohol with the government declaring that digital copies will no longer be acceptable. The directive was issued after the excise department found that a few "underage" customers were consuming liquor after producing fake digital IDs before the staff of bars.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Nagpur thief who drew ideas from crime serial and videos arrested
text: A 32-year-old man was arrested on Sunday for a series of burglaries which the Nagpur Police said he committed by watching a television serial on crime and online videos. Police recovered over ₹5 lakh in cash, a motorcycle and a sharp-edged weapon from the accused. Police said that he got ideas like pulling out door latches through videos he watched.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 'Oxygen Parlour' at Nashik Road railway station to fight air pollution
text: The Ministry of Railways on Monday said that a "unique Oxygen Parlour" has been developed at the Nashik Road railway station. The ministry said that it creates a natural atmosphere and pleasant surroundings in the station area by eliminating harmful effects of pollution, using common indoor air-filtering plants which filters harmful toxins and pollutants from the air.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Dubai's Emaar may sell view from world's tallest tower Burj Khalifa for $1 bn
text: Dubai's biggest developer Emaar Properties is selling the "At The Top" observation decks of the world's tallest skyscraper, Burj Khalifa, for $1 billion, Reuters reported citing sources. The viewing decks, which attracted 15.92 million overnight visitors in 2018, reportedly make about $163-191 million a year. The observation decks span levels 124, 125 and 148.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Jet Airways lenders seek fresh bids for the bankrupt airline
text: Jet Airways' Committee of Creditors have decided to seek fresh bids for the bankrupt airline, its resolution professional said. Last week, the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) approved extension of the airline's insolvency resolution process by 90 days. The resolution professional had earlier told the bankruptcy court that he has received early interests from two potential investors.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: It's you who wore suit worth ₹2 cr: Rahul to PM on 'clothes' remark
text: Speaking at Congress' anti-CAA protest, Rahul Gandhi said, "When it comes to clothes, the entire nation knows you (PM Narendra Modi) because of your clothes." He added, "It was you who had worn a suit worth ₹2 crore." PM Modi, while blaming Congress and its allies, had said, "Those who are creating violence can be identified by their clothes itself."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Will protect Constitution for CAA protest 'martyrs': Priyanka
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday said that in the name of all those who had been "martyred" in the protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), her party "will protect the Constitution and will not allow the Constitution to be destroyed". Priyanka was addressing party workers at Congress' ''Satyagraha for Unity'' at the Raj Ghat, Delhi.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Pandya, Shaw named in India A squad for New Zealand tour
text: BCCI has announced India A squad for the upcoming New Zealand tour with Prithvi Shaw being named in the two unofficial Tests and three ODIs away from home against New Zealand. All-rounder Hardik Pandya has been named in the ODIs squad. While Shubman Gill will lead the team in ODIs, Hanuma Vihari will be the skipper in unofficial Tests.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Older PCs double productivity losses of small firms: Microsoft India
text: Microsoft India said small and medium businesses (SMBs) using PCs more than four years old and functioning on older operating systems can see double productivity losses than ones using newer PCs. It added older PCs exposed organisations to security vulnerabilities and IT threats. As per its study, nearly 43% SMBs still use old PCs and function on old operating systems.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: World's first head transplant a possibility in 10 years, says ex-NHS expert
text: Bruce Mathew, an ex-NHS neurosurgeon, believes head transplant between two individuals could be possible in next 10 years. So far scientists looking into it considered severing the spinal cord but Mathew believes the entire spinal cord would need to be transferred along with the head. He said advances in stem cell transplants, robotics and nerve surgery could make transplants possible.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Boeing's Starliner first US-made crew capsule to land on ground
text: Boeing CST-100 Starliner, which landed safely at New Mexico's White Sands Missile Range on December 22, is the first US-made capsule to land on the ground. Previously, capsules from programmes like Mercury and Apollo all had landed on water. Starliner returned to Earth after having failed an unmanned mission entailing docking with the International Space Station.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: IIT Madras-incubated YNOS raises ₹75 lakh seed funding
text: YNOS Venture Engine, incubated at IIT Madras Incubation Cell, has raised ₹75 lakh in seed funding from angel investors. Mahesh Ramachandran, a partner at venture capital fund Pontaq, invested in his personal capacity along with other undisclosed investors. Co-founded by IIT Madras professor Thillai Rajan, YNOS helps entrepreneurs address some early-stage challenges.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Interior design startup HomeLane raises $30 million in Series D round
text: Bengaluru-based online interior design startup HomeLane raised $30 million in Series D round of funding. The round, which saw participation from existing investors like Accel Partners and Sequoia, was led by new investors Evolvence India, Pidilite and FJ Labs. This brings HomeLane's all-time raise to $46 million. Founded in 2014, it provides end-to-end interior design solutions to customers.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Chhattisgarh woman set on fire by boyfriend's family, dies
text: A 20-year-old woman, who was allegedly set on fire by her boyfriend's family in Chhattisgarh's Raipur district on Wednesday, passed away on Sunday, police said. Saraswati Sonwani had gone to boyfriend Lallu Satnami's house after getting a call from him. There she was reportedly set on fire by his parents. She had received over 80% burns.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: India test-fires 2 Quick Reaction Surface-to-Air Missiles in Odisha
text: India successfully conducted two back-to-back test flights of its Quick Reaction Surface-to-Air Missiles (QRSAM) against live aerial targets on Monday. The tests were conducted from the integrated test range at Chandipur near Odisha at 11.45 am. The QRSAM is an all-weather, all-terrain system with search and track on the move capability having a very short reaction time.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Journo body condemns police brutality against media at anti-CAA protests
text: Editors Guild of India on Monday issued a statement condemning "acts of violence and brutality by police forces...against media persons" during anti-CAA protests over the past week. The statement said, "Using force...against journalists on duty throttles the very voice of democracy." The Guild asked Home Ministry to direct police to offer protection to journalists covering the ongoing protests.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Temperature in North India to dip further after December 25, says IMD
text: Severe cold weather conditions that have prevailed over northern Indian region over the past week are likely to continue, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Sunday. "After 25th (December), [we're] expecting clear skies, low wind speed which will cause night time temperature to fall significantly," said Kuldeep Srivastava, head, Regional Weather Forecasting Centre.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: NRC may not be required in Goa: CM Pramod Sawant
text: On being asked about NRC implementation in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, "It may not be required." Reacting to Sawant's remark, Congress' Trajano D'Mello said that it's reflection of Sawant's "conscience which believes NRC would do more damage than good". This comes amid questions being raised about the future of Goans who hold a Portuguese passport if NRC is enacted.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Russia's Putin opens rail route to annexed Crimea
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin inaugurated a rail route to Crimea, which it annexed in 2014 from Ukraine, by personally taking a ride in the train across the rail and road bridge. "This is...the longest bridge not only in Russia but also in Europe," Putin said. He also said that it shows Russia's capacity to build "world-scale infrastructure projects".
author: Shailesh

headlines: Saudi ruling in Khashoggi murder case didn't serve justice: Turkey
text: Turkey's Foreign Ministry Spokesman Hami Aksoy said that Saudi Arabia's decision to give death sentence to five people in the murder case of journalist Jamal Khashoggi was far from serving justice. Khashoggi was killed in Saudi Arabia's consulate in Istanbul, Turkey last year. "The ruling...is far from meeting the expectations of our country and the international community," Aksoy further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Direct threat to outer space peace: China on US' Space Force
text: Commenting on US' Space Force, Chinese spokesperson Geng Shuang said, "The relevant US actions...undermine global strategic balance and stability, and pose a direct threat to outer space peace and security." He added that China is "deeply concerned about it and resolutely opposed to it". The US' actions are also "a serious violation of the international consensus", he further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Ex-Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren wins from both Dumka and Barhait seats
text: Former Jharkhand Chief Minister and Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) leader Hemant Soren won the Jharkhand Assembly elections from both the seats he contested. The 44-year-old won the Barhait constituency by a margin of 25,740 votes, while he clinched the Dumka seat by a margin of 13,188 votes. He defeated BJP's Lois Marandi in Dumka and BJP's Simon Malto in Barhait.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: PM Modi congratulates JMM-led alliance for victory in Jharkhand elections
text: After the trends showed JMM-led alliance leading in Jharkhand Assembly polls, PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate JMM leader Hemant Soren and the alliance on their victory. "Best wishes to them in serving the state...I thank the people of Jharkhand for having given BJP the opportunity to serve the state for many years," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Raghubar Das resigns as Jharkhand's CM after conceding defeat in assembly polls
text: Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das tendered his resignation to Governor Draupadi Murmu on Monday after conceding defeat in the assembly elections. Das is trailing from the Jamshedpur (East) constituency, as per trends. He had earlier said that the result means his defeat, and not of the BJP.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Decision on NRC will be in interest of J'Khand: JMM's Hemant Soren
text: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) President Hemant Soren on being asked whether National Register of Citizens (NRC) will be implemented in Jharkhand, said, "We will take a decision keeping in mind the interest of the state." Soren said this after winning from Dumka and Barhait seats in state Assembly polls. JMM emerged as the single biggest party in polls.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Cong leaders read Constitution's Preamble at Raj Ghat protest
text: Top Congress leaders on Monday read Preamble to the Indian Constitution at Raj Ghat in Delhi. Former PM Manmohan Singh among others read the Preamble during a Satyagraha protest organised by Congress against Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens. Interim Congress President Sonia Gandhi was also present at the protest along with Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 1 lakh people call for civil disobedience over CAA & NRC in Bengaluru
text: Around one lakh people gathered at Quddus Saheb Eidgah grounds in Bengaluru on Monday to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC). Protesters called for a civil disobedience movement against the CAA and NRC and shouted, "Hum kaagaz nahi denge, hum kaagaz nahi denge (We will not give our documents)."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India squads for T20Is vs SL, ODIs vs Australia announced, Bumrah returns
text: The BCCI on Monday announced Team India squads for the upcoming T20I series against Sri Lanka and ODI series against Australia. Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah, who last played for India in September this year, has been included in both the squads after recovering from a stress fracture. Meanwhile, Team India opener Rohit Sharma has been rested for Sri Lanka series.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: BJP MP, son booked for allegedly faking papers to get OBC certificates
text: Madhya Pradesh Police has filed an FIR against BJP MP from Guna, Krishnapal Yadav and his son Sarthak Yadav for allegedly submitting forged documents to get non-creamy layer OBC certificates. The Ashoknagar administration had cancelled the OBC certificates of Yadav and his son last week after it emerged that his income was in excess of ₹8 lakh.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: We respect the mandate given by the people of Jharkhand: Amit Shah
text: As the trends predicted victory for JMM-Congress-RJD alliance in Jharkhand Assembly elections, BJP President Amit Shah tweeted, "We respect the mandate given by the people of Jharkhand." He added, "We express our heartfelt gratitude to the people for the opportunity given to BJP to serve the state for five years. BJP will remain committed to the development of the state."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Mamata writes to Pawar, proposes joint Opposition protest against CAA
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday wrote to NCP supremo Sharad Pawar and proposed a joint protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act comprising all Opposition parties. Mamata wrote, "Let us create peaceful and meaningful opposition to these unholy efforts by the Centre and save India's democratic soul." She added, "Opposition unity must be on one platform."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Wipro deletes page highlighting its work on Assam NRC, restores it later
text: Bengaluru-based IT services giant Wipro deleted a page documenting its role as a 'System Integrator' for the Assam National Register of Citizens (NRC) project but restored it hours later. Over 19 lakh people were left out of the final Assam NRC. This comes a day after PM Narendra Modi said there has been no discussion on implementing a nationwide NRC.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Will not allow NRC in Andhra Pradesh: CM Jagan Mohan Reddy
text: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Monday said that the state will not implement the proposed National Register of Citizens (NRC). "The YSRCP government will not support...NRC at any cost," the CM said while addressing a public meeting in Kadapa district. YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) had voted in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill (CAB) in the Parliament.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 51 injured in US highway pile-up involving 69 vehicles
text: At least 51 people were injured after a pile-up involving as many as 69 cars on a highway in Virginia, US on Sunday. The cause of the accident is being investigated but fog and icy road conditions are being seen as contributing factors to the pile-up, police said. It took authorities several hours to reopen all lanes of traffic.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: We're foreign prisoners in China, help us: 6-yr-old finds note in Xmas card
text: A six-year-old girl from London said she found a note in a Christmas card purchased from supermarket giant Tesco that read, "We are foreign prisoners in Shanghai Qingpu Prison China. Forced to work against our will. Please help us". It also urged the reader to contact Peter Humphrey, a former British journalist. China, however, said the allegation was "a farce".
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: RInfra wins ₹1,250 crore arbitration award against Damodar Valley
text: Reliance Infrastructure (RInfra) has won ₹1,250-crore arbitration award against state-run Damodar Valley Corporation (DVC). It was the engineering and construction contractor for DVC's Raghunathpur thermal power project in West Bengal with a contract value of ₹3,750 crore. "This award is validation of the rightful position of the company," RInfra said, adding it will use the proceeds to cut debt.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Boeing CEO quits 9 months after fatal crashes grounded 737 MAX
text: Dennis Muilenburg has resigned as the CEO and a board director of US planemaker Boeing effective immediately nine months after its 737 MAX was grounded worldwide after two fatal crashes. Muilenburg started as an intern at Boeing in 1985, becoming the CEO in mid-2015. Chairman David Calhoun will take over as CEO and president, effective January 13.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Large-capacity magazine bans linked with fewer mass shootings: Study
text: A new study has found that bans on large-capacity magazines in US states is linked to fewer mass shootings and deaths. The researchers analysed associations between high-fatality mass shootings and state and federal large-capacity magazine bans starting in 1990. Out of the 69 high-fatality mass shootings during the study period, forty-four of them involved LCMs and 16 did not.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Jharkhand's people showed their opposition to CAA, NRC: Kejriwal
text: Commenting on Jharkhand Assembly poll results, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the people of Jharkhand have indicated that they don't want CAA and NRC to be implemented. He added that the BJP leaders had "aggressively" promoted CAA and NRC during the Assembly poll campaign. Kejriwal further said that the BJP's "arrogance" is one of the factors for its defeat.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Dented, denied & defeated in 2019 state polls: Chidambaram on BJP
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram tweeted, "Dented in Haryana, Denied in Maharashtra, Defeated in Jharkhand. That is the story of the BJP in 2019." He added, "All non-BJP parties must raise their sights and rally around the Congress to save the Constitution of India." The trends for Jharkhand polls showed JMM-Congress-RJD alliance crossing the majority mark in the 81-member Assembly.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 104 arrested, 12,200 booked in anti-CAA protests in Maharashtra
text: As many as 104 people have been arrested and over 12,000 cases were registered in Maharashtra's Parbhani, Hingoli and Beed districts in connection with violence during protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) last week, officials said on Monday. Protesters on Friday pelted stones and damaged public and private property in these three districts.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Vernon Philander announces international retirement
text: South African pacer Vernon Philander has announced that he will retire from international cricket following the Test series against England. The 34-year-old has taken the field for South Africa in 60 Tests, 30 ODIs and seven T20 Internationals. "It has been an honour and privilege to have played alongside the very best in the game," Philander said about his departure.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Pollard like a brother to me, a father-figure: Nicholas Pooran
text: Talking about skipper Kieron Pollard, West Indies wicketkeeper-batsman Nicholas Pooran said, "He's been like a big brother to me, a father-figure. He's been there since I returned to cricket." Pooran made a comeback after a car accident in 2015 and has an average of 52 in 19 ODIs. He scored 29*, 75, and 89 runs in the series against India.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Air quality to be monitored ahead of Aus Tests vs NZ
text: Cricket Australia will monitor the air quality for the remaining two Tests against New Zealand. This comes days after a Big Bash game in Canberra was abandoned due to heavy smoke from the bushfires in several areas across the country. "We do expect smoke to be in the state of Victoria," said an Australian meteorological department official.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Chelsea's Rüdiger responds to racism he faced at Spurs' stadium
text: Chelsea's Antonio Rüdiger responded with a series of tweets after he was subjected to racial slurs during the Tottenham-Chelsea Premier League match on Sunday. "It's just such a shame that racism still exists in 2019. When will this nonsense stop?" a tweet by Rüdiger read. Notably, a challenge on Rüdiger had resulted in the red card of Tottenham's Son Heung-min.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Securing land, maritime border priority for $5 tn economy: Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah said that securing land and maritime borders are a priority to achieve India's aim of becoming a $5 trillion economy. He also said that PM Narendra Modi-led government is committed to ending terrorism, left-wing extremism and insurgency in the country in the next five years. Shah delivered the 32nd Endowment Lecture of the Intelligence Bureau (IB).
author: Shailesh

headlines: AIIMS conducts re-postmortem of 4 accused in Hyd vet's rape & murder
text: A team of forensic experts of AIIMS, Delhi on Monday performed the second autopsy on the mortal remains of the four accused in the rape and murder case of a veterinarian in Hyderabad. All the four accused were killed in a police encounter earlier this month. The Telangana High Court on Saturday had ordered the re-postmortem in the encounter case.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Taliban claims responsibility for killing US soldier in Afghanistan
text: The US military on Monday issued a statement saying a US service member was killed in combat but didn't identify the US soldier or say where in Afghanistan the service member was killed. Shortly afterwards, the Taliban claimed responsibility behind a roadside bombing in northern Kunduz province in Afghanistan, saying that the US soldier was killed in it.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: I dedicate this victory to the people of Jharkhand: JMM's Hemant Soren
text: After the trends showed JMM-Congress-RJD grand alliance leading on 43 seats in the 81-member Jharkhand Assembly, JMM chief Hemant Soren said he would dedicate the victory to people of Jharkhand. "A new chapter begins for Jharkhand, it'll be a milestone for the state," he added. "I want to assure everyone that their hopes will not be broken," he further said.nn
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: OnePlus introduces Red Cable Club program to offer rewards to users
text: OnePlus has introduced Red Cable Club program in India to offer exclusive benefits to its users. With the program, users will be eligible to avail 50% discount on OnePlus Bullets Wireless 2 earphones, battery replacement, upgrade plans and also get 50GB free cloud storage for a year. Program members also stand a chance to win a gift box worth ₹1,00,000.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: TV actress Divya marries secretly as parents opposed inter-caste marriage
text: Television actress Divya Bhatnagar, who featured in the show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', took to Instagram to reveal that she got married to her fiancé Gagan in a secret wedding ceremony in Mumbai. The couple's families weren't present at the wedding as they opposed their inter-caste marriage, Divya told The Times of India. The couple got engaged in 2015.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: BJP shares animated video for Muslims to clear doubts about CAA & NRC
text: Amid protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, BJP has shared an animated video for Muslims to clear doubts about the Act and NRC, asking them to beware of rumours. The video shows one man telling the other that CAA 'isn't about taking citizenship, but providing citizenship'. It also blames opposition parties like Congress and TMC of attempting to instigate Muslims.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Latest ODI rankings released, Rohit 14 rating points behind first-placed Kohli
text: India opener Rohit Sharma, who won Man of the Series award in recently concluded ODI series against West Indies, is now 14 rating points behind first-placed Virat Kohli in the latest rankings. Meanwhile, KL Rahul's 185 runs in the series have lifted him 17 places to 71st spot, while Shreyas Iyer's 130-run aggregate helped him move from 104th to 81st.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: It is my defeat, not of BJP: Jharkhand Chief Minister Raghubar Das
text: As the ruling BJP appeared to be losing the Jharkhand Assembly election, Chief Minister Raghubar Das said that it was his defeat, and not of his party. Earlier in the day, Das said his party will accept the people's mandate. Notably, Das is trailing behind Independent candidate and former BJP leader Saryu Roy by over 10,000 votes.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Shiv Sena supporters beat up man, shave his head over post against Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena supporters allegedly beat up a man in Mumbai and shaved his head after he shared a post against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray for comparing police action on Jamia Millia Islamia students to Jallianwala Bagh massacre. The 30-year-old was attacked outside his house, even after he deleted the post on receiving threats from some people, officials said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: New form of uranium found, could affect nuclear waste disposal plans
text: Manchester University scientists discovered a new form of uranium which could have implications for current nuclear waste disposal plans. Burying radioactive waste deep underground can lead to a temporary new chemical form of uranium, which could lead to it being leaked into underground water. Notably, several global governments are planning to dispose of uranium by burying it underground.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: India's 1st Sun mission, Gaganyaan's test flight in 2020: ISRO Chief
text: ISRO Chairman K Sivan, talking to Times of India, said the launch of India's first solar mission Aditya L1 is targeted by mid-2020. He further stated that ISRO is targeting a test flight under India's first human space mission Gaganyaan and over 10 satellite missions next year. ISRO could also test out its reusable launch vehicle (RLV) in 2020.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: New 'titi' monkey species found, was wrongly classified in 1914
text: Researchers have confirmed a new species of 'titi' monkeys after their re-discovery on a plateau in southwestern Brazil. They were first noticed by scientists in 1914 but were mistakenly thought to be ashy black titi monkeys. The discovery was initially made by Mariluce Messias of the Federal University of Rondônia, who began studying titi monkeys in the region in 2011.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Colonialism in Africa a 'grave mistake': French President Macron
text: French President Emmanuel Macron, who visited Ivory Coast on Saturday, said that colonialism in Africa was "a grave mistake" and a "fault of the (French) republic". He called for "turning the page" on the past. Macron also called on young people of Africa to "build a new partnership of friendship with France".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Govt and even banks approached us to save Jet Airways: Gopichand Hinduja
text: Hinduja Group Co-Chairman Gopichand Hinduja has said the reason why his group took interest in Jet Airways was because the government and even the banks approached them to save it. "Why did we back out? Because NCLT wasn't giving us protection from past problems. We said we need a clean chit," said Ashok Hinduja, Chairman of the group's India operations.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Haven't allowed Priyanka to portray me in biopic: Ma Anand Sheela
text: Ma Anand Sheela, the late spiritual leader Osho's former aide, said she didn't choose Priyanka Chopra to portray her in an upcoming film based on her. "I don't give her [my] permission," Sheela said, adding that she has also sent Priyanka a legal notice via email. When asked if she has heard back from the actress, she said, "No, never."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Kareena is not a fashion victim, she's classic and glamorous: Rhea
text: Rhea Kapoor, while talking about styling Kareena Kapoor, said that her outfits should never overpower her because she has an "expressive face with bold features". "It's her face that should do the talking," she added. "Kareena is not a fashion victim, she's classic, glamorous and beautiful and the...brief I follow for her...is that she's...a movie star," Rhea further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Forced myself to gag, drank mud before 'The Lighthouse' scenes: Robert
text: Actor Robert Pattinson has revealed that to maximise creativity, he used to punch himself in the face, or drink mud, or force himself to gag before scenes for 'The Lighthouse'. He explained that he doesn't "really know how to act" and did it to make his acting seem "real". "[I]f you shake up your physical state...You...[walk] into...scene having...different...feeling," Robert added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Huge crowd shows people support CAA: JP Nadda at Kolkata rally
text: BJP Working President JP Nadda on Monday led the rally in West Bengal's Kolkata in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "Huge crowd here shows people are in support of the Citizenship Act. West Bengal CM (Mamata Banerjee) is just doing vote-bank politics by opposing the Act," he said. "She should...understand that people have rejected vote-bank politics," Nadda added.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Rohit Sharma to take break, set to miss Sri Lanka series: Report
text: India's vice-captain in the limited-overs formats, Rohit Sharma has reportedly asked for a break from the upcoming T20I series against Sri Lanka. India will play Sri Lanka in 3 T20 internationals from January 5, 2020 to January 10, 2020. Rohit is expected to be back for the ODI series against Australia later in the year.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: De Gea lets ball slip through hands as Utd lose 0-2 to Watford
text: Manchester United on Sunday lost to Premier League bottom side Watford 0-2 to register their fifth defeat of the season. United goalkeeper David de Gea placed Watford in the front in the 50th minute when he let the ball slip through his hands into the post. Four minutes later Troy Deeney doubled the lead after Aaron Wan-Bissaka earned a penalty.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Lazio beat Juventus 3-1 to win Italian Super Cup for the 5th time
text: Coppa Italia winners Lazio on Sunday defeated Serie A champions Juventus 3-1 to win the Italian Super Cup. While Juventus' Paulo Dybala scored the equaliser in 45th minute after Luis Alberto's 16th minute goal, Senad Lulic and Danilo Cataldi scored to help Lazio lift the title for the fifth time. "We did something magical tonight," said Lazio coach Simone Inzaghi.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Pak beat Sri Lanka by 263 runs in Karachi Test to win series 1-0
text: Pakistan on Monday defeated Sri Lanka by 263 runs to win their second and final Test match against Sri Lanka. With the 16-year-old Pakistan pacer Naseem Shah picking five wickets in Sri Lanka's second innings, the hosts dismissed the visitors on 212. Pakistan's top-four batsmen had scored hundreds in their second innings to post a target of 476 runs. n
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Austria has a park that submerges underwater during summer, turns into lake
text: The 'Grüner See' or 'Green Lake' is a park located in Austria which submerges underwater from late spring through early summer. The park's lake, which only spans 21,500 square feet during late summer, autumn and winter, widens to cover almost double the area when the ice melts. Submerging the park benches and pathways, the lake can run 40 feet deep.
author: Dharna

headlines: Any fool can raise startup's  valuation by pumping in cash: Investor Rekhi
text: Commenting on sustainable business models for startups, Silicon Valley-based entrepreneur and investor Kanwal Rekhi said "any fool could raise a company's valuation" by pumping in cash. He added many startups like OYO and Paytm with increasing valuations weren't running a profitable business. Rekhi also said he could never tell which entrepreneur would succeed but he can usually tell who wouldn't.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: New Zealand volcano eruption death toll rises to 19
text: The death toll in the volcano eruption on New Zealand's White Island rose to 19 after one more person died in the hospital, the local police said. Two people, included in the death toll, are still missing and presumed dead while a search for their bodies continues. Most of the victims in the volcanic eruption were tourists visiting the island.
author: Shailesh

headlines: US blocked Ukraine aid 90 mins after Trump's call to Zelenskyy: Docs
text: US officials moved to freeze around $400 million aid to Ukraine around 90 minutes after a phone conversation between US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, government documents showed. The documents were obtained by the Center for Public Integrity in a Freedom of Information Act case. Trump had urged Zelenskyy to investigate ex-US Vice President Joe Biden.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Pak denies permission to Maryam Nawaz to travel abroad: Report
text: Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) Vice President Maryam Nawaz was reportedly denied permission to travel abroad by the Pakistan government. The daughter of ex-PM Nawaz Sharif was denied permission as those involved in economic crime and institutional fraud could not be allowed to leave the country, a senior lawyer said. "Government's decision to bar Maryam...didn't surprise anyone," PML-N said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Fashion designer Emanuel Ungaro passes away at 86
text: French fashion designer Emanuel Ungaro passed away in Paris on Saturday at the age of 86. Ungaro, who was known for his use of "vibrant colour, mixed prints and elegant draping", designed clothes for celebrities like Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, Gena Rowlands and Catherine Deneuve. Condoling his death, his fashion house wrote on Instagram, "He'll stay in our memories as...master of...flamboyance."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: ArcelorMittal to sell 50% stake in shipping business to trim debt
text: World's largest steelmaker ArcelorMittal has agreed to sell a 50% stake in its shipping business to DryLog, a subsidiary of Greek shipping company Ceres. The unit, named Global Chartering Ltd (GCL), currently operates 28 dry cargo vessels and will continue to handle some of ArcelorMittal's shipments. The sale will help the company cut its $10.7-billion debt by $530 million.
author: Dharna

headlines: JMM overtakes BJP as single largest party in trends in Jharkhand polls
text: Trends in the counting of votes show Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) leading in 29 seats in Jharkhand, overtaking BJP as the single largest party that is currently leading in 23 seats. JMM has formed an alliance with Congress and RJD in the state and their alliance is leading in a total of 47 seats in the 81-member state Assembly.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Saudi sentences 5 to death over journalist's murder in its embassy in Turkey
text: A Saudi court has sentenced five to death over the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi in the country's consulate in Istanbul, Turkey. The court also handed jail terms totalling 24 years to three others. An investigation by UN Special Rapporteur Agnes Callamard had concluded that Khashoggi's death "constituted an extrajudicial killing for which Saudi Arabia is responsible".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 'Hum kaagaz nahi dikhayenge': Varun Grover's anti-NRC poem goes viral
text: National Award-winning lyricist and comedian Varun Grover shared a video of himself reciting a poem he wrote opposing the National Register of Citizens (NRC). "Inspired by the spirit of every protestor and India-lover," Grover captioned the video, titled "Hum kaagaz nahi dikhayenge" (The NRC papers, we won't show). The viral video was also shared by Shashi Tharoor and Sitaram Yechury.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Man shares Siddharth's pic claiming he's 'groping 15-yr-old'; actor replies
text: Actor Siddharth has criticised a man, claiming to be a BJP IT cell member, after he posted a picture of Siddharth and tweeted that the actor is "groping" a woman who is "barely 15". This comes after Siddharth took part in a protest against CAA. "This is targeted harassment. Even in harassment, the BJP shows their true colours," wrote Siddharth.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: CAA being opposed by illiterate, puncturewalas: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya
text: Karnataka BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Sunday said most of the people protesting the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) are people who own puncture repair shops on the footpath and illiterates. Tejasvi made the comments at a pro-CAA rally in Town Hall, Bengaluru. "People supporting this Act are from IT and banking sectors who contribute to the nation's economy," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: UP Police issues 'wanted' posters of anti-CAA 'rioters' in Meerut
text: Uttar Pradesh Police on Monday issued posters with pictures of the 'wanted rioters' who led the violence in Meerut during an anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protest. The posters also stated that people who provide information that will lead to arrests will be rewarded. Police said that more than 100 rioters have been identified through videos and CCTV footage.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Former J'khand CM Hemant Soren leading from both Dumka and Barhait
text: JMM leader and former Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren is leading from both Dumka and Barhait seats, indicated trends in counting of votes in Assembly polls on Monday. From Barhait, Soren led by 11,668 votes and from Dumka he was ahead by 2,750 votes by 2 pm. Soren is the chief ministerial candidate of JMM-Congress-RJD for Jharkhand Assembly elections 2019.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Cricket Australia reveal their Test XI of the decade, name Virat Kohli as captain
text: Cricket Australia have named their Test XI of the decade (2010s), naming Team India captain Virat Kohli as the skipper of the side. While Kohli is the only Indian in the XI, the side has three Australian and four English cricketers. Former South Africa captain AB de Villiers has been named as the wicketkeeper of the side.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I could win against J'khand CM Raghubar Das by 30,000 votes: Saryu Roy
