text: Former BJP leader and independent candidate from Jamshedpur East in the Jharkhand Assembly elections, Saryu Roy on Monday said that he could win against Chief Minister Raghubar Das by a margin of 30,000 votes. He said, "Lead of about 1,500-2,000 will continue in the coming rounds of counting." Roy is leading against Das by about 6,000 votes currently.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: WB Guv not able to get out of car amid protest at Jadavpur University
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was shown black flags and posters of 'BJP Activist Mr Jagdeep Dhankhar Go Back' by students on his arrival at Jadavpur University for the convocation ceremony on Monday. Dhankhar was not able to get out of his car amid the protesting students. Several Left student bodies have alleged that Governor acts as a BJP spokesperson.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: People of Jharkhand shattered arrogance of Modi ji, Amit Shah: NCP
text: As trends for the Jharkhand Assembly elections showed the Congress-JMM-RJD alliance ahead of the ruling BJP, NCP Spokesperson Nawab Malik tweeted, "The people of Jharkhand shattered the arrogance of Modi ji, Amit Shah and BJP. Democracy has won." The latest trends show that JMM, which is leading in 28 seats, has overtaken the BJP as the single largest party.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 1st result of Jharkhand Assembly polls out, BJP's Koche Munda wins
text: The first result of the Jharkhand Assembly elections has come out with BJP leader Koche Munda winning from Torpa constituency. Munda defeated Jharkhand Mukti Morcha leader Sudeep Guria by a margin of 9,630 votes. JMM's Paulus Surin won from Torpa in 2014 elections. As per the latest trends, JMM is leading in 29 seats while BJP leads in 25 seats.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: UltraTech in lead to buy Emami Cement for ₹7,000 crore: Reports
text: India's largest cement producer UltraTech Cement has emerged as the frontrunner to buy Emami Cement in an all-cash deal worth up to ₹7,000 crore in the final binding bid round, according to reports. Ambuja Cement, part of Switzerland's LafargeHolcim, is reportedly the only other contender. UltraTech recently completed the acquisition of Century Textiles' cement business.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: No one will leave this country: Rapper Raftaar on CAA
text: Rapper Raftaar criticised the Citizenship (Amendment) Act during his performance in Mumbai and said, "Today I'm being asked my religion to stay in this country." "You can't ask...my religion when I come on stage to perform," he added. "Everyone is like my brother and sister. And I am standing with them. No one will leave this country," Raftaar further said. n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: 'Badhaai Ho' wouldn't have worked without Ayushmann, Sanya: Neena
text: Neena Gupta, who played Ayushmann Khurrana's mother in 'Badhaai Ho', has said one needs youngsters for box office numbers even if the film is about older people. She added 'Badhaai Ho' wouldn't have worked if it didn't feature Ayushmann and Sanya Malhotra. "[If it] was made only with Gajraj (Rao) and me, it wouldn't have run at all," Neena said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: 15 detained during Daryaganj anti-CAA protest denied bail
text: 15 people who were detained in connection with violence during anti-CAA protest in Delhi's Daryaganj were denied bail on Monday. A Delhi Court dismissed bail pleas of all the accused who were detained by the police on Friday. They were sent to two-day judicial custody on Saturday. The detainees include carpenters, daily-wage labourers and people who went for Friday prayers.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Are EVMs working fine or not: BJP mocks Cong amid J'khand vote counting
text: Amid counting of votes for Jharkhand Assembly elections, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Monday mocked Congress, saying that they need to examine if the EVMs were working fine or not. "I have seen elections where it was found that EVMs were faulty," Bhatia jokingly said. "After the results, we will analyse what needs to be done better," he also said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Jharkhand results defeat of BJP's arrogance: Congress' RPN Singh
text: With the trends showing Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM)-Congress-RJD alliance crossing the majority mark in the 81-member Jharkhand Assembly, Congress committee in-charge for the state RPN Singh has said, "Results are a defeat of BJP's arrogance and diversionary tactics". Singh added that JMM's Hemant Soren will be next CM. Notably, BJP's incumbent CM Raghubar Das is trailing in his constituency.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Willian scores brace as Chelsea beat Spurs and go to 4th place
text: Brazilian footballer Willian scored a brace to help Chelsea beat Tottenham 2-0 and move to the fourth place in the Premier League table on Sunday. Willian scored first in the 12th minute with a curling effort into the goal's corner before scoring the next goal with a penalty strike in the first half's added time.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Jadeja’s improvement with bat so important: Sourav Ganguly
text: After Ravindra Jadeja helped India win the series-decider against the West Indies, BCCI head Sourav Ganguly praised him, tweeting, "[G]ood performances with the bat in a pressure game. Jadeja's improvement with the bat so important." In the year 2019, Jadeja scored 693 runs across all the three formats with six half-centuries to his name.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Have thanked PL for their match scheduling: Guardiola
text: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that he wrote to the Premier League to thank them for for City's schedule over the festive period with two matches set to be played in less than 48 hours. "When a team has 16 victories from 17, it's unrealistic to think we're going to chase them," Guardiola said about chasing Liverpool.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: SoftBank's $9.5 bn WeWork rescue faces hurdles in Japan: Report
text: Masayoshi Son-led SoftBank's $9.5-billion rescue deal for office-sharing startup WeWork is facing hurdles as talks to secure $3 billion from Japan's three biggest banks have stalled, Reuters reported. The lenders have reportedly hit internal lending limits to both the firms. The $9.5-billion deal was offered after WeWork withdrew its Initial Public Offering over corporate governance issues.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Swiggy has a 60% revenue market share in food delivery, claims CEO
text: Swiggy Co-founder and CEO Sriharsha Majety, in an interview with Times of India, claimed Swiggy has a 60% revenue share in the online Indian food delivery market, higher than rest of the players combined. On Swiggy's $47-million burn rate till September, Majety said the mere five-year-old business won't cut spending prematurely, as it had just started investing in adjacent segments.
author: Dharna

headlines: Amazon sellers buying fake 5-star reviews for ₹1,200 each: Report
text: Several marketing companies are selling four and five-star reviews to Amazon sellers for £13 (₹1,200) each, reported the Daily Mail. The fake but seemingly trustworthy reviews reportedly helped sellers get their listings to the top and lure millions into buying their products. The reviewers employed by these firms buy the products first to get ratings labelled as "Amazon Verified Purchases".
author: Dharna

headlines: 11 dead, over 300 treated in Philippines after drinking coconut wine
text: At least 11 people have died and over 300 people were being treated in hospital after they consumed coconut wine, lambanog, in Laguna and Quezon provinces in the Philippines. A Philippine General Hospital spokesperson said lambanog sometimes contains "too much" methanol, which is produced during its fermentation. Unregulated production and sale of the wine are common in the country.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Govt declines to share details of Indians' Swiss bank accounts
text: The Finance Ministry has declined to share the details of Swiss bank accounts held by Indians in response to an RTI query asking for the same. It cited "confidentiality provisions" of a tax treaty signed between Switzerland and India as the reason for its refusal. The ministry also refused to disclose the information received from other countries on black money.n
author: Dharna

headlines: J&J baby powder did not cause woman's cancer, rules US court
text: A US court ruled that Johnson & Johnson's Baby Powder did not cause a woman's ovarian cancer. This marks the company's fourth consecutive trial win this year, after winning a case last week. J&J, which claims the product doesn't contain cancer-causing asbestos, faces over 16,000 lawsuits, with most women claiming they developed cancer after using the talc for genital hygiene.
author: Dharna

headlines: 74-yr-old Surekha arrives in wheelchair to receive National Award for Badhaai Ho
text: Veteran actress Surekha Sikri arrived in a wheelchair at the 66th National Film Award ceremony held in Delhi on Monday. A picture shows her receiving the Best Supporting Actress award for her role in the film 'Badhaai Ho' from Vice President Venkaiah Naidu. The 74-year-old actress also received a standing ovation at the award ceremony.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: My son was almost 12, knew what was happening: Arbaaz on separating from Malaika
text: Talking about breaking the news of separating from Malaika Arora, Arbaaz Khan said their son, Arhaan, was almost 12 then and had a fair understanding of what was happening. Arbaaz added he was fine with Malaika getting Arhaan's custody, stating, "I felt when...child is younger, he needs...mother." "He'll soon...be 18...will make...his mind where he wants to be," Arbaaz added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: 7-inch bottle gets stuck in Chinese man's bottom while using it to scratch itch
text: Doctors have removed a seven-inch-long glass bottle from 60-year-old Chinese man's rectum after he accidentally inserted it into himself. The man told the medics that he was using the bottle to scratch an itch on his backside when it got inserted. The hospital authorities said the bottle under the abdomen could be felt from outside and shared its scan.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Each telco loses ₹1.5 cr daily in states facing internet shutdown: COAI
text: Telecom operators are each losing at least ₹1.5 crore per day in every state that faces internet shutdowns over anti-CAA protests, lobby group COAI told the Economic Times. A telecom executive said that with services being stalled, prepaid consumers delay recharges for bundled plans and avoid smaller top-ups, which hurts revenues. COAI represents companies like Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel.
author: Dharna

headlines: Jharkhand CM trails former BJP leader in Jamshedpur (East) seat
text: Trends during the counting of votes for Jharkhand Assembly elections show Jharkhand CM and BJP candidate Raghubar Das trailing from Jamshedpur (East) constituency. Meanwhile, former BJP leader Saryu Roy is leading from the seat. Saryu had contested and won from Jamshedpur (West) seat on BJP ticket in 2014 Assembly polls, while Das won from the Jamshedpur (East) constituency.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: GoAir cancels 18 domestic flights, blames anti-CAA protests & crew crunch
text: GoAir cancelled 18 domestic flights from Mumbai, Goa, Bengaluru, Delhi, Srinagar, Patna, Indore and Kolkata on Monday. GoAir said that the disruption in services was on account of protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) coupled with the duty norms of the operating crew. Reports citing sources claimed that GoAir also reported a series of incidents involving engine glitches.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Made a mistake coming to Delhi: Jamia student who lost eyesight in police action
text: Mohammad Minhajuddin, a law student at Jamia who lost sight in his left eye after he was allegedly beaten up by police, said, "I didn't know Delhi is such an unsafe city. I made a mistake coming here for studies." "What was my fault? I was studying in the old library...We had locked it... but [police] barged inside," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Show you're Indian: Rahul urges youth to join him at Rajghat protest
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday urged youth to join him at Rajghat at 3 pm to protest against the "hate and violence unleashed by Modi-Shah". He tweeted, "Dear Students and Youth, It's not good enough just to feel Indian. At times like these, it's critical to show that you're Indian and won't allow India to be destroyed by hatred."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Video of Mamata Banerjee raising 'CAA CAA Chi Chi' slogans goes viral
text: A video has gone viral on social media, showing West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee raising 'CAA CAA Chi Chi' slogans against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 during a rally last week. The CM also goes on to say 'NRC Chi Chi' and several leaders on the stage can be seen repeating after her in the video.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Calcutta HC asks WB govt to remove all anti-CAA, NRC ads from public platforms
text: The Calcutta High Court today directed West Bengal government to remove all anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and anti-National Register of Citizens (NRC) advertisements from public platforms. The directive is an interim order till the court hears the plea next on January 9. The state government had published ads which said NRC and CAA will not be implemented in the state.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pak pacer gifts BBL match ball to Indian guard who got emotional on meeting him
text: After taking a five-wicket haul for Melbourne Stars against Hobart Hurricanes in BBL, Pakistani fast bowler Haris Rauf gifted his match ball to an Indian Punjabi security guard. Rauf revealed that the guard cried and hugged him ahead of the match after he told him he was from Pakistan. The 26-year-old fast bowler registered figures of 4-0-27-5 in the match.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Amazon's second employee says the company should be broken up
text: A programmer hired by Amazon in 1994 as its second employee called for the world's richest person Jeff Bezos-led company to be broken up. Paul Davis told Recode that Amazon should be forced to separate Amazon Marketplace, where third-party merchants sell goods, from its own retail business. Davis alleged Amazon uses its control over Marketplace to benefit its retail business.
author: Dharna

headlines: Smallest 'gingerbread' house built, 10 times tinier than human hair
text: A Canadian microscope specialist from McMaster University carved world's smallest 'gingerbread' house, 10 times less wide than human hair, on top of a "teeny-tiny snowman". The house, which even features engraved text, is about half the size of the one built last year in France. The house was carved using a beam of charged gallium ions and an electron microscope.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: ₹10 lakh each to the deceased in cloth godown fire in Delhi: Govt
text: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Monday said that a compensation of ₹10 lakh each will be given to the deceased in the cloth godown fire in Delhi's Kirari area. Apart from that, ₹1 lakh each will also be given to those injured in the fire, he added. "Injured will be treated on government expenses," Jain further said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Bengaluru man claims his dog 'Samsung' worth ₹8 cr stolen, offers ₹1L reward
text: A man in Bengaluru has filed a police complaint alleging that his three-year-old pet dog 'Samsung', who is of Alaskan Malamute breed, has been stolen. The owner claimed that his dog is worth ₹8 crore. He has also announced ₹1 lakh cash prize to anyone who finds his dog. He had imported the dog from China two years ago.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Have problem in my spinal cord, paid extra for seat 1A: Pragya on SpiceJet row
text: Pragya Thakur has demanded an investigation into the incident where SpiceJet refused the wheelchair-bound BJP MP her pre-booked seat 1A. "I have a problem in my spinal cord & was allotted seat 1A which has leg space...I even paid extra for it," Thakur said. SpiceJet, however, reasoned that 1A was an emergency seat that is not allotted to wheelchair-bound persons.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 19-yr-old girl suffers back pain for 2 years, doctors find bullet in her back
text: Doctors at Nizam's Institute Of Medical Sciences in Hyderabad removed a bullet from the body of a 19-year-old girl. The girl underwent surgery after she approached doctors and claimed she had severe back pain for the last two years. The police said the woman sought treatment after her pain became unbearable. She did not share information with anybody, police added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Over 60 vehicles crash into each other on US highway amid fog
text: More than 60 vehicles crashed into each other on a highway in the US state of Virginia amid fog on Sunday. There were no reports of fatalities in the crash on Interstate 64 near Williamsburg but more than 50 people were injured. Police said that the fog, combined with icy conditions, would have been factors.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Boy who went missing 2 years ago found in wardrobe of suspected paedophile
text: A boy who went missing over two years ago was found in a wardrobe when police raided the flat of a suspected paedophile in Germany. The boy, named by German newspapers as Marvin K, was found in the same clothes that he went missing in. Police said that there were no signs that Marvin had been held by force.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Nearly 67% of imported toys in Delhi-NCR fail testing survey of QCI
text: Nearly 67% of imported toys failed the testing survey of the Quality Council of India (QCI) and only 33.10% passed all the tests. The testing was conducted by the QCI on toys available in the markets of Delhi and NCR. As many as 121 different varieties were procured and submitted to laboratories to carry out all the tests.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries loses over $2 bn m-cap as shares fall 3%
text: Reliance Industries Ltd shares on Monday fell almost 3%, erasing over $2 billion of its market value. This comes amid the possibility of the Mukesh Ambani-led company disclosing its assets before it freezes plans to sell 20% stake in its refining and petrochemicals business to Saudi Aramco. Delhi HC has reportedly asked RIL and British Gas to disclose their assets.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Producers cut 9 mins of 'Dabangg 3' on 2nd day of its release
text: 'Dabangg 3' producers trimmed around nine minutes of the film on the second day of its release, about eight minutes of which were reportedly from the pre-interval sequence as "viewers had issues with it being too long". "As for...second half...few scenes [were] shortened," a report said. A song and few comedy scenes were reportedly removed and another song was trimmed.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Big B to be honoured with Dadasaheb Phalke Award on Dec 29
text: Amitabh Bachchan, who skipped the 66th National Film Awards ceremony on Monday due to fever, will now be presented with his Dadasaheb Phalke Award on December 29, Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar said. President Ram Nath Kovind will host a high-tea for all the National Award winners at the Rashtrapati Bhavan where Bachchan will be presented with the award.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kareena is like wine that gets better with every passing year: Akshay
text: On being asked about his assessment of Kareena Kapoor's rise as an actor, Akshay Kumar said she's like wine which gets better with every passing year. Akshay, who'll be seen alongside Kareena in 'Good Newwz', further said the way she looks, she can never do "typical maa ke roles". "[She] has played roles on her...terms. She's always been...risk-taker," he added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Ayushmann, Vicky get Best Actor National Award; Keerthy Best Actress
text: Ayushmann Khurrana and Vicky Kaushal shared the Best Actor Award, while Keerthy Suresh won the Best Actress Award at the 66th National Film Awards. The actors won the award for their respective roles in  'Andhadhun', 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' and 'Mahanati'. The ceremony was held in New Delhi on Monday and the awards were distributed by Vice President Venkaiah Naidu.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Oppn used NRC, CAA to confuse J'khand voters: Former CM Arjun Munda
text: BJP leader and former Jharkhand CM Arjun Munda on Monday said that the opposition parties have used NRC and Citizenship (Amendment) Act to create confusion among the voters in Jharkhand. If someone does politics by creating confusion then it is not acceptable, Munda further said. Trends in the counting show BJP leading on 29 seats in Jharkhand.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: PM Modi no lesser than God for the persecuted: Shivraj Singh
text: BJP leader Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday compared PM Narendra Modi with God for enabling citizenship to persecuted minorities from Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh through the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "God gave you life, mother gave you birth but Narendra Modiji, you gave them a new life, respect and dignity," Chouhan added. His statement comes amid nationwide protests against the CAA.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das leads in Jamshedpur (East) Assembly seat
text: Early trends in the counting of votes on Monday show Jharkhand Chief Minister and BJP candidate Raghubar Das is leading in Jamshedpur (East) seat in the state Assembly elections. Das is the first Jharkhand CM to complete his five-year term since the state's formation. Meanwhile, Congress-JMM-RJD alliance is leading in 41 seats and BJP in 29 seats.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Trends show Congress-JMM-RJD alliance crossing halfway mark in Jharkhand
text: In the 81-member Jharkhand state Assembly, the trends show JMM-Congress-RJD alliance leading on 43 seats, crossing the halfway mark. The BJP is seen leading on 27 seats while the All Jharkhand Students Union (AJSU) Party is seen leading on three seats. According to the trends, Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (Prajatantrik) is leading on four seats.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Ranbir suffers injury while playing football, left with a bleeding lip
text: A video that has surfaced online shows actor Ranbir Kapoor left with a bleeding lip after injuring himself while playing football on Sunday. In the video, a photographer can be heard saying, "Thoda sa lag gaya hai", to which Ranbir replies, "Thoda nahi yaar, bohot." The actor was also seen taking selfies with his fans despite the injury.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Going off social media: Jaaved Jaaferi after being trolled over anti-CAA stance
text: After being trolled over his stance against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, actor Jaaved Jaaferi tweeted, "Can't handle this trolling and hate.. going off social media till the situation improves.. hopefully..Inshallaah..#indiafirst #jaihind." Earlier, a video showing Jaaferi calling the Act "very dangerous and very communal" went viral on social media. He also called it a "very big game".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Video shows police in UP breaking CCTV cameras after 1 am
text: A CCTV footage purportedly showing policemen breaking CCTV cameras in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar after anti-CAA protests has surfaced online. The footage was recorded on December 21 after 1 am, showing some policemen entering a building and one of them breaking CCTV cameras, following which the one that was recording the video goes blank. Locals claimed police vandalised their properties.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: We're not only winning but also forming BJP govt: Jharkhand CM
text: Amid counting of votes for the Jharkhand Assembly elections, CM and BJP candidate Raghubar Das said, "Let me clearly state that we're not only winning but we'll also form government under the leadership of BJP in the state." Meanwhile, the trends show Congress-JMM-RJD alliance leading in 42 seats and BJP in 28. Das is leading from Jamshedpur (East) constituency.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Heard screams all night in police facility: 74-yr-old UP man detained in protest
text: A 74-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar claimed he was detained by police amid anti-CAA protests on Friday after they smashed his vehicle and entered his home. "I can barely even walk...I was detained in a police facility, and I heard screams from different rooms all night. It was horrific," he added. The man said he was released on Sunday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Hemant Soren is going to be the CM of Jharkhand: RJD's Tejashwi Yadav
text: Amid the counting of votes for the 81-seat Jharkhand Assembly, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said that there is going to be a clean sweep for Congress-JMM-RJD Mahagathbandhan (grand alliance). "We have fought elections under the leadership of JMM's Hemant Soren. He is going to be the Chief Minister," Tejaswi added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Harsha responds to trolls criticising him for interviewing Jadeja in Hindi
text: Commentator Harsha Bhogle took to Twitter to respond to trolls who criticised him for interviewing all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja in Hindi. "In a post-match presentation...you always go in language...the player is most comfortable in. I've known Jadeja for 10 years now and so began in his language. The moment he indicated he was good to go in English...I shifted," Harsha wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Tula maanla re Thakur: Kohli praises Shardul in Marathi for helping India win
text: India captain Virat Kohli took to social media to share a picture of himself with fast bowler Shardul Thakur, who slammed an unbeaten 17 off six deliveries to help India win the third ODI against West Indies. "Tula maanla re Thakur (Maan gaye tujhe, Thakur)," Kohli wrote alongside the picture. India won the three-match ODI series against West Indies 2-1.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: US accuses 'ToTok' app of spying for UAE; Apple, Google remove it
text: US intelligence officials, speaking to the New York Times on Sunday, accused social messaging app 'ToTok' of being a spying tool used by the United Arab Emirates. Google removed the app saying that it violated unnamed policies, while Apple removed it saying that it was still researching it. "Uninstall it yesterday," a former National Security Agency security researcher warned users.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 3 sentenced for running 'GozNym' crime network to steal ₹711 crore
text: The US and Georgia sentenced three members of an online crime network which used the 'GozNym' malware to steal over $100 million (₹711 crore). The network operated for years, using GozNym to compromise over 41,000 computers and swipe money from targets' bank accounts. One of the accused was arrested by Bulgarian authorities and extradited to the US in December 2016.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Media firm gets no interview with Zuckerberg, builds a 'Zuckerbot'
text: Claiming it failed to get an interview with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, a media firm built a 'Zuckerbot' to question it. The Guardian fed three years of Zuckerberg interviews, speeches, blogs and testimony into an algorithm. When questioned about Zuckerberg's 'secret dinner' with Donald Trump, Zuckerbot answered, "I'm going to say quiet words in your face...like I did with him."
author: Dharna

headlines: Learnt importance of risk-taking from Elon Musk, says OYO Founder
text: India's most-valuable budget-hospitality startup OYO's 26-year-old Founder and CEO Ritesh Agarwal, while talking about books that helped him strategise and plan his business, said, "I learnt the importance of risk-taking from Elon Musk." He added that he admires the Tesla and SpaceX CEO's "innovative mindset" a lot. Agarwal further said PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel is someone he looks up to.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: You have no shame: Passenger to BJP MP Pragya over flight delay; video surfaces
text: A video shows passengers arguing with BJP MP Pragya Thakur over flight delay. In the video a male passenger can be heard telling Thakur, "Even if one person is getting troubled because of you, you should own up because you are a leader...You have no shame." The flight got delayed after Pragya refused to move to a non-emergency row seat.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 18 Indians kidnapped by pirates from Hong Kong-flagged vessel released
text: Eighteen Indians, who were kidnapped by pirates from a Hong Kong-flagged vessel near the Nigerian coast, have been released, the High Commission of India in Nigeria has said. "Thank all stake holders involved in their safe release," the High Commission of India tweeted. The vessel was attacked during the evening hours of December 3.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Amitabh Bachchan to miss National Awards ceremony due to fever
text: Amitabh Bachchan on Sunday said that since he is "down with fever" and "not allowed to travel", he will not be able to attend the 66th National Film Awards ceremony in New Delhi. He called his circumstances "unfortunate" and expressed regrets. Bachchan, who has completed 50 years in Bollywood, was supposed to receive the 50th Dadasaheb Phalke Award on Monday.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Cinema was created for crime genre, it's very cinematic genre: Anurag
text: Anurag Kashyap, known for directing films like 'Gangs of Wasseypur' and 'Raman Raghav 2.0', has said cinema was created for the crime genre, adding, "It's...very cinematic genre." Anurag added he's been fascinated with this genre since childhood. "I've grown up reading Manohar Kahaniya. I read everything of Ved Prakash Sharma, Surender Mohan Pathak...by the time I was 14," he said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Hilary Duff marries Matthew Koma in a private ceremony; shares 1st pic
text: American actress Hilary Duff, who married singer-songwriter Matthew Koma on Saturday, has shared the first picture from her wedding. Their wedding ceremony was reportedly a small and low-key event with attendance from only family and close friends and took place in their Beverly Hills home's garden. The couple, who got engaged in May this year, has a one-year-old daughter together.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Anti-CAA protests more important than Dabangg 3: Sonakshi Sinha
text: Sonakshi Sinha has said the protests happening against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act are more important than her recent release, 'Dabangg 3'. "I feel the way people are protesting...you can't snatch that right from them," she added. Talking about celebrities who've refrained from commenting on CAA, Sonakshi said, "Whoever wants to voice (an opinion) will voice...whoever doesn't...will not."n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Bengaluru youth returning from pro-CAA rally beaten; hospitalised
text: A youth was allegedly assaulted by unknown persons in Bengaluru when he was returning from a demonstration in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act on Sunday. The victim, identified as Varun, has suffered multiple injuries and a skull fracture but is reported to be in a stable condition. Bengaluru South MP Tejasvi Surya visited Varun in the hospital.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Drones to be used to monitor DMK's anti-CAA rally in Chennai
text: The Madras High Court has passed an interim order asking police to use drones to monitor the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam's (DMK) rally against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in Chennai. The court was hearing a public interest litigation asking it to pass an order to stop the rally, scheduled for Monday despite being denied permission by the police.
author: Dharna

headlines: Former J'khand CM Hemant Soren leads from Barhait, trails from Dumka
text: Trends in the counting of votes for Jharkhand Assembly elections are showing former CM and JMM leader Hemant Soren leading from Barhait over BJP's Simon Malto by 664 votes. Soren, however, is trailing from Dumka seat by 6,329 votes. Earlier today, posters stating, "Jharkhand ki pukar hai, gathbandhan ki sarkar hai. Hemant ab ki baar hai," were spotted in Ranchi.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Results not as per our expectation: JVM(P) candidate Babulal Marandi
text: Amid the counting of votes in Jharkhand, the Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (Prajatantrik) candidate Babulal Marandi on Monday said that the results (according to the trends) are not as per their expectation. "We will have to accept people's mandate. We'll play the role which people's mandate has given us," he added. According to the trends, JVM(P) is leading on four seats.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Former Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren leads from Dumka constituency
text: JMM leader and former Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren is leading over state Welfare (Women and Child Development and Minority Affairs) Minister Lois Marandi after counting of postal ballots in Dumka seat. Soren is also contesting from the Barhait seat. Early trends in the counting show Congress-JMM-RJD alliance leading in 40 seats in the 81-member Jharkhand Assembly.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: RIL contests govt's move to stop asset sale, says no final award due
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) has countered the government's attempt to stop the firm from selling its assets to Saudi Aramco, saying the petition was "an abuse of process". The government had asked it to honour a $4.5-billion arbitration award in the Panna-Mukta and Tapti production-sharing contracts case. RIL said the arbitration tribunal had not ordered any payment yet.
author: Dharna

headlines: Sensex falls 50 points in early trade, Nifty holds 12,200
text: Indian equity benchmark index Sensex fell by more than 50 points in early trade on Monday to 41,630. The broader Nifty 50 index traded nearly ten points lower at 12,261. Among the worst stock performers were Reliance Industries, Nestle India and Bharti Airtel, while Axis Bank, Hero MotoCorp and Maruti Suzuki India were the top gainers.
author: Dharna

headlines: Early trends show Cong-JMM-RJD leading in 37 seats, BJP in 29 in Jharkhand
text: Early trends in the counting of votes showed Congress-JMM-RJD alliance leading in 37 seats, while BJP leading in 29 seats in the 81-member Jharkhand Assembly on Monday. The voting for the state elections were held in five phases from November 30 to December 20. A party or an alliance needs at least 41 seats to form the state government.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Counting of votes for 81 Jharkhand state Assembly seats begins
text: The counting of votes for the Jharkhand state Assembly has begun. Voting had taken place for the 81-member state Assembly in five phases from November 30 to December 20. Overall voter turnout in the Assembly poll was estimated at 65.23% compared to 66.53% in 2014. As many as 1,216 candidates including 127 women fought the state elections.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 9 dead in fire at Delhi cloth godown two weeks after a fire that killed 43
text: At least nine people have been killed and 10 others have been injured in a fire at a cloth godown in Delhi's Kirari area. The godown is situated on the ground floor of a four-storey building which has no fire equipment and single staircase. This comes two weeks after a fire at a factory in Delhi's Anaj Mandi killed 43.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Jaaved Jaaferi says CAA is a very big game; video goes viral
text: A video showing actor Jaaved Jaaferi speaking against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and calling it a "very big game" has gone viral on social media. "This Act is very dangerous and very communal. It's against everything mentioned in the Constitution," he says in the video. "You're telling one particular sect that you are excluded...How is that okay?" Jaaferi further says.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Actress Sadaf Jafar arrested and beaten by Lucknow police amid anti-CAA protest
text: 'A Suitable Boy' actress Sadaf Jafar was beaten and arrested by UP Police while protesting against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Director Mira Nair shared a report of Jafar's arrest on her official Twitter handle, demanding for her release. "This is our India now - Appalling: our #SuitableBoy actress, Sadaf Jafar, beaten and jailed for peaceful protest in Lucknow!" Nair wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: PM contradicting Home Minister publicly on nationwide NRC: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday tweeted, "With PM contradicting Home Minister publicly on nationwide NRC, who is dividing fundamental idea of India?" This comes after PM Narendra Modi said that his government did not discuss the National Register of Citizens in the Parliament or in Cabinet. Mamata said people will decide who is right and who is wrong.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Priyanka Gandhi meets families of 2 killed in UP over CAA clashes
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday visited Bijnor in Uttar Pradesh to meet the families of two people killed in clashes over the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). UP Congress chief Ajay Kumar Lallu said Priyanka also spoke with other residents. "No one has the authorisation to ask for the proof of Indian citizenship," said Priyanka Gandhi.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Who should we believe: Owaisi shares Shah's LS video after PM's NRC remark
text: After PM Narendra Modi said that his government has not discussed nationwide NRC, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi shared a video of Home Minister Amit Shah from Lok Sabha wherein he says, "NRC across India is inevitable." Owaisi added, "PM Modi, who is lying? If Amit Shah is wrong, then it is breach of Parliamentary Privilege....Who should we believe?"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: UP govt starts process to seize anti-CAA rioters' properties
text: Yogi Adityanath-led UP government has formed a four-member panel to assess damage to public and private property during anti-CAA protests in the state. The panel will identify trouble-makers and impose fines on them and if they fail to pay the fines, their properties will be confiscated. Adityanath said on Thursday that rioters' properties will be auctioned to compensate for losses.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: India to build 11 new supercomputers with indigenous processors
text: The Centre has approved the building and installation of 11 new supercomputers in research institutes across India under the next phase of the National Supercomputing Mission (NSM). The NSM is being implemented through Pune's Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) and Bengaluru's Indian Institute of Science (IISc). The 11 supercomputers will have processors designed by C-DAC.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Chennai woman alerts police of sexual harassment using Kavalan app; 3 held
text: Chennai Police on Saturday arrested three men on a bus for allegedly sexually harassing a woman and causing a public nuisance after the woman alerted police through 'Kavalan SOS' app. She was allegedly subjected to sexual harassment and taunts by two inebriated law graduates and their friend. The app is part of Tamil Nadu State Police Master Control Room initiative.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Posters with 'J'khand ki pukar hai, gathbandhan sarkar hai' seen in Ranchi
text: Amid the counting of votes for the Jharkhand state Assembly, posters stating "Jharkhand ki pukar hai, gathbandhan ki sarkar hai" were spotted in Ranchi. "Hemant ab ki baar hai," the posters also read referring to former CM and Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) leader Hemant Soren. Notably, early trends in the counting show Congress-JMM-RJD alliance crossing the halfway mark in Jharkhand.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: If Tesla & SpaceX go bankrupt, so will I; as it should be: Elon Musk
text: Tesla and SpaceX's founder and CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter and said that he looked at his "wiki" (Wikipedia page) for the first time in years, adding, "It's insane!" "Btw, can someone please delete 'investor'. I do basically zero investing," he added. "If Tesla & SpaceX go bankrupt, so will I. As it should be," the billionaire further said.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 8 fire engines bring fire at Mumbai building under control in 1 hour
text: As many as eight fire engines and six jumbo tankers brought the fire at a 13-storey building in Mumbai's Vile Parle West under control on Sunday evening. The fire erupted on the seventh and the eighth floors of the building around 7:10 pm and was brought under control in nearly an hour. At least four people were rescued by officers.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Doctors leave newborn's body inside mother's womb after head gets severed
text: Doctors at a hospital in Telangana's Nagarkurnool left the body of a foetus inside the mother's womb after the head was severed during delivery. The patient came to know about it at a hospital in Hyderabad where doctors found only baby's body inside her womb. The patient's relatives damaged furniture of the Nagarkurnool hospital after the incident came to light.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Didn't want name in IPL auction as nobody would've picked: Mushfiqur
text: After going unsold in the IPL 2020 auction, Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim said, "I didn't want to send my name at first because I thought no one is going to pick me." "But when they [IPL authorities] sent in the request, I thought there may be some chance this time... It is not a big issue for me," Rahim added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Won't play B'desh on neutral venue: Pakistan board writes to BCB
text: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has intimated the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) that it will not host the Bangladesh team on a neutral venue during the upcoming home series in January-February. PCB head Ehsan Mani has reportedly asked BCB to give acceptable reasons for refusing to send their team to Pakistan for the two Tests in January.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Samsung Electronics slips to 2nd spot in R&D spending, loses to Google
text: An European Union (EU) report placed Samsung Electronics second in terms of research and development (R&D) spending last year. The company, which had the top spot for the same in 2017, was second to Google. While Samsung had spent $16.4 billion in 2018, which was up 10% from a year earlier, Google spent nearly $20.3 billion on R&D.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Online platforms like WhatsApp don’t cooperate citing encryption: Govt
text: Government officials told a Rajya Sabha panel that online platforms like WhatsApp and Signal don't cooperate with law enforcement citing end-to-end encryption. The officials added the platforms failed to honour legal requisitions from them. The panel was probing the issue of availability of pornography on social media and its effects on children.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Fake 'Star Wars' websites, social media profiles stealing users' data
text: Kaspersky researchers have found over 30 fake websites and social media profiles parading as official movie accounts of 'Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker'. These fake accounts were distributing free copies of the latest film and collecting credit card data under the pretence of necessary registration. The firm detected 2,85,103 attempts to infect 37,772 users seeking to watch the movie.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Photo taken with a mobile phone to detect rice labelling frauds
text: Researchers from the Complutense University of Madrid and the Scintillon Institute of San Diego claim to have developed a model that detects irregularities in the labelling of rice through a photograph taken with a mobile phone. Algorithms based on convolutional neural networks to process the visual information for classification obtained final precision models between 93% to 99%.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: China's internet rules seek algorithms to promote 'positive' content
text: In its upcoming rules for internet content, the Chinese Cyberspace Administration has called for platform algorithms to promote "positive" content, including "the core values of socialism". Effective from March 1, the rules also forbid "bad" material that "endangers national security, leaks state secrets and subverts state power". Further curbs were placed on exaggerated titles and online rumours.
author: Dharna

headlines: Haryana govt to launch scheme to allow residents to provide homestays
text: Haryana Tourism Minister Kanwar Pal said on Saturday that a new scheme will allow residents to provide homestays to tourists. Saying that the government was still in the process of developing the scheme, Pal added that this was being done to give a boost to tourism in the state. He was speaking at the Pinjore Heritage Festival 2019.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Storms Elsa and Fabien leave 9 dead in Portugal, Spain
text: Death toll in storms Elsa and Fabien affecting France, Spain and Portugal has gone up to nine while the region braces for more heavy rains. Two people were killed in Portugal while seven were killed in Spain. Reportedly, 1,18,000 households were left without electricity in the region after the storms brought down power lines besides uprooting trees and disrupting travel.
author: Shailesh

headlines: France's Macron announces decision to give up presidential pension
text: French President Emmanuel Macron said that he will give up presidential pension of around €6,000 per month after he steps down, his office said. Macron is facing protests by French workers' unions against his plans to reform France's pension system into a universal points system. Macron has urged transport unions to suspend strikes during Christmas to facilitate travel.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 13 wounded in shooting at a memorial party in US: Police
text: The Chicago police said that 13 people were wounded, 4 of them critically, after shooting at a party held in honour of someone killed in April. Two people were detained for questioning and a revolver was recovered, Chief of Patrol Fred Waller said. "It looked like they were just shooting randomly at people as they exited the party," Waller said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: India win their last match of 2019, register 10th straight ODI series win vs WI
text: India chased down the target of 316 against West Indies in the final ODI in Cuttack on Sunday to win their last match of 2019 and clinch the three-match series 2-1. This is India's 10th straight ODI series victory against West Indies. India's current ODI series-winning streak against West Indies had started in 2007.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: No discussion on nationwide NRC, it was made during Congress regime: PM
text: Addressing a rally at Delhi's Ramlila Maidan, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that there has been no discussion on nationwide National Register of Citizens (NRC). "NRC was made during the Congress regime. Where were the protesters then? ," PM Modi added. He further said that there are no detention centres in India.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: UPSSSC exams postponed as candidates unable to download admit cards
text: Uttar Pradesh Subordinate Services Selection Commission on Sunday postponed examinations scheduled for December 24 and December 26. These examinations for posts of junior assistants and computer operators will now be held on January 4 and January 10. The exams were postponed as many candidates were unable to download admit cards due to internet shutdown in several districts amid anti-CAA protests.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Journalist claims UP Police attacking people; asked to share evidence
text: Journalist and author Rana Ayyub on Sunday alleged on Twitter that "RSS members along with cops and local leaders are attacking Muslim localities" in Kanpur and Muzaffarnagar in UP. "Families are leaving for safer places. Cars and houses are being burnt," she claimed. UP Police denied the allegations, asking her to "share verifiable evidence" for them to look into.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 'Jinko chahiye azadi, unko de do azadi' slogan raised in pro-CAA rally
text: Slogans like "Jinko chahiye azadi, unko de do azadi" (give freedom to those asking for it) and "Desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaron saal*n ko" (shoot the traitors) were raised in a rally in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Nagpur on Sunday. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and former Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis addressed the rally.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: When Indian Muslims go out, they are seen as Hindus: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Sunday addressed a rally in support of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Maharashtra's Nagpur. He said, "When our Muslims go out of the country, they are seen as Hindus and are recognised as Hindustani." Gadkari added, "Hindutva is not a narrow-minded concept. In fact, Hindutva alone is nationalism is our firm belief."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 2 killed during anti-CAA protest in Mangaluru booked for rioting
text: Two people who were killed in police firing in Mangaluru during a protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), have reportedly been booked for rioting. An FIR was registered against them under IPC, CrPC and Karnataka Prevention of Destruction and Loss of Property Act. Police alleged that the two were part of 'violent' anti-CAA protests held in the city on Thursday.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 879 arrested, 5,312 taken into preventive detention across UP over anti-CAA protests
text: UP Police has said that 164 cases have been registered, 879 persons have been arrested and 5,312 persons have been taken into preventive detention in connection with incidents of violence across the state during anti-CAA protests. As many as 288 police personnel also received injuries, UP Police added. Action has been taken against 15,344 social media posts, it further said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Manoj Tiwary shares video drinking seaside, says he's celebrating IPL snub
text: Bengal batsman Manoj Tiwary took to social media to share a video of himself drinking seaside. "Life should not only be lived, it should be celebrated. So here I am celebrating the snub from IPL 2020 Auction," Tiwary captioned the video. The 34-year-old batsman had a base price of ₹50 lakh but no side bought him in the auction.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Till the time I'm Transport Minister, forget about driverless cars: Gadkari
text: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari reiterated on Friday he won't allow driverless cars in India, adding that there's a shortage of 22 lakh drivers. "Till the time I'm the Transport Minister, you forget that (driverless cars). I will not allow driverless cars to come to India," he said. Gadkari added there was a need for growth of employment in India.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Detention centres are real: Cong on PM's 'no detention centre' claim
text: After PM Narendra Modi said that no Muslims will be sent to detention centres and there are no detention centres in India, Congress tweeted, "Does PM Modi believe Indians can't do a simple google search to fact check his lies?" Congress added, "Detention centres are extremely real and will continue to grow as long as this government is in power."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Unnao rape victim, who set herself on fire outside SP office, dies
text: A 23-year-old woman, who allegedly set herself on fire outside the Unnao SP's office after a youth accused of raping her was granted anticipatory bail by the High Court, succumbed to her injuries five days later on Saturday. The woman had around 70% burn injuries and was admitted to a Kanpur hospital. The accused was arrested for abetment to suicide.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Banksy unveils 'Scar of Bethlehem' ahead of Christmas, shares pic
text: Street artist Banksy unveiled his artwork 'Scar of Bethlehem' in The Walled Off Hotel in Bethlehem in West Bank that depicts nativity scene showing Mary, Joseph and baby Jesus. Behind the manger, the artist displays barrier walls resembling the ones built by Israel in Palestinian territories. The wall has a bullet hole that resembles a star over the manger.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Store fined ₹2,500 for charging ₹2 more than MRP on biscuit packet
text: Consumer Forum of Chandigarh has directed a store to pay ₹2,500 for wrongly charging ₹2 more on a biscuit packet from a customer. The customer stated he purchased certain goods from a store called Shail Marketing Company of Patanjali Ayurved products for ₹118. He alleged that for a biscuit packet, he was charged ₹12 against the MRP of ₹10.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No shortage of capital, corporates aren't borrowing enough: SBI Chairman
text: SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar on Saturday said that there is no shortage of capital in the system, but the corporates are not borrowing enough and not utilising their capacities well. "By March 31, most of the banks will be in a good position with respect to stressed assets," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: TBZ group clarifies after company with similar name files for bankruptcy
text: Tribhovandas Bhimji Zaveri (TBZ) Ltd has issued a clarification after a company with similar name, Tribhovandas Bhimji Zaveri & Sons Retail Private Limited, filed for bankruptcy. Many mistook one company for another. "Tribhovandas Bhimji Zaveri Ltd is neither connected nor does have any relation with 'Tribhovandas Bhimji Zaveri & Sons Retail Private Limited'", a TBZ statement said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Hundreds form human chain in Pune to show support for CAA
text: Several hundred people formed a human chain in Pune on Saturday to show support for the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). "I'm a local businessman...I have no political affiliation. I'm...standing in support of the law that I believe in. Anyone can join us," said a participant. "I feel that [CAA] is just and will bring the country together," said another.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Sachin-Sourav faced better quality bowlers than Rohit-Kohli: Chappell
text: Former Australian cricket team captain Ian Chappell compared the duos of Sachin Tendulkar-Sourav Ganguly and Rohit Sharma-Virat Kohli, saying that the former pair faced better quality bowlers as compared to the Sharma-Kohli pair. "On the basis of the quality of the opposition, you'd have to lean towards Tendulkar and Ganguly," Chappell said while taking his pick between the two pairs.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Huawei patents phone with three 180-degree rotating cameras
text: Huawei has published a patent consisting of a phone designed with three 180-degree rotating cameras - main and selfie cameras. The cameras also include an LED flash with an ultrawide angle. It is speculated to be launched in 2020 as the new Huawei P Smart Z and a similar designed phone may be released by Huawei's sub-brand Honor.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Online bulletin board inventor Randy Suess dies at 74
text: Randy Suess, creator of the first-ever online bulletin board which led to the rise of messaging and social media, died on December 10 at the age of 74. Suess and IBM engineer Ward Christensen created Computer Bulletin Board System (CBBS) - a messaging system that gave users a central medium to talk. His death was confirmed by his daughter Karrie.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Boeing's Starliner lands successfully after mission failure
text: Boeing CST-100 Starliner successfully landed in New Mexico on Sunday, two days after it went off course and failed to reach the right orbit. Missing the orbit resulted in a failed mission which entailed the space capsule docking itself with International Space Station and staying there for a week. The mission was unmanned with just a dummy named Rosie onboard.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Flavoured vaping JUUL pods may alter DNA, raise risks of cancer: Study
text: A study by Rochester University found flavoured vaping JUUL pods may over time cause serious damage to lungs and even damage DNA, which could eventually lead to cancer. The study showed JUUL's menthol-flavoured pod, which it continued selling after ending sale of mint-flavoured pods, was as harmful as any other. JUUL was earlier sued for deceptive marketing in New York.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: North Korea's Kim holds meeting with top military officials
text: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un held a meeting with the officials of the Central Military Commission to discuss boosting its military capability, state news agency KCNA said. North Korea on Saturday said the US would "pay dearly" for criticising its human rights. Earlier, Kim had set an end of year deadline for the US to resume denuclearisation talks.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 33 Legionaries of Christ priests abused 175 minors: Report
text: At least 175 minors were sexually abused by priests of Roman Catholic religious order Legionaries of Christ between 1941-2019, a report by the group said. The report claims the group's founder Father Marcial Maciel abused at least 60 of those victims. The majority of victims were boys between the ages of 11 and 16, the report shows.
author: Shailesh

headlines: FATF asks Pak 150 queries in response to its compliance report
text: Paris-based watchdog Financial Action Task Force (FATF) sent back 150 queries to Pakistan in response to the country's compliance report submitted in early December on curbing terror financing. FATF sought more data, clarification and asked questions on actions taken against madrassas linked to proscribed outfits, an official said. FATF has put Pakistan in its 'grey list' till February 2020.
author: Shailesh

headlines: DoT seeks ₹1.72 lakh crore from GAIL in telecom dues
text: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has sent a letter to GAIL seeking ₹1.72 lakh crore in past statutory dues after SC's Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) order. However, GAIL said it owes nothing as it didn't do business with them under ISP license. GAIL said it generated ₹35 crore revenue since 2001-02 and not ₹2,49,788 crore, considered for levying past dues.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: BSNL looking to extend 2G licence set to expire in 2020 by 2-3 years
text: BSNL is seeking a two-three year extension for its 2G licence which will expire on February 28, 2020 and had reportedly written a letter to the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) earlier. The 2G licence spectrum could be worth ₹35,000 crore and the government will take a call accordingly. Earlier, it was reported that the government refused any consideration beyond 2020.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Rohit records most international runs by opener in a year, breaks 22-yr-old record
text: Rohit Sharma has set the world record for scoring most international runs by an opener in a calendar year, achieving the feat during the third ODI against West Indies today. The 32-year-old overtook former Sri Lanka captain Sanath Jayasuriya, who had scored 2,387 runs in 1997. Former Team India opener Virender Sehwag follows Rohit and Jayasuriya, with 2,355 runs (2008).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India's highest ODI and T20I totals came at the same stadium
text: India achieved their highest-ever T20I total by scoring 260/5 against Sri Lanka at the Holkar Stadium in Indore on December 22, 2017. On December 8, 2011, India had achieved their highest-ever ODI total by putting up 418/5 against Windies at the same stadium. India's highest-ever Test total of 759/7d came in December 2016 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Went through depression again during Chhapaak, needed counsellor on set: Deepika
text: Deepika Padukone, during an interview with Rajeev Masand, revealed that her depression "did spiral through the process" of shooting for 'Chhapaak', which is based on the true story of an acid attack survivor. "I needed to have my counsellor on the sets of the movie with me," she added. "It got really bad and I started feeling claustrophobic," said Deepika.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: We did not make NRC, did not discuss it in Cabinet or Parliament: PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said that his party BJP didn't make the National Register of Citizens (NRC) and it was not discussed anywhere including the Union Cabinet and the Parliament. He further said that the NRC was brought only in Assam because of the directions of the Supreme Court. Earlier, BJP deleted its tweet of implementing nationwide NRC.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Aligarh Muslim University students expel VC, Registrar amid anti-CAA protests
text: Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) students have expelled Vice-Chancellor and Registrar of the university amid anti-CAA protests. The Office of the Students made a notice public, collectively signed by the students, teachers and non-teaching staff.  The students have asked the duo to vacate their official residences by January 5, 2020. They have also closed down all activity until the duo resigns.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Uncertainty could affect neighbours: Bangladesh FM on CAA, NRC
text: Amid widespread protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and the proposed National Register of Citizens (NRC), Bangladesh Foreign Minister A K Abdul Momen said that "uncertainty in India" may "affect its neighbours." "The [CAA] and the NRC...are internal issues of India," he said on Sunday. "We are the No.1 friend of India," he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Modiji should listen, 9 states said they won't implement NRC: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said, "Modiji you should listen, nine states have said it. Even your partners Bihar CM and Odisha CM who supported you in Parliament are saying they won't implement National Register of Citizens." He added that the PM must announce that neither NRC in its current form, nor the Citizenship Act will be implemented.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Researchers claim to have developed 'uncrackable' security system
text: Researchers at University of St Andrews, Scotland, and their international partners have claimed to have developed "uncrackable" security system to protect communications against cyber attacks. The team claims the new technology can also overcome the threat of quantum computers used for hacking. The system uses optical chips that send information to the user using a one-time-only key.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Pragya was on wheelchair, refused to move to non-emergency row: SpiceJet
text: SpiceJet on Sunday responded to BJP MP Pragya Thakur's complaint accusing the airline's crew of misbehaviour and refusing her the seat she had pre-booked. SpiceJet said Thakur arrived on her own wheelchair with pre-booked seat 1A, which is the emergency row seat that isn't allocated to wheelchair-bound passengers. SpiceJet added that Thakur's refusal to move to another seat delayed flight.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Has anyone killed people: BJP leader on chanting 'goli maaro desh ke gaddaro ko'
text: BJP leader Kapil Mishra, whose video of shouting 'desh ke gaddaro ko, goli maaro saalo ko' slogan in a pro-CAA protest surfaced online, said he stood by the slogan and claimed "he didn't instigate anyone to take law into their hands". "Has anyone killed or threatened people?" he added. The slogans were raised during a 'Tiranga march' in Connaught Place.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Indian man detained at Chennai airport; had 12 rats, 3 dogs, 1 squirrel, 5 lizards
text: The Air Intelligence Unit at the Chennai airport detained an Indian passenger who was coming from Thailand's Bangkok. As many as 12 kangaroo rats, 3 prairie dogs, 1 red squirrel and 5 blue iguana lizards were seized from the man's possession. The rodents and reptiles are being sent back to Bangkok.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Real spy world not like James Bond: Army chief-designate Naravane
text: Army chief-designate Lieutenant General Manoj Naravane on Saturday talked about importance of intel in successful military operations, saying that the world of intelligence isn't glamourous. "When we...think about intelligence, we...think of James Bond, guns, girls, guitar...glamour, but [it] is not (like) that," he said. He added that the world of spies is "more of John Le Carre's Smiley novels."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: No chance of change in GST slabs, rates until revenue stabilises: Sushil Modi
text: States are not in favour of increasing GST rates when there is a consumption slowdown, Sushil Kumar Modi, Bihar's Deputy CM and Convener of Group of Ministers on IGST, said on Saturday.  There's no possibility of any change in the GST rates till revenue stabilises, he added. "Not a single state...is ready to raise the tax rates," he said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I can finally tick it off my wishlist: Ananya on working with Deepika
text: Talking about working with Deepika Padukone in an upcoming film, actress Ananya Panday said that she's "really delighted" that she can finally tick it off from her wishlist. "Deepika Padukone is an actress I truly love," she added. Talking about the film, Ananya said it belongs to a genre that she hasn't tried before. It'll be directed by Shakun Batra.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Katy Perry features on cover of Vogue India's January edition
text: American singer Katy Perry has featured on the cover of the January issue of fashion magazine Vogue India. Perry, who performed in Mumbai in November, took to social media to share a motion poster of the cover and wrote, "Not every [girl] gets to commemorate their trip to India with...cover of @VOGUEIndia." She was styled by Anaita Shroff Adajania. n
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Fan wanted selfie while I was crying: Emilia on not taking selfies anymore
text: Actress Emilia Clarke has revealed she won't take selfies with fans anymore. Talking about the incident that led her to take the decision, she said, "I...[was]...having...a panic attack...crying...[when] this guy's like, 'Can I get a selfie?' And I was like, 'I can't breathe.'" Emilia added she is open to giving autographs as then "you're actually having a truthful human-to-human" interaction.n
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: ₹10L ex-gratia for 2 killed in anti-CAA protest in Mangaluru: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa announced ₹10 lakh relief each to the families of victims who died in Mangaluru during the anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protest. The two persons died following the bullet injuries they sustained in police firing during the protest. The police have also mentioned their names in the FIR registered in connection with the violence that erupted during protests.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Those against NRC, CAA should hoist tricolour at their homes: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi appealed to people to hoist the national flag at their homes to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and NRC. "This will send a message to BJP that they have made a wrong law," Owaisi added while addressing a rally in Hyderabad. The AIMIM chief also said that it was not a fight of Muslims alone.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar deliberately went to jail: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Sunday criticised Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad, saying that he "deliberately" went to jail. She claimed that although Azad is from UP, he chose to protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in Delhi because Delhi Assembly polls are coming. Azad is in judicial custody after being arrested for allegedly "instigating" violence during an anti-CAA protest.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Liverpool lift FIFA Club World Cup after beating Flamengo
text: Liverpool lifted the FIFA Club World Cup trophy after Roberto Firmino's sole strike proved to the match-winning goal in the final against Brazil's Flamengo. Jürgen Klopp's team will be the first-ever Liverpool side to win the title, after having attempted it three times before.The Club World Cup is the third piece of silverware Liverpool have claimed this year.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Messi reaches 50 goals in a calendar year for the sixth time
text: Argentina's Lionel Messi reached 50 goals for the sixth consecutive calendar year by netting for Barcelona against Deportivo Alaves on Saturday. Messi moved to 50 goals from 58 matches for club and country in 2019. Out of Messi's 50 goals, 34 arrived in 32 La Liga matches, eight scored in the Champions League and three in the Copa del Rey.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Manchester City end Leicester's unbeaten run
text: Manchester City came from a goal down to end second-placed Leicester City's 11-match unbeaten streak. City had gown down after Jamie Vardy scored his 17th goal of this season, following which former Leicester City player Riyad Mahrez and İlkay Gündoğan scored before the half-time. With the win, City are within one point of the second-placed Leicester City.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Indian-American Monisha Ghosh appointed 1st female CTO at US FCC
text: Indian-American Dr Monisha Ghosh has become the first woman to be appointed as the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) at US' Federal Communications Commission (FCC) and will take charge on January 13. She will advise the Commission and its Indian-American Chairman Ajit Pai on engineering and technology issues. Ghosh has been the Program Director at the National Science Foundation since 2017.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: LetsVenture's portfolio with 195 startups valued at $1.07 bn
text: Bengaluru-based investment platform LetsVenture's portfolio is now valued at $1.07 billion as of November 2019 with about 195 startups. Compared to last year, the firm increased its number of investors by 23% in 2019 to 1,523, out of which 28% are global investors. LetsVenture has invested in over 220 startups to date some of which include Yulu, LBB and Sattviko.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: May never know fate of missing plane with 38 on board: Chile
text: Chilean Air Force Chief Arturo Merino Núñez said it is possible that they may never know what happened to missing Hercules C-130 cargo plane that had 38 people on board. The plane went missing on December 9 while on its way to a base in Antarctica. "[T]he plane suffered a complete collapse that caused it to disintegrate," Núñez added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Notre Dame not to hold Christmas mass for 1st time in over 200 yrs
text: For the first time in over two centuries, Notre Dame cathedral will not hold a Christmas mass, French officials said. However, Notre Dame Rector Patrick Chauvet would hold a Christmas mass in the nearby church of Saint-Germain l'Auxerrois. The cathedral, over 800 years old, is currently under repair work after it was damaged in a fire in April.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Air India unions write to PM Modi urging govt to not sell airline
text: Several Air India unions have written a letter to PM Narendra Modi urging government to not disinvest in the airline, once viewed as a "jewel", as it'll cause loss of national pride. They, instead, suggested the government waive the loan and make Air India a board-managed company like ITC. The government is planning to sell 100% stake in the airline.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Infiltrator never reveals identity, refugee never hides identity: PM on CAA
text: PM Narendra Modi while commenting on Citizenship (Amendment) Act on Sunday, said, "There is a very simple difference, an infiltrator never reveals his identity and a refugee never hides his identity." "Many of these infiltrators are coming out and speaking. Why don't they speak the truth? They are scared that their reality will come out," PM Modi added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I don't exercise, maintain body with manual labour: 54-yr-old Elizabeth Hurley
text: Speaking about maintaining her body, 54-year-old English actress Elizabeth Hurley said, "I don't do any exercise, per se." "But I'm extremely active, because...I've always found...[that] the best bodies are on manual labourers," she added. "I use a chainsaw, I use a hedge trimmer. You burn a ton of calories, and you're using every muscle in your body," said Hurley.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: You never called me aunty: Sona on Aamir's daughter calling her aunty on Instagram
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra replied to Aamir Khan's daughter Ira's Instagram post, wherein the latter referred to her as 'Sona aunty' in the caption. After commenting, "Be fearless and free always", Sona wrote, "You've never ever called me aunty, so don't bother now too. [Don't] be politically correct I say!" "I always call you aunty. Glad you haven't noticed," Ira responded.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: U'khand on high alert, police leaves cancelled amid anti-CAA protest
text: Security forces were put on high alert across Uttarakhand in view of protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) on Sunday. Leaves of all police personnel were also cancelled due to continuous demonstrations in the state. Uttarakhand DGP (Law and Order) Ashok Kumar has directed police headquarters in Dehradun and Haridwar to maintain high vigil in the cities.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Cong spreading rumours Muslims will be sent to detention centres: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi addressed an election rally in Delhi's Ramlila Maidan for the upcoming Assembly elections on Sunday. He spoke on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and the National Register of Citizens, saying that it was a lie that Muslims will be sent to detention centres. He added that the Congress and its allies and Urban Naxals are spreading this rumour.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: PM Modi and Amit Shah have destroyed future of India's youth: Rahul Gandhi
text: Amid anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests across India, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Dear Youth of India, Modi & Shah have destroyed your future." He added, "They can't face your anger over the lack of jobs & damage they've done to the economy. That's why they are dividing our beloved India and hiding behind hate."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Mamata asked to stop infiltration from B'desh years ago, what changed? PM Modi
text: Referring to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee supporting anti-CAA protests, PM Narendra Modi said, "A few years ago, she had stood up in the Parliament and asked to stop infiltration from Bangladesh and wanted help for the refugees." PM Modi added, "I want to ask Mamata didi, what changed? Why're you spreading false rumours? Why're you so afraid?"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What will you get by pelting stones at policemen: PM Modi on anti-CAA protests
text: Referring to anti-CAA protests while addressing a rally at Delhi's Ramlila Maidan today, PM Narendra Modi said, "What will you get by pelting stones at the policemen?" He added, "After India gained freedom, more than 33,000 policemen have given their lives for the security of the citizens and peace." He stated, "When any problem arises, police don't ask your religion."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Teri waat lagne wali hai: Sachin recalls teammates' remark before 1st presser
text: Recalling his first post-match press conference, Sachin Tendulkar revealed his teammates scared him in the dressing room as he hadn't faced foreign media and post-match interviews. Sachin added, "My teammates told me 'Teri aaj waat lagne wali hai', they are going to ask you all sorts of questions." Sachin further said that the team manager asked him not to worry.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: FBI program helps companies fool hackers with 'decoy data': Report
text: Companies are reportedly planting "decoy data" or bogus data to confuse fraudsters and corporate spies looking to steal valuable information under an FBI program IDLE (Illicit Data Loss Exploitation). Under the program, bogus data is mixed within existing data structures to make it appear authentic. A hacker would merely download the decoys that would warn IT staff about a breach.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Hacker 'Spdrman' who took down Liberia's internet to leave jail in 2020
text: UK-born 31-year-old hacker Daniel Kaye, also known as 'Spdrman', will be released from prison in early 2020 after being sent to jail by a London court on January 11, 2019. Kaye admitted to attacking an African phone company that inadvertently crashed Liberia's internet in 2016. After release, he'll face court-mandated restrictions limiting his access to phones, computers, and encryption software.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla nears land deal for gigafactory outside of Berlin: Report
text: Elon Musk-led automaker Tesla has reportedly neared deal and is working with state officials in Brandenburg on the contract to secure around 740 acres of land outside Berlin for its European gigafactory. Tesla has also reportedly filed the requisite documents with local environmental monitoring authorities. In November, Musk revealed that he had selected an area outside of Berlin for gigafactory.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I started Zostel with $15,000 which I won in poker: Co-founder Chouhan
text: Gurugram-based backpacking hostel startup Zostel's Co-founder and CEO Dharamveer Singh Chouhan told YourStory that he began Zostel with $15,000 he won by playing poker. Chouhan said he played poker during his free time at IIM-Calcutta. "Instead of giving a push to my Poker career, I decided to invest that money in building something in the travel industry," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Northern Hemisphere witnesses 2019's shortest day today
text: Today marks Winter Solstice, the shortest day of 2019 in Northern Hemisphere, which occurs when one of the Earth's poles has its maximum tilt away from the Sun. In Delhi, the Sun rose at 7.09 am, and will set at 5.29 pm, making the day 10 hours, 19 minutes, and 17 seconds long. Saturday in Delhi was a second longer.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No singles allowed at New Year's Eve parties in Hyderabad: Police
text: Hyderabad Police has put a ban on entry of singles at New Year's Eve parties. Permission will be granted to only couples and their acquaintances, police added. Further, guidelines issued state those found drunk driving will have their vehicles seized and the driver will have to visit the court, pay a fine of ₹10,000 or go to jail or both.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 7-judge Constitution bench of SC to hear Sabarimala petitions in January
text: A seven-judge Constitution bench of the Supreme Court will hear the Sabarimala review petitions in January 2020. In November, a five-judge Constitution bench had decided to send petitions to the larger bench with a majority of 3-2. The case deals with the Kerala High Court's earlier verdict to ban the entry of women aged 10 to 50 in the temple.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Faulty McDonald's drinks machine killed 2 employees, says manager in Peru
text: José Andrade, General Manager of the company operating Peru's McDonald's restaurants has said the beverage machine at the outlet where two employees were fatally electrocuted last week had experienced an electrical fault. "The information...that the machine was...giving people shocks was only known within...local managers," he added. "What they ought to have done is to stop using [it]," said José.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: India's forex reserves rose 5% in second half of FY20: RBI report
text: India's forex reserves increased by 5% during the second half of the financial year ended September 2019, according to a Reserve Bank of India report.
