author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: NCLT extends Jet Airways insolvency resolution process by 90 days
text: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has approved extending the insolvency resolution period of Jet Airways by 90 days. The carrier's Committee of Creditors sought the extension to buy more time for the sole bidder South American Synergy Group which had asked for more time to conduct the due diligence. The lenders also cited fresh interest from two new entities.
author: Dharna

headlines: All schools, colleges to remain shut across UP tomorrow amid anti-CAA protests
text: All schools, colleges and universities will remain shut across Uttar Pradesh on Saturday amid anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests. As many as six people have died in violence during the protests in the state. Internet services have also been suspended in various parts of Uttar Pradesh. Over 150 people have been arrested amid the protests in state capital Lucknow.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Internet services to remain suspended in Ghaziabad till 10 am tomorrow
text: The District Magistrate of Ghaziabad has said that internet services will remain suspended in the district till 10 am tomorrow following anti-CAA protests. He also said that all schools will remain shut in Ghaziabad on Saturday. As many as five people have been killed in violence during anti-CAA protests in Uttar Pradesh.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Family of US TV show's stuntman who fell to death on sets awarded ₹61 crore
text: A US jury has awarded $8.6 million (₹61 crore) to the family of a stuntman who fell to his death on the set of TV series The Walking Dead in July 2017. John Bernecker's parents had sued AMC Networks and other defendants involved in the show's production, saying they compromised on safety measures over scheduling and financial concerns.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: What I meant was opinion poll: Mamata after 'UN-monitored referendum' remark
text: A day after she called for a "United Nations-monitored referendum" on the issues of CAA, NRC, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "What I had (meant) was that...a gana vote (opinion poll) be conducted by a panel of impartial experts...It can be observed by the UN." "I am proud of my country...I have full faith on my countrymen," she added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Which prominent cricketers went unsold in IPL 2020 auction?
text: As many as 10 cricketers having the base price of at least ₹1 crore went unsold in the IPL 2020 auction. All-rounder Yusuf Pathan went unsold in the auction for the first time ever. Other prominent players who went unsold include Martin Guptill, Tim Southee, Cheteshwar Pujara, Manoj Tiwary, Liam Plunkett, Adam Zampa, Mustafizur Rahman and Colin De Grandhomme.t
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rahul Dravid's son Samit smashes double hundred in Under-14 cricket match
text: Former Team India captain Rahul Dravid's son, Samit, slammed a double century in an Under-14 state-level cricket match. The 14-year-old scored 201 off 256 balls in the first innings for Vice-President's XI against Dharwad Zone. His knock included 22 fours. In the second innings, Samit slammed an unbeaten 94 and took figures of 3/26. The match ended in a draw.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kumar Birla's son Aryaman takes indefinite break from cricket due to anxiety
text: Madhya Pradesh's 22-year-old batsman Aryaman Birla, son of industrialist Kumar Mangalam Birla, has taken an indefinite break from cricket to cope with "severe anxiety". Birla, who was released by RR ahead of IPL auction, said, "I've felt trapped. I've pushed myself through all the distress so far, but now I feel the need to put my mental health...above all else."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: His calf is bigger than your thigh: Kohli trolls Chahal over pic with Pollard
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli trolled leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal after the latter posted a picture of himself with West Indies' captain Kieron Pollard. "10 kilo ka bat, 2.5 kilo ka haath!!" Chahal had captioned the picture. Commenting on the post, Kohli wrote, "Abey Teri thigh se badi calf hai uski (His calf is bigger than your thigh)."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Swiss drugmaker to offer 100 doses of world's most expensive drug for free
text: Novartis has launched a lottery-style programme to give away 100 doses of its $2.1 million-per-patient (₹15 crore) gene therapy Zolgensma for Spinal Muscular Atrophy. Zolgensma is the world's costliest single-dose treatment. The Swiss drugmaker will give out 50 doses of the treatment through June 2020 for babies under 2 years old in countries where the medicine is not yet approved.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 7-year-old Pune girl playing in a temple raped by unidentified man
text: A seven-year-old girl was raped in a temple in Pune on Monday. The mother of the victim filed a complaint on Thursday after the girl told her about the incident. According to the complaint, the girl was playing in a temple when an unidentified person forcibly took her to a corner of the temple and raped her.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Former Kerala Minister Thomas Chandy passes away aged 72
text: Former Kerala Minister and Kuttanad MLA, Thomas Chandy, passed away on Friday at the age of 72, after a prolonged battle with cancer. He was the state President of the Nationalist Congress Party in Kerala and had served as the state Transport Minister between April and November 2017. He is survived by his wife and three children.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Australian PM apologises for taking vacation amid bushfires
text: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has apologised for taking a vacation in Hawaii as the country faces a crisis due to the bushfires. At least eight people have been killed in the bushfires, and more than 700 houses and millions of hectares of land have been destroyed. More than 100 fires are currently burning in Australia's New South Wales.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Why is stock market up when economy is going down: Ex-CEA to IIM-A students
text: Former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian, while addressing students at IIM-Ahmedabad, asked why the Indian stock market is going "up and up and up when the economy is going down and down and down". "If you can crack this puzzle for me, I would fly down here all the way from the US to understand it," Subramanian told the students.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: If I borrowed from India, I'd be under ED probe, face jail: Anil Agarwal
text: During a discussion at an industry event, Vedanta Resources Chairman Anil Agarwal said he is less reliant on borrowing from Indian banks due to fear of action by enforcement agencies. "I borrowed mostly in foreign countries. If I borrowed from India, I'd be under probe by ED and others. Maybe they would've even put me in jail," Agarwal remarked.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 'Justice will be provided': Jamia Vice-Chancellor to students
text: Jamia Millia Islamia Vice-Chancellor Najma Akhtar on Friday said that it was "unfortunate" that the police made "unauthorised" entry into the campus and assured "that justice will be provided". Akhtar said she has been in touch with the injured and will provide them with "full financial and emotional support". She also urged university students not to be misled by rumours.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Locals offer tea, roses to police after protests in Delhi's Jafrabad
text: Amid the ongoing protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, pictures shared by a news agency show residents of Delhi's Jafrabad area offering tea and roses to the police personnel deployed in the area. Earlier today, a protest march being taken out from Jama Masjid was stopped by the police at Delhi Gate leading to clashes between police and protesters.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: No citizen will be thrown out: Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray over CAA
text: Calling to maintain peace, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has said that no one will be thrown out of the country after the implementation of Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "The state government won't allow violation of the rights of citizens of any community or religion," Thackeray added. He further said those who want to protest should do it in a peaceful way.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Over 10k take out protest march against CAA, NRC in Pune
text: Over 10,000 people took out a protest march against Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Pune, Maharashtra on Friday. The march began at the Babajan Dargah Chowk and ended at the Pune district collector's office. Religious leaders from various faiths participated in the march, which also saw presence of students in large numbers.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Be cautious while posting on social media: Assam Police tells people
text: Assam Police on Friday urged people to be cautious while posting or sharing information on social media. This came after internet services were restored in the state, after a suspension of nine days amid anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests. "We request citizens to be cautious while posting or sharing unverified/ provocative information on social media," Assam Police tweeted.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Will speak to Dravid: Ganguly on Bumrah's fitness test
text: BCCI head Sourav Ganguly said that he will call National Cricket Academy (NCA) head Rahul Dravid to find out what the matter is regarding Jasprit Bumrah's fitness test after NCA refused to conduct the fitness test. "Everything has to go through the NCA so we will find out [about Bumrah]," the former Indian team captain added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Mirabai Chanu wins gold at Qatar International Cup
text: Former world champion and Commonwealth Games gold-medallist Mirabai Chanu on Friday won gold in women's 49kg category at the 6th Qatar International Cup in Doha. Chanu lifted 83kg in snatch and 111kg in the clean and jerk to finish on top. France's Anais Michel and Manon Lorentz finished at second and third respectively.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: France fines Google $166 mn for 'opaque' ad platform rules
text: Google has been fined $166 million by France's competition watchdog for its Google Ads platform rules which are "opaque and difficult to understand", and are allegedly used for "abusing its dominant position" in market. The authorities said Google lacked objectivity and predictability in defining rules on the platform. In a statement, Google stated its policies are designed to protect consumers.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Boeing's unmanned spacecraft fails to reach International Space Station
text: Boeing's uncrewed CST-100 Starliner went off course and failed to reach the right orbit on its first test flight. However, the officials reported the capsule was in a safe and stable configuration. Starliner's mission was to reach the International Space Station and remain there till December 28 which it would not be achieving after having missed its target orbit.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Quikr lays off up to 2,000 employees following a major scam: Reports
text: Online classifieds platform Quikr has laid off around 1,500-2,000 people from various verticals in the last one and a half month, a report said. It reportedly laid off 1,200 employees in Bengaluru and 138 in Pune. The layoffs are an outcome of an alleged scam where employees faked business transactions to earn crores in commission, the report added.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Ankit Gupta to head OYO’s Frontier Businesses in India, South Asia
text: Gurugram-based hospitality startup OYO has appointed Ankit Gupta as Chief Operating Officer (COO) and Senior VP of Frontier Businesses, OYO India and South Asia. Gupta will be leading OYO Life, OYO Townhouse and  OYO Home among others. He will be joining the startup from McKinsey and Co where he served as a Partner.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: 19 flights cancelled, 5 diverted due to dense fog in Delhi
text: A total of nineteen flights were cancelled and five were diverted due to dense fog at Delhi's IGI Airport on Friday, a Delhi airport official said. On Thursday, IndiGo had cancelled 19 flights from Delhi as crew members were stuck in a traffic jam due to anti-CAA protests. Apart from IndiGo, eight Air India flights were also delayed.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Putin says presidential term limits can be removed
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the constitutional rule which limits the president to only serve two successive terms can be removed. "(This clause) troubles some of our political analysts and public figures," he said during his annual year-end press conference. Putin, who has been in power since 1999, has either served as the President or Prime Minister.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Indian citizens don't have to prove ancestry with pre-1971 documents: Govt
text: Referring to CAA, the Ministry of Home Affairs said Indian citizens don't have to prove any ancestry by presenting documents like identity cards and birth certificates of parents/grandparents dating back to pre-1971 situation. "Illiterate citizens, who may not have any documents, authorities may allow them to produce witnesses or local proofs supported by members of community," it added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 5 people killed in violence during anti-CAA protests in UP
text: As many as five people were killed across Uttar Pradesh in the violence during protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act on Friday, Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Kumar Awasthi said. One person was killed during the protest in Lucknow on Thursday. Over 50 policemen were seriously injured during the protests, Uttar Pradesh DGP OP Singh said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: UK to leave European Union by January 31 as MPs approve Brexit deal
text: The UK will leave the European Union (EU) by January 31 after MPs voted in favour of Prime Minister Boris Johnson's EU (Withdrawal Agreement) Bill on Friday. MPs passed the bill, which also bans an extension of the transition period beyond 2020, by 358 votes to 234. The UK is now "one step closer to getting Brexit done", Johnson said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: NRC won't be implemented in Bihar: CM Nitish Kumar
text: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Friday said that the National Register of Citizens (NRC) will not be implemented in Bihar. He is the first NDA ally to reject the implementation of NRC. Kumar's JDU has supported the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019. JDU Vice President Prashant Kishor has opposed his party's decision to support CAA.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Car set on fire near DCP's office in Delhi's Daryaganj amid anti-CAA protests
text: A car was torched in front of the office of the Deputy Commissioner of Police, Central, in Daryaganj near Delhi Gate when police tried to foil anti-CAA protestors' march from old Delhi to Jantar Mantar. Police resorted to water cannon and baton charge to disperse the crowd. Delhi Metro closed several Metro stations due to the protests.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Additional DCP injured during anti-CAA protest in Delhi
text: Delhi's Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police Rohit Rajbir Singh was injured during protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act near the Seemapuri area in Delhi. As many as 16 metro stations have been closed in Delhi amid the protests. Police used water cannon in Daryaganj against the protesters after a car was set on fire outside a police station.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Chetan Bhagat says 'CAA+NRC is discriminatory', gives possible scenario
text: Novelist Chetan Bhagat has said the Citizenship (Amendment) Act when clubbed with nationwide National Register of Citizen (NRC) becomes discriminatory. He went on to explain a possible scenario that could arise if both are implemented together. The CAA makes it easier for non-Muslim minorities in Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan who settled in India before 2015 to obtain Indian citizenship.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: PM must immediately announce that there is going to be no NRC: Ramachandra Guha
text: Historian Ramachandra Guha, who was detained by police mid-interview during anti-CAA protests on Thursday, today tweeted, "The Prime Minister must immediately announce that there is going to be no National Register of Citizens." He added, "That simple and single announcement will do more to restore peace and trust than anything else. India needs a healing touch, and from the top."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Deeply pained: Nobel laureate Kailash Satyarthi on police action at Jamia
text: Nobel laureate Kailash Satyarthi said he was "deeply pained" by the police action on students of Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) University in Delhi. He added that "democracy shrinks" when such voices are "forcibly suppressed". "A safe...space for students and young people who respect the Constitution should always be guaranteed for voicing their opinions and concerns peacefully," he further said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Anna Hazare begins 'maun vrat' seeking speedy justice in Nirbhaya case
text: Social activist Anna Hazare on Friday began his 'maun vrat' at Ralegan Siddhi village in Maharashtra, seeking speedy justice in the Nirbhaya case and in cases of crimes against women. He had written to PM Narendra Modi informing him that he would observe 'maun vrat' as a "penance". "If justice isn't delivered, I'll go on indefinite fast," he said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Protest your right but protecting India your duty: Anupam to students amid protests
text: Anupam Kher took to Twitter to share a video amid the anti-CAA protests across India. "My appeal to all wonderful students of India- Protest is your right. But protecting India is your duty," he wrote. In the video, Anupam said that several elements are taking advantage of students' protest and those who are destroying public property are enemies of India.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: US shouldn't obstruct flow of talent from India: Jaishankar on H-1B visa
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, while emphasising the importance of H-1B visas, said that the US should not obstruct the flow of talent from India as it is an important part of the economic cooperation. He added that it almost acts as a strategic bridge between the two countries and "no unreasonable legislative provisions should constrain that".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Ozil removed from Chinese version of PES 2020 after his comments
text: Arsenal's German midfielder Mesut Ozil has been removed from the Chinese version of the Pro Evolution Soccer 2020 Mobile following his comments regarding China's treatment of the Uighur Muslim minority. "China's Communist Party propaganda outlets can censor (Ozil) and Arsenal's games all season long, but the truth will prevail," US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo wrote.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: To save Ambedkar, Gandhi, Nehru's legacy, we need to protest: Owaisi
text: On the ongoing protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi while condemning the incidents of violence said, "To save the legacy of Ambedkar, Gandhi, Pandit Nehru, we need to protest." "We don't support violence but we cannot become mute spectators," he added. On reported remarks of Imams and clerics supporting CAA, Owaisi said, "Let them live in delusion."nnn
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: It's like addiction: Liverpool's Lallana ahead of FIFA Club WC final
text: Speaking about the FIFA Club World Cup final, Liverpool midfielder Adam Lallana said, "It's like an addiction: you win one medal and you want to win another." "Another trophy is up for grabs so bring it on," he added. Liverpool, who won the Champions League last season, will face Brazilian club Flamengo on Saturday in the Club World Cup final.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Maxwell hits 39-ball 83 a day after his ₹10.75 crore IPL auction
text: Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell hit a 39-ball 83, with five sixes to his name, a day after he was bought for ₹10.75 crore by the Kings XI Punjab side in the IPL auction. The Melbourne Stars skipper scored almost half of his team's runs at a strike rate of 212.82 against Brisbane Heat in the Big Bash League.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Indian badminton needs structure, earlier I was it: Gopichand
text: Speaking about the changing ecosystem of Indian badminton, national coach Pullela Gopichand said, "Indian badminton needs a structure. Earlier, I was the structure. Everything had to go through me. Now [PV] Sindhu has a strength and conditioning coach." Gopichand added that earlier shuttlers like Saina Nehwal did what he told them to but now they have their own support teams.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: KXIP picked up Sheldon Cottrell in desperation: Gambhir
text: Speaking about Kings XI Punjab's new pacer Sheldon Cottrell, ex-KKR captain Gautam Gambhir said, "I still don't think Sheldon Cottrell has enough quality to become an 8.5 cr bowler... I think Anil Kumble picked him up in desperation." "There were no better options, Pat Cummins and Chris Morris both were sold out," Gambhir added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Sweden defeat India 4-0 in U-17 Women’s Football Tournament final
text: Sweden defeated India 4-0 in the three-nation U-17 Women's Football Tournament final in Mumbai. The Swedes took a lead in the fourth minute and then scored two more goals in the first half before making it to four in the 71st minute. India had lost their first game of the tournament against Sweden but registered a 1-0 win against Thailand.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: KKR lacks backup options: Gautam Gambhir
text: Former Kolkata Knight Riders' captain Gautam Gambhir said that the team doesn't have enough back-up options and the team management could have gone for all-rounders in the players' auction to provide the squad more depth. "[T]here is no backup for Andre Russell, Eoin Morgan, Sunil Narine who is a one of a kind bowler," Gambhir said.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Apple working on satellite tech to beam data to devices: Reports
text: A team at Apple is secretly working on satellites and related wireless technology to beam data such as internet connectivity directly to its devices, Bloomberg reported. It has engineers from various fields working on the project to deliver results within five years. Bloomberg added the project could be abandoned and that the use of satellites hasn't been finalised yet.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Facebook acquired startup to build a live shopping feature
text: Earlier this year, Facebook acquired a video-shopping startup Packagd to develop live shopping capabilities for its online trading platform Marketplace. This feature will help users to complete shopping through a live video. "We are exploring ways to let buyers easily ask questions and place orders within a live video broadcast," said a Facebook spokesperson.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: Google buys game developer Typhoon Studios for Stadia platform
text: Canada-based Typhoon Studios, which is yet to launch its first game, has been acquired by Google for its indigenous cloud gaming platform Stadia Games and Entertainment. The Typhoon team will be joining Stadia studio in Montreal. Founded in 2017, Typhoon Studios will be releasing its first game, 'Journey to the Savage Planet', on multiple platforms.
author: Aishwarya

headlines: CBI court rejects Indrani Mukerjea's bail plea for 4th time
text: A Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court on Friday rejected the bail petition of Indrani Mukerjea for the fourth time. Indrani, who's a prime accused in the murder of her daughter Sheena Bora, had sought bail citing deteriorating health conditions. While contending for bail, she had told the court, "Every minute's delay is causing damage to two million brain cells."
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Infiltration attempts being made from Nepal: Amit Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said elements who did not want peace in the country were using its open borders, especially with Nepal, to enter India. He claimed that in the last one year 54 "infiltrators", including two Pakistanis, have been nabbed at this border. Shah made the comments on the Raising Day of Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB).
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: India deployed missiles in region: Pak writes to UN on Kashmir
text: Pakistan's Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi wrote a letter to the UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, claiming that India has deployed and tested several missiles of various ranges and capabilities. In the letter, he claimed that India could launch a "false flag" attack on Pakistan to divert the world's attention from the "grave situation" in Kashmir.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: UK's Prince Philip admitted to hospital as 'precautionary measure'
text: UK's Prince Philip, the husband of Queen Elizabeth II, was taken to a hospital on Friday as a "precautionary measure", Buckingham Palace said in a statement. The 98-year-old was in London's King Edward VII's Hospital for observation and treatment of a "pre-existing condition". He had stepped down from his royal duties in August 2017.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Entry & exit gates of 16 metro stations closed amid anti-CAA protests in Delhi
text: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has announced that the entry and exit gates of 16 metro stations have been closed amid protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. A car was set on fire in Daryaganj, with the police using water cannon to disperse the protesters. Protests are also being held at India Gate and Connaught Place, among other places.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: 4 men get death penalty over 2008 Jaipur bomb blasts that killed 80 people
text: A Jaipur court on Friday awarded death penalty to all four convicts in the 2008 Jaipur bomb blasts case. Around 80 people were killed and more than 170 others were injured in multiple bomb explosions in Rajasthan's capital city. The Indian Mujahideen had claimed responsibility for the attack.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Earthquake of 6.1 magnitude hits Hindukush region, tremors felt in North India
text: An earthquake of 6.1 magnitude hit the Hindukush region at around 5.10 pm on Friday, with tremors being felt across Delhi-NCR and parts of North India. The northern areas of the Pakistan including Peshawar and Islamabad were also jolted by earthquake tremors. An earthquake of magnitude 6.1 at Richter scale had struck 173 km North-West of Lahore on September 24.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Man says Savdhaan India host lied about removal from show, actor replies
text: A Twitter user has claimed that Sushant Singh lied about his removal from 'Savdhaan India'. Sharing an article from December 5 which speculated Sushant's exit from the show, the user alleged it had nothing to do with his participation in anti-CAA protests. Responding to him, Sushant said the statement by the channel was untrue and he would file a complaint.n
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: She pays more tax than this: Rangoli after Forbes says Kangana earned ₹17.5cr
text: Kangana Ranaut's sister Rangoli Chandel called Forbes a "fraud" after its Top 100 Celebrity list ranked the actress at 70th spot, stating that she earned ₹17.5 crore in 2019. "All this is PR, Kangana pays more tax than her entire income mentioned in the poll," she wrote. Rangoli further said this information is "super confidential".
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: CAA is life jacket but Muslims won't get it: Chetan Bhagat criticises CAA-NRC
text: Amid protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, author Chetan Bhagat tweeted, "CAA is a life jacket. NRC is everyone being pushed out of the plane as they've to prove themselves all over again. But Muslims don't get the life jacket." "CAA by itself [is] not the issue. But CAA+NRC is discriminatory," he wrote in another tweet.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Vehicle torched in Bulandshahr amid anti-CAA protest; internet suspended
text: A vehicle was set on fire during a demonstration against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), 2019, in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr on Friday. There is heavy police presence at the spot of the incident, reported ANI. Bulandshahr District Magistrate said on Friday that mobile internet and broadband services will remain suspended in the district from 3 pm onwards until further notice.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Kerala journos released after 7 hours of detention in Mangaluru
text: Several Malayali journalists who were detained by Mangaluru Police on Friday morning were released after seven hours of detention. The scribes were arrested from Wenlock Hospital, where they were covering the post-mortem of the two anti-CAA protesters who died during police firing in Mangaluru. After their release, the journalists told the media that Karnataka police treated them like 'criminals'.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP using brute force to suppress dissent is unacceptable: Sonia Gandhi
text: Criticising police action against anti-CAA protestors, Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi said, "BJP govt has shown utter disregard for people’s voices & chosen to use brute force to suppress dissent. This is unacceptable." She added, "In a democracy, people have the right to raise their voice against wrong decisions & policies of the government & register their concerns."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Delhi Capitals release video of Hetmyer dancing on bed after IPL auction
text: IPL franchise Delhi Capitals took to Twitter to share a video of West Indies batsman Shimron Hetmyer dancing on bed after the IPL 2020 auction. "Us: Hi, Mr. Shimron. Welcome to DC! Can you please share a message for our fans? *1 minute later* Hetmyer:," Delhi Capitals captioned the video. Delhi Capitals bought Shimron Hetmyer for ₹7.5 crore.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: ₹140.3 crore spent for 62 players in IPL 2020 auction, RR buy most no. of players
text: The eight IPL franchises spent ₹140.3 crore to buy 62 players in the IPL 2020 auction in Kolkata on Thursday. Rajasthan Royals spent ₹14.15 crore and bought the most number of players (11) in the auction. Kolkata Knight Riders spent ₹27.15 crore, the highest amount among all franchises. As many as 338 players went under the hammer at the auction.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Economy was headed for destruction 5-6 years ago: PM Narendra Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Friday said the Indian economy was headed "towards destruction 5-6 years ago" but his government turned it around with "discipline and positivity". Speaking at industry body ASSOCHAM's annual conference, PM Modi asked businesspeople to "take decisions, invest and spend without any hesitation". He added the country will emerge out of the current slowdown much stronger.nn
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: US, India announce annual Parliamentary Exchange from 2020
text: The US and India have announced establishment of an annual Parliamentary Exchange to discuss issues of strategic importance to the bilateral relationship, said a press release on Thursday. The initiative is expected to begin sometime in 2020, said the release. The announcement coincided with the US-India 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP deletes its tweet on NRC amid anti-CAA protests across India
text: Amid the protests against CAA and NRC across India, the official handle of BJP deleted one of its tweets on NRC. "We will ensure implementation of NRC in the entire country. We will remove every single infiltrator from the country, except Buddhists, Hindus and Sikhs," the now-deleted tweet had read. BJP had put out the tweet on April 11.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Half of US population will have obesity by 2030: Harvard study
text: A new study led by Harvard TH Chan School of Public Health has claimed that about half of the population of the USA will have obesity by the year 2030. The team estimates that, currently, 40% of American adults have obesity and 18% have severe obesity. The researchers used self-reported body mass index data from over 6.2 million adults.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: RBI announces India's version of 'Operation Twist'
text: The Reserve Bank of India has said it will conduct a simultaneous sale and purchase of bonds, a concept similar to 'Operation Twist' used by the US Federal Reserve in 2011-2012. The central bank will buy ₹10,000 crore worth of 10-year bonds while selling an equal amount of bonds maturing in 2020 in an effort to bring longer-term yields lower.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Ranveer, Ranbir are the most stylish men in Bollywood: Yami Gautam
text: Yami Gautam has said that actors Ranveer Singh and Ranbir Kapoor are the most stylish men in Bollywood. "I think it's not just about the clothes...you wear but also about...kind of personality that you have and how you portray it onscreen," she added. "I feel you shouldn't wear clothes that make you feel awkward and uncomfortable," Yami further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: It's been tough, really proud of her: Ram on wife Sona's #Metoo fight
text: Musician Ram Sampath has said that he's proud of his wife, Sona Mohapatra, for standing up for the #Metoo movement and added that it's been a "very hard, a very tough battle". Ram further said that the movement is not a "flash in the pan", adding, "It's a cultural movement. It's...paradigm shift and it's going to change...future of our business."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Violence will make it easier for govt to suppress: AAP to protesters
text: Aam Aadmi Party's Sanjay Singh on Thursday said people should peacefully protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Singh said that if violence takes place then it will be "very easy for the government to suppress the whole movement" and "slander the whole cause". He also appealed to people not to be instigated by anyone and follow the path of non-violence.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Needed destructive middle-order player so we bought Maxwell: Kumble
text: Speaking about his team's purchase of Glenn Maxwell for ₹10.75 crore, Kings XI Punjab head coach Anil Kumble said, "[I]n the middle order we needed someone who could really be a destructive player and that's why we chose Maxwell." "[W]e were lucky to get (Jimmy) Neesham, (Sheldon) Cottrell and (Chris) Jordan," Kumble added.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Himachal's Zeena Khitta wins gold in women's national 10m Air Rifle
text: Himachal Pradesh's Zeena Khitta has won gold in women's 10m Air Rifle event at the 63rd National Shooting Championship. Khitta secured the top position after she finished ahead of world number two Apurvi Chandela and world number 24 Mehuli Ghosh. While Zeena, who was fourth in qualifying, shot 252.2, Mehuli finished with 250.5 and Apurvi with 227.6.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Rafael Nadal, Ashleigh Barty named ITF World Champions for 2019
text: Spaniard Rafael Nadal and Australian Ashleigh Barty have been named International Tennis Federation's (ITF) World Champions for 2019. Nadal, who's currently the world number one, this year won his 12th French Open and a fourth US Open. Barty, who's also on top in women's rankings, won her maiden Grand Slam title this year after defeating Marketa Vondrousova in French Open.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: India's first 3D 'trick art' museum is located in Chennai
text: India's first interactive three-dimensional art museum is located in Chennai and houses paintings designed to 'trick' the eye. Called 'Click Art Museum', it holds 3D paintings such as 'Mona Lisa' reaching outside the frame to grab someone's shirt, a chimpanzee taking selfies and Charlie Chaplin poking a visitor with his cane. The museum was created by renowned artist AP Shreethar.
author: Dharna

headlines: Chimpanzees may be making 'music' with rock-throwing act: Study
text: After observing grown male chimpanzees across West Africa throw rocks at trees and run away, researchers claim that the activity is either a method of communication or the apes like the sound of a rock hitting a tree. Researchers found out that chimpanzees' favourite trees to throw rocks at were those with a lower, longer-lasting sound, such as Treculia trees.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Microdosing LSD for Alzheimer's proves safe in early human trial
text: Researchers have safely conducted the human trial of microdosing lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) in healthy older individuals for the treatment and prevention of Alzheimer's disease (AD). As a part of the study, 48 individuals having an average age of 62.9 years were orally administered 5 μg, 10 μg, and 20 μg LSD every fourth day over a 21-day period.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Early exposure to pet dogs linked to less schizophrenia diagnoses: Study
text: A study of 1,371 participants found that people who are exposed to a pet dog before their 13th birthday are as much as 24% less likely to be later diagnosed with schizophrenia. The researchers state that early exposure to pets as an environmental factor may help alter the human immune systems genetically or otherwise predisposed to develop psychiatric disorders.
author: Dishant Sharma

headlines: Fitch cuts India's GDP growth forecast for FY20 to 4.6%
text: Rating agency Fitch on Friday cut India's GDP growth forecast for the fiscal year ended March 2020 to 4.6% from 5.5% it projected earlier. It attributed the downgrade to a shortage of credit availability from non-banking financial companies, and weakening business and consumer confidence. Fitch, however, estimated the economic growth to recover to 5.6% in 2020-21 and 6.5% in 2021-2022.
author: Dharna

headlines: Media changes my girlfriend with every coffee outing: Kartik on Kareena's show
text: When Kareena Kapoor asked Kartik Aaryan who he is dating on her radio talk show, the actor said, "I go out for coffee, like people normally do. According to the media, my girlfriend changes with every coffee outing." "Sometimes, my mother reads about my link-ups and tells me 'Beta, you are dating her'," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Wonder how many know what's CAA: IPS officer on Farhan's reason to protest
text: Reacting to Farhan Akhtar's answer on why he was at anti-CAA protests, IPS officer D Roopa tweeted, "If this is with celebrities like [Farhan], I wonder how many protestors actually know what is CAA, how many students joined out of peer pressure". When asked the reason, Farhan had said, "If everything was okay, why would so many people be concerned?"
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Boy who starred in Kai Po Che! as 14-yr-old bought by Mumbai Indians in auction
text: Maharashtra's 21-year-old all-rounder Digvijay Deshmukh, who portrayed the character of Ali Hashmi, an aspiring cricketer, in 2013 film 'Kai Po Che!' was bought by Mumbai Indians in IPL 2020 auction. Digvijay was sold at his base price of ₹20 lakh. The youngster, who made his domestic cricket debut in a T20 in November, has played seven T20s so far.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: FIR against actor Siddharth, 600 others for staging CAA protests in Chennai
text: An FIR has been filed against actor Siddharth and singer TM Krishna among around 600 people, who participated in protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Chennai. They have been accused of unlawful assembly" and "staging protest" by defying orders at Valluvar Kottam in the city on Thursday. Siddharth is yet to respond to the FIR.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Ex-Prez Mukherjee's daughter detained near Shah's house in anti-CAA protest
text: Delhi Mahila Congress President Sharmistha Mukherjee, who is the daughter of former President Pranab Mukherjee, was detained near Home Minister Amit Shah's residence during an anti-CAA protest on Friday. Around 50 other women members of the Delhi Mahila Congress were also detained, Sharmistha said. They were taken to the Mandir Marg police station.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: IIM-B'lore students leave footwear outside campus after not being allowed to protest
text: After Bengaluru Police imposed Section 144 in the city, IIM-Bangalore students left their footwear and posters outside the campus gate to register their protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. A professor said that students will hold the protest only after Section 144 is lifted. Several people protesting against the Act in the city were detained by the police on Thursday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Small hiccups don't define your career: Irfan after Yusuf goes unsold in auction
text: After his brother Yusuf Pathan went unsold in IPL 2020 auction, all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to share a throwback picture from 2007 T20 World Cup. "Small hiccups don't define your career...you've been outstanding through out. A real match winner. Love you always Lala @iamyusufpathan," Irfan wrote alongside the picture. Yusuf had played each of last 12 IPL seasons.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: A lot of fake tweets going around: Ganguly on Sana's Instagram post on CAA
text: Referring to his daughter Sana's Instagram post on CAA, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "I've said what I had to on Twitter and that is what it is." He added, "There are a lot of fake tweets going around....just be careful in what you pick up." Sana had posted an excerpt from Khushwant Singh's novel 'The End of India'.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Alexa told me to stab myself in heart for greater good, says UK woman
text: A 29-year-old UK-based woman has said that Amazon's voice assistant Alexa went "rogue" and told her to make sure to stab herself in the heart "for the greater good". Danni Morritt had asked her Echo device about 'cardiac cycle' while studying when Alexa answered that beating of heart was body's "worst process" and bad for Earth as it caused overpopulation.
author: Dharna

headlines: CAA makes me concerned about my plans to fund businesses in India: Tim Draper
text: American billionaire venture capitalist Tim Draper has said the Citizenship (Amendment) Act makes him "seriously concerned" about his plans to fund businesses in India. The law offers citizenship to non-Muslim migrants from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan who settled in India before 2015. "Unfairness permeates society like cancer. I don't want to invest to support bad behaviour," Draper said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 1st black hole image named breakthrough of 2019 by journal Science
text: The first-ever real image of a black hole, created using the Event Horizon Telescope's observations, was named as 2019's 'Breakthrough of the Year' on Thursday by the US journal Science. The image shows the event horizon, a bright ring formed as light bends in the intense gravity around the black hole that is 6.5 billion times more massive than Sun.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Earth's inner core could be covered by iron 'snow', say researchers
text: Researchers, including those from the University of Texas, found that the Earth's inner core is covered with "snow" made of tiny particles of iron. The "snow" falls from the outer core and piles on the inner core, researchers said. Scientists study the core by recording and analysing signals from seismic waves as they pass through Earth, they added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Pay 65% of legal costs to India in Hyderabad Nizam case: UK court to Pak
text: A UK court ordered Pakistan to pay 65% of legal costs to India and the two princes party in the Hyderabad Nizam case. The court had ruled earlier that a sum of £1 million transferred by the finance minister of Hyderabad's last Nizam to Pakistan's envoy to the UK in 1948 belongs to the Nizam's descendants and the Indian government.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Trump picks Indian-American scientist to lead National Science Foundation
text: US President Donald Trump has picked Indian-American computer scientist Sethuraman Panchanathan to lead National Science Foundation. "Panchanathan brings to this position a wealth of experience in research, innovation, academic administration, and policy as exemplified by his distinguished career," the White House said. Panchanathan is currently the Executive VP at the Arizona State University.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Pak govt calls for removal of judge over his 'drag Musharraf's body' verdict
text: The Pakistan government on Thursday called for the removal of the leader of a three-judge panel which ruled that the corpse of former President Pervez Musharraf should be dragged to the D-Chowk and hanged for three days if he dies before his execution. Pakistan Law Minister Farogh Naseem said that the judgment showed that the judge was "mentally unfit".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Kangana had to put on some weight for her role in Panga: Director
text: Filmmaker Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari has revealed that Kangana Ranaut had to put on some weight to portray a Kabbadi player in her upcoming film, 'Panga'. "Her body type is such...it doesn't look extra on her. She immediately lost...kilos, but has put them back for her next," she said. "I don't know how she does it over and over," Ashwiny added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Visuals which I saw in Jamia, I didn't feel were pleasant: Taapsee
text: Talking about the police action on students protesting against Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Jamia Millia Islamia, Taapsee Pannu said, "Visuals which I saw in Jamia, I didn't feel...were pleasant." "I felt...sad when I saw...videos where students were talking about their plight," she added. Taapsee further said she hasn't expressed her views on CAA yet as she's not studied about it.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Akshay beats Salman, becomes highest earning B'wood celeb in 2019
text: With an estimated earning of ₹293.25 crore in 2019, Akshay Kumar has become the highest earning Bollywood celebrity and beaten Amitabh Bachchan (₹239.25 crore) and Salman Khan (₹229.25 crore). The list released by Forbes India includes Shah Rukh Khan (₹124.38 crore) and Ranveer Singh (₹118.2 crore) in top 10, as per their earnings. Alia Bhatt (₹59.21 crore) bagged 20th position.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: No one can equal Govinda, Karisma in Coolie No. 1: David Dhawan
text: David Dhawan, who's remaking his 1995 film 'Coolie No. 1' with Varun Dhawan and Sara Ali Khan, has said the original pair, Govinda and Karisma Kapoor, created magic on screen. He added that no one can equal them and shouldn't even try to do that. David further said the two pairs are not comparable as they belong to different eras.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Protesting is no crime: Siddaramaiah on Mangaluru police firing
text: Senior Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday said that protesting is not a crime over the death of two protesters in police firing in Mangaluru on Thursday. "The protesters had not damaged public property but were protesting against unjust CAA (Citizenship Amendment Act)," he added. "There were other ways to suppress protests," he further said.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Can't agree to NRC without reading its draft: LJP's Chirag Paswan
text: Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) president Chirag Paswan on Thursday said that his party cannot say yes to National Register of Citizens (NRC) without fully reading its draft. "As for Citizenship (Amendment) Act, it would have no adverse impact on Muslims living in India," he added. LJP spokesperson Ashraf Ansari said that CAA and NRC shouldn't be "confused with each other".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: No Bangladeshi will get to enter Assam after CAA: CM Sonowal
text: Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal has said that the state will "always be of the Assamese" and added that its "land, language and culture will be protected". This comes amid reports claiming that one-two crore Bangladeshis would enter Assam after Citizenship (Amendment) Bill becoming an Act (CAA). "Those who...gave false details about immigrants are responsible for...violence," Sonowal added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: RJD calls for Bihar bandh on December 21 against CAA
text: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has called for Bihar bandh on December 21 against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). "The act is unconstitutional and against humanity. It exposes the divisive character of BJP," RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said. On Thursday, one person was killed in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, while two others lost their lives in Karnataka's Mangaluru during anti-CAA protests.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Online home design startup Livspace in talks to raise $100 mn: Report
text: Bengaluru-based interior design marketplace Livspace is in talks to raise $100 million at a valuation of over $500 million, a report said. While its existing investors, IKEA and Ratan Tata’s UC-RNT Fund, are reported to participate in the round, Kharis Capital will be leading it. In May, Livspace had raised an undisclosed amount from IKEA's largest franchise partner INGKA Group.n
author: Aishwarya

headlines: AAP launches 2020 election campaign with 'Ache beete 5 saal...' slogan
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal-led Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has launched its campaign for the 2020 Delhi Assembly elections. The party revealed its official slogan 'Ache beete 5 saal, lage raho Kejriwal' (Past five years have been good, keep going Kejriwal'). Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that the AAP government will take its "report card" to the people next week.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 1 dead, 5 injured in shooting near Russian intelligence HQ in Moscow
text: One person was killed and five others were injured on Thursday after a gunman opened fire near the headquarters of Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) in central Moscow. The FSB said that attack was carried out by one shooter who was later "neutralised". The FSB, the successor to the Soviet-era security service KGB, didn't comment on the shooter's motives.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: India cuts FY20 fuel demand estimates by 3.3 million tonnes
text: The Petroleum Ministry has revised its estimates for fuel consumption in India to 216 million tonnes in the financial year 2019-20, about 3.3 million tonnes lower than its earlier estimates. With this, the fuel demand is reportedly expected to grow 1.3% in the year, at the slowest pace in six years. India consumed 213 million tonnes of fuel in 2018-19.
author: Dharna

headlines: Bhim Army chief detained while leading anti-CAA protest at Jama Masjid
text: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad has been detained while leading a protest march against Citizenship (Amendment) Act from Jama Masjid to Jantar Mantar in Delhi. He was seen carrying BR Ambedkar's picture and a copy of Indian Constitution in his hands. The authorities have shut entry and exit gates of Chawri Bazar, Lal Quila and Jama Masjid metro stations.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Internet, SMS services suspended in 14 UP districts till Saturday noon
text: Internet and text messaging services have been suspended till 12pm on Saturday in 14 Uttar Pradesh districts after violent protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act on Thursday. The districts include Lucknow, Meerut, Ghaziabad, Bareilly, Mau, Azamgarh, Agra, Kanpur and Unnao among others. As many as 3,505 people have also been kept under preventive custody, according to authorities.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Ex-BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar jailed for life for raping minor girl in 2017
text: Former BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar has been sentenced to life in jail after being found guilty of raping a woman in UP's Unnao in 2017 when she was aged 17. The court has also ordered Sengar to pay a compensation of ₹10 lakh to the victim. It has asked CBI to offer necessary protection to the victim and her family.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Biochemist crowned Miss America 2020 after she performs experiment on stage
text: A Virginian biochemist has been named winner of Miss America 2020 after performing a science experiment on stage. In her acceptance speech, Camille Schrier said she hoped to "break stereotypes about what it means to be a Miss America in 2020". The 24-year-old has two undergraduate science degrees and is studying a doctorate in pharmacy at Virginia Commonwealth University.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Bhim Army chief escapes with supporters' help after being detained: Police
text: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad, who's leading a protest march against Citizenship (Amendment) Act from Jama Masjid to Jantar Mantar, escaped police custody after being detained on Friday, Delhi Police said. He was taken out of the spot by his supporters, the police added. He was holding the march despite being denied permission by the police.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: OnePlus launches Bug Bounty programme to boost cybersecurity
text: OnePlus announced the launch of two initiatives to boost its cybersecurity. OnePlus Security Response Centre will offer a bug bounty ranging from $50 to $7,000 to security experts who discover potential risks. OnePlus has also partnered with HackerOne, a hacker-powered security platform, which will tap into their network of security experts to surface the most relevant security vulnerabilities.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Weinstein asked me to undress, forced me to touch his penis: Ex-model
text: A former Polish model has accused producer Harvey Weinstein of sexually assaulting her when she was a 16-year-old aspiring actress, according to a newly filed lawsuit. Kaja Sokola, now 33, alleged that Weinstein "aggressively and threateningly demanded sex and instructed her to take off her clothes", and forced her to touch his penis while he "grabbed at her breasts".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 15 journos detained while covering post-mortem of 2 killed in Mangaluru protests
text: Over 15 journalists were detained by the Mangaluru police on Friday, while they were covering the post-mortem of two people who died during protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. The police said that the journalists were being questioned because they were not carrying 'accreditation cards' issued to them. The reporters belonged to news outlets like Asianet, Manorama and News18.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Police chase protestors inside Mangaluru hospital after they pelt stones
text: CCTV footage have surfaced online, showing police personnel with lathis in hands chasing people protesting against Citizenship (Amendment) Act inside a hospital in Karnataka's Mangaluru. Videos showed protestors pelting stones at the police and some of them running inside the hospital. A video also showed the officers banging and kicking doors inside the hospital.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Police use drone cameras to monitor situation in Delhi amid CAA protests
text: Amid protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019, the Delhi Police is using five drone cameras in North-East Delhi to monitor the situation in the area. This comes after Section 144 was imposed in 12 out of 14 stations of North-East Delhi. Reportedly, police is conducting flag march and keeping a close eye on social media accounts.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Very proud: Paytm CEO after Satya Nadella named FT Person of the Year
text: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to congratulate Microsoft's India-born CEO Satya Nadella on being named Financial Times Person of the Year. "Very proud...Simply incredible leadership and one of the biggest turnaround story of our time," Sharma said on Nadella and his role as Microsoft's CEO. Sharma also shared a photo with Nadella.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: US-based Indian techie pleads guilty to $7-mn insider trading scheme
text: Janardhan Nellore, a 42-year-old Silicon Valley-based Indian IT professional, has pleaded guilty to insider trading charges. A former IT administrator at Palo Alto Networks, Nellore admitted to trading on confidential earnings information about the firm that he obtained through his credentials. Nellore and four others with whom he shared the data, earned over $7 million in illegal trading profits.
author: Dharna

headlines: WhatsApp spyware used on Indians targeted Pakistani officials too: Report
text: Israeli spyware Pegasus allegedly targeted mobile phones of at least two dozen Pakistani government officials earlier this year, The Guardian reported. At least two dozen Indian journalists, activists and human rights lawyers were among the reported 121 Indians targeted by the spyware. The Facebook-owned platform had revealed that around 1,400 global users were spied on using the tool.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Lenskart turns unicorn with $231 mn funding from SoftBank Vision Fund II
text: Eyewear startup Lenskart is raising $231 million (around ₹1,644 crore) from SoftBank Vision Fund II Lightbulb as part of its Series G round, as per regulatory filings sourced from paper.vc. The deal takes Lenskart's post-money valuation to $1.5 billion, marking its entry into the 'unicorn' startup club. The Faridabad-based startup also raised around $55 million from Kedaara Capital in September.
author: Dharna

headlines: After EU, US approves decade-old investigational Ebola vaccine
text: Weeks after European Union issued marketing authorisation for decade-old investigational vaccine 'Ervebo' to prevent Ebola virus in adults, the US FDA has also approved it. The EU had granted a "conditional marketing authorisation", which is a type of approval reserved for medicine that addresses unmet medical needs. Notably, an ongoing Ebola outbreak in the Congo has killed over 2,000 people.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: World's oldest fossil forest found, dates back 386 million years
text: Scientists found the world's oldest known fossil forest in a sandstone quarry in Cairo, New York. It's believed the extensive network of trees is around 386 million years old, Cardiff University said. This makes the Cairo forest around 2-3 million years older than what was thought to be the world's oldest forest at Gilboa, also in New York, it added.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Smriti Irani reacts to Farhan's answers on CAA protests, says 'Whattay'
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Friday took to Twitter to share a video of actor Farhan Akhtar answering questions on the anti-CAA protests. Reacting to the video, Irani tweeted, "Whattay......" along with a face-palm emoji. In the video, on being asked why he was at the protest, Farhan replied, "If everything was okay, why would so many people be concerned?"
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: US man gets 15-yr jail for stealing LGBT flag, burning it outside strip club
text: A US man has been jailed for over 15 years for stealing an LGBT pride flag from a church and burning it outside a strip club. Adolfo Martinez said he did this because he is against homosexuality. He was found guilty last month of hate crime, harassment, reckless use of fire and being a habitual offender.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Anand Mahindra to become Non-Executive Chairman of M&M from April
text: Billionaire Anand Mahindra will transition to the role of Non-Executive Chairman at Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) with effect from April 1, 2020, to comply with SEBI guidelines. Managing Director Pawan Goenka will be re-designated as MD and CEO from April 1. Anish Shah, the Group President (Strategy), will succeed Goenka as MD and CEO after his term ends in 2021.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Lucky to have been accepted in the industry: Sidharth Malhotra
text: Sidharth Malhotra has said he's been lucky to be among a "handful of actors" who've been accepted in the industry. "Since 2012, there has been...feeling that people like to see my face on...screen," he added. "People see potential, they like my work, and I think that's where my performances override my consecutive films that haven't done well," Sidharth further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: A film with both Shah Rukh, Salman almost happened: Producer Nikhil
text: Producer Nikhil Dwivedi has revealed that a film starring both Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan had almost happened but director Sanjay Leela Bhansali wasn't happy with the second half of the script. "[He] wanted more time to work on it," Nikhil added. On being asked if there is a chance that the project would be revived, Nikhil said, "I've...doubts."
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Violence should not be the solution: Rajinikanth on anti-CAA protests
text: Rajinikanth on Thursday took to Twitter to express his thoughts regarding the ongoing protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in the country. "Violence should not be the solution for the problems," he wrote. "Indian citizens should stand united and [be] aware [of] the nation's security and welfare. I am deeply saddened...because of the undergoing violence," Rajinikanth added.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: This is ideological opposition, Gandhi Ji also did that: Swara
text: Swara Bhasker, who joined the protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act on Thursday at Mumbai's August Kranti Maidan, said their protest is an "ideological opposition". "Gandhi Ji also did ideological opposition...This is part of the democratic opposition," she added. Swara further said that the demonstrations are for the "unity between Hindus, Muslims and other communities in the country".
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: FIR registered against SP leaders over violence during protests in UP
text: After protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act turned violent in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal, FIR was registered against 17 people including Samajwadi Party (SP) leaders Shafiqur Rahman Barq and Firoz Khan. Police has alleged that the Samajwadi Party was "responsible" for inciting violence in the name of protests. Reportedly, four state buses and six police vehicles were vandalised on Thursday.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 'Plot to kill PM' in draft charges against accused in Bhima-Koregaon case
text: Pune Police submitted draft charges against 19 accused in Bhima-Koregaon case, to an Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) special court. Conspiracy to "assassinate" PM Narendra Modi, "waging war" against the nation, are among the 16 charges. Reportedly, "inflammatory speeches" at Elgar Parishad conclave had led to caste violence in Koregaon Bhima in 2017 in which one person was killed.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Patanjali Ayurved acquires Ruchi Soya for ₹4,350 crore
text: Baba Ramdev's Patanjali Ayurved has completed the acquisition of debt-ridden Ruchi Soya for ₹4,350 crore under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code. With this, Patanjali owns Ruchi Soya brands such as Nutrela, Sunrich and Ruchi Gold. While Patanjali MD Acharya Balkrishna was appointed as the Chairman and MD of Ruchi Soya, Ramdev was appointed as a non-executive director on its board.
author: Dharna

headlines: Pre-Bookings for Tata Altroz are now open
text: Pre-Bookings are now open for Tata's premium hatchback, Altroz. Inspired by the world of laser carving, the car features a sporty exterior with split tail lamps and integrated spoiler while the interiors are designed to be modern. The car features BS6 petrol & diesel engine options along with a host of segment-first features like custom packs across variants.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Entry and exit gates of all metro stations opened in Delhi
text: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has announced that all the metro stations have been opened and tweeted, "Normal services have resumed in all stations." This comes three hours after DMRC announced that Jamia Millia Islamia and Jasola Vihar Shaheen Bagh metro stations had been closed. On Thursday, 20 metro stations including Lal Quila were shut amid anti-CAA protests.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Who were the most expensive buys in the IPL 2020 auction?
text: Australian pacer Pat Cummins became IPL 2020 auction's most expensive buy after being bought for ₹15.5 crore by KKR. Cummins also became the most expensive overseas buy in IPL history. KXIP spent ₹10.75 crore on Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell, making him the second-most expensive buy. Spinner Piyush Chawla became IPL 2020's most expensive Indian buy at ₹6.75 crore.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: DCP sings National Anthem to calm protestors in Bengaluru; they join him
text: A video has surfaced online, showing DCP of Bengaluru (Central) Chetan Singh Rathore singing National Anthem to calm the people gathered to protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. The protestors stood and joined the officer to sing the anthem. In order to convince them to leave, Rathore also warned them about anti-social elements that use such agitations for their benefit.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 25-yr-old killed during CAA protest in Lucknow; internet suspended in city
text: A 25-year-old man died during violent protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Thursday. Internet and SMS services have been suspended in the city till December 21 noon, according to an Uttar Pradesh government order. As many as 10 cars, 20 motorcycles, three buses and four news vans were set on fire during protests in the city.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 2 people killed, 20 police personnel injured during anti-CAA protests in Mangaluru
text: At least two people were killed in Karnataka's Mangaluru during violent protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act on Thursday, police said. Protestors carried out demonstrations in Mangaluru despite Section 144 being imposed there. As many as 20 police personnel have also been injured in the violence, Mangaluru Police Commissioner PS Harsha said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Anti-CAA protestors pelt stones at Gujarat Police; locals try to save officers
text: A video has surfaced online showing a group of people cornering police personnel and pelting stones at them in Gujarat's Ahmedabad during protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. While the policemen try to shield themselves, some locals stand in front of them to stop the protestors from hurting the officers and rescue them. Several policemen were injured in the incident.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 50-yr-old gets 5 yrs in jail for ₹853 crore theft from Facebook, Google
text: A 50-year-old Lithuanian man who scammed Facebook and Google into sending him over ₹853 crore ($120 million) was sentenced to a five-year jail term. The man and his accomplices sent payment emails to the two technology giants disguised as their Taiwanese business partner. The accused was arrested in Lithuania in 2017 and extradited to the US, where he pleaded guilty.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Facebook building own OS to end reliance on Android: Report
text: Facebook is reportedly building its own operating system (OS) in a bid to reduce reliance on the Google-owned Android platform. Facebook's smartphone apps will remain available on Android, while its OS would primarily be for hardware like Oculus or augmented reality glasses, the report suggested. It also suggested that Facebook is hoping to take a similar approach to Apple.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: US teen finds her stolen car through Apple's 'Find My iPhone' tool
text: A 19-year-old woman in the US tracked and recovered her stolen car using the 'Find my' app available on iPhones. The car was stolen after Victoria O'Connor left her car keys, iPhone and wallet inside the vehicle while visiting a convenience store. After discerning the iPhone's location with the app, the police recovered her car from a nearby apartment complex.
author: Dharna

headlines: Amazon tracked people attending its conference via Bluetooth badges
text: Amazon confirmed reports that it provided Bluetooth-enabled badges to attendees of its 're:Invent' conference in Las Vegas. The e-commerce giant claimed that the data obtained was anonymous and to help understand attendance at certain events. "We knew something was different this year because...if you lost your lanyard, you'd [have to] pay $150 to replace," Motherboard quoted an unnamed attendee.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Data of over 267 million Facebook users found leaked on dark web
text: A database containing user IDs, phone numbers and names of over 267 million Facebook users was exposed on a dark web forum, available for download, found security researcher Bob Diachenko and Comparitech. It was allegedly stolen through illegal scraping or Facebook API abuse by criminals in Vietnam. Researchers said the data could be used for large-scale spam and phishing campaigns.
author: Dharna

headlines: 2018 Tesla car-crash likely occurred as speed was 187 kmph: US NTSB
text: US National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB), in its final report on the Tesla Model S car crash in Florida last year, said the accident likely occurred as the car was travelling at over 187 kmph. "The probable cause...was the driver's loss of control as a result of excessive speed", NTSB said. The crash had claimed the lives of two 18-year-olds.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: OYO denies it plans to fire up to 2,000 India employees before Feb
text: OYO denied source-backed claims cited in a media report that it plans to fire up to 2,000 employees in India by January-end. The Gurugram-based startup said it has a performance-based system with monthly employee evaluations. The media report had also claimed that OYO has fired over 120 people from its sales team of 180 in Mumbai.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Russian motorist converts car into Cybertruck replica; video viral
text: A car which had its exterior converted to replicate Tesla's newly unveiled 'Cybertruck' was spotted being driven around in the Russian city Khimki. A viral Instagram video of the replica showed that it had a functional rear light bar like the actual electric pickup truck and a Russian licence plate. Tesla's Cybertruck is expected to go into production in 2021.
author: Dharna

headlines: Won't allow students boycotting exams to register for next semester: JNU
text: JNU has warned its students, who are boycotting exams, that they won't be eligible to register in the next semester if they fall short of the academic requirements. Recently, JNU announced that it would be conducting exams through WhatsApp and email amid a boycott of exams by students. The university's students are protesting on the issue of hostel fee hike.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: I have no interest in meeting her: EAM Jaishankar on US lawmaker Jayapal
text: Reacting to a report that he had cancelled a meeting with US lawmakers, including Congresswoman Pramila Jayapal, who criticised Indian government's Kashmir moves in her report, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "I have no interest in meeting her." "I don't think her report is a fair understanding of the situation in Jammu & Kashmir," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Houses of 3 men who sexually assaulted a woman, killed a man set on fire in MP
text: Residents of a Madhya Pradesh village on Thursday set fire to houses of three men accused of killing another villager and sexually assaulting his pregnant sister-in-law over a plot of land awarded under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. The villagers pelted police with stones and damaged their jeep, leading to a lathi-charge and firing of tear gas shells by the police.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Take immediate and irreversible action against terrorists: India, US tell Pak
text: India and the US have asked Pakistan to take immediate and irreversible action to ensure that no territory under its control is used for terrorism against other countries. The countries also asked Pakistan to prosecute the perpetrators of cross-border terror attacks, including Mumbai and Pathankot. The joint statement was issued at the end of the second India-US 2+2 dialogue.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Impeachment charges against Trump 'absolutely made up': Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the impeachment charges against his US counterpart Donald Trump are "absolutely made up". The Democrats had accused Trump of conspiring with Russia but the accusations had turned out to be false as well...and it couldn't be the basis for impeachment," Putin added. "Now there is this made-up pressure on Ukraine," he further said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Want an 'immediate' Senate impeachment trial: US President Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said that he wants an "immediate" Senate impeachment trial. "So after the Democrats gave me no due process in the House...they now want to tell the Senate how to run their trial," he tweeted. Republicans have majority in the Senate, where two-thirds of the 100 Senators will have to vote to remove Trump from office.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Tenet is the most ambitious movie I've ever made: Christopher Nolan
text: Filmmaker Christopher Nolan, while talking about his upcoming film 'Tenet', said that it is the most ambitious film that he has ever made. He added that the film was shot in seven different countries "with a massive cast and huge set pieces". "We're crossing a few different genres in a hopefully exciting and fresh way," Nolan further said.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Matter of national shame: Javed after Guha's detention for CAA protest
text: Javed Akhtar on Thursday took to Twitter to condemn the detention of historian Ramachandra Guha during a protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Bengaluru. "This great Indian is much above narrow political partisan considerations. Some may not agree with him but any attempt to [silence] him is...matter of national shame," he wrote. Guha was released from detention on Thursday evening.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: Kota Factory beats Sacred Games to top IMDb's Indian web series list
text: TVF's 'Kota Factory' has been named as the top Indian web series of 2019 in a list released by IMDb. Following 'Kota Factory' is Saif Ali Khan and Nawazuddin Siddiqui-starrer 'Sacred Games' and Manoj Bajpayee's 'The Family Man' at the second and third position, respectively. The ratings are determined by users who rank TV shows on a 10 point scale.
author: Udit Gupta

headlines: BJP has become Bharatiya Jidd Party: Cong on anti-CAA protests
text: Amid ongoing protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Congress' Abhishek Singhvi on Thursday said that Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has become "Bharatiya Jidd Party". "You [BJP] have redefined a new definition of normalcy, the J-K definition on normalcy now prevails in...country," he added. "This is an undeclared emergency...BJP has become man-eater it seems," Singhvi further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Vote in record numbers: PM Modi on 5th phase of J'khand polls
text: PM Narendra Modi on Friday asked voters to vote in record numbers as the fifth and final phase of Jharkhand Assembly elections began at 7 am. "I request all voters to vote in record numbers and join this festival of democracy," he tweeted. The final phase will witness voting for 16 Assembly seats wherein 237 candidates are contesting.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Gang chases recently engaged inter-caste couple in K'taka, kills fiancé
text: An inter-caste couple, who got engaged fifteen days ago, was chased by a gang of six who killed the fiancé in Karnataka's Koratagere on Thursday. The incident took place when the couple was returning from fiancé's native village. Reportedly, the deceased had developed a rivalry with the gang and the police said that they're investigating the angle of 'supari' killing.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Internet services suspended in Ghaziabad from 10 pm tonight for 24 hrs
text: Ghaziabad District Administration on Thursday said that the Internet services will remain suspended in the district from 10 pm tonight for 24 hours till 10 pm on December 20. The move comes amid the protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Earlier today, several vehicles were set on fire during anti-CAA protests in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mobile Internet suspended in Karnataka's Mangaluru for 48 hours
text: Mobile Internet services have been suspended for 48 hours in Karnataka's Mangaluru and rest of the Dakshina Kannada district. This comes after protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) turned violent in Mangaluru on Thursday. As many as 20 police personnel were injured in the violence, Mangaluru Police Commissioner PS Harsha said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Glad I went, I'll continue to protest: Guha after release from detention
text: Following his release from detention in Bengaluru, historian Ramachandra Guha said, "I am glad I went to the (anti-CAA) protest." "After being detained we were bundled together and put in a place in Adugodi, where I met more than 100 people of...diverse backgrounds. It was an...enriching experience," he added. "I will continue to protest against discriminatory laws," he further said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: His crime is that he's a human: Harbhajan on Jamia student who lost his eye
text: Sharing a post by Rajdeep Sardesai about the Jamia student who lost an eye in police action, Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "His crime is that he's a human." Harbhajan added, "It's so sad to hear from him what he has gone through..very sad for what’s happening in Delhi...this needs to stop." Harbhajan further urged people to maintain peace amid anti-CAA protests.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ronaldo jumps to a height of 8.39 feet to score NBA-style header, shares pics
text: Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo jumped to a height of 8.39 feet and scored the winner with a header to help his team defeat Sampdoria 2-1 in Serie A on Wednesday. Ronaldo later took to Instagram to share pictures of his header, writing, "CR7 AIR JORDAN!! #forzajuve #finoallafine." Meanwhile, Sampdoria manager said, "Ronaldo did something that you see in the NBA."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Chawla becomes IPL 2020 auction's most expensive Indian buy at ₹6.75 crore
text: Leg-spinner Piyush Chawla has become the most expensive Indian buy at IPL 2020 auction. The 30-year-old leg-spinner was bought for ₹6.75 crore by Chennai Super Kings. Chawla has played in each of the previous 12 IPL seasons, scoring 584 runs and taking 150 wickets in 157 matches. Pat Cummins was the costliest overseas buy in the auction (₹15.5 crore, KKR).nn
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Why is Virat Kohli so animated? Please ask him, says Kieron Pollard
text: On being asked about Team India captain Virat Kohli being animated after his dismissal in the second ODI, West Indies captain Kieron Pollard said, "You have to ask him why he is so animated. I can’t answer that for you." He added, "It is what it is. You ask him that question and let him answer that. I don’t know."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Man asked to pay ₹10 as e-wallet account recovery fee, cheated of ₹1.6L
text: A 66-year-old Mumbai businessman was allegedly cheated of ₹1.6 lakh by unidentified cyber fraudsters posing as an executive from an e-wallet company and demanding ₹10 as a recovery fee. The complainant received a message saying his e-wallet account is suspended over KYC rules. Seven OTPs were generated on his mobile number and ₹1.6 lakh was fraudulently debited from his account.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Lotus blooms in mud but it won't happen in Maha: Aaditya Thackeray
