text: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray in his first speech in the Assembly on Wednesday said that lotus blooms in mud but it won't happen in Maharashtra as Sena-NCP-Congress are together. Aaditya also said that had some people started reading the Saamana earlier, they would have been sitting with them, on Devendra Fadnavis' remark that he has started reading Sena's mouthpiece.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Voting begins for 16 seats in final phase of Jharkhand Assembly polls
text: Voting has begun in 16 constituencies for the fifth and final phase of polling for Jharkhand Assembly elections on Friday. As many as 237 candidates are contesting in the seats, of which 29 contestants are women. Chief electoral officer, Vinay Kumar Choubey said, "Few pockets in this phase are affected by left-wing extremism. We've ensured adequate security in every booth."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: JAP supporters dance to Bhojpuri songs in saris at anti-CAA protest in Bihar
text: Male supporters of Pappu Yadav-led Jan Adhikar Party on Thursday wore saris and danced to Bhojpuri songs on Mahatma Gandhi Setu over Ganga river during the party's anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protest in Bihar. Many others demonstrated on streets bare-chested despite the cold weather. Earlier, Yadav claimed he has been put under house arrest to prevent him from protesting against CAA.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: UK female politicians sworn in as MPs while carrying their babies
text: Several female politicians were sworn in as MPs in the UK while carrying their babies.  Labour MP Stella Creasy brought her baby in a sling, while Labour's Ellie Reeves and Conservative Party's Kemi Badenoch had their babies strapped to their front. Reeves and Badenoch are on maternity leave but needed to appear in person to take the oath.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US files appeal in India steel dispute at WTO's top court which it shut down
text: The US has filed an appeal in a steel dispute with India at WTO's Appellate Body, which doesn't have enough members to hear the appeal. The US rendered the Appellate Body powerless by blocking appointments for over two years. The terms of two of the body's three members came to the end last week, leaving it unable to issue rulings.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Drag Musharraf's body, hang it at chowk if he's found dead: Pak court
text: If Pakistan's ex-President Pervez Musharraf is found dead before his execution, his body should be dragged to Islamabad's D-Chowk and be hanged there for three days, the court that handed him the death sentence said in its verdict. "The convict be hanged by his neck till he dies on each count as per charge," it said in the 167-page verdict.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: US govt removes Black Panther's Wakanda from list of trading partners
text: The US Department of Agriculture on Thursday removed 'Wakanda', a fictional country from the movie 'Black Panther', from an online list of free trade partners. The department said Wakanda was added to the list by mistake during a test. The listing was first spotted by a software engineer who was looking up agricultural tariffs for a fellowship he is pursuing.n
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Indian consumers have been enjoying very low rates: Airtel Chairman
text: Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal on Thursday said he expects the industry's average revenue per user to go up to ₹300 per month from the current ₹200. "Indian consumers have been enjoying very low rates. But we need to have a balance between the requirement of investments and the consumer," Mittal added. Telecom operators recently hiked tariffs by up to 40%.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Can Articles 14, 15 and CAA, NRC stand together in law's eyes: Abhay
text: Abhay Deol on Thursday questioned, "Do we follow [Constitution of India] in every sense? Can [Articles 14 & 15] be scrapped?...Can those Articles and CAA & NRC stand together in the eyes of the law?" Notably, Article 15 prohibits discrimination against citizens on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or birthplace and objective of Article 14 is equality before law.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: West Bengal Governor calls for stopping anti-CAA agitation
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday said that as the Supreme Court has refused to stay the implementation of Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), people should "give up agitational path". He urged people to stop protesting "in the interest of peace so that normalcy returns and suffering of people is contained".
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: People should do Satyagraha against CAA: Ex-UP CM Akhilesh Yadav
text: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Akhilesh Yadav urged the public to do Satyagraha against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019. He blamed the BJP for the violence and claimed the party had forced people to fight amongst themselves and created an atmosphere of hatred. Yadav also accused the police of frightening the public.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Pakistan all out for 191 on opening day in Karachi Test against SL
text: Sri Lanka dismissed Pakistan for 191 on the opening day of the second Test in Karachi on Thursday. While Pakistan's Asad Shafiq and Babar Azam were the only batsmen to cross the 50-run mark, Lankan pacer Lahiru Kumara and spinner Lasith Embuldeniya picked up four wickets each. Sri Lanka ended the day at 64/3 with Mathews and Embuldeniya at crease.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Russia to appeal against WADA's 4-year ban
text: Russian Anti-Doping Agency on Thursday voted to file an arbitration case with the Court of Arbitration for Sport in Switzerland against Russia's four-year ban from all sporting events including the Tokyo Olympics. Russian President Vladimir Putin termed the ban as "unfair" and "contradicting common sense". Russia was banned by the WADA over the tampering of doping tests.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Google alerts Indian users of data leak due to Chrome 79 bug
text: Google began sending notifications to Indian users to change their passwords on affected sites after a possible data leak due to a bug in its latest browser update, Chrome 79. Users reported receiving pop-ups by Google stating that their passwords may have been stolen. Chrome 79 rollout was paused after the bug deleted data from third-party apps on Android devices.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Kerala CM writes to Shah seeking help to stop attacks on students
text: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Thursday wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah seeking his intervention to prevent attacks on students from the State during anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests in New Delhi. "I wish to bring to your kind attention the state of anxiety of the parents and relatives of the students...in this regard," he said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: UK-US treaty bans WikiLeaks Founder Assange's extradition: Lawyer
text: WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange's lawyer said he cannot be sent to the US from the UK because a treaty between the two countries bans extradition for political offences. Assange faces 18 counts in the US that includes conspiring to hack government computers. He could spend decades in a US prison if convicted on the charges.n
author: Shailesh

headlines: UK govt rejects demand for new Scottish independence referendum
text: United Kingdom (UK) government has rejected Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon's demand for another Scottish independence referendum. "A second independence referendum next year would be a damaging distraction," the government said. "It would undermine the decisive result of the 2014 referendum and the promise made to the Scottish people that it was a once in a generation vote," it added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Sintex Industries’ lenders reject its $1 bn debt revamp plan: Report
text: Sintex Industries' lenders have reportedly rejected its $1 billion debt restructuring plan and intend to push it into bankruptcy. The plan proposed that Sintex would be able to service only 30% of total bank loans worth $888 million along with an infusion of about $28 million by two yarn producers into the company. Sintex's lead lender is Punjab National Bank.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Chanda Kochhar’s writ petition shouldn’t be entertained: RBI in court
text: An RBI counsel told Bombay HC to not entertain a writ petition filed by ex-CEO of ICICI Bank Chanda Kochhar, saying it would invite similar such petitions in future. Kochhar had moved the court in November challenging her termination from the bank and sought RBI's response. ICICI had said that RBI had given a go-ahead to Kochhar's termination in March.n
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Mangaluru Police fire shots in air as anti-CAA protesters defy Section 144
text: Mangaluru Police on Thursday fired shots in the air as protesters agitated against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act despite Section 144 being in force. Police said they fired in the air when protesters didn't calm after lathi-charge. Curfew has been imposed in five police station limits till tomorrow and all schools and colleges under Mangaluru City Corporation will remain shut tomorrow.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Imposing Sec 144 to prevent protests insult to India's soul: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has said that the government has no right to shut down colleges, telephones and internet and to halt metro trains. He said that imposing Section 144 to prevent peaceful protests is an insult to the soul of the nation. Notably, Section 144 was imposed near Red Fort in Delhi and entire Uttar Pradesh state on Thursday.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: CAA not a threat to citizenship of Indian Muslims: Ajmer Dargah head
text: The Citizenship (Amendment) Act does not pose any threat to the citizenship of Indian Muslims, the spiritual head of Ajmer Dargah, Syed Zainul Abedin Ali Khan said. "There is a need to clarify the fear and myth spreading among the Indian Muslims," he added. Khan urged the Centre to issue guidelines to police to not use force against protesting students.
author: Shailesh

headlines: No question of refusing Sahitya Akademi Award: Tharoor amid CAA row
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor who won the 2019 Sahitya Akademi Award for his book 'An Era of Darkness: The British Empire in India' said that there was no question of refusing the award amid protests over the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Tharoor said, "Even when a few years ago when the eminent writers returned the awards, I was...telling them not to."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: What are the rights of a person if he or she is detained by police?
text: As per law, being detained isn't the same as being arrested. The person must be produced before the nearest Magistrate within 24 hours of being detained, excluding the travelling time. He/She has the right to ask for a lawyer and the right to remain silent. A woman can be detained only by a policewoman, only before sunset and after sunrise.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Kings XI Punjab appoint KL Rahul as captain for IPL 2020
text: KXIP have appointed wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul as their captain. "He has been through a lot in the last year or so and has now come back strongly," KXIP co-owner Ness Wadia said. "He has silenced his critics. You'll get to see his ability not just as a batsman but also as a captain. He was our unanimous choice," he added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Kohli doesn't like you: Old video of Paine teasing new RCB buy Finch surfaces
text: After RCB bought Australian batsman Aaron Finch for ₹4.4 crore in IPL 2020 auction, Cricket Australia shared an old video of Australia Test captain Tim Paine teasing Finch for having played for "all" IPL franchises except RCB. "Virat Kohli doesn't like you," Paine can be heard saying. "No one likes me. That's why I keep moving," replies Finch.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 17-yr-old Yashasvi used to sell panipuri, now bought in IPL for ₹2.4 cr: Preity
text: After Rajasthan Royals bought 17-year-old Yashasvi Jaiswal for ₹2.4 crore in IPL 2020 auction, Kings XI Punjab co-owner Preity Zinta took to Twitter to praise IPL. "17-year-old Yashasvi...used to sell panipuri on streets for a living 2 years ago. Today this talented cricketer is bought by a franchise...₹2.40 crore. IPL really is a place where dreams come true," she wrote.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Dinesh Karthik to remain KKR captain despite Morgan's purchase: McCullum
text: Kolkata Knight Riders head coach Brendon McCullum has said that Dinesh Karthik will remain the captain of the franchise despite the team buying England limited-overs captain Eoin Morgan in the IPl 2020 auction for ₹5.25 crore. "A perfect lieutenant for Karthik, he will also fill the gap at no.4. He is in the form of his life," McCullum added.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Don't have to play against Bumrah: Lynn tweets checklist after MI buys him
text: Australian opener Chris Lynn shared a checklist after Mumbai Indians bought him for ₹2 crore in IPL 2020 auction. "Mumbai Indians. Quality Franchise. Flat wicket. Don't have to play against Jasprit Bumrah. Can't wait for IPL 2020," he wrote. Responding to Lynn, Mumbai Indians tweeted, "Chris Lynn. Hitting the ball. Out of the Wankhede. Lynnsanity. Can't wait for IPL 2020."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Maxwell has earned ₹31 crore across IPL auctions, most by an overseas player
text: Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has been bought for ₹10.75 crore by KXIP in IPL 2020 auction. The 31-year-old has earned around ₹31 crore across the auctions, which is the highest sum for any overseas player. He was bought by MI for $1 million in 2013, by KXIP for ₹6 crore in 2014 and by DC for ₹9 crore in 2018.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Oldest player in IPL 2020 auction, 48-yr-old Tambe, bought by KKR for ₹20 lakh
text: The oldest player in the IPL 2020 auction, 48-year-old spinner Pravin Tambe, has been bought by Kolkata Knight Riders for ₹20 lakh. If he plays a match next season, Tambe will become the oldest player to play an IPL match. The previous record holder is Brad Hogg, who played for KKR at the age of 44.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: We are out of NDA, but not with UPA: Shiv Sena
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has said that his party is not a part of the BJP-led NDA, but it is also not with the UPA led by the Congress. The Shiv Sena didn't join Congress-led group of parties that petitioned President Ram Nath Kovind against CAA. Shiv Sena has allied with the Congress and Nationalist Congress Party in Maharashtra.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: NASA's Mars 2020 rover passes first driving test successfully
text: NASA revealed that its next Mars rover passed the first driving test successfully. In the preliminary assessment of its activities on December 17, the rover rolled forward and backwards and pirouetted in a clean room at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California. "The next time the Mars 2020 rover drives, it will be rolling over Martian soil," NASA announced.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Would love to argue for Guha if he challenges his detention: Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram said he would love to appear and argue for historian Ramachandra Guha if he challenges his "illegal arrest and detention". "Ram Guha was not violating any law when he was arrested. He was alone! Sec 144 'prohibition' was not attracted," Chidambaram tweeted. Police detained protestors, including Guha, who gathered at Bengaluru's Town Hall on Thursday.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Jamia University website hacked, hacker posts four demands over CAA
text: Jamia Millia University official website (https://www.jmi.ac.in) was hacked on Thursday. Under the 'News' section, the hacker posted four demands which read, "1. Rollback CAA, 2. Rollback NRC, 3. Free unlawfully detained students, 4. Probe into police brutality." Further, the hacker termed PM Narendra Modi as "Modiolf Hitler" and Home Minister Amit Shah "Amitrich Shimmler".
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Wedding-crashers asked to leave, came back and killed groom: US police
text: A 30-year-old groom in California, US was beaten to death by two brothers who were kicked out after crashing the reception, said police. They allegedly got into a fight with some guests and were asked to leave. The groom's brother said the accused used a baseball bat, the same weapon prosecutors say the men used to assault two other guests.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Brazilian woman turns lingerie model at 79, says goal is to make women 'visible'
text: Helena Schargel from Brazil, who used to work for a fabric company for decades, has become a lingerie model. The 79-year-old, who has launched her own lingerie designs and modelled for them, said, "This project has a clear goal: to make women visible." "I never thought about how old I was, this never worried me," she added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Keep academic institutes away from politics: HRD Minister
text: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal on Thursday said that students are a priority of the Narendra Modi-led government and he appealed to political parties to keep academic institutions away from their politics. "Modi government is working day and night for their (students) better future," he added. The statement comes amid protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act across various universities.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 'Govt scared of historian': Mamata condemns Guha's detention
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday condemned the detention of historian Ramachandra Guha and others during anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019, protest in Bengaluru. "This government is scared of students. This government is scared of one of India's most accomplished historians," she tweeted. Hundreds of people were detained during protests in Bengaluru.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Meghalaya Assembly asks Centre to implement Inner Line Permit
text: Meghalaya Assembly adopted a resolution demanding the Centre to implement Inner Line Permit (ILP) in the state. The ILP is a travel document issued to outside travellers in Nagaland, Mizoram, Arunachal Pradesh and those regions of North-East covered under the Sixth Schedule. The Centre announced that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 won't be implemented in ILP areas.
author: Shailesh

headlines: I guarantee no wrong will be done to minorities: Bihar CM
text: Appealing for harmony and fraternity amongst people, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "As long as we are at the helm, I guarantee that no wrong will be done to the minorities." He added, "We don't think about who instigates whom, we are committed to working for every section of society." Kumar made the comments during a 'Jal-Jivan-Hariyali' campaign.
author: Shailesh

headlines: India end 2019 at 108th spot in FIFA rankings
text: The Indian men's football team has ended 2019 at 108th spot in the year-ending FIFA rankings after losing 11 places throughout the year. India were ranked 97th in 2018 year-ending rankings. While FIFA World Cup 2018 winners France ended the year at the second spot, second runners-up Belgium ended on top for a second successive year.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Takumi Minamino to become 1st Japanese player to join Liverpool
text: Liverpool on Thursday confirmed the signing of Japanese forward Takumi Minamino reportedly for around £7.25 million (₹67.21 crore). Notably, after joining the Reds on January 1, Minamino would become the first Japanese player to play for Liverpool. Minamino, who currently plays for Salzburg, has scored 64 goals in his 199 appearances for the Austrian club.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: 73% cyberattacks occurred on Microsoft Office products: Report
text: Microsoft Office products were exploited the most by cybercriminals worldwide with nearly 73% attacks taking place in the third quarter alone, as per a report by PreciseSecurity.com. Further, countries with the maximum web-based attacks included US, Netherlands and Germany. The report added that Browsers had 13.47% of the total number of attacks followed by Android with 9.09%.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: UK PM Boris Johnson accepts PM Modi's invitation to visit India
text: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has accepted the invitation extended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit India. On Wednesday, PM Modi had made a telephonic call to Johnson to congratulate him for his victory in the UK general elections and extended him an invitation. During the call, Johnson expressed his commitment to further strengthen India-UK ties.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Pratt & Whitney appoints Ashmita Sethi as India MD
text: Pratt & Whitney (P&W) has appointed Ashmita Sethi as their new Managing Director for India, the company announced on Thursday. Sethi has previously worked with Boeing and Rolls-Royce in the communications and public affairs department. Her appointment comes after the DGCA had ordered IndiGo to replace unmodified Pratt & Whitney engines on A320neo aircraft following a series of engine incidents.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: 10 cars, 3 buses, 4 news vans set on fire in Lucknow anti-CAA protests
text: As many as 10 cars, 20 motorcycles, three buses and four news vans were set on fire during protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act at Lucknow's Parivartan Chowk on Thursday. A police post was also vandalised in Lucknow. Around 40-50 people have been detained in connection with the protests, Lucknow SSP Kalanidhi Naithani said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Getting threats from handles followed by PM Modi: Actor Siddharth
text: Actor Siddharth took to Twitter on Thursday to claim that he is receiving threats from handles followed by PM Narendra Modi. "We are trying to speak our minds in a free country. Ugly words and draconian laws will not choke voices of dissent," he added. This comes after the actor spoke up against Citizenship (Amendment) Act.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: All Delhi metro stations open except Jamia & Jasola Vihar Shaheen Bagh
text: All metro stations, excluding Jamia Millia Islamia and Jasola Vihar Shaheen Bagh, were opened on Thursday evening. As many as 20 metro stations including Lal Quila, Jama Masjid, Delhi Gate and Mandi House were closed earlier in the day. Section 144 of the Code of Criminal Procedure was also imposed near Red Fort amid protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP brought Kashmir to every doorstep: Mufti's daughter on CAA row
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti's daughter Iltija has said the BJP has brought Kashmir right to the doorstep of every Indian. She posted the message from her mother's account as several politicians and activists were detained in Delhi for protesting against the Citizenship Act. Iltija said, "Fellow citizens don't need to visit Kashmir anymore to witness their subjugation."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 8 Air India flights from Delhi delayed by 20-100 mins amid CAA protest
text: As many as eight Air India flights from Delhi were delayed by 20 to 100 minutes on Thursday, an airline spokesperson said. IndiGo cancelled 19 flights from Delhi on Thursday amidst protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in the national capital. The police removed the barricades placed along Gurugram-Delhi expressway after around eight hours of traffic jam on the way.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 62 arrested, 3,000 sent notices to not protest in Uttar Pradesh
text: The administration has placed 62 people across Uttar Pradesh under arrest keeping in mind the scheduled protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), said Director General of Police (DGP) OP Singh on Thursday. Singh added that close to 3,000 others were sent notices requesting them to not take part in demonstrations, rallies and any kind of violence.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Priyam Garg, who will lead India in 2020 U-19 WC, bought for ₹1.9 crore by SRH
text: Meerut-born batsman Priyam Garg, who will lead India in the 2020 Under-19 World Cup, has been bought for ₹1.9 crore by SunRisers Hyderabad in the IPL 2020 auction. The 19-year-old had a base price of ₹20 lakh. Priyam averages 66.69 in first-class cricket and 47.13 in List A cricket. SRH also bought Jharkhand's 22-year-old batsman Virat Singh for ₹1.9 crore.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Jaydev Unadkat bought in IPL auctions for 9th time, sets record
text: Pacer Jaydev Unadkat has set the record for being bought in IPL auctions for most number of times (nine). The 28-year-old was bought by RR for ₹3 crore in IPL 2020 auction. He was bought by KKR in 2011 for $250k and by RCB for $525k in 2013. Notably, he has been bought by RR in the last three auctions.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Youngest batsman to hit double ton in 50-over cricket bought by RR for ₹2.4 cr
text: Mumbai opener Yashasvi Jaiswal, who recently became the youngest-ever cricketer to slam a double hundred in 50-over cricket, has been bought by RR for ₹2.4 crore in IPL 2020 auction. The 17-year-old has played 13 List A matches, scoring 779 runs at an average of 70.81. Yashasvi is also a part of India's 2020 Under-19 World Cup squad.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who are world's highest paid YouTubers of 2019 & how much did they earn?
text: Ryan Kaji, an eight-year-old boy who reviews toys on YouTube channel 'Ryan's World' has been named the highest-earning YouTuber for the second year in a row by Forbes with ₹184 crore earnings in a year. He's followed by sports-entertainment group 'Dude Perfect' with ₹142 crore earnings. Five-year-old Anastasia Radzinskaya of channel 'Like Nastya' is third-highest paid YouTuber at ₹128 crore.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Australia heat breaks record at 41.9°C, a day after setting new one
text: With an average maximum temperature of 41.9°C across Australia, Wednesday marked the breaking of the record for the hottest day recorded in the nation. Notably, a new record had been set just a day ago on Tuesday at 40.9°C, breaking the previous 40.3°C record set on January 7, 2013. Australia witnessed heavy bushfires across certain states, with some continuing still.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Dogs can process numbers, use similar brain areas as humans: Study
text: Georgia's Emory University found that dogs spontaneously process basic numerical quantities using a distinct part of their brains corresponding closely to number-responsive neural regions in humans. The study used functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) to scan dogs' brains as they viewed varying dots flash on a screen. 11 dogs, including Bhubo, Daisy and Truffles, were used for the same.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Girl protesting against CAA offers red rose to policeman in Delhi, pic viral
text: A picture showing a girl offering a red rose to a policeman at Delhi's Jantar Mantar during anti-CAA protests has gone viral. The protesters said the police can baton charge them as much as they want but their message is "love in return for hatred". Some lawyers present there also offered legal assistance to protesters in case they are detained.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Will seize rioters' property & compensate damage to public property: UP CM
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has said the government will seize the property of rioters and compensate the damage caused to public property during anti-CAA protests in Lucknow. "You can't indulge in violence in the name of protest," he added. As many as 20 motorcycles, 10 cars, 3 buses and 4 news vans were set on fire during the protests.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Video of Kerala police officer sharing food with man goes viral
text: A video of 30-year-old Kerala police officer SS Sreejith sharing his food with a man on a strike day near Thiruvananthapuram this week has gone viral. "When I was about to open my food packet I saw a person watching...closely. I asked him whether he had food and he said no. Then I told him to join me," said Sreejith.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: If you have guts, hold UN-monitored referendum on CAA, NRC: Mamata to BJP
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday dared the BJP to hold a United Nations-monitored referendum on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and the NRC. "If the BJP loses this mass vote, then it should step down from the government," she added. Mamata has been leading protests against the CAA for four days in a row in Kolkata.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Pak govt to defend Musharraf in appeal against death sentence
text: The Pakistan government has decided to defend former President Pervez Musharraf during the hearing of an appeal filed against the death sentence awarded to him in a treason case. "If the person who is accused is not getting justice this government will stand against that injustice," Pakistan's Attorney General Anwar Mansoor Khan said. He added that Musharraf's trial was "unfair".
author: Shailesh

headlines: Cyrus Mistry legally entitled to attend next Tata Sons board meeting
text: Cyrus Mistry is now legally entitled to attend the next board meeting of Tata Sons as the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal's order restored his directorship on the company. The court also restored him as director on all Tata company boards where he had served before his dismissal in 2016. The Mistry family has an 18.4% stake in Tata Sons.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Can't go around and stop someone from talking: Malaika on trolls
text: Talking about how she deals with social media trolling, actress Malaika Arora said, "I don't bother at all." She added that she feels sad that social media has become a negative space and said, "I can't go around and stop someone...People will continue talking, so let them." Earlier, Malaika was trolled over age gap between her and boyfriend Arjun Kapoor.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Haven't seen Rockstar, Tamasha as I lack perspective on Ranbir's films: Rishi
text: Actor Rishi Kapoor has revealed that he hasn't seen his son Ranbir Kapoor's films including 'Rockstar', 'Anjaana Anjaani' and 'Tamasha' as he has "no perspective" on his films. He explained that he didn't watch Ranbir's films because he "can't judge a film". "[My wife] Neetu is very practical and...watches every film of both [of us] and gives...feedback," Rishi said.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: CSK buys Curran, IPL 2019's costliest foreign player, for ₹5.5 crore
text: England all-rounder Sam Curran has been bought by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) for ₹5.5 crore in the IPL 2020 auction. Curran, who was the costliest overseas player last season, was released by Kings XI Punjab ahead of the auction. Among other overseas players, England batsman Jason Roy and all-rounder Chris Woakes were bought by Delhi Capitals for ₹1.5 crore each.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Snowden's book Permanent Record's proceedings to go to US govt
text: US' ex-intelligence contractor Edward Snowden, whose book 'Permanent Record' revealed secrets of the US surveillance programmes, will not be entitled to receive any proceeds after it's published. The money will go to the government as Snowden failed to get content approval from CIA and NSA. Snowden viewed himself as a whistleblower and gave out details about government emails and calls.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Goldman Sachs leads $15 mn funding round in Bengaluru startup ZestMoney
text: Goldman Sachs has led a Series B funding round of Bengaluru-based digital lending startup ZestMoney, in which it has raised about $15 million from existing investors including Naspers. The startup has raised about $63 million in Series B round so far. Founded by Lizzie Chapman, Priya Sharma and Ashish Anantharaman, ZestMoney is an AI platform offering real-time credit approval.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: PM Modi discusses strengthening of bilateral ties with Portugal PM
text: PM Narendra Modi met with Portugal PM Antonio Costa in New Delhi on Thursday and discussed the broader roadmap for strengthening Indo-Portuguese relations in areas such as defence, science and technology and trade. PM Costa will attend the second meeting of the Organising Committee for the celebrations of 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, the Ministry of External Affairs said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Detention of 10 lakh Uighur Muslims 'utterly fake news': China
text: China's Ambassador to Australia, Cheng Jingye on Thursday said that the report of the mass detention of at least 10 lakh Uighur Muslims in China is "utterly fake news". Jingye claimed that the detention had nothing to do with human rights and religion. The detention camps were education centres "aimed at deradicalisation", he added.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: 50,000 Syrians fleeing country to Turkey: Turkish Prez Erdoğan
text: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan said that 50,000 Syrians were fleeing Idlib in Syria to Turkey. However, he did not say whether the Syrians had actually crossed the border. Erdoğan added that Turkey was already hosting around four million Syrian refugees and it required support from other countries for the 'safe zone' for refugees it had created in Syria.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Will pursue legal recourse on NCLAT ruling: Chandrasekaran writes to staff
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has written a letter to employees saying that Tata will take legal action after NCLAT named Cyrus Mistry as the executive chairman of the company. The tribunal has also termed Chandrasekaran's appointment as Executive Chairman as illegal. "I urge all employees to stay focused on their businesses and the welfare of our stakeholders," he said.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Restore mobile internet service in Assam by 5 pm today: High Court
text: The Gauhati High Court has directed the Assam government to restore mobile internet services across the state by 5pm on Thursday. Mobile and broadband internet services were suspended in parts of the state on December 11 after incidents of violence during protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Meanwhile, it was announced that mobile internet was suspended till Friday 9am.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: After 8hrs of traffic jam, police remove barricades on Gurugram-Delhi expressway
text: After facing nearly 8 hours of traffic jam on Gurugram-Delhi expressway, Delhi Police removed the barricades placed along the way for vehicle checking. Heavy congestion was witnessed from 8 am onwards on Thursday after Delhi Police placed barricades in order to clamp down on Anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protesters. A six to seven kilometre-long traffic jam was reported on the expressway.n
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Pat Cummins becomes most expensive overseas buy in IPL history at ₹15.5 crore
text: Australian fast bowler Pat Cummins has become the most expensive overseas buy in the history of IPL. The 26-year-old fast bowler, who had a base price of ₹2 crore, was bought by Kolkata Knight Riders for ₹15.5 crore at the IPL 2020 auction today. England all-rounder Ben Stokes was the previous most expensive overseas buy in IPL (RPS, ₹14.5 crore).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India not world's youngest democracy, writes Twitter user on Hrithik's post
text: Hrithik Roshan on Wednesday took to Twitter to share his views about the police action at Jamia Millia Islamia University. "Great teachers learn from their students. I salute the world's youngest democracy," he tweeted. Commenting on the post, a user wrote, "India is not the world's youngest democracy. And people are increasingly worried about how long we will remain one."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Delhi Police offers refreshments to detained anti-CAA protesters
text: Delhi Police on Thursday offered refreshments to people who were detained protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and brought to Surajmal Stadium and Rajiv Gandhi Stadium in Bawana. Several activists and politicians such as former JNU student Umar Khalid, Swaraj Abhiyan chief Yogendra Yadav, Congress leader Sandeep Dikshit and Left leaders D Raja, Sitaram Yechury were detained in Delhi.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: HC denies interim protection to Jamia students; lawyers chant 'shame'
text: Delhi High Court has declined interim protection to Jamia Millia Islamia students protesting against the Citizenship Act from coercive action including arrest even as the lawyers chanted "shame shame". The court, however, issued notices to the Centre, the Delhi government and the police on a PIL seeking setting up of a fact-finding committee to look into the violence at university.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Haven't moved 1 km in 2 hours: Man who was stuck in Gurugram traffic
text: Amid the massive traffic jam at Delhi-Gurugram border after police barricaded roads over planned protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, a commuter stuck in traffic tweeted, "Been sitting in car for last two hours and have not moved one km even." "Massive traffic. Ambulances stuck in this jam," another tweet read. Several Twitter users also posted videos of the traffic jam.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: After buying him for ₹11.5 cr, ₹8.4 cr in last 2 auctions, RR buy Unadkat for ₹3 cr
text: Rajasthan Royals today bought fast bowler Jaydev Unadkat for ₹3 crore in the IPL 2020 auction. In IPL 2018 auction, Rajasthan Royals had bought the fast bowler for ₹11.5 crore and had released him ahead of the IPL 2019 auction. The 28-year-old fast bowler was bought for ₹8.4 crore by Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2019 auction and was released later.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Social media speed, Lynnsane: Mumbai Indians after Lynn follows them on Twitter
text: Mumbai Indians took to Twitter to share a screenshot which showed Australian batsman Chris Lynn followed them on Twitter. This comes after the IPL franchise bought the cricketer for ₹2 crore in the IPL 2020 auction. "Social media speed, Lynnsane," Mumbai Indians wrote alongside the screenshot. Lynn was released by KKR ahead of the auction.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Manmohan Singh demanded citizenship for persecuted minorities in 2003: BJP
text: BJP's official Twitter handle shared a video of former PM Manmohan Singh asking the then-NDA government to grant citizenship to persecuted minorities of neighbouring countries such as Bangladesh and Pakistan. "Our approach to granting citizenship to these unfortunate persons should be more liberal," he had said. "Citizenship (Amendment) Act does just that," the BJP wrote sharing the video.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Man pushes 3 daughters in well, hangs self after 4th girl child's birth
text: A man in Gujarat pushed his three daughters into a well on Wednesday and then committed suicide. "Preliminary investigation has revealed that the man had financial problems and the birth of another daughter was the trigger for this horrendous step," police said. As per reports, the man took his daughters to a farm and after killing them, he hanged himself.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 19 flights cancelled, 16 delayed as crew gets stuck in traffic in Gurugram
text: IndiGo Airlines cancelled 19 flights from Delhi and 16 others were delayed as crew members got stuck in a traffic jam at the Delhi-Gurugram border due to anti-CAA protests. Vistara, Air India and IndiGo announced that their passengers, who are stuck in the traffic, will be adjusted in subsequent flights. Police barricaded roads and imposed traffic restrictions amid the protests.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Proposal to build smog towers at 26 places in Delhi at ₹26 crore next year
text: North Delhi Municipal Corporation has proposed a ₹26 crore budget to build smog towers that work as large-scale air purifiers at 26 places in Delhi next year. Earlier this week, Supreme Court gave three months' time to Centre and Delhi government for pilot project of building a 'smog tower' at Connaught Place. The governments had requested for nine months' time.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: HC rejects Nirbhaya convict's juvenile claim, fines lawyer for wasting time
text: Delhi High Court on Thursday rejected the plea of Nirbhaya gangrape convict Pawan Kumar Gupta, who had moved the court claiming that he was a juvenile at the time of the offence in 2012. The court has also fined Gupta's lawyer ₹25,000 for wasting court's time  and trying to "play hide and seek" by not showing up for hearing.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Bound by govt order: Bharti Airtel Chairman on internet shutdown in Delhi
text: Bharti Airtel's Chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal on Thursday responded to the temporary suspension internet, voice calling and SMS services in parts of Delhi and said, "We are bound by the order of the government. We are following their order." Amid the anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protests in Delhi, several telecom carriers temporarily suspended mobile internet services in parts of Delhi.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Court that heard Tata-Mistry case had many big rulings changed by SC in 2019
text: Six of the eight big cases decided this year by the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal have been reversed or modified by Supreme Court, according to a Bloomberg analysis. The appeals court ordered the reinstatement of Cyrus Mistry as Tata Sons Chairman. The company said it "strongly believes in the strength of its case and will take appropriate legal recourse".
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: HDFC Bank becomes 3rd Indian company to cross $100 billion in market value
text: HDFC Bank on Thursday became only the third Indian company to cross $100 billion in market capitalisation. India's most valuable company Reliance Industries is worth $140 billion while the country's largest IT company Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has a market value of $114.2 billion. HDFC Bank now ranks 110th among the world's most valued companies, according to Bloomberg data.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: I'm not that well informed to take a stand: Ananya Panday on CAA
text: Amid ongoing anti-CAA protests across India, actress Ananya Panday has said that when it comes to politics she "isn't that well informed to take a stand". "It's very important to use your voice...but...you should have...knowledge before you do that," she added. "I would only like to speak once I know all the facts and information," Ananya further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: It feels bad that 'Sonchiriya' didn't get nominations: Bhumi
text: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that "it feels bad" that her film 'Sonchiriya', directed by Abhishek Chaubey, didn't get nominated for any award. "But...'Sonchiriya' never faced a dearth of love. It earned...respect," she added. Calling the film's box-office failure "heartbreaking", she said, "For me, it will always be at...top of my filmography as...[t]he film required a lot from me."
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: I would love to style Rihanna: Celeb stylist Shaleena Nathani
text: Celebrity stylist Shaleena Nathani said in an interview that one day she would love to style Barbadian singer Rihanna. "I think she's one of the sexiest women I have seen," she added. "Deepika Padukone is one of my favourite people to style. Of course, she's absolutely gorgeous, but I love the collaborative effort," Shaleena further added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Singer Camila apologises for 'hurtful language', says 'I was uneducated'
text: American-Cuban singer Camila Cabello took to Twitter to apologise for  "horrible and hurtful language" that she used in the past. "I was uneducated and ignorant and once I became aware of the history...I was deeply embarrassed I ever used it," she wrote. This comes after "racist" remarks that she wrote on now-deleted Tumblr posts resurfaced online.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Manchester derby in League Cup after Utd, City enter semis
text: Manchester City will face Manchester United in the League Cup semi-finals after both won their respective quarter-final matches on Wednesday night. While Joao Cancelo and Raheem Sterling helped City beat Oxford United 3-1, Marcus Rashford, Ryan Jackson and Anthony Martial scored for United in their 3-0 win against Colchester. Leicester will face Aston Villa in the other semi-final match.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Drone delivery tests in India by Dunzo, Throttle get DGCA's approval
text: India's civil aviation authority DGCA has approved Google-backed hyperlocal delivery startup Dunzo and Bengaluru-based drone maker Throttle Aerospace Systems to test autonomous drones. The tests, expected to begin in 2020, will measure the safety of the solution and will be carried out outside of Bengaluru. The experiment is a part of DGCA's programme to test drone-based deliveries in India.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Spanish startup Glovo achieves 'unicorn' status after $167 mn funding
text: Barcelona-based food delivery startup Glovo has raised $167 million in Series E round of funding from Abu Dhabi-based investment company, Mubadala, pushing its valuation to over $1 billion. As per reports, Glovo is Spain's second startup to achieve unicorn status after ride-hailing service Cabify. The startup has raised over $500 million in its previous rounds, as per Crunchbase.
author: Anushka Dixit

headlines: Bolivia issues arrest warrant against ex-President Morales
text: Bolivia issued an arrest warrant against its former President Evo Morales on charges of sedition and terrorism for allegedly promoting violent clashes in the country before and after he left office. Morales left office in November after public protesters accused him of rigging the October 20 presidential polls in his favour. Morales claimed the protests were a coup against him.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 1 dead, 3 injured in US shopping centre stabbing
text: One person was killed and three others were injured in a stabbing at Oregon's shopping centre in the US on Wednesday. A 20-year-old attacker stabbed two people inside a bank and another was stabbed at a gym next door. After the stabbings, the assailant also stole a car. "This is an ongoing investigation with several crime scenes," police said.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: Philippine family jailed for killing 57 people in 2009 massacre
text: A Philippines court on Thursday found members of politically affluent Ampatuan family guilty in the murder of 57 people in 2009. Five members of the Ampatuan family, which governed the southern province of Maguindanao, were sentenced to life imprisonment. They were accused of killing members of a rival family, who were on the way to file election candidacy papers.
author: Kirti Joshi

headlines: CM Kejriwal launches free WiFi scheme amid Internet suspension in parts of Delhi
text: Delhi's Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday launched the free WiFi scheme amid the suspension of Internet services in parts of the capital over the ongoing protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Kejriwal said that it was "paradoxical" that Internet services were suspended today. As per the scheme, 11,000 WiFi spots will be established across Delhi.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Akshay Kumar beats Salman Khan in Forbes Celebrity 100 list, comes 2nd
text: Akshay Kumar has bagged the second position in the Forbes India Celebrity 100 list beating Salman Khan who had been topping the list since 2016. Salman has slipped to third position this year. Amitabh Bachchan has bagged the fourth position, while actresses Alia Bhatt and Deepika Padukone have bagged eighth and tenth positions respectively.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Taylor Swift's pic used to hide malware by cryptocurrency mining botnet
text: A cryptocurrency-mining botnet is infecting computers with an image of American singer Taylor Swift to spread its malware. The operators of botnet MyKingz are using steganography, a technique that enables them to hide malicious files inside the genuine ones, according to UK cybersecurity firm Sophos. They are hiding a malicious EXE file inside a genuine JPEG image of Taylor Swift.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Orange 'p***y-grab' bragger impeached, thank you God: Richa on Trump
text: Richa Chadha took to Twitter on Thursday to comment on US President Donald Trump's impeachment. "Was depressed all day yesterday...on my bday... due to what's happening, didn't celebrate...slept in," she wrote. "Woke up to hear that an orange, 'p***y-grab' bragger has been impeached! Thank you God, that's a delightful present! I'll take that!" Richa further wrote.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Services suspended in areas including Jamia, Mandi House: Vodafone
text: Vodafone on Thursday tweeted that services were suspended in parts of Delhi as per the directive received from the government. It listed "Jamia, Shaheen Bagh, Bawana, Seelampur, Jaffrabad, Mandi House and part of Walled city" in its tweet. This comes amid protests in Delhi against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Historian Ramachandra Guha detained mid-interview during anti-CAA protest
text: Police detained historian Ramachandra Guha in Bengaluru during an anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019, protest on Thursday. Guha was taken away by the police officials while he was in the middle of an interview. "The paranoid rulers in Delhi are scared. I feel sorry for the police as they are getting orders from Delhi," Guha said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: 50 detained outside Hyderabad's Charminar amid anti-CAA protests
text: Hyderabad Police on Thursday detained around 50 people protesting outside the Charminar over issues related to the National Register of Citizens (NRC) and Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). "In the entire south zone, rallies and procession in favour of or in opposition won't be allowed. No organisation has been given any permission to organise a protest," said Avinash Mohanty, DCP South.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Muslims offer namaz outside Jamia; people form human chain around them
text: A video has surfaced online showing students and people of Muslim community offering namaz outside Jamia Millia Islamia University in Delhi, while people of other faiths formed a human chain around them. The video comes amid protests by people against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 across the country. Section 144 has also been imposed in several cities.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Indians struggling for jobs, how will new citizens be employed: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday raised the issue of providing jobs to immigrants, who will be given citizenship under the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, when there isn't enough employment for Indians in the country. "There are so many other issues that need attention," the CM said. Kejriwal's statement comes amid the ongoing protests in parts of India against the Act.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: State transport bus set on fire in UP amid protests over CAA
text: A state transport bus was set on fire, allegedly during the protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal on Thursday. Protests against the Citizenship Act have been taking place in several parts of the country with many getting detained by police. Internet services have been suspended till further orders following the violence, Sambhal District Magistrate said.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Chinese state media cites India's example, says 'internet shutdown natural'
text: Chinese state media said internet shutdown in India "proved" that the necessary regulation of internet is a "reasonable choice" and a "natural extension of national sovereignty". It further wrote that when China adopted a similar strategy few years ago, it was criticised by US and UK. This comes after internet suspension in Indian cities amid protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Centre panicking, shutting everyone's voice: Priyanka on protests
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi has criticised the Centre, saying that those who spent crores of taxpayers' money on advertisements on the Citizenship Act to convince people are panicking so much by the public's voice today that they are shutting everyone's voice. She added, "Metro stations are closed. Internet is down. Section 144 is imposed everywhere. Raising voice isn't allowed anywhere."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 6 more cricketers added to IPL 2020 auction list, take tally to 338
text: As many as 338 cricketers will now go under the hammer in the IPL 2020 player auction to be held in Kolkata today. This comes after six more cricketers were added to the original list. Players who have been included in the list are- Vinay Kumar, Ashoke Dinda, Robin Bisht, Sanjay Yadav, Matthew Wade and Jake Weatherald.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Released by KKR after 6 seasons, Robin Uthappa bought by RR for ₹3 crore
text: Wicketkeeper-batsman Robin Uthappa, who was released by KKR after playing six IPL seasons with them, has been bought by RR for ₹3 crore. Uthappa's base price at the auction was ₹1.5 crore, the highest among all the Indian players. Uthappa is the sixth-highest run-scorer among Indians in IPL history. Meanwhile, Delhi Capitals bought England opener Jason Roy for ₹1.5 crore.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Chris Lynn 1st buy of IPL 2020 auction, bought by Mumbai Indians for ₹2 crore
text: Australian batsman Chris Lynn, who was released by Kolkata Knight Riders ahead of the IPL 2020 auction, has been bought by Mumbai Indians for his base price of ₹2 crore. Kolkata Knight Riders had bought Chris Lynn for ₹9.6 crore in IPL 2018 auction. Chris Lynn has played 41 IPL matches, scoring 1,280 runs at an average of 33.68.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who is Hugh Edmeades, the man who will conduct IPL 2020 auction?
text: IPL 2020 auction will be conducted by Hugh Edmeades, who is a 61-year-old freelance auctioneer hailing from United Kingdom. Edmeades conducted over 2,300 auctions after making his debut in August 1984, selling over 3,00,000 lots for more than £2.2 billion, while working at British auction house, Christie's. He was also the auctioneer at Nelson Mandela's 90th Birthday Gala in London.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Deepak Chahar ruled out of final ODI vs WI, Navdeep Saini named replacement
text: Pacer Deepak Chahar has been ruled out of the final ODI against West Indies after he felt mild pain in his lower back following the second ODI. BCCI medical team examined him and suggested that the fast bowler needs some rest to fully recover. He has been replaced by fast bowler Navdeep Saini, who is yet to play an ODI.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Gboard bug locks users out of their Android phones, Google releases fix
text: Google has released a fix after several people complained Google's keyboard Gboard was often crashing, becoming un-operable and even locking them completely out of their Android phones. Users claimed this new bug came with the latest update of the app via the Google Play Store on December 17. Google said a fix for this issue (8.9.14) has been rolled out.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: First ESA exoplanet mission launches with planet-hunting telescope
text: European Space Agency's (ESA) first exoplanetary mission, the Characterising Exoplanet Satellite (Cheops) successfully launched on Wednesday aboard a Russian Soyuz rocket. Cheops aims to characterise planets outside the solar system of nearby stars, observing known planets in the size range between Earth and Neptune. It also aims to find if the planets are rocky like Earth or Mars.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: This is shocking: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw after Guha detained for anti-CAA protest
text: Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said it was shocking that police detained noted writer-historian Ramachandra Guha for his "peaceful protest" against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Bengaluru. In a video, Guha was seen standing alone and giving an interview when the police dragged him away. Bengaluru Police imposed Section 144 across the city for three days midnight of December 21.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: Maoist leader who carried ₹40L reward dies of heart attack in Chhattisgarh
text: Maoist leader Ravula Srinivas alias Ramanna, who carried a reward of ₹40 lakh on his head, died of a heart attack in the Bastar forests of Chhattisgarh, the police said. "We're trying for more details about the death of Ramanna," police said. Ramanna had led several attacks on security forces in Chhattisgarh, including killing of 76 CRPF jawans in 2010.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Man tweets if it'll be 'dry day' in B'luru amid Section 144, police replies
text: After Bengaluru Police tweeted on Wednesday that Section 144 has been imposed throughout the city while all markets and educational institutions will remain functional, a user asked, "Will it be a dry day tomorrow?" Responding to his tweet, the police said, "Everything will run normal." Several people are protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act in the city.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: AAP MLA announces ₹5 lakh, job to Jamia student who lost eye in police action
text: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan today announced ₹5 lakh and a job at the Delhi Waqf Board to the Jamia student who lost one of his eyes during police action at the university. The Okhla MLA, who is also the chairman of the Delhi Waqf Board, said he will meet Minhajuddin, an LLM student of Jamia, to provide him appointment papers.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Personal vendetta against me: Musharraf on his death sentence
text: Former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf has said that the death sentence awarded to him is based on a "personal vendetta". "There is no example of such a decision in which neither the defendant and nor his lawyer was given permission to say something in his defence," he added. Musharraf was sentenced over high treason for imposing emergency in 2007.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: India is maharaja of tariffs, has highest tariffs of any large nation: WH adviser
text: The US is "engaged" with India on trade but wants India to lower tariffs, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said. "I like to joke, India is the maharaja of tariffs. They literally have highest tariffs in the world of any large country," he added. "90% of the time, India charges us higher tariffs than we charge them," Navarro said.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: El Clasico ends in goalless draw for 1st time in 17 years
text: El Clasico between Real Madrid and Barcelona on Wednesday ended in a 0-0 goalless draw for the first time since 2002. The match, played amid fears of pitch invasion with pro-Catalan independence supporters clashing with police outside the stadium, was interrupted briefly when beach balls were thrown onto the pitch. Around 46 people were injured in clashes outside the stadium.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Liverpool beat Monterrey 2-1 to enter FIFA Club World Cup final
text: Liverpool on Wednesday night defeated Mexican football club Monterrey 2-1 to enter the FIFA Club World Cup final on Saturday. Goals from Naby Keita, in the 11th minute, and Roberto Firmino, in the stoppage-time minute, helped the Reds to overcome Rogelio Funes Mori's goal in the 14th minute. Liverpool will face Brazilian football club Flamengo in the final.
author: Ankur Taliyan

headlines: Mobile internet, SMS, voice services suspended in parts of Delhi: Airtel
text: Mobile internet, SMS and voice services have been suspended in parts of Delhi, Bharti Airtel tweeted on Thursday. This comes amid protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. "We're complying with instructions received from government authorities," it added. "Once the suspension orders are lifted, our services will be fully up and running," the statement further read.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Entry & exit gates of 7 metro stations closed in Delhi amid anti-CAA protests
text: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) announced that entry and exit gates of seven metro stations have been closed due to security reasons. The seven metro stations are Jamia Millia Islamia, Jasola Vihar Shaheen Bagh, Munirka, Lal Quila, Jama Masjid, Chandni Chowk and Vishwavidyalaya. This comes amid ongoing protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Section 144 imposed near Red Fort in Delhi; 7 more metro stations closed
text: Amid the protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019, Section 144 of the Code of Criminal Procedure has been imposed near Delhi's Red Fort. Moreover, entry and exit gates of seven metro stations have been closed. The seven metro stations are Patel Chowk, Lok Kalyan Marg, Udyog Bhawan, ITO, Pragati Maidan, Khan Market and Central Secretariat (CS).
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Farhan to join CAA protest; IPS officer accuses him of waging war against govt
text: After Farhan Akhtar said he'll join a protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, IPS officer Sandeep Mittal accused him of breaking the law. "You've committed an offence u/s 121 of Indian Penal Code," Mittal tweeted. Section 121 states that whoever wages war against the Government of India, or attempts to do so, shall be punished with death or life imprisonment.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: The trend #ShameonBollywood is justified: Kangana on silence over CAA
text: Commenting on Bollywood celebrities' purported silence over Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), Kangana Ranaut said that the industry is "full of cowards". "They're the most scared human beings...they're sissies...spineless people," she added. Kangana further alleged that actors are "indifferent" and that's why she thinks that the ongoing Twitter trend #ShameonBollywood is "absolutely justified".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I would disown my kids if they behave like Trump's kids: De Niro
text: Hollywood actor Robert De Niro on a chat show called US President Donald Trump, who was impeached on Wednesday, a "low-life". Without giving any clarification, he added that he would "disown his kids" if they did what Trump's kids did. De Niro further said that Trump is worse than some of the past characters the actor has played in movies.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Police official carries woman on shoulder for 4 kms after she faints
text: A police official in Andhra Pradesh carried a woman pilgrim on his shoulders for four kilometres after she fainted while going to Tirumala on foot. The woman was walking through the forest area with other pilgrims when she fainted. Since no vehicle was available there, special party constable Kullayappa carried the woman and admitted her to a hospital at Tirumala.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Man held in UP for having 10-11 videos related to Jamia protests in mobile
text: Uttar Pradesh Police on Wednesday arrested a man accused of carrying 10-11 purported videos pertaining to Jamia Millia Islamia protests in his mobile phone. The police claimed to have acted on the basis of information and nabbed the accused with his mobile phone in Chandausi. "The videos can disturb the communal harmony of the society," the FIR stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Congress leader Harish Rawat takes part in protest against CAA
text: Congress leaders Harish Rawat and Ripun Bora have taken part in the protest against the amended Citizenship Act in Guwahati on Thursday. Swaraj India President Yogendra Yadav and activist Umar Khalid were earlier detained from Delhi's Red Fort area while protesting against the Act. In Bengaluru, historian Ramachandra Guha was detained during a protest.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Yogendra Yadav detained near Red Fort during anti-CAA protest march
text: Delhi Police have detained Swaraj India President Yogendra Yadav near the Red Fort area during an anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019, protest on Thursday. "The citizenship of this country cannot be divided and this is our protest call today," Yadav said. A large number of protesters gathered in the Red Fort area where Section 144 has been imposed.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Pics show massive Gurugram traffic jam as police barricade road amid CAA protests
text: Pictures and videos shared online show massive traffic jam at the Delhi-Gurugram border on Thursday as Delhi police barricaded roads and imposed traffic restrictions over a planned protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Gurugram Traffic Police tweeted about the congestion at NH48. The police also imposed a ban on large gatherings under Section 144 of the CrPC near Red Fort.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: How much money can each team spend in the IPL 2020 auction today?
text: Kings XI Punjab will have the maximum amount to spend at ₹42.70 crore in the IPL 2020 auction today. Kolkata Knight Riders follow Kings XI Punjab with ₹35.65 crore. Meanwhile, Mumbai Indians can spend ₹13.05 crore, the lowest amount among all the franchises. Further, Royal Challengers Bangalore have the most slots available (12) to fill.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who were the most expensive players in the past IPL auctions?
text: Pacer Jaydev Unadkat and spinner Varun Chakravarthy were IPL 2019 auction's joint-most expensive buys after being bought by RR and KXIP for ₹8.4 crore, respectively. MS Dhoni was the most expensive buy in first-ever IPL auction, bought by CSK for $1.5 million. In 2015, DD bought Yuvraj Singh for ₹16 crore, making him the most expensive buy of IPL ever.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Time Magazine to recreate Martin Luther's 'I Have a Dream' speech in VR
text: The Time Magazine built a virtual reality museum experience, The March, to recreate Martin Luther King Jr's "I Have a Dream" speech in VR for the first time. It uses motion capture, AI, 'photogrammetry' and 3D rendering. King called for civil and economic rights and an end to racism in front of the Lincoln Memorial on August 28, 1963.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 8-yr-old toy reviewer highest-earning YouTuber, earns ₹184cr a year: Forbes
text: Ryan, an eight-year-old American boy who reviews toys, topped Forbes' list of highest-earning YouTube stars after making $26 million (₹184 crore) in a year. Ryan had topped the list last year as well at $22 million. He was followed this year by channel 'Dude Perfect' at $20 million and Russian-born five-year-old Anastasia Radzinskaya at $18 million.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Star 340 light-yrs away named 'Bibha' after Tata Institute researcher
text: A yellow-white dwarf star 340 light-years away was named 'Bibha', meaning "a light beam", to honour Bibha Chowdhuri, who was the first woman researcher-faculty at Tata Institute of Fundamental Research in 1949. Bibha's exoplanet was named 'Santamasa', a Sanskrit word that means "clouded". The names of the two astronomical bodies were announced by Paris-based International Astronomical Union (IAU).
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: India leads the world in pollution-linked deaths: GAHP report
text: India leads the world in the number of pollution-linked deaths with 2.3 million deaths, followed by China, Nigeria, Indonesia and Pakistan, a Global Alliance on Health and Pollution (GAHP) report found. India also entered the per-capita list at the 10th spot. Pollution was found to be the largest environmental cause of premature deaths on Earth, causing 15% of all deaths.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: 23-yr-old air hostess found hanging in room; PG owner booked for harassing her
text: A 23-year-old air hostess was found hanging from a fan in her room at a paying accommodation in Gurugram. Police booked the paying guesthouse owner after her parents alleged he was harassing and humiliating her and that he also hacked her phone. Her father said that before her death, the owner called him to tell his daughter might kill herself.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: HC recalls order, to hear Nirbhaya convict's claim of being juvenile in 2012 today
text: After Delhi High Court adjourned the plea filed by one of the four convicts in the Nirbhaya rape case to January 24, it recalled the order saying it will hear the matter on Thursday itself. The plea has been filed by Pawan Gupta who has claimed that he was a juvenile in 2012 when the incident took place.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Journalist booked for roti-salt mid-day meal video gets clean chit
text: Journalist Pawan Jaiswal, who was accused of criminal conspiracy for recording a video in a government school serving roti and salt in the mid-day meal, has been given a clean chit by the Uttar Pradesh Police. Jaiswal, along with two others, was booked in September. The Editors Guild of India had condemned UP government for filing an FIR against Jaiswal.
author: Jigyasu

headlines: Perpetrators should get punishment at the earliest: Varun on Nirbhaya case
text: Speaking at the trailer launch of his upcoming film 'Street Dancer 3D', Varun Dhawan said that perpetrators in Nirbhaya case should get "maximum punishment at the earliest". "I think the whole country is waiting for the criminals to get their due," he added. This comes after the Supreme Court rejected the review petition filed by one of the four convicts.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Soiled my pants out of excitement for Ed Sheeran concert: Selena
text: American singer-actress Selena Gomez has revealed that she soiled her pants "a bit" while she was stuck in traffic on her way to attend singer Ed Sheeran's concert as she was "that excited". "There was so much traffic and I was very uncomfortable...'down there'," Selena said. "I will say that it was the first time I...soiled my pants," she added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Saif Ali Khan, Rani Mukerji to reunite after 11 yrs for 'Bunty Aur Babli 2'
text: Saif Ali Khan and Rani Mukerji are set to reunite after 11 years for the sequel of 2005 film 'Bunty Aur Babli'. "#SaifAliKhan and #RaniMukerji bring their magic back in #BuntyAurBabli2," Yash Raj Films tweeted. 'Gully Boy' actor Siddhant Chaturvedi and debutante Sharvari will portray the titular roles. Saif and Rani previously starred together in 'Thoda Pyaar Thoda Magic' (2008).
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: We raised them to have a voice: Priyanka on students' protests over CAA
text: Referring to students' protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019, actress Priyanka Chopra said, "Every voice counts. And each voice will work towards changing India." "Education is what empowered [students] to think independently. We have raised them to have a voice," she wrote. "In a thriving democracy, to raise one's voice peacefully and be met with violence is wrong," Priyanka added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: Don't shy away from asking better package: Kanika Dhillon to writers
text: Screenwriter and actress Kanika Dhillon has urged writers to ask for "better payment packages" and added that "right now, it's a very good time to be a creator". "The economics of demand and supply is looking out beautifully for writers because [they're] in demand right now," she further said. Kanika added that producers are "open to giving writers better remuneration".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Deepika, Meghna to not promote 'Chhapaak' in Delhi over CAA protests
text: Actress Deepika Padukone, director Meghna Gulzar and 'Chhapaak' team have announced that they will not promote their film in Delhi due to ongoing protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Their statement read, "It will be insensitive...to promote our film...when...[Delhi] is going through...unrest." "We...regret the inconvenience caused by our absence [and] hope you will understand," it added.
author: Vidushi Mishra

headlines: UrbanClap’s Salon Spree prices slashed further, extended by 3 days
text: Owing to high demand, UrbanClap has decided to extend its ongoing Salon Spree for women and men by 3 more days. Customers can avail services such as free waxing and free haircuts on select packages at even more discounted prices till December 22. UrbanClap has tied up with Amazon Pay to offer 20% cashback to customers paying via Amazon Pay.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Section 144 in place in UP, no permission given for any protest: Police
text: Amid protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act across the country, Uttar Pradesh DGP OP Singh tweeted, "'Sec 144' is in force and no permission for any gathering has been given for 19.12.19. Pls do not participate." He further asked parents to "counsel their children". Meanwhile, Samajwadi Party and some other organisations announced that they'll protest against the Act on Thursday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Donald Trump becomes third US President to be impeached
text: Donald Trump has become the third US President to be impeached following a vote by House of Representatives. The Senate will now hold a trial on whether to remove Trump from office. The charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress were brought against Trump over his alleged attempts to pressure Ukraine to investigate his political rival Joe Biden.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: What is the procedure to impeach the President of the US?
text: The US House of Representatives, the lower house of US Congress, debates and votes on impeachment articles against the President. After voting in favour of impeaching him/her, the matter moves to Senate where Supreme Court Chief Justice presides over the trial. Removing the President from office would require a two-thirds majority of those present and voting in the 100-member Senate.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: UK's richest woman pays herself ₹3,000 crore in 2018, breaks her own record
text: The UK's richest woman Denise Coates, the Founder and co-CEO of gambling company Bet365, paid herself $422 million (₹3,000 crore) in salary and dividends last year. This is the highest amount paid to the boss of a British company and breaks the previous record of $347 million set by Coates a year earlier. The 52-year-old owns about half of Bet365.
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

headlines: 7-month-old baby made honorary Mayor in US
text: William Charles 'Charlie' McMillian, a seven-month-old baby, has been made an honorary Mayor of Whitehall, Texas. The role of honorary Mayor is auctioned off to the highest bidder each year during an annual fundraiser. "We're in a difficult time in our country's history and Mayor Charlie is helping to bring peace," councilman Josh Fultz said.
author: Nandini Sinha

headlines: Meals in jail good for those who like spicy food: Payal after getting bail
text: Actress Payal Rohatgi said food in jail was "not very good" but it was good for those "who prefer spicy food". She added that she spent a sleepless night in a female general ward and was "touched by the inmates' stories". Rohatgi was sent to eight-day judicial custody over an "objectionable" video on Nehru family and granted bail on Tuesday.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: You will be fixed soon: BJP Mumbai General Secretary to Kunal Kamra
text: BJP Mumbai General Secretary Mohit Bharatiya appeared to threaten comedian Kunal Kamra after he shared a graphic on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. 'Dear PM Modi, Media is with you, Bollywood is with you...but we stand rock solid against you', the graphic read. Kamra had captioned it "Fixed it", replying to which Bharatiya wrote, "Take my Words U will...be Fixed Soon".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: No political views behind removing Savdhaan India host, clarifies channel
text: A spokesperson of Star Bharat, that airs 'Savdhaan India', while speaking about reports that actor Sushant Singh's contract as host ended after he took part in anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act protest, said, "The channel has no political views." "The next format of 'Savdhaan India' did not require a presenter, and hence a new contract was not signed," the spokesperson added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: We honour Indian democracy as they have robust debate: US on CAA
text: When asked about the Citizenship (Amendment) Act at press conference, US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said, "We honour Indian democracy as they have a robust debate on the issue." "We care deeply and always will about protecting minorities and religious rights everywhere," he added. Pompeo was speaking with the reporters at the conclusion of the India-US 2+2 ministerial talks.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Video shows police allegedly firing during Jamia violence; police say they'll probe
text: A video has surfaced online which allegedly shows police personnel with guns and one of them firing during protests by Jamia Millia Islamia students that turned violent on December 15. While the police had denied using firearms earlier, they said they're yet to ascertain the authenticity, location and time of the video. Meanwhile, another video showed a protestor getting hurt.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Let it stay a mystery: KL Rahul on his celebration after scoring 3rd ODI ton
text: On being asked about his celebration after he slammed his third ODI hundred against West Indies on Wednesday, Team India opener KL Rahul said, "Let it stay a mystery." The 27-year-old was seen celebrating his hundred by closing his eyes and covering his ears with his fingers. Rahul has now scored two hundreds in his last four ODI innings.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Please keep Sana out of all this: Ganguly after she posts book excerpt over CAA
text: After his daughter Sana Ganguly took to Instagram to share an excerpt from Khuswant Singh's novel 'The End of India' amid anti-CAA protests across India, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly tweeted, "Please keep Sana out of all these issues." He added, "This post is not true...she is too young a girl to know about anything in politics."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What records did Rohit break with his 10th international hundred of 2019?
text: Rohit Sharma became the first opener to score 10 hundreds in international cricket in a calendar year. He also became the first player to score ODI tons against seven different teams in a year. Rohit (190) surpassed MS Dhoni (186) to record most international sixes in India. He also became the first batsman to post eight 150-plus scores in ODIs.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I want fair Olympic trials, which should be televised live: Boxer Nikhat Zareen
text: Boxer Nikhat Zareen, one of the four challengers for the lone Olympic qualifying spot, has expressed concerns over the fairness of the selection trials, to be held in New Delhi on December 27 and 28. "I want the trials to be televised live on TV and not in close doors so...people can know what happened in the bout," she said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rolls-Royce builds AI to help ALS patients speak with own voice
text: Rolls-Royce built a new tool called Quips, which uses AI and 'voice banking' to learn the unique way its user talks, essentially helping people with Lou Gehrig's disease or ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis). Rolls-Royce and its R² Data Labs created Quips with help from Motor Neurone Disease Association and companies including Intel and Microsoft. However, it's still early in development.
author: Kanishka Pandey

headlines: Facebook, Instagram to ban influencers from promoting guns, vaping
text: Social media giant Facebook and its photo-sharing platform Instagram have announced a ban on "branded content" posted by influencers which promotes weapons, tobacco and vaping. Further, users will also see "special restrictions" on posts that market products like alcohol and diet supplements.
